comment: Homeworks are graded the harshest I have ever seen. Very strict on grading and quizes. Doesn't really teach, has you watch youtube videos before class so you understand the concepts.

She teaches nothing. She's the type of teacher that basically just has memorized the lectures and can't answer a question in more than one way. Her exams are based on tiny little things and are super annoying. She took off points for missing a semicolon (it's handwritten exams). She's probably the worst CS professor I had, so it gets better!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Hamel gets a bad rap. She teaches the intro CS class to kids that already know how to code so they have a hard time adjusting to Racket which is a really weird language. But I was someone who had very little experience and thought it was easy. If you humble yourself, ask for help, and put in some work you should get an easy A.

She doesnt really teach anything because she probably doesnt know how. She relies on us watching videos every night of some other guy doing stuff and then expects us to be fluent in Racket. Her tests are unreasonable, and if you dont care you are going to fail

Took Cs1101 with her. Most of the lectures are online so you are not required to go to class except on quiz days (depends on whether you take the class in A or C term. If you take in A term, quizzes are everyday but for C term its only Thursday). Her tests are relatively easy. She also gives bonus points if you work with a partner

Personally I found the lectures really clear and helpful. There was a plan for every class and no sidetracking or rambling. I found her very approachable and she responded pretty quickly when I would post a question on the forum.
Extremely unreasonable exam problems and grading, excessively focusing on trivial things rather than true KNOWLEDGE.

I wasn't the best at CS and expected this class to help with that, especially since it was stated that this class was an intro to programming (using Racket), but boy was I WRONG ��. Her lectures are hard to follow, the tests are way to difficult and the point system on the tests fails to recognize the parts of the code you did get right

Prof Hamel is a very nice lady, and I have to give her credit for this, and for being available for help. However, her lectures are quite boring, to the point where even if I payed attention, many lessons did not make their way into my head because the material was just not taught in an engaging manner.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Hamel is a great professor, but CS1101 is a tough class. Her lectures are helpful and she does her best to clear up any confusion. The material isn't too hard to understand, but homework and tests are graded very harshly. Start the homework before the day it's due.

Quizzes every class, usually on the material from the previous class. Make sure you show up at least for the beginning of class. However it's usually good to stay as what she teaches will likely be on the next quiz. 3 Exams, not too bad especially if you use the sample exams. Use the grading rubric before submitting HW. She also posts class code.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I had professor Hamel for 2102 and 1101. 1101: Easy class really only need to show up for quizzes and tests 2102: Essentially AP CS, the class is called object oriented concepts. Concepts is the key word there isn't much coding more theory stuff. Not very fun. The tests were ridiculously harder than they should have been.

If you have prior programming experience don't assume that you'll breeze through this course. 'Racket' is an understandable but difficult language. Many students have a problem with the language and subsequently the professor, which is why she's underrated. Professor Hamel is accessible and helpful, I have no problem with her teaching.
You have to watch the videos in order to understand the class/homework/labs but if you do that you should be fine.

She is nice and patient outside of class. Online notes are more helpful than her lecture. Homework takes time but not so hard; however, figuring out her confusing instructions is way harder than doing homework. Tests are hard and she is a very tough grader. Learning Java isn't too hard, following Hamel's logic is the real challenge of this course.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests are tough

comment: Not as bad as people say, but not great. Encourages good OO programming practices so you will not get an A for correct code if it's not sensible. Homework is time-consuming and autograders are annoying but the assignments are good. Lectures kind of boring; you learn more from reading online. But she really isn't that bad and you'll learn Java.

First thing first, she is really nice and helpful if you would like to meet her in her office hour. She would explicitly explain everything you ask with great patience, and would like to hear and accept your arguments on homework and even tests, definitely helping you improve your grade. So this class is all about No pain and no gain, simple
If you do all the homework and pay attention to class you should be able to ace this course. I did all the homework and it made her tests seem really easy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Made the class much more complicated than necessary, a large percentage of the class received an NR. Pop quizzes almost every day and only three tests make grading almost unfair. Poorly explains new topics.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This class is extremely difficult and is especially difficult if you have never programmed before. Racket is the worst programming language to learn on and there is no help online for it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Soporific.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Extremely hard to understand, the lacks of textbook makes her lecture even harder,  homework is long and hard. I would read a book about java before taking this class, else you will ended up getting a B or lower.

Really tough grader and tests are unrealistic. All tests are handwritten in code. I went to office hours almost everyday for the second half of the term and still did not do well because I couldn't bring my first test grade up. Will not give back points for questions being unclear.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: OK, so I don't like to be hard on people, but Professor Hamel is a fan favorite for being terrible. She is very obscure about what she is teaching, she grades really hard. The class average for the final was a 54, which is terrible. This is supposed to be the second CS class you take at WPI, and she makes it impossible. Don't. Take. It. With. Her.
Her tests are completely based on homework and lectures. She shows how to do problems in lecture and has quizzes every lecture. Homework and tests are really relevant so homework is really helpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Inconsistent grading.

Hamel made my transition into Computer Science much easier. She gives daily quizzes but drops the 3 lowest grades. The homework and exams were fair, and she gives extra credit for working with a HW partner. Her lectures were clear and they went by really fast. You may never use Racket again but it was a good language for beginners. Solid class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Ms. Hamel grading guidelines are very rigid.  Partial credit has a whole new meaning with her, I don't even think she looks into your code!  Grading is based on specific statements rather than how (and if!!) you solved the problem.  Did NOT think that was appropriate one bit.

She expects at least an intermediate level of programming knowledge coming into the course, and assumes prior experience with Java based on how she conducted her lectures. Unclear on homework expectations, tough grader, would not take another course with this professor.

Unfair grading, will ding you for not including things that were not asked for in the assignment whether the code works or not. Quizzes and tests are the same, there is no partial credit. You need to code the way she codes . She also gives a bonus for working with a HW partner so if you have social anxiety, visit  Disability Services.
Hardest class I have taken at WPI mainly because she didn't teach us much. I had prior java experience going into it and it was still incredibly hard.

Assumes everyone to have java experience, even that this course is for java beginners. Pace is so fast that non of the students can take notes. Many online notes and instructions for homework are faulty so we have to search for correct methods by ourselves. Tells students not to email her.

There were many aspects of the class that I really enjoyed but with the way the class is run, it is important that you keep on top of the material. With a good deal of preparation it should not be difficult to succeed. The daily quizzes can get annoying but they do not affect your grade much if you have a few slip-ups.

Unfortunately, this course had no textbook, as any textbook would have been more useful than lecture. She is the most soporific professor I have ever had; she conveys no interest in the course material and doesn't teach it appropriately. As she says on her website, "I'm never satisfied that I've found the 'right' way to teach a course."

Lectures were simple and easy to follow. That was the problem though, they were far too easy compared to the homework assigned and the exams given. The passing average was low on every exam, so she takes that into consideration and scales, which is helpful.

Fantastic! I learned a lot even though I am not a huge fan of Racket. Everything that we did had some kind of purpose. Her tests were very fair. I only consulted the online textbook a few times, but I liked her notes more.
Super easy class especially if you have programming experience. Just do the work she assigns and you could easily pass without paying much attention in class. Be prepared for daily quizzes.

She is tough, but she's willing to help. Some TAs are helpful but some are not, so take your pick. Racket is useless but can help you learn programming logic. In fact, Racket is so limited that you will have an easier time if you don't have programming experience. There are sample exams and you can bring a cheat sheet so exams are not that bad.
While she gives a lot of daily quizzes, they aren't worth much. The few tests are code-on-paper, which sucks, but her lectures are clear, if a bit slow-paced.

I do not recommend this teacher at all. She teachs a CS1101 class but her pace and readiness to explain new concepts looks as if she thinks she's teaching a class for people who have had programming experience before. I would not recommend this teacher to any student. Just take another CS1101 in another term. Plus she gives quizzes everyday.
Hamel teaches CS 1101 the racket class well,  but not the  object-oriented programming class. She uses Fisler's notes and doesn't explain the material well. Try to take Fisler for this class.

Its been two weeks in her class, and the reviews below this one are totally on point.  I already feel like I have been left behind and have resorted to reading the entire book page by page and going through online resources to learn as much as I can.  I have a test coming up, and from the reviews by past students, its going be horrible.  Take the course with a different professor.
Do not ever take classes with glynis unless its racket 1021. She is terrible with Java and her tests and quizzes are hilariously terrible.

She has clear explanations in class and the way she organizes the class makes it very easy to develop a better understanding of the material if you are confused. Unfortunately, some of the ta's are terrible. Finally,  the grading is really confusing because she does not release the rubric, so it is very hard to consistently do well on the homeworks
Take everything she says to heart. One subtle missed test case or one missing java class and you could be docked a lot on homework.

Inconsistent grading. You could show one TA an assignment and he'd say you had everything you needed, and then loose 10 points for missing things. On the midterm the average for a 100+ person class moved 3 points due to people talking to the professor. Tough tests: midterm avg-58, final avg-60. Not clear on grade cutoffs until end of term.
1101? Great. 2102? Terrible.

WPI brags about how 98% of the professors have PhD's. Well, Professor Hamel is not one of them, and it shows. She steals her material from other professors and she is virtually useless as a professor. She expects everyone to have already known some java and it leaves a lot of people behind. Avoid taking her class if you can.
Sucks... She's a terrible professor.
Doesn't actually teach the material.  Gives one generic example and then expects you to just know the material without teaching you what your actually doing.
Just awful. Learned the content online

Initially, I was in CS 1102. After about a week, I switched down into Professor Hamel's class. She taught at a much slower pace, one that was actually beneficial to me. Nearly every day we were assigned videos to watch and then quizzed on them the next day. She is very fair about grading and is willing to talk to you about any grade you relieved.
Very good instructor. Tests were pretty easy and homework really prepared me for the exams. She does assign videos each night and gives daily quizzes on them but they don't take up too much time
SHOULD NOT have taught 2102. Fine for 1101 but OO programming is beyond her. Avoid!
Worst teacher I have ever had, ever.  Had a test where 16250 students got over an 80, didn't scale at all and said it was typical for her class.  Avoid at all costs!
NO. JUST NO.
When I first walked into class, I could smell the mellifluous aura of her computer science skills. It sparked my passion for Java, which reminds me of a mocha latte on a glistening sunset.

Prof Hamel did an OK job introducing students to CS, but CS 2102 with her did not go too well. She is always willing to take your questions and would go all length to help you, just didn't play too well with java and OO programming. CS1101 was OK, but Racket? Really?! Non-majors should just take C or Python for non majors...

Professor Hamel's explanations are usually fairly straightforward and she is helpful answering questions. Grading could be more fair, though, considering she would not scale an exam grade with a below-passing class average. -Some of TAs were unhelpful, other excellent. Overall I found the class worthwhile and would recommend it despite the issues.
horrible Instructor
Not a bad teacher but definitely not the teacher you'll be excited about. She explains things well but is always picky about things.
Overall a pretty good class. Very clearly organized and easy to understand. Made me be a little interested in CS. Definitely would recommend this class.

Average teacher all around. Her lectures are okay and easy to understand. The tests aren't that bad either, since we could use 2-sided study sheets. The main issue I had was with grading policy: I ended up with a C in the class, even though I had received a perfect 100 on the final. The class isn't too bad, but your GPA will definitely suffer.

Interesting course with great  organization. Exams are given back the day after and the grades could often be seen already the same night. I did not have any previous experience with programming so the programming language racket, did not bother me at all. In the first half of the course we had to watch several lecture videos every day as homework.

Overall, I'd say she is good but her tests are VERY tricky. Going from never programmed before to having to program under time is extremely hard. Her test curve was 80 avg for first test then 70 avg for second and the final was like 50avg. Extremely difficult professor. Her tests are meant to trick you.

For someone whose never programmed, she's a great teacher for this course. She has a clear loud voice for a large lecture hall. She has many examples to help you understand what's going on and explains how they work. Her tests aren't awful. They may be tricky but she lets you have a cheat sheet front and back. She taught in DrRacket.
Overall very understandable and very good at answering questions effectively.

Beware at all costs. Decided to do online lectures and just answer questions and do work in a 150 person lecture. AWFUL. Is a very harsh grader. If you have to take CS 1101 find anyone but her to take it with!! Homework and quizzes occasionally had problems we hadn't gone over and didn't know how to do. Awful teacher

Took Java with her. As soon as anyone found out, they'd say "Why didn't you take it with Fisler?" Honestly she wasn't terrible, but she was really boring and did not really explain why things worked the way they do. The first week was translating Racket to Java, which was really slow and painful, but things get more interesting later.

Best prof I've had at WPI. Her teaching is so clear. Now I love CS and want to major in it. Make sure you bring your laptop to class though, because it's easier if you follow along with her, in DrRacket.
She will make you like CS!
Examples are clear and responds to emails quickly. Changed my major to CS after this class!
Good teacher, will go over a subject multiple times if asked. Makes good use of projector and hand written notes. Take notes and the tests aren't too bad, and are curved.

Very clear teacher. Gives examples in class that are very helpful. Study the class examples and homework for exams, and you'll do fine. However, she will NOT give in and bump you up a letter grade, no matter what you do.
Great professor for introductory level to Computer Science. I changed my major into CS after her course. She is good at explaining, focus on applying->Great teacher
Horrible teacher, barely passed. Took 2102 and easily got a B. One of the worst teachers in the CS department. As previously mentioned, take another class instead.

Ok, it seems like a lot of people are getting tainted views since this is their first CS class. STRONG suggestion from a senior? Take Systems Programming Concepts BEFORE this class. This class teaches you some of the WORST programming mindsets, in one of the WORST languages. Avoid this class until senior year, if possible. You'll unlearn most of it

A very good teacher. She was very clear with her explanations and really emphasized coming to numerous office hours for help if you did not understand anything. Very helpful especially if you have never programmed before. This was my first time programming and I enjoyed the class. Too bad she didn't teach CS2102 when I took it.

Great professor. Always answering questions with nice attitude and high clarity. You will get A if you work on it. I think scheme is a good language to built concepts of programme. Highly recommendation to students who learn programme first time.

Great professor! I don't know why people have bad comments about her but I think she is fairly clear about everything! Also my friends who's taking CS2102 with another professor said they would love to have her instead of the professor they are having now!

Great for ppl new to programming. Its called Racket now btw and its crazy simple. You don't use dashes and dots and stuff u legit just type out what u want and it does it. The ppl who say its difficult are complete idiots. Crazy simple class, good clear instructions. Easy A

She's a pretty good teacher.  Very clear with class objectives and explains material thoroughly.  She has lots of TAs and SAs that are very helpful, I highly recommend going to office hours if you don't understand something. Homework is done with a partner which is nice. 3 tests and you get credit for just showing up for labs.

Don't plan on taking a class with her if you plan on having a social life all term. Homeworks took up entire weekends and were the reason for many sleepless nights. Class averages around low to mid 70s on her tests.

Technically she is an instructor not a professor.  Yes, scheme is not a good langauge for an intro class and its design paradigm is radically different from what is used in industry (C/C++, Java, etc.).  Does well with a class that has variety of experience levels.  You pretty much have to take at least one class with her, make the best of it.
why are you teaching scheme???

Exceptional teacher for a student with no background in programming. Her lectures are well organized and clear. She teaches in scheme, a language that most of the class (which experienced students) hates. Those people pretend they know all about programming and don't accept her style of teaching. If you want to learn, listen to her!

Instructor Hamel is great for new CS students; she helps weed out those who just aren't ready to be programmers.  This intro class used Scheme, which is an amazing language for beginners.  People who says Scheme sucks probably didn't do well in the class or just aren't meant to be software engineers.  Some of her TA's are terrible.

Robot Hamel. She is programmed with wierd language Scheme as her smile suggests.  So remember, you need to push a button on her if you do not understand sth.  If not, you will get no help from her. Visit her office often.

During class, she created elaborate and hard to follow diagrams of classes and interfaces that took up several chalk boards. Homework is hard so pick a good hw partner! Final and midterm are hard because you have to code on paper - there's nothing to tell you when you forgot a ; or )
She stresses office hours! And it is really helpful!

She is good but Scheme is hard to understand.  Students usually do not get a good grade in exams coz the tests are given in paper form.  We can't use computer and we don't if our codes are right or worng.  Try to get 100% in hws if you intend to get A in that class.

If you think this woman is mean, you will NOT survive in engineering. Period. If anything, this class was too slow-paced. I don't like having to show up for in-class problems, though, but it's graded so that you can bail on a fair amount of those and labs and still crush it.

Awful. Avoid her if possible. Want an explanation of a problem? Here's a Hamel quote: "Because that's just how it is." I wouldn't recommend taking a class with her if you want to learn the material at all. Her class was probably detrimental to my programming skills.
No no no no NO NO NO NO!!!!

Ms. Hamel was an excellent teacher. She is the perfect teacher to introduce programming to first-year students. She is easy to understand and her homework and classes are fair. Classes encourage to ask questions and there are an adequate amount of help from Ms. Hamel and her several teaching assistants.
Very clear in explaining things,and very logical.The homework is not easy and really takes a lot of time, but it worth trying.First 2 exams are fine but the final is scary...

Had her for CS1101 in A Term. Very good class, made learning a new language easy (even though Scheme sucks). Very understandable for people both with and without prior CS experience. Homeworks can be challenging though, and exams may trip you up, but it's not too bad (gives plenty of help in class). Definitely recommend to have her as a professor.

I think she is a decent teacher. It doesn't help that the material she is teaching (Scheme) is the most impossible language ever. But she seems to know it well and is willing to help anyone having trouble. Homework takes too long but tests are fair.
Very clear and well organized. Would take a class with her again.

Worst teacher I've had at WPI.  Her teaching style is dry and doesn't leave the material fresh in your mind, her organization of the class makes very little sense, and her tests are disproportionately difficult and nonsensical.  I wouldn't recommend this professor to anybody who values their GPA.
The homework could take HOURS to do (sometimes upwards of 5+). Class went over things, but not in depth enough for her unproportionately hard tests.

Could ace the homework (which can sometimes take 4 hours to complete, however) but the tests were a lot harder than expected. The test she gives should have a two hour time slot, not one. Very thorough in class and lots of TAs with office hours for help.
Hated the class.  Hated the teacher more.
No Comments
Ugh, frustrating is a good word for her classes.  At least the projects were easy and the TA's provided great help, but as a teacher id pass on her classes.

I can't believe Professor Hamel is rated this low. She is an incredible professor. The tests were difficult, but definately doable if you studied hard enough. The programs were excellent in terms of material covered and difficulty. They weren't outrageously difficult yet still far from simple.
The class was kind of hard but I have no complaints with the teacher. She presented clearly, was well prepared, friendly and willing to help.

The new Scheme class that replaces CS 1005. Difficult course! (probably because scheme sucks) Nice professor though. Tries hard to help you understand the material. Definately DONT GET BEHIND and go to office hours for help when needed.
wow, very clear lectures, but the homeworks are damn difficult. Tests are fairly easy if you know the materials

The homeworks and tests are good ascessments of how you will do in the course.  If you have taken EE2022, and know any programming, this class should be cake.  The class is well structured, and the professor will always stop to answer questions.
Very clear teaching style.

Deceptive tests that had nothing 2 do w/actual programming,gave me 0's 4 hw passed in thru turnin cause she couldn't find them,almost made me want 2 change majors after having her 4 2 classes,there's no reason for the grades i got having 3 yrs background
Very clear and easy to understand. Homeworks and tests were not that hard.
I think that Prof. Hamel deals with difficult course material well. She explains things fully and is always there to answer questions and offer help. I don't think that she's a bad professor at all.

After 2 terms in a row with Hamel, I nearly went insane. Her test are extremely deceptive, I already new ASM before I took the course, yet I only managed a B. Her stupid jokes made me want to vomit everyday in lecture which was useless anyway.
The only reason that she has low ratings is because she gets a lot of non majors who don't like CS, in her class. this isn't her fault
Very clear & easy to understand
The projects were interesting, but the exams were almost completely unrelated. Not recommended for non-CS majors.
Teaches material that will *never* be used by any CS major ever in their lives. For non-CS majors, she is NR incarnate. AVOID.
I found Professor Hamel to be one of the best instructors that I've ever had.  I learned a lot.
Fair and clear professor.  Assessments were pragmatic and well applied.
Doesn't understand real life CS.  Tests are deceptive, rather than clear.  Code examples are contrived and meaningless.  Absolutely no real-world value to CS.
The earth needs to swallow this woman.
Boring as hell, better then Kliensmith, but that's not saying much. Tests are worth nothing, which is pretty cool, you can have a 60 test ave and good homework, and have a B as a final grade.

Why are you all whining about hamel.  She certainly wasn't a bad teacher.  She went over all the topics and explained them clearly, we had a book which supported what was being taught, projects which reinforced what was being learned, and accurate tests.
No Comments
VERY GOOD professor! She made things VERY clear and provided adequate assistance and fast replies to e-mail. She should teach ALL CS Courses!!!
No Comments
I learned more when I DIDNT go to class
awful
Easy class, taught well, programming needed, ignore the readings, but was good for test.
Her class isn't easy. You need to follow the reading assignment schedule and take notes. She was also very helpful whenever I came to see her during her office hours or contacted her through email.
Why are there so many bad reviews? Most of you probably had more programming experience than I did when I took CS 2005. YOU NEED TO READ THE BOOK. Professors are not there to spoonfeed you!
_IS_ as bad as everyone says. Stay away if you can.
I would have rather had Kleinsmith, at least the test would have been easier and I could have gotten a better grade, because I didn't learn anything with either teacher.
Is not even a real  Prof  (no Ph.D.); keep her away from C++!
Dreadful.  Puts you to sleep at 8AM.  When you are awake, you won't learn.
knows material very well. great job explaining details/ answering questions
She didn't always define important words but very helpful outside of class.
Made me change my major. I used to love CS until I had her
talk about learning a class by yourself, no help at all. she wasted a whole term
better than john kleinsmith, but thats not saying much
No Comments
Not as bad as everyone says... but you do have to have a strong C++ background.
examples, but on paper, help available, hw grading unclear, tests not bad
No Comments
Not as bad as people say, she knows her stuff, tollerable overall
Test's are unfair representation of course material. You better already know C++
her code is written in the form of pictures, which we must try to translate to c
No Comments
Very unhelpful, poor teacher.  Very inflexible regarding course requirements.
horible tech
Tries to play mind games, boring, and incredibly difficult
No Comments
No Comments
hard to do hw when she gives criteria after grading it
I got an A in 2005 ... i knew the material before hand ... hamel == bad teacher
No Comments
I would rather be hit by a truck then have to sit through another glynis class
Will not test you on programming ablity.  Good, cuz she doesnt teach it either
Wow... this class will waste your time like no other ever will.
Not a hard class... but she makes it hard with her quality of teaching.
Horrible Teacher
Class WILL put you to sleep.  Teaches straight from the book.
No Comments
She does not help with anything!
No Comments
Class Sucks
No Comments
No Comments

AWESOME Actual Quotes:  "Welcome back to the land of awesomeness" "Calculus killed magic" "Fantastically, I always do everything correct" "Whhaaaattt?" "Life is evil" "Calculus not fun" "I need some haters to feel better"  In response to a bug in the room: "Who is flying here?  It could into my mouth and then *choking noise*"

He is absolutely wonderful. Helps during quizzes which are reasonable. Gives clear explanations during lectures while also being entertaining. For the final exam he gives previous exam problems for practice which help prepare you for what you will be tested on.

Professor B is AWESOME Overall he is always willing to help. He will stop during class and explain something that you don't understand if you ask him too, he is always easy to approach after class even if you take a lot of time. He's easy to approach during office hours. His grading is a bit odd. About 15 quizes and a final. He will help u on quizs

All around great professor; had him for Calc 2 at ERAU. Very clear, thorough, and encourages students to ask questions. He went over quiz problems in the lecture preceding the quiz, which was super helpful. Sometimes his accent makes it difficult to understand some words, but more often than not it helped me remember the material better.
Dude's AWESOME.
easy A for both calc 1 and 2. He gives out answer to his tests. Very friendly and funny

So Berezovski is an amazing guy, who never fails to brighten any students day. He is can be a VERY easy professor... if you took calculus in high school. His test are open notes. He gives you an example test the class before so do not skip that lecture. His tests usually have a trick question in it. 10 hw questions per week. EASY PASS

He is a really great guy. He always says "awesome" it will make your day better. As a whole, Calculus 2 with professor Berezovski was an amazing experience. You will learn a lot in any course taught by him.

He's awesome and he always reminds us to be awesome too. His class is pretty much interesting 'cause he blends a mixture of different mediums of teaching; for example, animations, videos, slideshows, real-time problem solving. He even helps us DURING the quizzes which leads to better scores. He wears classy outfits too (if this factor counts)

Professor Berezovski is the best. Although his lectures are very fast, you will learn alot from him. Pay attention in class and just copy the notes in your own free time. Do not be afraid to ask a question if something is not clear because he will help you. He is very funny and super fun! Everyone should take his class :)

Prof. B is THE professor everyone dreams to have. He's awesome, funny and wants to help his students sincerely. He gives extra credit points but you should be hard-working to earn them. Take the class!

He is the most popular professor in WPI and the best calc professor I've ever met, but he will not teach anymore here. His lectures are organized and he has a lot of examples to show you how the concept works. His course is easy to get an A.
Berezovski is awesome.
He is awesome, always willing to help, and ots very clear in his lectures.
Super funny and very helpful!

He's a great teacher that really cares about how you do and is willing to help. There was a large chance for extra credit if you wanted it, but each point took a while to do. His lecture moves very fast and he doesn't go through problems with you, but shows an example of him doing a problem so it's a good idea to study if that's not enough for you.
He checks your quizzes while you're still taking them. He points out your silly mistakes so you only lose points if you actually have no idea what you're doing.

Berezovski is the best professor I have ever had. Period. I'm sad that he is no longer teaching at WPI, I would have chosen him for C and D term in a heartbeat. He was funny, a clear teacher, and get the class interesting. He will help you if you're stuck on a problem during a quiz, and he wants you to get an A. He's also got the best style. :P
He wants his students to succeed and motivates his class, even when it's calculus.

Professor B is awesome. His grading criteria is very clear, his quizzes are reasonable, and his lectures are fun (at least as fun as MA1021 can be). He goes over the types of problems that will be on the quiz, so if you pay attention in class you shouldn't have trouble. All homework was done once a week through Pearson's MyMathLab.
Great Prof! Teaches material well and is very clear on what is necessary for exams. Very approachable and extremely helpful.
Best Professor so far!

If I had any other class at 8:00AM I would probably not have gone to as many classes as I did.  This class was a good pick me up in the morning and especially the days where I had a 3 hour lab a few hours prior.  I would take this class again and I regret not signing up for it in B-term.

Great professor. Super clear and helpful. When he saw that one dumb mistake was going to cost me a lot on a quiz, he gave me full credit on the quiz and told me to come to office hours to fix my mistake.
"Awesome!"
Taking another of his classes next term because so awesome

Prof B. is really the most perfect math teacher you can ever have, he is always willing to help his students with their problems, He is every time perfectly prepared for the classes, and he really teaches you how to become a math wizard. He teaches you the most necessary things that will help you solve any problems.
The class is an easy A.  He checks your quiz before you hand it in and you get a second chance on problems that you get wrong the first time.  Very nice and helpful.

I had taken calculus before this and I was a little lost in some topics, but when he explained them, they became crystal clear. His notes were easy to follow although he can move quickly through them. Overall, I think that he is a fantastic professor and I look forward to having him again this term.

Prof. Berezovski is awesome. He really knows his subject; if you're taking a test, he just needs to flip through your paper for (no exaggeration) 5 seconds before telling you that you got everything right. If you make any mistakes, he tells you right there and you get to fix them. Can't wait to have him again B Term!

Professor Berezovski is the a dam good math professor. He knows that calculus can be boring at times but he does his best to make it interesting for students. His explanations are clear and he is willing to help you if you still need it. Good thing I have him for Calc 2
He was a great teacher. He helped when help was needed, the expectations were clear, and I learned a lot.

I just finished Calc 1 with Professor Berezovski and now I regret not getting into his class for Calc 2. His lectures were always clear, focused, and included a good amount of humor.  Professor B focuses on what you need to know and does not bog you down with unnecessary amounts of homework. Overall, a great teacher and a great dresser as well.

Every lecture was posted online if you missed writing something down in your notes during class, and all topics were covered thoroughly. He always made sure we had a chance to ask questions if we had any, and was really good about giving us answers we could understand.   Also, this professor is literally the coolest cat in town. He makes math fun
I LOVED this professor. he is as awesome as his style in clothing. I would highly recommend taking this class. you won't regret it!
Awesome teacher! Lectures are organized and easy to follow, always available for extra help if needed!
Such a baller! Fantastic professor. Best class taken Freshman year.
BEST PROFESSOR EVER

Berezovski is the absolute best! I took Calc 1 online and he would answer my questions in a timely manner. He conveyed all of the material well and he's just an overall great person. I would love to take every math class with him as the professor! I owe him so much! "You can imagine, right?!" - Berezovski

Prof B is the bomb! Had him for Calc 1, 2, 3. Makes jokes to keep you entertained in class and is very straightforward about what material he wants you to know and what's not important. Make sure you complete the homework & study earlier quizzes. Try to get into his classes!

I managed to get in this class even though even the waitlist was filled 2 minutes into registration- a testament to Professor B's talent. He has so far been one of the only professors I've had who I truly believe has wanted his students to succeed. What I enjoyed most was his eccentric, no-nonsense teaching style.
Too bad he doesn't teach Calculus IV this year. Having been stick with him through 3 Calculus sequences, I can guarantee you won't regret taking his class.

Although Calculus 3 tends to be a collection of the miscellaneous (and some difficult) topics of our textbook, Professor Berezovski made completing Calculus 3 manageable.  He is an excellent professor, who is dedicated to his students having a strong grasp of the subject.  It was a pleasure being his student.
I believe he is the best professor I had at WPI, he does everything to help you and makes even calculus 3 a really easy class. I fully recommend this professor he is great!!
Best Professor Ever! Take his class any chance you get! Makes calc fun and interesting! One of the coolest professors who is always willing to help!

Professor Berezovski is one of the best math professors I have ever had. He is very organized and thorough with the material, and he is invested in his students. Good luck trying to get into one of his classes, he is very popular.
Professor Berezovski is my favorite professor. Very helpful. Makes boring material really fun.
Sometimes I think Professor B. is the biggest hipster on earth who just decides to have fun by being an awesome Calculus teacher.
Best math teacher at WPI. One of the best teachers I've had in my life. Bottom line: Take his class.
Awesome professor! Truly cares for his students and always willing to help you out if you seek help. Also, very funny and hip!
Best. Teacher. Ever. Good course with sufficient challenge but he wants everyone to get an A and does what he can to make that happen. Great class to be in, he's just the best.
Best Calculus teacher around! Makes calculus interesting and easy to understand!
What can I say... BEST. CALCULUS. PROFESSOR. EVER.

Prof. Berezovski is the absolute best. I struggled with calc previously, but passed this class with flying colors. Reasonable amount of work, and extremely fair tests. He is humorous and never boring. He helps you out as much as possible (even during quizzes!) and wants everyone to get an A. I would never take a calc class with someone else!

Professor B is awesome! I had him for MA 1021, and before him I hated math. He definitely made it easier to learn. Plus during quizzes, he is super helpful by guiding your thinking or catching small mistakes. I highly recommend him!
Awesome guy. Super helpful and mad chill. Worth the 8am.

Professor Berezovski is by far my favorite professor. He explains everything very well, and is willing to help you out when you're stuck on a quiz. It is easy to tell that he wants his students to succeed.
Prof B. is perfection. He is very clear, engaging, helpful, and wonderfully attentive. If you need help, he's very willing to give you a hand. Plus, Prof B. has STYLE.
Wants students to improve and succeed, helpful, well-dressed and concise
Prof. B is an amazing teacher. His main goal is for his students to succeed. Would absolutely recommend taking him for as many classes as possible!
Great teacher, great personality! Loved every minute of his class! Very engaging and has a unique fashion sense!

Professor Berezovski was helpful and knowledgeable about the material we chose to cover. He gave me very good feedback on how I was doing/where to improve and I would definitely recommend anyone thinking of taking either a regular course or an independent study.
Great Professor.
Best professor @ WPI so far, highly recommend. Helpful and nice!

Awesome! I wish all professor could be like him: stylish, clear, friendly and helpful. He treats students so kind! Always helps and gives hints on quizzes! Highly recommend to take only him for Calculus!
Awesome professor! Take all Calculus courses with him and you will be out of troubles! So clear and easy to follow! Highly recommend!

Best math professor I've had by far. For my class, you could have notes for the quizzes, and when you finished he would check your work over and if you had something wrong you could correct it before passing it in. He personally helps you understand the material if you have trouble. 10/10 would take class again (except not really, its still calc..)
He is great! Best Professor on campus! Make boring lectures funny and keep attention of the class. He made Calc III course fun!
He is very good professor! Helpful, professional and stylish and funny. Cares about students, tries to explain in the simplest way.

Clearly the best and most competent calculus professor at WPI. He cares about student learning more than grades so he is an "easy grader" that way, but you will come out of his class knowing the material very well. He is always happy to help students and offers extra credit. A+

Take as many courses you can with professor B,  He uses technology to help the class stay interesting and helpful.  He is always willing to help if someone is in need and he is clearly one of the best WPI offers.  I had him for calc 1-3 and it was the best decision i could have made.
Professor Berezovski is great at his job. He is clear and very helpful as well as a talented calculus professor. He understands his students and wants every one of them to succeed.
TAKE AS MANY CALC CLASSES WITH PROF B AS POSSIBLE! He's so kind & helpful :)

Prof B is the BEST! He's always willing to help and go out of his way for your own benefit. Easy to pay attention with his funny jokes and entertainment. Makes learning fun and easy! Allowed to use a cheat sheet on all tests so it's easy to get an A. TAKE THIS CLASS (or any classes possible with Professor B)!! :)
Berezovski is the best calculus professor on campus.
Fancy professor, great teaching style, care bout students.
Extremely helpful and kind professor. Helped me a lot to understand Calculus. Best Professor so far.

Professor Berezovski was the M.C. for the Coffeehouse put on by the 2016 Class Board.  He was really funny and entertained the audience, just like he does in his Calculus classes.  His passion for teaching and presenting is amazing.  Great professor with a cool accent.
Best professor ever, miss him so much, wish he teach more courses.
He is a calculus rock star! Extremely helpful and tries to make calculus easy to understand.
Only take calculus with Professor B! He's super helpful and will do whatever he can to get you a good grade and make sure you learn the material. Nicest professor at WPI by far!!
Prof. B is Calculus Genius!
Professor B is amazing! Totally devoted to the success of his students! Makes class fun and provides numerous resources to succeed! He is super nice, positive, and really helpful! :)

The Best Professor at WPI, can't wait to C-term for Calc III with him. Extremely helpful and clear what is main topic of the lecture. Highly recommend if you could get to his class.It is really hard,  it is always overloaded. Sometimes there is no place to sit anymore.

This professor was an asset to each student.  Whenever you needed help, he was available.  When something wasn't clear, he made sure you understood the topic over time.  He was also great for morning classes.  He kept each class exciting and motivated each student to do their best.  Highly recommended.
Diligent, helpful, and he always kept the class motivated.  He is good to have in the morning.

Prof B is EXTREMELY helpful and willing to answer any questions outside of his regular office hours. Tests are not always the easiest, but they will prepare you for the final. Very helpful during the tests & allows one page for any formulas you have not memorized, etc. DEFINITELY recommend him for any level of calculus-STRIVES for YOU to get an A!!

I took Calculus 1, 2, and 4 with Professor Berezovski. He is a great professor who is very interested in seeing his students succeed. His classes make you interested in the material, and he is always willing to help outside of class. He is a very committed professor, is always upbeat during classes, and one of the best teachers I had freshmen year.
Great professor. Very itnerested in helping students. keeps in touch even after having him.

Professor Berezovski is unique, such a helpful and warm professor, truly helps you excel in mathematics. I think he used to be a researcher, so he knows each step in learning the material extremely well. My favorite professor at WPI!

I have had Prof Berezovski for both A and B term, for both MA 1021 and 2022. He honestly wants his students to understand the material and is incredibly helpful in and outside of class. He has numerous office hours and is willing to meet at other times if necessary. He is one of my favorite math teachers to date.

The class quizzes are very easy and you can receive an A if you pay attention.  The only thing that really lowers grades is the final. Be sure to do all of the practice exams, and go to him if you need any help.  Out of all the professors for Calculus he is definitely the one that is the best teacher. He is engaging and loves to teach.
He is my favorite teacher. He does his best to make sure everyone is interested in the subject and is always willing to help. If you can take a class with him you definitely should.

He's a bomb teacher. His class is tough but he is more than willing and urges you to sit down with him and ask questions. He is sometimes difficult to understand due to his bomb accent but will clearify himself you just need to ask.
He's a really good professor. He's not always very clear, but he really cares about the students and he'll help you if you ask for it.

Prof. Berezovski boosts your interest in the class. He know how to maintain the class interested and make calculus entertaining and fun. He knows how to explain very well and makes the goals and objectives easy to understand. He is a great professor, probably one of the best I've had so far here in WPI. 100% recommended to any student.
Professor B is the man, that's really all you need to know!

Professor Berezovski is an amazing teacher and the best that I have had during my first two terms at WPI. He is so energetic and enthusiastic! He really helped me understand calculus better than my previous professor. I would definetly recomend him. I do not regret taking that 8 AM class :)
Awesome prof - lots of fun and not hard to get a good grade in his class. He also tries to keep class fun and has an incredible sense of style.

Straight out of GQ we hav Prof. B, not only does he dress well, he is the best at teaching as well. He explains everything perfectly and assigns the right amount of homework to help you learn the material. Do all the work and you will get the grade you deserve. Makes class enjoyable and a pleasure to go to. Highly recommend him for Calc 1-4.

Great professor. Very helpful on quizes. Very fair grader. Makes content easy to understand.  If you do the work assigned you will get an A in the class. One of the best dressed professors at the school. Very funny, will make you laugh. Would reccommend him to any student.

Berezovski is the MAN! he explains calc. well and is a very fair grader. The Russian accent makes him that much more awesome. If you don't understand anything he is very helpful in office hours and is very available. If you want to get a good grade in calc, understand the material and have an enjoyable teacher I highly recommend him!
Great teacher! He is always willing to help if you don't understand the material. He is very nice and friendly.
I love him so much! He's wonderfully dressed and his homework is the best.

Great professor, will help you with any problems or issues you have. Sets the class up in a way that you will pass with flying colors unless you don't take the tests or quizzes. I definitely recommend this professor for anyone taking the basic calculus courses (MA 1021-24)

This professor is awesome.. his quizzes are great because he helps you while you are taking them! I definitely recommend this class-you learn a lot and you can get an A for sure! I looked forward to his class every day, even with it being at 9am!
Amazing Professor! Very Funny and has a lot of respect for his students. Loves teaching math. Great sense of humor. Easy to get an A if you do the work. It was a pleasure being in his class. ;)

Great guy. Super helpful. He really wants you to do well and understand the material.  If you pay attention and do the minimal homework you will do great. Very interesting & always dressed nice. One of the best professors I have encountered at WPI

Prof. Berezovski is absolutely the man. He keeps kids interested by making jokes, he gives a fair amount of homework that he will give you help on, and his quizzes are very fair. I loved having him and I highly suggest trying to get him for any of the calculus courses. He really wants his students to do well and enjoy his class, and you will!

Prof. Berezovski will do anything to help his students! If you don't pick up on new material quickly, he is the professor you should take. He will allow you to retake anything you've got a low score on :-) He's super nice, funny, and is pretty fashionable! Great guy.

Mr. Berezovski is the man. Very straightforward and honest person. He clearly puts effort into making his daily lectures helpful and entertaining. Assigns just enough homework (not much) to reinforce the content and pass the quizzes as well as ace the final. If you pay attention in class Mr. B. will tell you everything you need to know.
Loved him :) one of the best professors at WPI. Really helpful and cares about everyone.

He is a great teacher who makes calculus very clear and easy to understand. Some quizzes are hard but he always helps if stuck and gives very reasonable grades. No tests and homework is easy if you go to class. Best teacher i have had
Professor B is the best, very helpful and easy to understand math with him.
very easy to understand and very clearly teaching

Despite a thick Estonian accent, he's very easy to understand, and very clearly teaches his subject.  He also teaches very useful shortcuts and alternate methods to solving problems.  I highly recommend.
Great professor, Innovative and fun.
Amazing Teacher!! Great for Math and he is very helpful!!
Exceptionally helpful when you are stuck.  He has excellent office hours, he is efficient in class, and adamant about putting his lectures online right away.
GREAT Professor! Always willing to help, help a lot with homework during office hours, point out what you should know exactly. You always know what to expect on quizzes. Highly recommend!
Amazing professor, the style and the manner, very helpful, easy to follow, quizzes like homework.
Best potentially metrosexual professor ever with an amazing fashion sense.
Great professor, highly recommend him. He is calculus genius :)
Very good professor. I  highly recommend him. Help me a lot with understanding Calculus
His is the best. Care a lot of his students, always willing to help, very enthusiastic, I highly recommend him.

Such a great professor! always willing to help students. Tests are like examples from class and homework, so if you go to class and do your homework you'll be fine. Highly recommend him as a professor!

I don't see the big deal about him.  He's nice and easy, always interested in helping students but I found his lectures incredibly boring- he didn't seem to care about the subject and doesn't have the best handwriting.
I love him!

very helpful and cares about his students. If you finish a quiz early and he sees that you made a stupid mistake, he will give it back to you so you can fix it. Passionate and energetic and easy to talk to outside class hours
He is so helpful, he makes all things quite simple and always told to what to be prepared for.
Great professor, highly recommend.
Berezovski is such a good professor that I dropped calc IV so that I could take it with him two years from now.
very good professor strongly recommended
Brilliant! I nerev want to skip his class. He is always wicked funny and cover all material very clear. I highly recommend him!
He is the fairest professor so far. I like his lectures. Always willing to help.
By far, the best professor at WPI! His lectures are interactive, very clear, and easy to understand.
Great professor! Very helpful. Makes the lectures funny and easy to understand. Love his style!

Literally the greatest teacher I've ever had. Explains everything in depth with multiple examples, always keeps the class laughing. When you hand something in, if he finds an error, he'll point out what you did wrong and let you fix it - He even allows this on the final, overall great teacher.

An extremely lenient grader. If you pass in your quiz and he finds an error, he'll let you correct it. Wicked funny as well. His handwriting's a little sloppy, but he speaks English well. Does a lot of practice problems. Doesn't use the book at all (copies problems over for homework). Really liked his class.

I had already taken calc in high school so this class was mostly review, but he was a great teacher. Very enthusiastic, very fun, good sense of humor. His accent wasn't too hard to understand as long as you're paying attention. I would definitely recommend him.
He was an awesome professor. Definitely would recommend taking any class with him.  He was easy to understand and was always willing to help students.
Great professor! I love his style and attitude!
Good professor by all means.  Can be funny at times.  Nice guy always willing to help if needed.  Has accent but is very understandable.

He is not respectful of students. I went to his office hours for help understanding what i did wrong on an exam and he told me that I dont deserve to be at WPI and that he would not help me.

I somehow passed, no thanks to him
Confusing lectures. Only does examples and no theories which makes it really hard to follow what he is doing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor's lectures are hilarious, but I have a hard time getting behind a linear algebra professor who doesn't teach geometric meanings of concepts, it was strictly calculations. Learned more from watching 2 hours of 3 Blue 1 Brown than from this entire course. Also uses Diagonal method for 3x3 matrices.
Most boring class ever
Funny guy. Lectures are good, although he makes a lot of mistakes. Very nice guy and responds to emails fast. Fair grading and good explanations. Good professor.

He is a nice person, but I wouldnt say he is an excellent professor. He does not have conferences or office hours, which makes the course even harder than it already is. He does not clarify on many things, and the hw can be confusing sometimes. But he responds to emails really fast, and tries to remember everyones name. He is a nice guy :((
The class was honestly fine. Just pay attention to the announcements/emails and go to the extra lectures and conferences.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: He is a nice guy, but the class lacked structure. His lectures were hard to learn from, the conference with the PLA is how I learned. Projects were pretty hard, but he scales the grade so no one can fail. The final exam was only on one subject matter and very easy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Don't let the jokes fool you, this man is one of the worst Professors at WPI. Definitely the worst in the Mathematics department. While he does try to include humor in MA2051, he does not teach the material at all and expects you to just "figure it out." If you reach out to him, he'll definitely respond, but it won't be helpful. Good luck.

What a goof. Always laughing at his own jokes. He taught most of the material quite well with some pacing issues. Sometimes hard to understand him through his accent (especially when hes giggling) but i definitely enjoyed his class. Not a bad choice for MA1023
Lui goes a little fast, but he is a generous grader and a pretty nice guy.

Professor Lui is the funniest professor I have had at WPI. His sense of humor got me through his class. In terms of teaching, he does sometimes have trouble hearing and understanding the questions of the students. He tries very hard to know everyones names. He also gave us plenty of hints for the tests. He lets you bring a cheat sheet in for tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: I enjoy this professor a lot because he's very entertaining and knows what he's talking about, however he gives extremely hard problems on tests and I had to do a LOT of work outside the class to keep up. I also discovered that it seems we cover more course material than many other MA 1023 classes, which makes it that much more rigorous.
The lectures were understandable, the work was a good evaluation of the material taught, and I didn't need the textbook to learn, lectures were enough.

Roger is a great professor here at WPI. He truly cares about his students, and sets you up for the future. Put in the work, go to his office, and you will be fine. I have taken many classes with him, and plan to do more.
rating_tags: Inspirational--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He posts lecture notes in time after every lecture, which is well-organized, so you don't even need to attend a single lecture to do well in this course. Also, he provides one or two practice exams and a couple of past exams before midterm and final, as long as you do those problems well, you will get a high A with ease.

Clearly knows what he's talking about at the same time being chill. His notes are neat and clear, and he posts them after every class. He doesn't berate you for asking questions and answers them clearly. His tests are straight-forward as long as you take notes. He has an accent and on occasion makes dry humor, but you get used to it after a while.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Rudest teacher I have ever had.
Is an awful teacher. Does easy problems for notes, gives easy homework questions, and then puts stuff on the quizzes/ tests never seen before. Also is hard to understand. However, he is a good guy.

Hilarious guy. If you pay attention and attend classes, you shouldn't have much of an issue. Does pretty well at getting students to understand the concept (why you are doing something) rather than just memorization. Don't take if you get annoyed easily, but for the majority of people he is a fantastic teacher.

Prof. Lui is a great guy, his tests are hard but he is a wonderful teacher and very willing to help out anyone who needs it. I had heard that he was an awful teacher prior to taking his class, but when I actually sat in his classroom as a student I found that he's great, and he LOVES what he does, which is sometimes hard to find.

Prof. Lui is a really funny guy - I thoroughly enjoyed all of his lectures. He's good at providing clear explanations during class - you just have to pay attention. If you pay attention in class, work on the homework early, and go to him if you have questions you should be okay. He tends to cover material quickly so make sure to go to class!

Roger Lui is a straight savage. His lectures are filled with awkwardly placed jokes which lands him a 5/5. The example questions in class are basically your exam. Even if you pay minimal attention in class, you should still pass with an A. If not you should strongly reconsider becoming an engineer. If he learns your name be prepared to be called on
What a man and what a cutie. Called me Elvis after on bad hair day. Hilarious man. Once he learns your name you will he called out constantly.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He called me out for eating a sandwich...

I had no clue what we were doing at any point in the class. I did all homework and studying based on the few examples he gave. Very hard to understand and random. His jokes were funny, or at least the timing of them made them funny because they were so out of the blue. Only went to class because of the clicker quizzes.
hilarious professor but tough grader, and can be very confusing at times. homework didn't come in accordance with the teaching. Sometimes even forgot what he said previously and made things worse

Professor Lui was an okay professor but great guy. Homework and quizzes are really easy and only gives one exam that was super easy. Only thing I felt unprepared for was the Common final at the end of the year. Overall, super funny guy but not the best professor. Also has clicker questions so you have to show up to class for those.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Doesn't go into a lot of detail but is very funny and exams made by him are very fair. Questions are basically set up the integral so if you know what you're doing its a easy A on tests if you study. Doesn't throw curve ball questions which is really nice! Common final is the only reason i might not get an A. Really funny though .
Clear lectures, tests were straightforward with no curveballs

Prof Lui is a funny guy during class and off class. His lectures are sometime hard to follow, thus it's strongly recommended to do the optional homework on textbook. Optional homework helps you understand his lecture materials, and it's super helpful on quizzes and exams! Not a hard class but requires works.

Roger is a really nice guy and teach things pretty well. He deserves a higher score than only 3 in this website. Participation is extra credit. 2 exams, 4 quizzes, and 5 webwork is all the thing that matter to your grades. You can do very well as long as you finish all the homework he assign. Webwork is super hard but will not be in exam )

Little hard to understand what he's saying, but he works hard to make sure you get the material . If you have questions do ask him. Great class layout with conferences. Do go to conferences. Conferences helped refine what lui covered in class.
Confusing lecture, I self-taught and learned from the TA

Roger Lui is a terrible professor, and here's why I would never recommend him to another student. His teaching in lecture is unbelievably confusing. When questions are asked, more often than not the class is left more confused than before. There is no partial credit in this class. Professor is straight up rude to students during office hours. 0/10

Spends all his time on derivations or examples without actually explaining anything. Rarely gave partial credit on exams. Gets side-tracked easily and just talks to you about random stuff instead of helping during office hours.

Rog was hilarious! Very kind professor, sometimes calls students out for no reason at all, but is all in good fun. Wants you to ask questions and go to office hours. If you do , he will remember you for the rest of the term. Very enthusiastic and into what he is doing. Homework is manageable, and tests are pretty easy if you STUDY (it's a thing!).
Rog was awful. Had zero empathy, wouldn't help you at all, and graded tests extremely harshly. Would avoid like the plague.

Lui is a hilarious professor. He will totally call you out for not knowing something, but he is very nice about it and funny. He really keeps your interest with all of the jokes he tells, but also gets the point across. People either seem to love him or hate him. I definitely love him. You just can't take the class too seriously (study though).
Absolutely zero predefined grading criteria

He is actually a very inspiration teacher, this course lead me in the world of modeling, thanks a lot. But I have a free rider teammate, so I did almost everything in our project, we got the same grades finally.....

He got very excited when presenting proofs and was always willing to help students. His tests were based on computation and needed to be done quick. Quizzes were based on proofs and needed a lot of studying. He also loves Bitcoin, you should ask him about it.
He is fairly a good instructor and exams are easy.

Pretty meh. Wasn't really interesting, and he made quite a few mistakes during lectures. Overall progress is slow, and although he writes down quite a few stuff not all are useful. Those few days when Farr substituted him were the highlight. Exams weren't hard, he gave out quite a lot of homework, somewhat helpful in answering questions

Roger Lui was a fairly good instructor, though for some topics I thought him an unnecessarily harsh grader. Unfortunately he has a habit of disrespecting students and acting unprofessionally while leading class. I would recommend any student to avoid his classes, or at least consult with a student who has had him before.

Lectures and notes are extremely messy and not helpful. Test grades are not fair. I got a hundred on first test and solved every single question for second, but failed it. Better avoid him. If it's too late, just fail it. Don't try hard, you get not even B. Better get NR from him so that you can take it with another prof.

Had him for Calc II and Diff Eqs.  He is a great man and a great lecturer.  Diff Eqs was a lot of work, but he explains the material really well and is always willing to help students.  I would highly recommend Roger.

He does not teach to the level of the test and can not focus long enough in class to get through an entire problem. He is very distracting and relied on another teacher to do most of the work. Also could not explain problems well and messed up all the time. Recommend another teacher.

Roger is the man!!! One of the best professor's I've ever had, hopefully I'll be having him again for Diff Eq. I thought he explained stuff well, and makes it fun so you remember.  Will know your name by the first day.  Tests are very fair, though the Final was kind of hard.  Take a class with him!!
Had for Calc II; knows everyone in the class, amazing teaching style, genuinely cares about everyone in the class. If you can have him, do
Entertaining professor.  Very friendly and pretty helpful.  Holds lots of office hours for help and knows material well.

Knows everyone's name in class make sure you come. Very funny teacher and explains everything well. Homework and Webwork are easy and he will always go over questions. Tests are only 6 questions and very similar to practice tests he posts online.

Roger is a great guy who made class enjoyable. He offered help if you needed it and was aware of your performance throughout the course. He is a great professor and I wish I had him for my next calc class because I learned a lot in his course.
He is so excellent

Awesome teacher. He is known for constantly making jokes throughout the lecture. I had him for Ordinary Differential Equations, and he knows how to teach the material. You get to know him well if you go to his office hours, and he also calls on people throughout class to answer a question. I highly recommend him. Great for MA 2051.
He will make you laugh. His exams are straight forward, half the test is homework problems. The class did move rather briskly, but do not fall behind in the homework and you'll be fine.

FANTASTIC lecturer. Keeping a class laughing while teaching differential equations is a feat only Lui can pull off. Tests and homework were reasonable, nothing "Tricky." Only complaint was somewhat questionable grading/curving policies..very harsh on the partial credit and curve.

Great teacher. He might go a little fast, but it is WPI. He likes to make jokes during class (sometimes at students expense), which makes for an enjoyable lecture. Just attend class if he knows you. He know when you don't, and calls you out for it. And go to conference to pick up papers, or he'll give 0's at the end of the term for them.
Roger is a good prof. pretty funny sometimes. good explanation of material. very involved in helping students do well. it your fault if you dont pass. pretty much begs kids to go to office hours

Anyone who has the opportunity to take a math class with Rodger Lui should! He is the best teacher, he cares about the students, he is hillarious, and he actually TEACHES you. Great experience in Calc II. Grading is fair, and he prepares you for the final. Lui is the man!
Not the same guy other people have commented. He cares about students, is helpful, clear, and tests are very do-able. Very funny too!

Worst Teacher i ever had...  he made a high school level statistics class hard...  worst examples i have ever seen in a math class...  He asked the class who was moving on to stats II and then preceded to say that we were screwed because he had not taught us anything.
really funny will keep you awake but he likes to make his class really hard and gives tons of HW. good at office hours
The class itself was wicked hard, but Lui tried to keep it interesting. He's very random, but fun. All in all, I would recommend everyone take a class with him at least once.
Funny man but tests and quizzes are very hard.  Very strange professor and often off topic or unorganized lectures.  More interested in theory and proofs then application or examples.

His "tricky" days are over! When the class did so-so on the first test, he took over conferences from the TA, simplified the second test to questions nearly directly from the homework, and did almost a week of review for it. He's a great teacher, genuinely wants us to pass, and has a great sense of humor. Basically he's the man.

overall not very good. didn't explain things well, taught from a powerpoint. learned most of the material in lab. also, his exams were nothing like the problems we would do in lab and hw, so that made exams interesting. overall, however, i wouldn't reccomend him.

Not a good teacher.  I feel like if the class average is 60% perhaps it is the teacher that is the problem.  This quickly becomes the problem for us, the students. We need to know this material, yet no help if offered.  Very poor, I shall avoid taking a class with him again if possible.

Some might call him a DIAMOND in the rough. I just call him rough. I'm all for diversity but for the price I'm paying for this course, I want a prof who speaks clearer English and is more helpful and less tricky. If you have to take him, take him...but go into the course with your eyes open. The guy is tricky and he deserves his tricky nickname.

Great guy. Specialty is in biological mathematics, so all of his problems relate to biology. He's not easy, but he's helpful and fair to those who are willing to work, and his accent is no problem at all. Learned quite a bit in this class.

Roger is awesome!  He makes every class interesting, and always likes to joke around. He also is a great professor.  He not only takes the time to explain things in class whenever someone needed help, but he also would arrange times to meet outside of class to make sure every student did well.  His tests were a bit tricky but otherwise he is great

Lui was great for Calc I. He's pretty funny and engaging. Lectures were always clear and the homework assigned was very helpful. As others have said, his tests are fair, bit difficult but they make sure you know the material (makes the final easy). Once as a hint "sqrt(2)" -it was not needed. If you study, though, you'll be fine.

absolutly flipped out on a class, broke down and almost cried after he got so mad he threw his chalk and eraser  because a kid asked a question and lui said "because teacher says so" as an explanation, then when he asked again and said "because i said so" isnt going to help him learn the material
Lui is the man. He genuinely wants you to know the material and pass. He is at times hard to understand, and his explanations are usually bizarre, but he is considerate and caring. Give him a chance.
Great Professor, in class he is engaging and often hilarious. Tests were all open book open calculator; they could be challenging at times, but always seemed fair.
Very good teacher.  He is not "tricky".

Amazing professor. I'll admit I was a bit leery of him at first due to his nickname, but his sense of humor and his teaching ability brought me around. Exams were difficult, but they were fair. I found him to be always willing to help, and always willing to answer questions. Put in your fair share of work, and you'll do well in this course.

For Mathematical Modeling, Professor Lui was fantastic.  I can't guarantee the same for introductory calc classes, but with a class he loved and related to his research, Lui did a great job in teaching the material; more importantly, he taught us how to think like applied mathematicians.
awful professor.  Dont bother going to him for help, you won't get any.  Can't understand a word he says in class either.
couldnt learn from him, horrible accent and talks really fast

Prof. Lui is amazing and hilarious. To this point, I have not noted any exceptionally "tricky" behavior on his part. It's true he is sometimes difficult to understand, but he's happy to clarify things if necessary. The material is challenging, but bearable. Prof. Lui is a very funny man; every class is a blast.

He doesn't deserve his bad rep. His "tricky" days are over and he is an excellent teacher. I learned a lot from him last year in Calc 3. The tests were pretty easy and followed homework problems to the T.
Terrible professor.  Does not offer help outside of class.  His tests are very hard and are often "exception to rules."  Homework is ridiculous and he only grades 1:8 problems.

"Tricky Lui" - Intentionally put an incorrect hint on the board for a test to trap the students.  80% of the class used it...thinking that the professor was trying to teach them.  I guess he was.  He laughed when he told the class that if you used the hint, you were wrong...because he is "Tricky Lui"
This man is evil. He comes from the depths of hell. And he laughs about it.

my god this was the worst professor i have ever had at WPI...you can't understand him, his tests are ungodly insane, his homework is just ridiculous to comple in the aloted time, and he makes really really stupid jokes in class that begin to annoy you after a while
He is awful.  Intentionally mislead entire class of students and laughed about it on a major test.  80% + failed test.
Lui is the worst professor i have ever had.  he is by far the worst professor ever, in the history of ever.
Judge yourself here are some facts (out of 29): 2 A's, 4 B's, 21 C's and 2 NR's.
you learn alot, but takes off way too many points on tests, very hard
Professor Lui is a good teacher and was very willing to help; and doing things like setting up review sessions.
He made some mistakes during lecture, but overall the class was pretty easy, and my god, he is so funny.
He's really funny, kept me awake :)
he's funny.
Awesome professor. Explained everything extremely well in plain English (albeit with accent). Has a sense of humor, and enjoys cracking corny jokes. He immensely enjoyed teaching our class.

Everybody had me really scared about Lui...but he is an awesome teacher! I found him very easy to understand and learn from. If you do your homework/ask for help when you need it (which he is more than willing to give), you'll do fine.

He's an amazing teacher, he gets the point accross and will answer any question you have for him in a very clear manner. He's really funny and makes his class a fun time.  I didn't find anything "tricky" about him and would love to have him agai
I think that he's a good teacher. You just have to put in your share of the work, in other words study and do your homework.

I thought Lui was an awesome teacher. He knew and could communicate well the course material, and his joking around was great. Alot of people seem to have trouble with him though... I think as long as you do the HW, you should be fine in this course.

He was the worst professor I encountered at WPI.  He would lecture about one subject. He would then assign homework on something completely different.  His tests were on subject not covered in the hw or in class.  He failed 50% of his classes that Dterm.

Took MA2051 in the fall of 04.  Probably the best teacher in the school.  Go to him for extra help and he'll make everything clear.  No one has any right to complain unless they're retarded...in which case they'd never understand the material

Unlike the authors of all the high-rating comments here, I'm not easily fooled into thinking I'm getting an education when my time is simply being wasted by this professor who doesn't really care enough to help students.
