Lui was an awesome teacher.  He told you what he was gonna teach, then he taught it while being perfectly clear with everything.  in addition to good teaching, he made the class a lot of fun to go to joking around and whatnot.

Ridiculously difficult to understand and learn from. Anyone who gets that much pleasure from failing students should not be teaching, and you know something's wrong when 79% of a class fails and the administration has to "step in" and change gra

I like this professor because he's hard. Most of the students who put bad ratings are slackers and the type who would rather party than study. I had no problem making an A in this class. It's nice to see a professor who isn't afraid of failing students!
OMG how can you complain...chance for a clean slate with the last test (anyone remember alternative grading scheme?). And 4 cheat sheets for it! And give him some credit...he worked his @ss off.

I don't believe the material to be very difficult yet he makes it very difficult. The hardest amterial of the course was within the first week or so. The homework problems required Maple yet we couldn't use calculators on the test.
No Comments
Tricky is quite possibly the most horrible professor/teacher I have ever encountered.  Not only does he not know how to teach, he dose not know how to grade.
I hate him more than anyone else at WPI.  Gets off on failing students.  Really pathetic.  And no speaky English.
There couldn't be a worse teacher. He should be an embarrasment to the school!

Extemely difficult class, but despite what others may say, Tricky Lui really did do a very large amount of work to ensure that people passed.  Interesting lecturer at least.  He was just the messenger of one of the hardest messages ever.

Fails a lot of kids, singles kids out during class and makes them feel stupid, tests are ridiculously hard. Occasionally some of his jokes are funny, though - in that "what is this guy smoking?" sort of way.

Right now I am sitting in his help session. This is rediculous. He is reviewing the first section of the course. The one that we all know 26% of. Yeah, this is helpful... real helpful.  Tricky Lui is the worst professor ever.  never take his class
THIS GUY IS A JOKE. He makes no sense with his all-or-nothing tests that you cant finish within the time period. BEWARE!
This guy is a complete ****.  He just completely sucks.  The worst part is that if you take him once, he'll fail you.  So you'll need to take him again.

he picked on my almost every day of class. but that wasn't what was bad.  It was how he made other people feel so worthless about themselves... i stronly urge you to only take this class if you have a high self esteem and don't mind going home crying

Tricky Lui is the worst excuse for a professor in the world.  He does not care about the students whatsoever and is a horrible human being.  He is not approachable and is demeaning in class.  NEVER, NEVER take his class.  HE IS TERRIBLE!

Evil teacher.  Makes fun of questions.  Recieves complaint emails and proudly forwards them to the class mailing list.  Introduces new material for final during an "optional" review session the night before.  Avoid at all costs!

This teacher is horrible...on our first exam only 3 out of like 180 passed...and so he gave us a make-up which was harder than the original. He won't answer questions, he grades you all or nothing with no partial credit. He'S EVIL!!!!

Tricky Lui should not be teaching.  He refuses to answer questions in class and openly makes fun of those who ask.  On our first exam the average was a 25%...He gave us a make up exam that was harder than the original. WPI needs to do something about him.
terrible teacher

Very difficult and irrational tests.  Homework is entirely unrelated to exam material, it doesn't help because the difficult questions that you need practice in, can only be done with Maple (math software).  He is very apathetic towards his students.
WORST TEACHER EVER. If you have financial aid, don't even consider taking a class with this guy. For the first test, 199 of 200 students failed. The guy who passed got a 74. RUN AWAY
He sucks! He isn't clear at all. Tries to spend time to help, but in the end his tests are nothing like what he preps you for.
This guy sucks at life. he puts students down, accuses people of cheating and he's just a general ass.
This guy is classic; everyone at WPI should have him once.  He is the funniest prof I've had.  HW is wicked hard though, and of course, beware of his tricks on exams!  Tricky Lui  for a reason.
One of the worst professors in the school. Can't teach. Puts students down for his own sake.
unhelpful, hard to understand, called Tricky Lui for a reason
Not that bad.  Just go to class and pay attention.  He is helpful.  Funny too.
Easy class, just need to organize the material yourself, cuz not very clear
very hard, did not explain material clearly
He calls himself  Tricky Lui , and he makes fun of his own accent.  Amazing.
He is NOT a helpful professor, nor is he flexible or understanding.
Funny as hell
Although the course is difficult and there is a lot of homework, the professor is very patient and teaches at a good speed. Would take again
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Honestly the best math professor. Makes jokes, brings in props to help visualize concepts, explains and will re-explain as you need, great office hours, checks to see if everyone understands and is on the same page, will answer questions clearly. The homework is A LOT, but break it down like he intends you to, and it'll be much easier to manage.

His lectures were information heavy and he cared about the "why" behind the math we were doing, meaning I sometimes lost how to actually complete the problems we were working on. The first hw assignment was around 90 problems, but after that they were closer to 30 (thankfully).

Lectures were in depth and helpful. Exams were similar to the practice exams posted on Canvas. This professor really wants everyone to succeed and was good at answering questions in class. Class examples were helpful and relevant to what was on exams.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor assigns excessive homework (up to 90/week), unresponsive to requests. Emphasizes theory over application in class. Paper quality subpar. 3 exams worth 50% grade. Neat but confusing notes. Avoid if preferring practical learning.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Had him for Calc 4, hes a nice guy, assigns a lot of work which is from the textbook. Lectures were not recorded, and not always accessible in person, he monitors his email like 24/7 and wants to help. Sometimes made me feel stupid for not knowing something. Id take him again, and would recommend him (except for the work & we had to write a paper)
100% would recommend don't be afraid to reach out.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Goulet is great! While his lectures are a little boring he is very good at explaining difficult concepts. Definitely go to his office hours he is very helpful!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Had him A22 and he made calc 3 much less of a behemoth. Don't get me wrong the class is hard but if you go to class and use his practice tests to study you will be fine. Discussion is alright, mostly just practice problems. Homework can be a pain however, but there are only 6 of them. You have to pass two out of the three exams to pass the class.

He is a great professor! Well-organized lectures, holds a lot of office hours every week, and cares about understanding the content. The class is homework-heavy so you'll want to start it before the day it's due. He assigns a lot of problems that are due once a week, so very manageable. Use his resources and you'll do fine. Highly recommend him!
Very dry sense of humor, very much enjoyed. Class was hard, but Calc III always seems to be. I don't think he did anything wrong, Calc III is just always bad.

rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Took during Covid, his recorded lectures were FANTASTIC! Everything he talked about made so much sense, which is so difficult to do with Calc. The teacher can easily make or break someone's experience with math, and he's the one reason I like math enough to consider taking math beyond what I need for my major.
Goat
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Absolute best professor I have ever had. He cares so much about his students and really wants you to pass his class. He is also very good at going into detail in his lectures.

Very experienced professor. Not too harsh at all. Makes everything clear before tests, teaches the relevant material, and provides great examples. Easy to talk to before or after class. Not the most captivating lectures- he posts the notes after class which are all you need. Homework is helpful, grading is mostly reasonable. Would recommend.

I learned so much from him and his lectures. He did lots of examples so we were ready for the exams. Webworks were useful and we had unlimited attempts. The worst part was the written homeworks, which were long and had topics we hadn't learned. Still, these difficult problems never came up in the exams. He answered emails quickly and was helpful.
Great Professor
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Love him, love him, love him! Take math with him, he makes it so easy! Just pay attention in class and sometimes the homework is long, but the practice exams are the same as the actual exam! MAKE SURE YOU HAVE GOULET!

THIS MAN IS THE BEST MATH PROFESSOR I'VE HAD. If you just pay attention in class and do the practice test, then you can get an A. The practice test is basically the actual exam. My lectures were also recorded which was awesome. There are literally no tricks. Do yourself a favor and take math with him.

Honestly, close your eyes and imagine the perfect human being. You probably imagine a kind hearted soul, who cares deeply about you and your well being... Open your eyes, and that's Jonathan A. Goulet.

Goulet is overall a great guy. He is easy to work with, understandable, and reasonable. His lectures are as interesting as calculus lectures can be, and he really makes sure students understand topics.

Professor Goulet is a great teacher, and makes it very easy to do well in his class. That being said, if you are not interested in Multivariable Calculus it will be difficult. For the first homework assignment he gave us nearly one hundred problems. I did way more work in this class than I did in Calc 3. Expect a lot of work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He recorded the classes so you don't need to attend. Homework is plentiful and difficult, but it is essential to pass the 2 tests. My hw TA grader was ridiculously fast and precise. The tests were very fair and represented the material well. I did much better on the tests than I thought I did. He tries to make the lectures interesting.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: He explains everything in a fantastic way and is passionate about the mathematical connection to the majors of his students. Always a very nice guy. Always go to lecture and down procrastinate if you watch his lectures. HW is due once a week, and when spread out over the week is very manageable (about 5 problems per night). Highly recommended.

Goulet will take the time out of his day to help you if you just ask for help. I had him for Calc 3 and 4 and would always be there whenever I needed help. I would email him at 8:30 on a saturday night extremely desperate and he would get back to me in less 30 minutes. Highly recommend Goulet as a professor.
There was so much homework the class took up a lot of time outside of lecture, and he makes you feel stupid for asking questions in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: A king amongst men. Took Calc III and IV with him and both were a breeze. Funny, easy to talk to, and could probably successfully explain these mathematical concepts to a middle schooler. I swear by this prof. Take his classes, you will NOT regret it.
didnt let me change my conference so i could get into physics.....

Professor Goulet is the best professor I've ever had at WPI. I had him for both Cal3 and Cal4. The homeworks come from textbook, but textbook is not required. The three exams are relatively easy, if you pay attention to the conference material you can easily get a high grade. He doesn't give any quiz at all. He will record the lecture every time.

Goulet does sometimes give a lot of homework and when it comes down to the wire he does not teach well under pressure, but overall he is a great professor who knows how to explain things extremely well. Overall, very good professor.

Golet does sometimes give a lot of homework and when it comes down to the wire he does not teach well under pressure, but overall he is a great professor who knows how to explain things extremely well. 9/10 overall

He's the most amazing man I have ever met. I had him for both Calc III and Calc IV, and I was so happy I got him as a professor. He knows what he is talking about and can actually convey new information to college freshman just starting. He has office hours where he will answer any question without making you feel stupid. Most amazing man ever.

Great professor, would recommend for students taking Calc 3 and 4. Two or three tests that are very straightforward. Goulet doesn't try to trick his students but tests them for their knowledge of the material. Outstanding.

Really great professor. Every lecture he would teach new material and then spend the rest of the time doing practice problems. The homework was all from the book. He made sure the class understood the material and his tests were pretty straight forward as long as you study the lecture notes and do the homework.

Goulet is a great math professor. He really knows his stuff and makes it as easy as possible to learn the hard topics that are in calc 3. We had dedicated review/ catch up days during the harder material which was a life saver. Textbook homework can take a LOT OF TIME but the tests are very fair with very reasonable questions. Great professor!

Goulet is a great professor. He keeps things simple so it is easy to understand and the way he lectures is very easy to follow. He does tend to give quite a bit of homework but it is totally worth it because it corresponds to very good practice. All around 10/10 would recommend taking calc with him.

Goulet is an all around great professor. He teaches in a logical, coherent order in a way that you understand how and why. He is very clear when speaking. He has many office hours outside of class and enjoys helping students. He also manages to occasionally mix some humor into lecture. Easily the highlight of math at WPI.
The best math teacher I've ever seen cares about his work/students, knowledgeable and can really convey why and how math works. If given a choice, I would have him teach every math class possible.

If you miss a lecture, he posts both the notes AND video recordings online. Homework tends to be very long and sometimes isn't exactly what's covered in class, but is very good practice either way. Always keeps his office hours updated, but is extremely flexible about scheduling other hours. Super easy to communicate with. Also pretty funny.

I took MA 1023 and MA 1024 with Prof. Goulet. He cares a lot about his students and is always available to answer questions and make sure you understand the material. He makes the lectures interesting, even if the material is a bit dense. There is no required homework, but it is definitely a good idea to do all of it to be successful!
Great teacher, always open to help. Really wants you to understand the theory which could make everything a bit harder
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had Professor Goulet for both Calculus III and Calculus IV at WPI and he is the epitome of an ideal professor. His lectures are clear, answers any questions, and really cares about his students/their understanding of the material and overall well being. Challenging textbook homework is optional, so each student can discover how they learn best
Goulet is pretty awesome. You'd be extremely lucky to have such a great professor. Super clear and understandable lectures as well as a pretty funny guy. Would take his class again.
Goulet does his job. Makes lectures understandable!

While the material was sometimes a bit tricky, he managed to make it pretty understandable. Gave plenty of examples and lots of extra problems as optional homework. The required homework was never too difficult and didn't take up too much time. He managed to make a large lecture class seem very personal.
He is very patient and a good teacher. If you don't understand his explanation of something, he will take a different approach and work with you until you get it.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is so classic!!!

Lectures are good and focus on the reasoning/concepts. Doesn't give too many examples in class but there are plenty of practice problems provided in the optional textbook work. Tests give solid partial credit and are fair; if you study the topics provided you will probably do well. His jokes and personality make calc lectures more engaging.
He was exceptionally good at making the course material understandable. Good personality too, and helpful.  One of the best.

Great class - straight forward and stress free.  Homework is helpful and reasonable. Tests are fair and partial credit is generous. Lectures focus more on the concept and meaning/application of what you are doing, while homework focuses on the procedure. You can skip them but you might miss out on that deeper understanding or a funny moment.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Was responsive in class and good with student feedback. He became comfortable with the class itself and was able to make jokes while teaching. He did a lot of examples which helped a lot. It was material I did not enjoy, but the class was bearable.
Goulet is the bomb. He is so hilarious and very clear in lecture. Take if you have the chance. Sometimes there's a lot of homework, but his persona makes up for it.

Professor Goulet is a great teacher. He is willing to explain things several different ways and is very approachable. His tests are fair, and match the homework. He gives a lot of homework, but you will definitely understand the material by the end of it, and it helps you be prepared for the exams.

Had him for calc 3 and 4. In lecture does a great job of mixing theory, examples, and practice problems to explain concepts. Presents information clearly in a way that's easy to take notes and develop a solid understanding. Encourages and answers questions, and his razor sharp wit keeps things exciting .
He's a caring teacher.
Amazing professor for Calculus 4.  Great sense of humor, great explanations 10/10 would take his class again.
he is the godfather of calculus
Clear instructions and lectures.
Makes you feel pretty stupid for asking questions, make use of office hours. Class is decent paced, not too fast but not slow .
Great
Great professor, understandable, gives layouts to the test, funny and great lectures. Good amount of homework but all spanned over the week, so not as bad if you don't wait until last second.
Really good professor, explains well, good sense of humor. Only thing is he gives a LOT of hw. Don't wait until the last to do it, or you will be sorry
Easy to follow, no trick questions on tests. Honestly if you put in effort and go to class most of the time, you'll get an A.
Prof. Goulet is super nice, cares about students, and grades very leniently. I would definitely recommend him.
Prof. Goulet was great and very helpful. his sense of humor was on point too

I had Professor Goulet for Calc 1 and 2. He was extremely helpful and willing to spend the time it took with me individually in order to grasp the material. Tests were graded fairly and lectures were relevant. Best teacher I've had at WPI, would highly recommend!

Hes a great professor, and I would recommend him to everyone. He was very clear with explanations and his tests were easy if you did the homeworks. The homework assignments are relatively long, but worth it when you see the A on top of your test.

Professor Goulet made his best attempt at making an awful, awful class manageable, and he did a good job at it. It wasn't a hard class, just boring as all hell. Regardless, he graded fairly, made lecture interactive and clear, and was an overall great professor.

Lectures are helpful for homeworktests, clear and focused. He is very kindfunny and talks to students before lecture. For Lin Alg, we had a small term project focused on our majors (ex. I'm ECE so I did sound analysis in Matlab). Exams were easy compared to homework. I spent 1-5 hours outside of class. He's a very intelligent guy.

He assigns homework on subject matter that has not yet been explained. This led to me having to teach myself the material before class in order to pass in the homework and then being bored and distracted during lecture because he would go over the basics of something we have already learned.

Had him for linear algebra. He is one of those rare professors that can just speak math and you understand it. He explains things really well. This was my last math class I have to take, and I wish I had taken my other math classes with him. Awesome prof.
Not best experience
Excellent professor.  His lectures were clear and understandable so the material was a breeze.  He's always willing to help.  Highly recommended.

He is an amazing prof. I have never heard one negative comment about him. Try and take a class with him if you can! He is great at explaining everything and will always help you when you need it. He genuinely wants his students to do well. And it is almost impossible to fail his class, which is amazing!!

probably the greatest professor I've had at WPI. teaches class more like a high school teacher rather than college professor and gets to know each student personally. always willing to help students outside of the classroom. very easy A/B if you go to class and listen to the guy. Ask questions if you have them, he WANTS you to pass.

Professor Goulet rocks!!! He was always willing to take the time needed to help a student learn. There were a few times when I had trouble solving some problems in my 4000 level Physics classes, I did not have Professor Goulet since I was a sophomore but he remembered me and was more than willing to sit down and help me.
BEST math professor I have had. He knows how to clearly explain math and is really good at teaching as well.

Professor Goulet was an excellent math teacher! I took Calc. 1 with him and recently registered for Calc. 2 with him. He is extremely helpful and genuinely wants his students to do well. He is willing to meet one-on-one with you and responds very quickly to emails. His grading is fair and hes good at giving partial credit. Also, he allows re-takes!
He is simply amazing I am taking calc 2 with him now man has he helped me out so much

John Goulet is simply the greatest math teacher I've ever had.  He is extremely clear and fully understands every problem a student may have with a concept.  He's also very tech-savvy: he let me do most exploratory assignments in Maple.  All around amazing guy and I wish I had him for all my future courses as well!

Best MA teacher ever. He stayed up till midnight to help me with some stuff. HE is EXCELLENT at explaining concepts and you'll ALWAYS understand the material.He is very nice and very funny and always willing to help you whether you like it or not!  BEst teacher I've ever had. Unfortunately he only teachers semester courses! sadface.jpeg
Best math teacher that I've ever had. Very clear and seems to genuinely want us to do well in the class.
Best math teacher i've ever had. He made everything so simple and clear. I wish he taught all of the maths here.

Best Math Teacher I have ever had hands down.  I had him for Calc 1 w/ prelim topics, which was an easy class anyways, but if you didn't get it before, he definitely helped you get it.  Wish I had him for Calc 3 :(
Very helpful in teaching the review concepts in Calc I with precalc, Id reccomend the course with him to anyone who feels shaky about learning calculus.
Truly one of the best teachers I have ever had.  One of the kindest!!
This guy is one of the best teachers/professors ive ever had. Hes also pretty funny and is extremely clear and helpful.

Goulet was the best.  I was so awful at math and hated every math class I had before I took Calc with Goulet.  I was dreading it but I ended up really looking forward to the class.  His structure and teaching style really helps anyone do well and he's so nice and helpful.  You can always come to him during office hours.

He is probably the best professor i have every had. I have had him for two terms and he does a really good job of getting the information across in an easy to understand way.  If you r have to take calc two take it with Goulet.  If you need a GPA booser than take calc with him

Excellent professor. Extremely clear and concise. Makes math easy to understand, and uses  a curriculum that guarantees success. Very friendly, and will go over problems and help you if you are unsure about anything. Highly recommended. :)
By far, the best professor at WPI! His lectures are interactive, very clear, and easy to understand. Overall, a really great guy.
Great teacher. Can be a bit sarcastic at times, but if you can take it you shouldn't have a problem. He teaches math in a way that makes you understand it.

One of WPI's best! He is very helpful and cares about his students learning. His class is set up to motivate students and make it very possible to pass, while still ensuring that there's a firm grasp of the curriculum. Do HW, b/c while it isn't a big part of the grade (15% for about 20 assignments), it all adds up. Plus, it helps know the material.

BEST teacher I've ever had. REALLY helpful...if you have any trouble at all he's willing to put in the time during his office hours until you understand the material. He's very clear and overall just good at what he does. His notes are extremely helpful too and good to have around for when you take more math classes.
Best Math Teacher I have ever had...Really cares about the students and is very good at what he does. I reccomend anyone to take this class, especially if you find calc some what difficult
AWESOME!! Take his class if you want to pass; he helps you so much and really wants you to succeed
Great professor, sincerely wants his students to suceed, and makes a concious effort to make sure students learn the material.
AWESOME
Very helpful, and cares about the students a great deal.
Great teacher. Genuinely wants to help his students. Class structure was clear and very understandable.
made class pretty easy, helped me out when i couldnt make the final
awesome teacher...try and get him for any math class you have
this guy rules.  he explains things so well and if anyone fails a test they have to keep taking it till the pass.  If anyone fails this class they are a dumbass.  Go to class and you will learn alot.
Best Math Professor...I think I agree that he can teach a Rock calculus. If you couldn't do it in another class, take his, you can do it here!
Goulet could teach a rock calculus
Great professor. Class structure (with 'goals') is perfect. Understandable in lecture!
I was only at WPI one term but he is the prof I remember.  Clear/focused lectures.  He is nice, funny, and very helpful.  Wish we had more profs like him at McGill.
Rocks da funk

Goulet is one of the best professors I've had.  MA 2071 is an 8AM class, and he adds 5 pts to your final grade if you show up every day!  He knows the material, funny, and very organized.  In other words, you want him for Lin Alg!
Great guy, very down to earth.  Knows his material and he is very helpful.
No Comments
One of the few professors I've had who actually understood his material as well as being able to convey the material effectively to his class.
No Comments
He is the man. I tool lin alg with Goulet, and it's the best math class I had as of yet. He teaches really well, a fair grader and always very helpfull.
No Comments
Good guy. Helps students connect the material to their majors.

He's always available to help students outside of class (i.e. lots of office hours). He assigns interesting projects based on a student's major. Lets [CS] students resubmit project for regrading. Made learning Linear Algebra I interesting.
Prof. Goulet is the best!  Courteous, kind, caring, and always willing to help.  He's down to earth and he recognizes how students learn and it shows in his excellent teaching ability.
Best Prof. I had in 4 years at WPI; great guy; down to earth; very helpful outside of class
This guy kicks ass. Really nice, helpful, semi-humorous.
Makes subject easily understandable, interesting by connecting it to your major
I feel i am learning the material really well form him, he makes learning easy
No Comments
Moves slowly, comes off as patronizing, but with good reason: he makes it easy.
He definitely cares about the students and encourages you to ask him questions.
No Comments
Great Guy, Great Teacher
Totally Awesome!  If you don't learn here, you're not trying!
goulet is the man!
No Comments
Amazing professor!! Main focus is on making sure students learn.

Professor Servatius has a unique teaching style, but the course content can be challenging. Attend lectures, complete assignments diligently, and consider using study tools like Unstuck AI to stay on top of the material. Overall, a rewarding class.

Servatius is a bit of a controversial professor at WPI for his teaching style, but as long as you pay attention in lectures and make sure to do practice problems that he recommends, you should be fine. The quiz heavy style might not be ideal for some, but he usually is leinient on quiz grades.

Lectures were engaging (though antiquated). Do all of the quizzes and homework and you will do fine. No need to buy the textbook. This was personally one of my favorite classes at WPI and Prof. Servatius knew his stuff.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Herman Servatius is clearly intelligent. This, unfortunately, manifests as a boiling witch's cauldron of laziness, lack of clarity, overestimation, and terrible accommodation. He is a poor professor that cannot share the meaning of Discrete Mathematics with his students and commonly writes wrong answers. Self-study or take it with someone else.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: just do learn and work everyday
Doesn't care about students
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Absolutely awful. Lectures were confusing and poorly explained, and he refused to clarify anything and would point to the textbook when asked. Exercises often had wrong answers, and sometimes remarks instead of answers stating that if you got it wrong it was your fault. TAs weren't much help either, didn't seem confident in the course material.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: horrible. textbook has wrong answers, exercises have wrong answers. tas have no chill taking off points and 90/100 points of the whole class is quizzes. prof is hard to follow, is not helpful, did not even bother to show up for his office hours on the day of the final. if you get a total of 10 points off, youre automatically at a 90. dont take it.

Discrete math with Servatius was extremely difficult. Avoid him if you can and take it with the other professor. However if you must, I still think he is a professor who genuinely cares about his students. He's very accessible during office hours and responds to emails. The class just takes a ton of practice, so prepare yourself going in.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Really hard class for no reason. Syllabus is confusing and you are only graded by few things. No homework. Does not explain anything. My grandma was literally dying before the final and he wouldn't let me take it at home so I could go see her. Do not recommend.

Notes are poorly designed. Textbook is a scam and shouldn't be advertised to buy. Gives examples but never the solutions. Exercises are given weekly to be used as practice for the quiz, but the exercise solutions aren't given until after the quiz so how are they supposed to help? Poorest teacher I've had here by far.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures were clear, well paced, and well organized. I found the exercises and quizzes to be very fair. Feedback on quizzes was timely and helpful.
The slides are incorrect. makes changes in the slides during the lectures. Like fi your slides before the class please.

The whole class is graded on 100 points overall. I went to his office hours, told me that I must not be trying hard enough yet I spend 10+ hours a week studying. Doesn't give answers to questions, instead will say things like "This is easy I learned it in third grade you don't need me to tell the answer" to something no one has ever seen before.

Good at explaining things, but makes mistakes that get called out. 60% of the grade is 6 quizzes, 10 minutes each where you can "strike" if you're not confident that you did well (only before grading). That 10% will be added to the final, which is 30% (base). 10% is group proofs. Lots of partial credit, but pretty inaccessible outside of class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Although he seemed to care about his students, the entirety of the class was taught on a chalkboard, and it was often tough to follow what he was doing during his lectures. It wasn't terrible though, and you can manage if you work through it. If you are in Salisbury 411 like I was, you might want a front row seat to see the board clearly.

Servatius is.. an experience. He's intelligent and certainly knows the material, but doesn't usually explain it very well. The tests made up 81% of the grade, so if you're going to take this class with him, you best be a good test taker. Make sure to befriend the PLA, as he can be hard to reach for help. Not the worst, but there are better options.
Professor Servatius is very hard to follow and although clearly has a good understanding of the topic material, doesn't do a good job at explaining it

Definitely knowledgeable about the material. Lectures are posted asynchronously which is convenient. Quizzes are optional and can be replaced with your grade on the final exam if you'd like. Lectures are pretty easy to understand. He's not the best at scheduling and communication.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Just reuses recorded lectures (many of which have mistakes that he doesn't catch, leading to a lot of confusion among students and he never lets us know anywhere about them). Bad at scheduling (has quizzes on days off and doesn't change it until midnight on the quiz day). Not easily reachable, not flexible. He is knowledgeable about the subject
Not the best at explaining but he tries and works with the student to make sure they pass. The class itself is pretty hard, and with covid its not easier
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Discrete math with Professor Servatius was mediocre at best. He is very knowledgeable and definitely interested in the material. He does not explain very well and assumes prior knowledge for a lot of topics. The class is difficult, but if you do the homework and take every quiz you should be able to get a B.

His lectures are a stream of conciseness making note-taking very hard. If you have the option to take someone else please do! Also for clac 4, the break down of grades goes as following: 90% Exams, 5% HW, 5% Lab which is very annoying and difficult because the labs basically count as nothing.
Over complicates material. Lecture style makes taking notes very difficult.
The obstacle course that is the weekly quiz games is ridiculous.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I have never and will never have another professor as bad as Herman Servatious. The thought that he makes a six figure salary as a professor makes me sick. He does not teach things in a way most people can comprehend. He writes tiny and messily and no one can read it. He makes tests of very small quantity worth tons and obscenely difficult.

I really enjoyed this class. He was very helpful and the assignments were always good measures of course work and graded fairly. He was tough but because of that I learned a lot. I would absolutely recommend

He is not a good professor and doesn't care about how much we are struggling in his class he just leaves that part to the TAs and they are actually way more helpful than he is and they should be the professor instead because they can actually explain concepts and answer questions and actually care about the students.

10% of what's written on the board is unreadable. listening to lecture covers for 9% of what's unreadable. encourages questions during class. you can choose to not submit a quiz and it won't count against you but will make the final count for more of your grade. pay attention, do the hw, don't buy the textbook, and you'll be fine. i like the class
Although this subject seemed difficult, as he said working on homework problems helped to score good in quizzes and exam

Servatius has possibly the worst student communication of any professor I've taken. Homework collection is never made clear (despite it not counting for credit; he uses homework to decide how much to curve up border grades at the end). Quizzes were short, full of trick questions, and involved mind games as to whether you chose to submit them.
I feel I became smarter by taking his class! shout out to Professor Servatius!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Not a bad professor. Homework problems can be challenging and unnecessarily long, but if you understand the homework problems then you should do fine on the tests.
I thought I was taking discrete Math. Turns out I learned more about french war cannons than anything else.

Set up exactly the same as his undergraduate courses: final exam being 30% of final grade (cumulative of entire semester), and quizzes each week making the other 70% of the grade. Look at past quizzes online to know what to expect for all his tests, no matter what course. Awful at teaching. CS503 still would have been better and probably easier.

Weird grading system. Probably the most confusing lecturer in this school. His lecture is like he brainstorms and talk it out loud, maybe he follows his own logic but extremely hard to follow for students. His handwriting is just illegible.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Really nice guy, but his teaching style just didn't work for me. I had a hell of a time following the course material with him.  I didn't have this trouble with other math professors so I don't think it was all just me.
He spends most of the time explaining proofs on the whiteboard however a good amount of it is illegible. Often makes mistakes that students point out.

Grading system is weird.  Great lectures but often about things not relevant to what will be asked on quizzes.  Quiz questions often have nothing to do with what is talked about in class.  Be able to teach yourself.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Servatius is certainly an experience. A lot of people complain about his class, which is difficult, but it is possible to succeed in his class. Tests are tricky but the do stick to the material he teaches. Plays mindgames with his grading policy. He's a very smart man who teaches a tough subject, he's tough but fair.

A very intense, but engaging professor.  He seemed to be really into what he was teaching, and was actually pretty good at explaining material, given how difficult I found it.  Be prepared for the occasional trick question on quizzes, though.

Doing well is not impossible, but difficult. His lectures are fast-paced and full of proofs. His writing is often messy and illegible. Lectures don't cover much of the hw. You must do the hw to pass. Take advantage the double down quiz. Very passionate about math; he is not as bad as others say, but be prepared to self-teach and do the work.

Go to class and take notes, go to conference, which is helpful.  He moves fast on the board, sometimes unreadable.  He provides all books.  I needed more time on the quizzes.  Good material for ECE.  Pay attention to the unique grading style, and plan ahead to take advantage, this could save you.  Covers unique topics - induction, logic, and RSA.

Despite what many say, Prof. Servatius is a fine teacher. However, you are expected to put in your own work and read the book on your own. His grading criteria is as follows: one quiz every week (for 7 weeks) that makes up 10% of your grade. The remaining 30% is for the final. BUT you can choose not to turn in a quiz, adding 10% weightage to final.

Professor Servatius is a tremendous lecturer. If you pay attention and take notes you will be sure to learn something. With that said his grading system is a little strange and many students don't prefer him because of that. He is a very respectable man but his grading system could be changed. He is pretty lenient in terms of points given on a quiz

Many people don't like his class, but in my opinion he is very dedicated in teaching. I love the games he gave us on class, it was fun. He gives quizzes every week and you can choose to submit it or not. It's only a matter of percentage of the final.  As long as you do or ask him to do the practice problems on conference you can get an easy A.
Awful teacher. Avoid at all costs

Overall he was a great teacher.  He really has a genuine love for mathematics.  Quizzes were somewhat difficult, but not too bad.  Final test is extremely easy, and depending on how many quizzes you turn in, it is worth a lot of your grade.  You do have to read the textbook if you want to do well, however.  Put in the work and you'll get an A.

To consolidate the good and bad reviews, I will say that he's a difficult but interesting professor. His lectures are not so much "teachings" as they are demonstrations; they are helpful if you follow and study adequately on your own. Do not expect to be spoon fed. He's an incredibly intelligent person and will teach you a lot if you try to learn.

AMAZING teacher. Made me like math! Extremely insightful and interesting lectures and nice human being. You have to work to do well in the class but it is well worth it. Would take again in a heartbeat! Herman is the best!

Only forced to rush through material because he must fit several chapters into a concise, 6 week time frame. Read through lesson in PDF before class and ask questions during lecture. HW isn't collected, but complete it in order to understand the class. Go to office hours. Extremely helpful. He'll talk you through any concept you don't understand.

His writing is confusing, so if you want to learn something in class, you have to pay attention to his words.  You can learn all the techniques needed to pass quizzes in class, but if you want to know more read textbooks.  The quizzes are not hard if you prepare for them and practice a lot.  And he loves the function z9-x^2-y^2.

Worst math teacher I've ever had in my life. Lectures are useless because he doesn't teach anything useful for the quizzes. He spends all his time proving formula without showing how to apply. Avoid him if you can.

Professor Servatius seems like a nice person who is very passionate about calculus. However, his explanations are rarely very clear. He often does not work through problems completely, and his lectures are very fast-paced. The book is no help either, but overall, he is a relatively adequate professor.
Clear insight, great at explaining the real DEPTH behind mathematics.
Fantastic teacher and impressive proofs. It is clear that he loves mathematics and understands the material. I just wish he was not tied down to the calc 4 material.
Skipping lectures is okay Not doing hw is okay Easy to get high grade if you are good at doing quizes However, lectures are really boring and !!!you can't even clearly read his writing

You need solid understanding of Maths (sets, functions, recursive definitions etc.). If you fail this class it means you were not prepared for the class, it doesn't mean the professor was bad. I liked it, but need to work hard, of course - if it were easy everybody would get a Master's degree.

He has a very unique class setup where he lets you choose whether you want to hand in the weekly quiz. Make use of this and only hand in quizzes you are sure of. The final exam is basically 3 or 4 quiz questions. He did offer a "double-down" quiz in the last week which lets you replace your lowest two quizzes. This was very useful.

Do not take a class with him. He is not helpful at all. You can ask him questions but he will not give you a useful answer and when prompted for something more helpful he makes no attempt to help. Doesn't respond to emails. If you can't figure the class out on your own or with your TA you will feel pretty hopeless.

Worst teacher I have ever had in my life.  Do everything you can to avoid taking his class.  Not helpful at all in any way.  Quizzes are much more difficult than assigned homework problems.  Overall, terrible teacher.

Servatius was a horrible teacher. First of all his handwriting is awful. I had to sit very close to the front to read it. His quizzes are difficult. The worst part was he would do examples with deliberate mistakes, but not tell us the mistakes so we would learn it wrong then have to relearn it. And he is bad at explaining examples.
A pretty good class. He derives formulas before telling you so that can be confusing. His quizzes are pretty hard and are the hardest version possible of a problem. A nice guy overall though

IF YOU HAVE NOT TAKEN AP BC OR EQUAL CALCULUS, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. He teaches special cases in lecture and proves formulas before writing them making it hard to follow. This term he did not count graded homework so don't expect a cushion from the final (main grade portion).

Although many people say he's bad, I thought he was a very good professor. Very enthusiastic about math and I thought his explanations were very clear of the things we actually needed to know.  Does a lot of crazy proofs on the board but does not expect them to be learned, just understood.
Worst Professor I've ever had. Definitely one to avoid. Ridicules students for asking questions and constantly makes mistakes.
nice person and lecture quizzes are easier than the home work
Nice person, but extremely poor lectures. His quizzes are far harder than any of the homework and it is difficult to prepare for them. He also throws random identities into his quiz problems.

Awesome teacher! His tests were brutal. Class averages tend to be below 60. But I get 100s on all of them because I am boss at Calculus. I love his Ponytail, but it is very distracting. He likes to jump when answering questions. Great Professor!

Worst professor at WPI. Everyone says the same stuff: he moves too fast, doesn't explain things clearly, is rude, works awfully with TAs/SAs, and isn't willing to put any effort into helping you understand the material. Oddly enough, if you scroll down you'll see he has some good reviews from when he left WPI.. But everyone here says hes horrendous
poor communication with TA's, homework was graded but not handed back, poor teaching in general.  he's an interesting person, but a god awful teacher.  avoid.
Such an awful professor. I've had him twice now, for linear algebra and differential equations. Try to avoid him at all costs.

Easily the worst professor I've had at this school. Does not communicate well with PLAs at all. No one fully understood which book section was on each quiz/ homework that was due. WASTE OF YOUR MONEY.

His lectures do not cover much, and you essentially have to learn the material yourself. The course is not too challenging, but he likes to test you with "True" or "False" questions, and not on actual computations.

Does not require you do the HW, that's because they do not help on his quizzes. His quizzes are based off the TOPIC he teaches, but the actual quizzes are something that are completely different. Most people are getting 4's and 5's out of ten on his quizzes. Do not recommend him for any math class you have to take.
Really great professor and a great guy.

His tests have improved throughout the years (see website,) and are what we learn in class.  If I can keep up (use breaks while he writes sentences on board) I find he makes a kind of sense I can recreate.  I noticed he's rude, but it's an understandable/non-bothersome kind of rude.  However, the textbook and class are different worlds.

I took his class at Clark University. Turn you phone off, common sense but he really HATES it when a phone rings. Halfway through the class my mind is drifting and Im thinking this is boring, but hey, its calculus, what did you expect. He is alright, he actually seems very passionate about what he teaches, at times says funny random things.

Servatious was tough, but I learned a lot.  He teaches you everything you need to do well on the tests.  Do the Home work, study, and do practice problems.  The tests are hard, but not impossible.  Do well in this class and you are golden for the final.  He is tough, but in the end it is worth it and you can always ask questions.
He moves quickly through the material, but always makes time for questions during lecture. He's not great at explaining the topics, but he knows the material very well. That counts for alot.
No Comments

This gut is the worst teacher I have ever had in my life. He goes way too fast through lecture and mubles to himself the entire time.  He stands in the way so you can't see wat he is writing.  He writes faster than he can talk so there is no way to keep up with him while trying to learn the material at the same time.  Don't enroll in his classes!!!
This guy is the worst teacher at wpi. Do not take a class with him ever and if you get stuck with him enjoy doing all your work on your own... he does nothing to help you. Good Luck.
Good Luck! His notes are hard to read, and he assumes that everybody has taken calc before.

I had already taken calc 1, but when I went to this class, I realized that we must special math at WPI. Nothing covered in "lectures" was actually Calc 1 material. Instead of allowing us to use the weekly conference as a help session as we were supposed to, he assigned the TA to give us the weekly test. Rather self-explanatory...
No Comments
Worst teacher ever. I felt like I studied the wrong material when I looked at his tests.

Herman Servatius is an idiot... he will be by far the worst teacher you have at WPI.  He doesn't do any examples and is very rude in help sessions.  His tests are rediculous because they do not cover any of the material taught.
just a HORRIBLE professor.  RUDE, UNHELPFUL and BORING
Friendly, goes too fast in lecture, not very flexible for tests, etc... Overall did an average job teaching this class...
very booring class, doesnt teach well, test s are hard

what a miserable, boring, disgusting class. i learn more by reading the book myself. his tests are on absolutely nothing that was done in class, which is really frustrating because the homeworks that he assigns are all easy.

Horrible.Like all other math teachers at this school,doesn't know how to explain or use logic.prerequisite:calc4 :)Just quickly goes through examples with the word "obviously" understood throughout the explantions."i won't give trick questions on tests",yet nothing on tests are relative to homework.

Goes a little fast, but if you have questions he does a good job of answering them.  Random irrelevant comments add humor to the class, and he is pretty nice except if a cellphone goes off in class.  Tests are unpredictable for the most part as far as difficulty goes.

Servious lectures are very unclear,no body in the class understand a thing he said. I basicly learn cal 2 myself by reading thruough every single page in the book. But his test were pretty easy if you understand the materials.

he is the worst professor EVER.  He is like a giant 50 year old wedge rat, but atleast wedge rats are NICE. He ISN'T. If you see him in your class at the beginning of the term, do yourself a favor and turn around and walk right back out of the room.

The previous comments pretty much sum up Servatius rather well.  He's an okay professor, but one has to be prepared to understand quickly.  He will explain everything - but his reexplnations will be quicker and more scant than the first time around.

He did a wretched job of teaching calc 2. His explainations of trig integrals were particularly horrible, ammounting almost to "derive the equation every time you want to do a problem". Class drove me nuts.
Awesome professor!  He teaches calc in a way none of my other teachers have taught it.  He really forces you to understand it!  I'm not a WPI student but I'm glad to have taken his course at WPI.
What a jerk (a fitting phrase would be censored).  This guy is the worst teacher ever, is rude, has horrible writing and is just plain a jerk.

Likes to derive everything really fast on the blackboard. Thankfully the TA gave more practical explanations during the help sessions. Very difficult class, but in all fairness, DiffEq always is and the book was hard to use.
He never explains anything. He insults you in front of the whole class if you don't do well on something. He's rude.
Very smart guy, but he tends to move fairly quickly...
he faild half his class , NO COMMENT
He was nice but he zipped through things so that it was kind of confusing sometimes. But he did enough example problems that it was ok.
You gotta stick it to the man to get any help out of him. Oh and he goes faster than speedy gonzales on E
Only time I actually had to hold my eyes open. This guy pooched me on the first math classes
No Comments
Does problems wrong and has you learn them that way
No Comments
No Comments
He is head and shoulders (and a nose) ahead of many WPI profs... not bad at all.
No Comments
No Comments

He was nice and I thought he taught well! Sometimes he would make mistakes that would take him a little bit of time to fix, but I overall enjoyed the class with him. Weekly quizzes that weren't difficult and easy homework's. Learned a lot in this class

Not a bad professor, has a rigorous and algorithmic teaching style for a rigorous and algorithmic subject. VERY punishing grader, and quizzes are harder than class work. Do the homework before the weekly quizzes and you'll be fine. Final and midterm are worth A LOT and tend to also have tricky questions. Exams/quizzes also only have 2-4 questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Poorly prepares the class for exams, which is unhelpful because quizzes and exams are 90% of the grade. Handwriting is very challenging to read, and he makes an unbelievable amount of mistakes during lectures, so you can never really trust his notes unless a smarter student steps in to help.
Goes over lots of practice problems in class and doesn't give you a lot of new information all at once. He does write pretty fast and his handwriting can get bad sometimes.

The class is very easy to pass if you take notes. Attendance isn't mandatory, so as long as you look at the class lectures you will be fine. He does weekly Friday quizzes, but those are open notes and the problems are very similar to the HW problems. There is no midterm, only a final which was probably the only downside of this course.

Impossible to get an A. I knew many people in this class who had upwards of a 99 going into the final exam, and everyone I know ended up with a B. He is a very harsh grader and makes it extremely tough to get an A.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's a funny guy! His lectures follow examples similar to homework/test questions. The course is super test-heavy (40% final, 50% weekly quizzes), though, which I struggled with. Diff eq isn't easy but it's doable and I'm glad I took it w/ Humi.
He does examples in class and allows questions along the way, which is pretty much the whole lecture format. I learned and retained a lot. He's a pretty funny guy.
Good lecturer and solves lots of examples in class. Homework just like in-class examples. He is a funny guy during lectures.

I personally enjoyed taking Professor Humi's class. His lectures are easy to follow and he's willing to help you if you ask. He is very inspirational. I still remembered on the syllabus he mentioned "Worthwhile achievements in life do not come on a silver platter." He wants you to study to actually understand the materials, not just for the exams.

He's an older professor who knows the subject material very well, but he sometimes can't get explanations across well to the students. For lectures, he projects a piece of paper that he writes on, and it can sometimes be difficult to follow along. Also a bit of a tough grader, but there weren't any surprises on the tests. Overall, not bad.

One of the worst professors I have ever taken in my life. His explanations were very unclear, so I had to learn most of it on my own. His handwriting is terrible and pivots from one problem to the next without full completion. Insists that something is intuitive and obvious when it would take an extra 5 seconds to explain why. Difficult grader.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Humi is the worst professor I've ever had. I am on the verge of NRing the course (about half the students this term are too) because he does not give partial credit on exams. On the homework and quizzes I do fine, because they are not graded by him. His handwriting is terrible too! Avoid at all costs

Let me start by saying LinAlg as a class is super easy going by material. With that said, if you want to make it as difficult on yourself as possible, take his class. He prints notes at the speed of light and doesn't explain anything because to him it's intuitive. He gives 0 partial credit either and his handwriting is horrible.
He gives little to none partial credit. He speeds through lecture and his handwriting is hard to understand at times.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I believe the material itself isn't that hard to understand, but when it comes to exams (midterm and final) he is a very tough grader. Doesn't give much or even any partial credit. I've spoke with multiple classmates and none passed midterm. I have 100's on HW and high 80's on quiz,but with exams each being 32% of your grade it make it hard to pass
No partial credit, doesnt want you to pass and doesnt care. Overall mean guy who wants his class to seem like the hardest. Everyone I know got less than a 60 on the midterm.

I'm surprised this professor is still in this school but he's tenured so I guess no matter how bad he teaches he still stays. Worst investment I've made up to date was taking this class, he rushes through notes and barely gives any partial credit. It's all or nothing to him for some unknown reason. What really makes or breaks this class is your TA.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: As most other people state, he flys through the lectures.. he acts as if our arms can print text as fast as printers. And as the rumors say, hes very strict on grading.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Humi moves fast in his lectures and does not like to slow down to explain what he's doing. His class is graded primarily on tests and while he offers makeup exams to all students, he grades like a hacksaw. He takes off a lot of points for small mistakes and cares little about the rest of the process.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The content on the homeworks/quizzes versus the tests were worlds apart. I got 100's in all my homeworks and quizzes and the content on the tests were almost unrecognizable from them.
He does not know what partial credit is and his test is questions from the homework or lecture too.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Very picky with grading tests, almost no partial credit given on midterm and final. Cold calls people in lecture when no one has questions. Difficult to learn in his class. Worst math teacher I have ever had.

If you're taking Matrices and Linear Algebra 1, be ready to use online resources to supplement information (YouTube has lots of great videos that deliver easy-to-understand explanations). Put effort into understanding the homework/quizzes he assigns; lots of problems on the midterm/final are very similar to material covered on previous assignments.
Added things to all the tests that weren't covered in class. Very bad at lectures.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Humi was generally good at explaining BVP. He obviously cared a lot about the subject and made sure that everyone understood the material before moving on. The two quizzes (20%) were a little tough for me because you had to learn as you took using the textbook. The exams (70%) were very very very similar to homework problems and in class exs

THe absolute worst professor I've ever taken a class with. I have only ever gotten three grades below a B at this university in my four years here, and all three have been with Humi. On every exam I take with him, I get all of the questions correct, only to get 20-40 points taken off due to semantics. Rude to students who don't understand.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Humi is a very intelligent professor, and is very helpful when you go to office hours. Taking him for lower level courses like calc is good because he can help you understand topics. HOWEVER, he is an incredibly hard grader. There are 2 exams each worth 40% of your final grade. He also uses very esoteric notation.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Humi is by far one of the kindest professors on campus. If you actually pay attention in lecture and drop by his office once or twice if you have any confusion on material, he will be happy to help you. I wish I could retake calc 4 just to remember what it's like to have a good professor. WPI needs more teachers like him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: His class seems straightforward. Does tons of review in class and both tests are all problems already covered in class. This being said he takes off obscene amounts of points for the smallest mistakes. You've seen the questions before but unless you're perfect you'll struggle. Unfair especially because he makes tons of mistakes while giving notes.

I would not recommend taking this class with him. His lectures are confusing and incomplete. Even though this was an easy course, it used my time because I always had to go back to the lecture videos to figure out the details that he missed. The class does't feel like a 4000-level class. Homework is easy and the book used for the course is bad.

Professor made homeworks and quizzes worth NOTHING. 84 percent of the grade based on two exams where almost no partial credit was given. Trick questions on exams harder than anything we had ever seen before. Otherwise he was a great lecturer and really made the material easy to understand. Impossible to get an A, but easy to get a B.

Excellent professor!!! Goes out of his way to help you and does a wonderful job explaining how all of the math you have learned relates to science and engineering. He genuinely cares about all of his students and wants them to succeed.

Excellent professor! Humi gives very clear explanations, shows how all the math you have learned is connected to science and engineering, and goes out of his way to help all of his students. He is without a doubt the best math professor I have had thus far at WPI!!!

Funny. He makes references to fish and strawberries a lot. Knows the material and wants to make sure everyone understands. He tries to get students involved in the lecture. You won't regret taking this class

Humi is a great professor, he prepares you very well for the exam and the exam is just like the homework for the class. Exams are worth a lot (2 exams, 42% each) but if you pay attention in class and do the HW you will be fine.

I've never had a professor who genuinely cares so much about his students as much as Humi. I took a second class with him because I enjoyed him so much. Takes off a lot of points but that's because most of his test is homework problems we've done before. Highly recommend him, especially for more difficult topics.
very hard grader makes mistakes in class but doesn't allow any mistakes by students without major points taken off.

Very harsh grader, and difficult exams. On one test he made an unsolvable problem and still counted it, taking off points if you didn't solve it to the point where he decided you could tell it could not be solved.

Very hard grader. interesting material, but he makes it so laborious. He also loves to find excuses to give no credit for problems. last question on midterm and final hadn't been taught when we took the test.

Absolutely fantastic professor. He's crystal clear, he cares about helping students learn, and he's pretty funny sometimes. He can be a bit fast, and this class is more than a little challenging, but absolutely my favorite math professor I've had yet.

He's a great guy, really cares about his students. But watch out for little mistakes on exams, he'll butcher your grade for them. But the exams are very similar to homework and the re-take saved my grade, literally brought it up  2 letter grades - lol i recommend him

AMAZING guy, but his tests are worth A LOT and he takes off a lot for the smallest mistakes. But he prepares you well for the exams and gives you the chance for a makeup, which can really help you out :D i recommend!

Great lecturer.  His notes are incredibly clear and he thoroughly explains the example problems that he does in class.  Plus he loves to take and answer questions in lecture. Two tests make up over 80% of your grade, but he lets you re-take one of them and the problems are very similar to the homework.  He takes off a lot for small mistakes though.
Skips steps during examples. Takes obscene amount of points off for the littlest mistakes
Terrific
This professor is REALLY good. Hope I can meet him in his class again.
Great professor, willing to help and very clear in class

Excellent Professor. Willing to help students learn what Differential Equation really is. If you go to class, do the hw, take the quizzes; this class should be an Easy A. BUT watch out! Sometimes in the exam he tricks the students with EASY but TRICKY problems. So if the exams too easy at first, look out for the little complications. Best Math Prof
Awesome professor. Easy to understand , repeats the previous course materials before he starts the new one
Great professor, if you go to most classes and do the homework it is very easy to get an A.  Exams were very fair.

Great professor!  Always covers the previous lecture's topics and goes over a sample problem at the beginning of each lecture, so it's fine if you miss a class.  I missed a lot of classes at the end of the term and bombed the final, but still somehow pulled off a B.  Very clear instruction, would definitely recommend for MA2051!
Great prof.  Challenging but is more than willing to help you after class.  Final grade is based almost entirely off of two exams throughout the year.
Very good teacher, tests are difficult. In class he will show the theory then do examples over and over. He will ask random people in the class for questions, even if they are just sitting there.

Most unapproachable teacher ever. Horribly condescending attitude if you ever actually catch him during his office hour (Note, I did not say hourS. Hour. Singular). Highly advise you stay away from this professor. Horrible grading style that he gets very defensive about if you question.
He can't pronounce "coefficients" properly. He says "cough-she-ints." It's hilarious.
pay attention in class and you should be fine
Very helpful, will MAKE you ask questions. Explains things clearly, and is pretty funny as well. Best math prof I've had here.

I disagree with the comment below, the only reason he rolls his eyes are b.c some ppl dont listen and when they decide to they ask the same question that someone asked a minute before,& some ppl do ask the obvious without thinking and that is why he rolls his eyes, I would highly recommend him for any math course, great professor.explains very well

he explains things very very well, gives help session (which he doesn't get paid for it) each week. exams are from homework and lecture problems. if u study hard, u can get an A surely! really! he can turn this advanced math course in WPI to an easy class!

He quickly picked favorites in the class and for the rest of the term was very friendly to them, and harsh and dismissive of the rest of the class.  If someone not his favorite asked a question in class, they received a roll of the eyes and a sigh before he re-explained it in a patronizing tone. He embarrassed you in class for any perceived wrong.

I had him for 1023 and 1024. He was a pretty good teacher, but I found that he did more solving problems than explaining. He also graded very harshly, and his tests counted for 80% total. In both classes, I had a 95-100 average on quizzes, labs, and homeworks, but due to his harsh grading I barely pulled off a B.

Humi is great at teaching.  He always asks if anyone needs help, even to the point of asking anyone with a blank look.  He likes to be personable.  Also, he tries to keep the atmosphere pretty light in the room.  Teaches theory at first, and then does many many examples.
Teaches really well! He is always there to help the students. He makes sure students understand the materilas he teaches before he goes on. Each week he offers one night review session, very helpful!

Professor Humi is very enthusiastic, always offering help sessions. His teaching material seems harder than other professors. But it is very reasonable. Exams are based on hw and notes, exactly the same. Don't miss any class!
Does not not how to check exam papers and does not offer partial credits but teaches well

He was a great teacher and had genuine concern for students' understanding the material. But beware, his midterm and final exam were graded extremely harshly. There were 5 questions per exam and they didn't test general concepts, but specific hw questions and proofs instead. He gave little partial credit. Each exam was worth 40% of the total grade!

GREAT TEACHER!!! he is always willing to help, if you do your daily work you can get an A. I dont know why people keep complaining that he is bad. he knows what he is teaching and has plenty of review sessions for additional help. his TA was pretty helpful too

Covered a lot of material and I learned a lot however grading was not very well done.  First of all, Humi told me that the test problems would be very similar to HW, and reviewing HW was all that was necessary to prepare, but found exam problems not at all similar and he was very unreasonable about partial credit.  However very helpful outside clas

He was boring. He didn't actually teach but would just do problems. His tests count for a very large part of your grade and are graded harshly. You have to go to conferences because there is a quiz during them. He made me hate math when it had always been my favorite subject.

I had him first for Calc 3 and then for Modeling with Diff Eq's. For Calc 3, he was one of the hardest professors I've ever had. In the Modeling class, he was helpful and graded less harshly. He is very willing to help if you just ask, and make sure you do - he is a tough grader.

Good teacher. Sometimes lectures would slow down because he wanted to make sure that everyone understood it after asking "Is it clear?" Also changed the order of material, which seemed to make more sense.
A great teacher.  Really cared!!

The material isn't hard, he explains everything well and properly. My only problem is his exams pull random problems out of the notes that were gone over quickly and never brought back up or, worse, not at all. My last exam now had a problem that I had never even had practice or even seen before.

His lectures are crystal clear. He makes sure that everyone has understood before moving on. He really seems to care about his students. Also, sometimes he gives pizza prizes to the top scorers in his exams :)
Humi is the best professor ever! On top of being a terrific lecturer, he is extremely bright, caring, and funny. WPI is extremely lucky to have such a wonderful professor.
Goes through lectures fast but offers retests for full credit and only uses problems from class on test
A little challenging to keep up with in lecture...(he writes REALLY fast), but is very willing to explain things and encourages questions.
sooooooo hard to understand. not because its hard stuff or he tlaks faast. but because of his thick acccent

Humi is great. His lectures are clear, interesting, and entertaining. His jokes are exellent. The only downside is you have a quiz every week in conference, but they are easy and you can use your notes. His tests are fairly easy too. They are scaled, and everything on the test is directly from the notes from lecture.
Good class, but really hard tests.  He's funny and such, but he can be kind of a pain.  He gives VERY little partial credit and only likes it when you do it his way.

He knows his material, and he expects you to know it, too. Never evaluated later integrals, but that's because we explained that earlier in the class. He -really- wants to see students pass, but he can sound a little intimidating in person, but he does what he can. Harsh grader, usually a problem from the notes on tests as well.

Fast paced. He enjoys teaching the material and is good at it. If you have any questions go to office hours (this is also a good way to get your homework done as he will guide you through every step but the last).

One class of method for every two or three classes of just straight examples. The catch is that all of the exams are examples from the board, so your notes will save you (at least on the initial exams). However, RETAKES WILL BE DIFFICULT - be prepared for much harder retakes than the original exam, think long and hard before taking them.

Very funny.  Spends LONG time on setting up each example, then doesnt bother to solve the final integral. Extremely hard grader. First 20 min of class is Always review of last 20 min of previous class.  Tests dont always reflect class material.

Humi was completely focused on the obscure stuff, and not enough on actually how to do the problem. He's a great theoretician, but he doesn't know how to tell you how to find a tangent plane or what a gradient is used for. Further, he's almost cruel when you go to office hours, I went once, and he practicly yelled at me for not understanding.

lectures were good but test questions come from nowhere and he is the hardest grader I have ever encountered.  Almost no partial credit, 5 questions per test, 20 points each, you either get all 20 points or none.  Really Really bad at answering questions and gets frustrated easily with the whole class.
He sucks at answering questions, but besides that he's not bad.
Not good. Notes he gave were often incorrect and I didn't agree on his philosophy on what was important in the class, i.e. he would want us to derive a formula vs. implement a numerical method.
Humi is a great lecturer, however he takes off so many points for simple mistakes. For example losing 35 points for adding inccorectly...

I thinks he does not explain things very well, and he explains things a bit different from the book, so if you miss a class it's hard to understand. Tests are decent, not very hard but not very easy, however he is a very harsh grader and 1 mistake can hurt you a lot.
Good professor, although he goes very fast in lecture. Easy tests, and 1 makeup for each never hurts.
fast, doest go over the broader ideas just the nitty gritty, very harsh grader.

very confusing, especially when answering questions, but very willing to help outside of class. Try avoiding asking simple questions because he will explain and re-explain things 3982 times. Tests are straightforward and almost exactly like the homework problems, but he is a harsh grader sometimes.
He doesn't answer questions well and doesn't like to admit that he's wrong.

I had this guy for both BVP's and Calc III. I don't know why people complain about him. He may go a little fast but if you need something explained he is very eager to do so. He is also very approachable  outside of class and his makeups certainly help. One of my favorite math professors.
not very good at teaching.  not very helpful.  the TA he had was even worse
Funny guy, willing to help you.  Difficult to understand, however.  His TA was even worse.  He was very good at confusing the class.

Can be a little rough, but a nice guy, especially since he gives makeups at the end of the term.  Moves VERY fast through lecture, you really have to work to keep up...don't expect to understand what he's doing though.
Class is pretty easy, but if it weren't for his attempts to confuse you every chance he got it would have been much better.
Class was not easy and pace was very very fast, but if you keep up you can do okay.  He really tries to help students...  Also, free makeups at the end of the term never hurt anyone.

Rushes subjects a little, and doesn't answer questions very well. It's one of those classes where you have to copy everything down in your notebook then try to figure it out when you get back to the dorm.
Difficult to understand
No Comments
His class is very good, tough course with tough exams but he makes it easy
His class is hard core. Pretty tough, but penalty free makeups help you out alot
Has an accent, but speaks clearly and has funny quirks
No Comments
he's nice by providing makeups, but try to pass the first test instead
He's amazing, funny, and smart
