weekly tests, great informative and engaging lectures, tricky but if you stay ontop of the homework and go to reviews sessions it isn't too hard

If I could only take classes from one professor for the rest of my time in college, I am confident it would be with this man. He lights up the room with his passion for what he teaches and is incredibly smart and great at explaining things. We saw him make sparks fly out of outlets and he had a TA bring in a musical Tesla coil. Truly outstanding.
Very knowledgeable and entertaining during his lectures.  I learned a lot from his class, and I would definitely recommend.

Prof. Makarov's lectures are amazing and so engaging. His passion for what he's teaching is so fun to watch. The material in general is a little tough to understand but for tests GO TO THE REVIEW SESSION!!! The review session is like free answers and the TA's help a lot.
My favorite professor at WPI so far. Even if you are not an ECE major, I would recommend taking the intro ECE course (2010). Lectures are engaging and Sergey is always enthusiastic.

The most entertaining professor I've ever had, and he managed to do it while also teaching a lot of material very quickly. I was excited to come to every class. The tests are at home and fully open note, and they are most of what you are graded on. The labs are rather difficult if you are unexperienced with circuits as they get complicated.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Makarov was beyond enthusiastic when it came to ECE. His love for it rubs off on you by the end of the course, and the amount of knowledge you leave with is astonishing. I highly recommend completing all the homework assignments completely as they are very useful for the exams each week.

Professor Makarov is one of my favorite professors at WPI. His enthusiasm for the class was contagious, and made you want to go to class, even at 9am. He does go through material pretty fast, but as long as you're prepared for that it shouldn't be an issue. He also helped me a lot during his own free time to make sure my lab circuit functioned!

If you need this class and you don't take professor Makarov's class, you are seriously missing out. The weekly tests can be quite tough, but if you do/look at the answers for the non-mandatory homework, then you should do just fine. He is the most passionate professor and he knows his stuff. Best Prof. by far.
By far my the best lecturer Ive had so far in college. He brings a certain energy to the room that makes anything ECE related exciting and interesting.
Very fun professor, who is clearly passionate about the content. Fun and helpful labs. He's kind of difficult to understand with his thick Russian accent, but still engaging.

As you read below, He's just an amazing professor super enthusiastic... with an amazing accent. The labs in his 2010 class are fun and he's able to project himself very well. He's very nice too if you have a question!

Probably the most enthusiastic professor at WPI. His class inspired me to become an ECE major. He was more than welcome to talk to me about the classes I would take and which professors he thinks are the best teachers. He shows real dedication and care when he makes an appearance in the labs to help the students, even though it isn't required.

Amazing Professor. Very enthusiastic about electrical engineering, and his excitement rubs off on you. Always running around the lecture hall to get to different blackboards faster in his excitement. Super accommodating to my mental health needs, and very willing to work with me on rescheduling tests, labs, and pushing back homework assignments.
The best crazy Russian professor. I learned a lot. His class motivated me to major in ECE. If you need to take ECE 2010, do so with him.
Easily the best professor I have ever had. His lectures are filled with energy and they are clear and concise.

Top tier professor. His lectures are the best I have attended at WPI. The class is well organized and he provides practice problems that will prepare you for the weekly tests(all weighted the same and no cumulative midterm or final). If you can take a class with him do it.

Professor Makarov is likely one of the best professors at WPI. His ECE2010 lectures are dynamic, perfectly paced, and his class covers an incredible amount of ground in only 7 weeks. He comes in to lab and helps students out and talks to them about the class even when he could just let TAs handle it all. Fair workload, constant and no big spikes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the best professors I've had at WPI. His lectures are lively, easy to take notes for, and cover more than enough ground without being overwhelming. He knew the names of most people in the class by the middle of the term, and encouraged people to ask questions. He also came into labs and helped us out which was great.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was hybrid and poorly constructed. There was a lot of confusion among students on how the course was running and nothing was clear until it didn't matter anymore. There are tests every Friday based on lectures which are just the TA speaking. Saw the prof once a week for 5 minutes during labs. TA was helpful but I paid for a prof to teach
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Makarov is an amazing professor. His lectures were very engaging and he was able to explain the topics really well. He is available outside of class- a lot of times he would go to labs and matlab help sessions. There are tests every Friday, but there are usually help sessions the night before the test (highly recommend going to those).

The best or nothing !!!!!!!! He is so amazing !!!! I would like to say he is the best professor in our school ! He is always ready to help you. The lecture is a little bit confused if you do not have any background in physics. If you wanna learned something really useful , just choose him as your professor! pleeeeeeease!
He is a good teacher, but he loves his job too much. Made us come in on our day off to take a test. Also, you will have a quiz each week. Get ready to quickly read more ECE than you ever want to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I took ECE 2010 with Makarov and TA for the class now and will probably have him for my MQP. If I were to describe WPI at its best, I would use Makarov as my example. If I were to select one professor to take in underground, Makarov would be my choice.

Best professor at WPI that I've had so far. He knew my name in a large class, and was very encouraging. Lectures involved him sprinting between boards and putting knitting needles in wall plugs. He would come to lab sections and jump right in with the students, showing us cool tricks that went beyond the lab. Gives great hints during tests too.

The first time you will understand anything truly in your life. He has 7 exams, one every week on material he's taught for 3 days and plus an additional lab every week, so lots of work. He's available at 9pm on a Sunday and loves answering questions and helping students out, highly recommend taking his class.

This is the only ECE course I need to take, and I'm happy it was with him. This class made me like ECE, at least for this one class. Super engaging lectures (even at 4pm). Do the homework and understand the concepts, and you will get an A. Matlab assignments are also due weekly, but are only 9% of your grade, so don't fret other that.
Fantastic guy. You will never want to skip his lectures - they are fantastic. Tests every week, but they are easy if you prepare.

I've made it my mission to go back and rate every professor I've had at WP. I'm a pretty average student that knows how to work hard. Sergey Makarov goes above and beyond the call of duty for a professor. He brings the most genuine interest and passion to every lecture and is a joy to have. Not the easiest classes, but you will learn so much.

Makarov is extremely passionate about ECE and really tries to teach you the material. I would recommend reading because the book usually gives easier ways to do things than he does in lecture. The labs are a pain but an easy A if you can get through them. Overall he is great, and there are 6 tests so if you bomb one its no big deal.

Very likeable, enthusiastic guy. I found, however, that he assumes you know many of the fundamentals of EE when in fact you don't, as the class is supposed to teach them. I felt that he was way too fixated on building a "practical" circuit, rather than teaching the full scope of EE fundamentals needed to actually do so; & no CE material is covered.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: He is one of the greatest professor in WPI.

He's an excellent teacher. You'll learn a lot. His lectures are enthusiastic, vivid, clear, and fast-paced. Lots of material, and there's a test EVERY FRIDAY. Tests are based on the homework, which is never collected. The essentials are worth 20pts, the details worth 5 pts. Labs are equal to tests, and they can be confusing, but graded generously.

One of my favorite professors so far. If you are lost in class then you can come to him and he'll be so happy to help. He is so excited about the material! Most likely he will highlight formulas you need, but he derives everything. If the deriving confuses you, wait until he boxes the formula you need. If you are struggling on the test, he;ll help.

Deserves the reputation he has. Tests/HW are easy. Do the reading and HW, they help. Labs are fun. MATLAB assignments can be a little difficult if you've never used it before. Definitely not a light class at 7 hours of class a week + MATLAB/HW/reading on the side. ECE 2010 with Makarov is one of the best classes you can take at WPI.

This was the first real big lecture class I had and it was a big wake up call as far as difficulty, but it was also my favorite class from the semester. Makarov is hilarious. don't miss lectures because they are pertinent to you passing and they are probably going to be the highlight of your day. Go to the lab help session or you will mess it up.

I loved the class and definitly convinced me to be an ECE major.  The lectures went in to depth on the topics but Makarov was so enthusiastic it was never boring. If your having trouble go  for help. The tests were difficult but there are 6 of them so you can do badly on a few but still do well.  Also do book problems!

He really cares about the students and loves what he does. The class really boosted by interest in ECE. Labs are really helpful and fun if your interested. Not much work at all but theres a test every week. He's the only professor I'd take for intro to ECE
Best teacher I ever have!
Awesome professor who defected from Russia, he is super enthusiastic about what he teaches. If you want an easy A, look elsewhere; he makes you work for the grade.
Absolutely my favorite professor at WPI and I'm not even an ECE major
What a great teacher with an amazing Russian accent i wish he taught more classes because i would take all of them he is always there for the student.

Prof. Makarov is what every professor should try to be.  He knows his material inside and out and gives phenomenal lectures.  He is helpful and a genuinely nice person.  Exams are difficult but doable.  To top it all off he has a GREAT Russian accent which makes it easy to listen to his lectures!

I appreciate his enthusiasm during the classes. 9 AM is the time when you still feel sleepy, but he ignites you up positively. So much work in this course, but it's a lot interesting specially the labs. HE HELPS A LOT. I messed up in a quiz but he gave me an alternative to gain extra credit. NOTE: You miss one lecture, you'd not do well on the quiz
The best professor I've had at WPI. I look forward to lecture because it's exciting and entertaining, but totally informative.
Rarely have I had a professor who clearly cares so much about both the material and helping his students learn.  His lectures always kept me interested and have taught me more than any other class.

Makarov is a human pinball. In lectures, he bounces from blackboard to blackboard, gesticulating wildly with his hands, so it's hard not to get into the groove and devote your full attention to the material. In labs, he's phenomenal, always there to help. In the final, he was a guardian angel, walking me through a particularly hard question.
The intro class with him is harder then the other prof, but Makarov is AWESOME! You learn so much and it's obvious he enjoys teaching.
Great Professor! He teaches you a lot of the subject and challenging material, but a lot TA sessions and he engages with students during labs

Makarov was the man! He knows everyone in his lecture and is a really nice guy. I learned a lot in the class, even though I was dreading taking it. He knows his stuff and he makes you want to attend class and learn from him. Better known as Big Mac.

He is very clear and gives good examples that he will take painstaking time to draw accurate pictures to go with. His tests are easy if you attend lecture, read the textbook and actually do the homework

Best teacher ever. Simple and straight forward. Very enthusiastic, runs from board to board all the time. Only assigns few homework problems, problems that will appear on the test, and provides solutions to all of them. Do the homework and you'll do fine. PS Don't worry about derivations on the board, not on test, just does them for fun I think.

BEST TEACHER YOUR WILL HAVE. EVER. although he has an accent, you can still understand. He is insanely passionate about the course and tries to know everyone on a first name basis. Even though homework is optional, do it and you'll pass
TAKE IT WITH HIM.  It may be hard at sometimes but I feel like his class is easy to get an A in if you are interested in learning (which you all should be) He is an amazing person and professor

This guy is so enthusiastic about the material that it's funny.  Lectures are engaging and fun to listen to.  He attended every one of the lab sessions and was always willing to help.  I wish he could teach all of my classes.

Best Professor in the ECE department and WPI in general.  Makes the material fun and interesting. Labs are very cool, as he attends all of them and shows you extra cool things. Can be a lot of work at times, but he is understanding if you talk to him. He will literally put aside what he is doing to help you outside of class. Take Makarov.
Absolutely awesome. I switched my major into ECE after taking the intro class with him! One of the best professors in WPI for sure! Really good at teaching and has a great passion towards teaching!
Good professor and obviously loves what he is teaching.

I'm a junior ME student and Prof. Makarov has been the best teacher I've had in my time at WPI so far. Really enthusiastic about what he's doing! Truly dedicated to making sure you learn the material, and shows up to every lab. He's an entertaining lecturer and really inspires. I wish I had half the enthusiasm for my ME classes as I did this one

Makarov is a great professor, he cares about each student's progress and he puts in 110% effort for every class, lab, etc... Tests are sometimes hard, but so is the material. Labs are a good complement to the class.
he is a good teacher

Amazing Enthusiastic Professor, Dedicated to students, knows 100 students by name, attends all labs to help you finish. Funny, intelligent.  Attending Office Hours will help you even more. As long as you pay attention in class and focus for labs, You will have the experience of a lifetime while kick starting you ECE education with fun applications.

Super enthusiastic, to the point of it being really funny- keeps things interesting though! Cares a lot about students- goes to every lab section and tries his best to help you. Tests are fairly difficult, but it's easy to get A's on labs. Highly recommend =)
Awesome professor! God bless him!

He is an okay professor. He talks very fast and spends more time on deriving the equations than teaching you how to use them in examples. He is very nice and caring but simply not great at explaining how to do things and this shows with our class average being low. He also assigns a lot of work, this class will stress you out big time.

One of the best professors you will ever meet. If you care so will he! He is a fair grader, he understands most situations, however there is that language barrier.I loved this class! However the labs in the middle of the course are too long and dont miss Thursday's lecture, for all 75% of the test is based on it! Too much material, too little time!

He made what I thought would be boring material interesting. Extremely helpful, will go out of his way to help you understand. He's so enthusiastic its impossible not to get into the class at least a bit. Best professor I've had here.

Professor Makarov is certainly a character, but he is one of the best professors I have ever had. He genuinely wants students to learn, makes class interesting with his vigorous teaching style (it's hilarious!), and is extremely amiable. If you want to learn ECE the right way - TAKE MAKAROV!
best professor at ECE department ever! I took the intro course with him and he made me love ECE~ simply the best!

Best professor ever. I went in to this class concerned since it was my first ECE class. ON the first day Professor Makarov came up to me and introduced himself and asked me my name, he had trouble pronouncing it so he asked me to write it down for him. After that, he and I talked regularly. In conclusion, best professor ever.

This is by far the best professor I have had at WPI. He actually cared about how his students did in his class, as well as he was so totally enthused by the material himself he was able to make lectures an enjoyable experience rather than insipid. His tests can be a challenge, but keep up with the material and you will do fine.

Professor Makarov is the best teacher (not just professor) I've ever had. His competence, enthusiasm, and helpfulness have made his class one of the best I've ever taken. Not to mention he essentially knows every student by first name (impressive given the size of the class). He also attended every 3 hour lab. Now that's dedication. He's the man.
Enthusiastic and precise. His lectures are incredibly organized and helpful.
Great teacher
Great, great professor. Very interested in what he does. Go to lectures, pay attention, and you should be fine.

LOVED HIM! great great guy, I have never laughed so much at a lecture. he made material fun and his labs were interesting but a little long. exams were reasonable and his TA Kurk was awesomly helpful.take the class with him, you will not regret it. great greay professor!
Wonderful Professor, Made the hard material Easy. Very committed and helpful. Dedicated but his labs are loooong though. Exams are fair and not too hard.
Committed Professor, I enjoyed the class

Great professor. Made ECE fun when I thought it was going to suck. Lectures are interesting and engaging. He applies everything to the real world constantly. The labs were also fun. His tests are quite easy too. If you take notes and listen in lectures, an A should be no problem.
Cool class. Good guy. A little unclear at times, but it was manageable. Easy quizzes. Textbook was horrid though.

most useless class(es) ever...they are wicked easy since the guy asks you jack on the quizzes but otherwise a complete waste of time...avoid unless you want easy classes to fill in with your MQP or such.
not funny

The class was not a waste of time but his lectures were a bit unclear at times because of the language barrier.  Hes a good guy otherwise though.  The quizes were not easy, but you could usually pass them without killing yourself.

Oh I completely disagree. His lectures are absolutely mediocre - you can SEE him struggle trying to teach any and every concept...the only reason you might disagree with me might be that you, yourself, were sleeping in the class and so perhaps you really didn't notice how much he sucks.

Someone said this is a waste of time for ECE majors. ignore that person. Makarov is the most amazing professor I've had at WPI. His 3311 lectures were amazing in their clarity, logical progression, and conclusion. You'll have to work like crazy for this class to pay off, but it will if you put the effort in.
he blows

Don't know about non-majors but this class is a waste of time for ECE majors. Just skip this class and take CommII if you want to learn anything. The professor is very unorganized, unclear in everything he does and teaches you whatever his research interests may be, as opposed to what the course description says in the catalog...

Good guy, getting to know him will definately help keep your grade high.  Difficult material for non majors.  Likes to start lecture about 5 mins early, so get to class!  Decent class, labs are cool.  Good guy
No Comments

He was very good.  Nice guy.  Very clear and understandable lectures.  As people before me have said, he seems very enthusiastic about the subject matter despite the fact that he's teaching non-majors.  Definitely take his class if you can.

Fantastic guy as a professor.  You have to really sleep through (or not go to) his lectures to fail (although it is possible).  He was a great resource for another class, even though he wasn't our professor then.
Works hard to get the matter across. Has a somewhat heavy Russian accent. Overall OK.

A great guy and teacher. He is very organized, very enthusiastic and very clear. He is helpful in the labs, help sessions and dedicated to helping students understand the material. He does an amazing job considering that he is teaching a bunch of non-majors. One of the best you will find here.

Very enthusiastic, I took this course cause I almost failed 2011 (I am an EE) and I wanted to make sure I understood the basics.  He is great and helped me a lot, I have done very well in my other courses since starting off sort of shakey in his course.
Makarov is the most organized professor I've had here. He is so enthusiastic about the material he makes you enjoy it. The most sincere teacher I've had here too. A great guy all in all.
I wish a lot of other professors followed his teahing method!!! Great system, very organized,  and love for the subject that he transfers to you. I learned a lot. If your lost, GO TO HELP SESSIONS!!!

At first I was not not enthusiatic about ECE3601, I am ME (thermo-fluids).By the end of the class I was almost as enthusiatic as he was, spending much time for the class. As a result he gave me a ECE text as a gift.Thank You Prof. (1 of the best @WPI)
Evinced as much genuine enthusiasm for the subject matter as anyone I've had here, which is especially impressive given that he was teaching a bunch of non-majors.  Good guy.
Absolutely one of the most underated professors at WPI. Willing to help you in any way he can. Clear and concise teaching style.

This professor is so enthusiastic about teaching you can easily stay awake during lecture.  Sincere and helpful.  Lectures are very neat and organized: my notes are legible! Friday 'quizzes' (7) instead of midterm and final allow you to make up bad grades
This guy can't speak english at all. He won't help much either. Stay away from him.
No Comments
One of the nicest and most sincere professors I've encountered. Trult cares about each students.
No Comments
He is an awesome teacher!
Very funny teacher, presents a slide show for lecture, sometimes hard to follow. Very easy class, sometimes hard to understand but very straight forward guy.

Good lecturer and not much homework. The lectures are his notes and he just goes through them, but it's not confusing. There is only one homework a week, and the tests were all online for this course. Good professor and good person.

He is a funny and great guy. His lectures are him reading off of a PDF of his own work but are not difficult to follow. He understands that math is hard and does not expect more than a basic understanding. The homework is good preparation for exams. Tang's exams are online, easy, and similar to his practice exams, but you will be pressed for time.

I think I went to this class all of 3 times. Just read the notes he puts up online, do the homework, and you'll be fine. Half the test questions come directly from the homework— sometimes he forgets to even change the numbers.

Nice guy and cares about attendance and effort but bad professor. Only gave 2 exams so if you do poorly on one youre done for the term. Notes are chicken scratch and lectures are impossible to follow, no point in going. Insanely tough grader of exams, wont accept any corrections or concerns you might have. Avoid if youre able to, nightmare term.

Nice guy and takes appreciates effort and attendance, but very harsh grader on exams and only gives 5 homework assignments. If you perform poorly on one exam, youre done for the term. Also says that he is open to discussing exam grading mistakes, but denies every attempt. Notes are chicken scratch and lectures are unorganized. Avoid if possible.

Tang is a nightmare professor, he is basically inaccessible outside of class, his lectures are all over the place and never have any real structure, his notes are basically unreadable and it is almost impossible to have a real discussion with him about grades because the "Grader grades everything" and he is not involved. Tests were online.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I found that Professor Tang was a great lecturer; everything lined up well with our assignments. The little homework he gave was straightforward and we always had plenty of time to complete it. There were only three (non-cumulative) tests and he provided useful practice tests beforehand. As long as you go to class you'll have no trouble at all.

Professor Tang had a strange form of lecturing. He utilized pre-written, chicken scratch notes that he read to the class, but on occasion, he would write on the board for clarity. He also would go off on tangents, with little relevance to the lecture, for up to ten minutes. Overall, my TA was more helpful in my understanding of the material.

Terrible professor, grading entirely depends on TA (similar tests had a 40% difference across different graders), I was fine in this course because I had a good TA, but he is unhelpful and unwilling to help students, his answer is  to study harder for anything you ask

The workload of the homework will only be felt if you intend to do each week's assignments in one weekend. The tests are very similar to study guide. He might seem unhelpful during lectures when you ask questions because he turns it into a joke for the whole class, but if you ask him in person he is a very nice guy and will help you for sure.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His class itself is not too bad, however he extremely rude when you reach out to him for anything. In lecture he is very nice, but one on one he is extremely rude and unprofessional.
This professor was awful. Doesn't know what he's talking about. Has to get corrected during the class all the time, and reacts with screaming. Actually 1head.
Amazing lectures, amazing quotes, very clear explanations. Don't miss lecture, it will always be a fun time.

He's a lighthearted guy and cares about what he teaches, but he sometimes avoids the questions he gets asked. His notes look like chicken scratch. But the lay out of every test is very clear. Go to the prep sessions and look at the practice exams. The best thing I experienced in this class was my TA. He was very accessible with email.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Tang holds true to his grading criteria. He has wide knowledge of the stock market, and wants nothing more than his students to succeed. Professor Tang is great, and to maximize the quality of your experience, you must come to him with questions if you expect him to share more on a specific topic.
Awful. Don't even bother.

DISCLAIMER: Took the class online during quarantine, maybe he's a better teacher in-person? Lecture style was very disjointed and confusing--our TA could explain every concept better in half the time. Lecture notes were disjointed and difficult to read, questions weren't answered clearly or well. Would recommend finding a different prof if possible

This professor is quite difficult to understand and is disorganized during his lectures. He doesn't respond well to feedback and can be rude when questions are asked. His grading system is ridiculous, he actually went against the normal grading scale and made it harder to get an A or a B in the course(needed over 90 or 80 respectively).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: He is the kind of professor to give you a lot of homework and make you study all by yourself. The topics of the class are pretty simple, but prepare to learn by yourself. All of that would be enough to make him a bad professor, but he is absolutely unable to take any criticism. Worst math proff I have ever had
The tests feel like a challenge as to what is actually taught in the lecture. Not helpful when asked questions or advice. Much of the new material is just assumed to be known.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Sends out practice tests which are very similar to the tests he gives

Learn material on own time or in conference. Equations will be pulled out of midair and brushed over in less than a second. Teacher doesnt explain steps or even read aloud what hes doing. Erases board fast and inaccurate so reading the board is a front rows thing. Text book is needed for homework.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: honestly just take my word for it and don't take his class. he tries to explain things through confusing metaphors and no one has any idea what he's saying, attendance is not mandatory and after the first exam people just stopped showing up. not good at explaining things and will get mad at you for not understanding the material.

Professor has high standards for his students. He doesn't care if you're here to mess around or be rude. Great feedback and approachable outside of class. Recognizes students who seek out help and takes note of it accordingly. Show up, do the work, be respectful and you will do well. Professor is funny at times and is known to roast students.

Funny guy, knows his stuff, allows formula sheet front and back, provides practice tests and actual tests are pretty similar. Gives lots of partial credit if you show work. Pretty easy A as long as you do the work, go to class, and get help if you don't understand something by going to office hours, MASH, tutoring, etc. Overall would recommend.

Dalin Tang is not a bad person. He knows his material, and if you actually pay attention to his lecture, you pick up a decent amount of information. However, participating in his class is a wild ride, even though he really wants you to. When I tried, he roasted me, so I kinda just layed low for the rest of the term. However, he is a good professor.

Pretty confusing and disrespectful. Attendence was not graded, but he got mad when only a few people showed up. He based his cutoff of A, B, and C off of how well the class did, not off how many points were earned on the assignments. With no way to check your grade, final grading was confusing and we had to get like a 94% to actually get an A.
He gets off from failing his students. Class test averages were about 40%, I passed with a 50%. Get ready to teach yourself. Sal Khan was the only way I survived.
Caring professor, gives good feedbacks. Communicate with him immediately if there is anything you don't understand and he will help out!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: basically spend around 2-hour per week watching stock price and write the report. It was a little bit rough on start, since we didn't get on the same idea and had to do a lot of initial research. However, gave good and helpful feedback, knew what he wanted, reasonable and always available to answer questions. Overall, highly recommended for IQP.
He is a really good professor. Gives you the freedom to choose your resources. The IQP gives you a great experience with the investment in stock market. Just follow what he says and you will be fine

Professor Tang was very disappointing in terms of clarity. Most of my classmates would agree that the conferences were the only consistent source of help with the class topics. Unfortunately he is also not always respectful of all his students, especially during office hours, AND I suspect one of my exam grades was lowered for non-academic reasons.

Some professor tell stories to keep you interested but they only do that once they get their point across. This guy, however, cuts in right in between the lesson and goes off topic which was terrible. he is confusing and you won't survive without a good conference instructor. The comment below mine has exaggerated the matter. he's not that bad.

TERRIBLE PROFESSOR. DID NOT TEACH ONE THING - DO NOT GO TO LECTURES. VERY DEGRADING AND ALWAYS RUDE TO HIS STUDENTS. IF YOU GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS, HE WILL CALL YOU STUPID AND KICK YOU OUT. LEARNED EVERYTHING FROM CONFERENCE. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR - HE IS SO UNBELIEVABLY RUDE AND DOES NOT CARE ABOUT HIS STUDENTS.
very confusing in lectures, you need a good PLA to understand the material. Class was easy though.

Do not take this professor if you want to learn. I didn't learn anything. You do the work you fine in the course. Great if you are retaking it. not so much if you need to learn the material for later.

Tang is a great professor and is probably the most helpful faculty you will meet. Good Accent. He's humorous in his lectures but can get too much when you're trying to understand the material and he goes off topic mid-explanation. Some might say a good part of the class didn't go to lecture. Do the home works well in advance, you should ace it!

Best Math professor i have had so far at WPI. He brings examples from real word and relate them to math and that what I like most about him. If you don't get an A in his class, math is not your thing.
IQP was a very pleasant experience. Feedback was consistent, knowledgeable and helpful.
Great IQP Advisor, really gives the students free range of the project to do what they want and responds very quickly to emails.  Quite knowledgeable about the stock market topic and great feedback

Best math teacher at WPI. Gives concise and easy to understand explanations. Thick accent but I could still easily follow his explanations even if I wasn't catching every word he said. Also awkwardly funny.

He is very funny and engaging; good at answering questions; presents material in an organized manner that makes it easy to study for tests; book used is an old version (I got it for $5!); don't talk in class and you'll have a good time!
Very funny during lecture, not the clearest explanations, homework is very hard but he grades VERY fairly.  Do the work and you'll be fine.
Extremely humorous and keeps lengthy procedures to a minimal with simple bullet point procedures to solving problems.

Tang is a unique professor: he understands his students, yet he also understands what it takes to get ahead. Frequently dishes out fun bits of life advice which keep you entertained. class is very challenging, however he teaches you good work ethic. no surprises on tests; representative of the material. overall very good prof. Pick him if you can.
Very good teacher. Tests are hard, but fair: no surprises. Makes everything understandable.Very good teacher, but can be very scary personality-wise.
Good prof. Tough tests but easy grading policy. If you fail his class you probably belong at QCC
Very hard to understand.

If you don't like professor Tang, it's because you suck at math and just want to blame your professor. His English is good enough to understand easily and bad enough to entertain you during lecture. His asides during class may take up time, but it keeps you awake, and when he does teach you, he is to the point. Fantastic professor.
Very helpful and thoughtful professor.
AWESOMEST TEACHER EVAR!!!! pero, L2Engrish
I did the Stock Exchange IQP With Prof. Dalin Tang and it was a great experience and We ended up doing very well, Highly Recommended

Talk to him right away when you dont understand something that he wrote. It is much easy that way rather than changing your paper without fully understand his comments. There were a bit miscommunications between us. But they were all resolved in the end.

I took Differential Equations with Prof. Tang and enjoyed it very much.  I learned a lot and still use much of the material I learned in my ECE courses todday.     If you do the homework, show up for lecture, and seek help when you need it the course will be fine. I would reccomend Prof. Tang

He explains the material very clearly and makes sure everyone understands it. The notes I took were a book in brief, so there was little need to read it. No surprises on the tests because he makes sure everyone is prepared to those. His grading curve is absolutely amazing.
Has interesting research/MQP opportunities for students. Recommended as a research advisor.

Amazing professor.  Think of him like a miniature budah.  Has a good sense of humor and teaches the material, just show up to lecture.  On the plus side cheat sheets and calculators are allowed on tests.  One other thing GO TO CONFERENCE, they will help so much.

Not a cool guy. He doesn't seem to enjoy helping the students. Tests and hw are not bad but he covers a lot of material (more than other professors). Also, he gets angry very easily, especially if nobody answers his questions.
Hard to understand.
Good math professor for DFQ, have good sense of humor. Class is easy, and exams are fair. Just understand how to do the Hw, you should be getting at least B in the class
Hard to understand, Didn't explain the material that well... I'd try and find a math teacher that speaks english (good luck)
Bad to quite bad.  Can't speak or write english.  Easiest IQP ever though if you like slacking off bigtime and getting an A for it.
No Comments
No Comments
WASTE OF TIME. If you take his class, you'll have to take it again. You can't understand half of what he says and he's mean to you when you ask him to repeat himself.
No Comments
No Comments
Not cool
No Comments
Horrible teacher, never answered your questions directly. Very mean to his students and basically yelled at you if you didn't understand what he was talking about

Dalin was by far the ABSOLUTE worst professor I have ever heard of or had. He was completely unhelpful, mean, and his classes were horrible. I would never take another class offered by him, even if it meant I would not graduate.

KNows exactly what he was talking about, and teaches it well.  Willing to answer questions, even if they are ridiculous.  Very very funny and it helps pass the time.  Isn't wikid wikid easy, his one downside is that he doesnt always finish examples in class.  But overall great to have!

I agree with an earlier rate, Tang needs to stop bullying people around. If you don't do well, he's more likely to criticize than help at all. He is without compassion or sympathy-he said himself, "I am a machine." His tests will usually catch you off guard with their rediculous difficulty.

Prof. Tang's lectures are almost useless. He is funny though. Talks a lot about China. His lectures were the only Math lectures, other than Prof. Labenski's(Awesome Prof, who left), in which I were able to stay awake. This is because of his moderately funny jokes. Helps in his office anytime.

Dalin Tang was one of the most energetic math professors I've had. He's full of funny asides, and tends to waste class time. But, it's entertaining to write all the sayings down and it helps you to pay attention.

Tang is one of the best math prof. in wpi math department. His lectures are very clear and helpful, he got a great sense of humor and will keeps you laugh in the class for the whole time. Tang makes this DFQ course very interesting and i learn alot from his lectures.
Easy to understand and the tests were pretty fair.  Lectures were boring but what are you gonna do?  It's math.  Dalin is a good guy.
This guy is The Man.  HILARIOUS.  plus he's supposed to be the easiest guy you can get for diffeq's.
Dalin Tang is an amazing professor. He is funny and conveys the information well. He's is not hard to understand at all. Tests are very fair. If you go to lecture you shouldn't have any trouble.
this guy needs to get a grip on life and stop bullying people around...probably a half decent professor otherwise

I had Dalin "David" Tang for MA1022 as well and both times I found him fair and pretty easy to understand. His accent and ramblings are humorous. But he takes the time to explain everything to everyone unlike most professors. Very easy class.
Tang is a good professor
Lecture didn't help me learn the material too much.  Conference with the PLAs was much much more helpful.

His so-called accent is overblown. He's actually quite easy to understand once you get used to it. The problem is that his lectures are boring and the book used is written by a WPI Professor (i.e. it sucks). Get a different book for studying purposes.

Terrible professor.  He should not be teaching anywhere in America.  He cannot communicate at all and send 50 emails a week.  His English is horrendous.  Never take his class.  He doesn't care about you, that's for sure.  If you know Chinese you're set!
This guy is really smart, and knows how to explain things well... if you can understand what he's saying. Take good notes, and use a cheat sheet! DiffEq's fits on 1 piece of paper (really!)
No Comments
He said  You No Go To Lectia, Minus Twenty-Five!   This guy is very unlcear and not cool....but if  you do not learn the equation....you feel shame!!
Easy class!
Very concerned for the students.
Just as long as you don't pay any attention to what he says and pay attention to what he writes you will be fine.
Why is he still here?
Doesn't speak English.  Makes no sense.
doesn't speak english very well at all, only made it through b/c of good PLA
No Comments
Hard course.  If you really want to pass, you can.
No speaky english
Hard course, but he tries to help out
No Comments

There will be homework, but less than many of the calc teachers. His lectures are occasionally a bit tough to follow, but if you keep listening things usually get cleared up. He's generally friendly and tries to be helpful. Passing the class is very straightforward - if you understood the homework, you'll do well on the tests.
Best professor ever. If you want an A, go for it.  All the class about is calculation, not too much definition, no reading homework. The test is easy enough if you can do all the stuffs on notes.

Dr. Qi Han is always there for his students. If needed, he makes himself available outside office hours to help any student who needs it. He assigns homework on each section covered in class and then weekly quizzes that replicate the homework. He has an accent so it's hard to comprehend at times but he's always willing to explain things.

The guy knows what he is doing and is compromised to getting you to learn. He can be very funny and although he has kind of an accent, he is understandable and easy to follow. Will help as much as he can and is a fair grader, shares his notes after every class.

I like Qi Han's teaching style (he only writes on the chalkboard), but he was absent for many classes this term with no explanation. Many times, when someone would ask a question he would use a somewhat condescending tone. I think that Qi Han is a good guy, but not for Calc 3.
Qi Han is super cool. Not as good at teaching calc 3 as calc 2 in my opinion but he's still a good professor

Great professor, beautiful class, difficult material, reasonable tests. Professor Han is always ready to help as loon as you ask or visit him in office hours. Made me ready for cal 3 4 and will follow him in C term. He should go easier and strengthen less topics in the future, but I like his teaching style and class organization very much

Han is a great professor. His quizzes are straightforward and many of the exam questions are taken directly from the quizzes. Only complaint is that I had him for Calculus 2 and he didn't teach us many of the topics that were on the Common Final.

It was a great class and Prof Hen did an amazing job! He really cares our learning and did his best to help us. He taught the material clearly, warned us frequently common mistakes and explained the connections of college math courses, and always gave us interesting bonus problems. My only complaint is about the HW; otherwise I really love it

PROFHan is a great person and teacher! The mathematics was taught clearly, and the class was a lot of fun  as he made jokes or presented the material using graphs or cartoons. The quizzes and tests are hard, but most the topics were shown either in class or via HWs. Pay attention and you will do well. I will follow him to cal 3 next term :-)

He gives lots of examples and extra credit on every quiz and test.  He barely has an accent, you can understand him perfectly. He asks for feedback a lot, he really wants to make sure you're learning and understanding. Absolutely amazing professor
My favorite math teacher at WPI. I like his teaching style and cannot recommend him enough. Do the homework, go to him and ask questions and you will master the material and succeed.

4HW, 4QZ, 2Tests were all you needed. QZ straightforward, Tests hard, the first HW was big - 30+ problems about row reduction and solving linear system of eqs with lots of computations. He taught most parts clearly and pretty laid-back, and used cartoons  sometimes - the class was fun. He asked us for feedback so he cares about his teaching.
He is a great professor and prepared me well for the final!
I would take his class again. Sometimes hard to understand, but he is a very good teacher and by far the best Calculus 2 professor at WPI

Professor Han is amazingly understanding about the rigor of most college courses, which makes him very easy to talk to about grades or questions. Also he doesn't want to have to give out anything less than an A!
Good amount of assignments, doesn't go overboard on assignments like other introductory math professors. Last test was a lot harder than the rest of the material.

The first part went really slow - 2 weeks on row reduction. That could be good for those who did not know matrices before. After that, I think everything went smoothly and Han explained the motivation and application clearly, especially about the eigenvalue problems. I particularly liked his color coded way in showing matrices multiplication.

I took the introductory linear algebra course with Han. He taught very slowly, and didn't explain much. I can now diagonalize a matrix, but I have no idea what that actually means or why you would want to do it.
Excellent professor. Really tells you everything you need to know for each test and quiz.
Amazing professor!!
He's an awesome teacher. Sometimes hard to understand, but he wants you to do well and makes it easy for you to do so.

Han is a very nice person and a great professor who knows the background of his students and how to adjust his teaching. The material can be hard depending your experience with matrices, but he does make things easier to be understood. 2 tests and 4 HW and quizzes. Extremely helpful online notes, solutions sets and chapter reviews.

Professor Han is a great professor and his lectures are very straight forward. He puts notes online and chapter summaries that will tell you exactly what kinds of problems will be on the test. The tests are exactly how he says they'll be, there are no surprises. If you put the work in, you can get an A.
Dr. Han is a riot in class. He discusses his policies frankly and honestly, and offers all the assistance he can to his students. The course is straightforward. Study, and then pass.

It took me about a week or two to see the logic of Dr. Han's teaching and after that everything goes smoothly and almost perfect. His is really inspirational and ready to answer your questions whenever you ask him. I would say do the assigned work carefully and use his office hours effectively then you are surely safe.
Good guy, there to help and solid grading system. Makes you work to learn the material by assigning a targeted number of homework problems that will best help
homework helps on testsquizzes, fair grading
drops lowest homework grades, clear about test topics, organized notes

Can't say enough good things about Professor Han! He was clear with course objectives, understanding about material we needed to cover, and helped us with anything we didn't know that would help us do better in his class.
Good course, prepare you for the graduate course
The class content was difficult, but assignments are easy as long as you take lectures. Exams were based on assignments and lecture notes. Han is a really helpful teacher.

Prof. Han is someone who really cares about the subject he teaches and the students taking his classes. He encourages any and all questions and stresses understanding over grades or straight memorization. If you go to lecture and pay attention, you'll do fine on tests and homeworks. You might even have fun.

Qi is an incredible teacher. He was able to take an intricate class such an the  Calculus of Variations and make it into a beautiful journey of mathematics. I highly reckon anyone to take this class, really opens your eyes up to the power of mathematics and calculus.

I know there are great calc professors and terrible ones, but I'd put him a little above average. He's not amazing, not terrible. Lectures are kinda confusing - doesn't always tell you what you need to know for quizzes. But I'd generally say he's a great teacher. His homework is SUPER HELPFUL, so do the assigned problems and you'll pass with ease.

Master Han is the man. He cares very much for his students and their success, is always happy to answer questions, even from the dummy who asks the most obvious ones - and always respectfully. Kinda feels like we're his children. Excellent, excellent professor. You'll work, but you'll know the material cold when the term is over.

Took MA1023 and MA1024 with him. Clearly explains everything. Feel free to go talk to him after the class with any of your queries. Encourages communication outside the class (like in his office hours). Willing to go over class material again if you have any problems. Pay attention in his class, do well in his quizzes and you should be all set!
Once you get past his accent he's a really good professor.

Awesome teacher, condenses the text and the syllabus to its essentials, assigns only what is absolutely necessary; very fair grader who gives lots of partial credit. Makes jokes in class occasionally. Cares about the application of the mathematics he teaches.
Not a bad course. Pay attention in class and you'll ace the quizzes and tests.

Lots of examples that are easy to follow and make the material easy to understand. He won't let you fail the class so as long as you do the work you're guaranteed not to NR. I would definitely take this class again.

Professor Han was an amazing professor! He goes very in depth with concepts to make sure you understand them,  but he doesn't just hand you an A. At times he'll give you exact questions from the exams as examples so it's recommended that you go to lecture. Also, do the homework to further understand concepts, it's really helpful! Would take again!

Professor Han is the BEST Math Professor I have had at WPI. He cares a great deal about the success of his students. He truly wants you to succeed and gives you all the tools to do so. If you attend lecture, pay attention and take the time to learn the fundamental concepts behind what he teaches, you will earn an A. He is helpful and hilarious!

Qi Han is a very good professor. Lectures helped teach material and he is actually kind of funny. He asked us to rate him on here which shows he wants to be a good professor and wants to improve where he needs to.
His lectures were very good, a bit hard to understand at times, but the course content was well explained.
He's very clear when explaining things. He gives so many examples and how to work through them. He tells you what the test will be like and the topics on it so you can be more prepared for it.

The class is hard but the way it's given is very inspirational with many 3d graphs - it simply makes you understand, think and work to success. Prof  Han is very nice and helpful, and hef an interesting person like a cowboy, I feel... Be careful though to listen - even he put his notes online everyday, he also presented different things in class.
Qi Han is the best calculus teacher I've had at this school, however the class was difficult as Calc 3 is, so it took a lot of work.

Explains everything well, though some may find notes to not be straightforward enough. Ranks topic importance for the final. Gives plenty of examples. Tries to make himself a better teacher-takes suggestions seriously. Is a happy person. Straightforward tests, with the occasional repetition of a hard problem from HW (due weekly). Great teacher
This guy is the man. Great teacher. Really understands how to discipline the students indirectly.
Qi Han is a god. He makes it his goal not just to teach you, but to make sure you learn the material. There are only four quizzes and homeworks per term, so I never felt overwhelmed.

Professor Han is a very good teacher. His lectures are clear and to the point, but he is always willing to answer questions too. I did very well in the class with a very reasonable amount of work.  He often tells you what is on the quizzes or at least hints. Definitely, do the homework and don't leave it until the last minute.

Professor Han is direct in what he expects from his students. He gives you a straight-forward guideline of what is important for tests, and what he is teaching for theory and understanding. He asks if you have any questions, and will do his best to answer during lectures. Otherwise, he will tell you to talk to him after class. Awesome teacher!

Prof. Han is an amazing professor. His lectures are good, although most of the time I felt the need to look for additional help after the lecture (my Calc background was not good, though, so that may not be your case). Most people could get around a B in his class, and probably an A if you have a good Calc background or already know the stuff.
wonderful guy and take cal4 with him. To be continued...
He's great. Nuff said.
With homework turned in weekly you have plenty of time to clear up anything that you do not fully understand.

This is my best math class ever and I really enjoined it. The course was taught very clearly and the notes were neat and updated online that were so so so helpful, you won't even buy the book...I am not really good at math but this time I am really into it as I do not have to do long, boring computations. Strongly recommend and take calv with him

I had taken a course similar before at another institution so I already knew some of the material. He is straight forward about what will be on quizzes and exams. The most challenging aspect is his unorganized notes. Overall, I got an A in the course due to prior knowledge and using the TA as a resource. Prof. Han is decent though.
Very clear, fair grading
Interested in providing his students with the most important aspects of the curriculum to underline the necessities and put less focus on the useless points that the syllabus requires.

Professor Han is a very good teacher. Depending on you math background, the class could be easy or difficult. He has an accent that can bother some, but I was able to understand him. A large portion of your grade is based off of the final. Doing practice problems from the book is a great way to study for his quizzes and the final.
Great prof. Inspired you all through the semester. Never skipped a single class and fight  for  pass - it seems my hard work paid off with a B Would recommend him and surely take his class again...

Professor Han is a great teacher who tells you exactly what you need to know to do well in the course. He cares most that students understand the mathematics as opposed to showing them long and drawn out proofs.
Need to work more on pronunciation!

He is an okay professor in terms of teaching, but his explanations can sometimes be unclear. The grading of the class is a little rough. You could get an A on everything and still get a C in the class if you do not do well on the final exam, which is a difficult test in the first place. Be willing to study for days before the final.

Professor Han was very helpful overall. He used a lot of examples in his lectures, and he gave only one homework assignment per week, so the workload was very manageable. His quizzes were also much easier than the homework, so if you can do the homework, you should be able to get an A. Would highly recommend taking Calc 3 with him.
Han is very helpful, he'll make sure you understand the material before he moves on if much of the class doesn't understand. Also keeps it lively. Good prof.

Dr. Han is a very generous and fair professor. He drops the lowest quiz and homework grade (theres about 5 of each) and gives several bonus questions, so it is very possible to maintain a high average until the final. He is very clear on what you need to know for the final exam and  is very willing to spend more time on topics if its needed.
He's a great professor. It's too bad I wont be having him for Calc IV.

Han is the man. Class is very easy to get a B and if you put in a little work can get an A. Quizzes are very easy, once a week or two weeks, and there are only 4-5 HW assignments total. Final is challenging but not impossible. Take this class if you can
I would definitely recommend taking a class with Qi. He teaches well and I'm fairly certain he is a certifiable genius. He is also humorous. All around great experience with this Professor.

Professor Han is a fantastic professor. He teaches math in a very efficient and understandable manner. It may be difficult to understand his accent, but you will learn a lot. No tests, but weekly to biweekly quizzes that are two or three questions. Pay attention in lecture and it will be an easy A.

Good guy, but class is very cursory and boring and he does not properly explain the concepts for use in later mathematics classes. Easy A but would not recommend for students who actually want to learn new math.

Prof. Han is an excellent professor. I really enjoyed his class. The way he sets up the class makes it easy for a student to be rewarded for hard work and persistence. The final was tough but I still got an A. With Prof. Han I feel as though anyone who puts in the time will be successful in the class. I would give him my very highest recommendation

He is an exceptional professor, very invested and enthusiastic in helping students learn. His mild accent did not inhibit clarity for the most part. He always listens to students suggestions and requests and works hard to make the class work for everyone. Very fair assessments. Friendly guy. WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!!!
Qi is a great prof.  Knows his class and knows they do not want bs.  Teaches to the class not just from the book and does a really good job.

Professor Han is an excellent teacher. He explains all his examples in full detail so you understand. Also all work learned in class and through the homework accurately showcase what were on the quizzes and final exam.

Professor Han is excellent. He is clear and thorough explaining the material in the lecture. His notes are well organized and available online and the homework he assigns is relevent to what you will see on the exams. He is very willing to answer any questions in the lecture or in his office hours. I would choose him as my professor again for sure.

He is very understanding. Overall he is a good professor and he cares for his student. He also frequently asked us to asses his teaching style. So I think he is someone who listens to his students and looks out for their best interests. He is reasonable person to talk to in terms of grades and any sort of concerns related to the class.
He is overall a good professor. I liked the fact that the homework, the quizzes and the test reflect the things that we have gone over multiple times in class. Easy class yet super helpful.

I loved having him as a Professor. He really cares about his students and encourages them to attend office hours for extra help. His homework assignments properly prepared me for his exams & final. Notes are easy to follow and it helps that he posts them online after each lecture. Wish he was my professor for calc 3 and 4! Would strongly recommend

Professor Han made things easier to approach and understand, with some very relevant homework questions and in class quizzes. He also gave 2 tests which enforced the key topics for the final exam. He is very helpful and always answered your questions. Recommend him.

Qi is an outstanding teacher. His lectures are clear and easy to understand, he provides detailed examples of all the materials covered in exam, and he is easy to reach out to for additional assistance if need be.
very good
Good

He is a really good teacher who simplifies everything down so that you can understand the basics and then get good grades on his quizes. He is eager to help anyone who has a question as long as you ask

Very helpful Professor. He showed us many many examples in detail and gave us some quizzes for practice. HW are assigned very carefully without repeating too many problems. Questions are very relevant and helpful for understanding the theory. Final exam are hard but with bonus. Grading are very fair.
Very good teacher

He is the best professor in the world!Extremely caring and he would do his best to help students get a good grade. I totally recommend him, he is such a nice guy. pretty easy grader his exams are easy and the hw assigned is pretty helpful. He is the best! He made me love math again!
Very helpful professor and tests are kind of easy. However, his teaching sometimes lacks examples and difficult to understand.

Great professor! Extremely helpful and understanding towards the students. The assigned homework was relevant and helpful in learning the material. Sometimes there were a little too many problems though. As the term went on I understood more of what was being taught in lecture because Han slowed down to meet the students needs.

He does plenty of examples to help you understand how to use the concepts.  The homework was good review for the tests but it would be nice if you could ask questions about the ones you don't understand. His hand writing is a little hard to read

Han is a very nice professor and his teaching style is awesome. In the beginning, he went fast yet he improved his teaching greatly ever since he asked us for feedback. He was willing to help and answered your emails quickly, even during weekend. He also clarified hard concepts efficiently. I am happy to have him as my first college math teacher.

His lectures are difficult to follow. Very information heavy without much explanation. Skips steps in examples, leaving students feeling confused and lost as to how he got the answer he did. His English is not the best (not his fault) but it also adds to the confusion aspect of his lectures. Questions on tests are very different than homework

His lectures are not engaging in the slightest. 

His grading scheme makes it easy to fail if you lose your footing

If you are into doing homework, his quizzes are easy to pass, but it is a LOT of homework, get ready to abandon your hobby or club for a while

If you are not good at taking tests, this is NOT the class for you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I thought his lectures explained the topics very well and his grading was fair. He gave two exams, weekly homework (dropped your worst grade) and weekly short quiz in discussion.

Lectures were information heavy. He taught up until the tests which left us unprepared for the content on it. Poor explanations for a majority of the concepts. What he didn't finish explaining in class would be taught via "video supplements" which would be posted late at night. Went to office hours and he acted like I wasn't supposed to be there.

Very middle-of-the-road: not the worst, but very clearly not the best. Lectures aren't great, and homework is often advanced concepts that the professor didn't cover during class. Quizzes are the same as homework and he lets you use notes, so quiz grade is free, just do the work. Material is going to be taught til right before the exams, heads up

Homework Based Quizzes will save you in this class, you will be wildly unprepared for Test 1 because he teaches new material up until the day before the test. His lectures are boring and very information heavy, I would leave lecture feeling like I knew less every time I showed up. Discussion is mandatory attendance for extra credit TA was useless.

Professor Yakovlev is obviously very knowledgeable. However the way he expresses his knowledge can be hard to understand. His lectures oftentimes go longer than the class period and there are "supplemental videos" that cover material we didn't get to in class. Also expect homework after each and every class. Much time is spent after class on hw.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Gave really good examples on the notes. If you do the homework  and practice tests you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Yakovlov was far better than the other professor I had. He presents challenging examples in class and the homework can be difficult. Exams are heavy in algebraic calculations. You will be over prepared for the final if you have him. Hw based quizzes were a great way to do well in class. If you want to improve your math understanding, take him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: All of the lectures were recorded and sometimes very unclear. The TA was AMAZING. The content was interesting, but this class was more work than my other classes combined. I overloaded with this class and chem 1020, which was a lot, but not impossible. The only way to survive this class is perfect time management.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Absolutely terrible. Does not take suggestions from students and thinks the material is far easier than it is. The only way I'm even close to getting by is because of my conference with a TA. If someone asks a question he is rude and says we should already know the material. Will never take one of his classes again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: The only way I passed was because of the TA, the professor basically had no connection to the class. The best way I can describe it is that he was teaching for his own understanding and not for that of the students.

Dude went completely off script compared to other professors teaching ODE and his (pre-recorded) notes were constantly full of errors. The only reason I passed was the TA's conferences. Super passive aggressive as an individual as well and had an overall "I don't socialize with the lowly undergrads" attitude. Hope he gets his karmic balance.

Worst professor I've had since I've been here. Rude when students ask questions. One girl asked "what should I do if I start struggling in the class?" and he said "just stop struggling." That's how he answers most questions. Only had 9 grades for the entire term. 2 exams and 7 quizzes. If you miss more than one conference you fail automatically.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Nothing is his fault your hole class can fail the test and its all on you guys, he does not tell you what you do wrong on your mid terms of finals, and it supper defensive when you email him. You can loose almost all credit on home work for it not being neat enough. Don't expect partial credit or event credit for correct answers.

Calc 3 is difficult but the tests are open note so you should be set. Homework quizzes in class but open note the homework is based off the book so you should have all the answers correct. If you do the homework and try to understand the material you will be fine. Very good professor and seems like a decent person.

His notes really dont help with what he wants out of quizzes which are based off a terrible textbook yet he doesnt explain the concepts thoroughly in class. the class itself is easy in the beginning allowing us to perform well regardless of his poor teaching style, yet it does get worse
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I am taking this class during quarantine. He is not that good at explaining theory since he makes no sense, but at least his examples often make you understand. His hw is tough compared to lecture problems and often makes no sense, and quizzes are bad because he gives no partial credit. If you won't give partial credit just make it multiple choice.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Yakovlev gives a lot of homework. I mean a LOT. Expect to spend 10-20 hours per week outside of class doing the homework. The lectures are pretty dry, but not terrible. I wish he would spend more time explaining what is actually on the homework and what we are tested on. He spends far too much time on Riemann sums and Sigma notation.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very boring lectures, but pretty informative.
wont give you credit unless you complete problems the way he wants

This professor is clear in lecture but moves faster than others for the course. He is rude to students when they ask questions and does not answer them well. He sets up test review sessions which are nice, but they are led by a TA so the quality is not great. The exams tend to be much harder than the classwork. but he allows notes for exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Old school. I like his note taking style; he projects himself writing out the notes while he teaches so it is easier to follow. His quizzes are easy because they are the HW problems. Beware of his website queue of HW problems which he updates regularly. Tests are hard but you get open notes/txtbook.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Normally I suck at math but Yakolev is a good professor. Homework is not graded, but half of the weekly quizzes are hw problems - (free points). His lectures are boring, but he takes clean and organized notes and posts them online. Two exams, each worth 25%, rest of the grade is based on weekly quizzes. Good professor for diff EQs.

Wonderful professor. Homeworks are long but I would consider it a necessary evil. Help sessions are held before tests. Tests aren't bad if you know the material. Go to class, he does a lot of helpful examples. Quizzes are questions off of the homework so do the homework and stay caught up on it. Practice problems helpful before exams.
His lectures are really helpful, the grading criteria is amazingly fair, he has the best interest of the students in mind and really cares that everyone understands.

Vadim is a god of a man. He once held a video lecture where a TA walked in a played a video and every student stayed and every student took notes. Vadim is truly the best professor at WPI and will be the best instructor you will ever have.
Absolutely fantastic. The quizzes were just the homework so if you did the homework right, you can get a 100 easy. The exams were tough but fair.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lecture attendance is not mandatory, but conference definitely is. Just keep on top of the homework and you'll do well. Also, his hands are 40 years younger than his body. It's incredible.

Quizzes were based on homework so as long as you do the homework, all you have to do is copy the work. Important to do reading outside of class as he's pretty example heavy over concept heavy during the lectures.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: His grading criteria is very fair. Your quizzes are 50% you homework. So, technically if you did your homework correctly you have a guaranteed 50% each quiz. The tests are fair and not difficult if you understand the material. I believe his lectures are real clear and concise. Make sure to go to math tutoring if you need help!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof Yakovlev is great at explaining concepts and has a lot of good clear examples. The quizzes are problems from the homework and are open notes. So do the homework. He is one of my fave professors and I would definitely take another class with him
Professor Yakovlev's class was very difficult but extremely rewarding. Go to the test review sessions, do all of the practice problems and make sure your homework is correct.
He is not clear and is not really helpful when you ask him questions. Makes this class a lot harder than it should be

Great professor. Used to be tough but he revamped most of his classes and now  they are incredibly fair. He has realistic expectations for you in his class and is very thorough and clear in his lectures. A fair grader and all around great guy. Weekly quizzes for 50% of grade were based off homework too which was nice. Definitely reccomend.

I'm not sure if he always does this, but our quizzes and exams were open note/text/HW. QZs were made of exact HW Q's and you could copy directly. Exams were fairly difficult even with notes. I started missing a lecture or two now and then at the end of the term and still got an A in the class. He has a slight Russian accent but leads a good lecture

Yakovlev constintently explains the material transparently and assigns relevant homework. In both Calc 2 and 3, his weekly quizzes were just copying the homework onto the quiz, so if you knew the material well, it was not necessary to do all of the problems. The practice problems for his tests were always similar to the actual test. Great professor

Open book/open note quizzes about once a week with problems taken directly from the optional homework.  There were 3 tests (all had 5 pts extra credit available) which were also open book, but DO NOT take them lightly. They're a lot harder than the homework problems, so make sure you know your stuff and are not just relying on your notes.

Calc 3 is the class that everybody complains about it, but taking it with Yakovlev makes it totally doable. He gives weekly quizzes but the problems are taken directly from homework- as long as you do the homework, its a guaranteed 100. Also, his exams are open notes. He's also super nice and loves when students come to office hours.
Prof Yakovlev was great. Quizzes open note and directly from the homework. He's very clear and concise. The homework does a really good job preparing you for the tests. 10/10. Would recommend.

He is the best calculus professor I've ever had at WPI. His quizzes are from the homework so if you keep up with the homework you'll manage it. His exams are also pretty easy. Before the exam he gives test preview and he gives sample questions and they are so similar with the exam questions. Open booknotes.

Good professor. Quizzes are just homework problems. Homework is given everyday. Homework problems are from the text book. Tests can be kind of tough, but are open bookopen note, so they're manageable. He is very clear in lectures, I was rarely ever confused by what he was explaining. I would take another class with him.

A good amount of homework after each class, but quizzes are straight from the homework, and tests are open book and open note. Tests are hard, and each is worth ~20% of your grade. Don't take him lightly, but it can be an easy A if you try.

He is a really nice guy. There is a large amount of homework but it can be done with MATLAB and it speeds up the manual calculation. Quizzes are homework problems and open book. Tests are open book as well. He is an applied mathematician so he stays away from proof and focuses on example problems.

His class was decent. There was a lot of homework, but as long as you kept up with it when it was assigned, it was manageable. All of his exams were open notebook and he gave homework quizzes where you just copied down random homework problems from your notebook. He is not very approachable if you don't understand the material, but overall he's ok.

Course material is difficult and hard to follow. Quiz problems are taken directly from the homework and are open note. Tests are much more difficult, although ALL QUIZZES AND TESTS ARE OPEN NOTEBOOK/BOOK, VERY HELPFUL. Very manageable class if effort is put in.

Very bad at explaining things. Throws formulas at you but does not give either the motivation or derivation or even just why they are useful. Not rigorous enough to be a good math class, even considering it's application-oriented. Not so good at understanding student's questions either.
quizzes are easy, tests are WAY too hard. easy to pass class, hard to get an A
Quizes are open note and directly from homework, Tests are challenging but open not. An easy class to pass but not an easy A. I don't feel like I learned anything but I got a decent grade.
Too easy? Not sure if 7 weeks was necessary in order to learn the material taught in that class. The mini-projects done in pairs are a good exercise though. Open note everything

(MA 1024 as well) ABSOLUTELY take his class. All you need to do really is the homework and you pass the class. Quizzes are literally copying from your homework to a paper. Tests are open note and open book. Teaches theory and examples. Easy class, and the dude has an awesome mustache too. SO EASY compared to other Calc III and Calc IV classes!
Good professor. Gives lots of homework which you copy for your quizzes. Nearly half your grade is handed to you in quiz and lab grades. His accent is not strong.
Very difficult compared to what I thought I was getting into after reading these reviews. Almost NRed. Tests are challenging, quizzes easy.
the quizzes are easy considering they are copied homework problems but the tests are pretty challenging and he doesn't explain the 3D stuff too well
Excellent teacher.  Open note/book tests and quizzes make for an easy and enjoyable class.
GREAT teacher. Open notes/book quizzes and tests. I highly recommend him.
Probably one of the best professors that I have had so far at WPI, great guy and very clear teacher. If you do the homework and understand it you should do fine on the test and quizzes.
