Good prof. Open book and open notes quizzes/tests. Learned more from him than any other math prof.
AWSOME PROF
He is the best math professor I've had yet. He gives open note quizzes and tests and is very fair and open with the students.
He is the best math professor I've had yet. He gives open note quizzes and tests and is very fair and open with the students.
Awesome professor.. I had an average of 100 in the course with little effort

He was the best Calculus teacher I have had so far. If your not a slacker and actually do like the 8 problems he assigns a night...its an easy. He is good at explaining things and his accent really isn't bad.:o)

Class was hard and you hate the class while you're in it, but once you are out you miss his homework and test policy. Do the homework for the quizzes, the quizzes are questions from the homework and you get to have your homework in front of you. The tests are open book, open note. This may seem easy but know the concepts before going into the test.
Do the hw and you should be ok, but the guy is an ****, does not like to help students, and has the strong foriegn accent like 75% of the teachers at wpi...
An easy class if you do the homework.  Annoying because he always assigns the problems that involve the most writing, algebra, and arithmatic.  It's supposed to be a calculus class.
Really easy, if you do the homework.  Open book, open note tests, quizzes are problems from the homework.
Very easy professor. All tests open notebook/book. Accent is thick but you get used to it.
Awful hes awful

This man was one of the worst math teachers I have ever crossed paths with. He was difficult to understand at best. He mumbles and has a thick eastern european accent.He is a dull, unnaproachable man who gave me the destinct impression from the first day of class that he had absolutely no respect for any of his students.I have no kind words for him
Terrible professor. This man is unapproachable, not very nice and failed all of my friends and everyone i knew personally who took the class. Avoid at all costs.
an awful professor. his verbosity had a tendency to frustrate students. his class is passable if you can stand him.
Very difficult to understand, language barrier, but tries to help as much as possible.

The concept of "Math Movies" is stupid and wasteful. He fully implements his TAs. A sincere effort will give a B, unless you were never prepared for the class anyway. He is very smart and knowledgable.

Hes a cool guy. I mean the language barrier can be quite catchy at the beggining but once you get used to it youre all set. instead of saying vector he says wector and**** like that. and he has this funny movement in the hand when he writes ont the board

I thought he was excellent.  His tests were pretty easy, and so were his assignments.  He didn't explain the projects very well, and he didn't really clarify when we asked questions, but I blame it on the language barrier.  He sincerely tried to be helpful.

this class is easy to pass if you do all your homework and study for the tests. he gives sample problems for the test, which really helps. i had no trouble with his accent, but he says some words really funny. it makes his lectures fun!

I thought he was the man.  He knows his math, and he teaches it pretty well.  His classes aren't that difficult if you do the homework.  His quizzes were just copying HW out of our notebooks, and his tests were fair.  Math films/essays are bad, however.

The course itself is not that difficult. Do the homework and the tests will be all right. He is not out to trick you, only test what you know. Overall a good professor once you get past the accent and speedy explanations which can lose you.
Hes an average professor and his courses are VERY HARD!!!! BEWARE!!
I HATE MATH MOVIES!!!!!
No Comments
Not hard if you do the homework, and read the book
very apathetic
No Comments
He wasn't the worst but there were some issues that really ruined the experience for me.

This is the hardest class that I have taken. Do not take unless you got a 5 on AP Physics and Calc, and are willing to work very hard. If you do the work, you can learn a lot. Tests are very difficult, and good notes are a must, as Phillies goes through the process of solving problems in class. Labs take forever, and lots of studying is necessary.

While Prof. Phillies requires that students put time into it, his IMGD 2500 class is really enjoyable. The labs involve playing classic tabletop strategy board games, such as Carcasonne and Puerto Rico. The final project is challenging, but very enjoyable: create an original tabletop strategy board game in a group of four. He does go off-topic alot
I HATE him. My worst teacher ever. Dont make the mistake of taking his class.

Professor Phillies has well organized courses. His lectures generally have 2 flavors: theory or solving problems. His theory lectures are basically useless because he starts doing math and any idea of a physical concept disappears quickly. However, his problem solving lectures are extremely important and he often shows great methods and tricks.

He is difficult. I don't think he really liked teaching intro classes. I know that a lot of people hated him BUT he really knows his stuff. If people needed help, he would help, but a lot of people wouldn't go to his office hours. No doubt it's still the hardest class I've ever taken. But if you pay attention, you can learn a learn a lot from him.

His lectures were extraordinarily confusing, and the book that he chose was no help at all. If you don't have an AP background in physics, you will absolutely suffer through this course with Professor Phillies. I was and still am honestly very surprised (and relieved) that I even received a C in this class.

The lectures do not show you how to apply the material. The exams are difficult even if you completely understand the subject. Don't go to him for help, find someone else to answer your questions. Taking this class will take up all your time just to be able to pass (even if you've already passed the AP exam).
Very tough class. (PH1111). If you took ap physics in high school you have a chance. 13 of the class NRd and the homework and tests are impossible. Average grades around a 40 but he does curve some.
he seems to hate undercalssmen

George Phillies is an all-around terrible person. He teaches a freshman level physics class not because he enjoys inspiring the youth of WPI, but because he gets some sick satisfaction out of knowing he is infinitely more knowledgeable in physics than his students. He is a condescending and intimidating presence, and his heart is a black hole.

Phillies was a terrible physics professor. He directed you to other people when you needed help and his tests were really tough. I passed but 13 of the class did not. You really need to work in order to be able to pass. I recommend avoiding him or making sure you know someone who can seriously help you with physics.
Homework is tough. If you do all his homework right and go through his Suggest Problems with your conference professor, you should do fine in your tests.
If you dont do the work, he gives you an ouch. He's very rude to students and his questions are so bad I wanna fight him

I think he gives fairly clear lectures, but often focus too much on deriving equations. The homework is  very difficult and so are the exams, but he  scales quite a bit. I wouldn't recommend his class,  because he makes it more difficult than it needs to be.  The class is still do-able if you do the work and ask for help.

Good luck getting any help whatsoever. You rely completely on your conference instructor for help. His tests are ridiculous. Don't expect to get a good grade unless you're a genius or have no life and work your butt off just for his class.

Phillies has horrible lectures. I taught much of the material to myself, or knew it before the class. He claims in his syllabus to teach the class as if you have never had physics before. This is FALSE. If you haven't taken AP level physics, you will be screwed. I you don't have tons of time to spend reviewing, you will be screwed.
Tends to over complicate
This class will slap you around. Get ready for a lot of work. If you're not confident about your skills in physics take 1110.

Professor Phillies is not personable at all. He is not helpful and makes students feel stupid during his lectures. The class would have been much more enjoyable if he were not the professor. The tests are very wordy and confusing, and he does not expend any effort to help students understand the homework and labs. Overall, he is an arrogant jerk.
Fairly easy class that has unreasonable amounts of homework. The teacher spends most of the class time trying to scare the student and does not describe physics well.

He makes every problem ten times harder then it needs to be by using terrible wording and obscure initial positions. It's easier to teach a kiwi to box then to understand his homework and test questions
Professor Phillies explains things very clearly and does not hide any of the information. Go to class, pay attention, and do the work and you will succeed in his class.
Overly abstract and heartless when it comes to grades.  Homework was hard but he is available in his office. Exams were brutal with students ranging from 10-110 in grades, average 47.

He throws equations at you after spending most of class deriving them. Then he gives you the most generic and abstract examples which really aren't helpful on the tests or homework. The problems you do aren't actually so hard once you know what their saying, it's that he words them so VAGUELY. He expects you to know what's given information in each

I took AP Physics C in high school and got a 5 on Mechanics and a 4 on E&M. I took Phillies' class and scraped by with a C. Half the homework was intuitive, half of it was a little challenging. The tests (3 of them) were very difficult though not cumulative which was nice. The notes are waaaay more abstract than they need to be. Take anyone else...

Exams and homework problems were impossible. Did not explain things very well at all. I took the calculus based course and it was almost all calc and no physics. I was lucky to pull out a B. And that's only because it was scaled.

Extremely difficult exams and the homework was not as difficult but still rather difficult. I was originally going to be a physics major but not anymore! After taking his class it's safe to say i'm no longer a physics major. He was rude to me a few times and while he did explain the topic to me, his way of explaining things is confusing.

Avoid unless you like paying to be sad. His lecture is awful, his notes online are more helpful and pertain to the homework. There is no way to prepare for his tests, do not study from the practice exams as they are unrelated. If you are stuck use your con instructor of hang out in the physics lounge if you want to learn anything.

Don't do it unless you are a glutton for punishment. He will tell you multiple times per class that you will never amount to anything or win a Nobel Prize. He farts at least once per class so try not to sit in the splash zone. Overall, not worth the anal seepage acquired from this class.

Likes to tell stories, and talk about all the ways you can do physics wrong. If you are not good at physics, you will hate him. He's one of those hard professors who some people like for the challenge. He makes good cookies and if he likes you he will e-mail you when he makes them. "Physics minus calculus equals nonsense"

Difficult Professor. Passing is around a 50, and a number of students NR. Has a habit of making sign errors with equations. Homework due three times a week. Homework takes hours to complete. I learned a lot but that doesn't mean you can do well on his exams...

He isn't going to give you an easy time but if you do the work (and there's lots of it) you'll have an amazing understanding of the material and be a better student at the end. I would recommend Phillies if you are willing to seriously work

He only ever graded us on grammar and wrote grades like good or excellent. He would go way off topic and sometimes it was difficult to figure out what he wanted us to do. Taking a class with him is boring and confusing, but it is quite the experience. Check out his books.

Extremely arrogant and dry. Most of the material seems to be taken straight out of a textbook. Although he is very knowledgeable, he is a tough grader, unfair, and boring. Do not have him as your conference instructor. Do whatever you can to change that if you have him. Completely inspired my disinterest in physics.

Phillies needs to rethink his teaching strategies.  Lecture was spent writing a few things on the board, and pointing out a few things about it.  Homework was so difficult you had to research every topic yourself to do it  Lectures didn't help solve the homework, and the tests were very hard.  Know  the physics beforehand or you will struggle.

He is a teacher who likes to push students. While his class, PH1130, wasn't not by any means the easiest out there, I feel I got more out of the class because of his high standards for his students. All and all a good teacher. Also very helpful outside of class if you have questions, is almost always in his office.
He is a good teacher, but if you don't know what you are doing, he is not likely to be as helpful as he could be.
No Comments

Very knowledgeable on the subject and can talk for ever.  Will brake off on random tangent about some war that no one ever heard of and retell it in minute detail.  Very understanding when group members do not do their part. A real laugh in lectures. Phillies is the man!

Phillies style of teaching physics four is strictly a regurgitation of the derivations of various formulas used during the class.  I did not learn anything in the class that was a practical application.  May be good for physics majors, but if you're taking this as an engineer, stay away.
total jerk

Had him for PH1111. Although his class was pretty difficult his conferences were topnotch, and he does grade almost everything himself. He has a great sense of humor and is concerned about students outside of class. Don't be fooled by his rough exterior, he is very willing to help students in his office. I didn't like the book, however. 1930? WTF?
we have a point charge Q <sniffle> yes?
Beware of his metal pointer. This guy does not like A's for grades or fairness. Only prodigies get good marks in his book.

Dry lecturer, corny jokes, but that's okay... he does a good job going over the material and helping answer questions... Also does a good job of predicting what types of questions and variations of questions you're likely to see on the exams... Grading was easy

The class is hard but if you talk to him, he will explain the material you do not get to you.  His jokes are corny and often similar to eachother but its alright.  He personally grades the tests so no room for TA abuse...
This class was a waste of time. He is not a very good lecturer, very condescending personality and not helpful at all out of class. Do youself a huge favor and take 1110.

Don't take this class unless your a physics major or really really bored.  1110 is jsut as good and takes up about half your time.  Still not too ahrd to get an A, but I'm still not sure how i got it.
No Comments
worst teacher ever!!!!!!  couldnt teach for crap and his jokes werent funny!!!
A great, smart teacher.  Though very hard, he will get the point accross.  You just have to make sure to make him explain things if you don't get it and he will.  I took away a lot from this course.
No Comments
Very good conference instructor.  Went over what we were likely to find on exams.
Very difficult class.  His office is almost always open to help students.  Personally grades exsams.  Very good
This man is not worth writing a creative comment for.
No Comments

if you go into this class not expecting to do a lot of work, you will be surprised.  if you get midway through this course and still don't expect to do any work, you're a moron and you deserve to fail.  phillies himself is a good professor, but he DOES de
Difficult, but a good teacher and an interesting guy.
He tricks kids into his physics class by offering candy... :( and they leave with NRs and sore bottoms :(
Excellent teacher.  Hard course.  You learn a lot about not only physics but how to work hard and manage your time well.
This man is the Anti-Christ, avoid him as such!
He's an odd guy but he teaches well.  This class is mostly for physics majors so it kind of serves the purpose of weeding out the kids who won't make it in physics, he has to be hard.

If you get through PH1111, you are well prepared for any other course at WPI.  The work ethic taught in this class is enormous; gave me a class I was actually scared of failing for the first time in my life.
A good teacher, very knowledgeable of the material. Difficult material but he explains very clearly (he wrote the book, literally). Surprisingly not a harsh garder at all.
very tough grader, runs class so only a few will pass
difficult class, but I learned a lot.
he is a very difficult prof, I got a B in his class b/c I worked my ass off
the coolest man alive
he teaches his course with the intention of failing many of his students
if you know what he's talking about, you're fine. if you don't, he doesn't care.
Absolutely Excellent professor.  Expects students to actually work hard.
Definitely wants everyone to fail
hard, but smart, funny, runs wpi committee to legalize marijuana in mass
No Comments
He definately wants most of the class to fail...
Very difficult class.  He designs it so that about half the students fail.
I got a zero!!!!

Lectures are decent, provides lots of free resources (rely on them!!). Exams are open-note but much harder than concepts from lecture (bit harder than worst of homework). Projects are worth effort for points but tend to get pushed aside bc not mentioned much in class. Prof is difficult to reach but helpful-ish if you do. Curved final grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Impossible to get a hold of via email. Extremely rude email responses. Tests don't pertain to anything in the lecture. Does not care about the student. Would avoid.

Lectures were nard to follow, no slides except for "element of the day" and then just hand written notes. It was clear that he did not want to be teaching a lower level class, but that meant that his grading was not harsh.

Reading the reviews I expected the worst, but turns out he's just a normal professor, surprisingly light-hearted, and aware of the class' level. Exams were take-home, with questions from homework. Even if you don't understand, memorizing the solutions will get you a B or C. It was kind of sad when he mentioned his rate my professor score in class.
The class was easy but he was rude and arrogant. Don't ask him for help and don't even try emailing him. Good Luck!

2 online exams, use online resorces. Lectures go over ideas in a simple way, hw= much more difficult & weighted heavily. saw a tutor once a week for problems I didn't understand and got good scores. also reading= the most beneficial option. if you space stuff out it's not too bad. final project=lots of work but he barily looks at it, easy a
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: He was awful, he talked at you for an hour and did not answer questions or his email. You have to use the textbook to teach yourself. All of the tests and homework were online. The homework was graded for accuracy instead of completion and were completely different from what was said in class. He also changed due dates without informing anyone.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This guy has no compassion for students. Takes a boring class and somehow manages to make it even more boring. Gave us a take home test the night before a wellness day and expects us to turn it in the morning of the wellness day (talk about not improving mental heath).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: book > burdette
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: class was very easy, people thought he was rude because he didn't want to answer dumb questions, when asking him questions, at least look like you've opened the book. final project was lots of fun

Pearson homework that takes off credit after each incorrect attempt, lectures don't explain the homework (he basically just teaches what he wants), encourages office hours but doesn't give explanations when you go, exams are online so if you have chegg you'll be fine

Just read the book so take notes on that, lectures aren't very helpful for notes/homework (which is usually a lot so start Mondays so you can turn it in on time)/test prep (I'd recommend just using the Pearson dynamic study modules, or going to the ARC). I do like the Wednesday in class office hours.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Extremely boring and unfunny. Lectures are pretty useless. Covers topics that aren't needed for homework and tests. Handwriting is awful and does not provide much explanation to the problems that he is doing. Just read the textbook and you will be fine. Learned majority of course through textbook. Very useless when asking for help most of the time.
Online tests and pretty good overall. Chem is hard but he isnt bad

The exams are really hard but the homeworks make up a significant part of the grade, which made it easier to do well. His lectures are boring and sometimes confusing, but I did like his "element of the day" that he did at the beginning of each lecture. Reading the textbook is really important for this class.

He's a middle-of-the-road professor. The lectures were difficult to follow, but he tried his best to be open to questions for students. Much of what you learn in lecture went unutilized in assignments and the homework itself (the only weekly graded assignments) is graded steeply. I'd advise having strong prior knowledge taking his Chem 1010 class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is not as bad as all these reviews say I personally enjoyed his class and his exams are not hard at all as long as you know the basic stuff. Reading the text book will help you a lot when it comes to understanding. Hes a nice guy and he helped me a lot when it comes to the organic chemistry chapter.

if you want a professor who has a dry, sardonic sense of humor but wont teach you anything, Shawn is your guy <3. He has to be the rudest professor I've ever had. And you have to pay to do the homework in his class. Had a family member die and wouldn't let me take the final early. Easily agitated, participate in class if you dare

I went into this class optimistic, the first day we were going over the scientific method. But boy was I wrong. Aside from the occasional pity laugh from his "___ of the day" class was awful. This man will literally only talk about orbitals for the whole class. If you take his class, read the textbook and disregard what he says most of the time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I didn't even attend his lectures I just read out of the textbook (after seeing all of these reviews), and I was completely fine. Tests make sense, homework is from MyMasteringChemistry. Do not attend his office hours if you don't need to. Find a tutor. He is not helpful and gets easily agitated.

These reviews are really coming for this man's throat.. He gets a pretty bad rep but honestly I didn't find him all that bad. I'd agree he doesn't like to repeat himself and has a different sense of humor, but he certainly provides enough material for you to be successful. Don't go into this class thinking you're going to hate him, give it a chance

Gives an insane amount of homework which is strictly graded. He's has a very special type of personality which really turned me off and pushed me away from asking questions or speaking up. He only gives 2 test (final and mid term) which require you to know the material by heart to even get a decent grade.

Doesn't like to repeat himself but provides more than enough resources for people to be successful. Screwed up the first test and everyone initially failed, but he provided more than enough opportunities to correct the grades. Actually a good guy if you talk to him. I think a few negative reviews at the start set everyone up to expect to hate him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great prof if you enjoy being sad. Lectures are unclear and the class did bad enough on the midterm to warrant an assignment that could get 50% of the total grade added back to our grades, and then this was blamed on us and we were told we weren't smart enough for our majors or to look onward to higher education. Good vibes all around!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Lectures teach you absolutely nothing. He would occasionally reference the fact that he was teaching things wrong in lecture. If you want to do a class where you teach yourself from the textbook and get verbally berated when you show up to class this one is for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He isn't the worst but if you can avoid him, try to. Lectures are fast and vague, most of the course I had to teach myself. Although his class is difficult his grading is fair (drops lowest exam score/ curved final grades). You will not do well unless you review and read the textbook a lot. He does have a good sense of humor though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: So I was really nervous about having this professor after reading all these reviews, but honestly, this guy isn't so bad. Yeah it's a lot of homework, but to be honest, if you do some reading and just DO the homework, you'll be fine. I did awesome on the first exam, and almost failed the second one, but he drops the lowest one, so just do the work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I'm not going to lie, I was nervous to take this course after reading what other people have said. Yes, the class was difficult, but if you work hard you will be fine. Homework is not "necessary" but he will drop the lower of your 1st or 2nd exam and replace it with your homework grade if it's better. Read the textbook and study with peers!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Doesnt actually teach, just copies last years notes during the lecture, youre going to need to read the textbook. Assigns a ridiculous amount of homework in a short period of time, but if you do good on all the homework, youll pass. Exams are much much harder than the homework. Very sarcastic, thinks hes funny.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His lectures are confusing. He jumps from topic to topic. It is difficult to ask him questions because he often will not answer it unless it's specific to a homework question. If you're struggling with following his lectures, well, so is everyone else, and he won't help you there.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Awful person awful professor
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If you want to keep enjoying chemistry do not do it. You will survive if you do all the homework, however the key word is survive.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: If you are an incoming freshman DO NOT take a class with this professor. He was the first exposure to college level chemistry that I ever had and it threw me off and made me feel like I was so stupid. He is very degrading. You have 3 impossible exams. That's it. I swear that you will question if coming to WPI was a good idea because of this man.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: I originally thought his class was easy until the second test. The tests he handed out were vaguely hard and asked questions you shouldn't need to memorize and wont unless you read the textbook to study.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Can't reach him outside of class, his lectures are vague and not very clear about what he wants you to learn. He gives tests with obscure questions and expects you to memorize things that he never really covers only briefly mentions. You just don't know what he's going to ask. Everyone else thinks he's just a bad teacher and I think that I agree.

I am a Chem Eng and am having trouble, I feel like I'm doing more or less fine because I took AP, but he is not a great teacher and but has at least seemed to get better this year, taking it a term freshman year is rough.

He's very condescending and sarcastic. He gives you no partial credit and does not prepare you well for exams. Our class average was below a 60 and there was a huge curve. Your tests determine your grade. Try to get old tests from a friend, those are the only thing that'll give you direction and then you have to teach yourself the rest.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: I have yet to have a worse professor.

Burdette doesn't explain concepts well. If you have minimal chemistry background, you're gonna have a rough time. Tests are very difficult and are your entire grade because there is no homework/quizzes. Tough class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Does not care what grade students receive. His tests seem not that bad when you're taking them but he gives NO PARTIAL CREDIT on answers so he's definitely the hardest grader I've ever had. I took AP Chem in high school and have only gotten A's and high B's here but Burdette gave me a C. Get ready to watch videos bc he's not clear with many topics.
Worst teacher I have ever had in my life. Can't teach and is extremely rude.

Extremely unhelpful and makes it clear he does not care about his students. Office hours are ridiculous and only worth attending if you want to feel stupid. Tests are difficult and graded tough. Avoid him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class was the class which I studied the most for, and struggled to pass. Very very difficult.

Do not take Burdette unless you have a strong chem background. Regular sophomore/junior chem won't cut it, maybe if you took AP chem your senior year and need a refresher. He assumes that you already know things, and has few office hours. If you don't have a strong background, skip the lectures and just read the book and that will be much better.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Arrogant personality, no homework problems to prepare for test, grades test tough, don't bother asking questions unless you want to hear his sarcasm.

This teacher has very little respect for his students. He is very unflexible with his office hours and how to contact him. He is very rude and condescending. He also is a hard grader when it comes to exams. He is a bad teacher and if you can avoid him do so.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He expects you to already know a lot about chemistry at the 1010 level.  He will not respond to emails or answer questions often.  He is not approachable or friendly.
He does not teach.  The tests sometimes have things that were not stressed in lecture.  He gives incorrect information at times, disrespectful to students at times, and does not communicate.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: avoid him; really doesnt care about his students.

His tests are hard and deviate a lot from what he's taught in class. When he says you responsible for everything he means it. You have to know every small detail in the textbook. I may be being a bit harsh since I'm not a chemistry person but anyone who doesn't have a strong chemistry background better brush up because he skips a lot of stuff.

He's a complete jerk. His lectures are not helpful and he does nothing to support his students. He often make snide remarks about students not do well in his class. Just avoid him, if at all possible.

If you don't have much experience with chemistry, this course will be very challenging. Be prepared ahead of time! This professor essentially lectures with the assumption that a) you already know the material, or b) you have studied from the textbook intensively. Even after studying, I found his exams to be at times unnecessarily difficult.

Honestly, if i had not taken chemistry in high school i would have failed this class. His test are tough because he never covers half the material on it. He does not care whether you understand the material or not. You have no homework, but you need to read the textbook to pass the class. Do not take this class.
Very dry personality, occasional sarcastic remarks about the performance of students in general, but the material was very easy and straightforwards.

Professor Burdette does not know how to explain topics and his motto is that you must "know everything." His does not list his office hours and he does not tell you what to expect on the test. If you have no background in chemistry, passing will be extremely difficult.

Taking this class currently as a freshman with a very strong chem background, the class is hard and the tests are the worst. Almost NR'ed. Just as word of caution don't take this class as an A term freshman
Not willing to help students who face difficulties with his class.

He has an unhelpful attitude and will have the most unreasonable office hours. Don't take his tests in pencil because if he grades it wrong he won't recheck it, takes off lots of unreasonable points but he isn't the hardest teacher to understand if you have a good chemistry background.

This guy is a complete dingle dink. Does not care about anyone passing or NR his class. It's a shame WPI lets this guy be a professor. Tests are very difficult and off topic from his lectures. Recommend reading the book and doing examples.
Acts as though he hates his job and doesn't care if people pass. Very vague about information and questions. Coming to his class with a weak high school Chem background will be more than difficult.

His lectures are occasionally inaccurate but if you really focus he explains adequately. The only issue is that he skips over a lot of fundamental things which for people with a weak HS chemistry base are going to struggle. My only advice, by the book and make it your friend!

Never take this class A term with Burdette at WPI. It will be the worst professorstudent experience at the school. Unwilling to help students in need. Does not engage students what so ever. Seems to hate his job teaching this course.

If you know basic high school chemistry, you will have no problem with his class.  However if you don't have a good background, you might not do so well.  He can be pretty sarcastic, almost to the point of being disrespectful if you don't understand a topic.

As long as you go to class, pay attention, do the practice problems that he goes over the day before the exam (they are literally the exact same questions as the exam) then you will do fine. However, the lectures can get long and boring.

He seems stand-offish, but if you participate, he'll help you out. I bombed some tests but my hand was always up, and he gave me an A anyway. There are 4 tests, no quizzes, no graded hw. You have to read the textbook, and a strong chemistry course in high school will save you. If not, get help with the textbook and tutoring.

Coming from someone who did not take AP Chem in HS, this course was very hard. Burdette is not a very good teacher he expects you to know the material before he goes over it in his lectures, and if you don't you will be lost and you might as well not be there. I would study the book for hours and still not do very well on the tests. AVOID HIM.

Having taken chemistry in high school this class was not all that difficult for myself.  However, I knew friends who were struggling and needed some help with their studies.  They went to talk to this professor and all he did was tell them to do the problems on the website to improve their grade and nothing else.

Burdette is rude and expects everyone to know 100% of the material before he teaches it. If you've never taken chem before def. DONT take his class. I asked him for help and he told me to look at the syllabus and download the notes and practice problems -_-. You can't understand what he is teaching in class and his handwriting is messy

Not helpful at all. I had no idea half the time what he was talking about. I had to teach everything to myself. When I went up to ask for help he would just say " did you go online and download the notes". Well I did not understand the notes in the first place why would I want to download them.

You receive the same educational value of his lectures by skipping them. Do everything in your power to not have this guy, he is the worst. The lectures are pointless and you have to teach yourself everything. The tests are hard and he does not scale them even if the whole class fails. If you don't have a solid chem background, you are screwed
He is ok,but he gives no make up test and for someone with no chem background it might be hard to catch up to him.

This professor is the worst teacher I have ever had in my 18 years of schooling. Burdette's lectures are long, unhelpful, a waste of time and flat out awful. His test are confusing and almost never correlate to the material covered in lecture. Only credit towards lecture grade derives from 4 tests and you must do well to pass class

To his credit, his exams are fair and straightforward. His lectures are complete garbage, however; he makes tons of mistakes and is terrible at explaining things...you'll learn nothing from him. If you have a solid high school chem background you will be okay, otherwise prepare to spend a lot of time teaching yourself from the book.
He does not want to be teaching and it is very evident. Tests are confusing and he is never sure about the material. Lectures put your right to sleep. Never take his class.

I have taking two classes with Professor Kumar, and she is such an amazing professor. She genuinely cares about her students. She would come to organic lab an hour early to help students if they wanted to leave early. Or she would bring us Dunkin on long lab days.

BEST CHEM PROF I HAVE HAD YET. Her lectures and office hours are extremely helpful. She is very caring and willing to help. It is very hard not to do well in her class. she is very sweet and easy to approach. Nothing bad to say about her. Definitely recommend her!

Don't acknowledge all the given 5's. Her lectures were the only decent thing about this class. She is condescending when asking for help.Her tests are the most harshly graded tests that I have ever taken. Homeworks are just as bad and don't incorporate some of the pointless and out-of-the-blue test questions.If you can choose Grimm take him for1010

Homeworks that were due once a week and about 4 tests. The points taken off for literally anything and everything was absurd. 2 months went by, she still didn't know how to use the microphone. She gave you the answers to homework if you asked but clowned on your bloodline if you could not get the right amount of sig figs. Such a harsh grader.
Very few grades almost impossible to get full credit on homework and confusing and trick questions on the tests.

Had her C23 and it was not a great experience. Four homeworks and four exams, all graded harshly, with points taken off for silly reasons. Occasionally exam questions would be about stuff not/barely covered in class. Lectures are meh. What saves her from a 1 is that she is genuinely a nice lady and she has a plethora of office hours.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Hardest grader with little to no flexibility.

Your entire grade is based on 4 homeworks and 4 tests so I hope you are a good test taker as there is little room for error. Credit for work isn't given on homework either, so its either right or wrong. She is a nice person, but she also frequently doesn't respond to emails and is little help in trying to resolve problems. Avoid her if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Kumar just does not care about if her students pass or not at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Kumar is the least flexible grader i have ever had, I took her during C term thinking it would not be as difficult from what I have heard but she was quite the opposite. Her exams are terrifying because she is constantly walking around and staring you in your soul which is very stressful. Not a flexible grader, no extra credit, not a good teacher.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She is the worst chem professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Kumar is a caring and effective chemistry professor. She had office hours almost every day, making it easy to ask for help if you fall behind in lecture. There were four non-cumulative exams which reduced stress. She posts optional worksheets after each class but they are extremely helpful for exam studying. Be sure to mind your sig figs!

She was very sweet and accommodating. Tests were hard but manageable. Homework was easy if you understood the topics, impossible if you didn't. Her formatting of documents and horrible color choices were what I hated the most.

Hope you have time to teach yourself all of the material, cause you won't learn anything from the lectures since they consist of only examples with no real explanation. The homework and practice worksheet answers are posted with no work shown. I do not like this woman.
Can't lecture. Thinks teaching is only practice problems. Doesn't show work in answer keys of homework or review sheets. Make sure you have time to actually learn the material on your own time.

She is one of the most caring professors I have had. Her lectures were SO organized and put together. You can tell how prepared she was for lectures. There was a lot of homework, which was a big part of the grade, but it was great practice and exactly like exam questions!

Uma Kumar is one of the nicest professors I have ever had. She makes sure that you understand the material and gives daily homework. It is a little annoying how much work you have to do but going to office hours definitely gets you through it. If you want to do well in chem take it with her.

Kumar REALLY cares about her students to the point where if you cannot make her office hours, she will take time out of her day to chat with you. She always makes sure that you have the material down solid, and is an excellent choice for CH1010
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: I took two courses with professor Kumar, Chemistry 1010 and 1020. I received an B for 1010 and an A for 1020. You want to take chemistry with Kumar, her tests are not too difficult and she is very good at lecturing. Kumar is definitely the best option over all the other chem professors. Very nice and easy to talk to, wants you to do well.

Prof. Kumar is awesome. She does a really good job of explaining concepts and really cares about her students. She gives a lot of practice work, so if you do that it's not hard to get an A on an exam.
She's aight. All she does is talk talk. Listening to her for more than one hour can be unhealthy for normal body functioning.

I hadn't taken chemistry since my sophomore year of high school and I found the class really easy to understand. Professor Kumar gives good explanations during lectures, exams are straightforward, she posts lecture notes, and holds lots of office hours. The practice worksheets are similar to the exams, so definitely do them. And sit in the front!
If you took AP chem in HS, you'll do fine, the lecture portion of Chem 1010 was super easy.

The lecture portion of the class was really straightforward. She posts everything online, all lecture notes and all worksheet answers. The grading guidelines are crystal clear from day 1. If you put in the work, it is an easy A. She is kind and understanding. However, the class grade is exam based and the lab portion of the class can be difficult.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: I struggled in previous chemistry courses, but her lectures are really easy to follow and her classes are well-structured. Always willing to answer questions and so humble. As long as you take the time to study for her tests, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Kumar is great. I've had her for 1010 and 1020 lecture now and she's very sweet and explains the material clearly, taking plenty of time to do multiple problems from each section. She will pretty much tell you the problems that will be on the test at office hours. Just try not to take her at 8am because she makes you want to fall asleep.

Kumar is the sweetest professor you'll have. She cares about each student's success and goes out of her way to help you outside of class. Her tests make up most of the grade and she gives more exams than most professors because she does not assign homework. You will have to work super hard to do well though.

Prof Kumar was amazing this term. I came in to this class with close to no chemistry experience and I felt like I learned a ton in her lectures and didnt have a difficult time keeping up. Her tests were easy if you did the worksheets. Lab was a pain but thats not her fault.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is a very sweet lady, but doesn't allow cheat sheets or note during the exam during the test like other professors do. You will learn a lot but be prepared to do lots and lots of study if you don't want a C or B. Her test format is difficult because multiple choice questions are worth so much.

Prof. Kumar is an above average professor and is flexible and concerned with helping each and every student. Grades are fair and reasonable. 4 Exams with no homework in lecture - labs are another story... Overall good professor (needs to put the mic closer to her)...
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: The book is helpful but not necessary and she posts her lectures but as pdfs of the work done out. The only issue is that there is not explanation so its best to not use them to replace going to class but more to supplement your studying. In my lecture at AK 116, she was difficult to hear and sometimes her accent is a little difficult to understand
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Kumar is a great professor when it comes to explaining topics in a cohesive and straight to the point way. She provides opportunities to meet with her if you have any questions and provides good practice to debrief yourself before an exam. The only assignments graded are exams so if you aren't great with tests, I wouldn't recommend her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Kumar explains topics throughly so everyone understands her. If you do not understand she has several office hours and it is easy to get in contact with her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Going to lectures isn't necessary cause she uploads everything, but it is nice to go if you don't understand cause she explains problems very well and actually helps. she gives you practice problems before the test too. definitely would not have taken any other prof
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Kumar teaches well and really knows her stuff but sometimes is hard to follow. Tests are hard and lengthy although if you do the practice worksheets you should be fine. Labs are unrelated to the class and terrible, although that's not her fault. She is very helpful if you have questions and wants you to learn even though most don't get As.

Prof Kumar was generally friendly and her office was almost always open for questions. The class is predominately taught through slide show and verbal explanations, followed by step by step problem solving. The tests are a little overwhelmingly long. From my experience this Prof teaching style works really well for some students, others not so much
No extra credit, and impossibly long exams.

Prof Kumar is amazing at what she does. She goes out of her way to ensure students understand material. She is extremely patient and easy to understand. Lectures tend to focus more on the calculative aspect of chem so you definitely have to do personal reading for answering theory test questions.  She is a really great professor. One of the best.

She's a great lecturer. She engages her students with problems that will be necessary during the tests. Tests are usually long, but the questions aren't that hard. She's very helpful too, so ask her as many question as you can during the lectures or during office hours.

Fantastic professor. If you're taking CH 1010 or 1020, take her if you can. Very helpful during office hours. Helps explain tough concepts. Gives you daily practice problems to help you learn the material. She really helps prepare students for her exams, which are reasonable.

She gives practice questions that are really helpful. The tests are not that hard but she includes theory questions. The lectures can be boring. She is nice. She answers any questions that the students might have. If you go to lectures and you do the practice questions you should be fine.
seems like a good teacher. but she doesnt have the ability to take command of the class. class can get very VERY boring.
Awesome teacher, extremely helpful. Always willing to go out of her way to make sure you understand the material. Extremely caring, reliable, and smart.
multiple tests but prepares students well, homeworkstudy guides help
So good to all students. Very nice and helpful

Super kind, very helpful, simple class, offers chocolate to students, even bought us all cookies and pizza on occasion, would definitely recommend. Almost made me with I was a chem major, haha. She's wonderful.

He's hard to understand, but take the time to figure it out; His advice is VERY USEFUL. He's patient, kind, and forgiving of mistakes. He knows his stuff and is happy to answer questions. He's patient with students, we should be patient with his accent.

Best chem teacher.  Very organized with lecture notes posted online. Also provides daily worksheets for extra practice.  Tests are extremely fair and you are only tested on the topics she clearly teaches in lecture.  Easy to obtain an A with effort.

OMG. I wish she taught everything I've ever taken and was going to teach everything I still have to take. Clear, helpful, reasonable, fair. She is the best professor on earth. I've been fearing chemistry for 27 years, and she has made it so not only is it not scary, but I can do well! I'm not kidding, she is wonderful.

Kumar is great. She's really sweet & legitimately cares about the students. She's always available for office hours. She posts all notes online so the lectures aren't strictly mandatory. The material seems easy but don't underestimate it because the exams are more difficult. I got a C, but if I put in more effort I could have gotten a B or an A.

Great professor. Lectures are extremely boring and will put you to sleep, but overall, Kumar gives great examples and practice worksheets that contain problems very similar to test problems. She is always available to help students and she encourages that students ask lots of questions. Best chem teacher ever! but yah, she's kind of boring too.

Even though I didn't have good grade cuz some issues I had. She is the best Chem Prof. I like her a lot. She very kind and helpful. And she explains things very clear and make you like the subject more and more.

If you are new to Chemistry, she IS the Chemistry Professor  you need, period! AND if you have some prior knowledge but hate the subject because it wasn't taught well, your search ends here!! She WILL turn your "hate" into "love"! You will be amazed how easy she could make a very difficult and confusing topic seem so simple and easy. Good Luck!
She's very helpful and very easy, but you do need to study a little for her tests if you want to get an A in the course.
very useful, great professor, eager to help students.
Good Professor. Explains everything very clearly. Goes a little fast explaining the material, but the lecture notes she sends out help a lot. Lectures are sometimes boring and put you to sleep.

Incredible professor.  Online lecture notes are available so you don't have to rush to copy everything she puts up.  You can focus more on the problem solving aspect and what she is saying.  Tests are easy and mostly follow the practice worksheets she puts up online.  Some questions come directly from the reading, so reading the chapter is advised.
Excellent professor!  Very knowledgeable and helpful.  Also very organized; has online notes and worksheets and all info needed for upcoming tests.

Very good professor. Post notes online, lectures go along with posted notes. Highly recommended that lecture is attended because she focuses on specifics and hints at things for test not noticeable on the notes. She goes over problems in class and has problem sets online w/ ans. Approachable, good office hrs, lecture rushed a little due to material

Very Strict.  Pretty good at explaining things. If you have a learning disability she does not look favorably upon it and will not be very understanding.  I think that she thinks it is an unfair advantage.

Decent at explaining material, but covers no theory & then tests you on it. Refuses to curve/scale even when the reason everyone did so poorly on one exam was her fault for making it so long that we couldn't finish. Sticks to her syllabus to a "T"

Great professor!! She's organized, clear, straightforward with what she wants you to know, and extremely helpful. She is really friendly and is more than willing to help out her students. It's difficult to fail in her class.

I had failed this class once and then got a really easy A with Kumar, she is so straight forward in her expectations and has a ton of office hours if you ever need help.  I only wish I had taken all my chem requirements with her.  She leaves no room for confusion!

Speaks so quietly it would be difficult to classify as "speaking."  More accurate would be "whispering."  Teaches by example and covers little theory.  If you want to understand the theory, you must read the book since it is not taught in lecture.
Class was explain very well...she had worksheets with practice problems for EVERY lecture. She is also an AMAZING lab tech. I recommend taking a class with her.
The class is easy because of the handouts but if you have problems with any of the material, she isn't very good at explaining things one on one.
She gave out handouts on EVERYTHING we were learning and we always did tons of examples. Really good grading system. Tests were ok, not thast bad.
Lectures were purely example problems. Very sweet lady, very open with time outside of class.  Truely wants to teach whats most important and as much as possible.
She gave handouts every lecture and are extremely helpful. She is very nice and willing to help. She's a very good professor.
Her handouts were great and made it really easy to follow the lecture. Quizzes were a little hard but overall a great class.

Took the time to really explain material. Handouts are great supplements to her lecture. More importantly, was of great help in lab. Was never condescending about questions asked, and always eager to help when I did ask. Her enthusiasm rubs off, and her tests were simple. Great prof..

ive only been in her class for about a month, but****ar seems like a great prof. she puts a ton of time into the handouts and overheads and sincerely cares. she talks really soft tho and if im not in the first 2 or 3 rows i cant hear her.

Had him B21 and what I will say is that he is the only man that can make integrals fun. Very caring and funny. Puts dad jokes on his slides. Will drop the lowest test and will round grades up. Take calc with him if you can.

I definitely agree with everyone when they say that he is extremely caring and wants everyone to succeed, but the way he taught did not help me at all. I ended up learning more from youtube then his lectures. Also he gave way too much homework.
Prof. Abraham is so nice and caring. He wants everyone to succeed and his lectures are always fun. I found that he is really good at making things simple and easy to understand.
Great lectures and fair exams. Decent amount of homework

I had Prof. Abraham for Calc. I and it was such a good easy going class. He lectures were easy to follow and fun. He would always add puns into his slides to spice things up. The textbook was not required, but the rest of the calcs use the same textbook so it might be worth getting.

The problem with the class is the homework. There are textbook homeworks and Webworks each week. The homework is almost always on something that was never even remotely mentioned in class. I have had problems where I had to find the integral of something in calc 1. The word integral has never even been said in class. Everything else is great.
Cares about his students and their success. Very helpful during office hours. Very chill policies about late work. This could have been a very difficult course if not for the professor.
Practice Problems to get the most out of this course and watch any supplemental lectures he posts

Hes literally the GOAT. I had him for Calc 2 in B term and I loved his class. His jokes on each slide were hilarious and he understood if the class needed more time on assignments. If you get the opportunity, take every calculus class you can with him, you wont regret it.

Professor Abraham was by far one of my favorite professors I've had at WPI. His lectures were interesting with little jokes inserted to keep the lectures fun. He really cares for his students, even taking problems off of homework so that we don't have more stress.

Lectures are useful but not necessary to attend if you can read the book. Had a decent amount of homework but nothing out of the ordinary. Had lots of time outside class for help, and answers any question you have during lecture.

His lectures could be a bit boring, but he always tried to make them interesting and helpful. He offered many office hours, which was great for last minute homework help. The homework was a reasonable amount, and he was very accommodating for extensions. He listened to the class if we were having trouble with something and would extend deadlines.
did well in the class he taught the material well but when I dont understand things I tend to wear a stupid expression so he would ask how I was doing during lecture.

TAKE HIM FOR CALC 1 AND 2. He works with two other professors (a team of them), and he's the main man. Take him out of the other two. He's accessible and friendly during his office hours, cracks jokes, makes comics, and makes everything make perfect sense. If something seems unfair, he will hear you out. Tests are fine. 10/10 great man.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took Calc 1 and 2 with him, A and B. Had to buy $70 plus to do the homework. Okay professor, homework was a pain. Lecture was boring, very helpful though when I asked for extra practice he gave me a lot. calc is difficult especially with the quick terms. His conferences had graded quizzes. I feel indifferent about him. Overall slightly above avg Pr

Professor Abraham is a really great teacher, and amazing person. If you are ever stuck/ not understanding something go to his office hours as he is really helpful and patient. I was disappointed I could not take the full Calculus sequence with him as he is a great lecturer. He is also really approachable.
An amazing professor, had him for Calc 1 and 2, his office hours are great, try to go to them if you can. He really cares about his job and his students.

Prof Abraham is the real guy. Had him for Calc 1 and 2, he gives stellar explanations, has great comics at the start of the lecture, and really wants everyone to succeed. He writes the finals for MA1021 and MA1022, so you'll be familiar with the format and style of questions. Take a course with this man.
Honestly, a great guy who makes the concepts digestible

Clear, informative lectures and a great sense of humor. He writes on top of his slideshow using the tablet. He makes great use of color, and often throws in jokes, puns, and even comics in the slideshow to help keep you awake. All the homework is online, and it's not too hard.

He is one of the best professors I have had. He is so understanding and really wants his students to be successful. His weekly quizzes help make sure you know the content and are really easily graded. He provides partial credit on the exams and even some extra credit. He also really prepares you for the final exam by providing past examples.
The best guy ever. Really knows his stuff and is a big help when you are stuck on something. His lecture style is clear and concise. Best Calc I and II professor .
Great professor and great advisor, he helped me to get back on track when I changed my major, and he prepares you very well for the actuarial exams. Great guy.

He is really funny and breaks down the problems into the plain English. He really repeats a lot of questions in different scenarios so you really understand the concept. He is a really good professor to have if you have never taken calculus before because the transition into calculus is difficult especially at this school.

What a dude. Genuinely great guy and he doesn't ask a lot out of you--just attend lectures and pay attention, and you'll be fine. If you're not, he is very accessible with office hours and genuinely wants his students to succeed. His happiness is just contagious.

Abraham is awesome. He definitely cares about making his students pass, and as long as you listen to his lectures, there isn't much that you need to do outside of class to pass. Just attend the lectures. Also, his comics at the beginning of his lectures are great.
Probably one of the best teachers I have ever had. I have never had a teacher do a better job of explaining why you do something, rather than just memorizing formulas and processes.
I love this man. He cares about his students and is a great teacher.

He's a great guy, but his lectures are slow and didn't help me much. Even with experience in the course content, it was difficult because the exams are heavily weighted and very difficult. The large (150+) person lecture environment also sucks.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Great professor. Prepares for tests well

Abraham's lectures a pretty good for the most part. He starts every class with a funny comic, made better by the fact that he puts student faces on the characters. He has good wit and explains things in a nice and understandable way. My biggest issue was that there were only two tests and they accounted for 70% of your grade, that was a bit rough.

Excellent professor, great at explaining concepts, started each class with a funny comic, always willing to work with students when dealing with scheduling issues for conferences, quizzes, etc. Easy A if you do the homework and study.

Professor Abraham is the full deal. Personable and funny. But above all he was a great professor. Taught well, and exams reflected material taught. Be sure to attend review sessions as they are helpful and give you a better idea of what the exam will be like.

Abraham is a good teacher. He usually teaches in a big lecture hall and records his lectures, so attendance isn't mandatory. There are quizzes every week in conference, but you get 70 points just for writing your name. Class is well-paced and the tests are fairly straightforward. There is a decent amount of online homework due at the end of term.

Solid professor, BEWARE OF MIDTERM it's very difficult, harder than you expect. He does these word/modeling problems that are crazy confusing, but if you can do those well then you're set for the class. Clear explanations, recorded lectures, and mild homework load. Homework was really helpful to reinforce lessons, so be sure to do them.

Probably the best professor I have ever had! His lectures are extremely clear & he's always prepared.  He can answer any question you could think of, and he records his lectures so you can watch them later when you study.  On top of all of that, he's really nice and hilarious, makes class fun

Interesting and engaging lectures, assigned a fair amount of homework. Tests not too hard, although a little on the long side without extra practice solving problems. Homework grading policy based mostly on whether it was all done, not whether you got the right answers.

Nice and helpful in class but beware of office hours. He was inconsistent with his office hours, either canceling, running late, or leaving early. He is good with short quick questions but if you really don't understand the material seek help elsewhere. He tends to get frustrated when you ask "too many" questions and is short-tempered.
Professor Abraham is amazing!
Very clear, good examples and easy tests . He is hilarious.

He is a very fun professor. His daily cartoons get class off to a fun start. He is always willing to help students and he will stop in the middle of talking to answer students questions. He is a fair grader and very approachable. I would highly recommend.

Possibly the best professors I've ever had. Explains things in easily understandable terms. Records all lectures and posts promptly. Really wants to help students, he has ample office hours and responds to emails very quickly
didn't make an impression. not my kind of teacher

He is really a helpful teacher about everything. Once I missed a class and went to his office hours. He just summarized me the whole lecture. He teaches according to students' level. So he's not some super smart kind of jerk professor going up there and saying stuff what students don't understand. He is really teaching the subject.
He's that professor who understands the students, and he knows how to explain things as fun as they can be.
Awesome guy! He's hilarious, keeps the class engaged with silly cartoons, very approachable and really knows his stuff! And he gives extra credit on tests! One of the best professors I've had at WPI.

Great professor! He works really hard to make sure that everyone understands! I have used his office hours and he is always avaliable for extra help! I felt really prepared for the final and our class did the best! Quizzes aren't that easy but if you prepare and go to office hours you will get a good grade!

I had Prof Abraham for Calc I and II. He is a fantastic instructor. He makes the class interesting, and his powerpoints are always crystal clear and often amusing.  He is readily available for extra help, and he is extremely approachable.  English is his first language, a rarity at WPI. All around great guy and great teacher. Take this guy's course

Really fantasic, despite a slight obsetion with polarbears, his is a very understanding and involed teacher. After having him for 2 terms i never remember him turning a student away. All aroung great teacher,get him if you can.
so good!!
very good prof. strongly recommended
Very good professor. He always had a lesson plan, always explained things well and was very patient. Top marks!

The best math professor I ever had. If you do the homework and work you will have no problem passing this class. I took Calc I and II with him and loved it. I wish that he was able to teach Calc 3 & 4. Generally there is a quiz each week on the new material that you learned. No midterm but one common final exam that all Calc I students take.
BEST math teacher that I have ever had. I took MA1021 and MA1022 with him and got B's in both. He makes class somewhat interesting and is funny.

Awesome professor! One of the nicest people you will ever meet! If you do your work, you will have no problem passing his class. He generally has a quiz every week on the material you cover, and a final exam at the end of the term (no midterm). He is interested in his students and will help you if you need it. Take Calc I & II with him if you can!

Best math teacher I have ever had. Period. If you have a chance to take a class with him, do so. His lectures are always interesting and funny, yet very informative. In my class, everyone wished he would be able to teach Calc 3 and 4.
The man.  Had extra help sessions before quizzes to make sure you understood the material.  Class wasn't the easiest thing, but you learn a lot. Highly recommend.
Pretty much the best professor ever. He will go out of his way to spend 1-1 tiem with you and explain things slowly over and over again. Very understanding and grades fairly
Excellent professor. Learned A LOT in his class. Very good at explaining procedures and theories. I would definitely recommend him.
The best math professor on campus
Abe is the man.

Wonderful Professor, knows his stuff and very helpful. He makes the materal clear and east to understand. The weekly quiz is easy if you go to class everyday. If you have a choice, he IS the one to take Calc from

A great Calculus professor who knows the material well and presents it in a very organized fashion.  His quizzes are fairly short and not bad, and true/false worksheets are easy.  While he assigns a good deal of homework problems like most professors, doing them prepares you well for quizzes.  Overall, a very nice person and an excellent professor.
Very helpful, very nice, and reply email in 4 hrs. I enjoy his class a lot,

Great guy all around. Very easy to go to for help. He is very fair with his grading and is looking out for his student's best interests at all times. I had him for calc 1 and switched into his class for calc 2 b/c i knew i liked his taching style. Taking his class is highly recommended on my part!
Very nice guy, extremely helpful. Weekly tests (no calculator allowed) are a good way to not fall behind. AND HE SPEAKS ENGLISH WELL!
No Comments
Very helpful, very nice guy, and pretty easy.  I really liked the format of the class-a quiz each week with a final, which wasn't that difficult.  Would highly reccommend him!

He is an awesome guy. Real nice. Prepare for closed notebook book quizes every week. The only test is one final. He's nice, it makes the class better. If you just di the HW, which are only odd problems, you will be fine.
Prof. Adams is the absolute best prof ever. Will occasionally make last exam optional if you're happy with your grade. Retiring May 2019 so get him before he leaves!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: One of the best professor I had in WPI, took both BB4550 & BB4065 with him. Chill, funny, and super knowledgable person. Course is all in paper form, no textbook since he think textbook is useless, he hope student can learn to read paper, understand the concept, and critique whether the paper have goo "data". Exam is an oral exam, get A for both.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dave's lectures are incredible, filled with super cool info (if you're into bio) since he's been involved in so much research. His exams are objectively hard, all very specific multiple choice (lots of references to figures from the book), but he grades on a very generous curve (it's not hard to get an A).

Dave Adams as a human is AMAZING but Dave Adams as a professor is unbelievably difficult. I would not take this class unless you really know Biology. Your grade is based off 3 tests and they are scaled to the max because they are so difficult. His lectures are amazing and he is the smartest person Ive met here but his tests are too demanding
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: BEST TEACHER EVER honestly take anything he is teaching. Lectures  are not recorded, but you will do well if you go and take good notes. His research is awe-inspiring, and he is my idol. Super knowledgeable, one of the leaders in the field, so definitely a must have if you're at all interested.  Remember to read the book too! He gives you the pages

Dave is the man! Nominated for a noble prize (!), tremendous lecturer, and pretty funny. He works from the board and is very organized and good at explaining. No written HW, but tests cover 50% lecture and 50% assigned reading. Tests are hard, but take notes and make sure you know the bold book terms. Curves generously - 70% should get you the A.

Dave Adams is the man.  He talks in third person sometimes which is a little funky, but if you get passed that he's the best lecturer I've come across.  He's engaging, very passionate and has an encyclopedic knowledge of the subjects he teaches.  I'd rearrange my schedule to take classes with him.  They're not walk in As, but they're worth it.

GREAT lectures, very enthusiastic teacher. 3 tests in total, all multiple choices. The tests are hard and detailed, and contains materials from the reading only and not covered in lectures, but he tells you exactly which pages to read so it's all fair game. One of the best professors I've had at WPI.

Fantastic lectures!  They were very interesting and very relevant.  Professor Adams is so entertaining, often referring to himself in the third person.  He is very helpful if you make an appointment to go over questions and lecture material with him before a test.  Tests are tough and specific, but I would definitely take one of his other classes.

I found the way he taught to be very intriguing in the classroom setting, but hate the way he tests on minor unimportant details from the textbook that he expects you to learn without even mentioning any of it in lecture...

Dave is a great professor. Very interesting lectures. He frequently relates the covered material to current and local happenings in the field. There are only 3 test. No homework or quizzes. The tests are very hard and extremely specific.
Great lecturer. Difficult to learn ALL that information in 7 weeks with two other heavy courses.

Professor Adams is a passionate teacher. His tests seem impossible but the curve is a wonderful thing. In order to get an A, the readings are required. I would highly recommend this teacher. Some of his lectures blew my mind.

First of all Dave is an awesome professor. He will get you very interested in the subject! However, if you want to get an A in this class you have to work your ass off. Start reading the reading assignments as soon as you can, don't wait till the week before the test. Read all the pages and take notes!

He is one of the best and most passionate professors I have had at WPI. He conveys the material so enthusiastically that I even stay awake during the 9am class. His tests are difficult but he does not expect you to know all the material on the test and he curves every test.
Guys he has been nominated for Nobel Prize of Physiology!!! I guess you all want to have such a Professor

Best professor I have ever had! He is a GENIUS and is extremely passionate about his teaching, as well as helping students learn. His lectures always make sense and he keeps you interested. Exams are very difficult but he grades on a curve so you can still get a good grade!

Took all 3 courses he teaches and LOVED them!  He is incredibly passionate about biology and loves to share his knowledge with students.  He has made some breakthroughs in his own career but is down to earth and is happy to teach.  Crystal clear to understand and explains complicated topics well.  I learned more in his classes than in any others!

Easily one of my absolute favorite teachers at wpi. You can tell he loves what he is teaching and makes it all really interesting. Tests were really difficult tho, a lot of memorization (curved grading makes a B pretty easily obtainable). Only teacher I've ever seen get a round of applause during the last lecture... also looks like doc brown!
He loves what he's teaching, so class is always interesting.
Very good person. If you're a freshman who is not thinking of majoring in Biotech or some kind of Bio, don't take it. It's useless and VERY difficult to get a high grade.

Best Professor I've had. Lectures are always interesting and he is very enthusiastic even at 9 am. Extremely helpful, especially when it comes to exam reviews and questions. Straight forward about what is going to be on the exams and does not expect you to know everything. Simply put awesome professor!
He is a great professor and taught without books... using only actual journal articles. Also, oral exams were a really nice change from the usual
HE IS THE MAN - BEST PROF EVER
Best prof at WPI

Professor Adams is the man! His classes are extremly interesting even at 9:00 in the morning. Your grade in this class is based on three exams, which are all multiple choice. Although they are hard he doesn't expect you to know everything. Thus, he curves all the exams. I would recomend anyone to take this class or any class with Dave Adams.
Amazing teaching style. Made me more interested in biology. Highly recommend. The downside of this class is the grade is based solely on three equally weighted exams.
He is awesome
Best professor in the bio department
Best Ever! He explains things very well and is hilarious! He is a great academic advisor also.
No Comments

Tests are easy?!...it is easy to get an A, it is NOT easy to know all the material. Some of the ?s are very random, and very few people would do well without curve. Curve has peaked at about 40 out 65 so far...LOTS LOTS of info, if you can absorb it all, you're a genius/workaholic :). Good lectures, but that's all we ever do. Recommended.

This guy is soo cool! Love his class and his jokes. He always use third person instead of "i". He explains stuffs very well and know a lot. Great prof! Gave you lots info into how experiments are done. I would just sit in his class and hear him talk! Tests r not easy, but if you study, you will be fine. I am getting A, and he curve!
Awesome Professor; His tests are fairly easy and are multiple choice. He is very dedicated and enthusiastic and cares a lot about the students. He's the Bio dept's Goulet!
Dave is an awesome guy.  His tests are reasonable if you go to class and his curve is also very fair.

Awesome instructor, truly loves the subject and knows it well.  Very funny and interesting if a bit whacky but very funy class.  Only two tests, that was it for work other than reading.  Always availible for extra help if you need it, awesome advisor as well!
Awesome
No Comments
Dave's awesome... ask just about anyone.  He was my advisor for my IQP and he's just a really good guy.
