had him for cell bio, virology and MQP.  the guy is a machine, but if you get him off track he can get lost in his own thoughts.  overall a nice guy though
Great prof, really interested in subject matter
best professor ever
Always helpful, always available.  Tests are hard, but he is a reasonable grader.
Very informative and engaging
Was my advisor.  Challenging, but good for you - esp if you want to go to grad school.  Exceptionally intelligent man.  Clear, succinct lectures. Learned a lot. Fair.
he's my advisor, very helpful and very funny. a great guy.
excellent
Nice professor but very hard. Make sure you write down everything he says, not just everything he writes on the board. Lots of reading required for this course!

Much better for his advanced cell bio class than for intro class - more exams, and in a one-on-one oral format. My experience in BB 2550 was that he didn't really care about the class; the grade was based on only 2 tests.

Very interesting lectures, the exsames are very specific. Make sure to look at all the diagrams and pictrures and the molecular medicine sections. He askes very specific questions on the two exsams, which is all your grade!
Very very nice and smart guy, very interesting lectures, but be careful with his exams.Read all the details in the textbook. Your grades only depend on two multiple-choice exams.
He has excellent lectures, but watch out for those tests which can have ridiculously specific questions.  Watch out for details.
The best teacher I have ever had at WPI
The most interesting class I've taken thus far!
He is probably the best teacher I have ever had.  He is so enthusiastic about the topics he teaches, which makes the class that much more interesting.
No Comments
Probably the second best professor I've ever had.  He's gone above and beyond as my advisor.  GO DAVE!!!
He's very very clear in his teachings and fun
Dave is a really nice guy, he's always willing to help whether you're in his class or not - plus he knows how to teach.
Dave Adams is a wonderful teacher. I have had him for this introductory class and a senior level/grad class. He is always friendly and helpful, willing to answer questions. And he makes class fun!
No Comments
No Comments
Mad hard tests, lectures only, lots of reading
a a great teacher, and exams are dicussion based!
AWESOME teacher!
Dave Adams kicks ass!
Dave Adams is the coolest guy ever!
No Comments
Excellent Professor, gives you a look into what the real worl od Bio is like

Her teaching style was very ineffective in my opinion, it felt like she was teaching philosophy rather than calculus. She randomly left twice in the term without warning anyone. She was never very clear, and she often made errors in her explanations that lead to not much understanding. She was very nice tho.
I really enjoyed taking class with Prof. Servatius! It was a really interesting class, I learned a lot about group theory, and there was plenty of work but not too much.

I can see why Brigitte wouldn't be the best prof for something more concrete like calc, but she was great for graph theory. The professor is not the best at understanding/answering questions, but overall I feel like I got much better at proofs and lectures were cool sometimes. Lenient on assignments/deadlines as long as you show up and participate
Needs to learn the definition of constructive criticism.

It's so bad I want to give her a zero but that's not possible, so I give her a one. She will spend 30 minutes setting up a problem only to say it's wrong and then move on. The best adjective to describe her is incompetent.

She is just so nit-picky. Had her as my IQP advisor and she just points out the smallest things every single time. She literally roasts us any chance she gets but they don't even make sense. Our work is pretty clear she just gets confused but blames it on us when it doesn't make sense to her. She is nice but isn't helpful and honestly kind of rude.

She's an extremely passionate and smart professor with a lot to say. She loves talking about things that she's interested in, and wants her students to understand why the mathematics is so interesting. Her homework for this class is hard, but it is some of the most rewarding work that I've done as a mathematician. Cannot recommend enough.

Awful grader, give all your friends pass but only you need to redo all the homework even if you did group work on the hw problems. When you give very specific explanation she will tell you that your provement can be more concise but if you give a shorter one then she will tell you to be more specific and give examples.
Absolutely awful- must be on tenure. The subject could be soooo good, but unfortunately she ruins it for countless students. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

She really loves math but just doesn't know how to teach it. Lectures are all over the place. The quizzes aren't too bad if you do the optional homework first and the class overall is pretty easy, especially if you know anything about number theory. Class participation actually counts towards your grade so make sure you go to lectures.

Just dont even try her. I am sorry if she will be assigned as your IQP professor, I know you can do nothing about it but watch out and try to do good work but I am sure she is as tough in other courses she teaches.

She is really a sweet lady with a passion for what she does. Dr. Servatius encourages students to participate in research of their own. You can tell that she wants students to focus more on learning, rather than just passing the class. Weekly quizzes cover the basics of lecture. Show a genuine interest in the material, and you will do well.
The worst class I've ever taken
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I've made it my mission to go back and rate every professor I've had at WP. I'm a pretty average student that knows how to work hard. Brigitte Servatius is, I'm sure, a nice woman. She is a terrible undergraduate professor. I had never seen a professor get mad at a student for asking a legitimate question before. NR'd 2/3 of the class.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: She is a very nice woman, despite popular belief. She gives good feedback, and always pushes you to do more.

She is way too smart to be teaching undergraduate linear algebra for students who are taking the class as a basic science requirement. Unless you want to know why and how concepts were created behind matrices, don't take this class. It's a lot of work for a really simple class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not a good teacher at all. Her explanations don't make sense, even when you ask her for help. Homework amount is average, but it's difficult because she doesn't teach you anything. If you get stuck with her, prepare to basically teach yourself the material. Only plus is there are just 2 exams. You'll likely pass but not really learn.

While Dr. Servatius is obviously a brilliant mathematician and would probably be a great teacher in a graduate class, she makes no connections with undergraduates. She allows students to ask questions but often ignores questions or comments made about her work. The final had nothing to do with the material in the course. Do all of the extra credit!
She contradicts herself a lot during class and is very hard to follow during lectures. Her tests also seemed to be a lot more conceptually based even though we only went over how to do the problems.

Don't even bother going to lecture, you'll be self teaching anyway. There are only two tests the entire term. Each is worth 40% of your grade, and there are no curves.  Easily gets off topic in class, and often wastes the entire block going over homework (you know, like we have the dedicated conference block for) rather than actually teaching.
Do not take calc 4 with her period.

The class doesn't seam structured at all, she introduced quizzes halfway through the term and never has a lesson plan. Google and the textbook will become your best friends. Tests are easy if you study, and she bumps your grade up if you put in the effort. Homework is annoying, but not too hard.
She is one of the worst professors I've ever had. Her lectures are not organized and she is hardly clear. She's also not very helpful. Find a different teacher quick!
Lecture was aweful. Shes very theoretical, as well as the homework, but the test was much simpler. Basically everything I learned was on my own time not in class.
When you ask a question and your professor answers a different question that you didn't ask, you know you're gonna have a tough time. Bad at explaining and not the easiest to understand.

Let me be honest... she knows the material very well. She won't explain the whole thing to you. if you want to get a B or A  (or even pass) you got to spend lots of time reading the book and do all the hw. It's more about concepts than pure calculations. She will make this class harder than other professors.

Avoid at all costs. Cannot teach. Her lectures have no structure and are impossible to follow. She seems to assume that new topics have already been covered and begins discussing them with no actual introduction. The only positive is that she lets you use notes/books/calculators on the two tests. You will pass this class, but will not learn.

Worst professor at WPI. Absolutely no structure to the course, expects you already know the material. Online quizzes were impossible if not for google, and were full of typos. Expectations were not clear, and she didn't give the TAs any course material so they couldn't help us. She "forgot" to give the class course evaluations because shes so bad.
Avoid her like the plague! Her lectures have absolutely no flow and it is almost impossible to follow anything she says. The only reason I didn't fail this class was because of Google.
Useless Professor at Discrete Math. Teaches nothing in any sort of structured sense and even the TA's don't know whats expected of them.

Had for calc 3 and 4. Very bad teacher, takes most of the class to do one example and will usually make mistakes. Only plus was final being open book/notes. However, this is still a hard class to learn anything or get a good grade.

Avoid. A very bad teacher for Calculus 3. If you ask her a simple question, she either avoids it, or completely make it complicated by implementing graphs into the situation. When she asks the class questions and they respond, she doesn't seem to accept the answer. But, if you want a teacher to make fun of and to get mad at, she's the one.
had to teach myself and nearly failed.
avoid like the plague
Possibly the worst professor at WPI.
confusing

horrible horrible awful horrendous youuuu willl faillll. she will not teach you anything. and your homework will include words youve never heard. EVER. unless you cheated and took the class before . GET OUT. its worth a 100 dollarsssssssssssss

One of the most brilliant mathematicians I have ever met in my life. Not that good of a teacher, but if you try, you can understand her. For all the students below, its not her fault that you cannot learn anything from her lecture. Its the admission office's fault. And she is the nicest person on earth.

If you ever have a question regarding fractals and their convergence in multiple non-integer dimensions, she's fantastic; If you want to learn Calc III, don't do it. She's hard to understand, does problems incorrectly on the board and figures it out an hour later. She also doesn't seem too personable. But she's smoking hot.
terrible...just terrible
Calc 3 is hard enough as it is, she's just making it harder!...and its not even the third week! Only good point? she's helpful, but when you don't understand her teaching method...?

Difficult to understand; some accent; first week of class made a lot of mistakes, but then got better. Does not teach everything one has to know! Quizzes only based on what she teaches, but homework covers lots more, though conference helps lots. Not learned the text comprehensively, though text is very bad. No tests. Moderate diff. Not recommended

OMG sooo bad. It was agony to get up for her classes at 8am and climb to SH 3rd floor. She'd start on new material and ask for volunteers to explain some random graphs. People had never taken calc before and she was asking us to explain some random graphs she drew. That was the highpoint of the class.
She doesn't teach much during class, and sometimes mentions concepts that are far above the class, which can get confusing as the term goes on.  Conferences were fairly useful.
Avoid if she is teaching a class.  If you are stuck with her, drop the course, its better not to take it.  She made me hate Mathematics, I used to love it before.

If you are ever told this prof is your IQP advisor, run the other way as fast as you can.  Simply put, this prof is to an IQP what salt is to an eye:  painful, iritating, and it makes you want to cry.  Avoid her at all costs.

While she is nice if you ask for help, she cannot teach and gives little to no explanation of what she does. The homework that she has you do count for extra credit, but you have to do it online, which was THE WORST thing ever. Avoid her if you can.
she is the crappiest teacher ever.  She has no buisness holding a position at this university, and should be fired promptly.
bad teacher!! she doesn't explain a damn thing! but as a person is very nice and she always wants to help.

Class is very confusing. She does a bunch of steps in her head so if you're already a bit lost this will really throw you off! Tends to drag out problems! As someone said before if she knows you by face she will tend to be easier on you. If your struggling make sure you got to every class and sit up close. HW is extracredit,3 tests and final.
No Comments
she sucks...

She doesnt teach a damn thing. She is a wonderful woman but I have so much difficulty understanding the concept. She has like 2 or 3 PhD's Regardless of her vase knowledge of mathematics, her communication is very poor. But if she knows you by face and you ask questions attentively she will carry you through the course.
Easy class, easy grader, and nice nice help all you have to do is ask for it.  Nice and is interested in the students.  Like he said, make sure she knows you.
Very unskilled lecturer.  Makes simple concepts difficult to understand.  Does not relate well to students & lowers their self esteem.
Relatively easy to understand (much more so than some other professors). She's very helpful if you actually go to her and ask for help.
Horrible ! can't understand a thing she said ! learnt nothing ! quote as some one said " reading the books is much better than going to class "

The most important thing I can say is make sure she knows who you are. She may sometimes be a little confusing, but she will go over as many problems as you like. Unfortunately, this sometimes prevents her from going over other things.
Brilliant woman, horrible prof. Gives long, roundabout explanations when a simple one would be fine. Reading the book is more helpful than going to class. I haven't really learned much.
Do not get this lady as a teacher.  Tests may be easy in that they are open note and open book, but you will learn absolutely nothing in lecture.  Nothing.

Tests are easy, and are open-book, open-note. But her lectures are absolutely useless, she doesn't cover any material that's on the homework. There have been more than one occasion where she attempted to "teach" an entire section in last 10 mins
Yeah, just cuz you guys can't handle math. if you took some real classes you might not be such jackasses. professor is good. you're bad, you fail, so she was bad? You lose.

Not enough space for the class name! Combinatorics... VERY VERY VERY VERY VERY VERY VERY VERY VERY easy. I did virtually no homework, and my final project wasnt complete and didnt work properly. I got an A.
Awful!!
Open book tests, but you learn nothing
Yes math is hard.  It's not the prof.  Get over it.
Very...different....she's very smart...but difficult to grasp

Very good professor, very patient. I had a fever and did not take the eighth morning class of linear algebra, and she asked me to follow her to the office to get the paper and me to practice more and not be too anxious, and then talked for more than half an hour to analyze my paper.

Very respectful and nice. Lectures were very helpful. She went quick but all math professors are quick at WPI. One thing I loved about her is her prof hours. I found them super helpful and got to know her quite well. definitely would recommend taking her if you get a chance.

She gives three tests throughout the term. Only quizzes and tests are graded, homeworks are not. It is difficult to finish her tests within 50 mins since her real tests are generally more calculation intensive than the practice test questions. Not doing well on one test can drop you down by one letter grade

Professor Doytchinova is an excellent teacher! She might seem harsh at first, but don't let that discourage you. She's been at this school a long time and cares about her students passing. Complete the homework and the course is easy.

Calculus 1 with Tatiana was amazing. She explained very well, the optional hw was so helpful to prepare for quizzes and exams, and the quiz and test retakes took the pressure off completely. The TA's were good and she is the best math teacher I've ever had. Her lectures are funny but straightforward, and I would highly recommend her class.

Goes at a hundred miles per hour teaching as many concepts as possible in each class while talking quietly. Unless you already know calculus or are an *incredibly* fast learner with good hearing, do not take this course.

"You don't need to understand it, just memorize it" is a quote from her that pretty much sums up her class.

Do not take.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Phenomenal professor. Even though her homework are optional, definitely do them, for test questions are taken from hw. Weekly quizzes, but there are 2 retakes for each quiz. You can retake either the midterm or final as well. Gives a lot of partial credit.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: If you are in her class, immediately investigate alternatives. DO NOT put yourself through it.

Amazing! In MA1020 she knows she's teaching students not so keen on math so she adapts her teaching style. Everything is very clear. If you do the homework you will do amazing on tests/exams, because they're exactly the same, just different numbers. Starts from very foundational math so no worries about being behind. Though not much question time.

She did a really good job of explaining the concepts. Her examples were good and she was able to keep the class interesting. Her grading is a bit harsher but she still gives partial credit. She doesn't grade homework, she gives it for practice along with past practice tests and new ones. She gives quizzes a lot, but lets you retake them.
She gave me a hard time with exam accessibility. She gave a midterm and final and 1 graded homework per week, no quizzes.

This professor is by far the best professor I have had in college thus far. I wish I could have her for all my math classes. She really cares that her students do well, and offers plenty of help outside of class. If you have a chance to have her as a professor, consider yourself blessed.

This professor was very knowledgeable but she went way too fast and did not leave room for questions. She also graded based only on tests and quizzes and was a very harsh grader on tests so it was hard to succeed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Doytchinova's lectures make topics easily understandable and relatable to the real world. She really wants you to pass her class - all quizzes are retakable, as well as one of the tests. She'll review specific problems prior to exams, and tells you exactly what to study. Great choice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Doytchinova made topics very understandable and was easily accessible. The homework isn't graded, but she posts the answers. Your grade relies on exams and quizzes but we had a quiz every time we had a meeting. You can retake on exam and we could retake a quiz on our own time. I struggled with this calc but not because of the professor.

She's a great professor for calc, she makes everything easy to understand and does a lot of example problems that help with the homework. Homework isn't graded or collected, but many of the quiz and test questions are very similar to the homework questions. Doychinova is one of the nicest and approachable professors I've had. Study and you're good.

Take this with a grain of salt, since we were online. Professor Doytchinova was a decent lecturer, albeit boring. The amount of homework wasn't too much, I just disliked how it all felt like busywork and how little I got out of lecture. Midterm and Final account for 65%, so be ready for that. It was an okay experience, just left a lot to be desired
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Doytchinova is a VERY fast lecturer, she expects you to be on top of your game 100% of the time. MA2621 with her was the worst class I've had so far at WPI. There's so much information you have to learn that its impossible to miss even a single concept without failing. Exams are extremely complicated and she does not care if you fail her course.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Overall my biggest issue with this course was the combination of exceptionally difficult exams, and a lecturer who talks very quickly and quietly. Due to this if you are not in the front few rows it is night impossible to hear anything going on.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She lectures way too quickly for her students to follow and take notes at the same time. I remember her test had 10 problems on there and each question was a different concept. There is not nearly enough time provided to even get to all the questions. Also, I wish she had graded homework assignments.

I had her for MA 1023 and she was a good teacher. Her lectures are kind of boring because all you do is just write and write but she makes the calc understandable. She always does examples in her notes which is like the homework and her tests are semi-hard but if you practice you should do fine. Also, office hours are helpful, went all the time.

She is my absolute favorite professor I have had. She is so nice and truly cares about each student. She wants everyone to pass and receive a good grade. She is very clear about what will be on the quiz and the questions are similar to homeworks/notes. She is also very helpful at office hours.

Calc 3 is hell, but that doesn't mean she is a bad professor. Her homework is not collected, but the answers are posted online and there are pop quizzes based on hw questions. She does talk quietly and writes fast, but there is a lot of material to cover. Overall, she treats students fairly and is understanding.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Doytchinova is a very friendly person. She doesn't require the textbook and also doesn't check HW, just has quizzes on it, which is nice. If you put in the effort, you will do great, but with that said, she doesn't post lecture notes, and her teaching style might not be for everyone.

She is a real gem of a teacher that I would take again in a heartbeat, people may say beware of pop quizes, but she makes it clear from the start that you'll have one when your HW is due. While she doesn't grade HW, she'll pick the 2-3 quiz questions right from the HW! And she doesn't even grade your HW! She is an amazing teacher I'd recommend her!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This Professor is good. Although she doesnt post her notes. Homeworks and Solutions to them are posted which is a very good study tool. Lectures can be a little confusing at times but she is very accessible and so are her TAs. Quizzes taken in class instead of conference and can be retaken. 1 Test execpt the final can also be retaken. Good Class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Stats here sucks but honestly I don't know which professor is worse. She's boring, writes on the board only for notes, and posts nothing after class. She talks incredibly quiet and is probably the most uninteresting professor I've had at this school. Believe me, I'm currently sitting in her class writing this.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is a really great professor. She does write very quickly and speaks fairly quiet, but you'll get used to it and not even notice after a while. Her lectures are pretty straight forward, just take notes. She only uses homework problems on the quizzes so those are easy As. As long as you study for the tests, they are doable. Overall, 10/10.

My advice to a student enrolling in Calculus at WPI--take Doytchinova's class if there is a seat open. She holds high expectations for her students, but you will learn to master the material in her class. She gives quizzes twice a week but allows students to retake them during office hours--her priority is that you learn above all else.
rating_tags: Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is very clear in what she expects from us and what we need to know for tests. Her lectures aren't the most interesting/exciting, but they're easy to understand and she explains the material well.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: A good math professor, she knows what she is talking about. I was really worried about the final but she was able to meet with me outside of office hours the day before and helped out enough that I managed to get an A. She bumps up grades for people who take time to meet with her and try in class.

This class, in general, was very difficult for me. Tatiana's teaching style is unusual as well. However, she is a very fair grader and willing to go out of her way to help you get a good grade in this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Trying to learn from her lectures is impossible. She talks and writes too quickly to keep up and she doesn't post any of her notes online. While her quizzes are homework problems, the tests are impossible and look nothing like the quizzes or homework. Be prepared to memorize, since she doesn't let you have a notes sheet on any of her tests.

To be honest, she's not that great. She tries to cover way too much material in too little time. My hand literally cannot keep up as I try to copy her notes from the board to my notebook. Tests and quizzes are hard and unforgiving... I took this class as an ME student to fill math credits, and it was a real struggle for me by the end of it all....
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Class moves very quickly and not all notes are online. Homework isn't graded, but do it so you can do well on hw quizzes. She is a great teacher, but the tests are difficult. You do not have much time so work quickly and know the material!! Do not fall behind in the material, keep up with the homework and it will help. She is willing to answer q's.

Just finished a semester with her, and it's safe to say she is one of the best choices for taking Calculus freshman year. She's stern but very willing to help students, and you'll have plenty of opportunities throughout the week to reach out to her or the TA. You can also avoid using the textbook altogether if you pay attention in class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Would take again

comment: Clearly cares about her students. Wants everyone to do well.

Tatiana is a great teacher! He lectures were easy to follow and taught us everything we needed to know. The homework is optional, but she gives 2-3 quizzes on the homework each week. If you pay attention in class, these quizzes should be easy. She also allows you to retake each quiz during conference.
She explains in a very straightforward and simple way.  She cares about her students and genuinely wants them to succeed.

Great professor! Loved her class and her desire for having students learn. She is not around in campus very much but she will do her best to help you as much as she can. Makes Calc 3 bearable but there is one thing... she is very quick when lecturing.

Goes over lots of examples in class.  Gives formulas, derives some but not all.  Gives tough exams, but is very fair. Exams cover what was taught. I had an off day on the final, ended up 2 points under a B for course, went to her after final, she assigned problems and allowed me to show I understood the material.  Definitely would take again.

She is an amazing professor! Gives the theories and then tons of examples. You have quizzes 2-3 times a week (14% of grade)  but they're DIRECTLY from the homework that she posts every night . There are 2 tests and you're able to make one up. Then a final. MUST GO TO LECTURE Definitely would take again with her, she makes calc 3 understandable.
Homeworks are not mandatory.  Allows re-tests. Grading is lenient. My fav prof

Possibly the best math professor at WPI. Does not assign online homework. Written homework is optional but is highly recommended because the quiz are similar to the homework. Would take again if possible. Great teacher, better person.
She is very clear and gives good examples.
Amazing professor. Really wants to make sure the students do well and understand the material. Wish I could have her for all four Calcs.

Best math teacher I've ever had. She just wants her students to succeed. I took Ap Calc AB in high school and got a 5 but I still learned new things from her. She will explain anything you want if you ask questions and it's nearly impossible to fail because she lets you retake all of her quizzes and one of her two tests. Great teacher.

Take a class with her if you can. You can retake any test or quiz to try to get a better grade. She is really clear when she teaches, but if you don't get something she will explain it to you personally at her office hours. Best math professor ever.
A great person and professor. She really wants her students to do well and helps a lot during office hours. Her explanation is really clear and engaging. I wish all my professors were like her.
Great teacher

The best professor I have had at WPI so far. Cares about her students and helps them do well as much as she can. She made the class easy and clear although the textbook was bad. Definitely take her if you can for every math class.

If you can, take calculus with her. She is extremely helpful and her lectures are excellent. Be prepared to write a lot if you want to take notes of everything she writes on the board. She has weekly quizes with questions taken assigned homework. Easy exams and overall just a great professor.

Best calc 3 teacher you can get. She posts solutions to the homework, and the quizzes are 100% = to the homework... and she posts the solutions ahead of time. She lets you retake the two exams. She drops the lowest quiz. Has office hours. Teaches very clearly. MAKE SURE you have her for calc 3.

Fantastic professor! She offered many office hours and made accommodations if your schedule conflicted. She wants everyone to pass and will make it so you do. She drops the two lowest quiz grades and offers retakes on each test. I highly recommend her.
She is one of the best teachers at WPI. Very understanding and willing to help in class and during office hours.
She is one of the best teachers in WPI. Very understanding and willing to help students to do well. Well-prepared in class and really helpful during office hours. I definitely recommend her.
She does have an accent, but I did not have trouble understanding her. She is very helpful outside of class if you are struggling with something.
Great professor. Calc 3 was hard but I'm glad I took it with her. She has a heavy ascent but I could understand most of what she said. She'll help you after class if you ask.
She is a great professor. One of the best math professors I've had. She is very nice! Ask for help if you need to! Her exams are not easy but she explains well enough.

Great Teacher. Always provided plenty of examples. Wants students to succeed. Allows a retake of one of two tests given. Tests are a little tough, but if you pay attention and practice you will do fine.

Excellent professor.  When something isn't clear in class, office hours are the most useful item.  No doubt, the class is hard.  If you put the time and effort in, you will do well.  The professor wants students to succeed and she doesn't everything in her power to help.
She is one of the best professors I've had at WPI, I would highly recommend her.

Straight forward and to the point. Professor teaches her class by explaining what you will be learning, how it will be used, how to do it, and then show lots of examples. Out of the professors I have had at WPI, she has been one of the best.

She's an awesome professor. She has an accent which isn't hard to understand at all. She's extremely flexible with grading. She allows you to retake a quiz and one of two tests. She's probably the best Calculus teacher I've had so far. She writes a lot and explains fast, therefore pacing yourself accordingly is important.
Didn't much care for her. She taught far too slowly in the beginning and seemed to rush things near the end. The class basically depended on your individual studies outside of class.

Overall great class. Extremely easy in the beginning. Would have been better if she had spent less time on 8th grade stuff in the beginning and more on the harder stuff later on. Rather easy grader. I would recommend her.
Very nice class. She at first taught like we were in kindergarden but started to pick up the pace. Decent grading and kept with a subject until we understood it. Answered all questions fully

Professor Farr was more lighthearted than most professors, and his lectures always held my attention. He was always willing to help, and he only got frustrated when we weren't taking the class seriously. He was my favorite professor at WPI, and everyone reading this missed out now that he's retired. 350 characters isn't enough to do him justice.
Honestly a great guy, he knows how difficult Calc 3 can be and really wants you to pass the class. I'm taking his course during his last term at WPI and he will be missed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Very good professor, gave the chance to use a cheat sheet on every test, making every test very doable. Also, he puts all his notes online and you can skip lectures and not fall too far behind. His way of taking notes is very helpful, and he gives answers to practice tests (which can go on the cheat sheet!), best math class ever taken.

Profesor Farr is an amazing teacher. His explanations in class are very good and he gives good examples. IF you do not understand in the lecture go to his office hours, he gives very good explanations and is a big help. The tests are tough, but he gives partial credit and is a very fair grader.
I love Professor Farr, he is such a genuine and caring professor. If you have the opportunity, definitely take this class with him!

Professor Farr is very helpful during office hours, gives good and clear lectures, and is always willing to answer questions. Calc 3 is a tough course, but he made it better to understand. I would definitely take his class again.

Farr is literally the best math teacher I've ever had. He's really good at explaining the material he teaches and is really funny in class. The tests are almost the exact same as his practice tests with a few numbers switched. Also when he makes a witty comments he twitches his eye brows as if hes proud of himself and its hilarious.

If you haven't had a class with Farr, you're missing out. He is an amazing, hilarious person. His lectures are very straightforward (a bit monotonous, but it's Calculus). He gave three exams that were 75% of the final grade, so study hard! Otherwise, the homework and labs are fair. Great prof, I hope to take more of his classes in the future.
Really good at teaching. Overall amazing person

I took the class with another professor and i didn't learn anything, i took the class again with him and everything made sense. He is always there to help you in office hours and he is a very fair grader.

There's a reason this guy's office wall is literally covered in letters praising his teaching.  Farr is easily one of the more helpful Professors at WPI and wants you to pass with flying colors.  Only downside I have is that the lectures themselves are monotonous.

I didn't really attend any classes because they were so boring, long, and I was learning nothing. Therefore I did not do well on the tests but the homework's were so easy. Conferences are no help, no one attended them either and the ones who did said they weren't helpful. I do not recommend this guy if you have trouble with boring professors.
Super Swaggy. Great Guy and Teacher. If you take notes and go to office hours, it is pretty much a guaranteed A .

Professor Farr has a very straightforward and clear teaching style. Even when I was confused during lecture, everything made sense in the long run because he is so organized. I never went to office hours, but I can imagine that he is extremely helpful. If you are going to take this class, definitely take it with Professor Farr!
Great professor, go office hours and he will explain all the homework

Very good teacher! He is thorough and descriptive in his lectures. The material on the test is not a surprise and if you pay attention you will be prepared. Class is enjoyable as he makes jokes to lighten things up. Take advantage of his office hours. He is willing to go through any questions you have and help anywhere you need it.
Bill Farr is the man! Easily the best math professor I have had here. Very clear lectures, reasonable hw, and reasonable tests. Take a class with him if you can.

Professor Farr is an awesome guy. He's probably one of my favorite professors at WPI. His lectures are very clear, he's easy to find in his office and gives clear explanations. His tests are very fair and not too difficult, but they do weigh a lot into the final average. I highly recommend Professor Farr.
Prof. Farr is a really helpful teacher and makes clear explanation of the course material. His test is pretty easy but if you studied in advanced you might find his lecture boring.
I would totally suggest you take any course with him!  Kinda easy, kinda not, its just totally awesome!  He is amazing!  He made his own book and it was amazing!
He is awesome! One of the best professors I have met so far. Very helpful and is really good at explaining things.

The best teacher I have had at this school so far.  A great challenge that can trip you up if you are not fully prepared.  Class is only 3 tests and 30% is usually based off of theory.  Make sure you ask him for help if you start lagging behind or else your grade will suffer.  Above all he is cool, funny and a great guy
this guy is awsome
Really funny and awesome guy. Try to do the homework immediately, so you might have some semblance of an idea what he's teaching in lecture. He's much more clear if you go to him for extra help.
Excellent professor although it is hard to understand the material during class only when you go through the homework do you realize that you actually know what you are doing...
Awesomeness in math form! I don't know why his rating is only 4.8! Bottom line, at WPI, take diff eq and lin alg with Farr. If you can't, figure out how.
Second time I've had him, directly after Differential Equations. He's been absolutely awesome in both, with clear wording, good reviews, and a good sense of humor. Tests are perfectly balanced.
His class is my favorite of the day. His teaching style is engaging and he is very clear and willing to help students.
Greatest proffessor ever, very clear, very hel[full, has lots of office hours, really fair grader. Everyone in the class loved him.

Class concepts clear. Homework simple. Practice exams straight forward. Actual exams difficult because about 25% of the exam is on the theory behind the math instead of how to do the math (which is what the practice exams/homework is). Don't get caught by surprise-- if you take Diff Eqs with him study the theorems.
Extremely clear and helpful. One of the best math teachers I've ever had at this school. If you go to class and make an effort on the homework, you should be golden.

This guy is the man, one of the best pofessors here, defenitely the best math prof, always in hi s office and ready to help, even very understanding, i had a bad grade on one exam because my hardrive failed that morning and he was completely understanding, recomended to take any and all classes with him, truley the man

Fantastic professor, teaches by example.  The book he chose is different from the other profs and is one of the very best in my opinion.  Even if you miss class but read the examples in the book, you'll know what you're doing.  Great class!  Highly recommended!
One of the best math professors! Really helpful and reasonable.
One of my favorites so far.  He is great at office hours, going through every part of a problem.  Also offered extra review sessions for tests.

Awesome teacher.Very clear. Writes class notes on a overhead projector and is punctual about uploading pdf formats to his website. Review sessions are long and in depth on material covered during class lecture. I attended first 2.5 weeks and stopped coming to 9AM class. Only reason i got a B was a mistake i made on the first exam...
Bill Farr is the absolute man. He provides examples for everything and makes even the hardest concepts crystal clear with a little studying. Best math professor I've had.

This teacher really cares about his students. In this class he got to know everybody's name and even joke with us like a friend. The material for this class is very hard but he is makes it easier by holding review sections for the exam, homework, and he even gives individual help. One of the most awesome teachers over at WPI.
Funny guy, really helpful, but sometimes went too in depth in terms of theory.

The most amazing professor ever. He cares for his students, and will go out of his way to help them. He both wants people to learn and to get credit for passing. The class was hard, because he'd go more in depth. If you're interested in math, take his diff eqs class, its harder but you learn a lot more, and you get an amazing prof.
Bill Farrr is the man! He is fair, and clear.

real good proffessor, has office hours throughout the day, holds review sessions before exam,but the advanced diff q course was damn tuff,take this professor if you got the guts to handle advanced course.definately recommend him for easy courses, fair questions, real easy grading.

Definitly a good professor overall. Really nice guy. Sometimes gets ahead of himself on theory and become difficult to understand. Definitly worth taking if yuou like alot of theoretical mathematic explinations

yep delightful professor...think he may have just convinced me to get a math minor...unfortunately there are not too many in the math department like him - he's simply fantastic and I'd recommend any math class you wanna take with him
Very interesting and clear professor, very willing to help and explain how to do things, if you ever need cal credit, try it with farr

Bill Farr is possibly one of the most patient and generally concerned professors I ever had. While he embodies everything you would expect from a geek, he also truly cares about his students and works to make sure you understand things. Truly great!
Most personable teacher I've had at WPI for after class questions. Classes are enguaging and he always gets things right (he's afterall the department head).

Of all the profs I've had so far at WPI, he's the best. His homework is always pertinent to tests, he stays for reviews before his tests till late at night (even during snowstorms). He genuinely cares about his students, whether you pass or fail, and always has a smile on his face to help. Great guy
Bill was very helpful and easy on the eyes!
Prof. Farr is head of the Math dept and an awesome teacher. It's funny when he goes off on a slight tangent about the people sleeping in class. His class never seems boring to me though.
he made the material really clear, and easy to understand. he would even hold review sessions on sunday nights.

awesome teacher, explains things very clear and never less than 3 times.  Holds review sessions on nights before exams, he's very concerned about you learning the material well and does everything to help you.  Very nice guy and easy to approach for help.
Quite possibly the geekiest man alive, but refreshingly, he doesn't hold a grudge against the world because of it.  Very friendly and very helpful.  I learned a ton in his class.
IS  AWESOME!
Probably the best professor I've had at WPI.  Makes things so clear it's impossible not to comprehend what he's teaching
He is very nerdly!!!!!!
This guy knows what he's talking about; very organized and helpful
Very smart professor.
Funny and a great teacher and person
No Comments
Good professor, he made the class quite doable.
Good teacher, but maple sucks
Good professor, very smart.  Lectures a little boring.  Take notes!
Easy to get along with, helps out readily, works with you
Tough course...good teacher for it...very merciful :-)
Very willing to help

This professor has made the ECON 1120 class harder in 2024. Absolutely boring lectures. Your grade is based on 28 quizzes (14 in class and 14 online). You can't skip questions and come back to them later, and you can't see what you got wrong until you have used all 3 of your attempts. This leaves no room for grade improvement. Avoid this professor!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He tends to talk for 2 hours straight while going on random tangents about his life, he also gives very little to do in class. If you are into System Dynamics, then this is a really good class. However, I would advise not taking it if you don't even know what system dynamics is.  Overall, very relaxed environment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Radzicki was one of the best I've had so far, his lectures were interesting, and the grade was based exclusively on 14 online quizzes (each had 2 attempts). While the course might be challenging if you want to have a deep understanding of macroeconomics, it is very easy to get an A
the entire class is based off 14 online quizzes that have 2 attempts. Best econ class

He just talks for two hours straight which gets kinda boring, the only assignments for the class were 9 take home quizzes on canvas and he makes them very easy. Not much of the lecture was on the quizzes, mostly whatever article he posts is what the quiz is about. Stress free class, it's interesting if you like system dynamics.

Had him A21 and I'm gonna be honest it wasn't the best experience, but not terrible by any means. Lectures were optional but you really should go to them because small details end up on his quizzes. It honestly felt like a STEM class, but there is a lot of reading and simulation analysis.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Had him for SD 1510, which wound up being very easy, and he allowed for test corrections at the end of the term. Lectures were crucial for the first few meetings because the quizzes had topics he covered only verbally in class. That was the only hard part about the class, the rest was extremely easy. So take good notes for the first few weeks.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: All he does is talk on and on for two hours.

I took system dynamics with Radzicki in A term. It was okay I guess. Lectures were kinda boring but not the worst thing in the world. The class is based off of seven homework assignments and four take-home quizzes. Feedback came far too late in the term and the criteria wasnt overly clear with the homework assignments. Eh.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The lectures were kind of boring, but 4 years later I still remember some stuff he said. he cares a lot about the students and is overall a great guy.
skip if you can.
not recommend this professor. he is def over-valued. boring, he doesn't care about the students and he thinks his opinions are more important than the class. wouldn't mind at all if he left wpi.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Very easy class, but his teaching wasn't the greatest.

As everyone else said, the whole class comes down to exams purely based on his opinions mentioned in lecture and all other materials are irrelevant. Find another professor where you can learn the material correctly.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He seems like he is a really nice guy and he knows lots about economics. He can be very boring. His lectures are hard to follow and they have way too much info on the slides. When he put things on board, it help a bit. Its very hard to tell what will be on the tests as anything said in class is fair game. Also, HW had nothing to do with class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Tests are very specific, and only based on what he says in lecture, so you gotta show up. PowerPoint slides are useless, as is the homework.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Radzicki is one of the best professors I've ever had in 16 years of formal education. He's intensely passionate about Economics, and has a gift of being able to explain complex topics in a way that even a lay person can understand. He's fair, understanding and a solid human being. If you apply yourself, you'll like him a lot.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Basically the grade is composed of online homework and two exams. The homework isnt hard but it has nothing to do with what the exams are on. The two exams are completely based off of what he says during lectures. You have to go to lectures so you have all the information but even then good luck trying to figure out what the exams will be on.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This professor is very kind and friendly. The only problem is the midterm and final are extremely difficult to prepare for and are the only tests/quizzes you take the whole term. The midterm and final come straight from his lectures so if you want to succeed you should attend class.

Tests are based off small details from his slides and the words that come out of his mouth during lecture which rarely follow the textbook or his slides. Course is competently based off of his opinions of macro. During one lecture he complained that he had to spend a day going from the book to explain principles of macroeconomics.

His class is the most boring class I've taken in the entirety of my life. The average on our midterm was 70.7, Final was 61, and Homework was a max of 70/70. This means the average class grade is a 74 and he won't be scaling. Awful teacher, gives homework that has nothing to do with what will be on the test
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He only talks about his experience and opinions about famous economists in lecture but 90% of the test is based on these. He talks about these like once and don't leave any notes to take. Slides are based on his own interest and irrelevant with this course. Homework is completely based on textbook. A lot of news articles to read.

If you're actually interested in economics  take his class, he clearly loves the material and it shows in his lectures. He does test on what is said in lecture, no what's on the powerpoint, so class is a must. Homework is all online and tests are multiple choice and very directly relate to what's covered, although the tests were somewhat difficult.

He doesn't care if everyone is asleep. He will go on and on nonstop and laughs at his own jokes. He thinks he is interesting by saying I met this economist and that one. He only mentions things one time and it will be on test. There are a lot of questions on the test that are very specific.

This class is garbage. Don't do it. I can say confidently that you will regret it. This should be your last option. They guy cannot teach. He will listen to the sound of his own voice all day, but it won't help you at all. And please don't spend $250 on a rental book with online access. He doesn't use the online part.
Online HWs are tough, but exams are not as long as you come to class and take note. Enjoy!

Horrible prof of easy topic.  Lecture slides consist of only pictures and everything on the test is only said once in class with no way to study.  Expects students to read way too much of the text book and articles with no real relevance.  Worst prof I have every had. Avoid at all costs.

Terrible professor. Class was overly difficult, professor was bad at teaching the information. Too many articles to read and exams had impossibly hard material. Intro to macro shouldn't be nearly this complicated. Relatively easy material that was taught in quite an awful way. Avoid Radzicki

System Dynamics is interesting, but probably not very relevant to a undergrad. I struggled to understand the materials, only vaguely understood some of the basic concepts(some point are great thou). He is an interesting guy, incredibly friendly, but you will probably end up sleeping in class. Take this class if you know what you are doing

Professor is very well versed and involved in his respective field, with a contact list of all the important figures from the founding till today. Sadly, this computer heavy class suffers from a lack of a lab component, and so his high energy teaching style struggles in later classes to convey the most important of details: How to run vensim itself
Don't try to take this class. The course is cool, not the way he teaches.

Do not take this class of your own free will. The professor is a friendly person with a great personality but he can't teach a fish to swim. He knows the subject inside out, but he seems to be incapable of clarifying anything. There are no office hours for him and God help you when he tries to teach you how to use Vensim.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. It will be the worst decision you will ever make. The prof is an awful teacher and even though he is very good at what he does he cannot teach if his life depended on it. He's a great guy but just don't take his class. He doesn't explain anything clearly and has no office hours. He just tells unrelated stories all class long

Pretty cool guy, and an interesting class. Pretty easy and everything is in the textbook and on the online reading, you will know what's up if you read it. Honestly the only social science worth wasting your time on at WPI.

Terrible. That's all I have to say. If you can avoid taking Macroeconomics with Radzicki, do it!!! and do not look back. He put everybody to sleep. Heck, I went to his classes, took notes, everything and still managed to get fail the final. Because he bases your grade on just a final and midterm (I had an 84 here) I ended up with a C. Terrible.

Awful. Lectures put everyone to sleep so nobody really went. Tests have random questions that are way too specific at times. Even less interested in econ than was before. Will make sure to never take a class with this guy again

There was no grading rubric for the class I took with him. No book for the class, just random Wall Street Journal articles and some very hard to understand powerpoint slides. My favorite quote from him, "Your grades are just math to me, I get paid the same." Terrible.

Got written hw grades and midterm 2 weeks after the midterm was taken. Most of the class failed. Didn't set expectations, and tore through the class when it came to grading on a rubric that we didn't have. Awful class
Radzicki was very confusing at some points. His tests are extremely hard.

This professor's tests are extremely difficult. All of the questions are very specific details rather than general concepts. The material that is on the tests is not in his lecture slides or the book, but rather in the specific details of what he verbally states. Being a visual and kinesthetic leaner, this class was terrible.

Contrary to what most other people here have said, I found his macroeconomics class difficult (and boring). If you don't do well on the midterm and final you won't do well in the class because those are the only 2 grades.  I wouldn't recommend this class unless you have prior experience in economics.

Great Prof. just do the work, and stop being lazy. And the Wall Stree Journal Articles are actually VERY liberal the editorial are VERY conservative. I think it is good to read both sections (althought I tend to laugh at the editorials).
not easy anymore... as people say.. cant use notes and wut not... read the directions on your test!! i screwd up MCs cuz there can be MORE than 1 answer.. gave us a EC project.. cool guy
Amazing person!

Wow, everyone else who's rated this guys is crazy. Although the course doenst have alot of work and yes you can get a good grade in it, dont take it if you are really leftist because he wanted us to buy the wallstreet journal and read it every day. Yeah, right. Extremely biased toward right wing economic ideas and thought titanium was a mixture...?
Awesome guy.

Really easy class, however you don't actually learn very much. I found that he didn't seem to take the class itself very seriously and it suffered because of that. I suppose he's good if you want an easy A, but not if you want to learn.
really easy class.  really nice guy.  knows his stuff.  makes boring economics relatively easy to understand
So easy
Very dynamic. Makes a boring class interesting.
No Comments

Clearly puts no effort into this introductory macroeconomics course (D-term 2004). Seemed a little insecure about teaching it, too, when he scolded the class for poor attendance on one occasion. It was like he knew all the students were there just to fulfil their social science requirement.
Definatley the man. Quizzes are easy and you learn alot too.
Very easy. It's your own fault if you don't do well.
I really enjoy his class because it's easy.
great professor, prob the easiest class at WPI
Did not get an A, but it's my fault. Good teacher though.
easy as pie
classes are made so that u have to be a moron to not get an A.  he's your best friend if you get on his good side and a terrible enemy if u get on his bad.
Excellent teacher, he is a great guy and very helpful.
Blame students all the time.
Easy class.  Would be better if he didn't wear short-shorts...
buff guy, all exams are copied and pasted from HW, highly recommended
Pretty cool guy, good class.
A real persons person.  Gets right to the pt
No Comments
He is a creep. check out his quora. misogynistic .

Roughly one project a week that teach you C/C++ (he discusses concepts in class). Midterm and final are open-note/open-book. Hilarious lecturer, although not absolutely amazing. Don't expect this to be an easy class.

Lectures were just him reading off slides. He never taught syntax or did any live coding. Often goes on tangents that are meaningless. Grading was often incorrect and objectives were not clear. There were many errors in instructions and starter code of homework assignments. He is a wonderfully funny human being, but a terrible teacher.

Mainly just tells jokes in lecture. Lecture isn't super useful but he's very nice and helpful outside class. The homework will really teach you C and C++. Exams are a good measure of the material covered. Quite a legend at the school. Textbooks are useful and both exams are open-book.

Really bad at lecture but knows the material very well. He can't teach but he can always answer any questions. I didn't go to lectures at all and learned everything by doing homework and reading online. Quizzes every week but don't reflect the material covered, luckily they are open note. Homework is long and tough but is the ONLY WAY to learn in
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had Ciraldaddy for both Systems and Assembly C and D term of my Freshman year. He doesn't do a great job explaining things in lectures, but he's very knowledgeable, and it's worth asking questions to him when you have them. He's a reasonable guy, and will bump your grade up if you're on the cusp at the end of the term.

I love Ciaraldi. He's a funny guy and despite despite his tangents he clearly conveys the dense course material we needed to cover in 8 weeks. Quizzes are very tough and are essentially tests. Homework is long and tough but is very effective for learning course material.

Teaches off slides alone, only theory, and has quizzes every week which don't reflect the level of knowledge of the course at all. In order to pass the quizzes you have to have all the answers written down already, which is easy since they are duplicated from previous quizzes which are given to you. Not a class to take if you want to actually learn

His class is extremely unorganized, assignments are graded late, feed back isn't helpful. In class he only teaches off of power points and never codes in class. He tells dirty jokes and gets off topic a lot. Some of his slides are poorly written and concepts are hard to understand. Thq quizzes are very difficult and the averages fall around 50%.
Only teaches theory behind coding, expects you to learn all actual coding on your own. Assignments are difficult to complete without going to office hours.

Teaches the material. Records lectures. If you run into any issues he will help you. Tells jokes without getting off topic. Knows the history of computer science because he was there for most of it. Deep knowledge of topic. Open note exams/quizzes. Every second of class time counts. Good at explaining the details.

This class is a lot of self studying, especially if you've never programmed in C/C++ before. Because he does not actually teach how to code within the language, the homework may seem a bit rough at first, but once you get used to them they become more manageable.

He is very caring, nice, and chill. He only talks about features and trivial details about C/C++ without even teaching you how to code. Might be helpful for reviewing but doesn't help at all for learning. I learned everything through homework and searching concepts online. Get ready to self learn because he won't provide anything helpful at all.

He's a nice guy and care about his students, its just that the course was not all it could have been. Instead of doing things like live coding in class and teaching us the syntax (would have been nice), we learned about specific features of C and C++, some of which we never ended up using. Lectures were not super helpful, but the projects were good
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Ciaraldi was a kind professor but was easily distracted in class. Homework was very challenging but manageable as long as you do the reading and either attend or watch recording of all the lectures. Grading was often incorrect and required additional attention. Overall, was not satisfied with the way the course was taught.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Well, he is a nice guy but definitely not well prepared to be a professor. Over this introductory level computer science class, he hasn't done a single code example in class, which make the Homework really hard. You definitely need to have a lot of CS knowledge before taking this class; would not recommend him in general!
Really good professor that cares for his students, and his grading scheme is relaxed so overall it is an easy A as long as you keep up the work and study for it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall course is great and very interesting. However, the professor's explanations are very vague (to the extent that it takes you longer to understand what he wants you to do than actually doing the stuff). Also, grading is very (very..) slow.

He is just awful as a teacher. He just can't teach. Or better, he just doesn't teach. Some of his lectures don't even begin until half way through the class time. For some of the labs, half  the students don't even finish it because the material was never taught. Some of his responses to perfectly valid questions were also sarcastic in tone.

Awful professor, lectures don't help at all. Half the time he is just telling a story or making some completely unrelated analogy. He straight up doesn't teach. You are much better off going and reading a book then attending his lectures. He will say this is a thing then wont explain how to use it or any syntax. Avoid him at all costs!

The lecturese was him reading slideds and telling unrelated storys. Homework took hours because we were never taught CC++ just told what it could do. Exams covered only some of what was covered in lecture but most was not. Despite being open book and open note expect to do badly.

His homework are really long so you better do it ahead.  His exams are very difficult. He talks a lot about random things in the lectures. My advice is taking note during class, they will be in the test. And have a copy of the textbook in exams, they really helps.

The professor definitely likes to help students, and you can tell he loves what he does and has been doing it a long time. The lectures aren't the most helpful thing, as he goes off on tangents often and shows you more of what things are rather than how they work.

While RBE is always a challenge, RBE1001 wasn't bad with Ciaraldi. While he gets distracted a little in lectures he is awesome to go to for help. I really want him as my MQP advisor because he knows a lot and is GREAT to brainstorm with. Really happy and funny guy.

Easiest ever. Had him for systems, and every homework had ~15 points of easy extra credit. We wer supposed to have 5 random quizzes, but he forgot to give 4 (the one we did I somehow got a 15 out of 5). He's also an alright teacher, just gets on tangents constantly so it's hard to tell when he's actually saying something important.

How to do well in this class: Take notes. Write down (on your laptop, on the powerpoints he provides online for you, as he goes through them in class) things he says. Random things sometimes are quiz/test questions. Start on the homeworks ASAP, and always go to office hours for help, from both him and the TAs. Tells random stories a lot. He's okay.

Worst professor I've met so far. I don't know why some kids give him high rate but they also point out the problems he has. Don't teach at all so don't take him if you are a CS major!!! You will suffer in things related with operating systems later!  Don't use mic so no one can hear after three rows. Only tell nonsense jokes that noboday laughs.
He is a nice guy but he just can't teach. Read off slides that are not very helpful in the first place. Doesn't expand from slides.
good professor, fairly amusing, posts slides online so you dont have to take notes, homework takes a while, but not esp hard.

This class took up a lot of my time, but I got an A. Homework is hard and counts for a lot in this class. On the midterm and final he asks questions that he did not cover, so you have to know what you are doing. I learned a lot about C/C++, doxygen, and Linux machines.

He's a great guy and tells amusing anecdotes, but as for a teacher, he isn't so great. He reads off the slides and changes his mind about everything. The homeworks are much more difficult and time consuming than is fair and the tests cover material that half the class has never heard of. He teaches catering to students who already know C and C++.
Easy prof. Loves to go off-topic during lectures and tell stories.
Great guy, awful teacher.  Didn't learn anything from his classes and remember even less.

This class was a waste of time. He spent the lectures showing videos rather than actually teaching us. He rarely said the same thing twice without contradicting himself. Overall, if you want to learn CS, don't take this course.

Really nice guy, but totally useless. To be fair, the class really should be two different classes, but  he asks questions on the test that are not covered and cannot explain something twice without contradicting himself. Still, one of the nicest profs I've come across- he really wants to both help you understand and make it fun at the same time.
very nice; loads of assignments but exams are open-book and easy; very helpful as well; watch out for surprise quizes!

He is a nice person, and very helpful one on one, however, his large lectures did not really teach what you needed to know for the homework assignments, and he reused the same questions as from previous terms, which were all online, and you were allowed to use notes and the book during the exams.
Great teacher. The work piles up but it's worth it because he doesn't focus on tests that much.
Puts alot of material into historical perspective which is very important.
No Comments

I came in his course expecting a lot since i heard a lot of good things about him, but he did not live up to it. He does have such high ratings here because he is easy - in this class, there were 7 homeworks and 2 tests, and all of them were weighted the same. It is almost impossible not to do well

This guy tells a lot of stories and good jokes. Didn't really learn a whole lot and didn't really do a whole lot, but got an A anyway. This was a summer course, so maybe that's why he seemed a little TOO laid back...
<3 Best Professor EVER!

He is a horrible professor, students like him because he is easy.  If you want to learn go elsewhere(not wpi, especially graduate, with its zero research and low quality professors.) if you want an easy class, heres your man.  I had so many bonus points I didnt have to taket he final.

he tells too many stories, he consistently didn't finish lectures in time, and made us complete an assignment a week after class was out (on the 4th of july) because he didn't assign it early enough. do not take his summer class.
Looks like an Ewok.  You'll want to hug him.  He once took up half an hour in class showing us the original "all your base" video on the class projector.
Good guy, interesting stories. Occasionally you hear the same jokes he told last class, but it's cool - very knowledgable prof.
This guy is one of the best CS professors I have had so far.  I would highly recommend him.
very funny, nice guy.  easy on the workload and grading.

Joking, funny and interesting, this is a guy you not only want to spend listening to in class, you'd also want to spend an evening listening to him expound on the meaning of life.  This guy is the Humanities Professor of CS Dept.  Also a playwright.
If WPI were the 1960's, this guy would be Elvis.
Excellent teacher, one of the best CS professors I've had here.
Used to be the guy with the most comic books in the US.  how cool is that?
Very jovial man.  Also, a very good CS professor, seemingly a rarity here at WPI
No Comments
What a fun and happy professor! A rarity in this major.
excellent jolly guy. he is fun to listen to in class and grading is fairly easy.
No Comments
AWESOME teacher...Such a relief after CS2135 work!
Definately a good professor, we need more like him
No Comments
Didn't even lecture. He posted pdfs for us to read.
I got this A entirely out of spite towards Konstantin Lurie. Avoid at all costs, or have the TA teach you everything while ignoring all the lectures.
Never again.

It is incredible how confusing he can make simple concepts become. You are better off watching Khan academy or reading the textbook than ever attending his lectures. If you can't self teach this class, then you won't learn anything.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Lurie is smart, however he's very bad at teaching. He'll spend an entire class solving a proof to get to an important formula, but never shows us how to properly use that formula and when. He stands in front of his work constantly for long periods of time and it was clear even the TA had no idea what was going on. Get ready to teach yourself.

Professor Lurie is a very smart guy, but has trouble actually teaching the class. He has a heavy accent and speaks very quietly, making it difficult to understand what he is saying. He also does not seem to understand what the student is asking when they have a question. He doesn't give you any relevant information as to what will be on exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Never have I had a professor call me into his office on one hours notice to insult and berate me about a test score. Never take this class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Very traditional professor uses the board and knows what he's talking about. Unlike other professors, he doesn't really apply his theory to practice. Sometimes, he would introduce a new concept that's not on the syllabus or on the assigned reading. Half the class usually leaves by week 2, because grades are mostly done in conference.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: You will learn more from the textbook than the professor. Professor Lurie reads lessons from a binder verbatim and the lectures are useful only for understanding what will be assessed. His accent makes lectures incomprehensible. Students with misconceptions are belittled if they ask for explanations in class until no questions are asked at all.

If you like someone that's going to talk about math very abstractly, take his class. I didn't go to any classes and got a good grade. If you happen to be stuck with him like I was, go to Stratton Hall math center and have a tutor teach you it. They're way more helpful.

Professor Lurie talks quietly, un-understandably, and doesn't really answer questions. His lectures are very useless. Because half of the grade comes from quizzes that you can bring notes to, it's not hard to do well if you read the textbook and do all the (optional) homework. Beware that his exams are very conceptual, not problem solving so much.
His lectures are confusing but you can tell he is brilliant and knows his stuff. But seriously a lot of people don't bother going to lecture because he can be so confusing.

Lurie uses a lot of theory and concepts that are pretty hard to keep up with and often doesn't do examples or does very little. I ended up taking my own notes from the textbook and teaching myself most of the material. Tests aren't too hard for the most part if you know what you're doing.
A truly respectable man in his field. I had a great time in his class. Lots of theory but that is what is important to know and then you can apply it.

Professor Lurie is a nice guy, but his lectures are always long and meaningless. He never seems to follow his own schedule in the syllabus, and 90% of his lectures are proofs or concepts. However his tests are very easy, they cover half of what you learned if that, and the content is not challenging if you do work outside class. Awful class, easy A
He spends the whole lecture doing proofs on one formula and doesn't explain how too use it. Try your hardest to get any other calc 4 prof.
This professor doesn't know about speak up while asking students to speak up.

He is very dedicated to teaching the material well. He insists you ask in class if you have any questions on the covered topic. Gives good analogies and tricks to remember  tricky material. The Matthews textbook is worth it's price and can be a good reference guide for future related courses.

What I want to say you can only learn by yourself if you take his class because his lecture is in a mess! Fortunately, his tests are not too tough and you can got an A if you can digest almost examples on the textbook. Therefore you can choose his course if you are confident about your self-learning ability.

Avoid taking his class, but if you want to challenge yourself, go on. He goes over proofs and not what's important for his poor tests. Half the class failed his exam and a retake was issued, first time I've ever seen this happen. For office hours, he simply wants you to the exit the way you came in. But if you can be patient, he just might help.
Never translated what that textbook said, just wrote it word for word on the board. Would not recommend. Did a lot of self learning this class.

I would not recommend taking any math class with this professor. The syllabus is clear but his lectures are not. Had to learn most of the material by my self. Did not want to scale any tests. I am sure he has good intentions but comes off as uninterested and hard to understand.

I can see why many people are complaining about this professor but this class is not too bad. He doesn't follow the syllabus well and his tests are horrible. But if u're wise enough, you will pull  of an A in his class without ever going to class. I basically took his class as a challenge and saw what I was capable of without a professor. easy A
HE IS A FOX

Very dedicated professor who provides crystal clear explanations. He will walk you through from start to finish and you will understand the material from a fundamental level.  Highly recommended; if you have a choice between two professors for a course you should choose Lurie.

Prof. Lurie is not a good teacher.  His lectures are all proofs that will do nothing towards your practical understanding of the material. The homework problems he gives are decent, but his exams are far more difficult than anything you've seen in the homework, and there's no partial credit for differentiation or integration errors. Awful class.

Excellent class, but you need to work hard and review undergrad courses to get an A.  I learned a lot of necessary math for the subsequent master's courses.  Prof. Lurie is always available to help. And yes, he gets annoyed w/ stupid questions, and so would I... This is grad level!!

Horrible teacher. Talks down to students. Do not ask questions unless you want to be humiliated for not knowing something. Decided to cut a 10 week class down to 7 and cram everything, had to add extra an class in order to meet his shorter time frame. Just goes over theories and barely any examples. You won't learn anything from him

Prof Lurie really has an interest in his students. If you need help he will be there as often as you are willing to.
