He leaves a lot of time in his schedule to help students in need and he is patient and understanding of the fast pace of the WPI schedule. He genuinely gets that learning upper level math classes in 7 weeks is not easy.
He is the best ever. Know how to teach. Make me work and love math. Thanks a lot. You are the man!!!!!!!!

I loved this class! Professor Lurie was extremely helpful in solving my queries about homework problems. He is extremely dedicated and patient with students!Prof. Lurie deserves the highest rating for this class!Thankyou so much, Professor!

I took class with Prof. Lurie in my very first term in WPI and i learnt a lot from him. I did not have any trouble understanding his teachings. Doing Homework and keeping up with the syllabus REALLY helps. Just attend lectures, pay attention and you will be fine in the class. He wants his students to work and on top of the work,if u do,u cn get an
not good at all

Doesn't follow his syllabus much.  Tests you on material not yet covered in class.  Hard to understand, talks to the board so you can't even hear him most the time. Doesn't explain what he is doing, assumes you know everything, and never goes over the basics, the basic properties you need. Don't take this class, you won't learn much.
Definitely would stay away from him, entire class is always lost.

If anyone has something positive to say about Professor Lurie, good for you, go be a math teacher. Otherwise, whoever reads this, spread the word to EVERYONE at wpi (especially incoming freshmen who don't know any better): DON'T TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS PROFESSOR, HE IS THE WORST EVER.

This is honestly the worst professor i hope i EVER have to encounter at this school. Its not even worth going to class. You can't understand what he is saying, and when you finally can it just doesn't make sense. He teaches everything that you DONT need to know. avoid at ALL COSTS. I wish I had read this before i took his class.

Professor Lurie's time as a professor should be over. The way he speaks, presents himself, and interacts with the students is the worst I have encountered in 4 years at WPI. He would teach the class if no one was there, because he walks in and talks to the board for 3 hours. Avoid taking this course with Lurie at all costs.

lectures are EXTREMELY boring. had 8am class..not fun.. always slept in class... sometimes he yells at u for sleeping... still people sleep... tests are'nt fun..things that you never covered appears on it.. bring 4+ pepper mints from daka with you to entertain your self during class..
Not a fair grader at all. Takes points off without explanation and won't give partial credit.
WORSE PROFESSOR EVER, dont take him. He cant explain. In the last exam we had the class avg. was 49%! HE SUCKS

Wow, I was getting a B all term, then i failed the final and failed the class just because of the final. The average on the final was a 60 (failing).  I talked to him and he wouldnt do anything for me.  Horrible.  Go to conference.

he sucks , he teaches something, asks completely different, grading is fair , since the TA was very good, ,dont go to him for partial credits , he will cut out chunk of your marks,does not help that muchif you go to his office,make it a point to go to his class for review real important .otherwise sleep in class, better dont go, or watch movie.sth.
he is boring, but his exams are fair.
very fair grading system

the most boring teacher i have ever had.  easy to get a grade without learning much (just jot down a cheat sheet the day before the test).  never asks questions to the class, there is NO class participation.  i feel sorry for those who have him.

I have never had a worse math teacher/professor. Ever. He is very hard to pay attention to, and i've had some snoozers before, but this guy takes the cake. But the class was easy, i rarely attended; just learn by the textbook, it's a good text. so yeah he's bad. Thank God for those good looks!

Lectures are hard to follow and he comes across very condesending in class. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS AND CONFERENCE. He is actually a nice guy if you go talk to him. And he will do the homework problems for you. Also, quizzes are very easy - just old homework problems.
dont take his class, if you do, you're doomed, better off reading the book then going to lectures and wasting your time, this teacher is horrible at lecturing

Lurie is an lousy teacher. He sounds like the stereotypical college math professor, all math-formal about everything. He hates examples and helping people, and loves convoluted proofs. Alas, rumors that he was leaving last year were false.
This isn't the USSR, in america we learn by example, proofs =****!
Dude sucks hardcore.....almost hit me in the parking lot in his saab.  He could lecture with no one in the room, and doesn't help you out.

Terrible lecturer, goes straight from the book, monotonous, boring, i didn't go to lecture the last week of the term because i figured i'd learn more by just reading the book...and I did.  P.S. - go to conference!!

For a foreign teacher, his accent is actually very understandable. The material was more advanced and the professor would give out random quizzes, but the questions were old homework questions AND we could use our notes!
Do the work and he will help you out.  If you don't he's pretty ruthless.
Decent professor; the material for the course wasn't too bad, and his explainations of methods were adequate. Tests weren't too bad.
He's NEVER there, even during his office hours!
Jumps right into lecture, sit in front rows or don't bother trying to listen
interestingly enough, i didn't even know what his name was until i got my grades
better understand the material if you're gonna take his course
he was horrible

this guy. he seems to care, but i learned nothing in his lectures.I couldn't understand what he was saying half the time, mostly because he just goes on rambling about random stuff. But assignments were fine, tests weren't too tricky, so that that as you will.

The tests were multiple choice

Homework and discussion is done through MasteringPhysics

in lecture, he goes off on tangents a LOT

The grading scheme is very forgiving

The labs are demanding, frequent, but still engaging and doable

This is not a challenging class to pass but it will require a modest amount of effort.

Professor Kashuri wants you to understand the topics he covers and is always available after class or by email to answer questions and/or concerns. His lectures are sometimes a little hard to follow, and reviewing outside of class will be key.

Professor Kash was great! E&M is tough content wise, but he always tried to make sure everyone understood what was going on in the class through PollEv, and practice problems via Mastering Physics. He also immediately responds to emails and is always extremely helpful during exams, especially with giving partial credit on multiple choice questions.
Prof. Kashuri is good at explaining concepts and the hw assignments/tests are not hard at all if you attend lectures. His accent is sometimes hard to understand but it isn't a huge problem.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Kashuri was an all-around proficient and reasonable teacher. His tests were multiple choice and did not vary far away from topics and examples in lectures and homework. Although tests were definitely not gimme's, his partial credit given was life-saving if you write out your work. Lectures could sometimes be messy and hard follow.
Awesome dude really helpful with many topics. Very knowledgeable professor in physics. I would definitely recommend him!

Professor Kashuri's lectures were tough to follow as they were sporadic and disorganized. Although he did upload the lecture slides, they were unedited versions, which he seldom utilized during the actual lecture. Also, most of my learning occurred through Mastering Physics (subscription required). His exams often used MP questions as well!

Lectures are difficult to get through. He focuses on very unimportant details, and puts little focus on the key concepts of the lecture. If you rely on lectures for learning and aren't comfortable with learning outside of class, avoid this teacher (that was the case for me). Homework isn't bad, and makes a large portion of the grade though.

There was alot of homework but you have 10 tries on every problem. This class uses Pearson so you will need to buy an access code. Professor Kashuri doesn't really have regular office hours set up but he holds a review on zoom the night before every test and is very helpful over email. He truly cares about his students and wants you to do well.

I liked his lectures and I thought he did a good job keeping them engaging even though they were long. He really wanted everyone to pass his class, and on exams he gave partial credit on multiple choice questions. His exams weren't too hard. The homework was hard sometimes, but he gave 10 attempts for each problem (it was on mastering physics).

Professor Kashuri really wants you to pass his class. He is very lenient with grading and does genuinely care about you learning the material. He tries to give as much credit as possible even if you get the majority of the answers wrong. He is slightly difficult to understand but i would highly recommend him he knows his stuff and he really cares

I had Professor Kashuri A term as a freshman and he's been a great professor. He's eager to answer any questions you may have about the material and he really wants you to understand the content and do well in the class. Study the practice exams, stay on top of mastering physics, pay attention to lectures and ask questions and you'll do fine!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I can't say that he gives the clearest explanation of things, but he gives a lot of examples and is very forgiving of mistakes. He mostly just wants to see that you understand the physical properties at play.
Fantastic professor. I missed the homework deadlines a few times and he'd extend them for me of his own accord. Really wants you to do well.

Kashuri is a good guy, physics is hard if you don't have experience coming from highschool. His homework is mastering physics which you have to pay like 70 dollars for, so make sure you get a chegg account and get 100% on the homework. Doesn't speak english very well but is a god in physics, life clearly has balances. Tests were not too difficult.

Professor Kashuri is a good professor, and very accessible through email, so don't hesitate to email him if you're confused about anything. If you have a strong high school physics background you should be good, otherwise you might struggle a little. His accent can get a little difficult to understand at times, but it should not be a huge problem.

He is a little hard to understand sometimes in lectures. Really helpful is asked for help directly (like after class.) Stay on top of mastering physics and it's easy to get 100% on the hw. Exams aren't that bad either. He literally gives you all the equations, just know what you're doing.

Prof. Kashuri did everything he could to make you pass. The tests were based off practice, the online HW had 10 tries (he sent hints often), he dropped the lowest wkst grades, and communicated well with the class. Sometimes the lectures weren't fun, but polls and wksts made it ok. Try to take the class with the S (B01S/B02S) for studio version

Clearly knows what he's talking about and interacts with the class through polls. His lectures are posted online, so the lecture halls as time goes on get less and less. Answers questions clearly though when asked.

This class was so hard to take at 8AM because he spoke in such a monotone, it was so easy to stop paying attention, but going to special office hours before the test saved me and he spent so much time going over problems with us. Homework was on webwork, and the class was heavily curved

I took him in B term 2016. I thought he was very good with the material and the exam/assignments were not too difficult. My only critique is getting used to his accent. If you cannot understand him well the Conferences usually fill in the gaps. Labs were straightforward as well.

Professor Kashuri was a great professor for physics mechanics. He was always accessible, even when I emailed him a few days before the final. He sat down with me and went over all of my questions and was patient and kind. I am thankful for professors like him. He truly wants students to succeed and understand the material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Kashuri's lectures are easy to follow and he goes at a good pace. I also had him as my conference instructor, and he made sure that everyone knew what was happening. Also, if you don't understand something, he is good at explaining it in a different way. My one complaint is that he was not very accessible after class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Hektor is a nice guy really cares about each student. A bit hard to understand as he hails from Albania and has a bit of an accent. However, he teaches what is going to be on the tests and always provides a wealth of practice problems.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lectures can be hard to follow so using the book or rewatching lectures is very helpful. TAs and Conference are also great times to clear things up. His accent can be hard to understand at times so listen carefully but your ears will likely adjust. He especially shines as a conference instructor though. His one on one help is really great.
Prof. Kashuri is a decent professor. His lectures are okay, and the topic is not particularly challenging. Not the more engaging lectures, but the information is provided.
If you put in the work, you will get an A. He gives "practice problems" before every test that are almost identical to the test questions. He can sometimes be hard to understand during lectures.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Almost no real numbers in this course. Pretty much every test was a bunch of questions on what the equations would be for a certain situation which personally i didn't like at all. His notes are scattered and essentially have no use. He teaches his own conferences too which makes it even worse if you're lost in his lectures.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof. Kashuri didn't quite cut it for me. Not the worst professor, but hard to listen to for even a quarter. Class was usually confusing, however my saving grace was that he was my conference professor in which he was much more helpful. Definitely NOT a professor to be avoided, but not an amazing lecturer either.
Average lecturer, but tests are definitely indicative of the practice problems. Curves final grades a lot too, and accessible outside class. Would take again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Caring

comment: He gave  lectures based on the material covered in the textbook. I  liked to read the textbook after his lectures, as it made the material a lot easier to understand.  The conference problems and the practice exam are extremely helpful. The practice exams are, for the most part, similar to the exam. The exam problems are usually more difficult.

Professor Kashuri is extremely generous when he grades exams. However, his Albanian accent is a little hard to understand at first. You will need to get used to it, but he explains the concepts very well and I highly recommend him for physics. He is open during office hours all the time and will accommodate any issues or problems you have.

Professor Kashuri is a straightforward teacher.  The lectures provide the students with clear explanations and practice problems.  The practice problems he gives before exams are very similar to the exam itself and are very useful.  I would recommend taking him.

Great teacher, even better person. Gives clear and through out lectures. The only take away is that his thick accent and that he sometimes let some other professors grade for him, who are by the way terribly tough grader. On the other hand, professor Kashuri is an extremely fair grader but the sad thing is he only sometimes grade the exam himself.
Great Teacher! not always clear, but conferences help with that. gives out formula sheets for test and only has online homework (all already posted so you know when they are due).

I recommend this teacher. Very straightforward in his teaching. He is a little hard to understand but he is very predictable on tests. Gives awesome study guides with clear cut instructions on how to prepare. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN! Very fair and consistent grader.  If you put in the work and do the recommended problems, you will do well!

Completely useless. You're forced to go to lectures because you get extra credit for answering clicker questions, but otherwise all time spent in his class was a complete waste. He reads whats on the slides and leaves, there is no effort put in. Take absolutely anyone else you can; otherwise have fun reading the book this term.

Professor Kashuri is a great Lecturer, He knows the material very good and is there to answer any question you might have. He's a very good grader, exams are just like the material you have covered. He'll give you the day before exam practice problems which are really helpful for the exam, you should take him if you're looking for a good professor

The best Physics Prof.   He knows the subject  very well and how to teach it.  I like that he Uses nowadays  tech.  I take a class to learn and not to make fun. Physics is a tough subject , not a joke. I worked hard, but learned a lot and I got a good grade thanks to him.

Did not enjoy his lectures at all. Spoke softly and with a think accent. Lectures were nowhere near as helpful as conferences, which were vital in passing the course. Wouldn't take another course with this professor if it weren't so easy.

Lectures are a little confusing, but for the most part he's pretty good. He teaches his own conferences.  Go to all of them. As confusing he is in lecture, he is SUPER HELPFUL 1 on 1. Also, he puts practice exams out the week of exams, DO THEM cause they are almost verbatim what's on the actual exams, with worked out solutions for each problem.

In my opinion, he is a great teacher.  He is hard to understand and may look bored while teaching lectures but is willing to help during conference and office hours.  Also, his tests are very fair with the practice material he gives.

Professor Kashuri tries his best to convey all of his ideas as best he can, but is difficult to understand due to his thick accent. With that in mind, if you found his lecture to be confusing and are in need of help, he is much more helpful during his office hours. His post-lecture explanations have saved many confused students' grades.

I definitely did not enjoy this course. I felt as though he did not care about his students. I often times went to office hours to ask questions and he made me feel stupid and left during our meetings to answer cell phone calls. Also, the last exam I didn't finish in the time period and asked for 10 minutes and he would not consider it. Not great
Really nice professor. Very willing to help during office hours. Explains well and you don't have to use the book a lot if you go to his lectures.
Amazing guy. Very helpful and very thorough, both in lectures and office hours.

Very thick accent and vey boring. It's clear he has no interest in teaching. Often rude to students also. Class average on exams fell somewhere around 50%. His only redeeming quality is that he can be quite helpful in office hours.
Accent is unclear but he is more than willing to help students out. The mastering physics online homework is annoying but sometimes helpful.

Take this class! Its the best thing u can do! he is great with grading, he is helpful, and his exams are easy. He is a great guy! He is well organized and knows well the material. he knows how to answer questions!

Took Waves with him. Great accent, don't know where it is from. He made a fair number of mistakes but is friendly in correcting them. He insists that we shouldn't have to memorize anything but can be sort of unclear in the material. Like most intro physics classes, the labs are awful.

I only attended two of his lectures before trying to switch into a different section.  He tends to mumble and his accent is so thick that you can barely understand him. His handwriting is also horrific.  Avoid if possible.
He is a hard working professor and has really deep knowledge of Physics. I took 1140 with him. You have to take notes because the lectures straight from the books are hard to follow.
I really liked him.Well organized and very clear explanations of the concepts.No confusion during the lecture. Always available to help.
very good professor.He really knows the subject and he is after the concepts.Highly recomended

Overall good conference instructor. His explanations were sometimes a bit unclear, both due to accent and simple non-clarity of explanation, but he was very eager to help students out. His lecturing style left something to be desired, however. Fair grader.

While not a bad professor, he is prone to mistakes when trying to explain E&M concepts. Also explained to the conference all about the mysterious "Weston Bridge". What he meant to say was "Wheatstone Bridge". Pretty easy grader, and willing to help when asked.

If you're dependent on lectures to help you understand material, don't take his class.  Spent 5 hours a night in his class and I could never find him for office hours.  If he's the Lecture AND Conference professor, you will be lost.
A great TA, sometimes his thick accent makes him hard to understand, but he still manages to always get his point across and makes sure we understand
Doesn't use numbers and he can be difficult to understand, but if you ask for help in conference you always receive it and he really knows physics.
Doesn't use numbers, hard to understand and follow at times. Good with partial credit on exams.
he knows his stuff and cares about student learning
no complaints
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: very knowledgable and teaches well
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: great lectures - you have to hard work

He is a great person but never responds to emails. If you are not good with chemistry do not take his class, it is nearly impossible to figure out just from his lectures alone. Makhlouf's homework will take a while, do not put them off till the last day. He does not give review guides, practice exams, or exam helpers besides the one equation sheet.

You will like him until you take your first test, lectures are very interesting and informative. 

The tests, good luck, very little time (50mins) for a test on 1/3 of the information in the class, test questions are often quite different than any practice. Grades super unfairly giving very little partial credit if any. You will THINK its easy
You will like him until you take your first test, lectures are very interesting and informative. Homework does take a good am

Great guy and a pretty good professor.  Be careful with exams, as they are worth a large amount of your grade, and its difficult to recover if you do poorly even once.  There were more NR's than A's.  GO TO LECTURES

Horrible professor. It feels like he's more teaching for the paycheck than trying to help us learn. Loads of homework that don't relate to his lectures. Tests are based on the examples that we did the least of in lectures. We are never taught HOW to do the problems. Many of the formulas he says we'll have aren't given because they are "basic math".

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. HOMEWORK IS IMPOSSIBLE AND TESTS ARE JUST AS HARD. BARELY COVERS MATERIAL THAT IS NEEDED FOR THE HOMEWORK. TELLS YOU TO READ THE TEXTBOOK BUT IT IS USELESS. DROP IT WHILE YOU CAN.
maybe the best in this material. very knowledgeable ... likes you to ask questions
will work you very very hard, but you will learn a lot - I appreciate that
you will learn a lot from Prof Mac ...
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: great guy - best lecturer .. tough, but fair

Terrible professor, terrible guy. AVOID at all costs. Actually thinks he the best when every normal student hates him. Homework takes forever and does not help in any way for the tests which are on concepts you have never heard of. Laughs at bad ratings and claims select students ruin it. On top of all this, he is the most strict professor at WPI.
nice guy. explains well
i learned much from him. he is very knowledgasble
Very knowledgable .... you will learn a lot but be prepared top work hard
Excellent teacher but you have to work hard

Prof. Mak's biggest flaw is "laying out" everything very clearly at the start of the course. He takes this as an excuse to be a subpar professor, hardly going over content in lecture that is relevant to the exams. The exams themselves: an amalgamation of trivial information that was mentioned once, off-handedly, and problems not covered in lecture.

Asides from being a nice guy, Makhlouf was one of the worst professors I have ever had. In his lectures, he moves way too fast and doesn't explain examples. He also does not post lecture notes, making it nearly impossible to study and take in any information missed in class. Homework assignments are extremely tedious, and tests are graded strictly.

Fun lecturer. Nice guy. Can hardly see, and doesnt explain the examples he goes over in class. The examples are useless for the sheer amount of homework he assigns. The ppts are not uploaded in canvas (or any alternate website) so that you can look at them later.
clear explanations that help you understand difficult concepts

comment: best prof. I had at wpi
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: i learned a lot from him
amazing lecturer
Very clear .. and I learned a lot

Professor Makhlouf is the most inflexible and strict teacher at WPI. His lectures really only scratch the surface of the knowledge required to do well on exams and homework, which are graded harshly and have unnecessarily broad requirements. Absolutely avoid him at all costs unless you want to do twice the work for half the grade.
the best if you want to learn ..

comment: Assigned way too much homework. Was an insane grader. Much of the material was lightly covered in class, making homework very difficult.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He knows a lot and class is interesting, but you have to memorize the details. I learned a ton, but it's hard to do well in his class. He covers how things are made and why. He overemphasizes metal casting because it's his specialty. Get ready to memorize machine diagrams and cost graphs. Don't expect feedback on tests. No late HW. Hardest B ever.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Literally the best professor I have had at WPI. His tests are super hard, the average on ours was around 65-70. That being said, he is very fair, he lets you know exactly what his expectations are, and the material that is on the tests is always stuff that has been covered either in class or in the reading.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Excellent professor, really enjoyed his class. His knowledge on the material is second to none. Highly recommend Professor Mak
one of the best, if not the best if you want to learn, he's the one to take.
Those who can get an A in Prof. Makhlouf's course are real good students who work hard.

Absolute worst professor I have had at WPI thus far. 80% of the grade is based on your midterm and final, which he bases off of a large chunk of material that he says is all fair game. Its all memorization and not learning. He also lectures off of slides that he will not post. He doesn't even use Blackboard. AVOID HIM IF YOU CAN.
Everything he taught in the class is actually useless for exam. He likes to knock down the good students.

Excellent. If I could take every class with him I would. Explanations are concise and clear, and follow a very precise flow that makes perfect sense. Exams are hard but he is very upfront about that (know all derivations, just like he says, e.g.). Be confident, try hard and he will respect you; if you disagree with a grade talk to him.

Useless at teaching anything. Reads his own PPT slides word for word, and does not explain what point he is trying to make. Gave material that was a copy of a copy, and useless to the class all together. Would not help even when asked. Did not care if you understood or not. If he answered a question, it was with an answer that meant nothing.

Gives good lectures, but grades on tests and homeworks are impossible, partial credit does not exist. seems to enjoy failing his undergrads, and is not very helpful if you go to his one office hour a week. Most tests are not designed to be finished in an hour.
Excellent lectures but requires a lot of studying

Do NOT take a course with this professor.  I am a senior with a minor in Materials and still found his exams comically unfair and graded as harshly as possible.  He knows and explains material very well... however, because of the the personal satisfaction he seems to gain from failing good students, I would advise to NEVER take a course with him.
great

This guy really knows his stuff. He is always extremely clear on what he teaches you. You better pay attention because he only teaches from transparancies and PP slides. You might get carpal tunnel from furiously copying down notes. If you are interested in the subject matter he will definitely help you out. Exams were reasonable assuming you study

He wasn't very thorough in teaching the material. Constantly told us to read the book, but the book is pretty useless. Wasn't clear about what was gonna be on the tests. Very arrogant. Seemed proud of the large number of NRs. Should have been a managable course. He made it a hassle. Tests were very hard to study for and harshly graded.

By far the worst teacher I have ever had at WPI/ever. He doesn't have office hours, is disrespectful to the students, and prides himself on failing half the class. If you're in it-just get out now. He will make your life .

If you value your sanity and/or gpa avoid es2001 with Makhlouf.  Throughout the entire course I have seen perhaps one example done out for me.  Homeworks are the first time much of the material is seen, and is simply graded wrong or right, giving no indication as to how to how to properly solve it.  Tests involve materials not even covered in HW...

Probably the worst teacher I've had so far. Despite it being an easy subject, he makes his tests difficult by requiring extensive memorization. He lectures almost straight form the book, making class a waste of time. He assigns a lot of work and doesn't go over most of it till the after the homework is due. Doesn't have study help sessions.

Probably the worst teacher I've had so far. Despite it being an easy subject, he makes his tests difficult by requiring extensive memorization. He lectures almost straight form the book, making class a waste of time. He assigns a lot of work and doesn't go over most of it till the after the homework is due. Doesn't have study help sessions.

This class wasn't the easiest in the world, most people had trouble on the first test, except for me. However I had just finished Chem 1020, so all the stuff with finding the density of BCC etc came easy to me. The other tests seemed to be fairly easy comparatively. Most problems on the test were fairly similar to the HW problems and practice exam.
BEWARE: He will destroy you like an academic ninja.

He is a good teacher but it is true that he expects half the class to NR. His tests are not hard...but he is a VERY VERY tough grader.  Either you get it all or ZERO.  My first test CLASS AVG was 53%....AVOID HIM IF AT ALL POSSIBLE!!!!
Excellent lecturer, but requires extensive memorization for exams (no notes allowed).  Quite possibly the most difficult professor I've encountered in 5 years at WPI.
Great lectures, but impossible exams.  You can do really well if you work hard in this class.  He is great about helping students outside the classroom.
Tie at the top of the list for worst teachers at WPI.  The WHOLE class did poorly and he blamed it on us. (In case you're wondering, he ties herman servatius for worst teacher at wpi)

Alright teacher, but he expects half the class to NR. Tests are straightforward, but his grading is very harsh. The CLASS average on my last test was 54% and he blamed the students for not studying hard enough. One of the worst classes Ive taken so far.

Gives a lot of homework, make sure you do this early and often. If you keep up with it and attend class you should have no problem passing. He really tries to let everyone pass. The final was homework problems with the same exact numbers.
Expects a lot from you, but teaches well
Too technical and makes to memorize everything
Lectures ok, but tests are difficult, and he expects you to memorize everything.

Prof. Blais is an excellent instructor who understands his students. His HW reinforces key concepts, and he explains clearly. Midterm and final weren't easy, but questions closely matched practice materials, which helped. Overall, he cares about student learning and provides a well-structured course.

Terrible professor. Would not recommend. Grading systems makes zero sense. Lectures are not fun. Brings a ball that lights up to class as examples. (???) Goes over one example per week and so much theorem or talking. Barely any examples. Pre written and answered examples. Doesn't do it in class together with the students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Outstanding professor. Outstanding class.

All the other reviews are accurate. Probably the best calc professor I've had at WPI. He uses webworks and has a million office hours with himself and the TA's so someone's always accessible outside of class. He doesn't overcomplicate topics and his exams are very similar to his practice exams. As long as you do the homework, you will be fine.
The GOAT of calc professors absolutely take him if you can

This professor made calculus 3 so easy. He makes the material very easy to understand and explains their all the materials use cases, so you internalize the concepts. By far one of my favorite math professors/professors of all time; you should definitely take him for any course that you can.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Blais is great! The homework really helps you understand the subject. His tests are very accurate to what is on the homework. His lectures are engaging and he always has a funny story to tell.

Prof Blais is the best professor I have had at WPI. He has engaging lectures, homework that is harder than the exams, and is overall very funny. He makes pop culture references and wants students to understand the material rather than just regurgitating formulas. I wish I went to some of his office hours to get to know him a bit better. Great Prof!
Probably the best Calc Professor I had at WPI. Very clear on grading and gave moderate homework. Exams were not too bad.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Blais has an amazing understanding of calculus and is great at teaching it. The class was hard but Professor Blais made the content easy to understand with thorough and engaging lectures. Homework was intentionally hard so exams felt easy. The material for the entire term is posted, making  it easy to get ahead.

Professor Blais was great. Even though class was hard, he made the content understandable. The homework was harder than exams which made exams seem easy. All the material for the term was on canvas, so it was easy to get ahead, though definitely go to class as he's very engaging and thorough. Additionally he stimulated my interest in mathematics.

MA 1023 was a breeze with Blais compared to what it was hyped up to be! He broke-down complicated concepts by connecting them to applications, making the content enjoyable! The only tricky part (content wise) was Taylor Series. Also offered many Office Hours every week, made videos on all topics, and even offered 2 extra WWs which boosted my grade!
He was an amazing teacher that made the boring parts of calc 3 more fun and understandable and interesting. I would 100% take him again

Linear programming was pretty easy with Professor Blais. He's great at helping you understand the concepts which is what matters because the techniques are just row operations. Lectures are all you need for the homework and the homework is enough studying for the exams. None of the proofs he'll ask you to do are that tricky and his projects are fun

I took this course during the E Term (Summer Course) and words cannot describe how much I loved having Professor Blais as a teacher. He is truly caring and understands everyone as a student. His strategy is very efficient. I am not a math person but I enjoyed his course because every lecture is straight to the point and a helpful resource.

Best math professor I've had so far. Difficult class, but Professor Blais made the topics clear and understandable. A decent amount of homework each week, but nothing unnecessary. You'll definitely want to participate in office hours as he's great at answering questions one-on-one.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: His lectures are very polished and you can tell he has been teaching this class for a long time. Definitely the hardest of the calculus courses in my opinion, but he has lots of office hours and cares about helping his students. I did not do well on the two midterms, but he let me and anyone who wanted to retake them because of COVID.

Blais ("Blaze") is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He is extremely flexible with due dates and will give out extensions, no questions asked. Most of the homework is pretty short. If you're stuck on a problem, he will fully do it out in office hours. Overall, he made a tough course not so bad. 11/10

Prof Blais is the best teacher I have ever had. Everyone in my Calc 3 lecture agreed that he is among the best professors we've ever had. He explains things in such a clear way and is great if you are a visual learner. He really cares about his students and it comes through. For difficult material, it really made sense coming from him. Super nice!

Professor Blais one of the best MA1023 professors, considering what I have heard about other professors. His lectures are mostly easy to follow and he does a great job explaining concepts and enforcing them with multiple examples. There is quite a bit of homework though, and he tends to take large amounts of points off for small mistakes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Very chill and personable. Gives quite a bit of homework online, but nothing you can't manage. The class was very organized and the criteria was clear.

A gentleman and a sweetheart. Very good at explaining concepts and gives lots of examples to help you understand better. Explains how calculus is used in real life (economics, cars, engineering) and keeps class interesting.

Before I had Prof. Blais I had very little love for calculus - he completely changed my mind after this course. He is extremely accessible outside of class and goes out of his way to make sure you understand the material. 100% recommend him as a professor if you get the chance to learn from him!

Best professor I've had so far at WPI. Really cares about students, and his lectures are really good. If you're having trouble in the class attend office hours, he's super helpful and will go over specific concepts you're having trouble with. Overall a fantastic professor and fair grader.
Very captivating lecturer. Got messages across very well. Good after class with working with students and helping realize mistakes.
Professor Blais is by far the best math instructor I have ever had. He knows exactly what he's talking about, and always makes sure to convey the information in the best possible manner.

One of the best professors I've ever had, really nice guy. Explains things extremely well during lectures and give plenty of different examples. Always answers your questions and give practice exams that are very simular to the real exams. Would definitely take a class with him again.

Amazing Calc4 Professor, uses the classroom space to help students visualize what is going on with all the Multi-variable stuff. Stops his class until all questions are asked. Makes a big lecture environment fell like small one. Always helpful and enthusiastic about students learning math and being curious to dive deeper into it. Not hard A overall

Gives great lectures. Very good at explaining concepts so that students understand. Great at answering questions. Two tests, midterm and final. However they are very easy and only focus on basic concepts.

I would say Prof Blais is overall the best Prof I knew these years. Not only did he give great classes and inspirational projects, but he's also accessible out side the class which will give you career mentor and answer most of your questions. He's good at the finance/programming/maths knowledge, teaching and communication! Perfect!

He is a pretty chill professor. I ate food in class all the time, and he just didn't care. Also, he is very clear with his explanations and gives good examples, so students can understand the material. In addition, he knows a lot of the students by name, which is pretty cool. There's a bit of homework, but it's not bad if you pay attention in class
He is awesome. he explains everything clearly and I loved his lectures. he is always trying to help you out and answers every question clearly! you should definitely take his classes!!

Worst professor I've ever had. Weekly homeworks, webworks, weekly quizzes and mandatory attendance. It was a very easy course but he made it unnecessarily hard that it was ridiculous. This guy gave me the worst experience when I was a freshman. Never letting him teach me anything again.

Great professor. Really clear explanations and is incredibly helpful during office hours. The class has homework every night, but they're small assignments and they really help with understanding the material. Highly recommend.

Great professor and teacher. He makes hard material easy to understand. Talk with passion and good examples--never bored. He also do research on students major and background before teaching. Take his class, you'll love math more!!!!!!
Very good
Great teacher. Recommended for any class.
Awesome Professor! Very lucky to have him

Explains material well. Provides several examples to make sure students understand new material. Homework was somewhat frequent, but enough to create a good understanding of the topics. His practice midterms and finals are extremely useful. Going to his office hours help you understand how to solve particularly tough problems. Would recommend him.
By far my favorite professor at WPI. He gives great lecture notes, is willing to meet and help with homework, and all assignments are useful and fair.

Awesome teacher. Really care about students and explains all work very well. Most test were easy and extremely fair. Final is a bit more difficult though but would recommend this teacher t anyone who can take him.
Such a great teacher! I would recommend him to anyone. He explains concepts incredibly well and does so many great examples. Definitely take him class
He is an awesome teacher. I am awful at calc but had an easy time doing well in this class. Tests are extremely fair and he thoroughly prepares you for them. Webwork and Homework is an easy A.

He is the best calc professor I have ever had! He really cares about his students and wants us to do well. He gives extra credit quizzes sometimes, and while the exams are difficult it's manageable if you go to class! He teaches theory first and then many examples, and he is very clear about explaining what he did and why! I totally recommend him!

Marcel was an amazing professor. The way he explained things were easy for me to grasp and understand, and when I didn't understand, he was available to explain it to me in greater depth. The only downside to having him was that all of the other Calc teachers I've had pale in comparison.
I LOVED MARCEL! Bt far the best professor I have ever had. He teaches through examples that are always really clear. His material is understandable and I wish he would teach Calc 3 and 4 this year.
Took calc 1 and 2 with him. Very clear, one of the best professors I've had
Great Professor very clear, but had very difficult tests
AWESOME PROFESSOR!

Professor Blais is great. His explanations are easy to understand and his tests are very fair.  Going to class isn't a chore, and he is a good guy.  From all of the teachers that i've had all throughout freshman year, he has been the best in terms of clarity, benefit from going to class, and grading policy.

One of the best lecturers at WPI and one of the best professors I've had the pleasure of interacting with. He keeps the class laid back but interesting, and the rapid pace keeps things interesting. Excellent outside of class hours as well.
No Comments

Mr. Blais was the best teacher I've had to far at WPI. He speaks ENGLISH! VERY WELL IN FACT! But besides his clarity in speaking english, his clarity in the subject matter is also superb. He also will help you whenever you need it, and answers every and all questions during class. He'll stay after class and help you. He's also very funny ;)

I was really impressed with this professor.  He is VERY clear with his explanations, and he goes out of his way to teach things that are useful (e.g. he introduced us to differential equations in calc 1, which saved my ass in physics).  He definitely stimulated my interest in calculus, and his tests are also challenging but managable.

Excellent teacher, follows along with the textbook almost word for word. He does many great examples in class but leaves some of the hardest problems for the test. He taught me so well in class that I did not need to go to office hours at all. He's very organized and an excellent teacher overall. I recommend for all students!
he's really good but he goes fast - don't miss class cause sometimes he does stuff out of different textbooks. his tests are hard but he scales them so its ok
the material is taught rather fast, but that is because of the 7 weeks. He is excellent help during office hours. I strongly advice going to them if you feel lost or behind...
Goes quickly with material in class and it's easy to get lost/behind. However, he's extremely helpful in conference. Go to his office hours.
i didn't learn very much in his class...but that also might be due to the fact that it was an 8 am
Had him the first term he taught, learned nothing, just read what was from the book which doesnt help at all

Prof Heilman is great, lectures are understandable and engaging. Lots of textbook reading to reinforce concepts and go in-depth with case studies. Grade is mostly exams with a term-long group project. Only complaint is lack of materials for students to catch up on lecture if they have to miss (review videos only posted at end of week, no Echo).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Test heavy, hard exams, if you don't do well on every exam you just will not pass

His lectures cover in depth material yet he makes them easy to understand and engaging, very knowledgeable and teaches well, his lectures are also quite funny. The content was hard but very rewarding to learn, really feel like I learned a lot in this class. Also very kind and easy to talk to outside of class.

Prof. Heilman was fine so long as you were doing well and didn't need extra help in the class. I ended up NRing the class my first time through and went to him for help many times outside of class but was told that I had no chances of bringing my grade up, he even went so far as telling me to not attend the final exam.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Easily the best professor I've had, his lectures are simultaneously hilarious and so, so detailed. His analogies are super helpful in understanding complex processes, and he describes things very well. Outside of class, he is very down to earth and easy to talk to and ask for help. One of the few teachers that made me wish classes lasted longer.

Nice guy, no doubt. But his flipped classroom method does not work in a class like this one. In person lectures are necessary for most to learn, and he would just make us watch lecture videos on our own time. Recitations were not helpful at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Heilman is an amazing person and professor. His lectures are engaging, informative, and applicable, and he's refreshingly honest. Half of his lecture introducing the pH system was spent complaining about the pH system. Tests weren't easy, and he doesn't curve but does adjust grade cutoffs. Overall, would 10/10 take him again.
Awesome professor. He definitely makes you work for a good grade, but you will certainly learn a lot from his class.

He is a great professor overall. Super nice guy and really cares about helping his students succeed. If you are struggling with the class I would definitely recommend office hours. He helped me bring my grades up to A's after I failed the first exam.

Heilman, as I said in my course report is a God-Tier Professor. He makes a hard class, easy, fun, and interesting. I learn more from his classes than all the other classes I take in a year combined. He just has that Professor touch... he cares enough about students and enough about the subject to make it amazing!
WPI's very own older, wiser Hank Green. But no videos, so go to his lectures! It is important to read the book beforehand and take notes so you can follow along in class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He was awesome. His class is so hard, and you need to be very, very specific and 100% correct to get credit for things, but he's awesome. His lectures are fun to go to, and his examples are so crazy that you can understand (and remember) complex processes.
Professor Heilman is incredibly inspirational and has high expectations for his students

He doesn't do Echo 360. So although attendance isn't mandatory GO TO LECTURE! Exams are pretty tough, at least for someone who doesn't have a huge bio background and mainly a chemistry background. Average exam scores are mid 70s if that says anything. Read the text, do the practice problems, ask for help! Listen to the little details.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Very good at giving explanations for tough material. Was clearly enthusiastic about the subject material. The lectures were engaging and interesting.

Prof Heilman made difficult and complicated Biochem material exciting and easier to understand (but not easy by any means). Group project was not too much work and was a good grade booster. 3 tests+project is all you get for grades. Overall one of the best professors Ive had, feel like Ive learned a lot.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Heilman is an excellent professor who will stimulate your interest in biochemistry. The class is tough and I previously almost failed a prior course I had with him, but he has a vested interest in helping you succeed and understand complex materials. You will do alot of studying but end up better as a result.

His exams are really difficult unless you know the material inside and out. He doesn't test on whether you know things just in terms of memorization, but really and truly understand the material. He is a busy man; however, super willing to help you outside of class and even outside office hours if you need it, and he does offer extra credit.
Never thought keg parties, pizza, and tennis ball analogies would be the reason I understand enzyme kinetics and allosteric inhibition! Amazing lectures.

Literally THE best professor at WPI. He is so down to earth, and really understands what its like to be juggling classes and college life. He is always crystal clear on what will be on exams, mostly lecture material based, and makes learning easy with understandable analogies for complex concepts. Everyone should take at least one class with him!!!
Pushes you hard to understand the underlying concepts rather then just how to use the equations.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very passionate about chemistry, and good at teaching subject. Do not take him for the lab portion though, as he is an extremely hard grader. Exams are moderately hard, but very long.

Highly recommend any other professor for chem 3, he is extremely unorganized and an EXTREMELY hard grader. I probably spent on average 20+ hours a week on this class teaching myself the material that he NEVER went over in class. Don't waste your time going to office hours either he goes off on random tangents that have nothing to do with anything.

Sure, his class is not easy. But you can still ace it if you know how to do it (he does curves and counts partial credits so dont worry): 1/ Read textbook before going to class 2/Address any issues with understanding after class 3/Ask him on how to work better in class (he will show it to you). note: CH1030 is one of the hardest, so be prepared

His class is way to much work. He refuses to teach the material on the tests in class. It's extremely hard, if you want to have any free time do not take this class. He refuses to teach the calculations aspect of chem 3 when literally very question on the test is calculations. Not a good teacher, nice guy but you will end up teaching yourself.

Great professor. He loves chem and explains chem concepts well. You have to go to class because he doesn't put his notes online. He expects you to read the textbook and be familiar with the material before class. Tests aren't that hard but they're super stressful because there isn't enough time to finish them. He's always avail for office hours.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof Heilman is awesome! He makes lectures so entertaining, you actually want to go. He really wants to make sure you understand the material and you're not just studying to pass the test. He's soo helpful and so in love with chemistry. DEFINITELY take his class. His tests are half conceptual (not totally), so you have to understand to get an A

One of the best professors in the chem department. You must attend class to do well because he doesn't post notes. Concepts are tough but he gives great explanations and great analogies. His tests are tough, but he is very helpful in office hours to prepare students.

Prof Heilman is a very good professor until it comes to the first test. and the rest. The chemistry department is anal about how they make their tests and they are set up in a way that if you do not have a solid background in chem prior to coming to college you will not do well. The tests are difficult and questions are not weighted proportional.

He doesn't teach anything in a standard way, no outside resources will help you so you must pay attention in class and be able to take good notes. does not use the board effectively and likes to just talk so you must learn to be an auditory learner and note taker to do well. projects are graded easily and don't take too much time, an 85 is an A

One of my favorite teachers at this school so far. Makes lectures fun, interesting and worthwhile to attend. Three tests, and 3 parts to one group project. He assigns the groups, but does it very well and plays to everyones strengths/ weaknesses.

Prof. Heilman is without a doubt the best professor I've ever had. He knows biochemistry inside and out and has unbelievable communication skills. He's also got a great sense of humor and just does a fantastic job. I cannot speak highly enough of him.

Professor Heilman is awesome! His lectures are so interesting, and he really makes you understand chemistry. The topics in 1030 are challenging, but he does a fantastic job explaining everything. Take this class with him if you can!

He was is definitely one of my favorite teachers here at WPI. He is very interested in teaching to students and is very smart in his subject area. He really encourages out of class contact with him and is almost always free and willing to help. The tests are  of average difficulty where most people get around an 80 Would highly recommend taking him

Best professor here at WPI by far. Knows his material to a tee and makes the best analogies to engage his class. Always available, very easy to talk to, and also extremely knowledgeable in terms of premed stuff! Highly Recommended!!!

Best professor ever! Uses hilarious metaphors to keep you entertained and extremely helpful outside of the classroom. Exams are difficult but would never consider taking the class with a different professor. Definately top at WPI
Genuinely interested in chemistry.  Gives awesome lectures that are interesting and actually make sense.  I was sad to have the class end!
Amazing professor! Definitely top in WPI

Had Professor Heilman for CH1030 and Biochemistry 1 and 3 as well as MQP. Easily one of the top professors at WPI. He will give additional help to anyone that asks and has a clear and enjoyable teaching method. Extremely helpful as an MQP advisor and highly knowledgeable.
Really amazing teacher. Best metaphors I have ever heard, really enthusiastic and extremely willing to help out in any way! Literally the best teacher i have had at WPI thus far
Fantastic teacher. Extremely willing to work outside of class. Gives partial credit, very fair. Makes you want to learn the material. Very energetic. BEST TEACHER EVER!!
Best teacher still at WPI.
Best professor at WPI.  Take any class he teaches, and be prepared to pay attention and learn everything you've ever wanted to know.
This is probably the best professor I have ever had.  The old remarks seem to be from whatever school he used to teach at and they did not seem to have the WPI work ethic or a basic understanding!

I took him for biochem I and III and he is by far the best teacher i have ever had. He is always clear, very organized, and i am always dissapointed when his class ends. Always willing to help and extremely knowledgeable. I recommend him for any class he is teaching!
He's like an extremely knowlegeble teddy bear
Professor Heilman was the best MQP advisor ever!  Not only was he extremely helpful but also very knowledgeable!  I recommend him very highly for any course or project. You won't make a mistake here!

It's easy to crap on a teach because you're an ME major stuck taking Chem I. That's not his fault. Destin is extremely approachable, clear, and administers fair exams. Notice how no one has complained about the biochemistry series? You have to want to be there to get anything out of it.

One of the best profs I had during my 4 years at WPI. Always helpful, patient and has a great sense of humor. Lectures quickly but clearly, and is always willing to clarify if asked. Encourages students to show up at his office and answers all questions. Always present and hands-on helpful in the lab (which is really important). Highly recommended!
One of the best at WPI!
Really great teacher, he's young so he still wants to save the world. The fact that he's really hot doesn't hurt either. :)
Great teacher, helpful, nice hates windows PCs

Ive read the other comments and completely disagree. Professor Heilman is arguably one of the best teachers this institution has to offer. His lectures are lucid and he is always willing to help you understand a concept no matter how long it takes him. Taking any class he offers is sure to improve your knowledge of biochemistry.

Really nice guy, lectures occasionally confusing, but he would clarify things for you easily after class. Also, he was always willing to listen to you argue for more points on your test or project. The fact that he's really cute doesn't hurt either. :)
Not a good teacher...doesn't seem to know the material himself....much less how to teach it to others.
No Comments

This is the first course he is ever teaching, so he is probably learning too ;) He is nice enough though, and always willing to help. He collects HW regularly and checks the lab notebook. He is in the lab basically all the time and answers all questions.

Prob the worst teacher here at AC. Moves at an extremely rapid pace and isnt easy to understand.  If you do not have an extensive medical backround or arent planning on studying for this course every minute you are awake, do yourself a favor and dont take him.
Isn't to clear in class yet so cute.  He is always there for extra help and if you take good notes and don't mind studing you can get through the class.

Horrible teacher.  Confusing. Doesnt explain the complex things that are necessary to understand the material fully.  Expects you to live and breathe science; of course if you want to pass, you'll have to do this.  Doesnt "give away" whats on the tests. Do urself a favor and dont sign up.

The one memorable prof from my time at WPI. He defends ideas you won't hear anywhere else at WPI. If you don't get to know him, your experience will be poorer for not having done so. He doesn't pander to students, which is probably why he has some negative reviews, but when it comes down to it, he's fair and humane and very decent.

A very honest and open-minded professor; and, contrary to other comments here, very open to opposing views if they're well-defended. Most of his views are quite well-defended philosophically, and most opposing views I've heard students blurt out in class aren't - he's critical of poor intellectual rigor, not opposing ideas.

They are honestly one of my favorite professors, with their classes being great. I took a 2711 and a 3711 with him which were a lot of fun and really interesting. There is a good bit of reading in their classes, but it's not that bad, especially if you listen to them with an auto reader. The writing can be rough if you don't like writing though.

John is a professor who is serious when it comes to ethics or philosophy concept in general. He is not into technology, and he forces everyone to print out all the materials (~300 - 400 pages per entire term). That being said, he is not that old school when it comes to teaching. He is just funny. The lecture is good.

He was fine, got the job done. Learned a good amount but that came at a price, both literally because he makes you print out all the articles you read (like $20 of paper by the end of the term), and metaphorically since the class took up so much time. He rips your essays apart and you end up writing like 13 pages in the term. Tough guy, okay class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Unreasonable amount of reading and writing for an introductory philosophy class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: One of the worst professors i've had at WPI. He does not teach clearly and gives a lot of homework, he doesn't take into account others opinions and doesn't care about his students and their success. If you are a freshman coming to WPI I suggest avoiding this professor if you want rethink coming here.

I have taken courses across all majors and found that this one was the most difficult to cope up with. This was because the professor was really a very tough person to deal with. His instructions are not clear and all assignments seem to be open-ended while they are not in reality. If you are interested in philosophy please don't pursue this prof.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Never understands the situation of student what he/she is going through. Thinks that students are taking only his course. Very difficult grading for papers. After 2 days I felt lost in the class. Thinks he is a great philosopher (which he is clearly not). According to 1000 level course, far way too difficult, avoid at any cost.

This class was brilliant, it really makes you confront society and figure out what you want to stand for. The professor is hilarious, relatable, and still incredibly educational. We only had 3 short papers the entire class and he was very much more impressed by effort than professionality. Just try to learn and open your mind and you'll do great!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: He's the worst person I've ever encountered. He is a preachy vegan and if you don't agree with his belief system you are wrong and will not be taken seriously by him. He definitely grades with a bias based on whether or not you share his beliefs, and he is rude and condescending to other students.

I really enjoyed Professor Sanbonmatsu's lectures. He made the lectures engaging and is very thought provoking. The only thing that bothered me about the class was the grading because the syllabus specified not to say what the professor wants to hear, but if you don't then you don't get a good grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Best professor at WPI by far. Makes idiot tech students think critically for once. Really makes you wonder if this is all worth it. Honestly an inspirational person, a visionary of sorts.

Great professor who is passionate about the subject and teaching. He is always willing to help students truly understand the material. Subject will change your life and make you think about your actions. Lots of reading material and a tough grader on essays. One of (if not) the best class I have taken so far.

I had heard horror stories about this guy, not even from my most conservative friends, but was pleasantly surprised. I really enjoyed his film choices, and though it was fairly demanding compared to friends' capstones, I would take the course again. I still hold some of these films close to my heart.

John can be described as a more liberal thinker. Therefore, you may have a bit of a rougher time if you are conservative in your stance. There is a ton of reading for this class, way too much in my opinion. He is a tough grader when it comes to the essays but he gives good feedback. Overall, he is awesome and helps you think outside the box.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Want to be even the slightest amount of conservative? Good luck being immediately disliked by this man. All I've learned from this man is that liberals are just as close minded as conservatives, in their own ways. His class influenced my change in major and minute influence on my change of school. The philosophy course is a waste of time.
He is a great professor. Very clear and very passionate. I would take this class again in a heart beat. Maybe next time I'll actually pass :/

I am really fortunate to have  prof. Sanbonmatsu in our university. He is not just a teacher of philosophy but a philosopher himself. Also an animal activist. The combination of the two are interesting to me. Just setting on the class and listening and expanding you mind are worthy reasons to take the class.
Excellent professor. Not too hard on the readings, but lots of optional material for those interested. Definitely a deeper investigation than I expected, and well worth the time/effort.
I once thought philosophy is boring, but when I take Intro to Philosophy with him, I changed my mind !

Sanbonmatsu is an excellent professor and WPI is fortunate to have him. He is very passionate about teaching and truly cares about the students. If you are interested in philosophy, you can learn A LOT from his classes if you apply yourself.  His classes are very reading and writing intensive though, so be prepared to work hard.

Superb professor. He teaches profoundly, but quietly, managing to cover a broad spectrum of topics with enthusiasm while staying reasonably evenhanded with each. My only objection is that on the topic of animal rights he gets a little conceited, even when citing objective facts, though this is probably since he's extensively studied the topic.

Interesting class.  But, professor doesn't like computer games.  Why he is teaching the class, I have no idea.  He doesn't change his mind either.  He's very stubborn. If you disagree with him, you're wrong.

Nice guy. You will do great if your a liberal, socialist, feminist, vegan hippie female. Otherwise, you will be miserable, and will be force fed all of the above.  Almost impossible to get an A, EFFORT MEANS NOTHING. You will learn why they killed socrates.

Absolutely amazing professor.  I recommend this course, Philosophy & Ethics of Games, to anyone who is able to think philosophically and wants to better understand technology and its uses.  Your mind needs to be completely open in his course, because you will learn and be changed for the better.

had sanbonmatsu for intro to ethics. hated the class, worst professor ive had so far. has little tolerance for viewpoints other than his; grades you based on your ideas and not on the effort you put in. at one point we discussed vegetarianism and he told me in front of the class that b/c i eat meat i might as well eat my cat.avoid him as a prof.
Makes most topics interesting even though the reading is often dry..... Funny

great teacher  and good book selection  requires alot of reading and essays    not very clear on prompts (But its philosophy)   he says if u miss 3 or more days u nr the class but i missed about 25 days and still got a C   has good discussions but he seems to have a biased oppinion on most subjects even tho he tries not to express it   lectures

Amazing class! I took phil/ethics of video games and that class changed my life. It opens your eyes to so many things about the world really Paper-based course, but he really pushes you to do your best.  May be the most knowledgeable teacher I've had yet. I highly recommend this IMGD class over the Social Issues class (this is thought provoking).

Excellent class, manages to get draw blood from a stone with discussions in a class full of engineering/CS students, many of whom are there just to fulfill a requirement. Obviously hindered by the 7-week terms, but you need to take PY/RE1731 with Sanbonmatsu if you have the opportunity. Interesting note: he once liberated a lobster into the sea.

Excellent, definitely thought-provoking. I've never had a class that made me think about things as much as his. If you can back up what you say, or successfully argue against his position, he isn't close-minded. He is quite unfamilar with games, but puts serious thought everything. Reding is long and thick. Biggest quirk: sometimes apocalyptic.
Seriously the best prof in the whole ****ing world. It should be a requirement to take a class that he teaches.
Not the easiest professor around. But really thought provoking and challenging. Funny too.
WOW! What a great teacher. never new phiosophy could be this much fun!!
Best professor ever. This person has taught me more than anyone else ever has. He is fantastic.
Great prof.  Knows his stuff.  Funny in class, and provokes thought and discussion.  You come away with a better insight to the world.
Very interesting and thought provoking. Even if you don't agree with him you do walk away from the class asking questions you wouldn't ask otherwise.
very interesting

Don't bother with him. He talks about having an open mind and such, but in discussions he doesn't listen to other peoples arguements because his mind is already made up. He also assumes that every white male has a supriority complex, even if it is subconscious.
sug-bag worst.
Truly one of the best teachers I have ever had.
He's a liberal professor who presents everything from a liberal bias.  If that's your preference, then wonderful.  I didn't think philosophy professors were supposed to be so fiercely biased though.
Really good prof.  His class is a good start for philosophy classes.

Great Professor! Good in-class discussions. Good reading selections. But some were too complex for an intro class. One reading from Tom Reagan about animal cruelty almost made me a veggie. Prof. Sanbonmatsu does not rush you with the papers. You can take your time to think and write a good paper.
great guy, learned a lot, he knows his stuff, very hard grader though.

He was is very thought provoking person.  He found ways to relate questions that have been asked in philosophy for thousands of years to current events.  Class discussions were interesting and the assigned readings were well worth the time invested in them.  If you like philosophy, I recommend him.
Excellent professor
Prof. Sanbonmatsu is a great professor and you have to have him for the philosophy classes!
Professor Sanbonmatsu is terrific. He is not only an excellent teacher, but also a very moral person. I wish him all the best.
ideologies are dangerous
great prof...great lectures
No Comments

The addition of Professor Sanbonmatsu to the Philosophy department at WPI tremendously benefits the institution as a whole. The syllabus he provided was concise and the reading selection was brilliant!
Ok he Might be a vegitarian and have a son but let me tell you when he wears black this guy is HOT and if not for the wedding ring, I would have gotten an A in that class :)
He's an alright guy, but kindof a radical left winger

He's super nice and makes an effort to know his students. His exams aren't too hard, but there are so few questions that if you mess up a little bit you get a low score. He gives out a lot of homework.

He is a good instructor but his homework are unnecessarily difficult. They do prepare you well but they are so hard even he can't figure them out sometimes. He is good at explaining the concepts but sometimes will trail off and forget to go back and address the previous topic.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I loved having Mr Johnson as a professor, he always showed up ready to class and had so much energy with everyone

He gives clear math instruction, and if you are ever unsure about content, he is happy to explain it to you outside of class. He cares and is passionate about the subject. He's not the most animated but he is sweet and really wants you to understand. He gives hard homework assignments, but the tests aren't that hard. He's a good teacher.

I had Prof. Johnson for Calc II, which is a difficult and content-heavy course, in my opinion. Prof. Johnson is a good lecturer, and very fair if you are willing to put in the work to learn the content. Very grateful to have him as a professor in a subject I definitely find difficult.

He is a really good professor, I did not take this course, I took ECON 1120, but he is amazing. He would always be helpful in office hours, encourged me to ask questions, and on the tests he gave as much time needed for me. I highly recommend taking any course with Professor Johnson.

His lectures have plenty of examples and his notes are well explained and color coded. There were lots of webworks, but the problems helped prepare for the three exams (your best grade counts for more of your overall grade than the others). Office hours were very helpful. Would recommend.

He gives three tests throughout the term. The highest one will count as 28 percent of your grade and the lower two count as 14 percent each. The exams will have one question that is more calculation intensive than the practice problems. An average of 75 percent will guarantee you a B for the course.

Good guy and taught pretty well. Neat handwriting and even color coded stuff. Lots of homework but it definitely prepared me for the tests. Most importantly, he was very organized. Posted all his notes on Canvas and made sure to give us a list of concepts to know for each test as well as a brief overview of each concept, which helped me study.
Will take the time to answer any questions you have and offers office hours where he'll walk you through any confusing hw problems. Provides straightforward explanations and examples in lectures
Awesome professor!

One of my favorite professors so far. In every class he goes over practice problems to make sure everyone understands. He writes out very neat notes and posts each one in canvas after class. He is very nice and made calc 2 much easier than I expected it to be.
Really good dude who cares about the students. Very patient with any type of question asked.

Professor johnson is a great calculus professor. Class is very well organized and his lectures make it easy to learn the material and teach you how to approach the types of problems he expects you to do on homework and tests. He also provides practice tests which have the exact types of problems that are on the real test but a bit harder.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He isn't the best teacher. That said he is a really nice guy, who WILL take the time in office hours to go over things the best he can. He gave me multiple extensions and make up exams when I got sick, and as long as you email him with what's up he is really understanding.
Really nice guy. He gave great feedback on my tests and even rounded up my letter grade to an A when I was right below a 90.

Johnson is the BEST. He is so sweet and caring, and always comes to class with a big smile on his face. Our class asked many dumb questions, yet he answered each one patiently, making sure that each student left knowing the material. He truly cares, and he guided us every step of the way in an otherwise difficult subject area. I will miss him a lot
He's a really great professor who loves answering questions, making sure you understand the content, and is generally a really nice guy. Would love to take another class from him.

Really funny, solid professor. Easy to follow lecture style and very to the point about his material and how to solve problems. Made statistics about as fun as it could be by analyzing "widgets" and potato chips and the 2016 election.   I only had to take 1 math class but I would choose him again!
Love this guy. Great professor and enjoyable. Took calc 2 with him wish I had all my calcs with him. Take this guy for calc if you can, or any class.

Prof Johnson is, in my opinion, the best professor out there. He's extremely clear in lecture, and is more than willing to go step by step throughout each and every process. For calculus 2 he gave us one free sheet of notes (Awesome!) yet his exams were very tough. Overall, an amazing guy. Go to office hours!
Probably one of the best teachers you can get. Very understanding and great in lecture.

Johnson is the best. His lectures are so in depth and clear, you never find yourself asking "How did he get that?" or "What did he just do."
