All his stuff is online  so if you need to see it again or skip, you're in the clear. Kinda a harsh grader and there's no curve but his tests are pretty close to the practice test and they aren't very hard.

Although homework can be quite long, and the tests can be a bit difficult, it's worth taking his class. He is very nice and helpful. Even out of his office hours, he is there for you. Go to lectures, do the homework, and ask questions and you will surely pass the class :)

Professor Johnson is one of the greatest teachers ever. He explains the material really well. If you pay attention his class and his tests are really easy. Missed a class? Don't worry about it because his lectures are all online on myWPI. And most importantly his practice tests are a really good reflection of his actual test.

Course can be challenging but all the hard work paid off really well. All of the coursework help a lot in revision of knowledge.  Required MyMathLab, but other than that you will be very good in Math if you take him and do all the work.

This dude is the man. Highly recommend taking the gentle giants class. Very helpful outside of class and his lectures are clear and concise if you pay attention. Homework can be a bit lengthy but overall great experience.

Professor Johnson was my by far my favorite professor this term. He's a really nice guy, plus his notes are very clear and formatted extremely well. The homework he assigns is very helpful, exams are a fair test of the material, and he is a generous grader.

Good teacher, very nice and helpful. He speaks loudly which I appreciated and takes time to explain things. He records all of his lectures and allows a note sheet on tests. The tests are difficult if you're not good at doing basic math in your head, but there are no surprises. Do the homework and you will be fine.

Johnson is a clear lecturer and his tests are straightforward. He's a doll- very approachable. I recommended his class to my friends who hadn't yet taken Calc III. It has moderate difficulty, nothing to complain or rave about- just the average.

Professor Johnson takes simple concepts, and spends an hour making everything more complicated. He teaches Calc III in the opposite order as other teachers (Starts with parametrics, then polar, then sequences and series). Lectures are confusing, homework is unnecessarily hard. He allows a notes sheet on tests, but they are still almost impossible.

I really liked Professor Johnson for calc 4. He makes sure to get to know everyones name and his office hours are fantastic! Before our last exam, he originally offered to have them for 2 hours but was willing to help us for longer. He allows you to use a note sheet on all the exams and that helps a lot. I never used the textbook though

Hardest calc teacher I had all year.  Tests are extremely hard and you never have enough time to finish.  Lectures are very confusing and do not correlate to to the test.  Would not recommend for calc 4.
very nice teacher. weekly homeworks assigned. lets you bring a note sheet to all tests.

Ask plenty of questions in lecture if things don't quite make sense and do all the practice problems he posts. The textbook has good explanations and examples worth looking at. Overall an easy class if you do the assigned work

Had him for MA1023 and MA 1024. Super nice guy. Very clear with explanations. If you attend class, do the homework and attempt the practice test. This class will be very easy for you. Highly recommend.
Good teacher, clear and prepared lectures and he posts the notes and recordings of the lectures online. Fair grader, but difficult assignments. Homework was hard but not too long.
Prof. Johnson was very helpful in office hours. Tests could be somewhat difficult but were comparable to the questions we were given for homework. Overall a good class.
Absolutely wonderful. Grades fairly. Homework is tedious, but it helps immensely on exams. Lectures are worth going to, even if his examples can get long-winded.
Great guy, good teacher. Gives challenging tests but is an easy grader and scales most tests. Tests are like HW questions.

I come to class having read the chapter in the book, understanding most of it, but somehow prof Johnson manages to find a way to create the most complicated, unnecessary example and get lost in it for nearly the entire class only accomplishing further confusion for his students. Also, his voice is monotone. Avoid if possible.
Mr. Johnson might be one of the most confusing and worst teachers I have ever had.

If I could have this guy responsible for my entire graduate education I would.  His lectures are crystal clear, he is helpful with homework, and he makes the class seem easier than it is.  One very minor critical point, his homework can get a little copious, but that is just pale in comparison to what an amazing teacher he is!

He is the most helpful professor with the most available office hours. He is available almost everyday to help students. The hw is hard and tests are based on hw. But, if you pay attention and ask him for help, he'll tell you how to do the hw problems and give the answers. he don't care, he just wants you to learn! only lazy students  do bad.
Very helpful

This is one of the best calc teachers I have had yet. He is very reasonable on tests and explains the topics in calc III well. His notes on the board could be in a more organized fashion. Overall if you are taking any of the calcs here at WPI, try and get into his class.
Great math teacher.  sometimes made explanations hard but overall did great job teaching material.  tests are hard so be prepared for them.
Great prof, awesome guy, cares a lot about his studnets.  Gives oodles of help outside of class with office hours and 2-hour-long help sessions before tests. Fair tests and grading.

Spent a lot of time outside of class helping anyone who needed it. Cared a lot more about students success than any other math teachers I've had here. However he strangely changed the grade cutoff after the final causing a few to fail.
VERY helpful outside of class! A very skilled teacher! If I had any troubles at all, he helped me during ofice hours... VERY nice guy!!
Mike...u are a dedicated teacher....but u got lots to improve....like making ur explanations less complicated...

Mike's a nice guy, but not a good teacher.  I fell asleep in all but 3 of his lecture classes, not including our 3 tests.  I found that he often made things more complicated in his explanation than they needed to be, compared to the my HS AP class.
Ummm, learn to teach, although you are a nice guy, but you need to learn to teach.
No Comments
Great guy.
michael johnson is the BEST calc teacher. i love his class!
I had him for Calc I.  He's a good guy, but he could probably teach the class better.

Third time w/ Richman. About 2-3 hw's a week. Exams are tough, prepare to spend 4+ hours on them. The math isn't tough, but the concepts can be. Hard to know when to use what formula/process. Sadly no longer uploads class videos, in person only. Still a personable guy who's happy to explain things in office hours. This is a tough class, be prepared
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Expect take-home exams to take you all day to complete. Lectures and homework only show simplified examples of what to expect on exams...exam problems are insane! When giving him feedback, the whole class expressed how long the exam was and how unreasonable it was, but he made no changes. Also, expect to have homework 2x a week!

Professor Richman is the best engineering professor I have had. Although he can be hard to contact outside via email, he is very caring and understanding, amazing lecturer. Follow in-class examples for homework will be just like those. Lecture + homework prepare you well for exam, which are long but he gives a reasonable amount of time.
HE IS AMAZING!!!!
Probably my favorite professor, really wants to make sure people understand the material. Tests were long but very fair and very similar to the homeworks.

Richman is a great professor. His lectures are extremely easy to follow and take notes on. He really cares about teaching you the material. His tests aren't very hard but they are long and you will be working till the last second. He was extremely friendly and approachable during office hours.

He's a great professor. His lectures are clear and thorough, and he writes everything on the board nicely. Make sure you do the homework! The tests are basically like the homework, and they're kind of long but not extremely tough. He's a fair grader and also a very nice guy. His humor added to the lectures. Would recommend!
He is a very great professor. He was a truly nice guy and a great lecturer. Exams were sometimes long and difficult, but if you did the HW you were prepared. Definitely recommend.

He gives about 3 hw problems a night, from the textbook, and the tests cover ALL THE HOMEWORKS SINCE THE LAST TEST. His lectures are clear with a sense of humor. Class is traditional: chalk and talk style. He's reasonable with grading and hw, and answers questions well. Take the class seriously and you'll be fine. Takes graded attendance.

Had high expectations for his class. Tests had material on it that were not yet covered and he had unrealistic expectations on tests. Homework keeps you from falling behind and he's a nice guy, but his exams were unfair.
He is a great professor!!! Everything would be easy if you go to the class, take the note and DO THE HOMEWORK.

One of the best Professors at WPI. Great teacher with great notes. If you don't take notes you will struggle with the material, but sometimes he posts lecture notes. Had him twice. Lots of work but It makes the exams easier. He likes long exams with lots of material, but is very fair about what it covers. Is not out to get you, just DO THE HW!

Richman is a great professor who really cares about his students. In some cases, where I couldn't go to one of his lectures, he made a copy of the lectures notes that I missed during that class for me. He also is helpful with review homework problems and exams during his office hours (Which I recommend going to see if you need help with homework).
Great professor! Genuinely cares about his students and teaches the material very well. His class is very organized and he's very helpful. One of the best professors I've ever had.

Great Professor. Difficult material-- Aeros complained there wasn't enough Aero material, and it was basically just advanced Stress Analysis. The class is very abstract, he's a great great Professor, always wants questions and can explain well. Be sure to start hw the night it's assigned and utilize the TA. Tests are long so bring coffee.
Excellent Professor

Assigns lots of homework. HW ends up being useful though. Tests are fairly straightforward and not too difficult. Lecturing skills are excellent. Additionally he is a great guy who really enjoys helping students.
great lecturer but he can be condescending. Tests are way overcomplicated. Homework is easy and then he slams you with impossible test problems. But he does teach well in lecture
Great teacher where you really learn a lot but his exams are not easy and I rarely ever finished one.  Partial credit is given though

Richman is THE MAN. He is the BEST professor at this school. He's... ALSO the most absentminded prof I've ever met (after emailing him asking if it was ok to skip his class as my friend had an appointment, he responded with "see me after class") but honestly it just makes him all the better. Take any class you can with this guy. He's the man.
Great professor. Knows what he is doing and has been doing it for a long time. Everything was clear, the work reasonable, the tests on the material, no tricks. Get him if you can.
so far the best engineering professor I've had at this school, scratch that, one of the best teachers i've had at this school. a great guy too. I beyond recommend.

Great professor. I woud recommend him for thermo or statics. He is very helpful and encourages questions. He can be quirky at times but it relaxes the class. The one down side was that he assigned homework every night. Sometimes this can be overwhelming, but if you attend office hours he is very willing to help.
Excellent teacher. Highly recommend.

Great class. Complex concepts were explained in great detail. Almost-daily homework made us aware if we were falling behind, and Prof. Richman was always willing to take the time to help us out. Grades were based more on understanding of concepts than mathematical accuracy. Highly recommended!

I took Dr. Richman's class in Statics & Structure. He is not only knowledgeable but he is very talented in explaining the idea in the clearest way possible. In addition, he is very humble, polite and a great example for a teacher. Do not waste the chance to take any class with this professor you will learn a huge deal. God Bless him.

Professor Richman is one of the best professors at WPI. He is teaching style is fun and upbeat. He likes to have fun and teach at the same time. He does many examples and is a very fair teacher. If you do the homework and try to learn you should receive nothing less than a good grade.

He is a great thorough teacher. he cares a lot about the whole class understanding the material and not just a few smart ones. he goes through many examples, even has his TA do a hw problem prior to handing in! his test may be tough for the fact the material isnt light. but he cares more about work and gives a lot of HW but keeps it fresh in ur min
Very organized, helpful, gives great notes. Makes waking up early for class worth your while. Tests cover the material learned and there are no "surprise" materials on the test that we didn't expect.

Wonderful guy! he taught well, HW and exams were challenging but if you go for class everyday and take it seriously you will end up with a B, if you do the exams well its an easy A. Loved him, was extremley helpful outside of class hours andknows how to explain the material well. I would also take another class with him if I could. great great guy!
Great professor. Took 2501 and 2502 and he taught the material well. If I could take all my classes with him I would.

The best teacher I've had at WPI.  He teaches really well (Concepts first and then examples).  Make sure you go to class and do the homework.  His tests are tough, but you can easily work through the problems.  I would take all my classes with him if I could.
You will learn the material very well. If you go to class and do the HW you will not have a problem.

First class @ WPI that I felt I learned something in. He teaches by first talking about general concepts and then he dives into examples that effectively illustrate how to use them. He revived my faith in WPI after my awful freshman year. Also the almost-daily HW assignments are great for retention of material; I barely had to study for the tests.
Mark Richman is the best Aero or ME prof at WPI.
Excellent prof. Do the daily HW and you are all set.

EXCELLENT prof. Lectures were more or less mandatory - attendance was 10% of the final grade. Covers material thoroughly and really teaches it. Homework was assigned daily, but not in excess; learned a lot from it. Somewhat challenging course, but fairly easy to master by putting in the time.

Amazing professor. Made everything extremely clear. Very organized. Tests were long, but very simple if you knew your stuff. Gives a lot of homework, and requires attendance, but neither are in vain. You truly understand everything if you participate in the class.
Definitely the BEST professor I've ever had. Amazing teaching, and exams are very fair. Yes, late to class, but this doesn't take away from the class, and he won't hold you over.
He is SO HOT!! BEST professor in WPI.  Never had a professor that is as crystal clear as him.  Straight to the point and willing to help.  AWESOME!!
Best in ME department! I wish i could take all classes with Mark. You really learn in his class! Cool guy too
Was consistently 5 minutes late for class, but a really good professor. Made sure that students understood the material. Tests were hard and there was homework every night.

Probably one of the best professors in terms of explaining the material clearly. Homework every night, but ample time given to complete each assignment. Attendance is mandatory, but definitely worth it

Explain theory and idea well. Class is fun. Test is long and homework every night, but you really learn. One advise that keep you from killing yourself on homeworks. GO TO CLASS, it will save your day!
No Comments

Richman is awesome! He does show up to class 5 minutes late and gives a lot of hw.  Just make sure you stay on top of the work and you will be all set for the tests. He really knows how to explain the material well to students.

Probably the best prof. I've had at WPI.  Explained concepts perfectly and moved through material at a perfect speed.  Assigned a lot of hw but if you did it all it ended up making the tests very fair and easy.  Also he's pretty funny sometimes.

He was horrible. He showed up 10-15 min late everyday, and kept us 5-10 minutes late everday. He never explained his examples because he had to rush through them and never related anything to the book. He often stood directly in front and talking INTO the chalk board, so notes always fell behind. Friends say he was just as bad in other classes

Richman is an AWESOME professor.  Cares that his students learn the material and can explain it well, in many different ways.  He'll also randomdly break out into stand up comedy mode and tell you a hilarious story in the middle of class.  He's amazing.
P-Daddy Richman Rocks!!!

This guy rocks.  Very clear, very helpful, very intelligent and an all around good guy.  You'll learn a lot and enjoy doing it.  You'll have to do some work that is frustrating, but they don't come much better than Richman.
Excellent professor. Very intelligent, helpful and a pretty nice guy too. I recommend for any class he offers
He is an excellent professor.
Best professor i have ever had

Burt Tilley is an incredibly competent professor for ODE. His lectures move fast, but by the end after you've gone through some examples, it is usually pretty clear. The homeworks are very well assigned and are just enough to give you a very solid understanding of the material.
Just don't even take him, do anything else

The lectures were completely different from the work assigned. I often had to spend long periods of time trying to figure out how to solve the problem because the way to solve the problem was not covered in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Exams= 80% of grade. Hw= 10, labs=10. Two 5 question Exams. Very fast lectures. Unhelpful office hours. Everytime I went he made me feel bad for not understanding material & kinda shamed me. The kids that did okay had already taken calc bc. Not helpful for less experienced students. Goes into history of math instead of teaching needed material

His lectures were very quick, and it was hard to keep up. Taught a lot of topics that were not even on the final. Did not focus on the important topics and focused on the optional topics. Gave a lot of Extremely hard homework. Lectures were not very helpful and just confused me more. If you can avoid taking him, I would recommend doing so.

Prof. Tilley was a nice guy don't get me wrong but as a teacher, he was definitely not the best. 80% of our grade was based on exams, if you're not a good test taker, I don't recommend him. Lots and lots of homework each week. Lectures made topics feel overcomplicated.

This was the most intense course I have ever taken. The lectures were insufficient, merely providing surface-level information and expecting the students to learn the rest of the material themselves (granted, teaching yourself some content is normal, but this was excessive). I also found myself spending 20+ hours/week on his homework alone.

His lectures moved very fast which isn't uncommon for WPI but this was extra fast. The homework was a lot and took a lot of time. I found myself doing homework when I should have been studying for a test. The tests were not too hard but that was beacuse sample exams were given.

For reference I took AP Calc AB my senior year, and I feel like I got worse at calc throughout the course. His lectures are boring, the concepts are terribly explained, and the amount of WebWork given was insane. Do not recommend at all.

Prof. Tilley's ODE class wasn't too bad. Your final grade will be based 25% on  hw and 75% on exams. You can expect the exams to have problems similar to the ones on the homeworks and practice exams. Show up to lecture, understand the concepts, and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: goes fast and webworks are 50 problems long and some questions take a long time but there are only 3 and you have a couple weeks to do each one. he gives 3 exams worth 75% and 3 WW worth 25%. Also he let me retake the last exam went I accidentally missed the class even though the policy was for me to take it next term which would have been the fall

I absolutely LOVE Professor Tilley. His lectures are VERY fast (compared to others I've had), but his lectures are incredible, explains very well and I really like his demeanor. I also had him for MA 1024 and MA 2051, and the same applies.

He is very friendly during lecture, and answers questions incredibly well.

His lectures were very comprehensive. He covered a lot of material quickly, but the video lectures and slides were always posted on canvas. The homeworks were not too long. His exams were significantly easier than the homeworks (the class average for the exams was around 85% which I think is high). Overall I liked the class but it was difficult.

Either you get all the notes down and a sore hand, or you pay close attention and try to keep up with the concepts. Doesn't listen to students that ask him to slow down. Provides very few, complex, examples, and hardly gives students room to participate/think. Asks class for feedback on how hes doing, then proceeds to do nothing to remedy critiques
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Tilley sprints through his lectures. Most of the time I would miss the in-person and play the recorded lectures at 0.75 speed. The fact that 90% of the grade is 3 exams is a killer. And if you ask any questions or any help expect a passive-aggressive answer. Avoid at all costs and if you cant then study your heart out.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: His class is very fast. I had a lot of troubles reading his handwriting notes in class and catching up what he taught. He expects you to study a lot outside of the class.

Tilley is borderline verbally abusive to students, he treats them with no respect and will happily belittle you if you ask questions. His lectures are fast so it is quite difficult to write everything down in time, but if you try to take a picture he will yell at you for it. The homework wasn't worth enough and took too much time, just avoid him.

I loved this class! While Tilley lectures very fast, the two conferences a week definitely help you catch up and the homework problems are harder than the exam, so if you can do those youll be set. The one thing to watch out for is that if you ask questions, theres a good chance youll get a condescending response. But in general, solid prof!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Tilley is very competent and he knows it. His lectures are helpful and he goes through many example problems in class, but his "smarter is better" attitude is very self-evident. If you ask questions without putting thought into them, he will not treat you with respect and it will be frustrating for both of you. Tests are 90% of the grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Tilley is very clear in lecture, albeit fast. His tests are worth a large percentage of the grade, but if you have done the homework and gone to class the tests are relatively easy.

Tilley is the worst lecturer Ive ever had the honor of knowing . He gives students minimal time to take down the notes and comprehend what they are writing down. He doesnt explain what he has written and condescendingly answer any question you may have. He also only uses chalkboards in a lecture hall that fits 200 students so nobody can see.

Prof Tilley is great at math. So great, in fact, that he becomes unable to explain it clearly. He flies through his lectures and is not always great at answering questions. I think it's because Diff Eqs is just second nature to him at this point. He is very helpful during office hours, though.

He goes way too fast. Lectures confused me so I went to the TAs to learn and did better. Quizzes are too hard and homework is way too long with many questions. Midterm is fair but final is very hard. Tilley doesn't like answering questions or being corrected and is very passive aggressive. So avoid this guy, but be prepared to work if you can't.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I took Burt's class a few years back and I actually really enjoyed it. He's very clear and doesn't try to be too abstract, which a lot of engineers do when teaching math. Yes his homework and exams are hard, but news flash, if you continue to do math in graduate school it only gets harder, and if you don't it's still a good experience in REAL math.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: An absolute nightmare. I happened to be part of a class with some pretty smart kids and the prof thought this meant we should all become geniuses in an instant. WebWork took way too long and included some really demanding problems. Exams are hell compared to the other classes & going to office hours won't necessary help you. Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Was generally not good at what he did. Poor at getting ideas on paper correctly, had to be corrected by students multiple times per class.

Tilley seems like a good professor until you realize that you're supposed to be learning something. He can be exceptionally condescending and patronizing, especially if you need accommodations for something. He will not be understanding when you need it. I would not recommend him at all.

He goes through material super fast and you just copy it down as fast as you can without actually understanding what you're doing. He's a nice enough guy, if not a little condescending, but I would not recommend since he's not a good prof. He only assigns WebWork for homework which does boost your grade but the problems are really hard sometimes.

Prof. Tilley is a nice guy, but he FLIES through material in lecture and acts slightly annoyed if students ask questions.  It's not impossible to get a good grade in his class, but you have to put A LOT of effort into it, more that it was worth to me at the time.  If you're a freshman, I'd recommend you choose a different professor.

Took Calc 3 with him- Challenging, partly just because its Calc 3, partly because he lectures like he's sprinting a marathon.  Very amiable guy, loves helping people, tests were not too challenging, lots of homework.  The lectures though, you basically just write down as much of what he's conveying as fast as you can and try to understand it later.

Decent teacher who just happens to teach a difficult class. His lectures are confusing because he moves really quickly and doesn't do many examples. He assigns a ton of homework!! 25-40 written problems along with online homework per week. Tests are pretty straight forward though, most of the test problems come from the homework. He is a nice guy.

The Tilley monster. Very good at the condescending head nod. He went at a ferocious pace in class and the online homework could be very annoying. Available to help out of class. Tests we're typically okay but he through some oddball questions on there too. Stay away if possible.

He gives a lot of webwork which is sometimes a lot harder than what is taught in class and doesn't help with test materials. There is also bookwork every night. Class is a lot of work and pretty hard. The test are hard, quizes are based off of bookwork. Lectures very fast and hard to keep up and take notes at the same time.

Lectures quickly and energetically. Helps you if you need it. Most of the time he lectures too quickly and the WebWorks tend to be too much. Exams oftentimes have a disparity between versions. Wasn't that great at accommodating for my disability.
Very good teacher
Prof.Tilley is very energetic in his class. Although his homework assignment is pretty hard, his test is easy enough for everyone to handle it.

Lectures go fast, but the homework (though there is quite a bit) will teach you exactly what you need to know for the exams. The 2 exams count as 80% of the grade, but they aren't outrageously difficult.

Had him for Calc 3 & 4, very intelligent and helpful if you are willing to work with him. Can be challenging at times, especially the last 3 weeks of Calc 3. Make sure to go to office hours if you get behind, the class moves fast.
While the workload may be heavy, he always makes himself available to make sure everyone understands the material.
Had Him for Calc 3 and 4. Not easy classes, but he made every attempt to make sure everyone knew the material!
Too many homeworks and webworks. It looks like there are webworks everyday so that I missed for 3 times. I prepared for each class or I would be confused.
Talking to fast and too much webwork

Extremely passionate about teaching and the subject and it shows in his lectures even though I almost fell asleep a couple of times but that might of been pure subject matter. Makes an effort to learn names, good man.
I had Tilley for Calc I and II. He definitely makes you work hard and pushes people to work ahead of schedule, but it'll help for your future math classes... in the end, you'll learn more.
Tilley is worthless teacher. stoping here, no more comments necessary.

Failing to adjust to Tilley's teaching method after trying very hard in his class, I have 2 questions, am I dumb when I had 4.00 before Tilley's class, or is he not a good teacher. Tilley may be a good man, but he is definitly the worst teacher I have encountered in my college carrier. I would not recomend him to anybody. Drop his class ASAP.

tilley is a great man, you may find him a bit tough at the beggining but he is teaching you well overall. In addition he is a great helper, always responds to e-mails, and is ready to help you with your problems. But he expects you to do your work! Laziness not allowed!
He expects you to work but just read the book and you'll be fine. His tests are really straight forward. Do the pretest and you'll get at least a B. His questions are straight from the book.
If you have taken his class i would reccomend to drop it immediately! so that you do not lose your scholarship!!!very poor teaching habits, most of the class does not know what's going on.
Mediocre professor. Lectures not very helpful. Slightly above average expectations. Reasonable workload. Fair grader. Neither recommend nor disapprove.

Great guy, expects students to pay attention in class and use the textbook to supplement his teaching. Some students strongly dislike having to read ahead, then come to class with questions about the material... You will learn the material very wll in this class, though it may not be the easiest class to cheat your way through, or just skate by...

Tilley is the worst professor I have ever had. He expects students to teach themselves the material PRIOR tO his lectures. He is disrespectful to students when they dont understand him.  He thinks he is a good professor (he is not).  His lectures are useless and not worth waking up for. I have loathed every minute of his class. DO NOT HIS CLASSES.

This professor scared me: by the end of this course, I didn't hate calculus any more.  Class is definitely not easy, tests short and hard, but you will learn the material, and I even ended up liking it. Awesome prof, Tilley is the man.
Her lectures are amazing and she goes through everything you need to be preppared for her exams
Worst class ever

I have been fortunate to take two math courses with Professor Weekes 1022 and 1024. Both courses she taught were amazing, In the beginning of 1022 I was nervous to ask for help but once I had she was extremely willing to help and she was able to have a technical conversation with me so I understood my mistakes. I would highly recommend!!!

Great teacher. Lectures are well paced and keep you on your toes so you don't get bored, but isn't difficult. Tests are fine as long as you study. She keeps lectures interesting. I would recommend having her for this class.
Very tough grader and only gives weekly quizzes
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The class was very straight forward. Lectures/notes could get a little confusing, but still understandable. She was always open to answering any questions too. She always would make sarcastic remarks to be funny.
she leaves way too much homework, she doesn't explain the concepts well and goes through each chapter way too fast would not recommend her at all for MA2051

Disrespectful toward students, difficult style of pedagogy, and overall negative experience. Teaching assistant for this course was unqualified, professor is unwilling or unable to offer help on topics in computer science related to numerical analysis

Lots of homework is assigned. Sometimes even double the work because of the online homework and the written work. Quizes every friday with the lowest grade dropped. Moves fairly fast through the material.

Slow, but amusing lecturer. Doesn't teach concepts, just formulas, but she understands the concepts. A lot of straightforward homework that has every problem graded. A class for those with a bad math background

Prof. Weekes was amazing. Lectures seemed to fly by, but I still felt like I was learning a lot.  Would definitely love to have her again.  She was funny and interacted with students in a way that spoke "friend" opposed to "pupil".
Not really helpful and not good at teaching the material. Turned a fun class into a really bad one. Learned more online then I learned from her lectures/ assigned textbook.

This class was great! Prof. Weekes is very pleasant, and her explanations were clear. The only downsides were the massive amounts of homework and the constant class participation. But besides those, I would recommend taking this class!

Bad Explanations. Painful Homeworks. This course is for pure math student not for an applied math student. I first look forward to the course as an operation research major but not after I took the class with her.

A very pleasant professor. It was a fun class too, with her cracking a joke sometimes. The material she covered was interesting too. The only downside was how she handled the last few topics, specifically 2 person games. She went by that topic too quickly, but besides that she covers the course well.

Very good professor, she knows the material very well. Go to class, and to her office hours. Weekly homework and quizzes could be a pain, but help a bit to digest all the material. She is harder than other profs but you'll also learn more in here class.
She's an excellent teacher and has no accent. Get her as your teacher if at all possible.

Great professor. Very engaging, answered questions well, good examples, simple homework. Watch out for spring and mass systems. She doesn't like them and thus does an iffy job teaching them. Overall I highly recommend her.

She helped make the class very engaging. Prof. Weekes is super passionate about teaching. she always had a clear flow for the lesson. Thorough knowledge of concepts from Calc 1 and 2 are expected. Quizzes are easy and help reinforce homework. Tests are difficult but manageable if you put in the preparation work.
She is the best teacher that I have ever had. She explain the things very clearly. She cares everyone on her class.

Probably one of the best professors I've had. She clearly explains everything does numerous examples that all apply to her quizzes. Her quizzes are sometimes hard, and so are her tests, but she gives plenty of time to finish them. Extremely helpful in office hours.

She: clearly teaches each step of the problem, pauses after teaching a new concept to let you process the information, knows you, cares how you are doing/if you're learning, encourages questions, doesn't put people on the spot, gives a lot of homework out of the book, webwork, and a quiz each week-but it is to your benefit. Learn, work, take her.

She really knows what she is talking about, but has a tendency to leave example problems unfinished.  When she comes into class, she expects a hearty "Good Morning!" and is angry if she doesn't get it.  She also has a tendency to call on people to answer questions on the board who are madly scribbling notes and trying to catch up.

shes not a bad teacher but she did emphasize the importance of homework and short quizzes...her examples in classes are really helpful and the tests and quizzes arent that bad if u hav been doing the assignments...she also tries to energize the class
Prof. Weekes is a great instructor how cares deeply about her students. If you want a good grade in her class, study and do your work. And ask for help if you need one, and she will help you.

I had a hard time in this class (barely passed). However, these complaints are outlandish and ridiculous. She cares deeply about her students! It's about personal responsibility and I just screwed up in this class. The homework was a little much but it's college people, get over it! She is a great professor overall.

She is one of the worst professors I've ever had. She doesn't explain anything, her accent is annoying, she gives the most rediculous amounts of homework to the point that you'd think she likes to make you suffer.

She is very anti-student. Her quizzes, which make up 50% of your grade, are only 2-3 difficult questions. She gives an absurd amount of homework and is generally unavailable to help. Furthermore, she has no problem embarrasing students and discouraging them. I would highly recommend not taking a course with this professor.

Very bad. doesnt finish the problems she starts to do. just says "come on you should kno how to do this" very bad experience overall. if she gave less homework then we could actually pay attention to each problem and do it correctly. dont bother going for extra help
No Comments

Class was heavily weighted against students... 2, 3 question exams made up for 40% of your grade, failing one and then having trouble with the incredibly difficult and time consuming hw put you in line to NR.
Pretty bad overall.  Can't stand her accent either.

My favorite professor so far- shes fun, brilliant, and extremely willing to help you provided you are willing to do your work.  IF you want easy, go somewhere else, but if you want to come out knowing a TON, TAKE HER IF YOU CAN
Very intimidating. If she wants you to fail she will see to it that you will.

Weekes is an extremely helpful teacher. Many people on this site rate her as unclear. At times her lectures can be difficult to understand. People do not realize that calculus is a difficult subject to teach and not everyone understands it the same way.

she is the meanest teacher i have ever had (there is just no other way to put it). She is not there to help you learn, it's almost like she wants you to fail. She told me to drop her class, and I ended up getting an A taking it with another prof.

Meanest teacher I've had in my whole life. She basically called people stupid, tries the whole negative renforcement. Makes you feel horrible, unless your a natural in math. Stay away at all costs, do an ISP with Peter Christopher instead (100X nicer teac
Teaches clearly, but as someone said before she is very intimidating and calls on you in class.  Don't think you can hide- you WILL be called on.
She likes to pick and call on people.  Tries to do the whole interactive-classroom participation thing.  If you like speaking up in class, this is the prof for you.
She's not that bad a teacher, but she can be very indimidating.
No Comments
Weekes was a good professor, Calc 2 was easily explained, and she had office hours often.  The grades were based on one quiz every week, then the final.  I did fine, got an A.
She is terrible and made me NR.

Awful teacher, don't take anything with her. She yells at you if you don't say goodmorning to her to her total satisfaction.  She makes the class afraid to answer questions because we're all afraid she's going to yell at us if we don't answer it correctly
I think she is an awful teacher.  I do not understand when she teaches me and even going to extra-help with her does me no good.

Really smart, hard grader...i think i should have failed her class but she passed me so i'm thankful for that...and it's nearly impossible to cheat in her class so stay away if you're a cheater. she's really nice once you get past how intimidating she is
No Comments

An excellent calculus professor who gives very good one on one interaction. Very encouraging to do your best, however very strict and hard. She is not that great with large classes, because it's hard to give personal attention to 150 students.
No Comments
Very hard teacher, very unforgiving at grading
She is a very effective teacher
This woman is the epitomy of all things evil and wrong.
Worst teacher I've ever had in my life.  Quizzes on material not covered.

He speaks slowly, which is good for talking down notes. Very generous in final grades. You are expected to understand the subject. There will be 3-4 problems as assignment with two weeks time. Ever student is given a fair chance to excel. Problems will be based on how notes and lectures. Don't miss a class. Explains little details beautifully.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Class is very hard but the professor tries his best to make sure everyone understands the material. He is very willing to meet outside class to help if you are struggling.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's a decent professor. Knows a lot about Physics, and is good at explaining things as well. Homeworks were tough (MasteringPhysics) which didn't help much for exams; it took a lot of my time. But other than that everything was good. Nothing wrong with the professor.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests are tough

comment: His lectures are posted online, which is a VERY nice resource. I lost count of how many lectures I neglected to go to in person so I could work on other things, but since I could just watch them later, I still got an A. He tends to ramble a little bit and keep everyone a few minutes past when class is supposed to end.

One of the worse teachers I have had. He teaches under his tests, most test had a class average under 70% (FAILING). You can not possibly do well in his class unless you already know the material, even then its crazy hard.
refused to let me have extra time/makeup exam due to illness. Nitpicks over every point.

I have had a couple of classes with him. He is amiable and helpful. He always tries to make sure that every student understands the concepts. His courses are probably the most organized in the physics department.

He is a good teacher, and has fairly light accent compared to many of the professors in the department.  He will go over things as many times as necessary until people understand, which can make his class boring if you already know what's going on.
Explain theory well, and do experience in front of you. ONE WORD for those who hates Physics, GO TO CLASS! That will save you from flipping that big physics book non-stop

Professor Aravind really cares for his students.  His lectures are well done, and there are many applications and demonstrations.  I don't know what comment below is talking about, he speaks perfect English, he just has an accent which is understandable.  He is very helpful outside of class, definitely take advantage and go see him for help.
No Comments

This guy is great and explain stuffs very well. He does  not speak prefect English, but I can live with it because he really know physics back to front. Be sure you go to class, even just sit there. Masteringphysics is kind of sucks, i rather have more problem on paper.
He's really repetative, but he explains everything and gives all the essential equations in class. I usually don't have to refer to the book much.
The class was tough, and I felt very bogged down. I wish I took more math before I took on the task of Intermediate Mechanics I. He's very helpful if you go see him after class.
aravind himself isn't too bad - his in class experiments are hilarious.  in general though, he didn't cover enough material.

His teaching style annoys me.  He's very repetitive, and while he knows the material and explains it well, he does nothing to make the material pertinant or interesting.  Very dry, very boring, very repetitive.  I've had better professors.
No Comments
Hes great and hot
No Comments
Very nice and truly concerned if you understand things.  Good at explained concepts and relating them to problem applications.  Take his class.
VERY good at explaining everything.  This guy truly gets it.  If you come to lecture and take notes, you can ace the class.  I didn't even attend conference and got all I needed to know.

great conference teacher, hell explain any problems plus he GIVES you the 10 points, he doesnt quiz you on them and make you earn them like others...lecture can be boring however and right from the book, but overall hes really nice, at least u know he isnt trying to screw u on purpose

He's a little boring but he really knows what he's talking about when it comes to physics, he truly understands it conceptually and he's pretty good at explaining it if you can get through his accent.
DONT TAKE HIS CLASS!!! If you are stuck with it, go see Keil for help.  Keil speaks English and ALSO knows physics.
Accent is a def boundary, lectures suck and i always fell asleep.  I learend alot more in conference and review sessions.  Tests can be a pain in the ass
hes okay, trouble staying awake in class.  its nice to have all the demonstrations in class though.  tests throw a few curveballs, so make sure you know whats going on.

Very thick accent..."pablo plates" are "parallel plates." Lectures are mostly out of the book, and they're slow and ineffective. He doesn't do many examples in class, so you're somewhat lost when you're doing Mastering Physics homework, which is very difficult. This guy loves his stirring rod...
Wicked neato accent.  Krazy dude (that's right, with a k)  lousy lecturer but test's aren't bad if you study.
P.K. Rocks!!!  He always asked us for questions, and was willing to go through a whole problem when we just didn't get it.
I will now stroke the glass rod with this flannel cloth... Sometimes entertaining, but otherwise terribly boring lectures. Try to get the most out of your confrence teacher.

I think he knows the material well.  It's just hard for him to get it across.  The accent is somewhat of a barrier, but he also gives extremely boring lectures.  I fell asleep in most of them.  The tests were different from the sample tests and tricky.
Very hard to understand. I learned more in one help session with Prof. Keil than I did in 2 weeks with him.
Lectures can be boaring.
zee best!
Test questions are less direct than those on the sample exams. Slight language barrier during lectures/help sessions. He knows the material, but asks strange and more involved questions on the exams.

Ugh.   Redundant, repetitive lectures straight from the book.  Erroneous answers to sample exams, even if he makes an exam that ISN'T the sadistic bigger brother of the samples.  Nice guy, but a poor lecturer and hard grader.
Nice guy, helpful if you ask him questions, and gives very fair assessments of the material taught in class.
dedicated and helpful.....
No Comments
not a good professor.  his conferences are very boring and confusing.  hard to understand when he speaks
BORING!!! Try to get Jasperson.
No Comments
Average teacher, not a lecturer by nature.
Teaches well, always available for help, very knowledgable....a real nice guy too.
Difficult to understand, knows his stuff but isnt a very good teacher, kind of confusing tests questions and assignments, unneccessarily so.
nice guy, but not a good lecturer
Would do better in a smaller classroom, shouldn't occupy a lecture hall
No Comments
He probably bores even himself
Boring as hell and hard to understand
No Comments
Keep away, does not teach well!
No Comments

Very very nice guy, super accommodating and understanding and makes lectures enjoyable. He does go way too fast over slides though and is a slow grader. Exam format was sort of strange, they were take home half multiple choice half written document, both are timed separately. In class example and study guides were super helpful
Drew Brodeur is the absolute best! One of the greatest professors I've had!

Amazing professor, lectures were incredibly entertaining and helped keep me easily engaged. He does teach rather quickly but once you learn what to write down and not write down it'll be a breeze. Also online exams are really helpful but I don't know if he will keep doing them, and there's basically no HW

He talks way too fast and gives no time to actually understand what is being said or take notes from his presentation. Not only does he talk too fast but he takes forever to grade things (done group work that he still yet to be graded and did give exam 2 grades back until right before finals). He also gives no feedback for written exams.

Prof. Brodeur is great at explaining and his lectures are great. His exams are extremelly hard for no reason, but he'll give extra credit assignments and the grades are always curved at the end. Just make sure to understand the examples he gives in class and you should be okay.

The quizzes online are nothing like the tests at all. He flies through the problems in class to the point where you cant even write down the question before he switches slides. I would have gotten a B in this class if he actually explained his syllabus (you need to pass every test or you NR). He never goes over the exams after you take them.

Not a good teacher, his quizzes do not reflect his exams at all. The exams are a lot harder and ridiculously long. If you get an average under 65% for the 3 exams, you fail the class regardless if your overall grade is higher. Little to no opportunities for credit other than the exams (70 points each). There's only 6 other quizzes. Then lab.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He talks really fast in class. Being in his class for an hour feels like ten hours. I had to rewatch his lectures in Echo 360 everyday just to understand his lectures. His lecture doesn't contain many slides but it contains tons of informations.The online exams are very difficult, probably the hardest exams I've ever taken so far as a Freshman.

He really cares about his students and encourages office hours which are very helpful! Lectures are content heavy but he gives thorough answers to any questions. I had him in lab too and he was really understanding and willing to help when I didn't have the best lab group. His feedback is helpful and in-class projects were relevant and interesting.
He has a ton of office hours and really wants to talk to students. His lectures are engaging. The exams are difficult but reasonable. Overall he is a great professor.

Had him over E term and he was so easy-going/understanding that this was a summer course and wanted us to learn rather than be perfect. Go to class and show that you care, and you'll do great. Brodeur talks chemistry which is really a test if your paying attention so ASK QUESTIONS IF YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND!

Brodeur is seriously the best professor I have ever had. Make sure to attend lectures, take notes, and read the book to really understand the content. He is super friendly and has the cutest cate that comes on zoom everyday. I have never understood chemistry better than I do now. 8 am lectures are tough, but I actually stuck through them this term!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: I love him. Great man. Owns rainbow alpaca earrings. I had him for online lectures and his cat (Samantha) kept eating plants. You get a quiz each week (study with the worksheets he gives you), and two exams. So test heavy, but you should be fine. Tests and quizzes are fair (a few exceptions but it's okay we still love him).
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I received an NR taking chem 1020 with Brodeur, not the best professor by any standard. The tests were unnecessarily difficult and long. The final was cumulative, brags about how many students fail his course. Avoid taking chem 1020 with him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The only reason I pulled through 8 am chem this term was because Brodeur was the Professor. His explanations are very clear, the out of class quizzes were very representative of test material, and he has so many office hours so theres no reason you should ever not get a question answered. Would recommend for anyone taking CH1030!
Not the best when explaining topics but is a cool guy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Even though inorganic chem isn't an interest of mine, I didn't dread lectures because Prof Brodeur is really great! He is funny and respects his students. The textbook was hard to read and he didn't provide many practice problems before the test, but if you put in effort, maybe go to office hours the class is straight-forward.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Not a bad professor necessarily, but very hard course. I you do not have background Chem knowledge I would not recommend him. I had him for lab as well and he is a great lab prof. Tests were much too long to actually show that you have understanding. On every test there was a question I didn't have time to finish/start.

Brodeur is a good professor and teaching is straightforward and understandable, however the tests do not accurately reflect the learning because the tests are too long and have much more complex problems than we do in class or homework quizzes. While the workload is manageable, you have to study a lot before the tests to pass, so be prepared.

Brodeur is a great teacher, its just that this is a difficult class. He understands this and tries to help everyone out if they need it. He is chill too (he has an industrial piercing for god's sake and even cancels class on Wednesdays cause he feels lazy) but just beware of the killer workload and boredom in the lab. Work hard and it will be fine
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Absolute wonder, I've had brodeur for 3 terms now and he's great. Very understanding if you need to move tests around, and always willing to help. Open office door policy, so def stop in and ask questions. Says there's no curve, but there is at the end so don't panic

Really fun dude to have a class with. Tests aren't necessarily hard but they are long. The worksheets harder problem are a decent representation of what's on the exams. Because of the lengths of the exams, I would recommend doing the worksheets to get used to the questions. Grade is 25% Lab and 75%. No mandatory HW but still do the WS.

Good teacher, very friendly, however his tests are extremely difficult and it is hard to get an A. Your entire grade is based off four exams no homework is given so it is hard to know the type of questions on the test. He does administer worksheets each week however the questions rarely correlate to test questions.

Very caring and wonderful during office hours.  The class was very hard but he would work with you to understand the material if you went to him. Only knock is he said there would be a scale at the beginning of the term and there never was even though the average was a low C

Great lectures and outside help, organized, posted useful (optional) practice problems. Moved fast and tests were hard. Rarely had enough time and there were no curves. Grades super fast, is fair, and gives partial credit (thank god) TLDR: He's a good teacher with hard tests

Hilarious and nice professor. People might say he is a tough grader but it's not really true, he will try his best to give as much credits as he can while grading as long as your thought is right and you do write it out. Exams aren't hard as long as you understand all the concepts. One of the best professor in WPI and will definitely recommend him.
Excellent lectures. Very clear at explaining concepts. However, tests are very difficult and weighted heavily.
Prof. Brodeur is an awesome lecturer but your entire grade comes from 4 very difficult tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Brodeur is a great professor! Offers tons of office hours, lectures are pretty clear, and is very easy to get along with. Will know your name after talking to him once. Tests can be tricky, however. If you study, pulling a B or even an A in the class will be manageable. Highly recommend him; get him  for 1020 too. Labs stink though!
Very easy to approach! Is really willing to help students and is not trying to make anyone fail. :) Even after the class, he will still be ready to help with any other stuff like recommendations!
Great guy who is really willing to help. Incredibly clear in lecture and really helps you to understand the material well.

The Tests in any WPI CH1020 class are tough to get an A on b/c of the way the points are distributed, sounds weird but you'll see what I mean. Brodeur himself is the man, as he's a great lecture and his notes on the blackboard are helpful and  extremely easy to follow. If you need help he is more than willing. I would take him again in a heartbeat.

You could not ask for a better chem professor than Brodeur. He has TONS of office hours and is always there to help you. The tests are tough but manageable. He has a great sense of humor and is very easy to get along with. He literally memorizes everyone's name, its insane. I wish he taught the entire chem sequence. STRONGLY RECOMMEND!

Prof. Brodeur was a great! He is very clear in his lectures and doesn't mind answering any questions. He has office hours 2-3 times a week. There is no required hw for the class, but there are practice problems on myWPI that are very helpful for tests. Tests can long and somewhat difficult; just make sure you do the practice and you will be fine.
Brodeur's lecture is amazing, but his tests are pretty hard. I really like prof brodeur as a person he is very helpful. I wish he taught all 4 of the chem sequence
He rushes through things, is extremely rude, and a horrible teacher. Do not take this class.
His exams are pretty difficult but if you go to office hours, he explains the material in more depth and makes sure that you understand it.

I recommend Brodeur highly to my friends how have to take chemistry. I've had two classes with him, and he's my academic advisor. Knowledgeable and full of the enthusiasm that comes with a younger professor. Very sweet guy, very smart. I think his career will be quite successful.

Dr. Bro is exactly that. A bro. The class is tough, and he does his best to explain everything as best he can, and provides plenty of online practice material. I never went to his office hours  but those who went got the help they needed.

Professor Brodeur is a very nice person. He sparks your interest in the subject and explains clearly every new concept. However, speaks very fast and you will have to copy down everything that he is saying because he does not write down everything. Otherwise, he is excellent. Take him if you can

i had him for an insight advisor and he is now my academic advisor as well as being my chem teacher for chem 2 & 3. couldn't have asked for a better teacher, even signed up for 8ams just because i knew he would be teaching it... well worth it
Great guy who is always willing to help.  friendly outside of lectures and very helpful.
Best professor I have had! Challenging class but always willing to help. He's a super friendly guy and knows all his student's names. I definitely recommend taking CH1030 with him.

Great and interesting lecturer, he really made class enjoyable. Tests had trick questions, homework didn't count for much. Easy class to get a B in, but insanely difficult to get an A. Have to be near perfect to get an A and he wont curve even if scores are low. Plus he throws curveballs on the tests. Minus the grading, Great Professor
Awesome professor. I would want him as my FA if I was chem eng. He is the man.
good lecturer and nice guy, take CH 1020 with him if possible. He's awesome and teaches well

I loved this course, but I do not recommend taking it unless you are truly interested in chemistry. The topics are a little more challenging here, but the professor is always available to help and gives very good explanations.
He is very helpful and his tests are not designed to trick you. If you pay attention in lecture and you are willing to study, you won't have a problem getting an A in this course.

He is an amazing professor! His tests are very hard, though. He may test you on a topic he barely mentioned during his lecture. If you seek help during his office hours, he'll grade you easier on the exams. I recommend taking any of his classes.

The best chemistry teacher I have ever had. He really cares about his students and is very helpful if you have any questions.  The tests were a bit hard but easier then the Sapling Homework. Lectures were interesting and informative

This is the best professor I've had at WPI. He teaches in a very organized and logical fashion, can explain anything in understandable terms, and knows how to run a class overall. Take as many courses with him as possible!

Tests are not always the easiest but he is always willing to help students. I went to attend help sessions both one on one and in a group setting. If you listen and do all his suggested problems then his class gets easier! Great guy! Also very helpful in lab setting too

awesome professor, really interested in helping you. Lots of opportunities to get extra credit as long as you go to class. Highly recommend taking a class with him, he really cares about his students and their success.
Heineman was easily the best CS professor I've ever had. He shows genuine interest in the subject and his course reflects his desire to get his students to love it too.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Heineman is the absolute best professor I've ever had. He genuinely loves what he does, and it really shows through his teaching and how he cares for all his students. This was definitely a tough course with a big workload, but he always tries to help in any way he can, so if you put in the effort, you will learn a lot from him.

One of the greatest professors around for this field. If you ever get a chance, take one of his courses. And take it seriously. The material is no joke but my god he's the most down to Earth, thoughtful professor I've ever had. Anytime you have a question, he's got the answer within minutes. He truly cares about his profession and his students.
Amazing professor, friendly respectful, extremely helpful for students struggling, is usually available online late into the night.
By far the best CS professor I have had. Explained everything very well, and would spend countless hours making sure he could help his students.
Competent in both the material and pedagogy. He is a really good professor and he cares a lot about what he does.
Professor Heineman really cares about his students and will always help quickly and thoroughly. He explains content extremely well in lectures.

Professor Heineman is a rare combination of a wonderful person and a good teacher. His passion for the subject and his interest in helping students learn was evident in every lecture and assignment, and I don't think I would have made it through something as hard as softeng without his incredible thoughtfulness and awareness of student needs.
Best CS course I've had a wpi. I really learned a lot.

Heineman will gave you a fantastic appreciation for algorithms and CS in general, but be prepared to work hard. The homework is time-consuming and thought-provoking. Lectures are interesting. Exams are medium-level difficulty if you're prepared. Really cool guy and gives music selections to listen to while doing the work.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Definitely the best CS prof I've ever had. He gets to know each student, is really clear about grading criteria and what's going to be on the quizzes, and is extremely helpful. The class is a lot of work and it's tough but I learned a lot from him.

Prof. Heineman is the BEST CS professor I have ever had. His lectures are recorded. He has quizzes each Friday (lowest one being dropped) and has practice quizzes in class that are almost exactly the quiz. Never struggled in this class. Very easy with giving back points when TAs grade things too harshly or incorrectly. Take with him if possible!

One of the best CS professors at WPI. Goes above and beyond to help outside of the classroom if you need it. Exams are tough but usually aren't weighed too heavily. You definetely have to put in effort to get an A.

One of the best professors I've had. He is very helpful, and his passion for the material is contagious. Gives very clear explanations, but expects you to work very hard. Expect to work for about 10-20 hours outside the class hours, so plan accordingly.  Would take him for any CS course in a heartbeat.
Asks open ended questions, does not give credit even if you give correct answer just because it is not the answer he is looking for. If possible take it with someone else.

very good professor, very clear what he is doing and cares about student. Follow his instructions step by step. Pay attention to the points he made on the class. Not hard to pass, put effort will get an A.
Learned a lot in this class and the project was interesting!

Professor Heineman really likes to talk, and read. He explains his stuff very well though sometimes uses more words than needed. Projects are really interesting and I've learned a lot. He's always there for help and could easily answer your questions. Nice guy!

Very, VERY down-to-earth with lectures and relates in-class material to real-world examples. Made the Non-majors class easier to understand and very clearly knows what he's doing. He's also very accommodating to unforeseen events.

One of the best teachers around.  Made CS interesting and easy to learn. Wants his student to succeed and is always available in office hours and online at night. Hard course, but with hard work and effort you can achieve an A.

Best professor I've ever had. So helpful, makes himself very available including holding on-line office hours. Course work is difficult and you have to work in the class but he does everything he can to help you.

non majors class is too hard. He's so intelligent that it's difficult to teach CS to ppl who have most likely NEVER touched CS. He is a great lecturer, and is very clear. But if you are not paying total attention he will freak out on you. Nice guy otherwise. Tests are too hard

He is a very good professor.  He knows what he is talking about, the only thing is he made the non majors class too hard.  The work load for the class was heavy and the exams were very challenging.  He is very nice however.
Does a good job, only down side is that the workload is uneven throughout the term (more so than most courses).
I had him for Java in B term freshman year. He is a good teacher, but can be a little difficult at times. He is now my advisor and is very helpful with classes etc.

George Heineman was the best professor I've had. Was on AOL Instant Messenger until 3 AM before test days, and at least until midnight every weekday. Always willing to help debug code, and threw candy at us for Halloween. Apparently he debugged code in the morning lecture, but by the afternoon all his code was perfect. Take a Heineman course.
Excellent professor. Clearly experienced in conveying complicated topics in lecture. Easy HW and exams.
definitely like him. an enthusiastic professor!

He is a great teacher who can communicate complicated topics very well.  He does give out a lot of work and the homework is generally really long.  He designs his class so that you get out what you put in.  This makes it hard to get an A (he really makes you work for it) but overall, he's a very effective teacher
Makes you work for your 'A' but its definitely feasible...
Expects far too much for an intro class, and I took it as a Junior!  HW and labs are really long.  It's not too hard to pass the course, but VERY hard to get an A
he's brilliant! and awesome...

Yes, honestly I believe he is the most sincere, sensible, understanding, organized and clever professor around WPI. His lectures are fun and I can never forget the Indiana Jones stunt he pulled off one day...in general class is not the easiest - it takes a while to get used to his pace (of teaching and talking!) but its worth it! You learn a LOTT!!

I took him for Java in B04.  The class was quite difficult, but I really respect Heineman.  He obviously cared, was knowledgeable, and was approachable and helpful.  Text was nearly esoteric and useless for me.  I did end up getting a B, but my average was 65, if that tells you anything about the difficulty.  People passed that class with 48's.

Professor Heineman is the man.  His class was very entertaining, and it was fairly apparent that he put massive amounts of effort into the class.  He is very passionate about Object Oriented Programming, and he tries to pass that passion onto his students.  He even gave the best students a project instead of a final to give them a challencge.  A+.

A good professor who I learned much better from than the book for Java.  However, he often loses a godo deal of the class during examples of code because he makes changes and assumes we know exactly why he did it.  However, if you ask questions about what he did, he usually explains it well.  Also a very friendly and fun professor.

I had this guy for a class back in the 90's.  It was horrible.  The sole purpose for the class (on his end) was to gather material to write a book or paper or something.  It was an easy class, he dished out articles for us to read, then we'd sit in class and talk and HE would take notes.  I didn't learn a single thing, though.

Best teacher i had at WPI hands down.  Andwers questions well, great projects (they arent hard if you listen to what he wants).  Also probably two of the few classes that has helped me since i graduated.  Awesome!
Good professor, but relies on powerpoint too much. Kind of hard to please with the projects too.
Good professor overall. Sometimes goes too fast through the material and calls on the same people in class all the time, but he's always online and available to answer questions.

He was very good.  He got the concepts across and also joked around sometimes.  He responded on the boards very quickly on days when homework was due.  He expects you to know what you are doing and to put forth effort to get an A.  He also had us fill in blank Dilbert cartoons on exams.

Very good professor. Is ALWAYS online to help students who have questions, especially when homework is almost due or a test is coming up. He actually reads the feedback he gets from students and evolves with it. Its an easy class to pass, but hard to get high grades.

A very smart guy, however does not explain things in depth and goes quite fast through the material at the beginning. If you are not prepared to put a lot of work in it, do not take him cause you will not do fine. He also talks quite fast and is sometimes hard to follow
No Comments
He leaves alot of details to be determined - just like real work. He teaches a great class, and it's a great intro to the real working world. Be prepared to work hard and learn alot.

Probably the best teacher i have ever had. He is so awesome. Knows his stuff down pat and is really concerned about the students knowledge. If you want to actually learning CS, get him. If you want to sleep, go with professor Wong.
Knows his stuff, but caters to the higher end students and isn't open much to helping the rest.
Soft Eng w/ him was probably the best class I took. The project was very hard, but so worth while. An amazing man.

Most of the time, he would just throw one question after another, without getting anywhere, but only confusing you even more. Gave too much attention to nonsense students to talk, and wasted all our time. Didnt learn anything about SE the whole sememster.
the best cs teacher ive had.
Fun guy with fun projects.
excellent CS professor for an excellent CS school
Does not care about the class failing. Does not teach. Lectures don't cover material on exams and he does not go through examples. Study guides are not helpful.
Tests are not as bad as people say they are. Not very good at teaching the material (lecture "sides" are about 40+ years old). Pretty much everything I learned came by way of the textbook.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Worst teacher I've ever experienced. Homework is graded on accuracy so you can't make mistakes and yet preaches that u only learn by struggling. Could care less if the entire class failed his exams. Told us it was OUR faults for not studying (average was in the 40s) ?? Lectures are horrible, study guides are useless & just say read the textbook.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Be prepared to teach yourself everything. Inaccessible outside of class. Blames students for failing. Not caring. Egotistical. Tests cover nothing taught. Useless lectures with simple examples leaving students to teach themselves the stuff covered on exams that he couldn't bother to explain. If you have him as a professor: run. Take it another term
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Horrible professor. Blames the 51% average on the students not on his inability to teach. Inaccessible outside of class because "he does not have time because he is busy with the class and teaching another", yet all he does is lecture (poorly) 3 times a week while TAs and mastering physics do the work for him. Unempathetic human and does not care.
Worst Professor Ive ever had. All he does is draw examples. No words or definitions to look back on

The quizzes were INSANELY difficult. I was getting high 90s on the homeworks and averaged around a 55 on the quizzes (which are a majority of the grade). He's inaccessible outside of class and the lectures themselves were difficult to understand. I can't speak for the other options but I do not recommend Professor Quimby.

Had him for PH1120 online for D term 2021. Worst professor I've ever had in my life. Teaches nothing and has ridiculously hard tests. Posts videos discussing test results that basically make fun of the students and says things like "I'm glad the average is a 40%, that makes it easier to grade". Made me question why I spend so much money to be @WPI.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Quimby's lectures do not relate to the homework or quiz content. Homework problems aren't too bad, but when it comes to quizzes, don't be surprised if you fail. The problems on the quizzes barely relate to the lectures and homework content and cannot be found in the review problems he gives to us. Avoid this class at all costs!

Quimby is unwilling to help students learn. He will tell you the textbook he wrote is not mandatory, because if he told you the truth it would be a conflict of interest. The material covered is not complex, he just gives little to no guidance. Lectures are useless.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Great lectures and great personality.

PRO: There are four exams. He provides study guides for each exam. He provides practice exam which is very similar to that of the real one. Get exams back fairly quickly. Partial credit on exam. Gives most of the equations for exam. Conference good for practice problem CON: lectures can be boring and not make sense or not help. Doesn't use canvas

His lectures don't go through how to do the problems (conferences are used for that purpose). He clearly cares about people learning, but answers every question had in lecture, so some material is skimmed through more than it should be. 3 Exams are 70% of the grade, and rather difficult with not much partial credit, but the class is curved usually.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very excited about physics, but spends too much time on derivations instead of problem solving, especially since his exams are almost all problem solving. Still, very nice guy who will explain a lot to you and is very excited about his field. HW is online and can be frustrating. The textbook is only ok (his lectures were better than it).

He spends a lot of time in class deriving the equations you will use on the tests. HW questions are sometimes hit or miss, and he does very little in lectures to actually tell you how to solve some of them. Tests are DIFFICULT.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's a cute old guy but doesn't really know how the internet works. Doesn't use canvas, not even for grades. Syllabus is unclear about how much everything weighs. Have the HW is turned in during lecture but the mastering physics you get points off for every wrong answer. Writes on chalkboard instead of projector and doesn't post good notes online.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: The lectures felt useful until you went and did the homework and realized he was absolutely useless. Going to office hours isn't helpful either because he'll probably just tell you that you aren't "thinking about physics the right way." Absolutely useless, avoid if you can.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Worst professor. Literally unhelpful, insisted you do are irrelevant and difficult extra problems before he tries to help you  during office hours. Lectures are useless but you have to go because it is mandatory. All he does is derive equations, does not actually teach the concepts which makes homework impossible. Avoid if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY
