comment: Okay, I want to get honest here. He isn't hot. He's weird looking. The only way to pass is to cheat by typing your not allowed note sheet on your over priced TI-84. Get ready to suck his you know to get an A in his class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: never really went to his class but he gave us practice exams almost identical to the actual. homeworks are short. textbook can be found as a free pdf & i really only needed it to make up for never attending class
Professor gave really good analogies and made abstract topics seem very tangible.  I truly enjoyed this course.  Try to get him for conference; people in his conference always do better on tests.
He offers no help or understanding at all. Avoid him if possible. It is a waste of time to have conversations with him.

Always take notes because you need them for doing homework. The homework is not hard if you try MIT homework under the same topics. :) You need to do extra problems and read Morin if you want to score high in exams.  The professor is enthusiastic about the material, and what he teaches in class can always help.

He is really polite, has good graders, and grades the tests himself. He teaches with interest, is really respectful to students, and allows students to take a picture of the board, in case they don't want to copy down the notes (i.e., he's pretty chill).
Quimby's lectures and conferences are quite good. His exams are fair (they are on the covered material) but are quite difficult. He is very unhelpful in office hours and through email.

Lectures not particularily helpful or interesting, I had him for conference and he was very helpful as conference instructor, His exams are not difficult if you do all the suggested problems on the study guides, tests dont come from practice exams, pretty fair exams overall, BEST physics instructor for PH 1120 Ive had so far... for physics that is

The exams are so much harder than any practice exam or problem that he has you do. He gives hw on topics that he will cover in lecture the day that the hw is due so there will be times when you don't know how to do the hw and it's because he hasn't even talked about it in lecture yet. Pray for a good conference prof.
His lectures are not hard to follow, but the tests are nothing like the material covered in class or in the book. Everyone fails the class and prays for a big curve. Avoid this class at all costs.

An easy professor depending on how you approach the class. His lectures were okay, nothing spectacular. I stopped going to them. I simply read the book and went through each example by hand and was able to do the homeworks. You may as well do that for lecture. Study his practice tests as well and you'll be all set.
interesting lectures but his tests are completely different than the problems you do in class. you dont use the book at all but it helps understand the topic a little more
interesting lectures but his tests are completely different than the problems you do in class. try and take this course with another professor if you can

I will say this: Do not take Mechanics with Professor Quimby, but I would highly recommend him for Photonics. His lectures are interesting and he definitely has a passion for the material.  He relies heavily on his book for this class, and for once a professor's book is easy to understand and has formulae clearly outlined. A vast improvement!

Professor Quimby's class is unnecessarily hard. He makes you feel like you're learning something in lecture, but when you do the homework (which is nigh impossible), you realize his lectures weren't helpful (you'll be missing formulae/problem solving methods) Book (Morin) is useless as well (Examples are glazed over). Very disappointing overall.

Quimby doesn't prepare students for exams well. He barely does examples in class, only derives formulas that we don't know how to apply. He's pretty useless. Had to learn everything from the TA or on my own.

Test problems are either completely different or 100 times harder than any examples done previously. Homework is impossible when quimby teaches the material the next day (and inadequately). 2 days before the test, he starts material for the next test instead of covering the material that everyone needs help with for the test in 2 days.
I got an A in physics E&M, not because I understand anything about electricy or magnetism (I still don't), but because I can do basic algebra. Not a good prof.

Thought he taught ok until the tests...what was taught in lecture, conference, or assigned in the hws does not adequately prepare you for them. Best not to have him, take the class with another prof if possible.
This class was ridiculous. I could not understand word he said because he never explained anything he did. He was very unwilling to help me.
this instructor is like if meenkus from boy meets world grew up and became a professor.
I know all his comments are bad, but I think he's one of the best physics profs i've had.  He understands things very well and he's good at answering questions.
Horrible teacher... I think he would rather be doing research than teaching..

Quimby sucks as a professor. He feels that he can teach E+M through powerpoint and barely any examples. He uses integrals all the time, even though the class doesn't require Calc 2. Most of the class is always lost and test questions are unexpected (since he doesn't believe in sample tests).
mayor quimby is a bad mayor. richard quimby is a bad professor. avoid like the plague
Get a good conference teacher or else GOODLUCK
Nice guy, average professor.  He seems very smart, like he has to struggle to explain something simple enough for students to understand.

Not a great teacher. I think his obsession with powerpoint is poorly implemented. They make his class less interesting, but if you dont go to the class, the PP slides alone aren't enough to understand. Try for a good conf teacher if you have to have Quimb
He really has a hard time explaning anything so you can understand, if you want to do good you need to do alot of work on your own!  Really is useless for teaching, esp for conference.
No Comments
Quimby's terrible just because he assumed everyone had time to do lots of exercises. I had two other courses which were making me busy as it is... He needs to be more considerate about that.
Worst physics prof ever! gives no sample quizzes, Q&A's, or any help at all for the exams. quimby should ever be allowed to teach physics!
His lectures are so boring, makes it so hard to stay awake
Both courses I had with him were exactly the same lecture style. Pre-printed lecture notes he just goes over in class. Very dull and sleep inducing. If he lectured properly, would be a good teacher.

everything from the instructor "professor" was horrifically horrible. the instructors explanation of lab lecture is brief but terrible. THE INSTRUCTOR DOESN'T HELP AT ALL WHEN ASKED A QUESTION. the instructor doesn't hear well. the instructor sometimes answers furiously at a student and threatens to kick students, who paid for the course, out .
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The class is a lot of work. He is a very good professor, but doesn't believe in partial credit, and there is a lot of room to make errors on his exams. With that said, he does show you exactly what he wants to see you do on tests. Basically if you can memorize a whole textbook you'll be good. He also does not scale his tests or the class in general
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had Professor Pavlik for Organic Chemistry almost 25 years ago (as well as other undergrad and grad courses). He was an excellent teacher. Many complained that his grading, but I found it to be fair and easy to do well in his class if you put in the work. He is one of the main reasons that I stayed in the chemistry field. He was inspirational.

Professor Pavlik is undoubtedly one of the most dedicated professors I have ever had a class with. However, he will not stand for students who don't go home and "do their homework" before asking for help. Prepare for a good chide if you ask him an unclear question. Lectures  are clear-cut. HW is representative of tests and quizzes. Allows model use

People say that pavliks class is SUPER HARD. it is not. Despite the fact that he can be picky in terms of grading, pavlik is a very good professor (if nt the best for orgo). He makes orgo very interesting and easy to understand. If you do all of his assigned problem set n read his lecture notes, you dont need the textbook to get an A in the class.

Pavlik was an amazing professor, just a very tough grader. Fantastic teacher and tells you on Day 1 what his expectations are. Does not give many A's, but if you work hard, anything is possible. While this class has a stigma for being challenging, I found myself really enjoying what I'm learning even if the grading was rough. DON'T FORGET DASHES!
This professor is excellent. His class is difficult to receive a good grade in, but you will learn a lot from him.

So there's a super stigma about how hard his class is. His class is really not that hard, it's just very direct. His grading is very precise, which I guess is why people might not do well in his class. However; I liked his method of teaching because it was very systematic and clear.

Best professor I've had so far. He expects the very most out of his students so in order to do well you need to try extremely hard, and possibly harder than you thought was even possible. You will learn a lot and it will be well worth the effort.
does not give partial credit and very picky at what he believes to be the correct answer. very rude to students who went to office hours with questions about their test  quiz
Follow his directions and work hard, don't think of any way to be lazy and you'll succeed in his class. Favorite professor
Best teacher at WPI by far. Very tough and demanding, but very clear on expectations. Holds multiple review sessions every week and is very willing to help.
Requires a lot of commitment & studying, but overall an amazing professor!

Best professor I've ever had. Very demanding but his expectations are clear from the start. Great lecturer. His class is engaging and funny, and I look forward to it every day. It's been said that he doesn't give partial credit but I've gotten it a couple of times. If you do the problem sets and go to class every day (yes, EVERY day) you'll do well

I took orgo 1 and spectroscopy with him. He's super picky, you really have to get everything perfect. This means that people that can't handle that level of quality will fail his classes. You need to work hard and study hard to do well. Don't take the bitter people to seriously, he's a smart guy who is nice if you prove you're worth his time.
You will learn Orgo like the back of your hand.  You will NOT get a decent grade...assuming that you even pass which is literally a 50/50 chance every term.

I had Prof. Pavlik and he taught me to love Organic Chem, more than 15 years ago.  He was the best professor I EVER HAD.  Do the homework, go to class, and learn more than most people forget about organic chem.

Hated him through out the term, but after leaving and having a different Orgo professor, I realized just how much I learned from him and how great of a professor he really is.  Definitely take his class.  Be prepared to work hard (and maybe endlessly), but it will pay off in the end.

nobody gives this guy enough credit. his tests come right from the homework, and you only get partial credit if you deserve it. he's very clear about what he expects from his students and how exactly they can achieve that. i got a b in orgo 1 with him and was incredibly proud of it; i'm hoping for a b this term too.

You love him or hate him. I learned much more from his class than most, and I enjoyed it. Go to class and the review sessions and keep up with the problems sets, and you'll be perfectly fine. The material isn't hard, but there's a lot. He teaches in a straightforward way that was easy to learn from, though he did contradict himself a few times.

hands down the worst professor ever. he doesnt give partial credit.i instantly realized id need help, he was snotty when i asked him for help. i attended everyday and did every possible form of review and was getting 50s on tests and 10-15s on quizzes. this class screwed up my whole college plan and raped my financial aid. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

People don't give pavy enough credit; if you ever sit down and talk with him, he'll be the first to admit to you that he doesn't know everything. He's very easy to get along with as long as you are willing to learn from him. His sense of humor is very dry, but if you can see that he is joking it's hilarious. If you see him, stop and pick his brain.
No Comments

Asocial old guy who puts way too much into the course for a term, doesnt help, LOST MY TEST and wouldnt let me challenge the grade, then was noticably harder on grading me after i challenged him on losing my test.  this guy shouldnt be teaching, he doesnt care about students at all

A very difficult class.  The hardest class I've ever taken at WPI.  Most important part:  HE DOESN'T GIVE PARTIAL CREDIT.  This in itself sucks, but if you miss a quiz, he only gives you one time to make it up, and if you can't, too bad for you.  I wish I could neer take him again.
Very hard to please, but very clear with his expectations, which are often too high for undergrads... needs to work on his people skills!

Yes, the **** knows his stuff- but I would hope so, considering he's been teaching it FOREVER.  But- he really deserves a negative value rating for helpfulness- he only helps complete ass kissers, and even then- not that much.  ONE WORD: SATAN.

Extremely hard. He teaches well, and knows exactly what he is talking about. Quizzes and tests for the most part are similar to what has been done on the homework, but he gives no partial credit, or very little at the end of the course. Tiny mistakes can mean a failing grade. Good prof, but needs to ease up on the grading. Good luck.
total jerk! can't teach, doesn't know subject - WPI needs a new chem department with 100% new people
No Comments
never sit in the front row, and dont go questioning your test scores

BEST PROFESSOR EVER.  Changed my major, changed my life.  Sure, you have to go to class and do work, but why else are you in college.  Oh, right, beer.  I tried that approach the first time I took Orgo, and it didn't work.  The second time, when I did it Pavlik's way, I learned and I loved it.  Turned me into a chemist.  BEST PROF. EVER.
I only have one thing to say: "ccccouuuuuuuuuugghghhhhhhhhh"  Boo to Pavlik
No Comments

Good at explaining the basics of the material and gives fair quizzes, however, he makes a point of putting the most diffcult problems on the test, seemingly with the gleeful intent of seeing how many people he can trick

He is a great professor.  Everyone complains that there is no partial credit but with this material the answer is either right or wrong (for the most part). If you go to class and do the problem sets, you'll be fine.  He is very organized and clear and offers lots of help sessions.

going to class every day helps, but dont rely on the notes to help you out on the tests that much. tests and quizzes are hard esp. when he throws a 20 point question in as a trick where only like 3 people got what it was asking. he goes over the easy stuff like crazy but leaves out the hard stuff

Probably the best prof I've had here. Very difficult, but I learned more in his class than in any other class I've ever had. Tests are difficult, but if you do the problem sets over and over and don't get sick, you'll be okay. Lots of help if you need it, but can get moody. Outstanding lecturer.

Orgo I, Exp III, & Advanced Orgo - Pavlik is awesome. There is something about his approach to teaching that at first scared me in to doing well, but in the end made me appreciate the material. I respect him and his approach to teaching. So suck it up and do the work, its worth it!!!

Hard, but a very good professor. If you do his assignments you should have no trouble passing.  And if you do well, he's very nice.  Just show that you want to learn and he will help you.  You don't like him or his class...he won't like you.Simple as that
This man has a heart of stone.
Clear expectations
Pavlik is the man.  His antics are great and he makes class interesting.  Pavlik's not mean, he just has a confident and boisterous tone in his voice.  Best lecturer I know.
What a jack***  No partial credit, but he explains things very well.  If you're going to miss a class TALK TO HIM BEFOREHAND, otherwise good lucking getting a make up test.

Extremely hard professor.  No partial credit.  If you ask him to regrade a test because you think you should get more credit .. regrades whole thing and actually takes away points.  Very harsh teacher and not very friendly.  My least favorite class/prof.
He really is evil and boring, but unfortunately he does get the information across well. How can someone so rude and cold be so effective at teaching?
He's not that mean in person, he just has a hearing problem, so he ends up misunderstanding you and getting pissed off.
He is tough, but you will learn more chemistry from him than any other professor.  If you slack, you're done in his classes, so simply keep up with the material.
He never learned how to act like a Prof; don't insult your students. Undeserving of any respect.
he's as mean in person as he is in class
A teacher with a heart of stone, but there is much to learn from him...
The man is horribly mean and doesn't care about the students

Overall a wonderful professor! Lectures were engaging and easy to follow. Tests were manageable and heavily based on homeworks and example problems from class. He's very easy to reach outside of class and truly wants students to succeed.

Professor Kafle is great. I am terrible at physics, hence the C, but his lectures and explanations were very helpful for me to understand the material. He is also very funny and overall a charismatic person. He clearly cares about each of his students, even in such a large lecture.

He was great. He explains the topics well and is very funny. The class was very enjoyable and was informative. Late work is accepted mostly, and he is very fast to respond on email. His accent is a little hard to understand but it is manageable. I never looked at the textbook but did have to purchase the online version for access to the homework.

Prof. Kafle made learning E&M a breeze! His lectures were always very comprehensive and understandable, and once you get used to his accent is isn't at all difficult to follow the lectures. He clearly knows a lot and is passionate about physics.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Had him A21, not gonna lie this class is tough as an incoming freshman, but Rudra is a great instructor with great slides. Homework is on Pearson unfortunately, and there are also worksheets for discussion. His class is usually the big one in SL115, so it may be tough if you're struggling but he has plenty of office hours.

One of my favorite professors. Rudra is so caring and wants every student to get an A in the class. He is always available after class. His lectures are great and I learned a lot in his class. The only negative about Rudra is that he doesn't answer his emails so message him through canvas.
He truly cares about all of his students and will try to learn everyones name. He has a ton of office hours outside of class if you need help. Very high energy.
He was pretty good and made lots of time for out of class help if I needed it. His lectures could wander sometimes but were pretty fun the whole time and the material covered was pretty good.
The most wonderful man. Makes class entertaining and interacts with students even during lectures.

Had Prof. Kafle for my 1120 discussion. He is the only reason I am doing okay in physics. He was our TA for the class but you could tell he cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Take him if you have the opportunity.
He is absolutely amazing. Loves teaching, loved helping students
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I took Mechanics with Rudra in A term and while his class was pretty difficult I did enjoy it. Sure Mastering made me want to pull my hair out, but thats not exactly his fault lol. Hes a good teacher, knows his stuff, and he genuinely cares about his students. He learned most of our names out of everybody in a 140 person lecture hall.

He isn't the best lecturer, so the class can be hard if you don't come in with any prior knowledge on the subject. There are lots of different things you are graded on and lots of opportunities for extra credit, so it is easy to do well in the class even if you don't do well on the tests.

He's friendly and nice, but he didn't teach the course in a way in which I could grasp it very well. Tests are hard and there was lots of homework. It's definitely not a walk in the park, but you can manage it if you work for it.

Professor Rudra clearly cares about his students and his work. He is amazing and you can tell he loves what he does. Though for me personally this was a difficult class purely because if you miss a date the lectures are not well recorded. Its very hard to hear and this makes it challenging. Otherwise hes amazing and i would highly recommend.

Great professor, did his best to remember every student's name in a full lecture hall. Funny guy and truly tries to get everyone to understand the concepts as best he can. The tests and homework are fairly difficult, but nothing outside of what's covered in class.

Professor Kafle is funny, really wants his students to succeed, and is always available after class for questions. However, 1.5-3 hours of homework problems are due the same day on the lecture's topic. Additionally, little to no examples are done during class. Exams were difficult, but he assigned specific study guides which were helpful for those.

I took PH1110 with Rudra, and it was super difficult, but I definitely learned a lot. This was one of the hardest classes that I have had to take, but Rudra was such a nice professor, and genuinely cared about students, and loved seeing students at office hours, and always made an effort to help students, even after regular school hours to help.

Professor Rudra will often use condescending language and make students feel patronized. He strongly encourages students to reach out for help but yet, does not take feedback well at all and gives hardly any room on passing the course if you simply cannot understand him or the content. I find it hard to ask for help.

Absolutely one of my favorite professors I have ever had. He made lectures really fun to attend and was great at explaining the course concepts. He got to know each and every student in the courses and ensured that we all understood the material. He is a real gem and I wish I could have had him in every class!

Huge number of problem sets with extremely difficult (multi day) problems, and yet 50% of the grade is 2 exams? Extremely unbalanced grading that makes no sense. I wanted to talk to him about it, but he's not good at receiving feedback.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I had him for a project advisor and it was terrible. We were given practically no direction throughout the school year and then told to do well about a week before it was due so that he would look good. Incredibly rude and clearly has the wrong priorities.

I had Rudra for physics 1110 conference. One of the funniest dudes ive ever met. Despite being remote, he made the class extremely engaging, cracked jokes, and honestly made learning so fun. Difficult class but I got an A because of how invested he was in his students learning. All of the upperclassmen rave about him. That speaks on its own.....!!!
Really good teacher, easy to understand. Only things that count are homework and quizzes

Amazing professor. Took other physics courses and he was the most clear and caring professor I've had. He seriously cares about his students. He simply wants them to understand, learn and succeed. He gave 3 conference sessions and recorded the lectures, and he was available for scheduled and unscheduled office hours. Amazing person! 100% suggested
One of the best physics professor in WPI.
He's just great. Very happy and funny and just wants everyone to succeed.

The homework is simple, lectures are useful, notes are online, he tries to learn all of his students' names, he loves participation, and he is hilarious. Rudra wants us to call him by his first name despite being a doctor. He is a genuinely great guy.
This guy is funny, caring and his lectures are awesome.
Love him. Best professor I've ever had. Made me consider switching to a physics major. Was always accessible and takes it upon himself to make sure you understand his course.

Amazing professor, one of the best physics professors or professors alone you probably will ever have. He was so good that I waitlisted myself on 3 of his B term classes to ensure that I got him a second time. If you can take Rudra's class, take it. About 45-60% of grade is exams. He cares about each one of his students. He's a must take.

Rudra is a phenomenal professor. He cares about each student's success and is determined to help students master the material. I took his class for studio physics. The style of the class wasn't great but he's phenomenal at lecturing.

Rudra (which he tells us to call him that) is a very, very caring person who wants to personally make sure that everyone succeeds. He is easy enough to understand despite an accent. He is pretty good at lecturing and uses demos whenever possible to help you learn. Sometimes he gets too carried away and has to speed thru his final slides, however.
Rudra is the best professor ever. Anyone who does not have him is missing out.

He's very funny and his lectures and tries very hard to make sure we all understand the material. There is a lot of homework for the class, but it's very helpful to do it and get practice for the tests. Physics can be a really tough class for some people, but he helps make it fun and interesting.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Rudra is the best professor I have ever had. He really cares about his students and wants to make sure each and everyone of them understand the material that is being covered. He makes lectures fun and engaging. If you can take a class with him you definitely should cause you will learn a lot.
Always looking to help. Very enthusiastic and caring about his students. Very reasonable.

Rudra is hands down the best professor I've had. He is so high energy, and really hilarious during lectures which keeps you engaged. His personality is what makes the class great. If you don't have a good background in physics, you may struggle, but read the book and you'll be ok. Some topics are glossed over because "at WPI we fly."

It can take a short while to get used to his speed and presentation style, but Rudra was a great professor. He's very engaging, accessible, funny, and definitely cares about your success. He'll high five you if you answer questions in lecture and try his hardest to remember your name in those big lectures. Definitely a good professor to have.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Rudra is so funny and a great teacher. Offers a lot of extra help with office hours and is really willing to help students who don't understand. Provides a lot of study material and most of the time the study guides are harder than the actual test. Posts the powerpoint slides online but you definitely need to attend to understand the material
He provides fun lectures and looks out for his students best interests. Wants you to succeed.

The most caring professor I've ever met. He's amazingly supportive and cares about each and every student. Definitely take Rudra's class if given the chance. The material isn't the easiest of classes but he will take the time to explain all of it.

He's great! I stopped going to actual lectures from a different professor because I learned more during conference. The practice problems he has on his google page are incredibly helpful and if you can do them, you'll be fine on tests. And if you don't he was always approachable and willing to help.
He's actually fantastic.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Rudra is awesome. There is no words to describe how precious he is. He really cares for his students and is willing to help you whenever. HIs exams are not that difficult and are straightforward. He does not try to trick you in anything.   Beware he may call on you in lecture if he knows your name. He loves students to participate.
"Fantastic I LOVE THAT ANSWER, HIGH FIVE"

Rudra is by far my favorite professor I've had at WPI. He uses a lot of powerpoints, which can be good or bad depending on you as a learner. However, he is hilarious and makes learning physics fun. He is so passionate and cares about you. Go to his office hours and make sure he knows your name- he won't forget it. Love this guy. Really relatable.

He is an amazing professor! His lectures are interactive. You don't get bored in his class.  He is very helpful outside the class as well. He encourages students to ask questions and attend office hours. The homework and book are very helpful for the exam. Would take the class again.
He was always very energetic during lecture and genuinely cared about how students were doing, a very good teacher.
Prof Rudra is super passionate about the class, everyone loves him. He is fair in grading.

By far the best professor I've ever had. He's funny and he truly cares about student feedback. All you have to do is ask and he'll go out of his way to make sure you get an A. A lot of homework but all of it is directly relevant to the test. Practice exams are very similar to the real test so if you do well on them you'll be fine!

Fantastic: best professor I've ever had. Had him for a conference instructor. Probably would have gotten a low B or high C in that class, but with his help got a solid A. Definitely most interesting and engaged professor I've ever had. If you have a chance to take a class with him, DO IT!!

Kathi teaches at Brown University now and she is a great professor! Super passionate, genuinely cares about students and she cracks a couple of funny jokes every now and then. She puts an incredible amount of effort into teaching and she explain concepts well. Autograder was a little confusing and so was getting used to general structure of class.

This was by far the worst class I had taken at WPI. It seems not a single class passed by without Fisler saying "Oh but don't worry about such and such thing we'll learn that in two weeks." The class was also so poorly run. The autograding software never worked; it made the whole class a hassle. Avoid if at all possible.
Caring.
Well-spoken and clear on expectations.  Always willing to help and listen to students' concerns, even in large lectures.

Her grading is a little hard to follow, and the auto-grading hiccups from time to time. Regardless she's very willing to help and will try to fix everything. Homework is quite challenging, so office hour and the online forum are your friends. The exams are not too difficult. Old exams are posted but not all of them have answer keys. Caring prof

Fisler is awesome! The grading scheme is a bit odd, but I ended up liking it by the end. She had a ton of TAs and a forum where students can ask questions and get quick responses.  Her notes are great and she posts them online (along with any code discussed in class).  She always seems really prepared and is ready to answer any questions

The grading scheme is whack.  Just stick it out and you will be fine.  The back end of the course is loaded with points.  She has a huge class, but manages to have a fair bit of personal interaction.  AVOID OFFICE HOURS LIKE THE PLAGUE.  They are always overcrowded.  She does answer the discussion board fast, so ask questions there if possible.

Has a confusing grading system.  Help sessions were always too crowded to where sometimes students had to wait close to an hour for help but she didn't take any action towards that until near the end of the term.  She also assigned homework on midterm and finals week which honestly limits exam studying time a lot.

Actually good at helping students understand concepts, which was especially important for working with Java. Her grading scheme is kind of lunacy and you'll think you're failing for half the class, but stick it out and you'll probably get an A.

Professor Fisler is an exceedingly kind and helpful professor. Even teaching a class of over 200 students, she makes and effort (and succeeds) to learn every student's name. This term she implemented a new grading system that helps students understand where their gaps are, and she does her best to make sure every student can fill those gaps.
She's really helpful if you don't understand the topic, and really knows what she is talking about. She is also very enthusiastic about what she teaches.
great professor

She would be an outstanding professor if he she did not have one fatal flaw: her zealotry for Scheme.  She believes that Scheme is the apex of computer lanagauges and is the best language for all purposes (at least that is how she acts).  Make sure you are very proficient in Scheme before you take any of her courses.

Familiar with her from 1000 and 3000 levels where she filled in when the prof was out, she's very helpful and cheerful even in the face of agonizingly difficult topics or when a student just doesn't get something. She knows her stuff. Very fair and will work with you if you need help!

Fantastic professor! Although the subject was grueling, Kathi really knows what she's talking about and makes the lectures interesting. She's always available during office hours and even on her own time, and is extremely helpful. I would take a class with her again anytime.

A very good professor. She understands what the students are going through and is incredibly helpful if you have a question. Sometimes she even offers optional lectures on advanced subjects if there is enough interest--and she does this on her own time. If you have the chance, take a class with Professor Fisler. You won't regret it!

She was really clear in lecture and class was always interesting. Scheme isn't optimal, but it gets really interesting, especially toward the end. Web/Script stuff seemed out of place, but I still learned something from it. Midterm/Final were pretty difficult, but it's graded on a curve, so things even out. Pay attention and you'll get an A.
Professor Fisler rocks!

A very clear and informative lecturer.  If you attend lectures and go to her for extra help if you have trouble with a topic, you will definitely understand the material very well and make a hard course much easier.
Very clear in lecture, her voice seems to fill FLAUD unamplified without effort. Gives lots of examples and seems to be very experienced.
excellent teacher.  don't be thrown off by people complaining about scheme.  it's all right language and she teaches like a pro.
No Comments

The new Scheme class that replaces CS 1005. Difficult course! (probably because scheme sucks) Nice professor though. Tries hard to help you understand the material. Definately DONT GET BEHIND and go to office hours for help when needed.

She's good at explaining concepts, but Scheme is just a horrible language.  All those parentheses!!!  She curved, but I was about 0.1 away from the A cutoff, so I got a B with an 81.9 or something, when people who got 50s also got Bs.

Pretty good teacher, makes you understand quite easily. If you do understand, then the tests are easy, otherwise they might turn into a nightmare. I did not like the homeworks, they tended to be long and bad worded.

This course was a nightmare. Scheme may not have been such a rough transition if it weren't for the ambiguously worded and complex homework. Class avg on the final was a 50. An avg this low shows how poorly the material was presented. Oh, and you're not allowed to set a value to a variable. Unreal.

A good professor, very clear and easy to understand and knows what she is talking about.  However, scheme is a very annoying language despite it being easy to learn.  Homework assignments are extremely vague, often times you have several possible ways of interpreting the question.Good teacher though
Great professor all-around, sometimes she just isn't clear on what she wants for an answer on homework
No Comments

She's an alright teacher, but Scheme is a bad language.  Her husband created half the language and the compiler or something, so she likes it way too much.  The assignments are difficult.  The tests are hard as well, but the class is curved.

She teaches very well, and is a very inteligent person. However, she does not know how to ask questions. Often the descriptions for homework, or test questions are to vague, and are very hard to figure out what she actually is asking for.

Scheme is a bad language.  All recursion, all those parentheses will drive you crazy!  She's an alright teacher, but she likes scheme way too much and seems to expect too much out of the students.  Difficult class.
The class is pretty hard, test are brutal but curved a lot. Sheche is interesting language even though it's not easy and rather unusual.
She tries hard, and with extra help you can do well, but the class isn't taught very well.  add to that scheme is difficult to understand.....
Explains subject well. Most assignemnts were doable, but the final exam was horrible. Grades on a curve.
No Comments
Scheme is an interesting and powerful language. I wish it had been taught in this class. Class average exam grade was ~50/100, and this is the 5th time this course has been offered.

Excellent teacher.  Makes you think in class and on assignments.  If you slack, she will not cut you any slack.  However, she is very helpful in pushing you if you are in the top part of the class, and are bored with the pace of the class.
scheme 4 lyf3
Some people hate 2135 with a passion, I rather liked it though. She does as good a job as possible with the material.
hard class, but curve fixed it, good at explaining and helping with work
Her classes are hard on purpose.  Great teacher
Very definitely uninformed and stubborn. Knows little about her obscure subject.
very hard, but good professor
What are the rest of these people thinking? She's terrible!
Hard class, but she explains everything really well.
She knows her stuff but class was difficult. She's for those who love to code.
Wicked Smart, Awesome Teacher
No Comments
SCHEME is rough...hard work...GREAT TEACHER

Biased, insecure incompetence on display.  Class pets. Inarticulate.  Avoid.  No sour grapes here, I'm a straight A student perfect SAT, probably smarter than the professor. Just my observations and thoughts.

Heavy on group assignments, like almost every day, passive aggressive on her commentary, class is easy to pass but haven't learned much since you're supposed to read the book outside of class and she doesn't teach you anything. If she doesn't like your group your grade will reflect it. Vague directions on assignments.

Said she didn't want any non-bio majors taking her INTRODUCTORY course. All assignments based on textbook, but she doesn't teach textbook material in class, instead rambling on about random pictures of cells (attendance is mandatory). Rude and unsympathetic when I've emailed her. Feedback often doesn't match the grade she gives. Avoid Prof. Rulfs.

Her class was genuinely the most useless class I've ever taken. Group assignments are so easy but a pain because half the time your group never shows up or never does any work. Her instructions are often never clear  and she always messes up the grading. She is a nice person, but spends half the time talking about something completely irrelevant.

I've previously took Jill's BB1035 class, and believe Jill gets a bad rap from the introductory courses. In her smaller immunology course we spent class time participating in group discussion based activities. She would always walk around the class and give helpful input and encourage deeper conversations. Understanding with quizzes, 10/10 course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: She is genuinely one of the most condescending, most absurd professors at this school. She makes me want to never study biology ever again. Zero respect for students. Ignores emails and is not willing to ever help a student improve. There is not enough space in this rating to express how terrible of a person and Professor she is.

Practically unreachable outside of class, has difficulty with canvas grading but does not acknowledge when problems have not been fixed and refuses to discuss the responses to comments she makes on reports
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Not nearly as bad as everyone makes it seem. She has a good balance between lectures and group work, and is generally a pretty good and engaging lecturer. Beware that the groups for the midterm/general projects are randomly assigned so don't bother trying to take this class with a friend. Homework/reading is pretty easy and reasonable too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very unique/progressive approach to teaching. Her passion for biotech/biology is evident and contagious. There are no exams or closed-book tests. You take quizzes based on assigned reading from the textbook once in class and then at home after she goes over it, again. A great class to take for an easy intro to biotech. Quirky but good! GROUP WORK!
Good amount of textbook reading, most grades are group projects so as long as you have a good group you'll be fine, need a really good understanding of cell/micro biology from a class like AP bio
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: A lot of group work, so be prepared, however, it was a really fun and relatively simple class. It moved very quickly, but if you do the work she lets you just leave class. Very passionate about biology, just admits biotech isn't her favorite.
Was more about policy and government rather than biology. Lots of group projects, and quizzes on textbook readings. Not a difficult class, just boring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Be prepared to read the textbook to pass quizzes since most material is not taught in class. Classtime is spent on group assignments, but she often gives unclear directions and expectations. PLAs are useful and go to them for questions. The class is boring and could be taught much better, but if you just read the textbook you'll pass.

The class wasn't overly difficult, there were no tests and quizzes were open book. If you want to learn you have to read from the book, she doesn't really lecture. Group projects were kind of vague, but if you ask PLA's they will help. Quizzes could get tricky but not horrible. Final project was pretty easy. Teaching could have been a lot better.

Not a valuable class to take due to the professor's lesson plan. Quizzes on the textbook material are open book and notes and not helpful. Tends to ramble a lot in class about repetitive and irrelevant subjects. Grading is vague and rather arbitrary, although easy if you invest a little bit of effort. Group projects were not very useful.

She is extremely rude and unhelpful. You have a better chance of passing quizzes if you ignore her lectures and just read the textbook instead. Probably the worst class I've ever taken. Human biology is interesting, but if you care about your sanity and self-respect please take it with another professor.

Awful. Quizzes were super vague and the questions did not make sense most of the time. She never teaches in class so be prepared to read the book if you want to learn anything. Doesn't average your grades either and instead takes the lowest grade for your final grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Dont ever take this professor. She is rude and the worst teacher I have ever had. Goes over material after you have been tested on it, disrespects students daily, and is just overall unhelpful. She gives you your lowest grade at the end of the term instead of averaging overall. This class isnt hard but a middle schooler could teach it better.

Attempted to make the class more group and activity-based than lecture-based. Liked the idea, execution not perfect. Often, in the groups, only some people did the work. Her quizzes can be tricky sometimes, so you'll need to really read your notes before you take them. Instructions sometimes unclear, didn't really get much out of this class overall
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Extremely rude and sarcastic. Wastes time in class. Everything you need to know is in the textbook yet classes are mandatory. Quiz questions are vague. Lectures are boring. Really wish I did not take this class and is the only class I've regretted taking in college. I even took Organic Chemistry. This class was torture.

Does not actually teach anything in class. Talks about herself a lot. Is open about how shes hate that non bio people take her 1000 level class. Forces you to teach yourself everything. Timed online quizzes and doesnt give enough time. Doesnt even give a full class period worth of time. She can be funny sometimes Ill give her that.

She expects you to read and learn the material from the textbook, and uses class time ineffectively but requires attendance. Instructions are unclear for assignments. She did not treat me with respect, but instead inferred I was dumb and lazy. Would never recommend her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She focuses on things completely unrelated to the course subjects. She doesn't spend any time going over test material, so just read the textbook and you'll pass. You can do anything you want in class because listening was pointless - I did chemistry homework . Sometimes she does clicker questions for attendance so try to show up.
She doesn't understand technology within the past 10 years but her dry sense of humor is somewhat entertaining. The material wasn't rough and the assignments weren't bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Overall Jill was a decent professor. It was helpful that the exams as a whole were only 25% each so it gives you wiggle room on exams. The only thing is that whatever is said in class is never on the exam or particularly helpful for the exams. You MUST read the textbook, take careful notes, and understand the concepts to pass.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Does not answer to any emails... no clear grading rubric for any of the projects. Doesnt stay on topic in lectures.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Just an absolute awesome teacher! Sure, you need to attend classes and listen to do well but is still super charismatic and enjoyable to have as a teacher
Spent entire class period watching videos. Have also participated in several puzzles and adventures during class. 10/10
She really loves biology, but has trouble with technology.

She gets sooooo into the laws and politics of the Biology and the actual biology is a side note then the tests have questions from the actual biology.  Unless you're into how the government is connected to the food we eat then this class is for you!
not specific on grading criteriawhat she's looking for

I haven't experienced any of the aforementioned grief she apparently gives her students. It hasn't been demonstrated in Cell Bio, but perhaps she's friendlier with the BBTCBC students. Her lectures are, however, pretty useless, but I was already familiar with the material. She's not a very good lecturer- not very focused, doesn't cover much.

only taught the class about 7 days of the whole 7 week term. she gets other professors to come in for 2-3 days each and have them teach different topics. clicker questions 20% of the grade, 80% is 3 tests.

Worst professor I've ever had at WPI. Extremely rude and arrogant toward students. Refuses to answer questions. Grading very unclear and inconsistent. Quiz questions had nothing to do with the reading, and often were confusing (one time, the whole class complained about the vagueness of a question, so she was forced to give credit to all).

She used a new format for my class, and although it was allot of work the grades were easy. Lecture was a waste of time, you have to go to get credit on clicker questions. Every thing i needed to know was in the text book. Quizzes were a bit tricky, and writing assignments and projects were graded critically.

Goes on rants and will treat students like they are children.  Refuses to answer emails/will answer rudely. Actually told my class that she will not teach us biology and that we must teach ourselves...

I learned nothing from her class. Don't bother going, just come for clicker quizzes and cheat off your neighbor, she'll never notice and you'll get an A. Don't send her emails, she's snappy and doesn't like writing them, just drop by her office but don't stay long or she'll start grilling you.
Never take her course... ethnic biased. And the classes are just for learning nothing. Nothing indeed!!... Grades are based on rediculous way..

Quiz questions were more like logic games often found I knew the concepts but questions were presented in such a bizarre way sometimes even the TA didn't understand what she was trying to ask! Everything you are quized on you learn on your own. She gives a few minutes before quiz to teach material for first time and won't answer questions in office
No Comments
Exams were impossible (fill in the blank) and lectures did not cover what was tested. Not helpful outside of the classroom. I would not recommend this professor.
I took intro to biotech too. Her tests have nothing to do with her lectures. If you're in a good group you should be able to pass this.
I took intro to biotech.. class was somewhat boring, review of high school material. and then downscaled the entire class at the end of the term.. it sucked.

She's a generally friendly person, but is very sarcastic/rude when she's asked questions... BB1035 included a LOT of reading out of a very detailed textbook, and was followed by difficult CPS quizzes. The quiz questions were more in depth than what she wanted us to know, which as annoying. The conference projects were very interesting though.
She's very rude in e-mails.  She fails to meet with students outside of class.
great class, different way of teaching, alway explain your thinking to get credit, and it helps you understand the stuff

The class was interesting, but her quizzes had nothing to do with what she talked about or what is in the book.  The class averages for most assignments were in the 50's or 60's.  The good thing is that she drops your 2 lowest quizzes and 2 lowest homeworks, and also uses a pretty decent scale.
Awesome advisor.  Very involved w/ her students and loves to help and learn about us.
Helpful as a Pre-Med advisor; knows what she's doing
Get ready to hear the phrases "communistic" and "like I said" over and over. Overall pretty decent. Lots of reading, class participation and group discussions were important. The paper wasn't bad.

Go to class because participation helps and the things talked about in class directly relate to tests. His rubrics don't make much sense so ask for help on papers. He also turned global History into a class on why technology is terrible. He frequently strays from relavent topics to discuss his disapproval of all forms of technology and big business
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He has dull lectures, constantly strays off topics about why kids should not use technology for learning (this is a class on WWII foreign affairs by the way), easy B if you do the bare minimum.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The lectures are dull, and the discussions are next to useless when he jumps between groups without making sure everybody's following. The essays are modified versions of study questions where he's added more sections to answer seemingly at random, and he wants quotes from the text in a closed-book test. Brush up on your essay-writing skills.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Clear rubric, nice person and interesting material (somewhat repetitive).
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He is way to arrogant in sharing his view. He will ask a question that is an opinion and if he doesn't like it he will refute it. Also America is just the best according to him, he doesn't realize that even if Harvard is amazing doesn't mean Oxford can also be too. Discussions are not  discussions and lectures are not useful.

I really enjoyed this class. If you just introduce yourself once, say one comment in every class, and look generally interested and you're guaranteed an A. The test was not hard, just all mini essays, just brain dump and show you read the material. By the end of the term I stopped reading and still managed to get an A just from paying attention!!

Baller does tend to focus on particular topics and has a tendency to be single minded and close minded, however the class discussion is where you learn the most. Although he isn't a great lecturer, you do learn something through the required readings and class discussion. You have to do the reading and participate to get an A.

Most assignments are just reading; there was no real physical homework, just the research paper. He only gives you three topics to choose from for the paper, which was kind of annoying. Luckily, it did not have to be very long, and he isn't a harsh grader. On tests he doesn't care about specific dates, just that you know your stuff, which was nice.

Really into his subject.  Take a few minutes after class one day to introduce yourself and he will be your good friend.  Participation was part of the grade but if you email him beforehand about missing a class he will not count it against you.  Homework was just reading, tests and papers were graded generously.  Sometimes rambles during lecture.

He is the most rambling repetitive professor I have ever experienced. A lot of classes are discussion based but when he lectures it''s so disjointed it''s difficult to follow. Jumps around from topic to topic in non chronological order. He wastes a lot of class time essentially talking about how technology is bad and makes you stupid.
This professor is both disrespectful of kids in his class and arrogant about all his views. Would not recommend taking a class with this professor.

Really good class. Lectures were mandatory but I enjoyed them anyways so that wasn't a bad thing. Always talk during classes because if he sees that you are trying and are putting in the effort he will give you an A. The readings were very interesting too and we watch some videos that were a good break. I would definitely recommend him!

Do, the reading, go to class, and meet with him outside of class about your paper and you'll be good to go. He's more than happy to help you as long as you show interest in the class. Lectures can be a bit rambling, but usually interesting, and he incorporates a lot of group discussions. He's not for everybody but I would recommend him.

Good professor. The books he assigns are very interesting and you can learn a lot from them. He is not too hard, however you have to attend class, participate and demonstrate interest in the class to get an A. I advise you to go to his office hours to talk about the assignments/papers.
An interesting class, and a very passionate teacher.  Willing to help with and revise papers if you show effort, and with papers outside his class if he likes you.
Had American history with him. Tends to ramble, but is pretty accepting of well-reasoned opinions. Very broad tests, covering all the reading.

What a great professor. He is very nice and always has class discussions about topics. Just do your reading and write your paper with analysis and not just facts and you should do good. Not biased as the others are saying. A lovely professor and you should be happy to have him.
Very biased professor. If he doesn't like you he will either fail you/give you a C
Very nice guy and a very easy class that you will get a good grade in as long as you do the readings and come to class/participate a little.
Great professor

Really easy, very nice guy who is willing to help you out if you come to him. Just make sure you come to class and do at least some of the reading before discussions. Take him if you are looking to get your humanities out of the way without doing a lot of work.

It seems that he only helps the students he likes. And seems like he only likes American, which appeared apparently in class. If you are international, you will fail the class for sure. Before joining this useless class, history of Britain was very curious to me. He made it a mess. He is also very over confident and very partial on his judgement.
Great guy!

I signed up for his class expecting modern European history and got the history of soccer in England instead. If he doesn't like you (he didn't like me) then he won't help you. He treats you like a baby too. Very boring class. Not challenging at all.
it turned out to be a sucky course, and he hated me from the first class. Too impatient
Pretty cool guy, although he's pretty old.  Emphasizes key points.  Just don't cut his class, you won't like the results.
A great suff advisor, is very helpful when it comes to finding sources and editing your paper...highly recommended.
Law & Soc. in America.  Just about the most boring topic imaginable, but he pulled it off well.  Good lit selection.  Come to class and you'll do fine.
You will do well in his class if you come to class, read the text, and participate a little in class.
The best history prof I've had. He actually made history interesting, not just memorization. His book choices where excelent, he even used them to show you the correct ways to write history papers.
Very objective, good knowledge
Awesome Prof.!!!  Also an excellent suff advisor.  One of the best professors at WPI.

Straightforward: do reading, assignments, and attend class. Baller goes out of his way to help students learn to become good history students by guiding them through the process of writing reports. Keep in mind that he is politically biased.
Professor Baller is a great history teacher.  Of the several history professors i've had, his lectures have been the most informative and the most entertaining, even long two-hour lectures
Cannot get any easier than Professor Baller's History classes. I loved his class, because he only covered topics that we need to know in daily life. I had him for 2 classes, and both were awesome.

Not bad teacher, but his opinions about Europe and Cold War are very americanized... homework is not that hard if you like to read history, and it seems that all his knowledge comes from only one book which makes the class tedious.

Not a bad guy, reminds me of Hari Kari, so that's kind of interesting. You'll go thru 3 books in a pretty short time, so try to keep up your reading.  Nice guy if you dont skip, no quizzes, only a midterm and final, and a really easy paper.
Great suff advisor.  Lenient timetable and he was very understanding when more time was needed.  Clear in what he expected in a Suff, I got an A without an average amount of work
Politically biased, class focuses on current events, not government.  Teach the class in the course description, not your own agenda.
Old, condescending, no consistency from lecture to lecture, very unclear as to what he expects from you.  Assigns a rediculous amount of reading for a freshman level class.
Very good teacher, clear with grading and such.  Enjoyed going to his class

Very good prof for intro to history class. I actually liked History for the first time in my life. He counts top 5 of 7 quizzes. No tests. Quizzes are easy if you spend an hour reading the 10 pages for hw. Week 7 = almost nothing. MUST PARTICIPATE for 'A'

Excellent Professor. Lets you know exactly what he wants from you and if you give him that you get an A.  Any questions at all he is more than happy to answer.  Attendance is huge, and if you go to the classes you pretty much know the material and do well
Good professor, topics are defenilty random compared to course title, but still a good class and very easy if you keep up on reading and go to classes
He's a reasonable guy, the class is very straightforward.
Easy.  Talk in class, he likes that.  Show up and dont look like you're doing other work or sleeping or something.  Moves around transparencies a lot and repeats himself as nauseum.
Very nice guy, great teacher, made history class very fun.  I was compelled to do my assignments more then ordinarily.  If you need a history class, this is the guy to see!
Good Structure of Class...Attendence Important
He's a funny guy and a pretty good teacher, but the tests are something else. Average on exam 1 was a 30. He gave us chemistry questions. This is a physics class.

He was a pretty good prof, but he does goes so fast. He is funny, engaging, and entertaining. He is a considerate and reasonable guy, and has open note exams (although they frankly don't usually help because the notes we have require further derivations to be useful for the exam).
Very solid teacher and one of the best I have had at WPI so far. Attend office hours when he posts test hints. Will explain the questions clear and in depth.

This professor is a solid choice. His lectures are fast paced but he goes through a lot of examples and is always in his office for office hours. He was able to actually make me laugh sometimes in lecture with his antics. Highly recommend if you want to have a little fun in lecture.

Professor Di ck is a nice guy and is willing to help you if you go to his office hours. I would say that his lectures are alright, as I found myself needing to re-teach myself a lot of the concepts in order to fully understand. If you do the homework and keep a well organized notebook, you'll do well on the tests since it's open notebook.

He is by no means perfect, but you WILL learn the physics you need to in order to pass. His homeworks tend to be much harder problems than what are on the exams (which are open notebook); it is generally easy to get at least a B. His lectures tend to be all over the place, but if you read the textbook and understand HW, you'll be fine.

The 8 a.m. lectures were actually entertaining as well as helpful for the class. There was a required textbook, but I didn't actually use it pretty much at all. Homeworks were lengthy and not actually graded, it all came down to the two exams which were open note and open book and actually covered the material caught.

Definitely not a fan of going to lecture but never skipped his. Amazing professor, explains things very well although can be a little fast sometimes. Hilarious and definitely keeps the class engaged. Very helpful with homework questions outside of class during office hours. Wants to help students do well in class.

He is a great conference teacher in every respect. Unlike conferences he struggles to teach in lecture. He will teach you how to get to the formula but this irrelevant as we are only seeking its applications. It is a true waste of time. And his test are similar to his reviews but still extremely difficult. Our class average on the first test was 61

If you have to set an alarm for this class I suggest just sleeping in. He is often confused by his own examples, which confuses students even more. The practice problems are usually posted on Canvas later, and doing them on your own is much more helpful and a better use of time anyway. Try going a few times but dont force it if it's not working out

Unlike the person below, really enjoyed space environments, and found it real useful as a non-major looking to do work in the field. Pretty easy class, just study the homework solutions closely and make a good notes sheet based on them. Paper and HW graded on completion. Lectures were entertaining, but you could do the work without great notes.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Lectures are spent doing demonstrations and deriving equations that you'll use on the homework. 10 homework problems assigned after each lecture. Tests are extremely fair. He's not the best professor and the lectures aren't fantastic but if you do the homework and make sure you understand the problems you'll do well in the course.

Homework, and the two "projects" are graded easily. Just turn something in with some effort shown and you'll get 100%. Tests are jokes, based off HW. Lectures are completely useless and overall you don't learn anything useless from this class. It's an AE requirement(it shouldn't be) so just take the easy A and leave.
His lectures are always entertaining, explains things well, open to questions

Prof. D. is a very entertaining lecturer and is very good at explaining concepts. However, be aware that he will sometimes put equations on the board which are incorrect; look them up in the textbook to verify them. The examinations are difficult, but not unfair, so be sure to study for them. Be warned that homework takes about six hours a week.

The material and homework are not cake-walks and can get confusing but if you put a lot of effort into the homework and a lot of preparation into studying for the tests , you should be able to get an A. Tests are very similar to the homework.

His lectures are very confusing to the point where I feel like I learned more after I stopped going to them. Claims the exams are based directly on the homework problems, but they really aren't. Went to his office hours a few times and he still didn't explain things very well.

Overall, I didn't really like him. Tests were really difficult and graded on a steep curve at the end that left me wondering if I would even pass. Lectures were ok even though I was really bored through most of them.  Definitely a weed-out class. If you can find a better professor, take them instead.
Ok, so his classes are confusing and he doesn't do much. However, homework isn't hard and, if you go to his office hours, he will help. Don't get me wrong though, you'll have to work for it.

No partial credit on exams. His lectures will bore you and you are likely to fall asleep. He definitely knows the material himself but he does not know how to teach it. His exams are hard and very hard to study for despite the fact you get one sheet of notes. He will scale your grades at the end because otherwise almost everyone will fail.
lectures do not prepare students for test questions, multiple homeworks on MasteringPhysics, attend conference

I have never had a less useful course in my life. I learned more from 5 minutes with the (absolutely atroscious) text book than in an entire lecture. Not only should this class not exist, but Frank should stick to teaching physics and forego his career in comedy. Most of class is taken up by his bad jokes and teaching us math that we already know.

He spends almost no time in lectures actually teaching you the material. 99% of the time he is deriving formulas with calculus (this is not a calc based class). Labs are extremely easy and the homeworks are relatively easy. if you have him for conference you won't learn anything in there either. the exams are hard, but he curves the grade a lot.

Tests weren't too hard plus he lets you bring a sheet of notes and a calculator. Just don't miss the exams. the make-ups suck. Labs were easy. Mastering physics homework twice a week. I used the Textbook literally to do ONE problem all year.  His lectures are good, but he's very all over the place sometimes (sometimes disorganized). He's funny too

Seems not bad at first but tests are a bombshell. All about vectors and very intense tests ... but material covered by online homework problems and conference has absolutely nothing to do with the material on the tests. Labs are just as detached... utterly pointless.

Many people says he is tough. But I will say he is good. His class is really enjoyable. If you  really pay attention his class is really helpful. And his exams are not easy, they are not that tough though. If your concepts are clear you will do well in exams. He also allows one extra cheetsheet for exam with hand written notes.

Prof Frank is a nice enough guy but his class was very frustrating. The textbook was consistently inconsistent, lectures unorganized and overall frustrating. The material was super cool but the class overall wasn't great. Big curve at the end.
pure evil! DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS UNLESS U HAVE SOME TEARS TO WASTE!

I am interested in Astronomy, so I may be biased; but professor ****'s astrophysics class is great for anyone who wants to learn a lot of new and interesting things. Don't let his 1110/1120 classes discourage you because teachers tend to match student interest in there courses if you know what I mean.
Exams are way too hard.  Concepts I had never heard about were present on the exam, and I attended all lectures and conferences.  Don't take this class with Dick.

His exams are very hard, and don't match up with the book.  Students would be expect to teach topics to themselves using other sources besides the book.  Between lectures and conference, almost all of what I learned wasn't present on the exams. Don't recommend.

Take his astrophysics/solar system courses. Yes they can be challenging, but go to lecture and make a serious homework attempt and you'll do just fine. F. Dick is a great lecturer-- and that's saying something when he always schedules 8AM lectures. Definitely recommend him. You won't be disappointed.

Professor Dick has interesting lectures, especially for mechanics; but he does example problems slowly and gets behind in the material. I stopped going to class and saw no decrease in my grades. He also makes very fast paced tests that don't always test your comprehension as much as your ability to think quickly.

Is a nice enough guy & is energetic & upbeat for early lectures, but doesn't really explain the material well. Had to rely on TA for learning the material. His exams are incredibly hard and he doesn't really scale the grades at all. I studied really hard and did better than a large portion of my class but I still barely squeaked by with a C.

Unfortunately the worst professor I have ever had at WPI. Nothing on the homework has anything to do with the tests. Exams are difficult for someone who hasn't had a better PH teacher prior to this class. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! Not even MASH will help!!
His homework isn't related to his tests at all which are mad hard! and he isnt helpful in office hours or anything! dont take his class EVER!

Worst Physics professor ever. His lectures make you Zzzzzz... Don't choose him! His exams are ridiculously hard because they are not related at ALL to the textbook and his lectures. Avoid him at all cost!

His lectures are always fun and easy to follow but the exam is horrible! He puts 15 word problems an no multiple choice questions! Doesn't matter how much you study you still gonna have a 60 on your exam! Hated him! Half of my class is failing and he does nothing to help struggling students!
He changes the way I think about physics. I start to love it after taking his course.
He gives you the maximum amount of homework possible
Lives up to his name, but he really knows his material, and he's good at teaching it.
He is the most amazing physics professor I've ever met. He did the Moon Walk and plenty of other interesting examples. Self-study is very important to succeed in his class.
Fantastic professor.  Breaks everything down into simple concepts.  The homework was often, but not difficult.  I find myself constantly recommending him to others.

Great professor. He treats the class respectfully and does plenty of interesting examples that deal with actual in-class calculations. Crowning moment of awesome: I went to his office after getting a 55 on an exam and made the case that I had put in substantial effort, and 1 hour later he sends a class email saying he'll drop the lowest exam score.
HE was an amazing teacher, he made the class fun and he prepared us for the tests. I learned so much he is an amazing teacher.
He is an AMAZING teacher! He makes everyone understand the material! Very helpful, and patient with students. I loved this course, and CAN'T wait to have him again!

His lectures started off fine, tended to trail away from relevant material. Exams are excruciating! had nothing to do with the homework assignments; Required derivations. Did not prepare well, and fails to follow advice from fellow professors.

Lectures are fine, but his tests are ridiculous, first one was scaled to a 50% score being an A -and he refuses to listen to advice fro fellow professors, as he is a new professor this year(2008-2009)
Haven't taken this course yet, but had him for conference for PH1110 and PH1120. Very clear and enthusiastic, and also very helpful!
She's a very easy professor. If you've taken any sort of chemistry class before, you should get an a in this class.
Great professor! Not only willing to answer any of your questions with great patience, but also tell great jokes in class, making u interested in chemistry from now on.
Very nice. Needs to improve penmanship and voice level. Helpful to any student. Sweet. Will do anything for her students

Awesome professor! definitely adorable in her grandmotherliness, makes jokes, but great overall teaching style. Problems in class actually prepare you for the test and aren't the ridiculously easy ones. Plenty of practice material available.
Awesome for note takers who go to every class. EITHER read the text OR go to class unless you are really terrible at chemistry. Easy A.

Very grandmotherly, one of the nicest teachers I have met. Has a accent and a very quiet voice (thankfully she decided to get a mic halfway through the quarter) but it's still not too bad understanding her. If you do the suggested work problems and exam reviews, it is very easy to obtain an A.
Really nice person, really helpful in and out of class. A pleasure t listen to, she genuinely loves teaching and her students. At times really funny and cute in her grand-motherliness.

Awful at teaching. For exams just do all the review problems and read in the book for the multiple choice information because she will never go over that in class. Don't take a class with her if you actually want to learn something and do well
Very nice woman, but it was difficult to follow her in lectures because she often made mistakes and her accent was tough to understand at times.

I did not like this teacher.  She is very confusing to me and her examples were confusing as well.  I failed this class along with other students.  I took good notes and went over the text book, but her test are very hard.  I would not recommend this teacher

She's so cute, lol. Had her for CH 1010 and 1020. She's a great teacher, has plenty of handouts online and quizzes you can print out and practice. If you read the chapter, take notes, do well in lab and see her if you have any questions you will be fine.
She's adorable!  Class was pretty easy if you took the notes, did the reading and followed allow with examples.  Answers emails in a timely fashion.  Definitely recommend her!

Glazer is friendly and loves to help out her students. Yes, she is grandmotherly- she's very understanding and wants her students to succeed. Does not tolerate laziness nor reluctance to try the work. Challenging class. Occasionally hard to understand what she's explaining. Nevertheless I loved her class, she made chem a lot of fun.

I disliked this class mostly because she was disorganized in her in her notes both in class and online.  Also she spent a good portion of the class yelling at the kid texting on his phone or gossiping in the back row.  She was however very helpful if you sought help outside of class.  Old tests of hers make great study tools.

Glazer gives off the impression of a cute little grandmother. She knows her stuff, but makes many mistakes in teaching it. Her tests are hard but fair, do study for them and meet with her one-on-one and you will do fine.
No Comments

I just finished an intro chem course with her- I adore her! The examples she gives in lectures are useful if you pay attention and catch the silly errors she's prone to making, and if you read the book to back it up you'll be fine. She also has a sense of humor, and is always willing to help you work things out if you're confused.

ProfessorGlazer knows the topics,however her notes are disorganized so the information is unclear.She uses an overhead projector in a 175student lecture,so if you can't hear or understand her accent,you don't get the information.There is no homework,although she will grade voluntary work.Grades are based off 4exams and lab grades(5 labs,1 lab exam)
No the greatest professor by any means - gives off that sort of adorable grandmother feeling, but not much else. Lectures were generally useless and the exams were difficult -- very difficult.

Stopped going to class after the first few days. As a lecturer = useless. She just goes through examples and makes mistakes. If one needs extra help though, she is willing to help and does pretty well at it; pretty surprising given the awful lectures. Just read the book, you'll be fine.

She's an alright teacher, very funny, very short. She does examples during lectures, only briefs over important information in textbook. She is reasonable of tests and finals except online quizes are almost impossible  because she expects you to know material you havent covered yet

She is a pretty personable professor, especially if you suck up a little, however, lectures are impossible to follow because of the mistakes she makes.  Quite often she would make so many mistakes in a single example that she would give up going through it, and we were left to figure it out on our own.  Tests are also pretty difficult.

She was the worst teacher I have ever had. You can read the book, do all the problems and still be confused because she isn't good at explaining things. She doesn't take the time to help, just tells you to figure it out. She does examples all class, but constantly makes mistakes and uses wrong numbers so when you review for tests your lost.
Can't stand her, she's always confused and can't teach.

Nice teacher, very short, and very funny in such a sarcastic way.
