She mostly went over specific problems in class instead of teaching, so you really have to do the assigned reading, but it isn't too much at all. She came to all the labs and really knew what she was doing, and she speaks English really well with only a little accent.
She's my favorite teacher.  She is always willing to help students.
Great teacher, if your are having ANY difficulties she is willing to help you in any way possible but you have to make the appt. with her she wont make them with you
Great teacher. Knows what she is talking about and very funny. Goes out of her way to help. Makes everything really clear and her tests are very fair.

Loved her class. Easy A if you do the handouts. Puts stuff on my WPI, and gives a lot of handouts. Do those you get an easy A. Definately take this class with her or pat dealeny.Extremely helpful if you go to her.

Odd professor, has a slight accent but very understandable.  Unusual teaching, gives a lot of helpful handouts and puts documents on myWPI.  Tests are fair, grading is a little on the strict side but by no means unfair.  Takes getting used to but i've had many professors who were much much worse.

very nice and funny, she can keep you interested by adding little stories or sound effects to her lectures and her quizzes and tests are all on the things she covers in class, which you could skip and still manage pretty well
easy class with decently easy quizzes. Doesn't explain things as well as possible, but just enough to get by. Lots of overhead slides.

she is the worst teacher ive ever had! she uses incorect symbology that previous teachers have insisted apon with penalties if it did happen. she motivates people to skip her class, though i dont. she has a very random approach of teaching the material and often wont teach what the class covers.
Very funny teacher. Taught the course material pretty well. Her review sheets are very helpful.

If you ever need any help, she's a great professor. She'll hand out worksheets and go around the hall to help students. I skipped quite a few lectures and did well just by reading the book, the class is mostly a review of high school chemistry.
Good Prof. Teaches u until u learn if u go to her office. Very patient.

Glazer has been the best Chem teacher I have had. If you need help go to her before a test and she will help plus give you some problems that will be on the test. She is so cute to! You will always remember wave frequency!When she runs across the floor!
Famous Quotes: "SPANK ME!! I know it's very tempting, but don't take it literally!"... "The atoms are making out with the neighbor's wife!"
An excellent teacher for this introductory course. She will take all the time necessary to make sure her students understand everything. Plus she grades everything herself, no TA biases involved.
She makes every effort to make sure that everyone understands, and she's so funny!
Her review sheets are exactly like her tests, she's really nice, she's great in lab and she's pretty funny.
very helpful and cares about students, great lab instructor! highly recommended!
No Comments
No Comments
Great once you get past her accent-expects a lot of work!
Prof. Glazer was an excellent teacher who was always patient with us during lab.
She's so cute and adorable!

Took during Covid, online lectures consisted of "Here's an equation, now you're on your own to learn how to use it." Used with Mastering Physics, so there was no room to understand why you were wrong or what you missed. I only learned anything because I had friends who already knew the material.
The lecture videos were terrible and had no examples. Homeworks were difficult if you did not have Chegg. Quizzes gave students little time and incorporated topics not discussed in class.

Lectures were almost nonexistent and offered only explanations for the simple aspects of each unit. Homework was difficult, quizzes (1 each week) were EXTREMELY difficult and no partial credit was given. Prepare to fail the course if you take her during the pandemic unless you pull all-nighters trying to figure everything out.

Burnham used the fact that she was the head of the course to neglect her students, pushing off responsibilities to the people below her in power. When it came to medical injuries, mental health crisis's, and personal problems, she was cold and neglectful towards students. Used the excuse "I have too many students to grade". Would not recommend.

She is NOT an understanding professor in any way, especially during the current COVID pandemic. I had schedule trouble and joined the class late where assignments had already passed. Her advice totaled to a grand, "Oof, good luck man," and a couple of free zeroes. I understand times are stressful, but it's also now when GOOD teachers shine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Lots of masteringphysics work every week that are sometimes ridiculously hard, but overall the workload is fair. Really approachable and helpful during office hours and nice person in general. Some parts of the exams are bs, but I got As on all exams so its not too difficult. Overall good lectures and easy to follow.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I would highly recommend anyone to take Professor Burnham with their PH1110 class. It's not an easy class, so don't expect and easy A. However, grading is incredibly fair, as the grading breakdown is crystal clear from day 1 of the term. Explains things very well. She seems a bit intimidating outside of class, so I never went to office hours.

Professor assigned tedious studio work sheets and strictly enforced due times (11:59 PM). Course homework was online and wasn't clearly noted when any of it was due. Late work results in a 0. Tests were graded via "clicker" and offered no partial credit. Class participation was also graded by clicker. Harsh course grader and doesn't speak clearly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Burnham's teaching style didn't work well for me. Classes (studio style) included tedious graded worksheets and problem-solving sessions that left me with more questions than answers. Her lectures are great! Her conferences were amazing, but her tests were too difficult (and communication about what would be on the test was nonexistent.)
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had her for physics 1110 and she was a really good teacher. The class wasn't hard and it was easy to get an A if you did all the work.
Does a good job of making sure lectures aren't boring, so students won't zone out.  Gives clear examples with actual situations.  Is very helpful if you need it outside of lectures.

She is an overall good professor. You learn new material during conferences, so if that instructor isn't good it makes the class more difficult. Tests were tough. She scaled the class but not as much as she said she would. Do the work and you can get at least a B.

Professor Burnham has very clear grading criteria, and she's very clear during lectures.  Participation is taken into consideration through clickers (devices that allow the class to answer questions without talking). Tests were tough, but she scales them and allows retests if you fail. Put a lot of effort in and you should do good.

She used clickers for my class. That means you HAD to attend lecture, conference and labs if you wanted that 10% of your grade. She was very clear, if you had a question during lecture, she wouldn't hesitate to stop and explain.  Tests were sometimes harder than neccessary, but she would grade them on a curve, often making my C into a B.
Class is very easy and if you have any past physics knowledge you can get an A without too much effort

She can be really mean to rate the homework and you may lose half of the point just because you forgot to box the answer. However she shows the material really clear and she tries a lot to make her class fun.

Tests are too long for the amount of time you have with them and they are about 3 times more difficult than anything she talks about in class. She will ask you graded questions during lecture that she formats specifically to trip people up and is usually really happy when she succeeds in this. She was excited for the class test average to be a 50.
Great physics lecturer, friendly and willing to help students. Uses props to help students understand concepts.

Nancy is a majestic human being, beautiful and fabulous at that. The course work is tedious and boring, but Nancy brings in props and makes learning fun (Friday Physics Fun hyfr). I'm pretty sure everyone has to take this clss so choose Nancy, you won't regret it.

Prof. Burnham was my lecture instructor. She cared about what the students wanted to learn. The clicker questions are the reason to show up for class even if you don't think you need to. She was nice, approachable and even in a lecture setting attempted to make it fun. I would recommend her.

Great professor and I liked the whole setup of the course. It was an easy A but I was familiar with the material from high school. The class did take a lot of work thanks to the daily mastering physics homework (online). I did not find the labs  - which we had two of every week, very helpful and more a waste of time.

Gave a good understanding of the mechanics side of physics. MasteringPhysics homework plus conference REALLY helped me understand the material when lecture was not enough. Exams were reasonable in difficulty. The provided practice exams are tremendously helpful to study with. Would recommend.
She's pretty chill. She's tough in her tests, but she's available for office hours and they're pretty helpful.

had her for PH1110, 1130, and AFM, and she is by far one of the best professors at this school - down to earth, happy to help, approachable and highly intelligent - writing the textbook for the AFM class.  encouraged my enthusiasm for physics and i wish my minor weren't complete so i could continue classes with her

She is pretty good.  She does a good job of incorporating technology into the course, though sometimes at the expense of precious class time.  Tests were generally harder than practice problems given, so my advice would be to go to Conferences and study the Summary Homeworks, and be able to adapt them for trickier situations.  Not a bad class.

Class work was just example problems using equations and vocab that was never talked about or reviewed. I never took physics in high school so it was painful. However she is very smart, and i'm now a physics minor lol

She is my adviser, so I might be a bit biased, but I've had her for 2 courses and worked with her in her lab and she is the most friendly, approachable professor in the physics department which makes her a wonderful introductory teacher.  I definitely suggest taking a class with her if you have interest in physics.

Shes the worst physics professor I've ever had in my life. I love physics and took two years before coming here and I'm lucky I did because I would not understand physics at all after coming out of her class. She can't teach at all and has a DRONING VOICE. She's tries to keep it interesting, but that doesn't help at all, it is stupid. Sucks for you
Always helpful and clearly explains the material. HW and tests are hard, but are fair and nothing comes out of nowhere. Prepares you extremely well for other, more intense classes
Waters down the material a bit too much when explaining. Almost treating you like you are in elementary school. She attempted to make class interesting. Overall easy class and average lecturer.
OK Physics teacher.  Always had interesting videos on Friday. Used demos fairly often.  Would recommend taking physics from her.
she always stood right in front of what she was writing on the board and talked into the board instead of to the class. she tried to make class interesting by doing demos at least

This was supposed to be the non-calc based physics yet she insisted on explaining things with calculus.  This ended up confusing more people than it helped and wasted quite a bit of time.  Tests were usually very hard and not curved at all. I would recommend finding another professor.

this class was extremely hard because i had never taken physics before. half way through i decided to NR the course purposely. but, if you have taken physics the class is still a lot of work, but manageable. she's extremely nice and helpful outside of class.

Difficult class if you already know physics, because she grades formating instead of physics. You always lose points for missing vector hats and other trivial things. You could get all the answers and still only get a 75% on something. Once you figure out how to answer the questions her way, you'll get a good grade. Expect 50-60 on tests.

super hard tests.... need to allot a lot of time.. make friends with other ph1111ers or u probably wont survive the constant hw barrage.. just hope everyone does bad in the class.. and she will scale..
Great class, hard tests, but the teacher was great

If i knew ahead of time that this class was for physics majors, i would have dropped down to ph1110, i agree the class is unnecessarily hard. She does have clear speaking skill, but most of the time cannot get the minute deails across. she also wastes alot of class time sipping her tea, switching the boards, and doing goofy stuff.. The work was overkill, two online hw-one written hw- and one lab a week, a good 25+hours on this class alone... would not do it again

This professor is very hard, not alot of information in the lectures, the class is mostly text book driven with additional help if needed. Do not take this class just to fly by, it is difficult. Pretty much for only physics majors.
Atomic Force Microscopy class last year was great.  I didn't get a good grade because I didn't have the time to put in, but I still learned a lot.  DO STUFF ON TIME!

These classes are much more difficult than the regular physics courses, but she does everything she can to make the work easy.  Office hrs helpful, but dont expect her to do everything for you.  If you come in with a good idea of what the problem is talking about, she'll be able to walk you thru it

After working hard on the home work I did not learn much. Prof. Burnham's is more interested in her research than helping students learn the matierial. That is, if you go to her for help outside her office hours, she will not help you because she is busy with her research. Teaching is also bad.
Worst tests ever.  If you're like me, and you're not a physics major, you're not going to like her.  Unnecessarily difficult!
I had a great time in this class and am not a physics major.  Awesome job!
FAB!  Super helpful, understanding, etc., etc...
a little boring
Teacher was great

No other professor has shown so much consideration for helping students during my time at WPI. He wants his students to learn and apply it to real-life scenarios. While this leads to much heavier workloads for his courses, I cannot emphasize enough how valuable the topics are. However, be prepared to write lengthy reports (15+ hours a week alone).
Best professor at this school teaches with enthusiasm and really cares

Great lectures, he moves really quickly through them and there's a LOT of information but pay attention and ask questions and it'll be fine. Long homeworks and labs. He always seems excited to be teaching and tries to keep the mood light.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Bitar is great. He will give you a lot of work, but it is definitely worth it. Explains the course material better than any other professor. Prepares you well for exams.

Absolutely loved taking ECE2201 with Professor Bitar. He is a person who clearly cares about his students, and his passion for his material shines through in every lecture. The course organization is A++ as well. Really such an awesome guy, wish he was my professor for every ECE class!

Bitar is 500/10. Cares about students deeply. Always accessible via email, office hours, after class, most all other times too. Lab reports are LONG (ours were 20-40 pages) but he and TAs grade easily and fairly. Generous with partial credit on tests, and he and his lectures do well to prepare you. I definitely gained useful skills from this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Bitar is one of the handful of really, really good professors in the ECE department. He truly cares about every student. The lectures in Micro 1 are extremely info dense, but easy to follow. Super super helpful in office hours, and will stay late to make sure every student gets the help they need. His Micro course isn't easy, but it sure is good.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Makes class fun, clearly enjoys teaching students and does a very good job at it. Does demos of concepts on fridays. He genuinely wants students to succeed and he is very easy to talk to. His homeworks are straight forward and the exams are clear and dont try to trick you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's literally the nicest professor I've had at WPI. He cares so much about the material as well as helping students learn. I know a lot of people dread ECE 2799, but I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Great, friendly, super smart professor. Class was super organized, with great labs. Bitar really cares about students, and is super helpful in lab. Homework and tests are all challenging but fair. I wish he taught more ECE courses.
Among the greatest professor I've ever seen. Really care about students and love to deliver all his knowledge. Exams are okay, lots of homework and labs are long. Overall, Great professor.

Labs don't take longer than 2 hours each. There is a lot of homework buy its only worth 10% so it helps you learn but it also won't hurt to skip a few. Tests aren't too bad. He gives you details about each question before hand. Labs were really unorganized (missing equipment, TAs didn't care).
Great Professor makes material seem easy. Go to class do the Homework. If you start the HW early in the week you should be fine.  HWs and labs  constitute the test know both the HW and the Lab.
In class he seems like a great guy, if you meet him outside for help or projects just Ehh.
Bitar is a great professor and his class is clear and straightforward. However, be aware of TAs during the lab report.

He is a great professor. He makes lectures entertaining by adding sound effects, demonstrations, and hilarious analogies. Lab reports are super long though. 20 pages is the minimum. You really learn something in this class. He gives tough homework assignments weekly, but they are relevant and he is willing to help you.

Brilliant Professor. Had him for 2799 and Micro 1. You can tell that he really loves the content, and has cool demos in class that will make a history major want to switch to ECE. Tests can be a little tricky, but always solvable. Go to class, help sessions,and understand the homework well, and you'll get the grade you want.

One of the few professors at WPI with a genuine interest in helping students become successful.  He talks a lot, but he listens as well.  Tests are medium difficulty but with a curve ball at the end.  He's the closest teacher in AK to Bill Nye (nerdy jokes included).  To get him on your good side, talk about honeybees.

I've had the privilege of having Professor Bitar for ECE2201 and ECE2799. I heard horror stories about 2799....but to this day it's still my favorite class. Very helpful for MQP too! He has a good sense of humor, but don't let that fool you his exams are tricky. He wants you too think. You'll find out for yourself in 2799! Have fun with the course!

Take a class from this professor; he is an excellent teacher.  He assigns a fair amount of homework, but not too much (took about 5hrs/week).  His tests asked questions based on the theory; some students considered these "trick" questions.  Do the work; listen in class; comprehend the labs. You will learn. You will get good grades.
Awesome guy!  I mean come on, in how many classes do you learn to make a guitar amplifier within 7 weeks AND get to see it in action?  Yea try topping that off!
Terrible. Like the guy before said but with a sad face.

This guy like sucks. I had him for 2201 and 2011 and both times i thought on all the test he tried to trick his students. His scale is good but he just sucks. Inconsistent lab grading between classes. Remember, if you have him, He is trying to trick you as we speak. Plus he had a 4.0 at wpi. That makes him better than you.

Absolutely phenomenal professor.  Teaches well and grades fairly.  Includes one difficult problem on tests, but scales.  Homework can throw a few curve-balls, but doesn't take longer than a few hours.  Do the homework ALONE and the tests are a cakewalk.  Overall excellent professor.

Great instructor, knows his stuff very well. Knows how to pace the course and makes lectures fun. If you take a class with him make sure you are ready to do A LOT of work. Labs take forever to write up and the tests are 50 minutes long but would take any normal person about 2 hours to finish, so you better be able to put in the time or u'll NR.
just not worth the work, he wont give you what you deserve
Great teacher that tries to keep your interest in the material.  Can be very difficult though.
This guy is a lot of fun and informative at the same time.  You just have to put in your fair share of time on the material at hand and you'll have no problem.

Bitar is fantastic! This guy knows everything! He's one of the best lecturers I've ever had because his lectures are interesting, helpful, and informative. However, his lab reports are long and tedious (~25 pages/week for two people). Also, his tests were very difficult because each test had at least one curveball that made you really think.
Amazing.  Really good lectures, really knows his stuff.  Look out for LOOOOOONG and tedious lab reports.  Aside from those he is one of the best teachers I have had at this school.

I have had him as a professor for 3 courses.  He teaches very clearly and makes the material interesting.  He is very helpful and his help sessions are especially useful.  He is always willing to answer questions and provide additional help.  He is one of my favorite teachers in the ECE department.

Decent guy in class, I like the man and he's not a bad teacher.  Pretty good sense of humor, he likes to say "Hear what I'm thinking, not what I'm saying" when he makes a mistake - very unfortunately he was dead serious as I found out.  He asked for project revisions, we made them, and then he destroyed our report for not having stuff not mentioned
He is da man!
The guy is simply the best in the ECE department. I really loved him. If u go to his help sessions, u will do really well in the class.
micro is Bitar's thing.  he loves it like he love EE in general.  he is a tough teacher though, he really expects a lot out of students, however he is one of the best professors here

You will learn. Tons of work, lots of time, but he gives you the tools to do it and is a very helpful professor in and out or class.  I would take any class he teaches, I have gotten two B's and could have made them A's if I did a little more work.
I love Bitar.
I thought he was amazing. He helped me so much. He was clear, and helpful. He truly is an amazing professor, and would help you any way he possibly could

I feel he is a little overrated. He should not be teaching EE2011, and Bitar himself admitted so during the term. Take a class with him only if he has taught that class a couple of times before. Otherwise an easy class will become a mess.

good teacher, really easy to understand, very helpful. Tossed in a lot in the second half, may have made course more difficult. All around good guy, the type you want to have a few beers with at the bar.
He is always available, his help sesions are awsome, if you get the homework and the helpsession you will pass the class, make sure he knows your name by the end of week 1, definite bonus.

I hear he is awesome for microelectronics, but for 2022 he taught a bunch of stuff for the last half of the term, and the final had nothing to do with that stuff. Dont know if this was a fluke since I hear he is normally pretty good.
I like this professor a lot. One of the best in EE dept.  Gives you a lot of work but very helpful when you ask for help.
Very thorough teacher, one of the best lecturers in the department.  He's also very concerned about the students themselves, and makes an honest effort to get to know them.
A professor whose life is all about teaching. Great in lecture and excellent in expleining material outside. He takes teaching and students very seriously.
No Comments

I had professor Bursten for both A and B term for ch1010 and ch1020. He is very well prepared for class and his teaching style worked well for me to understand the material, not just memorize it. Bursten is professional and friendly in communication. sometimes the online homework gets tedious but it is posted well before the due date :)
He's a really funny person over all, his lectures were very entertaining, not a lot of homework, but the tests were difficult.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures could get tedious but he gave good explanations and was open to questions. Quizzes and exams were tough and not always similar to lectures and homework, but he scales final grades to help.

Professor Bursten is the best professor I've had so far. He loves teaching and chemistry and it shows through his lectures. He is extremely knowledgeable and very receptive to questions, especially interesting ones. If you do the homework and practice quiz you will be fine. If you have the chance and are interested in chem, take a class with him.

I have had Prof. Bursten for CH1010 and CH1020 and I absolutely love him! He is passionate about teaching and genuinely wants to see his students succeed. Attending office hours are a huge help. If you are truly looking to learn, with hard work, you will be satisfied with having taken available courses with Professor Bursten.

I loved Professor Bursten. He made class super entertaining but also taught exactly what you needed to know. He does do pop-quizzes every class so beware of that, but he is genuinely such a great guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I had Professor Burnsten for Inorganic 2, which was a class size of 8 or 9 people. He was flexible and tried to make the class helpful for people of all chemistry backgrounds. It was very engaging and low-stress. He was involved with the well-being of the students and made it a fun time for all. He was also very accessible and encouraged questions.

I loved having Bursten! He loves what he teaches, is always positive, and is hilarious. He appreciates participation and will get to know you if so. He lets you choose what you want for grades and the practice exams were helpful. He tests on what he teaches, so you have to get the book for homework, you don't have to read the textbook to do well.

He was very thorough in lecture. There were two tests, though poll everywhere 1 question quizzes were frequent so make sure you get help when you don't understand the material. Office hours are a great way to see him work through example questions. He posted practice exams in advance which were similar to the actual exam.
He's goated asf

Prof Bursten expects you to understand the higher-level content in the CH1010 course description, and tests you on it, but he's also very good at presenting it in an understandable way. I got a lot out of this class even though I had already taken AP Chem and some of the material was review.

I had an amazing experience with Professor Bursten. His lectures well organized and was extremely helpful during office hours. On a personal note, I had a difficult time adjusting to college and my grades suffered. Professor was so accommodating and understanding toward my situation and put in so much effort to ensure I succeed in his class.

Professor Bursten was clearly dedicated and passionate about his class. However, he wasn't lenient at all when I was struggling with assignments due to mental health reasons. In addition, he clearly stated that several topics weren't necessary to memorize as they weren't that revelant, which we were later expected to know in CH1020.

Professor Bursten's lectures are amazing - he starts every day off with some chemistry news or facts to get you interested and engaged in the topic. Tests and quizzes are extremely difficult and make up the vast majority of the grade, but he curves heavily. Overall, great, fun guy, and very good instructor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Love his lectures, a funny guy. Tests were difficult but his study guides were basically the material on the test so it wasn't too bad. Mastering is an L tho

Bursten is a really good professor, a lot of these comments say how hard his tests are, but they are definitely doable. He gave us sample exams that were extremely similar to actual exams and really helpful. Go over lectures, practice exams, and go to office hours. He also gave a really easy group project worth a lot of points. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof Bursten made me feel genuinely cared about as a student. Right away you could tell he loves his job and just wants to see his students do well, especially if he sees that you are putting in the work. His lectures were very understandable and he tried to make them fun. GO TO OFFICE HOURS, they were always EXTREMELY helpful. 10/10 recommend.

Professor Bursten is a very good lecturer and overall nice guy. The homework given tend to be more difficult than the quizzes and exams, but still very worth studying for. Paying attention in lectures is also very important in order to do well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Really funny lectures that cover the important parts of the material. Go to his office hours for help on the homework. To prepare for tests, review the homework questions, the practice exams, and his lectures. He emphasizes understanding, not memorization, and gives you a formula sheet. I would definitely choose him over other Chem1010 professors.

Bursten was a great professor. His lectures were immersive and interesting and his passion for chemistry shined through every day. Overall a nice and funny individual. Tests/quizzes can be tough, do the sample tests, they are exactly like the actual tests. Also loved the group work!

I had Professor Bursten for Chemistry 1010, and you can tell that he truly cares for his students and about his work. His tests can be pretty tough, but I would definitely suggest going to office hours as often as possible- He is super welcoming and will help you through homework problems, and really makes sure you understand the content.

Bursten puts so much time and effort into his lectures and it is much appreciated. For the midterm and final, he posted practice tests and they were very similar to those exams. Glad to say that I didnt open the textbook once and just studied those tests and lecture slides. He wouldnt let us see our averages until after the final, but it was ok.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Bursten genuinely cares for his students. The test material directly correlates with the lectures and he gives students some choice in the way the material is assessed. His exams tend to average lower scores, but he is upfront about it and about scaling final course scores.
Honestly loved the class and his teaching. The group projects were interesting and related to the course.

I really enjoyed this class. This was taken as completely online due to COVID restrictions, but Bursten tried to make it as interactive as possible and even helped us to get to know other students by creating project groups. He was very accommodating and his office hours were amazing!

Professor Bursten is a gem at WPI.. one of the kindest people I have met, especially it terms of professors. You can tell he wants his students to succeed and feel like his work is valued, but still pushes them to do more. Couldn't recommend him more.

Prof. Bursten genuinely cares about his students. I barely passed the midterm, so I went to all of his office hours (2 hours, 3 days a week- super helpful) and ended the class with an A! He was helpful, understanding, and receptive to feedback. I took CH 1010 A term, and really wish he taught CH 1020.
Super great guy! Tests are hard but my best advice is go to office hours, especially if they are on zoom. If you put in the effort you will do well.

Prof. Bursten was an incredible IQP advisor. He equally challenged and supported my team, and was always providing lightening the mood during a difficult remote IQP. Any student would be lucky to have him!

Professor Bursten is a very good professor. He makes sure to always put you first when it comes to the class and does his best to work with you and make sure you succeed. You can really tell he wants the best for his students, and help you achieve your goal if you spend the time getting help from him.
One of the best professors I had. He is super nice and funny in class and tries hard to get to know everyone's names. His test a very difficult though so be prepared to study.

Bursten is an amazing teacher and an amazing person. He cares deeply about his students and wants them to learn more than anything. His exams are difficult with an average of about 60%, but gives a decent amount of partial credit it. Study hard, go to every lecture, get to know him in office hours and you won't have an issue with this class.

Bursten is THE MAN. Some people don't like him because he doesn't give a ton of partial credit, but if you take the time to get to know him, he's actually a really chill prof, and wants the best for his students. Office hours definitely can help with clarifying concepts you don't get, but he usually does a good job explaining everything in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Professor Bursten is the kindest professor I have experienced yet. He genuinely cares about the well being of his students both in class and out. I began CH1010 poorly, but with his encouragement, I began to do better and finish with a B! Sitting in the front helps, and as long as you really pay attention and read the textbook, you'll do great!

Prof. Bursten is a great guy overall. His tests will take some getting used to, and they are VERY difficult, but if you study you should be well above the class average (tended to be 60% on every exam). Hilarious guy who cares about his students!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Great guy with great stories. Lectures are always interesting, not hard to get an A if you put in some effort.

I took CH 1020 with him and his lectures were really interesting and really makes you more interested in the subject matter of chemistry. He really does a good job of knowing all the student's names and doing fun demos to get student involvement. Tests are hard so DO THE HOMEWORK, read the textbook and pay attention in lecture.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Bursten wants to make sure you see chemistry through his lens, which isn't a bad thing. He makes fun references in class and goes into topics that are interesting. Don't be fooled by the sidetracks into fun chem though, his tests are no joke, and you should definitely study for them. He cares about his students and he has high expectations for them

Bursten not only wanted to cover basic material, but go beyond and stimulate interest in chemistry. He even incorporated interesting demos despite the limitations of the lecture hall. Tests can be hard but it is still worth it to take the class as he is very understanding with grades. He seeks engagement and hard work and is a really nice guy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome, caring, unique. He teaches, not lectures. His interaction and enthusiasm is contagious. He will challenge you, but makes you think. Pay attention for extra credit anecdotes. Exams are beyond difficult but go to OH often for extra help and you'll do fine. Talk with him 1:1. Bottom line, he cares and wants his students who care to succeed.

Bursten was a great professor. Chem 1020 is a lot of work, but Bursten's enthusiasm for chemistry made it easier to learn. He is very clear in his lectures and really wants us to think about chemistry instead of memorizing. His exams were challenging and really stretched our thinking. I am a lot more interested in chemistry now.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Bursten is a professor with a certainly decorated past. His expectations are extremely high and his exams were longer and more difficult than other professors. Homework is worth little credit and isn't even close to the exam material, but you MUST do it over and over again in order to pass. He WILL challenge you so expect low grades.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Bursten goes above and beyond to deepen your understanding of the material. Difficult homework and exam problems really challenge and improve your problem solving skills. If you're afraid of a little adversity, I wouldn't recommend. Lectures were always interesting even when the material covered was pretty dry.

If you do all the homeworks three or four times- you'll pass. If you don't have 40 hours a week to only do Pearson questions, you will need to meet with him and write aggressive notes in class. Gets very political in class but tends to keep it civil.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Bursten is a good professor but his exams are nothing like the material taught in class or on the homeworks. He doesn't like memorization and prefers that his exams are more learning based. He posts his lectures but does not have all the material on them. He is degrading toward the class when students do not preform well. Take other professors @WPI
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: His tests are much more of a show your work than memorization. Be prepared to study, and write down descriptive notes during lecture, even his tangents may be extra credit questions. He posts the lectures, but they do not contain all of the content he talks about.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Hilarious

comment: This man is so funny during lecture, he teaches the material but also manages to add in stuff he finds fascinating. Almost every lecture had some kind of explosion video or strange tangent that relates (barely) to the topic covered in lecture. Be sure to pay attention to these though, they appear as extra credit questions on tests sometimes!

This was probably the worst set of classes I have ever taken. The professor assigned daily homework with no opportunity to see or access your grade. The homeworks were either full or no credit. Gave absolutely no partial credit for thought processes or understanding of techniques. Consistently failed to give useful explanations of critical ideas.
Asking Chris Larsen for help invoked similar feelings as asking my mother how she feels about me after 5 martinis.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Made students feel stupid, wasn't accessible outside of class, grades were harsh, miss class on the wrong day without telling him and he'll give you a 0 on an assignment. This class was bs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: The least understanding professor I've ever had. Throughout the whole term I missed 1 class because I was sick, and I emailed both him and the TA twice asking what the homework was and he wouldn't tell me. Ended up getting points off for late submission even though I was not told the assignment until after the due date. Awful teacher, poor examples
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very knowledgeable professor. Easily accessible.

He made something as complicated as Real Analysis seem so simple. He's very good at explaining the concepts and making it intuitive. Sometimes seems a little unusual but is always interesting to listen too. Also loves class participation which is a plus. Great class and teacher

Coming from a math major that loves thinking critically about proofs and the underlying meaning and explanations of mathematics, I recommend Larsen as a brilliant and precise professor. He is quirky but passionate, and he is willing to help those who are engaged in the class. I would go as far to say this was my favorite class this far.

What should I say to this professor.  The course real analysis is difficult, he had a TA, without no help session. The reason, I think, is that the TA's understanding of this course is not that good, and the professor is lazy. The homework take a 50% of the final score, anyone can image how bad it is with a bad TA. Do not take his course.
He always let you think about the problems before tell you how to do it. He makes real analysis pretty easy.

He is very friendly, and witty. The lectures are run in a socratic style. He asks questions and the class participates in constructing proofs. This makes it difficult to follow at times, but otherwise engaging. His homework was assigned at lecture and was challenging but reasonable. Tests were very fair and easier than homework.

Brilliant guy who knows his stuff very well. Professor was hard and had high expectations but presented things differently (somewhat less abstract but similarly rigorous) than in the book. This is a hard course and if you spend the time to completely grasp the material, you are solid. Unfortunately, I didn't do this.

This man does not know how to teach. He did almost no examples and expected you to be able to solve problems based upon his proof of the most basic case. As someone else mentioned, he showed up late to the final and didn't even have all the tests printed until 1/4 of the class was over. Also, he made it an important point to never ever email him.

Where to start... On the day of the final (40% of your overall grade) he showed up 10 minutes late with half of the tests printed. I got my test 17 minutes into the class and he only gave us 5 minutes extra. He didn't even help distribute them after that (might've given us more time), instead, he left to check his phone. Didnt actually teach either
Gave two tests, first on the class average was failing and he blamed our previous calc teachers.  What a joke!
not a very good teacher.  very disorganized, showed up to class late, never clear in his explanations.
really good guys

Never in his office. Unresponsive to emails. Leaves right after class even when a ton of people in the class have questions. Has great difficulty communicating abstract concepts effectively. Shows absolutely no concern for his students actually learning the material. I would avoid him at all costs.

Good professor, understands his topic very well, and understands thoroughly what specific points should be stressed.  im not a fan of theory, but he does a good job.  dont take his class if you dont want to think, he will give you a good understand if you think a little bit.

My favourite math professor, had him for analysis, yet I wouldn't recommend him to everyone. He forced us to think on ourselves, focused on "whys and hows", and he IS FUNNY. So if interested in maths, loves to think deep about maths, he definitely is a good professor. Otherwise you'll suffer alot. His hw is extremely hard and sometimes long too.
A very nice man. The exams are extremly easy but the homewoks are horrible.(He gave homework everyday, sometimes more than 10 proving problems a day, it really takes ages to finish)
Not very helpful
Excellent!

Had him for LinAlg. At 8am, his teaching style put me to sleep almost every day. The class is all proofs and theorems, and the book doesn't give many examples at all. I wish there were help sessions other than the once-per-week conferences, because my TA had a harder time with English than the math. Overall more difficult than he should be.
Definitely THE hot math professor
Excellent professor, very clear.  Forced us to think and learn.
No Comments

Dr. Larsen is an amazing mathematician, and a clear and effective teacher. He taught Linear Algebra in a way that made sense. If you're a math major, you're lucky to have Dr. Larsen as a professor. And whether you're a math major or not, stop complaining and pay attention to him!
his tests are very tricky.  He goes over something for two lectures and expects you to be able to answer anything he asks.  Plainly stated, he's just not a good teacher.

Terrible.  It might not have been so bad if he answered any e-mails he recieved.  It also would have been helpful if he showed up to help sessions less than 25 minutes late.  And when he did show up, his answers were unclear and pointless.  I especially liked his "just think about it" response.

This guy can't teach. I stopped going to class halfway through the term because I got sick of his meaningless banter. He never explains anything and assumes your going to get the "click". He didn't even respond to my emails with questions about the sample exam 3 days before the final.

Excellent professor, precise, organized, has a sense of humor, wants students to arrive at the proof on their own, doesn't want someone who has already seen the proof to spoil the fun for others.  Great classes for everybody who is willing to study, definitely worthwhile :-)
Just veru hard...
Great Linear Algebra class... heavy on proofs and wants students to think.
Clearly a very smart person.  Explains things OK but refuses to answer questions on homework.  Instead he'll refer you to the grader who does not answer emails.
When asked for an explaination on a homework problem, he responds "Just play with it." Thanks for the help.

He's definitely a smart man, he knows his stuff, and he's a good teacher.  He has a wit, but he doesn't like his students to express theirs.  He would be better teaching MA 1032, because his method of teaching assumes you can grasp every tiny detail asap.
BEGIN INPUT : CALCULUS IV : END INPUT. He's like an android. A great lawyer, though.
Average teacher, a little confusing and tests were kind of tricky.
He didn't teach me anything and it makes me wonder if he ever took calc3 himself
DO lin alg with him, challenging, but ultimately rewarding (wait for the click)
Terrible teacher, doesn't help at all.
didn't really know what he was teaching
tried to be as helpful as he could.  failed miserably. ma 1023 is the worst calc
Nice guy, just not the greatest teacher.  Homework & Tests were just right
He mumbled at the board for 50 minutes straight, I never understood the class...

Emanuel cares so much about his students. He will help you during test, is free to meet whenever. The class' material is pretty hard but it doesn't matter because if you show him that you care, he will change test grades till you have an A. Final project is tough though.

Classes are fun, interesting projects, not hard if you do the work.  Also: If you are a WPI student and have never taken a class with him, SHAME ON YOU! You have no idea what you are missing. If you ever feel like you've lost faith in humanity, go to his office and talk with him. So inspirational and human!

Most student oriented professor I know.  Most knowledgeable professor I know.  His style is particular in class, so learn it fast.  Will drop everything to help a student one-on-one.  He teaches tough classes, so put in the work early and coast for the last few weeks.  Handouts are good for tests.  Learn PSPICE, he loves it in projects.

Prof. Emanuel is doubtless the best professor I have ever had. I took ECE 2019 with him; it was quite a challenging class but he really forces you to learn the material. If you ask him for help, he will drop whatever he is working on and give you as much time as you need. He is a wonderful person and I highly recommend him.
Excellent professor mentor. Helps you a lot when you need help and are willing to work for it.
Go to class, study his class handouts and you'll be all set. One of the best Prof in ECE department.

My absolute favorite professor in my four years at WPI. A man who is truly dedicated to his students and wants them to understand the material. I've not had any other teacher show as much interest in my school work or hopes and aspirations as Prof. Emanuel. That said, not a class you can sleep through, but if you need help you will get it!

I have never posted on this website but I have to post about Professor Emanuel. One of THE BEST professors and human beings I have ever met. He is truly dedicated to his students and is just too sweet. He always has inspirational stories to tell and will never give up on you. He's a genuinely wonderful man. Thank you professor!
He is the best professor EVER!!!!

Probably one of the most helpful professors if you take the time to sit down and talk with him about whatever you're struggling on. The book used was practically useless after the 3rd week. While the class does flow in a logical order, he does have a tendency to go a little off topic and if you aren't paying attention, you'll forget whats going on.

He is very willing to help you out if you go see him outside class and will probably bump your grade if you are borderline and he knows you very well. Gives your his own prewritten notes. The project for this class was so confusing and impossible to pass without bugging him for help with it. But the concept of the course was straightforward.
Very helpful, an overall beast.
Really nice person!
Really good teacher! great person who is extremely intested in his students. One of the best!

The only way to fail his class is if you don't try and never talk to him.  Even if you are completely terrible at the subject, he will give you an A just for trying.  He will literally help you out during tests.  He will also happily reschedule and let you make up tests if you feel you are doing poorly. One of the best professors in the department.
Very very passionate about teaching! Willing to give you an A only if he believes you've understood all the course material presented in class. He'll make you want to get an A though ;-)

He's an old foreign guy, but cares about his students. Very helpful if you go to him individually and ask for help, not so much in class. Sometimes its hard to follow what is being done in class and understand the concept unless you let him know. But overall a good prof. if you ask for help when you need it.

It has been my honor and prevailage to be a student of his class. He is not only a great Professor, but also a great mentor. I have learnt so much from him and it is my dream to be like him one day. He is a great project adviser also and many students have reached great accomplishments under his guidance. He is simply amazing.
Will tell you the answers to his tests during the tests.  Awesome guy, really cares about his students and their future
One of the best professors I have ever met. Amazing professor. He is extremely helpful.

The material could be hard, but he was always very willing to explain in class, or even sit with you for an hour outside of class to make sure you really understood it.  His grading was extremely fair and based much more upon your understanding of the material at the end of the class than on your mistakes at the beginning.
Really good and helpful professor. Concerns every of his students in their development. He talked to everybody during a Lab to know them. with charming personality.

Some told me they do not understand his lecture. So just go to his office, ask for help and it is damn sure that you can ace the course. His explannations are crystal clear if you meet with him one by one.

The opportunity to learn from this man is one of the best experiences you can find at WPI. He'll go to the ends of the earth to help any person in any aspect of their classes or lives. He can be hard to understand and teaches more than you need... but neither one of these traits are too detrimental in the end.
I remember his instruction after 14 years.  He made me provide myself with something to stand on.

Quality, experience, helpful. This man is the person why you would love Electrical Engineering. His enthusiasm and will to teach mixes with lots of different EE experiences and history that he had in the past. He makes you work your ass off and still enjoy the hell out of the class. There are so many things to earn from him, take his class!:)

This guy is one of the best professors in WPI ECE department.  He is hard but he can explain the ECE principles especially related to power engineering very very well.  Also very helpful inside and outside the class.  Do not get me wrong though, his classes are tough and he does not scale at all, A is at 90% or above.
Very boring and hard to understand.  Tests do not reflect class.  Book is better teacher.

After having him for the entire area of Power Systems, I have to say that he is The Man when it comes to power and teaching. The only way for you not to learn in his class is to not try. Ask him during office hours if you don't understand everythign during class. You won't be sorry.
Emanuel is the best Professor. If you put in the time, you'll get through. Hard tests and projects, but they definitely help you learn more in the end.

Emanuel is probably one of the best professors the EE department has to offer.  He may not explain things as clear as other teachers I've had, and he may make mistakes, but he actually wants his students to learn.  Very funny guy, get to know him asap.
No Comments
da man in our ECE department...no offense to anybody but this guy could kickass in just about any field that has anything to do with ECE...he's da ECE God

not that hard...exams are ok / easy if you know the stuff, which he takes a lot of pains to explain...otherwise the best professor I've had at WPI for a good time to come! And very flattering too... ;-)

Even though his courses are hard and he makes you fall asleep, he is there for you and challenges you to put in a lot of effort to truly understand the material.  His class is not one you can get by in without trying.  His exams are f-ing hard.
His exams are hard. He does put out alot of effort to help you understand the materials however
Great guy, decent professor, and always willing to help.

I had prof emanuel for 2 classes and my MQP. If you don't like him as a prof. it's only because you don't want to put in the time or work and don't really care to learn.  He's always there for his students no matter what.

He's a great professor; if you go to class and really want to learn the subject, not just get a grade.  If he knows you have questions he will do anything to make sure you undestand the material. He really cares about his students!!

His english is poor, grading very subjective and his enthusiasm is lacking. If you want someone who won't really help you how to learn the subject matter and will make you fall asleep in class then take his class.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
GO TO CLASS
She is honestly a great teacher all around. Before every test, she always had an extra office hour. W
I Love Dina!! One of the best professors at WPI.

Great professor! She responded to emails very quickly and was great at answering questions. Homeworks and practice tests were similar to the exams. Lectures were helpful with lots of examples. An extensive note sheet was provided for exams.

I would 100% recommend Professor Rassias! Although she introduces new topics rather quickly, every new topic is backed up with 2-5 examples, she always takes time to ensure everyone understands. The course is also structured very well, it is always clear when assignments were due and what was being asked. Accepted all reasonable extension requests.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Homework has little effect on grades, quizzes are rushed and poorly presented, somewhat challenging finals with limited time for preparation leaves my time in Linalg feel unfinished and unprepared. While she is very nice and well meaning, it feels like a facade to make the class *feel* easier. While Linalg is simple, her explanations are poor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Linear Algebra -  Exams are definitely harder than the homeworks so be prepared for that. Other than that, great lecturer and does tons of practice problems. Roughly two homeworks per week.

MA2071 - Honestly the best math professor I've had in my entire school career. She makes jokes and shows real world applications of linear algebra in lecture. Plenty of office hours per week and if you go to class, you'll get extra points at the end. She cares deeply for all her students, just show up, respect her, and you'll get an A. She's an A+

Encourages you to attend her lectures for your own good and gives extra credit on exams if you do attend the lectures. Her lectures are fantastic and the exam reviews correlates very well with the actual exam so you won't have to worry about disconnection. If you show up, do the work, A is very doable. btw this is for Linear Algebra, MA 2611

Weekly quizzes, written hws, and web works. Also a midterm, final, and pretension. Ab 10-15h/w. Hw often posted 2-3 days before due (has 24h grace period tho). Exams likely to have a question or 2 on something covered in class for 15min, prob while she was going over the 50 min class time. Attendance not really mandatory, but is extra cred.

Professor Rassias was absolutely amazing. I had her for both MA 1023 and MA 1024. She is caring towards the students and is always willing to help outside of class and wants to help students succeed. The lectures are fast paced and full of examples. Additionally, she allows note sheets for tests and provides copies of her own note sheets to be used

Professor Rassias was an amazing professor to have. She clearly had interest in the topics presented and wanted to make sure all student understood the material. The examples given in the lectures were much easier than the questions on the homework which was sometimes frustrating. But she allowed extra help and points back.

I honestly really liked her. She was very kind and respectful when questions were asked and she does try to help no matter what. Her lectures were very informative and useful. The homework can't be done early though because you have to wait for the lecture in order to complete the assignment.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Knowledgeable, funny, caring, and very accessible. I learned and grasped concepts with her the best out of any professor I've had at WPI (besides the outstanding Professor Makaroff). I went out of my way just to take Linear Algebra with her because of how good an experience I had with her in Calculus IV, which was equally as great.

Amazing during the first half of calc IV, but the lectures weren't as great in the second half. She cares a lot about her students and wants to see everyone succeed, and was very open to feedback on exam material/dates/teaching style, so go to office hours! Would take it again.

Made an account just so I could give her 5 star. Literally the most enjoyable math course I've ever taken. The content is hard, and she does go pretty fast, but she is EXTREMELY helpful during and after lectures. She gets very excited when teaching the material, and it made me excited. Also she gives a cheat sheet during tests, no memorizing! 10/10
Funny, caring, and understanding. She gives great lectures and explanations. She has great office hours as well.
Love this Professor. She takes her time and makes sure students succeed

Professor Rassias cares for and respects all her students and is always accessible outside the class, sometimes more helpful than the TAs! She responds to emails fast and tries her best to help you understand the material. She goes through lectures fast and will leave problems unsolved but exams are straightforward and the review is spot-on for it.

Professor Rassias is one of the best math professors I have ever had. She gives lots of example problems which are very helpful for homework. Exams are difficult to complete in the 50 minute class period, but she allows a few extra minutes if needed, and she lets you bring as many note sheets as you'd like. I absolutely recommend taking her class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Rassias cares about her students and it shows-- go to the office hours! Does not record on echo360 and has attendance quizzes; don't skip class. Nearly impossible to fail this course if you attend every class and turn in your assignments.

Lectures move quickly, especially through example problems; sometimes it is best to sit back and absorb as notes are posted online. Homework problems are often in-depth, but the workload isn't huge. Tests are designed to be generously easy and open note.

Professor Rassias was one of my favorite professors that I have had at WPI so far. She is so nice and approachable and willing to help you with any kind of question you have. She was very understanding when it came to deadlines and makeup tests. GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS, they were very helpful.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Rassias was an amazing Calc 3 professor. Calc 3 is known as the hardest calc class at WPI but Professor Rassias made it seem like a breeze. She was incredibly understanding of personal struggles and willing to accommodate her students. She was a very encouraging teacher and cared deeply about all her students. Would 100% recommend.

Prof. Rassias has been my favorite professor so far at WPI. She really cares about all of her students and her exams cover what was actually taught in class/on homework. She held office hours multiple times a week and was always available to meet one on one which I appreciated. I learned a lot in this course and would definitely recommend!

Professor Rassias is one of the nicest people I have ever encountered and by far the best professor that I've had at WPI.  She gave extensions if asked (sickness and mental health), and deeply cared about the mental health and wellbeing of her students, which isn't always the case.  100% would recommend to anyone to take her calc 3 class.

She I really enjoyed taking Calc IV with Prof. Rassias. She was accessible outside of class, and willing to provide help if need be. Shes also very caring and nice to talk too. Her tests can be hard to finish in the time limit, but she does offer extra credit opportunities to boost your grade. Shes also willing to give extensions for homework.
Rassias is an ok professor if you don't have anything going on. However, god forbid anything comes up, she pretends to be helpful but then leaves you in the dust when you need help.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She was so caring and truly wanted her students to succeed. Her tests directly reflected the examples given in class. She gave extra credit opportunities to boost exam scores.

Prof. Rassias is honestly one of the most caring people I have ever met. She tries really hard to make this class as doable as possible and really cares for her students. The lectures can be fast but she uploads lecture notes and you can ask to access the lecture videos. Homework is manageable and exams reflect class examples and homework.

She is a great professor and really cares about students. Her office hours are really helpful. Her exams are difficult to finish, but she allows a note-sheet on each one and her practice exams are almost exactly like the real ones. She also offers extra credit to improve exam grades. Her lectures are fast, but she is very thorough.

Great professor, caring, and ready to make your life easier. She tries hard to get you to understand the concepts, but you have to put in some time and effort too. She is always available outside of class.

She is a great teacher and person!! Wants you to actually succeed and learn the material so she will do anything to help you get a good grade/one you're happy with! 10/10, would take another class with just her because of what an amazing teacher she is!!!

Great professor to start off my WPI experience. Really does her best to try to care about every student in her class, holds office hours with good times, and offers lots of ways to get credit back if you mess up.

I would very much so recommend Professor Rassias for Calculus 3. She offers just the right amount of homework and her lectures are very much worth going to. She is also very passionate about the mathematics that she teaches and she is very understanding and offers extra credit when needed.

Professor Rassias really rambles on and goes off topic so it's hard to follow during lectures/class. She complains about teaching 5 classes a day, once a week like bruh you're getting paid 6 figs to barely do anything. She just seems more interested in herself than the learning of her students. Would not recommend if you're not proficient in calc!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: I wouldn't have passed this class if Rassias wasn't my professor. She was super understanding, helpful, and was willing to re-look at exams. If you're unhappy with an exam grade you won't lose anything by bringing it up with her. Super helpful at office hours as well.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I didnt have her as an actual teacher but the way Covid set up the calc sequence this year I interacted with her a lot. Office hours with her extremely useful and I found them the most useful of all the professors. She was also very helpful during tests as I know those must have been stressful for her online (lots of things always went wrong).
Rassias seems to have little interest in making her class engaging or useful. Lectures are hard to follow and examples are often left incomplete. There is rarely enough time to complete a test.

Doesnt post lecture notes which makes it very hard to achieve anything because in class youre rushing to write everything down and cant actually pay attention to what shes saying. Refused to round my final grade up even though it was 0.19 points away from the next letter grade, which pretty much any other professor would do.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Always accessible to meet with you both in office hours and outside. Tests cover material covered in class but with a hundred extra steps not covered in class. Will curve grades and provide extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: A few downsides to Rassias is that she lectures in a monotone voice and exams are difficult. Drink coffee before class. On the bright side, homework is both online and written, and the written homework is graded for completion. She is great one on one during her office hours. Also, she is great with giving out partial credit on exams.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is super unclear in class. She talks really quietly and doesn't make sense. She frequently makes mistakes and needs students to correct her. She either teaches a topic too much or too little.

Prof Rassias goes more in depth than other Calc III professors, but she is a bit inconsiderate to her students. She assigns weekly homework and encourages proactivity, but then changes the homework near the due date so that proactive students suffer and must redo work. While the material was not difficult, her teaching style was quite overwhelming.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Rassias gives very hard tests and does not scale, but is very good about giving partial credit. She does not use class capture, so you have to go to lecture, and she speaks softly, so sit near the front. Otherwise she is a very nice lady who really cares about you learning the material.
Made a ridiculous amount of mistakes during lectures and was generally unclear. Seems really kind outside of class but can't teach as effectively as others.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is a tough grader and he also does not care about his students. He has a zero tolerance policy no matter the situation. He also assigns an unreasonable amount of work. The quiz/tests have questions that were too long for the time that we were given and some of the question's answers were one off handed comment during lectures. expects too much!

He is a very strict grader and the quizzes end up being too long for a times quiz. Mid-term and final are also worth 80% of the grade so if you do not do good on one you are screwed. If you try and reach out about issues he is very unresponsive/refuses to help

Straightforward; Watch the lecture, do the reading, take the quiz, do the homework and you have an A. The amount of material assigned is ridiculous. way more than the allowed number of lecture hours.  A quiz with 30 trick question with 6 or 7 multiple choice options, several answers are correct but he will only accept exactly what he said in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Worse Professor every requires an ungodly amount of work from students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Solid Professor. His lectures are well thought out and designed. He expands on subjects to help you really understand them. Jumps around a little bit so you might have to go back and edit subjects in your notes. Fair amount of homework but if you do that and watch the lectures it's a straight forward A.

Dont even think of taking this class. lots of homework which require over 20 hrs of research. you will be checked for plagiarism even if this is not a writing class (The professor expects you to come up with your own definitions.) . Be ready to be tested on lots of useless materials. Quizes full of trick questions. Qns with 8 multiple choices.

The homework assignments for this class take so much time to complete. While they are 10 questions, each question has 3-4 questions, so there's about 40 questions to answer in total, yet it is graded on completeness. Lectures are sporatic and long. Exams are multiple choice with 60 questions for 50 mins.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He assigns a stupid amount of homework and quizzes that took up a ridiculous amount of time. Lecture notes posted online are incomplete, quiz/exam questions are misleading and cover the most minuscule topics, and when a student asked a valid question he said they were "wasting his time." Do not take a class with this man if you have the option.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Super difficult and throws in questions on homework that were hardly discussed in class

I have taken two of his courses before, which were fine. I thought this one was going to be ok as well, but it was not. Tons of homework and quizzes throughout the course, and the final exam was just madness. He expects you to remember every detail, even those he only mentioned in a single line in the videos.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Some of his lectures jump around a bit, so you should be familiar with the order of your notes. It's also worth looking into the extra resources he posts on canvas. Quizzes and tests ask questions about almost all of the topics he teaches, but don't go super in depth into the specifics, however if he goes in-depth for an example, take good notes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Take it from someone else if you can. He won't give you back your test and you have to go and sit in his office to look it which is extremely annoying. if you don't test well you're kind of screwed. He makes you draw a lot of conceptual graphs on tests that he will either not talk about or barely go over. Not a great experience at all.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Whatever you do, do not get up to pee, go on your phone, eat "smelly food", or talk during this guy's class. He WILL yell at you. If there is another option of a professor take it from them. He is good, but doesn't seem to care much about students. He won't give you back the tests and you have to go and sit in his office to look at them.
I was the most strefull experience in WPI
Terrible does not care to teach material

I took this as an online class which was horrible. He clearly did not want to teach an online class so the answers on the quizzes were marked wrong even if the answer came up correct and he didn't email or call back which made it very difficult to have these errors corrected. Would not recommend for anyone looking to take an online class with him.

I was surprised by how clear and interesting his lectures were. The material he taught us was relevant and could be applied to other engineering projects. That said, he gives a lot of assignments and they are painfully long. He also expects you to watch hours of video lectures each week on top of class. His lectures bounce all over the place too.

The lectures were incomplete power points that provide nothing without the class itself. They are useless for review ahead of time, and useless for review after the class. The online exams had trick questions, double negatives, and straight from book definitions. The "mid-term" and "final" were normal quizzes that happened to count for a lot more.

In a Shivkumar class such as Plastics you will learn more about material properties than you did in any other class, and then you will learn about the world of plastics. This guy packs tons of info into efficient, easy-to-follow lectures. Responds super fast to your email questions. People say he's difficult but I didn't think so. Great guy.

Quizzes and Homework due every week, 2 projects, and 2 exams. Exams worth 60% and are mostly based off of the questions he asked in the beginning of class. Pretty straightforward and a very interesting class
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: tons of useless work may learn a lot if the course is semester long
Tons of work and videos.  Do the work and you'll do well.

He assigns a ton of work and videos, but if you do it all and work to understand it, an A is possible and likely.  He doesn't like using his office hours though.  I am looking forward to more classes with him.

May very well be the worst class I have ever taken at WPI. Doesn't show up to his own course or office hours. The lack of caring and competency in teaching the class was astounding. The recorded content he had left a lot to be desired to say the least. Errors and typos were everywhere in the hw and exams. It was easy enough, but poorly managed.
excellent professor with clear cohesive lectures and tests that reflect the lectures and homework.  very helpful and available outside of class.
THE BEST PROF. IN THE DEPT. If you work hard you will get an A.  Gives so much work you but in the end it's worth it. Had him for 4 classes and he is one my my favorites.
Took two grad classes with Prof. Shivkumar.  He is the best professor I've ever had - graduate or undergraduate.  He is clear, helpful and you have to try really hard to do badly in his class.
Always willing to help. Quizzes are very difficult but tests are a bit easier. Lots of work and a difficult course, but good teacher.
goes over everythng thouroughly in class, dont really have to even study

Excellent professor. Homeworks take forever, and exams aren't the easiest, but he will teach you the material so well that you will leave feeling like you learned a lot. Always willing and eager to help students if they are even the slightest bit confused.
Very picky with IQP project reports. Will make you work hard.
Nice prof. Even you miss the class, you can listen to the whole lecture from mywpi. Tests are easy if you do his homeworks and quizzes.  A is not difficult if you are hardworking.
Good teacher.  Seems interested in making sure students learn.  Almost impossible to fail.

Clear, easy tests, totally straightforward, takes responsibility for your learning, definitely not an irresponsible prof (if he misses lecture, he makes use of MyWPI very well to make up lost time). If you have a question, he is certain to NOT just give you the answer! Ask intelligent questions! He really cares about you learning! GREAT prof!
Hw always has questions on topics not covered in class, always have to search for information to complete assignments. tests have obscure questions. you can learn alot, but hard to do well
Best class I've taken at this school.  Made class fun and interesting.

He's a very good teacher, he makes it interesting to learn about Materials Science, He repeats important information several times as the course goes on so it becomes ingrained in your mind. You will always know what a thermoset is! Sometimes he doesn't respond to emails. He teaches the class like it's a real college class, no high school babying!
Lectures were almost useless.  He coverd concepts but few examples.  Tests were on ludicrously unrelated material.
Decent class, go to lectures and listen a bit, pass in all hw (only 7) and do good on quizzes and you'll be fine.  not teribilly hard, and you learn alot of practical material
No Comments
Simple material in class.  Very difficult, completely unfamiliar material on homeworks.  I would never want to be in this professor's class again.
Painstakingly clear, very thorough.  You have to try to do poorly.
He is the best prof. I have ever had at WPI
No Comments
Great person, mentor and professor. Had him for my MQP last year. Was also available. He helped me get a job.

Doing my MQP (Electric FSAE) with Professor Planchard. Coming from industry, he can provide real world examples while he is explaining the design. He can be strange and to the point, but he makes sure you understand the subject topic. Great professor and mentor.
Best professor I've had at WPI. He stimulates your interest like no other. He was also a GREAT MQP advisor. Helped me to get a job.
Great class, using Zoom. All some professor. He is the best... Planning to do my MQP with Professor Planchard this fall.
