This was by far the rudest professor I have every had at WPI. It took three emails and me going up to him in class before he acknowledged me asking to meet with him. When I finally did schedule a meeting with him, he didn't show up. When I FINALLY got to see him, he was not helpful at all with my question and was very disrespectful to me.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Really enjoyed learning more about SOLIDWORKS. I had used the program before but was unaware of just how vast the software was. It was very exciting and rewarding to learn the software to more of an industry standard. I enjoyed all the unique objects we modeled to learn the software. The projects often showed real-life applications.
Way more work than any of my classes at WPI. Class is well worth it. Professor P is caring is a lot of fun.
Very intensive with the work, although it slacks off a bit towards the end of the term. Lots and lots of homework and several projects throughout the term.

The class was very interesting. I liked that I gained a very useful skill / program out of this course. I came in wanting to learn how to use Solidworks and now I feel like I'm at a point where I'm comfortable enough using it that I can continue learning it on my own. The professor and TA were very helpful if you needed any help.
Great professor at WPI. Sometimes too intense, but is always available for the students. Very knowledgeable in Mechanical design.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Planchard is great. This sums it up. Great course; If you survive the workload. A great class at wpi.

Just finished ES-1310. It was the most work that I have ever put into a class at WPI. I wasnt too happy with the work load, but at the end, it was well worth it. I learned a lot. I obtained my CSWA certification, planning to take the CSWP. Hes engaging, passionate and always accessible. If you have the opportunity, take a class with him.
Great Professor. Understands students. Is always available outside the class. I hope to have him for my senior MQP.

Best class I've taken at WPI in 4 years. Professor Planchard is a caring, inspirational person. He brings industry knowledge and experience to the classroom environment. The class was more work than my MQP to-date, but it was well worth it. We are filing for a patent!

ME2300 is a lot of work,  but is well worth it. Professor Planchard is passive about the class and the students. Best overall class I've had at WPI. It's a mini MQP. We designed, built and presented our final product. We are applying for a patent with Professor Planchard's help.

Grades are determined by homeworks and labs (2 a week), weekly quizzes, a final project, and final exam. The class involved tons of work (like almost 10-15 hours each week for me) but it helps you get prepared for the final exam and project. Planchard is really nice and funny, and knows what he is doing. Just stay on top of everything.

Great person and professor. One of the few at WPI. Cares about his students and it shows. I lot of work in ES-1310, more than a normal class but it is well worth it if you want to lean Engineering Design using SOLIDWORKS.
Sport friendly professor at WPI. Knows the material inside and out.  Cares about the students, and accessible outside the classroom.

He is the best professor I've seen and had  at WPI . He is a quality teacher and person. He is extremely knowledgeable in design. He challenges his students to get the best from them, but knows where to stop and grades mercifully.

Thank you for the amazing year! You were truly an amazing professor and a strong supporter of Formula SAE. I hope to see you more in the future. Any student would be very lucking having you for an MQP.

Inconsistent with course objectives and disrespectful to some groups. Course material was nearly identical to the advanced design class and amount of work was the most I'd ever had in a 2000 level class. Grading was inconsistent at best.
Professor P is one of the best professors at WPI. I'm very glad that I took this class. Teaching style is upbeat and fun (sometimes tough on the teams). I hope to have him for my MQP.

It was a lot of work. Labs require preparation/work to be done beforehand because they're too long to finish in two hours, and there was also homework as well as a term project. Class moved at a good pace. Despite this, he was a great professor, cared about the students, funny, and very engaging. Gives extra credit for extra effort.

Probably the most useful design class I have ever taken. a WPI A LOT of work, but it forces you to learn. Professor Planchard is very friendly and helpful.  I would strongly recommend him for any class or MQP.

He is one of the few smart, practical professors at WPI who cares about students. Great course; If you survive the workload (mini MQP),   Planchard is the best professor you will ever have. He is excited about the subject, and explains it well at all levels.

Professor Planchard is one of the best professors at WPI. His teaching style is upbeat and fun. He likes to have fun and teach at the same time. What a great ideal. He does many examples and is a very fair teacher.
Great professor. Fun and easy going. Comes from industry and it shows it. A great course to take.  Respects students in a project environment.
Great professor. Knows what he is doing and how to do it. Everything was clear, the work load reasonalbe, no tricks. Get him if ou can.
Smart, practical professor at WPI.  If you survive the workload, Planchard is the best professor you will ever have. He is excited about the subject, and explains it well at all levels.
Great professor. Focuses on the application.  Lectures and labs are very helpful and fun. Lots of lab homework - sometimes too much. Cares about the students and it shows.

I had professor Planchard for my FSAE MQP. We won the Provost award. He cares about students and his projects. Hes always available and is  easy to talk to. If you have the opportunity to take your MQP with him  do it. Its a great senior experience.
Fun class. I learned a lot about Engineering design and the real world. He picks on students to challenge them. Makes the class very interesting. He is very helpful if you approach him.
Great teacher. The best at WPI. Cares about the students.
Great teacher. Really funny and jokes around with some students.  Gave me and my friend free solidworks shirts! Knows solidworks very well. Lots of work but easy if you become skilled at solidworks.
He never response to your question and is so strict with everyone in everything.
Easy to get over 100 as your final grade if you go to class and do all the work. There's only extra credit work with just about every assignment. And he grades pretty easily.
Hard but fair. Comes from industry and understands what you need to obtain a job. A great mentor for an MQP.

Great Professor and really know the subject topic. He cares about the students but gives a lot of work. It is not an easy class, but you will learn a lot. I agree with the other student, a lot of professors at WPI do not care about the students ?? Professor Planchard is an exception.

He gives completely unnecessary amounts of homework for an intro class in solidworks,(we're talking about 4 hours per lab) and will repeat a topic several times. is unwilling to deal with students, blanket directing them to TAs
Gives enormous amounts of unnecessary work for an intro class. I ended up spending more time on intro to cad work than all my other classes combined.
He is very knowledgable in SolidWorks. Great teacher and mentor at WPI. He cares, not too many teachers at WPI do.

He really likes WPI students! He is very knowledgable in SolidWorks and occasionally tells you what the industry expects a designer should be. Attend his classes and you will find he is a great mentor.
Great professor. Knows SolidWorks very well. One of a few professors at WPI that cares about the student.

Professor Marcus was actually not as bad as most people say. His accent might be quite difficult to get used to but he is good at his work. There are 2 tests and a final. Homework was light (1 per week) and the tests were generally easy and you could easily get 100 without too much work. Overall a good professor and I would recommend him.

Professor Sarkis's class is a mess. Lectures are difficult to follow, he expects you to catch patterns or concepts he doesn't explain, and contain multiple mistakes that students have to call out. Homework also contained problems that are more difficult than the work we did in class. The only way I passed was by taking AP calc in high school.

He's hard to understand and his handwriting is awful. There is not much homework, and his exams are fairly easy, but they don't have many questions and he doesn't like to give partial credit. He is very knowledgeable, yet frequently makes mistakes on the board.

"He could try to teach us the area of a square and we'd still be confused." Highly qualified. He'd be a great grad teacher for sure, but he's awful as an undergrad professor. His explanations leave everyone confused, and it was always left to one poor junior who is shockingly good at explaining everything to pick up the slack for him.

He told me where and when a test would be and was just wrong. When I emailed him to ask where it actually was, he told me I'd have to go to a different section and to "read my emails more carefully" despite having never sent me an email. It also seemed hypocritically considering that was the first time he had ever responded to any email I'd sent.

Very poor handwriting 
Often times does not finish solving equations on the board
Fails to leeway credit for students who experience uncontrollable difficult circumstances

The professor is well versed in the material and manages time well. However, there isn't much of an effort to establish the idea or goal of a lesson, leading to far too many of the example problems becoming unhelpful when applied to other problems needing to be solved along the same lines. Overall, just too unorganized for most learning.
Does not expand on concepts and teaches in proofs. Work done on the board often has mistakes and he doesn't speak very clearly.

His teaches concepts in class using proofs, and expects us to apply the concepts we learned easily in the questions he gives in tests/homework. Only covers like 1 example per class. His handwriting is illegible and his explanations just complicates the material than it actually is. I just rely on PLAs, friends and youtube. Nice guy, bad teacher.
this good yes.

His lectures were often a bit boring and he made a decent amount of algebra mistakes that detracted from the class a bit. His explanations were generally pretty ok though and he clearly understood all the material very well (although sometimes misinterpreted questions). The quizzes, homework, tests weren't too difficult.

I wish I could give a negative review. Worst class at WPI. Messy writing, many mistakes, lectures very hard to follow/confusing. Practice exams and quizzes, but don't have solutions or reflect exams. Different versions of exams/ Some more difficult than others. You might get an easy exam or one a lot more difficult than what was taught.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Horrible professor. Copied every lecture note and homework from another professor, and did not even bother to remove their name from the top of the pdfs. Terrible explanations in lectures; I stopped going after a few weeks because the lectures made the material more confusing. Overall, I would recommend never taking a class with this professor.

His lectures are fairly hard to follow, he handwrites them, and not very neat. But at least for this class, the material wasn't hard to follow till complex numbers got involved. HW was very similar to exams, and he gives you old exams with the answers so you have an idea of how they will be run. If you do have a problem he holds office hours.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures are all over the place with messy handwriting and often incorrect proofs. Problems encouraged to study with are never provided answer keys, so you go into the exams pretty blind. Only a few assignments determine your overall grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Switched majors and dropped this class after the first 2 days of term. Horrible Professor. The lectures are extremely confusing and He is very condescending. Homeworks doesnt have that many problems but his explanations are so vague that only TA office hours and MASH will help. Only take a class with this professor if you absolutely need too.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is pretty bad at class, the first exam class average was 50 and the second one a 40, I just hope he makes a big curve.

Cannot even begin to start here. Went to lecture for the first 5 weeks of class, and took notes on everything and attempted to understand the material. The notes he writes on the chalkboard are impossible to understand. As well as that, does not respond to emails nor show up to times I set with him to meet.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: All around horrible Professor don't take him
Not a good professor. Too confusing and scribbles across every board until you cannot follow what he is doing anymore. Scales so much because each test has a horrible average grade.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. On the first test the highest score was a 70. He is unable to communicate clearly and often starts problems and has to stop halfway through because he doesn't know how to solve them. He is the worst professor I have had yet. Seems like he cares, however is simply incapable of teaching.

Perhaps the most boring lecturer I've ever encountered. Writing on chalkboard is sprawling, frequently using wrong symbols from line to line while writing proofs. Assignments tedious busywork, literally doing algorithms designed for computers by hand (get ready to do a LOT of matrix multiplication).  Avoid if possible. Boring class, boring hw, lame

Prof. Sarkis is a good teacher. I have had no problems understanding his examples or following my notes on his lecture. His English is completely clear to me. If you can't understand this man, you might be the person deficient in English. His homework never took me more than 6 hours per week, and the exams are appropriate in difficulty.Nice guy too
Not as bad as people usually say about him. Very dedicated professor, and passionate about math.

Awesome professor, great at explaining things and kept my interest during class. I always thought his tests and quizzes were very fair, doable if you attended class and studied. I didn't find his accent hard to understand at all. Loved the MATLAB component! It was a fun project to do that I think really helped understanding the uses of the material

Strange mannerisms and a very heavy accent, plus the fact that he can't explain very well is not a combination. The examples he uses start of exceedingly simple and then he jumps to exceedingly confusing examples, so none of its useful. To make up for his poor teaching, he scales the grades ludicrously(failed 2 quizzes and the final, got an A)

I liked him. He is a nice guy who obviously enjys teaching and cares about his students. His grading policy is very fair and he gives you every chance to succeed. For my class he gave 5 tests but only counted the top 3 scores. Very helpful if you go see him. And his English is fine.

Makes Calc 4 more difficult to understand; often times makes mistakes while lecturing. Accent is difficult to understand. He will provide extra help if you schedule appointments; willing to work with students. Homework is challenging and tedious. Be prepared to teach yourself this because the book isn't too helpful Bottom line: try a different prof

Classes were boring for me so I didn't attend his classes. Just went to the exams. Exam and quiz questions were always almost same with previous years or homework questions, and even without doing the homework I got an A

Prof Sarkis is a good teacher, using lots of examples and always asking the class questions during the process to keep the students involved. Tends to use the word "Yes" when he can't think of the English word to use, but don't be fooled, his English is understandable and his explanations are clear. Quizzes are relatively easy (sometimes take home)
Never went to class.  I had previously taken this material, and even I couldn't understand him.
Nice guy, but not a nice lecturer. Tests are easy. But I learned all by myself. Don't need to avoid him bcz A is really easy.
Very hard to understand... Many people stopped going to lectures and at least half of the class failed the basic skills exam. Too many proofs  and not enough how to actually do a problem.
I learned a lot in this course. Excelent teacher. He is impressive drawing pictures on the board.
can't even understand him

he cant speak english. i went to 2 lectures and in both he kept getting the wrong answer on problems that he was teaching us how to do. hes not a bad guy, and hes pretty easy. take his class, just dont bother with lecture. youll learn all you need from reading the book.
Just don't take a class with him. He's terrible.
He has trouble teaching the topics to students and his teaching style is very hard to understand. He even forgot to give us a test.
This man has no clue how to communicate using the english language. I have had trouble understanding anything he said in my calc 3 class.
This man has no english skills. He wanted to grant an A to one group member so the project would look good, even though he did no work, lacking ethics in my opinion.
I learned numerical methods for calc well with this guy.  In addition to the basic course knowledge, we also had a MATLAB component that I've applied in every course I've had since this one.
Ugh...definitely a low moment in my WPI career.
Great professor, not a tough grader at all! The quizzes and exams are all multiple choices and similar with homework problem sets. The homework questions can be a bit time consuming.

Took this class and didn't even think I had a professor. Taught myself from reading the textbook and doing homework problems using the 70 dollar MasteringChem. Didn't even really have lectures and NO office hours. Everytime I emailed him asking a clarifying question and I got a sassy response. Also made us take a quiz when we did not have school.

Class was asynchronous, so it was a little bit harder to learn this way. He is well-organized but the content in pre-recorded lectures and both that and the text didnt really help for quizzes and the final. Wish there was live classes.
He wasn't particularly difficult, but I thought he brought a lot of character to an 8 AM class that I was forced to take and ended up enjoying.

His class in incredibly boring and you can tell he's not too passionate about lower level chemistry courses. Unfortunately this class felt like he was trying to get students to switch out of a chemistry major. Just wish he was a little less corpse-like and had more assignments. His class is easy, just make sure you get everything in on time.

Lectures were very monotone and he would just read from slides which he posts online anyway. Went to lecture once only and still passed but didn't learn a lot so if you find it hard to focus in class without a great lecturer would not recommend. Exams are fairly easy as he gives you a very long and detailed cheat sheet.

I kept my chemistry notes from high school so this course was fine. He knows what he's talking about, but sometimes lectures can be very messy and all over the place. He's always willing to answer questions, but he lacks the energy and sometimes it's really easy to fall asleep in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: My lecture was at 11 am. I showed up for the first two days then stopped because his lectures will put you to sleep. All he does is go over some powerpoints he made who knows how long ago. I learned everything through khan academy & youtube and performed well on the tests.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great guy, but absolutely a boring guy. I made the mistake and took his lecture at 8:00 AM, every day, and it was brutal. I didn't go to many lectures, and basically taught myself Chem. He basically reads a powerpoint and goes... really.... really... slowly. Most people didn't go to many lectures; they're not needed. Homework is online

Dittami teaches you the material well and he is very easy. The one big flaw is his lectures are very boring. You may not have a fun time but you will learn the stuff and get an A so long as you put in some small amount of work. He's also a very nice and funny guy and gives some extra credit. Take if you need chem but it's not relevant to your major

Pace of the class is very manageable compared to other classes at wpi. tests were very similar to practice exams and gives an exam handout that is more than sufficient. If you took high school chemistry you'll get an A no doubt.

Would be a rough class if you've never taken chem before. Otherwise it's an easy A. Lectures are basically powerpoints-which are helpful but not particularly interesting. Homework and tests are reasonable and straightforward. He doesn't require much memorization (he gives reference sheets), which might leave you unprepared for future chem classes.

Hates his job and hates being in lecture and makes sure you hate being there too. Doesn't give you your tests back or have office hours. Completely unhelpful when you ask a question and most boring professor I have ever had. Could be a good professor if he cared about his students.

His lectures are long and monotonous, but he give lots of examples, which are helpful if you've never taken chem before. If you took AP chem, then this class will be a breeze for you, but also super boring. The online homeworks have multiple attempts & the lowest one is dropped, which is nice. The midterm & final exams are easily manageable.

He is an overall respectful and kind teacher. Yes, his lectures are boring, but he does many examples and is very clear with his teaching. He encourages you to ask questions in class and go for extra help. There aren't many tests, but they are relatively easy. If you have taken Chem in high school, easy A or B. If not, you may have to work for it.
Class is boring, tests are way more difficult than they need to be. Avoid this guy, he's probably the worst orgo professor at this school. Don't take his class unless absolutely necessary.
long lectures but gives good examples, not many tests
Easy subject matter, so easy tests. He clearly is very passionate about Organic Chem, but this is a really easy introduction course that I don't think he is passionate about.

Oh. My. God. His lectures are so boring. But it's easy to get an A. Pretty much sums everything. Well, he has knowledge but he is not good at teaching. You wake up hard to attend his class at 8 AM and end up sleeping again in his class. Weird? Yes.

If you took AP chem in high school this class will be a breeze. Seeing chem for the second time makes it so much easier. He isn't a great teacher so if you're learning chem for the first time I would take it with someone else. He is confusing and makes a lot of mistakes when he is doing problems at the board. Easy class if you have a background.

He reads his notes from his powerpoint word for word. The class is not engaging enough for an 8am. I almost fell asleep too many times. The class is really easy though, it is all review from  high school chem.
Very good professor for chem 1. It can be hard to get help from him, but his notes and assignments were very organized. I recommend him for this class.

Professor Dittami was great for CH 1010! He made things very clear and articulated well. The material he taught in class was what appeared on the tests, and he is willing to answer questions. I highly recommend him!

Best chem professor I've ever had. He explained well, was easy to understand, never made a mistake in his board work. He told us exactly what was on the tests and did in class review. Easiest A I've ever gotten and hardly showed up to the lectures choosing to view them online. Tests were easy multiple choice where work was required in a few of them
He's a great professor! He does expect you to do work on your own, which is why other people probably don't like him. Don't be lazy, you're a WPI student.

Dittami is a very nice person! His lectures were not the most exciting, but he did everything to help students. We had an online quiz every week, which we could check all of our notes. His actual tests were much easier than the quizzes, and he let us come in 6:45am to have a lot of time to take the test (until 9am). Definitely take him for CH1010.

My god. This is by far the worst professor. He acts nice in class but is not willing to help you out of the classroom and his notes and slides are terrible. He is extremely bad at explaining. He obviously doesn't care for the people paying his salary lol
He's an overall nice guy. However, his notes and explanations aren't very clear. And his office is in Gateway Park which isn't on campus so getting extra help is difficult.

Never take a class with this guy. He doesn't teach at all just reads off bad notes and ppts that are incorrect. He will not help you outside of class. He does not explain how he gets to answers and he just assumes you know certain things. Do not take a class with him. worst professor I have ever had.
Don't take chem 1 with him if you don't have a strong background in chemistry... I failed first try by .2 of a point and he wouldn't bump it up. super cool.
took this in the summer because i failed it with pavlik. dittami makes it so much easier to understand. definitely take it with him

Professor Dittami was alright, if I don't have to I won't take another class with him though. I had an alright experience with this professor. There are online quizzes each week which can help your grade a lot if you practice the online problems.
Very clear and helpful. If you listen in class and go. You'll do fine. He kept me awake at 8 AM. Quite the accomplishment.
No Comments

Very helpful. Makes some mistakes, however open to corrections. Cares about his students, and willing to help outside office hours. Online quizzes every week, everything online. Study hard, and everything will come easy..

very helpful, always trying to help you. online quizzes every week. if u study his online posted practice tests, you will do extremly good. notes are posted online. lectures are very helpful. great teacher. Always prepared for classes. and he will give u handouts for exams.
He was very clear and understanble, but the material was easy and didnt get very in depth (though that is mostly due to the material in the course)
Didn't like working with undergrads at all
He was very helpful when i needed it, aswell as understanding and fair.
doesn't care about students, very unorganized, has TA's do all his work
He's not a teacher.  He's the Department Head

Lectures can be boring and he can go a bit deeper into the material than necessary but overall teaches the material for homework and quizzes well. He gave plenty of time to finish the homeworks and drops your lowest quiz grade. Final exam is pretty tough but he is generous with points if you show work.
His lectures are great and his weekly quizzes related heavily to the material covered in class. You can tell he cares about his students.

I took MA 1033 and 1034 with Professor Fehribach, and he was excellent for both. I would recommend these courses for anyone that enjoys mathematics.
The class is very straightforward: with 1 homework and 1 quiz a week, and then a final at the end of the term. Students should know that 1033 requires proof writing.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Fehribach is honestly one of my favorite professors at WPI. He's incredibly caring about his students, and is very passionate about his work and the subject at hand. He gladly takes questions, and doesn't skip a beat if someone needs help. Although homework can be pretty tough with having to do proofs, the quizzes and exams aren't too tough.

Our homework was more than I have in my other math classes (taken after calc 4). The quizzes were not too bad and he drops the lowest one.  Only thing is, he is really not willing to help during office hours, and has "hours" only for 20-30 minutes. Even during that time he would listen to his radio and not be fully vested in helping with material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Great professor for Calc 4Y (first year version). All material is written by the professor himself. Some homework is a little extra in terms of test material, but does provide some more interesting stuff if you are planning to go forward with math. If not, though, don't go to the last few lectures as that material is not covered on the final.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Clear and concise. Explains mathematics in a way any one can understand. Brilliant lectures.
This guy came in and took over my class when the first professor got booted. Still did an incredible job and was able to give a good overview of the material in the 4 weeks we had left.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I ended up switching into this class the day before class started and it was my best decision this school year. It was my only in-person class and by far my favorite class this term. Professor Fehribach was awesome and the TA was FANTASTIC! I learned tons and had so much fun. The homework assignments took me hours to complete, but well worth it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I usually don't give reviews of Professors on here; but he made most of the credit homework problems (which he allowed one retake for each homework), the midterm was a take-home which we had one week to do, and he gave us a lenient final grade we could take that would prevent us from taking a final. A great professor, highly recommend.

Awesome professor. Theoretical calc is very hard but he's so enthusiastic about the material and very willing to answer questions in office hours and lecture. Gives chances to earn back points on homeworks and drops lowest homework and quiz grades. You have to be willing to work hard and read the book, but he wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great lecturer, gives extra credit, drops lowest grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great professor, actually enjoyed the class and explains really well  with examples

One of the better math classes and professors I've had. ODEs still wasn't exactly easy, but he wasn't trying to trip us up either.  Fairly clear and interesting lectures.  Helpful in office hours and seemed genuinely interested in helping us learn. Quizzes and tests weren't too bad, though doing and understanding the HW and lectures were important.
many quizzes but drops lowest grade(s), extra credit posted and helpful

Amazing professor willing to help you if you need it. He emailed answers to student's questions to the entire class when he thought they'd be useful. Also, there was a lot of opportunity for extra credit and he dropped the lowest quiz grade(s) depending on how many quizzes there are. Would recommend for any course.

He is the absolute man. The textbook for his course only costs like $15 so that's instantly a plus. Quizzes are easy if you do at least some of the assigned homework. Final is more challenging but very manageable. He gives a lot of extra credit opportunities online for extra practice.

Best professor I have had since I got here. His lectures are informative, his grading system is fair, quizzes are very easy so it's not hard to get an A. Very helpful to students. All around great professor.

Hands down the best math prof and class I've ever had. Teaches really well and super helpful. Quizzes aren't hard but exam will be more challenging. Highly recommend this class and Prof Fehribach to anyone seriously interested in math.
Best math professor I have had at WPI

Great professor. Weekly quizzes are great because the lowest one drops, and homework is optional. He is sometimes confusing at the very beginning of a new topic, but it always comes together in the end. Would absolutely recommend.
Extremely clear and helpful. Tests were over material covered only. Some extra credit opportunities were available.

Exceptional teacher, aside from the derivation of curvature. I think he lost everyone on that. Go to class and pay attention, and you will get an A. Also, he offers plenty of extra credit opportunities with optional online homework assignments. Even his textbook homework is optional, with homework performance being graded by the weekly quizzes.

The quizzes are really easy, and his colored chalk is helpful. He doesn't go too quickly, which is good for student comprehension. The homework isn't collected/checked, and the optional webwork assignments are worth extra credit. I'm having an easier time in his calc 4 class than all my friends are in calc 3.
He has a cute sailor hat and I love when he uses colored chalk because it's helpful to review notes. When you can't make office hours he will always schedule a time to meet. I loved him.

I had a family death during term and I had to miss several days of school. Fehribach offered to sit down with me and teach me what I missed one on one. Will out out of his way to help students who have questions and seek clarfication. Grading is objective and easy to understand
Best professor i've had yet
Great teacher
the best prof I ever had. i have heard about alot of other professors like huumi etc but Faribach is the best..easy quizez and final .. easy A

Great professor. always ready to help students. replies to your emails in like an hour, and sends emails to everyone.we had like 13 easy quizes so he drops your lowest 3. So easy to get a good grade. il didnt have my final yet but whatever he may give on it, Faribach wud still remain a great prof. 8.9 / 10 rating
Very good at teaching, very helpful when you have questions and homework has re-dos so you can always get a better grade, could score an A easily
Teaches well and will not hesitate to help if you do not grasp subject material

Advanced Calc - Very nice guy and lectures are very clear and well-presented. He is always prepared and he knows his stuff. He is MORE than fair about giving out extra points and partial credit. If you are not doing well, you can blame yourself. That doesn't mean the course is easy though.

Great Professor, very available for extra help, great personal webpage/course webpage that is much easier to use then myWPI.  Provides old exams from the previous classes he has taught. Would recommend.
Great teacher - helps a lot if you need extra help.
Very intellegent, perhaps overcomplicated course material with too many proofs. However always willing to help if you don't understand.
Over-complicates material, anal about details, final not well-representative of course material

Worst Professor I ever had! Lies to students on individual level. He thinks that every student is fortunate to be in his presence... Get off that high horse YOU ARE NOT QUALIFIED TO TEACH; YOU DON'T CARE ABOUT STUDENTS!!
Advanced calc...hope that is the right #
Isn't cut out to teach below 2000 level courses. He is too far above them.
No Comments
I didn't learn much but decent professor the cut off for a C was 25% in the class so easy to pass the class without learning the material

For sure the best organic chem professor at WPI. His slides are very well organized. The only grading for the class are exams, but they aren't that bad. After a while you learn exactly what to expect. His lectures are entertaining and he easily transfers his passion for chemistry.

I really loved how he taught organic chemistry, an objectively difficult subject, in a comprehendible way. He covered material quickly, but took breaks to tell stories or talk about careers, which gave some time to think about the material, and I never felt overwhelmed. He's a great teacher for organic, and a great resource for chemistry careers.
Great Guy
Super chill guy and really helps you become interested in Organic Chemistry. His classes and exams are tough, so come well prepared.

Professor is extremely rude when you ask questions as he gets super defensive. Will question if you even have a brain because you cannot understand his wording. Said that I will not do well on exam because I LITERALLY DID NOT UNDERSTAND WHAT THE QUESTION WAS ASKING!!!!!!!!
He wants you to leave the class with life experience that will be valuable and not just be a parrot which taught me a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Organic Chemistry is hard, and Macdonald gets that. His lectures are great, and the book is actually really helpful too. Do the problem sets. Exams are tough but he drops your lowest exam and ends up lowering the grade cutoffs every term too. Definitely recommend, he's a funny guy with lots of anecdotes to share

The subject of organic chemistry is hard, but he does a good job of trying his best to explain it. Very few practice problems in class which makes studying hard. You'll have to read the book to understand most of the material. Most of the questions on the test are completely out of left field, but he scales the grades very well.

Love this teacher, probably the best Chem teacher I've had so far. If you understand what hes saying it should be an easy A. He is very nice with dropping tests too, but please dear god don't nag him about grades. The only time he gets upset is when students don't care about learning or the course. I took both CH2310 and CH2320 with him

I took CH2310 and CH2320 with him, he is a hilarious and nice professor. Exams aren't hard as long as you understand all the concepts and mechanisms. Exams' question are base on the notes so as long as you know all the thing in class you will get an free A. One of the best professor in WPI and will definitely recommend him.

If given a choice definitely take him... don't worry you will 100% feel like you are going to NR the entire time even with the weighted original averages on the syllabus but he always comes through and usually drops a whole test... you learn a lot definitely take him give the chance

Meh it was okay. He goes a little fast and goes on tangents often. He does give a lot of input on random stuff during class pretty interesting. He does the class so that most people pass, he cares about the students but he wont help you that much. Keep up to date in the material and you should be fine
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: This guy deserves WAY more credit that he gets. I took orgo 1 with pavlik, orgo 2 with him, and orgo 3 with dittami. I can say with confidence that I enjoy orgo 2 the most (despite it being the hardest). He is HILARIOUS! Makes orgo very enjoyable. Read through all his notes, you do not need to read the book or do any exercise, and you'll get the A

He's mad funny and his expectations are very clear.  Examples he goes over in class almost always show up on the test so it's really nice to have those recorded, and make sure you do the problem sets.  They're identical in older copies of the textbook, definitely worth doing a day or two before the exam.

MacDonald is very entertaining and keeps class interesting. He definitely knows what he's talking about and is very intelligent. But, being someone who struggles with chemistry, I barely passed his class; exams are extremely difficult and the material is clearly geared towards chemistry majors.
Macdonald is a good professor.  He is entertaining in lecture but gives some killer exams.  I have never taken such difficult tests in my life.
Great professor. Best ever.

LOOKS LIKE PATRICK SWAYZE! Great professor, very entertaining, very through. He rushed through organic naming in my section which I found a little tricky but overall a good choice. Go to class and it's an easy A.

Very entertaining professor and does a fair amount of experiments to keep you interested. Tests were pretty straightforward and if you did the reviews he posted then you should be able to pass easily.

Great Professor. Tests were fair. Lectures were awesome, didnt use powerpoint which is a good thing because he moves at a good pace. very understanding. One downside was that he didnt assign any office hours. if you email him to get help he will meet with you and is extremely helpful. take chem 2 with him if you can

Great lecturer. Teaches concepts very well. If you do the recommended HW you should be in great shape for his tests. He does also supply a practice tests, which are very similar in content and layout to the actual exams.

I recommend this teacher. His lectures were always clear. He likes to go off on tangents, which are always interesting and a welcome break. Gave us previous year's test and solns for prep. Has said that none of his purported 'disrespect/rudeness' is intended. Challenges students and makes them think.

He acts like he really cares about his students, but he really doesnt. If you have to miss a test and make it up for any reason (like a death in the family), he will give you SO MUCH CRAP about it and might not even let you make it up. and all he talks about is how everything in the world will give you cancer. he's a crappy professor.

Really nice teacher, the material may be hard but he is more than willing to spend time to help you understand everything. He worked with me for 3 hours doing problems till I understood everything and I ended up getting an A on the test. He is really clear and organized in class.
No Comments

I love this professor, he was not only clear and explained things well, but he got me legitimately interested in the subject he taught, great guy, take his class if you have the chance.  His real world stories put everything into context for me.

Bad teacher, unclear expectations for Tests, frequently forgot tests and "burned in his fireplace" a bunch of review sheets by accident. I don't understand the people that like him or his style. As was stated ZERO compassion for anyone who is struggling in or outside class.  He's not even 1/100 Pat Delaney, the best Chemistry Professor EVER.
No Comments

He is a horrible professor who has ZERO compassion for his students. I worked very hard in this class and went to office hours but he is as useless outside the classroom as he is in the classroom. Hopefully when you are in his class you won't have any emergency b/c he won't care! Good luck there is a reason the class has a lot of JR and SR in it!
Awesome, I had some trouble at first but he was more than willing to help with whatever he could and I left the class with an A I was proud of!

Absolutely amazing prof.  Explains things very well and in an effective manner, in both written and physical senses.  Seems to enjoy what he loves.  Talks about orgo a bit, and thats barely a downside.  Would reccoment him to anyone and everyone.  Very friendly, helpful, dare i say charismatic? Definately knows his subject.

WONDERFUL professor! Explains things in matter-of-fact terms and makes lectures fun with real-life examples and hands-on concepts. Frank, funny, and also very helpful outside the classroom. Very understanding and isn't at all condescending when explaining difficult concepts.

I hated chem before, now I can say I have a better attitude towards it. Really loves the subject matter! Class is very easy just look over the homework problems and solutions. Best teacher so far in my WPI experience. Makes class fun and interesting.
He is a decent professor and is a Lot more fair than Prof. Pavlick. He tends to get distracted and go on tangents in class sometimes though.

He is a very excited about the class and he make it interesting, by talking about real life applications. It's kind of hard, because it's a cumulative and it's hard to remember all the different reactions. Concentrate on the concepts to remember the reactions.
good teacher, very enthusiastic about the subject, makes you really love organic, quizes are easy, gives partial credit :)
Didn't know the material well, unable to answer questions. Also, often less than personable and has bad course planning skills over the course of the term.
Really loves the subject matter!
Very helpful. Much better than Pavlick. And he gives partial credit!
No Comments

Definition of an average professor in my opinion.  He goes very fast over some tough topics and doesn't like when students ask questions.  He also isn't great in office hours.  This being said he gives practice tests that are exactly like his exams and if you study those you should be alright.
I really enjoyed this class. Farhod has a great sense of humor and is able to answer questions confidently. He has great handwriting too. 10 out of 10 would recommend.

Farhod is extremely chill during lectures. He goes over examples with every step for us to understand the concept and the accompanying algebra. His quizzes are cake if you understand the homework, as they are often easier than the challenge problems in the books. Tests are like extended quizzes, but are worth 50% of you grade for two exams.

Objective and easy to understand if you dedicate the right amount of attention. The material is hard with any professor but I think if you are confident about your learning skills I recommend him. He wont slow down if you get off track or lack a good Calc 2 background. No graded HW but has easy weekly quizze that helps you check if you are learning
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Farhod is such a good teacher. I learned a lot in his class. He tells you EXACTLY what you need to know. He tests you not on correctness, but rather if you have the right idea on how to solve it. Structures class very well: introduces ideas and then provides examples. Optional homework and weekly quizzes are a BLESSING. Take MA1023 with him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome professor 10/10 would take a course by him again
Real great guy. Knows and teaches the material well. Will answer most if not all questions and genuinely wants students to do well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: No homework, but still understood the lectures with a bit of effort
Very helpful professor
He was a very funny and good lecturer. He made calc 3 at least a little but understandable. If you pay attention in lecture you will do well. Gives extra credit problems on tests.
Just literally the best. I mean come on, "It's simple Algebra!"
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Farhod was great for Calc 3. If you can do the homework problems, you will do well on the quizzes and exams. One key thing to remember with Farhod is to really review the examples given in lecture because similar questions will be given on quizzes and exams. Overall the class is manageable if you study.

He was really nice. I was struggling and he gave me some advice. Asked me not to quit class. In the end it was worth it. Hes fun and grades well. If he PLA screws up, just talk to him and he will recorrect

I would take a class with him again. If you do the homework and UNDERSTAND the homework (not just copy online) than you will pass, probably even get an A. The tests are really tough but he gives a lot of partial credit. Go to his office hours, hes helpful. The material is difficult to visualize but he teaches it well.

Solid professor. Show up to class do the HW and you will get a good grade. sometimes extends his usual office hours before test .  His test are straight forward and fair. he gives a good amount of partial credit.

I found this professor was very clear with his lectures and he made the material easy to grasp. Having said that, it was very difficult to do well on exams due to his grading style. I found myself struggling to get good grades even though I understood the material quite well. Small mistakes can cost you a lot on his tests.

Farhod isn't the worst but he is far from good. The notes are absolutely worthless, it's all conceptual and he only scratches the surface on how to do problems. Tests only have 2 types of problems: really easy and really hard. He completely lied about what the last test was going to be like, pretty sure I failed it but he never released the grades.

Prof. Abedullayev can always explain the theorem in an explicit way, though sometimes may make minute mistakes. Also he's a very serious grader. MA500 is really basic for real analysis thm, and it is a prerequisite course for some master students. It's a good fundamental real analysis course. If you expected more, this course is not enough.
Clear and concise. Tests are very easy; the bonus question helps with getting As. HW can be difficult and tedious - weekly, takes about 1-3 hours to finish.

Farhod was good. He has a small accent, is decently clear in lecture, and gives many examples. He assigns weekly homework to be submitted (5-7 problems) with some suggested problems to do by yourself. The homework (worth 20%) and tests (worth 60%) can be quite challenging, but are doable. Just make sure you do the practice and ask Q's in lecture.

Great teacher, pretty funny at times. Had him for calc2. He gives nice partial credit on tests and homeworks. He teaches the material very well and really wants to prepare you for the rest of the calc series.

Good guy, he's got an azerbaijan accent but it's not too bad. He gave us 2 exams during our term with him not including the final, both hard af. Still ended up doing pretty well in his class. Would take again.

If you put in the work, go to office hours, and make sure you understand lecture material and homework you will be fine.  He is always willing to help outside of class and will not hesitate to set up individual appointments at a time of your convenience.  Make sure that you complete and understand the suggested problems he gives out each homework.

His exams are very difficult.  Even if you feel like you have studied enough for them, study for about two more hours.  If you have questions, he is available for office hours and always gets back to emails in a timely fashion.

He might be a good person out of the classroom but he is a terrible professor. DO NOT TAKE HIM. His test are BEYOND  hard, no matter how much you prepare. He expects ALOT from you ! I WOULD NEVER EVER EVER EVER EVER EVER TAKE HIM AGAIN!
He's the man. Take his class if you are willing to learn and you'll get the A

Having taken calculus in high school, I found this class very easy. Abdullayez is a great professor and gives tons of examples in his lectures. He's willing to answer questions and explain things during lecture. I missed a week of class due to illness and he was very helpful with making sure I caught up. He also reminds me of Shrek

Farhod is hands down the best math teacher you'll have at WPI.  He is laid back and very fair when it comes to grading.  He respects students  who try hard and put in the effort.  If you try hard and come to class, you should have no problem getting an A
He would give you more example than long concept and proving,and his exam is pretty easy. If you make some minor mistakes in the exam, it is possible that he won't take out your point.

Abdulayev is a fantastic professor. He is very clear, and his ways of explaining things are unique and interesting. I look forward to his class and I learn a lot. His assigned work is helpful and plentiful too. Take him if you want a challenge and are ready to do the work.

Farhood was very fair for tests and gives so much partial credit. Knows all his students and is willing to answer questions and helps with any questions. Calc III was well organized and taught extremely well but IV was taught slightly worse but both were much easier than other Calc teachers at WPI. Overall, Farhood was my best teacher this term.

This profesor isn't bad but I will never take a class with him again. His examples were confusing, notes lacking much needed information and he refused to give answer keys to check his own practice test.... In addition, homework wasn't impossible but he didn't use the book and it was mostly complicated algebra rather than practicing the concepts.

Farhod is legit. His class is fair and you will learn a lot if you pay attention. Do the homework and the suggested problems and the tests will be just fine. Office hours are great. Overall, Farhod is the man, man.

Farhod is a great teacher. I enjoy how he begins a new concept with theory and then applies it to examples. Also, he gives very hard homework and practice tests that really prepare students for his tests.

Farhod means well, and makes an honest effort to help his students succeed, but he is very disorganized. Explanations of concepts were very confusing. We never even finished all the material. Homework is very hard.  Tests slightly easier than homework, and grading is somewhat lenient.
In class he focuses on teaching proofs rather than do examples which isn't exactly helpful, but office hours are very helpful.

Although the professor is a nice enough person, he is not an effective teacher. It is very difficult to follow his train of though in class and he goes through material in a disorganized manner. I would not recommend taking a course with him.
Material is poorly explained, very difficult to understand, and follows no sort of logical sequence. The professor lacks the ability to clearly explain topics in class.
Farhod is the man. Tests aren't bad, homework isn't bad, and class is enjoyable. I highly recommend taking his classes.
Difficult homeworks but tests are easy compared to homework.  Go to office hours they are very helpful.

My specific class was part of a study: every assignment and test completed in groups of 4 (same people throughout term). Very lecture heavy, passionate, easy, prepare to take notes and memorize/understand a lot of things. Despite this course material is understandable for an elementary schoolers. Midterm and Final were heavily weighted ~60-70%.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor is very lecture/presentation heavy, at least for my Econ class, but he is passionate on what he is teaching and is always open to answer questions in and out of class. He's kinda funny sometimes, and the exams reflect what you're prepared for. Overall, he's pretty good, would take again.

This was a great class. You really have to be self-motivated since there are a lot of readings. He is lenient on turning in work, just as long as you turn it in. He provides you solid feedback and the answer key to review. A lot of modeling but it is awesome when it clicks.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Extremely organized guy who knows what he's doing. Keeps class interesting, and is chill, smart, and helpful.
One of the best classes I have ever taken. Prof. is very nice and does his best to help you succeed. Highly recommend.

He is very nice and approachable but we were graded on 5 assignments which included 10 multiple choice per assignment. Those 5 assignments determined our final grade. Lecture heavy as in every class was simply a lecture.

I never felt like I really learned anything in this class. He went through powerpoints but skipped over most slides before we had the chance to write down the information. We also weren't allowed to use laptops in class which didn't help. Group projects weren't too bad, but had very few instructions on how to use the software.

His lectures teach you nothing. The homework's will help you on the exams but not the lecture notes. The lecture notes are power points he puts online.  He said not to get the book however, the book explains the material better than he ever does. He gives a lot of extra credit though and curves the class at the end of the term.

He doesn't even make the exams. Takes them from other places, which is why they are so hard because what he teaches in class is 10x easier. He's an interesting guy, but I wasn't too interested in the subject which made it harder for me. But honestly he's too lazy to make his own exam, which is not only frustrating, but unfair. I would avoid.
The homeworks are pretty hard and the tests are harder. Not very helpful in explaining concepts. However, class is very interesting and entertaining

Pretty much a terrible class.  Over a quarter of your grade is team based so if you have a bad team it really sucks.  Also, the exams are much harder than the homework and practice exams and he has no scale even though they are worth 60% of your grade.  Thought it was an easy A class, well that was not the case at all.
What he taught in class is easy but the materials in exam are more difficult. You have to read the econ book to get better understanding...I don't think his class is very valuable...
Pretty clueless about American economy. Lots of references to communism and soviet culture. BORING!
Very nice; very helpful.  Lectures can be a little confusing.  Go see him for extra help if you're having trouble.
He is really helpful. And if you are an econ major he will help you find an intership even if he is not your academic advisor.

I took intro to micro with this guy. I seriously never used my text book. Never showed up to class some how I got a B for the term. I am currently taking intermediate micro with him, IT IS INSANELY HARD. I am dropping the class because Calc 4 is required prior to taking the class so be prepared before you ad a class like intermediate micro.
Great teacher, nice guy, funny, pwr points are used effectively, just wish the class didnt have to be 2 hours long
he's really entertaining in class and always willing to answer questions.

Class is set up to be very easy, still have to learn the subject material, but this won't be your hardest class.  Oleg Pavlov is a great professor, he speaks with a bit of a russian accent, but is easy to understand. Funny, teaches material well, lots of resources for learning (book, lecture slides online, homework online). Print hwk before submit!
Pavlov is da man! Take a class under him, you'll do yourself a favor.

He's a fairly easy professor.  Lectures are mostly from powerpoint, so they can be incredibly boring, but if you study them on your own, you'll know enough for the tests.  He had 3 tests and dropped the lowest one, so if you do well on the first two, you can ignore the last two weeks of the term for this class.
He is hot, smart, organized and very helpful. You can totally get an A in this class.
Clear, organized lectures.  Nice guy.  Not a difficult class.
No Comments
a little boring, easy tests, he is not very comfortable with English language. onlinehwks everyweek. if you go to classes, you will get an A. If not, you can still get an A:)
Incredibly easy, boring class.
The classes are only hard if you don't go to lectures. All of his examples are in his tests and all you need to do is pay attention during class. I would highly rec. taking one of his classes
He is hot!!! Helpful, brilliant, and always understanding, and always making time for students.  He is the best prof ever!!!

Good Prof. Much better than other Eco profs at WPI who just talks abt theory from the text. Lectures are fun since he keeps on asking interesting Qs. And of course, when a Russian talks abt Capitalism, u got to listen.
Works hard, teaches well and is pretty funny.  Good at relating material to students. How can a Russian teaching capitalism not be fun?

Pavlov taught directly from the book, even the examples. I realized I didn't have to go to class after awhile, and the tests were straight from the book. Difficult though, tricky tests and homework. Not written by him, made the class frustrating.
Great Professor
No Comments
Teaching doesn't help that much.  Tests are harder than is reasonable.
you will only have to go to class 4 or 5 times and will get an A.
A dedicated teacher.
Needs to work on English, learn Economics
Oleg is fun and sexy
Tries very hard, keeps the class interesting with humor!!
Great sense of humor... very easy to work with.
Lectured off of slides which I didn't really like. Really really nice guy, but would rather take the class with someone else.

Homework assignments are not collected for grading, but if you don't do it regularly, you will not learn well. Only seven online tests are given. Test problems are similar, not exactly the same with hw. 75% will guarantee you a B and 90% will guarantee you an A.

There were several instances where there were multiple mistakes on his homework assignments that he did not realize were there until it was pointed out a couple of days before the assignment was due. Inaccessible outside of zoom conferences. Audio lectures were not helpful. You'll be relying on his overly animated powerpoints exclusively.

A lot is thrown at you. Typically need to sift through many lecture files to figure out hw/tests. Live lectures dont really help, just need to study his notes. Both classes ive had with him, ME 5381 (Applied elasticity)and ME 5202 (Advanced Dynamics) were very difficult classes. Hard to understand him sometimes, and vice versa. But he grades well

Because he uses animation features in his slides, it can be hard to follow during lectures. However he gives plenty of examples and everything is posted to review later on. Our entire grade was based on weekly take home quizzes which were never too difficult. Overall an enjoyable class.

Course material is very well presented through detailed presentations that explain. Homework problems are assigned for each topic covered along with their solutions which gives more clarity. Course is graded based weekly quizzes which are straightforward to clear. Only downside is that professor is not easily accessible through email.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Overall, the class is pretty easy once you figure what he wants. Before then, good luck looking thru his slides. He is somewhat lazy tho. I had been emailing him about my missing quizgrade for 3 weeks, and he finally made the change a day before grade's due. I know I got an A in this class, but He has yet to submit my grade (fall break's over now).

He is alright. I took the online course, gave up on watching the lectures after the first lecture. Could no understand him, and he writes on the chalkboard that isn't visible for the recording device to pick up. But the power points and the prerecorded lectures that he has with the power points are good and explain the material well.
Doesn't speak clearly, gives class in slides and grades you on midterm and final exams, which are impossible(avg for midterm was 40%). Oh yeah, also doesn't curve!

Never opened the book. 80% of the grade was the 4 ANSYS projects (not too difficult), 20% for weekly quizzes. Second class with him, so I knew what to expect. Quizzes fairly easy once you figured out what he was asking for. Powerpoints are awful. WIsh he would use the board instead because he does a much better job teaching that way!
If only someone could take this man's power points away.  He is excellent explaining things on the board, but his lectures are impossible to follow because of all the magical voodoo animations.

Professor did not provide any feedback throughout the whole course and he doesn't go over homework. I have no idea whether I am passing or failing by the final. Expect 40 hours of study time per week to research the missing information from his lectures. Presentations are fairly decent, this is only positive thing I can say.
Took Intro to Statics, which is basically Mechanics but all the forces are zero. Really boring. Big lecture class. Homework, lectures and quizzes are all powerpoint presentations.

I had him for me2503, 4512, 593V (vibrations) he is invariably useless with cluttered powerpoints and a lecture style that is equivalent to listening to a textbook on audio tape. Exams are often unclear and considerably more difficult than material in lecture or homework.

Uses powerpoint almost entirely for lecture which makes it difficult to grasp the material. Homework is more difficult than the weekly quizzes by far. Lowest quiz grade dropped. Really nice guy and incredibly helpful outside of class. Going to see him during office hours made all the difference. I would take another class with Prof. Hou again

I consider myself to be a very global person, but i cannot understand this guy at all (accent)! He also explains things in the most complicated manner possible, bass ackwards. Expect to teach yourself most of the material. That being said, ES2503 has no exams just 6 open book,note,internet quizzes and he drops the worst one.

A bit of an unclear speaker..uses very dense powerpoints almost exclusively, very little from textbook. Regular quizzes, no big exam. However, he's a VERY fair grader, and EXTREMELY helpful if you're having trouble with the material.
He is one of the best professor I have ever had: although he has an accent, he is extremely clear and detailed. Always willing to help and available to answer questions.
Super bad teaching and super hard exams. You are on your on buddy. Amazing!

I also took 2502 with him, and will be taking 2503. The people rating this guy low have no idea what they're talking about it. He wastes NO time whatsoever, the material is dense, but if you can't follow it, good luck getting a degree in Engineering. His accent is WAY better than most of the people you'll run into in the industry or at school.

class overlaps greatly with PH1110/1.  He is hard to understand: cannot pronounce the letter L.  His tests are reasonable, open book and note.    Powerpoints are insane, very cluttered, every single thing is animated.   Literally slept on floor in back row of class since there was a quiz everyday at the END of class, daily quizes = 50% of grade.lol
this dude is pretty bad. don't ever take a class with this dude. I made the mistake of taking 2 with him.

Terrible class, he just sat in front of the computer and lectured off of his cluttered & confusing powerpoints.  Speaks heavily accented English, but it really was irrelevant when compared to the poor quality of his slides & explanations.
Awful. I cannot believe this man is allowed to teach. Can't understand him. Nice man however.

He really wants you to learn, but just does not know how to teach. The Powerpoint is good idea but just put you into sleep if it did not confuse the hell out of you. Expect seeing tons letters in his examples. He never uses number, I felt like I was a math major
Lecture is a waste of time, but tests are easy. It seems like he wants the students to do well. If you passed PH1110 you don't even need to attend the first four weeks of lecture.
Soooooooooooo funny.. hes so blind. and has no clue what he talks about. his accent is pretty messed up. but his tests are easy.

If u can predict exactly which question is gng to be put on the quiz like me, go ahead and take his class. Otherwise, you should atleast be familiar with Chinese accent. His Power-point lectures are better than your mom's lullabies (instant sleep inducers). Way too blind to teach.
Great teacher, sit in the front and carefully listen to what he has to say.
Really can't teach well, but as long as you go over lecture notes, and sample quizzes you should do fine.  But you really dont learn alot, just teaches you basic concepts
Read previous rating...I attended about 9 lectures out of 28, and slept in all of them.  Three words of advice: Graduate Teaching Assistant.
His accent is horrible, his slides are repetitive, the room is dark, it's early in the morning, all ingredients for a good nap, not a good grade.
Hard to understand, just reads from power point slides, half of which have errors on them. Gives a lot of homework. Not a good professor.
Very hard to understand and found myself day dreaming most of the time.  Alot easier to understand through email.  Relativily fair, and pretty easy to pass the class. Gives lots of HW.
Ends every word with "uh".  I wish I could understand him.
No Comments
his accent is hilarious
No Comments
No Comments
this guy can't speak no english

Genuinely a mean person - was rude and degrading to both students and his TA. He often started lectures before the time, and ran lecture at least five minutes over. When the vast majority of the class failed the midterm, he told us we had an issue with "basic logic" and he would have to slow the class down for "weaker students in class."
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: His grading is super confusing, and he does not provide great feedback.

One of the toughest math professors I have ever had. Do not take a class with him unless you are interested in the actual math theory. His lectures require your entire attention but are extremely interesting. The homework is hard but the class is rewarding as he leaves you understanding the topics well beyond what is needed for engineering.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Homeworks get difficult with upcoming weeks.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: If you aren't a grad student. . .run! Has no respect for undergrads and goes way too quickly in lectures. You'll be forced to decide between understanding the lectures or getting down all of the notes. Proof heavy class. Quote from the professor, 'You've been accepted into one of the top universities in the country, so you need to act like adults.'
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: He is awful and disrespects students. He uses the online textbook, but if you read them during classes, he will call you out rudely and never hear you explain. He will also refuse to answer your questions because of that. Lectures are full of useless proofs without actual useful theories. Be prepared to learn by yourself. Avoid this guy.

Had for two classes - okay if it's a class with established curriculum, but avoid for special topics courses as he was very unprepared when I took one with him. Anger issues and does not respect students. I didn't think so at first, then I saw it in person more than once, and directed at me. I love math too, 3.5 GPA - be careful.
He's  a great guy He helped me with some problems even though I wasn't in his class and didnt know him at all,
Textbook narcissist. He neither considers new ideas nor inspires them. He has suppressed anger issues.

Had him for MA2071 and found him run then. Don't get me wrong, he loves math, but he also carries a massive chip on his shoulder against students. Had him again for MA4891, and he was worse. He literally only taught on the first day, after that he had us teach ourselves because it's "the best way to learn". Angry, disrespectful, and a bad teacher.

Attended two of his classes and he was very unprepared on both. Presentation of topic was haphazard. Didn't grade/return homework by the time our exams came back, we had no idea of his expectations. Most disrespectful professor I've come across - a number of my friends with >3.9 GPA share the opinion.

The people complaining about Martin are intellectual midgets. This guy sparks an interest in math. GREAT professor. I'm one of those kids that habitually skips lectures if they suck. I went to his lectures because he would regularly blow my mind. Going to lecture = fun and informative. If you get disrespected, you probably deserve it. Lrn2math.

Having taken LinAlg several times, Prof Martin was easily the best teaching I had for the subject. Don't get me wrong, he makes it difficult and forces you to fully understand the theory behind what you're doing. But in the long run, I got more out of his lectures than any other math prof at WPI (except Tang).

This guy is awful! he teaches solely on proofs and theories so no one understand what he's talking about. Gets WAY to excited about matrices and the tests are not at all what he lectures on. Has no respect for students and calls you stupid in lecture. do not take his class.
Really rude and not a great teacher.

Possibly the most enthusiastic professor at WPI and tries to extend that enthusiasm to students. Drops lowest 2 homework grades, and holds review sessions 2 days before exam, helping the students run it themselves. Hard work and thinking is required for most homeworks, but exams are easier, and he is always willing to assist. Fantastic professor.

Please ignore the negative comments below. Prof. Martin does respect every student. His TA is also great too! Each week he gives one assignment with 5 problems in it(not easy), however, he only counts the best 5 homework grades over 7. He extends office hour prior to exam...he is one of the most enthusiatic prof. in WPI.
Disrespectful to both students and fellow staff members. Inconsiderate and solely concerned with his research. Failed to provide the necessary knowledge for future classes. Overall terrible
Very theoretical.  not a lot of examples.  class can be confusing but he's helpful in office hours.  said he won't grade on a curve. overall...WORST math class i've taken here in 4 years.

Incrediblilty difficult teacher.  However, does care about students (he did hold an office hour on a Saturday morning).  If you were VERY strong in math, you'll love this guy.  However, if you are not, just make sure you do the reading (he gives pop quizzes) and attend office hours, because he's pretty helpful there.
Picture Comic Book Guy on the Simpsons, except it's about Math.  Unless you're as in love with theoretical math as he is, he's one of the weirdest and most annoying professors at WPI.
Extremely rude and derogatory. Completely lost on the immense usefulness of computers, and denies their rightful place doing math for us.

Class started off as very abstract (aka hard), but he was smart enough to tone it down and concentrate on easier concepts, he's always there if you seek help, very excited about what he teaches, lectures fast, listen to what he says before you take notes

He is an excellent teacher who has a passion for his classes that spread to his students.  He also has really great crazy stories about Linear Algebra.  He makes learning fun )and easy if you go to his office hours).
An awesome teacher, and a nice guy.
He is crazy but makes you stay awake and interested, fair and helpful guy, good professor.
YES! Martin is the Man!!
No Comments
Very fair on grading, tries very hard to make linalg interesting
He is crazy, but he is pretty good.  Very friendly and helpful if you need it.
He maintains that computers are stupid.  I'm a CS major and tired of hearing it.
Excellent teacher
Martin makes class interesting, and that's enough.
very enthusiastic about matrices. maybe too much.
Great professor, very fair on grading and evaluations.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Nice guy, just a rough on grading
Scary enough to fear her biting your head off if you say the wrong thing.
No Comments
She's really nice and really helpful...and easy on the eyes.

She is a great Maple instructor who definitely knows her stuff.  She is very helpful, all you have to do is raise your hand.  She also does a brief instructional session at the beginning of each lab, which basically tells you everything you need to know to get a 100.  2 main reasons to want her as your Lab TA - 1.) Easy 95-100's, 2.) Extremely Hot!
very helpful in maple lab, sometimes a little unclear, but she writes everything that you have to do on the board. Easy as long as you pay attention basically.
