I agree...best looking on campus...makes MAPLE FUN!
She was super nice, and it wasn't a difficult class. I would recommend!

Caring, kind, and funny individual, but not great at teaching. Lectures are not useful to solve online homework which have complex problems. Sometimes does example problems on board. She does love her students.

Please avoid this professor if you haven't taken physics before. I managed not going to more than a week of lectures because she didn't explain concepts clearly at all. I feel bad for all the freshman who haven't take a physics class and took this class in their first year. Reading the textbook is a lot more useful than going to lecture.

The first 10-20 minutes of each lecture were wasted by her talking. The last 2 minutes she speeds through some of the most important concepts because she "ran out of time". Would very often hold us over the lecture time to include those concepts. However, great and caring professor. Extra credit is always available. She wants you to pass her class.

Prof. Stroe is super sweet and very flexible! Lectures were hit or miss, sometimes they were helpful and sometimes not. All work is done online on Mastering Physics, including homework and exams. Prof. Stroe gives a fair amount of extra credit opportunities and would generally allow students to make corrections on exams to get points back!
Lectures were a waste. Discussions were somewhat helpful. Just read the textbook.
Don't go to class, read textbook. Tests are online, everyone cheats. If you're taking 1111 or 1121, transfer into 1110 or 1120, you will thank yourself later.

(I took her at Clark University for astronomy) Easiest class I have ever taken. I cannot tell you anything I learned. Sweet and kind person, but not a great professor. Read directly off her slides and did not explain anything well.

Lectures are unfortunately not the most helpful. She is passionate, but the lectures consist of slow proofs that are not particularly beneficial and occasional examples. There is some extra credit throughout the course. Exams are fairly straightforward with a helpful practice exam available. Reading the textbook is quite helpful.

Her lectures are essentially useless, she ended up assigning less homework towards the second quarter, which is needed to understand the material. Read the textbook, and if no homework is assigned, do some practice problems.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: Gives online tests and barely teaches the content of the class clearly. People just look up answers. You don't even need to show up to lecture, just read the textbook.

Her tests usually go really bad and he entire class average for them is 75. But she 90% of the time allows students to do test corrections resulting in 8-% of lost credit returned. Plenty of hw but if you have trouble with it you can usually find the answers online. Uses pearson so you have to shell out 75 dollars.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures were a little disorganized at times but Prof. Stroe genuinely cares about making physics accessible and enjoyable to her students. Gave us real-life examples/videos and an end-of-term project to apply to something we were interested in. Grades weren't entered until the end of the term but there was lots of extra credit so no worries!

Professor Stroe is great! Friendly and easy to approach if you need help. Her lectures are great, has review sessions before exams, and is easy to contact outside of class. Despite what others say, she is easy to understand. There is homework which is time heavy but not bad. She wants you to get an A and understand the content. I recommend her!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Stroe is an amazing teacher who cares deeply about her students. She connects the course topics to real life and her lectures are a mix of taking notes on the subject matter and doing examples. Her tests are average difficulty, but students are able to submit corrections to gain most of the points back.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: A really nice woman that really cares about her students, she will always be willing to help me solve the homework questions that are hard for me, and she is the first one wencourages me to don't think less myself. for new students to wpi who watching this website for selecting classes, if you need physics, just take this one, you will not regret.

Mechanics is always rough, but Stroe is a really wholesome professor who genuinely wants all her students to succeed. Everyone in my class bombed the second exam (3 exams total), so she let us do test corrections for 50% credit! She takes a lot of care to answer questions if people are confused. 10/10 would take again
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is so passionate about teaching! I enjoyed sitting through her lectures. Somehow, she got me intrigued by electricity and magnetism! She is understandable, reasonable, and willing to work with you.

Professor Stroe is very possibly my favorite person, she is kind and has dry humor which will keep you engaged. She always offers extensions, help, extra credit, and half credit back on exams. She works hard to make sure you have all the material and information you need, and if you actually study the homework concepts you will learn everything.

Professor Stroe was a nice woman and wants to see her students succeed. Her lectures are not very helpful, and the few problems done in class are not helpful on the exams. Had I not taken AP Physics C, I would have struggled. She gives a lot of partial credit on exams, and if you see her at office hours she will give points back on exams.

Professor Stroe truly cares about her students. English is not her primary language, and her lectures are very math heavy, so it's not hard to get lost. However, Stroe tries to get to know and help every student. She often answers questions after class for almost an hour, and she has a lot of office hours. She is such a wonderful person!
A really nice professor. Patient when teaching students. Give a score on test and homework fairly

Stroe is a good professor and while the class may suck at times, she genuinely wants her students to do well and learn the material. She is pretty funny and very understanding, all-around really nice professor.

Got a D on the second exam; she was so sympathetic! She went over what I got wrong and gave me new strategies to study. Tests are not that bad, you're allowed a formulas sheet and the examples she gives in class are a lot like the exams! There's an extra credit project which boost your grade a ton, also homework is 30%!

Course is tough but she is very understanding and will help you pass the course. She has plenty of office hours and gives you the opportunity for an extra credit project and gives partial credit back on exams.

She's a pretty good professor I will admit. She's the better professor for studio if you take it. Mandatory attendance, but through an app so just have someone send code. Tests kinda suck but its okay. Extra credit project that bumps you up a FULL LETTER GRADE. Explains well in office hours. Thick accent so hard time to understand. Still take class
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Stroe is super helpful and gives extensions to students if needed for online assignments. Her office hours helped me understand tough concepts. The lab reports were very tedious a bit challenging. Her lectures are really good and I liked how she would do examples on the board and note important things that would be on the exam.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Normally when I get a professor who says that their goal is to make everyone happy in their class, they are always a poor teacher.  All except Stroe, that is.  Her lectures are a little dry, but her humor helps keep you awake, and the material she writes on the board is very useful.  She wants nothing more than you to succeed.  Stroe is an Angel.
She is a good teacher. Her lectures can get a little dry, but her tests are nice because she includes extra credit in them.

Teaching style was vaguely unclear but overall she was a good professor that genuinely wants students to do well. Goes out of her way to answer questions and be available for students. Has a little bit of an accent, so she's a little hard to understand but overall not a problem. Tests are very much like practice problems.

Most caring and available teacher I have had as of yet. Dedicated to her teaching and works hard for her students and her department. She isn't the most clear professor but she really tries hard to be despite her heavy accent. I really recommend her as a teacher.

Though not the best professor I've ever ha, Stroe really worked hard to make sure everyone succeeded in the class.  I struggled through the class and had to put in a lot of effort, but Stroe tried really hard to help me out.

The course material is moved through slowly, and the class is a little too easy in that one will need to do more problems on their own to ensure they understand the material. Lectures are basically straight out of the book. She's really nice though and I'm glad she makes sure this class happens every other year.

Professor Stroe did not do much to help me pass the class. She is not so much a professor as a supervisor. All of the assignments and readings were online besides tests, so you basically go at your own pace as long as it's before the deadline. I could have skipped every lecture and still gotten an A.
She's the best!

A very light hearted teacher who does not seem to have the most experience teaching but gives commendable effort. I personally believe that reading the textbook and doing the homework was more efficient than going to lecture or conference.
REALLY REALLY BAD AT TEACHING!! read the textbook ALL THE TIME!!! you'd better read the book, which is exactly the same as the lecture
Awesome class! Stroe has a really cool accent, but it can be difficult to pay attention. Labs are full reports, but there are only 5 of them. Subject matter was really cool and she explained it well

Great teacher, had an awesome Transylvanian accent, and gave out Russian Candies. Easy to understand once you get used to her accent,tells stories that start with "back during communism". She taught the material well, and was always more than fair with the grading. Shes the type of teacher that some students try to take advantage of her niceness
Conference prof. Tries very hard but can be confusing. More than willing to assist if asked. Attendance is not mandatory, however encouraged.

I preferred Professor Currier than my PH 1110 professor 1000%. He wanted to individually help all his students out and wasn't the type to trick you. Everything that he tested you on, he told you in advance and gave study problems for each exam (DO THEM). Also don't buy the textbook, there's pdf's online
Professor Currier wants his students to do well, though exams are tricky. He's willing to work with students when he is approached and also gives extra credit options.

Generally, I think professor Currier cares a lot about his students and really encourages reaching out for help. Given how hard PH1120 is, I think that he did a really good job of making sure a student had access to enough resources to fully understand the subject matter.

I think that Professor Currier does a great job at teaching the content presented in PH1120. He went at a pace that worked for everyone and always made sure that everyone understood things before he went to the next topic. He was very accessible outside of the class time to be able to sit and have a meeting to clarify things. Overall great class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Not good at teaching , have to learn everything on your own.
Uhhhhhh.. Im sorry if you have him. Tests are impossible, cant figure anything out. In class problems arent bad, its the tests which look nothing like those.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Currier is overall a very good professor and a great guy. He is very open to answering questions, and will take the time to make sure everyone understands the content. If you put in the work, you'll succeed in this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I don't particularly enjoy physics but I did enjoy my class with Prof. Currier. The online transition was difficult for everyone and I think Currier did great to accommodate everyone as he wanted to see everyone succeed. I would definitely take another class with him (preferably not online) as it was well balanced and the content was taught well.

Good professor who really does care about his students. Very understanding and helpful, provided some good practice problems, clearly explained how to approach problems, and posted informative slides online. Expects you to work hard and really understand the material, but provides a lot of help and extra credit and very reasonable exams.

I took Professor Currier for PH1110 and PH1120 and from my experiences, he's been good. Exams can be a bit challenging, yet homework is fine. He makes the class engaging and is overall a nice person. I highly recommend doing his practice exams. His only downside is that he goes through the class slides too quickly. Overall he is a soild choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I really enjoyed Professor currier. He was very adaptive to the switch to online learning and I really appreciated his enthusiasm for the topic. He was very understanding given the COVID situation and offered opportunities for extra credit and was willing to accept late work given the circumstances. Many grades provided opportunity To improve grade
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: All in all his class isn't that hard and the homework and structure of the class ensures that you are prepared for the material before the exams. Biggest tip, do the homework, worksheets and practice test and you should be well prepared for the exams. Doing the homework doesn't mean looking up the answers online, make sure you understand it.
Prof. Currier knows what he expects and he's always really clear about it. He works hard to make sure the students understand and finds time to talk outside of class. Overall would recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Professor really understanding. He was a perfect professor to get during this pandemic. He was very flexible with due dates and how work was done. Great Guy!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class was okay. I had a very weak understanding of physics before coming to the class. I finished with an A and did well on the exams, so that says something. However, I had to work like crazy to make myself understand because I sometimes found Currier's explanations to be unhelpful. Exams are like the sample exams though, so that helps

Professor Currier was absolutely awful for PH 1120. Going to class was honestly less helpful than just studying on my own. He spends half the time talking about his own research instead of teaching. He doesn't grade the tests, so you have to jump through hoops to get grade corrections/explanation. And there is NO PARTIAL CREDIT given on exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is a nice guys and tries to be reasonable, but he doesn't really understand that what makes sense to him doesn't always make sense to others. I.e., if you ask a question about something he said, he will likely just repeat what he already said of the topic of the question. Don't get me wrong though, he is a nice guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: If you like professors that think they are hot stuff and barely teach you Currier is your guy. Personally I prefer a professor that doesn't just flip through slides and pretend you all just immediately understand everything. Take someone that actually cares about their students instead of just talking about themselves constantly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Blake is a special kind of bad. To even come close to a 90 on an exam you're going to need to invest at least 20 hours of studying per test. He spends lecture speeding through a powerpoint while giving you nothing for notes except an equation. Pretty sure the combined class average was barely over passing. Great guy, worse professor.
Multiple choice is weighted very heavily and he just gives you the formula and lets you figure out the rest on your own.

Absolute worst professor Ive had at WPI so far. Had him for physics conference. Knows what hes talking about but gets mad when you ask him to explain things. Loved to say This ones for you to figure out when asked a question. If he doesnt like you then hell probably give you a bad grade, even if you attend class and are doing good on tests.

I had him for lecture and conference so I got very used to his teaching style. Not the best lecturer, hard to copy down notes because he has everything already typed, liked his conference style, always asked us what we wanted to work on. Test averages were usually in the 60/70's but the final grade was curved a lot.

He was absolutely helpful and actually caring of our learning process. He gives great advice for the exam and is always willing to help you improve, plus he is super nice. He won't give you the answers for anything but he will walk you through it as many times as you need and if you need extra exercises for practicing, he will give them to you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Currier was great. He went over excercises during conference that were good practice for the exam. He did a great job guessing the type of problems that would be in the exam, and we went over them. Also, he was available outside of class hours for help. I stuggled a lot in this class, and his office hours were very useful for me.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Currier cares so much for his students. He does help sections after his conferences and works closely with you. His lectures are also well taught. Good material covered and the exercises done in class provide a solid foundation for the exam.

Blew through lectures and didn't really take time to explain things. Expected you to understand the material and catch on extremely quickly. Homeworks helped understand what was going on but the tests included things that weren't practiced as much. If you know the material well you will do fine but if you need extra help you'll be lost in the class

Okay professor overall. His lectures are very rushed, and leaves little time to answer any questions. His favorite response to a question is "I'm gonna leave that one for you to figure out". Overall his class was fair. I put in decent work and got out a decent grade.

Goes quickly during lectures, but posts power points online. Homework can be challenging at times, but it's okay if you can time manage well. Some test questions can be challenging, but they're what was covered on the homework. Overall a reasonable professor.

Well, I'd love to give a review of Professor Currier's teaching, but that would imply that he actually explains things. If you have him for physics, prepare to teach yourself. He'll mention topics, but that's about it.
Dude is trash lecturer. Literally just teach physics to yourself. He might mention some of the topics you need to know in lecture, but that doesn't mean he'll teach you them or show examples.

He is a very personable  guy and his office hours are helpful. At times, his lectures feel very rushed and hard to follow. His tests require you understand the material extremely well and his homework assignments can get very frustrating.

You can definitely tell that Mr. Currier loves his job.  he very much keeps lectures interesting through his clicker questions and real- life examples. All homework is online and it is not just a "do it to finish" homework; every answer is graded and you get a final score. He was really helpful with  any questions you had, through e-mail or office.

This guy was not a good lecturer. He went way to fast and only skimmed the very basis of the concepts being taught. The tests were similar to homework problems, but that doesn't mean much when he's not teaching us how to properly do the problems. Actually made elementary physics concepts more confusing. I would avoid him at all costs.
He spends long time going through the calendar,  easy examples in the lecture and tough questions in the exam and the homework.

A great guy who wants his students to succeed. Would recommend him. He cares that his students understand the material and so his exams and HWs are a bit tough. His conference notes were really helpful and he makes his students practice a lot in the conference which prepared me for all his exams.

This professor wasted 10-15 minutes a class going over the calendar, went through lectures too quickly and didn't post notes until a week after class. Tests were difficult, always had errors and were graded a week and a half later. Professor did not check if room was booked before test. Did not learn much from this class and would not recommend.

Great guy, really willing to help. Assigns homework every week but on the bright side, the homework are similar to the exams. His lectures are posted online. His explanations get a little confusing sometimes though. Kinda slow with emails so it's better to go to office hour. Bonus: he's a WPI alumni so he knows what we are going through :)

His lectures go really fast but the conferences are great. Try to get him as a conference instructor because he goes through everything super well. Also, a great way to study for his tests is to do homework problems alone because his test questions are always super similar.
Careless, inconsiderate, and unprofessional. No constructive criticism. Held Zoom classes, which turned into YouTube videos. What a waste of money......
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Rehabilitation engineering is a great subject, but she was not. Professor Ault has no understanding for this subject area. She was never around for questions outside the classroom or for most of the labs. Lectures were boring..
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Beginner level Solidworks course and she was giving way more advanced assignments than necessary from day one. Grades way too hard, and gives pop quizzes. Do not understand why she assumes we knew Solidworks because it was the Intro course. This professor made my life miserable. Boring lectures.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Careless, inconsiderate, and unprofessional. Does not offer constructive criticism, regardless of giving your best efforts, unless you are succeeding. Gives blatant insults and takes your mistakes and questions personally.

Awfil. Lectures from old powerpoint slides which she created years ago. Labs - endless work. She will ask you to do items that she does not even know how to do. Never around for help. Comes to school, teaches and then leaves.  Good luck if you have her in any subject.

The class itself it really useful and you learn a lot. The classes themselves aren't too great. She grades really hard though.... .like super hard. Think you did it perfectly? Well no, it wasn't how she would've done it so there go most of your points. But I think she scales the class decently at the end, at least the term i took it she did.
This is the worst teacher at WORCESTER POLYTECHNIC INSTITUTE!

She provided little or no direction on the MQP. Does not care for the students or the WPI. I agree with the other student when he stated, "needs to be more practical, intuitive and well-rounded in mechanical design."

I don't mind being criticized. But I do expect her to give us directions on solving the problem rather than she pointing out and complaining obvious mistakes, and reiterating the project destinations which we all know. She needs to be more practical, intuitive and well-rounded in mechanical design and analysis essential for prototype development.
Does not care. You TA teaches the labs and most of the classes. She is the worst teacher at WPI
Really knows her CAD and very helpful if you see her in her office
Does not care - very poor with students. Too busy to spend time at school.  Stay away from this one!!!
This is the worst teacher at WORCESTER POLYTECHNIC INSTITUTE! Stay away for her.... We is very strange and does not understand industry

Absolutely terrible! Following the course schedule, you've got about a week to construct the prototype and write your final report. Sure, if you had no other classes, you could compose the perfect report she expects, but come on, this is a 2000-level class! It feels like she grades this MORE strictly than most professors grade IQP's. DO NOT TAKE!!!
Waste of time

never, ever ever ever do an IQP with her. quite possibly the anti-christ incarnate. you will beg for death at her uselessness. you will ask for posion when confronted with her ignorance. you will saw your own arm off at her incompetance. DO. NOT. RISK. YOUR SANITY. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Not so good, unless you have no option just take her but try to go for someone else. Not so clear, expects so much in your project. There is not so much guidelines with her. She expects way too much!!!

Good as an academic advisor, crappy teacher ME2300 was a joke One lab session we spend two hours learning how to use the Internet for research The project topics were stupid and not worthy of being called "engineering" and the only conceptual stuff of value (i.e. patents or the design process) you would just as easily learn on your own
Lectures are always fun with her and the quizes aren't too bad. Would be nice if we had more time to work on project though

Everyone seems to hate this professor. I think the problem is essentially the quizzes that has a decent amount of questions only covered in the assigned reading. Sometimes her assignments are a bit vague. However, whenever I needed help on anything, she was willing to give whatever help she could.

She expects too much of the students. If you get a single small thing wrong on the labs or H.W, you get a 2/3, which is a 66.67%, so in most of your H.W and Labs you'll get a C grade. Quizzes are lucicrously hard so watch out there aswell. Very rude to ppl she doesnt like and her helpfulness depends on how much she likes you so take with other prof
shes horrible
No Comments

she is horrible.  I don't care if she is teaching the only class you need to gradute, don't ever take a class with her, its for the best.  She is ****, condescending, bias, and she grades people based on if she likes them, not if you do well.  I can't say how much she is the worst human on earth.

Instead of being productive and professional, I felt my grade depended on her current mood.  She gives very poor feedback and will openly criticize the project (very little positive) but offers little suggestions.  I received an A but she drove me crazy.
One of the most irritating, ignorant people who walks the earth.  I cannot believe WPI allowed her to advise my IQP group in London. Completely unqualified, extremely rude.
And I thought I wasn't working on an IQP until spring... Seriously though, if you're always thinking, "Hey, I really wish I had something to monopolize my time," this class is for you.
She has no business being a professor.
"something is missing in your project, I'm not sure what.  think about that"
"Mini MQP" has unrealistic expectations for a 2000 level class.
Absolutely terrible in every respect- holds grudges, patronizing, vindictive, evil woman.
She was rude and very harsh.
Oh god, make it stop...

If know nothing of CAD, you'll work 8 hrs/day for 2 weeks on term project
No Comments
take CAD before you take Intro to CAD
No Comments
I LOVE DR.BILL!!
He was a funny guy! Weekly quizzes on Friday that weren't too bad and weekly webworks for homework. Overall enjoyed his class.

Awesome professor for Calc IV! He gave great solutions on Piazza and also took in other student solutions as valid. I wrote all of mine on paper and posted them on piazza, and it still worked. Also, he is very lenient with the online webworks. As long as you can get them done, he gives infinite tries.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I took accelerated Calc 4 with Dr. Bill and his lectures were very theory heavy. He would dive deep into the mathematical reasoning behind the various topics, but not always go over how to problem solve. His office hours were helpful and he always tried his best to clarify my questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: HE'S DA GOAT
Amazing professor. Great lectures, though they are primarily theory based. He is very visual and makes sure topics are understood in practical ways. I LOVE DR BILL.

If Bill has a million fans, then I am one of them. If Bill has only one fan then that is me. If Bill has no fans, then that means I am no longer on earth. If the world is against Bill, then I am against the world. There's a lot of homework but that's about it; he's also very accommodating and intelligent.

Dr. Bill is the best math professor I have had at WPI and my second favorite of all time. His lectures are all beneficial, and instead of getting straight into examples, he introduces topics and techniques to show you what they are doing. He is funny and very helpful, and I would take another class with him in a heartbeat.

Dr. Bill is a G. He truly cares about your knowledge of calculus. His lectures are slow, but it is for that reason that you will appreciate Dr. Bill because he wants you to have a solidified knowledge of calculus. His webworks are a little long but chill. His practice tests for his weekly quizzes and the final exams are similar. 10/10 man.
Dr. Bill was an amazing professor!! He truly wanted each one of us to pass his class and cared about all of us!! I would 100% take his class again.

He employs a flipped classroom style (watch lecture videos at home and do examples in class) which you may or may not like, personally, I didn't like it. Also took forever to grade, I got my midterm grade back during finals week. Really great guy though with lots of extra credit opportunities, but personally the teaching style was not for me.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment:
He provides a lot of extra materials to help you be success. He is very glade to help outside class (takes hours per day to help you) (He is one of the prof.s have most office hours in WPI).

However, he do gives tons of work outside of class for you to do

Dr. Bill is an amazing and charismatic professor. Practice exams are similar to actual exams.  I know many people are not a fan of his flipped classroom approach but it allows us to go over examples and homework problems step by step in class. He was really caring and accommodating, he honestly helped me in any way he could.

Dr. Bill is passionate about mathematics &down to earth. Unfortunately, he'd spend some lectures deriving a formula that was unneeded &, if I didn't already know how the formula worked, was hard to follow &easy to lose confidence. Textbook reading was a must to keep up. Gives extra credit for practice exams (do them!!), & very helpful office hours
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr bill is a solid guy. He teaches you what you need to know. With 1 hour lectures and only 7, often you will need to watch lecture videos to fully understand the content. There are very fair practice tests, fair tests. Homeworks are manageable but make you think. hes a fun guy who gives extra credit where he can!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Great guy and smart teacher only strife is that he assigns multiple hour long videos to watch outside of class a week and expects you to ask questions about those during class rather than teach you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Dr Bill is an amazing professor, really cares about his students and completely understanding. He knows the material, extremely intelligent guy. The homework is very hard, but he explains in class and the tests are easier than the homework. Wear flannel on friday for extra credit. only bad thing is tests are at night, 2 midterms 1 final
Dr.Bill is a great professor who makes learning math fun and enjoyable. Definitly take his class if you can.

He assigns a lot of lecture videos to watch outside of the actual lectures even though it's similar content. He provides his notes which is super helpful. His tests represent the content of the class well and you're given a formula sheet. I would definitely take a class with Dr. Bill again. The homework is also manageable.
Dr Bill truly cares that his students understand the material and does a great job with clearing up any confusion on what is being learned

Dr. Bill is really chill. Often his lectures are more proof rather then application based, which can be a little annoying. Otherwise, he's a really nice and funny guy and is very understanding. Also the sample exams are always very similar to the actual exam, which is very helpful.
This guy was terrible, class was useless but would post hours of lecture videos to watch outside of class. Was never specific, and took forever to grade stuff.

Love Professor Sanguinet, really enthusiastic about teaching and knows his stuff. However, he does not understand that his written assignments/exams can take anywhere from 9-15 full pages to answer. Had us literally do a complete RSA decryption for a take-home exam. Just make exams/written assignments with less parts and it'd be perfect.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Bill is a nice professor and always respond to your question if you ever email him. But his lectures are painful to watch, which he basically just write notes with you. I learned more by only reading the textbook and not listening to the lectures. Discrete math is already confusing but his lectures make it even more confusing.

Doc Bill is an absolute man. Love the guy. Class was easy as could be, the whole class didn't want to take the midterm so he just didn't do it. Powerlifter who can bench like 500lbs. Gave extra credit if you wore a floral or flannel pattern shirt on Fridays. Great professor. Very passionate about material.

Took him for D term online, had mostly asynchronous lectures that were way longer than scheduled class time. Had take home tests that he went over in class before they were due. Honestly I didn't learn much but got an A because I turned in the work. Seems like a cool guy outside of class tho

Dr. Bill is a great guy who's very reasonable with extending deadlines on homework etc. Online lectures were very monotonous and sometimes over 1.5 hours. He spends so much time on deriving formulas with very few good examples and come time for the homework, I had zero clue what I was doing. Tests were even worse and they were take-home style.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I had him for calcs 2-4. He was defiantly a nice guy who wanted students to succeed but not the greatest teacher by any means. Gives sample exams that are very similar to the actual exam. He often makes cringe jokes that don't make much sense so beware of that if you are going to take a class with him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had Dr. Bill for both Calc 3 and Calc 4. In this class all you have to do is show up to class, do the few (free) webwork homework assignments, and do your sample exams before each exam. You'll get a guaranteed good grade! He also cares a lot and is available for office hours and holds several review sessions where he explains any problem you need

Dr. Sanguinet is a nice guy, but I do not like him as a teacher. Everything gets delayed. The content on homework assignments is wildly different from what he talks about in class; you have to teach yourself all the material. He didn't schedule the "midterm" until a few days before we took it, which was three quarters of the way through the term.
He doesn't use MyMathLab! You don't have to pay money to do your homework. I love that. Also, the lectures are easy to understand and focus on.
OK teacher, nice enough guy. Very disorganized though. And really sucks at teaching.

I don't understand how could some people rate Dr. Bill so mean. He is an energetic and young guy. One of the best professors I've ever met in WPI. Very helpful and patient, accessible after the end of class. Just do the sample exam then you'll be fine. Disagree with someone's idea, why not learn some proving stuff in college?

Although many people have written harsh reviews, I believe he is generally a good teacher. Just make sure to take practice exam reviews seriously, they are typically a very similar variation of the test.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Bill is not a good professor. Even though he is known for saying "very very good" every lecture, he did not effectively teach and went off on wild tangents. As a result, the homework deadline was extended nearly every week. In addition, I did not know my exam grades even after the term ended. Overall, avoid taking a class with Dr. Bill.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Be prepared for delays, on everything. We had a hw delays for two weeks because no one could do it. This also goes for tests, quizzes (if you have more than one), and getting grades back. I didn't get my midterm back until it was almost time for the final.

Went to only like 3 classes for Calc 3 and got an A. His practice exams are almost the same as his actual midterm and final, so get to know the practice problems very well. Great guy, fun to talk to, can go off on tangents sometimes but that's ok. Very formula based during lectures as well as easy on exams, so good for math majors as well as others

"Very, very good" guy but as a teacher he spends too much time deriving equations that we don't need to know and we end up not covering the material in class that's assigned for homework. Sample exams were nice and were very similar to the actual exams, he also had review days before the exam and allowed a note sheet which was nice. Overall, okay.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Sanguinet is generally a nice guy, pretty young, funny, and engaging in lecture. However, his teaching can be hit or miss, depending on how well students pick up on the topics covered in class. Finally, beware of pop quizzes every other week; they aren't worth too much, but they're important for understanding the material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: One of the worst professors I have ever been taught and or advised by. Unable to be clear with any grading criteria's, assignments, and reasoning for grading. A very disrespectful and two faced professor. Not approachable, thinks she knows everything, and will not accept her input being wrong or ineffective.
Badly organized lectures, you need to learn yourself. Tough quizzes in class and heavy projects at home. Never helpful, only ask the TAs to answer questions.

Extremely difficult class, not even halfway through it and I don't think I have a passing chance. There are projects where you can't even get help from the professor nor the teaching assistant even if you're too confused to work on it. Steer clear unless it's a needed course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Hey I have to admit you can learn a lot in the class BUT it is because you are forced to learn everything by yourselves for projects and tests. Difficulty/Amount of each project looks like a final project and each test looks like a final test. And you need finish 5 of them. And most of the contents she tested are useless in ur future:)

She is a kind and smart person. She teaches difficult courses, but tries to her best to do it well. Her accent can be a bit difficult to understand, though. And the amount of homework is huge. Other than that, she is a good professor.
I wouldn't  wish this class on my worst enemy.
My major is data science, and to be honest, I found this class is one of the most useful DS classes in WPI. No matter how tough it is. Though I admit the project is a nightmare...

Lecturequiz(20min)+explaining quiz(1hr)+student presentations(1+hr). HW is beyond human imagination in terms of vagueness and boredom. Has a title similar to a top conference but surprisingly irrelevant. However, I love this course anyway. Those who hate it know nothing about life. After taking it, any other class looks comparatively awesome.

Ruiz is actually the most EVIL and incompetent professor I have ever encountered. Not only does she not speak proper english, be able to answer any question correctly in class, she also falsely claimed that I cheated in an exam and forced me to accept an NR. When I told her I'd take it to the judicial board, she said she has tenure and laughed.

Homework takes 2 weeks to complete, and you have 1, not to mention she completely changes the assignment the day before its due. Her lectures not worth going to she reads off the slides from other professors at other universities. She blames the students for a test she wrote poorly. This is not taught as a CS class, I don't know what it is.

Extremely difficult to understand when she is going over problems in class and often doesn't know how to answer questions asked by the class. She has more than once answered a question about a hw answer with "I don't know why its that answer lets move on". TA's were awful and not consistent graders, I would get an A with one TA and 50 with another
her clarity at communicating what she wants from students during assignments and in class is awful. didn't understand most of the lecture. homework's are very ambiguous and hard to understand

For machine learning - this class was a lot of work but probably the most rewarding for the effort. There were 8 project reports ~10 pages each and she read every page and made relevant comments.  You don't get that kind of feedback and time investment from many professors.  She knows her material, teaches it well, and expects a lot.

Her class is very very very well-organized. She explain things clearly, assign projects and reading in good pace with class materials. She is very helpful and care about students. She is strict on projects, but if you keep learning and improving yourself you'll get a good grade
Data mining is probably the most dull class I have ever taken. Do not take it. If you are required to take it, change your major. Ruiz is ok, the material is just terrible.

Very smart woman, but an awful lecturer. Hard to understand, especially when she starts talking a mile per minute. Often unable to explain concepts throughly. Based on the past ratings, I think she has eased up a bit--homeworks and exams were manageable. Not easy by any means, but not unreasonably difficult either.

Avoid this professor at all costs. She wastes tons of lecture time discussing topics that will NOT be tested, and and her exams are excruciatingly difficult. Unless you want Algorithms to seem like a grad course, STAY AWAY. She makes you wish you took the course with Hofri instead.
She's boring, unclear, and unhelpful. She'll take 30% off your hw grade if it's not in her hands within 1 min of the start of the class. Avoid her at all costs.
Great class, very fun, but very tough.  projects were sometimes out there a bit, and sometimes we tried and failed at them, but we were graded mroe on the attempt.

Ruiz doesn't teach easy courses, so don't expect to just slide by with her as a prof. Plan to spend at least 3 hours a day studying, etc and plenty more when you have a project. She teaches hard material better than any other prof in the CS department though. You will learn quite a bit.  Going to her office hours really helps too.

data mining is okay, theory of computation not recommended. where precision and accuracy was required, we got confusion and half-right diagrams and theorems. not enough for a class where tiny things matter.
ai and dataming, both were great classes and I learned a ton. People with negative comments just dont want to do work.  she was fair and quite warm towards all of the students in my classes

Homework is nitemare, long and time consuming, but grading is easy, the proj is a joke--reading other's java code? i always write down what she says about the algorithm in class and that gives me a perfect score.

What the other posters regarding deadlines and long homeworks is true. If you have questions keep bugging her (that's how we got deadline extensions). You better not be taking other hard classes. Great class and Prof., but very time consuming and painful.

I think she's very clear and knows her stuff. What she doesn't know is how much work she is assigning or how horribly difficult it is. She tried to be fair by granting extensions, but she gave the whole class a lot of grief. Her class was good but be wary
Endless project&hws... imagine writing 50pages per week..
omg...the home work can never end...avoid at any cost..

while she is very smart, and has the potential to explain things well, she is brutally unfair. we lost 25% for having an assignment 9 minutes late. i could write a paragraph as to how unfair she can be... the class was a nightmare.
Not very helpful in teaching the class.

I think people here w/ negative comments probably had more problems w/ the material than the teacher.  she treats her students like her children and is more than helpful.  I wouldnt have graduated if it wasnt for her help and guidance. She's hard but fair
useless. lectures explained very little. when we went to her for help on a project, she basically brushed us off. doesn't seem to have planned the class very well. etc. just avoid if possible.

Dear God, why did you curse me with this professor? She manages to talk non-stop for 50 minutes and still not really say anything. I enjoyed sleeping through her classes, everything I needed to know I had to learn myself. I ::heart:: Dharmesh, awesome

She can't teach, schedule a course, or realize when she screwed up.  She will fail you and you will have no recourse except divince intervention.  Example: Less than one week to complete a project that needed 3 weeks.  No one finished.
Horrible teacher. Do not recommend her at all.  Lectures are not helpful!!!  Avoid her at all costs!!!!!

She is terrible to work with or for.  She does not have any idea what she is forcing people to use for research.  She has yet to read source code that she requested to be written years ago and is still in use...
Very intelligent, I also found her to be very understanding and attentive. I would take any class she offered.
She's a terrible advisor for MQP's.
Great Class. Would love to take another one of his courses

Lectures were useless. You could easily not show up to any of them and still get an A as long as you reviewed the useless content before the exams. He wasn't understanding about the online transition at all, and made the class awful. Should have taken it with Bitar. Still got an A, but I learned nothing. He made me hate this class.

Michalson expects participation and work ethic. He was great to work with, responsive to email and available in his office, but sometimes was late with project feedback (though we did get it well before crunch time). Funny guy, and can talk forever about his hobbies and interests.

Professor described his relationship with students as being "adversarial". Was continually talking about how hard the assignments he gave us would be, and laughing about it. Taught very slowly, which was useful for more complex topics but resulted in most students falling asleep, not paying attention, or skipping class. Not a great teacher.
Great professor, and fantastic MQP advisor. 10/10 would recommend.

The point of RBE500 is to make cocky new robotics students realize how little they know, specifically about navigation and state estimation. Michalson doesn't explicitly say that, but it is quite obvious by his overly-kind demeanor. Students tend to take his kindness for granted - but in reality - he knows way more about Kalman filters than you.
one of the worst professors at WPI. He doesn't care about his students and makes a bunch of terrible jokes while lecturing. Took an intro class with him that he made impossibly hard and inaccessible.

Michalson was a decent guy but after about three weeks the class got almost unbearable. The last test was insane. There was a disconnect with the Senior Tutors and that was reflected in the help sessions. I liked that he posted homework and test solutions. Other than that, did not enjoy the class.

After the 4th week of class I was almost completely lost in this class. Typically, Michalson teaches graduate classes, however, he tried to teach this class at the same pace as he would to a bunch of ECE majors. He reuses a lot of homework problems on test. If you can find another professor for an introductory level ECE class, I recommend switching
Great MQP advisor. Didn't micromanage at all and was very supportive.
Often went off on tangents during lecture, and some material felt out of place. Homework and tests were quite difficult. Lab was good though.

What could have been a great class turned ugly about half way through 1) never handed back homework assignments 2) HARDLY EVER answered email 3) missed classes 4) no shows for office hours 5) Went off on tangents that had nothing to do with the subject matter. Bottom line... class was not worth the $, avoid this prof for this particular class.

Probably a great prof. for grad classes but for undergrad stuff he sucked.  He would assign hw we didn't know how to do and you would be stuck in the computer lab till 3 in the morning working on it.  You learn EVERYTHING from the book.  Class attendance isn't important at all.
Interesting class - I wish I knew more about current and resistors first, but it's awesome seeing how these circuits work.

Great professor...Explains concepts well and in depth and tries to provide some humor in class.  Study what he tells you is on the test and you'll do fine.  Big picture kinda guy...skips irrelevant things and gets to the point.
Interesting material, the teacher was excellent and had a good sense of humor.
Good class.  Lots of real examples.  I hope 3801 is this good!
Good class, but the last two exams were LOOOOOONG!

One of the best classes I've taken so far.  The Prof used lots of real examples and had homeworks that were really good (but some were a real pain).  If you ask questions outside of class the prof will stay with you until you understand the answer.
Great class, but if you want help be sure to go to the prof's lab - he's NEVER in his office.
Some of the homework took a long time but the class was a lot of fun.  The Prof knew lots about real world problems and gave lots of examples of good and bad designs.
I'm writing this now, befor I take the final 8-0.  This was a great class - I cant say easy - but very interesting.  The prof was real good about questions and gave good examples.
I had a lot of fun in this class.  I didn't think I'd be interested in VHDL, but the professor made the material interesting.  I like his approach of showing us the "traps" and how to avoid them.
This man should have been fired a long time ago, or worse.  He is smart...I'll give him that, but if he was involed in my life in someway...I can't legally complete this sentence.
Jerk
Would rather be arrogant and belittle you than teach anything. Note that I'm not naive enough to think that I'm being educated in his class or that his toughness is representative of real life.

Arrogent, mean, and likes to trip you up, but he DOES teach well, DOES provide ALL the info you need and is explicitly clear with what he expects. Expect him to be an @$$ when you deal with him, and dish it back...he'll respect you for it.

Michalson has a bad rap, and yeah he does get kind of insulting about some things, but bottom line is he knows his stuff and teaches good overall methods of assembly programming. Also, get over it, he is just kidding with his jokes.

He's hard on you because that's the way life is. The hard work pays off in the end. Recommended prof if you REALLY want to learn something, and not just get an easy grade. If you stay on top of things it's really not too bad...
He's one of those guys who thinks its funny to be a jerk to everyone. He knows his stuff, though.

The most arrogant waste of space **** anywhere, You can't even ask for him to post homework solutions without getting his arrogant attitude.  Only enjoyable I ever had with this prof. was shooting him at IEEE Paintball.
Horribly vague teacher.  You might as well just read the book and give up on lectures, because they do you no good.  Also, pompous and rude.
treats you like an employee,be prepared to take criticism and work your butt off
Absolute idiot - insulted people in the middle of class, to their face
worst proff ever
Knows what he is talking about, but tries to be ambiguous and trip you up
No Comments

The weirdest guy on planet earth. I would highly recommend avoiding this guy at all costs, as the last three weeks have brought the same 3 topics, all of which were from Calc 4. His weekly homework is 3 pages of single-spaced paragraph-long problems, each of which has no relation to the course material. Office hours are no help either. Truly awful.

I can confidently say that Professor Fofana has been the most disorganized and disjointed professor I have ever had at WPI. Besides having lots of enthusiasm when teaching, the past 3 weeks have brought nothing but the same repeated topics, all of which are not even slightly related to the course. If you can avoid him, I would highly recommend it.
He's so lovable

Fofana is the worst professor I have ever seen. He is more like a liar than teaching staff. He used the same example as the start of the class during the whole semester. We need to learn everything by ourselves. Control system is not a challenging course, but Fofana totally messed it.

Class with him was absolutely awful. I learned nothing the entire term, and we went over the same 2 systems the entire time. We were given our term project with no rubric or expectations given and expected to write the ABSTRACT first. When we got our grade back, he commented that we were missing concepts we hadn't learned yet.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: There is no such thing as clarification with Fofana, only an inability to listen to the question. I completed the class but have no idea what it was on. He has amazing notes but doesn't teach beyond them. One of our major projects was delayed after it was due... and even though he's a super nice guy, he repeats material and doesn't teach the basics

Professor Fofana is a great guy but doesnt do a great job of teaching. The class (Intro to Control of Dynamical Systems) is challenging regardless of the professor but any other professor Ive had (except one) could have done a better job. He is too quick to answer questions and half the time his answers are somehow unrelated to your question.

Begins each class with the exact same derivation, taking about half the class time. We were assigned two large group projects for the course. Neither have any relevance to the course. Its the last week of the course and we have only covered one topic from the course syllabus. Spent more time lecturing on how gears work than on controls.

Fofana is a really good person. Hes super nice and he wants to help you, but he has gone over the same exact example every single day for the entire term and everyone in the class has either learned it by now or never will. There are two full robotics projects in the class and you have less than half the term to do it and you pay for them yourself.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If you can avoid this professor, no matter how bad it may shift your schedule around, do it. It is completely worth it. You can ask this professor if 1+10, and he will say "Yes, just read my notes, it's so simple". He completely ignores every student and is overall super unhelpful, weird, and his grading makes absolutely no sense. Avoid him.

Probably the worst professor I've had so far - class was consistently a mess. Don't take it with him if you want to learn anything. Class should be called "Introduction to confusion" because that's pretty much all I got out of it.

Nice guy, super enthusiastic, but a terrible lecturer and a disorganized mess. Gives really weird assignments that you don't learn anything from, so avoid him if you want to learn stuff. His class was crazy hard for me, but from the sounds of it he can also be a complete joke, depending on what he's teaching. If you're stuck with him, good luck.
don't take his class!!!!

Very disorganized. I learned very minimal from his teaching. The term project report format was directly from an MQP outline instead of relevant course information.  There was little direction on all assignments and exams, and he cared more about learning units than the actual subject matter.  We only covered 4/7 topics in the course syllabus.

Homeworks, projects, exams, and lectures are not related at all. He will not even try to teach dynamics until the end of the term. Can not answer any questions well.   Lecture is a waste of time. It is just derivations without any understood end goal and zero example problems.  I don't even know what I was supposed to learn in this class.

Fofana is an extremely kind human being. He is one of the worst professors I've had. He is very excited about Dynamics. he isn't able to teach the subject. We spent 1/2 term doing basic calculus review &didn't even start dynamics until the 5/7 week of term. Tests aren't like hw. Extremely unhelpful when asked questions. No examples done in class
Terrible. You will have no idea what you are doing for your project. Please don't take IQP with this professor. You will regret it.

Avoid this guy at all costs! Even though he has a super long syllabus with crystal clear agenda. He's just going to ditch it and teach his own pace. Expect to not go further than the first 100 pages of the textbook (worst case: 30 pages with our class). Almost everyone failed the class and he did not feel like scaling the grades up (swag mode: on)

terrible!!!!!You thought he was clear,actually he said nothing. Repeating same concept again and again. take too much long time on quiz and hw. Very unclear for the questions on take home quizs and hw. never pay attention to student's hard work.

Worst professor ever had in 6 years of college!!! He a friendly guy, but disorganized mess with his grading and managing paper work. He lost quizzes. He is awful teaching the material too. Avoid at all costs!!
The single worst professor I've had in College. Class time and homework assignments are useless, and every single person failed the midterm. It was not scaled.

Professor Fofana's lectures were clear, enthusiastic, and worth attending.  He is helpful and he expected me to think for myself to apply concepts.  I asked him questions and he took the time to discuss answers with me.

Professor Fofana's lectures tended to be clear, and he has an accent but it is not bad. However, he refused to answer students questions in class multiple times, saying that he had already covered it during the lecture, or that they should have been reading the textbook. Additionally tests and homework were extremely difficult.

very disorganized class, never even took half of the quizzes on the syllabus nor a project! If you are a good talker you can talk your way into an A with this guy. If not you'll still get a B for showing up.

The guy wonders through the material, he never focuses on anything. No organization of the class whatsoever. Easy on the grades though. If you want an easy A he's the man. But you won't know anything. He can be helpful if you ask him.concise questions, request clear examples. Good luck with that!
Took him for Dynamics. Exam problems were taken STRAIGHT out of the book. And the project was hella easy. If youre looking for an easy A Def take with this guy.
No Comments
Talked too much crap and the exam was the easiest thing on earth...
Really nice guy and very funny.  Pretty easy, but you won't learn a darn thing and the book is worthless as well.
Professor we should have a take home test instead of in-class one.  Ok so we do.  One of the happiest people alive.  If you go to class it will be a challenge to not get an A.  Highly recommend
One of the happiest people ive ever met. Explains things fairly well, but definitly keep that textbook handy. Overall a good prof and not too hard to get an A.

"ok class we're having a test on Friday." "But Professor Fofana, the material is sooo hard" "Ok test postponed to next Friday, my friends!"  EASY class, and no the above illustration was not exaggerated.
what an un-organized guy ....doing problem 12 with picture for thirteen.loves his job and is a pro-active grader.....like everyone to pass
Not the easiest to understand, but gives major points (dare I say A's?) for effort
This guy can be best described as a disappointed basket ball star. Always trying to impress but nothing to impress with.
Guy looks like he is stoned all the time, plus he acts like it... defintely his classes are worth taking...
He is very nice. The lectures are great. The homework can help u learn a lot
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Nice Professor. Very helpful. I took his class twice. The lecture is super clear

He is one of the worst professors I have ever had. He emphasizes matlab way too much, this honestly feels like a matlab course rather than ECE course. He gives hw projects, which are all meant to be done in matlab. If you have no experience, you are on your own. Also the grading in exams and hw is extremely unfair, takes off points for nothing.
Very clear, very precise. Concepts are not particularly difficult either. There's a bit of homework, but by no means is it too much.

Very clear lectures and emphasizes material that will be on exams. Homework was short and similar to problems seen in lecture. Exam questions were taken from past years' tests (so just practice those, they are nearly identical). Test averages were mid 80's. Easy class, nice professor.
Very clear in lectures and exams are similar to previous ones. He doesn't curve, so if you're right on the cusp, he won't bump you, even if you come to him for office hours regularly.

Tests are exactly like previous years tests that he provides you with. Loves the material too. Interesting lectures. Decent amount of homework but is definitely do-able if you go to class & help sessions.

So far the most organized professor in WPI. Homework is really hard but it is worth doing. He provides five or more different practice exams which is so similar to what you would expect on an exam. Overall GREAT professor.
Very organized and motivated professor. Work since the beginning and keep up with the work and you'll be fine. He is very clear and friendly. Take this class with him!

Great class, great professor. An Easy A if you work hard.  Highly recommended you skip ECE 2312 and go straight to 503. The material is very similar between the two. Check with your advisor first but it is a very feasible option to get grad credit and get a nice A in it. It is redundant to take 2312 and then have to take 503 later down the road.
Great professor, good class. His note method makes you pay attention (is good, unless you're really tired). Exams and homework are very fair.

Great advisor.  Provides excellent and timely feedback on your MQP paper.  Focuses most of his energy on the paper.  Helps you write much better technical documents and present your project well.  Also very good at finding ways you could improve your research.  Great guy
Very helpful after class.  Go see him for help if needed.

Phenomenally helpful guy. Very professional but approachable at the same time. TRY TO GET CLANCY AS A PROFESSOR. ignore the whiners who couldn't make it through 2011 without handholding and blamed it on the professor.
very tough class, o well, i got thru it
Great guy personally.  Terribly dull class.
Great professor. He taught the intro digital course so well that when I took ECE3801 (Advanced Digital) I already knew half the material.
No Comments
Easy class, lecture was sort of worth it..ish. Eh no it wasn't, read the book do the hw and go to help sessions, you will get more out of it.  A very approachable helpful man.
Very good professor. One of my favorite in the EE department. If you have trouble with the Hw, go to the help sessions, the TA are also very helpful.

Went to him for help and it took us a half hour a problem because of a simple mistake in calculation. Frustrating, but bearable. Until it happened again. And again. I wanted to strangle him. I found the solved sample tests the most helpful part of the class. Avoid.

Had to add my $.02 when I saw the green face next to Ted.  I found this class straight forward and overall well above average.  In all fairness, my lab partner did struggle.  Lucky for her she had me as a partner (nyuck nyuck).  God if he could only learn to draw an OR gate...
He is an extremely understanding and helpful professor, after taking his class i decided to make him my advisor, very approachable, and excited about the material.
one of the worst EE prof. his lecture is not very clear, i learn more from going to help sessions than his lecture. AVOID THIS GUY
Makes sure engineers can write.
like somebody mentioned - be prepared to work really hard if you want an "A" in the class. Otherwise a really nice, smart guy who goes about with his lectures in a very professional manner.

He knows what he was talking about but at times had trouble explaining what he was talking about, I got more out of going to EVERY help session than to his class.  He doesn't like to give a straight answer to questions.
Will not admit mistakes.  Generally unhelpful.  Lectures not reliable.

Moves VERY fast, but makes an honest effort to be clear. Prof. Clancy really shines in that he is very approachable and very helpful outside of class. He also tries to know every student. Just be prepared to work! =)
He is very helpful inside / outside the classroom. A very nice man. Take his class.
Good teacher who seems to genuinely care about students and their goals.
He is a subpar professor, who does more to confuse students than teach them.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

oh my god. hes terrible. all these reviews are LYING to you. he's SUPER unhelpful during ofhr, speeds through material, and his grading allows no room for error. i went to ask how to improve for the final, NOT EVEN TO GET POINTS BACK, and I was told "oh I graded ur midterm so nicely! you don't even know what that is!" then told me to talk to a ta.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Discrete was amazing! I've learned a lot from every area of math which gave me foundation for future math courses! Lectures have plenty of examples, though at times the theory got confusing. The homework requires some thinking, but he drops the 2/5 lowest. The practice final was also a lot different than the actual so prepare your note sheets well.

He's just a good professor.  He sufficiently teaches the material of the course in a respectful way.  He tells you exactly what's going to be on the exams, and he follows through.  I would definitely recommend him.

Is understanding of circumstances (just ask). One assignment/week except for the week of midterm+final. Lectures are content-filled, he writes a lot of content on the board but doesn't give the best explanations. He is very academically knowledgeable but isn't the best explainer. Definitely try to go to his office hours.

I took this course for my cs credit. If you enjoy math or proving things, avoid him. He is pretty tyrannical about the way he wants things are done and completely unreasonable whenever you do something your way

I broke a limb during his class and missed a lot of days but the way he did the course allowed me to catch up. Answered all my questions clearly, but often explained concepts clearly enough that I didn't even need to ask.
His notes on the board dont make any sense. I had to teach myself everything through the textbook. Dudes always so rude in office hours. This class was a huge force.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor failed to be accommodating for students like me with disabilities. This class has a lot of writing, he has no empathy for the pain I was going through when I asked for a ONE DAY extension on the hw because I have arthritis! I went to his office hours, he was dismissive and degrading. This class was the worst experience of my life.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Sarkozy does an amazing job of teaching in lectures. Engaging, clear, and easy to understand. He's not very helpful outside of class but you likely won't need too much extra help if you go to class and take good notes. Exams are worth a lot and moderately difficult so make sure you practice beforehand. Great professor!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: I feel like I have learned so much from his class. He is really intelligent and because of this, he assumes that everyone understands what he is talking about. The tests are similar to the practice exams and homeworks but way more difficult if you don't understand or know how to do the problems by yourself.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He knows the material extremely well. Because of this, he sometimes thinks that concepts are easy for us to understand, even though they aren't (unless you are a VERY mathematical person). HWs are 1/3, Midterm is 1/3, and the cumulative Final is 1/3 of your total grade. Still glad I took it over CS5084, even though I am a BS/MS student.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the best professors in the CS department, and I say that even though I don't like the theory side of CS. His explanations are good and thorough, he clearly knows what he's talking about, and is always happy to answer questions. The class is a little boring, but that's because of the topic and not his teaching. Go to class and pay attention.

Very passionate and heavy lectures. Has online notes for all his lectures and you can also find all the contents of lectures in the book. Reasonable (both amount and content) homework and exams. Grade by homework and 2 exams only.

Mandatory class for CS so it's a big lecture class. Content is not really too interesting until the last week or so when everything builds up. You have weekly homework, a midterm, and a final. Worth 30%, 35%, and 35% respectively. The class is not that difficult.
Great lecturer but does not help you at all outside of class. His grading criteria is also pretty unclear.

Professor Sarkozy is my favorite professor in the program. He really knows what he's doing, and his lectures are both highly informative and entertaining. I have scarce had another class so enjoyable in my life.  I highly recommend him to any and all interested in his classes.

He gives very clear examples and lectures which are worth going. Homework itself can be tricky and really require a good level of thinking (but thats what TA's are for). He taught the material very well and if you actually understand what he is saying, you'll do well.
Gabor is the man! He is very organized. Very helpful and had a great sense of humour. A great professor at WPI.
Great at teaching the material, and a great friend out of class plus top notch for academic advice. Tests cover the material this man will teach you. He is Professor Gabor McAwesome.

Sarkozy is the best teacher I've ever had at WPI. I was starting to doubt the credibility of all the CS teachers until I had him. He explains things so regular people can understand. TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM. You'll actually learn something AND get a good grade.
Professor GaborMcAwesome truly is as incredible as his name suggests. He explains everything clearly and his accent just makes the class more enjoyable instead of confusing you.
One  of the best teachers at WPI. He  has  a  way  of teaching the essential that  makes  you think  you're  not waisting your time there. I can't wait  to have  him  for  another class.
Lectures are intense and he does a great job of teaching the material. The homeworks helps you learn the material and prepares you well for the tests.

Incredibly interesting and engaging lectures. He manages to teach a ton of material throughout the course, yet he connects everything and makes it seem simple. As a result, the homeworks are do-able without help sessions or even the book. Without a doubt, the best professor I've had at WPI.
The work is easy, but I've still learned more from him then from any of my other classes. He teaches very well. Just be ready to take 3-5 pages of notes every day.
No Comments
Good teacher, taught concepts clearly and concisely, nice guy.
I thought he was pretty good.  He went a little fast and did some crazy proofs that we never would actually need to know.  The assignments are basic, and the class was pretty easy.
Gabe is a decent teacher and his class is wicked easy.  When you go to his office hour he kicks you out ASAP, but the class requires basically no work the whole term.

The class is easy. If thats all that matters to you, go for it. But if you actually want to learn, this class is BS. Gabe is not your typical prof. He gives the most basic hws and does not challenge you at all. You go for help and he barely spends a minut
Great CS professor, which is rare to find. Plus a hottie to boot :)

Best CS professor I've had. He knows exactly what he's talking about and he presents it well. Either I enjoyed the material, or he presented it in an interesting way, because I enjoyed going to lecture more than any class I've yet taken.
I've never had him, but I would take a CS class taught by him for purely for aesthetic reasons.
He made learning fun... and I am not being fascecious. If you can get past his slight accent, his lectures are far more effective than the book. One of the best I have had so far.

If you missed the previous day, don't come late to class--the first 10 minutes are always a helpful review of the material covered.  Tests are almost exact replicas of the practice tests.  This guy is a Hungerian mathematician, he knows his stuff!
Smart, organized, has quiet hunky-ness going for him
reviews daily (but not too much), which helps a lot. doesn't always understand.

Prof Koleci is one of the best teachers I've ever had.  She gives examples of everything and works through them clearly.  She encourages questions and  office hours.  I was very disappointed to hear she won't be back this year.

Appropriately challenging for a 11x1 class. Knows, and really enjoys, the material. Sometimes assumes too much prior math knowledge, making examples occasionally hard to follow. But Koleci is a genuinely caring professor, who will do everything she can to not only get you through the class, but appreciate the physics as well. GO. TO. OFFICE. HOURS.

She does not cover the material at all. Everything that she goes over is useless and you don't understand why you are doing what you are doing. The homework assignments are way beyond the level of understanding she provides you with. The exams are sometimes nothing like the multiple practice exams she supplies so you are prepared to fail.

She covers the material in a very sloppy manner. The subjects students typically struggle with are hardly touched upon in lecture, but the easy topics are covered over-extensively. Additional the homework assignments are not well thought out, throwing students right into the most difficult problems, and adding an easy 1 or 2 at the end.

Everything is SCALED. I received a 60 on my first exam and somehow pulled off an A for the course. If you don't understand the material, she holds office hours almost daily for you to stop by. She's very helpful in office hours and during tests, she gives out candy to distract you :)

Professor Koleci is a really good teacher! She thinks she is really funny and gives out candy... she's really not funny but that's why it's funny. Her tests are kind of hard but she scales up A LOT. Very helpful with many office hours. Very nice and respectful.

She's amazing. She holds lots of office hours to help you with homework, group work or basically anything you need help with. If you can't make office hours she'll make time to see you that fits around YOUR schedule.
nothing special but just a comment: take prof koleci's classes and feel the difference!
Extremely helpful and engaged prof. Office hours were exceptionally helpful. WARNING: Don't take PH1111/1121 unless you like calculus!!!
an amazing teacher. Go to the office hours and you'll do great in the class

She was an amazing professor. Always willing to help, clear in lectures and genuinely tried to make the class interesting. For someone who hated physics in high school, it was really refreshing to have it become my favourite course in college!
I have not yet met a better professor.

there's a rumor that prof koleci was denied tenure and will be leaving in the end of next year. if you are planning to take any E&M courses while at wpi, i would strongly encourage writing the dept head and asking to think twice before kicking koleci out, because she is the best professor i had at this school
Best teacher ever. She's absolutely brilliant, and encourages everyone to participate in class. It's absolutely great being a student in her class! Take any class with her!
She is wicked awesome and coolest professor ever!

What a dear. She gives out candy in class when you ask questions, and encourages group activities for extra credit/ projects. There wasn't a lot of time to go over examples in class but the help sessions took care of that nicely. She shifts gears fairly quickly, so be awake in class. One of the nicest profs on campus, and very well dressed to boot.
