The WPI Physics Goddess. She is simply amazing. She knows what she's talking about, she's very good at explaining things, and she actually wants you to succeed. As a lecturer, she puts even Keil to shame.

She will go out of her way and miss out on her lunch ect to make sure you freakin' know physics lol. She is an awesome teacher. Very Very clear. She hands out candy :-D! but other than that I would take her course 3 times if I had too. I will take her course again next term! but for PH1120.

Prof Koleci  is a great teacher, I hate physics, this was my first time taking the subject, and the only reason I did well was her. She makes it very clear, organized, and is so helpful. I often went to her after class to get help too! Wish she was physics 2 professor too!

A wonderful techer who is truly interested in her students' success. Classes were often fun, I only fell asleep in one the whole term (a new record for me). Group oriented class:).Homework gets to be a pain if you procrastinate like me, but overall she's awesome, and fairly easy on the eyes to boot.
She is VERY nice and helpful. I would definately recommend her. She was the best teacher i had this term. I would love to have her as my professor again.
really nice person, very helpful, very clear.  The type of professor that wants you to do well.  Most teachers are out to take points away from you at all cost

This woman clearly has no idea how to teach.  Her lectures are directly related to the tests.  She gives absolutely no preparation for the homework.  She tries really hard to get people to understand after class, but is unable help during. Very bad jokes.

koleci really, really cares about her students.  this woman has gone out of her way to have extra reviews for us, always has office hours, is always willing to explain things.  it's really great that she does all this outside stuff because i can't follow
I am not afraid of physics anymore because she was so helpful and didn't stop teaching me until I understood the material. She even baked cookies for our conference! Yum.
Best teacher ever! At first I thought she was a student.
Very VERY helpful teacher.  The sample exams really boost my grade.  So far i'm aceing the course and it's primarily because of her.  I hope i get her for ph1120 next term
The best professor I've ever had! She got me through Physics and understands the material so well. Just a great person!
If only more teachers were like her
an excellent teacher!
She will not stop helping until the student understands.  Excellent as a teacher, friend, and advisor.  One of the best in the Physics department.
No Comments
No Comments
Really cares about students and improving the class.  Very enthusiastic!
Extremely helpful - she'll go out of her way to help students learn the material
No Comments
You have to buy $80 textbook for class, very easy class. Kadam is very funny and sometimes not easy to understand.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She's great at explaining things, exams are easy but there are a lot of them, she does extra credit, and she has office hours very often. If you have trouble understanding people with accents, she might be hard to understand. She also doesn't take accountability that often. She's super nice as well as passionate about physics and equality.
Great Professor. Class wasn't too difficult. Lots of class engagement with polls and practice questions. Easy to follow.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: She is insanely kind and will work with you to improve your grade if you attend her additional lectures or office hours.

If you learned E&M in high school this class will be very easy. Her tests are multiple choice and the homework and discussions are completion on a paid software with unlimited attempts. She did not do well with explaining concepts, she just writes equations down and moves on. But if you dont care about the content and want an easy A take her.
Lots of partial credit given on tests. All tests were multiple choice. Sometimes she didn't explain concepts very well and struggled to answer more complex questions but overall a very good class

Lectures were very easy to follow and were posted after class everyday, felt empathetic to all students despite being in a class of 140 students. Lectures covered what was on the tests, which were not difficult if you did HW and discussion work. Could have skipped lectures if you took HS physics, but recommend going regardless.
She is a very positive professor. The class was very easy overall. There were extra credit opportunities.

Probably the sweetest physics teacher there is at WPI! She teaches concepts clearly, albeit we rushed through torque a bit. She also has a discussion class where she solves discussion homework in front of us. Her tests are super easy and based on questions she gives for homework, and in our class polls. Clear and concise, 10/10 would recommend.
Doesnt speak the best english but is positive an spreads happiness.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I had Kadam for both 1110 and 1120. I loved having her as a professor. Tests are worth a lower percentage of your grade which was really nice. Review the lectures and discussions before the test because problems discussed in class could be on the test. Higher amount of homework but you have unlimited tries so it was easy.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Prof.Kadam is very nice and caring. She has office hours everyday and she is very helpful. Some questions on the exams are the same from the lectures' examples. The formula sheets are given for all of the exams and there's up to 5% extra credit. Definitely an easy A class. I literally ended up above a 100%.
Exams were the exact homework, discussion, or in-class problems. Not a great lecturer but if you do the homework and discussion problems it's an easy A.
Only 1-3 assignments per week and every test was multiple choice. Should be a free A for people with minimal understanding of physics.
Great professor
I had prof. Kadam for physics 1110 she was a decent teacher. In my opinion she over explained some things too much but other than that hw was pretty easy and so were her tests.

She is an amazing professor. Her lectures and discussions were always engaging and fruitful. Her lectures were a good balance between explaining the theory and going over application problems. You have unlimited tries without any deductions on the homework and discussion problems. She posts detailed solutions. The exams have very similar problems.

She was very nice and respectful to her students, and I found her lectures relatively straightforward and comprehendible for the most part. The tests were all multiple choice, which was great. Not too much homework either, and plenty of extra credit. She was super helpful during the discussion times, and I would definitely recommend her.
None of her notes ever make sense, the tests are ridiculously easy but everything else will make you feel like an idiot.

She was my conference instructor for Burnham's class -- super accessible after the conference and offered so much help. Definitely would recommend her if you're in Burnham's class. The quizzes are difficult (but that's Burnham, not her). Posts example problems from the conference that are super helpful to go through. Overall, really good prof.

Prof. Kadam is well organized with her lecture material. She posts all the lectures and conferences on canvas on time. She is an enthusiastic teacher and genuinely likes to helps students put their best efforts and get the best scores

She was very helpful in building a plan to help me pass the course when I was feeling very stressed after a rough start to the course. I appreciated that she acknowledged that I was improving and wanted to help me pass based on the work I was putting in. The study guide was helpful for suggested examples. This did help me prep as best as I can.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She cared a lot about the students. She was super helpful when you went to her office hours. She also listened to students when they said what they wanted her to do/how to teach them the best.

Physics is not the subject i can say I am good at. Prof. Kadam helped me focus on understand the concept through problem solving. She brings in worksheets and makes us put efforts for ourselves for our own learning to excel in the topics. I felt that was the most helpful for me doing my best

i like the classwork that Prof. Kadam gets students to go through It helped me prepare for my exams much better. She is very helpful during office hours and was always motivating me to put extra efforts to get the best grade that I deserve.

In this class, I learnt how to strategize problem solving. The professor walks you through the problem step by step to better understand how one can solve different but similar problems. Very helpful one one one during office hours always gives extra credit if you are reasonable

THE WORST professor I have ever had in all my years at WPI. If I hadn't taken physics in high school, I would never have passed Kadam's class. Illegible writing & she gets angry if you ask for clarification. Her class was more confusing than just teaching yourself the textbook, which explains why by the end of the term no one went to class anymore!

I was one of her students at WPI in the AP Physics Course in the Summer of 2018. I received an A in her class. I truly enjoyed the class and it was monumental in helping my understanding of the curriculum and narrowing the area of studies I want to focus hereon
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Kadam gave a lot of feedback on the problems I got wrong on an exam and gave pointers on how to do better. She cares more about you understanding physics and the process than getting the right answer. I can honestly say that Prof. Kadam is one of the most caring and understanding professor I have had so far in my career at WPI.

Physics is not one of my favorite subjects, but Professor Kadam made the class enjoyable. I have never taken a real physics course prior to Physics 1110 and she understood this. She cares about her students and wants them to excel. Thanks to her I was able to earn a B in a class I had no prior knowledge of. Her office hours were extremely helpful.

She was always willing to help and is very kind, really cares about student's success and prepares students with all materials to study for the examI. I liked the organization of the subject content. everything in the course is well displayed on canvas and the material is relevant

Great person but sometimes the lectures can be a little hard to follow. The speed of the lectures is what overwhelmed me and I even took physics before in high school at a high level. She is a very nice person and is willing to help but it felt like something wasn't clicking for me and I felt it is an issue of too much content and too little time.
Her tests are completely different than her homework and lectures. I get more confused in lectures then just reading it online
No just no
All about the velocity

She behaves nice because she covers the fact of not knowing how to answer the Physics questions. I had her last summer and I lost big time on her class. If you want to learn some Physics pick up someone else that teaches you something ,because she is not confident on what she is teaching and is looking like still learning herself.

Very helpful working one-on-one with students during conference and wants students to do well. She will give partial credit on exams and is extremely helpful discussing conference problems and exam questions during her office hours.

I was very unhappy with exam grading. She was not the main lecture, she was only the conference instructor.  I was often confused by the way how she explained the Physics concepts. She only reads the solution of the problems.

I thought he would be a difficult professor because he was the head of the Spanish department, but quite the contrary. He actually interacts with the class, gets to know you, makes jokes, and keeps the class interesting. Gives opportunities for everyone to share something about themselves. Would always let us out early. Don't miss the opportunity.

His lectures were always so fun to attend. He is an amazing person who truly cares about his students, and he always had fun stories to share about his life. The tests were exactly what he said they would be, and as long as you study the material from the textbook, you'll be completely fine in the class. 100% would recommend!

By far one of my favorite professors at WPI. Never a dull moment in class and he makes sure that everyone participates in class. Exams aren't hard as long as you're listening in class. Overall amazing professor and I would definitely recommend if you're getting bored of WPI classes. 
(he also has really cool tattoos and shares fun stories in class)

Rivera was amazing!! Each week, we'd watch a film, analyze it in class, and write a short essay review. Readings were in English with short quizzes on film terminology. The nightly homework was optional, and the exams were both take-home which took the pressure completely! The films were also hilarious!! Overall, a really fun, laid back class!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Rivera is an incredibly kind person and does a great job making sure each of his students understand what is going on in the class

Don't take him for SP 2521! He expects you to learn many Spanish conjugations outside of class and know it for every single verb on exams and daily participation in class. He also barely went over it, except when we had questions. His exams are difficult - 7 pages, 12 sections each and barely tells us what words/conjugations to study from the book.
I have taken 2 classes with Professor Rivera. His class is fun, he cares about the students, and he is an interesting character. He gives clear feedback and grades gently. Great prof.

I love Prof Rivera. My experience with all the SP professors at WPI has been amazing, but he's by far the kindest and funniest professor yet. The class itself is slightly boring but he makes it so interesting (he does really cool fun facts and jokes in class). I would 100% take his class again. Not as much of an easy A as other Spanish classes tho

Professor Rivera is one of my favorite professors I have ever taken a class with. He genuinely cares about improving your writing and speaking and corrects mistakes kindly. His classes are engaging and the material is very interesting. I can't recommend him enough!

Prof. Rivera visited my uni to teach a Span literature class for native speakers/advanced learners. Excellent class, my favorite Span class I've ever taken! He was clearly passionate about the subject (sci-fi), but always synthesized student opinions into discussions too. An amazing, joyful person! Professional & understanding during COVID-19 also!

Professor Rivera is the best Spanish teacher I've ever had. He cares about his students a ton and really cares about teaching. The classes flow naturally and even if we didn't stick to the topic we were supposed to, we were still having conversations in relevant Spanish.

If you are looking to learn Spanish here at WPI, Rivera should be your go-to guy. He is extremely passionate about you as a person and Spanish itself. He is also quite funny, very nice, and makes the class very engaging. He runs fun activities and low pressure skits and makes us speak a lot which really does help and is required to really learn.

Prof Rivera is easily one of the best professors I've ever had. My Spanish skills developed more in his 7-week class than they had over the 5 years I've taken Spanish classes. He encourages the class to become more conversationally fluent. This was a weakness I had before, but I never felt afraid to speak up in class and make mistakes. Amazing

Great guy! He is so funny, understandable, and reasonable. He makes class interesting, meaningful, and useful. There is a lot of textbook work and the books are expensive, but that is true for all WPI Spanish classes. Prof Rivera is easy to work with and makes class something to look forward to.

Amazing lectures. Really cares about you, and teaches you a lot about both the Spanish language and Latin American culture. Your Spanish will improve and you will have a good time. Work is medium-level of difficulty.

Rivera cares a lot about his students, provides useful feedback, and teaches practical, usable Spanish. Never did I feel uncomfortable or unsure speaking up in his class, even though I'm not great with the language, because even with wrong answers comes positive, useful, and supportive feedback.

He's a great guy. I didn't enjoy a large amount of the material though mostly because I don't like reading and this was a literature class. Even though the material was difficult at times, his grading was very lenient.

Rivera is an extremely intelligent man - he knows an incredible amount about history, culture and language. And on top of that he's tons of fun to have in class! He will push your Spanish a little bit, but he's kind while he does it, trying to get you to do your best without embarrassing you. Definitely take him if you get the chance!

I have two hour classes with Rivera and each one goes by so fast. His lectures are interesting, and the homework, though it seems like a lot, isn't hard. He's an extremely easy grader and cares about his students. He's a lot of fun and I'd definitely recommend taking a class with him, it is definitely worth the effort needed to get a good grade!

This professor will make you work a little bit, the homework is very easy and take less than 20 minutes each. His lectures are usually funny or you'll watch a few videos movies. Exams are somewhat hard, but its mostly memorizing some chapter vocabulary. Overall, he's a great professor whom I've taken for two different Spanish courses for A's

Rivera is easily one of the best professors at this school.  He's organized, friendly, fun to talk to, and genuinely cares about his students.  His classes aren't cakewalks though, you will be expected to participate and put in the effort to learn.  If you do so, you'll have a great experience.
Great professor! Doesn't grade too easily but is very interested in keep the class fun. Is always very clear about the assignments and course objectives. I loved his class.
Very good professor! Canceled class a few times, but was still able to keep us on schedule with the syllabus. He is very good at keeping the flow of the class going.

The best Spanish Professor Ever! He is very serious, well prepared and organized for all his courses. He focus on the overall language improvement(read, write, speak, listen), and he genuinely cares about his students. Its not an easy A course, but you are sure to get a good grade if you pay hard work.
Keeps class interesting, not a very hard grader. Really nice guy too.

Have had this prof. for a few classes now [3521, 3523]. Loving his teaching style, and his dedication to keeping students interested in the course. Wants to make sure your understanding of the class' objective is, and is always there to give you a hand. Make friends in class and study together!

Film class was fun. Films were very relaxing to watch. Class was decent. Work: film review, quizzes (super easy), midterm/final (ok). Class not too hard. Class discussions weren't that great; folks just weren't too fluent in SP, but that's the class, not the prof. Rivera always enthusiastic, explains clearly, cool discussion topics. Great class!

I took Spanish Culture and Civ; will take Film and Media. Prof extremely clear, speaks Spanish quickly but understandably. Very helpful and understanding. Mild amount of work (40 pgs Spanish reading/wk, 1 essay, 1 group oral, 2 tests). Fair amount of class discussion. Lots of interesting things about Spain. Very good class, highly recommended.

I am in my second week of Intermediate II and am HATING it.  It's not that he is a bad professor, his class is just very fast-paced.  If you are used to just ****ing around in spanish class, I would avoid this professor.  If you are willing to do the work and participate in class, then I recommend him.
Had him for Adv. Spanish I. Very well organized and taught his class with a great attitude. Lots of opportunities to speak in class, including a bit of off-topic chat. Challenging but rewarding.
No Comments

Rivera is awesome!  He challenges you but wants you to do well, and is very helpful.  I took his  class as a freshman, and had to work really hard.  It is definitely possible to get an A in his class, but you have to work for it.  His Spanish is also very clear and understandable.

This guy is the man. Having had to learn English himself, he is very good at explaining the finer points of the differences between Spanish and English. Also discusses interesting things in class, which moves at a relatively intense pace.
No Comments
He's helpful and cares a lot about the students. He doesn't collect homework (except for essays and translations) but he does discuss it in class.
Very approachable, understandable, reasonable workload. Great professor!

Absolutely terrible mind numbing lectures which is a shame because the material meant to be taught in the course is quite interesting. Does not use canvas and you are in the dark about your grade until it appears in workday, which leads to half of the class NR-ing because they had no idea if they were doing enough. Should not be a professor.
Only graded on participation and a presentation. Did not use Canvas and didn't post grades anywhere. Not tech savvy.

NRs half the class, empty canvas page, no guidelines are given for participation and presentation (final grade's components). The first grade you receive is the last you receive, class average < 50. extremely boring lectures, students' presentations are more entertaining. Incompetent with the use of technology, NEVER ever take a class with him

Gave incredibly vague grading criteria at the beginning of the course and by the end I nearly failed despite attending almost every class and giving a solid presentation, the lack of explanation for any of the grades is infuriating and the overall lecture style of each class was mind-numbingly boring. Definitely avoid taking his courses.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: The way quizzes were structured actively discouraged learning. Feedback on quizzes was comically bad, such as "No" or "?" on answers I thought were at least partially correct when compared to the textbook and answer key. I even got "Unclear and problably wrong". Stay away at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He gave a tough grade to students, but he didn't give the same requirement to his lecture. Giving poor explanation and offering his own personal lecture notes. Commented on your score in front of students when he returned back the exam paper. This is totally waste our tuition fee and time. Why WPI still keep this kind of professor!

Starts his class with - "Questions? ". He expects students to read his gibberish notes that he writes without teaching anything. Unwilling to teach. To explain a question on fruits, he starts with fruits, jumps to vegetables and ends with cancer. He does not give a damn about your grades. I would never recommend anybody to take any of his course.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Hofri is very smart but that's the problem. If you are average, you will suffer in this class. He cannot deliver contents in a way that a student might want to receive. You will end up doing his course more than others and yet scoring very bad on tests. Not a good experience and sometimes, I feel like I am wasting my time in this course.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is passionate about the material; but that's it. Lectures are incomprehensible; hw are based on the lectures, tests are super hard. Sometimes he just gives up halfway during the lecture because he doesn't remember what he meant in HIS OWN NOTES! Did not scale grades even for people who improved during the course.

During the course the professor often could not present material in a clear and understandable way. Additionally, homework problems were not stated clearly enough to be approached the majority of the time. Consequently, the end result was a poor course that failed to provide the necessary fundamental knowledge. If you want an F, take this course.

Lectures were boring and uninformative, yet attendance was mandatory.  Sometimes just dismisses opinions he disagrees with.  Often waits until class is already over to try to start handing back the homework.  The class website was difficult to navigate, and due dates on the website didn't always match what he said in emails.

No. Just no. He is confescending horrid. He teaches social implications of technology AND DOESN'T KNOW TECHNOLOGY. Makes discussion a criteria for grading and then dismisses all students. His essay's are not essays and he doesn't understand what a critique is. His lectures are horrid and he often gets things wrong.

He prepares very hard for the class and really tries his best.  He has a passion for the stuff he's teaching and wants the students to learn.  However, he needs to manage his time and material better.  He needs to put emphasis on the important material (computer science theory) and cut out the time he spends on doing algebra.

I would not recommend this teacher to anyone. He has poor time management, both of classes and what time of the week the homeworks are released. He expects you to know the material already and if you ask a question he thinks is something you should already know he will dismiss it it a rather rude way. The lectures are him mumbling at the board.
do not ever take his class . i think he is psycho. he doesnt know how to grade home works and exams and final grade will be not based on his gradding system

I don't think Hofri needs any more negative feedback; but here comes some more. Social Implications is a 2 hour nightmare of a class. Participation is 30% of the grade and he dismisses most student comments as unrelated banter. The essays, which are the other 70% of the grade, are returned with low marks and two comments.
just don't get it

M. Hofri's mastery of this material is not in question. He lacks the ability to articulate or clarify topics covered. Keys to doing well in his his course are: 1) Understanding "Hofri English" 2) Learn How he writes exam questions. External resources will provide better teaching of the subject. Don't be discouraged by his condescending tone.

He doesn't teach - he belittles.  I went to the dept chair to complain about him and got nowhere.  He insulted my entire class, and gave low grades out to everyone.  He's clearly smart, but lacking in professionalism.  Do NOT take a class with him - you (and your GPA) will suffer from it!!!

Micha Hofri is a clearly brilliant man with a great grasp of his field. He does not convey much of this information. I don't know what this guy is doing still teaching. Don't take a class with this professor. However, if you come out of his class with any knowledge of Algorithms whatsoever, the scaled grade will be an A.
Droning tedius lecture style.  Homeworks difficult beyond the ability of a half-dozen seniors and grad students to do.  Avoid at all costs.
Teaches undergraduate as grad-level

An excellent and kind man and an algorithmic genius (think Knuth).Understandably his classes are a little advanced and he gets a little short if you're not quick enough. Talk to him 1-on-1 and work hard to get the best out of his classes. I will never forget the personal interest he took in me.

It's been said before. Seems smart, but he fills the board with incomprehensible equations that no one follows, then stares at his work, then says "wait that's wrong." Not that it matters - by that point you couldn't possibly care less. Why is he teaching?

TAKE NO CLASSES WITH HIM Micha is a nice guy, and quite intelligent.  He does not understand that people in his class havent been doing combinatorics for the past 15 years.  He constantly says things are "EASY" when obviously they are not, as no one in the class can answer his questions.
Teaches far above the level of his students, and seems to be oblivious of that fact.  Frequently makes mistakes on the board and in homework assignments.  Avoid this class.
he sucks
horrible teacher

I warn all away from taking all classes with this man. He does not want to teach, and will act like it is a burdon for him to do so. He is against the students and doesn't care if you learn anything. The workload for this is muchworse then a full time job
I would rather be vivisected by the nazi's than take another class with this bozo.  Stay away, I'm not kidding.  Right now, the class midterm average is a 43 ...

His philosophy: "Class should be hard so students learn more." I'm glad I took the class. it was hard but I learned a lot. He's also willing to discuss CS topics not covered by the course. The projects are often ambiguously worded. Buffer with e
From preschool to graduate school, I have had more teachers than I can count.  But, without hesitation, I can tell you Hofri was by far the worst I have ever had.  Do not take anything with Hofri.
Uhh, insulting, singles people out, assumes you know everything right off the bat.  Never take a class with this guy.
far and away the worst professor I have ever had. avoid at all costs.
Let's put it this way... I stayed in his class less than a week and that was enough to tell me I needed to get out.
argh. Unclear, unhelpful, un-everything. Avoid if at all possible.

Prof. Sarkar does not give clear explanations. His lectures are confusing, and even though he asks if anyone has questions, he rarely gives a good answer. His tests are extremely difficult, but with the curve, it is definitely possible to pass. Conferences and reading the book were more helpful than the lectures.

DO NOT take his class. He is the worst professor for physics. Switch out of his class ASAP if you are put into it. His exams and, excruciatingly long homework are both difficult. He is also a boring lecturer. The only good thing about him is he learns everyone's name. Overall, I had a horrible first year with him. Never again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Spends too much lecture and conference time on easy examples. Homework way too hard comparing to lecture examples. Tests are almost irrelevant with learned material. Cancels his office hours way too often.

I thoroughly enjoyed his class and he made physics very easy to understand. He makes sure everyone is comfortable asking him questions if they need help and always makes lectures something to look forward to.
You want a challenge? Here you go. Feel prepared for meaningless lectures and impossible tests with a class average of 44% (true story). Don't take any class with this guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Very difficult to follow in lectures and not very helpful, he is also late to class a lot and tries to rush everything to make up for the time he missed.

I overall really liked Sarkar as a professor and as a person. His class was executed really well and he really tried to make sure students were always on the right track. He also memorized everyone's names and had us invent a lab for the class as an end of the term project which I thought was really cool. I'd definitely recommend him to a friend.
If you want to pass you must cry. the dude sucks homework is hard, tests are hard and he has very poor lectures

Very unclear and unhelpful. Lectures are boring and he usually left problems unfinished, didn't explain his solutions, or would over-complicate the math to the point that even he didn't know where he was going. Impossible to know your grade until you're done so it's hard to know if you're doing well. Only good thing is he allows cheat sheets.

While he was great and quite helpful one-on-one, Professor Sarkar was useless as a lecturer. His lectures were uninteresting and had little to do with the homework. However, the tests are doable if you know the concepts in the material. The whole class is also curved, though you won't know where you are in the curve until you get your final grade.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Impossible homework the TA's can't even do. Homework assigned at midnight and due in 12 hours. Homework on things he hasn't taught yet. Insane tests (first avg was a 38, no curve) and he expects you to memorize all formulas and concepts. Useless lectures. Disrespectful. AVOID if you like your sanity or gpa

Sarkar is the worst professor at wpi. His exams are all concepts with no formula sheet, makes them impossible. Posts hw unannounced. Kicks students out of his office and never emails you back. If you value your gpa don't take a class with him. Talked to the department head a few times, but he was of no help what so ever.

Got a C but don't even know my final test grade. Others who did worse than me got Bs in the course, based on the first two exams. Waiting to get an email back from him but he tends to never answer or take forever. Would never ever ever take another class with him. I had mental breakdowns and felt degraded. Save your time.

Sarkar is the single worse professor at WPI. Exams are concepts only with no formula sheet allowed, which makes them impossible. Uses high level calculus when he should not, then says he can teach whatever he wants. Posts HW unannounced, and kicks students out of his own office hours. Extremely disrespectful to students and flat out insults anyone.

Sarkar is the worse professor at WPI. Disrespects his students and kicks them out of this office DURING OFFICE HOURS! Exam are concepts only with no numbers and no formula sheet which makes them impossible. Uses upper level calc when he's not suppose to then says he can teach any way he wants. Doesn't respond to email & posts hw unannounced

He has experience with teaching higher level physics but can't connect to newer students.  The exams center around memorizing a huge quantity of formulas.  That may or may not be your learning style,  so take that into consideration during registration.   His lecture skills are not up to par so you'll need to teach yourself.  Lots of homework.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. EVER. Classes are useless, tests are tough, his office hours don't help and he treats students like trash. Gives PH1121 course instead of 1120 and tells class that he is going to teach whatever he wants to.

One of the worst teachers I have had throughout my 3 years at WPI. Entirely disrespectful and rude. Refuses to provide additional help during scheduled office hours. Insults and humiliates students that struggle with material. He and his actions have personally destroyed my love for physics and my interest in the subject as a whole.

AVOID. He deserves to be fired. I have been kicked out of his office hours twice because he was 'busy', he teaches more advanced  calculus than is recommended for the course (ie: triple integrals). There is too much homework. He does way too many easy examples in class, and then our homework is so complicated, and he refuses to help. Disrespectful.

The last test had a 38% average grade. He said he was aiming for the average to be a 60%... which still isn't passing. There's a difference between wanting to challenge students and setting them up to fail. He is an awful professor. Do not take his class.

Avoid. First test had an average of 38 for a reason and with no curve. Upper level math that shouldn't be in the course is taught. Lots of assignments put up with no notification, in addition to just a ton of homework. Went to his office hours to talk about the test and was degraded for not knowing the physics applications when they weren't taught.

Signed up for PH1120 and he taught PH1121. When addressed about this fact he told the class he was going to teach the class the way he wanted to. Have had multiple class fights with him. Doesn't give formula sheets and doesn't help during office hours. Also takes multiple days to respond back to emails. Avoid at all costs.

If you choose to take Sarkar, be ready for impossible exams with no curve, no formula sheet, and no numbers. This means you have to memorize concepts and formulas. He is also VERY unorganized and assigns handout homework in additional to online homework and always changes the due dates. Ultimately, he makes you work for your grade.
Cant get any worse than Sarkar. He really is awful so dont take this class. Lots of other good professors for this class

AVOID AT ALL COSTS - Sarkar is a really tough grader, his lectures are useless, he won't help with homework, which even physic majors juniors find difficult, better overload one term and not take his class.

Horrible as a lecturer and professor. I understand challenging students, but I believe teachers should simultaneously foster and assist student learning. Rather, he refuses to help during scheduled office hours and continuously disrespects students. Graduate students recommended as helpful by Sarkar were unable to complete the homework he assigned.

Horrible Professor (AVOID AT ALL COSTS). tough abstract questions that do not follow the course guidelines. I would enjoy the challenge if he actually helped us. Very disrespectful to students (arrives late and keeps us overtime). There are NO FORMULA SHEETS on test! Tons of irrelevant homework that won't help you prepare for the test!

Had him for conference and class. His teaching was very unclear and hard to follow. Assigned homework on things we hadn't learned yet. Didn't believe in providing formulas. You're gonna have to teach yourself from the textbook, he doesn't help during office hours.

Had Sarkar for conference (but thankfully not lecture) for PH1120. He was routinely late (sometimes 15 minutes+), very unclear in explanation, and only gave prepared examples - if you had a question from the Mastering Physics or another book problem, he refused to answer them or would only partially work through the problem before giving up.

Professor Sarkar might not be the best teacher in the sense that he makes small mistakes and his points aren't always clear, but he is the sweetest guy you'll ever meet.  He really cares about his students and will help you if you take the time to ask.

Class was theory heavy, few helpful examples and he never finished the ones he started. Routinely late and routinely ran over. Asked us what he could do to improve, but after getting feedback, refused to change anything about the course.

Doesn't answer student questions in conference, solves pre-selected problems instead.  Routinely runs out of time and falls behind schedule; most of the final was on a subject we barely got to and did no problems on (inductance, if you were wondering).

I have heard great things about Saby in conference, so I was excited to have him as a full professor. I was very disappointed. It was not clear to me that he knew what he was doing. I think he needs practice handling a large lecture, because he was not very good.
Very helpful! Not very organized though. He gets people's names extremely fast and gives you a personalized learning experience. Generally a good teacher.

Prof. Sarkar is a good teacher who always tries to make sure everyone in his class learn the material properly. Although he sometimes make small mistakes in class and may need more experience in teaching, he is a very helpful  guy after all.

Statistics should be a simple class. Professor Petruccelli makes it quite the opposite. Super boring, basically reads out of a textbook during the lectures. Problem is, his textbook does not match the lectures or the quizzes. Notes and textbook are allowed on the quiz, but does not help at all. Quizzes are 10x harder than practice quizzes.

Don't. take. this. professor's. class. Stats should be easy but he goes out of his way to make it difficult. He makes overly difficult quiz questions with only 4 confusing multiple choice questions so get one wrong and you already have a C. I completely understood the material for the first quiz but failed it along with most of the class. Stay away

Applied Stats I is an easy A as long as you take good notes, however you will learn nothing. Lectures are incredibly boring and read entirely off of slides. Quizzes are open note. Labs are incomprehensible Matlab programming projects which the TAs will walk you through.

Only teaches using his powerpoints, which have 100 words per slide. Doesn't seem to care about his students and is rude and disrespectful towards them. Quizzes are multiple choice, no partial credit. Labs are super hard. Get ready to teach yourself everything.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: THIS COURSE IS HARD
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Flies through Chapter 5 and 6 (the only difficult ones) and makes the quizzes extremely picky. No partial credit and he is completely unapproachable outside of class because he will offer no assistance. Hes basically a walking textbook.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Okay, he is a nice guy, but probably gives the most boring lectures of all time. Of the 150 kids in my class, 20 show up daily. Quizzes are nothing like practice tests, Labs are impossible , TA's are unhelpful as well. This class is horrible, take the other guy. Only bright side is you can't fail but its hard to get a B!

One of the worst professors I have ever had. He doesn't really teach. Every class he reads powerpoints word for word, and never does any relevant or helpful examples. The quizzes are either very easy or impossible. The final was extremely picky and very hard. Get ready to teach yourself most of the material.
He is sarcastic and tries to show up students, to make himself look more knowledgeable.  Simply passive aggressive and snarky when questions are asked about quizzes and homework.
Would get  NR if you get lower than 70% of either one of the objectives in the final.

The worst professor I've had. Boring and long lectures that doesn't even make sense. Lecture notes, the book that he wrote as well as him teaching in class is the worst three combination you can have in your life. He makes STATS harder that a grad robotics class.  DONT TAKE THAT CLASS.

Horrible professor. Quiz questions are ridiculously picky and are on information that he barely skims in class. Doesn't actually teach anything, just reads vague slides during lecture. On the last chapter with 4 weeks of class left because he ran through the rest of the material.

Utterly useless at explaining the content, meeting with other students was the only way I passed the class. He seems to live in a world of statistics and doesn't understand that people don't understand what he's teaching. Although tests are open book many students found it challenging and a number of them failed the class with As on all tests but 1

Had him for MA 2611 and MA 2612.  Both classes work the same (need to pass each of the 4 "objectives"...have 3 tries to do so for each)  Can get an A with no problems (as long as you do the work!).  Lecture notes posted on myWPI and they come straight from the book (which he helped write).  Open EVERYTHING on all tests/quizzes!

Extremely easy to get a C, really easy to get a B, hard to get an A. The Final is infamously difficult. Petrucelli is also known for being extremely boring- and he knows it. He asks "why are you still awake?" Have to admit its pretty funny. He is also not very helpful. He will point you to TAs before he offers his own help
One of the easiest classes i have ever taken. 3 chances to pass quizzes and if any effort is put in, only one will be needed

Required to pass quizzes to pass the class but given 3 chances for each. Failed one quiz, called him on incorrect grading, eventually agreed with my argument but refused to give points back. Is of no help outside of the classroom whatsoever. Good thing: quizzes are open notes, open book. Automaticall receive a C if all quizzes are passed.
Very boring, but clear lecturer. All lecture notes are posted. Pass is pretty easy to pass. Labs are goppingly awful, but you can do them on your own time.

He is a teacher who makes the class very easy to pass.  The problem is, though, that he will slow up the class to help people, and he may end up not getting to some of the material he originally planned to cover.  All in all, he is a great teacher, regardless of what this system thinks what I put was.

My IQP advisor - he sucked. Feedback was all on grammar and provided almost no help with developing the project itself. He has zero interest in advising IQP's. After giving everyone hell all term, he slapped a B on everyone's project! Worst experience at WPI I've had was with this guy.

I had him for Stats1 and thought he was a hardass, but then took Stats2 with him E-Term and found out you just have to approach him for help.  He really loves the material so that clouds his judgment on how interested you are, but if you read the book and get help when you need it you can actually LEARN alot and enjoy knowing what you're doing.
Homework is graded strictly, and he's not that helpful.  When I went to office hours he gave generic answers, like he wasn't that interested in studetns.
Worst I've had, somehow made stats1 more difficult than stats2.  He wrote the aweful text book.  Neither he nor his book helped.
made stats incredibly boring and hard.
Tends to form opinions on students early - but if you can build a relationship with him, he can be very helpful and teach you a lot.

He is an ok prof, but he gets way too picky with the answers on tests. You can end up with no points on a question where your answer was almost right cause of the way he grades.  Also, he is horrible with questions.
One of the worst professors ever.  I think he is the devil.

Seems to enjoy singling out foreign students for questions using colloquilisms causing them to have no idea what he's saying.  Has a very perky demeanor in front of the class that totally disappears in one on one interactions.
He teaches fine, but don't go to him with a question . . . I did several times and all he'd say was "It's clear to me that this is the answer" or "I'm not here to teach you English"
he wrote the worst book ever! And teaches a class with it. Stats is so easy, mostly common sense, with some unnecessary vocabulary. He manages to make it hard.
Totally closed to ideas/needs of students.
not a good class at all.
No Comments
Boring.  Just reads slides.  Could feasibly pass with A without ever going.
he wrote the book for the class.....

His project instructions are incomprehensible and very poorly made. The projects that seem relatively simple at first turn into Gordian abominations that you will have to tear your hair out over. Other than the (very) frustrating projects, he publishes slides that are simple and easy to understand. He is also generally very understanding.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I took AP CSA with a very lenient teacher and this was a decent jump. His lectures are difficult to pay attention to, but the slides will catch you up if you read them after. Starter code in projects are not commented very well. Takes time to get started. Quizzes and projects are manageable if you know what you're doing. Has great availability.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor isn't bad, don't get me wrong, but I feel I've had more passionate, caring professors here. At least for CS1101, lecture is not needed and plenty of learning can be done on your own with the canvas materials. he's not bad, but there are better CS profs.
An excellent introduction to CS. Makes a good effort to get the class involved.

He's an alright professor, the class can be a bit tougher if you don't have any object oriented background. But the projects are not too difficult, although some questions on the quizzes can be ambigious at times.

1 HW assignment/week (can get a partner if you want), 1 quiz on Canvas (done outside of lecture time)/week. Quizzes are not bad refer to practice quizzes, no midterm or final, drops the lowest quiz grade, and the last quiz cannot be dropped. TAs will be your best friend. Start HW early no matter what. Go to office hours (there are tons).
weekly quizzes were annoying and the wording of the hw makes it way more confusing than it needs to be

It was not a fun 7 weeks with this professor. His lectures were tough to follow, and I repeatedly got lost trying to keep up with his code. He didn't explain what he was doing during lectures well, and it made the homework assignments very difficult and needlessly painful. A lot of hours were spent on the homework, so be ready if you have him.
I can't believe it! The grading for papers is incredibly tough. Few capitalize and not so strong points and voila! You got yourself a bellow 60 paper. Better luck next professor!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He is passionate about the subject. But his grading is very rough and unfair. You have presentations you can film or present over zoom. and he will take off points if your microphone isn't crystal clear, he will also take points off depending on how well your annunciations are. His essays are graded harder than any English essay I wrote.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures tend to be just watching him code, the labs follow roughly what he did which isn't bad. The homework is very long and rough. Most of it is more advanced then he taught. As for the quizzes. They are very strange, all the questions are worded horribly. They don't test your base knowledge more of the edge cases in each subject matter.

I took this class over the summer term for the 4k credits, but I was pleasantly surprised to see how interesting this course was. Prof. Cuneo makes you do 3d modeling manually from scratch in JavaScript so you learn everything through the hard methods. It's a very rewarding class and if you have any interest in video games or 3d modeling, take it.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Pretty good teacher, his pre-recorded lectures especially are super high-quality, but unfortunately there wasn't a lot of synchronous lectures in the class of his that I took, but the quality of the prerecorded lectures I would say mostly made up for it. Swell dude.
Prolly one of the easiest classes I have taken given the class was supposed to be hard. Id recommend the class with him, easy way out.

If you take this course dont expect much in terms of help from him. The TAs and SAs around him are amazing and extremely helpful but he specifically requests that you dont speak to him or ask him questions, and he doesnt grade anything. He doesnt do anything for his online class. Lectures dont help with homework and rubrics are vague.

Loved taking this class with Cuneo, hes super nice and patient and his lectures cover pretty much everything you need to know. He also provides extremely detailed rubrics for the homework that let you know exactly what you need to do to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He is such a great professor. Great at lecturing and actually codes in class as he explains concepts. The homework is pretty long and time-consuming, but you learn so much. This was my first CS class which I felt like I learned a lot. Go to class and google things, you will be fine!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: The instructions on homework is extremely unclear.
I dont understand why the ratings are so bad. I did the bare minimum and got a B. Hes very nice and understanding. Just do the hw and try. You'll be fine.

Easily one of the worst lecturers I've had. He knows his stuff but isn't good at teaching it. He's fast and vague. Homework is ok, make sure you have a good homework partner. Tests are reasonable. Check test grades to make sure they were added correctly.

Tests and quizzes are relatively easy, but homework requires a good partner or lots of after class searching for stuff not clearly stated at class. The description for homework itself is also vague and hard to follow.

As a student with a disability he was very accommodating to me and helpful. Very rarely, do you find professors like that at WPI. The class topics were very interesting. There were 3 papers, an individual and a group presentation. The work sometimes was a lot, but class culture itself was really laid back. Overall, I throughly enjoyed this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--So many papers

comment: Joshua Cuneo has been the worst professor I have had at WPI, I have taken 3 Java classes previously in my life and nothing would have prepared me for this hell.

Really enjoyed his course. Very nice guy. Everything was clearly stated and I could do it and learn it quickly even while not having previous Java experience. Pushed back deadlines when the class needed. Learned a lot.
I did not realize how good this course was until going to upper level classes at WPI. CS2102 with Cuneo taught me the foundational skills I needed to be successful in other classes.

Although difficult and work heavy, this professor provides a lot of good context that will greatly assist you in future computer science classes. Lectures are cohesive and organized, and he manages to stay on topic while taking time during lecture to clarify confusing topics. Furthermore, he is understanding and helpful during office hours.

If you sit in lecture and just listen to what he is saying about the code, it will be pretty clear to understand. Even if you don't go to lecture though, the homework goes over the concepts well enough that you can do well.

This professor gives very time consuming homework assignments which are way beyond the material he teaches us before the homework is due. Expect to do a lot of self teaching for the homework. His lecture notes and reading often don't help with the homework. He does not prepare us well for the homework, quizzes, or exams. He is not a fair grader.

Worst professor I've ever had. His instructions on assignments(homeworks, quizzes, tests) are often unclear, vague, and meant to trick you. Feedback on assignments is never helpful. Don't try to take this course without any prior java knowledge, you WILL struggle. Exam averages were both in the 60's, which should say a lot.
Homework assignments were often unclear, and the professor/TAs are not responsive to questions on the forum.

He is extremely unspecific in what he expects from students but he takes large amount of points off for extremely specific details. During lectures, he reads off of an old professor's notes, makes careless mistakes, and doesn't know what he's explaining. The homework he assigns is much more difficult than anything we are taught in class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The homework was barely a reflection of what we learned. Speaking with TAs, even they agreed that some of the stuff we learned was way beyond the level of this course. 40% of the grade was homework... and with such strict grading this is pretty much a guarantee to hurt your gpa.
He does not seem to know what he is doing most of the time in lecture. He also expects us to understand the code by him teaching us theory but no actual syntax and implementation.

He seems to mean well, but he makes mistakes in lecture that he then half-heatedly clarifies days later. His tests are pretty simple, but the course is weirdly focused on these specific learning methods for Java that are ultimately useless outside the course.

He worked with Prof. Hamel and took the Homework part. His homework is not hard at all but full of confusing explanations and errors. He tried to change Prof. Fislers original homework, but so far his works seems to a failure unfortunately. The result is losing tons of points on your grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Algorithms is a hard class if you're not a CS major, however, he made the content easily digestible and engaging! He brought in toys like blocks and stuffed bulldogs to demonstrate sorting, and is extremely passionate about the subject! Exams and quizzes are take-home, is very lenient on grading, and offers A TON of extra credit. Love this guy!!!

Super chill guy, really great explanations, he would literally do interpretive dances to explain concepts and it actually made sense. The homework assignments had really clear instructions and rubrics too. 10/10

He is the best. You will enjoy his lectures. Too much in terms of content, but he is very understanding and even offers lots of extra credit. As long as you are trying to keep up with the quizzes and collecting points, you should be fine. Don't be afraid to reach out to him. Best Algorithms course in WPI. 100% recommended.
Class was enjoyable. Workload is not bad but I agree with another review on here: this class is too easy and does not ensure a solid understanding of some of the most fundamental algorithmic topics.
Would absolutely recommend taking his lectures. He's very engaging and covers a wide range of topics.

He's a good professor and a good guy, but he makes the classes too easy. Algorithms was an easy A, and he didn't go in depth into concepts that a lot of other colleges' Algorithms classes would. The class was made to be easy for the students but you don't gain a deep understanding of the material, and this hurts you in coding interviews.

Very fun professor. Had this professor for numerous classes, and I have had an easier time understanding this professor than any other professor I have had. Uses clear examples to explain concepts during lectures
Goated professor, always reachable for help on assignments and funny lectures.
He is amazing, very helpful. Would defiantly take his class again

Great professor who has a great personality in lecture. Obviously as an intro class with 100+ students it can be hard to manage, but he always makes sure everyone is understanding the material presented. The daily quizzes can be annoying for some, but are pretty easy as long as you pay attention in class.

Assignments are pretty challenging to conquer going from structured assignments to the first assignment having almost no structure. Quizzes are given on Canvas after class time, have unlimited time and practice quizzes are given alongside the real quiz which helps. The midterm and final were both on canvas, outside of class time, ~90 minutes long.

Engling is one of the best professors I have ever had. He cares about each student and understands responsibilities outside of the classroom. His main goal is to ensure you learn rather than remember the information. His lectures are very funny and engaging.

I love this guy. He genuinely shows respect and cares for his students and ensures everyone learns something in his class. From his overall enthusiasm in lecturers to responsiveness outside of class, you cannot go wrong with him. It was a challenging definitely but Professor Engling made it worth every second and I learned a lot in this course!
He is one of the best professors I've had so far. He is funny, His lectures are engaging, and He is passionate. He is overall just an amazing professor

Professor Engling is absolutely amazing. Every morning he plays a classic song relating to the topic that day. For binary search trees, he played "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For" by U2. Very clever. Also he's just hilarious. If you know  classic movies such as The Princess Bride, get ready to nerd out with him. And clap sarcastically.

Pro Engling is great at teaching. He gave a hw a week, def go to his office hours and the TA and SA office hours for help. There were 3 exams. He responds very quickly and thoroughly to emails. Gives a quiz at the end of every class, ours were on Canvas, 30 mins after the lecture, fairly easy, with unlimited time.
i love this man

He's one of the best you'll find. He teaches the course material in a fun and entertaining manner, and if you pay attention in class then you'll do well. He has super short daily quizzes that help boost your grade and reinforce the material from the lecture. He's also very caring and accommodating.
very good professor

Best teacher in the CS department. He is the reason I became a CS major. His class is the perfect blend of fun and challenging. He really cares about his students and makes himself available outside class.10/10 would recomend. Would jump at any opportunity to take a class with him.

Great professor and great class. He's nice, fun, enthusiastic and very caring. Daily quizzes are easy if you go to class, and he drops 2 lowest. Weekly homework w partner also pretty easy, sometimes questions worded weirdly but he's happy to clarify if you ask. 3 exams, all worth less than 1 homework assignment. lots of chances to boost your grade.

Amazing professor that wants to connect with his students and really makes the lectures interesting. Daily quizzes that are easy to get 100s on if you pay attention in class. Watching the assigned videos aren't necessary but can help with homework assignments. Definitely recommend taking a class with him.

Great professor. He teaches well and answers every question he can. He answers emails quickly and will sometimes get back to you even late at night. Watching the assigned videos isn't necessary if you pay attention during class. Make sure to understand the extra tidbits he posts on canvas along with the lectures as you'll be tested on them.

Professor Engling is great at what he does and explains everything in depth. The homework that he assigns helps me grasp the information better and he always makes sure that we're prepared for the exams by creating exam samples. I would recommend taking his class.

Prof Engling is amazing at what he does. He is sociable and connects with his students even in a big lecture style. His jokes are funny and he tries his best to keep us on our feet with interactive teaching and explanations!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: As previous comments state, it's quite obvious that Professor Engling cares about his students and wants them to succeed. The lectures weren't always super interesting but that's what can be expected in covid times. The homework was easy to understand and representative of the final. Overall, this was a great intro class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Engling does a great job at making boring lectures interesting. But I cannot say he is always responsive. I failed one of my classes with him because of a silly error, and repeatedly tried to communicate this with him but he ignored my emails (COVID era) . Even a simple "sorry but you have no excuse" would have been more reassuring.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: A very good professor overall. Cares for the student's health and a fun professor.

Just like the previous comment, he's a very caring teacher and will help you if you're struggling. This year was a hybrid year and despite the class being very different he was able to help out everyone whether they were physical or not. Very inspirational as well he always played music at the beginning of the class and was very generous.

Professor Engling is very caring, and willing to help. 2303 is not a difficult class with him if you put in the work and go to lecture. Lectures were mainly spent on reviewing code and weekly homework assignments. He is much better for algorithms but it is not hard to get an A in this class.
While this class wasn't easy, this is the best CS lecture I have ever taken at WPI, bar none

Lecture can be difficult to pay attention to and sometimes boring. The homework, however, was always interesting and a challenge (C++). Professor Engling gives weekly quizzes and drops the lowest four. Homework is worth half of the final grade. I got a 76% on the midterm and failed a homework assignment and still received an A. Very caring.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: A great professor at WPI and always has office hours. Encourages questions. Plenty of opportunities for an A. Homeworks worth more than exams. Up to 3 quizzes a week-dropped the lowest 4. Lets you work in groups for HW. Lectures are decent but not the best. He doesn't post notes. If you want to learn, go to office hours and read up on the material.
He is really good at explaining the class concepts and makes them fun. He is very helpful during office hours, so deferentially go see him.

Professor Engling is the better teacher for CS1101 at WPI. He is more caring, and the daily quizzes are much easier to do well on. He dropped our lowest four quiz grades, which helped quite a bit. The final was almost exactly the same as the practice test. Be prepared to sit through boring lectures (he tries to make them interesting)
Assignments were just creating board games in C/C++, much more of a self-learning class with her just regurgitating the documents put into Canvas, but she's gone so yeah
Did not give a care about mental health, very willing to schedule office hours but unwilling to help

She is literally the worst professor you will ever come across. She has no lessons plans, no organization. She is extremely rude and condescending when you ask for help. She helps by telling you what you need to type but gets mad when you ask her to explain. The difficulty jump for the last two assignments was uncalled for (graph theory).

professor smith is very talented and knows what she is talking about. however,  not going to lie she is not the best teacher/lecturer. it is hard to understand what she is saying in class and to follow along. I would have personally rather learned the material myself. to make up for this, she is a very nice person and spends hours in office hours.

You literally can't learn anything in this class. It's structureless through out whole course, she teaches things whatever comes to her mind and didn't gave any specific steps or instructions to follow. The lab is also a disaster, She's late for lab and students were been notified by email that the lab is held on Zoom after about 10 mins of class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Not worth going to lectures

It's a toss up: sometimes she makes no sense at all during lectures, and sometimes she makes perfect sense but at a very fast pace. Despite the confusing lectures, she is better suited at helping during 1-on-1 office hours or Zoom sessions. With 7 total assignments, it wasn't all that bad with starter code and after re-watching lectures.

Therese smith is the worst professor Ive ever had. Ive never wanted to learn about something so much and not been able to. The more you try to understand what shes saying, the more confused you get. Lectures are terrible, homeworks dont help at all. If theres anything you can do to get her fired, do us all a favor and act now.
don't expect to learn a thing in this class but she will give you hw answers if you go to office hours

Therese Smith was a horrible professor. I went into the class under the expectation that I needed a basic knowledge of C, but she expected us to code at a professional level in a non-major, sophmore level class. The starter code was almost always broken, the lectures were boring, and I learned nothing in the class. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Her canvas site gave no confetti when I turned in the assignments. Very unhappy, would not recommend.

The lectures are not super helpful but she sits on zoom for office hours for the entire day. The office hours are extremely helpful and she will straight up walk you through the entire homework assignment. I would not have switched my major out of CS if I had her earlier

Confusing syllabus, programming assignments are poorly chosen. Lecture is full of confusing and downright terrible analogies. But a very kind and caring teacher who puts immense number of hours on Zoom helping her students. Of course she wouldn't have to if she could teach a little clearer, but she truly does care.

Incredibly disorganized. Syllabus is a mess and the assignments give extremelly unclear instructions. Prof changed the grading policy partway through the term, making due dates more restrictive and adding penalties for late work when previously there were none.

There should be a tag that says "Skip Class? You WILL pass". Listening to Therese Smith makes you actually worse at coding. She has an awful way around speech that will only confuse you. When she explains something not known to the class she pretends it's "too easy for me to talk about" and skips it and gets upset when you ask for explanations.

This class taught me more about how to google than systems. She was not helpful in learning how to code in C or C++, the TA often had to fix the mistakes she made in her starter code. The good news is you can submit homework up until grades are due in bannerweb, and she'll give you infinite attempts to resubmit.

Course is a disorganized mess, all we did was code board games. She grades arbitrarily, takes points off for no reason and doesn't follow her own rubrics. She even bribed kids with recommendation letters to teach her students for her. Pretends to know what the "industry" is like but gives us useless hw like translating c to c++. Such a god complex.

Likely the most disorganized teacher I've ever had. For the amount of work she assigns, you'd think we'd be learning something useful. Lectures consist of her reading the homework problems and explaining nothing; often refuses to actually code. Then again, all of her starter code has had issues, so who knows if she really can code.
Great lectures, lots of energy, lots of good advice etc. Overall good professor. Would sign up again!

Very difficult to learn this online, I ran into several software issues that she and the TA's were not very helpful in solving. Only bright side is she lets you redo any and all work at any point in the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Horrible class! Even though she is knowledgeable of the class material she has no organization whatsoever, very unclear requirements and a homework-heavy class.

Inaccessible especially for an online class. Her responses to emails were completely unhelpful. Assigns tons of homework but teaches us nothing with it. Our school cut our term break already and she gave us so much work we had to use all of break to finish it. Don't take this class if you value your free time and sanity.

I literally received A grade in this course as per the usual criteria (above 90%) which showed on canvas as well after all my assignments were graded. For some reason I received B grade on bannerweb. I wrote many emails to her after this happened for which I didnt receive any reply (which was very frustating at that time).

She did not contribute to my learning. I had systems with her and lecture was her standing at the front of the room reading pages and pages on information. It's really hard to learn when the teacher is not engaging at all. The only grade was HWs (which you can ask the TAs to help you get a 100) and exams (kinda hard but she curves)

Worst or nothing, the only thing i learned is how to take screen shoot in this class. I got 40 points in a homework which does not have any error, and the reason is the sequence of screen is incorrect. Useless class and never take it. Just waste money!

You should absolutely go to office hours! Because her lectures are hard to follow and do not teach you how to code. She is very very nice and labs are easy, but if you dont already have heavy background in coding (especially with pointers) you will get lost on the homework. It is an easy A if you submit things though. Just not good at teaching.

She is a very caring,accessible and patient teacher. It really exemplify how great of a teacher, and how committed to your learning she is that she will stay in her office until every student has left with there questions resolved, even if she has to stay very late. Even though attendance is not mandatory, I strongly recommend you go to the lecture
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Awful class. dull lectures. Every file on canvas is thrown in there under Files. Starter code given is super long and very confusing to understand. 4 weeks in, pretty much 5/6 of the class stop coming to lectures. I regret signing up for this instead of taking Java or Python as a non-CS major.

Homework assignments & quizzes were worded with abysmal grammar that lost their intended meaning, little care was shown regarding how well students do or how much they learn, and lectures were taught with PowerPoint presentations that did not teach anything useful. This class was a joke that could easily be skipped unless it's a quiz day.

Extremely vauge when it comes to directions on homework. Often referred to resources that didn't exist. Inconsistent grading for the same work. Poor lecturer. Never had labs prepared, tas didn't know what the labs wanted either. Only good thing was that it was easy. Don't expect to learn anything.

A worthy successor to Ciaraldi: just as many weird jokes but better at teaching the lecture. Also very responsive to students: willing to push back deadlines when students are struggling. Very knowledgable about C and C++ and can answer any questions.

She is very helpful outside of class. She helps with any homework or general questions you have. She even slept in her office overnight to help students with one homework assignment! I have yet to see a more dedicated professor who cares about students success. Utilize her help and you will succeed.

Smith and Ciaraldi co-taught systems my year. Smith is actually a way better lecturer than him, but that isn't really saying much sadly. Class was very disorganized, labs were revised several times, and homeworks were changed halfway to the due date. Her office hours are EXTREMELY useful. She will basically code everything for you.

Good lectures, and though his handwriting can sometimes be hard to read, it is easy to adapt to. The homework assignments are a lot tougher than the tests, but he is very open to helping you and gives you a lot of time to work on the problems. Use the office hours, they are extremely helpful and insightful.
Volkov is a very kind professor and was great at explaning the Lin Alg concepts to the class. Easy to follow with his soothing voice and homeworks very pretty straight forward

Volkov is charming. Sometimes what he's saying can be unclear, and homework can be tough, but at the end of the day he is willing to sit down with you until you get it. Tests are weighted heavily, but they are on more basic info than the homework.

I thought about whether to post a review for Analysis II compared to the first, but there's such a difference that I have to mention it. Once he gets used to the students for a term and the students get used to his grading style, Volkov shines. He even verbally says that a lot of the problems will be easier than the examples. Take him for MA3832!

Here's the thing: Volkov is a funny professor/good guy who can deliver a good lecture. I'm sure if you took him for a basic calculus class he would be a great professor. The format of class is what made me dislike his class. Homework/exams can be very hard and you don't know how much he'll curve scores until term end. That can make you go crazy.

Darko Volkov is the best professor I've ever had. If you are taking his Analysis course, make sure you like a rigorous approach to math, because that is exactly what you are going to get. Darko will show how the foundations of mathematics are built by proving everything from the basics. Also, he's hilarious in class, and has an amazing accent!

He's so monotone its almost impossible to stay engaged for the whole class. The class is scaled A TON because if it wasn't, over half the students (if not more) would fail - clearly something isn't being explained well. He doesn't answer questions in office hours and instead essentially tells students to "do better". THE most frustrating prof.

Volkov is pretty cool as a person, but a very bad professor for real analysis. No partial credit and a very tough grader means that a significant portion of my class got less than 10 points out of 40 on the midterm. At least 10 kids dropped in the first week, wish I had followed their example.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: super vague in lectures
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took Lebesgue Measure and Integration with Volkov, and although the course content is difficult, Volkov is very accessible outside of class, so if you put in the time and effort, you will be able to ask him questions and do well in the course. Additionally, Volkov as a person incredibly nice and comical, which makes the lectures better!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The midterms and finals were extremely important as they each counted for 35% of one's grade, but he doesn't make them brutal. They honestly seemed a little too easy when you factor in the curve, but that's just me. Definitely see either him or your TAPLA for help when needed, and you'll be fine.

He is an amazing guy - more than just a teacher. He would make jokes in class, as well as teach. Really helpful and answers queries very well. Grading system is very lenient. Gives lots of examples. Has a structured way of teaching the topics.
Calc 4 is hard, but Volkov makes it easy. Very helpful in office hours. I plan on taking him for MA 3831,3832. Great Professor.

I loved his accent! It was very funny how he said certain words but his jokes in class and light mood helped make calculus III more enjoyable. His lectures are okay but he's most helpful outside of class. I found he explains the material better in his office. Exams are fair and slightly challenging and homework is easy. He curves your grades.
Office hours are really helpful. Very clearly explained. Easy to fall asleep in class but KEEP AWAKE!! Notes are really helpful. Easy quiz and exams if you know what he is talking about in class.
