But you can ace the tests and still get a C. Graded attendance. Homework can kill your grade. She cares about her students. Go to her office hours with your project.
Learned a lot from her class. Taught me to enjoy learning more about the subject. Really cares about all of her students.

Before each class you can watch a micro lecture (5-20 mins long) or do some reading prior to completing a warm up due an hour before class. Then during class there's a team quiz everyday for 15% of your grade. Really great class if you enjoy collab. 3 Exams worth 50 % of grade, though. Overall, very excellent teacher.Won an award from obama in '11.
Made materials science so interesting. Study hard and you will learn a lot from her classes.

Gives a lot of work outside of class. You are expected to have learned material and taken online quizzes on it, before you go to the class for that section. Made material science a lot more work than it had to be.

If you have plenty of time take this class, the material is not hard, you just have to keep up and be devoted to working everyday, if you do all the work and try to understand its not too difficult, the structure is quite interesting and can be helpful if you make the most of it, i heard shivkumar is easier to take for matsci
You MUST go to class to get a good grade and there is a lot of work outside of class. She is a very good teacher and will help you anyway she can if you ask.
Very helpful, understanding and informative. She is very organized and gives you all the necessary resources to learn the material.
Excellent Professor. Devoted to class and students. Attendance and homework are very important.  Tests are very fair. Very well organized class. Highly recommend.

Not a favorite, tons of work to do, lectures are all recorded ahead of time and have to be gone through on your own time, there are then individual quizzes on them and then again with your team, lots of chances for grades but somehow little errors add up over time.

Amazing teacher. She uses a lot of examples and breaks things down so you understand materials. Gives a lot of homework but it is do able and helps with the tests. She is very helpful if you see her for office hours as well.
Great Teacher. Very Nice Person. Slides on projector make material very easy to grasp.

She is a very good teacher. She assigns a lot of small tasks, but she does an amazing job teaching the information. It is the first time lectures were very helpful to me with the activities she incorporated.

She's one of the best teachers I've encountered at WPI. She reciprocates every ounce of effort students put into studying and assignments. Her lectures are extremely well planned and are incredibly  useful, she works through plenty of examples, and takes the time so you thoroughly understand the concepts. You'll work hard, but she'll match it.
Very well taught for such a hard course.
Excellent Teacher. Wants students to learn and always willing to help.

Very structured and challenging, but also very helpful and willing. Plenty of difficult homework and tests and expects you to follow a certain format. As a person she's nice. She's right, if you succeed in this class it will feel very rewarding.
Seriously, do your work in this class. demetry is a professor that believes in ethics & working hard.  If you do things consistently, all term, you will succeed.

Demetry is on a major power trip when advising IQPs and is VERY closed minded.  She also makes the other advisors see things her way and their opinions seem to not mean anything.  IQP with her was probably the worst experience of my life.
No Comments

Professor Chrys was very nice, but the amount of work that she brutally dished out was way too overloaded.  The tests did not deviate much from the practice exams.  She was very flexible with the course and used technology to the fullest.  If you want an easy A you probably shouldn't take her class.
She learns everyone's names which is really nice ina class of 96 kids.  She's very concerned with how the students are understanding the material as well.  Easy course.  Good professor.

She loves her job,gets in at like 6am and pretty much never leaves.I learned a lot in her class but she is definiltey a tough grader.She tries to be fair, but is sometimes a little biased.  Overall, I liked her but sometimes she tests my patience.

Chrys works harder on this matierial science course than any of her students. Trust me, she is obsessed with this course in a good way. This does not mean that you have to love it too. Everyone has to work a bit hard to get a good grade.

Nice teacher, takes the time to get to know students names, does on confrence sections, confrence sections helpful for homework, tests can be a little tricky, needs better study aids, overal recommend.

She has a major power trip and wants things to be done (written) exactly as she would have done them, regardless of whether or not your way might come out well.  Very closed minded in projects.  Very dominant and I think tends to sway other advisor.
She's hard but she makes you learn a lot.

Worst. Advisor. Ever. Contradicted the other advisor, didn't give helpful feedback, assumed a lot, and expected way too much out of everyone on the trip. Plus, she seemed to actively dislike everyone invloved.
No Comments

There is not enough that I can put into words how amazing Professor Matos is! From no homework, to telling the class what exactly will be on the tests, amazing feedback, shared stories, films, and experiences that relate to the content, she is one of the best, most caring and understanding professors I've ever had! I miss taking classes with her.

They are such an amazing professor. I had them for all four terms of my freshman year and going to their 9:00am class was the highlight of my day. They are extremely caring and considerate of the students because they want to see you succeed and is willing to help you as long as you put in the effort to try because learning is from making mistakes.
If you can, try to take every class you can with Ingrid. She is the easiest professor here at WPI and so understanding about everything including things outside the classroom.

She is a super sweet and funny professor, by far one of the best I've had here so far. She does her best in trying to avoid lots of homework and even tries to let class get out early everyday. I will definitely be having her for future Spanish classes
She's amazing! You have to show up to class everyday and she makes everyone participate (she will call on you if you don't), but the class is an easy A if you show up you will pass.

Professor Matos-Nin is the nicest and most caring professor I've had at WPI. She is very passionate about what she teaches and cares very much about her students. The content may not be as difficult as it is in other Spanish courses, but you learn just as much because she often gives interesting Latin American history lessons. 10/10
Professor Matos-Nin is a super nice person. The class is super easy and she always gives interesting facts from her experiences.

Worst teacher ever. Is very disrespectful and has no concern for others. I will never take a class with her again and have specifically changed my schedule in order to do so. She doesn't teach you anything and has made me hate Spanish
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Ingrid is an amazing person - she is funny and gives little fun pieces of random information. class is not hard - you have worksheets and quizzes every so often and she LITERALLY tells you EXACTLY what is on the test before hand. in the long run though her teaching method might not be great for memorization, but tbh i'm just here for the credit

AWESOME!! Sh'e truly passionate about spanish and she's so learned on the history and the culture of the language. She's  very helpful and accommodating. Her tests are super easy and she basically tells you what's on it before. Awesome professor!! Get her whenever you can! I didn't have her for one term and I almost died!
Had her for Int. Spanish 2. She's good, pretty easy if you do the work and have a strong foundation in spanish. If you fail this class there is a problem. She's funny too!!!
one of the best spanish teachers I have ever had, will help you through even if you dont want to go

I practiced more grammar and read more than with the other two professors I had before. Not only a great professor but always there if you need her. Knows a lot about history of the language as well as history of Latin America. She is a learned person and has a wonderful personality. Lots of work so be prepared to learn.

ok.  she is funny, i will give you that.  but if i wanted a comdey hour for $200/hour, it wouldn't be her.  what did we learn, not sure.  always let us out early.  she must have a bladder problem because we never went the whole 50 minutes!

Nice lady but she does not teach.  Attendance is mandatory but she does nothing in class.  not one full 50 minute class all quarter.  35 minutes and then she would let us go. she tells you exactly whats going to be on the tests including the verbs tenses,  but youhave to learn them yourself, she doesnt go over grammar...or really anything at all.
love her
Engaging class. She makes you think while teaching the language... Funny and knows a lot of history and culture.
One of the finest professors WPI has to offer. You can perceive immediately that she loves to teach and cares for her students.
she is awesome!  she's so enthusiastic, and she allows resubmittal of papers.  she's very knowledgeable about history and culture too.

She's a great lady. She funny and engaging and she cares about her students. She also seems to be more interested in the class than in being picky about grades, which is nice. She's a good teacher to have.
Easy class but not a whole lot of in class teaching the whole class is derived directly from book examples. Great prof and really fun class, definitely would recommend.
This lady is awesome.  Probably the best Professora in the whole department.
Hilarious
I never thought learning was going to be so much fun

rearranged my schedule to make sure I had her for 2522 and 3521. Awesome professor. Easy classes and really cares about her students. Always ended up having a 10 minute conversation with her when I saw her around campus. Great person.
Helps a lot. Hilarious. You'll really learn.
Great teacher. Makes you learn. Cares about her students. Very funny!
great professor...she is hilarious
No Comments
She's an awesome teacher...I don't think I've ever had a better one

Great professor. The course material was very difficult, but the lectures were informative and office hours were always helpful. One thing to understand about Dr. Dougherty is that he approaches his subjects math heavy. My one complaint is that he dedicated too much time at the beginning of class for questions about the previous class's material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: His score here confounds me. Purposefully omits content so he can ask you it on homeworks and exams despite never covering it. Refuses to give solutions to anything, so you cant even study. Ghosted me after I asked for help. Never set up office hours beyond "ask in class." Assumes its as easy for students as it is for him. Not hard, just cant teach
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dougherty varies between being a dry lecturer and showing you really cool things about the theory of computer science. The homework is very interesting but also quite hard. Fortunately he is very accessible outside of class and is willing to provide hints when needed. His tests are tricky but very fair.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: It's clear he is very knowledgeable about the material and usually manages to communicate well to class. You basically need to go to lecture every day to understand the material, it's dense stuff. Very approachable and happy to explain material outside of class. Homework optional and not for credit, but you basically need to do it to pass tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He knows the material. But it seemed like he had never taught this class before. He was creating his own textbook, which he referred to as "Notes" on the fly. In class he would always say "refer to the notes." Since he created it on the fly, it had many errors.  You don't do well if don't read the "Notes." You need to understand "Notes" to do well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: For someone who's interested in the material, he teaches the class well. While his lectures may appear to be disorganized, you'll be at a loss if you miss even one. Also, tests made up 100% of the final grade for the class -- they are difficult, but very doable if you attempt every homework problem. Any less, and you'll flounder.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: His lectures are not an indicative of his expectations in exams, he fails to convey objectives in a clear fashion and instead going to his lectures is a waste as the exam depends of book lectures and homework assigned in his page.

He is really helpful if you go to him for help. You can prepare the test very well if you could do every homework problem. If you keep focus on his lecture actually don't need to read textbook so much, but it's still useful. Take with him!

Nice guy, but has a fondness for overly wordy books.  The book for this class is different from the 2223 book and is nigh impossible to read.  It was written in the sort of careless manner that leaves the inexperienced reader (heshe who is not well versed in advanced math or theoretical CS) lost in the details.

I am shocked at how consistently unprepared this professor is for class.  His explanations show no knowledge of the material, and his exam questions and projects show even less.  I get multiple emails a day from the professor correcting yet another typo or error in grading a student pointed out.  Everything I've learned has been from the textbook.

Prof. Dougherty was one of my favorite professors.  Quizzes were fair and "easy" if you did the requisite studying.  That's not to say anything was actually easy, you have to work hard for a good grade but you won't encounter any trick questions or unknown material. Class lectures were as fun as could be expected from the dry source material.
Dougherty is the best professor at WPI and probably one of the best theoretical CS professors. He is the man!

He is an EXCELLENT professor!  The work is hard, and there is a lot of it, but if you put enough time into it you will do well.  He's helpful and fair.  I do advise that if you take this class and work full time, DON'T take on a second one.  It will be rough.
He's a really nice guy, but has a weird way of grading. He's a great professor though, so he makes up for any other shortfalls.
Awesome professor. he was the first professor in my first semester. He made me interested in boring subject like cs502. Really awesome.
He is a great professor. Will make things easy for you. Each class is very interesting A++
He is really nice to me and he is the best!!!
Great prof, cares about students.  Keeps algorithms interesting.  Another awesome WPI prof.
he is a hunk gorrila and he is very nice.
I've had Prof. Dougherty twice since I arrived at WPI.  If the rest of the CS department had half his teaching ability I'd be a CS major.
Easily the best professor I've had at WPI. Puts in a lot of effort to make an otherwise boring subject somewhat interesting and really cares about the students.
Great teacher. Made class interesting. Exams are based on sample questions available prior to the exam. Algorithms is the most challenging 2000 level CS class I've taken.
Sexy algorithms
No Comments
Clear and concise.  Cares about students. Along with Ciaraldi, prob best CS prof
First term at WPI.  Great guy.  Very fair.  Great Class!
Really good prof. Makes algorithms interesting.
Really intresting class
Damn decent for a CS prof.

This is for AE 5031. First day of class he said "dont ask me questions about the course material bc its in the notes and I dont know abt it". All he did was read off slides and they were impossible to read. Half of the homeworks were not graded and I entered and exited the course with the same understanding of the subject. Waste of tuition money.

literally one of the worst, lectures are super long and derivation heavy and irrelevant to homework/exams. expects you to sift through 80 pages a week of lectures. grader is tough, doesnt give partial credit. professor also literally just ghosts the entire class, he got rid of an exam and has ignored all student contact about new grade distribution

honestly one of the worst professors ive had, lectures are derivation heavy and lecture organization is confusing. Im in the online version and he expects you to sort through at LEAST 80 pages of notes a week. Is rude when you ask for help or clarification, and is a blurs the lines for students with accommodations
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He told me on the first day of class that he won't help me outside of class. Not helpful and puts as little effort as possible ( or so it seems) into creating a class. Uses the same notes year in and year out, and doesn't seem interested in the students at all. Horrible handwriting and his notes are difficult to follow.

Lectures were heavy on derivations over practical examples, and his handwriting is hard to decipher. He has a contagious energy for the topic though, and you can figure out most everything from the super-extensive formula sheet he posts. Take-home tests were straightforwards, though homework was graded harshly with little relevant feedback.

Gatsonis gives a lot of lecture notes but does not do enough examples. The homework is hard for the wrong reasons and the TAs' usually are terrible. However, he keeps his word when he says the test will be straightforward and well thought out so you're not thinking yourself in circles the entire time. He is helpful during office hours.
He's an excellent professor only if you ASK QUESTION. He knows all the material by heart and is willing to explain in detail with you.
Very inspirational and appreciates all forms of math and science from simple linear algebra to vector calculus. Would take again.

Gastonis has sloppy handwriting and his lectures were verbatim from a textbook. CFD could have been a great class, but it was a lot of Numerical Methods and really not much Fluid Dynamics. Good news is it's 100 % homework, but be prepared to spend 20 hours per week on it. Make some friends in the class so you can bounch ideas off each other

Gatsonis is an incredible scientist. The man may be difficult to follow at times but if you want to learn from the best you take his class like a man. His course hands down change my view of engineering all around.

Terrible Professor ! You send him and email asking for help and he does not respond at all. You ask him for help after class and he says you should know how to do this or this is easy. Runs through the material and does not care about anything but his research. This professor is the worst I've ever had !
He is by far the best professor I have had. He keeps a class interesting and interested. He will gladly provide more details, and wants his students to excel.
Going to class will not help you for tests, and homework will not either.  Hope you have jun as a TA

Had gatsonis for 2713. He knows how to teach that course well.ME 3602: Gatsonis does not take the course seriously. All concept, refusal to post HW solutions, refusal to meet after class. Gatsonis is a good, smart man who has serious issues as a professor. He believes his methods, and his exams fully dont think of mentioning anything being unfair.

I'm not sure how to rate Gatsonis. ME 3602 was pretty awful, but ME 2713 was amazing. I think it was due to organization. ME 3602 was really poorly organized, while ME 2713 was _always_ organized into very clear 2-column notes. Highly rec'd for 2713. Definitely not for 3602.

This professor would not be a bad professor if it weren't for a few bad traits. 1) His handwriting is completely illegible 2) he skips over key points in examples and expects you to 'fill in' the missing points yourself 3) his tests are unpredictable 4) He will not help you out if you do not understand. Overall, he is smart but a bad teacher.

Not a bad professor at all.  He goes pretty fast but this course had a ton of material to cover.  Be prepared to spend a ton of time on the homework though because you need to know the material like the back of your hand to finish the tests.  Tests take over 50 minutes even if you make NO mistakes and never stop to think.

Great professor for smart students.  If you struggle with the material, this class can seem very daunting and he is not very helpful.  But for students who are eager to learn and fairly good at math and fluids, his clarity and explanations are rivaled by no other.

I know he has some pretty low ratings, but I really liked him.  I think he does an great job explaining concepts.  He goes pretty quickly but if you pay attention and go to class, you will learn a lot and the course is easy.

Rips through material and expects you to have an endless reference guide built into your head.  Test are tough and you'll never be able to guess what will be on them.  Only does examples that are already in the book.  Might as well stay at home and read...don't forget to do the HW, it;s generally a big chunk of your grade!

If you like going to class just to be more confused, there is no better teacher than this guy. He does not care about the student and he doesn't mind giving tests that are unreasonably to long for the class period.  He sucks, switch professors at all costs.

Bring a pillow for your pillow, because your pillow is going to get bored by his lectures.  His final was an unsteady-state problem, which was bad because it was the only one we ever did in the whole class.  God, what a toolshed he is.
Had this professor for MQP.  He wasn't too bad, but he took a very hands off approach to the project.  Would peek his head in every now and then, but other than that stayed locked up in his office.

His time is far more valuable than your time. Hes never on time to lectures and always ends them late. Dont even think about trying to get a hold of him for help. Pray you have a good TA. Lectures are typically useless rambles based around his MIT days.
Good guy.  Try's to joke around but it gets lost in the greek accent.  Tells you about tests the day before.  teaches a lot of theory and tests easy applications.  Not too bad overall
Take a shower and change your clothes...and then prepare an actual lesson for class...i learned nothing from him...read the book if you have to take a class with him...
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

This is probably the most disorganized and confusing class that I have taken here, not so much in terms of the material as figuring out course logistics such as how many and what assignments there are, how the final grade will be calculated, etc. The schedule is improvised, almost as if he did not know he would be teaching a class this term.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The grading is very harsh, his project seems straightforward and then he throws out some extra requirements. Basically roasts people when they ask questions so over time people are afraid to ask questions.
harsh grader about small things

Pollice is one of my favorite professors. The catch is: you have to be really engaged with the course (I usually am so this wasn't a problem for me) He genuinely cares about you learning, gives great advice, and knows how to teach online. Yeah, he can be a little abrasive, but if you can grit your teeth a little, he's an open book of great info.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I dont know why such a waste course even exists. In most time you dont know what he's doing. Will learn nothing in this course. Totally waste of life.

Doesn't like being questioned or asked for a small change. When I came to online office hours once (it was an online class), the experience was so poor and he seemed so harsh that I never again tried to contact him. He also doesn't have much of a sense of humor (I sometimes enjoy putting a small joke or gag in my homework, usually they're enjoyed).

There're usually many ways to approach things but he has only one way in his mind and he DOES NOT accept anything else. He's extremely stubborn and a little cranky that he cannot stand students who question him. His assignments instructions are very unclear. Of course you can ask him but it is annoying when you have to ask to clarify everything.

For our course, we used something called Cucumber, which I think we could have done without. The main project of the term (a new game outlined by him) was difficult in the sense that there were too many small details that we needed to pay attention to. He would keep changing his mind on them as well. Overall, not bad, but could have been better.

Very tough grader. A small mistake in the homework makes a difference from 100 to 50. The organization of the class is very poor and grading rubric for some homework is unclear.  However, it is pretty easy to get an A.
Excellent professor. Gives really good advice.
learn a lot from projects

Easily the most real-world, get-it-done project oriented professor in the department.  Heavy emphasis on testing strategies and design.  Take his courses and you WILL learn and love TDD, design patterns, compiler design and programming language semantics, and software engineering tools!!

Great professor but very strict. Small mistakes can be the difference between a 100 and a 50. Has a great sense of humor and shows it through his stories of his work experience. Used UML at work all summer but didnt know it well enough to get above a 60% on his design quizzes. Beware.

Gary Pollice is the man. He's a really smart, is a very good professor, and also has quite a bit of wisdom, something I've found is lacking from a lot of the other professors. Take classes with this guy - you will be given an assignment and you will question it, but he has a purpose for everything. Nothing in his class is half-assed.

Great software engineering professor. Professor Pollice has obviously put a LOT of thought into the way he teaches the course, and really does a great job. Don't expect to have any free time when you're taking CS3733 with him, though!
doesn't seem to know anything and expects you to figure out all! sometimes irresponsible - not a hard one, though

Hope you like Eclipse. Because he sure does. As long as you love Eclipse, Macs, and teachers hocking textbooks they helped with, the self-appointed "code curmudgeon" (that's not a cool thing to be, prof) will be fine for you. Otherwise drop it.

Awesome Professor - the guy is extremely knowledgeable and knows how to delegate that information to his students. Project was difficult, but he adjusted his grading accordingly. Class was worth going to. Grade reflected how much work was put into class. HIGHLY recommend taking a class with Professor Pollice.
awesome professor, awesome guy
very helpful - was online a lot and encouraged us to IM him

Explains the material very clearly during lectures, gives helpful homework assignments and quizzes. Term project seemed impossible at first, but we ended up learning a lot and doing a great job. Going to class was a real joy. Prof. Pollice is awesome.
great professor, extremely helpful and personable. he's not so far out there in academia that he's no longer relevant, which is great.

He is a professor of practice and clearly aware that there is a world outside of academia.  There was a running joke in our class that he's worked for every software company ever to have existed.  Very clear teacher, he made the class fun and challenging.
This guy rocks! Very knowledgeable and experienced and really enthusiastic about the course. Definitely one of the top profs in the CS department. I mean, how many prof's encourage you to IM them?!
Experienced. Patient. Practical. Open-note exams, extra credit, flexible grading policy. A professor with enough wisdom to know a world exists outside the classroom.

Very knowledgable guy. Has a lot of experience in the realm of Software Engineering. I'm not sure if it was the course material, but the content was rather fluffy- it's hard to get concrete knowledge about SE that doesn't sound like bull.

Very odd course; the major project came together at the end for our group, but i'm not sure it did for others, and it wasn't really their fault. this was his first time teaching the course though so it may be very different after this.
No Comments

Professor Kinicki is the holy terror. The passing grade on the midterm was under 30%, and twenty% of the class still failed it. His tests are specifically designed to make people lose points whether or not they knew the material. He asks for the output of things like (2+3  *  5) and the results of triply-nested loops. Avoid like the plague.
Tough but fair, awesome professor

Kinicki is actually not a bad teacher. Systems course just happens to be a bad with too much info in one quarter. Tests are  really not bad at all if you prepare, and the programming assignments are fair. Be sure to say something at once if you have problems in a group. My partner dropped the second to last day, and I had to write all of program 5.

If you're new to CC++ I was, you'll need to be ready to dump a lot of time in the class, particularly later in the term.  5 Program assignments, 2 Exams, with the last 2 programs being done with a partner.  Lectures move fast and all Powerpoints are written in Comic Sans
I would better die than have to take a class with him again.

Difficult Teacher, brags about NRing half his class. Makes you learn the material yourself. Tests are hard, and homework is difficult, program 5 was hellatious. I have never been so proud to pass a course. Avoid him if possible.

Tests are hard but not bad if you read the powerpoint notes before the test. Homework takes a large amount of time and the wording is convoluted but the assignments aren't too hard. Labs are easy and very helpful for the homework assignments.  Overall take if you like CS and are willing to spend a majority of time for this course.

Without a doubt one of the worst professors I've ever had and supposedly one of the worst professors at WPI. His presentations are useless (and in comic sans), his programming assignments fail to teach the concepts well, and the midterm was impossibly difficult. The average midterm grade was under 50%, and a significant portion of the class failed.
No commments!
Avoid

The worst professor I have had at WPI so far. He gives very hard homework and tests. His lectures in messy power-points are not helpful at all and you have to read the book a lot if you want to pass. He makes the class as hard as you get stuck and don't learn much. Doesn't respect students and encourages them to drop out. Avoid as the plague.
Didn't seem to respect students and is far from being gentle in his language and actions.
poor lecture, hard exam, bad teacher

he is one of the worst professors had him for id2050 and iqp and he was not helpful went away with his wife for 2 weeks and did not care how much work was put into the project. he was not helpful at all and more of a nucense to us and to the school.

This course is not easy. There's a lot of homework. However it is helpful because it give us the oportunity to coding, and writing reports. Professor is very nice and helpful. But it is not easy to get a A.
worst professor, he only think put his class in the difficult level, and happy with become a rough bad teacher. just dont take his class....

HE GIVE YOUR MANY HOMEWORK TO DO BUT NO OTHER INFORMATION TO HELP YOU. IF YOUR HAVE BACKGROUD OF THIS COURSE, IT IS OK. HOWEVER, IF YOU ARE NEW LEARNER, YOU ARE IN THE HELL. AND ONLY ADVISE HE CAN GIVE YOU WHEN YOU CANNOT FINISH THR PROGRAM IS YOUR PROGRAM IS WEAK, YOU SHOULD DROP MY CLASS!!!...AND EXAM IS CLOSE BOOK, AND REALLY HARD.

Gives horrendous tests. Doesn't respond to emails after the final, weights final way too heavy.  Projects are LONG and HARD, yet don't pull on your grade enough; your midterm and final grade are it.  Sick of this guy.

great teacher,  only need to come on midterm and on final (not even to labs)  he gives alot of work but his tests are really easy   he takes alot of time in class going over methods step by step which is very tiresome    the textbook is just there for reference, it is not needed  he is very helpful outside of class if u take the time to go to him

Gives challenging assignments and tests.  Assignments require a very large time commitment and considerable thought.  Gives hints to the material on tests which are true.  I suggest taking this course with him if and only if you are willing to be 100% devoted to it.  If you are you will get a lot out of it.

Worst teacher I have ever had.  Lectures are incomprehensible (he insists on using PowerPoints that are an utter mess.)  His assignments are impossibly hard and not productive at all, he insists on directing all questions to the TAs, who are also not helpful.  His tests are also completely un-passable, and he seems to enjoy being a bad teacher.

Insanely difficult class, but fun to stumble through.  While i did not do well in it gradewise, i learned a whole ton about networks.  His tests are insanely hard.  Study everything and you might get a 50.
Tries to pack a lot of content in his classes (a little too much).  Doesn't know what's going on with the projects he assigns, points you to the TAs.  Not bad, but not great either.

Probably one of the most difficult professors at WPI, but makes things at least interesting. Pretty funny guy - makes humorous analogies which help you remember topics. ("Attenuation" is when the signal just poops out.)
I have him for an advisor, and he is never on campus to help with course selection etc. Doen't like to reply to emails ether. But once you get a hold of him, he is a helpfull guy.
Tries to make you work.  Very knowledgeable
No Comments
Mostly looks at the floor when he talks. Not very animated or engaging.

Gives good lectures and good feedback on tests. The homework can be difficult, but he gives multiple attempts, and his lectures sometimes go on tangents, but usually are pretty consistent and informative.

Professor Qi is by far the best physicist I had. He is very helping (available and helpful at office hours and fast responding emails). Open to remarks and notices and happy to consider regrading tests. Made lectures fun and comprehensive. As long as you pay attention and put work into his class you will get an easy A.
Very caring and treats students with a lot of respect
Great guy.
This guy's a stud.

His lectures were pretty good and you can tell that he is passionate abt physics and teaching. His exams were a bit tricky, and whenever I went to office hours for help he made fun of students a bit for not understanding.

I did not enjoy this course with Professor Wen. Most of the lectures were not very helpful, as they did not correlate with the assigned homework. Furthermore, the concepts were not explained thoroughly in lecture (or discussion), meaning that students had to learn most of the content via pearson (which was true of the entire course).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Qi Wen's class was not hard at all, he is great at explaining concepts and didn't hesitate to give extra credit. The tests are not hard if you go over the practice tests.
He wants his students to succeed, often has extra credit. The homework assignments were long and difficult  but the exams were easier than the homework.

Personally, he is a pretty good professor and you can tell he is pretty passionate about physics. He gives a lot of visual rep of concepts, grading is lenient, lets you retake tests, and gives pre-lecture quizzes which are very helpful since the lectures are a bit heavy. He's also very accessible outside the class and sometimes funny.

Good professor, wants you to succeed and does his best to make it in your favor, a bit quiet in lecture but otherwise great at explaining and good to follow. Has many office hours that are very helpful, willing to sacrifice his Friday nights for last minute homework office hours. Tests were decent, lots of partial credit.

Prof. Wen does a good job explaining concepts so you don't have to read the textbook much outside of class. Also he lets you do quiz corrections to get up to 90% of the points back which is helpful. E&M is a challenging course, but he really took alot of stress out of it for me.
Lectures get more complicated than what he tests on, he cares alot about the subject material and wants you to understand it, has lots of energy some days.
Qi Wen is a very good professor.

Qi Wen is a really nice guy, but the majority of the class is lectures that seem to drag on forever because he rarely shows demonstrations or simulations or anything to make them interesting. Also, the majority of his lectures are him deriving formulas that he gives on the test anyways, so not very helpful. He also doesn't tell the PLAs what to do.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great Professor, very caring and approachable, you won't regret taking his class.
Never graded on time and was pretty rude during office hours. Knew his stuff but was agitated when asked questions.
He's great
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Prof. Wen made PH1121 seem doable and entertaining, which is impressive. He was often accessible after classes, or whenever you have to make appointments. The homework is difficult, but if you use the textbook, the formulas are in there. Just be sure to show up to class to get that A or B. Also, 75-89% is a B.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Qi was amazing. He was my conference instructor, and was probably the only thing that got me through the class. He was always willing to help and would explain anything in as many ways as you needed in order to understand, yet never seemed impatient or annoyed. He is able to explain better during office hours so definitely go to them!
Don't take 1111/1121. Just don't do it. It's super not worth it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Not a very good lecturer, however very helpful in and out of class. Curves everything  generously (else 60% of the class would fail). Don't take PH1121 unless you're a physics major. Homeworks are absolutely insane. Lab reports are long. Tests are incredibly difficult (60 average) even with an easy grader. Save your soul. Do not take this class.

Amazing teacher, nice grading, amazing curve to help everyone out but in an incredibly hard class. Really thing a million ts before taking the calc based ph seq. The hard part about this class are the absurdly hard HW, confusing lab reports due that take hours and hours a week, stressing you out, tiring, unhealthy. Challenge yourself somewhere else

His accent makes him hard to understand but if you listen to him really hard you are fine. He makes lots of mistakes during lecture. He always forgets to post notes on his website. Exams are a little difficult.
Really good. Tests similar to homework, makes Physics easy to understand

If you have to take PH 1120 take it with him. He is EXTREMELY clear and helpful. Will explain something all day in order to get the point across if he needs to. Grades fairly. Very nice, very helpful. Awesome prof for a normally crappy class

He is the best Physics teacher I have always had. He explains extremely well, goes over many examples in a detailed and clear way, is very helpful to everyone, and makes tests very fair (just asking for what he actually taught, which is what every teacher should do). If you want to take any Physics and he is available, definitely choose him!
This guy is a stud, makes physics actually understandable
very helpful gave lots of help, a little hard to understand, but explained a lot.
Tests are exactly like the quizzes and homework.
It's clear that he cares a lot about teaching. His style of lecturing is great at keeping you awake without being over the top too.
A very good teacher. A intelligent person.
This professor is fine to learn with in class, but his intelligence has clearly gotten the better of him. He should be careful not to make students feel stupid or unworthy of being at the school.

He's a pretty entertaining teacher, and I felt like he had the class pretty well under control for the first time it had been offered. Tests were open book/note. Only thing to be wary of were that the TAs sometimes gave you false information.
Go to class, or watch it later on mywpi.  He can explain complex topic very well, and helps students really understand the material.

Fantastic teacher! Gives tons of in-class demos of the concepts, the tests mirror the homework nearly perfectly, and he gives chances to make up credit and get help. Even the labs are well explained so you never feel lost.
He has very strong background about ECE and this course

This course was taught very well. However I feel cheated that I didn't get an A in the course when it was beyond obvious that I knew all of the material easily. There were just simple patterns that I failed to see in the Karnaugh maps. Disappointing, however he's a great teacher.
Very good at presenting the material.  He provides lots of real-world examples and applications.  Awsome lab grading policy as well.
He's a really good teacher. He's thorough and I'm glad that I took Intro to Digital Circuits with him. Very smart guy, messes up sometimes but the mistakes are very minor.

Best I've had at WPI. His lectures were awesome and his homework was great prep for the exams. Lots of opportunities for makeup if you get a bit behind. Funny guy as well, he shocked himself in class numerous times (I doubt it was for our amusement).
TAKE ANY AND ALL CLASSES YOU CAN WITH THIS MAN...HE IS UNBELIVABLE...WILL MAKE ANYONE WANT TO BE AN ECE MAJOR....HE KNOWS HIS STUFF...HE COULD TEACH ECE TO ANY MONKEY
very good professor and very good system of teaching. he knows his stuff and he is a good guy. seems goofy but you will learn a lot and get a good grade. just dont skip lectures
great teacher, interesting and goofy. he does a lot of demos and all his tests are open book and open notebook. goos guy

Really funny guy, and you learn a lot!  Probably the best professor I've had here.  Lectures are very entertaining, and the demos are interesting.  He made the entire class crack up several times.  Tests are easy, but grading is nasty because there's no partial credit.
His classes are fun!
The best professor...He is GOD..he knows everything!!
Teaches from his heart. Homeworks helped and he told us how to do them well. Tests were a fair measure of material covered in class. Certainly one of the best professors I've ever had.
Very concerned about the students. Actually went back to a topic and reviewed it because the test average was too low. This guy got me into the field of EE.
Doesnt respond promptly to emails if at all
Testing is a bit unfair... very little partial credit offered. Teaching very good.
Great teacher! knows how to teach and have fun at the same time.  The demos were cool!  Made learning fun and interesting.
He has a very unique way of teaching and gives a demo at the end of every class.
he actually cares if you do well and goes out of his way to help you
Outstanding professor
good teacher, great demos
The funniest professor I've ever had, and he explains concepts well
Great proffessor!
Great guy, he loves what he does
I had Prof. Buckholt for BB2915, BB2917, and BB294X. He's a great, funny guy who's always willing to help while also making sure you're doing things autonomously/without too much supervision.

Buckholt is a great professor who makes Environmental Bio very fun despite it being a class filled mostly with non-Bio majors. The topics covered are interesting and he always puts fun easter eggs like the birds at the beginning of his slides, and the homework is very light but also fun to complete to take your mind off other stressful classes.

Amazing down to earth professor who you can tell is very passionate about what he does. Encourages students to experiment/try various techniques. Dirth Lab is definitely a class where you get out what you put into it. I speak from experience: I fell into a bog collecting a soil sample (he did warn me). Highly recommend every BBT take this course!

He's not a grading person. He wants us to learn and discuss environmental issues and make us think. The class itself is pretty easy and all you have to do is show up and participate in group discussion. In a regular class, there is not a lot of work. But with online, a lot of in-class stuff turned to individual homework which became busy work.

He is one of the worst profs ever. I am taking this class online due to the pandemic, and he does not even try to be useful. You have to do about 6 assignments per week only for this class. The case studies are horrible, impossible to understand, and he keeps making you try to do artistic work and jump in different unfamiliar websites.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Soil lab with Mike was a great experience and would reccommend to everyone, especially if you have an interest in microbiology. We did original research for a national initiative and got to design our own experiments too! Mike is always willing to help and encourages everybody's interest to "go do science!" Workload is very manageable as well.

Grading is based on online quizzes, in class quizzes, and clicker participation. He is a funny guy and gives decent lecture. He assigns reading every week for online quizzes and gives relatively easy homework.

Throws rubber crayfish at you for bonus points when you answer a question. Drops lowest grade for every type of assignment. 5 min hw assignment every week. In class quizes and online quizes. clicker questions.

Wonderful!! He gives a lot of easy work some of which you can drop the lowest grade. This way you are learning and not cramming to hard for tests. Hes also hysterical and lectures are fun. Highly recommended
Mike is a quirky guy, but a fun professor. He is very clear about course objectives and his quizzes are so easy! Also, he gives a bonus point for every question you answer in class.

Class is very biased to the students who procrastinate, or have labs later on in the week. Having a Tuesday lab and a Monday Lecture was terrible. He only went over how to do the lab report the day before, and put up the pre-lab quiz a few hours before it was due for the Tuesday section, but the later sections had days to complete it.
This guy IS the Brawny paper towels man! (and not a bad professor either)
Interesting Classes... Helpful and understanding if you miss a lab or getting extensions for valid reasons.  Quizzes aren't too hard.  I wish he taught bio classes, not just labs.  Very nice...
He's a good guy.  Strives to help students succeed.  Quizzes are never very hard.
Very helpful and clear, and forgiving of mistakes. He is one of the more laidback teachers at WPI and he likes to try to make class interesting. Good teacher all around.

Really good teacher.  Very helpful in the labs.  Gave awesome hints to pre-lab or post-lab questions, and the quizzes were nice and simple assuming you did all your work during the lab and payed moderate attention in class.

Really good teacher.  Very helpful in the labs.  Gave awesome hints to pre-lab or post-lab questions, and the quizzes were nice and simple assuming you did all your work during the lab and payed moderate attention in class.
A very good teacher. Always remembers that we are students not yet specialist in this field. Makes it fun interesting and most of all highly relavant.
Mike is an awesome professor - too bad he only teaches labs. He is extremely helpful, great at explaining things, and very down to earth. If you have to take labs, you want to take them from Mike.
Genuinely nice guy. Your grade is based on six lab reports, six prelabs, and 3 quizzes(fairly easy).Labs are usually not bad, and you do end up learning a lot.
Very pleasant and generally nice guy. The lecture portions are clear, and his quizzes are fair. Def learned a lot in his classes :)
Great lab instructor. Answers every question. Extremely helpful and kind. TAKE HIS CLASSES.
No Comments
I LOVE MIKIE!!!!!
He is awesome if you have him as the TA for your section in experimental bio-just an all around cool guy
his labs are helpful if you take modules later
The true Starr of the show at WPI. I have never met someone more professional and inspiring.

Professor Starr changed my life. I entered his class knowing nothing but with a left a job at NASA. professor Starr helped me explore my educationand space. I would say hes been the star of WPI career <3
he wouldn't let me into the class but everyone else seemed to have fun!!
Amazing professor! Clear with what he taught, respectful, and made the class fun. He also makes great videos as a teacher, astronaut, doctor, you name it!
Professor Starr is the best professor I've had at this school. He is a great person and wicked smaht.
Professor Starr is the best!
He made sure I got through the class and my mental health was kept in tact.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: best professor at the school
Best Prof
Professor Robbie Starr saved my life and lent me one of his lambos! He cute too
Prof. Starr has easily had the most impact on me during my college experience
Robbie is synonymous with "the best professor"
Absolutely amazing professor, genuinely cares about his students
cool dude

I was going to drop out of WPI but then I took this course! Changed my life forever and I will always be grateful. There really is a tight knit community within this class. Thank you Professor Starr XD :P
Professor Robert Star was by far the best professor I have ever had.
Awe inspiring
Robbie is the most caring person I've met in a long time. Truly respects his students and wants us to succeed.
Taught me the ability to use 40+ chrome tabs at once
Professor Starr is a fantastic professor. You will learn a ton about yourself and grow. He hits you in the feels right when you're least expecting it.
He's just real good
Professor Starr is the GOAT. you will never have a class experience as fulfilling
Professor Starr taught me everything know.
Kinda good. Really great.
Professor Starr has been amazing. Such a great speaker, and always has his hair neatly combed.
Professor Starr is a legend. His review sessions are the best out of all of my courses here. Thank you professor Starr
Robbie is the best teacher i've ever had! He gives great feedback, speaks clearly, and is very understanding of the current situation. He's the man.
Best teacher at WPI
I personally enjoyed all the listening assignments. It was an extremely organized class and made easy especially for someone who has never taken a music class.
I took it during summer and it was great. She explained assignments well and we worked on them during class. Because the class was small, it was like tutoring sessions and I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I also took mu 393x--Beethoven. this course was amazing, I've taken so many music classes and this was the most interesting one. Good choice of composer for the class. I also wanted to take her mu1511 but it was full

i really enjoyed this class, i actually thought it was one of the best courses i have taken at wpi. extremely interesting and informative and i did not like classical music in any way before this class, it really opened up my mind to the music i thought i would never listen to on my own time. this was one of the fairest and most well taught classes

Professor Shim was very kind and excited to teach class. I thought she was a great professor. The only thing to be aware of is that this is not an easy class by any means. You have to put in a lot of time to get an A. You will have about 40 song titles to memorize by audio recognition including a few facts about each... on top of class material
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mixed thoughts about Prof. Shim. She is a very kind person and does a fine job teaching, her tests are just a bit unfair. She puts questions on exams that are meant to trick you with small wordings. This puts all the emphasis on very specific details. With exams being short, this winds up impacting your grade quite a bit.
Good professor. Some times you get lost in lectures. But reading gets you back on track.
Kind and light hearted. No too good of a teacher
Really kind and caring teacher, ignore the hate. The only thing one could complain about is her force use of memorization on tests, but if you like the music it helps. Easy grader.
She is terrible, one of the worst prof. at wpi by far

She might not be a bad person but she is far from being a good teacher. She is confusing and not helpful. Requires you to memorize more than 25 pieces of music at once. If you all do bad in the class she assumes it is your fault and you just took it too easy. Avoid!

She is such a sweet professor. I  had her for Intro to Music and Music History II and both classes were set up the same exact way even though one is at a harder level. The exams were easy and the homework was extremely simple! If you attend the lectures and do the listening assignments you should be able to get a very good grade. :)

Took MU2721- she had clear expectations and made the class interesting with notes, playing the pieces, and video. She knows her stuff, and if you pay attention in class the memorization isn't too bad.
Take this class with another professor if you could.

Worst teaching experience I've ever had in my life.  She was my IQP advisor, and admitted half way through the term she didn't really understand the project.  But she still adamantly demanded that we make her corrections, when many of them were irrelevant or flat-out wrong.  I assume English is her second language, but that's not the whole problem.

All over the place, doesnt complete sentences, hard to understand because the fluctuations in her voice are at the wrong times (language barrier), extremely fast paced.  said one day, o well this isnt a composition class so you dont need to know that, and then proceeded to teach us four part writing. a great sleeper class

Not the best fundamentals 1 teacher.  Often you think you know what you're doing because of what she taught and then on the quiz she marks it wrong because of minor errors/exceptions that she didn't tell you about, which makes it frustrating (this is true mostly in writing chords).  Make sure to do the hw and go to class (credit).

Awful. Barely teaches anything worth while. If you can memorize how a song sounds (sometimes upwards of 15-20 at a time), you can get a decent grade in MU2721. Awful at teaching fundamentals. Honestly, if there weren't people in the class that knew more about theory than she did - we could have learned everything wrong!
Waste of time.  Very little actual substance covered.  Pure memorization of songs=Grade

Good at music history, decent at fundamentals. Knows exactly what she is talking about. Very helpful, if you ask a question she will answer right away. Help available if needed, but easy classes. Pay attention and it's a breeze. Only a little outside time necessary if you go to class everyday. Good overall, definitely take classes with her.
She's certainly knows her stuff and is extremely nice.  Sometimes with fundamentals she can be a little confusing but for other couses she's good.
She knows a lot about what she's teaching she just doesn't quite know how to get it across

Horrible fundamentals teacher.  If you have her get out of that class.  Totally scatterbrain and computer illiterate.  Does not work well with the computer program or the books. Very frustrating to work with.
REALLY good music history professor, she's really nice and knows SO much about what she teaches.  not as great as a fundamentals of music teacher, but she's very nice

A decent fundamentals teacher and an excellent music history teacher, I've had two of each with her. She will help you out in any way she can, really a great person. Her tests contain a lot of material but it is clear what to study for. Great Professor.

four words. "does it make sense?" no it freakin doesn't make sense and practicing without knowing what is going on doesn't help either. bad music fundamental professor AND she is foreign. i hear she is good at music history though.
She was very clear on what her tests and quizzes would contain, no tricks.  Good lectures and tried to help out with any problem a student might come across.

She's not a great Fundamentals of Music teacher, but she's a lot better at Music history.  She knows sooo much about it and it relatively clear explaining it.  She has trouble answering questions sometimes but she's really nice.  She's also a good pianist

Ok professor and very nice person. The labs and Homeworks are terrible and, while the exams are not bad, they are very hard to receive an A on. It is virtually impossible to take this class and get an A with a normal course load.

Seems smart in lecture and knows what she's doing, but the second you try and ask her for help in a lab, clueless. Doesn't post grades until right before exams, exams are too hard/long. Aggravating, labs are really long and annoying, be prepared to do homework assignment (one assignment) for an entire week or 7 hours straight.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I got through with an A and it was an easy course albeit Jarvis attempt to make it as frustrating as possible. First of all, the labs are long and the instructions seems like it was taken out of some ECE book in another language and then translated using Google Translate. The homework and the exam were easy though but she was not very helpful.

She is extremely unorganized and she has no sense of time at all. The homework, lab, and exams take centuries to complete. She seems like a nice person but she does not care about the students all that much and she doesn't explain the material adequately I am glad that this course is ending because I cannot take another term with this professor.

Knows what she is saying and  is very knowledgeable. However she consistently fails to explain the material to the student. Poorly-written lab instructions plus homework that essentially is just going through pages of data sheets. Perhaps the best thing about that you know this is the only course she teaches.  0/7 Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Pretty easy class if you attend. Allows a sheet of notes for exams. Clear lectures. Do the homework and you'll do well on the exams.
I only got a B cause I overloaded with this course. While the labs were hard, if you paid attention in lectures, you learned a lot. Good prof.
She explains things well. And she's really easy to go to if you don't understand something.

Least favorite ECE class to date. I feel like Jarvis didn't want to help students and instead used many TAs. Also do not like her teaching style at all. She doesn't seem very engaged in the material. Not dreadful but far from good.

Jarvis is an "eh" professor... she did not provide very clear explanations, and she seems generally unwilling to help students personally; office hours with her tend to be brief. She does not seem very enthusiastic about the subject matter. The labs are pretty time-consuming; MAKE SURE TO GET A GOOD LAB PARTNER or you will have a bad time. Tough hw
Had no idea what she was talking about. Just learned the topic on my own. Don't go to class if you know some C.

Very simple class (also interesting). She is very friendly and willing to help students (but also makes a lot of typos and mistakes on the HWs and exams). Labs are not hard but instructions are poorly written. Overall I would say she is a good prof, just try to pay attention to possible mistakes.

Overall a good teacher, explains things well and is helpful, though I didn't come to office hours. Tip: For ECE 2029, you can do the labs on your own computer (software is free, or remote desktop into the lab). Do the labs with your partner on your own time if you don't need TA help.
Good class, I learned a lot and found a real interest in embedded systems

Pretty easy class provided that you pay attention and look over the notes. There may be some stuff that you might have to ask her to clarify sometimes. Test's are not too bad as long as you look over the notes.

Don't listen to the comment below. She honestly is a great professor. She teaches her material straight-forward. She doesn't throw curve balls. Her notes are HANDED OUT, so with all that typing, expect possible mistakes, no one is perfect! None-the-less, Homeworks are fair, Exams are alright, but manage your time efficiently, and you'll do good.

Man she had the MOST ERRORS I'VE EVER SEEN A PROFESSOR MAKE. She reuses materials and assignments, and somehow STILL doesn't fix the typos year to year. Come on, you're an embedded systems teacher, code typos are kind of major. Ate half of the exams explaining typos. Don't attempt this class with her unless your a cs major with C/asm experience.

She's a great professor and is always willing to help with anything. I've had her for two courses, she helped me with my 2799 project, and now she's advising my MQP and is very helpful. The best thing I can say about her is she's extremely helpful and a pretty easy grader. Sometimes she makes mistakes in class, but she's not to proud to admit it.

Easy prof, but the course is fantastic! extremely interesting and engaging. Yes, she sometimes makes mistakes. Exams are NOT excessively long, labs and homework are on-topic and informative. Was one of my favorite classes to date.
Her tests took long but were straight forward. Her labs were long as well. Did make a lot of mistakes on the board. She was always willing to meet with students and a generally nice professor.

Easy class. Dumb professor, was corrected on many occasions including the grading on tests.  If you don't care about the material, take the class with her because you won't really learn it and it will be an easy A.

worst professor i've had at wpi...constantly makes mistakes, is completely unorganized and has no sense of time.  gives 50 minute tests that could take well over two hours and labs that take multiple days...would definitely not recommend.

Actually thought she was very good. Very helpful, always willing to spend extra hours with students. Her lectures were clear, and her notes (which she distributed at the beginning of class) were some of the better ones I got. Projects were fun and interesting; final project was really tough, but fun. Put in the time, go to lecture and talk with her
Lousy
She always seemed to talk to herself always saying "caviat" here and there. If you not a CS major don't even bother taking this class with her
Got better at teaching as time went on but had to be constantly corrected and did not seemt that prepared to teach.

Horrible organization, and like the person before me said, she had to be constantly corrected in class. Labs were rediculously hard compared to the level of tests and in-class material. Was absent 2 days, including a test day, although the got Prof. Looft to come in as a sub. Avoid at all costs.

Absolutely horrible! She couldn't figure out the abbreviations in her own notes, and she copied another professors material wrong. I learned more from the original professors power points than from hers. She finally got her act together for the last lecture. Students corrected her all the time. Tests were abstract and dumb too.
Shes a hoe whos doesnt believe white kids can speak Spanish well.
She's odd, but something about her is enjoyable. She is bold, reasonable, and funny. You never need to do the homework (she never looks at it) but her exams do cover a lot of material.

Halpine wants you to succeed and goes above and beyond to help students to do so. She is very aware that students have lives outside of her class and tries to make the class conversational so that students can talk about what they are interested in. When she looks to you to answer a question, if you're struggling, she helps, but asks to repeat it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Prof. Halpine is extremely nice to all of her students, and because the Spanish classes tend to be smaller I got to know her fairly well. Definitely a big fan of history for some reason, loves to weave it into her lectures and tests from time to time.

class itself is very stressful because there is constant required participation (though in the long run it is very helpful and good for your memorization). the tests and project aren't that hard - she tells you the subject so you just need to know what youre doing (don't slack off though)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Adv. Spanish II is more conversational than Adv I is. You get a lot of practice speaking as well as listening to Spanish. Tests and homework are a little easier than Adv I although the final presentation is harder. You'll have to work in this class but you'll learn so much: I can't recommend it highly enough.
I learned a lot in her class. I really liked how interactive it was. She makes sure that everyone in the class understands what is happening before continuing.
The class is interactive and fun. Would highly recommend her as a teacher.

Professor Halpine is not the easy Spanish professor: this is good though because you will really learn Spanish from her, as well as cool things about culture & history of Spanish-speaking countries. Her exams are graded toughly but she tells you exactly what will be on them. If she likes you and you work hard, she'll help you out extra.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Great teacher. She is very caring and funny. If you mess up saying something, she is very good at correcting you without making you feel bad. She made sure the entire class was involved consistently.

This was my second course I have taken with this professor and I liked the class a lot. Exams are often tricky but if you prepare for them you will have no worries in her class. She has a good personality as well.

I found her class very interesting and I actually looked forward to it each day. She is funny and sarcastic and though her exams can be tricky, she always gives a heads up as to what will be on them so with a bit of preparation, an A should not be difficult at all to achieve.

One of the best teachers I've had throughout my learning experience. Wants to see students succeed and does everything in her power to help them gain a full understanding of the material. Keeps class interesting and relevant. Always very helpful, friendly, humorous, and kind. TAKE THIS TEACHER!
Best professor I have ever had!!!!

Halpine is a good Spanish professor if you really like the material and want a bit of a challenge. She's very clear with what will be on the test, but it deceptively requires a lot of studying, even for someone who is proficient already. She's helpful and personable.
Fantastic Professor!!

Shes rude and unhelpful.  She sneers when you give a wrong answer and makes you feel dumb.  She is a hard grader.  She has a sense of humor.  The number one word I would use to describe her is aggressive.  Not an ideal teacher at all, very unpleasant experiences.

great spanish professor!! knows the material very well and wants all her students to pass and very helpful outside of class. Format for exams and class are the same for each spanish course she teaches. very consistent! cracks jokes on her students but in good taste. recommended!
Keeps class active and you really learn the material.  Plus she gives you the exam format beforehand so there are no surprises.  Great professor.
Loved Halpine, and really enjoyed her class. Very clear and easy to understand, and very willing to help students succeed. Highly recommended.

love halpine! funny teacher, cracks jokes here and there and is very cool. gives you the format of the exam before hand and makes sure you're prepared. if you already know spanish, she's def an easy A/B

she is a really helpful professor if you want to learn spanish and practice spanish. Grades are depended on 3 exams, 2 essays with rewrites, oral exam (at the end of the term) and class participation. You need to pay off, but at the end, you will feel worth it because u really learn the stuff.
She's very helpful and easy to get along with, and has a sense of humor. She doesn't tolerate stupidity and laziness, so do the work and you'll be fine.
No doubt about it.  She is the typical prof. to get new-to-spanish students to get introduced to Spanish Language.
Decent professor -- helpful and fair. Tests are a good measure of the material covered, bit of a hard grader though from time to time.
She's a great teacher and is willing to help those who are struggling. I recommend her to everyone I know taking Spanish.
No Comments

She is very unhelpful, and does not teach at all, and doesnt even really use the book, but instead does exercises out of the workbook.  Plus, she expects you to give her what she considers the correct answer even if there are other possible correct answers.
I find Professor Smith to be a bit rude and not care about students' well-being. He is also extremely strict regarding due dates.

I really liked him, graded fairly and generously for tests. Explains concepts clearly through nice drawings. He can go fast sometimes but he always stops to ask for questions which he will answer clearly.
Great professor. Intuitive and straight to the point. He explains everything clearly and is a very organized speaker. Covers lots of content each lecture.
His in class examples are great and he answers questions thoroughly and with detail. I hope that every WPI student gets an opportunity to take a class with him.
Great professor.
He is one of the best professors. He makes sure to connect every dot and never just shows a formula without explaining it.

No idea why he's rated so lowly. Took Calc III class and had 0 issues. Lectures are understandable; lots of material. Takes questions well. Quizzes were almost too easy. TAs go through quiz problems w/ different numbers the day before. Covers material before quizzes. Midterm was easy too. 10/10. Super smart. Wish I could take more classes with him.

To those who are trying to see if he's a good professor for MA1023, just read this. Professor Smith's class requires you to do the following: pay attention in class, attend discussions, and make sure you don't fall behind. His lectures are from the textbook. He asks for questions constantly. if you want prof who knows his stuff, he's your professor

Great professor. Not sure why his ratings are so low, but he was very clear with his explanation of the materials and was very patient with questions. Weekly quizzes were fair and going to discussions give you a great idea of what they're going to be like. HW problems prepare you well. Wish I had him for Calc IV.
Very good and clear lectures. Answers lots of questions and is always ready to give extra examples on the fly. If you do the homework, the quizzes and tests will be easy.

Not sure why ratings are so low. Prof Smith encouraged questions, class is lecture based and I would recommend going to lectures even if you know the content. He is very knowledgable and explains all concepts to a high level. This may be why some students get confused but if you pay attention during lecture you will be fine. HW + Tests were fair.
Comes across as tough/mean, but actually very helpful/nice. He explains things well and answers questions very well. His quizzes/tests are very straightforward and are on the easier side I would say.

His lectures were simply specific example problems from the textbook and it was really up to the students to learn a lot of the material on their own. There were quizzes every Friday that were manageable but lots to study for. The midterm and final were harder than the quizzes.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: If you aren't good at calculus I wouldn't take him. Not great at explaining anything, quizzes and tests are so so so hard. The webworks are very difficult, he doesn't seem approachable, seems like he dislikes his job. He won't explain past material before quizzes, overall not a great class.

This prof does not teach the material anywhere near as well as other professors, I often found myself teaching myself the material or going to other professors' lectures. Furthermore, the quizzes/tests were made much more difficult than they had to be, where he would throw numerous difficult curveballs that were incredibly difficult. Don't take.

I actually had him for MA 2024 but that wasn't an option.
Any-hoo, he takes three weeks to grade home work and quizzes, his webworks are ridiculously hard, and he's the most unorganized prof i've ever seen. I do not recommend his class and I will 100% have to take Calc 4 again.
Don't walk away, run.
He is a good lecturer and very much about concepts in class. there is a lot of homework but it all helps prepare for the exams and quizzes. Hard class but it was a good experience.

He's an average calc professor. He lectures from the book, so if you understand the material as it's presented in the book there's no need to go to lecture. He answers questions you have about the homework/quizzes during class which is nice. Make sure you understand the material covered for that weeks quiz and you'll do fine.
His lectures are clear, concise and from the book. It may not be for everyone but a lot of theory and seems like a good guy overall. Hard deadlines no late credit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: This man does not know how to teach. Calc 1 really isn't that hard but this man made it so difficult. If I had not taken Calc 1 in high school I would not have passed. He has no structure to his lectures and explains things in the most confusing, complicated way possible. Average on our final was a 40%. Do not take a class with this prof.

The tests are heavily weighted in this class. He teaches the class and gives notes everyday; however, the explanations make the concepts more confusing. Don't take this class if you don't have a previous background in Calc I; otherwise, it will be hard to pass.

Do not take a class from this professor. If you dont have background knowledge/have taken calc before the class will be extremely difficult for u. He makes the concepts of calculus so much more confusing than they actually are and his lectures have no structure he just draws random graphs. HW and quizzes dont correlate to what we do in class.
Professor Smith is a really good professor who protrays the concepts of calculus very well.

He makes the basic calculus concepts so difficult. Im glad that I have taken a previous calc class, b/c without the background you will be so lost. He was very cold during lectures and when ever you asked questions he would make you feel stupid for not knowing the answers. Labs are 5% hw 5% midterm 30% and final 30%. Midterm was only 7 questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Didn't explain things very well, never engaged the class. Did not prepare us well for quizzes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Smith is a great guy but was very difficult at first. He moves very fast but will gladly explain a topic if you ask. He is a new professor but has potential. Be kind and it goes a long way.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Quizzes, midterm, and final are 30% of your final grade each. Homework is only 5% of your grade so it's not going to save you if you do poorly on any of your exams. Lectures make sense when you're sitting there but as soon as you go to do homework you realize everything you learned was out of context and makes no sense outside the lecture hall.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: There is a lot of homework and its only worth 5%. He doesnt make canvas easy to work with or grade the quizzes. He puts a lot of weight of tests (30% of your grade is dependent on your midterm). Save yourself the trouble and dont take this class with him!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He gave us the wrong equations on numerous occasions. He was supposed to help us with practice problems and it was difficult to understand what he was doing. Everything was conceptual rather than with numbers. He was sweet though.
Super knowledgeable and knows how to explain material in a clear way. We all felt very comfortable to ask questions and discuss various topics. Excellent communication skills. Very nice person.
I enjoyed taking class with Professor Popovic, the class was very engaging. Sometimes I felt like there was too much math but Professor made sure that we got it.
Very accessible and helpful during office hours. I definitely feel like I learned a lot during this course thanks to Professor Popovic.

While he reads off the slides he didn't make, he says this in one of our last lectures: "I am completely lost here. Oh God. This is not how it's done, not how I'm teaching it." pause "okay. So this is a very simple calculation." pause "Ah, I see what's the mistake, this is wrong." Also, he has the worst grading scale that I can't elaborate on in th

It was an honor and quite rewarding experience taking Biomechanics and Robotics with Prof. Popovic, considering he wrote the first textbook on the subject. The best part (besides the always super fun and animated lectures) was working on the real world and realistic homework problems, all very unique and challenging and require creative thinking.

Popovic is a great scientist but a horrible teacher. His classes involve him reading directly from presentations. He teaches some of the more interesting applications of robotics but his classes are dull and lacklustre. His homeworks are tough as he never connects the lectures to them. Doesn't care about students only talks about his research.

Not only is Popovic incredibly knowledgeable about the subjects he's teaching, he also knows how to explain the concepts in a clear way. If you pay attention and participate you'll get a lot out of class. Got a lower grade on a test and went in to ask him about it, he spent 1.5 hours making sure I understood the problems I missed. The best at WPI!
