Very correct and fair. Even the exam problems were fun. He was late with assigning the homework problems a few times. Also, he should consider giving practice problems in conferences that students can do on their own first. That would improve the quality of the conferences. But, overall very good. I enjoyed his lectures very much.

I was REALLY worrying that I wont pass this course. I guess I couldnt connect with my other physics teachers in the past. But this was something else. Professor Popovic was available anytime and he worked hard to communicate and answer all questions and he explained all the tough concepts very thoroughly. I got a well-deserved A. And it was fun.

I just want to share an amazing fact. Its never happened to me before. I was actually looking forward to Professor Popovic lecture hour. It was always dynamic and interesting. I never thought that I would say this but I actually started enjoying physics. Thank you prof Popovic, your freshman class on oscillation and waves was a wonderful experience

Prof. Popovic is a nice guy and a very intelligent person, but he does not effectively communicate physics at freshman level. He tends to just read the slides without explaining equations. Tests and quizzes are very hard. Huge curve
Very helpful. Challenging but in a positive way. The lectures are fun, I'm really enjoying this course.
One of the best professors I've had at WPI so far. The class so far is really great and I've been learning a lot, the grading is fair as well.
I have done well in every class except when he is involved. He gave me wrong formulas when asking for help and he does not test you on what he teaches
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: BEWARE! He is funny and brilliant, but he does not teach. Therefore you can never be sure what the tests are on. He is very generous when it comes to grading and there is a massive curve. If you really believe in yourself go for it, but be prepared for more work than you have ever done as an undergrad. He doesn't understand that you're not a PHD.

Oh. God. Drop. Immediately.  In all seriousness, he's a nice guy. But his knowledge is above most normal people's knowledge which makes his teaching pretty much pointless. It's like having a language barrier with the one thing that can keep you alive. He grades on a curve the size of Everest so if you're the betting type, go all in. Beware and GL.
The lectures were so awesome, I definitely learned a lot.
He knows his job. Excellent!

Popovic spent a lot of time deriving equations not done in the textbook or in the exams that added confusion. I was confused the whole time until we got a big study group together. Exams were extremely difficult and graded on a modest curve. His accent is fairly understandable, though he is a little too quiet when lecturing.
Tests are very difficult but grading is generous. You will pass it but you will feel confuse even you got A.
Great Lectures, not much homework. Tests were extremely difficult but he grades them on a steep curve so that the actual grades are fine.

Tests were exceedingly hard and impossible to finish but he grades nicely and on a steep curve. A little disorganized and has a thick accent, but lectures are still very interesting, and he definitely knows what he's talking about. A little hard to track down for help but if you can find him he's happy to help with anything.
Beautiful
It seems that he did not pay enough attention to teaching though he try to be nice on giving grades.

Was very confusing in the conference he taught where he would make mistakes while doing.  He is very hard to get in contact with for help.  He has a a thick accent.  He takes attendence once or twice and if you were not there that one day you lose points for the conference grade.

Prof Popovic is awesome, he is super smart and extremely generous and understanding with both grades and students in general. Just don't ask overly stupid questions. Show interest and you'll get an A.

Avoid this professor at all costs, you will regret taking a class with him. Doesn't know how to teach, but he is good at making your life miserable. Assigns so much homework you will not have time for other classes. Also expects you to know how to use Mathcad from the first day of class and does not teach you how to use it at all.

He is the worst professor I have ever had. He was disrespectful to students, talked down to them and refused to take feedback. He assigned insane amounts of homework a night to the point I barely had time to work on anything else. His lectures were worthless he covered almost no material and refused to teach us how to use the software. DO NOT TAKE
He is a good instructor, but the course is challenging, and you have to put enough time to work on quizzes and project.  I enjoyed the class and learned a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Spent at least 25 hrs/wk on hw and most of it was not even collected. The class is one of the more useful classes I have taken at WPI, but the professors made me loathe the class. He just reads of slides in class which makes it very difficult to pay attention or learn anything in class. Would not recommend him.

One of harder professors I have taken at WPI. He presented the material well, but about 24 hours of HW each week and project reports wash out understanding the. Very nice guy, but plan to work hard for your grade

I learned a lot from this class! It was a huge time commitment though, 2-4 hours of homework per night plus working on a group term project. He is very friendly and helpful in office hours and genuninely wants to help you learn. The project is not well-defined so you NEED to go to office hours to ask him exactly what he expects for the report...

Very good class, probably the most useful ME class I have ever taken. A LOT of work, but it forces you to learn. Professor is very friendly and helpful, he explains concepts well and going office hours is great because he really sits down and helps you. I think everyone just hates of Furlong because of the huge amount of effort the class requires

AVOID. Mateial for class is extremely easy, but he is the hardest grader i have ever heard of. ex, 75 on a test and the only mistake was a single missing coefficient in a geometry formula (not even important material!). BS grading in hw and tests makes it extremely hard to do well.

He made this class miserable. It was difficult to pay attention to lectures, most people in the end stop going because they were pointless, you got more out of teaching yourself then going to lecture. Labs could never be completed during lab time and excessive amounts of hw were assigned and less then half was graded. AVIOD AT ALL COSTS!

I hate this profssor. He makes students suffer just for the sake of it. For our labs he took off points just so that he can keep the class avg at 80, and we clearly did everything in the lab. his teaching style is good and very unteresting but again he himself is a D**k from the inside.

ME 3901. He is the most useless prof I have come across. He is not mean, just completely useless, ridiculous in his expectations, terrible in his clarity, not helpful, does not reply to emails. Doesnt use his time wisely. His Power points are repetitive, leaving out any new info that is relative. AVOID!!!

Weekly tests that are not designed to fit in an hour. They build on previous exams so its possible to prepare. LOTS of homework. Do all of it and you will probably pass the class. He is never in his office hours, but is in his office most other times and will help you with anything. Class will own your life.

One of the hardest professors at WPI. Be prepared to spend countless hours on homework and the course project.  If you plan to go into engineering design or testing this is the class to take. Even though he's really hard you'll learn an incredible amount of material.

Be prepared to spend 2hrs a day AT LEAST (not 10 at once) on HW. This class is why I take ADD meds - the HW is just too much for my attention span. Cosme is a very bright guy, but no one keeps up with him, so the lectures always fall behind. Also, MathCad is your friend... very close friend that you wouldn't be akward with sleeping in the same bed.
Terrible Terrible. Only three weeks in and thinking about dropping it. 25 pages of hw a week and will only collect 5 or 6. Doesn't teach, book is bad and its ruining my term. Worst experience so far.

Horrible professor, never made clear what he wanted for lab write ups, but expected you to know. Hard grader. Tests were impossible. Lectures were pointless, whatever he taught had nothing to do with what we were doing, just him mumbling big words. Homework was rediculous as well. STAY AWAY FROM HIM!

Agree with previous comments...This dude doesn't teach...he spend all the time showing off using big words.  Not interested in teaching. Exams are impossible...homeworks are endless...  Don't take him...

This guy got serious issues. He can't teach yet he wants everyone to think he's smart. He's afraid of students asking him question so he uses word such as "Too simple...it clear...it's straightforward" in lectures. He read off power-points and call that teaching.  Go figure.  AVOID AT ALL COST!!!

This guy is a joke.  He uses big words just to confuse everyone and make it sound like he is the smartest guy in the room.  He is never there for office hours.  If you ask a question he just says it is "so simple" and you should know how to do it. At the end, we didn't have a final if we gave him a good review because he "really needed it".

Class starts out 40 students...then 25 students...then 7 students.  SEVEN of us left by the time we take the final.  This guy is tough...he doesn't scale either.  He's a nice guy...but horrible teacher.  Avoid if possible.

Tough class with a lot of homework/lab work.    Labs were revised renditions of other professor's labs, and by revised I mean tons of**** added. Lab time was squandered by lecturing on obscure topics. Tests consisted of turning in HW's at random, short written part, as well as a practicum based on lab exercises. Not very helpful outside of class.
This guy is tough. Due all the homework. 50% of test grade. Knows his stuff....moves thru the chapters like the wind......have fun:(

He reads power point and calls it teaching. Ridiculous amounts of homework. Tests aren't on the covered material, then he blames the class for getting bad grades. He is helpful outside of class, but you shouldn't have to spend another 4 hours with him after lecture to cover all the material properly
HORRIBLE.  Wicked jerk.  This guy does not care about the students at all...much like most of WPI.  Try to never take a class with him.

Prof. Furlong Teaches really tough classes which makes it seem like he is a bad prof. but makes the effort to help.  He helped me as late as 11 at night!!  You can go to his office anytime of the day and he will help you.  If you put forth effort he will reward it, if you slack off you will pay.
This guy is horrible, avoid him if possible!!!
No Comments

Dear professor Higgins is one of the best professors I ever met in my life. There are pop quizzes in each class, you have to go through the slides and the textbook so that you can earn grades from the quiz. The final project requires some time, and it is very helpful. Highly recommended!!!
Professor Higgins is one of the best professors I ever met in my life. Excellent lecturer. The financial project is helpful for my career. Don't hesitate, her courses are worth to take!
Professor Higgins is the best professor I have ever met. She is really nice since she will give very detailed feedback for every work you've done. Even they are just some simple calculations.
There are quizs in each class, you have to go through the class so that you can earn grades from the quiz. Also, lots work for Final, but you will get a Good grade if you pay more.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Higgins is a very nice lady. She always asks about how she can improve. Class was fairly easy to follow. Online quizzes for homework allow for 2 attempts. Hated the PollEverywhere at the end each class (can be stressful). Easy projects if you meet with her to review. Final was a bit tough, but not worth much. She is not the greatest with technology

Lectures are boring and sometimes confusing but there are some good group activities that happen in class which help teach the subject material. Office hours are super helpful for checking your projects over with her before submission. You can almost guarantee 100% on your projects as long as you review them with her a few times.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Easy to A as long as you listen to class, quizzes are simple and easy as well. Professor Higgins is a really good professor, you will feel relaxed in her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Does a great job of explaining finance.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Best professor ever
Really nice and really easy
Great Teacher
Great professor!

The course is easy if you do the homework and the UBuild project. She collects homework, but if it is wrong, you can resubmit it. Is extremely helpful at office hours and manages to convey the material really clear. Overall, a great teacher.

Attentive professor that focus on learning and not grades. Workload is a bit heavy, but definitely not hard at all. She allows for re-dos and has tons of office hours. If you study just a bit you should be fine with an A.

Relies too heavily on slides that she doesn't put on-line.  Tests come straight from the homework.  Once you get over her "$100 Million" house that she loves to talk about, she doesn't really have any real life experience integration which doesn't help if you're a very logical thinker.

While she is not the best professor she teaches u everything u need to know for the tests.  The tests are online  and r open book open notes.  Quizzes are online and exam questions come straight from the homework.  Do the homework and go to class and you will have a guaranteed A

Very difficult to understand (language barrier). Seems to know subject well, but completely incapable of passing knowledge on. Class is centered on PowerPoints and online tests and homework, none of which help to learn the material. Wastes a lot of paper; slides not available online. Expects us to know analytical details without guidance.
awful, didn't learn a thing from her, couldn't understand her, no point in going to class except for the discussion paper after each class, will never take another class with her again!
not really helpful and sometimes unclear. you'll need to do a lot of work on your own. but i'd say she's pretty fair.

Horrible teaching, irrational method of grading, homework "does not reflect an individuals progress in the class" or help with studying for the exams, does not help with student's understanding of the material
She's a pretty nice teacher.
She doesn't really teach.

Difficult to understand, second-guesses herself in the middle of class, and doesn't explain concepts completely or clearly.  Tests are multiple choice, yet somehow short answer for partial credit. Says that previous students said her tests were "very easy, yet very easy to lose lots of points on."
She is somewhat boring but she does explain the subject matter. Not an awesome professor, but I've had far worse. Easy class as well.
Boring class, graded participation, but easy
No Comments
No Comments
Such a sweet nice guy take him you will learn alot!
Awesome Prof. Very interactive and respectful towards his students while answering their questions. Sad that he is retiring. PS: Very nice to be a TA under him.
He made a boring subject fairly interesting.  Explained algorithms very well.

He tries to make the class interactive. He does a good job at explaining the algorithms and how to arrive at them. The tests were pretty easy. Some of the homework assignments were long and programming/stats/prob were needed on more than one.
very good teacher - he really wants to do a good job.  If he made better presentation material he would deserve all 5s.

so I'm still not sure what foundations is useful for, because selkow thinks "teaching" means copying formulas from his notes onto the blackboard. the wedge rats all have a selkow ****, but everyone else is left to just read the book and pray the exams are managable. i guess i should be grateful he's not hofri.
Very intelligent. Sometimes goes a little fast with the material.

class was alright, he sure knows graph things.  He seemed like he would really like to be doing something else, but he is a better teacher for those unfamiliar with the material than hofri is.  The tests had a some "trick" questions, but the assignments were interesting.
evil, enough said. unhelpful, cold hearted, no corrolation in any work
He was alright.  The lectures were very boring, but he explained everything pretty well.  Plus, taking this class with him meant not having to take it with Hofri.
Difficult assignments but great teaching makes you learn a lot.  A worthwile challenge.
head in the clouds
kinda burnt out.. unhelpful during office hours.
immoral and unhelpful
Uses CS jargon liberally... great if you like CS and CS jokes.
He is not very helpful to me and me and my friends think he is so mean he should get fired!!!
He's a good teacher. I found the class challanging. Selkow does not like to help outside of class but he teaches very well.
I slept through class, but that was because of the hour, not his teaching. Good teacher
Doesn't teach what's in the homework, and made me feel rather stupid when I went to him for extra help, instead of just helping me learn the materal.
Encouraged me to drop (poor grades), then his final curve was C = a 50 and below.
If you're want to learn theoretical computer science, take classes from this guy.

I've had selkow for discrete, foundations, and algorithms.  I think he's a great teacher.  The subject material is difficult but I think he taught it very well, I've had a great experiance in all his classes.  He's funny, and he knows his stuff.
No Comments
He loves his algorithms.
good teacher, and CS3133 is one of the best classes I've taken here
I agree.  He seems to like teaching math more than CS.
It's a CS course, not a math course. Someone should tell him that.
Read the book yourself, and get extra help if needed his teaching style is a bit dry and have going over some basics.

He will ramble on in class with no examples and then when he finally does an example he will not Finnish it leaving you even more confused.  His tests are nothing like what he doe sin class.  You get a very big scale but it is hardly enough to help you pass.

There were three worlds in this class - what he explain on the board, what the book said and what the problems asked at the end of chapter. None matched. Unlike for other people below, I thought his tests were very reasonable and covered the basics. I still disliked his teaching style and learned very little.

Not a very good professor, for some reason I simply couldn't understand the concepts; I tried, went to office hours and such. The other time I was in one of his classes, I didn't learn anything lasting.
Worst professor I have ever had.  Does not care about students. Teaching styling is horrible, refuses to do examples/
hes not good

I don't know what a lot of these people are talking about, Hill is the only reason I ever passed Calc 2/4. He avoids a lot of the underlying proofs and focuses more on the mechanics, introducing theory occasionally to help students understand what's going on. He explains things over and over again and makes sure everyone gets it. Fair, great prof.

Don't take a class with this guy if you can help it. His class usually consists of useless theory and derivation with no instruction on how to solve a problem. He will often spend a whole class playing with a java applet on the overhead. You must get a 70 on the final in order to pass, and it will be very hard. Study hard and you might pass.

Doesn't know what he is saying.  The only way to get through his classes is the TA.  He also takes off an insane amount of points on tests for really stupid mistakes.  He doesnt care if you understand the material.  NEVER take a class with him!

He is a nice guy, and knows the materials. However he teach class with no notes, aka he made up everything on the spot, so lots errors. I learn everything from my PLA. His test is not hard, as long as you get a good PLA or TA, you are fine. The book is useless! and he kept refering to it

Horrible Prof, his class is about showing prove. Love to use math terms, which makes something very easy to something complex. I didnt learn anything from him, i rather pay my PLA $90/hr, WPI should fire this guy. Not respect student at all, going to him for help is like going for insult. I got all As on Calc n love math, if that helps.

He is ABSURB!! EXTREMELY rude to students,both in person and in e-mails.  He doesn't how to teach, period.  He, holds the book & read it line by line...to the typo.  WORST professor I've ever encountered.  The good remarks that you read earlier from ratings...I swear they are written by Mack Hill himself. Avoid at ALL cost.
All theory.  Didn't even finish the example problems he started.  Ended up getting the concepts, but not how to apply them -> bad news for tests

AWFUL. was very RUDE and SARCASTIC in e-mails. not approachable AT ALL. tests and quizzes were unproportionally hard to the things he DIDNT go over in class (because, it's true, he spends all his time playing with applets that he googled and doesn't know how to properly use half the time). seriously, DON'T TAKE HIM! he's just plain mean.

Literally the most boring professor I've ever had.  Talks to the board the ENTIRE class, rarely asks if anyone has any questions.  He is well spoken and fairly clear on what he is teaching, but he's not very nice or approachable when you go to him with questions.
No Comments

Prof. Hill is a decent teacher. He did a good job of explaining the concepts and going through examples if you asked questions. He did spend lots of time with the projector to show us how various curves and such worked. However we were able to cover everything that was on the final.
Read the textbook.  Hill takes a lot of time to play with his toys, so not everything gets covered.  Thus, you WILL find NEW material on the Math Section Final.
The worst professor i have ever had. His test are wicked hard and he doesn't collect the homework (and he gives alot of hw).

Dr. Hill teaches very slowly in class.  He explains even the most basic concepts at GREAT length and spends an unnecessary amount of time on unnecessary things (for example, setting up an online clock on the overhead so we know what time it is).  Classes are, therefore, very boring, and sleep is inevitable.  His quizzes are disproportionately hard.
His class was VERY easy.

The class itself he would be able to explain the stuff to people who don't know it, but with everyone with any idea getting extremely bored and wanting to fall asleep. The quizzes and tests are unproportionally hard. He basically even told us half the class fails always.
Great Professor.  Knew exactly what he was tlaking about.  Real easy tests and very little homework.  Definately Recomend.

He sucked. He spent more time playing with applets on the projecter than actually teaching. He covered the same thing for days, literally one problem for multiple days, and then gave tests that were way to hard for what he taught in class. If you can avoid him, do it at all costs.

I have NO CLUE what the two ppl b4 me are talkin about. This guy knew EXACTLY what he was talking about and EXACTLY how to teach it so it would make sense to the masses. Much better than my previous Calc prof.
I can just 2nd what the first guy said. He is not very effictive in class, plays around too much with the projector, wastes class time. His tests are improportionally hard compared to the class.
He's a really nice guy, but not a good teacher...in fact a TERRIBLE teacher.  I didn't learn much from him, and a lot of the class failed a majority of the tests.

Median of the midterm was a 62 and was not curved. Simply blamed his students instead of his own teaching. He curved the final grade of the class but did not say anything about this in class. Avoid if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is not understanding at all and does not accommodate based on needs. Focuses on written rules and does not go out of his way not one tiny bit to help his students. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of the most carrying professor. Good explanation of the material, he uses simple english words so material is understandable for international students . Also super useful office hours.

The lectures are kind of boring and simplified compared to the homework assigned and the exams. The midterm is 30% and the final is 35% so you really cannot mess up if you want to get a good grade. There are no makeups. You have to do a lot of practice problems and review the concepts often and you will be fine in this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He was very difficult to coordinate with when I had a passing in my family. He was less than accommodating and told me the best he could do was have me take the final a day late the same week my cousin died. Atrocious moral code, even worse pedagogical experience.
Horrible Professor, made the class much harder than it had to be. Should learn how to teach before getting another class.
He makes the class way harder than it should be but doesnt teach us enough to meet those expectations. Had an A up until the final, theres no reason for him to be that hardo

Tends to provide clear explanations during lectures. He does simply the concepts, but I think this made it easier to understand. Was very helpful when I attended his office hours and is genuinely interested in helping you succeed. Tests were the bulk of your grade, so if you didn't do well on them it hit you hard. Pretty sure final grade was scaled
So I would like this class to not be so focus on exams and quizzes and have more substantial questions on the exam, but at least the the professor was nice at the end of the term about grading.

This professor's grading criteria is the most ridiculous ever. First of all a very unreasonable portion of the grade is on exams. Second he over simplifies things on the exam so you actually don't know what to do. His exams ARE NOT like his homework. Because he over simplifies things if you get a small thing wrong you lose 10 POINTS!!!!

Probably one of the worst professors at WPI. His lectures so boring and he oversimplifies the topic to the point where you're confused. He always has so many people in office hours because no one gets what he is talking about in class. Also if you don't pass the final you prob won't pass the class. The practice exams are nothing like the real exam
Worst professor I have ever had. Never in his office hours, does not answer questions. He is not there to help students.

Really appreciates students that clearly put in effort. a difficult course, but if you go to office hours he will try to help. He also set up review sessions more than once for students who didn't fully grasp the pre-requisite material so he does want students to succeed. He'll open up to the class more if you interact and show interest
Literally, the only grade that counted was the final grade, the entirety of the first half of the class is graded but then not counted.
He never shows up to his own office hours. Not reachable outside of class.
Awful for Probability, worst professor Ive ever had

Do not take a class with this professor. He is very vague in lectures, does not give clear examples, and the material he teaches does not correspond to what you will see on the midterm and final. He picks favorites, and if you are not someone he likes he will call you out in front of the entire class. STAY AWAY
He won't be your favorite teacher, nor will he be your least favorite. He knows probability so I guess that's good. Nothing special though...

Grading is based on homework, quizzes, and 2 exams. His lecture is composed of only definitions and examples, which is exactly what you need for a math class. Homework and exams are consistent and relatively simple.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Be serious with his course, you will get an A. I thought I would get a B for this course though I worked so hard(I am not from math background). But he really awarded student who works hard and I got an A.   This is the second time taking his course. Really learn a lot.

Easy B, medium hard A since the grade is mostly test and quiz based. Notes are online but don't make sense unless you were in class. Cheat sheets are allowed. Potentially one extra credit problem on each exam.
Read his ppt, you'll be able to do all the assignment. MUST do practice test, cause it will be AlMOST EXACTLY the same on real test. should be easy to get an A

He has great after class lecture notes uploaded, but there is no class capture so going is highly recommended. He is great help outside of class if you have a bad TA or don't get something. You get note sheets for 2 exams and open note during quizes. One exam is 25% and the other is 35% so they are really heavy. HW is weekly and mostly online.
Very organized. Lectures can be boring but his notes are clear and precise.  Grading is  lenient. Very helpful outside of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: OK class, not the best teacher, he is smart and knows this is Stats 1 so doesn't go hard. If you took stats before you could skip all classes except tests and get at least a B. Grading is a bit rough he wants specific answers. Overall it's super boring lectures with printed out notes and super easy homeworks, and average tests.
He is very unclear and hard to understand. Not helpful outside of class time or during class.

Prof. Peiris is excellent. Probability problems can be difficult to decipher sometimes, but Prof. Peiris took the time outside of class to go over the homework and make sure I understand the material. I would recommend taking a class with him. You will learn a lot.

MA 2611 is an extremely easy course and Professor Peiris does a good job at making it as non-boring as possible. His accent is hard to understand, but you'll get used to it eventually. I would recommend his class because it is easy and he is a very fair grader.

Duffy is great, but definitely not easy. The exams have a much different format from the other classwork, but are identical to his in-class handouts. If you have an understanding in Cell Bio or Micro already, the class really isn't that hard, you're essentially handed 50% just for turning in everything, and the other 50% are his 3 exams.

30%-50% of the class failed every exam this term. Lectures are stream-of-consciousness, slides are illegible, and course material is organized arbitrarily. No feedback, deadlines on weekends/national holidays, overwhelming amounts of superfluous information... He reiterates the text and expects you to know how to apply concepts on your own.

Lectures covered a lot of material very quickly, it was difficult to keep up. Luckily, it was all recorded for Covid, it might be different for others. He made the content feel very interesting, it wasn't just all the same stuff I learned in high school but more in depth. He offered a lot of resources to make assigned work easier as well.

Duffy is literally the best professor at WPI. There is no assigned homework, just online quizzes, a few small projects, and 3 exams. Everything is based directly on the lectures, the textbook is not necessary but definitely helps if you miss something in class. The exams are tough but very straight forward. If you put in the work you're good.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Projects are really interesting! Can get an A in the class if you study a lot. Tests are hard. Duffy is really enthusiastic about biotech and very willing to answer any questions. Manageable workload.

Prof. Duffy loves biology and you can tell, but he is not accessible to his students. We get very little feedback on our assignments and tests are graded harshly-- if you lack a word or two that he wants, you lose points for it. On the midterm, we lost points for an answer that came directly from his slides, so sometimes grading doesn't make sense.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Duff is amazing. In 7 weeks, you learn so much about biology, technology relating to it, and how to apply this. The reason everyone thinks he's so hard is because you have to know how to logically apply what you learn, not just spit back facts. Study a lot and use your brain and you'll get an A as well as have a good time. Also read the textbook.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Does not do a good job thoroughly explaining complicated biological processes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Duffy is said to be an easy teacher but hes NOT. I honestly worked for that class an still got a B. He gives two exams ( Midterm and Final)  which are REALLY hard . You cannot just memorize the material you have to know how to apply the material, which i hated. He gives you 2 group project but honestly he grades those kinda harshly.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Weekly textbook readings, followed by weekly quiz based off readings. Interest lectures, ask questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very clear and audible lectures. Extremely knowledgable in his field. Answers all and any questions with respect and intelligence. Easy to talk to! No HW assignments, just two projects (1 group, 1 solo). Helps a ton if you have biology experience for BB1035, but I didn't and still managed a B for the class. Go to his test review sessions - helpful!

Very tough and subjective grader. Only 4 grades in the class that do not reflect ALL the material covered. Lectures contain way more than what's on the test. EXTREMELY hard to get office hours with him (by appointment only, have to go through his assistant first). Tells you to be concise on the test yet takes points off for not enough detail.

He expects a lot from an A-term freshmen. This is listed as an intro class but it is really not, don't take unless you already have a strong foundation in biology.  He only has a midterm and final. Use the book if you want to pass. Attendance is critical.  Oh, and you have to schedule office hours, he doesn't have listed office hours.

Had the worst group partners I've ever experienced and Duffy said he would help and did not. Tests were impossible with more people getting below a 50 than above an 80. No guidance on 2nd project what-so-ever. Gave pointless review sessions before midterm and final. Showed up 8 minutes late to class most of the time by the end of the quarter.
Interesting lectures. Too much information not needed for the tests. He's there to help you. Go to the lectures!

He is a good teacher with a lot of knowledge in the field of biology! His lectures contain a ton of information, most of which is not useful for the test. Going to the review sessions was the best decision I made all year, he outlines what will be on the test. Only a few grades (4) so make sure you do well on them. He does curve which is nice.

The class was very interesting. He clearly has a lot of knowledge in the field. There is a lot of information given out and put on the tests. Studying is a must because there are only 2 tests and 2 projects. Put effort in and you will succeed

Prof. Duffy was very kind and willing to talk to students. Course material was very in-depth and lectures contained A LOT of information. Very few grades (4), but Prof. Duffy curved test grades making it very fair. Easy to succeed if you put the work in.

Fun course, his lectures are pretty good. Only 4 grades count as your entire course grade, so one slip up is costly. Tests are meant to confuse you if you aren't careful, but he offers a lot of extra help!
Excellent professor. Makes the class very interesting and is a great teacher. He's a very nice person too.
He speaks very clearly. All his expectations are the information needed to pass this class are provided during class. Expectations were not too high. Very interested in helping students do well.
Very clear speaker, interesting for those who truly like biology, otherwise fairly average. Significant portions of tests based on class slides.
Great teacher! Really nice when you talk to him in person. Knows what he's talking about and every now and then humorous.
Worst teacher ever. he didn't explain anything and expected way too much of a A term freshman.
Into to biotech was terrible, but genetics was great. I actually understanded what he was teaching during genetics. He was not going all over the place during genetics and was easy to understand.

The class was very easy. However, I did not do well because I just came to America and could not understand the material. Duffy helped me a lot with it. And finally according to my improvement, he gave me a B. He is really nice and cool. But the exams were focusing on details.

Very cool guy, pretty funny. Attendance is 100% mandatory due to daily quizzes, although the sheer number of grades are a good thing because it drowns out bad ones. This class takes a ton of time, especially on the projects which are due weekly.

Told me to drop the class because I was doing poorly on the daily quizzes. I wanted to prove to myself that I could excel in a subject I love.  Told me not to try and just move out of the class.  I worked my way up to an A, but after the last homework, I dropped to 89.6.  He decided not to round it likely due to previous interactions. I got a B
A solid choice for classes that revolve less around grading and more around practical experience. He is extremely knowledgeable on several topics but is much more helpful 1 on 1 than via lecture.

Prof. Beck is not that great in terms of preparing the lesson. I want to learn in the class, especially at the graduate level, more in-depth topics rather than having to watch a series of youtube videos at an introductory level. Grading is harsh as he misses a lot of things in the work despite having it in there. This should be undergrad not grad.

has quizzes every day. Really good professor .Is obviously trying to improve every term/year. Has the Astrological sign of Gregory, the guy who makes the videos that you watch every night, as a bonus question at the end of term. Remember, he is a Virgo.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Group projects

comment: Beck made every group project bearable with humor and helpfulness. He took the time to explain questions as you asked them, and quiz grading was fair and clear.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Hilarious

comment: Incredible professor, and a very well structured class even during the Covid online era
He couldn't be bothered to help anyone. He just lets the TA's do everything for him and hates any interaction with his students.

Has us using Racket which is an extremely hard language for an "intro" class. Lectures are practically useless, and he has us watch YouTube videos of another professor that don't prepare you enough for an assignment. Practice problems stopped being assigned as the term progressed. You're better off skipping this class or learning elsewhere.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Really disappointed. I came into this class with little coding experience and it's a nightmare. DrRacket is a useless, frustrating language. He has us watch videos on youtube daily and those were more helpful than anything I took away from the lectures (still not great though). He seems like a nice guy, but he shouldn't be teaching this class.

The class I took (CS1101) he basically has you learning a useless comp sci language and doesn't teach you anything about it in the lectures. I took 4 years of comp sci in high school learning python, java, C# and I'm getting a C in the class. Despite doing all the work correctly points are just taken off with no explanation on properly done work.

"Its late so you don't get credit" -As to prepare us for the real world. Like this isn't high school, we have had jobs, and if you get the work done, you get the work done. Also gave a 0 for an assignment due to an error on the submission software's end. Entire grade is based on 7 HW, so that 0 is a 15% grade drop.

Easily my least favorite professor. We use drracket to program which in itself is a mistake. His lectures boils down to, hope you watched the videos and know how to use the racket help feature because I am not teaching it to you. I will give you an example, have you do it, and call that class, except my example is more me stammering about my code.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Beck answers any question you could possibly have instantly and intelligently. Nothing gets by this guy in the world of code. Loved having him in A term. You will have to try but he will give you the resources to succeed.

Due to the daily quizzes to ensure that you've been watching the nightly video assignments, you probably won't pass if you skip class (as each daily quiz accounts for 2% of your grade), but if you show up to class and wing the daily quizzes you'll do fine. I never gathered the courage to show up, take the 10 minute daily quiz, and then leave early.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: The way he structures the class is really great. There is a quiz at the beginning of every class which really helps to identify what you need to work on. The pace of the material is logical and reinforces core programming concepts. Beck really cares about the students and wants everyone to pass. He is very helpful if you ever get stuck. Loved him
He is a great guy, the most I have learned from any professor or teacher was from him. Great guy and really teaches you a lot, I would take another class with him, no doubt
Daily quizzes instead of exams make learning very easy, but difficult to get an A if you already know the material and decide to skip class. Would take again.

Beck has this brilliant idea of giving daily quizzes instead of exams: it forces you to study and really really learn the material instead of just remembering it for an exam and then forgetting. The group assignments are very fun but also time-consuming. We don't do a ton in each class but that worked fine. It is also definitely very fast paced.
Had him for IQP, TERRIBLE at responding to emails but easy grader
Nice guy, a CS professor teaching a non-CS class. It was weird, but he was pretty reasonable.

Great teacher. Half the class was a daily quiz, the other half was a weekly homework assignment (with a partner). Had an Optional Final that was 100% extra credit.  Very fair teacher, best option for introductory computer science.

Very disorganized; was teaching this course for the first time. All material presented via video, not lecture. Only 2 of 6 projects were returned at all, and very late. Very bad at writing quizzes and homework; lots of ambiguous wording. He does know the material, is helpful via email and office hours. Skip course if you have solid CS background.

Prof. Beck seemed competent but didn't seem like he had really been prepared for our class's material. Had him for Accelerated Intro to Program Design and his class was relatively easy but his grading scheme did not live up to my expectations. Out of six labs, only one was returned by the end of the term. Pretty bad form in my opinion.
I had the good fortune to catch a guest lecture by Prof. Back in my AI course. He's an AMAZING lecturer, if you get a chance to take a class with him TAKE IT! I know I will.

I had a very pleasant time with Prof Beck. This was my first CS class and he was God sent. He is empathetic, and all he wants you to do is understand the material. He is an excellent and merciful grader. I highly, highly recommend him.

The worst professor I've ever had at WPI. DISORGANIZED. His tests are literally one giant paragraph with blanks to fill in. His questions are phrased as if he hasn't been speaking english for ~60 years. Goes off in tangents so it is difficult to know what to study. Take this class another term with another professor. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
Don't want to hate him because he such a great person. He gives quizes on material we learn the day before and not post stuff. Give us less than a day to study all the time.
Horrible quizes, but a great person.
Really funny, will play guitar

Great man, decent class.  He really loves what he does and it shows.  Teaches by crazy powerpoints that make sense in class, but once at home you'll need your notes to understand.  Go to the review sessions to get fishes = bonus points.

Nice guy. The powerpoints are NOT the way to learn for the class. It's all short-term memorization, if you're good at that, you'll do fine. Use the book, use the checklist of words, pay attention during the quiz-day review. I'd take another class with him.

Great Guy, but i can see why most people do not enjoy his lectures. His lectures tend to be really disorganized and he uses powerpoints that dont have all the info on them that you need. If you read the text before and after class though, you do fine. He likes to through fish at people.

I had him for Anatomy and Physiology.  He gave us a final quiz and a cumulative final on the same day in a 2 hour block, which pretty much sums up my experience with his class.  The classes were useless and he emphasized the wrong things to study for the quizzes. All in all, his class was one of the worst I've had at WPI.  Nice guy though.

I can't imagine people criticizing his teaching style!  Not only would he make up power points that would have words and pictures, and animations- but he would supply supplemental reading, create "songs" of info, and have students independently learn subjects for presentations. He was always ready to help, and even used trivia games! Great teacher!

All memorization. Every class is based on the ppt, which is difficult to read and follow. Speaks very quietly and quickly, so it is difficult to write down what he says. Quizzes do not measure what you know because some of the questions are obscure. However, he's a really funny, nice guy -- he sings sometimes. Adds interesting anecdotes to lectures

Despite using powerpoint EVERY DAY, he somehow manages to fumble with the program for 5 minutes at the start of every lecture. Biodiversity was all (short-term) memorization, and I've learned NOTHING. He seems like a nice guy though and tries to make lectures interesting (with a 50% success rate).
this guy is great!  Really!
Loved him for MQP...classes not so much, but get to know the man behind the madness.

Had him for anatomy/physiology and zoology.  After three terms of him I was ready to shoot myself.  I skipped every lecture in zoology and got a perfect score for the class.  All memorization, going to class and listening to him is a huge waste of time.

He is rather condescending towards the students in this class. This class is all memorization. He is very arrogant, and his lectures are so disorganised. The power point presentations are not helpful, and he does not give you a general picture of zoology.

It is amazing to me how incredibly boring this man makes what is supposed to be an interesting subject. Lectures consist of 4th grade level power points and random/useless information. Don't take this class if you want to learn. Easy A.
Tests are very straight forward and he tells you everything that you need to know for the tests.  Interesting guy
If you can memorize stuff and you like group projects you'll be fine. If you like actually learning material, run.

Had him for zoology, anatomy, and physiology. He's easy in all of them! His tests are right from his lectures, he gives out lots of bonus points during study sessions, and all his lecture material is available online if you don't feel like going to class.
Lots of memorization in this class (Zoology), but he makes it as simple as possible. Also his poetry is amusing.
Nothing more than PowerPoint presentations, everything posted on the internet.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Very smart, structures his course well, it's hard but he makes it do-able

The best part about the class is the lectures. The professor's obvious enthusiasm about the subject matter rubs off on you. I enjoyed reading Shakespeare for her class, and I don't like reading. She is also the nicest professor I have had. Even if you are not big into English as a subject, her class is worth it.

Very interested in her subject material. Need to be comfortable reading aloud and participating in class. Very few graded assignments, mostly participation credit. Makes shakespeare relatively interesting.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Ephraim is a nice person, but grades harshly. She didn't agree with the takes I made in my essays, so she would grade them down. She would say the essays were great structurally but she didn't like the positions I would take on the material. The class was also heavy Mass Academy students which meant most WPI students didn't get to participate.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Don't take this if you don't like Shakespeare. You'll write one or two one-page essays every week that are usually on related materials that she posts. The majority of the class is discussion-based. She provides extremely good feedback and brings a passion to that class that makes it that much more enjoyable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Class is discussion based, analysing thr text you read outside of class. Lots of writing assignments, but if you show up to class and pay attention theyre not too hard. If youre not into Shakespeare, probably not a hood fit for you. Very good at helping when struggling with material. Wonderful person, very genuine.

Wonderful professor! For my course attendance was mandatory, but I looked forward to going every day because her in class discussions were so fun and interesting. The themes analyzed in class will help you write your assigned papers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Classes could be a bit boring at times but workshopping time was really helpful. She didn't give us any grades until after the term had ended so it was a bit difficult to tell where you were at grades wise. As long as you participate and give good feedback on other peoples essays you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She taught us different ways to write a non-fiction piece. We had easy assignments (I don't write a lot and don't like it so yes it was easy) due for class and she didn't grade them. As long as you participated in class and gave feedback to your group members and showed improvements its an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I had her for Shakespeare in the Age of Elizabeth. She is a very interesting and  engaging lecturer.  She even took our class to see a play! The reading can be a bit much sometimes. ( 5 plays in 7 weeks). She  also gives  1 page essayresponses  about once a week, two 4-page essays, and a final exam. She is really fun! Take this course!
Very nice person by gives lots of reading to do. Don't think it is a 1000 level class considering the workload is a bit high.

Great teacher with a clear love for what she does. Her Shakespeare class was a blast - lots of hands-on activities, including acting out scenes. We got to go and see a show, too. She asks a lot from her students - expect at least one essay every week - but rewards them well for it. The class is pretty easy if you pay attention and manage your time.

took Creative Writing: Short Story. Great class! We read a lot of short stories and had to write a lot. We had some interesting discussions in class, so be prepared to speak up, because that is a big part of your final grade.

Took Lit. of Sin with her. She grades papers pretty hard, but class participation was 30% of grade so as long as you show up and talk your grade shouldn't be too bad in this class. Probably one of the only english classes I have enjoyed at WPI, she is a very engaging speaker. Also let me turn in a paper two weeks late , very accommodating.
Interesting, inspiring, good LOR. I wrote what is perhaps my greatest literary achievement as one of ehr homework assignments. AND she's willing to take class outside on a sunny day.

She is a very engaging teacher and clearly interested in the subject (Shakespeare). Lectures are mostly discussion based and get pretty deep. Grading on papers was pretty harsh but she scales at the end of the term so don't worry about your grade. Overall, she is pretty hard but a good teacher.
Can you say grading on a curve?  Not terribly hard but without fail, there'd be an a or two, a couple c's and pretty much b's for everyone else.
Way too many books for a 7 week term.  Not enough time to discuss.  The end of term is very rushed.  Very helpful, answers most questions well.
Great professor... She is hott too!... As long as you do the reading and keep up with your papers, this class is fun. The discussions in class can get really good too.

Very awesome teacher!  really cares about how students feel and willing to help out any time.  she is wicked cool and very clear.  willing to hear any point of view and if you get confused while talking in class she will help you out not embarrass you.  deffinetly a top proff

Shakespeare class was full of discussion and fun to participate in.  A strict but fair grader on essays and an awesome teacher to have to transition you from highschool style to college style writing.

The class itself was not overly bad but can become very hard if you are bad at interpreting Shakespeare. If you listen and participate, a good grade is possible although it can be very hard to stay awake. Plus I think she hated me....
Sometimes its boring, but over all she explains things well
Her class was awesome. And with homework/papers, she was more than willing to give help to those students who wanted it. She's a great professor.
Elements of Writing...more work than Prof. Code but not bad. Kinda fun and flexible?

This class was actually fun! The assignments were pretty awesome (this is the only class I can think of where I can write about anime and video games) and overall you learn a lot. She is very fair and it's an easy A or B if you put in the time to revise!!

Wilkes is really passionate about the material. We stopped following the syllabus about halfway through the course. He recommends really good books and seems to be interested in French post-modern philosophy. He also looks like Milton from Office Space.

Syllabus is a disaster and he will often surprise the class with a due date or ask for essays in class that he has never mentioned before nor put on the syllabus. He is a great guy though and the class material is really interesting and he certainly is interested in the subject that he's teaching.

Clarity is limited and tends to ramble on and on. His notes are abysmal and incomprehensible. Although he is a very polite and knowledgeable professor, it's hard to say that you will go through this class knowing what is expected from you. Attendance, participation, and a decent amount of effort will not shy you from a good grade. Not recommended.

Interesting but tends to ramble on without making a point.  Assignments are easy but long-winded and repetitive.  Don't bother asking for help; you'll spend 20 minutes talking to him and later realize that he didn't tell you a single thing.

Took a course and IQP with him. His course was quite interesting , but he thinks everyone always has free time for his plans. Prepare to do some after class things for him. Don't EVER have him as an IQP advisor though. He changes the scope and topic every other week and you never get anything done. Had to change advisors just to get some work done
He is very long winded and hardly ever had a point

He is like a little princess inside the castle. Isolating from the outside world. He does not want to hear your tale on the reality. He will pick whatever sounds good to him, and fill in the rest with his imaginary truth. Then come back to hurt you!

DO NOT, I repeat-DO NOT do your IQP with him.  He draws everything out, never has anything corrected on time, is terribly disorganized, and frustrating.  If it was up to him you would be doing an IQP for the whole 4 years you were there.  What you accomplish with him in 3 terms in his roundabout ways could be done in 1 week.  AVOID HIM!
Has a reputation among professors and students as not being the sharpest knife in the drawer.  I would say that is a vast understatement. He was a constant irritation.
Just go to class every day and almost guarunteed a B.  You don't have to put in much effort at all.

ARG. He is completely unclear on all assignments. When asked about assignments/due dates/material due his clarifications often included excessive use of the word "UM" and "Uh" and dont clarify anything. Only credit he gets is giving out mostly As and Bs for putting up with him

Whatever you do, DO NOT choose this guy as your IQP professor.  I spent 2 years on my IQP, and had my MQP done before this guy accepted my groups.  I don't even want to imagine what his classes are like.
Worst class...
Avoid embarking on one of his many IQPs at all costs.
Two words: Milton Waddams.

Don't start a project with him... DON'T.  It'll never end.  You'll think you're gonna do something fun, then he'll change it every meeting and the only way to deal is to sit back and let him talk.. and talk.. and talk...  ARG!  And NEVER go in a long car ride with him.

I have him for IQP... likes to hear himself talk A LOT, isn't a very good writer (which is surprising... since he's a SS prof...), disagrees with work you've done quite often which can get very frustrating... I can go on and on.

extremely confusing and unclear. when you ask a question he goes off on something completely different and isn't very clear about what the assignments are.  I managed to get an A anyway so i guess he doesn't grade too hard
Very unorganized and unclear in his lessons.
Check out this guys office if you have the chance.  Its the messiest room I've ever seen.  Looks like it is all going to topple over and kill him.
Looks like Milton from Officespace....about as organized.  Means well, easy A, but *snoooze*
horrible syllabus; very unorganized.  but good subject matter
Thougt provoking class - bad syllabus
Great person to talk to, but not that great as a teacher
Very confusing, syllabus is useless when its passed out
Too much homework & boring lecture

Great professor and learned a lot from her. Her class is fun and she is a nice person, just go and talk to her if you have any concerns, easy A class if you attend and pay the effort in the project. She is little confusing about the syllabus but all is good most of the class passed with an A

Professor expected a lot from students. The homework was posted on Friday and due Sunday night so unless you checked regularly you had no idea a homework had been assigned. The tests were extremely hard and didn't cover material that was in the homeworks directly.

Honestly, terrible. This was the first class I have ever wanted to walk out on because the content and organization were just atrocious. I have the utmost faith that she is intelligent and she is trying to make the course 'interesting', but she is straying from the focus: automotive materials and process design. Also, ridiculous homework.

Very helpful in office hours, when I took statics homework wasn't mandatory and by doing the examples in the powerpoints I did well in the class. She provides good examples and explains them in detail, but just like any other class, go to office hours if you don't understand something!

Made material seem much harder than it is. Hours of homework per night that doesn't count at all and can only hurt you. Tests are long and worth %50 percent of your grade each. Teaches solely from powerpoints and lacks full examples.
She was my advisor for my graduate studies.  She is great, genuine and interesting.  I found her supportive.

WORST TEACHER EVER. Stupid amounts of HW. The material for the class was easy but she made it seem harder. I would have done better on the 5 questions that our entire grade was on without taking the class.
There is a very heavy workload which will not count towards your final grade, but you have to do the homework or you cannot take the tests, which are each 50% of your grade.
Spent most of our class time talking about beer.
I really liked her, if you show interest in the subject and make an honest effort it's hard not to get a B or better.  She's reallt nice too.

horrible teacher you can put the time into the class and still do poorly because she picks bad problems for the exam.  She could not figure one of hte problems out on the board after an exam.  Also blames students for poor test score never thinks that there could possibly be a problem with the way that she grades/teaches/picks problems

TERRIBLE Professor.  Had a new spot to drop-off homework about once a week (never in lecture).  Extremely unhelpful.  When asked in class to elaborate on topics, rather than doing problems out she would click backwards on her slideshow of material copied directly from the book and try to set the world's new land-speed record for mouse clicking.

the worst professor i've had so far. was so unhelpful. her favorite line was "email the TAs" and she won't answer your emails and get mad because you sent them. takes forever to return the exams and was not clear on what she wanted on the exam(took pts off if you didn't have an actual section dedicated for strategy) awful teacher
very bad, takes forever to grade exams, one of the worst professors at WPI, she does nothing

WORST TEACHER IVE HAD AT THIS SCHOOL!  I got a 71 on the first exam when I got everything right.  Do things her way or no way.  Gives a ton of homework, then doesnt even take the time to grade it, (only grades 30% but you still have to do all of it because if you fail three you fail the class). Just reads off slides from the book.  Nothing good.

She can be easy, if you're lucky enough to understand her testing, though no matter what the first one is unfair. It's all out of the book but you definetely learn. She has an ok opinion on helping students go but comparatively she is lazy.
She used power point slides with pictures right out of the book, lots of hw, not very nice
Grades on personal relationship, not numerical score.
Very Easy Class...Extra Point on final grade for every 100 homework...and her tests were very simple
yeah she pretty much sucks, i mean if you study you'll do fine but she's not a good teacher. she doesnt care about students much.
Limited office hours, very unclear, 1 TA for like 200 students, seemingly arbitrary final grade
No Comments
bad.. yea.. bad..
No Comments
Show up to classes, you won't even open the textbook. Ask questions during lectures and he'll find ways to give you an A. Tests and HW's are straight-forward. Definitely would recommend.
He's just great

Worst professor I have had so far.  Spent hours on each homework assignment only to learn the material the day after it was due.  For tests you had to teach yourself from homework solutions released less than 24 hours before the exam.

Controls - Half of the class was ME/AE, but concepts were only ECE. Very tough exams. He gave us a massive 3 page problem straight out of the book. Class is boring. Only good thing, if you go talk to him before exams, he tends to fill you in with what might be coming.

Coming from a person who got an A in Signals I--I'm just lost. I've attended every lecture. Read every chapter. I even invested in a different textbook. I am now confident that the problem does not lie with me. Stabbing a board with chalk and saying "It's easy, no?" does not constitute teaching. I'm fed up with Prof. Hakim. I just want what I pay f
Really takes a personal interest in his students.
Can't understand a word he says. No partial credit for exams.

Excellent professor.  Has a passion for teaching and for his field.  He is a really nice guy who will bend over backwards to help you, but you have to show some initiative.  Interesting lectures, good organization, good class.
The homwwork is very hard but the tests are really easy.  If you care about your grade and learning you will easily ace the class.

poorly organized course. He can't provide clear explanations for anything, nor did he provide enough examples. The material shouldn't have been this hard. I'm sure I'll forget everything in a few days.

He is Senor Salsa! Cares way too much about his ballroom dance team than ECE... Its ridiculous. I wouldnt recommend Hakim if you had a choice. His exams suck (4 problems, very little partial credit)...Has an eerie resemblance to Saddam, just without a mustache

Not a BAD teacher.  Helpful if you go to talk to him, lectures...eh.  His HW's are way harder than the test which is how it is supposed to be, Helpsessions are a must.  Over all...nice guy, ok for signals 2.

He accussed me (and 11 others) of cheating; I have never in my life!  This meant that I either accepted the consequenes or waited six months to try and prove to the campus hearing board that I didn't cheat.  He had no proof and it was my word against his.

HORRIBLE AS HELL. This guy had the nerve to cut a whole whole week of lecture, and make it a 6-week class. We learned only half the stuff Ted Clancy taught 2 terms earlier. Did not prepare us at all for ee3801. Teaching skills are nil.
Topics and concepts are tough but he does a good job.

He understand that signals is a hard topic, so while he may give very challenging homeworks, examples on the tests are easier, and he curves the tests. I also found lecture very helpful, since the book was a complete abortion.
great guy, always willing to help and makes a hard class much easier if you go and pay attention

He is a smart guy,minimally hard to understand for a guy w/ an accent, signals is a hard class and he makes it better with review sessions before tests. and cheet sheets are life savers - he allows them.
This class drew out my hatred for signals. I didn't go to lectures toward the end of the term because it was too painful.
Curves waaaay up, and his review sessions are life-savers.  Homework is MUCH harder than the tests.
His lectures are almost nothing.
Confused on the material 90% of the time...
No Comments
Could have been a little more understanding
Teaches in theorems. Gives way too much homework. Easy tests and quizzes, but you'll be confused on the final a bit. Do NOT take her class if you didn't take calculus at all in high school.

Took Calc 1 and 2 with her freshmen year first semester. Does not cover all the material in class. Checks attendance sometimes, but not sure how she used it for grading. Very easy quizzes and exams, but homework grading is total BS. Very nice lady, yet not the most interesting one for sure. Take her class only if you know the material already.
Easy teacher if you have basic knowledge of the course before taking it otherwise may be difficult to understand her notes considering she teaches by theorems

Poor teacher. All she will ever write on the board is a theorem and then proof. Very few examples in class and simply cannot explain math concepts. Test are not bad but she grades very hard taking away many points for simple math errors. only take class if you enjoy teaching yourself.

She takes attendance for the first week and never does it again. She's a very easy teacher only to be balanced out by the fact that she can't explain math if he life depended on it. Overall, take the class for it's easiness especially if you've done calc before.

Relatively easy course. Not a very good teacher, makes errors frequently and seems to be confused a lot. Quizzes are easy. I got a B because of the final, so just study enough and you should be fine if you take her class.
Had to teach myself everything. Not clear in explaining things and boring. Nice woman, but bad teacher.

If you like teaching yourself 100% of course material, then sign right up for any of prof. tashjians classes. she rants on and on in lectures and barely covers material on tests, and she usually uses conferences for quizzes instead of homework review. I did fine in this course but was NOT impressed.

She is very nice as others have said, but her lectures are very boring and slow. You cover everything you need to know for the final and her tests and quizzes are easy. If you take her class, you will learn math just fine, but be very bored (and sleep a lot) in the process. Overall I would recommend her if you're looking for an easy A.

She might not be the most interesting teacher, but she's a very nice person. She covers the material and it's really easy to get an A. Her quizzes and tests are easy, and she's pretty nice too. She just gets a little boring, but she doesn't really mindd if you sleep in class so it doesn't matter.
She's really nice and very understanding, but she can't keep a captive audience most of the time. Extremely helpful though and tries very hard to have her students do well.
She is really nice and helpful. Very pleasant and sweet. Wonderful lady and teacher. Easy class! Yes!

had her for 1021 and 2621  she is always right and knows what she is doing she has a passion for math,  she takes attendance sometimes, her classes are soo friggin easy if u fail it ur fault and not hers  she is helpful whenever u ask her and very clear  but she is very boring (prolly cuz its math)   and she blinks alot  wink wink ;)

Really easy class. Sure, she does randomly burst out into laughter, and she does go a bit slow, but overall good. Learned well enough in just the lectures (no office hours or anything) to get the quizzes done in ~5 min and the tests in ~20 min. Quizzes and tests are straightforward and cover the material taught in class.

she es by far the WORST teacher i've had in my life. she just rambles on in her lectures and has no idea the class doesnt no what she's talking about. she gives homeworks for the same date on exams that have nothing to do with the test!! she's useless, crazy and just not worth it. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Not a bad professor.. easy to understand. Though grades her exams a bit unfairly. In one instance, I went too far with my answer and gave her more than she asked for, but I still gave her the answer she was looking for. Didn't get any credit for the problem. Decent overall though.

She genuinely wants her students to learn is a very nice lady. She does tend to move slowly, but this can be advantageous if you aren't good at math. Take home quizzes and graded homeworks help your grade.
TERRIBLE. BEWARE. not going to repeat other comments as I agree whole-heartidly.

I don't know what all you guys are talking about, but I took her this year for Calc 1, and she was amazing.  Although she did teach slowly, it seems that we learned more from it.  I feel bad I couldn't take Gloria's class again.  (I thought her twitches and insane laughter were amusing!) Many of my friends switched into her class, and they love it.

WOW... DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER!! She was once teaching about infinate series and using a chocolate bar as an analogy... she just stopped and broke out in hysterical laughter... She's crazy and uses conference for more lecture... AVOID HER
No Comments

DO NOT GET THIS PROF! She teaches slow, so she needs to steal your conference time to use for lecturing. As a result, we did not go over a single homework problem the entire term. HW is basically a take  home quiz, since you have no room for error on it. She also confuses herself easily.
Very boring professor, just stands in front of class and repeats herself way to many times. She also has this twitch when she looks at you that gives me a headache.

Soooo boring. She offers no class participation, she just lectures and rights exsactly what she's saying on the board. She also does really easy exsaples in class that don't help once you get to the HW.
At Worcester Polytechnic University Professor Vick was my favorite she was awesome and I highly recommend diving into her classes you will learn lots and have a great time . Thank you Susan.
As long as she thinks you tried you're getting an A in the course. By far the easiest way to finish off your humanities credits at this school.

This was a great class. The standard routine was to read a play, and then there would be a group presentation (pretty casual) and discussion about it next class. She gets off topic fairly often and tells interesting stories. The final project is very open in that you get to focus on one aspect of any of the plays that have been studied.

The class is easy. She believes in grade inflation. Show up and talk. She's opinionated and dramatic, but she respects her students and their opinions, treats us like adults. She spends 1/3 of class telling stories about herself. The plays are fun, VARIED, and sometimes raunchy. Do whatever you want for the project. You must attend all the plays.
Very light and small, yet fun, discussion-based class. The Theatre Studies reading is a little heavy but that only lasts for two weeks. Plan your 10 hours of "lab" work. Do not miss class.
Very quirky and funny. Favorite class of the semester was her intro to drama class. A lot of fun

Took the intro to drama class. Very, very nice lady and very passionate about theatre. Just make sure you go to her classes and even tho you have no relevance with drama before, I guarantee you will have fun with her. Only negative thing is that she makes you work in her plays in Little Theatre.
great teacher, loves her job, and easily sidetracked, yet somehow manages to teach us. definitely suggest taking one of her classes, but don't piss her off. just do the work
Best class of term for me.  Get into it if you can.
Challenges students in unique ways to think. Loved the class.
Cool, great class open to many ideas
Loves what she does.  First two weeks are hell for homework.  Very spontaneous, doesn't stay on one topic very long.
She is crazy!!  She only yells, can't speak in a normal voice.  Loves her own work, and that's about it.  I dreaded going to her class.
An amazing teacher for an amazing class. But it's not a walk in the park, you have to be commited.
Cool, scarey person, really knows the field and VERY into what she does
In Class she is very smug and is very very into herself. But when you get to know her outside of class like in theater or in personal meeting(which are assigned in class) she is pretty nice.
smart and funny
No Comments
No Comments
Susan's great and the class is fun but you don't want to be on her bad side...
fair and demanding
SUSAN ROCKS!
No Comments
Scary at first, but cool

He is not a kind person. No grading rubric, manually grades all of your assignments based on what final grade he thinks you deserve in the class. Impossible to reach over email and gave me a C because I missed some classes and he was upset. No late assignment policy but will dock points regardless.

Bianchi was a good IQP advisor. Was fairly sociable, especially about music. Enjoyed listening to his stories/advice even if unrelated to our project. At times, it felt that he was not as involved with our project as other advisors, and some students did not care for him.

the course is project based with assignments that change each week. You can make the projects as easy or tough as you want. It depends on how much you want to put into the course. Bianchi doesn't really lecture, he just comes in , sits in front of the class and talks (sometimes for quiet a while) like he's having a conversation with you. Good prof.
Excellent class and would recommend it anyone interested in working on interesting ideas. Bianchi is a great professor and totally cool!!!!

Completely confusing mess of a professor. There is no background requirements for the class yet it ended up being full of CS majors who already knew what they were doing. Don't take unless you are familiar with programming or MAX program. Exams are easy even if you don't know what is going on (mult. choice on canvas).

He's definitely out there. I had him for an IQP advisor and I saw a lot of other groups struggling with him not really *grasping* their project and then giving them unhelpful feedback or impossible tasks. But, to my knowledge everyone came out with an A. He doesn't care about the report, but is adamant about the final presentation.
had a good experience with professor in puerto rico for two months. he's pretty calm, lots of ideas, in the end lets you figureout things on your own. not to tough on grades, cool, really experienced

if you have him for iqp, be prepared for him to spend your PQP going over unrealistic scenarios in his attempt to bring "creativity" to your IQP. he's a great man but he is not helpful when it comes to writing a 100 page IQP report
One of the most influential men at WPI. His class didn't change my life, but it came close. Amazing lecturer, experienced musician, legendary man. I want my kids to look like him.

Cons: you can't really solve grade-related problems with him. he doesn't reply to emails.     Pros: for everything else, Best professor. WPI is very lucky to have him. So successful in life and so intellectual. You can listen to him 10 hours without getting bored...
Great professor.  Take every class you can get into with him.  Work is interesting and stimulating and it's only once a week.  lectures usually don't last full 3 hours.
Very engaging lecturer. Gives tough assignments but helps you do them. Very easy with grading. One of the best professors I've ever had.
the guy can give a three hour lecture without ever looking at any notes!!  Great class .......
Awesome guy. Always glad to talk to you. Doesn't matter what he is teaching just take it, it will be fun.
Extremely nice man, whenever you need help he is always more than willing to do so.

He worked with me to figure out the project, was fun to work with, and showed a willingness to adapt.  He was hard to find at times, and often was away from campus for many days at a time, but it worked out in the end.  A great time and I'd do it all again.
