Very knowledgable, class is very discussion based.  It sometimes seems like discussions go nowhere, because you can't really argue with him, since he knows he is always right, but they are interesting anyway.  Look up a bio on him some time, he's done a lot of cool stuff.
like to talk, sometimes has a hard time keeping the class on track. but i couldn't say this is a bad thing. is often away from class, it seems.
The man.  Easy to understand.  Fun classes.
Everyone was right ... this guy is a genius!
Very good professor. Easy to understand; makes sure you know what he is talking about.
Great professor - really easy course - very knowledgable man
Nice guy, Fun music classes.
great teacher
cool guy
best teacher i've ever had!
Coolest guy in North America
Cool & nice guy
Best teacher at WPI ever!
Cool teacher
Super Hot dude
Excellent teacher
Simply the Best
Best Teach ever!! De Man
Cool guy! Great Teacher
Very good teacher. Excellent math
best teacher ever
Excellent Prof!!! made me love Financial Math
No Comments
No Comments
how about no scott
Absolutly horrible, I have to teach myself this whole class from the book
I never go to class anymore. It's rediculous. You won't learn anything from him.
DO NOT GO TO CLASS if you have this guy. You will keep yourself smarter that way
cant talk or write, wears same clothes everyday
Worst professor i've had at WPI so far... He can't speak clearly. He mumbles
Can't speak clearly or write on board.
No Comments

The professor refuses to use Canvas. He also does not allow computers or phones to be used in his classroom. He expected people to have printed the syllabus that he sent via email, rather than open it on their computers. Within the first hour, 3 students left. Do not take his classes.

The professor spent the first 15-30 minutes saying that he would not accept any excuse for lateness. As somebody who had to travel across campus, that didn't work for me. His quizzes would be given in the first 3 minutes, and if you missed them or the final, that was too bad. He acts like his is the only class that matters in a tech school.

Quizzes were randomly given. We weren't encouraged to ask about grades because he'd "think lesser of us." Information about the midterm or final was given two days before the date. Writing persuasive essay was worth 50% of the midterm (25%) and final (50%) and we never went over it. Only take if you're confident in writing and analyzing poetry.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Does not use any online platform like canvas to communicate with class. Little outside assignments. No feedback on the pop quizzes. No way of viewing our grade until it is finalized. Makes it difficult to do well in the class. A quarter of our grade was based on an essay in the final that we never went over in class or were taught how to write.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: There is a lot of reading and the lectures aren't very substantive but the class is fun and prof is very nice

He's a great teacher when it comes to reading poetry and understanding the structure and theme of it, But he never taught how to understand the form of poems but rather instead just gave us the vocabulary we needed to know on how to describe it.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: EN1242 was a very easy and interesting course and I really enjoyed it. 2242, however, involved reading about 200 pages per week, and you can't skip a class because there are two quizzes every class on the reading from the previous class. Prof. Brattin is a fair grader and a very nice man overall, as long as you don't mind reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Brattin was great. The class involves a lot of reading, as you might expect from a literature course. The reading consumes a lot of time, and if you don't read everything in the book's assignment you are likely to miss a question on the 5 question quizzes he gives every hour of the 2 hour class. The papers were not difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I saw his RateMyProfessors page before taking this class and thought it was exaggeration- I was wrong. Very smart, but scripts his lectures and reads from a paper during class (2hrs). Assigns a ton of reading and essays on the same reading due on the same day, which would be fine, but he only gives us 3 days to do both. I did a lot of skimming...
He scripts each class. Brings in a little collapsible lectern and reads off of his script. Rarely, if ever, strays from it. I was not impressed.

The novels had potential for great discussions, particularly about social themes. But classes were 2hr lectures, which consisted of him relating the things that happened in each reading ( 100pg), with no depth, just the facts. I was disappointed and very bored. Don't recommend to anyone looking for in class analysis or conversation. Wrote 3 essays
Incredibly picky and specific. It's nearly impossible to get an A. He seems incredibly stuck up and gives quizzes the second that class begins... Every class. Not worth taking any class he teaches

Assumes you can read between the lineS, when you take hiS advice He dOcks you for it. he is on a power trip for being a humanities professor at an engineering schooL. Effort is disregarded. obsession with hendrix is ridiculous. i had him 3 years ago and already graduated, that shows what i think

Very unreasonable with his assignments, +70 pages a night for reading, for at least one book. Summarizes the chapters without any in-depth discussion, then assigns an in-depth essay. He didn't seem to play favorites, but he is VERY self absorbed. Just stay away from this guy.
This guy is unreasonable in his assignments, and has favorites that he grades the rest of the class against, he SUCKS
stay away
Pretty unreasonable, unfair
A LOT of reading. I didn't think he chose favorites, which he is rumored to do. Graded fairly.
This guy knows Hendrix better then his mom did. How could he be a bad prof?
He wants to be British so much it hurts.

Course material was fascinating.  He does seem to favor a few kids, but I always thought I was graded fairly, and I don't think he particularly liked me.  A little bit hung-up on himself, as well.  We don't care about your new CD!
read 3 hours a night, every night for the entire term, eventually went insane...
An excellent teacher.  One of the best I've had here.
**** picks favorites and those who aren't chosen are damned

Head of Department and Exceptional professor. Gives the lecture at a very good pace with appropriate pauses to consume tougher concepts. Once earlier concepts are learned in lectures and homework he will pick up the pace and skip steps, but if you learned the earlier material you will not get lost. I got a lot out of this class! Can't go wrong.
Best ECE professor at WPI for analog. Lectures are extremely good and have some real world out of textbook stuff.

Exams are very similar to practice exams (at least one question of 3 is the same). Homework is due once a week and doesn't take more than a few hours to finish. Nice guy and very invested in his teaching quality.

Very good professor. His lectures are great and he is pretty humorous. His assigned homework and exams are difficult. The labs are straightforward and easy and although the labs are not worth a lot (20% or so) toward your average, it is a large factor in determining your final grade. Show him you grasp the material if you don't test well.
Great Professor

Good in lectures but his tests are the most unfair thing you'll take. No matter how much you try, every question on the test will be curve ball from what you've studied. His HW is unbelievably long as well as the prelabs. Tries to cover way too much material. Only gives two hours a week for office time... I would avoid if you could.

Love this professor, but the material is very difficult. You'll have to pay attention in class, but he makes it worth it.  His explanations are crystal-clear, and he has a very good drive for helping students out. He's very modest, and has a killer sense of humor to boot. Definitely try to take at least one class with him if you're doing ECE.

It is definitely not a hard class. He will go over all the basics and explain the hard part several times in class. He also uploads his clean notes online every time, so you can always catch up. Homework and exams are not impossible if you understand the material. The professor organizes the class really well.
Good professor. Very straight forward. But NOT an easy A. He will curve so that just a few get an A. Start working from the beginning of the term and you should be fine.
Great professor, he knows the material and equally important knows how to convey the material, with good, clear explanations and analogies.

Excellent professor. He wants you to know the material very well. He is also very clear and friendly (and funny). Go to class, pay attention and go to his office hours (all the time) and you should be able to get a B.
The material is pretty difficult and so are the exams but he organizes the class very well and he is one of the best professors I have ever had.
Best Professor at WPI. Work is hard but Prof. McNeill makes it easy to learn the material with great examples and organized notes
So organized, even when he taught an experimental class. Would recommend.

I have had the privilege of having Professor McNeill for ECE3204, ECE4904, ECE4902, and my MQP next year. He's a genius or close to it. Has a great sense of humor. You will remember most of the material from his classes. Highly recommended!!
Excellent professor!
Nice professor, and he is hot
No comments - I think he's the best ECE professor ever at WPI.

Professor McNeill inspires his students to do well and is one of the best in his field (Analog). GO TO help sessions as you will learn a lot more than you might in the course and he's a great guy to talk to and has an excellent sense of humor as well :-D

Great.  His lectures are always interesting and well organized.  He was able to give a thorough and helpful answer to any question that arose.  His tests are challenging, and I strongly suggest you go to all his help sessions.  Overally, he's just a great guy to learn from.

Prof. McNeill is nationally recognized in the field of Analog IC design, and is simply too good of a teacher. Exams are a bit challenging if you dont prepare well and understand the concepts behind the formulas. Excellent help sessions and overall great professor.
Great teacher.  Notes are clear and detailed but his test are challenging.  Very conceptual, must understand how to apply the theory.
cool guy..great sense of humor and really helpful both during class and outside. Exams are really easy and I'll be surprised if anybody NRs this course!
McNeill was a good professor, very thorough on everything that he went through, the first test is cake, and the last two are difficult.  Managed an A in the class.

Amazing at teaching the concepts and making sure students understand the material. However the class is very very time consuming and a heavy work load with exams, long problem sets, and a large group project worth 30% of grade.

She is a super kind and caring professor. She absolutely knows what's she's talking about, and she is willing to provide extra help whenever. Her term project is due before midterm, and the majority of your grade is two exams. If you're not prepared for the exam, you will not do well. She's an amazing professor, but she expects you to do the work.

Wodin Schwartz is just a great prof. She knows the material like the back of her hand and she is extremely good at putting it up on slides and writing problems out live in front of you. She KNOWS how to teach very well. The group projects aren't unreasonable and are very doable. She is understanding, caring, and makes herself available.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: NOTE: Her teaching style does not work for everyone. For me, it was awful. She requires everyone to watch 8-10min of videos before class that explain a topic, then uses class time to do examples only. She does no lecturing or teaching in class, only example problems. I can't learn by video, I need in person teaching, so I barely learned anything.
The professor is really really organized and class material was so easy to access, and she was always willing to help. Great professor!

Sarah is one of the BEST professors I've had so far at WPI. She is very organized and provides a ton of resources for students struggling with the material. We had a term-long group project of 6 people which was challenging/time consuming, but she gave great feedback and made herself available to help us whenever necessary. Good class atmosphere!

Prof. Wodin-Schwartz is incredibly kind and caring but does expect students to work. Her lectures are phenomenal and obviously much work went into them. Anyone can succeed in this class if they come to lecture, pay attention, and try on the homework. The group project is only difficult if you are unorganized and don't even bother to ask for help

Overall, really nice professor that is passionate about the topic. The term project is very intensive, so be prepared for that. Tests are reasonable, homework is tough, but it prepares you. She is very nit-picky about homework and formatting, pushes you to work hard in every way.

It is indescribable for me to express how much I hated her class. **Absurd** amount of work, based around impossibly graded problem sets, and a *term long, 6person* group project that *easily* takes up 1/2 your time for the class, but is only 30% of grade. *Easily* the worst professor I've ever had, and worst class I've taken in my academic career.

Great professor! Extremely clear during lectures, lecture notes are posted. The notes are really helpful, I still go back to them sometimes even after the course. Always happy to help and accessible outside class. She absolutely loves teaching. The term project is a bit more work but it's mostly applications for things taught in the lectures.

Very passionate about engineering and the course she teaches. Tries to go above and beyond connecting what you learn in class to the real world which sometimes results in very difficult homework and group project assignments but she is very helpful if you go to office hours. Tests aren't easy but shes a reasonable grader and will curve is needed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GROUP PROJECTS--Tests are tough

comment: I had her for ES1310, which had a lot of homework and labs but it prepares you well for the Solidworks Certification, which you take as the final. The PLAs are better at Solidworks but shes a great person
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I've taken her before. She really wants the students to learn, especially in office hours. She invented labs for this course (which are half-baked but fun). Weekly homeworks are time intensive, nit-picky, and harder than the tests. MathCad software is buggy but optional (usually). The core material's really useful after college though.

Prof Wodin Schwartz is a great professor! She is engaging and makes the material interesting to learn. There was, however, quite a bit of work outside class. Always encroaching deadlines for homework/lab reports. I would definitely recommend her as a professor!

Wodin-Schwartz is one of my favorite professors here! It was her first time teaching Statics but she did a great job! If you go to office hours and do extra credit, she'll remember you and you'll get a good grade. She also tries to make some things hands-on to really make sure her students know what is going on.
She bought us Pizza and gave me an A, will be taking her again.
Learning the subject as she teaches. Be prepared to watch YouTube videos and ask a lot of questions from the PLAs. She is worthless as a teacher, but nice as a person.

Best Professor I've had. She's a fair grader and gives you all the resources needed to do well. Makes lectures interesting and fun. Was very good at conveying tough concepts  to the class through demonstrations and examples (and food!). Can't say enough about this professor. Take her if you can.
She made a potentially very boring class extremely entertaining. My favorite professor I've had so far

It's like HS. She's really easy, brings food in, and the labs are short. No lecture homework. I'm not sure this is why I'm going to college ($$$$$). Very nice person, but I learned more from the tutors who are students.

She's really nice and tries really hard to make lectures fun. Brings in snacks. Labs and homework are not long and quite easy. Easy grader. Lets you take the CSWA exam, which is useful I guess.  Overall easy A class.

She's new to WPI and it shows. She tries, but fails to have engaging lectures and labs. In lab, she sits in the back with the PLAs. No book. All YouTube videos and web links. I can do this myself. First time teaching ES-1310 and it shows. Nice person, poor instructor.

She's new and had some bugs to work out in the class, but was a fabulous teacher. Explanations were clear and office hours were extremely helpful. Was a really fair grader and obviously wanted students to learn and be able to apply skills, not regurgitate. Had some good extra credit opportunities. A really great person and would highly recommend.

She's new to WPI, so she takes feedback from students. Her lectures are clear and interesting, and she tries to engage the class with good powerpoints and objects to pass around. 3 tests per term, HW twice a week (graded on completion) but she plans to cut back. Grades come back quick and fair but cryptic.

J.J. is a super understanding prof! After the midterm exam, I went to his office hours and he gave me the option to fix a couple of problems to earn back credit, because I was not satisfied with my grade.

Even though he has the accent, it is not hard to follow him in lecture. You don't have to turn in homework, but he still assigns homework (less than 10 Qs). Quizzes are held during conference, and problems are very similar to those in homework. Exams won't be hard as long as yo do the homework and read lecture notes regularly.

I found his class quite difficult but I partially blame that on the way calculus was taught at my high school. His lectures were very difficult to follow and his writing was very hard to see unless you sat in the front row. Having said this, he is very kind and accommodating and will be glad to help you if you ever ask . He is a funny guy too.

The worst. He made up policies on the spot and changed the whole course around without properly notifying anyone. He changed the grade system on the midterm as a result I went from above the class to below the class. I sent him an email to figure out the changes and instead he gave me a passive aggressive email in response. 0/10 Wouldn't take again

JJ is a nice person and a great professor, I got both A in MA1023 and MA1024. Optional homework but all the quizzes and exams are based on homework. If you know everything in homework, you will get an A. Grading: 2 exams(70%) 5 quizzes(20%, will drop the lowest one) and lab(10%). Some people say he have accent, but it actually not a big deal.

JJ is the classiest math professor i have had at wpi. I had him for calc 3 and 4 and i got an A in both. He's a funny guy, not the best at English. Do the homework because all of his problems on the midterm, final and quizzes are from the homework. He will make you smile during lecture too. Everyone claps for him at the last lecture.

The class was rather easy. Most of the class stopped attending his lectures after the first  2 weeks of class since he isn't helpful in lecture. He got upset though that people stopped coming to class and made the tests super hard and gave out extra credit to those who showed up. If you don't understand him, READ THE BOOK. It's more clear than him.

His lectures are confusing, because he has an accent,  uses poor grammar, and doesn't EXPLAIN things well. He knows the material, but he doesn't teach it clearly. He made up the grading system as he went along. Literally. Tests are pulled from the homework, he doesn't even change the numbers, and they cover sporadic topics. I don't recommend him!

He's a great teacher and you can tell he understands what he is doing but (maybe it's just me) I felt like there was a gap in what he expected us to know and what the course said we should know. also, very fast paced.

There are only two tests but the questions on them are based entirely on homework problems. Homework is optional but necessary. JJ can be a bit difficult to understand with his accent but he writes down everything he says on the board

There are homework but are not graded. Quizzes and exams are straightforward and related to homework. Easy first exam but tough second exam. Will curve the exam scores but not the final grade.  JJ's accent is a little hard to hear. He gives good examples in his lectures. Awesome guy overall.  Do the work and you can get an A
Easy A if you attend class. Also, JJ's a pretty chill guy and gives bonus points questions in the exams. The only issue I had was that he didn't allow a cheat sheet for the exam. Otherwise, top noch
Amazing professor! He is the best in math department! I would definitely take this course again!
Amazing professor! He is the best in math department!
Very clear when going over homework questions, and exams are based directly on homework. Seems like he cares a lot for his students. Homework is optional, but there is no reason to not do it.
old huang is a remarkable teacher. i would highly suggest his class.

A lot of material covered, but he goes through everything thoroughly with lots of examples. When the class doesn't do well on a test he is happy to give extra credit. Nice guy. If you go the class and do the homework you'll pass.

Lectures present the material in an easy to understand way, much more so than the book. Repeats the easy stuff, but doesn't explain the hard stuff quite enough. Some of the example problems in lecture were so long that I was lost by the end of them. Tests are not too difficult, although some of the grading can be overly specific. Would recommend.

He's fine. Go to lecture and he'll explain everything. When a scheduling snafu messed with our lab project, he just gave everyone 100 because it wasn't our fault. :) He doesn't have a terribly high standard for grading, or for what we learn. The really hard stuff is unlikely to be on the test. He's reasonable, but he won't push or challenge you.
Despite his accent, he is an excellent teacher.

JJ(as he likes to be called) is very helpful. He is always willing to stay after class to answer any questions. Moreover, he tells us what to expect on the tests and so far as you attend lectures and do you homework, you can pretty much get an A.

Ugh, I NR'd this class, not because I don't understand the concepts of the material, but because his final way too hard. I did the homework, and never skipped class.  As a lecturer, Huang is pretty clear and repetitive, but as another user pointed out, will often be repetitive about the easy things and completely skim over the important bits.
He is very helpful and easy on grade. His only downside is that his English is not clear. I can't understand his lecturing and have to read the text book to know what the class is about.
Get ready to meet Professor Claypool and his amazing Dragonfly game engine! You will learn C++ in this class and you will learn a lot!

Mark is a fantastic professor, and the school is lucky to have him as the director of IMGD program.  He is very enthusiastic about game education and does a great job of sharing that with his students.  I also have him as an advisor and he gives great advice both about classes and general stuff.

If you have the energy to keep up with him, you can learn a lot. He talks far too quickly and paces across the room a lot. If you ask questions, they better be intelligent ones. The OS course is flawed in that the classes do not teach you what you need to know to do the homework. Classes are theory. You're expected to practice without help!
I was not very impressed, he was not very clear even though he he really wanted to help student. The projects were a bit hard and we did not get very mnuch help for it. Didn;t really like the class.
Good teacher, knows his****. Remembers kids years after they leave school. Awesome MQP advisor.

Talks WAY too fast to understand.  Gave no hints as to where to look in the kernel to do our projects, makign them insanely difficult, and the TA's would just laugh at you.  Passed but took it again with another teacher to understand it better.
good class, but talks to fast
I had him for two classes, and he is an amazing professor, best CS guy at wpi!
He is not "Playcool"..awesome Prof.
It's like taking a class from the Micro Machines guy!

Claypool is a fine professor, but the work he assigns assumes you have absolutely no life outside of class... and that's just to squeek by with a C... "Sorry class, I didn't realize how hard the project was...but it's still due tomorrow. " So if
Woot!

Haha, this guy is awesome! Yes, he talks VERY fast, but if you don't understand something, he is incredibly helpful. Reading the textbook will also be very beneficial, too. Oh yeah, and he plays Warcraft III! ^_^
Nice enough guy, knows what he's talking about, but he talks waaayyy too fast. Homework, tests and projects are unclear/poorly explained.
He talks fast, but he knows what he's talking about.
Challenging class, but Mark is an awesome teacher and extremely intelligent.
Not too bad
Packs a 2 hour lecture into 1 by talking twice as fast
Very enthusiastic.  His projects are quite challenging but fun and effective
a very good, but tough professor.  slacking will get you an NR
For 3 days.  Talks very fast.  However, very bright and energetic. Great teacher
Great Prof.  Asks a lot if you don't know C and Unix, but you learn a lot.
Great Professor. Course work can be tough if you suck at C and Linux.

His lectures are great, material is taught in a way where I actually liked the class for a while. But, the absurd group homework policy and grading made me hate it. great art skills tho
UPDATE: turns out he scales the total grade, so I ended with an 80 but recieved an A (Yay!). Still don't like the homework policy. But still great lectures.

This man looks like he went through a midlife crisis deciding whether to be an artist or math teacher. He explains and draws things really well in lecture. His grading policy is outrageous. Homework is done in random groups where accuracy greatly matters! Half of the homework grade is all or nothing. His tests are hard, lots of analytical thinking.

He is a great lecturer, however, the group homework=bad. You are put in randomly assigned groups and given weekly homework sets that you must complete separately, then meet up with your group and turn in one set of final answers. These problems were extremely challenging and 8 out of the 10-11 questions were all or no credit, easily tanking grades.

Sam is the man! Lectures were clear and the exams reflected what we learned in class. The tests are long but he curves it greatly. Homework was long and done with groups which was hard at times. But it was great practice and he was always able to help out in office hours.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Calculus classes with professor Walcott, while difficult, are overall pretty decent. His teaching style is definitely unconventional but you will definitely learn the material. Expect lectures to be mostly focused on derivation of concepts. The tests are curved heavily but make sure you do all the optional book problems to adequately prepare.
Very nice guy who didn't give any unnecessary work. Expert drawing skills. Watch the lectures on 4x speed though.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Phenomenal attic. Loved the phone notifications. Recommend watching lectures on 2 times speed.
Tests are just like the lecture material for the most part.

Prof. Walcott is a nice guy. His lecture is really clear and his homework/worksheets/tests are all well written but really hard so you might need to spend some time on it. If you utilize the Piazza and discussion part well, you will understand everything. I don't know why other people hate him a lot but he is one of the best professor so far.

So I NRed this class. Twice. So I took a calc summer class to make up for it. I am already done with my online summer class for calc and I finished with a 100 in the class. There is no reason whatsoever that this guy makes his classes so hard, seeing as I obviously understand calc well. And yet I failed his class. Twice. Avoid him at all costs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I have taken two classes with this professor. I have passed zero. I put so much time and effort into this past calc class that I almost did not pass my physics class, and I love physics. The mental toll this professor takes is just too much to put into words. If you ever have this professor, I am so very sorry.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: GET THIS GUY OUT OF WPI. Tests are so not representative of what was taught in class, so not WPI style. We learn together and help each other learn and studying with classmates in this class just made us all psychotic because we didn't know what to study. Let's hope I don't have to take this class for a third time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Good person, however, he may not be the best professor. He definitely will not change his methods of teaching even when most of the class is failing. He makes the exams hard, but do expect a scale of around 30 extra points. You have to put in a lot of time and effort in learning the materials. Homework groups, and no extra help in conference.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Samuel. What a guy. There are simply no words. I hope I never come into contact with him again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Walcott's classes are nightmarish. His ways of teaching and testing obviously do not work but he refuses to listen to student feedback, make any changes, or even admit that there is something abnormal about the fact that test averages are consistently around (or lower than!) 30 percent. I recommend avoiding his classes at all costs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Imagine giving out exams, worth 75% of the overall grade, and having the average score be roughly 30/100. Samuel Walcott doesn't have to imagine. If I NR another class with him after spending over 8 hours a week watching khan academy on top of his lectures, all I can say is he should owe me some tuition money.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Expects you to learn everything in your homework groups and no one else know what's going on in the class. He changes all the problems so it's not even actual calculus, it's a damn english class. 75% of the grade in his class is based on two exams that are ridiculously hard without any prep exam. Only class I didn't get an A. Really poor Professor.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: His teaching and testing methods just dont work. Homework is impossibly hard (even the TAs dont know how to do it) and test averages are around 20-30%. He doesnt curve well. He refuses to listen to feedback from students and insists that his methods have been proven to work in some study he did at his old school. Worst class Ive ever taken.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I highly recommend avoiding this professor. This is the second class I have taken with him, in neither class I have understood anything. He fully expects most of the class to fail his tests. Over all this class is not worth your time and tuition.

Tests are impossible. The average grades for his two tests tend to be < 30. No one knows what is going on. You can't get help in conference from the TA. HW is done in groups and is ridiculous. Avoid this professor, he does not listen to students whats so ever, he won't change the way he teaches no matter how many students are failing and confused

He cares a lot about his students and what we're learning. But, he is extremely different from other professors. 75% of grade in his class are based on two exams without practice exams for. He doesn't teach you calculus, he tries to teach you what calculus is and says learn it yourself. All hw is in groups. I had to fight for just a B in his class

Walcott decided that, based off of around 50% his calc 2 class in B term failing, that he would use the same exact teaching methods that caused those people to fail, in calc 3. He will go on tangents about how his teaching method is "proven to work", while ignoring all of his students struggling to keep a passing grade at all. Wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This man said if we got a 50% on his test then we would get an A. He also said that we would not finish the test in time. Oh and the average grade was a 28%. He doesnt let the TAs help you in conference instead he makes them give you a work sheet. He gets extremely mad if you question his teaching methods or if you ask for more examples.

Probably should take the fact that less than a quarter of the students in his class show up on normal lecture days as an indication of how good of a professor he is. Overly nitpicky with projects, masochist when it comes to homework, degrades students at every point he can. Just stopped showing up towards the end.
Homework assignment for every single class, assumes you know lots of kinematics already. Wish I hadn't taken the class
Guy doesn't know what he's talking about and still somehow talks down to students. I didn't learn a thing from him.

This professor has no respect for his students. He thinks that all of the students that don't meet his expectations will become garbage collectors in the future. BFI, is his motto and it stands for Brute Force and Ignorance, it supposed to mock those who do things wrong in his class. I think it is fittings as he is very ignorant.
Just does not want to be there. Putting in the time.
No help at all. Thinks he knows everything. Do not talk any class with this teacher.

I took ME 4322 with him and he is a good teacher. He speaks really fast at times and sometimes yells a bit. He is a nice person though. As long as you do your work, you will be fine. Quite a reasonable person and grader.

Excellent professor. If he knows what he's talking about he can explain it very well. If he doesn't, he will try to BS his way through. Extremely easy grader as I got A+ or A++ on most of my projects and papers (though we worked really hard on them) would recommend him to everyone. WPI better keep this guy.

Do your work and you will get an A.  If you don't understand what to do ask him in class and he will tell you (even during the class where it is due).  He grades very lightly so don't worry about it you will probibly do fine.

He likes to do this thing where he jumps up and grabs thin air.  He's a crazy man, but awfully understandable.  He wants to make sure you get it and calibrates his class accordingly.  Homework is really reasonable.
Really helpful guy, ES1310 was not very hard, if you attend all the labs and periodically attend lectures you will get an A

practical teacher, gives ALOT of real life examples (mainly on jets) you will learn, I enjoyed the class. he will go out of his way to help if you ask him to and he always says "there is no such thing as a foolish question"
Pretty good professor. Wasn't too clear about some assignments, but was an easy grader.
Absolutely awesome!! He really cares about his students.  Great at explaining and he makes sure your understand before you leave his class.  Awesome professor!!

Was not too clear with the assignments.  Everything got out of control at the time of plotting all the assignments.  he just would not understand all the problems we had and had to struggle to get a good grade

Wonderful professor, interesting class. Very understandable, and if the class doesn't get something will take the time to go over it again in a different way. Brought examples of gears, cams, etc. in to show the class. Projects were interesting and not too much work to complete in the time allotted (about 2 weeks a project). I love this proffessor!
It's an ok class. He doesn't always make his point clear though.

He's a good guy, always easy to interact with. At the beginning of the term I think he was trying to play hardass, but that didn't last long (except for some of the freshmen.) Labs are basically there for the Prof and TA's to hold your hand.
Very entertaining teacher.  Lectures can be kind of boring, but the labs are pretty fun.  Very approachable and always willing to help.
Very entertaining guy. Makes material easy to understand. A kid at heart who likes toys and gadgets.
CAD GOD

Very manic-depressive. Kind of knows what he's talking about, but teaches by making you think he's the Pro/E god. He teaches the easy class ok, but I doubt he'd be any help at all with tougher stuff. Sometimes has frightening outbursts, but sometimes whis
Not the easiest Prof, but you can learn a lot from him!

Solid professor. Structure of his class is great, he starts with basic concepts and gives a good understanding before building it, before you know it you're using 3 basic skills in a bigger one you actually understand. Practice midterm and final are almost carbon copies of the actual exams. STUDY practice exams, and you'll do well on the real ones.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Not my favorite by far. The way he taught was not clicking with me, by far worst Calc prof so far.
Prof. Zhuang had very clear grading criteria and his tests were very easy (almost identical to practice tests). However, he doesn't do a great job at explaining some of the concepts in Calc 3
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Is not the most sociable teacher was very grumpy for 8am, he has an accent that can be difficult to understand. Midterm, final were worth 30%, 35% respectively. Felt well prepared for both tests, yet did poorly because time spent in lectures didn't correlate to what was on the test. Highly recommend Calc 1 if you come from a non-test heavy school.

Had Zhuang for MA 1022 and he did a great job. I always appreciated his sense of humor. He seems to have improved drastically from what other ratings described him to be like. Although it was never an issue to me, sometimes it is difficult to understand what he is saying. However, you can just see what he is writing and you should be fine.

Can be a little hard to understand him, but he tries his best and genuinely cares about his students.  homework prepares for your test and the practice exams are basically the same type of questions so nothing is unexpected.

He was great and super accessible outside of class. He talks pretty fast and does cold-call students if no one is answering. He does post the necessary questions in a pdf for the homework so you don't really need to get the textbook. Overall the class was pretty easy and i would absolutely take a class with Professor Zhuang again.

This professor is a great teacher. Quizzes and midterm are the same as the practice for them so it is v worthwhile to do those. He really values participation in class, but its not required. He will post pictures of the textbook problems so you don't need to get it. Only downside is the final was worth 35% and the midterm was 30% of the final grade
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Zhuang was good at teaching calculus. He understands it very well and can communicate the information well.

Not a bad professor, but may not work for everyone. Class is tough with only a precalculus background and a lot of the time he goes on tangents that dont make sense. If you have taken HS calculus you would probably be fine.

His class is either really easy or impossible, depending on a few things. If you already have a conceptual understanding of what he is teaching, or can just understand arbitrary algebra, it all makes sense, but he never explains the conceptual parts himself. The quizzes/midterm are really easy, but the quizzes and final are most of the grade.

Professor zhaung has improved a lot since his first term. He is very caring and looks to do better every class! Professor gives feedback forms to students and does his best to set his students up for success.

I had him for 1021, and he has improved so much. He's very kind and is great at teaching. After taking the final, I can say that he prepped us well. Attend lectures, practice for quizzes, do HW, and also do extra credit when given! It pays off! His accent is fine, and he uses a mic so he's understandable. Also posts all the notes and vids.

He definitely improved a lot this term. He wants students to pass his class and tries to get the class involved with participation. He even posts practice sets on canvas (with answers) so students can review material. Great professor overall. Some people have a bit of trouble with his accent, but I had no problem with it.
Professor Zhang has gotten really better and wants his students to do well. He is caring and explains things in a good manner.

This man has completely changed his teaching dynamic. He writes on the chalkboard in very legible writing, gives us small quizzes for some extra points, and has introduced himself and has learned our names. He cares a lot about us and wants us to do well. The difficulty rating has nothing to do with him, but with the course itself. Took 1021 prev.
caring professor. takes his time to explain and wants students to learn. A little hard to understand his accent but he is trying his best

He was new to WPI and was a little unorganized at first, but got better as the term went on. He goes very fast and it was hard to understand his lectures sometimes, but if you read the textbook and go to MASH, you should be fine. Very minimal homework and didn't have any tests other than the midterm and final. Was generous with grading on exams.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: It is evident that he cares about his students. We had minimal homework, 10 textbook, and 5-7 WeBWork problems. He wants us to succeed, and gave opportunities for reworks, late submissions, and extra credit. He was also very generous with points on the midterm, and always admits when he makes mistakes. Overall not a bad class at all.
Seems like a nice guy but extremely hard to understand and doesn't know the material. Midterm was 5 times harder than other calc classes.
New professor. caring person and trying his best. Do your work and study outside of class and its an okay class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Look, he is a new professor here, and has a very thick accent. But, day by day it gets more and more easy to understand him. He is obviously very smart, gives students the opportunity to answer questions, and he wants his students to succeed. If you take notes, participate, and do your own work outside of class as well, you'll be fine! I promise.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: This was his first year teaching, and his pacing is way off. His lectures are nearly incomprehensible due to his lack of elaboration, tendency to rush through topics, and heavy accent. I'm a week and a half in, and he has not once taken attendance in his lectures. Not very personable either, hasn't yet introduced himself to the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: The WORST

Avoid her, don't even think of taking her. Taking her class was the worst decision of my college experience so far. Her lectures are very confusing and she teach the materials really fast; a little too fast.  She is a very unfair grader( she takes points off for everything). even if you do all the hw you might still fail because of her grading.

Clear requirements, grade is based on weekly quizzes, a midterm, and a final.  Weekly quizzes are exactly like the optional homework problems and exact quiz problems were often reviewed in conference.  Also very helpful in office hours.  However, she is soft spoken and has trouble controlling the class.

Gives a midterm, a final, and weekly quizzes, all made of hw problems from the textbook. If you can do the hw without help, you'll be ok. She has trouble controlling a large class, and if the mike dies only the first row can hear. If you don't understand, ask questions. Otherwise she'll just keep going. But her explanations are better the 2nd time.

Lectures are very confusing. Learning happened entirely from friends, or in conference and that is if you have a well prepared TA. Final grade was calculated from quizzes and 2 exams. Both quizzes and exams are based on homework problems.

the grade is based ENTIRELY on exams and quizzes. She doesn't let you make up quizzes but will drop the lowest grade automatically for everyone. So if you have a legit excuses to miss a quiz, you'll be forced to get a zero in it and therefore drop it. Rostami herself is an immensely boring lecturer and confused everyone with complicating everything

I think she doesn't understand what is she doing or she is just too bad at teaching. It couldn't be more confusing for such an easy material. She doesn't grade the HW and the grade is based on quizzes and exams. Exams and quizzes together are like 70% OF the grade.
Does not grade homework, grade is based off 2 tests and quizzes

She was very disorganized. The fact that I did my homework and went to class regularly, and didn't do so well on the tests is what frustrates me. Being that it is her first time teaching a large class(aprox. 150 students), Rostami failed to explain things thoroughly, mostly depending on her TA's to explain in conference.

Fantastic math prof. for calc sequence. Do not be afraid of Calc 3 if you have Rostami! Great structure for class, no required hw but quiz problems are just like them. Helpful at office hours and over email too, always wanted to help. If you try, she won't let you fail.

If you are willing the put in the work and do her optional homework every night, her class is very fair.  All quizzes and tests are problems from the homework.  She is always willing to help during office hours or other scheduled times.
Homework is usually "optional" but the quiz and exam problems are very similar. Spend a couple hours the night before the exam and you can get good grades. Super nice Proff.

Professor Rostami is a great professor. She is fair in all her assessments and explains the topics very well. Her homework is optional, but she pulls homework problems for the quizzes and tests. Calc 3 can be difficult, but if you do the work her class should not be hard to pass. She also gives a few partner quizzes on especially difficult topics.
She's ok. I don't like her teaching too much.
Professor is awesome! She takes the time to help you understand. The tests are a breeze if you do the homework regurlarly. Really easy grader as well.

Awesome professor! Minghao is funny and a great teacher! Homework isn't graded but highly recommended. All quizzes (one a week) and tests (midterm and final) were based on homework problems. As long as you go to lectures, do the homework, and study you will do well. She also dropped the lowest quiz grade. I loved her and wish I had her again!

Very clear explanations and very helpful. Homework, quizzes, and exams are all from the book, so studying is easy. She genuinely cares about students' learning. One of the best math professors at WPI.

Excellent professor. Very clear with explanations. The quizzes and exams cover exactly the kind of material as the assigned homework. She is very willing to help students to. I strongly recommend taking Calc 4 with her.

Good Explanations and very thorough. Just need to do 3 things for an easy A.  Step 1 Go to lecture and listen. Step 2 do the homework which usually is under 30 minutes Step 3 Understand how to do the homework( quizzes and test problem are either exactly from homework or with slight tweaks)
Explain everything really clear!!! Excellent teacher!
Excellent teacher, explains the material very well and has weekly quizzes similar to the homework given. Very open to helping students at any time and with any problem asked.

Awesome teacher!! She explains everything super clearly! Although she is new, she does a much better job than some of the older professors. She is ALWAYS there to help you even if you miss the office hours. GREAT teacher!!

Most of his lecture is based on throwing equations based on different topics with very little explanation outside of it. For in class examples, he rarely used actual numbers and stuck to variables, which was confusing. Tests are 75% of the grade so be ready ahead of time.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Overall pretty good prof, he is very variable-heavy in lectures so sometimes it can be hard to understand. He is a very nice guy and really wants to help people learn the material. He always wants you to ask questions and will use his own time to help you learn.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Mathisen is your average engineering prof. The workload itself isn't too bad, and the exams are doable and fairly graded. The big downside would be he isn't very organized and his notes are very difficult to read. It's a big frustrating that he doesn't always solve out examples with numbers, just variables. His assignments can be a bit unclear too.

Don't do it. You'll spend more time trying to understand his handwriting and his inability to solve most equations without adding random variables to make his answers right than you will spend learning. Just don't. Don't hecking do it.

Lectures are a joke, Mathisen struggles to convey even the simplest concept. He stumbles through examples, does not come prepared to teach the class, and ended up confusing me almost every class. I would avoid him at all costs for this class and all others. That being said, he is a good dude and the tests were not too difficult.
Awesome professor, very caring, he did a huge favor for me that no one else would do it. I wish I can take more classes with him

Awesome guy, but sometimes gets a bad rep because he teaches such a hard class. He knows the material really well and really wants to help those who are struggling, just go to his office hours. Would strongly recommend.

I would recommend taking this class with another professor if possible. Lectures are unclear, and examples are poorly explained. The Wiley Plus system used in for HW/Practice problems is terrible. Prepare to teach yourself if you take this class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: he's not good at explaining concepts, he def knows what he's trying to say but can't get it out. He often makes mistakes in his notes that he relies on the students to catch
The class was pretty tough and the professor wasn't really great at explaining the concepts. His examples were good but it was hard to follow his work and handwriting.

Extremely hard to follow in class, constantly makes mistakes in his speech and stumbles over words and has terrible handwriting and drawings, is terrible at keeping clear variables and constantly changes what different variables mean. Notes are near impossible to completely follow.

Very nice guy who teaches a very hard class. Exams are a lot similar to HW, tho. So if you understand the HW, you should be fine. A big chunk of the grade is based on exams. So make sure you don't mess that up. Go to his office hours. He's eager to help

Tests were really easy. Professor uses lots of examples in class that don't always work out for him. Seems to stumble over his words during lecture, makes some mistakes. If find homework to be manageable, then you should get an A.
He taught the course pushing to understanding the concepts of fluid mechanics. His HW and tests was fairly easy. Recommend him for this class
Tests are not difficult, and homework isn't too bad. Lecturing skills are poor as he lacks clarity and makes mistakes during examples.

Amazing guy, amazing professor. He really cares about his students and knows the material really well. He prepares you well for the exams and has peaked my interest in fluids with his clear passion for it

Extremely nice guy, very approachable! Very helpful 1 on 1, but tends to get off track in lectures. He uses lots of physical examples in class which is great and a lot of fun to watch. Homework was more difficult than quizzes and the quizzes almost always followed his review sessions. Would recommend

Although he can be a bit disorganized at times, he really knows the material and explains it well.  He is very approachable and will help clear up any problems you are having.  His projects always have real-world applications and the field trips are a great experience.
Teaches too much theory in class. Doesn't really teach you how to approach the problems that you will be given on homework and tests.
Professor Mathisen's teaching is passable, organisational skills are not. Inter-personal skills are excellent.
Very helpful professor. Strongly recommended
Mathisen is just a great guy.
No Comments

Favorite humanities professor at WPI. Bit of a grandad telling stories about history vibe, which is amazing. He gives a lot to read as homework but overall the courses he teaches are not that difficult. If you like history and listening to a guy who knows a ton about it, take his classes. I took HI2315 with him as well.

Hanlan is a great lecturer and very easy to learn from in class, the bulk of the difficulty comes from the sheer volume of nightly work. Average of 30-50 pages a night and a typed report due the next day. I hope you like reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --So many papers

comment: He's a knowledgeable guy with plenty of historical stories. I had his class entirely online, so there were 4 book outlines and 2 essays. I had no major problems with him, but his lectures were dull at times. He's an easy grader, and it's an easy A if you pay attention during lectures and connect ideas from them to the books/ prompts.
History through film is one of the easiest, most fun class I've had at WPI. I would recommend this to anyone taking their inquiry seminar
Participation based class so attendance matters. Nightly readings followed by nightly papers. Very mundane though not difficult. Very funny commentary during class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Hanlan is a great lecturer, he keeps you interested in the material and even makes you excited to read the assignment for next class. Be prepared to read every night. The reading assignments will vary from 20 pages a night to as much as 100. You have to come to class with a one-page 'essay.'  I say 'essay' because it's a single page. Great teacher!

Kept my interest in lectures and quizzes were fair.  Tests required a lot less critical thinking than most engineers are used to and more memorization.  The provided study guides were very helpful.  We did a considerable amount of reading that we were quizzed on, so it was important to read the whole thing.  Overall, I really enjoyed this class.

Decently engaging lectures. Two midterms. For the first one, I didn't use his study guides and very barely passed, relying just on my notes (after extra credit). However, for the second one, I prepared with his study guides and got a perfect score. Success is based on memorizing; alright class, but not a lot of critical thinking needed to get an A.

Good professor. He's clear in lectures and kept my attention. I was never bored in class. You have to read 5 books outside of class throughout the term for this class, but there is no homework other than that. Exams are pretty easy as long as you take good notes and study. Gives some extra credit.

Awesome teacher. Although is a little biased at times (liberal) he really knows his stuff and the way he says things makes you remember them. History is usually boring but he makes it interesting, also he is pretty funny too haha. Definitely take a history class with him.

This guy is the best teacher I have had here at WPI. He makes his classes laugh with his impressions of the people he's talking about, and adds little amusing facts. The reading is strenuous, but it gets better as the term goes on. Take his class.

Very good teacher overall. I like how he puts his powerpoints online before the actual class. He is very helpful if you go to talk to him and you can tell he knows his stuff. Fair class overall, but a lot of reading.

Professor Hanlan was a good teacher. His tests were fairly easy and very straight forward. He offered a lot of extra credit. There was, however, a lot of reading for his class. A little spacey at points, but a good teacher in the end.
Very funny.  Makes the class very easy and enjoyable.
He hates Republicans.
Definatley the man. Missed a few lectures, told me what I needed to do to catch up in no time.

Excellent professor. Uses powerpoint very effectively. Makes the class fly by with his insightful interpretation of the material in question. He is in no way politically biased when he teaches the class. Overall, one of the best humanities professors here

Great class, well taught and it was one of the only classes where I didn't have the urge to fall asleep.  He also knows how to use Power Point very effectively.  Tests were easy if you did your studying.
great for a relitively easy class.   the projects are the hardest part, and are not to be taken lightly.  overall, great guy. ANd, i had him for a semester in PLC 2 so, what that means to you, ok.
Easy teacher, dont need to read for class discussion, tons of extra credit available
Easy tests, interesting lectures, easy papers, don't have to read books for discussions, extra credit available
Extremely unorganized! You should hve seen his office (if you manage to find it)

She's rude to her students and gives a lot of homework. She's strict about grading, and you have to buy a $90 art kit or else you NR the class. She gives DQ's to ensure that you triple check how it's submitted  her way, and even if you forget to capitalize one letter or word and accidently submit it as true you will NR the class.

Disagree with lower-rated reviews. She is a great professor. Grade based on a points system. Need 120 for A; 165 total to choose from by end of term. Each assignment worth a different number of points. She doesn't take away points. I finished with an A by end of Week 6 to free up week 7 for other classes' final exams. Do all early assignments. GLHF
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: She has been one of the really good teachers I have met. She has been very caring and understanding throughout the course. She gave us extra time if needed. She never forced her personal opinion on us but gave suggestions. She has been very flexible and accessible to all the students throughout the course whenever we needed help!

Friendly and approachable. She makes me better at drawing and more confident at it as well. I would say shes a tough grader and stressed a lot of photographing your drawing correctly (there are assignments that I had to submit 5 times before she marked it as completed). She definitely is more lenient if you are a beginner though.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I really hate art, and I also suck at it so I'm not sure what compelled me to take this class. However, I really want to stress that in addition to grading fairly, being easy to talk to, that Professor Keller actually will make you better at art. I started with stick figures in this class, and ended with semi-decent pastel drawings!

The professor is terrible. I strongly suggest you all NOT to take any of her class. I got a 87% average before my final project submission. However, she gave me zero point on this project just because it was in wrong format, which resulted in a loss of 10 points, and a C for the final grade. Irresponsible, not understanding and mean.
Keller is a wonderful and friendly art professor. Her grading can be harsh but if you follow the rubrics given for each assignment you will do well. Not an overwhelming about of work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you have her for an art teacher try to switch. I took her for essentials of art where she took off points for the way I see color...I would recommend just going straight to AR1101. Marie Kellers class is a waist of time. I would spend 4 hours on just one art piece. If you're taking this class, be prepared to spend a lot of time on her homework.

I like art and I dreaded going to this class. The focus is on techniques, materials, and  making realistic images rather than creativity. Do not take unless you are decent at art AND are willing to put in many hours for one drawing. Assignments are repetitive and boring. Art kit is expensive and overkill. SKIP straight to 1101 or other AR courses.

She's a little eccentric which I guess can be expected from an art teacher. She's very particular about her assignments and goes into a lot of detail explaining things which can sometimes be tedious. I would only suggest taking this course for an A if you're decent at art and are willing to put in some effort because she can be a tough grader.

Hard grader, didn't give much feedback on the work. Homework is time consuming. Gave time each class to practice the techniques discussed, and walked around to check on our progress. Would sometimes make a comment or two. The required art kit is $120, no way to get around it. Classes were enjoyable, but grading/feedback aspect was a bit stressful

Pretty easy class in terms of the workload, attendance is mandatory but homework is optional. However, if you want an A, don't take this class, there are 4 graded assignments and it's nearly impossible to score above a B on any one

Although this class was a nice break from my normal studies the mandatory art kit was super expensive. Also she ONLY GIVES OUT B's. So, if you don't mind getting a B go ahead and take it. Almost impossible to get an A. She's a really harsh grader but doesn't have any guidelines or rubric on what to do. I wouldn't recommend this class to a friend.

Yes, she does require a lot of work but she's more than happy to help you if you're struggling with any assignment. This may seem somewhat overwhelming at first, but as long as you don't procrastinate until the last minute you should be fine. Have to purchase an expensive art kit but worth it. Fun class if you're genuinely interested in arts.
easily the worst and most unfair class I have taken. You get a B if you do what is expected of you, and you get an A if you go above an beyond. There is a lot of work and she is a VERY harsh grader.

An expensive art kit was necessary ($120) but used every class. She was a very harsh grader. The class was a lot of effort, which required at least 10 drawings due within 4 weeks from the start of the class. I personally wouldn't recommend this class to a friend.

This class is one hundred percent about progression. You can be the worst artist ever, and at first the class will feel impossible, but soon you'll realize all the professor cares about is you doing assignments and trying to improve. I got really sick, and she helped me make up drawings and let me work with her to finish.

If you don't have much experience with drawing, please do not take this class with her, unless you never care your GPA at all. And if you think you are an expert at art, you won't gain progression after done this class.Period. However, if you are a nut on drawing, ignore this comment.

Good Professor. For me not being very talented in Art, she grades on progression more than pure talent. I enjoyed the class and it was a nice break from my Calculus and Physics class. Only gripe about the class was the expensive art kit she requires for the class. I recommend taking the class.

Excellent instruction. Even students who had never taken an art course understood her assignments. A bit slow-paced for those who have taken an art class before, but still a very good fundamentals class.

Fun class! It's a nice break in the style of homework (not like math problems or homework sets) but does require some effort. Very easy if you keep up with the work but if you put it off there is some crunch time pushing out drawings. Take the class!

Great professor in my opinion. The class isn't hard, but it does require some time to get all the projects and assignments done (daily drawings). She usually assigns two drawings a week that could be anything you want. And on top of that...she assigns a project (one every week). It really isn't that difficult, and I definitely enjoyed the class.

Marie is the new art professor, teaching "Essentials of Art".  She has a LOT of experience which is clear from her portfolio.  In class she's really...eccentric, but in a good way?  To some she may seem flaky, to others she may seem adorable.  Grading was kind of harsh.

The only grades in the class will be exams, and refuses to curve exams. The range of exam grades for my CH 1020 class were between a 4% and a 100% (really only people who took AP Chem are passing). No lecture slides, and does not use a textbook, most of lecture is doing problems instead of teaching concepts. Doesn't seem to care how students do.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The RMP reviews for Kaminski are outdated. He really wasn't that bad of a professor. I took him in D term 2024 and finished the class with an A+. My biggest piece of advice is to do the worksheets he gives you. It wasn't uncommon to see the exact same problem (with the same numbers!) on an exam, so if you do the homework you get free exam points.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures are very helpful and the exams are pretty much exactly what he will tell to you review, however, they are extremely long and he will only give the topics the day before. Grades based entirely on exams that are too long for anyone to finish. Content wasn't super difficult but the course structure was the worst.
He will not curve any test. The only grades for this course are tests and you can easily NR. No grades for homework or anything else that will help you pass.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The only grades are your exams and the exams are graded based on full points only, no partial credit, it's basically impossible to succeed in his class.

I LOVED THIS CLASS. I had Kaminski for Thermodynamics and I understood EVERY SINGLE THING he taught (which literally never happens in any other class). He is so good at explaining everything in detail. The lectures have their dull moments but overall he is very interesting (if you enjoy chemistry). Such a great prof. Homeworks took hours though.

Professor Kaminski is a GREAT professor, he provides thorough explanations of the material as well as additional resources and several sheets of practice problems to make sure students are prepared for exams. He broke down the course into 4 sections, which made it easier to memorize and work through course material. He is also very kind and helpful
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: To be honest, I blame myself for failing the class. However, Prof. Kaminski knows what he's talking about in class, it's just really hard to pay attention during his lectures. He's always willing to answer questions and you can tell he tries his best. However, no one can seem to finish the tests. It's not their impossible, it just takes so long.

Class average for the second exam was a 52. Solution was to "scale" by 2 points and offer "extra-credit" on the next exam when the problem is no one can finish. Professor discourages questions and speaks condescendingly. Class average is a C-, which he says is "where it should be". Avoid if possible
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: As the term draws to a close, Kaminski gets worse and worse. It's clear now that he couldn't care less about students doing well in his class. Does not hold office hours, instead you have to talk to him after class and then he'll simply tell you to try harder because there's nothing he can do. absolutely awful. worst professor I've ever had.

No partial credit on anything, and it's clear he doesn't even review his tests before he prints them. Tests are not a test of skill but rather how much you can get done and still get an A. At least the labs for this class are well designed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: this class is composed of only 4 exam grades which are worth 75% of the grade, plus your lab grade as the other 25%. class average for our first exam was a 74% and for the second was a 52%. Exams are way harder than example problems and almost no one finishes in the time given. If he doesn't curve the final grades I doubt anyone can score a B.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He does a lot of in-class examples and gives a ton of partial credit on exams and on homework. Honestly, if you do all of the homework and understand what you're doing, you'll do well on the exams and in the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He wasn't a bad professor. Gave clear explanations of he concepts. Does plenty of examples to get you prepared for each exam. Each exam is reasonable. It's annoying that his office is at Gateway and he's not the most personable professor. Overall is great for chem 4

He was by far one of the worst professors I have had so far. He doesn't explain concepts very well or give good explanations when questions are asked. Fortunately, the concepts are easy enough to teach yourself for this class and the exams aren't hard.
one of the most confusing teachers ive ever had. he only does practice problems instead of teaching us how to do the concepts first. always has an interesting shirt and tie color combo though

Kaminski was apathetic and harsh. He even refused to answer a students on topic question during a Q&A portion of the class. The Homework was different than the material covered in class and the tests almost impossible The average test grade for a test in my class was a 58 and the median was the same. Students even complained to the department head.

Worst teacher I have ever had at WPI. Literally could not care less about students, discourages questions in class with a snobby, indignant attitude, makes the simplest things mad confusing, gives terrible explanations. Get out before he fails you.
He does example problems to death and if you attend lecture and understand those problems, his tests are very easy.
He doesn't care about anything pertaining to the class and won't help you whether you are interested in the subject material or not. He shouldn't be teaching!

I attended every class with this man. He is very disorganized and DOES NOT care about his students. If I didn't need to take this class again to graduate, I would never ever take another class with this man.
Well organized professor however not the most interesting. Tests are well composed. No required HW, attendance recommended. One criticism is that he doesn't really care about students.

Dr Morgan is very professional and teaches her students very well, she genuinely wants to help her students achieve good grades and good career success. As a person, she is kind , generous, and great as well.
Dr. Morgan is a very nice professor and exams were very similar to review guides given. Material was not too challenging either

She teaches at Seton Hill now, but she is very sweet and really cares for her students! She wants everyone to do good in chemistry and understand it fairly easily. There are quizzes approximately each week in the class, but nothing crazy. Exams typically dont have many problems to them, and she is very helpful during exams. 100% recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Morgan teaches at Seton Hill now. She is an amazing person, though her class is hard. She takes the time to explain things that confuse you. Read the book before class (the class is heavily self-learning and she highlights key topics). Super kind and supportive prof! Would recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Morgan is an amazing professor and mentor. She absolutely cares about her students and is a true sweetheart. I take her fundamentals of chemistry class. Very easy to access out of class. She loves to teach and help you out when you are struggling. Would recommend her if you have the chance to.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She didn't know what she's talking about, says the exact opposite of the textbook, if you went off the textbook you would get things wrong on the test, do what she says and you'll pass but you're screwed for next semester chemistry

Not a very good lecturer, she went too fast and made several mistakes that the students had to correct her on. Exams are fairly difficult. As a lab professor, however, she was willing to help you go through every step of the experiment and came back around to make sure you were on track.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She seemed to not understand the material that she was teaching. If you have to take chem with her the book is a better study option than her lectures because she frequently presents information incorrectly the first few times. She was not at her own office hours the first 2 times I tried to go. Tests are hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She makes a lot of errors in her problems. If you go talk to her and aren't rude, she will give you a few points back. One on one is sometimes helpful, but I would not recommend scheduling an appointment because she will no show.

Super sweet woman, chemistry is a hard subject and the class isn't easy. Her tests were hard and the test questions were much harder versions of examples in class. If you go to her office hours and do the work for the class, you will do well. She will go out of her way to help you through the class, she really cares about her students.

She cares about her students, understands the material, but struggles w/ delivering her message in class. Tends to make mistakes during lecture w/ what she says and what she writes on the board, making it difficult to understand. HW isn't bad but it doesn't always apply to the test & the tests aren't always true to what she says will be on them.

Professor Morgan is a caring professor! She makes some mistakes when writing problems on the board but that's more of just writing mistakes, she definitely knows the material. GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS. She explains things you're stuck on in depth and holds review sessions before tests. It was a tough class for someone with no chem background, study!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: The lecture is fine and she really cares about her student. Sure she makes mistakes but they are corrected. Her tests are more than fair and I would gladly take the class again if she taught it.

She makes a lot of mistakes when doing problems in lecture and forgets how to do the problems pretty often. Assign readings and expect you to know everything from textbook. Gives relatively helpful quizzes before exam. The problems on the exams are normally covered in class and not so complicated.

Honestly it's just sad. She gives factually wrong answers and information, and when the class calls her out she tries to prove that she was right by telling them to "do it themselves". How she becomes a professor in Chem is beyond me.
Professor Morgan cares for her students. She struggled explaining sig figs, but she corrected herself 5 minutes after. Her office hours are amazing and she even helped us with the lab exam.

It seems people love her or hate her, I personally thought she was a good professor.  I agree with the fact that you did need to have some chemistry background to be successful.  Very accessible and excellent during office hours.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Morgan is a very sweet lady. However, I do not recommend taking her class. She struggles with public speaking, and it was not unusual for her lectures to be factually inaccurate.  We were also behind the other classes in subject matter learned, and because of that I am behind in CH1020. Beware if you do not have an AP background.

Professor Morgan is a kind and caring professor. She cares for her students and wants them to succeed. Her lectures can sometimes be confusing. However, going to her office hours or pre-exam review sessions will help A LOT! SMASH and independent studying is highly recommended to do well in the class.

Professor Morgan was all in all an amazing professor.  She had her faults no doubt about it; she struggles with public speaking  making her lectures hard to follow and the class seemed to lack structure.  But she really cares about her students and will go the extra mile to help us succeed.  Go to her office hours and do the extra creditpass
She doesn't know how to teacher. Is terrible at explaining things.

Professor Cooper-Morgan cares deeply for her students. GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS. It is the difference between a C and an A. I received a 97% in this class. She teaches all of the material necessary for CH1010, however in order to do well, do work on your own outside of class. Do the nonrequired HW's-  they are word for word exam questions.

Yes, RJP assigns a lot of homework, but he HAS mellowed out a bit over the years, and makes a point to change things if a student calls for it. Helpfulness is through the roof, if you attend office hours he will walk you through the homework, and he lets students take an exam with as much time as needed on request. Basically, just talk to him.
Easily the worst teacher I have had so far. Ridiculously intensive homework EVERY night. I wish someone had warned me about this teacher! Never Again!
