Dropped the class after two classes and two homework assignments. Homework assignments were longer than necessary and unrelated the materiel in lecture, he didn't really teach what he expected us to learn. Avoid if possible.

Assigns more homework than necessary and it ends up distracting from actually learning the material. Requires mastering 2 different software programs as well as text. While extremely difficult, he's willing to do anything to help you get the hard stuff done and very available. If you don't drown in the homework you'll learn a lot.

Lectures are always off-topic. At least 3-5 hours of homework per night. Do not start off on the wrong foot in his classes. Very helpful during office hours. Had a much better experience one-on-one, and he's actually very understanding and kind. Enjoys seeing his students try and learn, not give up.
tons of homework every day, along with random discussions you would find in a history class. Not a professor to take a class with unless you have no choice.

Awful.  Lectures thermo from powerpoints, basically useless.  Endless, nightly homework with little educational value.  Not bad in office hours, but still pretty terrible.  Avoid this professor at all costs - he almost makes thermo impossible to withstand.
busy work for HW

Awful teacher. Lectures are straight out of the book and mind numbingly boring. Attendance wasn't mandatory but he gave pop quizzes so it kind of was. His tests were impossible to finish in the alotted time and were incredibly overwelming. I highly suggest avoiding this teacher at all costs.

Awful Awful Awful, Taken 2 courses with this professor and it only got worse. Homework is overwhelming and easy to fall behind on. Lectures are useless and hypnotic. One shining point is he is great about having to miss class. Missing class for games, events, etc he has no problem on and offers plenty of time for outside help....but it's not enough

If you're not taking any other course at the time, not working, no life at all, a lot of time in your hands you can take a course with him; because the amount of homework takes over your life. If you also like slides, bad teaching and a professor that thinks he is the smartest person in the world, take a class with him otherwise avoid at all costs.
Bad

Completely useless. Expects students to learn 2 software packages just to accomplish homework, yet doesn't bother talking about them at all. Basically refuses to actually teach. Uses slides taken directly from the CD that came with the book and says almost nothing about them in class. Do NOT take any course with him if you intend to learn anything.

Useless class.  Teaching is not talking about pictures in powerpoint for 50 minutes, or telling us 20 times during class how succesful he has been with his research, or assigning so much homework and quizzes that this class basically takes over your life.  Exams are about how fast you can go, not how much you know.Final project is ambiguous

This was the worst class I've ever taken.  Prof. Pryputniewicz is an egotistical dink, who puts pictures on slides and claims to teach.  He is no help to any student, whatsoever.  Completely rediculous exam that nobody would have time to finish.  He sucks, plain and simple.

EGO AS BIG AS HIS HEAD! Yep, that's him. It's a good thing they're getting rid of this course. He went on surprise research expeditions for weeks at a time, totally neglecting the class. Professors that had no idea what we were doing (like it mattered anyway) who filled in for him did a better job teaching material. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Homework every night (takes at least a couple hours just for one problem), not enough time to finish tests, randomly yells at the class, thinks we're all slackers, huuuge paper due at the end of the term - yeah, have fun doing that will all the homework he still assigns...

Everything others have said is very true - ridiculous homework, big ego, etc.  He also gives unannounced quizzes at the start of class and doesn't allow makeups, so if you're like me and tend to be 5 mins late to class (which is at 8AM), be forewarned!

His ego is as big as his head. All he is interested in, is his own research. He doesnt really care about his class. He teaches heat transfer by reading through his powerpoint presentations. His homeworks are ridiculously hard and exams are absurdly long.
he has no business whatsoever teaching or even attempting to teach anyone, his ego is so big i'm suprised it fits in Higgins.

HW takes 5-15hrs per night to start (is due every class) and is worth 40% of your grade (also assigned problems for MathCAD & AutoCAD without showing how to use those programs). He just reads from the textbook during class. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
HW is extremely time-consuming; Exams are ridiculous races, be prepared to fly through em.  There is also a fudge factor in the grading, which is a disappointment

Good guy, not so great professor. He laughed at a student in class when they did not offer the correct answer. He does not explain things very well and you are better off skipping class and teaching yourself the material because if you understand Calculus he will make it worse and you will not understand when he is done explaining.

MA1021 is based off of four exams (out of 90), a final (out of 135), and 7 labs (worth 35). The total number of points needed to get an A in the class is 480/530. However, 477/530 is 90%. The next problem with the class is homework. The homework in this class is non-existent and you need to teach yourself out of the book to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's a nice guy but cannot follow along in class to the point where it is probably better to just teach yourself and not go to class. Everyone in my class has the same opinion.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Really nice guy but not the best teacher. He gives a lot of suggested practice problems (doesn't collect or grade) that closely resemble those asked on his quizzes.  Lectures were really confusing - pretty much just went through the book and taught it to myself..

I definitely respect this guy. His lectures were very clear, and the problems on quizzes were straight out of the assigned list from the book. Homework isn't checked but it's in your best interest to do it. He drops the lowest quiz grade.

There is no homework only recommended practice problems, and usually questions on the quizzes are taken right from them. He sometimes gets confusing when explaining some examples,  but overall he teaches very well. On the quizzes if you don't do the work in the way he specified you will get points marked off. Overall nice guy, and good professor.

JJ is the man! An awesome person to talk to, he has some calculus puns that will make you groan. as a teacher, his examples sometimes get a bit muddied in the explanations. He doesn't have homework in the class, which means the quizzes are worth a lot. His quizzes are just problems taken from the "suggested practice problems" or other finals.

Quizes weren't bad, but he was not very good about grading them.  If you used a technique you learned at MASH or in HS instead of in his class, you got no credit.  Do that again on a 4 question quiz, that pretty much quaranteed a fail.
i don't really think he's clear enough in class, but in general, he's a very nice and fair professor.

Very good prof, organized lectures and very good at teaching calc.  Makes things very easy for you when explaining things and lets you know where you are in the class and is willing to give outside help.  Would reccomend this guy over any other math teacher in the dept.
All homework was optional, gave 5 quizes and let you drop your lowest AND he let you bring a page of handwritten notes into the quiz. overall a nice guy

I understood Calculus just fine before I took this bozo's class.  He insisted on correcting everyone's "misconceptions" and taught things all back-asswards  - ened up with a NR after having passed AP calc in HS
No Comments
He was very helpful if you were confused.  Some of the test questions were from the hwk so do it even tho its optional.  Good Grading system.

Grandpa JJ....He's a funny guy, and he really wants his students to do well.  He even taught the conferences himself.  Although his homework is optional,  most of the test questions come straight from the homework, so its to your advantage to do them.
Good grading system
pretty easy but make sure you ask if theres something you dont get. hes really nice to students and doesnt make u feel dumb if u dont know an answer. kinda funny in a goofy/nerdy way. i like him :-)
very helpful and very fair grading
No Comments
Easy class.  He was very helpful.
likes to teach everything "his way" (ie: youve never seen it b4 and it probably contains way too many greek leters) also has a crappy grading system where things arent graded out of 100.
Nice guy - great grading system - very fair
Don't need a textbook for this class but you will absolutely need to participate every day
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This professor is the biggest hardo about grading papers. You will only get an A if you are completely engaged in this course. I don't recommend taking 1504 with professor Doyle as he is super specific about what he wants in his papers and gives no leeway grading. He is happy to give you below 70 on his papers.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I didn't really learn a whole lot from this class, and the class was overall very boring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Professor Doyle is an extremely considerate professor, and his class is not too hard if you are willing to put in the time and effort into his homeworks and tests. His lectures are enhanced by tons of demonstrations that show , rather than just tell, about psych concepts. You do have to read a fair amount by yourself. Lots of EC opportunities.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Fantastic professor. Here's how to do well in this class: Do the reading. Take notes (don't have to be too detailed). Look at his syllabus and get ahead on your reading instead of waiting until 2 days before a quiz or test. If you just do the homework, the class is easy. Also, the mind tricks you learn from him are very useful later on! :) Awesome.

I did not like this teacher.  I loved studying the subject, but he was a pain. The quizzes for the first few weeks were just basically memorizing random words that he gives during the quiz (which I believe should not be graded) and then quizzes about the books. The grading was confusing and i was worried about failing the class. I received a B.
An interesting class but the projects are tedious and overtaxing...  Got B's on tests and did not regularly attend class.

Ok teacher. Likes to have students talk in class about things.  The only thing I didn't like was that he didn't let us choose groups, but instead picked them for us.  I got with a group that was fine, but others weren't so lucky.  Tests are a little more difficult than it would seem, but you can always talk to him about grades.
His idea of teaching is arguing his points not proving his point, what a naught case class
No Comments

Avoid this professor. His idea of a class is to have you do all the work for him (i.e. learn from the textbook). But wait, there's more! He wastes your time daily because there is an attendance requirement, even though he is not even remotely helpful. Tests include things from the book and class (which have nothing to do with each other).
interesting stuff in class, but not the best fit
Class is interesting, professor teaches well and is pretty fair. If you need to take SS classes this would be a good choice.
Make sure you read the textbook for the exams. Watch out for the end-of-term paper; he takes ridiculous points off for not being "perfect."
Indifference to students' responses to his questions is interesting and somewhat discerning. Definitely has favorites-hope for a C if you're not one of them
Everything this man says is always 100% correct. You will learned alot of good stuff in his courses
He's a total bore (speaks slowly with lots of hesitation), but the material in the class is interesting so that keeps you awake.

Fun, interesting classes. Also, he's not afraid to make his atheistic viewpoints clear and tell god-squad people why they're wrong -- unfortunately,  this scale only goes as high as 5. He should get a six.
Class is so boring that students stop going - no challenge class too easy, no thinking involved- try a SS class that makes you think!
Funny, easy professor.  Good way to clear up those pesky SS requirements.
good prof, easy to get along with, cares about students
Professor Skorinko assignes journals and is very unclear about the length of them and what should be written.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Did not provide on-time or good feedback on graded assignments and didn't let us keep our tests. The material was very hard and you are expected to memorize a lot of information in a short time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Took this class so my schedule would be lighter than normal for this term. This class ended up being harder than any other class I was in. I recommend not to take this introduction class to save your gpa

Skorinko is a great person and engaging in class; she has great stories and a jolly voice. As a grader, however, she's different. Her feedback is untimely and curt. It's really blunt and sometimes rude. At times it's vague; she seems to be a big believer in figuring it out on your own, which sort of defeats the point of asking questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Way too loud for a 9 am class. She doesn't give feedback until after you've submitted your second paper, doesn't give rubrics/instructions on what she's looking for, doesn't put grades into Canvas until the semester is over. She is always talking about her past research (like seriously we get it), and her tests are insane. Would not recommend
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Skorinko always sent us her feedback the night before the second paper due date. Her grade evaluation seems to be a simple one-minute decision also the feedback she gave can not give me any improvement in my later paper. There is really no guarantee of getting good grade in this class even if you work hard.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Professor Skorinko is AMAZING. She's so funny, so sweet, and really helpful. Psychology is a subject that can be the most interesting thing ever, or the driest thing ever, and prof made it the former. I love psych. Tests require you to study, and you definitely have to work hard, but it's a class worth taking.
Will lock you out of class if you're late by 1 minute. Also, gives projects and out of class survey assignments that are a hassle.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very nice professor and engaging during lecture, but exams are very hard and she takes a long time to give back grades.
Good professor, but makes you write a lot and very strict on grading
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Great class, brings candy every day. Cool final paper project ideas, very invested in student's learning. Tons of reading though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She clearly cares.

Alright, Skorinko seems like a cool and chill professor but when it comes to homework and exams it is a whole other ballgame. The homework is a bit agonizing, and at times lame. The exams are in depth, so you actually need to read the whole chapters she assigns, since anything assigned is fair game in the LONG tests. Tough, and strict professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She definitely has hard tests and expects you to do a lot of reading. Put a fair amount of effort into the journals and the study credits, she likes to see effort. It was a hard class but enjoyable. She has really cute dogs that she brings to her office hours.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Only b I ever got
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This is the one class I've had in my life where reading the book could actually hurt you. Unless you have a fantastic memory, knowing the material could cause more confusion on the ambiguous multiple choice tests. The assigned work is generally very interesting and useful though. Spend a lot of time on it.

This professor is really fake. She pretends to care. She expects you to read the whole textbook in a 7 week course. She doesn't cover 14 the material but tests you on all of it. She doesn't give good feedback or let you have your exams. She doesn't change her exams so she doesn't let you keep your exams so that she can be lazy. I hated her class.

Everything in the textbook, covered or not, is fair game on tests! She is a very engaging lecturer and is always available for extra help if needed. The class is far from easy, especially with 6 chapters covered in one test! But overall, you will be challenged and will learn a lot from her!

There is wayyy to much material covered on her tests! She puts 6 chapters worth of material on the tests and there are both short answer and multiple choice questions. Her grading is harsh, she grades everyone blindly so she doesn't know who she's grading

She is a fantastic professor, and IQP advisor. She cares deeply about her students, and is was very friendly (in a prof. appropriate way) with students. She doesn't let you get away with not doing work, but will support and help you along the way.

Excellent professor. Lecture is mostly powerpoint slides but are effective and incorporates many examples and clips. Course objectives are very clear. There are a few papers but the guidelines are also clear. Just attend class, pay attention, and skim the textbook for the key words and their definitions. Interesting class. Highly recommend.

I took this class in D2018. Addison is very passionate about this class, though he only has four official grades (two quizzes and two exams) along with participation. If you are active in his classes and attend (he does keep track), it is hard to not get an A. He posts the essay questions before exams and assigns a fair amount of online reading.

Without a doubt, the worst professor I have taken at WPI. Pushes his own political agenda and does not tolerate any conflicting ideas. The class is not "European Cultural History" unless talking about kneeling for the American National Anthem is Euporean. Absolutely no explanation behind any grades, expect to just receive a random letter.

He is a hilarious guy and he mixes personal anecdotes with his lectures. You can tell he loves history and he tries to engage his class all the time. I probably should have gotten a B from my actual grades but he gave me an A because I participated a lot and showed my interest. Show up to class and you'll fine!

Great professor, really cares about what he is teaching. Assigned lots of reading but not much graded work, not a very tough grade. Great professor overall, very helpful and friendly, would definitely recommend him.
Great humaities class, that really makes you think:  "is the pen really there or is a demon projecting it into your mind?"  normal reading for a humanities class, most of class is discussion
This was one of my best hum classes. Hopefully I'll be able to take another of his classes.
No Comments
very difficult class with a lot of reading. Very captivating however asking a lot of mind boggling questions. His grading is pretty nice though. He rips apart papers but gives good grades for them.
Lots of reading and writing but hes a good teacher

One of the best professors I've ever had. I hate European history but he made it all seem so captivating. A very eye-opening course. This guy knows what he is talking about. Very witty and intelligent.
Great guy. Assigned a really hard first assignment to cull the class, but it was smooth sailing after that providing you do the reading.
Confusing and demanding with more work required that was not even gone over.
Extraordinarily helpful, very intelligent.  Conducts deep and meaningful class and conversation.  Methods and assignments rather unorthodox, but definitely interesting.  Overall a great prof.
blah blah
Made classes very interesting.
Great for  a Suff advisor
Pretentious, prejudicial, and ****.
Great personality, interested in students work, highly recommended for SUFF!!
No Comments
No Comments
Great Teacher

Her lectures are overly confusing and dives too much into the theoretical aspects of calculus than is needed for a non-math major. Her homework is pretty heavy, especially compared to other calc professors. Her study guides are not helpful for the test and the tests are difficult to complete in the time alotted.
Good person, fair grader, and the exam was easy. Didn't cover many topics. Derivation in class was a bit verbose. But you don't have to spend much time and just get an A.

Class was a little slow at times and could have spent a little more time on tensors and index notations vs the vector stuff but that may be more  a factor of the timeframe we had. She is extremely nice and very fair.  Her tests and quizzes are weighted thoughtfully and are a good test of concepts without killing you. Also she is cute too.

Olson is the ideal math professor. She is helpful, clear, and gives homework that is super similar to the tests and quizzes. She is extremely fair and always makes sure everyone understands what is going on. She is a little boring and goes slow at times, but I would rather have a professor that goes too slow than too fast. Overall very worthwhile.

Professor Olson is very nice, and a good teacher. She makes mistakes now and again when doing problems on the board, but that doesn't really affect her ability to teach. She explains the topics well, and is very clear with what is on exams and quizzes. Take this class (differential equations) with her if possible!
Professor Olson is a very good professor, as long as you can stay awake. She is pretty monotone but her material is clear cut and the grading is straightforward. No problems with her.

Sarah Olson is the best mathematics professor on campus. She is clear, concise and gives you useful examples in class. There is no "gray area" in her class and you don't feel embarrassed to ask questions because she is always willing to answer them. She is undoubtedly my favorite professor thus far. Lots of hw and quizzes, but they are FAIR!
Professor Olsen definitely really cares about her students.  She will go above and beyond to help out a struggling student.  Her quizzes, homework, and tests are very fair.

The lectures are clear, and she'll answer ANY question. Tests and quizs are not easy, but they are exactly as advertised. She's easy to get to know. She drops the lowest quiz and homework, which is good because the homework is all online, and that means no partial credit. With her, what you see is what you get.

Always very helpful during office hours. I went numerous times and I often got 1 on 1 attention  Homework was graded, but you had unlimited attempts online to get the problem correct so getting a 100% HW grade was easy. 1-2 Quizzes a week, usually on the last 2 sections covered in class. My grade in the class is due to my  bad test taking.

I agree with the person below. I switched out of the other differential class to be in Olson's class. There was homework due twice a week and a quiz once a week. They were pretty fair. The lectures on the other hand were very unclear and after students corrected her things would become more unclear.

Professor Olson was a big disappointment.  Everyone raved about her calculus classes but her differential equations class was very poor.  Her lectures are very poor. Unorganized and littered with mistakes. That said, her exams and quizzes were fair.  The assigned homework can be very hard but it does prepare you well for the quizzes and exams.
Great teacher. She's very clear and helpful. She does move very quickly through the material but does a great job teaching it. Try to get her if you can!

Good teacher.  Provides solutions to all work, tests, and quizzes given as well as a practice test and material outlines for tests.  Tests and quizzes are relatively challenging but material on it is predictable and from class work.  Expect to work hard but learn a lot.

I love her. She is a great math teacher. Her notes and lectures are very clear and the tests are fair. She explains everything you need to know for the quizzes and exams. The homework is fine. You will never dread that class. She is straight to the point and very focused on teaching. I wish I had her for MA 1024.

She is a great professor. Her quizzes are really easy and tests are only moderately difficult. Homework is easy and light. Math labs are a piece of cake. Take her for Calc 3. I have heard other professors are much harder.

Took Calc 3 & 4 with her. Okay class, but math is not a super fun topic. She doesn't have an accent so if you are looking for a clac professor who you can understand, take her. She's pretty boring though.
Very helpful and information needed for tests was clearly explained in lecture. I would definitely recommend her for a calc 3 and 4 professor.

The best calc professor at WPI.  So many of people wanted to switch into her class but there was only room for 60.  Clear teaching style, questions on test test concepts without requiring crazy algebra.
Cannot expect a better math professor than her
She is very helpful and extremely detailed. I hope the WPI Math dept could hire more professors like Sarah.

Excellent professor.  Taught the difficult topics of calculus very well.  Relied a lot on the theory during class, but extremely helpful during office hours with homework questions.  Posts homework solutions to help you prepare for tests.  Tests are based off of the homework questions and very easy if you understood the homework.

Super nice professor! I would highly recommend taking this course with him. This is a difficult class, but his lecture will make it a lot easier. He also has a lot of office hours, making sure you can learn a lot and finish the assignment.

I highly recommend Professor Andrews. He is very considerate and can tell he cares about the material. He wants everyone to succeed and has a ton of office hours available for any help needed. I would definitely take another course with him.

Cares a lot about students learning, very responsive to questions about the material and homework assignments.

You must show up in-person for the quizzes, but otherwise attendance is not required.

Very organized class & 5-6 TA/SAs - tons of office hours. I respect him a lot for admitting his mistakes from the prior year(s) to us and making such huge changes because I haven't seen any of the things people complained about. Not CS - wouldn't take him again, but I recreated (in pygame) the dino offline game controlled by Arduino / gyroscope.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I highly recommend that you this class with Professor Andrews. He explains the concepts in terms that are easy to understand, especially multithreading and paging. Professor Andrews has plenty of office hours all week, accommodating almost any class schedule. It is not an easy class but you will learn a lot and he will make sure that you succeed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: CS2011 was pretty straight forward. He wasn't very engaging in the lectures but he made sure we spent enough time to learn everything. I enjoyed it and with all the extra credit I found it pretty easy.

Not necessarily a bad professor but does have a lot to work on. Group projects were handled very disorganized and copious amounts of work had to be done. A lot of coding is done and it is quite difficult for people that are not majoring in CS despite it's an introduction for non-majors. Visit MASH and TA's for help with understanding homework!!!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Class was somewhat difficult and a little unorganized for those who have "no" experience in coding, and his directions are often unclear. However, he is very passionate and will help where he can during office hours and outside of classes. This was his first year, so I'm not going too hard on him.
He was very nice but he was not usually prepared for the lecture or was reading off the slide. He was late for the majority of the lectures as well.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: This instructor lacks skills in teaching college students effectively. While he is undoubtedly hardworking, his approach to project management and task prioritization appears to be poor. I would recommend that he consider seeking mentorship from seasoned professors to enhance his teaching methods if he wishes to excel in his current role.

Bud treats non-majors as if we're in our 10th year of coding and ready to join a software team. He intentionally does not teach certain things needed for homework so that you can get experience in "googling". Office hours and MASH are your friends here, the TA's taught more than he ever did. Stay away from this dude at all costs.
This class was terribly organized and we were not setup for success. if you want fair grading do not take this class.

CS1004, he does an ok job explaining things, and its CS, it's not super interesting, but he does an ok job with real world examples. The first 2/3rds of this class was good, you should get a 100 on homework, is an online submission, that will tell you what's successful and what's wrong, instant feedback. Final Project is terribly organized.

If you really want to learn about CS, do not take the course with this professor unless you have time to constantly go to the TA's office hours or MASH. The final group project was structured horribly, there was no clear directions as to what his expectations were and he kept posting new assignments for it until the last two days of the term.

Everything needed for homeworks and/or quizzes was not explained in class, really hard to follow when explaining concepts so go to office hours of the TA's and MASH if you want to learn. How the project is organized is awful, kept posting assignments for the project until the last two days of the term so you really don't know when is it done.

He was a great professor that clearly cared about the material. The lectures supplied all the information you really need as a base, but it is somewhat expected you will use the internet to fill in gaps. He does not do this because he can't teach, but because using online sources are a major part of CS.

Hands down the worst taught, least engaging course I've taken. Professor is incapable of explaining any concept clearly and concisely. He spent an entire week talking about how working on a group project is like baking an apple pie? If you've never programmed before DO NOT take this professor.

Prof. is completely inept when it comes to teaching content to non-majors. Although he is passionate about his field, he does little to work in teaching the fundamentals to students. Additionally, this prof. provides very little explanation on assignments/quizzes, often telling students to "cite a search engine," despite forcing in-class quizzes.

This class is for non-majors, but that is not the way it is taught. The explanation for the code is terrible. His syllabus is unclear. Our homework is put into an online grader so there is no real explanation for what is and isn't wrong with our code. He also yelled at us in a very unprofessional way one class. Do not take CS 1004 with him.

This is an introductory class with a professor who quite literally could care less. Take this class C term with Gillian Smith to actually understand and know what is happening. He solely relies on an online grader for assignments which means no one is ever actually looking at your code. Just dropped this class.

Monotonous voice. In class examples sometimes supplemented with pdfs that are hurriedly rushed. However, important concepts tend to be taught well, and labs are 'relatively' straight forward. Three exams, remember to write all eqs you use otherwise you don't get credit. Homeworks are long, make friends in this class, it's very much a group effort.

Very busy work oriented classes. HWs are long and tests too. TAs for all his classes are vicious graders. Lectures are ok but there's a ton of extra information not relevant to the subject matter. But nice guy and is willing to help.

Olinger is great! The class is tough if you don't read the textbook as there are a lot of small details that may not be discussed thoroughly in the class all the time, so make sure you read the book and this should be a great class!

Olinger is a good professor for this class, as he teaches you most of the material but leaves you to figure out the last 15%. The first test is easy and the take home test is an automatic A if you put the time in and have the book. From then on the material gets hard and his final test is real whomper. Slight Curve helps.

Olinger takes this class more seriously than AE/ME 3410. He's still kinda all over the place during his lectures but the notes you take still end up solid. The tests are hard and you've really got to do the reading if you want an A on them. The labs reports are time consuming and graded hard. All in all: Doable B, ridiculously difficult A.
HE IS SUCH A GREAT PROFESSOR! And he's hilarious. Would definitely recommend as a professor to teach a class and a professor to have an awesome conversation with

Had him for multiple classes. Positive experience both times. Homework load isn't too much, and exam was take home! Class project wasn't too bad. His voice is kind of monotone but he also is very engaging so they cancel out. Overall good prof.
Such a nice guy, makes the class interesting and interactive, easy to succeed if you're willing to work, would definitely recommend!
Very helpful as a professor and an advisor.  Ask for help if you need it.
He told us what to do every week, we would do it, he gave us an A.   Awesome.
Overall good professor. No real complaints at all. I wish the class wasn't at 8am though.

The dude's voice is hilarious.  I can't believe someone actually talks like him.  Monotone and Ditone like crazy.  I failed his class.  8am is why.  That whole class is a blur to me.  He's very particular about his wind tunnel, and so moved his class to 8am so he could play with it.

He is not easy, but you really learn fluid. Very helpful and good at explaining concepts. Love his in-class demo. If you really want to learn fluid, take his class. If you want an easy A or can't spend 8 hours a week on the homework, find someone else. After his class, I can do fluid in my head, that's how good he is.

He doesn't really care about the students...but he is good at what he's doing.  Very good at explaining theory in class.  Gives out great examples.  Homeworks are HARD.  Tests...not impossible, but very difficult. Oh, he doesn't really scale either.

Olinger knows what he is talking about, but is very very boring in lecture. He could put anyone to sleep. Homework was long, some of it was difficult, but he and TA's will answer questions. GO TO EXTRA HELP SESSIONS b/c they do at least one hw problem. Tests difficlut and sometimes questions are obscure.  His real world apps and tools are great!
I had this guy for 2 weeks at Frontiers. He was pretty nice and stuff and I think I learned a lot from him even if I wasn't being graded. Oh...and his voice cracks. :P

He teaches you what you need to know. Not just what's in the book. Wasn't an impossible class if you actually attended lectures. A clear cut teacher but willing to make esceptions when necessary. I would recommend taking other classes with him!!!
No Comments
If you do all the HW, tests will be easy.
A great teacher. Made learning fun!
Lectures really well, but tends to grade harshly.

I took Rocket Propulsion with Prof Blandino. His lecture notes are immaculate and contain all the info you need for homeworks and exams. I still used the textbooks on the side, mainly to supplement. His interpretation of staging and steps for rockets is a bit odd to me, but overall course was good, homeworks reasonable and exams not too bad.

Fantastic class. Notes are all-chalkboard and things move very fast , so you can't really miss class, but you'd never want to -- explanations are clear and you learn a ton of both the math and the actual design of these systems -- he has a ton of practical experience. Tests were fair, homeworks sometimes long and tricky. Conceptual quizzes are nice
Interested in helping students.  Very reasonable and helpful.

His exams were easy as long as you genuinely knew what you were learning in class,not the most helpful but he will give clear explanations. he goes fast,and doesnt pause at all, but everything is on the board so you kind of have time to write down, if you pit in a good share of effort the class is easy with the professor.
He gives hard homeworks, but if you do it in groups, he is cool with it.. also, his exmas are just from the homeworks.. and very less theory.. Great guy!

He is a good professor but gives a lot of notes. A lot of homework, start early. Test is usually easier than Homework but he is not available out of class os much. He dislikes to help students out of class though

Prof. Blanidno is one of the best teachers I have had in my 6 years at WPI. I have had 3 classes with him and 1 graduate class. His graduate gas dynamics class is the best course I've taken at WPI. Very clear, very fair, very helpful.

Below comment is almost completely untrue. Blandino goes out of his way to make distinguishable P's and rhos. I would not say he ever emphasized memorization over understanding. Very good at explaining; among the best profs I've had at WPI.

Aweful Teacher. Emphasizes memorization over learning possibly because he has difficulty getting people to understand. Uses indistinguishable symbols to represent different properties in an equation (cannot tell row from p for density and pressure).

Extremely good lecturer. Creates great notes throughout class on the overhead, rather than crappy PowerPoints. Homework can be difficult, but it makes the tests seem easier. Only way he could be better is if he did a few more examples in class rather than just notes on theory. Overall excellent, highly recommended professor.
Excellent professor. Made everything very clear. Extremely articulate, and always willing to help. Made a potentially difficult course a breeze.
Amazing lecturer. Made everying extremely clear. Tests were always easier than I thought they were going to be. I feel like I really understand thermo after taking his class
No Comments
knows his stuff amazingly well, best professor I've ever had.
Very good teacher, extremely smart and helpful
Great Teacher, one of the best i have had
Awesome professor!
Even though it was his first time doing Heat Transfer, he was very generous with office hours for one and was very helpful in lectures.  Good prof.
No Comments
Prof. Blandino takes the time to explain things, and really cares about teaching and the students.  He's a real credit to WPI.
No Comments
Professor Walls was one of the most engaging and fun professors I had at WPI
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: THIS PROFESSOR ABSOLUTELY BLOWS. He has zero social awareness and does not relate to students. Okay lectures and his jokes dont land.
is very condescending
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: OS is one of the harder classes at WPI, and Walls doesn't really attempt to make his students' experience in the class much better. Not very open to helping outside of class, and gives unclear advice on IA when help is needed. Also needed to republish test cases for multiple HWs because of some error, which hurt students who were already stressing

I had a disappointing experience with Professor Robert Walls as my OS professor. I found that he was not very helpful and seemed to lack interest in his students' success. Whenever I asked him questions, he would either give me short, unhelpful answers or seemed dismissive of my concerns.
Very tough grader. This guy does not care about his students.

He is genuinely one of the most condescending, most absurd professors at this school. She makes me want to never study biology ever again. Zero respect for students. Ignores emails and is not willing to ever help a student improve. There is not enough space in this rating to express how terrible of a person and Professor.

Would frequently cut students off, made the quizzes super difficult and essentially wanted us to fail. He also had no interest in responding back to students on time or helping them out, as he only had one office hour per week, and they would switch up every week.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Sucks
I struggled so much in this class it genuinely made me want to reconsider my major or even drop out. Professor walls does not care about his students or their mental health at all
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Tough class with brutal projects, and he made it tougher. Quizzes were tricky, and Walls never shoots you straight. It's almost like he's constantly trying to trick you, and it's not a welcoming learning environment.  Every 1-on-1 encounter I had with him, he seemed annoyed and dismissive of my questions. Future students: beware, and good luck.

I thought this course was in C# before I registered so I thought I could coast and load up elsewhere with hard classes and when it ended up being in C but C is so much harder. I really struggled to keep up with this course.

Beware! Professor Robert's OS class is like a horror movie. You'll be scared, confused, and begging for it to end. I give him a solid 0.5 out of 10, and that's only because I'm feeling charitable. So, if you're looking for a good time, stay far away from his class. But if you're into self-punishment, go ahead - just make sure to bring aspirin

Very strict grader and not very understanding. Robert puts numerous truck questions on the exams and assigns very heavy amounts of homework. Very difficult to understand lectures and frequently mumbles to himself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I do not like this Professor.

Okay lectures, kinda funny guy. This class was hard and learned a lot but would have liked to see more understanding towards students and adjustment to course to better cater towards a learning environment, especially more accessible office hours and showing respect to students.
Bad professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This class was a mess. Quizzes were structured for you to fail. They were closed book, in class quizzes. The questions were very specific and they were graded very harshly. On top of that the quizzes were retroactive, so anything you have learned in the class, can be on the quiz. Concepts are dense. Please take with another professor.
good teacher. funny lectures. strict grader and tough quizzes but you learn a lot from his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I spent more than 20+ hours on each project per week, so his class was pretty stressful for me. However, if you plan on earning only a passing grade, then his class is pretty doable. No tests/quizzes/exams, but you will have projects every week, which will count as majority of your grade.

I went into this class hearing that it was a difficult one, however, I was pleasantly surprised by how organized and assisting Prof. Walls was. This class is a very technical topic of OS but you really learn a lot. The lectures are really useful and the projects are actually fun to do. It's rare to have a project , or even class, be so engaging.

Very good class. Concentrated on low-level security. Instead of forcing you to read challenging research papers, he presented them as concepts to the class during lecture, which I really liked. Very clear with his explanations of concepts. Like most (if not all) of his classes, the grading was 45% projects, 45% Midterm/Final, 10% participation.

Professor Labenski gave us all our exams online, and only a few homework assignments. In general, I enjoyed her class, though I would have struggled a lot had I not attended the lectures (they weren't recorded).

This lady is the only reason I passed Calculus seriously.  She really improved my calc self-esteem. I started in Calc I and since I had no calc in high school it was quite challenging.  She has phenomenal teaching skills!

I don't know why people like her...I had her for Calc 1 and she made it way harder than it had to be. I think it showed when half the class failed that term. (i wasn't one of them) But...that's pretty bad.
Prof.Labenski left WPI due to financial and personal reasons. If I had a million $ I would have given it to her, so that she could stay. Best Professor ever.
Best Professor I have had at WPI. Explains the most complex stuff in the simplest way. She is the only Math prof at WPI that I had, who could teach so well. Too bad for future students that she left.
She breaks it down easy for you- what you need to know, what you don't, and how to do what you NEED to know.  Very laid back; wants to get out fast so gets to the point.
No Comments
Nice, but maybe a little lazy. If you do the homework, all of which is optional, it's an easy A.  Lenient grader. Every day, let us out an average of 10 minutes early.

She tells you exactly what's on the tests, which are pretty easy anyways. Assigned only one homework, which she let us do in Maple (took like 5 minutes). Wears sweatpants.....always. Refers to functions as "this guy" and "that guy".
everyone thinks she is a great professor but i dont see it. maybe its because i had the best math teacher ever last year, but i think she is very unclear and not that good of a professor
Awsome Teacher
Always smiling, very easy to understand, willing to help and the tests come straight from the homework/lectures
Wonderful math teacher.  Very helpful and clear!
Definitely the best Math professor anywhere. Should get some kind of award!
Best professor at WPI
Very good teacher! However, didn't see much hope for us. LOL
Best math teacher I've ever had.  Very easy to learn from
Very dedicated and hard-working
Ms. Labenski is a GEM! WPI would do well to hire a dozen more teachers like her!
Great teacher. Understanding, and does not put you to sleep in lecture.
Awesome teacher
Unable to read the notes at all. please dont take his class if you see this comment.

Well, this class is an advanced class but he simplified the concepts nicely. He does respect students and remembers most of his students' understanding. His office hour is really helpful to make you successful in this class. This class is test-heavy but you don't need to do many calculations during the exam. He makes a lot of mistakes on notes.

His lecture is the best lecture I have from math dept. It is not sugar-coated nor too advanced. You can tell that he crafted his own homework and tests in the way that it will teach you and point your mistake on understanding right away. His homework is quite challenging if you have no background on analysis. Easy to reach and kind. Good lecture.

This guy... He talks to the floor and the board most of the time and rarely looks up at the class. His writing is horrible. He wrote the textbook so his examples are right from the book. His exams are pretty easy though. And the TAs were great they posted notes online that are legible. And all exams are open book open notes which helped a lot.

If you want to ace his class, make sure you understand his notes. His quiz can be somewhat tricky but hey all the quizzes and exams are open notes, open book, though the book is not helpful at all. TA will offer practice exam before the test, which is very similar to the real one. He has the weirdest sense of humor.

DO NOT GET THIS PROFESSOR. He teaches to the floor, speaks quietly, and writes illegibly. Even if you could read his writing, it wouldn't be worth reading because he never does a coherent example and has notes with no order or sequence. He fails to maintain his composure in class, and bases his tests' difficulty on how much he likes the class.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! If you don't have a good TA you will be completely lost. He does not speak english and his writing is literally impossible to read. His sigmas look like sixes.Just don't do this to yourself. Not worth the effort.

Speaks worse English than he writes, and has no control over his class. If you have a helpful TA and can decipher his textbook (which he wrote himself, unfortunately), statistics is a breeze, but you will no doubt hate him by the end.

Trying to read this guys handwriting is like trying to read Arabic while wearing someone else's glasses. He talks in circles and despises formulas. He uses the book, but since he wrote it, that's actually a bad thing since its just as incomprehensible. Unless you have a good TA or have previously taken Stats, you're screwed. Avoid!

I really dislike this teacher.  He has a strong accent and his penmanship is terrible!  He wrote the text book and it is written the same way he talks.  During lecture he does not project and I could hardly her him in the front row. I did get a B in the class, but i really do not know how. His quizzes and test make no sense. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

Had for intro prob. Got an A. Balgobin was an AWFUL teacher, we had to talk to him or the TA with questions about every HW, and I have never had as unpleasant and unhelpful experience in trying to talk with a professor.  He went from not helpufl, to downright rude.  Avoid if you can.

Most unfriendly professor I have ever had. No interest in teaching undergrads. In my statistics class, he taught from a book he wrote himself and gave unclear lectures. He teaches as though he were teaching grad students in math, and does not answer questions with complete answers. He yelled at the class for not getting it on the last day.

Very poor communication skills.  Lectures are scattered and very hard to follow.  He wrote the book, and the book is equally incomprehensible.  When someone asks a question, he won't answer, insisting that the person should have known the answer.  The last lecture he goes on a tirade about how we're the worst class he's ever had.  Huge ego, avoid.

Terrible teacher with a poor command of the English language. Lectures aren't worth going to and the textbook (written by him) doesn't help much either.  Avoid this class unless you know someone good at statistics.

An atrocious professor.  His lectures are unclear, his handwriting is small and impossible to decipher, and he has a habit of talking quietly at the floor during lectures, making it nearly impossible to hear him.  He doesn't explain concepts well. He uses poor examples that don't always apply.  Avoid at all costs.
Great prof - just takes a little bit to get to understand his accent.

This class was an absolute disaster.  Too much theory and not enough examples to be able to do the homeworks well.  The prof is difficult to follow during the lectures since he tends to make a lot of careless mistakes while writing on the board.  Books were almost useless. Don't hurt your GPA by taking this class.

Great professor, but can be difficult to understand. Brilliant math mind - loves to talk about his research. Will make himself available if you have any questions. Better MQP advisor than in classroom. Quirky sense of humor - cracks me up

Lecture is worthless. You're better off reading the book on your own. Tests were poorly worded and ridiculous. Quizzes nothing like homework, but our conf. instructor saved us. Useless when you go to see him. He was asked to e-mail solutions to a quiz and he said it would take too much time. Avoid.

The material is so poorly explained in lecture that you're better off skipping class and reading the book on your own. He's so bad that class attendance dwindled until only 1/3 of the students were attending class by the fourth week.
He tried to teach the class well and cared about the students, however too much theory and not enough getting to the point made most students confused.

Absolutely Awesome. Class was so enjoyable I would forget to take notes. will personally help you at any step and really cares. Personally cares about all his students to and is plenty easy if you go to class and do  the homework.

Coool (insert Romanian accent).  Perhaps the best math professor ever.  He will provide you with all the help you could ever possibly need to pass his course. If you get stuck he will walk you through a problem by asking questions until you solve on your own.  If you can take him avoid anyone else! Coool

You are lucky if you can get him for a class. He assigns very little homework and tests are more than reasonable if you understand the material. His teaching can be a bit inconsistent and hard to follow at times.

If you're planning on taking MA1024, take it with him.  He's pretty funny and keeps you entertained.  You may have no idea what's going on in class, but he does proofs and shows you the behind the scenes stuff.  Tests are similar to given sample exams, which is always a plus.  Also has bonuses on exams.  Great prof!
Heis REALLY GOOD...
He has an impressive presence in class. He explains clearly and cares about the performance of the students. Overall, a great person in and out of the class.

He's really helpful. He gives practice exams and the actual tests are very similar to the practice exam and homework. Not a lot of homework. Gives three tests that account for about 70% of the grade. Awesome professor!
he is confusing in class
If you show initiative with him, he will help you so much.  That is why I made him my academic advisor.  Consider yourself lucky if you have him as a professor.
If you're stuck, go to his office hours, he is very helpful.  Problem with him is that he has a thick accent, so it's a little hard to understand him.
Witty teacher who tries hard to help his students.  Pretty easy to understand.  Very clear and practical.
very clear and coordinated teaching;knows the material in- depth; forceful personality; one of my best math professors ever.
hard to understand professor. Head of the math department that liked to proove everything and not give enough examples.

The tests were pretty easy and he also gives extra credit from time to time. He explains quite, even though going to class seems to be kind of useless at times because you can understand the material by reading the book
I really like him.
very good teacher, cares about all his students and actually knows who they are, sat in back of class all year and one day i sat in front and he knew who i was!!!! overall good guy
he's the head of the math department for a reason.  also, he tells great stories during class every now and again.  (calculus dance party anyone?)

Accent is incredibly thick, combine that with the fact that his favorite two variables in the world are 'u' and 'v' (which look identical when he writes them, mind you), and you have a professor who's almost impossible to understand.
Sometimes hard to understand.  Witty.  Good teacher.
Good teacher, seems concerned about his students
Best Math Professor

Terrible. Very hard to understand at first, once you figure out what he's saying, then you'll realize what he is saying makes no sense. Likes to talk about mountains... Grades on only a midterm and final, which are both NOT a good representation of what is learned in class. For your own sake, do anything to avoid taking a class with him.

Such a nice and caring professor, always encouraging his students. Every time I ask him questions or anything via email, he replied soon and explain every thing in detail. His accent is a little bit difficult to understand at the begining though.

Hands down the worst math teacher i've ever had(that means he's worse than shibian dai!). spends all class working on one example, however he usually gets the example wrong. horrible feedback, hardly ever gave a sufficient explanation of the material. 3 people passed his final out of a class of 20. should not be teaching at all. do not have him!

The worst prof i have ever had if you have him take it another term with someone else. He got one problem right on his own throughout the term he doesn?t do the questions before he assigns them many have typo's his exams are horrible

Terrible Teacher.  Tests are not a good measure of what he teaches.  I have no idea how he grades the class, I thought I NR the class but got a B.  He probably had to scale when he saw everyone in the class had a 50 average.

Horrible Horrible Horrible!  If you get him for your professor drop the course and take it in another term with Peter Christopher!  Run as fast as you can from this professor!  Impossible to understand and not just because of his accent!  Tests are landmines with no warning!
Really hard to understand, and linear algebra is all about the professor's ability to explain stuff. Has only 1 midterm and 1 final. Wouldnt recommend!

85% of our grade was based on a midterm and a final.  He did not give partial credit on either, so it is very easy to mess one problem up and be close to failing.  He also liked to talk to the floor when lecturing.

I'll start off qualifying this rating: there's only one math teacher that's ever taught me math. I'm the read-the-book learner over listen-to-the-prof type. That said, I still think Vermes was boring. The man didn't seem excited by his topic at all. But at least he has great handrwiting and uses the board well. Material very really fun though :)

Professor Vermes never made clear what was important to learn for the exams and graded only on 2 exams after anouncing the first day that homework would count as part of the grade.  He would not allow me to do make up work to achieve a passing grade even though I needed his class to graduate on time.  His response time to email was very slow.

Vermes was good at teaching the material. He was also a funny guy. The only tests were a midterm and a final. It's unfortunate that the final grade weighs so heavily on these two grades, but there's always homework. It took two weeks to get the midterm back, so for a while we had no idea if we were passing or failing the class.

needs to actually let us get feedback on our performance so if we need extra help we can get it...he can teach the material well but sucks as an overall professor because he was never free for help, niether was the PLA, and you never even knew if you needed help because you barely got anything back in a timely manor.
Referred to caribou in alaska while talking about calculus
He's a nice guy.  If his accent is hindering you from understanding, then you've got problems.
This guy makes the stranges refrences i have ever heard!...and his accent is wicked funny.  An ok teacher not the best not the worst
He was a great teacher and acted in the best interest of the student always.
was not fair when grading the course being that most of us are taking it again
He uses strange refrences and has a huge accent
This guy is FUNNY and he can TEACH! Not too hard to understand throug his accent

Very kind and understanding professor that cares about the success of her students. There was a fair amount of reading but quizzes were very straightforward, the group project was interesting, and just overall a decent course.
literally the most amazing women, love her life lessons

Awesome lady! There are some things that could improve in her class but it is an easy A if you participate and do what you are supposed to. She is really friendly overall, she gets angry for no reason in class but nothing too bad. Great human being!
long lectures, easy grader
Awesome professor, motivational, expresses her experience.
Very nice, made an effort to know every student. Frequently tells students to "cut the words by 50%" so be succinct. Highly recommended.
Very fun times! She actually teaches relevant things in her class and she always makes class interesting. There was not a single boring class for the entire year. Excessly uses "etc."

She tells you exactly what's going to be on the exams.  When you're up in front giving presentations she's a little annoying because she constantly interrupts, but she's nice and really only trying to help.
A brilliant and refreshing approach to class. I had her at 8am, and she nearly had perfect attendance (or at least it seemed) for the entire term. That is saying something!

Business Leaderhip. GREAT class! Probably one of my favorite that I have taken at WPI. Easier than MG2300. Did a good job teaching/interacting with the class. Very nice Professor. WPI is lucky to have her.
like any other managment course, the material was a joke but she at least tried to make it more in depth. she's a good doobie
Definitely a different way of teaching.  Not your usual lecture format, but an interactive one that kept the class interested. Extremely supportive outside of class.

Class was ok.  She doesn't lecture enough though.  Can be VERY obscure in requirements for assignments.  I will say however that she does care deeply about students and is willing to listen and help.  Says "etc" too much though.
Very fun interactive class; plenty of activities.  Only fault is that when she gives assignments it's given very nonchalantly, so sometimes you miss it or don't understand the importance of it.
Her class was the biggest waste of time ever.  WPI should offer refunds.
very unique teaching styles, will prepare you to be manager in the real world!!
Fun class, learn a lot of stuff.... too many questions in exam though
I felt she was too disorganized. Not bad, but not great either.
VERY unorthodox class, not easy, but you learn a lot and she knows her stuff!
Excellent professor; friendly and fun. Dont expect the normal lectures here.

I love Professor Gray. Although she will assign reading and then summarize what you were supposed to read in class the next day, her lectures were never too boring (and very helpful on those days that I did not read). She can assign a LOT of reading, but it's doable if you are good at scheduling your time.

Amazing professor! One of the books we used was a terrible read and therefore wasn't read... :) But if you read the chapters she assigns and take notes in class you will get an A. Otherwise a B or C. Take Gray

Gray is one of the best history professors at WPI!  She makes class interesting and shares her passion with the class.  The class is set up so it makes the student succeed!!! Definitely take her classes

She is a wonderful professor. A few papers, mid-term, presentation, and a final. Attending class is mandatory. Always willing to help, very fair tests and definitely a good professor to take history with at WPI.
If you have opportunity to take class with her, go forward. Great professor!
TAKE HER CLASS...YOU WILL GET AN A IF YOU HAVE ANY SENSE AT ALL!!!

She's very helpful and interested in what you want to write about. She only does one draft, though. Make sure it's a good one. Other than that, it was a great experience. 20 page minimum, but definitely do your suff with her. You'll get something out of it.

Had her for A term in 04 and then immediately switched to all her classes for the rest of the year to fulfill my History req. Very easy, doesn't change her curriculum between courses. Almost always 2 exams, group project, and a paper. Attendance is key.

Awesome!! I never really liked history B4 but this class was actually pretty cool. There was, too me, quite a bit of reading but oh well. Prof. Gray really cares about her material and adds in her own experiences to help to relate to the material. Class consisted of an oral presentation, midterm,paper,and final. Attendance was taken so be there!

Professor Gray sincerely cares about her students and wants everyone to do well. Her enthusiasm is contagious and her lectures convey information in an interesting manner without simply giving out boring facts...Deborah Gray is awesome!
definetly a boring class but she is possibly the easiest grader ever. for the last 2/3 of the course i didnt do any of the homework and i still got an A.

professor teaches with speech and very little use of white board; therefore very difficult to take notes. Easy grader with lots of input. Doesn't answer any questions, just gives information on the sources they can be found in.
Very enthusiastic teacher and very helpful. The exams are fair and the professor gives alot of feedback on everything she grades.

I bought one of the books that was required, and indexed the other two when it came time for essays. Overall, being in a seminar course with her wasn't too bad. Classes got boring, but "group work" was a nice change. She's a pretty easy grader, and easy to talk to.

There were 5 required books for this course, 3 of which I never read. Basically, if you go to class and pay attention, you'll easily grasp the concepts which will help because the exams have questions directly taken from lectures and discussions. Overall a good course taught by a nice professor.

I don't agree with all of the theories she teaches, but this is the only history class I've been able to turn in work that isn't bullshit. I actually got to write a report applying the theories from class to real world events of interest to me.
Class was boring, but all history classes are. A very nice teacher and easy grader. Take 'some' notes and I don't see how you couldn't get an A.
Easy teacher to understand, class is simple, youll get a good grade. Lectures can be boring.
Awesome! Made me actually enjoy history! Informative lectures, fair grader, reasonable tests. Writes extremely helpful (and legible) comments on essays.
suff advisor, extremely helpful, and doin a suff with her is rather painless
He provides great notes and is willing to help. He doesn't grade hwk in a timely manner, but grades tests in a timely manner.

He is one of the best professors at the school. A very hard working professor who genuinely cares about his students and the material they are learning. He is very accommodating for office hours and SO helpful and encourages help outside of the classroom. Will extend homework with no questions asked. Tests are easy if you know what you're doing.

Awesome Professor who cares more about the students education than about following a strict grading criteria. Professor M answered every question I had with ease, and came prepared to every class with a well thought out lecture. The homework assigned is never collected nor does it count towards your grade. Final grades depend merely on two tests.
Diff Equ was not easy with Professor M., he made it easy, he has good sense of humor, he cares for students' learning, very good teacher. I will take him again.
Very boring during lecture. He cannot teach the subject and has to rely on his TAs to do it for him. His exams were really unfair. I would not recommend him at all.
Really cares about his students. If you put in the effort you will get the A, he is always open to help.
He is a really sweet guy who cares about his students. Really good in office hours!

He really wants everyone to pass this class. He has a thick accent that freaks you out the first day but you get used to it. He has kinda weird office hours but he is in his office almost every night until like 2 am because he does math research at 2 am? He will go out of his way to help a student pass.

Awesome professor! Always available for office hours, there's one quiz a week and they are much harder than the examples, so you'll need to find hard problems to practice either in the textbook or in the study plan section of mymathlab. He drops the lowest quiz grade, though, which is helpful. His research is also very cool if you ask him about it!
Good professor who lectured well and cared for his students.  Calc 4 came pretty easy to me but he was more than willing to help when I did go to him.

When I say you don't need the textbook or to show up, I would still say it's highly recommended. His lectures are put online, and his grading is very forgiving at times. He is also a really kind professor who seems to genuinely care about his students, and wants everyone to succeed. Just show effort, and show up.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor M is very good teacher, he had shown a lot interest in student's learning, he let you ask questions and respects students issues, always available in his office, go to his office and he will make you understand the complex material, planning to take him again for Linear Algebra in B-term 2017.

Muddamallappa is a great lecturer. He's hilarious in lecture. His research is neat too - go to his office hours and ask him about it. The lecture content was dry - everything was straight from the textbook. Considering this was an introductory course required for all majors, I don't think the lectures are a reflection of this professor.

I took MA 3257 Numerical methods for Linear and nonlinear systems class with Professor M, he is an awesome teacher, writes everything on the board, shares lecture notes, so you don't have to worry about the notes if you miss a class, he cares for his student's learning, always available in his office, even on weekends, very workaholic, real gem.

Professor M is awesome. He is a great professor and is always there for you but he really does expect you to learn everything there is to know about Linear Algebra. If you are willing to work hard he is a great prof. Work really hard and getting an A is very doable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Professor Muddamallappa is an awesome teacher, please stop whining about homeworks, lectures etc. Sometimes Professors needs to go few minutes overtime, so what is wrong with this? Also he gave enough homeworks to prepare for the quizzes and exams, he gave solutions to homeworks which helped many in the class. Overall he is an excellent teacher.

Do not fall into trap by reading the above comments about Prof. Muddamallappa. He is an awesome teacher and cares about his students learning. I tool Cal-I, Cal-II, and linear algebra with him at WPI. He is available all the time in his office and go out of his way to help the students. He is real gem of a teacher. I would take him again.
boring in lecture, ALWAYS goes a few minutes over in class, sends out assignments in untimely manner, not a bad class just a few annoying things that I thought are obvious

His lectures can be confusing at times. Sometimes he mis-speaks or doesn't explain things well, and then when someone asks a question, he doesn't give them a sufficient answer. The quizzes are fairly straightforward applications of what we've been learning in class.

The lectures were sometimes boring and tough to get through but overall he is a good professor and works really hard to make sure students understand the material. His homework is optional but really good preparation for quizzes and exams. Quizzes were every week but only a few problems.

He doesn't explain anything at all and when you ask for examples or clarification he just repeats himself. There is 3 hours of homework every night and you can almost never finish it. You had to get 75% of it right to pass but it  only counted for 5% of your final grade. He also wrote the book so you can't even reference it for help.

Professor Davis is not as bad as people say. His exams are good you just have to look for EXTRA help if math doesn't come natural to you(me for example). Besides his lectures I use Paul notes, khan Academy, and watched you tube videos. One thing he tends to do is have homework and web-work due before the tests so you have to plan accordingly.

This guy is the worst, if you have him for Dif eq's run for the hills, literally useless at lectures, he wrote the book too and that sucks even worse than he does. I'd honestly avoid taking dif eq's for a term if this is the only prof u can get.

I took Diff EQ's with him, so I cannot speak for his Calc classes. Otherwise, he was a great teacher, these other reviews don't do him justice. He practically spoon feeds the processes to the class, answers every question he is asked, and is very open for office hours. He teaches in a very direct manner and takes his time through the problems.
Everybody seems to be giving Professor Davis bad reviews. He may not be the best professor but he is definitely clear and understandable. He also is very willing to see students for extra help

He's a pretty neat guy, but he is very difficult to learn from.  He leans too much on theory and assumes that we figure out the intuition ourselves.  I do not recommend you take him, unless like Cterm 2012 he is the only one teaching.  If you must, pray you get a good TA like Jocelyn Pitman.

Do not take his classes. I had him for calc 3 and 4 and hated it. He doesn't teach and in order to do the homework, beg on your hands and knees that your conference instructor knows the material. HIs tests are not what he emphasizes in class, and the difficulty can vary by an order of magnitude.
Do not take him. I had him for two terms and those were the two worst classes I've ever taken in my life. I suggest that you completely avoid him as much as possible.
Took calc IV with him. He droned endlessly in lecture and blindsided us with absurd tests. I would have learned nothing without conference (different instructor). Avoid.
Useless teacher, who made us buy his own book. Learn from "http://tutorial.math.lamar.edu/Classes/DE/DE.aspx" its alot easier and understandable than what he "teaches" in class.
I took calculus 3 with Davis, and I am dreading 4. It was a 'teach yourself calculus' course. No help. I was saved by conference.
Terrible teacher. Useless lectures, if it weren't for conference, no one COULD pass.

Honestly he is the worst teacher that has ever walked the face of the earth. i would learn more if a chimpanzee was up there teaching. He does NOT teach. If it wasnt for the fact that the school has good TA's everyone would be failing

He's a nice guy and everything, but he can't teach worth anything. Basically, the class is spent watching him derive equations and not explaining what the point was. I basically had to learn from the book and the entire class needed the TA to explain and teach (not reteach) everything.
Not great at explaining things, but easy grading and a great TA

You'll either love him or hate him. I suggest getting toward the front row so that he knows who you are. The daily homeworks were tedius but required me to learn the material ontime, helping me ace the class. He had a huge understanding of the material and even helped students on the tests when they had questions. Just do your work with integrity.

Great teacher if you want to lower your GPA. His explanations are incomprehensible and he never fully answers questions. The tests are awful representations of the material we covered. Without conference sessions, almost everyone would fail. My advice is to ditch Professor Davis and go with someone who actually teaches, like Professor Goulet.

Professor Davis did not explain anything well. It took attending ALL of the conferences to understand the material. The classes were extremely confusing, and the exams were ridiculous We were assigned about 4 very easy homework problems a night and then you would get to the exams and often would not have seen the material.

I hated daily homework. He seldom lectured the material, but if we had questions, he would answer them. The way to learn in that class was: read a book, struggle with homework, ask a question in class... spend the entire class discussing that problem... do homework on new material at home with the book.
No Comments

I was very disappointed with professor Lou, Prof. Jarvis is much better, contrary to what other posters say. Normally the ECE teachers are the best at WPI but she is one of the worst. Poor English, typos in slides, won't accommodate students who have 3 tests on one day.

Hands down the worst professor at WPI.  I would not recommend taking any classes with her.  I looked at the posts on RMP before taking her class...but sadly didnt listen to them.  She is completely inconsiderate of the class time...every class ends by the next class practically pushing us out of our seats.  Crams 3/4 of the work into the last week.
Cut off A at 90, either got full point or zero. Can't be good for students

Had her for 2801 two years ago. She's the reason my friend started attending the faculty interviews. Avoid her like the plague. She teaches by power point, badly, and her accent is very bad (although understandable). Feel asleep in her classes, so stopped going and read the book. Got an A, friends that attended lecture didn't. Disgrace to our dept.

She is a very good Professor for ECE2801,the exams and hw's are easy,the only parts that is hard is the Labs.If you don't understand any programming concept in class, you should go to her help section, she is very helpful.Definitely recommend her Over Prof.Jarvis.
Prof Lou is my academic advisor, and she isn't very good at that. She couldn't help me when I asked her a couple questions about my schedule. I think I'll be sure to stay away from he classes too.
again... not as bad as the previous reviewers make her out to be. at least she tries pretty hard to teach. class is easy, as are the exams. the labs are  pretty much the only hard/frustrating parts.

she's not THAT bad..I've seen worse in the ECE department...the class is really easy so far and although her enunciations and presentation skills still need drastic improvement I would still recommend her over Jarvis ANY DAY!!!
wtf
No Comments

She can't teach for beans.  If you read the book, you don't need to go to class.  In fact, class might confuse you more than it helps you.  At least it's an easy class if you know the first thing about computers.

incompetent teacher.  she may mean well, but took a class i was sort of interested in and killed it for me, didnt teach just used pp slides and read off them not getting anything across to the class. . . terrible teacher please avoid if possable
She should not be teaching.  Her lectures are nothing but a waste of time.  She is only good as a cure for insomnia.
She may be a good researcher, but has no clue how to teach!!!
