Can't speak english to save her life! This fact alone is unfair and an insult to students paying big $$$ @ WPI for classes! Not enough text space to say what I want to say! She has no idea how to teach, pushes right into advanced prog techniques without 1

Very poor teaching methodology. Speaks terrible english and presents material in an unorganized and inefficient way. Pushes material too fast onto students. First lab requires detailed prog experience instead of opportunify to learn/practice basics of 808

Appears to know the material well but hasn't gotten the hang of teaching yet. Sometimes starts teaching one thing, realizes she needs to cover something else and goes to that, and then goes back and resumes where she left off.
The professor was hard to understand and she didnt explain any of the basics of the course before she threw up code onto the screen.  All she did was read from the powerpoints during class.

Unintelligible and uninformative.  If I didn't already know something about the topics, I wouldn't have learned anything because the presentation was horrible.  Read from the slides word-for-word.  My 3 hours per week could have been better spent drinking

Read from Powerpoint slides that repeated the material in the book, all in a thick accent. Homeworks asked mundane questions about security protocols, and tests depended on your ability to remember obscure details.

Really knows her stuff but can have difficulty with wording questions. Very good explainer and very helpful in office hours. Most of this course was discussion-based and she does very well facilitating this and making sure everyone understands the information from the papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dont take this class with her unless you have a bio background. I took it because I thought it would be an intro class and it was so much harder than an intro class. Grading is very relaxed and she is really nice and helpful and willing to work with you. But A LOT of background in bio is needed

Ryder's intro class to BCB would be impossible with no bio background. With bio, problem sets are confusing but very useful once she explains them properly. Some lectures are very interesting, some not as much. Really knows her stuff and is willing to help students but has difficulty wording questions. Class topics vary a lot.
She is extremely nice and one of my favorite teachers - can't understand all the bad comments and ratings she is getting; though I did take her for Neurbiology

Genetics last year. Easily one of my favorite classes so far. She's very fair and teaches well. I argued a couple answers and got good responses. CPS use is OK, much better than Rulfs's.  The book is mostly unnecessary. Some found the problem sets difficult; take the time to work them through, and do them with others if possible. Tests were fair.
No Comments
Terrible class, the TA's do the hw for you in conference, and the tests are not a reasonable measure of knowledge acquired in the course.

The powerpoint thing is really not a good way to teach AT ALL. The material isn't that hard though so you can learn it on your own. Make sure to do the practice exams they make a world of difference. She REALLY needs a fashion makeover! NOW!
No Comments
some interesting stuff in the class, but not easy by any means
Good Professor, but has problems writing tests. She doesn't convey the question well enough to get the answer she wants.
Horrible class. She likes to ask questions that the papers didn't cove in the most difficult way possible so that no one could possible answer correctly then she's all happy because you look dumb.

Ryder seemed to delight in asking questions that had no right answer, and then showing the class how dumb you were when you tried to respond. She seemed to take sadistic glee in making students look bad.
quality professor, very organized

Very difficult class extremely hard exams, she teaches on the Power point slides,which is not an effective way of teaching.mostly reads it. The cps questions dont help as most of the poeple are talked to usually guess the answers, help sessions are useful.PLA 's know how to explain the things well.

Makes really good power point slides, that have everything you need to know for the tests, also lets you bring a sheet to the exams. H/w is a little tough if you try it by yourself, easier in groups/ help sessions. Overall a good class
Bad. Just...bad. Had her for an advisor, too. She has limited knowledge of stats - and that's her specialty. No clue about anything else, even basic bio. Not as bad as Tyler, though.

She knows what she's talking about but she doesn't usually express it well.  Her power points are helpful but they don't tell us all that we need to know.  The actual teaching is hard to understand a lot of the times.
Most boring lecturer I have had yet.  I ended up skipping the last fourteen classes minus the exams and still got an A after copying her chickenscratched notes on the web onto my cheat sheets.
Horrible advisor; clueless and unhelpful

Don't take this class. You will be subjected to difficult projects and no guidance whatsoever. Moreover, Prof. Agu will just read the slides in class and will give no practical examples of how to code your own applications. The slides are from at least 5 years ago. The quizzes do not make sense.

Agu is a good professor. He knows the material and wants to help you to be able to know it. Sometimes the class seemed to move a little slow. Android Studio was the worst part of the class, but that isn't Agu's fault (too many weird errors that even the TA couldn't figure out, and everything takes longer than expected in AS). Overall, good class.

Great at teaching, good sense of humor. Notable how he was very interested in the material. Would also put a lot of effort into helping the students understand the material. Something worth noting (since it's the first time it ever happened to me) - he does adjust grade cutoffs upwards. I was given a B with > 90 overall (and it was not a mistake).
Very good guy. Take his classes.

Agu is awful, is rules for grading are unclear. The entire class is just students presenting papers. I have learned absolutely nothing for this class. He also knows nothing about the topic, he knows absolutely nothing about how easy or hard things are in android. He is useless
Prof. Agu was not the best. He was funny in class but the assignments required deep programming knowledge and lots of spare time. Tests were ROUGH too. Would not recommend.

Emmanuel Agu is the man with the master plan.  He is very smart, assigns work relevant to the course material, has a great sense of humor, and has the cojones to override a TA's crappy grading.  If he's teaching a class, TAKE IT.  I don't care if it's outside your major.

A knowledgeable professor who cares about his students, not just in terms of their learning but also as people.  Yes, his homeworks are time consuming, but they are essential to a deeper understanding of material.
Nice guy, somewhat hard to reach.  Projects were very time consuming.  Tests were not too bad.
He is an excellent teacher. I think things could have been better if the course was organized a little better.
He teaches the material well, gives interesting projects, and is one of the most friendly professors I've met.
Very knowledgeable and helpful. Love helping the students. I enjoyed working with him.

Emmanuel is the baddest professor this side of Nigeria. The guy comes to class snappin some necks and cashin large checks. He be sippin the water from the coffee cup allllll class long. And don't get him started on the data link layer. He'll mess you up!
Smart and well informed.  Very friendly and helpful.  Projects were good, lectures were interesting, and exams were okay.    Overall a good teacher.
Explains material pretty well, esp. if you ask him. (In-class presentation is so-so.)  Always answers questions quickly, and you learn a lot from his projects.

Projects were good, though graded inconsistantly, and we never saw any reasons for the grades. Exams were a good measure of the material, though unrelated to the projects. Overall good class, good prof, but still room for improvement.

Exams were too long for the class period, obfuscated, and relied on obscure examples. Projects were ridiculously simple, though grading was unbelievably inconsistent. Lectures were mostly worthless and spent too much time covering basic math.
Projects are difficult
No Comments
No Comments
Excellent advisor, fully committed to everyone's projects and provides helpful feedback throughout. Very supportive through thick and thin, just a great guy all around.

Sets you up to fail. Sees you not doing something correctly or up to what his standards are but doesn't say anything about it until several weeks in. Then proceeds to grade you based upon your conduct before giving feedback. A bit unfair.
Explained the goals of the project well and gave a lot of useful feedback in our work
Amazing IQP advisor!!
Absolutely one of my favorite professors, very clear class, very helpful office hours, really nice guy to work with
Simply one of the best teachers i have ever had.

Exceptionally good teacher!  I learned a ton.  The subject is tough but he makes it real and understandable... no small feat!  Great lectures and lots of extra help.  I was sorry when the class ended.  Make sure you take this teacher.  Move your schedule around to make room for his class.
amazing teacher.  knows over 100 kids by name.  is very organized and clear with his class, highly recommend doing anything with this guy.
amazing professor. unmatched dedication to teaching... and damn good at it

One of the best professors I've ever had. If not one of the best, then the best. Lectures are straightforward. He uses those 50 minutes more efficiently than anyone else I know. Homeworks are more difficult than exams, and discovery projects are not as bad as I thought they'd be. Nothing bad to say about him
very good professor. very approachable and knows his stuff. in a class of over 100 kids he knew everyone's name..... wierd

Really good advisor, but if he coadvies with Professor Demetry then she runs the show and IQP will stink.  Good professor, good advisor, very unfair when giving grades...does not grade like other professors, makes up his own grading rules.
In a class of 200 (the big lecture hall in AK) he knew everyone by name.  I learned a lot - and I'm not even a double-E :)
Vaz is impossible to fall asleep in class with, and that is hard pull off especially when you have his class at 8AM
He's a great professor and a decent guy to deal with.  But then again, he tells you that at the beginning of every class.
Prof. Vaz makes your goals a reality and is 100% behind you!

Quite possibly the greatest advisors ever.  Not only is he approachable, but he's clear about objectives and a good all-around guy.  I'd highly recommend a course taught by him or as a project advisor.
Very good lecturer. It's a crime to skip his class. He'll make you enjoy doing work.
The best professor WPI has ever had. An incredible person to get to know too.
Best professor I've had at WPI.

I think Hersh gets a bad rap due to the fact that his only class is inherently difficult, writing-heavy, and time-consuming. He definitely has his faults - he can be a bit inconsistent and his lectures aren't the most useful. But I found he genuinely wanted to help and support his students, and didn't notice any signs of disrespect or lack of care.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Such a terrible professor. Thinks he knows everything and doesn't listen to what the students have to say. Such little respect for students.
Used degrading and offensive language to students. Contradicted his unclear expectations, and was kind until you made a mistake.

While ID2050 wasn't the best time (is it ever?), I really enjoyed having Bob as an advisor in the end. He genuinely cared about the well-being of our project (and us) and went out of his way to ensure we had a good time on IQP. If you show that you care, put in effort, and show professionalism in the project, you'll get along great with Bob!

He is incredibly hard to work with. He never gives clear expectations and in 15 weeks of having him as an advisor he only twice gave positive feedback to my group. He is extremely arrogant and will only point out what is wrong and will rarely tell you how to fix it. Avoid.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Disrespectful, rude, and refuses to take responsibility for his own actions. Everything that goes wrong is your fault even though you redo things exactly as he describes them. Will never give clear expectations until the after due dates, and only to tell you you did a horrible job.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: The most unprofessional and rude professor I have ever worked with. Constantly contradicts himself every other day and only skims students work when grading. The worst professor of all time.

Ah yes, "Instructor Bob"(He doesn't have a PhD). This guys got an ego that will inevitably frustrate you and create extra work. Ultimately just do what he says, come up with something creative for your project, and show that you give a damn and the A is yours. Don't let him ruin your time abroad with his demands, just fake it till ya make it.

Hands down my favorite Professor I've had so far. He went above and beyond to see our project succeed. He is a very knowledgeable and caring professor that takes the time to get to know each of his students. I'm usually not the type of person to write these reviews, but I honestly can't say enough good things about Bob Hersh.

Great teacher who is super dedicated to his students and committed to furthering their knowledge and involvement with the world around them. Provides useful feedback on papers and is always willing to push the students in thoughtful conversation.

"Ugh" basically sums it up. He was really rude and showed absolutely no interest on my group project. He insulted my group many times and would make us go against what our project sponsors wanted, even though it is their project. At our final presentation, he sat there never once looking up and left the instant it was over. Rude. So. Rude. AVOID.
Assigns tons of work and expects you to do it in almost no time.

He was very unprofessional throughout the duration of ID 2050 and IQP. Often times his suggestions were unrealistic and seemly unrelated to the project. Appeared as though he rarely prepared for meetings and didn't read your work until the last minute. Seemed more interested in his personal objectives than in advising projects.

During IQP he was not only completely unprofessional but did not help at all with our project. If comments were made they were not useful and only made us more confused. He was also poor at returning assignments in a timely manner.
Can be demanding but I learned so much about researching, presenting, and writing. He's a dedicated teacher.
There was extremely poor communication between him and the project advisor and there was slow turnaround on our feedback for our project.
Fantastic project in Cape Town.  He's an excellent professor
Prof. Hersh was excellent and his written comments on papers were extensive.
Doesnt read your paper until last minute at which point he destroys it and expects you to last minute rewrite your 100+ page paper.
I had IQP last year with him. He throws around key words and rambles alot.
This guy is very disrespectful to students. The man has passion, but honestly made me question being a robotics major
Best teacher I've had here

The most passionate lecturer I have ever had. Very smart and good at explaining what he needs to. Helps  A LOT in office hours. Rude and condescending at times, which makes it hard to want to work with him, but does not happen too often.

Stafford is a great lecturer and super helpful outside of class. Don't be afraid to go to his office hours. I went to almost all of them and learned and understood more that I would have by just going to lectures. He wants you to learn, so he will push you, but if you really want to learn and don't just want an easy A, he is who you want.
Very helpfull

RBE1001 is the closest thing to a weed-out class at WPI. Working in teams in mandatory. Staying up late is mandatory. Putting lots of hours into a thing that won't really work is mandatory. But the class is awesome. If you love it, you will be a fantastic robotics major. If not, you will still make a pretty good robotics major.

Difficult and VERY fast paced class. A completely new topic is discussed every two days. Don't fall behind and come into the class with at least a basic understanding of programming. Stafford is open to helping you after class. Very enthusiastic, but he will talk your ear off if you let him.
Partnered with Gennert, he teaches his class very well, and is clearly passionate about the material.  Just don't make him angry.  You wouldn't like him when he's angry.
Great guy! Gives extra points after quizzes for coming in during office hours! Make sure to come to class everyday, and pay attention. Quizzes are also open note, which are also available online.

Great help when stuck on problems/quizzes. Quiz material is VERY unfair, and homework will never be handed back when you need it.Otherwise, fun class, clear communication, and interesting approaches to the mundane.
Great Guy, super interesting, but as far as teaching goes he's pretty unclear. He can only teach something one way.
Stafford is the man. And he's special ops, so he's probably killed people with his bare hands. That spells good proffesor to me. Easy A, don't get killed.
Smart guy.
Very Cool.....
Fun guy, writes BAD tests
awsome dude
No Comments
Teaches Well, not very helpful in the labs
This guy is the best teacher I have had at WPI!

Very good professor, always havs time to answer your questions. You can really influence your grading by the amount of work you put in the assignments. You will really get a lot of it, in he course CE587 it was 12 readings, 12 labs, 13 class exercises. This counts for 60 percent of the final grade and 40 percent the term project, which is much work
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: Go to class and you will do fine. Quizzes very similar to the homework. Overall enjoyed this class.

I had his classes 20 years ago. At the time I thought his assigned work load was very heavy and he was tough on grading and probably would have rated him Low because of that. I have since realized that this is what to expect in the working world and he undoubtedly prepared me more for my professional career than any other professor because of it.

The guy can be nice sometimes but is mostly a jerk. Doesn't care at all about his students. My overall grade in the class was a 79.89 and he gave me a C. Wtf. I asked if he could round up a fraction of a percent (like most professors would do) or give me an extra credit credit assignment and he wouldn't budge. Also, sucks at explaining concepts.

Salazar is a nice guy and he cares deeply for what he does and his students. His quizzes are graded some what harshly at times but as long as you do your hw you can do well on them. The homework is busy work mostly and is a lot of complicated excel work. The group project can be kind of vague, ask as for help as much as you need in order to succeed
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Help me through the tough time

has no concept of the work load he assigns. doesn't grade anything so he is clueless where the students stand. does not explain problems well, likes to complicate life for no reason by assigning busy useless work. don't take him if you can.
HORRIBLE PROFESSOR DONT TAKE HIS CLASSES

Helpful outside of class even though he is taking on several projects and is part of several committees. He even takes on students who are paired with other advisors who aren't receiving as much help. Good guy! Uses a lot of hands on examples and gets students connected with real employers and people in the industry.
very good

Prof. Salazar is a great professor. If you go talk to him he will work hard to help you and can always provide useful real-world examples to put the project into perspective. I would recommend him to any student!!

Horrible professor. Has no concept of time and assigns very vauge and time consuming work. If you take one class with him, you will have taken them all since he uses the same powerpoints and only knows how to teach project management. Even in a class that solely was meant to teach 3D design, he teaches project management.
He is too busy to help his students.

Did an MQP project with him in 2001/2002 as an exchange students. He is very dedicated and helpful. Takes his job seriously and provides very good hints. Even though it was a tough time for me, I had a very good experience. Thanks again.
No Comments

He knows what he's talking about, assigns a good amount of work but its not that hard, mostly just busy work, I liked the class tho...I recommend taking it if your interested in Project Management or management in general
Very enthusiastic about the subject, but doesn't explain requirements well, and assigns excessive amounts of busywork.  Is also in love with powerpoint.
The class is a general waste of time with regards to learning, but is a good intro to CE.
Cool guy, fun class, lots of hands-on activities.

Super chill. I love this guy. He is unclear with deadlines and assignments, mainly because he doesn't care when they get done. Absolutely no reason to hate on him. He won't let you fail his class. He makes it impossible to cheat or fail tests because he doesn't like failing people. On that topic I never had an exam in that class so no need to worry

His class is horribly organized, he hasn't posted a quiz for the past 3 weeks. His "textbook" is something he was writing along the way and he gave up on halfway through. His lectures do not have a clear point, but he does know what he's talking about. The lab section of the class had seemingly no point for most of the term. Grading is not clear.

Toby is one of the best professors at WPI. When you get into the higher level stuff (i.e. above ME1800) it's clear that he really knows what he's talking about. One of the few classes where I've actually wanted to go to the lectures and pay attention the whole time. Final was verbal and done as a class. Made dope stuff and got to keep it. A+ guy.
Terrible. Extremely inconsistent. Does not post assignments when he says he will, is inaccessible outside of class. Quizzes are nothing like the lecture material. Don't take this guy
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lectures are completely optional. He knows a lot but he's not good at illustrating points and ideas. Labs are interesting.

Super smart guy! Clearly knows what he is doing. He makes lectures super entertaining. Not to much work outside of class but material is fascinating. Labs and lecture don't overlap too much but both are interesting on their own.

He really knows his stuff. He is not one of those m.e. majors who teaches it without practical experience. He has worked in the industry for years and has a great mind for engineering. This class is a real look at engineering. It is messy, difficult, and will not always work as planned, but this class builds an engineering thought process.

Toby runs a fun and engaging class. He may not be very organized online, but he brings a lot of experience and energy to the classroom. I think he has the right mindset for an introductory manufacturing course: get kids inspired rather than teach them a lot of stuff they'll forget (you don't learn that much).
If you have never done any ME labs before, you will find his labs very confusing. He does not help you in the lab, and does not reply emails often.

Toby is absolutely AMAZING - in some respects. His lectures, while hilarious, usually don't mean much of anything to the class itself. I know the class is being redone, but coming in with no machining knowledge at all. the labs were really, really confusing. My best advice: use your PLA's. Confused? Ask questions, that's why they're there!
One of the easiest A(s), I received in college. I don't retain much from this class

Good lecturer who tries to engage the class, which is a nice change. Labs are pretty straight forward and fun. CAM assignments can be a bit frustrating, usually there's little help during lab time. Quizzes are generally easy, too. Overall good teacher, but pretty unorganized. Very nice and personable one on one though
Worst teach at WPI. Totally into himself. He is not good teacher. Often changes dates for quizzes and labs.

Lectures are relatively straightforward and can be skipped. Class is an easy A, but not very helpful besides giving access to Washburn Shops. Get a friend to show you how to use the machines instead if it's not a requirement.

Had him as a lab instructor and substitute lecturer.  He is very disorganized.  The first 20 minutes of every lab was spent figuring out what we were supposed to do.  I still don't know if I finished all the labs, and the TAs didn't seem to know much more than we did about the material. Decent at lecturing, but I was very disappointed in the course

He is enthusiastic and spastic and amusing to watch in class. Unfortunately he is also not good at teaching the material relevant to the homework. Class is still interesting but if you want to do well of the quizes use the ME Manual available online. Often changes dates for quizes and labs. No tests tho :)

The ME department gives the impression that this is a must-take class for Mech-e freshmen. Do it as an overload later on with Toby, and take an extra class you want. Lab work is trivially easy, and lectures aren't really useful unless you plan to design machine tools for a living. Weekly quizzes determine much of your grade, an almost guaranteed A.
You learn how to hit the big green button on a CNC mill. that's it. REALLY EASY CLASS
Great guy, machine shop manager.  Knows his stuff and is happy to teach it.  Can be overworked at times.
Had Prof. Levey twice so far. She is such a sweet person who really cares if you understand the material. She is really helpful at office hours so don't be afraid to go!

Levey was great for Thermo! Her teaching was very understandable exploring concepts without being too dry. She was very friendly and empathetic, and always supported questions when brought up. The actual course was very lenient with the tests being relatively easy, overall a great experience

I have received a B in every single one of her classes, but she's easily one of the best professors for ES2001, ES3001, ES3002, or ME4420. If you do the work and put time into the course, she'll recognize that. At the same time, you have to work for an A. Again, one of the best profs at WPI.

Prof. Levey did a great job explaining thermo in simple terms that made perfect sense to me. The homework was doable with some work and there were no surprises on exams. She obviously cared about teaching the material and making sure students understood it. I would definitely take her again for another class.

Professor relies on Power Points to lecture, but doesnt put any of the important stuff in the presentation. Teaches mostly concepts, but HWK and tests are calculations. Expects students to do four times the graded work to prepare for exams.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is a good teacher if you are quick to understand concepts. I NRed the first time, and the second time around I still do not understand ( but that is just me ). She does not like to go off-schedule, and it is hard to make-up and reschedule tests if you have a prior engagement. In my experience with her she was also very disrespectful

She's a good teacher, good at explaining things, wants students to succeed. Thermodynamics is hard. Her homework load is difficult. The HW is occasionally wrong. There are tests every Friday (lowest is dropped). You should read the textbook. It's online and a pain, but clearly written. You'll learn a lot, it's a content-heavy course.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Little bit dry personality, but if you follow her curriculum you will do well in the class.

Levey is a good teacher who cares about her students learning. There is a decent amount of homework, but I found it to prepare me well for the test. Lectures are a good mix of explications and examples.  Overall, I found it to be good class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: It was a really hard class. the HW is close to the exam but you would suffer from the definition or the one word questions which she ADORES. She doesn't provide practice exams which make it even harder. Do the clickers. If you want to get an A don't take that class !

Awesome Professor. I took her class for both Materials and Thermo. Sometimes takes attendance. Respectful towards students.  Really wants you to learn. A fair amount of homework, but not extreme. She always spends time going over extra practice problems in class step by step, rather than just telling us a lot of theory. Great Professor.
Classes were mostly example problems. She was very helpful with giving help on HW in class and responds to emails quickly. Tests were very fair and relativity straightforward.

A bit harder than I would expect for an intro class, but she's a really good lecturer, and you come out of it feeling like you learned something. Decent amount of homework but it's straightforward and good practice. Tests were a little tough but not unreasonable. Pay attention and go to office hours if you need to. Overall great prof.
Maybe I'm just slow, but this class was HARD! I NR'd it.Lots of HW! Make sure to get lots of help from her and the TA's ,something I didn't do.But yeah not easy,lots of new concepts to learn.
Great professor. Homework is straight forward and connects to the tests. Uses demonstrations and other methods to hit points. Will always stop for questions. Definitely recommend!

Excellent professor! Homeworks are straightfoward and good practice on what was talked about in class, never ran into any random curveballs. She was also really helpful and did everything she could to help students understand problems if they were having issues.
She is great. The in class problems are really great for learning and helpful for the tests. She brings in lots of fun things for examples. Tests are cumulative but fair.
She is very helpful and the material is relatively straightforward. She is very nice and willing to help!! I would strongly recommend this professor.

Good professor to take Material Science with. Lectures occasionally go off-topic. But Levey gives great homework and tests, no surprises. She even spends a few minutes of every class on in-class example problems. Helpful outside of class too. Quiet speaker...sit up front.

ES1020 with Professor Guceri has a simple breakdown. If you attend all classes (30% of your grade) and do HW (20% of your grade w/ revisions if you lost a few points) you've already maxed out two categories in your control. A 30-page (individual) or 50-page paper (partner) is not graded harshly but 30%. The final is 20% (Take notes during lecture)
You have two options, learn thermodynamics or get an A. Take this professor's class if you want an A. Teach yourself thermodynamics through the course as needed.

Teaches a lot about real-world applications of the course material which is cool. He's really kind and passionate about giving people A's, but everyone I knew cheated their way to get there. Office hours were the only way I learned anything.

If you are looking for an easy A he's the guy for you. Nevertheless, he doesn't know how to teach and won't teach. His powerpoints have all the equations you need and were it not for his flexibility with the exams people wouldn't be getting As. I learned from the book for the entirety of the class.

He was one of the nicest professors I have had! He spends a lot of time lecturing and does not give too much homework. He does however give a40 page paper which he explains is a "project" so beware. Overall it is easy to get an A in this class and he is very nice and fun to learn from! "
Literally easiest mechanical engineering class I have taken. He's a riot and super nice, really passionate about giving out A's. You probably won't learn much though.
Guc is probably one of the nicest people in this school if you want an A, I would recommend taking his classes he will guaranteed give you an A. Just make sure you understand what is going on though.

Very nice professor, although teaching style consists of asking many basic questions to students that relate to material, but at times felt unnecessary. You should read the book in addition to attending lectures, as it will help you retain notes. Most people earn As, but make sure you do all your work.

Professor Guceri cares a lot about students but basically gives everyone an A. Definitely the worst professor I've ever had at WPI. Doesn't teach at all, spends entire lectures talking about history instead of thermo. Going to class is a waste of your time, except he makes it mandatory. Gets confused by his own example problems, taught myself.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Guc is such a caring professor who really wants people to learn the material. He spends a lot of time making his slides and theyre really helpful, along with his study guides and sample exams. He tried to make difficult content as manageable as possible and is willing to spend time with you to help you learn! There are no tricks in his class.

Hes a really sweet guy who cares that you know the material. He spends a lot of class time talking about real life examples and doesnt do too many problems but he goes over how to do each homework problem. His lecture slides provide everything you need so if you pay attention, its actually very easy. Go to office hours, they really do help you!

Taking this class with Professor Guceri was a great way to help ease me into the WPI curriculum A term freshman year. This class hardly took any time outside of class for the first half of the course aside from a few homework assignments which were actually interesting. Sometimes gets carried away due to his passion for engineering. Highly reccmnd!

Super nice guy, but super easy A. Pretty sure the final was scaled AND curved. Teaches concepts super in-depth, but nothing is every applied to actual problems in class, so the practical purposes are found in the textbook examples. My friend and I essentially taught ourselves the course. Don't know if I really learned that much.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: The only big things we had in this class was a 30 page paper due at the end of the quarter, minimal homework, and a quiz as our final. This paper may seem daunting at first but you learn a lot about your topic, so as long as you pick something you are actually interested in it's great! He is also very knowledgeable on the subject.

Guceri is a real sweet person, he definitely cares about his students. I had him for Intro ES which is a rather easy course. Homework was scarce and really easy but his final quiz and term paper amped it up a bit. Really it boils down to participation and effort, that's what he cares about.

He's a really nice guy and it is clear he doesn't want anyone to struggle. His homework assignments and tests are brief and not too difficult. His lectures are interesting only if you are interested in engines and/or power plants.  He makes obscure references and calls on students randomly. He does a good job of making tricky concepts simpler.

If you show up, you get an A. But, you may not learn anything from the class. This will only hurt in the long run as it shows in my summer job. He does not care about test scores as much as making everyone happy. This is college?

Guch is great! Office hours are the key to getting an A, regardless of test scores. The class itself is hard, but he truly cares about students and wants you to learn. I would definitely recommend this professor.

Professor Guceri has the students' best interests at heart. He made it a point to learn everyone's name and put effort into providing a comfortable learning environment. As long as you show up to class and show mild interest, he will hold a high opinion of you -- even better if you go to office hours. He is the best professor I have ever had!

Please leave WPI. He uses the same course information in all of his classes.  I think the slides were created in the 90's. I had him for an advisor (4 years) and an MQP advisor this year. He is a terrible advisor both for school and the MQP.

He teaches the same materials in his freshman, sophomore and senior classes. He uses the same lectures and notes. He assigned the same book for all three courses which is the worst book ever. I did not learn anything in  this class. Why does WPI keep the older professors that should be retired. No a lighter note, easy grader.

I took Intro to Engineering with Prof. Hoffman. The class was very work-heavy and group-focused. It was a LOT of work. That said, I definitely recommend the class. The skills it sets you up with are invaluable. Learning how to write proper papers for engineering and working on an engineering project as a group are a must at WPI.
He assigned was the worst book I've used for any course. I didn't learn anything class
Worse choice for an advisor. Interesting project however that means nothing when advisors are terrible. Doesn't not understand industry only academics.

Term project really put "Theory and Practice" into use, providing valuable experience. Surprising has a lot of writing for an A-term freshman course. Homework and quizzes were graded more leniently than expected. Reading assignments are very important to do. Lectures occasionally get a bit boring. Overall would recommend the class.
Extremely condescending. Some of the material is interesting but completely unnecessary. I would not recommend taking his class at all.

Fairly easy class, but also a lot of fun. This class was project based, so it gave you some good experience to talk about during job interviews. Class simulated a real company, with each member of group given a 'job', which was cool to do. Quizes were pretty easy as long as you read the book

He is a pretty nice guy.  The class is a bit more writing than I was expecting for my first course at WPI, but you learn a lot from this class about the design process and what it means to be an engineer. A lot of work, especially for the term project, but he grades pretty easily on quizzes and homeworks.  Good project experience

One of the best professors I had at WPI. Dr. Hoffman is very knowledgeable, communicates effectively and a fair grader. The work seemed a lot but you will end up with a comprehensive knowledge of the subject without a lot of stress. Excellent graduate level course.
Read the book, mainly the case studies and you will do fine on the quizzes.

Hoffman is awesome. He is interesed in the subject matter and makes it hard to doze off in class even when its early in the morning. He's really helpful when you ask him questions in and out of class. Definately take a class with him if at all possible!
No Comments
Professor Hoffman knows what he is talking about. Having been in the field, he explains how class work is useful in the real world, and keeps things interesting for all.
i pay fourty thousand dollars a year to listen to this man **** for fifty minutes five times a week.
PHoff is the man. His delightful stories kept me awake during those 9 oclock classes. He is a God of men
Fluff class itself so material's not hard.  His accent his hard on the ears- heavy, loudy emphasis on some words and light on others. have no idea where it's from.

I completely agree with the other person's comments. He's one of the most condescending profs I've had to deal with. This entire class was complete b.s. I didn't learn a thing.  Worst class I've taken (& I'm a senior). Lectures were boring as all hell.
I dont know why everyone likes him I think hes very condescending and he doesnt teach a thing except how to bullshit.

First, he doesn't use canvas so you have to track your grades on your own. He teaches all the concepts through the use of graphs and equations and it can get confusing because the textbook doesn't have some of the things he writes. If you miss class your screwed because most of what's online are not the same as how he teaches.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: He taught my Microeconomics class and really was an understanding guy. He graded us on only three criteria (2 tests and homework), and I thought after failing the first test, that I would for sure get a C. However, I spoke with him, he got to know me, and he ended up giving me a B because he knew I was trying my best in a class outside my major.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Doesn't use canvas, so it is very hard to tell how you are doing in the class. I got an A on the first test, As and Bs and the homework, didn't get my final test back, which I thought I did well on, and ended with a C. He is very hard to understand and there are not really any resources for help outside of the class.
Doesn't use canvas

Great professor, hard to understand sometimes with his Greek accent but all in all a great professor and am taking him again this term.  Easy A if you go to class and pay attention.  50% of grade is off take home midterms and finals!

Great guy. The class is conceptually easy but he teaches most concepts with graphs. Open book exams are easy 100% and closed book is hard if you don't read the textbook. He loves to tell jokes so try to bring funny stories to class.

He is a really good professor but you basically have to learn everything on your own for the closed book tests. He explains everything with graphs which doesn't help you to understand things conceptually. Open book portions of the test are easy 100s as they are cookie cutter problems. Full credit for hw regardless of whether you did it or not
His course is absolutely worth to take.
Easily the best professor I've had so far. Loves his students and is extremely helpful. Makes a 2 hour class seem like a breeze. Take home exam and in class exam aren't too bad.

Was that 2 hours? It would only take someone as special as this professor to make you go through a 2 hour economics course and make it feel like you've been there for only 20 minutes. He is so funny. I only took this course as part requirement but this is most fun I've ever had taking a class. Take his class, you'll not regret it.

Fun guy, makes a two-hour economics lecture occasionally interesting. Test material comes directly from the lectures, as does homework. Copy down what he writes in class to get an easy A (Open note tests/hw).
LOVED HIM - Best prof I've ever had - and he's funny
best professor ever! strong recommended

Extremely interesting and very understanding! The difficulty level is very moderate. He also has long office hours and a very positive attitude. Overall, he's just a very nice guy. Extremely knowledgeable of the material and is current with topics in economics. A fantastic class! Must take for social requirement!
The best Professor i have ever had. Prof. Kanteralis is just amazing.His lectures are sooo interesting and he is hilarious too.u wd just love attending his class

Light-hearted with a good sense of humor. He has a slightly thick Greek accent, but he does his best to compensate. Prof. Kantarelis incorporates current economic events into the class to drive points home. I would highly recommend taking a class with him.
No Comments

Didn't speak loud enough or clear enough, and it was compounded by his inability to draw clear diagrams. All he used were these damn diagrams, and we were supposed to memorize every single one of them.
He's really funny, had a funny Greek accent, and made a topic that was completely uninteresting to me moderately interesting.

Dimentberg is not the best, but not the worst. He is cute, and enjoys what he does. The lectures are very dry, however the tests are easy. They are re-used year to year and open book, open note. More specifically, the tests just says to do 3 book problems and turn them in, you can verify if your answer is correct in the back of the back of the book

Worst professor I had at WPI. He speaks very slow and is hard to understand. Lectures have no context. The course is supposed to be broad but he focuses and bases his lectures/exams on his research/papers. There is no TA so the only person you can get help from is the professor but if you talk to fast he doesn't understand.

He is one of the WORST professors I've had. He's way too old to still be teaching. His lectures are slow and boring and his directions for the project are very unclear and confusing. The textbook is even worse than he is because it skips over so many important steps needed to understand. The assigned work an exams are graded very easily however.

Lectures mostly consist of him reading straight from his notes without explaining anything. He doesn't understand questions and will answer something completely different from what was asked. Only reference materials are his own (hard to understand) published papers. Grade was based on three take-home exams, two of which were due in the same week.

One of the worst professors I've had. Lectures did not cover exam material until a 'review' lecture right before the exam. Very hard to understand what he said. Heavy Russian accent. His 'examples' skip nearly every step and take 20 minutes of math and research to prove he did them correctly.  Avoid him if you can. Learned very little.
Analytical methods should be a broad topic.  He made it extremely narrow and I honestly don't know what I "learned" from this class other than how to grab information off technical papers.  Avoid.

Very nice person, but lectures are way above undergrad level. 90% of lectures are theory and deriving formulas. HW and test problems are much more practical, like advanced ES2503/basic DiffEq type problems. Thank god for the wonderful TA because I don't think I would have passed the class otherwise. 3 exams total, 1 project, HW due every other week
One piece of advice: don't rely on the solution manual. you won't learn dynamics from the solutions. the professor is willing to help you. he always listen to us.

I don't understand why ppl rate this professor so low! His class is very useful. If you get an A in this class just because you have the solution manual, then you will fail to learn dynamics. His class examples are pretty good, you have to read the book first in order to understand his lectures. the pace is fast. however, you won't regret the class

This guy is way to smart to be teaching undergraduates. You need to teach yourself a lot to understand his in class examples. He will try to explain things to you the simplest way he can, but there is a bit of a language barrier. He really does care about his students. If you approach him about something he will do his best to help out.

If you want to learn about dynamics, do not take him. He uses examples from the book to lecture and is horrible at explaining things. You will need to exclusively learn from the book. All exams are open book, open notes with problems from the book

Good teacher if you want an easy grade, but you will not learn too much.  All homework and exams are taken from the textbook.  Very difficult to understand in class and generally only teaches from examples already outlined in the textbook.  Be prepared to learn from the book.

If you wanna learn, DONT take himThis guy can not teach to save his life, very unclear in teaching something as simple as stress analysis, open book and open note tests? AND test questions straight from book? you have gotta be kidding me. So get this, last exam of the term, TA catches half of the class using solution manual to EVERY single problem.
Very easy, and very interesting.  And by interesting, I mean fun to watch.  "In Russia, we drink Vodka from can."

Avoid like ... well Avoid at all costs.  He is unclear, thinks the students are idiots, and when told that he did not teach something he will pull out a notebook from several years ago and say, here it is, after not finding it in the book he is using.  Impossible Tests. No respect for the student.
Easiest A i have ever gotten
not bad teacher, but homeworks and exams are hard...
Guarenteed A, but I would suggest NEVER going to class, it is just a waste of time.
sooooooooooo slow

This class is unreal. Professor doesn't know biology, only as topic to teach advanced statistics that all seem to be roundabout ways of analyzing data. There is no structure to the class at all, can't even follow what I am supposed to be "learning" from the course. Homework needs outside sources and doesn't relate well to class. Dread every class.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Genuinely an awful professor. Teaching a 4000-level bioinformatics course with no background in biology, except for Kahn Academy, and is frequently incorrect on statements made about it. Lectures are extremely roundabout, not straightforward. Homework is tangential to lectures at best, and requires outside resources to complete.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Absolutely terrible professor. Did not know what he was talking about and had to be corrected by several students many times. Could not correctly do math and took off points when he was wrong. Did not go over homework and just took points off. Taught a 4000s level BCB class using Khan Academy and responded to a student with "this is what khan says"

His homework is counted toward 40 percent of your total grade. Please do the homeworks thoroughly. The mid-term and final-term takes 20 and 30 percent respectively. The mid-term and final-term questions are similar to homework questions. Homework assignments are on MyLab Master

Prof. Wu's course was well-structured; however, his lectures were rough, even with neat lecture slides. His handwriting was atrocious, and following it during an example was near impossible. He relied heavily on Pearson ($100+), which did not award partial credit for exams (you had to email him for it). Also, he did pop quizzes to force attendance.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Had him C22 and it was eh. Homework is once a week and on Pearson, labs are also once a week. Tests are on Pearson... which doesn't give partial credit but if you email him about it, you can get some partial credit from it and same with the HW. Lectures are verbatim from the slides, so you can either look at the slides or watch his Echo360.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He was very organized and his lectures made sense. He made it easy to do the class online if students wanted. This class was super boring, and I think he relied too much on materials from Pearson/ the textbook. I stopped going and just looked at the lecture slides and it was fine. The grading was fair and the homeworks and exams were not hard.

I had him for stats 1 this past C term and it was alright. Homework was on Pearson, due once a week except for the last week when we had two assignments. Tests are on Pearson, which is understandable but annoying because theres no partial credit. Pearson is horrible but thats standard for every class. Labs were easy, follow the directions.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Only two tests, midterm and final, but sample midterms and finals were posted that were very similar to actual exams. Online homework, not very challenging. Prof is not super engaging, but gets his point across. A lot of people stopped showing up, pretty sure they did fine. Posts lecture notes, labs are pretty easy
This professor has the worst handwriting in history, honestly it makes a doctors handwriting look like my grandmas cursive. Also his class is very ambiguous and hard to know what youre learning

Lectures were straightforward, but kind of boring. Professor Wu is definitely knowledgeable about the subject. Homework was on Webwork and wasn't hard. Only had a midterm and a final. Labs were easy, just follow the directions.

Good professor, straightforward lectures, low workload. You can bring a double sided cheat sheet to the tests. Can definitely get a good grade. Lectures are straight powerpoint and not very engaging, but not a huge problem.
He makes me internally scream every single class

Not worth going to class. Can't hear or understand him and all he does is read off the slides. I learned more watching youtube videos than reading his lecture notes. Puts trick questions on the tests so watch those. Simple weekly homeworks. Extra credit for showing up to class
Loved the class. The professor is helpful and encouraging. What I learned helped me in my MQP work.

Easy A. Was a boring class, barely attended because he read verbatim off the slides. Wasn't very engaging and put trick questions on the exams. If you complained he would not budge a bit, even when the entire class complained about the same problem. Overall easy A but I do not have a great knowledge of the material. Avoid him if youre taking Stat 2

He teaches simple materials and makes them complicated. Wasted a lots of time on class doing hard calculations by hand, instead of focus on 'mathematical-thinking'. e can't interpret students reaction (whether they got it or not) because he only talks to the blackboard. A good person, respect students,hard working professor, but not good teacher
Just reads off his slides all class, not very engaging.  The notes are not very helpful either
He put me to sleep every class
NICE PROFESSOR!
Pretty Nice Professor. He is really expertise in his field. Fun and interesting
Perfect professor and perfect class

This guy has no idea how to explain concepts. The most scatterbrained professor at WPI. He has no idea what he's talking about half the time (doesn't know how to do his own HW). His posted assignments are a different version than those he hands out in class! This guy spends zero time concerned with undegrad. Steer clear!!

Worst professor in ECE. He gives awful explanations that make no sense. He interuses terms you never heard of. You've never seen the material on the homework. He wrote his book so it's zero help. His tests are incredibly hard. He will not help you outside of class. Extremely dissorganized. Avoid at all costs. You've no idea if you have an A or F.
Best professor in ECE department, have a good vision in wireless industry and localization technique. Benefits a lot in his lecture!!!!
Best research oriented course ever.
Best professor in ECE WPI
Very condescending professor.

DO NOT listen to the undergrad simple minds from ECE3308/ECE506. Kaveh's book is using by over 7million students world wide and his response to technical questions are perfect. Learning with him is a good chance to open a brand new gate for future career!

As a professor he lacks the ability to convey his ideas to the class. Gives moral lectures more compared to what is required. Talks about his own personal achievement more which is totally unnecessary. Often talks about entrepreneurship more than what should be taught. Professor Wyglinsky is way better and knowledgeable.
Perfect lectures and easy homework. 2 TAs well prepared to help students on whatevery question. If you still find that math is a problem, you have to review your highschool course...
The best in his field. Explains clearly. Might get a bit boring, but overall great guy.

This professor is incredibly intelligent. If you're a zombie student who doesn't ask questions you'll have a higher chance of getting lost. Helpful through e-mail/office hours. The key is to ask questions if you get lost and not expect him to know Wireless networks AND exactly how much you know too!

This professor is very kind and intelligent.  He tends to talk a lot and get off topic, but if you do the homework every week, you'll get an A in the end.  He's more than willing to give extra help, and he is a VERY fair grader.  Easy A.

He is supposedly well-reputed in the field of Wireless, but honestly I think he is dumb - atleast as an instructor. I think the guy's brain is fried from thinking too much about wireless. His lectures and his damn BOOK are all over the place. I didnt learn much from the class, although it was an easy 'A'. Overall: Not worth your tuition.

Pahlavan is a founding father of Wireless Networking. He cannot, however, convey information clearly. The class work and book is scattered and dense. Tests involved overly complicated math. I learned little and was bored to death. Avoid like the plague.

Palavan was the absolute worst professor I have ever had. He does not communicate well at all.  He wrote the book for this class, and the book is mostly useless. He jumps around in class and speeks in a heavy monotone.
No Comments

The worst. For such an important topic in materials science he barely teaches anything. Presents little if any insight into the material and his notes are either illegible or straight up wrong. If you want any true insight into the material you need to seek it out yourself. Avoid at all costs unless you're just looking for an empty A.

Maybe he is a good professor in person, but his online classes are BAD. Barely explains subject or expands upon key principles. Lectures are very short. Notes contain errors and are scanned so poorly they are illegible. Material taught is barely expanded upon. Tests are straight forward though. Easy A but little understanding.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. He is by no means difficult, as exams are copied from homework, all of which are copied from his past classes. Slides appear to have been made right before class. Barely responds to email, vague and rude when he does. It's clear WPI can't fire him and he knows it. He literally does not care if you pass

This is a materials science class, not a heat transfer class. He's an informative lecturer, and a good teacher. He'll answer questions but he's sassy about it, almost insulting. He'll tell you what's on the test, study that and you'll be fine. You'll learn a lot, but it's scattered knowledge and he doesn't use course time efficiently.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Respected and helpful but Very Cocky and assumes a perfect student
Very interesting prof. Speaks a little of color at times, but definitely knows his stuff. Not super helpful, so it may be a tough class if you can not follow along.

Web-based class. Lectured online only 1 hour per week. No help sessions. Doesn't answer email/phone messages. Posted no homework solutions until after mid-term exam, which was given in eighth week of 10-week class.  10-week class ran into 12 weeks.  Lectured straight from assigned readings. Didn't learn much about the class subject in this class.

Very lazy. No formal syllabus, organization, TAs, recitation, office hrs, etc. his approach was way too laxed. Talked about football too much during class. Didn't make an effort to give a good lecture
He's an awesome Professor. His lecture r very cool. Make sure u know about the american culture.

He's good at explaining things and has lots of good real life examples.  He doesn't always seem to have a lot of respect for the class: taking weeks to grade papers, using the exact same presentation for multiple class (and not reviewing it beforehand), coming late and leaving early, etc.  You do learn a lot, though.
Great Teacher. Great Stories. Loves Virginia Tech.
Sisson is amazing! Make sure you know what a hokie (Virginia Tech) is.
Really nice guy, fun class.  If you go to class and pay attention you should do fine on the tests.  Sometimes he rushes though.
Extremely nice guy, fun class.  He goes through the material pretty quickly, make sure you take good notes, test are very straight forward no suprises.
He is such an awesome prof!  And even if he's not your prof, get to know this guy!!!
Best Prof at Whoopie
A great professor.  Take a class or do a project with him.
one of the best professors WPI has.  is genuine and knowledgable.  take his classes!
No Comments

Reads straight from her slides with no insight into the material. Major project is worth 27% of your grade and she did not explain her expectations at all with an example given 1 week before it was due! No feedback when points are deducted from assignments which are so far beyond the lecture material it might as well be from a different subject.

Lectures are boring and sometimes confusing. The homework questions are rather easy but the exams are hard. Be prepared to encounter tricky questions on the exams that aren't learned in lectures. If you want to get through this class, rely on self-study.
She is not responsible for either the class and homework. You can not find her out of the class if you have any question. Not a good model for the student at all.
Not responsible. Made us more confused after taking her class.

Tell us nothing in class but the homework is pretty difficult as well as the final exam. Easy to get C in this class, and your grade will be depend on who is the TA. Her presentation is pretty boring and not well organized,she even cannot answer students questions, the slides she used in class can be useful unless you can understand by yourself.

Taking her class is like listening to presentation. She doesn't give a lot of explanations on formulas since she basically just reads off from the screen. I went to class solely because she counts the clicker grade. Boring class, fair tests.

Prof. Liang was average. She reads directly off a PowerPoint, and is somewhat clear/unclear in lecture. She does clicker Qs and in-class problems all based on effort and are helpful. There is weekly HW that is pretty manageable. Term-long project using a materials database is also pretty easy. Tests 1 and 2 were easy, 3rd was very difficult. 3/5.

About half of HW assignments were graded on participation and in-class problems are also graded. One small project (only 3 % of grade) was assigned. Tests are cumulative and finish with a 40% grade final exam. They are very easy, however. She is very unclear in lecture.
Avoid at all cost. 2 hour tests are more difficult than weekly homework assignments.  Doesn't understand the point of teaching.
Professor Liang is a good professor. The material in the class isn't very difficult in itself, but she does a good job of clarifying points of confusion.

Had her for Material Science, not the worst teacher but not the best. She is very interested in helping you learn the material but lectures are pretty boring. The material is really easy if you don't over complicate it. Lots of bonus point for coming to class and answering questions because a lot of people skip.

She doesn't teach. Everything that she talks about in class is 'review' of the assigned work. When i say work, i mean watching the video lectures that SOMEONE ELSE made and posted. At best she should be a conference instructor, rather than lecture to us. When she asks us if we have questions, she moves on without giving time to even raise a hand.
Not a good teacher. Boring class, disorganized with the presentation schedule.

class is boring but she is a very easy grader. you wont learn that much unless you really try hard, but the text book is always there for gaining knowledge. she also gives alot of in class questions which are quite helpful.she gives sample questions before exams too.

Just plain bad prof all around. disorganized, poor understanding of the topic, and iron and ion - pronounced exactly the same.  she doesn't need practice, she doesn't know what needs to be said in a class to help students understand
EASY class. She is very easy and helpful. I learned a lot and would take a class with her again in a heartbeat.

Very unorganized, doesn't really know what she is doing. Contradictions were common. Does not speak English well AT ALL so very very hard to understand. I would recommend taking this course with somebody else. Not a difficult course if you have a better professor.
Very inexperienced - maybe with practice she'll improve, but for now, I recommend avoiding her courses.

Awesome professor! Super understanding and really wants to work with his students as long as you communicate with him and put in the work on the quizzes. Every reading was also on Canvas, which was super helpful.

Prof Kirby assigns take home quizzes, and if you go to class, he pretty much gives you exactly what he wants for answers, so I recommend listening, even though sometimes you can zone out.  He takes attendance randomly, and attendance is part of your grade for class. Hes a funny, great guy, I  recommend taking the class

I found Prof. Kirby to be a very frustrating lecturer. He said in the beginning that "philosophy is a dialogue" but for him it was more a monologue. He never ended class on time and rarely had input from the class. He is a good guy and a fair enough grader. But class could just be very frustrating for students.

Great guy and a good teacher. He can go on and on sometimes but he really cares about the course and is just trying to get you as intrigued as he is. Assignments and reading are always given but if you have a busy day and can't get to them it's not a big deal. Extremely fair grader. Very enthusiastic. As I said, great guy.

There are no surprises when it comes to tests and grading. The material is really interesting if you keep an open mind throughout. The class environment is as fun as you make it. Prof Kirby provided good platform for debate and discussion which I really enjoyed. He really wants you to take something away not just merely pass the class.

Go to lecture, take note on some things he says because often times he just tells you the answers to the take-home tests. The other answers are in the assigned readings/videos so DO THE HWK. Easy class if you can spend 1 to 1.5 hours each day  outside class reading/ watching videos. NOT BORING if you are willing to reflect over the material

His class was very boring but he does not assign much work. If you pay attention in class than the quizzes are pretty easy. (And all quizzes are take home so thats a plus) But I found it hard to focus and find anything interesting because all he does is lecture. He isn't a bad teacher but also not the best.

I was really excited for this course going into it for the discussions and whatnot yet by the second week it turned into "Facebook time". He is a nice guy. He likes to repeat himself and just kind of mumbles onto his own side topics. Easy to get a good grade out of though, just do the research.

Really helpful. Loving to repeat himself in class. Hard to focus in class. Yet if you listened in class you could easily figure out the quiz questions, otherwise, a lot of searching will be needed. READ the materials even if they are suggested!!
Best philosophy professor, very interesting and nice.
Excellent lectures, he always has a lot of stories and anecdotes to share. Work-load is minimal to moderate and grading is fair.
Really nice guy but lectures can be kind of boring at points. Overall a good professor who gives out almost no work. Extremely lenient on deadlines when work is given and grades fairly.

Didn't really go to all of the classes, although it was technically mandatory. Very lenient on deadlines, and very thorough in his explanations. Sometimes it was hard to pay attention in class though.
Great Professor, take his class!!
sometimes hard to hear.
Easy though worhtwile assignments, Interesting and loads of fun! He's got a ton of stories. Highly Recomended
Wicked easy and LOTS of interesting stories!
Awesome guy, fairly interesting class. The assignments are really easy and interesting. Ask him about his life, he has great stories. HIGHLY RECCOMENDED!!

Class is very passable but its obvious he doesn't really care about teaching. Each class is written powerpoint slides that are the same as what he uploads on Canvas, and he'd find some way to end class early every time. Exams are multiple choice, so no partial credit, but there are easy bonus questions on them. Just do the hw and youll be fine

Posterro is just a bad teacher, he puts very little effort into his teachings, but the class is easy. Have to buy expensive program to do homework, which doesn't even get factored into your grade. Essentially, this guy does not care both him and his class is a joke.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took Posterro for MA 2071, (lin alg). His lectures are boring, but they get the message across. He is forgiving regarding extensions and his exams are usually very easy. Homework is on Pearson and its usually pretty straightforward.

Lectures are extremely fast paced, but are primarily examples of problems. Tests were weekly with bonus questions, lots of opportunities for extra credit. He was also very good about answering any question fully. He is personable and really gets the concepts across, but lectures are important to attend as that is where you learn everything.

Quizzes make up 90% of your grade and there are no tests. The quizzes are every week but are straight forward and multiple choice. Lots of chances for extra credit on the quizzes. Lectures are very fast paced but usually ended at least 10 minutes early.

You don't get any credit for homework. Your grade is an average of 7 quizzes. Submit it late and its a 0. This guy looks for ways to screw his students over and doesn't care if you learn the material or not. Avoid if this is not your learning style.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Quizzes each week out of 10 points, you can get half credit back with 5 extra credit questions at the end (each worth 1/2 point). Homework is odd problems out of the textbook, so the answers are on the back of the textbook. Straight forward, makes Calc 3 super bearable; it wasn't my hardest class this term. Take him for simplicity.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: The class is out of 100 points, and how the percentages work out, one point off a test is one point off of your grade. This can be frustrating since there is no note sheet allowed on the exam, so you need to memorize all of the equations. All exams are multiple choice, so make sure you know the material. Lectures are very boring. The labs are easy.

His lectures are boring but ppt slides are helpful enough since the course is relatively easy. His labs are really easy, usually take less than 30 mins. His tests are not hard but he doesn't allow you to bring a sheet of note, you'll do well if you remember everything from his ppt slides.
Statistics was honestly depressing, boring. Barry does not lecture well when it comes to stats. would NOT recommend for statistics

Would not recommend for statistics. The entire course was out of 100 points and the exams were multiple choice. In other words, if you missed a question on a test, it was -1 from your total grade. He didn't give back homework and refused to post our old tests to study for the final because it meant he'd have to make new tests.

Easiest calculus III class at WPI, Prof. Posterr ran straightforward lectures and frequently let us out early when he was done covering the material. Quizzes were focused on the material at hand,  and did not require use of more difficult forms of integration or more obscure trigonometric identities. Would highly recommend.
Clear, reasonable, and fun. Barry made calculous interesting and was a great way to kick of my freshman year of college.

Barry is great. He has a clear voice, a very organized method of teaching, and is extremely clear about what you need to know and what to expect from each class, quiz, and test. He does give homework, but no busy work if you can do every problem on the homework then you can do every problem on the test. If you cant, you can go talk to him.

Absolutely excellent. I am going to try to take as many classes from him as possible. Speaks perfectly. Just ask and he will explain in further detail. His classes are open to dialogue. I am actually starting to really like math. He assigns homework out of the book, so get one, or share one.

He was clear in class, and although he assigned homework every lecture, it was fairly easy, and the quizzes that were given every Friday were just homework problems with different numbers. Basically do the homework and pass.

At first, he was not that clear about basic concepts but as the term progressed he became very clear about how to do a problem and the theory behind it.  EXTREMELY clear about what is going to be on the weekly quizzes and has good office hours.  Willing to help students and wants them to succeed.
I had never taken calculus before, but he gave me the extra one -on-one time I needed to fully understand the material and do well in the class.  He genuinely cares about his students.

90% of the grade is based on 3 exams. Exams are 80% multiple choice and very short (20 questions or less). He is wicked funny and nice if you get to know him. He provides lots of clear examples, and supplemental videos. Definitely the easiest of the Biochem's

Very rude and unhelpful. Once refused to answer a question when asked in class. Misspellings abound in everything he writes. Clearly values research over the students. Lectures are extremely unhelpful. Exams are basically all multiple choice, zero partial credit. Group projects are easy but he will take off many points for minor citation issues.

While he was nice, he did not explain material clearly and was not helpful one-on-one. He was also a very strict grader and exams were 20 multiple choice questions. I would avoid this class at all costs or be EXTREMELY COMMITTED to study on your own.
Difficult to understand, absolutely no structure in his lectures, failsr to make the subject interesting. Very strong accent, ADD, colorblind, and dyslexic (frequently misspelled terms).

It seems like he doesn't even try to pronounce things correctly, and in a class where you have to learn a lot of new vocabulary, this is bad news. I don't want to go around saying Fo-ffo-leeped! The whole class tends to sleep though his lectures, and in a class of 18, it can be prettty akward to be around. AndIhavenoideaWHATTOSTUDY

Had him for Biochem II. Probably one of the worst profs. I've ever had. Unhelpful, full of himself, unclear, expects you to read his mind, and treats you like you're stupid if you don't get something. If you don't need it don't take it.
Class lacks organization.  Professor has impaired ability to speak and write English.  He is often hard to understand.

Took biochem lab +upper level biochem lecture with him (8yrs ago,ugh). Terrified of this guy, because he would make such a big deal out of details like keeping labbook, planning an exp't. when I had coasted thru other labs. But now as a 'real' scientist, the things he made too big a deal about are what I'm glad I ever learned...
He's not very helpful and his lectures are hard to follow. I never know what the point is of what he's talking.
He's a nice guys and he wants to help but he is hard to understand and his class plan (tho planned) isn't very easy to follow.
knows his stuff and lectures well, but class setup isnt great, not the best learning environment
No Comments
Patronizing.  Lectures are not clear.  Fickle with expectations.  Best to steer clear!
He appears all fun and helpful, but watch out - he'll screw you over and think nothing of it.
How could you not like this guy?  He's funny and very nice.  Has clear expectations as most chem profs do.  Very good professor if you just pay attention.
Patronizing, rude, does his best to belittle you and intimidate you.
Avoid him.
No Comments

He comes across a little apathetic or maybe just burned out. He's a good professor and gives good feedback, but he's a bit outdated. It was supposed to be a seminar, discussion style class, but he lectured a lot and students didn't have a lot of opportunities to discuss ideas. It wasn't a bad class but also not an inspirational class either.

Spanagel is a true gem. He is well organized, teaches using a variety of methods (discussions, videos, readings, essays), and is very knowledgeable. He is also very understanding and kind! He is a bit of a stickler for grammar, we had essays weekly of 4-5 pages each, and reach about 100 pages a week. Reading was a bit tough, but rewarding.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Spanagel is a very kind and understanding professor. He's interested in what he teaches and clearly cares in helping students learn. It was more reading that I expected (100 pages a week), and a weekly essay (take with a grain of salt because virtual term). I would recommend, but be prepared to read and write.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I took my history inquiry seminar with him. It was a great time. He is a very understanding guy and I would have loved to take an actual course with him. It was history, so we did have to read a decent amount, but he let us choose what we wanted to read, so it wasn't that bad. Overall, great professor!

I've made it my mission to go back and rate every professor I've had at WPI. I'm a pretty average student that knows how to work hard. David Spanagel is an amazing professor. Even though you're attending a tech school, if you enjoy history even a little take a class with him. Makes the material enjoyable and intriguing. A's aren't given away.

Professor Spanagel is a nice guy, and I found his class very interesting. However, there is a lot of reading for the class, and his tests are VERY hard. Basically memorize the books... Humanities are not a priority at WPI, but he doesn't seem to get that or care.

I didn't particularly prefer Professor Spanagel's class; however, he really wasn't that bad. He is a pretty lenient grader but you better write with good grammar. You can get away with not reading but if you don't touch the reading material at all, you're screwed.
His tests were tough, but he will grade how the overall class did as grade average. He gives you a optional paper to be made up for a bad test grade

Went in not liking history at all, just needed a filler class. Came out of this course loving the unique style that he teaches and the historical takes on science as we know it! Not an easy class for an intro course, but a well taught and managed one!

Had him for history of exact sciences. A LOT of reading, but if you show up to class and volunteer you will find he is a very accommodating prof. I missed the midterm due to sickness and he let me write a paper to make up for it
Excellent teacher.  Very approachable and knowledgeable.  Very nice and friendly.
