i had him for GPS. I would say that he is an easy professor and gives you good advice for your papers etc. I was expecting an A in GPS as I had done soo much work in that class. But i ended up with a C. He couldnt judge how much work each individual had done. I just missed one class and he made this reason a basis for my lower grade.

Had him for a GPS. He is very easy to talk to and displays a lot of interest in what everyone has to say. I didn't get a great grade in the class, but I later used him as a faculty recommendation when I went abroad. He is very enthusiastic about his subject matter and that quality tends to be catching.

he's a cool guy. he grades fairly and will help you when you ask for it. if you take his class, be prepared for a LOT of reading. you will not walk away from his class without gaining something from the experience.
Excellent teacher yet hard grader. He has a true passion and interest in his subject which makes learning about it a lot better.
Awesome teacher. Clear, precise and keeps the interest.
Helpful in stategies for writing essays, lots of discussion.

Wouldn't be bad if he graded easier. Directly from his mouth "If you follow my instructions exactly and do just as I ask that is worth a good solid B." Doesn't realize that history isn't the main focus at this school and expects too much. Be warned if you are looking for an A that you will get in most other classes.
Professor Bafaro was the best lab instructor I've had. She actually cares that you understand what happens in the lab, and is a surprisingly lenient grader.

Couldn't ask for a better lab professor. She is super kind and understanding of the students. I have gained so much knowledge from her lab and the material was super interesting. Highly recommend a lab with her. One of the best all around
Very kind and understanding, clear explanations, awesome professor. Goes above and beyond to help students.
Absolute G
It was her first time teaching a lecture and there were definitely a couple bumps along the way, but she was honestly so great. Lots of office hours and she was very kind and helpful during them.
really cared about students, very understanding if you're lab partner isnt good. however is a very tough grader, gives feedback though

She was extremely helpful on all of the labs we did, pointing out things that we could improve and guiding us through our research. There were enough assignments to bring your grade up if you did poorly on anything.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The labs were a lot of work, but Professor Bafaro did a great job explaining the concepts and was quite accessible if you didn't understand something. Gave useful feedback on assignments, making them an actual learning experience.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is the most amazing person ever, I wish I could have her for every class.
Very helpful in labs and easily accessible outside. Love her.
Love her, she will help you with anything if you ask. Gives great feedback and you can tell she just wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: One of the kindest and most caring professors on campus. She actually understands the stress that students are under and will accommodate (speak up!). She is always willing to meet outside her office hours. And, she is super approachable and wants to know your opinion in order to help you. Truly a great teacher for such a demanding class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She was an amazing lab prof. She gives really helpful feedback without telling us what is supposed to happen. She is also SUPER nice.
Probably the nicest person I have met. Gives great feedback on labs. If you submit them early you should have no problem getting an A.

Professor Bafaro is the best professor/instructor I have had at WPI. She is incredibly kind, she takes time to learn all of her students names and makes sure they understand the material. She provides excellent feedback and students feel comfortable asking questions. If you have a problem with the work or a lab partner talk to her and she will help

Professor Bafaro was amazing, I had her A and B term. The workload is very heavy, especially if your group partners aren't doing a fair share of the reports. However, she did her best to make accommodations when my group dynamic was not ideal. Helpful during office hours and gives really good feedback if you turn things in early
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Bafaro was incredible for Chem 1020 lab, ABSOLUTELY go to office hours, she will help you every step of the way with the labs (and maybe complain with you about how the lab structure sucks). Very kind she helped me deal with a partner who didn't do work without forcing me to write the entire lab and without hurting my grade. Highly Recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Bafaro is one of the nicest and most helpful people on campus. Chem lab is difficult, but she allows early submissions for revisions (SUBMIT THEM EARLY) and her feedback will lead you to the grade you desire. She is always positive, caring, and available to help out. I highly recommend taking a chem lab with her!

Great professor yes. Unnecessarily hard though. Too much homework. Exams were longer than the allowed time to take them. Too many essays and having to rewrite them made them worse. Harsh grader when it came to exams.
Always available, super caring, and lenient.

I loved Profesora Madan! She cared about her students' well-being, and always made sure that we were doing ok. She taught us a lot of material, and it was somewhat fast-paced so be aware of that if you plan to take this class. She was always very friendly, and would take the time to work with you if you struggled with grammar.
She is wonderful, excellent, and understanding when you're having a hard time as long as you're trying. Do the reading and she will be impressed with you. Conversations are great with her.

I loved taking class with Madan! There is quite a bit of busy work, especially at the beginning of the term, but doing all of it pretty much guarantees an A on the test. She really likes when people show a real interest in Spanish outside of class alone, and she's super nice at office hours.

Madan is a great professor! Beware that she will make you work for the A and she looks for students who are putting in a lot of effort. Try to go to her office hours so that she gets to know you better (she looks to be your friend not just a professor). Be prepared to read A LOT and go to class with talking points to be sure you get full credit
Profesora Madan is by far the best professor i have had since attending WPI i would recommend to anyone that they should take atlas one of her classes

She is one of the best professors I've ever had. Her classes are definitely not easy, and there are some challenging assignments now and then  but if you actually want to learn Spanish well, take her classes. She engages everyone in class discussions and treats students like friends. Would always be there for you if you need any help.

I've taken a couple classes with her. Participation is really important for your grade and there is more work than a class with Matos but you'll get a better understanding of the material. She's super nice and encourages students to reach out to her for help. Sometimes she'll play music in class too!

I always wanted to come to this class. Definitely need to stay on top of your work and engage with her/the class, but  do-able if you're willing. She was willing to help and engaging, expectations are clear. Quizzes and discussion board posts were helpful for the two exams (1 hour each). Great class for your capstone, would highly recommend.
One of the best professors at WPI. Great and interesting class. She actually cares about her students and you will learn a lot.

Amazing class and professor (one of my favorites). Would recommend this class and you learn so much.  She actually wants her students to succeed.  Hands down one of my favorite classes/experiences at WPI.
Great class and professor (one of my favorites). You learn so much and she really wants her students to succeed. Also one of my favorite classes and experiences at WPI. Definitely recommend!
Awesome professor, and one of my favorite at WPI.  Extremely helpful and knowledgeable on the topic. Actually listens to her students and I learned so much. Great class!
Extremely strict about attendance/participation but very helpful with any questions you have. She clears up a lot of misconceptions we typically get from high school.
A very good Professor! Very knowledgeable of the subject. A hard grader and very  strict with participation in class. I learned a lot in the class though.
Has anyone ever heard of her before? She was hired this November, but I can't decide if she'll be a pushover or extremely hard her first term
One of the most thoughtful professors at WPI. Both on a personal level and an academic level. I'm better for having taken her class.

So I am a HumanitiesSocial Science major at WPI and she is my religion minor adviser. She is a great person and truly knows what she is talking about. HOWEVER, if you are a STEM major and simply taking her class to fulfill your humanities requirement avoid her; you can pass but you'll probably be frustrated through the whole class.

No need to read any of the material. Knowing it backwards and forwards only allows you to get a decent grade. Writing limited to her own views seems to be the answer to an A, and a low one at that. Grading is arbitrary, although the knowledge gained is satisfactory.

Worst professor I've ever had at WPI.  She told us we had to "meditate on the syllabus" in order to understand it.  She's totally wacky, talks in circles, and very rarely gives grades that aren't 85, 87, or 92.  Avoid at all costs if you want to get a good grade and keep your sanity.

I have never been so frustrated in my life. She is a great person and helps you think in different ways but she has a very specific way of grading her assignments. Listen to her in class and she will tell you what to write.
Although you don't really have to read any of the works in order to pass the class, she truly appreciates thoughtful analysis of the lectures and discussions.
Stay "far and away" from her and you will stay safe.
Recommend having the ability to take MEANING from her assignments. Also, a brain. If you have both of these things, you'll pass.
No Comments
wow, we learn nothing in this class. AVOID THIS PROF.

Smith is sooo wacky!  She says that she doesn't teach from personal opinions, but the books we read espouse her personal opinions.  I did not learn anything about either religion or culture from this class.
I got NOTHING from this class.

Her choices of works was horrible. The books were useless, and I found the less I read, the better I did. If you listened to her lectures, she writes your paper for you.  It's a class that you can choose either to read the books or listen to the lectures.

Her lack of insight into the topic area was astounding... she basically parrotted off the writings of others, but when it came to that  deep reflection  part that is so fundamental to philosophy... forget it.
She is probably one of the best Profs I have ever had at this school.  She's an excellent advisor.. and really thought provoking.
No Comments
tough and demanding, but not mean, and often rather interesting.
Demanding, yes.  But interesting.  And yes, using your brain is advisable.

I really loved Creative Writing with Professor Aguilar. The course was interactive (largely discussion based) and a lot of fun. There are some assigned readings for early classes (before workshopping peer's writing pieces begins) but they were not too heavy. The main bulk of the class (a 3k short story on anything you want) wasn't stressful at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: So great!! Would go out of my way to take more of his classes!

I loved having prof. Aguilar. He was so nice and very caring and understanding. He taught poetry but he didn't care if the poems were good, only that you tried your best and gave it your all. Super nice guy, really chill, funny. I would love to have him as a professor again and I would highly recommend him.

I loved Professor Aguilar! I hated every English class I took in high school but I actually really enjoyed this class! There are discussion posts and weekly readings you have to do, but they are really easy and he's super flexible. Classes are just discussions about the readings and it's overall just a good class.
Chill and understanding professor.
Really nice guy, super easy class. Was nice to have this in addition to my stem courses. He was very understanding when I got sick and had to miss a few days. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a nice and caring professor. Other positive reviews hold true!

One of the chillest Professors on campus. He gets what it means to be an engineering student and gives you an A as long as you are truly engaged and interested in the material. Hes very interesting and raises great points in class! Honestly, I think he made me a better person!

He is a lenient prof. I can not give a perfect review. The class was taken online, so we only met once a week. The lectures consisted of a few min discussion about a topic, then we were put to break out rooms where the students came up with discussion questions. So he really didn't do much but assign hw. Still really nice, and was a good grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Joe Aguilar is the MAN. So nice and caring. Classes are engaging. Really fun time. One of the best people I've met at WPI.

Prof. Aguilar is easily one of the nicest WPI professors. He tackles each class with a refreshing attitude and understands that studies really aren't all the cracked up. If you have any doubts for papers you have to write, GO TO HIM! He will sit down and talk it through with you. Replies really quickly to emails and is just in general a good prof.

Prof Aguilar is a great instructor! He understands the rigor at WPI, and his class is often laid back. Come to class, do the (typically short) reading, and participate and you'll be fine. Writing exercises and papers are mostly on completion and if you do them well. You can get away with not reading sometimes. Show interest and you're guarenteed A.
Professor Aguilar gets to know all of his students and really cares about them, and he is a very inspirational teacher.

Prof Aguilar made his class easy to follow. Make sure to read syllabus daily to be prepared for the following class meeting. Would go over assigned reading through class discussion. Weekly quizzes are based off class notes and discussions. If you pay attention and do your work, you shall be fine. If you do not like reading, this class isn't for you
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is super funny and personable. He writes back to you on all of your papers and gives really solid feedback. All his coursework also builds off of one another and it made the midterm and final papers a breeze. There was a paper a week, but only one page and nothing that requires more than an hour or two to complete. You can tell he loves English

He is a very nice guy. Just starting teaching actually and my lecture was his first class he ever taught. I took him for American Lit: Beginnings through hawthorne and it was a good class and easy A. He just assigns a lot of reading sometimes but you can get away without reading it. Weekly quizzes that are very easy, free 100s. Take this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Really good teacher. I hate writing and thought I would hate this class but I loved it probably because of him. Very short readings every night but theyre discussed in class. Only had 2 long essays and a few short papers (1 page). Take his class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Awesome dude and one of the best professors I've had at WPI. Class is really fun and engaging. He cares about student success and making the course a meaningful experience.

Nathan Uricchio is no doubt an amazing professor! Lectures were extremely engaging, understandable, and was overall an experience I wish to have again. There's no doubt that Uricchio loves to teach, and it makes his class great to be in. Would 100% recommend.
Professor walked through notes, gave plenty of examples, and answered questions thoroughly when needed.
His lectures are very well thought out and he explains math in a way that is easy to understand. Only bad thing is he speaks in vocal fry.

He is an amazing professor. I did not take this course, I took discrete math over the summer. But, I am sure he would be good even for other classes. Really nice, responds to email fast(FAST), and good lecture style(loved his use of colors). If you take a math course, try to take it with him, you will not regret it.

Lectures are colorful and pleasing to the eye so you don't get distracted. Lectures are interactive and VERY easy to follow and understand. Makes topics clear. Had an 8am lecture so the class was dead, but he brought the energy up. Funny professor, always available, fast email replies, welcomes feedback, great office hours. Take his class.

It doesn't get much better than Professor Uricchio. I strongly urge anyone who needs a Differential Equations credit to take him. The tests aren't too bad, and a lot of the questions are similar to the questions on the weekly quizzes (which are graded on completion). His lectures are also amazing (recorded and the notes are posted online).
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Phenomenal professor. Incredibly organized, super kind, cares about his students. Exactly what he teaches is exactly what is on the test. Gives unlimited attempts on webwork. Jokes with his students. He made an effort to know all his students by name. High quality teaching too. Take math with Uricchio, I promise you won't regret it.

Prof. Uricchio is an incredible professor, he makes the lectures engaging and interesting (even just small things like asking what color to highlight his notes in makes the class so much more enjoyable). Although his posted notes are sometimes handwritten they are always clear and legible. My grade in this class was my own fault, not his.

Prof. Uricchio is the best teacher I've ever had. He's straightforward with his class material and clearly enjoys teaching mathematics. If you put effort into his class and do the assignments (which aren't too heavy to begin with), the class is fairly easy. He's a very smart guy and the best way to characterize his teaching is efficient.

Professor Uricchio wants you learn the material rather than memorise. In lecture he encourages questions and writes notes as we go to prevent himself from going too fast. Tests were 60% while the other 40% was labs, homework, and reading checks. He was helpful during office hours and offered corrections when the class median on an exam was low.

Prof Uricchio is a good dude and solid teacher. He showed us his Halo stats. His class served as great review for the department final with the skill and main portion. Comfortably got an 85/100 on the main and a 35/35 on the skills thanks to his class. I think overall most people failed it but I think those were kids mainly from other classes.

Awesome professor! He was prepared for every lecture and recorded every session, so most days where I didn't feel like it I would just skip class and rewatch the lectures again. He went over the materials until all of us understands it. Was pretty good for my first course at the school.

11/10 would take again

Professor was amazing. Started out lectures in a fun way and typically easy to follow (and will often send 
corrections if he thinks he was confusing). Homework heavy-ish but given unlimited attempts, take-home quizzes, decent tests (except final, which was department based). Very helpful office hours - online or in person.
Dude is a G. He is so helpful, but the lectures were sometimes confusing. He is very willing to help if you go to his office hours though, so it makes up for it.

homework was on webwork with unlimited attempts, quizzes were take home for completion, tests were fair, lectures were taught efficiently and easy to follow without being too boring, he was my favorite professor

Uricchio is a great professor, his quizzes are graded upon completion (but use it as an opportunity to learn from your mistakes!). Tests are fair, and homework is on webwork (plus you get infinite tries). Do all of that, attend lectures/take notes, and you're good. He also cares a lot about student feedback, and will advocate for you, so speak up!

He's an amazing professor! Often, he'll talk about his day and ask how we're doing. Then, he'll walk through multiple example problems! Every exam and WebWork was each worth 20% and he offers extra credit on the WW. Everyone failed the department's final (not his fault), so he adjusted the grade cutoff. Take him if you can - would highly recommend!

Fabio was my IQP advisor. He always offered my group help and feedback, and worked with us to better our project throughout the term. He was personable and easy to work with. He expects teams to put a lot of effort into their projects and is very passionate about his work.

Fabio is a tough grader, but very passionate about projects. Keep the website up to date-his area of expertise is in making "wise" cities. He expects maximum effort on your part (which is to be expected for IQP). He would make himself available to us whenever we asked, and even treated our entire group of students to lunch (24 of us).  INDIA CENTER

His expectations are too high before you go to the project site. Love's Wiki and Google Drive. His methods of feedback wasn't helpful either. Sometimes felt more confused leaving advisory meetings than before

Terrible advisor.  Micromanages projects yet expects students to take initiative.  Constantly (as in 3 times a week) changes his mind on major project goals.  Since going on IQP, I have lost respect for him as an advisor and as a person.  Do not go to Venice for the projects.

The destroyer of GPAs and student's dreams. He grades on favortism and opinion... Students that actually do good work are graded down while those who don't receive better grades. I should have stayed on campus for my IQP. Avoid at ALL COSTS!
Worst advisor ever. He destroys the futures of students by assigning grades completely disproportional to effort given. The man is a tyrant. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Terrible teacher. Never around, always using the office in Venice for his personal use and would get angry when we wanted to use it because he was spending all his time on dating sites. He should be fired but WPI cares more about money and exposure than teaching their students.
No Comments

This guy is supposed to be the Site Director for projects but the only way you can see him is to travel 40 minutes and visit him at his other job, teaching at ANOTHER SCHOOL! He ignores the project sponsors and project reports and only seems concerned with how project data will benefit his portfolio. DO NOT GO TO ANY IQP SITE ADVISED BY THIS MAN.

totally useless.  Suggested an IQP option to us, then "got concerned" that the IGSD would think it was too risky the day before the forms were due and didn't send them in.  When I started asking the actual risk management people, he backed out.  Almost lost my friends their other IQP options.  Avoid him like he's got the plague!

He was unable to live up to deals that he claimed were sure things.  He also has the noted habit of constantly changing his mind.  It almost messed up multiple's peoples futures when he wasn't able to deliver what he had been promising for months.
What a jerk. Make sure you're his buddy or you might go nuts being screwed with. He'll probably drive you crazy either way. Totally unfair.
real useless.  gone all the time and arrived a week late to venice.  left for a week and wasn't very helpful.  if he spent more time with his students and less with his boats, we would be better off.
This guy sucks.  He kept changing our project, even when we got to the final week of the term.  He also really screwed us over at the end of the term by not talking to our other advisor.

This guy is a douche-bag.  If he could change his mind and then his story any more he would really start tripping over his own tounge.  Make sure that you get a written agreement on what is required, since he flip flops so much.
He's quite pretentious and arrogant. Also, he likes to point out how much he prefers Italy to the United States.
People usually hate this class, but Fabio made it fun! Especially the debates. He seems kinda shady, though.

Prof Clark is definately one of the best in the department, and at WPI. Passionate and engaging lecturer, and although the reading was a bit denser, the writing was manageable and allowed freedom on the final presentation topic. Definately would recommend taking one of her courses for sure.

Professor Clark is among the kindest professors I've had. There is a lot of reading but it is only used for discussion and there are no assessments. In this class, the grade was determined by two group presentations, a source evaluation, a short essay, and canvas discussions on the readings. She graded lightly as long as you demonstrate effort.

If you put any effort into her class you will no doubt pass. She is really passionate about what she teaches and you can see that. We only had 4 different things being graded on, but as I said as long as you actually put the effort in you will get an A. She really nice, and really cares about her students.

Constance Clark is by far the nicest and best professor at WPI. For the research paper we were allowed to choose whatever topic we were interested in and were told to have 7-10 pages of well researched history of our topic. Each week we'd have to turn something in, but the class was really chill. She gave the best corrections I've seen on any paper
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Clark is a great teacher, and a really interesting person. The amount of homework she assigns can be a little overwhelming at times. Put a lot of effort in class discussions and your individual work and you should be good.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Easy A. Class consisted of an essay a week, and these essays built upon themselves to create a final paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: She's the nicest professor I've ever had, and she's always willing to help. You'll need to do the readings and writings for her classes, but if you're having trouble, she'll gladly talk you through it. She's immensely caring, and if you show her that you're trying, she'll help you every step of the way.

This was my third class with professor Clark. She's a fantastic Professor with wide ranging knowledge on many historical subjects. This was an inquiry seminar in which she helped everyone personally pick a topic for their paper and develop it. Absolutely recommend.
Great professor. Going to class isn't required at all but she does her best to make it entertaining for those who do.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: This was my second class taken by Professor Clark. She's very knowledgeable about the history of technology in all sorts of matters. Her classes make you want to get really into some aspect of technology, which makes any projects she throws at you easier. We had two big projects for the class, both of which were fun and not overly time consuming.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Caring and nice teacher who goes the extra mile to make sure the class is fun and interesting. Lots of reading but as long as you participate, you should be fine. Many fun activities and presentations. Would definitely take another class from her

Prof. Clark cares a great deal about her students. She is always willing to talk to you about the course subject, or anything else. There is a lot of reading, and while you can get away with not doing it, participation in class makes the course more interesting, and Prof. Clark appreciates it.
Wonderful caring understanding teacher. Participate in class and glance at the reading and you will be set. A fantastic professor take any class with her. 10/10 would recommend
Show some effort, do the readings, participate in class every now and then, and you will get an A. Great lady, very nice.
Sweet woman, very fair. Show some effort and you will do just fine. Take this class for real
By far one of WPI's best professors. She loves teaching the subject, and finds ways to make it fascinating fo reveryone else. Major part of the grade is on participation and presentations.
ABSOLUTE CASH CLASS $$$$$$.....think about a class where you apply 0 effort and your final grade is an A+....one word...KA-CHING
FYI Prof. Lemone retired from WPICS *several* years ago, so ratings for her here aren't very useful.
Worst professor in the department.  Completely inept at basic computer use and doesn't care.  Seems to think she is teaching middle schoolers.

She is very negative about groups, even though she contributes near nothing. She doesn't read almost anything that you'll send her and comes  to meetings/class/etc unprepared. At best, she is the worst teacher I've dealt with at WPI.
One of the worst teacher I have ever had!!!

The overall course was not hard, but the book that she uses leaves a lot to desire, and when she was showing problems on the board it was hard to followed because she didn't show all the important steps from start to finish.

Not enough room here to even begin to describe. unable to answer any students questions, has laughed at students for asking valid questions, does not know how to teach, and dont even bother going to office hours/TA hours. Bearable, but try to take it with another prof if at all possible.
Worst teacher ever...don't even get me started; I can't believe that evlution hasn't wiped her out of the gene pool yet.

Not as bad as many people say she is, everything is taken from the book and when you ask questions it seems she does not know what you are talking about, but other from that you understand quite well when she explains. Tests and material are really easy.

dont go to wpi but thought i would post for someone i care about. apparently the work is never explained but replicated from the book. and asking questions? forget it. it will be assumed that you do not know the material and this will lead to a failing grade. trust ratemyprofessors posts!
No idea how she has lasted this long at WPI, its pretty hilarious to get her flustered though
She is very unclear and asking for help generally makes it worse.
Not very helpful

CS4533 was been one of my more interesting CS courses thanks largely in part to Prof. Lemone.  She explains things well and seems genuinely interested in the subject matter.  Her obsession with the sometimes buggy, always insecure "Of Course!" w
At best she was useless. That's the best way to describe it.
Ouch.  This was a tough one to take.  She knows her stuff but is not the best professor.  Try taking it with someone else.  Not Dobrushkin either!
She makes you have freakin namecards.  Its like kindergarten
Assignments are too demanding, teaching style leaves much to be desired.

One of the best math prof I have ever had at WPI. No exams for his course. Only homework, quizzes and projects and sometimes homeworks problem are a bit challenging and need solid understanding of the course material to do well. He designed four interesting projects for students to consolidate concepts learned in classroom.

He never grades the projects worth most of your grade so there is no opportunity to improve your grade. He is rude when you question why the projects have not been graded or give him feedback. Also, it is very hard to read his handwriting when he is lecturing. I would recommend taking this class with someone else.

He is so sweet and kind and genuinely wants everyone to do good. He will always clarify and recognizes his own weaknesses and is able to work around them and make sure everyone is ok to call him out for them.

Don't get me wrong, he is a very kind man. If you are sick or need extra help, he will help you out. However, he is very slow at returning homework grades and the midterm exam is worth 30% of your grade and the final is worth 40%. He refuses to post solutions which really screws us over when it comes to exam time. Good luck.

Very difficult class, Sturm has a lot of available office hours but can be very judgmental if it's a dumb question. Overall, it's a fine class, but takes up like 17+ hours of your week outside of class. Would avoid unless a math major.
Professor Sturm is the warmest Austrian man you will ever meet. He is open with his students and provides incredibly clear explanations during lectures. One of the best math teachers at WPI.

Does great lectures. Material itself is super hard, but he teaches it quiet nicely. I know I was struggling a lot with homework and he always helped me out. Attend office hours if you want to pass the class. 2 homework assignments with 6 questions each due every week. Hard homework but really prepares you for finals and midterms. Great class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Strum was a great professor. The class itself was very difficult and run by multiple professors, but professor Strum was always good. He played music at the beginning of class and he had 2 hours of office hours the day the written homework was due. If you need a lot of help with the homework he would usually walk you through it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Funny German man who holds a great lecture. Homework sets are very challenging but true to the material that ends up on the tests. Super kind and helpful during office hours and will probably offer you coffee or tea.
Very caring, is clearly willing to help anybody who is struggling. Gives a lot of homework but if done well it will be the best prep for the exam you can get.

An absolutely fantastic experience. His handwriting is rough, but he makes fun of it constantly, and it's an absolute joy to attend lectures. The tests and homework assignments are extremely similar, so doing well on homework will ensure you do well on exams. He's an extremely fair grader and all-around great guy.

Hes a good teacher, and knows how to make the lessons understandable. Be warned, it may be on you to teach yourself some examples. He spends plenty of time deriving formulas, but little examples. Be sure you know plenty from MA 1022, because the class needs it. I didnt take that course first, so I wound up with an NR.

Professor Sturm is a great professor. While his accent and handwriting make him somewhat difficult to understand at times, he understands his own limitations and is quick to help if there's confusion. This was a small class of 5 students, so he was especially accessible for it. I look forward to taking more classes from him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: His handwriting is difficult to recognize. Almost of his assignment is about coding, but his slides are about theory. He highly recommends students to use Python to finish homework, but never posts any solution. And the grading method is weird. It's 24 points for about 4-6 problems, which means if you have any little mistake you may lose a half.
Very approachable

He too hard on tests and there's giant gap between class and what u have as homework, because he's "challenging you". Example: 'I expected no one to get #3b on the test it was there to stretch your thinking," (add Austrian accent)

Professor Sturm was always willing to answer questions and to help students out. He can be a bit hard to understand at times with such a strong accent, but he recognizes this and encourages students to ask for clarification if they don't understand something.

Probably one of the nicest professors I've had at WPI but this class is a ton of work. Lots of MATLAB and a lot of doing very similar problems and it seems kind of overkill at times. The labs can be cool to take part in but the lab reports are a lot of work.

Hardest class I have ever taken. He's a nice guy but a VERY VERY VERY hard professor. He expects students to read his mind on expectations. Get ready to have a grade below a C the whole term only for him to say "grades don't matter" and expect you to pass

This was the hardest class I've ever taken. The project was unbelievably complicated (corporate sponsor) and the group size (11 people) was incredibly tough to organize. Pradeep is kind and available via slack and was helpful but also had incredibly high expectations.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Extremely poorly conceived problems for the midterm that demonstrate the professor doesn't have a good understanding of some of the basics of reality. Constantly extending deadlines because he assigns too much work for anyone to be able to reasonably finish it on time. Unreasonable grader. Only gives extra credit to people who got everything right.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Gave a lot of homeworks and labs that overlapped, grades very hard, gives chance to redo labs but good luck because your group project will take up all your time at the end of the term. Also he gave a 6 hour take home test that everyone failed so good luck.

This was the hardest and best class I've taken at WPI. Pradeep will grade your tests to a T. He is also about the engineering grind. If you put in as much work as he does to his class, you will pass. If you pass, you will be much better and smarter for it.

(ME 4322 or ME4320) One of the most work intensive courses you will ever take. The professor doesn't understand when to stop giving out work and by the end of the class 90% of the stuff in your bag would have been dedicated for his class. You will be a pro after you've taken his class whether you've gotten a 'C' or an 'A'.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I've made it my mission to go back and rate every professor I've had at WP. I'm a pretty average student that knows how to work hard. Pradeep is a solid teacher and what the average professor should be. Clearly cares about the material, answers questions thoughtfully and teaches clearly. Don't bring your phone to class.

I would use the word sadistic to describe Prof. Radhakrishnan. He enjoys making his life misery and thus his student's life as well: he enjoys reading every single line of homework, lab and exams. So if you are into BDSM and a little bit of a sadistic yourself, would highly recommended him.
Great professor. He is always willing to help people. You can find out any time to meet with him even you don't have much to ask, and you will learn a lot from doing all the projects.
Great teacher. I love his class. You can really learn many thing by doing the projects and HW.
Clearly didn't want to be teaching the class. I don't feel like I actually learned anything. Spent a long time on basic things without ever actually teaching anything.

Very helpful and there for you when you need it. There is a lot a work to be done in the class, which can make you exhausted once you finish it, but his helpful hand really makes it possible to get through it. You will learn a lot out of the class. :)

Never have I had a professor who cares more about helping students learn than Pradeep. He's a casual professor, and in his own words, "I do not care if everyone gets an A. In fact, that would be great! That means everyone is learning." He is always willing to help struggling students. Just showing up to class makes him excited. The textbook helps.

He is a very nice professor and he is always welling to help. My friend and I  were always in his office for help and he was happy to do so. If you cant make his office hour, he will try to find another time to meet with you. His class was very difficult so you should start your hw early, do the readings and pay attention in class.

He is a very nice professor and he is always welling to help. Me and my friend were always in his office for help and he was happy to do so. If you cant make his office hour, he will try to find another time to meet with you. His class was very difficult so you should start your hw early, do the readings and pay attention in class!! Ask questions
Not clear at all. Never answers questions, seems to go around them. Never explains how to come about answers, says "you should know how to do this"

Ljungquist is the man, he's funny, extremely personable and helpful. His lectures can get a little boring but his tests are super easy if you take notes and mark down what passages he analyzes in class. You do have to read or at least look up the book online because otherwise you'll be lost but if you show you care even a little, you'll get an A.
Great!
Subject matter is interesting and made even better by Ljunquist.  I am definitely taking another class with him.

Professor Ljungquist is really good at making his 9 AM lecture something you ACTUALLY want to wake up for and go to. He is really funny and grades well and fair. I LOVED THIS CLASS. I would most definitely take his class again. Besides the Junto was lowkey his fav group. :P
Prof Ljungquist is dope. Take his class
He is a very interesting lecturer who is very fair and grades well. Make sure that you do the reading for his class though!

Professor Ljungquist is arguably one of the best professors I have had at WPI. Although English and Literature might feel like chores at times, he makes the class pretty easy to deal with considering all the discussions, grades fairly, and is a tremendous help. Definitely take his class I took 4 classes with him in all.

Best professor I ever had. Very fun and always keeps the class interested, and extremely helpful! He's really encouraging too, gives great advice and suggestions for improvement, and always has a compliment for the students' work. I thought I'd hate English class- Ljungquist made it worthwhile.

I ended up in his class completely on accident and I seriously thought i wouldn't like it, but he turned out to be a GREAT teacher and he makes the classes interesting. It's an 8am class but i dont mind waking up for it in the morning. You'll love this man!

I had Professor Ljungquist 3 times while a student at WPI. Easily my favorite professor on campus, and I asked him to become my advisor. He knows his stuff, but like it was said earlier he doesn't flaunt it. Fun, interesting classes with great discussion.
No Comments

I had him for Amer Realism. He makes the class very interesting- you cannot fall asleep! Good teacher, knows his stuff well but does not show off. I learnt a lot from his class. I just didn't find the subject matter, the American Realist movement, very interesting...
Absolutley the best professor at WPI, hands down.  Take a course with him and you will not regret it.  The only class I can honestly say has not put me to sleep.
He is just a wealth of info. I had him one-on-one. Quite funny, and always very excited about the material. He won't BS you about the material
I had KPL for both id2050 and IQP.  he is a bit of an oddball, but he is smart and helpfull.  He is also very open, atleast as far as i found from my iqp, to not following the line with the igsd.
A little long-winded at times, but generally very interesting.  Always helpful, and while he doesn't like to flaunt it like other WPI HU@A professors, he knows his subject matter inside and out.
Very energetic and eingmatic professor, a renowned authority on Poe!
Be sure to go to office hours, that helps a lot, and he tried really hard to help students one to one. There are also a lot of extra credits in tests.

The material is not so difficult but the lectures are not helpful, even kind of confusing. The practice problems are useful for the exams. Homework is long and not related to the exams. There is a project but it's not that hard to do. I wouldn't take the class again if I wasn't required to.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: His class wasn't too difficult. We had four quizzes and the lowest was dropped which was nice. His major drawback was his lack of clarity. He often turned easy concepts into confusing ones with complicated diagrams and poor/non-specific wording; it was easy to lose lots of points with few mistakes. His and the TA's office hours were very helpful.

Billiar is nice, very knowledgeable, and helpful at office hours. However, lectures can be long and confusing and he makes some mistakes when doing problems. Randomly calls on students so be prepared. Weekly HW is a little difficult, but not impossible. There is a group project. There are four quizzes (60%), lowest dropped, can be hard and unclear.

Professor Billiar is a good guy. I took BME 2511 with him and it was alright. Kind of boring lectures and exams are way harder than the practice problems. I did learn a reasonable amount though. Also, he is pretty helpful in office hours.

Very nice and helpful prof. His material in this class is pretty tough, and he is a stickler for detail. But if you pay attention and make sure you hit every specific thing he is looking for in the assignments then you should be fine.

Class was good if your interested in biomechanics. Used a lot of statics/stress problems. Term long project was good and graded very fairly. TA sessions for quizzes are extremely helpful. You have to work hard for the A.
No Comments

This was a great course and Billiar made it that much more interesting.  Homeworks were a lot of work and required many hours, but were very useful in preparation for the exams.  Awesome lectures, although a bit stressful when he decided to pick on you to answer questions pertaining to the lecture.

Good professor overall, needs more examples before assigning problems...go to lectures and TA help sessions and you will be fine. Great grading policy, quizzes straight from class material, no tricks. Definitely take this class.
Very cute!  Nice guy too.  A bit of a hard grader tho.
If he only talked a little slower - Sometimes he's on overdrive - you have to run just to keep up with what he's saying!
He is a very nice guy. Demanding, but willing to offer help all the time. He is definitely one of the professors you would like to keep in touch with even graduate.
He's a great teacher, it was his lectures that first got me interested in Biomedical Engineering.
Im really glad im working with billiar on MQP hes very helpful and interested in the project.  Good times :)
No Comments
I love Prof. Billiar. He makes class fun without making it very hard. This class used lots of stuff from PH 1110.

She is knowledgable in her field and is available for help which is nice. She does have a bit of a cold energy to her though; she's rather cut and dry, very specific in her grading, and doesn't make many exceptions. The class is group work and assignment heavy, no exams. This was nice, but she had too much busywork especially in the last week.

Her class was amazing! It was really interesting and if you did the work you got an A. There are no exams just papers and presentations. Almost everyone got an A unless you were lazy and turned in everything late. She really cares about her class and got me really interested in ecology. Easy class, nice professor, fair grading. Would 100% recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Her class is fun and she is very clear about her expectations regarding the class. There are no exams just paperwork and while there are multiple assignments due in a week they are not difficult at all. The papers are interesting and she explains them clearly. Most of the people i knew enjoyed the class and found it easy and interesting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Typical week in the class: 2 days we have a 2 hour lecture where you cannot possibly stay awake, homework due on 2 different week days, individual paper due friday night, another homework due saturday night, then to top it off, another group assignment due monday before class. This woman is the worst. Avoid her at all costs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: The workload was worst because of the research papers, which were often pretty complex. However, she explained them during class so if you paid attention you were usually fine. The case studies she assigned were amazing and super interesting, the complementary videos/documentaries were fun. The questions from the readings were hard but doable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Homework assignments require you to read a lot of academic papers and explain research articles, which does get difficult. Exams are take home exams but definitely not easy. She gives good feedback but is a very tough grader. Besides the exam, most of the homework assignments are group work you do in class and sometimes outside of class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: So many quizzes. Her tests should have been an assignment we could do in a day or two not 2 hours. She loves to help though and wants her students to succeed
Her tests were not related to her lectures, her groups projects were ridiculous and the labs were a joke.
Too rigid in her expectations. I would not recommend.

Tough Grader, but gives excellent feedback. Lots of in class participation and reading, definitely don't skip. Great professor, actually listens to student input. She usually does a midterm course eval type thing and depending on responses will make conscious changes to the course structureteaching style in order to serve her students better.

She is a hard grader and an even  harder editor. For upper level classes, she focuses on discussions, scholarly papers, and group work. She does pick relevant things to study and most of the time has good feedback.
IMPOSSIBLE to get an A, unless you are a bio major, and they even struggle. Good variety of materials: HW, tests, labs. Doesn't scale, I do not know anyone who got an A. Interesting material though.
recommend for BB2040 but in BB3160 she refused to give help with projects and gave my entire group a C even though we came to her for help multiple times

Class got me interested in ecology! Material is great. Prof explains clearly and answers questions lucidly and without evasion. Lots of  teaching methods: lecture, computer labs, debates (!),  group & indiv quizzes, group presentation. The mix helps makes things more interesting, but her lectures are nevertheless very good. Highly recommended! :)

Nice teacher.  I like that in our ecology class we had some group tests.  Her tests aren't too difficult... I enjoyed having her.  Only thing I would change is make the amount of equations and math explanations (you don't have to use it but still) a little less
Great class!  Grade based on quizzes, essays, class discussions, and lab reports, so there are plenty of opportunities to do well even if you don't test well.  Very good straighforward teacher!
greta class but too much upper level stats in a bio class.  new prof is good teaching in small groups but not big ones
Spent 10 minutes describing how to draw a line in Solidworks

Rude and disorganized. His calendar, syllabus were both wrong 24/7. Left no time in class to watch the required lectures, at one point uploading them at 2AM THAT DAY. Blamed everything on his TAs. This class was easy, but it was made difficult by him forcing us to follow cookiecutter steps. Overall, a class to learn a useless program (Labview).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The walking dead. If it was not for the tutors, the class would have been a total waste of time and money. Solidworks is great. Scarpina is not.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: He might be as dull as a rock, but he cares about doing what he does, and you should have no reason not to pass his class.
Lectures and lab sections are pretty much useless. Id say definitely pick a different professor.
Class was pretty straightforward and detailed. Somtimes difficult to pay attention but overall well organized

ME3901 is a lab-based course. In lecture and lab, he shows/tells you how to do the lab. It's boring, an overly detailed and repetitive monotone. You make LabVIEW code step-wise as a class. In the last 15 minutes of the 2 hour lab, you do the experiment. If it doesn't work, you'll have to finish on your own time. The practical exam is not that hard.
If you have trouble sleeping ... his lectures can help with that.  I would be wary of talking to him though ... you may never escape.  Hope you like LabVIEW.

So, the guy's pretty useless, and for a class like CAD, you learn barely anything. If you really want to learn Solidworks, take it with another professor, itll be harder but worth it to actually learn the class. If you're forced to end up with him though, just ask your PLA's everything, youll learn everything from them

Professor Scarpino is a helpful teacher. His class is  easy, and his lectures have personal stories. It can be fun to listen to, but it's hardly rigorous. Still, I can use Solidworks without crashing it, so it was a good class to take freshman year. I'd recommend him, but know that he won't push you too hard. You'll learn less, but you'll learn.
Great tutors and course using solid works. The tutors knew more than he did. No CSWA exam. Try to take it with Professor Planchard. I would not recommend him.
Why is he here? Do your self a favor, do not take any class with him. Lectures and labs have very little educational value.  It is an easy A class but you won't learn any thing.

He has  lots of industry experience., and he teaches design principles. There is more to SolidWorks than what he uses, but he builds things crash-proof. Ask questions! He's a wealth of information. The final exam is a practical, so there's no book learning. A fun course, and labs aren't due at the end of class, which gives you time to finish.
He is a very strange person. Does not want to listen to students. I had him for ES-1310 and learned nothing. Why is he teaching at WPI? I want my money back for this class!!!!
Does not know SolidWorks. I learned more from the tutors than from him. Always was changing the material. No one know what was going on.
Very nice man.  Always willing to answer questions.  Laid back class that taught me how to use Labview.

He talks way too much on trivial details which we engineers can understand on own own. Lectures have very little educational value and no help for understanding or analyzing lab data.Very inexperienced and it seems like he doesn't even know what he is supposed to teach and assign to students.It is  an easy A class but you won't learn a thing.
I hear she used to be a good professor. Changed her name. Something happened and now she's terrible.
Great teacher with a funny personality, cares about how you do.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Great class and Prof Plummer is the best in the department. She makes you work hard but it is worth it. Extremely tough grader and is a huge stickler for formatting. Always willing to help or provide more guidance. Speaks clearly and made the class fun at times too. Lab was fun and although it seems like she gives too many instructions its  helpful

very very organized and clear! goes by a strict curriculum and never goes off topic. gets students engaged and gives LOTS of example problems prior to the HW. HW is straightforward and she is willing to help during office hours or even over email. Tests are similar to the HW.
organized, very clear, great teaching style. take good notes and you will have pretty much everything you need
Awesome class! Broken down and organized in a very easy to understand way. Plummer is also just an awesome professor on top of that. If you go to class and listen you'll get an A
Great Prof!
Good teacher. Seems pleasant enough but if you get on her bad side she's a completely different person. Very unrelenting about cutoffs, even if you're less than a point away.

Fantastic teacher. She is extremely organized, clear, kind, and helpful. Gets to know the students and actually works to make them do well. Also was happy to talk outside of class, and was just as helpful then.
Possibly one of the best teachers I've had, completely organized and is very open and clear about what she wants and doesn't vary from it at all.  most straightforward and helpful teacher yet at WPI
Excellent, well organized
She's my favorite professor at WPI.  Explains stuff very well and actually tries to take the time to get to know the students.
She is an excellent prof.
Can be nice, if you don't get on her bad side.  Follow her directions explicitly on lab reports.
No Comments
No Comments
We is an excellent professor and exteremly helpful.

Weekly homeworks, but was always available during office hours, and would foster a very conducive environment with the number of students there. There was a midterm, final, as well as an extra credit problem on everything. She gave very good comments, and was a very good educator who asked the student a lot of questions to understand their thoughts
Amazing class, so much extra credit. Great explanations, truly wants you to understand the material.
Amazing teacher, plenty of extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Easily one of the best professors I've had so far at WPI! Her lectures were very easy to follow and the posted notes were great to refer back to. There were many helpful extra credit opportunities and she really wanted students to succeed.
Like others have said, a great professor and would recommend for Calc 4. Was very open to feedback, fair tests, and was very helpful during discussion/conference sections.
Amazing professor. Her calc 4 class made me remember why I like math. Her lecture notes are clear and organized and she's great at answering questions.

Prof. B is very well organized and fairly easy to follow in lecture. When I had to ask for an incomplete, she was very willing to take a moment with me to figure out how it would all work out. Also, she has a very chill, likeable vibe during office hours.

Prof. B is an amazing teacher. She is very organized and you can tell that from the course schedule that she publishes and the beginning of the term. The homework (written assignments) is harder than the exams. Exams would be a piece of cake if you went to the review class before the exam. With the ton of extra credit, it is an easy A.
Great professor, the homework was a lot of work but there were lots of extra credit opportunities. She was very helpful during office hours

I had Prof B for MA2051 and I liked her at the start of the term but as the term went along the material got much harder and I struggled to keep up. She started getting angry at students for not understanding what she considered to be simple concepts and got frustrated quickly when answering questions. HWs are long and hard but lecture isn't bad
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Bernardi is an amazing teacher. Her lectures are very organized, it seems like she loves to answer questions and when she does she provides great explanations. Office hours are helpful; the WAs due every week can be a little tedious.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Definitely a good pick for teacher. PAs (Preview Assignments) before every lecture were easy. WAs (Written Assignments) every week were tedious and difficult. Midterm and final were exactly what you'd expect, and she had plenty of extra credit. Clear and concise lectures, but she can be rude at times. Overall a good learning experience.

Prof Bernardi is a very tough but she has many office hours to help. The WAs are very intensive, and the midterm was hard. The tests are a lot of the grade, and there is not much time to finish them. The MTC is so so helpful for this class and Calc IV, so use them as a resource. I advise not taking this with another hard course.

Gives a lot of extra credit opportunities, which is needed since the exams and homework are very hard. Lectures make sense, but homework and exams do not. Also, daily homework due before each class (separate from weekly homework) were graded on completion and felt like busy work with no educational value.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Bernardi is an incredible professor. I had her for MA1023 and 1024. She takes time to understand and answer questions in lecture and office hours. The class is well organized. The homework is more difficult that the exams but it is not hard to get an A if you put in the work, go to office hours, and take advantage of extra credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: While the material is hard, she is very good at teaching it and making time to meet with you outside of class if the way it is taught in lecture doesn't make sense. While I did relatively badly on the midterm she was super helpful in helping me understand the material so that I could do better on the final. The best math teacher I've ever had.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Bernardi is a genuinely great teacher. She cares about her students' education. It's clear that she has a passion for teaching and for helping students understand the material.

The GOAT! Gives amazing lectures based on his long career as an engineer working for Bose and will flex about working on the Ferrari 458's sound system. Will use props to explain concepts in stress analytics. Will talk about how amazing Ansys is. Gives take home tests. Very helpful outside of class. 10/10 teacher. What a man.

Joe Stabile was an awesome professor who made class fun, interesting, relevant to ME, and overall was a pleasure to take both ME 4320 and ME 2300 with. He is extremely reasonable and not a hard grader. Very understanding of delays & problems that come up when building prototypes. I learned a lot about the engineering design process in the courses.

Stabile was great. He really values students who come to office hours. Lectures were engaging and interesting and he relates it to real life often. Weekly quizzes, reasonable daily homework, decent amount of extra credit and he lets you retake quizzes if you do really poorly. A very reasonable dude.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Genuinely cares about his students. Very dry sense of humor in his lectures every once in a while. Great class learned alot and did well.

If you plan to take Stress and Statics, I shall suggest you taking JOE. He is definitely one of the best professor I've taken so far because he's very approachable outside the class. Even though daily homework/weekly exam may turn out to be a lil bit annoying, he's always there for you.

Very good professor, Office hours are basically whenever he's not teaching, super welcoming to students and genuinely cares about their success. Nightly homework, Attendance is 10% of grade. Weekly tests, with cheat sheet. this is my 2nd class with this professor, and I plan to take more.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: I was in his design to engineering class were we designed speakers which was really hands-on and fun. Attendance is graded so show up to lecture becuase you just sit there anyway. No need to take notes; all quizzes are open note/can use his lecture ppts. He is super undertanding about making up quizzes/problems with group partners. Really nice guy

If you keep up with the homework (one problem a night) and do the practice quizzes (which are very similar to the tests), you'll do fine. Also, he is very accessible with office hours if you don't understand something. He really wants everyone to succeed and understand the material rather than struggle for no reason and it shows!

New to WPI. First time teaching ES-2300. The course was designing a Bose speaker.  Not must engineering design. Easy but boring class. Professor is out of his element. I would not recommend. What's to be friends with everyone. This is good and bad..

Daily homework, not long, helpful and relevant to the material but gets annoying from time to time. Weekly exams, really similar to the sample exams. Easy but boring class, not because of the professor but mainly because of the material itself. The professor is nice and very willing to help.
He is the best professor I've ever had. There was homework every night but only 1 or 2 problems. He also let us use cheat sheets on exams!

While he gives a lot of homework, he has an open door policy and if you stop by his office he'll help you out a lot. If you don't understand something and you go to his office he'll even make a little model to explain the concept to you. I learned a lot and understand a lot after taking Statics and Stress with him.

Stabile is Love, Stabile is Life. Best professor Ive had at WPI. Took 2501 and 2502. I suggest taking these with him. The fact that im going out of my way right now to rate him means he is really something. He assigns hw every other day(2-3 questions). Its all about going to his office hrs, he is there 24/7 basically  -Matty A55
Great professor. Always ready to help students outside of class. Lectures are boring though. Practice tests are great prep for the real exams.

Assigned frequent homework. Did not have many good alternate ways of describing a problem if you don't understand the first time. always available to help and wants everyone to understand material and get good grades. gives practice tests that are pretty similar to real test, gives you two hours for all tests but i only needed one every time.
He is easily the best professor I have had at WPI so far. He goes out of his way to help the students, and he is always available for office hours if you are having trouble.

Lectures tend to be a bit unfocused and you don't get great notes from the lectures. He is eager and willing to meet outside of lecture during office hours and is very helpful. He wants to see his students learn the material and cares a lot about seeing them pass. He is very approachable and easy to talk to. Attendance is a portion of your grade.

The class was fun, but you almost start to hate the films after having to watch it around 2 or 3 times. Delorey is literally the worst at responding to emails. The. Worst. It's extremely frustrating so if you have a question, ask in class. He never graded literally anything, but I'm pretty sure gave us all A's just because we wrote the final paper.
John is a good director. He can be a bit difficult to work with and hard to understand at times, but he's a great guy and will always do his best.
Really easy professor, but trying to email him and find him at his office is like trying to find someone that doesn't exist...really annoying. Other than that, good guy
Awesome professor!  Very easy and interesting class
I love Glinda. He's awesome.
He's a great director for glee club and is a great musician. But he read out of the book a lot and taught strictly on rules.
John is an amazing teacher.
what a sweet guy.  seriously, you never met a choir director as nice as john.  not only that, but he really works hard to make sure the choir always sounds great.  and he's a great cook.
Kinda flaky, but is very understanding and helpful.  Do your suff with him!
Cool guy.  Gets the concepts across well and wants students to do well.  Easy class.  Glee Club is awesome as well.
John rocks!!
I was a bit nervous at the beginning of the class, but things were explained well, and I now feel really comfortable.
A sense of humor, knows and loves the material, encourages everyone to push the limits of what they can do musically. Always supportive, and a gadgeteer to boot.
Delorey's a great guy and a great teacher... very understanding!
Fun director; join glee club or else!!
Amazing professor - cares tremendously - really nice - very fair
No Comments
Veryy time consuming. Some of his grading material wasnt clear. A lot of work.

Took in E1 term. I don't know why this class wasn't asynchronous from the start. He makes group projects due on Sunday nights, when we all have jobs outside of class. It is stressful and there is a lot of work.

Group projects were fun; however, test averages were very low, and he would come to class unprepared. He once spent the last third of class trying to solve a homework problem and ended up asking students for help. Explanations could be unclear, and the course was not structured well, with the "midterm" being at its start.

A nice prof, we had it rough this year because he was gone for a few weeks. He pushed back work so we had a lot in the last week with little practice on some concepts before the take-home final. Bhatia has extra credit and the grading is somewhat relaxed so If you put in the effort it's an easy A.

Took this class in 2020 E2 term. Great course to learn about CAD and engineering drawing. Heavy workload and generally not difficult, but quizzes can be stressful and you need to watch lectures to succeed. Labs and lab homework have detailed instructions, and points will be quickly taken off for failure to adhere to requirements.

Professor Bhatia is a very understanding professor who is on the side of the students. He will never try to give you bad grades in fact he will give extra credit as long as he knows you tried your best. His lectures can sometimes be hard to follow but the class itself is difficult. Get ready for all the HW! Have fun, hes definitely one of the bette

I read a lot of good thing about Bhatia. He was out of his element. Great perfessor, wrong person to teach Introduction to Engineering Design. Very easy grader. Never held any students to dead lines..

Great guy, good humor. His office hours are very convenient and he is always willing to help out with any problems you have. I didn't like how labs are graded out of 3 so just one mistake can leave you with below-80 grade. You'll have a learning curve and he understands that. Labs and HW are easy as long as you follow along and read the book.
He's a very nice guy, but the grading requirements on the class are pretty vague. The class is pretty easy if you read the textbook carefully, and check your work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: The work load for the class are heavy but he is supper helpful. Always available to help outside of the class and through email. His quizzes are hard so make sure you look over the slides before taking them. He cares about teaching and the student! Will definitely take a class with him again.

Bhatia is a real down to earth, caring, and accessible professor. He is happy to help you with whatever confusion you have and will work with schedules/extend deadlines. Lab homework can be time consuming so plan accordingly. I definitely learned a lot from taking this course.
Very chill and he and TAs are very helpful. Fun teacher and very personable Ten out of ten, would recommend!

I took Intro to CAD with him and I enjoyed it a lot. Hes a really caring teacher and extremely helpful during office hours. I messed up the submission several assignments and he was very understanding. Great guy, great prof.

The man, the myth, the legend. Professor Bhatia is the best. He cares about his students like no one else. He will give you recommendations for jobs, applications, etc. without question. He responds to emails super fast at any time (trust me i've gotten responses to 3 AM emails at 3:05 AM). He truly wants everyone to learn and succeed.

He gives extra credit to improve your grades. He covers a lot of material. I would recommend him if you are prepared to do lot of work. His test are hard whereas homeworks are easy. He is accessible and have open door policy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: It was his first time teaching materials, but he had no clue how to structure the course. By the end of the term he finally created exams that demonstrated what we were learning however, at the beginning he would test us in a was that was construed from how we were being taught. He is a very good person, but his class was horrible do not recommend.

Professor Bhatia is wonderful. He cares about you doing well, and is definitely the best CAD professor at WPI. He wants you to do well, and gives extra credit to help you get there. He is a little tough on grading, but he tells you exactly what he wants. Great person to talk to in office hours, definitely take advantage of them for the term project

Exams took a very long time. Coursework covered wood design in detail. But contextualizing the material was difficult for sophomores. The class is more understandable if you follow the textbook and read about the geometry of a building beforehand. TEK was very nice and helpful at office hours. I struggled to understand the overall design process.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is very nice and fun. He wants to see you do well, and his tests are reasonable. You should do well on the exams as long as you do the homework. I enjoyed his lectures.

Very kind professor. His tests are very fair and take-home with much partial credit. His office hours are helpful. His notes are incredibly clear and give an excellent understand of the material. There is a good mix of notes and examples to study off of for the exam. The homework can be a little long, about one hour for each of the 3 problems.

Professor El-Korchi is very kind and caring, he also has good lectures that helps guides you through the problems. Also his exams are take home and he gives you more than enough time to complete it.  When it comes to grading, he is not harsh and will offer you partial credit.
knows his stuff; fair, helpful. Good and informative labs
He is terrible, often unprepared, loses his place on the subject, evades questions, throws the class onto the TA. I would not recommend him. Can't speak unless he starts each sentence with, So...

Worst teacher I've had at WPI. This guy knows nothing about what he is teaching and is completely useless. He tries to make jokes that just aren't funny and makes it more awkward than anything. Should stick to department head cause he is terrible at teaching. Cares more about himself and his stupid trips than to help the students along seeking help
is the best professor i ever had i love him
he is the best teacher in the whole world i love him
I think he's fair
does not help, does not listen, does not know what he is talking about
only bad thing about him is that he tries to make jokes that are not funny
This professor is horrible, probably the worst teacher i have ever had at WPI, definetly in the CE department
Yeah, so hes not that funny. But hes easy to get along with and if you can understand what he does, he can be an excellent professor.
Don't bother asking questions--not sure if he understands the material.  He's also very confrontational when you don't understand things... great way to learn -- NOT
Dont ask questions in class because he wont be able to answer them. Not at all clear with his teaching.
Doesn't prepare for class ahed of time. Unsure of what he's talking about. Can't finish his own problems
No Comments

Awful experience for both grad and undergrad controls courses. Rather than actually teaching, he reads directly off a power-point presentation with extremely awful organization and several typos.

He heavily backloads coursework (80% of your grade is decided in the last 3 weeks of an 8 week term) and doesn't always teach to the assigned work.

His lectures were horrible and I skipped all of them because he stood up there just to read off of slides it was impossible to learn. Took off 50% at times for not "explaining" my work when he didnt ask me to. Really rude in office hours and has unclear expectations for assignments. Avoiding him at all costs in future didnt learn anything from this

This professor has mandatory lectures, but they are also completely useless if you ever plan on learning the material. There is weekly homework, as well as two projects during the term, and three exams. The workload is large and the amount of information gained is low.

Honestly speaking, i tried my level best to understand the subject. Despite not skipping a single class, I had a terrible time understanding everything that was discussed in class. Please refrain from this course unless you already know the subject and need to take it for the credits.

First part of the class is simple, but gets harder. Material gets lost in all the text/formulas, and speaks softly sometimes so its sometimes hard to hear. I wouldn't recommend him unless you plan on going the office hours, it was the only way I was able to do the homework.

the first few weeks and the quizzes are easy, variations of the Home work. Last few weeks are ridiculous and the final only covers those 3 weeks class average dropped 20 points on the final alone, and he scaled on 3 points on it.

Stay away from this guy if you can at all help it! He flies through material that he refuses to explain. If you ask a question in class he responds "you should know that". Throws arbitrary math up on the board, skipping numerous steps in between. The last 3 weeks of class are hell, as he doesn't convey what you're actually doing whatsoever. AWFUL!

Not a bad professor... Good lecturer, though mostly straight from the book. Exams are easy, not an extremely challenging class and you end up leaving the class with pretty good knowledge about the subject.
No Comments

Useless professor. Doesn't offer anything in his lectures that you can't read from the book. His tests are 80% multiple choice, so any question you miss is 2% off your final average. The tests don't always reflect the material covered in the course, or they're based on some obscure sentence or line from the book. Dont take this guys classes.
