Not a nice guy at all.  very unhelpful if you go to see him in his office hours.  not willing to give back points on tests even when you did something right and were marked wrong.  stands by the TA no matter what.  he has no spine.  hard to understand, teaches to the board, and writes way to small.  overall poor experience with this guy.

Starts early and ends late.  Class seems to last like 2 hours.  He goes really fast through the material and you barely have time to write everything down.  You won't learn a whole lot, but if you take good notes, you'll do fine on the hw, quizzes and exams, which are not too bad.

Goes VERY fast in lecture. You have time to jot it down in class, but not necessarily learn it. Seems intelligent.  Homework can be a little hard at times, but the quizzes are always like the more simple problems.  Gives a chance for extra credit on a few quizzes.  Do well on the quizzes, and you won't have to worry about the final much.

refuses to answer questions during lecture, writes way too small and doesn't talk loud enough to hear. Basically copies the text onto the board.  Smart guy, but refuses to admit that anyone else can be right. Doesn't explain ANYTHING.  DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM!

Lecture was not worth going to, he basically rewrote what was in the book on the board. No helpful verbalization of the concepts either. A very dry professor. I do not recommend any of his classes. Tests weren't impossible but bad enough to hate the course.

The guy himself is 100% unwilling to help students unless you pry information out of him.  Numerous times I went to see him in his office, and he couldn't take 5 seconds to explain a simple concept.  Will not negotiate grades, everything is black and white to this guy.  Clearly, he belongs at WPI...

VERY good professor.  He can get going pretty fast during lecture, but he really is an excellent professor.   He knows his stuff, his quizzes aren't impossible, and he's a very nice guy in class...he actually answers your questions when you have one.

Dude is so old you have to yell across the room for him to hear you. He is nice enough but was passive aggressive about comments on the book. Only graded on some in class writing quizzes (short essays) and one five page essay. Teaches more about the books plot than the literary movements associated.

Professor Schachterle's seminar, I was more focused on finishing the seminar than enjoying it, but my focus quickly shifted upon starting. I was pleasantly surprised to find myself enjoying our discussions and his insight into the material, and it became easier to read the 4 books and write the 5 papers once I was hooked. Make sure to participate!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I originally didn't want to take English at all in college, but Professor Schacherle changed that. His lectures were very informative and entertaining, the classroom was relaxed, and he was very good about giving feedback on quizzes/essays. However, there was a lot of reading so be ready to read 7 books over the term.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: There's a lot of reading in not a lot of time, but he is a super easy grader.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Really nice guy, doesn't assign a lot of work and is a fair grader.

Had prof Schachterle for HUA seminar. Course was difficult, not impossible. Grading criteria was clear. Most students end up getting very similar grades. Difference maker is participation! Class is presentation and essay based, with 7 times to present, 4 short essays and the final one. Put in the effort, you'll earn the A. Personal interst importan
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: What. A. Gem. He's the nicest guy, and his lectures really show his depth of passion and love for the subject. They can be boring at times, but it's honestly okay. Papers are graded easily, provided you are careful with grammar. There's just a lot of reading that you have to stay on top of.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Lance loves group presentations, but he grades fairly easily. Overall he is very nice. Sometimes lectures can be very boring.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great professor! Really cares about the books and his students. As long as you read and try you'll do well.
Lance is the best! He's super funny, has great opinions, and loves teaching. As long as you try, you will succeed in his class.

Had a really strong understanding of the material and the novels he assigned for reading. Gave good constructive criticism, and was fair with his grading. If you put in the extra effort, getting an A shouldn't be a problem. Would recommend and would take another course with this professor.

Wonderful professor. Yes there is a lot of reading, but it's an English course. You write 5 or 6 papers total, one on each topic covered (poetry, a play, a novel etc...). The papers are only 2 pages long. Very easy grader when it comes to the required oral presentation. Willing to help if needed. Class participation is key. He takes attendance.

One of the best Humanities professors at WPI.Topics of interest highly important and pushes you to think of your actions and morale as an engineer in society.Take at least one class with him. you are going to love it.
Was interested in the subject and knew what he was talking about. Really nice and supportive even through presentations.
Really easy classes.
he's a good guy with some interesting quirks. the class is nice and easy which makes life so much better
A really exciting Professor. Sometimes class could be a little boring, but he's pretty funny and we tend to have truly thought-provoking discussions! Recommended!

Online class and instructor recorded Zooms (4+ hours) mostly rants on BitCoin, AI, and other unimportant topics. Provided all assignments ahead of time and accepted them as final with complimentary feedback. No grades provided on any assignments and when asked, instructor ghosted. Students received A's and admit they didn't understand course.

He really cares about us and does alot beyond just the course. Coming out of the class I def feel more confident interviewing with financial companies and banks. Class lectures are amazing and full of useful info. and different perspectives. Discussions and class interactions are something we can vouch for. Great prof! Keep it up Koutmos!
Second semester now having him. He makes alot of time for all of us and wants to make sure he answers all our questons. Always has office hours for us and wants us to ask him questions.
Prof. K is awesome. Had him for Derivatives. Really cares about getting us ready for the future and job market also.

My rating may be a bit skewed but had him during D term of covid. Class is internship based but did nothing but a two page executive summary with my 6 partners for the whole term. Wish I couldve learned or done a little more but class was easy.

Great class lectures. Helped me personally to land an internship with a big 4 bank. Took his fintech class and did an ISP study with him while studying for my CFA, where he was really helpful. He's super nice and goes out of his way for students. Highly recommend him.
good guy. wants to help and see us do well. very enthusiastic and knowledgeable. i'm glad i had a chance to take class with him before i graduate.
awesome class!  Great learning experience about finance and risk. He's helpful, understanding and has alot of knowledge to share.
Pretty easy A with assignments that will consume very little of your time. The course itself is very interesting, however, and is well worth the time invested.
Great classes. I enjoyed going to class and learning. The research aspect of it was probably the best for me.
It's a really good class with a lot of real world examples. He's a nice guy and very helpful. I've learned a lot in class.

I work at a financial advisory co. which is why I took this class. He's awesome. Brings a lot of real-world experience. His classes have a lot of research material in finance... The assignments require indep research and analysis as well. All in all, very knowledgeable Professor. Would take more classes with.

Awesome class. He brings a ton of real world experience. Shares his trading strategies with all of us and where he is invested. In the next classes he then tells us how his portfolio is doing and what the returns are. Its pretty impressive. I personally learned a ton from him.

Yea, gotta say this class is the real deal if you want to learn how to invest. Prof is smart and loves talking about how research applies to everyday markets. No "fluff" material so if you miss some classes it puts you behind. Assignments can be llllonnnng and require research. Good stuff overal. I'm happy with it.

enjoyed the class very much. I walked away knowing alot about stock trading and how markets work. he is a high frequency trader and can spend hours talking about what works and what doesnt. although he's laid back and wants you to do well, dont skip classes or else you fall behind. you need to do lots of independent research and readings to do well

Koutmos tries his best. He really loves the subject and trades on the stock market. He has issues conveying the material and is quite confusing at times. However, he is really helpful at his office hours and will postpone assignments if the class has isssues with it. Takes an unreasonable amount of time to grade. Assignments are long.

I could Not understand anything he said. He kind of mumbles a lot and speaks in very technical business vocabulary that hardly anyone in the class can follow. When I asked him to clarify something for me I just got more confused. He is a nice guy and all I just can't understand him very well. I understood what he was saying after I looked it up.
Best professor

A quiz is given at the start of every class. 1st 3 assignments are done alone. Last 2 assignments and a project (split into 3 phases) are done with a partner. The project gives really good experience with SQL and java. You don't need to know much Java, it's only used for 1 phase of the project. Everything is learned in the class.

Wong's DB class is one of those classes where he leans on his industry experience to give students to best intro to DBs and SQL that can be found, which makes him a great professor. Homework assignments could be slightly challenging, but he was always willing and quick to help, and was attentive to the class schedule and even reorganized deadlines
A great professor, but be very careful, it's a lot of work and some of the assignment instructions aren't very clear.
Basically a massive group project that took 30-60 hours per week. While it seems like a lot, I would recommend everyone take it and I would happily take it again.

Software engineering was by far the most work intensive class I have ever taken. It was essentially a 50 hour work week of a class and we never slept the day before software iterations were due, but the amount I learned from this course was invaluable. Prof Wong was really helpful and cared about our success, but be prepared to work very hard.

Lectures barely matter past week 2. He is occasionally disrespectful towards students and student teams. Don't waste your time with a large robotic device as extra credit as a small simple one will earn the same amount of points.

The most transformative class I've had at WPI. I would recommend every student to take software engineering with professor Wong if you have the time. If you put in the effort this class will teach you so much more than just software engineering.

The class is well-designed and interesting, but it includes an incredible amount of work -- probably the most in any class I've taken at WPI. Well worth it though, it's a great experience in what software engineering means.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: This class had a lot of homework and projects but the professor was very clear in lectures and made sure to answer all questions even if he didn't know at the time, He was very laid back and often humorous in class. His power point slides are well made and I used them as reference to do all assignments. Exams are not bad as long as you participate

Be prepared to do tons of work! Assignments and final exam are relatively simple. Project is very time consuming but the final grade is greatly based on your own participation. He is interested in this class and he cares about his students. He is always available to talk to and gives great feedback.

A really awesome professor, if you have any issues in class/ with grading TALK TO HIM. He will accommodate you accordingly, really cares about students and is willing to re-explain concepts in and out of class. The TAs weren't that great when I took it so I had to reach out to him a few times for grading corrections.
Good Guy who cares about the students. The class itself is a lot of work but he does well in helping groups that are struggling.

Good teacher who seems interested in the class content and gives a lot of feedback. Is sometimes a little boring, dry, and dull, but otherwise the content is still interesting and covers a lot. Grading is sometimes strict but he offers lots of help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Really down to earth guy. He is always available to talk to and gives great feedback.  He did skimp over some very important topics. But overall it was a great class.  Also, he understands your group project is limited on the abilities of your group members, so your final grade is greatly based on your own participation on the project.

He's very dull and extremely hard to listen to. Doesn't really make class interesting and works through only theory or trivial examples. He didn't focus much on actual application and core concepts like updating a table were glossed over. Projects and assignments were good, but the quizzes, lectures, and exams weren't great.
More business type rather than technical.
avoid him at all cost

worst professor ever he should not be allowed to teach. he was confusing at lectures and i had him for calc 3 and 4, and it was so hard. although i did very poorly in these classes i managed to pass when my grade was significantly lower then a c.

Awful professor.  Went to office hours and received no help whatsoever.  I told him I though I was going to fail and asked him what I could do for extra practice or help, and he said not to worry - you're doing fine in the class --- and then he failed me anyways.  DO NOT TAKE CALC WITH MASAMUNE.
The best course in this line
Course is not easy,but the professore is fine and helpful. If u work hard, A is not a problem.

This professor was horrible.  He did not teach well, and could not clarify anything because he could never understand what you were asking.  Very little partial credit.  His quizzes were hard because they were on seemingly random, and really difficult, problems. Lack of homework is good, but it does not prepare you for the tests and quizzes.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!! You will not be given any slack in grading. You will not get help from him after hours. You will not understand him at all. NOT a good idea to take this class unless you already know you will ace integral calculus or any material he is teaching.

I found this professor very good. His way of teaching is maybe difficult for some, but actually he is trying to explain, so if u visit him or his TA, those office hours can be very useful. I would recommend using office hours of TA and professor because some things that were not clear for me, became clear after those hours.

It is really difficult to pass his class if you have not had prior experience in the mathematics related to the class. Looking back at high school I understand the Calculus much better than the way Masamune explained it. He almost made concepts that I easily understood confusing. The TA was of no use. This is not someone I would want as my professo

Nearly impossible to understand. Couldn't answer questions. TA graded all tests/quizzes including the midterm and TA awarded little to no partial credit. Masamune didn't check over the TA's grading. AVOID THIS PROF.
Taught dfferent materiel from the other calc 3 classes. his response to most questions were "yes, need to learn, very important for test"
Difficult to understand and can't answer simple questions, he can not understand them no matter how clearly stated.

Terrible class, half of my classmates NRd, and the ones that passed had already had Calc in high school -- SOOO hard to understand/comprehend. students ended up teaching the class. TA was of no use either, and contradicted what Masamune had to say. AVOID!!!

This guy gives no partial credit, has ridiculous quizzes, and just has hostile policies in general. He's a nice guy, but he brings foreign standards with him, and expects way too much of his students.
No Comments

First time teaching in America. He tries, but he is hard to understand, hard to read what he writes on the board, his notation doesn't make sense sometimes, his midterm is harder than other people's, harder than it should be.  He does offer some extra credit quizzes in class, but other than that, going to class is barely worth it.  Avoid Masamune.
If you want to experience depression take her class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The final is worth 40% of your grade and only has five questions. Before your final, your grade is made up of case studies from group work after every lecture that is due by 6 pm and takes at least 2 hours to do, so basically, if you have other classes after, you can't do the work.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Made the TA do most of the work so all she did was just talk off the slides. Mostly, she was incredibly rude to students throughout the classes. For the final, someone on one of the teams made a small mistake and she rudely complained about it for most of their 10 Minute presentation. There's a reason why wpi won't let her do grad classes anymore.

Atrocious professor. 40% of your grade is the final exam, attendance is mandatory—this isn't high school. Professor Saberi expects you to complete 7 tasks: read lectures ahead, do homework, two case studies weekly, two quizzes weekly, and a final project. If you want to experience pain, take her class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor insanely rude and condescending. Requires students to download a windows only software, and is not understanding of students who are on MacOS. Software needed for the final exam and she fails to accommodate, and when mentioned to her, she fails to be understanding, basically tells us that it's our problem to deal with. Worst Prof at WPI.
The only thing I learned from her is how to be confident and rude without really knowing what she is doing.
Very rude and disrespectful. Lectures are boring and honestly I didn't learn much.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Class was very fair with a wide range of assignments where not one was worth too much. The power point handouts were helpful when it came to studying and homework problems. Was always willing to answer questions and listen to students. Would definitely take again if I had the chance.

I told her about my flight 3 weeks before the final test and she refused to reschedule the test for me,failing to give a reason why she would not reschedule the test for me. Next term I hear a friend of mine took a final test from one of her classes earlier due to him having a flight on the day of the exam. Worst Prof in my 4 years at WPI, no doubt
Yes every class was just a lecture, but they weren't bad and the slide handouts I found to be pretty useful for holding my attention
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: The class is basically stats 1 but in excel. You have one group project doing some type of analysis on a data set. You either have to go to every class or write a summary of the online recording of the class. Besides the project the only other grade in the class in the final, which was a take home and took about 8 hours to complete.
Failed a person because they had a flight the day of the final and she didn't want to move the final. Not understanding of any excuses. Rough grader, has horrible teacher assistants.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Extremely tough grader for exams and homework, random pop quizzes.

EXTERMELY condescending. Gives EXACTLY 20 minutes for exams that need 30. Take home exams every class. Exams at the start of every class. During the final exam the WPI server crashed, which was needed by more than half the students, and her response was "you cannot complete your final." Until is was suggested we go to a lab. The exam ran 1hr over.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Rude, condescending, inflexible. Would rather fail students than let them take a quiz or test a day early (even when dealing with very legitimate excuses). Quizzes were unreasonable within the time limit. Doesn't explain topics well, has a hard time understanding students' lives, made an easier business class living hell.
Do not recommend good luck

She gives quizzes the night before every class and a quiz every class. She tells us we have twenty minutes (not even close to enough time) to submit the quiz, but we only have 17 minutes and she does not accept late work. Her quiz and test averages are usually around 30% to 50% and she blames the students for this. She is condescending and rude.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Zoz is a great lecturer for Quantum II, because he is very knowledgeable. It is not an easy class, and he may not seem too friendly, but you should be able to follow the lecture easily as long as you read the book. (We used Perusal, which I thought was a brilliant idea).
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Zozulya is a genius and knows a lot about what he teaches. Ask questions, but only good questions. If you don't read the book and read it carefully, don't expect him to help you and spoon feed you the material. One bad thing about him is that he expects all to have a high level of mathematical maturity somewhat unreasonably.

Good professor overall, a bit hard to follow sometimes. Homework was very difficult but the tests only moderately so. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK until you start the course. I never used it and it was a total waste of money.
Fairly easy class with a huge curve.  Had a 80 text average and still ended up with an A.  Not a bad prof at all.
He is very passionate about physics and it shows in class. Tests are 20 multiple choice questions. The first test is extremely easy compared to the others. One of the better PH 1111 teachers at WPI.

Professor Zozulya gave good lectures and posted notes online. Expect a large lecture setting in this introductory level course. Homework was all online, assigned every few days, and fairly graded. Three exams were given, and the last two were very difficult for many students. Do not fall behind in this class, and seek help when needed!!

Friendly personality makes him very interesting to listen to and he always tries to use diagrams and examples to explain the concepts. You would still have to go read the textbook to understand the concept fully, but then again you wouldn't have bought it if you didn't want to use it.
Great Professor. Very enthusiastic about physics and extremely good at clearing up any questions/misunderstandings about the material.
If you want a redefinition of the world you live in, attend this course.
Great as a conference instructor, very clear and very helpful. Good conceptual descriptions. ROUGH grader though

This guy is a pretty cool dude. If you've ever seen Despicable Me, he could be Gru's brother because he looks and sounds exactly the same.  I like him a lot because he explains all the concepts and problems and also has us doing a lot of practice problems, which is very helpful after being in Burnhams class. If he's your conference guy, thats great
Great guy! Sharp dresser. Great jokes!  Very helpful. Always available when you have a question.
He's a good teacher, very enthusiastic. he doesn't do many practice problems, and the tests are tough, but he scales them. don't let that scare you though, he's a good teacher.

I did not get much out of his lectures.  His lectures really only gave you an idea of what was going on and you had to go read the book and learn it on your own.  He didn't really do many practice problems.  This made the homework and tests quite hard.  He did make some lectures interesting though.
No Comments
This guy rocks

this prof is honestly a fantastic teacher. He walks u through EVERYTHING to make it as easy as possible. All the answers to quizzes are given in class, with multiple retakes & with no time limit. He is super understanding, and is even okay with students being remote (attendance isn't mandatory!). I don't know why the other reviews are so low :(
Wouldnt recommend
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I have taken many graduate courses and this is my least favorite class yet. It was exceptionally disorganized and deliberately not well thought out. would not recommend.
Would not recommend
Lazy professor who made me uncomfortable to talk to him. I felt very disrespected during his class. Its not a hard class he was just not good at teaching the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: not accessible outside of class, lazy, does not care. Really terrible class would not recommend this professor
He goated

Not accessible outside of class, I have never felt so disrespected by a professor before. He talks to his students like hes looking down on them. I do not feel like he wants his students to succeed but rather does not care whether or not students fail. This is only a 2000 level class and I expected him to be much more involved in the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor does NOT care about you at all. You can email him as many times as you want and he WILL NOT RESPOND. You can see him send out posts or emails but he will not care enough to email back. He is not helpful at all. Ive never had a professor care less about his students than him. Would never recommend.

The grading was extremely tough during this course, and the homework was very time consuming. The professor posted lecture videos to be watched before class and they were often far too long, and needed to be watched before every lecture. The exams were very difficult to complete in the given time because they were too long, and the labs were long.

Professor Albrecht is an amazing professor. Although we had a lot of lecture content, it was all important. He broke down the lectures during class time, which was helpful. Yes, for the tests you will have to study, but that goes for any class. He is available outside of class so take advantage of that and put in the effort and you will get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: As long as you keep up with lectures, do your assignments, comes to office hours and study for the tests, you should do well in this class. The labs are simple enough because it gives you clear directions. However, the tests require you to memorize a lot of it's not an equation, especially when you talk about circuits and the cardiovascular system.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: At first lectures were boring and confusing but after he asked for feedback, he changed considerably and lectures improved. Building the ECG was actually really interesting and the class was nice as you learned everything then applied it to an actual thing. As long as you study, tests are fine. Office hours were great if you had a lot of questions.

The class was very interesting and informative. The first few classes were a little boring and confusing, and he listened to student feedback and improved his lectures and explanations considerably, which was nice. The second half of the course is very interesting. Building an ECG/EKG outside of class was tedious, but fun. Manageable tests and hw.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: There is no textbook and his lectures are often vague and unhelpful for the homework. The tests are very specific details. He is unhelpful in office hours and tells you to just look at the lecture slides. He knows what he is talking about bio-wise, but is not fully knowledgeable in the electronics component of the course. Probably good in a lab.
The material is pretty hard but he makes his exams straight to the point so they're really easy. Very quiet and awkward but its an interesting class. Building your own ECG was really cool.

Dr. Baloo is absolutely not a good professor. He tried to make the class fully remote on the second day and only showed up once in person by 2 weeks into the term. He then was "concerned" over class ethics and made a mandatory quiz where if you got a 90+ you were allowed to stay in the class and if you got below a 50 you were kicked out.
Baloo is a very good person but not that much of a great teacher, only use existing presentation and homework.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Baloo really does care about his students very much. He is extremely nice however the sad reality is that he just was not great at teaching. He sped through the textbook slideshow which has awful slides with way too much info. The reading quizzes we sped through and did not get much out of that. More visuals and examples would be helpful

Baloo is the man. His class was based off attendance (a sign in sheet goes around during class), 3 exams, and 6 homework assignments. He allows an extra note sheet per exam so by the final you have 3 note sheets to fully look at. He's really funny and a great professor who grades hella easy. 100% take him for ES2503

Grades on proper procedure, not the correct answer. Which is nice for GPA, not so much if you're unsure whether you actually understand the information or not. Available alot for office hours, but isn't really helpful, as he usually just explains the procedure while looking at the answer key. Other than that, he's a solid choice for ES2503.

One of the best professors at this school. lectures are engaging and he was always enthusiastic about the topic of the day. This made me look forward for his classes. He related the materials we studied in class to real life applications. Office hours are helpful and always pleasant to talk to caring and willing to help students. Do Recommend!

An excellent professor in all courses that he teaches. I took ES2503 with Prof. Balaji as well as ME5313 and I can easily say he is one of my favorites at WPI. He is always more than willing to help his students. His enthusiasm towards the subject matter makes lectures interactive, engaging, and fun. Don't miss lectures!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Really receptive of criticism and willing to adjust the course to accommodate students so that everyone understands the material. Review sessions and class examples are extremely helpful, so attending lectures are obviously helpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Lectures were always important as lots of material was covered. Worked through plenty of examples. Very friendly and upbeat about helping students.

Professor Baloo is a very caring teacher who will go to great lengths to help his students; from skipping lunch to help with a difficult homework to staying in his office extra hours to elaborate further on a lesson a student may not have understood. He was a great professor and I would definitely take his class again.

Great professor. I woud recommend him for Dynamics. He is very helpful and encourages questions. Gives a lot of homeworks but they help you in preparing for the exam. He is very approachable and willing to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor, really cares about students.  He encourages you to come by his office, I recommend you take him up on it.

Yes there is alot of home work but he is willing to give extensions as well as move tests if he feels the class doesn't understand the concept. lecture is really dry but  there are test questions in those slides as well as the packets he gives out. If you are struggling talk to him he is a very personable professor and wants his students to do wel
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's a nice guy but he gives a lot of very challenging homework. His lectures can be boring as he mostly reads off of a power point but when it comes down to exams, the questions are easy (compared to the homework material). Also, you may go weeks at a time without any homework but when he assigns it, it comes all at once.

He just reads powerpoint slides the whole time and assigns online problems. I pretty much learned nothing from him that I didn't already know, and anything I didn't I just watched videos and read up on. I would definitely not recommend him for this class.
Great professor at WPI.
Great guy. I learned a lot from him. Hes tough on his students, but stick with it and youll do well.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Lots of work but if you do it, you will pass. People love to complain when they dont get a good grade - most of the time its their own fault!

His lectures are dry, hard to follow, and rarely helpful. Nightly homework assignments are not good reflections of what was learned in class. Professor Hall struggles to answer even the simplest question in class. The only saving grace is that the tests are simple and straightforward.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Loves talking about himself instead of teaching what's required for the labs. Grading is extremely strict for labs, he does offer extra credit if you can understand how to do it... On the bright side, the exams are straightforward and not very difficult.
Cannot teach, always speak himself. He is expecting students to find out everything by themselves. He cannot understand students' questions.

Tough class. Required, and he's the only one who teaches it some terms, but boy is it a tough class. Labs are confusing and have very specific requirements that he vaguely conveys. Lectures are dry as hell as he reviews a hodgepodge of  engineering material you learned in other classes.

This professor does not use course time effectively and expects students to learn problem solving techniques on their own time. He rarely does step by step problem solving and a large portion of his lectures focus on the incompetencies of the current generation and their over reliance on calculators. Exams were not a reflection of lecture material.
Copies directly from his notes, 3 hours of homework every night. Makes mistakes when writing notes. Confusing reference texts requires and doesn't explain how to use any reference material
Eh.  He's okay.  He's kind of hard to follow, but the subject is easy.  Nice guy.
Very useful class. Very handy and realistic. Lots of experiment. Fun!
Trying to fuse several classes materials into one.  Teach the basics of a subject and expect students to comprehend the rest in homeworks.

He is a nice enough guy, but he thinks that everyone should be able to understand all of the problems he gives based off the formulas and the one or two (or zero) simple examples he does in class.  Quizzes are off the homework usually, but isnt necesarily off homework we've done yet.  Grades harshly.
Can't teach, book is useless, only around at GOD awful hours, Grading is hit/miss
Easy class, does a double scale because he wants everyone to get an A.  If you can find him, he's helpful but hes never on campus.
Really helpful, great guy...attend every class annd pay attention, and you will ace it!
reminds me of Jimmy Stewart, fairly easy class, TA screwed me over

This professor is clearly passionate about his course material and is very engaging with lectures. Classes are made up of a lot of hands on work which lets things stay fresh. I would definitely recommend taking a course from this professor as He always keeps things fun and entertaining.

He's an amazing professor who is passionate about his work and is very knowledgeable about the subject. Although there were very few assignments, the points totaled only 100, he made the class a pleasure to be in every time we came in, and it wasn't incredibly difficult to maintain an A if you were present, even as one without any music background.

Definitely one of my favorite professors I've had at WPI. Prof Ibbett is super nice and always willing to answer any questions or give feedback on your work. I loved the hands on style of classes, it was so much more engaging than a normal lecture.

Professor Ibbet was very helpful whenever I was struggling and did his best to help with whatever problem I had. My only issue with his class was that without recorded lectures it could sometimes be difficult to replicate the techniques he had used in lectures outside of class time

Professor is insanely talented and has so much to teach about not just music, but its connection to science. Our course was mostly project-based, and he was so helpful and kind-- he made us all feel like we were great at composing, even those of us with no experience. He made learning music fun in a relaxed environment. Highly recommend!
Teaches material clearly
Professor Ibbett is wonderful. His course was super fun and easy to learn with tons of interactions and laughs.

This course had many different components including music history, arranging, composing, and theory, however, Prof Ibbett was able to teach all these aspects very well. His lectures were always interesting and engaging, and he complemented what was taught by playing piano and showing videos. He also gives great feedback on all projects.

Really great Professor Cares about the students and their learning. Only a midterm and a final, homeworks are spaced out evenly. Also insanely talented and can play anything on the spot. Would 100% take another class with him if given the chance.

Prof. Ibbett is not only a great professor but a great person overall. He makes an effort to know students on an individual level and is patient when explaining new concepts. He is an incredibly talented musician and it shows with each class. He's an unforgettable professor in the best way possible and I highly suggest taking one of his courses.

Professor Ibbett has an amazing energy. You can tell he genuinely cares about what he teaches and his students. He was able to really get me interested in class because he gave me the freedom to experiment and work on what I was passionate about on the projects. I just wish he was more accessible outside the classroom.

David is one of the most passionate professors I have ever met, he is genuine and wants to improve students of all skill levels and make sure that they are able to use what they learn from him lectures in ways that can express themselves. Did I mention that David is also extremely talented? He is able to produce music from anything and make it good

Professor Ibbett was awesome; I had a fun time learning new MIDI techniques in Ableton and augmenting those with the Max software suite. The final project is open ended, so there's a lot of cool stuff that comes out of it. Seeing other student's projects as well as showing off something you've built is a fun way to end the class.

Professor Ibbett teaches a lot of skills over a short time-span, but the class is definitely manageable. He teaches most of the skills for the class early on, so the last half of the term has a lot of exploration available. He is very insightful during project reviews, and provides a lot of examples to inspire us during class.

Professor Ibbett is a great professor, he taught the content very well earlier in the course (later on there was a lot more self-led learning) and was always there to help if we needed it. 
I liked the structure of the course (4 projects and 14 labs outside of class), as it encouraged us to spend time getting familiar with Max.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Awesome professor, great energy! Super passionate about what he it teaching.

Prof. Lud takes a very practical approach to RF Engineering.  He introduces as much theory as is necessary to understand the concepts, but really focuses on practical applications to circuit design.  The course topics are selected thoughtfully and covered completely (esp. transistor amplifier design).  I am much better at my job thanks to Prof. Lud
Teaching is okayish. Not very good as a human being. Tone deaf to students' issues.

Ludwig is a friendly, knowledgeable professor, and gives good, structured lectures with useful supplemental material. As a Physics/ECE major I really enjoyed the RF course. Make sure you understand the math and really know how to do the calculations, otherwise you won't do well on the exams.

He is terrible at his job. He is extremely lazy. He tries to hide it but you can still see that his lecture videos are reused. He purposefully tries to hold back information so that you will do bad on exams. No hw or test solutions published, and lectures are very disorganized. Also very rude and arrogant when asking about your grade. Avoid him.

Professor Ludwig is a great professor. He enjoys teaching and records videos to make up for the snow day's absence: he is the only professor I had last term who did it. He truly respects students and is very honest and helpful. He is not a big fan of partial credits, but he did add extra credits for all if the test performance is less desirable.

Teacher definitely knows the material. Don't ask him homework questions, he will just refer you to the TA. Passing grades for tests are 40%, holds himself in an arrogant manor. Breaks chalk accidentally as it bangs against the board in his frustration that no one in the class is answering questions. Take Bitar for MicroII
Great!!!

This guy is the most competent professor at Worcester PolyTech. He speaks better English than most of the native speakers. He has real experience in the classes he teaches and is excited about the topic. I highly recommend taking ElectroMag with him. His explanations regarding the subject are crystal clear and detailed. Do all homework.
Study Hard and you will survive.
Great teacher, knows his stuff, and help sessions before tests are a big help

homeworks are somewhat ambiguous at times..otherwise a nice guy who really cares about his students. The exams are not bad either, but require a lot of number-crunching, so they tend to be pretty time-consuming.
Cares about his students. Material is definitely not easy and his exams, though not necessarily 'hard' tend to be really long.

He obviously knows a lot about RF.  He is very helpful and normally available (in his lab).  His exams are hard and don't expect the homeworks to indicate what will be on them.  Old exams, however, are very similar, and a good starting point for studying.
Teaches like he was born to do it.  Knows his stuff better than anyone.  Dry sense of humor and all around nice guy.
One of the best in the department, really cares and is truly fair.  Great jokes about the French.
An awesome teacher who cares about students and material. Definitely knows RF.

I agree with the earlier rater about him being hit or miss.  If you like autonomy in how you learn the material, then you should consider his classes.  If you prefer a lot of rigid structure in your classes then you should look else where.

He is a hit or miss professor.  For most students, miss.  I have taken three classes with him, the key is to have a strong background in math, particular stats and prob.  If you don't, don't take his classes.  He expects more independent learning than is the norm at WPI, however he also gives you more autonomy in tests, hw, and projects in return.
Cannot teach at all. This class was a waste of time.
Very biased. Prepare to learn the course on your own.  He's not of much help.

This is easily the worst professor I have ever had. Students from class presented lectures We "studied" simulation without any math concepts.  Nothing on random number gen, queues or statistical tests.  The professor is hugely biased, conufses concepts and refuses to admit hes wrong.

Clearly biased for/against certain students.  Made us buy the preliminary edition of his own book and basically proofread it for him.  But, the book is pretty good, better than most on the subject.  Be prepared to learn the material on your own.
Easily the worst teacher I've ever had.
the review repeatedly showed Dobrushkin's bias toward certain students. Beware of his arbitrary grading!
wish he retired/gone. very unfair,unclear, and prejudice. Good for nothing type of professor!!!. Make sure that he likes you to make your life easy.

Skips the hard details, will not explain them when asked; He's a nice guy, just not good at teaching. He does allow extra credit assignments if asked. He knows almost nothing about computer programming - the guy is all math.
Cannot adequately explain the material.  However, will helpfully show you the solution to the homework problems if you ask nicely.
can't explain material. unhelpful outside class. v. biased towards/against certain students. (hint: get on his good side and you might get to skip the final)
Knows his stuff can not teach for a lick!  He tends to skip details on the material he is teaching because those details are obvious to him.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

I don't know why his rating is so high. He is one of the worst professor I ever had in WPI. This man is extremely unprofessional. He makes you stand on line to collect the hw. Avoid this class if you value your GPA and money in WPI.
I would def recommend going to his office hours for one on one help. He's pretty chill and listens to the students. Homework is relevant and helpful.
Really an amazing guy and cares about helping you learn and pass Calculus.

His homework assignments are out of 20 so it's easy to lose lots of points on them, but his teaching is so thorough and engaging that it's worth having to put more time into the homework. His lectures are amazing and clear. He will take time to answer and explain any questions on the material he's teaching. His exams are easy.
amazing guy, very willing to help students and always answers questions. Every lecture made me eager to learn

He's a teacher who actually cares about the students. When someone had a question, he patiently explained the answers in a clear way. He also made it through a lot of material compared with other calculus teachers. If you ever get a chance to learn with him, take it!
Cassani explained everything so that it was understandable. Cared about the class understanding all of the material.

Cassani was great. His tests and quizzes were straightforward, homework was totally doable, material covered was interesting and engaging. I didn't go to lecture but the book is dope so I used that. Tons of extra credit, study decently well for the tests and you'll pass. Wish I could take it again.

He really kept the class involved during his lectures. I was never bored in his class and he made the material very easy to follow. Getting a good grade wasnt difficult, as long as you go to conference and do some of the suggested problems he recommends both exams and the conferences quizzes will be pretty easy.

There's extra credit on everything (tests, quizzes, projects) and it's awesome. Really nice and funny. I found myself pretty confused during a lot of the lectures and wish he would've been more clear about examples and done more of them. Conference really helped clear everything up and its pretty easy to well on the exams.

Lin Algebra is pretty straightforward with Cassani, though he likes to spend much of lecture on theorems that are not really focused on exams, hws, or quizzes. First exam is very easy but exam 2 is a little harder. You can get up to 108 on the exams and 120 on quizzes. HW is webwork and you have 5 chances. The lowest quiz grade will be dropped.

Hands down the best mathematics professor I ever had. He is knowledgeable and knows what he is doing. A lot of homework is assigned but it is very helpful in understanding the material. I basically lived in his office during the term because he helps so much during office hours. Great professor and person overall.
Great professor. Cares about students and wants everyone to do well. Gives chances for credit and gives time for questions in class. Best math professor at WPI.
Amazing professor. Really cared about the student's learning and getting them to pass and understand the material. A really genuine and great person.
Amazing professor! Really cares about the students doing well in class.  Gives practice tests and extra credit. A really nice guy and a fair class.
Such a sweet guy! Wants you do to good, gives lots of opportunities for extra points, gives very fair exams (worth a lot but very fair). Best calculus professor Ive had at WPI. Also best accent ever.
Not the greatest professor I've had so far and the structure of his class was a bit all over the place. Luckily, the content for the class was pretty straightforward so it is pretty easy overall.

I took CHE 2011 and CHE 2012 with Professor DiBiasio. He is the reason that I excelled in chemical engineering. Some of his notes in class can be slightly jumbled, but he makes sure that everyone understands what is going on. He cares a lot about the success of his students and wants everyone to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Deebs recently stopped being department head so that he would have more time to teach. His lectures are still a bit disorganized (the man would seriously benefit from a set of printed lecture notes), but he's not an altogether bad teacher. If you don't catch something in class, visit his office hours. Same if you run into issues with the project.

DiBiasio wasn't the best professor, but also not the absolute worst you could have. It seems like he doesn't have time to teach the class; he went to two conferences in the middle of the term and missed at least three lectures. Homework can be very challenging, especially since he rushes through examples that are merely projected on the board.

Lecture notes are generally not specific.  Doesn't give examples and expects you to know how to do the problems.  Homework given includes material not covered in class.   Tests are difficult as he includes problems that have 'curve balls'.  Would not recommend if you want a teacher that teaches.

He is a smart guy but he doesn't know how to teach. He just assumes that everyone knows how to do chemical engineering excersiging. not helpful at all. selfstudy habit should be taking into consideration
He doesn't know how to teach. He just assumes that everyone knows how to do chemical engineering excersiging. not helpful at all.

The material wasn't to hard but he just didn't have time to teach the class. Good intentions but there would be almost no way to schedule a meeting time. Just make sure you go to lectures and don't wait to do the hw and you should be fine

I also took CHE 2012 with him and got a B, due mostly to a bad group for projects. Prof. DiBiasio (aka Deebs) is a bit disorganized, which can be frusterating. However, he is a good professor overall. If you need to talk to him, go the the chem eng office and have the secretaries (Felicia or Tiffany, they are amazing) schedule an apt.
Great teacher. Easy to pay attention in his class. Is a little disorganized but that doesn't matter much because he explains the stuff well and it's easy to stay awake in his class.

he is a smart guy but cant teach well. he has a tendency to slap things up on the overhead and assumes the whole class gets it. my advice, find a couple friends in the class and lean on them. they will lean on you too. homework is graded hard, but it doesnt count that much. DO THE PROJECTS WELL!!!!
Goes really fast but a good teacher and really wants us to do well!!!
No Comments
Cool guy, whacky sense of humor, very interested in students and in challenging them to do their best!
Didn't actually have a class with him, but he was my IQP advisor. Great guy.
No Comments

Higgins graded us over our progress the entire term for things that should not have been considered. Going into the class, our groups and projects were assigned to us, and while my group did not get along we did later on. Despite this we were still given a poor grade in teamwork. The extensions that were given to us were also held against us.

As an IQP advisor, Prof Higgins set arbitrary standards for grading that fluctuated with her perception of the team. We got a B on IQP because we had teammates that were more quiet although still contributed to writing/editing. Prof Higgins was bullheaded and any miscommunication would be amplified by her -- it was very difficult to do well.
Had her f or project advising. Was bull-headed and refused to cooperate or find middle ground with her co-advisor. Definitely hindered our learning process and our project success

Prof. Higgins was great for Intro to Rhetoric. Her explanations were clear and you could tell that she knew what she was talking about. Although all papers must be single spaced, she made sure that her assignments were interesting. This is the best Humanities class I have taken at WPI, and Prof. Higgins is one of the best professors I've had.

Tough grader, but she makes it worth it. The lectures are 2 hours and the papers are really long (single spaced!), but she's adept in her field and knows what she's doing. Be prepared to participate heavily and to read from the book. Tests do focus a bit too much on memorization, but this gets better over time.
A very nice professor although her grading scale is a little bit hard.
Extremely informative and practical class.  Be prepared to do a lot of reading and writing, though.
very *nice* person with somewhat boring materials.
No Comments
Dr. Higgins is a great prof, and she really cares about her students. Take the time to get to know her and it will go a long way.
make sure you bring coffe to her classes
teaches subjectivist theories in her classes. :(
No Comments
Good teacher.

Very interesting class! She seems to be active in her field and does an amazing job at explaining some of the results of her research to the class. If you want to learn how to write clearly, (no matter what your are majoring in) take her classes!
No Comments

Took Human Computer Interactions class. Uses his own website for class. Website is designed poorly with grammatical errors (irony). All in class questions are answered with "read the book/webpage," even if the question was about something in said materials. Lecture/reading are on completely separate subjects every week. Does not inspire confidence.
Can be a cool guy, but assigned bad/uninteresting projects all based off the previous ones, and the material, surprisingly, was horribly boring.  Projects also took forever...  Say no to Scheme!

This professor took our little MQP project very seriously, which made us worker harder at it and thus learn more. He challenged us to explain our ideas well and to write well. He works late, which is good for us college students. I'd recommend working with him in the future if you get a chance.

as a professor he may be ok but parojects require programming that he teaches little about. also the class is allllllllllllll BS. It's mainly common knowledge. if you can BS very well then you'll end up with a good grade in this class
Decent MQP advisor, took a while for comments on our paper but ended up with an A.  HCI was hard, but decent.  He made fun of my friend when he fell asleep in class.
Worst advisor I could imagine.  Didnt understand the project, and made horrible assumptions.  He loves the boring mundane details.  Grading is quite biased
Tough grader, but was clear in what he wanted and very helpful when the going got tough. Best advisor I've had out of the 3 projects.
Great advisor for my MQP - he had very high expectations, but he helped us produce a great project. Expectations were always clear, and feedback was helpful (though not always fast).

Worst course in my grad. study since he asks everyone to read book in advance and does not discuss in detail, it can be difficult. His projects are not about the stuff in the book and follow an old pattern of projects so it can become a nightmare.
Treats the subject matter very seriously. Class has much writing and little programming. British accent and attitude are always entertaining.
No Comments
Professor Brown was great. I'm too lazy to input anything else
No Comments
No Comments
Spent 7 weeks learning what was already obvious to everyone
Good professor. I dissagreed with some of his material, but he's above average.

Prof. Ward is difficult but fair.  Exams do require extensive reading but he has always done a full review of exam topics prior to each one, no trick questions.  Some expectation of C proficiency is assumed  but in the past I have asked to do projects in JS and Python before.  If you can demonstrate  the code works he won't care about the language.
Thinks he can teach
0 out of 10

Ward is easily the worst prof. at WPI. He covers absolutely nothing in lecture and expects you to know C inside and out. His quizzes are also extremely hard, seeing as the class quiz average is about a 40%. Scaling? Nope, he'll fail the whole class. Short answer, avoid at all costs because you will not learn C from him.

This professor suggested the class would be difficult but a class for nonmajors should not require students to be pros at coding in C especially when the professor himself does not teach or even know how to exactly answer students' questions. He's not receptive at all to negative feedback or concerns from the class. Don't take this class with him.

Just terrible. His lectures explain nothing. His quizzes are extremely hard and do not cover the material from class or the book. Very bad at explaining anything but believes he explained it more than adequately for you to write a lot of code in 5 minutes.

Took SysProg for Non Majors. This is perhaps one of the worst professors I've ever had. He doesn't show you how to code in C. His lectures are completely useless yet quizzes and HW are very hard. Do not go into this class unless you already know C, CS1101 is not good enough with Ward. Avoid like the plague.

Most of the material was focused on generalities of HCI rather than useful information.  For example, "this is what gestalt principals are" rather than "you should put the buttons closer together".  The final lecture where Prof. Brown evaluated projects proved more informative than most of the previous lectures.  Tests were a recital of the book.
Worst professor ever.

Projects with him NEED CLEAR GUIDELINES, set by you and agreed upon by him. Did an MQP with him recently, did fantastic by the sponsor's standards, but that meant nothing to him. Unhelpful in meetings and no clear guidelines given by him mean that you'll need to provide those qualities. Extremely rigid professor after mind is made up, so work hard.
He was a good professor.  He explained everything clearly, and structured the class pretty well.  Not too much programming was assigned in this class, mostly writing.

The projects were difficult but relevant.  The exams require some original thought.  Professor Ward's pdf book is short but very complete.  I now have a great understanding of graphics, so I'd say Ward is an excellent professor.

Well, his class was alright.  HE taught a graphics class using the overhead, when showing the projects on the computer would have been much more effective.  exams were easy, projects tedious but enjoyable
said course was gonna be harder than usual, but I didnt think so.  Clear and straightforward exams and lectures, though very boring.

I don't know if this is true for every course, but certainly for CS 3041 he said it was going to be a tough course, but it was actually the easiest class I ever had ^_^ ...kind of boring lectures, but gets his point across.
No Comments

I took this in D2018. Wyglinski is one of the most energetic professors at WPI. I think he siphons energy from students. He really loves communication/networks. He grades on 13 quizzes (lowest 2 are dropped) and has 4 Group assignments: three mini projects and one course project. You can pick teammates. Programming and circuit building is involved.

His lecture barely cover any material relevant to the project or the homework and his exams has got nothing to do with the projects or the homework either. He is never available except for a short office hour which is always cut short by some of his other appointments. I heard a lot of good things about him but I was left profoundly disappointed.

You are graded on what you learn in class and more. You are graded on quizzes and projects. The quiz material ranges from material only found in the textbook to material he will cover in a few days. The projects require background in arduino's, python, and  strong programming. None of which is mentioned before signing up for the course.

I love Professor Wyglinski! He is very enthusiastic in his teaching and is always available to answer questions. He is clear about what he expects and his quizzes are very fair and related to the material taught in lecture. Would highly recommend!

He is a very friendly guy and will help you understand anything personally but has a very hyper personality hence, looses the focus really easily. Once you know how he works, any course with him would be easy. Remember -  for any project with him, keep consulting him. He changes his expectations weekly
Would take another course with Prof Wyglinski!
Great prof!

ECE503 covers an exceptionally difficult topic that is difficult to teach.  Professor Wyglinski does an excellent job at breaking it down into reasonable sections and is a lively speaker that prevents the lectures from become overwhelming.  Grading was clearly explained and fairly implemented.  I would take one of his courses again.

Neither go down into how the models in digital communication work, nor offer useful advice on lab operating.  And the course is really heavy, and useless. A quiz, a lab report, and a presentation every week.  Different student group has different level of hardness. Our group achieved much more, but less points.

I took 2 courses with him and they were both the most painful experiences I've ever had. His expectations are at least 4x greater than any other class I have taken. I spent 5 days sleeping 2 hours a night to finish a final project. He overbooks his time; if you need help expect to wait 15 mins. for him to show up late to his own office hours.

What should I say...The teacher knows almost nothing about what he talked about.I don't even know how he graduate from his university with that little knowledge.unless you are losing out of your mind, don't take the courses he will in.
Great prof. Really enjoyed the course.
Very good, very helpful, friendly, knows the material well.

Not a great teacher.  Lectures only cover the absolute basics with homework several levels past what he taught in class. Does not teach Matlab code required for homework. Crams too much information into one lecture and rushes through everything. Lacks real world examples.  Would not recommend to anyone.
what should I say...
What should I say?!!

He is the worst prof I ever had. His tests are too hard, his homework doesn't make any sense and neither does the book he only uses to assign homework. He is discouraging in class, tells you this is supposed to be easy. He takes off all the points for a simple mathematical mistake. Don't take him unless you absolutely have to.

No. You won't like him at all, trust me. Nonmandatory attendance, but you never know when he gonna give in-lecture quiz. Basically just read the PPT during the whole lecture. Never show up in lab session. Much more difficult exams than that of other same courses. No late credit. Cool, now I gonna receive my first non-A grade from ECE course.

One of the most evil people I have ever met. He wants you to show up but he is very useless in class. He says he could not graduate for ECE so I think he has some sort of anger with this class. He takes NO late credit, pop quizzes are a mess and never explains pre lab. He is not organized. This world would be better of without him, RUN AWAY.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Extremely bad, wants you to do as worse as possible, stay away from his class
this class is bad. Avoid at all cost.
run from him

Professor Mendelson is excellent. He can be a bit dry, but it doesn't matter because he is such a good communicator. He knows and understands signal analysis so well and does an excellent job at covering the most critical topics. He encourages students to ask questions and will go to great lengths to help students succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took BME 4023 w/ Prof. Mendelson. It was a very challenging course and the class grades were low, but he was fair and curved the scores in the end. He knows the material well and does a good job at communicating. He is readily available to meet with students, and is willing to provide as much outside help as a student needs.

Professor Mendelson is excellent. He challenges you and forces his students to think and understand. Class quiz and exam averages are typically low, but he curves the scores at the end. He is one of the most accessible professors I have ever had. He is always willing to meet and discuss one on one.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof. Mendelson does a good job. He is stoic and can come across as disrespectful sometimes, but I do not think he means to be. He is usually willing to help out if you ask for it.

What's worse, he takes attendance and grades you on participation. In a lecture class! He says it's "extra credit," but that's bull. Lastly, the textbook was ancient. If you're teaching us about technology in medicine, we can't be stuck reading a book published in 1993, with citations from the 80's. Give us academic papers to read instead! (22)

Literally one of the worst professors I've ever had, and he's the only professor available for 4000-level BME courses in this track. So if you're instrumentation, you're screwed! The only grades in the class are quizzes and two exams, so if you don't memorize every tiny detail in the lecture notes, prepare to NR. (12)
nice guy, just moderated the graduate seminars.

Alright very hard to understand talks like the swedish guy from star trek. Homeworks are misleading as far as what he wants on the test. Hes also only really willing to help those students that dont need the help to start with.  Testsare very hard and he does not cover the material for the test very well
He is very difficult and doesn't explain well. His homeworks are impossible and his tests are even harder. Nothing he does in class is relevant to the reading material.

Professor Mendelson doesn't always get the best wrap, I've had people tell me to avoid him, but I've had nothing but good experiences with him.  I found him to be a very fair grader.  He write fair tests and assignments and is willing and available to help if you need it.  He always provides the resources to complete any work that he assigns.
Professor Wobbe is so nice and caring. She really understands that students health should be put first. She also  wants everyone to succeed and that is seen through her teaching.
Professor Wobbe was really nice and cared about the individual student. She explained everything and was really organized.

I'm taking Prof. Wobbe for the Food Sustainability GPS and she's awesome. Very helpful, interesting lectures, and clear grading criteria. Lots of group projects and presentations. This is by far the most interesting class I've taken, and I can't wait to see what's in store for B term! I highly recommend Prof. Wobbe and her Food Sustainability class
Professor Wobbe is an awesome GPS professor. She is very fair, clear, and easy to talk to and ask for help. Highly recommend for GPS.

I had Wobbe for Feed the World, a Great Problem Seminar.  I highly recommend her.  She is dynamic and teaches well.  Always comes up with fresh ideas.  She really taught me how to make a presentation, and how to work well with others, as well as the rest of the class work.
Teaches the logic of science, very clear.

Great class notes and very organized class lectures, a very good teacher.  Group projects are annoying but as long as you get a decent group you're fine.  She's quite mean outside of class though so avoid having to ask her questions outside of lecture, can be rude and rather unhelpful.  Very good teacher otherwise.

Her notes and classes are well organized. But she grades horribly. Your grades don't reflect the work you put it. If you want to get a decent grade for the amount of work you put it, don't take her class!

I adore Professor Wobbe!  She's smart, she's clear, organized, and she really does care about her students.  She wants to make sure we learn!  If only other teachers were more like her.  Best advice: GO TO CLASS!  The lectures are GOLD.

Her lectures are well orginized and easy to follow, and she's helpful if you have questions. My only problem is with her test grading. I took one test that I got a C on even tho most of my answers were right. She doesn't clearly explain all she wants, so write more than you may think she wants.
good organization and clear notes, generous overall with grading, one of the better chemistry professors at WPI (actually cares)!
Wobbe is a great prof. Her notes and lecutres are very well organized and easy to understand.  She actually cares about the students. She's one of the best prof's I've had here at WPI.
Wobbe was great, one of the best professors I've had at WPI.  Class was clear, formatted, and challenging.  She was very helpful out of class and truly cares about her students
No Comments
Professor Wobbe's awesome.  She speaks English perfectly, which is better than many professors at this college, and she gets the job done.

I took regulation of gene expresion with Prof Wobbe. This was one of the ABSOLUTE best classes that I took at WPI.. also one of the most relevant when I went on to graduate school. She was also my MQP advisor.

I don't understand all of the negative reviews about her - she was very nice and accommodating as my lab instructor! Every time I had a question, she would always walked me through on how to get an answer every time I was stuck. Even one time when the TA took points off on a lab for something very minor, she gave me the points back! Was very nice!

This class was easy enough. Not hard to get 100s on labs, but this woman is not helpful. She spends the first half of the lab teaching unnecessarily and will call on you if you're not paying attention. Once you can actually start the lab she will walk around and tell you you're wrong, but will not help you. She doesn't answer questions well.

Would not recommend relying on her... she tends to be bossy and curt in emails, does not care for her students' wellbeing, and does a poor job of explaining the concepts in class. Her only purpose seems to be to harshly attack you for having not mastered what she is unwilling to help with anyways.

As a senior ready to graduate- she is easily the worst professor/lab instructor/ TA/ etc. (pretty much any position) Ive ever had at WPI. Having reflected on all my time here- all my classes and professors, this is one of the worst labs and experiences Ive ever had in a classroom setting.

Had as lab instructor. Can be very rude and ignore student questions. Often times gets impatient and tells you to read the background (even if you already did). Often times wastes time "introducing" lab material to students. Takes unnecessary points off at time. Seems like a nice woman out of the classroom, but definitely not someone to argue with.
Horrible instructor - very condescending and rude to her students during lab. Avoid at all costs.
Addresses a room full of engineering students as if she was talking to a group of fourth graders
She is extremely impatient. Often gets irritated if you ask for her help. Even if you ask for help, she may not provide any useful feedback. Avoid taking a lab with her at all costs.

Condescending and rude about "answering" questions, and makes it perfectly clear she wishes she was doing something else. Labs are easy enough, but you'll find yourself being insulted. Don't take if you can avoid her.

Unfortunately she'll probably be your lab instructor. Very quick to look over students' shoulders and say 'You're wrong!' without helping. Condescending. That said, the class is easy enough. Not difficult to get 100s on labs if you follow instructions. Unrelated, but I found it a bit strange that she drinks soda at 8 am.
Takes the whole class to explain what to do then complains that we have no time to do it.

DO NOT TAKE A LAB WITH JANE BOUCHARD!!!  She is very snide to the students.  She consistently implied that the students couldn't read.  If we have a question, all she does is say "Read the Background", even if we already have a few times.  She is extremely impatient, and starts yelling if you don't answer her guiding question quickly.
No Comments
She's alright.  Have her check each lab over before handing them in.
She was very nice and very helpful in all of the labs. I appreciated her clear-cut outlines of exactly what she wanted in our reports.
awesome, down to earth

VERY tough grader. Sometimes provides feedback that makes little sense as well as absolutely no sense. Prof needs to understand that students already have it hard enough at WPI, so making them work insanely hard to get a C/B is unnecessary. A lot of work given in class does not pertain to the actual project. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Very difficult to satisfy and believes that an A means above average work aka your project is exactly what he envisioned. He does push you to produce a good project but has a tendency to form very strong ideas about your project, interrupt questions, and not give clear answers. Do not expect more than a B.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor is very helpful one-on-one and will answer questions so dont be afraid to go ask a million questions! His feedback can be confusing but he usually has a point and going to see him can clarify it. He can seem like a harsh grader but going to ask for help will help you understand what he wants from an assignment.
Peet is a very hard grader, gives B's to all the projects, rarely gives out As. Many of the assignments he gives are pointless and get in the way of actual completion of the project.
While Peet grades very hard, the work he makes you do in ID2050 makes your life during IQP a million times better. Some stuff was unnecessary, but all in all I think it was worth the effort.

Very nice guy, but a VERY difficult grader.  got Bs all term but ended up with an A somehow...not sure how he determines grades at all.  I had more work this term than any other term so far and I was only taking one other class.
He knows all about HK. He is very patient and always want you to learn. He is the best advisor for IQP. definitely take it!
picked Namibia project site to help people. if i knew i was screwing my gpa by taking this prof, i would've gone -anywhere- else. impossible to satisfy. awful.

Impossible to satisfy. Grades above the B range are unachievable. Throws more than enough pointless work at you to severely inhibit ability to do actual project. You will NOT be happy in this class. Drop all but one other class while taking this one.
awful

Basically what happens is he gets you onto an IQP and then nomatter what you start writing for it, he doesn't like it. He seems to mean well but I couldn't help but feeling that a B was the best possible grade acheivable.  So with him its kick through an IQP as hard as you possibly can for B and any less the grades just get worse.

To continue.. this man's incompetence severely impacted my IQP experience. His mother obviously still dresses him(his pants end 3 inches above his shoes!), and his common sense is well below that of the average 1st grader. Gives far more work than necessary, actually hindered the ability to do the project. Doesn't give A's! Unable to communicate!

Wow, where do I start. First of all, the last review gave him a 4 and claimed he was an "overall nice guy." What appears to be genuine pleasantness, is in actuality,just plain incompetence. I do not know how someone so blatantly unqualified and mentally unfit can acquire said position except that WPI is a tech school! Check the next review 4 more.
He gave a ton of work and I'm not sure how he came up with his grades. But overall, he is a nice guy.

He is a terrible communicator and by that token is not qualified to work with students at project sites.  Has a remarkable tendency to grade arbitrarily without clear reason.  Socially inept, worthless comments, ruined my entire IQP experience.
The amount of useless work for this class was unbelievable. Actually kept us from doing proper preparation for IQP by filling and wasting all of our time. Needs to learn not to micromanage.

I did not learn a single thing from professor Brown's class but my guy was so damn funny. His lectures made no sense but he knew they didn't and joked about it often. All of the hw answers were online so while it was time consuming, it wasn't an impossible challenge. This was for ES 2503

Prof. Brown is by far the worst instructor I had at WPI in my undergraduate and graduate years. He graded my English much tougher than what I actually learned which was weird. I did learn a bit of useful information, but I wouldn't recommend him if you want to get the most out of a class while enjoying it. No enjoyment here at all, only pain.

Don't do an MQP with Brown unless you are in one of his projects already or already have a design you like. He's nice enough but constantly changes his mind, adds on to what you're doing, and doesn't have any helpful input. He doesn't like reading papers also and will nitpick tiny issues instead of helping with large problems.
the labs are good the lecture teacher bored me Me 1800
