Incomprehensible professor.  Digresses all the time, makes very little sense in general.  Would not take this class again and do not recommend it.

While the professor is very knowledgeable about machining and metrology, his lectures are BORING and mostly based off the WORST formatted powerpoints I have ever seen. Brown needs to take a class on how to make a PPT. I was barely able to do the HW based off of them by asking students from previous years.

Very clear and understandable when talking but teaches heavily off of his powerpoints which are incomprehensible. Gets off topic very easily and often. You will learn a lot of miscellaneous facts about surface metrology and manufacturing.

He's nice enough, but that's about it.  Lectures are not worth going to, and I always attend every lecture of every class.  He gets off topic easily and I still don't know what we were supposed to get out of the class.  I was told it would be an easy A, but I don't know anyone in my section got higher than a B.  Quite disappointing overall.

easy yet useless class, I learned nothing, all the tests and quizes (including the final were done online) but the class was really boring and no one acctually understood what we were doing, just follow the step by step instructions, really easy A but boring and useless
This class is a complete waste of time and money and does not measure up to WPI standards for grad level course.
great professor, nice guy
Do not EVER do MQP with Prof. Brown. He didn't ever make up his mind on a design and always wanted something else added, or something tweaked. I basically finished my design the last week of class.

Great class, most interesting ME class you will take. Anyone interested in skiing, racing or just wants a good, relatively easy level ME class you won't fall asleep in take it.  Brown is very helpful and easy to talk to.
This guy is awesome.  Although lectures can occasionally get boring, he generally keeps everyone's attention.  He knows what hes talking about and is friendly in and out of class.

easiest A i ever got, but wow talk about useless. we spent half the course watching videos of people falling down mountains on skis and learning of how MFEs won the civil war and ww2. like i said, easy A, but dont expect to learn anything
Professor Brown is an excellent professor. He tends to get off topic and can be vague on what he wants for assignments, but is a fairly easy grader. He is inspirational.
Had no organization for the class. Bad memories of GPS.

This Professor might be the worst organized Professor I have had. Make sure to always over explain whether the questions ask for it or not. Essay expectations are never said not even a rubric so be prepared to lose points with a ??? Comment attatched. Additionally, she is very opinionated unless you share hers, you are wrong. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Will call on ppl at random and ask them about the readings, so DO THE READINGS. Three quizzes, all easy if you've read the slides. Two papers, you can choose whether you write an analysis of the readings or do your own creative writing based on the material. Fair grader, good lecturer, encourages disagreement/different opinions. Great prof overall!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Readings feel long and tedious, but fair. She relies heavily on group discussions and group work when it comes to presentations. For papers and tests, all you really need to get down are the historical context, a few important plot points, and central themes and you'll be alright.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The class was reading intensive and participation was important. The tests were fair, aside from maybe one question that we didn't discuss in class and that was so obscure I didn't remember reading about it. She didn't have a rubric and clear prompts for her essays which made her expectations unclear. She also wasn't very available outside of class
Lot of reading, but assignments and assessments aren't too difficult. She's clearly very interested in the subject.

There was a lot of reading assigned from the textbook, but it wasn't necessary to actually pass the class. You have to learn what she likes because she is very opinionated but very nice. Class participation can really help your grade!

Professor Nikitina is a decent professor.  She is a pretty nice person, but can be far too opinionated.  When you answer a question she repeats back her opinion which is not what you just said at all.
Great class!
Good professor, very helpful if you ask for help. Definitely a little opinionated but still good thoughts.
She is good. She wants her students to get improved with her strict guidelines.  You just need to follow it.
I'm taking another class with writing so I dislike her more and more. No freedom in writing. What we should do is essay instead of paper.
Although I got A at last but I do not think encourage my friends to attend this course
i don't like the way she commands my paper.
No Comments
No Comments

Worst professor I've ever had. She was my IQP advisor and makes getting any work done impossibl; she is arrogant, hard to understand and is more concerned with language and writing style than the actual project. She had our group running around in circles trying to even start the project and was of no help.

Absolutely miserable experience. She constantly changed the focus of our projects (she actually gave two groups projects that had been done in previous years and did not realize until several weeks in). The comments on our proposal were not only unhelpful, but hindered our progress. I feel cheated out of a proper IQP experience because of her.

constantly nit-picks your work so much you dont have time to actually get anything done, then says you arent getting enough done.  Does not follow her own rules about ANYTHING, and basically expects to run your life. Feedback on work is arbitrary but you will be expected to follow it without question.  Changes the focus of ur project constantly!!!!
Wow.  What a mess and so confusing.  Avoid her like the plague.  She thinks she knows everything and wants to control everyone.
She left us for a week to go on vacation!  How is this possible?  If she truly cared, she would do her job!

I have to stick up for SVG. She's not the easiest professor at WPI, but we're here to learn. She makes sure that happens, and she does it well. She's always willing to help, very organized, and even friendly if *you* don't suck.

Avoid at all cost. She is and evil witch. No one I've ever met had anything but horrible stories. Don't ask here questions because she just will confuse you further. My partners and I spent about 1/2 our time trying to fix her stupid comments and then she askes why we didn't do anything!! I hate her!!!!!!!

If she cant get her way with someone, she'll screw everyone over just to prove a point and get back at them.  VG is the most ridiculous person I've ever had to work with.  She seems to hate girls too.  So, if you're a girl, watchout!
She criticizes everything and is very stubborn! Makes many mistakes herself, but does not allow us to make a single one. Cares more about her reputation than about the students
she's a ****, make sure you avoid her being your teacher or advisor for anything

This harpy gave us a 5pm curfew in Costa Rica!  She thinks she is your mother!  Can't get anything right.  Dont go to Puerto Rico or Costa Rica.  She dictates all of the rules. Knows very little about projects there and the language classes are awful.  I learned nothing.

This woman is a horrible human being and shouldnt be where she is in the "hierarchy" of global studies. There is a point between being stern and being a completely sadistic hater of students and their dreams. absolutely awful..

what doe sthis woman do with her time?  she criticizes students and make them cry all the time.  we call her the dictator!  what does that tell you?  she never has anything good to say and is power hungry.  she should retire!

Hands down, most synical person I know at WPI.  Goes out of her way to demonstrate her power over students, will not comprimise, narrow-minded, conceited, selfish.  WPI should no longer employ this devil woman.  I feel as if a portion of my tuition dollars have been wasted on this person.
No Comments

Basically him reading off power points and you listening and taking notes. Only graded on 3 tests then the final/midterm. Very boring class ,but make sure you hand in your test on time since those are the only things that he grades you on, other than class participation. Still in his course right now, but I would not recommend this class if needed.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I love Prof Everett! He is a nice guy and is very helpful. I also took HI 2921 with him. He assigned way too much reading but I never did any of it. Each class two people did a 5 min summery of the assigned reading so you get filled in and only have to do that once. The papers seam difficult (They are not) and he is a super easy grader.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: I've taken a bunch of his history classes and they all follow a similar, well defined structure, two papers and lots of assigned reading. His lectures can be a bit long, but he does try to make students think about history more deeply than just surface level. Very understanding about scheduling kind of stuff.
He is the most boring lecturer of all time. He assigned the final paper a week before it was due. That paper was worth 50% of the grade.

Comes off as sophisticated... until he grades your papers. Very subjective with his grading and lacks clarity with what he expects of a student when giving assignments. Lecture is lengthy and not very stimulating. Overall, not a bad guy, but not an objectively great professor, either.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Assignments are vague, and only after submitted some, one can get a feeling what exactly he wants. However, he isn't a tough grader and he wants everybody to pass.

Do not take the class unless you want to be an economics or global studies major. Also, don't take it if you want to make deans list, you could write the most sophisticated papers and if he disagrees with you in the slightest you'll get docked a letter grade. awful first term experience. don't take
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: The only reason to show up to class is how heavily weighted your participation grade is. One missed class is a 95/100 average. Extremely boring class. Never have to read the 40 pages he assigns because he summarizes everything in class. There will be a handful of kids in class that participate so you'll never have to if you don't want to.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: 95% of grade is subjectively graded writing assignments. also count how many times he says or references chicago
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: The guy gave a 'pop reading quiz,' when quizzes aren't in syllabus or grading rubric.. last reading quiz i had was in 7th grade. A few bright spots in his lectures, but an overall terribly structured class..
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I dont know if it was him or the topic but the class was dry and made you fall asleep. Gave us way to much reading. Sometimes this totaled over 100 pages per class. No one did the readings because no one was stimulated in the subject. Plus doing the readings does not correlate to a good grade. Hes a nice guy but doesnt understand WPI quite yet
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures were super boring and we spent 3 days talking about beavers in an enviro history class. All assignments were unclear, debates were a joke, grades in canvas were wrong so beware of that. I didn't touch the assigned books & got an A. Too much assigned reading but he tells you everything you need to know from the readings.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took this class for my minor/humanities and was expecting something interesting but Ive never had a more boring class at WPI. Professor is as boring as could be. Class structure doesnt make total sense, and the debates have little relevance to the class. Also, he does not know how to put grades properly on Canvas, so final grades were wrong.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Excellent professor actually interested in helping students learn. Lectures are always interesting and even though they are 2 hours long he makes them feel shorter. Super happy I got lucky and landed in his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had him during his first term at WPI. He took a syllabus from an old professor so it wasn't very accurate. Quizzes were easy as long as you showed up to class and listened to the lectures. Lots of readings for hw but you could just skim them and he would tell you everything you needed to know about them in class the next day.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professoor Wright is a pretty cool guy, and definately someone I'd recommend taking a calc class with. Very open to feedback and attentive to student needs. Calc 3 is probably the hardest in the calc sequence but he was always there when you needed him.

Had him A21, for my first class at WPI, it was a good experience. Came in somewhat familiar with the material from online AP Calc AB the previous year so I had the class mostly in hand to begin with. Regardless Duncan gets the job done. Lectures were boring, but hey, that's derivatives for you. Lectures were on the blackboard.

Great professor. Lectures were set up great and by far and away the best online class I have taken thus far. Gave a lot of material to study from that made tests very easy to deal with. Couldn't recommend his class more.
one time i saw duncan at dunkin

I took Calc 1 with Wright in A term, and I really enjoyed it. He did a good job, lectures were boring but its calculus and thats to be expected. He did exactly what youd expect a professor to do and gave timely feedback on exams. Overall, I would definitely take another calculus class with him.
Ive had him for 2 terms now. Great professor. Genuinely cares about his students
overall 10/10 human

The only thing I can describe the class as is "okay." There was nothing particularly good or bad about his class and he sufficiently taught basic calculus. Sometimes his lectures were vague and unclear (i.e. he would skip key steps within his explanations) but overall the class is your mediocre introductory course with a relatively light workload.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Wright Got the job done. I wouldn't say he was anything special though. He wasn't mean, he answered questions well, and taught the material in a mostly understandable fashion. His timing on tests and quizzes was rough, we would often learn a topic one day and be quizzed or tested on it the next. Overall, he was a decent teacher.

Wright was one of the best calculus teachers Ive had at WPI. The weekly quizzes were so helpful in knowing where I stand in the class. He also dropped the lowest score of the quizzes. Lectures are also engaging and he is always open to answering questions. Take calc with Wright if hes an option. Dont make the Wrong choice!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His lectures were good although he often made dumb mistakes that confused us a bit. The material wasn't too difficult and quizzes/exams contained material in line to what we had seen in class, no surprises. The quiz dates were a little random but since they weren't hard, there was no need to freak out. Webworks were the only hw with unlimited tries

Professor Wright was an absolute dream to have as a professor! He assigned the right amount of homework to help you understand the content without overworking you. The information was clear and the structure of the class was perfect! 11/10 Would take more classes with him!
My boy Duncan is a bro. Love this man, very understanding and amazing teacher! Best professor at WPI

Professor Wright is probably the best math teacher I have ever had. His lectures are engaging, the homework load is good enough for you to understand the concepts, and the class is structured very well. He has handouts which you follow along with in class and the sheets have all the information you could possibly need for exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a great professor who cares about the material and deliveres it in an easy to understand format. I would absolutely rate him highly due to his value of 'legit' problems. He will not give outrageous problems that are busy work and is very clear on what he wants you to know for the exam.

Xavi is a really good prof and this class helped me actually understand what calculus is. The written assignments are long and can be very hard but all of the professors have easily accessible office hours and will help you so much with the problems. Also if you ask Xavi will give extensions for pretty much any assignment which saved me some weeks.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Xavi is a great professor. Extremely fun in class and made an 8 am lecture manageable. He is great during office hours and overall I would take a class with him again. Definitely recommend!

Had him C22, overloaded with this class and ended up with a 63 due to stretching myself too thin. Xavi changed my grade from an NR to an I at the eleventh hour and let me retake the final in D term because of my participation/completed homework. I didn't even ask for a C. That alone gives him a 4-5 but he's also a great lecturer and a caring guy.

Professor Olive is a great professor! His teaching style made it really easy to learn what is normally a confusing subject. Homework was daily but fairly easy and made the topics clear. I would very much recommend Professor Olive to anyone who has to take linear algebra, and I think this was easily one of my favorite classes that I took at WPI.

I overloaded and took linear algebra with him this C term. I ended up NRing the class due to stretching myself thin, so it was by no means his fault. Hes a very nice guy who has good lectures. If I do end up taking this course again I will take it with him, as I know he is my best bet when it comes to linear algebra.

Prof. Olive was awesome. He did a good job implementing a flipped classroom approach in which we had to watch videos before class, but they weren't too long. Also he would have us work in groups during class, but if we were struggling on the problems he would explain them thoroughly before moving on. He also has a great sense of humor.
wonderful guy, really cares about his students. by far the best math teacher I've had.

Great professor. He truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He had good lectures and the homework and tests weren't as bad as teachers in previous terms for calc lll. Active learning's were nice too, as they keep students engaged and boosted our grades. If you can get Xavier, you won't be disappointed.
Very good professor, had him for Calc 3. Super smart guy and is very nice. Goes over homework problems during office hours and is very helpful. Genuinely wants students to succeed. Would recommend
Awesome person! lectures were honestly kind of fun (although they were only once a week because of covid) He was super helpful during office hours and explains things in a very good way.

Xavier is awesome! His explanations are clear and he's super helpful if you have any questions. He also wears a facemask with a math pun every day so that's fun. Test and quizzes weren't too bad as he let us have a cheatsheet. As long as you put effort in it should be a fairly easy A.

I really enjoy how he explains things and he is very nice. He responds quickly and has helpful office hours. I chose him because of his high ratings with his classes and I'm glad I did. He's knowledgeable and really wants his students to succeed.
Such a kind professor who truly cares about his students! He does a good job with explaining things and is approachable for questions.

Xavier was a fantastic professor and I wish I could have him again. His lectures were great and his tests were fair and he gave lots of partial credit. Very helpful in office hours and is generally a great guy. Online and written homework, as long as you do it, will help your grade a lot. Posts all of the notes online which is nice. Take his class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I love chavy, best professor at this school!!!
readings every night in the textbook. pop quizzes on the readings. three essays on different genres of literature

Professor Mott is extremely kind and motivated to teach. This term was especially tough for him because of familial reasons, but he really came through. The materials discussed were fascinating, but sometimes they can get boring. He is a hard grader for papers. I got a B for mine, but I didn't try too hard for a good essay. Be prepared for reading!

Great professor! However, class was boring at times and he was a little unclear when discussing terms that would be covered on the test. Overall great guy with great insights if you are willing to sit through the two hours!
Good professor. Class was mainly discussion with resonable papers.  Not an easy grader but definitely fair. Highly enjoyable class,  do the reading and add to discussions and you will do well.
This Professor is the man, he is one of the nicest people I have ever met, very professional, classes are engaging, quizes are straightforward, read your stuff you will get an A

Discussion-based classes. Does not impose his own interpretations on his students. Rather, he gets students to critically read and discuss the text. I had him for 2 courses and then as suff advisor. Overall, simply awesome prof.
great guy, but although material is interesting, sometimes he can put you to sleep, great advisor and would recomend entry level classes with him

Fantastic professor, great scholar, hugely knowledgable. Very soft spoken, but knows his stuff in and out. THE GUY for 19th century Am Lit. Easy going classes with a lot of discussion, easy to fudge if you didn't do the reading, and a reasonably easy grader on reading journals and papers.
Grades his papers a little strict but wonderfully nice guy and good professor!
This guy is so nice! His classes aren't that hard, with the exception of his quizzes/exams.
There are easier graders in the English dept., but Prof. Mott is the real deal (he knows what he's saying).  Lectures can sometimes get really boring.

This guy really knows his stuff, but he doesn't know how to get it across.  didn't learn anything from him.  Doesn't give you any idea of what he wants you to say on his tests.  was unwilling to answer my friend's questions on his essay.

Really nice guy. Runs a good, discussion-based class.  Accepts everyone's opinions and does not have the attitude that his views are the only correct ones.  The last quiz/final exam was really hard and almost unfair, though.  Moderately tough grader.
Hes a great professor, who really knows his stuff. He is always willing to hear what you have to say, and is not  such a hard grader. He is a nice person,and truly a scholar.
A very good professor, highly recommended, a true scholar.

Actually a quiz every other day actually. Actually the lectures themselves actually are actually poorly delivered. He seems to get nervous and lectures like that. Unfortunately this is AI and the work is constant and the projects aren't difficult but do require you to do most of the research on your own. Other classwork? Too bad.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Sometimes there are two or three things due the same day. There isn't a single day without AI work of any kind, including weekends. The professor isn't very helpful in lecture

The professor is VERY smart but this doesn't correlate to his ability to teach. You have reading assignments due before every lecture and quizzes every other. Lectures go off the rails and topics are rarely reinforced. Assignments aren't bad if you know how to search google/youtube for people who will teach you what you need to know. Good luck!

This class is bad in so many ways. Projects are given the day after a previous project is due. There are quizzes, assistments problems (the professor's proprietary system), and reading the same days that projects are due. It would be ok if the work was helpful, but it seems like a lot of it is just busy work. Also, the TA's write all the projects.

Wow.  Just wow.  There are too many bad things to say about this course with this prof to fit in this box.  Don't ever take it with him.  He doesn't teach.  He quizzes you on a chapter of reading per day (which he may cover AFTER the quiz if you're lucky).  It's ironic that his area of research is in learning, since no one learned anything from him

Wow, I've never seen anyone say the word "actually" that much. And once you notice it, there is no way you will be able to ever pay attention to his class again. The person who sat next to me would actually spend the entire class counting how many actuallys the Professor said, which I found hilarious.

Heffernan actually uses the word 'actually' actually way too many times, actually. He teaches the course as if we were using C instead of Java. He doesn't want students to use code which he doesn't understand-- ArrayList is right out until two weeks from the end of term, since it is black magic, doncha know?

This professor seems to know his stuff, and makes the class interesting.  The projects are very difficult, but I found that I learned a lot from them.  He does give way too much work though, and in our class he acknowledged this and kind of shrugged off our "weekly reading" assignments.  All in all he's kind of crazy, but a smart and nice guy.
Expects A LOT OF WORK. Difficult subject matter. His verbal pauses are incredibly irritating at times.

I'm pretty sure he just thinks about how long a project will take you and subtracts a week and gives you that long.  Also, he seems to be very unwilling to give partial credit on his test, which are, btw, rediculous.
Assigns tons of work, but always willing to help students.  Only take a class with him if you're _really_ interested in the subject matter - he'll make sure you learn it!
He assigns way too much reading - it all becomes a blur.  Also, the tools he forces students to use are underdeveloped and nearly ruin the class.
Unfortunately thinks he is too smart or something. So, if you don't know anything abt the subject, you may have a nice experience. If not, it may be terrible.
Very smart guy, very helpful
No Comments

The lectures are just him reading from Power Points that he didn't make. He is very disrespectful towards students with superiority complex and often times rambles and waste productive lecture time. Try to avoid taking the classes with him as the instructor.

It is hard to put into words just how far off this professor is from teachers of other classes. It seems that he does not have an understanding of the material and that his slides and exams are from other professors. Expect random points to be taken off of exams just for the sake of taking off points and expressing his opinion. Do not take 2019.
Does not use partial credit while grading gives 1hw and 1 quiz a week. 3 tests worth 70%
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: He might be the worst professor ever. His exam questions are not super hard but his exams are way too long in length to properly finish in the time allotted. His exams fail to assess his students on what they learned in class, but instead, they are just a race to finish. He also fails to directly answer questions from students in the class. Avoid

ECE2019 is the class preceding ECE2010 so it is expected that you have some general knowledge of the course material prior to learning. However, this professor is not a good teacher/reviewer in any sense.   He doesn't enunciate making it difficult to hear him, soft spoken, poor presentations. Keep ECE2010 notes if you want to pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I had previously seen and heard many bad reviews before taking his class, but he wasn't half as bad as what he seemed. He was a nice guy, but it felt awkward to ask him questions, as sometimes he would veer off topic. If you asked him a question, he would ask you questions back to try to direct you to the right answer. Understand HW & labs well.

He is the worst professor ever, he doesn't know how to teach. He treats the students without respect, he ignores whatever someone tells or asks him. He has no idea how to answer a question, when someone asks him about something he answers the following way "what do you think". He stands behind the podium for 50 minutes and just reads the slides.
He will talk in circles, wont listen to what you are asking for in asking hours, exams on just lectures with no homework or way to check if you know the material.

Mazumder is useless in class as he just reads off slides that aren't his. Don't ask him questions in class or lab because he'll answer something you didn't ask and ultimately just confuse you or slow you down more. No partial credit on test or labs. Avoid at all costs.  Only good thing is labs are easy & the reports are grading ridiculously easy.

He is an awful professor, the worst I've ever had. He has inconsistent grading, terrible tests, and does not understand how to answer questions. If it is humanly possible, do not take a class with him.

Terrible lecturer and teacher. He just reads out loud his powerpoint in his lectures. Little to no relevant exercises. Tests without formula sheets, so they are unnecessarily difficult. TAs are meh. Way too much homeworks, and TAs never correct them they only grade.

He has no clue how to teach. Copies everything from McNeil's lectures. Quizzes are extremely long and have nothing to do with what you learned. He never solves problems in class and just uses his terrible PowerPoints. Also get ready for everything to be in landscape orientation including lecture notes and tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Really helpful if you go see him in his office hours. He has an accent so sometimes you will get lost in class. However, he prints out all of his lecture and he posts them online as well. The exam can be really tedious but the sample exams that he provided on Canvas would be really helpful. Also he is an extremely fair grader.

This professor is awful. When you ask him a question he gives you an answer to a question you weren't even asking. When asked to take atleast one question off the exam so the whole class has more time he said no we have to do the easy questions first and then work on the harded ones (easy question was 4 points). TAs had no clue what was going on.

Prof. is a nice person if you ask him for help. Homework felt like eternity, tests were kinda tough (moderate if you do all the work), labs were fun. You don't have to suffer for a C but can't get a good grade if you don't read the textbook, have a good lab partner, and go to help sessions. Tutors were cool and very helpful.

Terrible. Argued with the class over ambiguous quiz questions. Lack of a textbook is really crippling as he doesn't do so well teaching the material. Each class was him reading off the slides (sometimes tracking the text with the mouse) and an occasional "Poll Everywhere" survey for a participation grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures were incredibly dry and not suited for an intro level class (often very specific and technical without background knowledge). Professor wrote unclear quiz questions, acknowledged that the entire class got these questions wrong, and then refused to compromise on grading.

Quiet, boring lecturer who can't explain things well. Nice guy who likes the field (genetics is a cool subject) but not great teacher. His exam/quiz questions can be weirdly worded but are generally fair, although he grades rather harshly. Homework questions are good and a huge part of the grade.

Spent a week teaching us the basic algebra of the Chi square and no time on how to use the associated table. Contradicts himself and is simultaneously hard of hearing and very quiet. Read the class outline for a general overview and then skim the textbook. Includes weirdly specific unnecessary information on tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: His test questions are very unclear. He expects answers to questions he doesn't ask on the exam and makes it very difficult to talk to him about it because of his lack of office hours and busy schedule. His lectures are confusing and he tends to get the information wrong so READ THE BOOK AND TAKE NOTES.

Nice person, but horrible lecturer. Very boring and confusing lectures, very hard to stay awake in class. Frequently makes mistakes and doesn't realize (or correct) it. Tests contain weird details and materials that are barely discussed in class. If you can take the class with another professor, avoid him please.

One of the worst professors at WPI. He does not make the class lecture stimulating or interesting at all. Just goes off with talking from figures. The notes he writes on the board are little to not and they are not coherent. Questions on tests do not clearly ask for what is needed. He does not specify at all and thus he takes off a lot of points.

Awful professor. Poor communicator. So unclear about what he expects, and the outlines he gives you to study for tests are sometimes not even a good representation. He is VERY poorly organized, never responds to emails at all, and on the off chance he does he responds a week later. All around very unprofessional, would not recommend at all.

Honestly, I love this guy. He is very very dry and reminds me of the professor from Ferris Bueler's Day Off, but he knows his stuff and is always willing to help. If you go to class every day he will give you exactly what you need to know for the tests. Pay attention and do the reading and you're SET.

Most BORING class ever! He knows the material, but he has no confidence in front of a class, and doesn't teach with any emotion. It turned into a clock-watcher class. Despite interesting material, it is presented in a boring manner. The Tests are pretty comprehensive, but he scales. He is a nice guy though, out of class :).
a very monotonous guy, but pretty nice, pay attention and you should do well

His lectures come straight from the outline he hands out for each chapter.  He uses class time to go over his outlines and explain them using picutes from the book and drawings on the board.  He gets kind of boring at times, and his tests are hard but he grades on a curve

Seems to be an all-around bio prof, with no obvious specialty. The result is that he seems to learn along with the students. His notes are clear, tests are straight forward with few suprises-he's not out to trick his students.
This guy is so boring that I DID drop the Biology major after having him for class.
Made my consider dropping my Bio major; he's THAT boring
Great guy who is really passionate about the material. Skull inductee too, so you know he's legit.
He is a wonderful instructor, I enjoyed seating in his class.
Extremely boring lectures, but the actual material isn't too difficult.

Fantastic teacher, great with communication.  He remind us constantly that he did not want us to rush through work or go through motions just to get meet deadlines or get a good grade, rather he wanted all of us to succeed and learn how to apply the material correctly.  One of the best educators I've ever had.  The work he assigns is time consuming
Excellent but tough class. Very helpful feedback and communication, but no grades until the very end. No textbook.
A good professor that always answer you questions clearly and patiently. His class has participation grade so do not skip it. You will learn a lot from him. Tests are straightforward.

One of Sullivan's defining qualities was how fair his tests were (excluding last exam)- if you understood on HW and in class, you'd do well. He frequently brought up outside connections to engineering which made the material seem a lot more relevant. This class took a little work to understand everything, but certainly was doable.
He is a baller but lectures are kinda boring.

Great professor.  Focuses on application instead of boring you with theory.  Lectures are helpful, homework isn't too bad. Exams can be difficult but if you understand the concepts you'll be fine.  For us he dropped one of the four exams and let you know before the final whether you already had an A or not, and thus whether you needed to take it.

Good professor, is you do the hw, pay attention in class and take good notes you should be able to get an A. This class is a little bit tricky so don't overlook the material. working in groups will help

Really nice guy, very approachable, and always willing to help out if you ask. Pretty clear lecturer, but didn't do many problems on the board until the end of the term, so it was tough to really understand the material in the beginning. I feel like I have a solid understanding of the concepts after taking Sullivan's class though

Great professor, very clear and reasonable.  Exams were straight forward, if you understood how to do the assigned problems they were an easy A.  Focused on real world applications instead of ridiculously complex problems we would never have to solve after graduation.  Best professor I have had yet.

The best professor WPI has to offer. He is willing to spend extra time helping you debug code and fully understand the material. Take any class he is teaching even if you are not interested in it because you will end up being interested in it.
Exams were open book open notes open laptop so they were very easy to pass! He was very helpful when we had questions in lab too. And he bought us pizza on the day of the final exam!
exams are hard, lectures are boring... bring a pillow...

Prof. Ahrens is an incredible professor, he often engages students during lectures, encourages working alongside peers(although isn't mandatory), and will answer questions effectively and efficiently at nearly all hours of the day.
He is absolutely awesome! The homework's were definitely tough but taught you a lot. Gives extra credit for turning things in at the due date. Funny and awesome professor
Very nice and knowledgeable. Very accessible. Fun.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: CS1101 was a little bit slow and boring at times, not really to any fault of Prof. Ahrens
It is very easy to pass this class. They really set you up for success, they reopened past assignments that were missing at the end of the term. Easy A.

One of the most caring professors I have ever had. Gives a TON of extra credit. Homeworks are long but if you break it down it's all manageable. Lectures were just review of what he had us watch for homework, but useful nonetheless because he would basically explain and give us the template of what we would need to do for the homework.
Extremely chill. Never hesitant to give extra credit. Lectures are helpful and interesting

Great professor would absolutely take again! He presents the subject through example code and all his notes were given inside comments in the code, so everything was in one place. He does a good job keeping whatever he's talking about interesting and uses his cats in his example code problems.

Super nice guy. Funny lectures. Very respectful. Homework itself can be annoying but literally just go to class, get the basic idea, and then go to office hours if you are stuck (there are some office hours with him, but a BUNCH in total).

Hes such a good professor, hes takes time to help the students, almost responds immediately if a student has any question. I cant use enough words to describe Profesor Ahrens, I highly highly recommend. He also jokes around when teaching lessons, all round great profesor and great guy.

The best intro to cs class ever. There were so many office hour opportunities, he responded quickly to emails, and was very helpful. The class was well-paced and easy to understand, and every part of this class was structured for the students to succeed. Overall a wonderful first term class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He's simply the best CS professor I've come across! Suuuuper helpful outside class. Gives great advice and is easily approachable.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: A great guy and caring professor who put a lot of thought into the syllabus for his first time teaching the class. Definately a more unique style, though the discussions were a bit flawed due to roles, but it was interesting talking through the material and being able to choose a final project topic based on ethics of tech
Really helpful professor. Definitely reccomend!

Ahrens is a nice guy who genuinely cares about students and puts in a lot of work behind the scenes to make class as beneficial of a learning environment as possible. I would definitely recommend, but don't expect to just waltz through this class without putting in any effort, because a lot of work goes into satisfying the thresholds.

This professor was very good. He was willing to help outside of class and gave accurate and helpful explanations of concepts. The base that I built through his teachings in this class have helped me in higher level classes.

The best part about this professor is that he is very willing to help outside of class time during office hours & appointments and responds to emails about homework questions almost immediately. He has good Reddit humor that he uses as analogies during lectures which make it engaging. Tests are wordy but he is willing to adjust the time limit.

I loved taking classes with Professor Hatch! She is funny and is very nice to students. She does expect you to be present and wants people to participate, but was not a challenging class and she made it very enjoyable. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a wonderful professor and she really cares about her students. Would recommend for any music course.
She was amazing. Always prepared for lecture and the way she taught made sense. She is very nice and kind. Very understanding and willing to give you a break. Great class!

If you don't know music at all, Prof. Hatch's class is nice a slow-paced for you. If you know any music, teach yourself the class using the internet and find a higher level one. Prof. Hatch will teach concisely but slowly, if you have a solid music foundation you'll be bored. Also, she's very much a "chorus teacher" kind of music teacher.

NOTE: this is for MU1100

Lectures are very boring, she teaches right from the course pack that she wrote. Activities aren't creative at all. No collaboration between peers. Not super respectful to students. Attendance is mandatory. Makes assignments due before 11pm, usually in the 1-3pm range. Would not recommend without a background in music.
Lectures weren't the most interesting, but the class is pretty easy if you do the work.
She was very helpful in teaching course material, it wasn't too difficult if you pay attention. If you complete your work and show up to class it's an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: TBH just average. Not so respectful to students

This women deserves all the praise given to her. As a student with disabilities, she was very helpful and accommodating to me. I cant express how grateful I am for that because most WPI professors just dont care about their students like she did. Im very happy I took this class and learned what I did. It was very fun and informative.
Hatch is awesome definitely take her class, she cares so much about her students and will help you do well if you just put in a little time. She is very strict on attendance though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Would take again

comment: She will happily answer any questions you have and wants you to get the best grade possible. She is also very nice and lively and tries to keep class interesting. One of my favorite professors.
Great teacher. Really cares about the content. Has a real love for music. Great singer.

Was not difficult material and could understand on first explanation from her, however she did not appreciate that students didn't think as fast as she did when answering questions. was a little rude when people said the wrong answer or took too long because they had their own process for looking at music.

If you know anything about music, this class will be a breeze. If you don't, Professor Hatch is perfectly willing to help you with it. She very much understands that not everyone has an affinity for music theory, and adjusts accordingly. Wonderful teacher, and one of the best classes I've taken at WPI so far.

One of my favorite teachers at WPI. Class is really easy. She gives three unexcused absences before she starts taking points off your grade. You use the textbook basically only for the 1st test, but she doesnt make you buy it. Tests were simple if you pay attention in class and use the information she puts on blackboard. I love Professor Hatch!
Her passion for music can be felt throughout the class. She gets you thinking about music in a different way. I enjoyed the class.

His comments make it very clear that he hasn't even reviewed your work, yet will focus on the tiniest minutia that he does happen to lay eyes on. After years of working with him, all he's left me wanting to do is ask him, "Have you ever produced anything in your entire life that wasn't ABSOLUTELY FLAWLESS?"

Professor Gennert definitely makes an effort to help students out, but can be a little unclear at times or make mistakes.  However, he is still a better professor than most and I would not hesitate to recommend him.
sometimes his examples are a bit unclear and he makes typos which are annoying when you are copying code, but noone cares more about students than Dr. Gennert.
It is rare that someone meets a professor who cares about students and is engaging. Prof. Gennert excels at both of these.
snob.
Imagine, for a moment, that Kermit the Frog went to MIT and became a computer science professor...
Funny guy, cares about students
lectures too much
Rain Man teaches Discrete Math. He is my hero!
Good if you pay attention in class.
A bit sketchy, but if pay attention in class rather than whining about him.
passed the class without going...need i say more?
Poor professor, was a day behind for teaching assigned homework.
No Comments
Absolutely disgusting how she treats her students, multiple reports filed and nothing is being done

Very hypocritical, ask you to have everything turn in on time following her instructions, but will post instructions 1-2 days after telling you she will post it and then not understanding why you could not follow the instructions with only two days to do it instead of 4/5.  Behind her computer is very mean but in person acts like different person.
This woman is on a different level.

She was very unprofessional and disrespectful, sometimes attacking our character and constantly being passive aggressive. Her expectations changed constantly and were often too high to meet. She'd often single out one person in a group to vilify.

Professor Dodson had unrealistic expectations for students and overloaded us with work to the point where we had little to no free time on IQP. The expectations of this course were constantly changing and never clear. She was also incredibly unprofessional and condescending to us throughout the experience. Definitly would not take again.

terrible, constantly changing expectations with little feedback. watched a teammate call me "mentally unstable" during a group meeting and did nothing. fought my group on project requirements at every turn. went behind our back to tell our sponsors she thought we weren't doing enough work.

1. I am sorry, she doesn't care what you think about her she is incapable of being wrong 2. Try your best to get ahead of writing and submit early, create clear agendas during PQP meetings and sponsor meetings because she will blab on and on and you can use the agendas to tell her to shut up. Good luck soldier, I'll see you on the other side.

Avoid Leslie Dodson at all costs! Her idea of your project is very specific, yet she changes her mind every week. Our project was very technical and due to limitations set by our sponsor we were penalized by our advisors. She believes she is always right is impossible to work with. Avoid.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Took a technical project and threw it around for several weeks, then decided it was a social science research project and blamed us for not having it completed to her liking. Unclear expectations, refuses to take responsibility, and pushes you in a million directions before blaming you on not finishing it when she won't even explain what it is.

Dodson is extremely difficult to work with as in her eyes she is always right and any other way is wrong. during IQP she forced our project to be focused of social issues when our project sponsor was looking for a design project. she repeatedly told us we were wrong without providing a reason why. I pray for anyone who has her as an iqp advisor :(

Misleads you into thinking you are doing a good job then will slam you with work and tell you, you are behind and haven't done anything although it was never mentioned to be done. Expects you to be an expert the first day. Also has no respect for your time and doesn't care that you have other classes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Dodson has unrealistic expectations and grandiose ideas. She acts as if she knows the answer to everything and pretends that she's always in control. She makes her ideas take over and no one is right except for her. She was annoying on IQP and working with her was terrible.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I wouldnt recommend taking a class shes involved in. She doesnt make much sense and her expectations are not always clear. She liked to grab the center of attention and can be occasionally rude or patronizing. She definitely likes to hear herself talk. I will steer away from any other classes with her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Leslie was the heart and soul of our IQP. She really tries hard to give your project a real direction, and if you discover major issues with the direction she gives you, she will work with you to come up with a solution that is feasible and effective. Also a very nice person to get to know. She cares a lot. Can be preachy at times but very lovable.

Had him A22 and his class is very easy. Weekly news discussion posts, easy and fun group projects, and short weekly assignments, most of which are needed for the IQP application, so take this class as an A term sophomore. The final assignment is you turning in most of these weekly assignments (with small corrections) and a reflection all together.

Very easy grader, always happy to help, and give out extensions for certain assignments. There is a good bit of reading to do, and group projects are heavy, but I enjoy having this professor overall. Attendance is a part of our grade, so make sure you show up. Class is as fun as you make it, so if you participate, and contribute during discussions.

I took him in D term 2017. Really straight forward and interesting class. The grading is as follows: Class attendance and in-class discussion: 10% Canvas discussion board participation: 15% Map quiz: 5% Film/newsreel paper: 10% 2 Exams 30% each. Be active in his class for easy participation credit and he grades fairly. Nice guy as well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: British Empire was an interesting subject and i'm glad I took the class. The structure of the class actually kept me awake during the two hour lectures. Definitely a lot of reading. Has discussion homework, which you receive full credit as long as you do them. Exams are all short answer but he posted the questions before hand.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Very interesting subject, though the professor was not great. Very soft spoken, frequent pauses and silences during lectures, often ran out of material. Did not give any feedback on my tests and paper although I did receive a good grade. Overall, professor isn't great but the class is interesting enough to make up for it.
He just wasn't good for MQP. he doesn't give clear feedback AT ALL. and doesn't seems to care much. I get anxious having to get ready for meetings with him.
Overall really good guy. INTL-1100 is discussion heavy, but as long as you read the chapter you'll do well. Easy grader. Remembers his students.

One of the top professors at WPI, period. Have had him for two classes so far and definately would take him again. If you go to class and participate it is an easy A. He is an awesome professor and just all around a great guy.

This guy is just awesome. Teaches all of the interesting classes on the British Empire and other Empire-related subjects. He's friendly and helpful, although he's sometimes kind of soft-spoken. Overall, he's not a hard grader, just make sure you listen to his lectures and participate in class discussions and you'll do fine.
Had Prof H. for HI3321 & Inquiry seminar. He's a great history teacher & I enjoyed both classes very much.

Never before has one man so completely missed the point of the IQP. A term, it was forcefully rammed into our skulls that we worked for our sponsor, it was as if we were employees. Come B term, the only thing that matters is the paper. Screw the project itself, all that matters is that you produce a paper that neatly fits his cookie-cutter vision.

Had this guy for IQP, goddamn he sucks. Makes inappropriate comments often (berating a team in front of everyone as a joke). Very inflexible with his schedule but will always ask you to change yours to accommodate him. Very smug person, makes you want to hit him. Will never admit if he's wrong.
A very cool dude.
This guy is good, he actually kept me awake during a two hour history class
Great lectures and really emphasizes good practices in Econometrics

A lot of reading outside class and group work, but he does his best to make the content interesting in class and understandable. He also posts a lot of resources to read/watch, which can be helpful in quizzes, but take a lot of time.
Assigns lots of work outside of class, but his lectures are well-informing. Grades easily on homework but tough on projects.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: He does not follow-up on changing "I" to an actual grade.
A nice person. His homework can help us a lot in the exam.
He is really nice but the homework is unreal.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Extremely weak professor, expects students to learn outside of class through textbooks and other resources whilst not lecturing on relevant topics in class. Tests are extremely irrelevant to learned material and are very confusing to decipher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He knows his content well and cares about his teaching. If you participate in his class, he will like you more and will be more likely to give you an A. He gives good feedback on assignments and is one of the more caring professors.

Economics is always going to have a ton of reading, so that can't come as a surprise. The class is twice a week for 2 hours and you need to go to get the basic information to pass the class. The curriculum was kind of confusing, there were a lot of elements like online quizzes after reading which had different dates; however, Somasse is a great man
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Somasse is a very good professor. I had him for my macroeconomics class last year as a freshman and while the class was a lot of work, I enjoyed learning the topics a lot and the professor was more than willing to go over concepts multiple times to help with understanding. Also he still says hi to me a year later so clearly he cares :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: He is an amazing professor, that cares a lot about his students learning the material. He will assign a lot of work but you will learn a lot in his class as well! Also, try to go to office hours if you can, it really helps.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Nice guy, terrible teacher

Great lecturer, very concise and organized and easy to understand. Helpful. Lots of homework, not too difficult but a lot of homework. Easy A if you know what you're doing in the class and get the concepts. He does give you some random homework-survey stuff to do that I didn't like, however very good professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is definitely one of the best professors at WPI. Very nice, very clear, talented lecturer. Had him for a class and a project and had a very good experience learning in both matters. PS: Be prepared for a lot of quizzes. Overall: Awesome professor.

Professor Somasse has a very clear-cut class. It is easy to understand what he expects of students. The class isn't a gimme, however, and you still have to work for the A. He's a cool guy, very personable.

This guy is one of the best teachers at WPI. Super knowledgable and always willing to help. He's worked in the industry for 40+ years so he knows how to show how what your learning applies to the field. Super clear and always around to help. Gives a lot of work but its helpful. Definitely recommend taking every class you can with him.

If you survive the workload, Norton is the best professor you will ever have. He is excited about the subject, and explains it well. His book is fantastic. The projects, while demanding, give a fantastic idea of what real engineering work is like. Take a class with Norton before you get your ME degree...it's worth the work.

Smart, practical man.  Basically, this is a class where he can sit back and critique your ideas like crazy.  The feild trip was pretty cool.  So much CAD work and writing, but it's such a cool class.  This is class is like a spectator sport for him.  He literally has 2 hours of reading and grading to do a week, if that.

Needs to stay at the 4xxx level; he was a disaster in a sophomore-level class. Very vague with the topics covered (all of which were beyond the level of the course) and assumed prior knowledge that was above and beyond the course level. Doubtlessly a good teacher, just not for sophs. Having some other reference apart from his own text would be nice

Best professor I've had at WPI. He is rather difficult and gives a lot of work, but still fair with his grading. He stimulates your interest like no other, and the book he uses (which he wrote) is the best textbook I've used. He was also a GREAT MQP advisor.
No Comments
Awesome professor. Always available to answer questions. Lots of work but worth it in the end.
While initially overwhelming amounts of course work are scheduled, they are designed in a fashion to optimize the student's potential with regards to succesfully accomplishing the subject material.
The best ME professor at WPI, bar none.  He gives you a lot of work, but if you go through the sequence with him, it becomes clear why he does.  ME4320 is an awesome class.
Class requires A LOT of work!  The teacher is very helpful though, and always available to ask question.  Excellent guy.  maye too much work though.
He is the man. My partner and I had great time working with him on the MQP. He knows so much and he is very helpful.
arrogant
Tough Class, good teacher but too much work
No Comments

Great lecturer and very informative but, he had a tendency to shift focus very quickly from one topic to another. Sometimes this was helpful for connecting one material to another, other times it turned into tangents. One of his favorite phrases was "who cares," and I'm not going to lie it was sometimes difficult to. Overall good course.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Pins is not a good lecturer. He teaches by mostly talking about biomedical applications. Which, if you like that, he is your guy, however he does not teach the theories and equations that well. Test are easy and homework is not that bad. He also likes to go on tangents and speak about random stuff, which is funny. Overall he's just ok
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: One of the worst professors I've had at WPI. Spent more than half his lectures complaining about things his MQP group does wrong, that is if he actually shows up on time. Didn't look up from his computer for the first half of our final presentation we spent 7 weeks working on. Don't bother trying to go to his office hours. He doesn't show up.
This class was extremely confusing and difficult. I really didn't like this class at all.

Pins was one of the best professors I have had within my major. His style may have been a little unconventional, as he used examples to illustrate concepts more than definitions, but he was always available for extra help, and between him and the TA (Benny Yuan is best TA), there was always someone to explain difficult concepts.

He wasn't helpful at all. His teaching style was very sporadic. He expected you to know everything when he didn't really teach at all. His homework was ridiculously long and hard. The homework was almost impossible to do because he didn't teach the material ahead of time. Not very approachable, made you feel stupid if you asked a question.

Horrible professor. Is not clear on what he wants on material, ridiculous grading, and favors particular students. Overall bad professor. Be carefully if your BME, because you might get stuck with him
Favors students and really could care less about those he doesn't.

Very clear on what he wants done. Prints out lectures for everyone everyday and their perfect to just add notes too. He gives alot of homework that takes time but it definitely prepares you for the test. The homeworks are harder than the tests, but the homeworks are also worth more than the tests so it all works out.

Amazing... Extremely helpful and approachable. Exams were amazing. Kind of long, but if you know the stuff then they are easy. Homeworks are really useful. And he does oddly resemble Egon... Either way I can't wait to take another class with him!!
This guy is cool, he made materials interesting. and he knows a lot about tissue engineering, a truely BioMedical Engineer, not like some other prof who knows more engineering than Bio
this man starred as Egon in both ghostbusters movies. it was his idea to have the ghostbusters cross the streams.
Fun class, learned a lot, great professor.  Gives out lecture notes so you don't have to worry about taking them. Makes class entertaining.
great teacher, hws really prepare for tests.  awesome style, and preperation.

He taught the part of this class about biomaterials. He talks and explains everything very well. The only bad part is that sometimes he can get off on tangents and then might not cover all the material. But he does like to help students, which is great!

Emphasizes group work in nearly every class. Attendance isn't technically mandatory as long as the lectures are watched in real time, but I highly suggest attending the lectures you will get so much more out of them. He only gives take home exams and is willing to double the time even if you don't have official accommodations.
Easiest physics teacher for 1121 by far. he is the GOAT. i put 1120 because there was no option for 1121.

Ungraded class, but taken for IPL. 3 
labs done, one of which we made up. Amazing man who clearly cares about every one of his students. Taught how to teach and effectively speak, and made for a very comforting environment to be in, allowing to meet outside of class whenever necessary. Truly and inspiration, and a professor I'd aspire to be like!

My first physics teacher at WPI, but definitely will be one of my best. Everything in this class from lectures, grading criteria, feedback, and overall material was well laid out and easy to follow. He is forgiving with deadlines and is always committed to helping you improve. I definitely would love to have him in future classes.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor was absolutely my favorite. One of the only reasons I have remaining sanity after this term. He teaches the class in such a wonderful and inspiring way, talking about the history of physics and making everyone feel so comfortable. He's easy on the grading, but in such a way that it helps you to learn even better. BEST TEACHER EVER.

I was nervous to take PH1120 because of how hard people had said it was but as a non-physics, non-math major I got way more out of this class than I thought I would. Prof Noviello made the content digestible and easy to understand. His expectations were forgiving and reasonable. Prof N is easily one of the best professors I've had at WPI.

Professor Noviello was the best professor I have ever had since I've gotten to WPI. I had him for PH1110 and switched into his PH1120 class because he was so great of a professor. No exams, just quizzes that you can retake to get whatever grade you want. I promise, if you take his class, you will not regret it. Most caring professor I know.

Noviello is one of my favorite professors at WPI, he genuinely cares about all of his students and is very fair with the way that he grades and structures the class. It is pretty easy to get an A if you put in the effort and participate in class. He also doesn't use any textbooks or class content that you need to pay to use, which is a plus.
Unbeliveably teacher, great guy, really loves his students. Show up everyday, you'll never regret it.

If you're looking for a physics professor to take at WPI, Professor Noviello should 100% be your top pick. I have never had a professor express as much care for both the education of his students and their well-being. He is always accessible outside of class whether you have course/post-college questions or need advice. Truly one of the greatest.
Professor TJ was the best physics teacher I have ever had.

I don't have Nov in college courses however I did in high school. He is genuinely the best educator I have ever met. He cares for his students and relates to them however he can. To this day I still reach out for recommendation letters and general career updates. He is also extremely understanding as long as you are honest.
Super great guy! is a high school teacher which shows he really cares about teaching and his students. Class was very fair and if you put the effort in you should get a good grade.

She was well-prepared for every class, group project was funny and helpful, most of the projects were hand-on and innovative. Very easy class if you do exactly what she told you to do, you can get a B+, she is looking for creative in every works so if you can put any ideas in the work, she'd love to give you full credits.
She is a good instructor.
This professor usually shows up late and leaves early and you get taught by the TA more often than not. A large portion of your grade is based off of quizzes taken every week.

Wow, one of the best teachers I've ever had. Soussan is insanely creative, knowledgeable and passionate about teaching. She will pull you into her gravitational waves and plan out your entire future. Professor Djamasbi is the standard to which all other teachers should aspire.

Its an easy course, but she doesn't put much effort into the class. She was late each day, and began each class with a textbook quiz (which had many incorrect ?s). Lectures usually digressed. She did a lot of flipped classroom and student presentation of material. Expect lots of presentations and a high stakes group projects. Grading was nit-picky.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Does not post assignment grades so you don't know how you're doing until you complete the course. Information received in lecture was rather elementary and she doesn't lecture often. Instead, she likes to just talk about anecdotes that aren't particularly educational or helpful to project. Felt like attendance was a waste of time.
tough grader, no commends on personal assignment. you won't know why you get low grades.

I don't know how much time she spent for each class, but all the classes she taught were not organized at all. She taught only two "related" lectures through the entire semester.  All other classes were talking craps. Three helpful classes were taught by guest speakers.

Easy class. Takes herself very seriously but her assignments and projects aren't particularly difficult. Spend way too much of the class pushing the crappy library resources on us (that were not at all helpful for the projects).
not bad at all. sometimes ideas are unclear and naive, but generally fine to have. Focuses heavily on concepts and theories.
Quite boring
Excellent and engaging teacher. She is fair with grades, but does not like slackers. Come to class prepared and you will enjoy the experience.
not enough knowledge and contribution for master level courses.
New teacher, getting used to the schools procedures.  Fair grader, small assignments.
Clearly not a subject matter expert in the field of ecommerce. Class was a extremely easy and generally a waste of time. Djamasbi may have competencies in other areas, but ecommerce is not her forte.

Had him A22 and it was alright. There are very few grades in his class. You have the 6 problem set tests (closed notes), the midterm exam (open notes), the group project, and one extra credit assignment. The group project is fun but also hard, and your video submission is your presentation on the last day. He's a good professor and a caring guy.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: very fun!

This class is an advanced class on linear and nonlinear programming in a business setting. The lecture is amazing. Clear grading. Quiz every week, but the quiz is not at the level that requires you to do any complicated computation or need you to memorize anything. The test is really intuitive. Final project at the research level.

This class is just amazing. However, it is more business focus. That being said, this doesn't mean that we will not go into math. It is just that he approaches the topic in a business manner than a pure mathematician. Class content is mainly on the different scenarios of linear programming. Great lecture. Clear grading.

Also had for OIE2081. Prof Trapp is very outgoing and approachable! More than willing to answer questions and talk about application of material. Class is straightforward if you pay attention and try. Have quizzes most classes and a cumulative term project. Would take his class again!
Awful

The class had daily online quizes, weekly in class quizes and a midterm/final. The in class quizes were closed note, but the online quizes and midterm/final were open note/book. You will need to study for midterm/final to get a good grade. You get a participation grade every day of the class. Raise your hand a few times every day and you are fine.
He is really nice
The absolute most boring class I have ever taken.

He's a very nice guy. He does seem to show interest in teaching you something since he requires you to participate. But I felt the concept itself was a little dry. But he does give homework problems from the book, which help on his quizzes and exams. Actually do the HW and show up for class and you'll do fine.

Professor Trapp is very fair but expects you to put in the time and effort. Bottom line: do the work and you'll be fine. He genuinely cares about his students and is more than willing to help out if you are having trouble.
This class is terrible there is an unrealistic amount of homework.  Avoid at all costs

Avoid this professor. He gives out unreasonable amounts of work and conducts very dry, boring lectures. Although I understand why it must be like this (it's a data course, cmon...), he isn't exactly very fair. Long hw assignment before thanksgiving break and due immediately after? A little unfair, in my opinion. Nice guy. Class is a pain, though.

Overall, Prfoessor Trapp is a really great guy - and it might have been because it was his first year here at WPI - but this class had an unreasonable amount of work and effort associated with it. ESPECIALLY, for a 2000 level class that's usually taught by a more reasonable professor. However, he is cooperative and a good listener. I would avoid.
I am amazed at the reviews Joe gets. I have only taken one class of his though. A great experience in clarity.
Good Professor.  Straight forward, and assignments are reasonable.

Ok, so you guys must have ran him out of MA, but he ended up here in AR. Will you take him back? Nobody down here likes that guy... including the faculty. He's extremely unhelpful and won't answer a question without throwing some BS at you in the process.
AVOID HIS CLASS. Wait to take Stress with Richman
Well...don't know if hard is even the word.  Guy rushes through an encyclopedia worth of stress analysis information.  Knows his stuff though.
makes stress stressful.  He could be considered the suckiest teacher who somehow found a computer to write that crappy photocopied book
No Comments
No Comments
This man is so full of himself he physically can't help students.  Under no circumstances take any classes with him.
This dude's crazy... stay away and take Richman
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

This is a case-based course and participation matters. However, he is very helpful when you ask him questions. Just prepare well and try to process the material and it's goin got be an easy A. He's a very generous grader and has open book exams so don't worry about memorizing things. Just show that you're dedicated and you're good to go.
Excellent class.
Great class. Really interesting and engaging. The discussions are great and really get you thinking about how products come to market.

Discussing the cases is interesting, but does not give nearly enough feedback or tell you what he wants included in the projects; occasionally forgets to send out reading material to the class he meant to discuss
Excellent professor. Organized. Dedicated. Knowledgeable. Fair. Reasonable. One of the best professor's I have ever had (and I am a graduate student -almost done with my MBA program).

He kept me interested in class when I wasn't particularly interested in marketing.  He keeps the class interaction lively and fun.  As far as being interested in students goes - he sent a sympathy card to my home when a family member passed away - a YEAR after I had taken his class.  He's a great guy!
very boring lecturer. didn't learn anything
only superficially interested in students, bad explainer, boring lecturer, dubious grader, unclear feedback. Nevertheless learned a bit.

The lectures tend to be kind of boring, many people fight not to fall asleep during them. The tests depend on the lecture, so you actually have to go to them if you want to do good. The attepts of interaction with the student were kind of lame
Hard grader
Good Professor, knows what he's talking about and teaches well.  Changed class structure to include more student interaction.  Tough grader.
He lectures for the whole class, every class. He's not bad, but the class is boring due to little student interaction.
Chickery is the man
boring class, powerpoint lecture, and the worst part is that exams depend on it

Amazing professor. Highly recommend his HUA Practicum, Writing for the Web, where you make a website in 7 weeks using technical writing concepts. Every week, you meet 1 on 1 with him to discuss the current state of the project. His feedback is very valuable, and he helped me grow as a technical writer.
Will take a lot of points off if you submit something late. Doesn't care unless something really extreme happened to you.

Professor has very clear grading criteria, rubrics, and examples, which is good for grading assignments. He has VERY strict policies about rounding grades, for example, so don't expect to be able to get him to change anything mentioned in the syllabus. He is caring for his students, but won't make exceptions to the policies like I said. Good though

While business writing may be a little mundane of a class, he did a great job teaching all the little things no one notices that really do matter. He lectures all about the format of different communications, and the class concepts are really useful for future internships and jobs. If you do the work, you'll do fine in the class

Kevin is very to-the-point, almost mind-numbingly so, however he makes the class intentions clear. If you give him what he asks for then you get an easy A. This is a class you need to be involved in and make adequate time for. One big project, a group recommendation report needs cohesive team work and writing skills. Overall really good class!

Professor Lewis is a fantastic writing professor. He is knowledgeable about English language, grammar, and rhetoric. Class consists of lectures which can be monotonous for some. There are workshops where you work through the elements of your paper as a class, and it's an interesting process. He is respectful, kind, and an overall great professor.
easy A but boring class

Lectures everyday. He can get monotone, but the content is useful and helps directly with the assignments he gives. He grades fairly and gives good feedback on assignments. If you read the assignment and follow it, you can't fail, and you'd be hard pressed not to get an A. Grades attendence and participation.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy
