comment: I really liked this class. We did writing workshops in class and it really helped with starting the writing process. The workload wasn't too heavy and he's a pretty fair, almost easy, grader too.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lewis is the best. Happy to have taken 2 consecutive classes with him. He gives great feedback and teaches a lot of important writing tools. You can't miss any of his classes because you are graded heavily on attendance and participation. Good class discussions and projects that give opportunities for valuable feedback. He is always available.
Makes writing very objective. Seriously best professor I've had. Grades fairly.

Good professor; we did a lot of technical writing which was unexpected but not difficult. Didn't learn too much after taking AP English in high school so it was a fairly easy class. Lewis will willingly help you out if you ask.

Great professor! He has a very technical perspective when it comes to writing, which can be interesting, and he puts a lot of effort into making the course understandable. If you do all the homework you'll get a good grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Kevin Lewis is the goat. His class was awesome. Yes, you have to do some reading and writing but it is not difficult and literally he goes over everything you need to do. It is one class actually worth taking.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Song is a friendly guy; he tries to learn names in lectures. He is also very flexible, and may let you retake quizzes that you miss. However, I found his lectures to be a bit confusing. He would usually overcomplicate things or use metaphors that were not fitting for the problem. However, the material is easy to understand on your own.

Q is a homie but he does make a lot of analogies to robots (the matrix is the robot and the col vectors are his "moving skills") that took us a while to figure out, so don't skip class. Really well-organized course structure and SUPER nice guy- go to his office hrs! Pop quizzes in the discussion sections, but TA's teach you how to do the problems.

I must say that Prof. Song is a friendly guy; but within five minutes of a lecture, your attention span will vanish with his confusing "metaphors" regarding Spider-Man and "killing robots". WebWork assignments often covered material beyond what was taught in class. Easy exams, discussion quizzes, and an irrelevant, confusing group project.

A nice guy. The lectures are pretty boring, but he will go over homework and answers questions well during his office hours. There are about 1-3 webworks due every week with ~5-10 problems each with unlimited attempts for all problems so the homework is a really great grade booster. we had 3 pop quizzes throughout the term during discussions
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: I struggled to stay awake in Prof. Song's class. His lectures were confusing and hard to follow. He could never explain his work when asked questions in class and often seem unprepared for class.

Explanations did not make sense, and analogies only made you more confused. Was extremely quiet, not engaging, very easy to lose focus/attention. Only gave us one practice final/midterm and questions did not relate to actual test. No concept was expalined in mathmatical terms or related to real life.

Nice guy, but his lectures are extremely hard to follow and make no sense. Talks a lot about "Spider Man" and "his skill moves" as an analogy and went off tangent with it for 2 whole lecture periods. In minutes, he lost everyone's attention span. Before exams, I learned everything from his practice exam solutions. Investigate better alternatives.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Only a 15-20 problem webwork assignment and a short quiz each week along with two exams. The lectures could have had more examples of problems taking on concepts and could have had better explanations, but any voids in learning during lectures were clarified during discussion. Is very willing to help outside of class during office hours. Nice guy.

His lectures were somewhat boring, but Professor Song always put in a lot of effort to help his students. However, his lectures were definitely more confusing than the actual material. The discussions were mandatory as they almost always had pop quizzes during them, but the tests closely resembled practice exams.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He was a great professor. He was a little intimidating in the beginning because he told us there would be a pop quiz sometime soon on the first day, but it turned out he was bluffing. He is sometimes hard to follow, but he goes through problems slowly and thoroughly. He is also very helpful outside of class and is more than happy to help you.

His lectures were insanely boring and he often made mistakes and got confused when someone pointed it out. He did not give a lot of example problems in lecture. He did not give a lot of homework, and his exams were not too bad and closely resembled practice exams.
Just show up for the discussions, the discussions are quizzes but they will teach you how to do the problem before they give you the problem.

Great professor. His lectures may seem unorganized at times but he is able to get the concepts across well. Very nice guy and approachable if help is needed. Not much homework, but quizzes almost every week.

Took linear alg. with Prof. Song, he was very nice and always willing to go back and answer questions or clarify points in his lectures. Office hours were useful and he was more than happy to give clear answers for almost anything.

Lados' class is made up of slides, slides, and more slides. It was genuinely mind numbing to be there, especially since her explanations were pretty poor. I ended up learning more by myself doing the homework than in what she taught during class. Homeworks are about 17 questions once a week that takes surprisingly long to complete. Barely got an A.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Lados goes through about 60 slides per class covering an entire topic relating to material science. There is no way to learn from the lectures... by the time you've read the title of the slide she is on to the next one. Very very very poor teaching style... unfortunately this is how I end my college career. Don't make the same mistake.

Very unorganized and not clear on criteria. Nobody in the class knew what was happening because she spends 15 minutes going over something easy then glosses over the hard stuff. We ended up just learning from the text.

Lados is pretty clear in what she looks for understanding on in tests. She is a fair grader. If many people didnt get an answer right she usually is lenient on the answers given. Lots of partial credit given. Don't need to study too much to pass.

she knows the material, and is good at explaining it. tests are easy because she tells u almost all the question prior to exam. Do go to class, because you will find you are lost once you miss one class.

Notes are clear and she is very helpful. Always want to help you. Respect her students. Tests are not hard if you pay attention in class, and study her notes, fair game. Not very good at English, but hey, I am ESL too, so I am not here to complain. By the way, she is HOT!
she was kind of helpful. but more importantly she is smokin hot

This professor, although seemingly a nice woman, is extremely useless.  Does nto prepare you for tests, is a sleeper in class, PPT's poorly organized, etc.  Avoid if all possible.  Smart, but does not communicate that to the class or teach well AT ALL.
waste of time
nice person, but awful teacher.  Lectures consisted of her reading directly off of powerpoint slides that she copied word for word from the textbook.
Really Bad, Lots of Homework, Speaks to the board the entire class and doesn't turn around, tries to move through the material in order to get through the book, but doesn't teach it well.
Cant understand her and cant read her hand writing
Great prof!  Actually teaches the materials.  The only problem is she uses the examples in the book for class so if you don't get it then you might have trouble but she is always willing to help.

Extremely helpful! All lectures are put on my wpi in pdf format. Emails class everyday to inform us of new updates/assignments on my wpi. Homework solutions are always posted. She runs a very organized class where you actually learn. Also, very important, she keeps you awake.

I took the graduate side of Design and Optimization of Thermal Systems with Prof Yagoobi. Overall, across the class we struggled a bit with his poor hand writing and incoherent slides (classic), but enjoyed his engaging presentation style and knowledge of real world applications. The project was tough and exams were medium hard.

Hardest and most stressful class I have ever taken. 2 exams and 1 large/nearly impossible project determine your final grade. After taking this course I am genuinely considering switching my concentration because I do not want to have him again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Engaging lecturer, a good teacher, but not a good grader. His tests are very hard, requiring memorization of properties, application of material, and lucky guesswork. Read carefully, argue if you're unfairly docked points. Ask questions in class for lots of extra credit. The project was really hard and he kept changing it because we couldn't do it.

He is an awesome instructor with strong background that helps you understand the course.  He does not take you by hand but provides you with enough and reliable information to find your way and enjoy the course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Yagoobi knows and understands to a great extent the concepts of thermal systems. He will definitely teach you how to understand everything from constants to big systems. You will learn how to derive equations for large systems just to optimize them to increase efficiency and reduce cost. Expect to be called out during lecture.

This was a fundamental course at the graduate level and Professor Yagoobi made sure that the students fully understood the material and could not only work the problems but also had an intuition for them. Tough material and tough to earn a good grade but at the end of the course you KNOW heat transfer and are much better with fluid dynamics!

This is my second course with Professor Yagoobi "Design and Optimization of Thermal Systems." He is a great teacher who not only teaches the material but also provides a lot of very useful career hints. This course was not difficult although the other course I had him for was among the most difficult I have ever taken.

Prof. Yagoobi doesn't teach many classes, but when the Department Head steps out of his office, you're in for a treat. His lectures are extremely direct, efficient, and personal. He doesn't lecture off of last years slides - he rewrites everything and makes sure you are following along. Jamal Yagoobi learns everyone's name.  My favorite WPI prof.

Professor Yagoobi is very bright and is there to help you.  Unfortunately his class lacks any sort of clear structure and there is really no textbook to follow which leaves you with his lectures as the only source for learning the material.  The class got difficult very fast and the final was brutally challenging.
Really good professor always helped when I asked, Tough tests but if you listened in class you would understand perfectly.

He really hypes the class beforehand. There is no solid structure to the class. Very simple concepts are explained as complicated. I am sure there are other way to engage the class rather than pick on students and lough at them.

Calls out students in class, be prepared to know what you are talking about. Class got very difficult very quick. Seemed to make it more difficult than necessary. Class project was not well defined. Exams were difficult and professor was not at school during the week of the midterm. Not the worst prof but not the best either
Warning:  He picks on students to challenge them.  Makes the class interesting.  He is very bright and helpful if you approach him.

Picks on anyone and everyone in class. Tests were more difficult than  they needed to be. Claims tests are difficult to challenge students but they just make you second guess what you know. Wouldn't recommend him but if you have no choice there are worse.

Prof. Rissmiller was definitely one of the worst professors I've had. He had the worst monotone, and even though it was a level 1000 class, he had really high expectations for us. I found it very difficult to stay awake during his lectures. Unless if you are really interested in government, don't take this class.
Lectures aren't very varied. Quiet. Didn't seem to like me too much. Seemed to expect a lot of prior knowledge, especially for a 1000 level class. Lots of reading and writing. Boring lectures.

this class by FAR the most boring class I've ever taken. super easy if you can manage to stay awake in class. teacher seems lost, he just wings it every day and does not make this class interesting at all. half the class is on their laptops not paying attention. I wish I had dropped this class
complete jerk, didn't give any feedback on any of our papers, seemingly assigned grades at random
I think he's an average (I don't think he liked me too much, because I knew a lot of the material before hand).
concepts of historical analysis   and Middle project (so long ago  whatsit called...)

Had him for Intro to IR. Very biased in his views, a monotone Ben Stein style voice, and generally condescending to the students. Going to his class was a natural sedative, if you have insomnia, you should make a point to go. Other than that, listen to him rant, write his papers, you get an A.

You DO NOT have to have his same opinion to do well. A very busy man, but if you make a point to see him, he'll help you out with whatever you need. To get an A you need to go to class. He doesn't post his notes online. Also, lots of reading, but he makes sure it's not boring stuff.
what a mess

Good teacher. He made people read current events, hence why the last reviews were negative. As far as wanting people to write papers a certain way, they have to be good papers. Anyone who didn't pass was just too lazy. I would gladly have another class with this teacher.
Kind of a garbage class.  I don't really think I learned from it with this professor.  He spends the whole class rambling and often his classes are off schedule.
Very biased, if you write the way he likes it you'll get an A.  Class ok, but could be better planed. No clear objective.
No Comments
he wasnt the best teacher but we really didnt do much in that class. most of the time was spent discussin politics and the election. overall it is a great blow off class

If you're into going over 120 slides per class, than this is the class for you. Goes over material very quickly, and expects you to remember everything from the class before. Be prepared to write a group essay. Doesn't allow laptops, but then requires you to have one for the tests. The tests are super hard and don't match up with the study guides.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor John is a nice woman. However, her class was not informative and not useful. She incessantly references gender and racial discrimination which gets a bit old. Also, all quizzes were online and based on the honor system. This puts the honest students at a serious disadvantage.

Knows the material well. However, when goes off topic, she talks about things she has no clue about like they are a fact. Bases a lot of her semi-related information on Buzzfeed articles, and never bothers to validate them.  Also, one of her quiz questions was "What is my name". Two of the options were Melissa-Sue John and Melissa Sue-John. WHAT.

Professor John is one of the most inspiring people I've met, her office hour are useful to go, you feel refreshed after you go. She brings interesting topic to the class from our reality and she is very confident about what she is saying because they are all true but people doesn't like truthiness. Hopefully she will not change her way of teachin

She explains everything well but after two hours of a 150 slide PowerPoint every class you just can't take it anymore.  In her exams she included info from her slides and the book. So be ready to read if you want a consistent 80 or above on all three exams. She is also unclear what is on the exam or what she wants in assignments.

Developmental Psychology. Very friendly and entertaining during discussions. She brings plenty of interesting facts to class each day. You have to ask for help if you need it, but she gives you the information required to pass exams. Overall, would recommend for a professor.

The course is really interesting and Professor John seems really passionate about what she is teaching. She tries to please her students and make the course as interactive as possible. Test can be hard because they cover 5 or so chapters but if you are interested in psych the class is definitely worth it
She was pleasant in class but there was a lot of reading and her lectures were just her showing powerpoints of what we had already read. It was very repetitive and boring

She values participation and tries to make her course interesting. Show up. Talk. She's not a generalist, but its a general course. Her tests and pop quizzes are made last-minute and it shows, but she'll drop a question if no one got it right. You never know what will be on the test, and her instructions for the project were REALLY unclear.

Not so easy class for me, but worth it,the book review assignment has changed my life, however despite my effort put into writing the review, she deducted point just because I didn't write under the page limit.

TA does almost all the grading. Easy class. 3 papers, 3 tests, and participation counts. Extra credit was available. Pay attention and do the textbook reading every now and then and you'll get an A. She LOVES class participation. Make sure written assignments follow the prompt and meet all criteria.
Treated students with disrespect. Failed to grade exams before the next exam. Gave me a B despite being .03% short of an A. One of the worst professors I've ever had.
Pretty chill class in my opinion, compared to the other psych classes offered, we did not have to write many papers
She is simply the worst teacher I have ever had to deal with

Weinstock is a nice guy like others have said but his lectures are more on the duller side, which can make it harder to stay engaged with the class, especially a more difficult one like machine org. The quizzes also were more difficult at times
Seems like a nice person but not very knowledgeable about the content he's teaching.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I don't think I learned anything in this class. There was homework once a week that was graded by the TAs and had clear guidelines, so it was easy. The textbook was used for studying for the tests, but they were all online and open note.

His lectures were boring, and there were a few long, tedious (but kinda fun) homework assignments. Quizzes were tough, but they were open notes, so it wasn't too bad. However, he doesn't really seem like he wants to be there during lectures, and his apathetic attitude doesn't invigorate my interest in the subject matter at all.

Prof Weinstock reads from a Powerpoint slideshow so you'll probably not really have to go to class. He assigned us a homework assignment a week, the TAs and SAs are extremely helpful to solve it so be sure to attend their office hours and MASH. There were 3 exams in the term. Overall a nice professor but not great at teaching the content.

One of the best professors I have had to honor to learn from. The classes in the first half of the term consisted of prompting students with ethical dilemmas, and opening up the floor for intellectual debate. The other half was dedicated to final projects, where students picked a topic and presented it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Watching grass grow is probably more exciting than this guy's lectures.

Seems like a great person, but lectures are almost unbearable boring. He doesn't seem interested in the class. 9 am lecture and everyone is basically asleep including him. He is very unspecific about everything he says, including helping or answering questions. Basically just says look at the book.. which you will NEED to do a lot. READ READ READ
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Overall a really great class! Professor Weinstock really respected all students' opinions and was very clear about his grading rubrics. Student presentations definitely made the course more interesting. Participation is a must!

Professor Weinstock is easily one of my favorite professors at WPI . He is very clear how he grades things and as long as you follow it, you will get a 100. Participation is key and he takes note of who participates. If you participate a lot he will like you more and will give you a better grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Weinstock is a very nice person, but definitely not the most interesting lecturer. His lectures are quite dull and he doesn't explain the material in the best way.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Weinstock has a lot of knowledge in the subject of Assembly, and definitely stimulated my interest in the subject. Although his lectures were sometimes dull, the difficult but rewarding homework assignments made the class an enjoyable experience. Four "labs" make up the bulk of the work, and are very different from any other CS assignment

He was a nice guy but a terrible teacher. Coming from someone who had very little background in programming I had a difficult time with his class. He often just read off power points instead of actually teaching so I really didn't learn much and had other people teach me instead. Homework assignments were way to difficult for a Non-Majors course.

Weinstock is not the best public speaker but makes his lectures interesting regardless; also, the presentations from the other students tend to be interesting. Attendance and participation matter a LOT. For presentations and essays he is a very easy grader so long as you do the work on time and follow the rubrics. Definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Avoid any class with Rundensteiner she does not know how to teach clearly and concisely. You will have to take time out of your day to go over anything she teaches because she does not do a good job. Avoid at all costs!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: The professor cares a lot about making the class useful to her students, and not overworking her students. She gives extensions on projects, and takes student feedback seriously. Her lectures are good, but kind of abstract. Could use some more specific examples in class, but projects are useful.

Lectures are poor. Be prepared to spend hours of classes on getting a random project teammate assigned, returning quizzes, and useless student research presentations. When it finally comes back to lectures, they're nothing but histories and overviews. Waste of money. Go other online resources if u really want to learn. Agree prof didn't put effort.

Big Cong if u r on her Big Data mngmt course. You'd gonna get twice as much homework as other classes, and she will teach u nothing except the PPT contents. Be prepared to learn a new coding language in two weeks and write projects with somebody you dont know at all. RANDOM QUIZ and MID/FINAL.
very rude and likes to yell at students
Endless homework and projects... Lectures are neither clear or helpful.   Professor is fine but doesn't seem to put much effort in this course.
Good professor, knows her material and does a good job communicating it.  If you are interested in databases, I would encourage you to take her course.
lecture is boring...

Very easy (got an A with little effort), but not an oustanding professor. She very often made mistakes during lectures and on assignments, even on exams. Powerpoints were boring. Project was graded stupidly (deliverables which took 5 minutes to prepare were worth the same amount of points as the final deliverable, which took closer to 30 hours)

A gifted professor both as an instructor and as researcher.  She genuinely cares about her students and their learning and making sure that what is learned is valuable to them. I would encourage any students with an interest in the subject matter to take her class.
Teacher: Nice, she wants to help Course: Evil. HW did not prepare us for tests and the projects could haveused much better documentation.
She is Amazing !!!
No Comments
She is a good professor.  The Database class she taught was pretty good and useful in the professional world.
Can't write neatly. Tries too hard to teach but doesn't stick. Friendly and kinda approachable. HW is very manageable. Get ready to teach yourself everything.

Handwriting difficult to read and sometimes didn't explain topics thoroughly. Beware that if your coming from calc AB there are a couple topics that you haven't learned but really need for the class that he just assumes you've covered.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Good professor if you have a solid understanding of math. Lectures help with homework and homework prepares you for tests. Publishes review sheets on canvas which are ver similar to the test/and or prepare you for the exams. Great teacher despite the negative reviews.

Based on other reviews he gets a bad wrap. Prof. Zhang is very accessible during office hours they are not used. He did not attend high school in the states so he is still figuring out class structures and expectations. The material is not tricky and he tries to engage the class whenever possible. He takes feedback seriously and is a good guy.

Lectures were interesting. When you are able to follow along with the concept he does a good job, but when you are lost be prepared to teach yourself as he doesn't explain certain concepts that well. Midterm and final only, partial credit. Homework is worth 30% of grade and doesn't take that long each week.Decent class overall, harder than expected
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Only a midterm and final as well as one homework once a week due on Fridays. Be ready to teach yourself a little bit but other than that the class is pretty chill. There are also weekly canvas quizzes that are on Mondays that are not bad.
good

Quiz once a week on Canvas (not done in class), have a couple of days to do it, with (20-30 time limit). One written hw assignment a week. Gave a midterm and final. Def go to MASH and Math tutoring center for help. Not great at explaining.

Incapable of explaining material in lecture. Difficult to understand explanations of work in lecture. Difficult to read handwriting. office hours are useless. Do not take this professor if you're attempting to learn the material.

Avoid taking Zhang's class. He doesn't explain concepts well at all and does not go over the "why" for each problem. Has coughing fits every other sentence (lasted the entire term.) Blamed students for a failing midterm average rather than trying to change his teaching style. Would not recommend.
Very respectful professor. He really wants to help the students out. He sets clear goals for the class and encourages students to ask questions.
Worst Professor ever! Not professional. No respect for students. Shame on WPI to have a faculty like him.
He makes the class too easy so the final is very difficult
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Prof Krueger will make you work for your grade and will bring out your best work as painful as it may be sometimes. If he makes a correction somewhere he expects it to carry out through your paper. If you work hard, show improvement and understand the critiques you'll get an A.

From my experience he was a very caring guy that seemed fundamentally kind. Since the class was based around class discussion and debates, participation was graded. You also have to work for a great homework grade. If writing summaries based on social theory is your thing then take this class. He was also somewhat unorganized in terms of planning.

Professor that cares about environmental studies and teaching. Unfortunately he isn't good at making the class exciting, so there is low participation because no one want to be there. Would still say its ok if you are just looking to complete SS requirement as it is so easy, but take something else if you want to be interested.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He doesn't even try to teach. He didn't assign a single grade in his course. Don't trust or depend on him--he is extremely irresponsible. To mirror other ratings, I also found him rude and condescending.

Having to deal with Krueger really made me regret taking a class with him. Despite following his directions, he verbally assaulted me, accusing me of disrespecting him and being irresponsible, which deeply hurt my feelings. Adding insult to injury, he then flunked me, forcing me to drop the class.

Working with Krueger was possibly the worst experience of my life. From the word "GO" he was dead set against me. The man was rude condescending and repeatedly insulting. Doing work with him seriously made me reconsider going to WPI.
He was useless and terrible at getting papers back on time. He is a nice guy out of class, but I suggest staying away from any of his projects.

Professor Krueger will make you work to get your grade.  He really pulls the best work out of you and will never be completely satisfied with whatever you are handing in.  Sometimes he is unclear, but you'll learn to understand what he is trying to say after time.
Worst educational experience I have ever had, avoid.

Krueger's an interesting guy. He's friendly, but I was lucky enough to not get on his bad side. Funny, intelligent, but one of the more difficult IQP advisors. He's close buddies with Tuler. Ask about the zucchini story. It's messed up.
Dr. Krueger is an excellent teacher, but don't take this class if you don't want to work hard.  What ever they are paying him, it's not enough.
Weird guy - a jerk for half the term, then really nice for the second half... brought cookies on the last day of class. =D
not a nice person
Don't take a course with this man unless absolutely necessary.

His lectures were long and monotonous, hard to get through. Homeworks were alright, expect to spend lots of time combing through his early 2000's style lecture notes which is a PDF version of a Powerpoint with text bubbles covering other text bubbles rendering most of them unreadable.
old, boring, The professor doesn't give out a syllabusor hands out a one-paragraph syllabus that is just the course description from the Web.

This guy is absolutely terrible! H didn't smile once during the entire semester. When you pass in the hw., he looks at the clock and if someone is 1 minute late, he doesn't accept it! Takes points off for not doing the hw, instead of just not giving any. The man has no personality, he is terrible teacher and has black outs all the time!
He was so bad! low info! bad attitude, rude person

I've taken 5 online classes with Dr. Navabi. Homework is due about every other week and takes 6-12 hours. Lectures average out to about 3 hours of video per week but is very easy to listen to at 2.0x speed. Lectures are good but homework is usually not well defined and it takes 4-5 days to get questions answered.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The professor posts homework a week before but does not cover the material needed to complete it until the day it is due. Furthermore, going into the labs, many of the computers did not have the proper software to perform the lab. Additionally much of the lab was not covered in previous lectures. Lastly, it takes nearly a week to post lecture note.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Designs RTL circuits in real time to help you understand the design process. I followed the process and did well in the class. I feel like I can move on to more complex designs because of this class. He does move slow, but that is good when you are trying to understand the overall design and timing of multi-component circuits. No babysitting here.

Ended up watching the lectures at 2.0x speed for the first half of the class, second half I just ignored the lectures and breezed through the power-points to see if there was anything important. Homeworks/tests were project based and pretty much just graded on completion. I spend maybe 5 hours/week on the course total and got 100%.

The Professor doesn't care about his students.  I have taken a lot of his classes some are really easy some are really hard.  Typically he will giver a simple example and then for homework you will have an insanely complex one.  Don't expect to get any help from him either.

If you are into Electronic Design and Want an A-Grade look no further.  Super easy Assignments and Tests, which are in a very methodical manner.  The videos are long as previous comments mention but in my case I didn't have to watch the whole videos just parts that matter.  Topics are in a meticulous order and you gets lots of examples

Videos FAR too long.  Did not answer hard questions & did not explain the tools, just said, "it's something you have to learn by yourself".  He took WEEKS to grade the homework.  His idea of a "live" session had us typing something into the blackboard "discussion" area and he responded in there!  HORRIBLE!!!  STAY FAR AWAY!!!

Videos far too long.  Droned on about the obvious points and nothing about the details of the tools necessary to get the work done.  HOURS spent trying to figure out the tools.  RUN - don't walk from ANY CLASS with him.  You will easily put in 30-40 hours a week for his class and have no life left.  Too bad too, this class COULD HAVE BEEN great.

Homer's passion for linear algebra is infectious, he makes you want to learn.  He goes pretty fast through dense material, however, and there will often reach a point mid lecture where you're just lost for the rest of the lecture.  He will bend over backwards to help you outside of class.  Homer is a wonderful guy, and an ok teacher.

The professor chose to take off 2-3 weeks for vacation and attending conferences. This is a significant portion of a 7-week term to be without office hours. This professor has no interest in helping students learn and rewrites the theorems from the book on the chalkboard and calls it lecture. I enjoyed every calc class except MA 1024 with Walker.

There is a quiz every conference...and thats the hardest part of the class. But they are on the material covered that week (and that day in class).  He is not as hard as everyone says he is.  He is quiet and extremely nice.  Just go to class, take notes, and take the quizzes and you should be fine.  He is easy to understand and approachable.

Professor Walker is a really nice guy, however, it was difficult for me to say that I knew exactly where I was in the class at any given time. The professor missed an entire week of class (Midterms week of all weeks, also) and can get quite lost in his own material/lectures. Shy away.

If he could speak a little louder and just kept his wits about in lecture he'd be an awesome professor. He's extremely smart and exams tend to be on the 'harder' side. But he's a nice, understanding fellow so you can always reason things out with him.

Hard to get an A in his class, but easy to learn. He likes to think about a problem theoretically before he attacks it, so you as a student can understand where to take a problem from the beginning. Go to his office hours if you're having difficulty.
Very random professor. Did not tie anything together at all in the class. The tests were horrible. But on the plus side, he is a nice guy...

A very nice man. Loves his math a lot. Although he definitely understands what he's talking about, others sometimes don't ;) Generally, a great math etacher if you are not particularly interested in the subject. But exams may be hard then ;P
He's the head of the department, but teaches like he doesn't know what he's talking about.  He drew a wavy line on the board and stared at for a few minutes saying  Where to begin?
No Comments
absentminded professor... doesn't require homework...  good thing...
No Comments
i hope you get a good conference instructor....

Great teacher, great class. Can be boring at times but he really means the best. If you do the work and actually try you'll get an A. He was my advisor for half of a year and couldn't be more helpful. Very approachable, don't be afraid to talk to him about anything! He's also very knowledgable about the school's history. Highly recommend!

Entire class is read a chapter, email him some discussion questions, and then discuss with a 5 person group and 2 papers/1 presentation at the end. Very repetitive with 4 movies as breaks. Not very specific with guidelines for assignments but a B is fairly easy to achieve if you just do the work. Probably be a good class for one who enjoys subject.

The class is all discussions, no tests, and 5 papers. Overall really easy. Not what you would expect for a history of technology class but not bad. He cancels class ALL the time, on average once a week, so thats nice. He's a good guy.

This guys is great! I have had him for four years at Anna Maria College (as an adjunct) and he is amazing. Alot of reading, but just read and do all of the papers and you will be fine. He is truly a diamond in the ruff and has a very nice wife also!

Prof Rawson is very helpful if you go to him when you have any ques or concerns. If you have a strong opinion about the material in the course, you should go to his office and tell him. He likes when students are very involved and he remembers students who come to his office for topic discussions. Go to his office if u r unsure of the assignment

I just completed HI 2315 (Post-1920 America) with Professor Rawson. He has been a great teacher with a very nice lecture style. Our classes met twice a week for two hours each class. The lectures were long sometimes, but he always made it seem like a great in-depth conversation about what was happening and what society was doing throughout the era.

Overall he's a good professor, and he definitely knows his stuff. But, if you are looking for an easy course to fulfill your humanities requirement, I wouldn't take one of his. We had to write a couple of 500 words essays a week and papers a couple times. The final was pretty harsh too, but its worth it if you are actually interested.

Great guy! Had him for a class and my suff. Easy to talk with, grades fairly, and gives very interesting lectures. Very easy going and friendly. There is a lot of reading, but his discussions and assignments are based directly on the assignments. He's engaging and wants to see students do well.
So far the best history course that I've taken.  Class was very interesing if you like history and not very difficult.  I'll be trying to get more courses with him.
Professor Rawson was awesome, he was very easy to aproach and he was very nice in class. He did get sick alot though, so he had a tendancy to cancle a couple classes; I will take his classes again!
Cool guy.  If you like History, you will love this class.  He does assign a lot of reading however you can just skim and you'll be fine.
Make arguements in the online discussion board. Don't be obnoxious but don't follow along with what everyone else is saying. He really does read what people say and LOVES it when you speak up.

Great professor, he knows his stuff. Has you write lots of papers but if you can put words on a paper and back them up you're golden. If you don't like writing papers don't take this class. Also makes you participate in online discussions...easy to do, no in class tests except geography quiz

Going back and rating all my old professors from WPI. Weathers was not a highlight. From what I remember, she asked for a lot out of her students but didn't ever put in effort for us. Tough grader, only class I ever did badly in. If you can avoid this class, you should.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This is one of the harder classes i've ever taken. The material covered isn't that complex, its just that the tests are so specific and so random that it is hard to study for them. Overall the structure for grading isn't that bad (homework and lab are basically 100% if you do them), the tests give you a lot of stress.

I had Pam for an independent study. She was very helpful and pushed me to do better than I thought I could. She is a great professor who will push you to great heights if you let her. She has high expectations but if you exceed them she will praise and respect you.

Took plant diversity.  She's a really nice person (I almost failed, but she passed me anyway), but I find that her tests are sooo much harder than she makes them out to be and they are so difficult.  On the first test, the average was a 53 in a bio class!  Likes to focus on life cycles.

She wears plant-related clothes every day for the whole year. The class is nice but she thinks she goes easy on you with the exams and she doesn't. You have to keep your brain awake no matter how easy you Think it is going to be.
Very Good teacher and nice lady. Go to class everyday, take good notes and you'll do great. I love her personality

She is pretty nice, however, she makes the exams pretty difficult. And you do have to do decently on the exams to get a good grade; contrary to popular belief. She usually wears plant-related shirts to class; it's pretty funny

She makes the class easy to pass and easy to do well in. Her tests are kind hard, especially if you don't know what to expect, but you don't have to do too well on the tests to do well and the conf in the green house are really fun.

I was interested in this class before I took it.  However, taking it sucked out all interest.  She graded on her own scale, and did not actually teach what she graded on, or grade according to the course outline.  She also feigned to like you, but seemed to go out of her way to make your life difficult.
No Comments

If you go to class and take the notes you should be fine. I found that i usually remembered what she said in class easily. Exams are a little hard. Don't underestimate! but she grades on a curve. Really nice personality, a little boring at times though...
Very nice, and clear. Exams are a bit tough, but grades on a curve. Great Teacher :)
Very good teacher, explain everything clearly. She sets a high standards on her take-home exams, so be careful on that one.

The only reason I did poorly in this course is because Nicholas Bertozzi took 5% off from my final grade every single time I was late for class. If I was late by even 5 minutes, he would publicly shame me in front of the class and take 5% off from my final grade. I would have had an easy A otherwise. Bertozzi is extremely slow and hard to follow.

Bertozzi expects you to come into the class knowing how to program (the only prerequisite listed is 1001). While he has extensive understanding of physics, he does not know programming and cannot answer questions unrelated to code he copies from previous years. Horrible organization of assignments, boring lectures, barely teaches necessary concepts
Great guy, not a good professor, I hope he enjoys his retirement
Assumes you know everything
doesnt teach

Bertozzi is intelligent but not a good teacher. Lectures are not engaging. He assumes the whole class already knows a concept if one or two students know. Homework is near impossible without getting help from TAs. Same with the main project.

His lectures are awful. The only way to pass the class is to rely heavily on the TAs and/or have previous knowledge. It says there are no prerequisites, but he expects everyone to already have significant knowledge on statics, ECE, and CS. Not a bad person and does know the stuff, but he is not good at teaching at all.

Not Fantastic at teaching. Much of this class is "Go Figure It Out." If effort put in is visible, he is a lenient grader. TA's that are grading are much harsher. Great Guy that knows the mechanical side of the class in and out. Just be ready to spend hours in the lab with great SA's and classmates working on labs, homework, and studying.

The course was difficult, but I don't believe at the fault of Professor Bertozzi. He explains things well, but suffers to keep the class engaged. He does care about the students, but it's hit or miss whether he's feeling lenient that day. A lot of the class is just learning as you go. Quizzes/Exams ridiculously easy compared to lab and project.

Nice guy, but... Lectures skip over essential content. Teaching style is confusing. Doesn't explain/help with term project. Lots of work. Too many hours spent in lab. Unclear grading criteria, if you don't read his mind then you're wrong. High expectations. Doesn't code. Was a horrible term.

This professor seems like a nice guy.... however, he was one of the worst professors I have ever had. He belittled my group when we assumed things and when we did not understand his grading criteria. He provided no overall help when problems arose in our project and gave us extra days to complete it (but with a late penalty which we did not do).
Lectures are vague, confusing, roundabout, unclear, etc. Had to re-teach myself a majority of the things we were supposed to have learned in class when instead he was seemingly talking about nothing.
Really good lecturer, enjoys his job. not a bad choice for a teacher.
Presented material in a very concise manner. Well prepared.  Very helpful when needed.  Good personality.

Seems like a nice guy but not a very good teacher.  Lectures only had the basics and you are left clueless on the homework.  The practice tests are always way easier than the real tests.  I don't plan on taking another class with this teacher.

Lectures were writing proofs on the board almost all the time, never really showed practical ways to solve a problem or give an understanding of how the circuits worked.  Taking DiffEqs at the same time is no help, the timing is so that you're tested on stuff 1 week before you learn it in DiffEqs

This guy seemed like a good prof. I only went to the first 2 weeks of this class because this material was so easy. HW was a little tricky but his tests were very fair. Do the HW, read the book and do the sample tests and you will be fine.

Great Professor - did an excellent job. His exams are the fairest ece exams I took. Do your homework, go to class and you'll do just fine. He is very good when if comes to hw help during office hours etc. Overall, a great course and a great prof.
Unclear professor who had trouble explaining things and doing problems correctly. Not the worst professor you'll ever have, but definitely not the best.
Not sure when other kids had him, but when I had him I felt that the tests were a very fair measure of the material covered in class and on the homeworks. I'd say he's a good professor.

I didn't even use his lectures for the tests, they were useless.  He would switch around/add voltage and current sources on tests which he never went over in class. Nice guy, gave extra help but poor lectures + harsh grading = failing atleast 40% of class
Not a very good teacher.  Poor lectures that had almos no bearing on homework problems.  Ended up teaching most of the material to myself.  TA's provided absolute minimum for extra help.

I'm fairly sure that I would have been able to pull off a B if I had been given the tests and told and told the reading, but it is very hard to go between the book's way and the teacher's way. Unfortunately, I picked the teacher's way. Let it snow.

Worthless.  Basically copies stuff from the papers on his desk to the board while waving his hands.  Occasionally looks at class and smiles.  Body language is entertaining, but not worth the inconsistency between lecture material and graded work.

He is very confusing. The tests are the homeworks but with something added in that wasn't on the homework. He doesn't pay attention that much to the class. People have to yell in order to ask a question. This is diff eqs EE style (not good).
Hard class so early on. Lots of math. He did a pretty good job with it. I wasn't too into it and glad I (barely) passed.
I loved Professor Falco. You could tell he loved what he was teaching and it translated to him teaching with enthusiasm and passion. 1010, would take class again.

too fast talking, too much homework, too fast!!!! newer take from him!!! if you are not a musician, never take !!!! if you know music very well again, you should not take it. Even if you do everything he asks, you get B. For A, you must do much much better that he expects !!!

Played favorites -- if you were not in his jazz band, you got treated as though you were worthless and stupid.  He used powerpoints a lot, went through them too quickly, and then you wouldn't have access to them outside of class.  Hard to learn from and he seemed very full of himself.
Knows Jazz theory INSIDE AND OUT. Alot to learn but not impossible. He has a sick mustache. Watch his myWPI videos over and over and over and over

Jazz Theory: He's a cool cat, but if you don't already know a lot about music, aka took Music Theory, then you're stuck!! Expects a lot of pre-knowledge. However, if you go to him for help, he'll not hestitate. Take Music Theory FIRST!
Awsome guy, realy knows his stuffl.
very hip cat.  seriously, a good professor, is very fun to listen to, and knows his jazz.  thats all i can really say.
Definitely out there. Good guy, but has a tendancy to be very absent minded and can rub you the wrong way.
rich is the man
Really cool jazzer, man.
java = happy jazzer
one cool cat that makes a great mentor
Excellent teacher.
Fred doesn't deserve such a low score on this site. He might be on the difficult side, but he is also wicked intelligent, but doesn't boast about it, like some other faculty at the school.

This is a wonderful topic.  Looft has the experience and commitment necessary to profess the topic of Systems Engineering.  You will work hard but it is graduate school - what did you expect.  The class covers real-world topics and exercises that will be applicable for every engineer throughout their career.  I highly recommend this class/professor

Makes you work so hard, just to bring you down. No matter what you do you are gonna get a C.  He expects that you know what he wants without him telling you. He doesnt realize that he needs to ADVISE. Very good guy just not a good advisor.

He overworks you just to end up with a C in the end. I don't think anything would have impressed him enough, seriously. Unless you want a challenge beyond compare and a bad grade even after a ton of work, seek another advisor for MQP.
Tries hard, but just doesn't get that non-majors need some extra explanations.  Take the intro class with Makarov.

This class was really difficult for me, but Looft tried soooo hard to help people.  He offered tons of extra credit and extra help sessions.  He's always willing to help although he rushes sometimes on the board.  He is very knowledgeable and eager to share applications of it.  ECE 3601 with him is hard and a lot of work, but I'm glad I took it.
No Comments

and a HUNDRED THUMBS DOWN. I think the word 'bozo' was created, just to describe him and his attitude - not only as a professor but also as the ECE department head...add to the fact we have Hakim as the associate dept head, no surprises that nothing ever gets done in our dept.....

Again, ignore the whiners who couldn't hack it. No one leaves a school because of one professor. Looft is informative and very helpful, but only if YOU PUT THE EFFORT IN. He is very unsympathetic to lazy people who want everything spoon fed to them. He has also been a GREAT department head thus far. Two thumbs up.
I wish we had a more capable dept. head

This "professor" can't seem to keep focused long enough to explain what he is teaching. He jumps around too much and confuses the student. I found it necessary to consult the teaching assistant just to understand where he was going with the lectures each day.
The lecture I took with him was so painful I dropped out of WPI because I couldn't bear the thought of having to deal with people who teach like that again.
This guy is the man...great advisor and great person.

It was a pleasure having Seth for both ID2050 and IQP. His feedback at times may be pretty extensive and critical. However, he always pointed our group in a better direction. Was very personal, made IQP a much more enjoyable experience. Always willing to help (whether or not it was related to the project). One of the best advisors you can get!
Seth is my favorite professor at WPI. He is so friendly and goofy and he is very understanding and helpful with every difficulty faced during IQP.
Contradicts himself every other day. Skims students work when grading. Very Unprofessional

Seth was amazing as our IQP professor. He was very helpful and understanding when it came to our papers. Sometimes his comments were confusing but he was always willing to explain what they meant. He was caring and made sure that we weren't too stressed.

Worst professor I have had at WPI. The feedback he gives often contradicts previous feedback he has given, or it makes no sense, is addressed if he bothered to continue reading the submitted work, or is totally irrelevant to the purpose of the assignment. Words cannot describe how terrible and clueless of a professor he is. Avoid at all costs.

Definitely a terrible professor. He will constantly change what you write to whatever he sees fit, and shifts the entire purpose of your project a different way because he "doesn't think that what we are doing." He will always over complicate things and want you to look at the bigger picture when what you're doing can be super simple. Terrible.

By far the worst professor I have ever had. Each class is taught by a "guest lecturer" while IF he has shown up for that class he either grades papers or takes a nap. The course is useless as it has no direction and is just based off of who he convinced to teach that day.  Tons of pointless papers as well which he puts no thought into grading.
tulbag.  the man does not know what he is talking about, he is hypocritical and downright rude

gives unclear assignments, only criticizes, and he definitely doesnt read anything you send him including emails.  he has no idea how to teach, esp. not in an engineering environment. useless professor avoid if poss.

Tuler isn't a bad guy, but man can he appear clueless at times. He can not say "no." 2 months in Bangkok and I never heard him say "no, that's a bad idea," not once. One week he told us we were doing fine, then the next week when Krueger returned, completely different story. I agree with the other rating: he forgets we're engineering students.

I don't think he understands that he is teaching engineers. Wastes a lot of your time with class and busy work. His comments on assignments make it clear that he barely even reads them.  This class is a nearly criminal waste of time, but due to some wonderful policy, we have to take it. Good luck.
Tends to run around in circles alot with the material.  Contradicts advisors and gives too much busy work.  Reinvents the phrase "beating the dead horse" when it comes to project proposals.
Nice guy, wants to help, but insanely boring. If you can get him to stop lecturing, he is actually somewhat helpful

I appreciated how the class was organized so that we would learn about all fields of BME. It's not a hard class and it's entertaining to be in, but class attendance is strongly encouraged, as is class participation.

Prof. Reidinger is really nice!! She cares about the health of her students and is super approachable and funny if going to office hours is something that intimidates you. Her classes are pretty easy and not that involved, but her lectures/activities usually are very interesting and engaging. Only drawback is that assignments don't align w/lecture.

HW doesn't align w/ class most times. Slack used for 1/2 our grades & communication w/ prof. Assigned CAD hw, most students were freshman w/ no experience in CAD- did not help us. very sweet person but passive aggressive in class. Had other prof speak about research almost every day. Only learned about research & never graded 3 of my assignments
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Awesome and caring professor who cared about everyone's mental health and made sure to have her students reflect and improve throughout the class. Although the class was mostly BME professors and speakers presenting topics, her lectures were also interesting and engaging.

Prof Zoe was fair. Counted top 6 of the 7 HWs and the rest of the grade was easy participation. Learned a lot of broad information on BME which was good as a non major. Felt like much of the HW was busy work- mostly designed for first year students who lack an understanding on how to research or write. Dont take the class if it doesnt interest you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: She is an amazing person and engaging professor but there were some flaws in her class. The grading on all of the progress reports and homework were a little bit too strict, and most of the homework felt like busy work. Even with this she was more than willing to help students with their projects and was very caring.
Specific course was all guest lectures and prof was very respectful to the type of course it was. Really fun and easy.

Prof Reidinger didn't teach most of this class, but had guest lecturers come in to explain their research. Some were interesting but others did not understand that it was a freshman level course and we don't know a lot about the field. The weekly homework was a pain to do, but quizzes were really easy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Reidinger herself is fantastic. I loved her energy and enthusiasm, and she has some pretty funny stories to share as well. However, BME 1001 was a force at times, and I found some of the homework to not have that much of a purpose (though it was an easy A). I would definitely take Reidinger for other courses, though.
She is so much fun!

Super enthusiastic professor, a pleasure to listen to. Brings in guest lecturers and some are more interesting than others. Most of course grade comes from weekly homework assignments. No final test, and only four quizzes (drop lowest). Requires short writing response at the end of each class for participation credit (so you have to show up).
She's the bomb diggity. Best professor I've ever had. Class is pretty easy. Just do your homework and do well on quizzes and you'll be golden.

Zoe was a great teacher! She just got her PhD 2-3 years ago, so she can connect to the student body well. Very clear class expectations, very organized, and fair. She doesn't mind answering questions, and always keeps the class up-to-date on quizzes, homework, etc. Participation and attendance matters. She drops the lowest hw and quiz. Great prof.!
One of the best professors I have ever had. Very friendly and willing to help, easy to talk to. Made the material easy to understand and was one of the best lab courses as a result.

Lou has been the highlight of my term. He is extremely helpful and cares so much for students. The lab class I took with him was really fun and you learn a lot about how to work in a bio lab. Can't recommend him enough.

Easily one of the best professors at the school. He is super understanding of the work-load students have and is always flexible with assignments. On top of that, I have learned more skills from his lab than any other. Highly recommend taking a lab with this guy.
Amazing teacher, very kind and thoughtful of the students. Easy and understandable quizzes and reports.

Lou is a geninuenly caring and kind-hearted Professor and had a great class. Made sure to engage students on the topics, and the weekly quizzes were relatively fair and easy to complete. Always was open to feedback and made sure hear students' concerns, both about the class and academics in general, would definately recommend taking his class
Professor Lou is an absolute G. He is very reasonable with grading and very flexible with assignments and workload. Highly recommend taking a lab with him. Super nice guy as well.

Truly sweet Professor who wants you to know your stuff. If you don't know what's happening, he's super approachable and will explain one concept five different ways to help you learn. (Take the three hour lab in the afternoon though)

Lou was the best professor I've had at WPI so far. He is incredibly respectful and really cares about his students. He was always happy to help if you ever were confused or had any questions. If you ever have the chance to take a class with him do it for sure you won't regret it!

Lou is the best professor I've had at WPI so far. He really cares about students and if you're ever confused by anything he tries his best to explain everything very carefully. Super understanding and makes every lab fun and interesting.

He is one of the nicest, most understanding professors I've had at WPI. He makes an effort to get use to learn the material and the lab procedures without excess stress, which is rare. Reports were reasonable but I suggest following his rubrics very carefully because even if you mean to say something, a lack of clarity leads to point deductions.

Lou is by far my favorite professor. He truly cares for the students, wants to get to know them, and help them as much as he can inside and outside of lab. Always open to questions. The lab reports are a bit of a time commitment, but not overly difficult.
BEST EVER. Take his class and you will know what I mean. If full score is 5, he deserves 10. Really care about students and hope us to ask more question, super helpful and knowlegable.

Lou is the absolute best! He's super nice, funny, and an all-around great guy. One of the best professors I've had at WPI -  he's always willing to go the extra mile and genuinely loves biology. He's also understanding when experiments go awry and explains material well which is very important in biology labs.
Prof. Roberts is a great guy. Polite, pleasant, and super helpful. I highly recommend taking a course with him.

hated this guy when i was a student. he was new and didn't teach the couse the way i was expecting. all architechture and almost no programming. i'm teaching myself now and actually learned more than i realized. thanks to prof k.

didnt like him at first - terrible book and his first term at WPI. now that i am a software eng i realize how much he taught me. long winded on stories but always had a point. i would take his class over the other two i've since taken on hardware.

kleinsmith was one of only a few faculty I studied under at WPI who gave a dam about mentoring students. he taught my computer architecture course with assembler - both of which I had zero interest before taking his class. he taught to make the class understand rather than just remember. i took the grad architecture course later- thanks prof!
this guy was the first teacher i ever had who actually knew how to teach how computers work. i wish he had stayed at wpi but most students found his presentation over their heads
He could have been a good professor, if he didn't make so many mistakes.  Not only that, if someone pointed out a mistake, he got very upset about it.

ok - the guy knows his stuff and is obviously very smart -----but i was there to learn assembler - not computer hardware!!!!! Aaaaaaghhh!! He did give lots of time to meeting to helpout extra. Maybe he should be teaching ECE?
he did a good job considering this was his first term. I learned alot...he really cares about teaching and helping
Terible teacher... I was so glad to see him go
Horrible
Rambles, talks about dead guys too much, more fun to just stare into space
Very Very Bad Teacher
This one time at Cornell...
Stay AWAY!  Brand new.  Not sure of his own teaching.  Very scattered.
Really boring, tests on alot of material hes never even mentioned, but allows double sided cheat sheets. class is not well organized.

The class is pretty sleepy, and if you don't attend the lecture, you will be fine. You will get an easy A in this class. Just go over the materials he gave you for the exam and quizes. Finally, the grade scale is kind of ridiculus. If I missed the final, I can still pass the class.
Nice guy, but super boring and not at all easy to comprehend. However, if you read the book then you're fine, although class is sort of a waste.
He was really entertaining and really very easy... I enjoyed the class very much, but am annoyed with being 3 points away from and A ARGH!!!
hes a nice guy but hes clueless, i'd recomend taking the freshman micro course (an easy A), but nothing else, especially not microbial phys

Double sided sheets allowed for exams, curved grades, show up to class if you dont want to miss the quizzes, get entertained by a guy talking about beer, diarrhea and dying.  Not too bad of a teacher.

Grades were curved greately. If you study, you'll have no problem getting an A. Allows a double-sided sheet for tests. Grade was based on 3 tests, 3 pop quizzes, and a poster(group). Good if you like Powerpoints. Overall, recommend.

This guy needs to retire.  His powerpoints, his lectures, the book and his tests are all 4 different things.  The only good thing is he gives you review  questions, and a lot of the exact questions are on the tests.  He is really boring...good luck staying awake in the class.
The guy really likes his bacteria, but gets way more pumped about beer, how can you not like him
Boring, rambling, bo-ring...ra-mbling....bo- bo- bo- *snnrrrrkkk*
Makes many mistakes on his own exams.  Very boring.
Very amusing IQP advisor!
His microbio class is so boring-you don't even have to come to class!

Overall not a bad professor, though lectures are boring.  Material got more difficult as the term went on. Statics is in general kind of challenging (in my opinion), but Innis is one of the better options for professors.

Not the most thrilling lecturer but better than the reviews here reflect. He teaches you what you need to know and you grade is pretty much based off of 7 tests where he drops the lowest one. A little boring but overall pretty good.

Had him for both ES2502 and 3003, unfortunately. Learned my lesson after 2502 but last minute change of teachers put me in his class. I go to lecture, but you're better off reading the book because that's basically what he does. Having a sol'n manual let me to see how problems are done b/c he did ~3 all term. Never around campus. Waste of tuition.
He is such a boring professor. I skipped most of the classes and the ones i went to i didn't pay any attention to and still did pretty well in the class.
Got nothing from lectures.  I stopped going after a week.  The homework problems are much harder than the quiz problems.  Hope you get good TAs or else you will be learning the material yourself.

Overall a very easy class, with most of the grade being based on 7 tests (the lowest grade being dropped). However, lectures are very dry, and the professor was rarely available outside of class. He also answered most questions during class poorly.
Gives you the material with no frills. Not particularly engaging or interesting, but gets the job done.

Quizzes are from textbook with different numbers. Although his classes are easy to fall asleep in, he likes to make jokes in a serious way which could sometimes be fun. The class is not difficult, especially in first four chapters. He posts every lecture on blackboard. Read the textbook, do homework and then the quizzes are just easy.

Pretty easy class overall but he is pretty boring in lecture. I went to class about once a week and pulled off the A. Everything is directly from the book. He is very helpful outside of class and will make time to explain anything you don't understand.

Bad: The most boring professor I've ever had. You WILL fall asleep at least once every lecture. Actually going makes little difference. Not very available for private help. Good:knows the material and lesson plan is nice and simple. Homework collected once a week, and one quiz a week with no exams.

I'm a senior at WPI so I've had almost 40 profs by now, he's has been the worst. I went his office to try to get help or ask a question and got shoed away. Homework and exams questions are fairly difficult. He did maybe 5 example problems all term and they were taken directly from the book. He only proved equations, didn't show HOW to USE them!!
Not a very dynamic speaker; easy to get bored in class. Homework was disproportionately difficult to the rest of the class, and counted for FAR too much. Easy enough tests though.

Professor Innis is probably a new teacher in WPI. He is trying hard every day to make us understand the concepts. He is an easy going person and nice to talk with. The exams are not hard at all. He wants u to learn from the hw and exams.

Hes a super sweet professor and he truly cares about his students. Unfortunately I found him to be very disorganized and he never had a presentation prepared. He just lectured from his mind and didnt write anything on the board. I can not learn this way so this class ended up being pretty useless. But he is a very nice prof.
Steve has always been, and always will be, one of those people who cares.  Pretty easy on the eyes too.
kmiotek is the best professor at WPI. Wish he could teach me every class. Ask him to go for a coffee because he is full of stories and honestly, he's a great friend to have on campus!!
Kmiotek is the best person on this campus and I wish I could have him for every class. Everyone loves him.

Cutest professor ever. He is extremely friendly and teaches the material in a way that makes sense and applies to how it will be used. Not the complete best at presenting material, but he is great one on one to answer any questions and is always more than willing to go out of his way for any student

Professor Kmiotek has blown all of the other chem eng teachers out of the water.  He takes a lot of extra time it seems to answer every question you have and to be as helpful as possible.  He never makes you feel stupid for asking help or offended if you don't understand what he teaches.  The tests are fair.  The notes are clear.  Am I in heaven?
He is a great teacher! He is very understanding of any circumstances you may have and is great at explaining information.

Alright if for some odd reason you are having trouble deciding whether to privilege your existence with this god of a man step back and ask yourself a few questions.  Do I want all of my wildest dreams fulfilled?  Do I want a superhero as a teacher?  Is Tupac back? If you answered yes to any or all of these what's the problem here? He rode a camel.
Great professor, made the hard stuff look easy.
A very helpful professor on homework and projects. His industry experience is wonderful! (Also a teddy bear)

This man is the kind of person that immediately brightens up a room. He has the experience of a veteran and the energy of a young man. He is hands down the best professor in an already AMAZING department!

Such an amazing professor, in a different league.  So willing to help and devote as much time as needed to any student. Remembers names and faces and has become a great source of advice even when not in his class.

Easily one of the best professors at WPI. He cares so much about his students and the quality of his teaching. His dedication is unquestionable. I've honestly never heard anything negative about him or his teaching.

Solid presentations with an engaging environment, participation is important, long readings you can skim for each class, grade consists of four main writing assignments, a group discussion leader write-up, and participation/attendance, grade with letters not numbers
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He cares a lot about what he teaches and provides lots of knowledge for you to adsorb, but as long as you understand the basic gist of what the topic's about, it's fine to not remember every single detail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: I loved Professor Galante! The class is structured into four assignments based around four different topic sets, and a final website based off of your favorite of the four topics. At times Professor Galante seemed to be a tough commenter (not grader), but looking back he is trying to make sure students succeed as much as possible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Galante is an awesome professor and has a great teaching style because he is passionate about the topics. Make sure to participate to get a better experience in the class. The essays were interesting though they could be a grind for some, but was very accepting of feedback and caring of students mental health, as he pushed some deadlines back

Great guy, teaches well. We built the syllabus as a class and it worked really well, we were in control of when things were due, what projects to do and how to do them, even the grading scale. Our class did group projects and they were great. I learned a lot from the class and didn't do a ton of work. Great prof, would take again

Absolutely love this guy. You can tell he puts effort into his classes and getting people engaged in the discussion. Gives good feedback on papers and attendance and participation is required to get a good grade in the course. He is also very understanding.
He is very understanding and is willing to work with you, he does require a lot of reading, but I genuinely had some fun in his class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Galante really cares about what he teaches, and is good at driving participation. Bit of a tough grader when it comes to papers, but he's very flexible with due dates and gives good feedback. All the reading was on Canvas - really heavy stuff, necessary for the papers.

I took this first quarter as a freshman, and its not very much work and a great break from my other classes. You write three papers and a group project at the end. Participate because its worth a bit in your grade. He is really understanding and if you are okay at writing (or if youre not, you can visit the writing center), youll be good.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor and great guy. Took 2 classes with him freshmen year and was very engaging. You can tell he loves what he does and loves to teach. Lectures were rather interesting and papers were surprisingly enjoyable to write. At a school like WPI, it was refreshing, to take a step away from all the math and science and just learn something else!

Galante is a great professor. He knows what he's talking about and always engages students into the material. His class is a fun time but also educational and informative. He takes from different sources and is very objective. He is such a caring teacher and does his best to work with students and their work. Love him

Great Prof. for humanities, especially for WPI where no one really likes them. Very enthusiastic and good teacher. Takes attendance daily and counts participation if thats a dealbreaker. Good class for breadth.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: 3 papers, but he drops the lowest. Not a hard grader. Knowledgeable and engaging, should be an easy A if you participate and are a decent writer.

Heavy reading; the topic is about MENA but shifts focus to feminism and liberal ideologies quickly. The class is self-grading, but the final grade is chosen by her with zero transparency. She grades revised work but gives feedback when term ends. Very hard to revise work when class has ended. She contradicts herself and is unprofessional at times.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND: Ok, I'll admit, at first I wasn't a fan and as a grade-anxious person, YIKES but it really does work out ok. Now that I have her for a different class, I get it. I have learned so much already and she is so incredibly knowledgeable/passionate/caring. Very good at figuring out people.

PS: Tons of reading/work for Global Feminisms

If you can take a class with her do it. She is incredibly helpful and caring. That being said, this class wasn't exactly what I was expecting. It focuses on more recent philosophy starting at Marx and following a lineage of thinkers after him. This class was still really interesting and I would take this class again just for this professor.
Great prof, struggled during covid and she helped me succeed in all my classes.

Prof Moody is a great professor. She makes sure every student is included and comfortable during class. The midterm was a 6-8 page group paper and the final was a 10-12 page paper. Though because of things that happened on campus, it was changed and she was very flexible and understanding. HW: One paged abstract per week on the assigned content.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: she is the best professor at this school. changed my life, made me stay at wpi, no exaggeration. take her classes. you won't regret it.

She was one of the first teachers I had, and was one of my favorite teachers. I took global feminisms with her, and it was a great eye opener. She really makes you think and gives a lot of work, but is super accommodating. She is super kind and definitely a cheerleader for every one of her students. I highly recommend taking one of her courses.
Fantastic teacher. Keeps you engaged through challenging texts and encourages you to work at it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: "In this class Communism is our religion and Marx is our god." The class itself wasn't very difficult in terms of homework or material but I would like to mention that the readings all stem from a Marxist and post-structuralist lineage. So, if you wanted a class about mainstream religion or philosophy, look elsewhere. Nice person, very leftist.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria
