comment: Knows what she's teaching and values participation. In her class, it's okay to have opposing viewpoints on everything, which is good. The movies are more interesting than initially perceived. The readings and papers are long and the Harkness Discussion is very in depth, but do your work and you'll end up fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Really good philosophy professor! Workload is very manageable and easy to succeed. Participation counts, but its a very judgement free zone so anything you say is valued.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Participation really, really matters in this class. You won't get a good grade if you don't participate often, and with insightful content. Professor Moody did facilitate the discussions well though, and will certainly help you improve your grade if you talk with her. Be ready to put a lot of time into this class if you take it with Professor Moody
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Great teacher. She really cares about the material. The difficulty rating is only because of the amount of reading. Every night before class there is a required reading that is anywhere between 15-30 pages. A pain. Luckily she is really nice and doesn't call people out. I really liked her
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Prof. Sutter is a nice guy who clearly knows a lot about the programs he's teaching, but I didn't like him because he doesn't encourage his students to ask questions in or outside of class. He went really fast even tho it was an 8am and seemed irritated when students asked questions. He also wasn't very understanding imo. mediocre prof.

One of the best professors I've had. Very engaging lectures, cares about his students, very accessible outside class. He stayed up all night before the last day helping students and answering questions. He understands the software inside and out, and can answer basically any question you have. I would highly recommend anyone take this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Sutter was really friendly and made me enjoy his class each day that I attended. There was a lot of work that had to be done in the animation lab outside of class, but he always gave time to work on projects in class as well. He explained everything very clearly. Overall, really fun professor and class!

Phenomenal instructor and animator! Make sure to attend his office hours and lectures, for assignments rely on it. Having went to both, I've found that he offers great feedback and, not surprisingly, is open to questions on 3D animation and augmented reality. I'd definitely recommend this course to any prospective students in animation.

The professor gives a really good instruction for the course, and overall the course is really fun to take. The content is really heavy and it requires 100% attendance in order to understand what must be done, and be prepare for a huge amount of work. In the end, it pays a lot. I'd ecommend this course, but be warned this course isn't easy at all.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I think what some people don't understand is how much work has to go into a class like 3D modeling. Once you understand how much time and effort has to go into it, however, you /really/ appreciate how clearly and well he explains how to use everything. TAKE NOTES ON TECHNICAL INSTRUCTIONS. YOU THINK YOU'LL REMEMBER. YOU WON'T. AND IT'LL MATTER.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Really makes you work for it. Tough grader

He is very helpful if you ask for it and schedule meetings.  The information he provides in class is very important you should take thorough notes.  Expect to spend a decent amount of time outside of class working on your projects.  He grades mostly based on your effort.  Great prof and class!

Going to Ralph for office hours saved me. It may seem like the guy is super unapproachable, but when I met with him he gave me specific feedback that helped immensely. He is a hard grader but he mostly grades on effort- not skill. Your art doesn't have to be perfect, but he wants to see that you put the work into it.
He's the cutest holand-ic man ever. He's also an amazing teacher and artist but thats irrelevant.

Overall he is not that easy, but I felt that helped push me to create better art. Very knowledgable in character modeling and enthusiastic about the class. I definitely can recommend taking his courses. His course taught me a lot, it was also one of the more fun classes I took at WPI (so far).

Overall, he's okay. He comes off as really arrogant and cocky, and he sometimes expects his students to be "professional" artists. He surveys the class to ask who has/hasn't had modeling experience, and then completely disregards the fact that half the class doesn't have any experience, expecting Picasso-like models from everyone.

Best 3D modeling professor at WPI in my book. New to teaching, which is somewhat apparent, but he has a lot of potential. Very good at answering questions, but at times he's not very approachable. I would highly encourage you to take 3d modeling with him.
Great professor, inturesting. good guy to talk to after class. Very good at what he does and very smart.

As long as everything stays the way he wants it he is happy.  If there is anything out of the ordinary, he will procrastinate on dealing with it and if you are not aware of it then you will not find out until too late.  If you stay within his expectations you should be OK, not a professor who values diversity of thought or approach.

This class was AMAZING. Finkel described the various parts that make up video games. We had weekly papers (not for a grade), w/ excellent feedback. (In the end, we wrote a term paper, which was basically the weekly papers combined.) The midterm and final exams were pretty easy. Just pay attn. It's not hard b/c this class is very interesting & fun!
Easy class to begin with. Tests are decent and he was fair with the grading. Didn't seem very approachable, however.

Finkel rules!  His class was the first CS class that I really understood the whole way through.  It wasn't too hard, and he kept me interested in the subject matter.  I wanna take more classes with Finkel.

Nice guy, but powerpoint is a horrible teaching method. Hard to learn Java in such a short amount of time. The Second Java assignment was very difficult for the small amount of Java we had done and very confusing. Other than that, not bad.

I really enjoyed his class. Emailed me right back if I had a question and was always very approachable whenever I wanted a clarification; then, after clarifying something with a student (like me) he'd email the whole class just to make sure everyone was a

His class is really easy but extremly borring. Powerpoint slides are on line for every lecture. Makes very stupid jokes, laughs at them, makes weird hand motions, looks very happy with himself all the time. Doesn't do a very good job teaching but easy.
Very enthusiastic about the class and the material. Did a great job of teaching Prolog and Java. You should do the assigned reading before lecture or you might be a bit lost.

Supplements extremely poor explanations with even more inconceivable hand motions, and then appears satisfied with his sign language and moves on. Nice enough guy, but I don't think I've learned anything meaningful in this class.
VEry unclear when he teaches, and repeats the same thing each time, none of it making sense.  Worst of all, laughs at his own jokes.

He has an understanding of what he is teaching, but he's not really that smart. He advised my MQP, we had to create kiddy drawings to explain the basic concepts to him. Don't waste your time unless it's a low level cs.
Lazy, stupid
I actually learned a lot in her class, lectures were engaging, material was clear, exams are graded harshly so hard to get an A but a very managable and passable class.

She is very clear about what she expects students to know. Her slides are immaculate and super clear, and she is very diligent with keeping the canvas page updated. Always happy to answer questions and wants you to succeed. Tries to get to know each student a little bit, even in big lectures.

I took this last B term and had to work for my A, but she was a great professor nonetheless. I've garnered so much knowledge from her class. Her lectures are clear and effective. The key terms and concepts she gives at the end of class are the best way to study for exams. I would honestly say that the readings she assigns aren't important, though.

Very solid, clearly communicated teaching. Was able to cover a ton of material effectively. Little wasted time. Terrific at answering questions in class. Introduced specific real-world examples along with the materials that were relevant and useful. Exams are a bit tough and important but ended up being scaled. Final group project was valuable.

I really enjoyed taking this class with professor Shell. She is super kind and knowledge about the subject and makes complicated material seem easy and interesting. My only complaint is she can be a tough grader, especially on the exams and projects but other than that she was really terrific.

She is very nice and knowledgeable about microbiology. However, my biggest issue with her class is that her quizzes don't accurately reflect what is taught in lectures. If you want to do well you have to do a lot of your own research on upcoming quiz topics because you won't find it in your lecture notes.

Professor Shell is extremely knowledgeable about the subjects in microbiology. She is great at explaining material in a way that is easy to understand. Although she doesn't prepare students for tests very well, they are pretty easy and fully based on the material from lecture. She assigns a lot of text book reading, but you can just skim it
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Great professor.

Shell teaches you a phenomenal amount of useful information in an easy-to-understand way and is very approachable. Her tests/quizzes are good measures of the material and there is one actually very relevant group project. Her one downside is that she is an extremely strict grader so beware of that. If you want an A you'll have to work a lot.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a very approachable and nice person, but beyond those 2 qualities, it just goes downhill. She really didn't  prepare us for her exams, and even after getting negative midterm evals, she refused to alter the course. Funny enough, she didn't plan on curving the class but had to when she probably saw most people would NR the course. Avoid her.

Professor Shell did a great job for having taught this class for the first time. Now that she has had the chance to iron out the issues that occurred during my class, she will probably be a great professor. She is usually very clear in lecture and makes sure to clarify things that people don't understand.
Clearly passionate about the subject, explains concepts really well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She doesn't hold office hours and offers little preparation for her exams. Kind of confusing course objectives plague this class because Prof Shell will ask you to read a whole chapter, but will only test a part of that chapter.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: My advisor... Spectacular!

lectures were boring, lab was tough so it leveled out. his lectures had alot of videos which were intersting although it didnt have much to do with operations management. lectures were very useful for the final exam. if you do your work and take labs seriously getting an A is simple. would recommend to a friend

Nice man. Good to grow a relationship with. Ask for help if needed for project based work. Show enthusiasm and talk a lot and you will get a good grade. Lecture is variable, never the same topic for each class although could all be considered extraneous material based on topic.
needs to retire.
Gersty is the BEST
No Comments
Class was pretty much a complete waste of time. There was very little content (with the exception of the labs).. Gerstenfeld may be fine, but this is not a 3000 level college class.
talks about cheetahs a lot.. he does IQP for Africa & MQP for NY.  Great person to build a relationship with if you're interested.  Class material is fluff itself, so it's all good
Outstanding
This man rules
No Comments
a very nice guy, love this course

Uncle Ray was my Academic Advisor in the 80's. RRH explained technical details to non-technical juries - for his technical students, it was 'natural'. Back then, Comp Exam was a grad requirement. RRH helped me overcome a Severe TBI and obtain my BSME ... gave me a practice comp incl 8 hour on a Saturday. Best Prof at WPI. Forever in his debt!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Worst teacher ever!!  He didn't do anything but everyone in the class got an A.  The TA was awesome.
No Comments
I had Hagglund years ago and found him to be sensational and inspirational.  He will forever be remembered as my favorite professor.
Definitely senile. I tried asking for help, and he couldn't figure out what the problem was asking for about 40 minutes so I left. Don't take his classes.

He had to ask what class he was teaching everyday.  His 'lecturing' consisted of asking the TA in the front row how to do the problems in the book.  Final was just turning in homework.  Has been here forever, is an alum, and donated to the school.
Completely senile but an easy A.

Professor Hagglund has a hard time remembering his own Name.  However, He teaches very slow and  he does not reward students for creativity, and innovation in his classes, actually penalizes for it.  I would reccomend avoiding his classes

He's very helpful. He just doesn't know where he is. He's asked my lab partner a total of 3 times who she is, what she's majoring in and if this class has helped her with engineering. On the upside, the class is an easy A. The TA has been great.
Class is an easy way to waste time and get an eng credit.
No Comments
No Comments
What a great TA. If only all were like him. Keep calm and  continue testing.
Very nice, very helpful! Very knowledgeable about his subject area. Also, easy on the eyes.
He was an fantastic TA and explained everything so well.
Extremely helpful and always willing to answer any questions you had in lab and over email. Highly recommended :)
He is very great professor.
He was awesome!!!
Very easy to understand

Best possible lab TA to have for this class. James explained the kind of confusing labs very well and made them easier to understand. He taught the material better than the professor! Definitely highly recommended.
A very helpful lab instructor.
Decent Lab Instructor. Labs were made difficult by poor instructions written by course Professor. James Hopkins was able to interpret such instructions with ease.
Really awesome lab instructor! Very helpful, clear, definitely willing to explain things thoroughly. Highly recommend!!!
He is super helpful and nice!
His lectures are in-depth, and he's good at correcting mistakes. You get used to his accent eventually, but it takes effort at first.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Nice professor. really wants to help students learn. Class is not too hard.
I've never had a problem understanding him and he is very good at explaining topics.  Encourages students to ask questions.  I just wish the class wasn't at 8 in the morning.
He was OK.  Hard to understand at times.  Taught too much stuff at the end of the term that wasn't going to be covered on the final rather than reviewing for the final.
Very knowledgeable and tries to create student's interest in the topics.
nice guy - go to his office hours if u are struggling. also, his accent isn't really that bad - i had no absolutely no trouble understanding him.
powerpoint slides were more confusing than the book, his accent made lectures impossible to understand, and I had to teach myself everything relating to databases that was useful to me.
I think this guy gets a bad rap, 'cuz DB I kinda sucks. I went to office hours one time and he stayed an hour and a half longer than he scheduled for...

Teaches most of the SQL standard rather than the parts some DB vendor chose to implement. Expects students to participate more than they actually do. Always helpful. Easy to understand, but the wording in a few assignments and lectures is confusing.
Teaches and demands knowledge of topics that can't be used with any database implementation currently existing. Asks if class understands and assumes that 30 seconds of silence means 'yes'.

He can't seem to comprehend that the class cannot understand him.  In addition to his accent, his voice trails off to a whisper for important points.  Teaches topics in one way, but the homework problems are completely different.

The class wasn't very hard, what's very hard is understanding him. Lectures make little sense (and his horrible accent doesn't help), and he has very bad handwriting when he writes on the board. HW assignments and projects also tough to decipher.

I went to him about a grade that was 15-20 points below people w/ the same answers. He quizzed me on the exam i took 3 weeks ago and when i didn't know right away he told me I clearly did not understand what was going on and spoke about my worth as a student and a person. never left office hours feeling so disrespected
Professor Kazantzis is a great lecturer, and he will help you outside of class if you don't understand a concept. Very clear explanations and always organized and methodical in his teaching.
Controls with Kazantzis is fantastic. He is a very sweet professor. The work load is pretty light, and the exams are not bad either!

Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had. He truly cares about his students, and is very helpful in and outside of class. His tests can be tough, but he tends to not focus on grades as much as effort and ends up scaling his classes. He is also definitely extremely knowledgeable and passionate about what he is teaching.

This professor is one of the best chemeng professors in the department. He will pull perfectly timed 50 min lectures without notes while blowing your mind. He would casually redefine newton's laws without anyone noticing. He is brilliant and fantastic!
very good explainations u just have to get past the accent, if he can teach me quantum then he has to be doing something right

He is THE hottest professor I've ever had.  He explains the theory VERY well & if you don't understand, he will try diff. ways to help you. HIs tests are not easy but he scales. He really cares about his students.  Definitely the best Prof I've had in WPI (I'm a senior).
this professor is like pacey from dawson's creek and tom hanks if they had a baby that happened to be greek. also he is really nice and down to earth. sweet.
Makes class interesting and takes difficult concepts and makes them easy to understand. Grades pretty easily, but his tests are generally poor measurements of what the students are capable of.
awesome. i thought the theory was fun.... i really understood what was going on.
Always helped me if I needed it.
always was really helpful to me. it was a real quality class and i really learned a lot.
accent is difficult to understand, but willing to help if you have a problem

Cancer biology was a tough course but it was a rewarding experience. I feel as though I learned a lot from Professor Manning but it did take a lot of hard work and effort. If you are willing to put in the time, you will do very well in this course. I recommend doing the extra credit and going to office hours to ensure you know the material.

As a freshman who hadn't taken any bio since freshman year of high school, this class was a little difficult. I had to do a lot of textbook reading to get a simple understanding, whereas many other students breezed through the class based on previous knowledge. She gives out many easy points with workshops, extra credit, and discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: Class is honestly fine. It's a little boring at times, but tests are manageable and she gives tons of extra credit. Textbook reading is technically required, but I never bought the textbook and just read the posted slides instead and was prepared for the exams (which are mostly multiple choice). A pretty easy class that I would recommend.

She does not actually teach anything. Her lectures do not cover even a quarter of what is in the textbook, and then she uses Canva to grade the quizzes, which will mark the answers wrong or give a lower score for things that should be right. Her grading is arbitrary, and she does not offer feedback unless asked.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: This professor heavily relies on the text book read the text book because she won't teach everything you're expected to know (even though that's what she's paid to do). She also makes things do at 11:59 AM not pm and doesn't make an effort to make this clear, despite most other deadlines being 11:59 pm. She doesn't take late work either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Really cares about her students learning, and it exceptionally willing to help you outside of class, there is a lot of reading but that is as advertised. Really loved this class and would highly recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Boring lectures. Most of the work comes from reading the textbook. Quizzes uneven in what they cover. Extremely strict grader. About 1/3rd of class time is spent on presentations/learning how to cite scientific papers instead of learning cell biology. Do not recommend.

Her lectures are incredibly fast, so fast where you can't absorb any information. Her lectures got worse as the course continued, and became so vague you couldn't really tell what chapter she was on. She had weekly tests, which can have up to 4 long chapters in them each. Her average is like a 71 where you need a 70 to pass, so be prepared to work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Her quizzes are actually the worst. The average quiz grade was a 71, and if you get under a 70, you don't get credit for the class. Her grading criteria is very unclear for the projects, which are 25% of your grade. She also whips through lectures. The moment she says the last word of a slide. Overall, don't take her class.

This class is great if you like independent learning. I got very little from her lectures because she flies through material simply reading off of a PowerPoint. I spent hours reading the textbook. She has a very strange grading style. She is very kind and understanding. She does do a good job teaching students how to find and read primary sources.
Professor Manning was great. Yes, you have to read the book, but you'll learn a lot. She was a very fair grader and was helpful and responsive. I'd recommend her class.

Amity Manning is a nice professor. She has a test a week which is nice because there is not a lot of material you can cover in a week right? wrong. Each week she discusses 3 chapters vaguely and expects you to read them all before the test in order to get a full grasp on things. No partial credit on tests which causes poor grades in class.

Adryen is genuinely inspiring, and encourages not only pushing yourself as a learner but care for yourself and cognizance of scope. Take heed of their gentle guidance and inciteful advice and you'll make tremendous progress, ignore it, be a jerk to your classmates, or skip class and you'll learn less while confused why you're having a bad time.

Professor Gonzalez goes above and beyond to be helpful and effective in teaching. Chronic illness is a challenge she's risen to with aplomb, and any challenges she faced she was clear about and took care to ensure didn't impact the learning provided.
Brilliant and capable, but tough if you screw up. Communication is key!

A wonderful person, she is so lovely and kind. she is an incredible professor and i absolutely recommend taking any classes she offers in the future as a professor anywhere else if she is rehired or continues teaching. she is an amazing professor. she is patient and willing to work with you to learn and grow 100/10

Their classes have been great, with them being such a great professor who cares about how their students do. It can be a lot of work but the work is honestly pretty fun. For MQP she has been an amazing advisor that has helped so much. Her schedule can get a bit hectic so communication can be tough occasionally, but its not usually an issue.

I absolutely loved taking Video Production with her. Although she is tad unorganized she is very clearly passionate about the material and gives a lot really good feedback. This class can be a bit time consuming at times but overall it is great class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: A lot of homework but a worthwhile course, not an easy A.

Professor Gonzalez was a good professor. She taught class well and always kept class pretty laid back. Unfortunately our class was a bit disorganized but I feel there was a lot of factors in that and it's not completely on her. Her teaching was only okay though, teaching mostly through old recorded lectures and I felt the class suffered for it.
one of my favorite professors. Was extremely flexible with the work turned in and gave lots of creative freedom. I am hoping to have her again

She was terribly disorganized and gave back no grades until the end of the term. Workload was heavy although the big assignments were creative and fun to do. Only take this class if you are willing to draw. She required lots of expensive materials which we didn't use at all. She didn't answer emails for her 'mental health' but ignored ours...
She teaches very little actual technique, very slow to answer emails outside of class if answers them. Makes us buy a lot of art supplies and a majority of them will go to waste.

The teacher is nice, but she gives much more work than what should be thrown into this class, almost as if she expects us to take all of our time on art while students also have other classes to focus on. If you take her AR1100 course, be sure you don't have a homework heavy schedule or difficult courses or you will have a terrible time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor was very knowledgeable about what he was teaching and was able to stimulate interest. Classes were structured more as a conversation than a lecture which was great. Grades are essentially based on participation, a debate, and two papers.
Very witty and interesting professor.  Acts like a human being ought to!  He was able to make the material come to life and be relevant to our own lives.  Take this class.
One of the best teacher I've had. Interesting and funny lectures. No tests and only three papers. Definitely worth taking the class

Grades are based solely on participation and a few papers, so the grading is quite subjective.  The class was taught through somewhat entertaining lectures.  Make sure you participate if you would like a good grade.
SO GREAT
this teacher is soo great! take as many classes as you can from him.
awesome teacher

If you have any interest in international relations or diplomacy, this is the guy to go to. Hands down, the best professor I've had at WPI. Be prepared to write near flawless papers for hiim. He looks for grammar, content, and all that other stuff...
Very easy. My class had no tests and 2 papers. Interesting lectures. Don't need to take notes.
First of all he teaches at Assumption not WPI, but he does come in for Sokal a lot. Usually pretty interesting lectures. Loves his subject, can be boring at times.
Greatest teacher ever.  Of course, he's not actually a WPI professor, they have to import teachers this good from other schools.  TAKE HIS CLASS
No Comments

This course has introduced me to many different aspects of the game design industry, some of which I never knew existed. I have learned about different concepts, different roles, and the stress that the game industry will put on me. But yet, despite the lack of recognition and monetary wealth, I couldnt imagine myself doing anything else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS--Would take again

comment: Throughout this class, I have learned a lot about the game development process and have determined where it can fit into my life. This process held true for the game we designed called the Liberator, starting with a simple design that slowly gained complexity as we added elements.

This was an amazing learning experience. Before this class, I had only worked on a few projects that never really ended up getting completed. This is the first project Ive ever done from start to finish, and Im actually quite proud of the work Ive done, and the work that my team has done.

I learned a lot about what working on games is like and found that I enjoy it enough that Im seriously considering switching my major from CS to IMGD. During the development of our game, I was able to understand first hand the aspects of the industry that we had read about.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS--Would take again

comment: Before taking this course, I pictured the game industry much like it is seen on television- a lot of people hanging around computers, some creating art, geeks writing the program, and the bosses being the ultimate nerds in front of dozens of computer screens typing away on multiple computers. Not even close.

Most of what I learned from the different jobs in the game industry I was aware of but did not fully recognize. I feel that I will still most likely pursue technical art. Although, despite the difficulty I have already face with programming, feel that learning more about computer science is now a more realistic option for me.

The readings were extremely beneficial. I think between the readings and the supplementary information found in the videos, I have been able to find a good direction to follow so that I can build my career. While the games industry is an extremely complex one, with various nuances, issues, and challenges, I think I can succeed.

The readings and videos offered anecdotes and job profiles that created complete pictures of what every jobs role is within the much larger team and industry. . Prior to watching the videos and engaging with the readings, I had really rough ideas as to what was needed for a game development team, and what each person did.

I learned about the different positions that exist inside the video game industry and the roles that they fulfill in the development of a video game. I think that reading about the specifics of each profession has clarified a lot of things that were very vague to me before, such as the role of producers and designers.

The listing is incorrect, his department is Interactive Media and Game Development. He has huge experience in the game industry and really wants his students to understand the good and the bad about being a game developer. He made time in class to help students with their game assignments and gave constructive suggestions on how to improve them.

Prof Kesselman is not a good Prof. He reads directly off slides. Assigns work that had no educational value in the form of reading giant chapters, and then writing papers about them. Programming heavy even though its an intro course with a split down the middle between CS and Art (big CS project everyone does, no art projects)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: The only thing he does during classes is read directly off power point slides he got from another professor. He also often starts off by saying "I haven't read these slides yet either so bare with me" and has no idea what he's trying to teach because he never did come prepared to class at all. Also grading our first assignment took over a month.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Really engaging in class, never a dull moment. He cares a lot about his students, and understands when you can't make it to class. He knows how to teach students here well, I wish I had done my depth in Arabic.

He was a great Professor. He is incredibly knowledgeable & he is very nice. Arabic is a very hard language to understand but he helps a lot. If you attend every lecture and review notes outside of class, you are likely to do very well.
Top professor. Very helpful.
He is an amazing Professor,  i learned a lot about African History in his class. If you want to learn a lot and get an easy A go for him. He is amazing .
Great professor. Put work in outside of class, talk in class, and you'll be fine.
Easiest humanities class you can take. Requires no effort to get an A
Don't take this class if you want to learn Arabic. Take it if you want to learn to BS your way through a class or do a generally easy HUA requirement.

GREAT Professor!!! This guy is the MAN! Even though his class was at 9am I wanted to go everyday! This was  my favorite class. Sometimes he lets out his inner ghetto, being from Revere/Boston and it hilarious!He loves his chicken wings! He is very helpful on top of that. Very easy to understand. I never thought learning Arabic would be this fun.LOL

Great teacher and a goofy person. Very nice and will always try to help students understand Arabic better. Doesn't always understand exactly what you are asking when you ask questions though. Very easy and well paced class with virtually no homework.

Very enjoyable with the presentations. The class mostly consists of him talking about daily stuff about Arab culture instead of history and all those things you may find boring. I didn't really need help outside of the class, but he is very understanding with sickness/other situations. He can express himself pretty well too. Easy and not boring.

He is a great teacher that attracts students' attention to class all the time. He sometimes wanders around the subject but only to give students a better understanding of arabic culture, so that they would understand the language better.
wonderful professor! He teaches Arabic and I enjoyed it so much!
Very soft spoken but a very good lecturer. Practice tests are very similar to actual tests, if you can pass the practices you can pass the actual tests. Would take again.

Incredible teacher. She is very thorough in her covering of material. She often goes very fast, however, she is doing this so she can go back over previous material to explain everything she is doing currently for the class. For someone who needs a holistic view to really understand math, she's amazing. Go to class and keep up with the homework!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I had her for Calc 3 and she made difficult material much easier. As long as you take good notes from the board and make sure to pay attention to lectures, you'll do fine. She moves VERY quick, but everything you need to know for the 2 exams is covered, no need to teach yourself. Examples are covered thoroughly and clearly. ALWAYS GO TO CLASS.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Had her for Calc III and she made a really tough subject so much easier. One homework due a week, one quiz a week and easy exams if you did the work.

Prof Zhou is really nice and a good lecturer. She goes somewhat fast but makes sure everyone understands, and her accent takes getting used to but isn't so thick you can't understand. Quizzes were given each conference and all hw and quizzes were out of 10 points. Her midterm and final were very short (6-7 questions) and almost identical to quizzes
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Her lecture is very clear and useful. Homework questions are very similar to examples she gave in class, so try not to skip the class. Also, exams are easy. Almost all problems are similar to examples and homework, but pretty much easier.
It's a pretty easy class, some harder things some easier things. She has a pretty thick accent, but you can mostly tell what she's saying. Moves fast, but definitely knows how to teach the class.
Very responsive and helpful to questions. Clear speaker. Good at making material understandable.

Covers material too quickly and not very good at answering questions. Didn't explain the grading criteria for the midterm and final, and didn't write any comments on the exams. Mostly lecture based and more homework than MA3831.
She moves at lightning speed, so be prepared to not understand anything that is happening

She is a good lecturer, can be boring and I dozed off a few times but follow along and you'll do well. Also the homework are very simple, 6-10 problems a week. Just you want to put in the work to understand calc 4 because it gets tricky. and she does not allow note sheets which sucked :(

Professor Zhou is pretty straightforward. Her lectures are very good after retaking this class, I did much better. Her exams are very important though since there are only two exams. However, these exams are also curved and a minimum of 76 is still a B. As long as you go to class and do your homework, it shouldn't be that much of a drag.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: He may seem intimidating at times, but he is a great professor overall. I found him to be one of the better CHE professors. He takes notes on slides and uploads them afterward so it is easy to catch on. The class is based on tests and projects so it is important to pay attention.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He might seem a little intimidating but he is a great Professor. His lectures are clear and easy to follow. He is also very organized. I learned a lot from this class.
Lowkey an underrated professor, does his best to explain the material thoroughly (or as thoroughly as you'd need for his exams). As long as you go to class and take notes you should be fine.

He's a good teacher in the sense that he knows what he's talking about, but the class' work is difficult and had only 5 grades in it, 2 group projects and 3 tests, 2 of those tests were extremely difficult. I ended up barely passing with a 70.08%, but apparently he curved the whole class' grades since the gradebook says I ended with a B.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Definitely knows what he's talking about, but his Asynchronous chemical engineering lectures are very vague and give almost no examples. I would like to see more class time spent on specific instances of using equations rather than their derivation. Practice tests are very similar to the actual exam, so definitely do them.

Really tough grader. I did super well in CHE 2011 but this class was nearly impossible. His tests are nothing like the in class problems or the homework. He's rude to his students and will snap very easily. Barely has any office hours. TAs will help more than him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Zurawsky is the most interesting lecturer I've had at WPI. He addresses topics and skills that you'll be using on the job and is really funny in doing it. His tests are hard but he scales quite a bit at the end of the course.

He may come as condescending and angry to some but he has changed over the year. I feel like he is the best ChemEng lecturer I've had at WPI. He is clear and knows exactly what he is doing. He will explain anything if you ask him until you understand the subject.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Extremely Rude to students on more than one occasion. Screams at students and  even humiliates them. Material wasn't so hard that you'd fail but it not a fun class. He speeds through everything and STANDS in front of everything he writes so you can't really see it. Always 3-5 minutes late to class. He does not care about his students at all.

This man is the meanest professor I have ever met. Could not care less about his students, makes countless mistakes, does not want to help you, and looks down on you when you ask a question or get something wrong. Expects you to be an expert on every topic he discusses. Tests are a curveball and nothing like in class examples or homework. LEAVE NOW
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Zurawsky is really harsh. He takes ten years to give back any grade and when he does he's just mean about it. I got a B- on an assignment and I felt awful. I do not recommend taking anything with him. He  expects you to have a PhD in whatever he is teaching and then insults you/makes you feel like an idiot.

The lectures were very thorough and went in order by class (i.e. topics covered in the first lecture continued into the second, so on and so forth.). The homeworks were manageable and covered what was taught in class, and exams were similar to the homework problems given. He also has review days the class before an exam to go over any questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: YEah!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Lectures can be confusing, but Prof. Selent will give you all the tools you need to succeed. By far the most accessible professor you'll ever have, I did my homework in his office hours and he was super helpful. I feel like I understand java much better now, because he made a painful class manageable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He may not be the best lecturer, but he is definitely the most helpful, thoughtful professor I have ever had. He tries to learn every student's name and he is always in his office. We needed to pull an all-nighter to finish the group project, and he stayed up with us until 8am to help us. He is always trying to help students any way he can.
Amazing Professor! Extremely accessible in/outside of class. He may not explain everything adequately but if you go to office hours and show a real effort you'll do fine.
Puts lots of effort into engaging the class. Tries hard to learn everyone's name. Most negative things come from the restrictions of the curriculum.

I also had him for CS1004. His assignments are tough. However, he's getting better at understanding the difficulty that assignments should be and if you pay attention they do get easier to understand as you gain proficiency. He will also stay in his office WAY past the norm to help students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's new, and his assignments are challenging as heck. But don't think for a second that he'll throw you to the wolves without help. He is dedicated and helpful. He gives tough assignments but he'll stay till 10 pm some nights to make sure everyone that shows up gets the help they need. He's a gentle grader and will give you detailed feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Taking this class with Doug without any programming experience is very difficult. -He's a nice guy who cares about students. -Assignments are hard, students are not allowed to collaborate (most do anyway) -Expects 100% attendance, even at 8AM -Assignments take a long time to complete -Doesn't cover all the basics well enough -Great coder, not prof
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Absolutely terrible. He expects to be able to get across to students by doing mediocre examples and not offering much help to students. He gives lab assignments that are important to homework, which while may seem helpful, are assigned and due on Wednesday when the homework is due on Friday. No concept of how students do work and should do work.

The concepts of python were pretty easy to grasp, he assigned very difficult homework for a non-majors class (think writing AIs). In addition, it was difficult to get help during his office hours, and would often times cast people aside without giving them any specific detail on how to fix their code, or why the error was occurring.

Very difficult, while the professor is caring about students he is very inexperienced and it shows in his teaching method(digresses from topics easily). The homework assignments for a non-major class is insanely difficult. Doesn't really teach C, expects you to understand from reading and from that, do the difficult homeworks. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Assigned excessively difficult assignments to a NON-MAJORS course in INTRODUCTION to computer science: final homework was to program a pokemon type AI as well as the definition of moves. Avoid having him at all costs unless you're willing to put lots of hours in and/or understand CS already
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The professor refused to listen to the students' complaints. The class organization is bad. Flipped lecture so nothing much in the in-person class. Grading criteria, while clear, are too harsh and arbitrary. Group assignment is an abomination (2 students team while others have 7). It is sad that the professor did not teach properly for this class.
Jerk
Enjoyed and learn a lot in her class.

She is my advisor and I took a class with her. She's an interesting character, but also the most knowledgeable in the MIS field. She is extremely helpful as my advisor and the class I took was super fun and interesting. She has high expectations of you, but reasonable ones at the same time. I definitely recommend you take a class with her!
Greatest class/teacher I have ever taken.
Best and most knowledge professor in MIS department. You could learn something really useful in the real world only from her classes if you are taking MIS courses.

Horrible.  Likely the most boring class I have sat through at WPI.  She's a great teacher if you are an MIS/CS major, but difficult to keep up with for anyone else.  Too bad, because this class/content could be very useful for any major.  Never ever going to take a class with her again.

Professor Strong is great.  As was already said, she teaches you everything you need to know for the course, and you just need to do your end in the readings / homework.  She's neither too fast, too slow, too easy or too hard.  On top of that she's a really good asset to have as an advisor for MIS majors.
Very knowledgeable in databases.
ok, no major complaints... i think i just didnt like the topic
She is very clear and gives assignments that relate well to what we cover. Pace of instruction is neither too fast nor too slow. Considerable workload but easy if you do it all.
Very straight foward person, teaches well also

Does not particularly care about his students or the material being taught, and directly reads off of his lecture slides which are word heavy and do not provide any context to the applications of the material to webworks, homeworks and tests. Do not take this professor.

He reads from the slides with no explanation whatsoever. Expect that the exam will be very hard. I found learning R in the Lab is the only thing I learned. What really annoyed me was I didn't understand the material I am given. He would use theoretics more than explain what I will be using this for! hated Stats because of him period.
Gives 1 weekly quiz during class time, and gives 2 exams in the term. Is very respectful and kind, dedicated to ensuring students learn and understand the content.
Takes the whole class to go over 1 or 2 concepts. Reads off his slides. Slides are full of words. Repeats similar concepts. Not the greatest.
Loves to answer questions. He's very kind and takes feedback for grades very well. Will drop lowest grades of every category since he only cares if you understand or not.

Worst Professor Ever! Zou does not care about his students at all. He was extremely rude, was hard to work with, and made his exams 20x harder (and longer) just because they were considered "open book" and he was bitter about our refusal to use HonorLock. Lectures were useless, too quiet to hear, and hard to follow. Curved minimally (not enough).
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Awesome professor. Really cares about his students actually learning and doing well in the class. Told us today (like 4 days before the final) that he is dropping the lowest quiz, homework, and lab, and that we are allowed two cheat sheets on the final because it is cumulative. Also added extra office hours for final review. Great guy.

Professor Zou (pronounced ZOW) was not too bad of a professor. He clearly knew what he was teaching very well, which could be bad at times as more complicated concepts may not seem complicated to him. Overall it would seem you could skip classes and just show up for the weekly quizzes and you would be okay since he posts his notes online
He's a great professor in statistics department. After taking this course, I decide to follow him to do my graduate paper. The class is easy and he is so nice in his office hour.

2 tests, quizzes every Friday. Labs are easy, short, and dull. The textbook is rough. I read it, but it's complex. His accent can be hard to understand, but it's not that bad. Read the slides. If you don't understand, ask. His explanations get better the second time. Do the homework, don't just guess, and the tests are like the quizzes and HW.
WORST TEACHER SO FAR

He is a very nice professor. He is very accessible, if you don't understand his lectures, you should go to his office hour or email him. His tests are quite tough though, because he only allows one cheat sheet in the test, which is hard for a subject like statistics, with much to remember.

Professor Noetscher is amazing; lectures are incredibly engaging and detailed tho ofc challenging. Weekly homeworks which are difficult and time-consuming, but with help sessions not too bad. 3 exams on 2 HWs each, last being the easiest mainly on solar and wind. 2 design problems (long hw Q) are nbd. Just go to class, get help if needed.

Prof. Noetscher is a super nice and down-to-earth guy. You can tell he cares about his students' success. Great Lecturer, who doesn't just read off a PowerPoint presentation. Decent amount of Homework but nothing unusual for an engineering class. Tests are done asynchronously. Labs are a lot of fun!
Best professor at WPI, and great teaching style

Professor Noetscher is hands-down my favorite ECE professor I have had so far. His passion for the material and ability to provide clear explanations makes his class a must-take. The exams were easier than the homework, but they still were good measures of the material. The labs were sometimes frustrating, but his grading was fair for them.
Great teacher!
Good Professor, homework reflected lectures and exams reflected homework. Learned a lot in this class and the lectures were nice.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Just an awesome guy. The class was pretty difficult, but the homework and design problems are harder than the exams. In all the classes I've taken with him the lectures are recorded with echo360 and a tracking camera so you can always see what he's writing real time. The design problems can be a pain but they prepare you well for his exams.

Good professor but definitely a hard class. Only take this if you are going into ECE. Super caring and checks in with students often to make sure everyone is doing well. If you're not going into ECE but want a science requirement, just take 2010.
Amazing professor and explains everything very well
Awesome Professor.

Professor Noetscher is one of the best and most caring professors, and people, I have ever met at WPI. He absolutely always made time to help everyone that needed help. Exams are weekly(same structure as other 2010 classes). Homework is optional, but I really recommend doing it. I really hope I can get him again as a professor in the future.
Definitely the best lab professor to take for the intro chem classes.

Most amazing lab teacher. Unlike all other lab teachers, he goes through all of the procedures and tells you everything to do. He is so sweet and helpful too. He is not a tough grader if you put in effort. Would def recommend

I freakin loved having Professor Mardilovich. He cares about each and every student, and I respect him for that. He has a great progression, allowing us to get a feel for everything and all the equipment while also making sure our time is worthwhile. We got to preform plenty of amazing lab experiments. The passionate student will love his class.

Very kind and soft-spoken; will try to answer your questions but always says something completely unrelated so he is not at all helpful. Most students tended to rely on the TA for questions and help and not him. Not a tough grader and as long as you do all the work you should get a very good grade.

He was so much better than my CH1010 lab instructor. He helped us build the procedure and balance equations. He was a good grader of pre and post-labs, not too nit-picky. He tended to hang around a little too much when you didn't need his help anymore, but overall, extremely helpful and caring towards his students.

Mardilovich is the man. I had Chem 1010 Lab with him and had terrible pre and post lab assignment but still managed to get good grades. He will give you a good grade if you put in some effort. Take him over other lab professors!!! Hilarious guy and will help you understand the material. English isn't his thing but it isn't a lecture, legend.

Ivan is perhaps the funniest and most caring lab instructor at Wpi. He is beaming with enthusiasm, and although he has a thick accent, you'll be sure to put it aside the first time he says "Merry Christmas" when giving a handout to each group. A legend and a gem.
Had him for CH 1010 lab. Very, very nice man who really just wants to help you learn. Even when I flooded my lab station he just smiled and laughed instead of scolding me or docking me safety points.
I had Ivan for CH 1020 Labs and he was the best. Yes difficult to understand some times, but be patient and he answers all questions.
The best ever instructor

Worst instructure ever. Just because I forget to prepare for the lab, he tole me: "please, bring your head to the lab next time." with pure Russian accent. I have never heard such words from any professor. Please Please Please dpn't let me go to his class, and please wash your mouth everyday :))
The attendance was mandatory and he is not very good at explaining things. He is not quite helpful outside of classes.

Stay away if you can. Somehow with being online and on zoom for over a year, this man has still refused to buy a quality mic so it is near impossible to hear him. VERY boring lectures. The website we used, Zybooks, was where we did EVERYTHING and it didn't teach you a lot of the stuff needed to actually do the work. non-perfect codebad/no grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I spent 3 to 5 hours each day on that course. Besides, any homework over deadline is not acceptable.

He expected you to spend more than 20 hours per week on learning python. Homework is challenging; however, his quizzes are easier than homework but still not that easy. There is a few PLA comparing to amounts of students who struggle with their homework. So, you don't get much help from them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Without a doubt, the worst professor I have had at WPI and likely will ever have. You are buried in homework and quizzes obliterate your grade. Boring lectures, no encouragement of class participation, and is extremely degrading if you approach him about your concerns. For the love of all that is holy, avoid at all costs.

Professor Loi is disrespectful and expects to much from his students. His homework are extremely hard and he deosn't teach any of the material. He takes no credibility for his actions. Do not take this class if at all possible.

Loi relentlessly assigns HW and participation activities due every 12 hours on this useless website Zybooks. The assignments are auto graded; if your code does not match his exactly, you wont get credit. The quizzes are disasterous, and graded very strictly. Most non-majors will pass this class, but you will certainly not enjoy a single second.

CS 1004 is such an easy class that I didn't realize until like the 4th week that Hao Loi doesn't teach anything. Once the material started getting a little harder, it became apparent how lost he gets in lecture. I'd recommend the class for anyone looking to try out CS, but I feel like I would've gotten a lot more out of it with another professor.

Prof. Loi's class was rather easy. The most challenging part of the class was the homework. The quizzes were easy and the final test was easy. You get alot of help for the homework if you ask for help. Don't be lazy. I learned through practice with the homework more than the lecture. His lectures help a tiny bit. He is a very nice guy.

First I'll say is that my class was Prof. Loi's first at WPI (C Term 2016), so he could have gotten better.  That being said, I did not learn anything in CS1004.  1 quiz+1 HW every week, partners for homework and open internet, book, notes for quizzes. I spent under 5 hours every week outside of lecture. I have a 99% in this class, learned nothing.

He loves clickers and we use them for participation everyday. Which does effect your grade. Quizes every week and homework every week. He doesn't really teach and makes a lot of mistakes on his homework assignments and powerpoint presentations. Lectures are on lecture capture. Choose a different professor if you are able to.

OK, this teacher only grades 2 things: exams and homework. the day before the exam he does a review session where he does every problem that is going to be on the test, so those are super easy. the homework is a little hard but if you write down everything he writes in lectures you should be golden to get an A.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I like Hyungbin's teaching. You have to be concentrated in class else you cannot keep pace with the material. In MA572 It involves A LOT of calculation and tricky techniques, and if you can figure those out you'll probably feel very good. He helped students a lot while I don't quite agree because students need to think more independently.
Budgets course time very poorly.  Rushed through last units so he could spend last few lectures talking about nothing.  No review at all before the big exams.

Even though Hyungbin's soft voice makes it difficult to hear sometimes, he is generally a good professor. He is very organized, well-prepared and enthusiastic in teaching. If you don't get the lecture, you can go to his office hour, and he'll explain everything in a clear way. He also posts notes online, which are super organized & easy to follow
Fair grader. Homeworks could be unreasonably tough, but the exams were okay. Notes are posted online and are very organize, but he does more examples in class which is helpful.
Homework is tough, but he is a fair grader and a great guy! As long as you do the homework and study hard, you'll be just fine. An 80% is an A usually so don't worry about NR-ing...

A really sweet guy, but not a very good lecturer. He is very soft-spoken, so I recommend sitting near the front so you can hear him during class. He doesn't use the book at all, so you can't really get away with not going to class. The homework was brutally difficult, but grading was fair & the tests were usually fairly close to the practice exams.

The Homework given can get really hard, but it really allows you to learn the topics well. The exams didn't seem too difficult compared to the homework. He posts lecture notes online before the lecture, and they're really helpful. Takes a little time to get used to him, but he's a great professor.

There is a lot of homework and the homework is hard but it is worth it; the exams are based on the homework so you will always feel prepared for each exam. Also, he's a fairly easy grader (more than 60% of the class got As) so don't worry about failing. Great guy overall, if only he'd teach all my classes.

He tries really hard, but being a first year teacher, he was not very organized. He is soft spoken and difficult to understand. The homework is really difficult, but the test are easier. He puts the notes online ahead of class. Overall, he was okay.

Hyungbin (he likes to be referred to as Hyungbin) started off not very well as a lecturer, but now he's pretty good. His lecture notes (which are posted a day before each lecture) are amazing and his office hours are very flexible. On the exam, the question you got the lowest score in isn't counted, so if you're decent at math, you'll get an A.
I learned absolutely nothing, just a waste of time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Really Really good lectures and the projects are fun and interesting and always have a satisfying end result. Highly highly recommend
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Incredibly smart and a great explainer. This class pushed me to my limits, but I learned so much that it was worth it. He knows what he's doing and he does it well. He also has a great, dry sense of humor.

Lecture heavy, but you covers the material needed for the homework in depth. I only wished he gave more study material for the tests. They weren't too different than the homework, but one question on the final caught me off-guard.

Whitehill is such a great teacher! I learned so much, not just about data structures in CS, but also about good programming tips in general. It's a challenging course, but when you make it out on the other end, you'll be glad you took it.
Lectures and homework assignments are unrelated. Many confusing things.

Professor Whitehill is an amazing professor. He always managed to make class fun and interesting by making jokes, or showing us some cool topic that wasn't always related to what we were learning. He was always available for help and made sure his students knew what they were doing.

Whitehill is an amazing professor. I'm in his accelerated course -- he moves quickly and assumes a lot of prior knowledge. He keeps you on your toes, and there's never a boring moment in his class. The homework is very challenging, but also interesting and fun. He has a great sense of humor, he often has the whole class laughing! Also, NO TEXTBOOK!

Really smart and kind guy with a decent sense of humor. In terms of teaching he can get a little carried away with some assumptions of your past knowledge, but mostly because he doesn't have time. The only grade is 7 homework assignments that are short amounts of highly complex code. Expect to spend a lot of time on them.

There's around one project a week that you can work on with one partner, one midterm, and one final. It's a tough course, but Whitehill is a great professor who organizes his TAs well. They provide an up-to-date schedule of who will be available when and where, and can always meet outside those office hours. Also I think Whitehill is an immortal
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing Professor! Knows his stuff and teaches in such a great way. Whitehill really cares about his students and will remember your name. This class was difficult and project heavy, with one midterm and one final. Although it was tough, it was so worth it. He explains material really well and clearly has a solid grasp on what he is teaching.

Fahad is one of the best TA's I have had so far. He is always willing to help and is very clear in his explanations. He helps you even in contents for other classes. Regarding grading, he is extremely fair and awards students many points for their effort. I would definitely recommend having him!
Very cooperative  TA.  He is also very patient with the students during the office hour.  Provides feedback on homework and quizzes.
Very helpful, only reason I passed the class

Very easy to talk to. Very good at talking you though a problem logically and showing you where your logic and math do or do not match up. He will sometimes need a second opinion on which equations need to be used,but he knows exactly when this is necessary and will say so.

Very helpful. He can easily talk you though a problem and help you find areas were your logic does or doesnt match up with the mathematics. Though sometimes it is necessary to get a second opinion, if it is he often will say so.

He is extremely organized, reliable, and proficient at connecting with students and explaining advanced topics. Fahad accomplishes these tasks adeptly and with a positive attitude.  It was a pleasure to have Fahad as my TA. I learned many skills through his instruction and he has been excellent mentor both in and outside the classroom.

Great TA, great guy. Very knowledgeable, personable, and willing to help. Conveys material in easily understandable way and supports explanations with applicable examples. If you have him for a TA, you are in good hands.
Very good TA. He explains the material well.
Chill guy, knows the material, very helpful.
Helpful and responsive TA.
Helpful
Absolute G, will clear up any issues if you just go to his office hours
Binan is very open to helping students, homeworks could be a little tough but exams were very similar to assignments

He should teach Theoretical Calc 3 rather than normal Calc 3. Lectures were more on the proof of the concepts rather than the applications. Homeworks were not even practice, they were more deep-thinking solving which I understand is good, but really unhelpful when it came to studying for the exam. Don't take unless you want a hard class.
Exams are very difficult. Take advantage of homework corrections, as it may save your grade. While the content of the course is already very difficult, the explanations are not very clear.

Professor Gu is a great guy, I'll give him that.  He's just an OK professor though.  You can tell he cared, and would very carefully explain topics if you specifically ask.  Homework and exams are fairly evenly balanced, and the exams are based off of homework.  Make sure you understand ALL concepts, because he will test you on every little thing.

He's very passionate about what he teaches, which helps make the lectures engaging. He focuses on the why and on examples. He's a harsh grader, but purposely makes hw a significant part of the grade, so even if you tank the tests, you can still get a good grade in the class as long as you try on the hw.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor was extremely tough and unnecessarily hard. The lectures were all theory and were hard to understand and the tests were too long for the amount of time. For perspective, the class average on the first test was just over 60%.
Very passionate, emails back quick and is willing to meet outside of class

Sure, calculus is complicated, but if there's anyone that you want in your corner, it's Gu. He's an Amateur Golfer with a handicap of 8, a classical pianist with repertoires in Mozart & Beethoven, and a goated prof. He wants you to pass his class and is passionate about encouraging students' intuitions. If you can take one of his classes, take it.

I really liked Professor Gu. He is very smart and well-spoken, this is great because he can explain a concept multiple ways if you do not understand one. He cares about his students. Attend class, try to participate and see him for help if needed and you'll do great. Calc IV can be hard, but he made me like this class.

Had him B22 and he's a very likeable guy. It was his first year here but you wouldn't be able to tell if he didn't mention it. He lowered the grade thresholds throughout the term. His homeworks can be tedious but they are in web work with unlimited attempts. His exams aren't that bad either, but they are worth 80% of your grade total, so study up.

Couldn't read his handwriting, made no sense in class, and made no logical sense in his presentation of the material. Its an easy A but you wont learn anything so if this is being used as a pre-req for a later class avoid Gagnon otherwise go ahead he was wicked easy

Fast-paced, great lectures. Teaches exactly what you need. Doesn't bore you to sleep like half the professors in the school. The class is very easy and the two hour labs can be completed in no time. take a class with him if you can.

Think overall this rating for his is a little low.  I like him a fair bit.  He really teaches the useful stuff and will show you how to apply it.  Definitely better than any other probability professor here.  TAKE THE CLASS WITH HIM.

I don't really know if he was good or bad... I feel like he taught the material terrible and I have not learned much but I have a 98 in the class.  His lectures hardly help and his hand writing is pretty bad so taking notes can be a challenge.  The book didn't help at all...

Possibly the worst professor at WPI. He explains nothing, only throws up random theory on the board. Final grade of 89.4 with no scaling? You're not getting an A. You will have to teach yourself most of the course as he explains almost nothing. After class almost everyone could be heard saying "Who knows what's going on?"

Statistics. Super boring, and requires use of textbook for tables. Only shows formulas and simplistic explanations, but all quizzes are open notes. Uses SAS (a really horrible statistical analysis program) for labs. Also uses Java applets that run on Scratch (graphical teaching language) and don't play nice with Linux
He created a number of applets to help students study statistics better.
Super nice and awesome, I love the way he struts around the front of the classroom, he gives off an air of confidence that makes me inspired to learn. Take a class with him!

This class is great. I always look forward to taking a class with Dr. Jake. His classes are to the point, difficult when you don't go to class or catch up on the missed work or fall asleep all the time - but if you practice problems, you'll be fine. Every example is about LCD panels, zombies, angry birds, and Felicia with her darts&arrows.

Doctor Gagnon is great! He really cares about his students. Sometimes his explanations can be confusing and the teaches off of a powerpoint. His quizzes and tests are pretty easy though and it's not hard to get a good grade. If you can take a statistics class with him, you definitely should!
Super easy class!Free A+

I loved this class. Professor Heaton genuinely cares about all of his students. Despite having this class only two times a week for 1.5 hours each online, I learned tons (the way he ran the online class was fantastic). He obviously knows the material so well. However, beware of the midterm (40% of your grade). I totally recommend Professor Heaton!
Heaton is brilliant and cares about his subject matter and students. His lectures were interesting and the syllabus was reasonable. He's a really nice guy I loved his class

Very interesting class. I was scared for the 2 hour lecture but it wasn't boring at all. It's pretty dynamic and class is planned regarding what the students are interested  in. You have to write two papers but they aren't hard and you sorta pick the topic. He isn't that tough of a grader. I didn't even study for the midterm and got a B on the test

AMAZING PROFESSOR! Very easy class if you participate and put your time into the papers. He went to Law school and has a very well informed and interesting point of view. NEVER thought class was boring!

Clearly loved the topic. Great guy. Lectures were interesting and informative. But the midterm was terrible...based upon memorization of figures rather than concepts. Worth too much compared to final paper.
Awesome professor. Class was always fun and entertaining. Easy yet I learned a lot. HIGHLY recommended.

I currently have Professor Heaton for Environmental Policy and Law and he is definitely my favorite professor so far.  If you go to lecture and take notes, he covers all the material you need, clearly.  You will definitely learn a lot from him.  He is also a very nice professor and his class isn't that hard,  as long as you put forth effort.

This guy is great! Very helpful and very friendly. I always wanted to stay after class and talk to him some more... and this was a two hour class! Overall he is an excellent professor and I highly recommend taking a class from him.

one of the best professors i've ever had.  very helpful, always finds the positive aspect of any student's work.  makes everyone feel like they did a great job while providing constructive criticism when needed.

He is the best proffessor very clear about expectations and very helpful in the class. Made class enjoyable for all, everyone learned a ton of information. He really knows what he's talking about, if you want to learn about law this is the man to see.
No Comments

Grading was harsh and often questions I asked during labs would go unanswered. It wasn't always clear what was expected of me. Compared to others who had different lab professors, this lab professor graded much stricter and was unable to help with any challenges that came with working in randomly assigned groups.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Too harsh for a non-major chem class. Very nitpicky, do not take at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Had him C23 and now that lab is over, oh boy. Let's start with the fact that he cares more about tracking how late students are to lab CUMULATIVELY over the term (not just one lab) than getting up to help kids. His grading is tough and he takes off points for silly reasons. CH 1010 is very annoying anyways but he makes the labs that much worse.

RUN, he is disrespectful, inflexible, and immobile. All major lab reports were due the day before exams, he received over a hundred emails for an extension and did not care. He will NEVER get up to help you even when the equipment was broken and chemicals would run out.

He gives vague answers to questions, and doesn't go into the background on how or why experiments were being done. If you need an extension just ask, but not more than once. Never skip class or you will have to N/R. He is a tough grader for pre/post labs but as long as you do them and keep your lecture grade up you'll be okay.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: He forces students to follow certain unnecessary procedures during lab, which is very stressful as there is only a limited amount of time. When students need help, he does not help direct the student in the right direction, but just offers vague statements unrelated to the question itself.

He picks out the most random details in our lab writing and takes an unjustified amount of points off for them. The way he grades assignments is so specific that there is no room for creativity and he is very closed minded when it comes to others' opinions.

He graded assignments very harshly and provided the most vague feedback, and did not help students improve their lab skills throughout the course. He refused to help students work out lab partner issues, and gave some students grades that were unjustified given the amount of time and effort they put into the lab writing portion.

Even for CH1010, he graded the strictest of all chem lab instructors and gave no feedback. Lab mostly stressful because of him. Choose any other lab instructor. An A is doable for 1010, but you'll need to spend a lot of nights on the lab reports. Upperclassmen who have taken chem will give good advice, so reach out. Good luck.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Worst Professor I have had at WPI. Do whatever you can to not have him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: By far the worst Lab prof I have had at WPI. He doesnt care about any of his students and will never give anyone an extension, even for valid reasons. Good luck if your partners dont help you because he could care less. You will do all the work yourself and he will grade just as harshly. He also sits in the corner of the room and never helps.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Ram is a tough professor, but the things he teaches are much more than basic Physics. He is also incredibly flexible with deadlines, and many times pushed homework back by as much as a week. If you are willing to put in the work reading outside of class, it could be very valuable.

You will not learn the course material from lecture. All Ram talks about is his research even if it is entirely different from the course material. He claims he discusses it to relate the course material to the real world but this is never the case. I would recommend avoiding.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Homework, assignments, textbook, and midterm all were very straight forward and werent too much to handle. However, lectures were boring and the final was a DRASTIC change from past assignments/the midterm (beware).

Lectures rarely made any sense at all. I had to learn from the book and was greatly helped by taking BVPs concurrently. He frequently gets mixed up, and you have to confer with the other students to confirm that he's wrong. Make sure you start the homework long before it's due. If you go to his office he tries to recruit you for his lab and MQPs.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Only take quantum with him if you already know quantum. It often took several lectures before he explained the point behind the sprawling derivations he would cover the board with, and he did not actually define all of the notations introduced in the course. I had to teach myself far too much of this course. Run. Run like Cthulhu is chasing you.
Have had him for E&M 1, 2 and Quantum 1. Is terrible. Only passed because of the TA.
No Comments
Dude, at least learn to spell 'boring'
A little difficult to understand his accent, and pretty boaring.

Conference teacher in PH1110. He's kind of hard to follow and very boring. He started assigning sample tests as homework which kind of sucks. He knows what he's talking about but I don't think he's very good at expressing it.
