Very willing to invest time in individuals.  He's tough and moves fast, but knows what he's talking about.  He's helpful and will explain things from the ground up.  Excellent project advisor.

I don't think I have met professor quite as smart and passionate about literature as Professor Jim. A consequence of that is that you have to actually put in the work to receive a good grade, not easy to BS. But he does gives great feedback on every entry of every student, and his office hours are very useful. Kind professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Very unprofessional. This professor exhibited homophobic and racist behavior and gaslit me when I tried to talk to him about it by saying I was the only one who felt his behavior was inappropriate when almost half the class expressed discomfort. He also said he cant distinguish tone over text which is bad considering he's an English professor.

Took his Americana class over D-term online, used only Canvas chat for class. Overall a very interesting class and a very enthusiastic teacher. Not too much work but make sure to skim the readings before class. Would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took Jim's (he prefers Jim over Professor) Film Studies class. He is a masterful lecturer who instills and provokes thought in every sentence he composes. His skill and compassion for his students is apparent. Accessible outside of class. Also, he doesn't give numerical grades so be ready for that transition.

Best writing class I ever took was Cocola's Advanced Creative Writing (EN3219). It was an easy A (if you like writing) and was a lot of fun to participate in. Really got my brain working in different ways and was a nice break from math and physics. Fantastic professor.
Must do really well in all aspects of the course to do well.

Prof. Cocola respects his students as intellectuals. HU1411. a class where participation is 1/3 of your grade, was a really easy environment to participate an speak in. Effort is key with this professor.

Class discussions were very relevant to the reading and he tried to make class interesting by having the students lead discussion. Interested in the material he is teaching and was a good professor to have.
Pretends to understand engineering and those involved in engineering, when in reality he has no clue how we work... And this results in poor IQP scores for those who have a science based IQPs
great guy, very clear and pretty modern. picky about essay topics though, obssessed with arguments that are "contestable and compelling"
Very good Professor. Laid back and takes an interest in his students. Must work and participate in class to get an A, but totally doable.
Professor Zhu's course covers a broad variety of concepts that you learn over your time as an IE major. Interesting and not too hard.
Dr. J's course is a very good recap of most other IE classes and his projects are very useful.
Fine
Talks in circles, does not answer questions. Makes very easy material a lot more diffcult than it has to be.

As an IE major, I had to take this class. I didn't learn much, it was sort of review for everything up to this point. I became VERY disappointed however, as this is now a week after I submitted my final, and I STILL don't have a grade for the class/final, even though grades were due last week.

Worst prof I've ever had at WPI...can't understand a thing he says...not only confuses us but confuses himself.  Extremely easy material but learned NOTHING from this guy...avoid his classes if you can

I really wanted to learn in this class.  We haven't learned anything.  His powerpoints suck because he often leaves out key information so you have to copy it down in class.  What a pain!  Yes the class is easy, but if you actually want to learn something, then avoid this prof.
The worst prof in WPI
His accent is terrible.  I have no idea how he can talk for two hours about Excel, but he manages somehow.
Taught with enthusiasm even though the material was fairly mundane. Very encouraging to students.
MG2500=Excel: too easy, or is it just me?

Her teaching style in class was good, she posted notes far before class and then annotated the notes during class with explanations, the annotated notes were posted after class. Quizzes and tests were announced well before hand and grading of assignments was fair.
Basically just read over her already written notes, so lectures were not much help. Definitely go to the Math Tutoring Center and MASH for help.
If you don't come into the class with a prior understanding of the subject, the class will be hard. The grade is entirely dependent on tests.

Although the class was heavily dependent on three tests worth 85% of the grade, I thought that she was able to clearly and effectively teach the material of the course, and I learned a lot more from this class than my teacher in high school. Definitely a solid choice for a professor in my opinion.

A great professor who always explained everything clearly. The class is very test and quiz heavy, but she assigns lots of practice problems. Assessment problems are also taken directly from practice problems so be sure to complete all of the problems. Tests also have extra credit problems that really help your grade.

This is the worst class that I have ever taken. I took AP Calc in High School, and got an A over the same material. I took the class again, hoping for an easy transition to college, but this was definitely not it. The examples given were just formulas, and everything was explained poorly. MASH was way more helpful in teaching me what I needed.

Overall a greatprofessor. The course is very test heavy ( 2 midterms is 60%, final exam is 25%, weekly quizzes are 15%, and lab is 5%). However, she assigns weekly practice problems which are the exact same as exams. I always felt prepared and has plenty of study time for this class cause no homework. Exams are out of 120%, so room for extra credit
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: My grade was basically determined by 3 tests, 2 midterms and one final (80%). Lot's of studying has to be done in your own time. The practice problems for homework are a good representation of quizzes and tests. I never understood a single one of her lectures, go to office hours if you can.

She knows the material, but doesn't teach it well. Her lectures consist of over-explaining the simple stuff and barely mentioning the things we actually need to learn. Quizzes are only 3 questions and the only things that count for credit (there's no homework. At all. Labs are 5%). And on a gen-ed class? No thanks...

Professor Wu is the best math instructor I have ever had! She is super intelligent and able to explain abstract concepts very well! Homework helps understanding the material and exams are reasonable. Unlike some teachers with odd grading criteria (quizzes or exams only), prof wu grades fairly.

Wu was a new prof when I had her for Calc 2. She's clearly very intelligent and knows her stuff, just not how to teach. Graded 80% on three tests. Lectures were basically worthless as she only gave definitions and did problems but didn't really explain how. Material isn't actually that bad but I had no prior and taught myself the whole curriculum.
Lot of material, but take home tests. Youll be okay
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Respected

comment: Ive never had a professor that cared more about his students learning the material than him. He is always ready to be in the labs to help almost 24/7. His instructions are very clear and he lets you encourages practice and mistakes. Lab reports are heavy workload and it is a time commitment but you get so much out of it. + the PLAs are amazing!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: The course was extremely unorganized, and procedures often wouldn't be prepared for the day of lab. The PLAs who graded this course were extremely strict, and grading was often unfair as expectations differed between PLAs and the professor. The course required too much out of lab time, and the labs were often crowded and not following COVID guides.

I have taken both courses with Ambady and he is one of my favorites at WPI. His interest in helping students learn has been by far the most out of any, and he has always stimulated my interest in any course he teaches. You can tell he really cares and wants students to learn. I have learned so much from both of his courses.

Professor Ambady is the best professors at WPI. He is so caring, and anyone would be lucky to take a course with him. He doesnt assume any prior lab knowledge, making sure that everyone knows what theyre doing. He has made the course so that you feel confident in your abilities, but also not afraid to make mistakes. He has helped me so much.

Professor Ambady made himself very accessible outside of labs and lectures. He had a genuine desire to teach us meaningful skills that can be marketed to job recruiters. Although his instructions were generally pretty vague, he welcomed any and all questions and never made you feel bad for getting something wrong or doing something wrong,

There were 3 take home exams. Had three nights usually to complete these exams. Exams are hard but can get a good grade if spend a lot of time on them. Attendance factors into grade (takes attendance almost everyday by signing a sheet). Lab reports take a lot of time but not too hard (work in a group of 3)

Very interesting lectures. He is extremely helpful when you go to him. Testsquizzes are hard and cover all the material in the textbook and the lecture slides. You need to study A LOT to do well. Overall learned a lot from this class.

If you are a BME, this man should be your God. Hes going to make you work, and it will make you the better for it. If you coast youll get a b, but if you try hard and study you'll do well. Ask him for help, and he might be too busy but if you catch him at the right time, he will make your life so much easier. Do the work, get an A.

His accent does make him a little bit difficult to understand but his lectures are very informative. He is tremendously helpful during the labs. He does not, however, do a very good job of conveying what he expects as far as lab reports or homeworks. His quizzes are very easy though he always makes sure to cover exactly what he asks.

He is very hard to understand in class with his accent and he goes through the material entirely too fast. His quizzes are more like tests and he doesn't tell you what to study prior to the quizzes. They quizzes were very hard. He was helpful during lab, but didn't give guidance in writing lab reports at all. Overall, he is a bad professor.

Can be hard to follow as he does everything fast, however he explains things in a very understandable way and will go back through anything if anyone doesn't get it. He was very nice. He made sure the focus wasn't on grades. Very understanding and overall just looked for students' success.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: I had no real idea what was going on, but the professor was nice enough.

An amazing professor, really takes care that the students understand what he is explaining. The homework is time consuming, and the tests are very difficult but it does appear that he scales at the end of the class. Worth the hard work.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: One of the best physics professors. Material is difficult but he does his best to help everyone understand it and gives good explanations.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is the best physics professor in WPI.
Best physics teacher I've ever had! He is really helpful and always there when you need him! He is very excited about he does too! Totally a teacher everyone should consider!
Above average professor. Is more than willing to help his students and does his best to clearly explain all material.

Prof. Tuzel is very helpful teacher who can offer you great help. His homework and test are moderate, but he do try to make sure everyone in his class understand the material. He speaks pretty fast sometimes, but he is overall pretty clear.
Excellent teacher, very passionate about physics and does a great job helping students learn. My favorite teacher at WPI.
He teaches higher level concepts with very low level examples.  This provides an easy link between the material and the real world.  Lots of useful videos and demonstrations with applets.
Explains things very clearly and sincerely wants students to learn. Will go out of his way to help in any way he can. Highly recommended!
This class was easy going and very relaxed. Very few assignments but attendance was required. Nice guy who wanted everyone to learn.

Elmes was an all around a good professor. His assignments were fairly graded and I found the subject interesting.  Lectures were made more lively with engaging activities that helped us apply the concepts we learned about. We did a group paper that had extremely vague instructions but turned out well in the end. I'd gladly take his class again.

I really enjoyed this class. He's a great guy and as long as you show interest and actually put in the effort, you will pass with an A. Some of his assignments are odd, but in fact I actually learned  a lot about myself and he really tried hard to get you to think about who you want to be and what makes you a good leader; which is incredibly useful

I personally liked Professor Elmes, he was a genuinely nice guy who definitely helped explain the concepts brought up in the class. I must say that the subject matter did not interest me and it was not intellectually challenging, but he did his best to engage the class and promote a learning environment.
Took a class with him as an exchange student in 2001. It was inspiring and I learned for life. Very deliberate, empathetic and trustworthy character. Thanks for this experience.
Great exercises and activities. Very stimulating. Let's us take responsibility for our learning. Highly recommended!
Somewhat boring but a really good teacher.
Rigorous course, demanding assignments!
This guy's hilarious. lots of interesting videos to get points across, group activity examples. uses metaphors to convey topics, which takes some getting used to at first, but effective.
He's a great professor.  Very clear expectations, fair.  Able to integrate a lot of stuff together.  Pleasant & professional. Refreshing class.
Excellent
Raul is absolutely awesome! Such a funny guy, is extremely caring of students, and really wants to help you learn. Please take this class with him if you can! You will not be dissapointed

Absolutely amazing professor, like literally what a guy. Even in a big 80 person lecture he still tried his best to learn as many names as possible and talk to everyone. When I forgot to do the final HW assignment, he emailed me personally AFTER THE TERM ENDED to remind me and lmk he gave me an extension. Like what a guy to care during break.

Raul is the best professor I have had so far. He consistently has helpful office hours, gives a lot of extra credit, and cares about you. He wants to know who you are outside of academics and help you succeed in his class. His lectures are always engaging. I didn't think I would do well in Chemistry, but he made it worth it. Take CH with Raul!

Let me preface that I came to WPI with an open mind on what I want to do. First term taking chemistry made me realize I despise chemistry. HOWEVER this man made it bearable. Great lectures, he moves real fast so you have to stay focused but he is young and engaging and funny. very accommodating as well, gives extensions and extra credit. 10/10 prof

This man made me understand and even sometimes enjoy chemistry. Tons of extra credit, gives great cover page on exams and lets you have a cheat notecard. Super energetic and kind, he learned my name after one conversation. His office hours were also fantastic. If you have the chance to take his class, 10/10 recommend.
If you are thinking of taking his class, just do it! Awesome professor and lots of extra credit

Overall a great professor! He puts in lots of effort to make sure students are able to succeed in the course. There's lots of extra credit on exams (sometimes I could receive over 15% extra credit) and exams were very similar to practice problems we did in class. Lectures were engaging and helpful.
Best professor I've had so far; lectures were very clear and easy to follow. Had wednesdays dedicated to solving problems, which were very helpful for exams. Allowed

Best professor I've ever had. Made me want to get out of bed for his 8a.m. lectures. Cares about his students a lot, truly loves to teach, really funny lectures as well, actually tried to scare me while I was dozing off. If you're taking CH1010, TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.

Professor Raul is so funny and caring! I find his lectures very clear and coherent. He gives extra credit problems for all of his exams, there's office hours every week and he responds to emails in a very kind and timely manner.  Professor Raul wants everyone in his class to succeed and it shows, highly recommend him for chem!
He slays

Very personable and clear professor. Great energy and great knowledge of concepts. He is willing to elaborate on higher concepts if asked, but he never relishes on un-important topics. Great, clear, and passionate.

Prof. Medich was a fun and charismatic professor that made each class a joy to go to. Although EM Fields is a rather difficult course, his notes and teaching style made it very digestible when it came to it. He's very easy to schedule appointments with, and is very caring when it comes to timing and extensions on assignments and exams. Have fun!!

Prof Medich is a top-notch professor; extremely clear teaching for difficult material, it makes a massive difference to the learning experience. I found myself having a ton of "a-ha!" moments during his class as he filled in the blanks left from previous instruction. Personality is great: friendly, funny, just overall super pleasant professor.

He is consistently thoughtful in how he assigns homework and lectures and how much of your time he takes up. E&M is a hard class, but Medich puts in a lot of work to make sure students get the guidance they need.

His notes are online, his lectures are helpful, he lets you out early on Fridays. His tests were often word-for-word the practice test or conference problems, so make sure you do those. He made physics fun and easy.
Clearly knows what he's talking about. You can tell he tries his best to connect with the students. Always willing to stop class to answer questions and clarify uncertainties.

Prof Medich was a great teacher who really cared about you learning the material. He tried to keep lectures interesting by briefly teaching us about real life applications of the things we were learning. He would sit with you for a long time in office hours to help you out. Homework load was definitely manageable. Practice exams were gold

Dave was a great lecturer. This is because he organizes and presents his powerpoints well. He also provides great practice tests and study guide questions. Homework is online but there's no points deducted for wrong answers. He also have a extra credit assignment (which was basically a normal homework) worth +10 points on our lowest test.

Dave Medich is a true gem of a professor. He doesn't teach many classes at WPI because he is so busy, but when he steps into a classroom you know you are going to have a good term. His passion for the material is apparent in his perfectly organized lecture notes, and he will answer any questions you have as fully as possible. Available after class.

This guy loves his subject matter.  That makes for better lectures.  Normal amount of work to do.  Not sure how this style would work online but good offline-only class experience.  Not for the shy.  I suggest that you appreciate the course content else take a different class.

Know him as a conference instructor. I was struggling a great deal with E&M and I decided to visit him. Greatest decision I made. He is dedicated on making sure you learn the material. While his conferences were good, 1-on-1 were much better. I passed the class because of him and his assistance. Highly recommend him if you can get him
Most approachable professor I have ever had at this university. His primary goal is to get you to understand the material and he will sit with you for hours if necessary. He truly wants you to learn.
Geoffrey Pfeifer is a great professor. Great memories of Intro to Philosophy with him.

Amazing Professor. You can tell he cares about the things he teaches. We did have multiple readings a week but they were offered through Perusall which was free. Attendance wasn't necessarily mandatory but participation was important so it made a difference. Professor Pfeifer was always accessible outside of class. Definitely recommend !
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: One of my favorite teachers at WPI so far. Professor Pfeifer is very knowledgeable regarding current events in the real world and their relation to course content, which makes open conversations among the class very interesting.
Prof Pfeifer is one of the best professors I've had at WPI. He is caring, understanding and a great lecturer.

very good guy. class may be kind of boring sometimes, but the content in his classes are interesting and I feel like I genuinely learned something useful in the course. he is very nice and understanding and gives good feedback and grades that reflect learning.
Really nice guy and makes his class really interesting. Will take another course with him for sure. Work is very clear and manageable.

Really liked his class. Although there was a lot of reading assigned, the readings were incredibly interesting and during the lectures, he made sure they are clear to everybody. Definitely would take him again for any philosophy class. Very clear criteria for the essays.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--Amazing lectures

comment: I had him for introduction to philosophy and religion. He was such a good teacher. There are alot of long readings but he gives you time. Grades are mostly disucssion posts and a couple essays. He's fair with his grading if you put clear effort in. He gives okay feedback on essays. No tests, great professor.

He was one of the profs for my GPS: Biosphere, Atmosphere, and Human Fears. He is a cool person and an interesting lecturer. His passion for philosophy definitely showed when he talked about ethics and our relationship to the planet. A lot of papers were assigned but grading was fair.

Prof Pfeifer is amazing, he makes tough philosophical concepts and readings make sense, plus, hes funny! He provides the texts for reading, so you dont have to buy anything. Theres a lot of writing, but thats just how philosophy is. He is one of the best humanities profs, definitely take a class with him, even if its just a breadth

This class is an introduction to philosophy. He is not that strict when it come to grading. You will read  a lot and the material is really interesting.  It can  change your outlook on life.  I can  easily recommend taking any course he teaches.

Excellent professor! I loved the lectures and the way she integrated related concepts and used diagrams. The lack of a textbook was also a big plus because it was easier to learn information (at least for me). Overall I learned a lot of information that is going to stick with me and had a lot of fun!
Very difficult class, relying a lot on memorization. Large curve, but she gives out few A's.

Curves UP so that only a certain number of students will get an A, so you pretty much have no idea what you're getting for a grade until the end of the class. Doesn't typically seem fully prepared for class, which makes it hard to sit through, and she usually only has one way of explaining something.
This class had interesting material but she made it much harder than it should have been for a 2000 level class. Just straight memorization of tons of long medical words

FAR more difficult than most other 2000 levels classes at WPI. Grades on a comparative scale with grade cutoffs not clearly defined. Not interested in helping students. Attendance not mandatory. Tests are very eclectic in composition. Overall good amount learned but would not recommend.

She's good looking and locks the office door ;-) Very nice, genuinely wants you to learn the material. Knows her stuff. DON'T WEAR RED IF YOU'RE SHY! She'll call on you a lot! Get to know her and your grade will be better. She mixes up textbook and power point slides so you need to go to class to keep up. Tough exams but very fair grading.
tough exams. definitely not a blow off class

Her lectures and very hard to understand. She skips around a lot and uses slideshows that usually don't make any sense. The lectures are useless and most of the material on the exams is only in the textbook.
Rather easy lecture. lots of slideshows. assessments are on the easy side, but listen in lectures, she will test on little things that she mentions  even only once in a lecture
No Comments

If you understand the material it should be a fine class. BUT. His ppts and what he says in class are different. If you are able to listen to what he says and copy slides at the same time you will be fine. His tests are nothing like homework- he really challenges you with real-life questions. He is always willing to help you though.
Pretty easy class, he's very interested in helping students. Just make sure you study for the test and you'll be fine. Also a group project and homeworks.

and CE 3061, easy easy easy easy. He's good at explaining things, but this should be a 1000 level class. I'm a chem eng, and took this as a sophomore. I did 2 hours of homework each term and had no concerns about getting an A.
Took water and waste waste water treatment...SO easy. Open book tests, only 2-3 HW's per term. Easy A.
Extremely helpful teacher, always more than willing to tend to your needs.  Great Guy...
Very scientific and very good professor.  Hope he will be associate professor then a full professor soon and will serve to WPI for a long time...
Best Prof. I ever had
No Comments
Awesome project advisor, I'm doing both of my projects with him.
He's a great professor
Grant is one of the best professors I have ever had, he takes complex topics and explains them very simply in lectures. If you show up and want to be there you will get an A.

Professor is such a fun guy to be around and makes every lecture enjoyable. Despite being a required class I really enjoyed going even though I had no interest in the class. He truly wants to spark your interest on American Government and does so in a way that everyone can fairly share their answers.

Amazing Professor. If you care about the grade then just participate, go to class, ask questions if needed, and enjoy his entertaining lectures. Papers are prominent in the class, but as long as you source good information and develop a good argument then you will get an A. I really cant recommend him more.
he is the best ever

I've heard nightmares about ID 2050 from friends. Grant is my favorite prof at WPI. He has great energy and kept a 6pm class engaging. Class was more of a conversation and laid back. He gives helpful feedback and cares about students. The coolest part was the culture. He taught us a ton about Australia and I'm really hyped to travel there now.
Hilarious guy. Learned a lot from the course, enjoyed every second of it.

Prof Grant Burrier is an amazing professor. Class wasn't the norm WPI study for hours, memorize, then word vomit. This class would have us watch a 10min crash course video, a short read for homework and then have a 2hr lecture that felt like 5 min as Prof is great at getting the entire class involved and engaged, no matter the political opinion

I learned so much in this class, I reference his readings on the daily. Although we had to read A LOT, the readings were genuinely interesting (Jane Goodall made me cry). He was incredibly sweet and a truly good professor to get to know and talk to. Grade was mostly based on a midterm, final paper, and participation. Not scary.

What I really liked about this course was how Grant taught it. He was a very engaging professor which is helpful for a two hour lecture. He made sure we understood the course material while making it interesting. I was not originally enrolled in this course at the beginning of the term, but I am happy that I took it!

This guy is all-around amazing. Just a nice human being. Super funny, but his lectures are packed with data and information. He is passionate about politics and loves working with students to help them succeed . He was easy to work with on Zoom and he really helped me with my paper. I am definitely taking another class with Grant!
I took organic Lab with Prof Triolo. What a great guy! Very nice and easy to talk with. I highly recommend him. Also, very easy grader.

He likes to develop a relationship with students through dialogue.  The lecture before every test he will devote at least a half hour towards your questions.  You need to stay for this. He tried to make dry topics interesting, but if you do fall asleep he provides a general overview of the lecture the last 15 minutes.  I very much appreciated him.

Professor Triolo is a very nice guy, but he isn't the greatest professor. Some of his test questions were off topic, but it was manageable. Homework was online and you had until the end of the term to do it all. Overall, the class wasn't too difficult with some prior knowledge. If this is your first time with chemistry, it won't be an easy A.
He is a very smart man who knows the subject matter well but sadly he is not very good at explaining it to others. Overall excellent chemist confusing and scatter brained teacher

Triolo is a great guy! Great class and easy if you put in the work! I honestly don't know why people don't like him because I learned a lot and he genuinely cares about teaching his students well and helping them all succeed! Recommend for sure!
What he says in the class has totally no relation to the homework and textbook. If with outstanding self-learning ability, just choose him.

I cannot recommend Triolo for chemistry. The main problem was that there were big discrepancies among what was covered in lecture, what was on the homework, and what was on the test. He didn't know what the homework was, and tests were information found mostly in book. However, he is a really nice guy and genuinely cares about students' success.

showed up for class on the first day of my freshmen year and he talked about random things not having to do with chemistry... only went back to class to take the tests the rest of the quarter. would definitely avoid having him
Awful professor, terrible lectures that are completely off topic with what will be on exam, not very useful outside of class either.  Would not recommend.

Triolo is a really good guy. He is extremely fair and cares a ton about how well his students are doing. He loves to have people come and talk to him out of class, he spends extra time attending the lab sections, he tries to open a dialogue with every student he can. I recommend him highly.
awesome teacher, very helpful

honestly, typical art professor at an engineering school. He doesn't understand that we are not professional artists, and that we don't really have much of a choice when it comes to humanities. He's overall a nice guy, but way too judgmental and has way too many assignments. I spent more time on this class than any other class. Not impressed.

Definitely a biased guy. After asking what was wrong with my work(that the entire class loved) he responded with, Im a professional animator. You think youre right and Im wrong? Come see me during office hours, I dont have time to debate. And then in office hours, he threatened to give me a bad grade because I was "giving him such a hard time."
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Condescending to students. There is very obvious favoritism to people he knows better. He would just bash on all our work in front of the class, and I felt that the criticism was not constructive.
No one can read syllabus. It's not a syllabus but a poorly designed graph. Everyone in class was confused for what is due. Very unorganized.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I've put in more than 20 hours a week. My partner bearly put any in. He said we needed to keep track of hours. He ONLY graded us on what we did! My partner got a better grade. I almost failed. If I did not take over everything we wouldn't have had anything to submit. I've been doing so much more and he doesn't care.

There were a lot of assignments in this class but I liked the variety and that the assignments had a clear purpose in trying to teach you something. Sometimes he was unclear in his objectives but was overall fair and understanding.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Ive had this professor for two classes now, and he was excellent in both of them. He is super available to help outside of class and will put in a ton of extra time if you show that you care about the work you are doing. He pushes you to do your best without making it stressful.

He's lenient on deadlines and will let you work as long as you need to on a project as long as he's seeing progress. He will check up on you if you haven't turned in work in a while to see if you're ok mentally and physically. If you aren't, he'll offer extensions and be very caring overall during class time to make sure you get work done.

Super laid back and knows almost everything about animation. Super cool that he used to be an animator at Disney but now teaches people how to use Photoshop. Always ready to help you out if you put in a little bit of effort.

He's nice and encourages you to participate in class. Homework can be really short or really long and it varies between each chapter. There is homework due every day (except Wed). He doesn't really go over the grammar and teaching; he does a reverse classroom setting where he expects you to learn on your own and in class, you practice speaking.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Amazing professor. Really interesting lectures, meaningful assignments, and you will learn so much. Expert German speaker and knows the answer to any question you might have. Will inspire you to make your German so much better and to go visit Germany!
He is a good professor, very approachable too. He expects you to do a lot of independent learning in the textbook, however. Also, his tests and quizzes require a lot of memorizing.
He's a very tough grader and quite strict with grammar. But he's really approachable, really nice, and is excited about what he does, which is important.

he is the best person ever. he is a also an awesome professor. he cares so much and all the projects were fun to work on. his German is excellent and he is very passionate about history and literature. he is the absolute best!

Professor DiMassa is the best professor I have had at WPI. He genuinely cares about each of his students and will take the time to help you. He also makes you very interested in learning German and about German culture. Take him for your humanities requirement!

I've had him for 3/6 German classes at WPI. He's very helpful and nice. If you don't understand something, he's there for you. Email him anytime. He gives out extra credit and is rather forgiving if you forget your homework - just don't do it all the time.
Puts a lot of effort into his class! Great class and great experience. Requires you to stay on top of work and not be lazy.
He is the best professor you can ever take, he really respects his students, make class interesting and even though he is not from germany, he speaks german better than germans. definitely take him
Just. Awesome. If you have the chance, take his class.

If you read the textbook (easy to digest and free!), watch the lectures (engaging), and do the projects (fun) remember how to do pointer arithmetic in C, it's an easy class where you still learn a lot. Don't let other students scare you, the programming projects are totally doable by yourself.

Professor Shue is engaging, funny, and good at his job. His classes are a lot of work, and he's not an easy grader, but you'll learn tons and (hopefully) enjoy him as a person and not just as a professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: There is no required textbook, but he gives you PDFs of the sections for reading. Great lectures, and as long as the red net doesn't fail every 20 minutes the project is cool too.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Operating systems is a course that is difficult by design. There is so much that has to be learned. Shue does a fantastic job explaining all the concepts in class. There were quizzes every single class mostly based on the reading, but the readings are in easy terms that we can understand. Most difficult class I've had, but I learned so much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Shue is a very good teacher. You will learn a lot by being in his lectures. With that said, he is kind of tough to reach outside of class. Also, the assignments are very difficult, but his grading itself isn't too strict, and he's pretty lenient with a lot of things.

Good at teaching. His explanations are thorough and he is helpful, bu primarily in class. He's a busy guy, so it's tough for him to make time for students outside of class; most of that work is put on the shoulders of the teaching assistants. The assignments are way too difficult, and sometimes I think he doesn't realize we take other classes.

He is a good instructor (but very busy). I wish he had spent more time in the more complex part of the topics instead of briefly discussing the basic things. Quizzes at times are kind of unfair compared to how much topics were discussed. This is a good class IF YOU DO THE READING. The projects are very time consuming (ask the TAs for help).
Class is difficult with quizzes every class. But projects are lots of fun and fair. he drops 2 quizzes which is nice.

Professor Shue is an absolutely phenomenal professor. He truly cares about his students and their progress. He is not just a professor who teaches and says, "Well, hopefully something sticks." He honestly and truly cares about his students, while also making class fun and interesting. OS is a terrifying class, and Professor Shue makes it awesome.

Taking a class with Shue will not be easy. Don't expect an easy A - you'll work..a LOT. But it's worth it. He cares SO much about his students and classes, and even though it's a lot of work, he'll probably end up working more than you to make the class awesome. I learned more in his course than many combined...best professor at this school.

This professor gives enormous amounts of extra credit and very clear grading criteria. Although his speech speed is fast,  he will be very enthusiastic to help students answer questions. Studying in his lecture is exciting because he helps mobilize the learning atmosphere.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I took APCS in high school and got a 4 but struggled with the homework bc I didnt pay attention to the lectures (PAY ATTENTION TO THEM). Piazza is where u can reach the profs teaching this course when u have questions- normally they respond within 10 min. The labs are super easy, Prof Sun cares abt his students, engages w the class,would take again
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I would say his class is fine for me. However, every time my workload is very full for every term

I had him for 2102 and then again for 2303 and I can see the improvements. He cares about his student's education and while his lectures heavily rely on slideshows, he teaches good information clearly.

Professor Sun seems to get better each term. I've had him twice now, and I thought he was great both times. He uses a lot of slides matched with code that you can follow along with. You can reach him by email and usually on Slack. Overall, it was a great course with a knowledgeable professor, who I look forward to being in another class with
Took for Algorithms (CS2223) and had easy lectures and normal HW programming assignments. Quizzes were straightforward from lectures, and professor was accessible outside of class (Slack).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: He was new for CS2102 During B-Term in 2023. He said "In this particular case" thousands of times during each lecture getting as high as 20 in a minute. However in CS2303 During C-Term 2024 he no longer repeated the phrase, responding well to feedback. For his teaching ability, he is passionate about CS and knows his stuff I just struggled to focus

*CS2303* He's gotten better since the start of the year (he was new). He is passionate about what he is teaching but there is a lot in lectures, and often the lecture ends with the content not finished. I would take him again as I know he cares for his students and how they do in his course.

Professor Sun's lectures only made sense if you had a background in Java. The class was very difficult to follow and he teaches from a slide show not from showing you how to code. I would not take his class again and i would not recommend him to anyone else.

CS2102 is lead by Ahrens, so YuShanSun doesn't do much but teach and review the material, but his lectures are so hard to follow when he says "in this particular case" 162 times in 50 minutes (we counted). But, the course itself isn't that hard, and I'm ready to give YuShanSun another try.
"In this particular case" (on a real note, he's a good professor that tries his best to teach a hard starting topic)
Lectures were a bit boring, but he's a really nice professor and clearly very knowledgeable. Would overall recommend!

One of the most helpful and caring professor I had ever have at WPI. Labs are fun and not time-consuming at all. He was accessible outside of classes. He was clear in explanation of concepts and equations both in-class and outside of classes.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: He's a good professor at heart. His lectures can be a little boring, but the exams are modeled around the homework. He's really accessible, and you can't go wrong with him.

You're honestly a clown if you don't get an A in his heat transfer class. Exams directly coincided with the homework, take less time than actually prescribed and gives you ample pages for cheat sheets. Overall great guy.

Lectures are pretty hard to follow at times, but he posts good powerpoint slides online, although they seem to have more detail than really needed. Homework is hard (thanks chegg) but is very useful for studying for exams. 3 exams (night), lowest dropped, and a final that is only worth 15%. Good professor for heat transfer

His lectures are clear and engaging. He's the best HT teacher. He gives about 4 hours of hw a week, but you need it to understand the material, and it's representative of the test, so you won't need to "study". Tests are reasonable, with as many equation sheets as you'd like. He'll help you with the homework if you stop by. Friendly.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: His lectures are fairly dry, but they help when doing the weekly problem sets. The homework is fairly difficult, but his tests are simple if you understand the material. He had three tests and dropped the lowest one as well.

Daniello seems like a decent guy, and he is, but his tests are murderous. You need to know every example problem out there and everything he gives in lecture. Reading the book will help a lot but these tests were extremely hard regardless. In class final was a joke but it's only 15%. If you want A, don't take him.

I had him for fluids and heat transfer. Lectures are pretty much useless, you learn on your own. Homework is tough, but reflects what's on the exam pretty well. 4 exams throughout the term, drop the lowest, that's 75% of your grade. Homework is the other 25. Exams are at night too which kinda sucks. work hard, study a lot, and youll get through it.

He is a knew prof at wpi. He had high expectations.... we covered practically the entire heat tran. txt book (13 chapters). He assigns weekly HW, weekly tests, weekly readings, and weekly reading quizzes. He seemed to know his stuff well but was a boring prof. and I slept through most classes. If you keep up in the book/study you will be fine.
well, he does not have the ability of teach as well as communicating.   Do not take this class with him. It's just a waste of time... I can learn more and better by reading the book.

Diran was one of the best Prof. I have ever had here at WPI. If you ever have the chance to take a class with him, jump on the opportunity! Diran is by far the most intelligent person I have ever met, both intellectually and on a personal level.

One of the best professors at WPI. Has won many outstanding awards to prove his excellence. Prof. Apelian takes a personal interest in his students and asks things like "How are your other classes going? Oh if you are having trouble with that class you should do this..." Overall a nice guy and very professional too. Take a class with him if you can
Very much an absent minded professor.  Goes faily slow so he is easy to follow, but sometimes can be mindnumbingly painful.
He's a great professor that's really interested in making sure his students understand the material.  His lectures are well prepared and he doesn't just talk to the class.  Great guy!
good teacher except that he expects more than he asks for on tests
This guy is the man
This guy is the man.  He knows everything.  Sit in the front row of class and you will actually learn something from this 2000 level class.

Fantastic, professional lectures. Knowledgeable. Demanding. Exams test small pockets of knowledge deeply, leaving the "skip this section" student screwed. Don't look for 1-0n-1 time, you're an annoyance.

Not the easiest class in the world, but you'll learn your stuff.  He is very clear about what he wants done for the class and if you do it, you will do very well in the class.  He is also very approachable and willing to help.
Tough course, tougher grading system, but do well on the tests, and he treats you to lunch.  Can't go wrong there.

He's not even a real professor,  WPI just hired him because the English department was short staffed. Didn't know what to talk about so he wasted our time with random guests  coming to speak about nothing that pertained to the class. Never gave feedback. Purposely didn't give us eval. sheets to fill out because the class would've rated him poorly.
Easy class, but you will most likely get a B. Harsh grader on essays without much feedback.
He is a fantastic teacher. He really cares about his students and is always engaging.
he is really fun, one of the best prof. at wpi
I've taken several classes with him and he his the nicest guy, a talented journalist, and a hilarious comedian. I wish I needed more humanities credits so I could take more of his classes!
Best professor I've had so far.

Professor Dempsey is a extremely helpful journalist!!!! He didn't use the textbook a lot. but his teaching is based on the concepts of the textbook. Dempsey always want to help you! And he is always willing to spend more time on your writings so that you can improve. Take his class, you won't regret!

Professor Dempsey said on the first day of class that "if you are a very good writer, you'll get a B in this class, and you'll really have to wow me to get an A." I got an A and was pleasantly surprised. Show up to every class, participate in every class, and complete all of the assignments with effort and you will do well.
Great teacher, but does not give out due dates clearly. You will be suprised by at least one test or quiz. Very, very knowlegeable.

Easy class in terms of homework. Sometimes in class he just reads too much for it to be interesting. Overall though he knows how to keep people interested in the material...as well as giving our class donuts on Fridays (free food is always good).

Great professor, just do the readings and you can pass every quiz with a 100. Make a clear effort in group assignments and your fine there as well. His lectures are phenomenal and I can't wait to take another one of his classes.

An inspirational professor that really knows his stuff. As a student, I have high respect for him. There is a lot of group project and quizzes are given per week, but the quizzes are really easy as long as you listen to his lecture and read the assignments before class. I would definitely take him again for other courses. 100/100

A good, if intimidating teacher. Moriarty is one of the bigger, if not most connected names in the field. Generally helpful, though you won't get that impression from talking to him. Students think he is inspirational.  Not as good as an advisor. His course suggestions were not well thought out.

Perhaps both the most amazing and terrifying professor I've ever had. It isn't that he scares the students, it's that he name-drops friends of his like, oh, you know, Steven Spielberg and George Lucas in his lectures. NBD.  This man is a legend. If you're playing a classic game that you really like, chances are he was involved somehow.

BEST PROFESSOR I'VE EVER HAD. Does what he loves, offers insight only a veteran of the games industry could possess, and really knows his stuff. Even if game design isn't your major, take this class. You will learn so much about art, storytelling, technology, collaboration, and life in general. If you put the effort in you will learn a ton.

Moriarty is the best professor I have ever had (I am now a Senior).  He is the only Professor whose class I truly get inspired by.  He makes learning fun (what it should be).  Moriarty is a great professor, and great person outside of class as well.  I have learned a ton from him, both school-related and life-related too.  A+ Professor!

Moriarty is the most inspired professor I have ever had the pleasure to learn from. He's extremely knowledgable, enthusiastic, great in front of the class, 100% helpful, and a great guy in general. He makes students want to do well. Learned tons from his classes. I wish I had gotten to know him better before I left WPI. Nothing but fond memories.
Brian ROCKS! I've taken several of his classes, and I really admire him. Best professor!
Intro to game design was the most fun I think I've ever had in a college class. Prof. Moriarty knows what he's doing and does a great job of teaching it to the students!

Great professor, great class. Down to earth guy who loves what he does and does what he likes. Powerpoints are pretty clear and exams are not difficult as long as you pay attention and take good notes.

Excellent professor! The structure of the course (homework, quizzes, etc.) is some of the best I've had. His explanations were very easy for me to comprehend. He wasn't the greatest at understanding what students were asking when they had questions. He does have an accent. So, if you don't think you can handle that, look for someone else.

Wicked nice guy!! His accent is hard at first, but after a day or two he's easy to understand. As long as you try you will get an A. Homework and quizzes are essentially the same. He does make things easier so you need to prepare yourself a little harder for the final. I got A's on everything and did bad on the final but still got an A
hard to understand at times because of his accent. fair teacher and very willing to help at office hours
He is one of the best Math prof I've had. A great guy. Explains things very well. He brings his own note and upload it so you could study from them.
Excellent examples, fun professor, clear, very helpful.
Good man! Good teacher! Answer student questions patiently. His material is really helpful!
Awesome

For me he was really bad in teaching, First week I had a problem with what he was tryig to say. Then I picked up with him but still not that good. Best thing about him that his quizez are the same as the hw and he was clear about it. Then the final came and it was nothing like he taught in class. HARD!

Easy class, chicks say he's hot. Get your homework right and just study from that. Kindof "not caring teacher" lately (I've had him for 2 terms) but his quizzes are right off the homework. Don't show up to class...

Awesome professor! Absolutely loved having him for the past term, definately would recommend him. He is always willing to help and makes himself readily available to students wheter through office hours or in email. Best calculus professor I have ever had!

I thought this professor had really great lectures and answered questions clearly, but was otherwise bad. He had unnecessarily convoluted quizzes that seemed designed to mess you up even if you had followed everything in the 2-hour lectures. Also he graded projects extremely harshly without breaking down points in a way that was clear or made sense
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Amazing lectures--Tough grader

comment: most ridiculous clases of your life. Unless you are already fluent in the language being taught, you have no chance with this class. His office hours are nonexistant, he is rude to students and although claims to encourage questions belittles you if you ask for help.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Just don't take him. Thank me later
All quizzes are super tricky. There is no negotiation about quiz grades, period. Projects are do-able but double the difficulty of the same class offered in A term. In general a very tough grader
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Krishna may look tough and unapproachable on the first day of class or what he says on his course website but he is really cool and understands students pretty well. He will make you work quite a lot and will make you figure things out on your own but he will give you very good suggestions when you have trouble with projects.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I took Software Security Engineering with Professor Krishna and had an absolute blast! Security is his field of research. We got to hack real websites and apps for our homework projects! Relatively easy A if you read the slides for the quizzes, and do the projects (make sure you have enough exploits in your projects or you'll end up NRing).

The worst professor I've ever had. He lectured directly out of the book yet gave assignments and tests on material that wasn't covered. His grading was absurdly harsh and his interest in his students was non existent. He was useless in office hours and his teaching overall was abysmal.

The worst professor I've had to date in the WPI Computer Science department. Nothing in the class was original and a fair amount of material was out of date or incorrect. Professor did not seem to care about the students or teaching.
Cool guy. His class can be difficult if you don't pay attention and read the book, but if you do you'll be fine. I learned a LOT from this class, even though I didn't get an A, so I'd recommend him.

I had a good experience in his class, Prof. V addresses the class with no pretension and when talking to him on a one-on-one setting, it feels like you're actually talking to a human being as opposed to the academia antichrists I'm used to in this department. Funny guy, insightful, I would definitely recommend taking a class with him.
Very nice and lenient. Class is very interactive. Manage time or it will become a lot. You have to be social with people during class. Very approachable. Sometimes gives snacks. Tests are easy.

She was an amazing professor and I would love to have her again! The lectures were very engaging and I was able to pick up on the concepts quickly. There's a bit of homework you have to do for each unit/lesson, but it's nothing too horrible. It can all be done within 2 hours or so. If you study, you'll do just fine!

Her teaching style worked very well, the class itself is very difficult by nature. I have no previous experience, but I didn't struggle too much. There's a lot of work outside and inside of class tho.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Great professor. Always very friendly and respectful. There's a good amount of homework but you get it 2 week before it's due so it's pretty simple and all out of the textbook. Class is fun as it's a lot of pair work to help you learn speaking and listening. Overall it's an easy class that I would take again. She also brings snacks for the class :)

Zheng lao'shi is a great teacher overall! she gave us donut holes :D
W lao'shi

There's a lot of quizzes so beware of that, but they're quite manageable and she is really good at getting us to really know and speak the vocabulary she teaches
Lectures and in-lecture exercises were very helpful and I felt I was learning very well in the short time this class took place.

She is an amazing professor. Genuinely the first professor I met that actually cares about students and your mental health. The course work is durable and it is easy to develop a pattern so you can time manage your work since each lesson layout is the same.

Great teacher, not sure why she is rated so low. Class is lecture heavy, but it is bearable and fun. Read somewhere that she is disrespectful to students, but I never felt like that was the case. Lots of quizzes. Homework (a lot but you will be fine with time management) is due on the day of test and includes character workbooks and oral tests.
Absolutely horrible teacher. She is unable to listen to students and her teaching style will not give you anything. She doesn't teach, she demands that you just follow the textbook in all cases.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: She is one of the most unfriendly profs that I have ever taken. Prepare yourself for a number of rather confusing assignments with extremely unclear grading criteria and absolute zero of partial credit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She is great at teaching but has no empathy for her students at all so make sure nothing goes wrong in your life while you are taking her class. Her grading is weird so make sure you look at it before you start her class.

Grading system is unconventional, but you can correct mistakes on projects and resubmit for a better grade. However, you are punished for doing assignments early, as she modifies the assignments just before they're due, resulting in a lower grade. She also locked several assignments when someone submitted them early. Protip: procrastination is key.
Her grading methods, doesnt make sense. If get A on 6 Projects but u dont get enough points on exam, u wont pass lmao

I would 100% recommend taking her class! She is amazing and cares about all of her students. She is very available outside of class and has so many opportunities to improve your grade. She is amazing!!

I will be honest. the grading is horrible. if you are coming from coding background, there is no freedom to code. Projects were okay except the last project which is complicated for no reason at all. Exams were 70% achievable. My only problems with the professor are the worksheets and the projects in terms of grading and logic (Horrible).

Is the most mental health aware CS prof I've had. No strict deadline on assignments except the 4 projects. TAs were not really helpful (didnt know the right answers). If you can go to Prof's office hours for help, do so. Gives opportunity to correct exam and gain 10 points back.

Prof. Mortensen tackled the impossible by making the C programming language understandable with her lectures, and help was effortlessly accessible for homework and labs. She was always willing to break down CS concepts to their basics with diagrams, and as long as you paid attention in class, the exams followed the taught material well.
Your exam grade is pretty much the only thing that matters because she does categories and you get the lowest grade out of the categories no matter what.

I loved this class with her. She explained things well, and her grading criteria is very clear. Very possible to get 100% on the homeworks. Exams do not require you to code, mostly conceptual. Exam material only covers things discussed in lecture and practice exams are given. Just pay attention in class and get help when you need it.
This was her first time teaching and she was great at explaining everything. Her lectures were very informative.

Loved taking genetics with her! Your grade is based on so many things, and she gives you every opportunity to pass (exam corrections, drops lowest quiz, etc.) Her only flaw would be she sometimes appears a little disorganized in content, but given that this was her first time teaching a class, she did an incredible job, would absolutely recommend!

His lectures are sometimes difficult to follow. They're written on white boards and it can be hard to read. His presentations can also be a little disorganized. However, he is very helpful in office hours and he is very fair. His exams are similar to the homework. The homework is graded strictly but the exam is lenient.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Unnecessary amount of homework. Completely inaccessible outside of class. Gives no wiggle room what-so-ever. Will not respond to any emails or requests to meet with him. His lectures are disorganized and hard to follow.
Do not take him for CE3041

Very hard lecture to follow, completely disorganized. The professor is willing to help you outside the class, but you have to be very consistent, there is no wiggle room. Homework is very realistic to what an engineer would do, very hard to complete, and you don't know where to start. Good luck.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Tao's lectures tend to be a bit disorganized, yet he is always willing to further explain concepts or other questions outside of class. Skipping lectures will most likely negatively impact your understanding because many topics are difficult. Exams are a good representation of what was covered in lecture.

lectures were horrendously boring, I even noticed students sleeping in class.  This sucks because attendance is mandatory, and even if you have to go to the hospital (which I did) he ignores emails and I got a bad participation grade even though I went to the other lectures that I could do.  Assignments were way too long and grading was super slow

Tao isn't bad, he's nice and charismatic and he clearly cares a lot about geology. The workload though is honestly insane. Considering he himself acknowledged that most people take this course as a simple one that can be paired with other harder courses, I was surprised and frustrated by the frankly unrealistic expectations for work he had.
Extremely difficult, goodluck in Soil Mechanics.
Super boring professor never responds to emails and isnt helpful

For a class that is introductory, his lectures seem unnecessarily detailed. He has great knowledge of his field (geology/geotechnical). He is not clear on his assignment instructions which can be frustrating.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The content covered in this course is super interesting: volcanoes, earthquakes, caves. The homework isn't always related to class but is also interesting. It's an easy A if you take it seriously but if you skip class you'll get a B at best (there are in-class clicker questions). Tao is pretty funny and does a good job of answering questions.
Very engaging and a great personality. Best AE Professor at WPI.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Unorganized Class. Feedback is super general and it would not help you at all. Lectures are really bad, full of mistakes and errors that only show that the professor does not prepare his class. Grading is not clear. Basically this professor is really smart and I am pretty sure he is really good at research but is not committed to teach.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Best professor in the Aerospace Program by far. He is very engaging--to the point where he'll bring class to a halt until someone will participate. If you visit him in office hours, participate in class enough so that he knows your name, and show him that you're working hard you'll do just fine.

Cowlagi is easily the best professor in the Aerospace Program. His lectures are amazing. He explains everything in great detail and keeps you engaged. However, this class is really hard no doubt. Quizzes can rock you and are graded harshly, you will not sleep during the take-home midterm, and the final project is a lot.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: This guys is a legend. Youll love him, everyone does. Class will be hard but enjoyable. Also... DAT HAIR DOE!!!
Excellent class. The project is really interesting and indeed difficult.

Overall an excellent lecturer. He tries his very best to ensure each student's complete understanding of the course material and is always open to answering questions and helping you at his office hours. Classes are quite difficult, and even with maximum effort it won't be easy, but you will learn more from the challenge/difficulty and he scales.

Prof. Cowlagi is a excellent lecturer. He uses power points when they are helpful, and he runs through examples on the board when they are necessary. He is exceptionally helpful if you approach him out of class concerning any question you have about his class.  He is easy to get along with, but his class is hard.

Good lecturer.  His quizzes were very difficult but he acknowledged this and adjusted future difficulty.  Taking AE4733 with him now and he also said he would adjust from 3703.  Good guy, very helpful in office hours too.  He might assume you are smarter than you are though.

Good lecturer, gave clear explanations and examples.  Made an effort to learn students' names and encouraged participation.  Homework was doable, but quizzes were tough time crunches.  Exams were open everything (even internet) but if you didn't already know your stuff you'd likely run out of time looking things up. Overall, a good experience.

Spent so much time on basic linear algebra and probability theory, and then rushed through concepts and did not connect the fundamental mathematics to the concepts. She often refused to explain concepts in detail and said that you should just take the graduate level version of the course. The class was not challenging or stimulating at all.

This class is more on modelling class. While the professor did a good job on explaining the concept, the coverage of the course materials is not enough for Data Science major students. Not much math in this class and almost no programming being presented so if you expect that kind of stuff, choose other prof. Easy A if you know linear algebra.

Prof Emdad is one of the kindest professors I've had at WPI so far. She goes kinda quickly but is more that happy to help if you're confused. Extremely accommodating and really wants her students to pass. She dropped our lowest homeworks and quizzes and I ended up with a final grade of 100%. :)

She goes through the lectures at a decent speed, but clicks through the slides fast. Nevertheless, the lectures are posted so you can go back. She encourages participation, the homework is fair, and the textbook is optional but useful. She makes the tests as easy as possible without being unfair, and she gave us extra credit for building a snowman

Prof. Emdad is incredibly kind and well-spoken. Her lectures are fast-paced but she has great slides and goes through lots of examples. She uses MyLab for all quizzes and for the midterm/final exams, which can be a bit frustrating but overall it's doable. She is very understanding and shows that she listens to the class and any feedback we have.

Very personable, genuinely cares about passing her students. Work was not horribly difficult, provided you know Excel. Dropped the lowest test, homework, and lab grade. Online lectures weren't the easiest to follow due to poor organization of the virtual whiteboard, and less than ideal handwriting.

Other reviews have perfectly summarized how Professor Emdad fails are delivering anything of substance: she simply lacks knowledge and intelligence in her "subject" of data science. With little to no guidance, your grade is completely based upon how much you show instead of actually achieve. Huge waste of money and time, skip over this professor.

What an abhorrently awful professor. She does not provide enough time for students, even when attending the full class time is an expectation of her. Often ignores her duties as a professor including: attending scheduled course time, attending meetings, providing feedback, etc. She is technologically illiterate and unreasonable in all ways.

Pretty hard with all the quizzes, exams, online homework, physical homework, and labs. But she is really fair and if you have a problem with the way something was graded she will gratefully give you points back. She definitely loves what she does. She makes you work for the grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: There's no signs of knowledge or intelligence in her class. The amount of guidance you get from her class is zero. I honestly didn't do nothing and got better grade than my friend who worked much harder. I guess the only standard was whether she personally likes a student or not. Unfortunately, I don't like her. It's a total waste of time n money.

Terrible as a professor. He's an okay TA though (had him for ES 3003). He assumes you already pretty much know everything he's telling you, which is fine when he's a TA because you should from lecture. But when he's the prof it's really bad. He also has terrible handwriting, and an accent that makes him hard to understand.

Good lad. But should know that teaching is not really his thing. always lost in his own thoughts and seems disturbed about something. Not approachable at all. Seems like he will smash your face if you annoy him with a wrong question. Apart from that hes a really nice guy:)..But i advise you not to take his classes..

I found this professor to be pretty rude when you came to his office to get help, even with reasonable questions.  His TAs are the fair graders, NOT him. I guess I can't complain too much, I did well in the class, but I found him condescending.  The last exam was ridiculous, but the homework was easy and very generously graded.
Sucks at teaching but has good intentions. Wants everyone to get an A. The main reason why people don't hate him as much is the open book/note tests with huge curves.

Took Fluids and heat transfer with him, the first two classes he's ever taught. I thought his lectures were a bit useless, but only because of poor course organization. I think he could be a good teacher if he layed out the course in his own way. I got the sense he was working on someone else's schedule. Easy grader!

For a first time teacher, he was very clear and very reasonable. Homework was a point-booster because the summation was equivalent to two exams. Exams were straight-forward and rather reasonable. No surprises.
This guy is the man
Extremely  helpful and he knows his stuff very well, he is very young but he looks like that he is well experienced. I recommend yoy guys to take future classes with this guy
Not terrible. First time teaching, so it was a bit rough, didn't always know what to expect, but the end result wasn't awful. Ended up grading fairly and giving reasonable exams.
First class he ever taught. Lectures well but the structure of the class was still being worked out as he taught it which made grades rather perilous.
Favorite Professor at WPI. Helpful, smart, explains things well. He made me become a German major/minor.  Great personality.
One of the best professors at WPI,I would absolutely recommend him to my friends
Absolutely one of the best professors at WPI. Interested in students learning, very interested in the subject matter. Good guy.
Great Professor
Good teacher, is clear about the assignemts and very nice in general
ditto that! :-)
MUCH BETTER THAN SUSANNE EVEN  also, very good at relating German to native english speakers, as he is one of them.
Awesome professor...much better than Susanne Even
Great teacher; easy to get along with.  As long as you are present and actively participate in all discussions in class, you will have an easy grade.
Good at relating GN to native english speakers
Rude to students who didn't actively participate in the class. Grades pretty harshly. Homework and quizzes are fair and help you learn the material
Only take her if u have no other choices.

Prof Neamtu isn't a bad teacher, but she talks a lot about 'preparing for interviews with FAANG', but then completely skips over left, outer, inner, and right joins, and says "If you know natural and theta joins the rest is a breeze." This was my only grievance with the class, the rest was alright but look to Wong if you're looking for more SQL.
Felt like she was racist
Only take this professor if you must, even then, be aware that she is just not a good person. Her ego is so inflated that she hands everything off to a unqualified teaching assistant.

She truly is awful. For some reason she has no respect for students and ironically she teaches ethics, but has no ethics in her work. When talked to with reason and logic she actually just repeats herself. Do yourself a favor and by all means void her class. She also grades the class very arbitrary. I genuinely don't understand how she is so bad.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Doesn't respect students. Gives a 10-15 minute lecture on "how hard the class is and you should drop it if you don't want to try" to a class full of seniors. If we did not want to try, we wouldn't be taking four years of courses. Hyper-vigilant about cheating, far beyond necessity. Feels like a high school course despite being a senior in college.

Does a good job of teaching by going through many examples and exceptions. HW is good and useful, except that the you just do SQL through command line instead of an application, which makes it harder to learn. Exams and quizzes are easy in theory but graded somewhat harshly, which takes this course from easy to medium difficulty. Great professor!

You need to put up with her unique class discipline declaration in the first ten to fifteen minutes, which reminds me of my kingdagarton. She always failed to explain the essential concepts and topics!!! Don't take the final exam as sth of a fluke. What she couldn't explain clearly is exactly the question in your exam paper.

Reasonable about the grades. Will curve up the score(?). Very energetic in the class and office hours. The slides are unclear, good for the lecture but very bad for review or self-learn. The descriptions of assignments are always misleading that need a lot of time to speculate. The organization of material is something need further improvement.

You can tell that she honestly cares about students. She is very approachable outside of class. She is interested in making sure you really understand material. That being said, she doesn't grade anything and has her TA's do it. Often, grading is extremely harsh and unfair. TA's can't explain the solutions clearly. Projects and homework were easy.

Melissa should not be running IQPs. She comments on work without having fully read it, does not retain information, and is always confused. She has interrupted numerous meetings to ask questions about details that have been established for weeks. Our primary advisor was out for 2 weeks, and she served only as a burden in meetings. Do not recommend.

She's genuinely hopeless. She can't keep track of anything. Horrifically underqualified. Every team I've spoken to has considered talking to the University about her. She doesn't understand the projects she's supposedly managing and couldn't communicate clearly if her life depended on it. I can't stand it.

She is clueless. Does not know what's going on 90% of the time and likes to pretend she does. She gives back feedback without knowing the big picture of the projects and refuses to listen to student's input.

All over the place. She is very disorganized and made my group write many small papers that were more busy work than anything else. She tells you to write one way in class, then grades the opposite of what she told us. Every day had at least one assignment due, sometimes as useless as presentations/info-graphics on how we plan to do research
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: These ratings are ridiculous. Melissa was one of my IQP advisors and she was great. Useful feedback on the writing, responsive to student concerns, and a fair grader. I'd do another IQP with her.
Just no! save yourself
Professor Belz is a DISAPPOINTMENT!!

Get ready to submit a crapload of drafts of one paper. You will receive a crapload of nip picky comments too that would make you feel bad about yourself after spending hours researching and typing. Imagine a professor who wants you to do a math problem one way only and not alternative ways that get the same answer in the end.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: She's a disappointment as a professor!!!

Professor Belz is a disappointment. Inconsistent grading policies, poor reading comprehension, and a passive aggressive personality make taking her class absolutely miserable. The class is based around writing a single paper with multiple drafts. She wont give feedback that is on time, written coherently, or factually/grammatically correct
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Nice, but there's nothing at all to be gleaned from assignments. Writing this while I take a break from an assignment accompanying one of this week's readings. Alongside the definition of each word, we have to write what the definition makes us feel or think of. For like 30 terms. I don't know, man - how do Discrete and Diffuse Texts make you feel?

By any means necessary avoid this professor. She barely uses Canvas and doesn't like letter grading, so you either get an incomplete (0%) or complete (100%). I strongly believe she doesn't know how to teach because she spends class time talking nonsense and her instructions on assignments are pretty unclear.
