Very unclear in directions and important information regarding assignments is very difficult to find. Course website was not helpful and just added another element of difficultly to locate the directions and submission directions for each assignment.

She is unclear about what she wants on assignments. Her emails are condescending. Her lectures are discussion based for two hours about things that do not even pertain to the assigned work. Would not attend lectures if she did not grade attendance. Is not a nice professor overall. 100% would avoid.

One of the best professors I've had at WPI. She's super helpful in the process of drafting my HUA final paper. She's invested in making sure her "apprentices" succeed and is passionate about rhetoric and comics. The amount of work in the class is a lot but it pays off in the end. 100% recommend taking HUA 3900 - Comic and Culture with her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Honestly one of the best professors I've had at WPI. My experience with her (and most other amazing profs) is that you get out what you put in. If you attend class, participate, and incorporate her feedback into your work you will get a ton out of Riddick's class. If you skip class, act disrespectfully, or don't put any effort in you will fail.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Had her C22 and yeah this class was not a great experience. In what was already a horrible term this class sucked the life and free time out of me. She grades very tough, her grading system is odd (argue for your grade), and she is unclear about what she wants. And oh yeah she can be quite condescending as some of the other raters note. I'd avoid.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The professor teaches well, but in a fast-paced term system, her class seems to have way too many papers due every class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: She is definitely not clear on grading and changed up the grade policy in the middle of the term to be self-assessed. She grades on completion rather than actual scoring. You will have to read the assigned chapters (70-80 pages) and do discussion posts on them, but if you do all the work and engage in class it is an easy A.

I took rhetoric with her this past C term. My C term was rather rough as I was pretty depressed, and I had some issues with being late, and she talked to me after class and really comforted me. Besides that however, my experience wasnt too great. I got a C which was puzzling as she said she values academic growth, which I think I had.
So annoying. Not a good teacher and expects you to know everything already. So much homework and i would never take anything with her ever again. Already canceled my class with her next term
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This professor is new, and very clearly cares about people learning and doing well. She says this class is graded on completion, but the instructions are often unclear, so you can get a B or C while putting a lot of care into the class. However, I did learn a lot. She does care, but she's unclear about instructions and grades harshly. A lot of work

Would recommend taking this class. He teaches so much good information for improving professional writing which is important for all fields. I thought we had a fair amount of little writing exercises and we only had two larger essays.
Coolest guy around. Fair grader and really cares about his students. He puts in extra work to help you understand the material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: You can only miss two classes and we work out of the book. We go over homework in class and it's more of a completion grade. We have a few projects and tests but Prof. Madan provides plenty of feedback and tips to help you out. It's a great class for engineers as it will help them write their journals in a clear manner.

I thought he was one of the best english profs ive ever had. He did a great job presenting material and made hiself available for help outside of class. He really cares about his students and goes out of his way to be a great guy. Do your work and you'll get a good grade.
I liked his class even though it was tough. He is very nice and a fair grader.
This class wasn't that difficult, but I did not learn that much. Assignments often had unclear expectations. There was a high participation grade- not something I liked. Attendance was mandatory.

Literally one of the best professors I have ever had, and he's my boss now! Taking this class made me realize how lacking my previous English composition education has been. I loved every second of this class, despite the ridiculous amounts of reading we had to do. You'll work a lot, but you'll gain so much from it.
Excellent professor. Always respectful to students and just an all-around nice guy. He makes class interesting too.
Easily the best and most competent professor I have ever had.

Great class. Definitely helped me with my writing. You have to take the class seriously if you want to get anywhere and he can definitely be a big help. One of the better teachers so far. He says "ya" a lot in strange places. Pretty normal guy.
Mikhail graduated from WPI many years ago, and this record is pretty irrelevant now.
Easy class, good teacher.  The stuff was fun to learn, but ill never use it at my job.  One day he showed us a commie website.  kinda cool.

good guy, very knowledgeable, but unfortunately he's stuck teaching webware in antiquated languages (like perl/cgi - nobody in the real world still uses CGI for the web). J2EE etc is never covered because of this, but he does review web services.
Good teacher, python rules!

Pretty good professor, but since there's no textbook, I think PowerPoint is absolutely the worst method to present the material - and there's a TON! Probably because of that, lectures are pretty boring... projects were pretty fun though...
Good teacher, good class, helpful.
Great material, fun projects, funny midterm/final, an enthusiastic teacher with a good sense of humor and awe-inspiring knowledge of the material.
Awesome professor. Very enthusiastic and funny. He just finished his PhD, but he should keep teaching here.
Great instructor!  Never had a better CS class than his.

Prof. G. is a great professor. He constantly made sure everyone understood the material before moving to the next topic and he strongly encouraged asking questions in class and coming to office hours. He is also super understanding and reasonable in terms of making up homework or redoing quizzes. He's a pretty nice guy overall (super funny).

Wasn't a fan of this prof. He went really slow and his explanations didnt make much sense to me. Might have been just me, but I didn't get anything out of the lectures and taught myself from the textbook. Part of the homework was through Mathlab, part was written and handed in

This class is a very easy A. you have quizzes every week (usually based on the hw and can be finished in 15mins max) and are given the formulas (you aren't given them for the final but you are allowed a cheat sheet). You don't need to go to class cause he uploads everything, office hours are nice too
Kelum's a great prof; he has a bit of an accent, but you'll get used to it after a bit. Calc 4 isn't super tough, and he makes the tests fairly easy as long as you've studied for them.

Great professor, lectures can be somewhat slow but he is also very clear at explaining concepts. He's very good with partial credit, and if you give him a homework or quiz back, it's almost guaranteed you'll get points back.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His accent can be pretty tough to understand but its totally worth it. He does a great job with explanations and really cares about your understanding of the material. He wants you to get a good grade as much as you do.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Pretty funny guy who interjects jokes into his lectures. Teaches pretty slow though, which is good for understanding, but can drag at times. Overall, I was able to understand all the concepts from lecture and only used textbook for HW. Grade is mainly HW/weekly quizzes/final. HW is simple. The quizzes are simple. The final isn't too bad.

Teaches concepts well, homework is interesting, very helpful and accommodating, and pretty funny. The few downsides are small things: lectures a little boring, will get derailed by "that guy" in the class asking irrelevant questions, and there's only one test that makes up 40% of the grade. Overall he's a great professor and you'll learn it well.
A great professor who really wants to help his students achieve their best. He is accommodating and teaches the material very well. Only downside is that the lectures seem to move a bit slow.

Putnam is a G. Did so much work to make the labs work remote with RobotStudio. Always took the time to correct our code and sims outside of class. Very straightlaced but cracks a few jokes when you open him up. Would reccomend.
This man has single handedly kept the robotics engineering department afloat for years, and continues to even add new courses to it!

When everything else conspired against me while I was taking his class (partners, health, family) Craig made sure it was all okay. He might not be the most entertaining lecturer on earth, but he really cares about the students, and will go through great lengths to please them.

Putnam always did his best to make students happy, but most importantly, make us feel like his class, and the entire department (which was undergoing a lot of changes at the time) WAS FAIR. The most fair teacher in all the land!

Craig deserves praise for being such a humble teacher. I took six courses with him at WPI, and in every one, you knew exactly what was going to happen, what to expect, and that you could expect him to be there to answer every one of your questions along the way. Keep up the good work, Craig!

Still working on restructuring this course from previous professors material. Effective connection between real life applications of what we're learning in class. Term project is fun, lab equipment is a bit outdated. Professor works hard to help students understand the material outside of class. Fair grading. Put in the effort and you'll succeed.
Worse teacher ever. Half the time he doesn't understand the material himself, let alone teach it properly.
Very nice guy, doesn't teach a lot but very helpful
Course was an organizational disaster. Expectations for the final project were poorly communicated, and lecture material was completely disjointed from the labs. Reasonably nice guy though.
good professor, reasonable, effective use of class time

Professor Brown is simply amazing and a wondeful person, both in and out of class. At least give him a fair chance before you start your whining (to the guy who follows after the previous message). I wish he taught every class at WPI!

4304 was one of the most amazing classes I took at WPI.Very difficult but getting the A wasn't impossible.Incredibly informative and useful lectures. Someone mentioned that Brown's class only measures 'coolness' and not understanding? That is luricrous. ECEs-DO NOT LEAVE WPI WITHOUT TAKING A CLASS WITH BROWN!!!! VERY Highly recommended.

For you unlucky birds taking DSP or MQPs: DRB might be a 'great guy' non-academically, but he is THE HARDEST ASS in ECE. His hardness is unlike Ludwig's or McNeill's or Clancy's. His IDIOTIC ways do not measure your hardwork or intellect, rather they value "coolness" above everything. He is young, immature, Unsympathetic, and an overrated ****.

Knows his material, and even better, knows how to help you understand it. Has real-world experience, and is friendly and helpful - in class or otherwise. This class was NOT easy (A-term 2003), but I learned a lot. My favorite Professor.
Teaching is very clearly is his top priority. Also really friendly and has a great personality. Other professors should learn from his example.
No Comments
Really great professor. Smart, clean, clear, American. Great guy as well.
good guy
I recommend her classes.

I liked Professor Reshadi. Her class was interesting and she was very helpful. The only problem was that it was an online class and they can get boring because there is no interaction with other students.
Prof Resadi is very caring and her class is straightforward. Highly recommended.

Dr. Reshadi is very nice and genuinely cares about students. The class was an online course. She made us work with another student, which helped a lot since I didn't know a lot about data science. She is also very helpful if you have any questions.
It was a fun class. The instructor is very nice and warm and made a 6-9 pm class enjoyable. I HIGHLY recommend taking this class.

She doesn't help students. She is strict and rude. bad middle eastern accent
  Rude and illiterate

She has no knowledge
You will be surprised how illiterate she is

She is not that knowledgeable and informed of his course
 She is an illiterate person in the field of business, I don't know why she became a university professor

Never take any course with her
Awful method of teaching
Don't answer your question probably don't have any knowledge
I dont know who hired let her be a lecturer
3 tests for 50% of grade (not too hard). 4 labs for 50% of grade. I spent about 15-20 hours on each lab but got over 100 on each with extra credit. Easy A if you care enough to put in the effort.

Very easy course. Provides a good graduate level introduction to HDL, lectures are fairly interesting. Three projects and a final. DON'T overpromise on your final project or you will have a much more difficult time than necessary. VERY easy grader if you put in effort. START PROJECTS EARLY. 80% of class finished projects the day of. Don't be them.

Very good professor for learning HDL, gives out colorful handouts for every lecture, (no need to by textbook) very easy exams if you studied his review topics, very clear explanations to questions, I hope the labs could be more difficult&fun!

He is very full of knowledge and seems a bit pretenious in his approach to discussions.  He is reluctant to offer answers to questions, if you get an answer it will be either evasive or very detailed and accurate.  Generally didn't like the attitude, but I suspect it was alot of personality conflicts.  One person suggested it was a 'british' thing.
Sweet accent made listening fun.
Very clear and helpful...shows genuine interest and excitement in the subject and is therefore very easy to listen to in lecture.  Work is both interesting and relevant.  Easy to talk to.
This class was one of the best learning experiences that I have ever had (1999).  I still use the class notes for my job.  He makes you work hard, but he is fair.
Sometimes reluctant to answer questions, except ones like, "the processor can take 10 amps, right?"
Never makes mistakes, gives very thorough examples, and knows his stuff.

One of the most under rated chem eng professor in the school. He has a very clear logic and solid structure. You will learn a lot from him!! And he responds email very often and willing to help during office hour. I really like him!!

Professor Dixon is an excellent professor. He covers all the material in great and thorough detail, assigns homework to match the test material, and is clear about everything. The expectations of his classes are high, and he is a challenging professor, but I learned more than most other courses.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: This guy gets a bad rap for not liking sophomores, but I didn't get that impression.  His tests were tough, but no worse than Professor Clark's.  I thought he was a nice guy and a fairly reasonably professor.

You might not necessarily enjoy (hard) work while taking the class but you'll be greatful for it later when you need to use the info in other classes.  Will be helpful out of class but you need to explain what you don't get and be specific, fishing for answers won't get you anywhere.  One of the best CM profs.

He is not going to hold your hand if that is the kind of professor you want then take another class. He is good at what he does and he knows his stuff. If you go to class and put in the effort he is there for you. He teaches you how the real engineering world is, no one is going to tell you how to do everything step by step!

Not very helpful outside of class--especially for projects.  His tests are ridiculously long...don't expect him to baby you along.  You are now a "grown up chemical engineer"  Deal with it...have fun!
Good in the classroom, easy to get along with, but don't go to his office for help outside of the class, he won't be there very often, and if he is, he won't be very helpful
Very unhelpful, hardly seen in office, expected students to know everything
No Comments

If you do the worksheets, youll get an A on his tests. They are very similar problems. He only has a poll everywhere outside of class and online graded homework once a week, along with the three exams. His lecture requires less work than the other CH1020 lectures, but he goes through material a little faster. He is very understanding and kind.

Gericke was a great professor! His lectures are incredibly clear, and he would go over many practice problems which were immensely helpful for me. He would start some of his classes with short clips of animations which always brightened my day, especially because it was 8 am. Tests reflected the worksheets, so make sure to do them. Def recommend!

As long as you do the worksheets you'll be fine. At 1st I barely did them & didn't do well on the exams, but he met w/ me and I did every wkst and learned a lot. If you have questions he's always open for office hours & his explanations are clear. Even made video tutorials for the class. Best chem professor! I ended close to an A and he rounded up!

I took an 8 am lecture and I was worried I wouldn't be attentive, or maybe I'd doze off, but he is really engaging. The worksheets were an amazing tool, as long as you thoroughly did them all and stayed on top of them. He has plenty of availability to access him beyond the lecture. He is also very gracious in grading and posts his lectures online.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I had Professor Gericke for an 8 A.M. class and because of that he understood that everyone was going to be exhausted, he himself made mistakes and just laughed it off. If you do his worksheets outside of class you will get A's on every test. The worksheets are so well formatted and they slowly build  your knowledge till you've mastered it.
Good professor. If you do the worksheets he gives out you will do fine on the exams. If he says that something won't be on the test, study it anyways.
He was easy to understand in class, but there was a gap between what he taught and what material we were quized on so there was a lot of extra studying for this class.

He's new here at WPI (2012) but he's a great professor. If you can do all of the worksheets he gives out you'll easily pass this course. The material is hard if you haven't taken chemistry before bt I recommend taking it with him.
LOVE HIM

Lectures are monotonous, deadlines arbitrary, and office hours feel pointless. he can't answer questions to save his life, leaving students confused. Yet, his only saving grace is allowing a notebook in exams, helping students cope during tests. This small relief is the lone bright spot in an otherwise frustrating experience.
lots of extra credit and open note for the test is the only reason why i would take his class again

There was a decent amount of difficult homework but exams were open notebook, a ton of extra credit is given and I enjoyed his lectures.He's a very happy professor and making his lectures intersting, he does go fast on the chalk board but overall 8/10

He's alright. His exam policy is generous. It's open notes, and there is no limit on how many pages of notes you can bring, so take advantage of that. His past papers are similar to the exams so use those for practice. His Pearson assignments have limited attempts, and dock marks for incorrect attempts, which is annoying. Decent prof though, 7/10.

Professor Zekavat allows open notes on tests and unlike some others that rated him I learned a lot in this class. The only reason why his score is so low is because he cannot answer questions in a helpful way to save his life. If you need help in his class I recommend that you ask another E&M professor.

Had him B21 and walked away with a very undeserved A. Open notes on tests, which as far as I know no other E&M professor does. Lectures are okay. Overall it's very easy to pass but I didn't learn much. So take it with him if you're taking it as a gen ed but don't if you're an ece/physics/etc. major.

I only really understood ever other lecture at times the content got very confusing. The only thing that got me through was the open note tests. Just look at past tests and copy them down, they are formatted the same.

Professor Zekavat is probably the least tech-savvy teacher I've had so far at WPI. I lost most of my points on hw because in his syllabus he said hw would be due at the end of the term, however he was unable to figure out how to set mastering physics to this setting and I lost almost all my points from being unable to turn in later hw. sobbing.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I took E&M with him B term and he was alright. Very easy though. Open notes on the tests and at least for my discussion, not sure about the other one, we got full credit if we wrote a reflection of what we learned. I ended up squeaking by with an A I feel like I didnt deserve.

Super nice guy whom is easy to communicate with. Always encourage students who work hard but sometimes struggle. He is an outstanding guy in his field and presumably he can answer all questions you have. Textbook used as reference but not required. Not test heavy and not homework intensive
Great Professor always willing to help

He's an energetic guy who is always trying to involve students during class.  Only knocked off a point because he tried a "flipped classroom" approach that ultimately flopped.  However, he is a very knowledgeable professor, and I would definitely recommend him.

An amazing professor with a passion to be a great instructor. Clear effort is put into preparing lectures, Homework is reasonable. Very easy to talk to and makes great accommodation to meet outside of class. Sometimes lectures are a little long-winded but they are always relevant and helpful.
Super nice guy, and very forgiving for late work/accommodations. Tries his best to keep you entertained and invested in the content during class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Prof was always willing to help- would hold extra office hours and respond to emails ASAP. Was very passionate about material and was very thorough teaching. Exams were hard. Need to truly understand the concepts to do well. Gave us a chance to earn points back after midterm, which I appreciate.

Professor Zheng is a really great and enthusiastic professor. His explaining gets a little confusing, but he is very accessible outside of class. The exams were very intense, but at the end the grades distributed evenly. Do the homework because it is helpful.

Professor Zheng was an extremely nice professor who definitely cared about teaching. He was always super enthusiastic about the subject. Professor Zheng taught the subject in different ways than usual which made it hard to understand at times, but helped provide more insights to topics even if you already have experience with them.
A lot of insights in physics. Very clear and structured lectures. Strongly recommend.
Hard to understand. The course is relatively easy IF he provide practice tests before exams and you have a great TA that could actually explain things. You need to do homework.

As long as you do the homework and actually look over your homework/tests, you'll do fine. Since he's from China it'll be hard to understand him sometimes. Just pay attention in lecture and what he writes on the board and you'll do fine.

Some students did not like him, but if you went to office hours, he basically gave you the answers to the tests and quizzes he was going to give, and he gives you extra credit for showing up for help.  He does love math, and if you have a hard time understanding math, he understands and does what he can to help you.

Language barrier presents somewhat of a problem. His lectures can be a bit confusing, so count on the TA to get you through it. Quiz questions are taken directly from homework though, and homework is pretty low in quantity.

calculus 1 and 2 shouldn't require anything from the professor. dude is a good teacher who is very helpful. chooses questions on quizzes from hw..aka do it and get an A. funny dude. gets the job done. if you just follow what he says and do what is required you are golden. no reason not to get an A.

Professor Dai was the worst teacher I have ever had. He is mean and rude often telling his students that they will do terrible on his tests. His tests are impossibly hard, with majority of the class failing each exam. His notes are useless and he goes off on random stories in class that have no relation to the material. Worst class I took!

Shibin Dai has been the worst teacher in WPI's mathematics department. He proves everything, even when completely unnecessary, and does not slow down for a single explanation. Questions in his lecture provoke a stern look of impatience.

He would go up to the board and write on it so that you couldn't see what he wrote.  Then turn around and explain, still blocking the board.  He had to curve my class so badly that 40 was passing 60 was a B and 80 was an A.

I've had a terrible experience with Professor Dai.  He's almost impossible to understand - explains at a breakneck speed and often drifts into topics he claims won't be needed until graduate school.  On a recent exam, he decided to reduce the class average from a 75 to a 55 after the grades had been posted for several hours.
Louis thrives on the suffering of students. He likes to boast his knowledge by insulting students. He made me realize that all my life choices are wrong, and physics is not the way to go.
Never take his class, you will die and rethink your life choices. He's actually a devil troll that takes pleasure in sucking the soul out of his students and eating away their hopes and dreams.
fun teacher.  rushed through examples sometimes but enjoyable class.
teaches way too fast in class.. whizes through examples putting examples up but not explaining what is going on.. not very compassionate with tough homework problems either
Homeworks/tests, though difficult, are not overly complicated and help with the understanding of the material.  Does teach quickly, but also follows the book well.
Though he is well prepare, this professor does not answer questions well.  He also teaches very quickly.
Goes through things really fast in lecture hten does a ton of examples, but doesn't spend enough time on ideas.
No Comments

Goes too fast during lectures, messy handwriting.  Tests can be difficult if you're not prepared.  Go through the practice exam and do the study questions in addition to the homework.  At least the demos during lectures are fun.

Dept. Head Prof. Petkie is a pretty great teacher! I enjoyed his class a lot, with a ton of in class demonstrations of the subject matter at hand. Although he can get a bit distracted in his work in class, he gives great feedback on in-class work problems you do as a table--which are always posted on canvas for a grade. As such, do attend lectures!

Attending Douglas Petkies class will make you more confused than not attending. Not only is it at least two hours of homework each night, he sometimes forgets to post the assignments until very late at night when theyre due either at midnight or 7:30 the next morning. A friend changed professors after reading his rating, and I wish I did the same

This class was awful. He gave homework that took many hours and had very few office hours available. His lectures were boring, and not very helpful. The TA led discussions were distinctly better than his lectures. The tests were every week practically, and not easy. The questions on the test were very different than anything on the homework.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: This is the most organized professor on canvas. Homework is on another program but he sends out a calendar to ensure clarity. He posts his slides before and after the lecture as well as making recordings. He even holds extra office hours the week of the exam,
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: The class was interesting. His explanations were quite clear. As long as you do the worksheets and homework you'll be fine because the exams are based on them. Overall, if you enjoy Physics, he's a good choice.
Very confusing lectures. Always behind
I had him for both lectures and conferences, and he clearly wanted you to do well in the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: He may not be the best but if you know what you're doing in physics and you listen to the important points, you'll be fine.

Not sure how someone can teach something that he doesnt fully understand. The covered material was confusing, often incomplete, many times swamped in obvious errors. He tried to be nice, but was not able to really connect with us. Drove us mad. Course organization and teaching itself was chaotic, and sometimes very boring. Dont take his classes!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the best professors i've had. If he sees you putting in effort he will go to great lengths to help you. Engaging lectures. Difficult tests.

Lewin was very good. Compared to other professors for 1001, it sounds like lewin covers less material in more depth, making the class more manageable. The homeworks were long, but not terrible, and honestly quite informative. End of the term was busy, with the final being project based, but the lectures became easier!

I was an SA for this class, before and after Lewin. Lewin decreased the amount of time spent in lab from absurd to wow I can actually complete the lab during lab time. He also restructured the class so students actually know how to code and build robots before the last week. He values the student experience.

I would easily take another class with him again. He is always accessible to help if you have a problem. His tests were fair, and if something on the grading rubric ended up being a little too tough to achieve he is lenient on changing stuff to help you.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lewin is the best. He remembers his student and is always willing to help outside of class, even you are not taking his class. His humor makes the class less boring, and he helped us keep track of our robot progress. So we dont have such a hectic finals week. He is good at course planning. Overall, best class I have had in WPI

Prof. Lewin is a fantastic professor and cares about his students more than most professors I've had. He grades fairly, is very on top of his class, and makes the term great. He is probably the best professor I have had so far.

RBE 1001 is a notoriously tough course for freshman. Professor Lewin tries his best to prepare us for quizzes, tests, and labs. He is very open to feedback on the course and wants to make the course better. He obviously cares a lot about the students.

Professor Lewin was awesome for being a new professor for WPI. It is a very hard course, to begin with but he made it a little easier. He was always there if we had questions. My raw course grade was around 65% but he scaled everyone and I got an A. It was a very hard class but he was very helpful. Definitely going to take his course again.

Even though professor Lewin is new and is still getting used to teaching in 7 week terms, he is a great teacher. He is super caring and always available for help. He wants to make sure everyone can pass, while keeping fair to others. That, plus his hilarious jokes makes him a great teacher.

The exact same class as ECE3500 (take that first). The finals and midterms were take-home exams, and the answers were always within his lecture examples from previous weeks or in the ECE3500 examples. If you pay attention and review the lectures, you will do well.

Fair grader with great take-home exams that test on some new material but also hearken back to other concepts, so they aren't too difficult. Last few homeworks in this class have been tough (for me), but if you have knowledge of the subject and a good attitude, you will do well. Responsive to emails. Flexible with extensions.

Course is extremely interesting, only thing that saved me. Lectures unclear & fast paced. When asked questions, often got mad student didn't know the answer already and redirected instead of answering. grading & late policy is terrible, does not follow the expectations he sets for himself, and holds students to exact dates with no exceptions at all
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Super strict and very boring and confusing lectures

Prof Mughal was awesome when I took his class during the very first term of the COVID pandemic. The infamous D term 2020. Everything was chaotic and all the professors were scrambling to teach in such a new environment, but Mughal managed to make it one of my favorite classes I have ever taken! Great professor. Would sign up again if I could.
Overall a very good teacher. Wants you to learn and loves teaching ECE. The final project is somewhat daunting but he is very understanding. Would take another class with him.

He's a solid professor, his lectures I would say lean a bit heavily on the examples side rather than conceptual side, but that's just my preference. Also has a lot of old pre-recorded content online that is easily available, which is handy. Swell guy.

His class may seem difficult at first and may seem harder after the first HW and Lab, but trust me you want to stay in the class because it is the easiest A you will get. His tests and hws and labs become so simple and you wont even have to go to lecture to understand what to do. A simple youtube video tells you everything if needed. Fun Class!

Willing to go above and beyond to help out students. Lectures are print outs that you fill in yourselves, so make sure you study the material. Tests and Quizzes were open-note. Labs have youtube videos to guide you, but can be confusing. The final project is fairly easy if you put in a reasonable amount of time.
Very kind and respectful prof. Genuinely enjoyed the class and learned a lot.

Professor Pollard was awesome, he could guide you to understand really difficult concepts without giving away the answers. He was one of the most caring professors I've ever had, plus his office is an extremely welcoming environment! I would highly recommend him!

Professor Pollard was great and he made physics more interesting. He used a flipped classroom format, which I thought was good because it allowed me to learn the material at a faster pace than a lecture would have allowed. His classes were collaborative and relied heavily on practice problems. He emphasized the process of learning which I liked.

Professor Pollard is one of the nicest professors at WPI. You need to rely a lot on your own learning and finding time out of class to do that is difficult. He really relies on flipped classroom, but his quizzes are very reasonable, and the projects at the end are interesting. We chose our grades, but Im not sure if it will be replicated again.
The most amazing professor Ive ever had, no grades or tests in his class!

Despite being a new professor during A Term 2021, his teaching methods were pretty good. Also he cares a-lot about his students and is always available. But, I think he relied on the flipped classroom approach a little too much. For instance, we had to watch several 30 minute videos on Top-hat and answer questions to fully understand the material.
This teacher is the bomb, if you can take this class literally no reason not to. He actually cares about students and the class is an easy A if you just show up and try.

Uses a flipped classroom format- make sure you do the lectures out of class. Responds quickly to emails. Weekly quizzes on Thursdays, not difficult. Uses Pearson + TopHat (you have to pay for them); **Don't spend money on the textbook in advance**- you can get an e-Textbook from TopHat + there's an open-source textbook PDF in his syllabus.

He was great! He's very understanding, if you have any issues you can go to him and he'll work something out with you. There are weekly quizzes, but they aren't hard and you can use a calculator and a reference sheet and they're reworkable. The only thing is that he uses a flipped-classroom approach, so you will have to learn a lot on your own.

Professor Zeugner is an interesting man. He treats students with respect and often tells funny and interesting stories. I cannot say I learned very much, but its probably not his fault. It was a horrible curriculum.

He is very knowledgeable like others have said. Easy to talk to. He hates when people ask what will be on the exams(that shows that you only care about the grade). DO NOT expect easy A. Discussion require a lot of knowledge beyond the scope of the reading.

Came out of retirement just to teach this class. A very interesting class and he kept it interesting though out. Had three group papers and one optional final exam. He stated quiz dates before hands so people can prepare for them. Great professor to have if he ever teaches again.
Sincere and caring.  Class and private discussions were always interesting and informative.  A first-rate professor who sought to bring out the best in his students.
One of the most honest, knowledgeable, and interesting professors WPI offers.
Best professor from Humanities department. Very cheerfuil. He cares about students so much.
Easy A for indepedent studies or SUFF, recommended for all int'l students!!
Excellent Lecturer...Cares for students

Small illegible writing. Does not speak loudly. Did not properly go over course outline, syllabus is practically useless. Questions on first problem set aren't even remotely close to what is being taught in class.

Worst professor Ive ever had. Didnt go over the course outline or anything on the first day of class. Doesnt use a mic while giving a lecture and writing is terrible. Doesnt project her voice so if you sit near the back or dont have the best hearing, good luck!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Combinatorics:  Did not have a complete understanding of the proofs presented in lecture, never reviewed assigned homework throughout the term, was unhelpful during office hours, was incredibly harsh while grading exams, and required a text book that was never referenced in lecture. Will not take another course with this professor.
Professor is not very helpful in delivering her stuffs, lectures are irrelevant and boring, and tests are hard. There are only 2 tests so if you screw one you are dead.

Cross-discipline course (CS2022/MA2201); but NO CS content, just proofs.  Her "syllabus" was vague. Lectures very hard to follow.  Homeworks weren't counted toward grade.  Midterm and final were extremely difficult.  She gave no feedback.   TAs were supposed to do that, but my TA was confusing.  He kept going back and changing things.

2 exams, each worth 50% of your grade. 5 problems on each exam. But the exams are so difficult that getting the equivalent of 1 completely correct is a C, and 3 is and A.  Lectures are very confusing, and unless you have seen the material before you WILL be confused at some point.  Overall great/nice person, but not a good professor.

Class lectures were only barely related to the material on the exams. There are only two grades in the class and she is a very tough grader. There is also no feedback on the exams as to why the grade was given, so it seems almost arbitrary.  The primary feeling experienced was one of profound confusion that slowly turned to apathy and defeat.

Doesn't go over the content you are supposed to learn in class. You won't find it in your book either.  You could skip every class and learn more online then in lecture. She is a nice professor and clearly attempts to teach. But she just can't. She taught the class like a graduate level math course. No CS content either

He clearly loves doing the research he's doing with batteries, so many problems in class revolve around this. The lectures at the beginning were very interesting, but after the midterm, his lectures became a word cloud of buzzwords. Clearly is just teaching because he needs to to continue doing research. Nice guy, just not sure how much I learned.

Prof. Wang is hilarious and straightforward. He has a syllabus to cover and he sticks to it through simple powerpoint lectures, with some good self-deprecating humour.  He let's you know what will be on the test and you can't fail if you try. Chinese accent but pretty good English.

His request for course evals: "You be nice to me, and I'll be nice to you."   He's a poor lecturer, but he does try. He'll tell you what's on the test, and how to do it. The group project is about a third of your grade, and it's vague. If you take both tests, he guarantees you a C. I didn't learn much material from him. Touring his lab was awesome.

He is kind yet knowledgeable. There is a lot to be learned in this course but he understands that sophomores with no experience in chemistry and  grad students might be taking this course . So chill,  show up to class, get to know prof and do your HW. I thought it was cool course, because materials was a little different from what i was learning
He is a great person and a fair Professor, very knowledgable, plus very easy

One of the nicest teachers I've had.  He can be soft-spoken at times and does read off power points, but he teaches you what you have to know and he's really helpful if you ask him questions in his office.  Study those review power points!
cannot understand !!! never!!!! but exams are straight forward. good luc

He's Incomprehensible. In lecture it seems like he just memorized what he had to say and if asked any questions would just reiterate what he had said. quizzes are easy as you basically have a base score of 3 out of 4.

At first, I found his lecture style unhelpful and unclear, but this man goes so far to try to help you if you ask. If anything is unclear, go to his office hours. I feel like I learned a decent amount, and I have a great respect for him. The material starts off pretty easy if you've taken AP CS, but it gets more challenging with time.

Professor Eltabakh is a great prefessor. 585 has a ton of new content if you've never done Big Data before, but his lectures are very thorough and he gives great explanations. Always willing to answer questions. Group projects are tough but doable and very informative. Pay attention in the lectures and the class will be fine. He's a great guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Explains all the material well and exactly what you will be learning and doing in the class. Everything is pretty easy up until the last week when you get crammed with finishing the term long project and doing a homework all while studying for the final. Final was questionably really hard, half of the material was learned two days before the exam.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is a very good professor. His lectures are easy to understand, also his assignments are easy. Nice teacher!
bugs are everywhere in his slides..... basically do not trust anything he says about Oracle SQL syntax Homework and projects are super annoying but fair enough BAD LECTURER EVER!!!!!!!! :(

His powerpoint slides explaining the material were VERY organized and useful. His accent took getting used to (he's from Egypt I think). There was an odd style of grading the assignments, mostly because of allowing any programming language, but it was okay. Quizzes were the only major downfall for me, exams were pretty good and scaled nicely.
Very good at explaining things, mostly an easy grader although his quizzes were difficult. Scales the final grades. I thought he was a good professor!

A really nice professor! Had him for Databases this term. His lectures were very redundant, and could be rather boring but you actually learn a lot. You will do about 5-10hrs of course work TOTAL for this class. Besides requiring little work the assignments are very fair. He was a great professor.

Overall, class felt very loose and relaxed but this was detrimental to in-class discussions. Scripts were interesting and thought-provoking but discussions seemed repetitive and limited in dimension and depth. I wish the professor explored a wider variety of concepts. Very lenient grading, standard midterm/final papers were relatively manageable.
Great person and professor! highly recommend
Took her intro to drama class and it was great. She's really nice and her class was very straightforward. Not much homework, either. Highly recommend!
Great class great prof
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Super easy. If you go to class and complete assignments, you will get a good grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Despoina is really nice, and her intro-level drama class is a breeze. There weren't a lot of assignments, and most of the grading was based on completion and participation.

I took her Intro to Drama class, and it was great. The class was a lot of fun, and I would easily take it again. There were a few writing assignments, but there was a very generous timeframe given to write them.
Not a fan of her class. Didn't teach much in lecture and the hw projects were awfully challenging for someone who was not involved in theatre prior to the class
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Seems like a nice person, but is not a good lecturer. Classes were slow and often boring. He does the midterm and final in two parts and most people get around 50% on the first part for both. He curves, but the final grade in Canvas is not what he actually uses to give a number grade cause he has a completely different system behind the scenes.

Professor Powell is overall a great professor with a clear grading criteria. He is easy to talk to and encourages participation. His exams are somewhat difficult, but the grading is lenient and there are test corrections. He also gave the most heartfelt speech relating to his struggles with 9/11, providing me with a new perspective on life.

Prof. Powell is brilliant and is an okay lecturer. He gets distracted here and there but overall tends to be engaging and makes sure the class is following. He actively takes feedback every class and he is a very fair grader. He has 2 exam sessions in the second you correct errors for credit. Obviously cares about his work and the class. :)

Surprised to see his score isn't higher... I can't speak for his other courses but 2820 was great. The material was super interesting and well-taught, prof let us use cheat sheets & gave retakes on tests (though they were always difficult), encouraged us to visit during office hours, and it was clear that he really wanted us to succeed.

Powell is a brilliant man but he is not that good at teaching. His lectures are broad, general information and he rarely goes over specific problems that would be on hws or tests. The tests are short but can be on anything he ever mentioned in class which is scary but at least he gives you a cheat sheet. Fairly easy grader
Nice person, but a terrible professor. He didn't understand the material he was teaching, and the tests were not like anything we did in class, lab, or homework
Caring professor, but lectures were difficult to follow.
Terrible professor. He is bad at explaining things and made everything more confusing than necessary. It was more useful to not go to class rather than going to class.

I took Financial Accounting with him. He was a great professor, fun in class, and cares about his students. If I were to take it with him again, I'd make sure to do all the readings before class because he cares about participation.
extremely boring class. The worst professor I have ever experienced.

I do not recommend this professor! Doesn't show up to office hours, insults the class saying he has taught concepts when he hasn't, and jumps through several steps of calculations... all-around my worst professor/experience yet.
jj is the **** good guy and he is really accomadating to the students, I recommend this class if hes teachin it
great guy, fairly easy class and he is fair.
Very practical.  I use concepts learned in his class almost every day.  His teac
not very hard class, but boring and hard to understand him teaching
boring but not hard

He understands the material very well and is able to start discussions during lecture to foster critical thinking. Posts notes and practice exams on Canvas. The grading is difficult and mostly dependent on exams (70%), but I feel that I now have a deep understanding of probability theory, which I find to be more worth than a guaranteed A.

I have no doubt Mr. Gu is a good professor. But 70% of the grade calculate on two exam is not too fair. If you failed one exam you are DONE. This class have no lecture note they are all handwritten on the lecture. after midterm he teaches (and speak) really really fast and and most of students could not catch up.

Definately one of the better Stats professors, makes sure to go through the concepts in lecture throughourly and has fair exams. The material isn't really difficult, but he makes sure to help his students understand the material better.

Prof Wang was very fair. Had 5 HW assignments that the TA went over before the due date. Two exams worth 70% of the grade. The material after the midterm felt especially difficult. However, was always willing to help or reexplain concepts. Was very caring. Practice exams and hw are way tougher than actual exams.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This class was a prereq for a higher level math course I took next term - and that prof had to do review for things that we were SUPPOSED to learn in this course. His examples and homework are always way harder than the tests and you're expected to memorize a ton of things that he covered for maybe 5 min once. Nice enough guy but didn't prepare me

Prof. Gu Wang in my opinion is a very smart and cunning person. Don't be deceived by his gullible look because from my experience with him he meant every word he says. His explanations are easy to comprehend and he is very quick to detect problems with students or his own solutions, therefore confusions never happen in his class. A quallity prof.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Pretty decent for a calc prof @ WPI. Sometimes gets caught up in explanations but it's because he's one of those people that's actually passionate about calculus. If you make it clear you're working hard he won't fail you-though you may have to retake basic skills. One piece of advice: Go to the office hours as much as possible, it'll be worth it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I really enjoy Prof. Wang's teaching. He is one the best professor we have in this semester. Very clear and serious math proof. Never confuse himself or us. He absolutely masters all the knowledge and tricky skills in financial mathematics, and is also a fair grader. The performance in MA571 is like an IQ benchmark for students, and I love it.

Professor is a very nice individual who genuinely wants to see his students succeed. Probability is a tough course and is not something that comes easy to most people, he tries his best to explain complex topics in an easy manner.

Professor Mouti is a good professor teaching a hard course. Probability is a weed out course for math majors so it is hard. But professor Mouti teaches the topic well and is always available to help. The assessments are a little difficult but if you call him out on it he will make it easier.

It's comparable to trying to move a mattress. Its not heavy but awkward. I don't understand any aspect of the content and if I cared enough, I would report his teaching to the math department. I did not learn anything in this course. Take if you are okay landing a C or B without knowing any information, but otherwise steer clear.

The first half of the term's content was understandable and fair, but the second half of the term's material was insanely rushed and confusing, especially during the final two weeks. He teaches new subjects the class before the final and makes it unclear whether or not they will actually be on the final or not.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. He made this class unnecessarily hard, even if you think probability should be "easy". Unless you have a strong prior background in AP stats, no matter how hard you study, you will NR. The midterm was curved by 20% and the median was a 70. If you can, run! Swap professors. Avoid this guy like the plague!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: For your sake, do not take this class with this professor. The pacing for the class feels like we're rushing through complex topics so fast. No formula sheets allowed for a formula heavy class. Prof. also said he taught the class at another school where the average was a 73 and showed little to no concern that that's only 3 points away from an NR.

He seems unsure of what he's teaching to the class- he crosses out questions and makes mistakes.
Lecture examples are not even helpful for solving the homework questions, let alone the quiz and the exam questions. Exams made up a huge percentage alongside a few quizzes. The practice exam disclaimer, SMH. Super unclear, too many topics for 7 weeks.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This was the most out of touch professor I have ever had. Despite teaching an applications class (not a theory class), he refused to give us formula sheets for all but the final. He had rampant mistakes in lectures and assignments. He consistently ran over lecture time. He got turned around in his own examples. Don't take a class with him.
great teacher

Never answered emails.  Required students to come back to campus to take the final, even for an online course, which defeats the point of taking the class online.  Don't think he even knew about the online section.
He's a very good prof. He knows the materials very well. A very nice guy and friendly to students too. I wish I had him in Calc 4
He never replies to emails.

He is one of the best math teachers in WPI. He goes slowly, answers all your questions and that helps a lot. You can ask him anything about the material without being intimidated, he is really friendly. I think the accent is very cute, and definitely understandable. I heard he was a Cornell graduate.
This guy gives great explanations. He goes a little fast in lectures but his tests are pretty easy. Overall, he is a really nice guy, and most importantly, his English is understandable.

although he's bad at pronunciations, he's okay at teaching the subject...just follow his work on the board and do the homework (read the text to see examples, then you should be fine)...very nice guy too...willing to give you a second chance on exams with hints

Overall he seems like a nice guy. BUT: He can be extremely confusing... and he can't draw. He goes too fast and doesn't really explain the material, he just expects us to understand it. He also can't pronounce "derivative" and "g(x)". He keeps asking, "Is this clear? Any questions?" and gets mad if no one has any. No one knows where he's from.

I fell asleep in his lectures. He's pretty boring. He still has trouble with his surrounding technology. His office hours aren't really advertised. I had to teach myself usually from the book. His tests are easy and are just like the summary homework
His lecture is not clear at all, really boring. He does not explain things well in lecture, but he is quite approachable after class.

His speaking is not clear at all, lack of explain for hw (not satisfacted), never read text book (but some hw from the book...which doesn make sense). I don't recommand his class. just take Kolecy's class. its alot better.

You ask one question, he answers another.  If you ask something he hasn't gone over for a few days he stares at you like you have 5 heads.  Explanations jump around  a lot and he tends to assume you already have a background in the material.

This professor cares about the suggested problems a lot. He assigned every lecture for the conference. They are quite useful for you to understand the materials. Tests are fair. But a lot of calculations.

His class is very small and tests are different from the other professor. But don't worry, he has practice problems and his exercises are mostly from the suggested problems. prepare you for the exam. i like his way to get student motivative.

Professor Gau is new this year. At the beginning of the year, he didn't explain his lecture clearly. But now he changed his way to teach the class and push the students to work together on the problems. He has practice problems for the exams. and he always keeps updating the website. his teaching is improving.
No Comments

Pretty easy course. If you do the homework and make a cheat sheet you are likely to get an A. Her lectures are boring and sometimes hard to understand but she posted all of them online so I would often skip class and just watch the lectures at home. Her class is 80% reliant on exams but if you do the homework you are almost guaranteed a B.

Used the exact problems from previous quizzes for tests and you got a cheat sheet. Pretty easy to pass if you had a good sheet. Questions on tests and midterms were either previously done in class for homework or for previous quiz so it was fair. Did not learn the material at all tho because she did not teach it.
The tests are really tough!!!!!!!

One Excellent Teacher! I originally dreaded this class, but wound up having so much fun that I?m missing it now. She is very helpful and organized. She is seriously interested in her students being successful. While the material may be tough, if you put in the effort, you will succeed with Zhou!
pretty clear on the slides. just read the reference book and prepare for the class will be enough

Horrible, didnt tell us that we would need a different book than the required books to pass the class, only used non-required book. Reads out of powerpoints only, but you cant understand her and they are not put together well.  Expects you to read at least 1 chapter out of non-required book per day.  Tests and quizes every 3rd day.   doesnt explain
my god this woman is terrible

Christ, where do I start. Read directly from the book.  I Couldn't understand a damn thing she said.  When she wrote on the board it was so light that u could see a damn thing.  Basically she was awful to say the least.  I have no clue how she can teach grad classes

Really enjoyed his class. He takes the time to make videos explaining the material ahead of time and sends it to the class to watch before class time. This is great because going to class is essentially just solidifying everything. He is very patient and was kind to everyone. Very accessible person. Would defiantly recommend.

Clark is really funny and can explain things well to small groups. He's a bit unorganized during class but is really willing to help you out no matter what. The only trouble is this lab has a lot of TA's/helpers who may not be as great but Clark is great.
He gives great feedback on tests and homework. He also gives hints and answers for projects in class and during office hours so definitely ask for help when you need it!
Do the labs and ask questions and you'll do fine

favorite chem eng professor, really wants students to learn. is not the best at explaining things but welcomes feedback (if polite) on how to help your class learn best, go to his office and he will help you with anything and everything, read notes before coming to class so you can ask questions and help him to help you
Hard class, easy to get lost during lecture but he tries to make sure you get a lot out of the class. You have to really work to understand the material but he is a fairly flexible prof if you care.
I did not like this guy for class. He's not organized, gives you piles of notes, and doesn't really explain anything. Not to hard a class, but not a good prof.
No Comments
It is a self-guided class. She put in no effort to help you understand the material.
She does not teach at all. Get ready to have your tuition wasted.
Worst and the most careless professor at wpi.
worst and the most careless professor at WPI
The class is a joke. The professor puts zero attention into the class and gives out very little guidance on the group project.

Professor Tulu basically phones it in.  The MIS587 course is a joke and why the business school gets so much disrespect among other graduate programs at WPI.  Just assigns a PhD student to post pre-recorded lectures with discussion board prompts where you basically get a participation grade to regurgitate article summaries.  Reflects poorly on WPI.
Not enough knowledge and contribution for master level courses.
She was an ok professor, tried to make a somewhat dry material interesting by encouraging interactive work.

Her slides are regurgitations of the textbook. Also, there are little to no instructions for assignments but then she tears you apart because it doesn't meet her expectations but you legitimately have no idea what her expectations are until after the assignment has been submitted. She's a control freak about computers and phones.

She's a caring professor and even let us edit our test answers as a class after giving the actual answers to the test once we took it (group tests), but she was pretty harsh on grading tests even though we put the answers that were said by her word for word and she still deducted points for, which makes no sense

Dr R is amazing, and health psychology was best class I've ever taken. It's clear she really cares about the material and making sure students understand the material. Her lectures are so great there was never a time that I didn't want to go class. Feedback was super quick (the quickest was within an hour of the time due, longest was maybe 5 days)

A good professor, you can tell she cares about the material and her students. However, the class was graded based on 3 essays and 2 in class "exams." While this wouldn't be too bad, she did not post the grades for the first "exam," and did not hand them back so we did not know what we needed to fix for the next one.

Dr. Rodriguez is an exceptional professor and mentor. I have taken all of her courses and worked in her lab, and I have learned so much from her. You have to show up to class, and you have to participate, but trust me when I say you will want to as the course material is interesting and relevant to your academic and personal education.

There is no clear instructions and they are confusing and no room for improvement for her social psych papers. 3 of them make up 54% of your grade. The 4th one is then extra credit. You also have two in class collaborative "exams" which make up 30% of your grade. In class participation and attendance makes up 16% of your grade. That's all.

Dr. R is the absolute best! She is always there for her students and is an incredible instructor. She uses group exams that are open note, but grades harshly, along with group projects. However, she also takes participation into consideration and gives loads of extra credit, so there are plenty of opportunities to gain points. This class is amazing
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. R is my favorite professor at WPI by far. She genuinely cares so much about the success of her students and is super passionate about the subject matter. The lectures fly by and the articles assigned for homework are really light. Exams are fair. Could not recommend more.

Broker has a thick Dutch accent, but is understandable.   He's pretty funny, enjoys giving sarcastic answers to questions.  During lecture he puts a lot of information on the board, but explains it fairly well.  Don't be afraid to ask questions and correct mistakes.  Go to office hours, as he is most helpful 1 on1. Be prepared for hard HW and exams

Interesting prof. Dutch accent, perfectly understandable after first couple classes. Cracked jokes in my 9 AM - good start to the day. Course material: weekly HW (20+ Q's), Friday quizzes (easy, usually 1 multi-part Q, top 3/6 count in final grade), two midterms, final. Pay attention, don't be afraid to correct a mistake on board. Very fair grader.
so difficult exams

He is all over the place in class when it comes to his lectures. He doesn't have any context in his lectures. Which makes it hard to keep up what is going on. He is slightly disorganized. And you have to make an effort to make sure he knows that you exist.

From what I can tell, he's a visiting prof from Brown. His lectures will require you to read up from the book a little. In calc 3, it's easy at times to get lost in the different proofs, but you can tell he's really into math. If you attend the labs you should be able to grasp the next week's material (I skipped conferences and still got an A)

I really enjoyed lectures with Prof. Broker. It's clear that he wants students to succeed, and his grades are incredibly fair. He has a dutch accent, but it's not difficult to understand within a few days of lecture. Extra Credit opportunities are always very interesting. Weekly quizzes and homework are comprised of the essential materials.
unhelpful with everything, pray for yourself

Dr. Broker gives weekly homework assignments covering everything taught over the corresponding week. He briefly teaches students how to use functions and then spends more time proving why the function works, a method which got mixed reviews from my classmates. His tests are fairly graded and manageable. His quizzes can be more difficult.

I've taken three courses with Professor Clark, and she is hands-down my favorite professor that I've had in my time at WPI. Lectures were always super engaging, and she truly cares about all of her students. Truly a gem, and has many incredible stories to boot if you ever drop by her office to say hello. Would highly recommend her classes to anyone

Professor Clark is hands down the nicest, and most thought provoking professor in the HI/WR department. The class I took (History of Media Revolutions) has granted me with knowledge of the digital world I'll hold forever.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Clark may be the best at WPI. Took a 2000 thousand level history course with her and got an easy A. Had her for an online class due to COVID. Very understanding and good grader. You want her for a history course no matter what. A lot of reading but can get away with skimming, bc a participation grade. Best professor yet.

Posting this just to thank all of you in HI2332 that voted to have 5 weekly writing assignments (worth less) over 2 take-home exams (worth more). I really appreciate 30 some odd people costing me unnecessary hours dedicated to less weighted work.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Lots of reading, but the professor really loves the material and keeps class interesting.  Quizzes are not that common and when they are given, they are very easy.  There is a lot of group work.  And she is a very easy grader.

She is genuinely interested in her subject, wants to help students succeed. Class is interesting and reading is useful. Do the reading and you will get an A. Attend anything extra (like guest lectures), she considers that in grading.  Awesome Prof!
Awesome class.  One of the best lectures that I've ever had.  Can't wait to have her for my seminar.

Professor Clark is a great addition to WPI - she sets reasonable guidlines and is always available to help if you need it.  She is a very fair grader.  She seems to value people who think about what they do and say.  Respect her and she will make sure you do well in her class.
I took her class at New York City College of Technology. Excellent professor. Grades fairly. Encourages in-class collaboration to further understand the lessons. I highly recommend her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Clearly knows what she's talking about. Can sometimes be a little confusing, but generally understandable. Always willing to stop class to answer questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Amazing professor. Her instruction is very clear and she posts all of her class notes onto Canvas. I have never had a professor who cared so much about her students' success; she knew everyone's name in a lecture of about 60. There are about 3 exams, which her practice exam will prepare you well for. Weekly quizzes in conferences directly from HW.

Great teacher, really knows her stuff. She is always willing to take the time to make sure you understand the material. She is always suggesting to come to her office hours so she can help you even more. She is also very understanding, and incredibly nice!

Medina can be kinda intense but on the whole shes a really caring professor. She tries her hardest to see her students succeed and if you show up to class & just try, shell love you and youll likely be fine. Theres lots of opportunities to get positive grades that stack up and can pad test scores. She gave my class an extra credit mini test too
She cares about her students a lot, she's very good at posting things on canvas but she can be difficult at times.
Can sometimes be difficult to understand while lecturing, but is easily accessible outside of class. Do the practice tests and some of the suggested problems and you'll be fine.
Genuinely cares about students and their success. Gives extra credit opportunities on exams and has lots of office hours. Light homework load, especially compared to other profs.

Worst experience i've ever had in a math class. Didn't explain any of the concepts, taught myself completely out of the book. Completely hopeless when it came to zoom, he would spend about half of each class fumbling with the screen.

Umberto is by far the best Calculus professor I have ever had the pleasure of having. His explanations are fantastic, his course organization is clear, and homework assignments are extremely helpful in cementing the knowledge of the given subject. Couldn't recommend this man highly enough.
Really does not delve into concepts a ridiculous amount but will tech you enough for you to be able to use it in other facets.
One of the best professors I've had. Starts out hard, gets easier. Explains the advanced calculus concepts well. I loved his class.

He is the most famous professor research-wise in WPI's math department. There is a famous math concept named after him (Mosco convergence). Makes the advanced calculus courses very simple and easy. He always emphasizes the basics.
No Comments
Cant speak english very well, and confuses himself when he writes on the board.  its pointless to ask him for extra help because he just goes off on a tangent(no pun intended)
He cant speak english or understand anything you ask him.  NO people skills at all.  PS. Too bad he's tenour.
Really smart guy but horrible at explaining things. speaks soooo fast hard to follow

Prof. Fischers classes are thorough and well organized. His teaching is clear and concise and is available to clear doubts. Group projects are an excellent way to implement his lectures in practice, a necessary tool for roboticists. Not the most challenging of classes but a good class nonetheless to introduce yourself to the basics of robotics.

Great class. RBE workload isn't for everyone and Fischer's class is no exception, but you learn a ton. Interesting lectures, brutal but rewarding labs. Fischer really cared about making sure the students were getting lots out of the class, and was always looking for feedback. Tests were sometimes unfinishable in time allowed, but curved generously.

Me and my partner were looking for MQP projects for our Senior year and wanted to set up a meeting with prof Fischer. It took us 3 emails and a snowstorm, which caused a THIRD day off at WPI in a semester, for him to reply to our initial emails. Then he never followed up on what time or project we should meet, because of no further snowstorm
Professor Fischer is great! His teaching style is clear and concise, and his homework assignments are very helpful and well designed.

His lectures are excellent. You wouldn't require any other source except those. They are very clear and easy to understand. The home works checks if the concepts have been clearly understood. Overall very good course and excellent professor.

A great professor who focuses a lot on conceptual clarity. Very detailed lectures. Really cares for every student even in his extremely busy schedule. A little late on checking assignments and quizzes however.

Very nice guy. Focused on connecting the knowledge with practical application. Paper talk every week. The final project is a huge part with a lot of effort and great fun. The report is in Latex. Very pleased to answer questions. The mid-term is kinda tough. Anyway, in WPI, if you wanna study robotics, this is the guy whose course you should take.
There should honestly be a tag for "brings dog to class."
Titova cares and puts more effort into making sure everyone understands what's going on than most college professors. She is wonderful.
Prof Titova is super nice. Its a little difficult to get to know her because the class is so large but if you make an effort to reach out to her shell definitely be there to help.

The class was curved nicely - exams make up for 60% of your grade. She is really funny and uses the board well during lectures, but she's kind of quiet so sit up front. Doesn't use class capture, and the homework is assigned through webwork. Go to conference, it's really valuable and the example problems she gives are basically the exam questions
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: She mostly copied from pre written papers and narrated what she wrote. When asked questions during office hours, would say something that didn't answer the question. Pretty moderate teacher, knew some stuff but using the book to learn is way more efficient.

Really great teacher. Reading the textbook helps you understand her lectures more. It's a hard class because it's a hard subject, but she tries to make it as understandable as possible. She also really cares about the students, and is around a lot to help if you need it.

Her lectures are clear and easy to understand and she caters to the student audience (she used a Game of Thrones reference for projectile motion). She is easy to meet outside of class if you need help. There is a good amount of homework, but as long as you're okay with time management you should be fine.
Better class to take than 1110
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Had him B22 and all I gotta say is Wally! He's a great guy and this is a fun class. You can go at your own pace in his class for the homework, quizzes, and in class reports and essays. There is one required essay. He will grade based on mostly completeness, show effort and you get a 100. Lab is fun but grading is on correctness. Very good class!

Professor Towner is one of the few professors I have met that places his student above everything else and has extreme consideration and compassion as a professor and mentor. He gives clear hws and exams, he gives you every tool needed to succeed and excel in his class. He emphasizes the importance of financial literacy. Please keep inspiring Wally

I enjoyed Prof Towner's classes! I also took BUS3020 and OIE3420 with him. Class is straightforward and if you do everything on time, no reason to not earn an A. However, most lectures are him giving stories of application, rather than explicitly discussing the material. Definitely read the book if you want to gain a deeper understanding.
Easy class
This class is very simple if you just complete assignments on time and attend lab(which is fun). He is a easy grader and nice guy.

Professor Towner is by far one of my favorites at WPI, he has really insightful lectures, has genuine interests in seeing his students succeed and absorb the material, and more importantly, what he has to teach is incredibly substantial.

He teaches on subjects that genuinely interest him, and this shows.  He has lots of real life experience, and talks in a very narrative manner governed mostly by stories about what he has seen during his career.  He is a very easy professor where if you pay attention and do the work, there is no reason you shouldn't get an A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Easy A as long as you do the work. Even if you try and don't get a good grade he goes over answers in class and you can re-submit for full credit. Also very easy lab, and group projects. He wants you to learn and if that means everyone gets an A that's what will happen.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment:
Fantastic lectures for learning computer networks. He also marks his slides so you know exactly what to study for the quiz and has sample midterm and finals that correlate very well. Projects are well-structured in a way that helps you understand further about the materials.

Goes above and beyond for students. Genuine and caring. Highly recommend

His lecture is a real gem. He motivates people with his lecture and clearly shows how the current research (well, not so current but within 5 years range) are going. Projects are really helpful for you to understand the concept. Yes, it is hard and required a lot of resources but it is provided. It is worth your time at night to learn this class!

A remarkable and helpful professor, organized contents of the course very well and the concepts were clearly explained. It was an enjoyment to take this class as its logical hierarchy made me very comfortable.
