And he always expressed his willingness to help students and can always explain the concepts and questions in an easily understandable way.
he is a good teacher.

Li is a good professor. He want students to learn something new rather than finishing homework and exam. If you can prove you tried your best and have good attitude, he will grade u A. Highly recommend his DS 504. It is a paper based lecture and you can learn a lot from it.

Very good lecturer teaching on a super interesting topic. Exams, quizzes, and labs are all fair and generally easy. Programming projects are a lot of work but there are plenty of office hours to help, and they are pretty fun projects once you get the hang of them. You don't need to go to his lectures to do well but I highly recommend going anyway.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I literally never go to any of my CS lectures because I do better self-studying, but Li's lecture's are worth waking up in the morning for. Super helpful and it is very clear what the quizzes and exams are on so you know how to prepare.

He is a pretty good professor. Gives plenty of chances for extra credit, even though you shouldn't need to do it to get an A. Two exams, 8-10 quizzes (lowest one being dropped, plus you can use a cheat sheet on each), 3 individual programming projects, and 3 easy lab assignments. Willing to modify deadlines/ assignments if necessary.

I had Dr. B for PSY1400 and PSY1800. He truly cares about his students and I really like that about him. Because we have had so many suicides at this school, he promised that we will all receive an A in this course if we show effort and do our work. By far one of the best professors Ive had.

He tells you when you are doing bad, but will give you the tools necessary to fix. He also tells you when you are doing good. He will say it how it is and that's what I loved. He has greatly improved my presentation skills and writing throughout this past semester. He also helps outside of class hours. He is truly happy when his students succeed
He gave critical, but very helpful feedback. Very chill when not working, played poker with us one weekend :).

On our IQP, he was very critical but in a professional manner. He helped many students with their presentation skills and overall professional demeanor. He has a plethora of stories and things he has done in his life that he loves to share with those who want to learn. He cares for all of his students and shows it through his teaching practices.
Will yell at you for the smallest thing possible. Pray you do not have him for ID 2050 or you will have a bad time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Type of guy to make you call him Dr instead of Professor. Thinks he's jesus on earth, and your job is to save the world instead of complete your project. Often forgets what he's previously told you then yells at you for doing something wrong.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Gives everyone in a group same grade regardless contribution of individuals. Has millions of reasons to give you a B include using white powerpoint background and making minor grammar mistakes. Want you to save the world rather than doing your actual project. Only gives you comments which criticize you language use but not on the content .

If you get him for ID2050 be prepared to actually work for an A. He tells you that Cs are for people who do the minimum so you need to go above and beyond. Already he is very picky about what he wants like PowerPoint slide presentations. You either live him or hate him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Thorp is a great professor, really cares about her students and their education. Cool person too.
Goated professor for Applied Statistics I and II. Would absolutely recommend.

One of the best professors I've ever had! She uses standards-based grading, which allows you to revise any piece of her work in her class (including quizzes & exams), surveys the class on data to use in her examples, and brings in free food sometimes! If you're stuck, she is also willing to sit down with you and explain a concept until you get it.

She has engaging lectures and is very personable. She likes to include humor in the lectures and usually has a funny story to tell from her experience as a statistician. She uses a specialized grading system, which is a hit or miss. The tests are easy and usually include some bit of extra credit. The homework is not difficult, but usually lengthy.
The lectures were engaging. Not a huge fan of the different grading system.

Professor Thorp has been my favorite professor so far. Her class is super laid back, but I still feel like I learned a ton. Also, I need to know where she gets her jeans because I want a pair. I love her. That's all.

Cool lady, Bad teacher. She can't answer clarifying questions or engage with any alternative procedure for problemsolving except for the one in her slideshow. She does not know where formulas come from, she does not know why "this is just the way we do it." I felt unable to engage with the subject on any deeper level than just copying down formulas

Gave one assignment every week except during finals. Gave a midterm+final. Lectures definitely help with hw. I was surprised that I didn't use R for the whole lab. Homework was long. Prof is new and a little awkward at times but is really good at helping students when in need of assistance, ask her for help, she will clarify problems.

Carly Thorp is a new professor this year, she told us this and it is very obvious. She is an okay professor, if you can ignore her passive aggressive disposition and petty comments on assignments. She grades homework for correctness, which is one thing I do not like. And her office is on the third floor of stratton hall, not very accessible.

EXCELLENT professor! great explanations and actually stimulates thought versus others in his department that rely on memorization techniques. he actually cares to teach his students. definitely stands out as a wonderful professor.
Great professor!!! Very well prepared, and he explained all the course material in a very intuitive way.
He is helpful if you show interests in his course.

He knows a lot, you just have to get by his arrogance and actually listen.  Teaching isn't great, but I've had worse, just keep in mind that to do well in the class you have to LEARN, not just memorize.
He is hard to understand and is somewhat impatient with students, but if you go to him during office hours and just ask dumb questions, you can do pretty well in his class.
Awful, terrible
He thinks he know everything, terrible Italian accent, hard to understand, he may fail you after a week of taking his course (so better kiss some a**, before its to late).
He really wants his students to learn and also pushes them really hard. Nice guy.. enjoyable to talk to.

Professor Boucher is the best she will give you multiple tries to resubmit an assignment to get the highest grade possible. she is flexible with deadlines as long as you email her first. If you are a person that skips class she isn't the professor for you
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Very professional professor. She doesn't really care about deadline, as long as you submit something great at the end. Always go to her office hours because she is really helpful in one-one explanation. Show respect, go to class and do the work and you should get an A.  Overall, Great professor.

You'll observe a high school class 2 hours/week. Set that up with Katherine. No tests. You write short journal entries and teach mock lessons. Some of the teaching advice is practical and helpful, some is self-contradictory and confusing. If you miss a class, you drop a letter grade. Miss 3 classes, and you fail. Wouldn't take again. No deadlines.
easiest A in my life
She is helpful, but the final grade will make you surprises.

I recommend her ISE course because the course can teach you basic English writing skill. Prof. Boucher is super nice and patient, if you have some problems, just go and ask her. Her course refreshed my mind of English writing, which is pretty helpful.  For International freshmen whose writing is not good, her course is your best choice.
Excellent professor :) She gave lots of interesting articles!
All essay topics she gives are very interesting. Also, her comments on essays are very helpful.

The course is graded on short, remote quizzes and weekly assignments. The quizzes reflect the lectures/powerpoints. Expect to learn a lot outside of class and go to every office hour to get the assignments done. None of the assignments or quizzes have deadlines except that you submit them by the last day of the term, which is helpful.
This was my first class in masters and professor Xiangnan Kong is a real gem. We learnt a lot from him. Great teaching and a very nice person.

Prof. Kong is one of the great professor in WPI. Even though his example is simple, his homework are considerably quite challenging but not so challenging that it is impossible to do. He is very knowledgeable on his expertise and if you have any question, he will answer it right away. Prepare for a lot of movie memes and funny video.

Professor Kong is by far the worst professor I've had at WPI. He's very friendly and willing to work with students, but that fact that this course is a 4000 level CS class is a joke. I learned very little. I stopped going to class and easily got an A.

Kong is one of the most respectful Professors for me in WPI. He has comprehensive knowledge of machine learning and always able to answer tough questions intuitively. The homework is a design by himself with an amazing structure and test cases. The only bad thing is he focuses on storytelling too much and may jump hard concepts so quickly.

Professor Kong is a friendly professor, but he's the worst lecturer I ever had at WPI. I was unable to follow most of the lectures, even on toics I already knew about. He tried to explain everything TOO clearly (which made the lectures impossible to follow), but still leaves out important details on how everything fits together.

The class had virtually no overlap with the course description. Course content was either full of irrelevant material (e.g. a video on Facebook corporate culture, an Apple Face ID ad, a clip from the film "Moneyball", etc.), poorly explained with too many simplistic examples, or so niche as to be useless. I stopped showing up and still got an A.

You'll pass easily, but you'll learn nothing unless you put in the time to teach yourself, which is necessary for neither the homeworks nor the quizzes. In some cases, the homework doesn't help at all topic, because it's so specific to one part of the topic. This is the class that made me realize I'd prefer a hard class to a bad one.
Great teacher
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He's good at working with people from all different musical backgrounds. I had already been playing clarinet and piano for years, so the class was an easy A. But, if you don't know anything about music it is still an easy class and balances out science and engineering courses well. He's also got a good sense of humor which I appreciated.
Funny and easygoing guy; the class is very easy and even a little boring if you've played an instrument or know a little theory.
All around great teacher

This class is very easy if you've taken even the most basic theory before. I enjoyed his classes for the most part, though sometimes it could get boring. We had a ton of little quizzes and homework so there's nothing to worry about if you don't do well on one.

This class has a good amount of busy work but is overall very useful. I came in with no musical experience but can now read it well. The only issue was that we did not listen to much music in a music class, instead learning theories behind it. The tests were like the homework, he is very inclusive, and he makes sure you all learn it.

Had him for the vocal performance practicum. As the other reviewer said, if you put in the effort, he'll know. You really need to be on top of your stuff for this class; deadlines come up pretty quickly. It's semi-random who sings each week, so you always have to be prepared. He is incredibly supportive both in and out of class.
Had him for the vocal performance practicum. He really challenges you to be a better singer. Put the work in and he'kk know.
Great director, has done a lot in the short time he has been here.
Cool Professor!
Professor Olsen is a skilled lecturer but often makes errors in grading and can be rude in emails to students.

Her lectures were not very helpful and the way she did homework was awful. Went to prof hours and she did not really help. Her tests are very long, and you can barely if that finish them. Would not recommend taking her as she does not really teach, and I struggled, and she did not really help me when I went to prof hours.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I had Professor Olsen for Metabolism and Disease and I loved it! As someone who struggled with Orgo and all the other gen chems, personally, this class was by far the best and the educational value of this course was much more than previous chem classes. I would 100% recommend this class. Primarily the grade consists of tests and a final project.
Good

Olsen is a decent teacher, though you can tell she'd rather be teaching a more advanced class. She is very knowledgable and talks about her lab a lot, but it seems she has a hard time "dumbing herself down" for an intro level class. Lots of reading assigned but you don't really need to do it, as everything is covered in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She was new to teaching this course so some adjustment was to be expected. The small daily homework assignments were great for grade boosting. The tests are insanely long and it is nearly impossible to finish them during the class period. Lectures were good, but got boring real quick. Some bonus point were given.

Not a good chem professor AT ALL. She is new and has never taught a chem 1010 class before. Each test had a class average of 70 or below. Students often corrected her and sometimes she was unsure about the answers to her own questions. Tests have way too much material for a 50 min period. Lectures are useless. I would strongly suggest avoiding her.
Don't fall for it. I thought this would be an easy course, it wasnt.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Gives unclear feedback. Tries to make lectures fun, but basically just goes over stuff in the textbook and then gets off topic. Graded on a bunch of 1-page papers (about one a week), which are easy enough. Admits to purposely NRing students who don't show up even if they do the work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the youngest and best professors at WPI. Very passionate about the evolution of the computing industry. No exams; graded only on 4-5 one page papers, an individual presentation, a group presentation, and class participation. He gives extra credit; it's a good idea to do one of them to be on the safe side (usually just another paper).
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Bombards you with extra credit 'opportunities' and admits to deliberately giving low scores on the many, many mandatory papers.  Requires you to turn in papers on Blackboard AND in person.  Doesn't actually teach class, just asks your opinions on readings and papers.

By far the best professor I have ever had at WPI. Professor Pray is an incredible teacher and really cares about his students. His class is definitely a lot of work, but he does a great job teaching. If you work hard in his class you will have a great time. Can't recommend him enough.

Extremely kind and invested in his students. He makes an effort to get to know everybody.  The class topics aren't so inherently interesting, but he makes them great. Lots of one page papers but they aren't *so* bad. Overall fantastic professor, but be prepared for lots of work.

He is a good speaker and it was a fun and entertaining class, however, a lot of the discussion was off topic from the readings and slides.  If you take this class be prepared to have lots of one page papers due, although they generally aren't too bad to write.
No Comments

If you follow his classes and 'attempt' to do your homework, you are sure to get all the course outcomes that are mentioned. I have taken 2 of his courses, RBE 500 & RBE 501. He really takes feedback very seriously. His TAs usually are tough on the grading and it makes you work anything from a min of 5-6 hours to 15+ hours a week.

He puts in a lot of effort to prepare for his lectures and is a really caring person in general (almost always available). He is well-intentioned but has a hard time conveying his thoughts to the students which leads to some difficulty in understanding his lectures if you are new to the topic. He acts on the feedback he gets which is appreciated.

Although this professor started out poor, once we gave him feedback he completely turned around, going out of his way to help students understand every concept, hosting online weekend help sessions, changing the exams, etc. He would revisit old lectures if the class did poorly on a particular concept on the test.

I have never seen a professor so dedicated to his students. He is determined to assure his students understand the curriculum. For example, when our first exam went less than perfect, he went to Best Buy, bought recording software to make high quality example videos, hosts Sunday zoom lectures, and set up more office hours. Im still so impressed.

This professor was really disappointing.  He took concepts which were taught in the original class and made them very difficult to understand.  I found myself having to go to the book which he admitted was incorrect in certain places (and I validated that statement when I went to the book for some of the homeworks).  Awful

His 3+ hours of lectures every week are like reading a dictionary ... perfectly clear ... if you are a robot.  He seems to be one of those professors that is really smart and well-intentioned but has a tough time relating the material to students.  Expect to be given test & hw questions you have never seen or practiced before.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this professor like the plague. He is not helpful at all, extremely unreasonable, and an extremely harsh grader with no justification.  Do not take him for any course unless you want to work 50+ hours a week and still get failing grades on every assignment when there is not a valid reason for it.

I would highly recommend this professor. I NR my class with Planchard but I did well with this prof. I am pretty sure I would get an A. He made comprehensive ppt and all quizzes are from ppt. Lab and HW take some time but he is always willing to help and answer any questions. You'll get an A if you go to class and do HWs&Labs.
test have nothing to do with what was taught or in the book.  Prof is totally unhelpful.
I have no idea how he is as a professor, but he was good asn an IQP advisor. He suggested possible avenues for us to pursue in our research and was quick to notice how much work we really put in.
He is a horrible professor. His classes are really boring but DO NOT DO PROJECTS WITH HIM! He gives no guidence and brings up problems at the last minute. Very inattentive and NOT helpful

This guy is so awful. His homework has nothing to do with his lectures which have nothing to do with his tests.  He says he doesn't want you just looking up equations, but then gives problems from chapters you've never even seen before and marks you wrong when you attempt to derive things yourself
No Comments
bad
rather unclear in his explanations most of the time

Probably my favorite class I've take here at WPI. Her class format is brilliant. She gives you a short 20m video lecture you can watch on your own. You solve an easy HW problem based off of the video. Then in class you work together to solve a harder problem and when you're finished, you can leave early! Just don't miss class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Did not actually teach, she tried a new technique that involved watching lectures online at home and then handing in homework the next day before she discussed the material or could ask questions. then in class you would do a harder problem, when you didn't even understand the "easy" homework problem. never really taught anything, and no good book.

A lot of HW and in class problems, but she put up a discussion board for questions for the HW or class problems on mywpi. I guess the worst thing about the class was it's tough office to see TA and her-self. Overall she wasn't bad

All she did in lectures was conceptual stuff you could read from the book instead of example problems with calculations. Homework and exams were difficult because you had to teach yourself the material.
Hard

Very, very inefficient use of time in class. Used clicker questions and would spend twenty minutes on 1 question over a basic concept. Then the homework would have ridiculous material on it. Clickers were everyday too.

This professor is awesome.  She only teaches once a year, but it is well worth it to take this class.  Does the practical side of heat transfer, versus most other professor that teach the theoretical side.   Very hard (expect a fair amount of work), but she's helpful and you learn a lot.   Definity take Heat Transfer from this woman.

Funny and the nicest guy I may have ever met. Lectures are enjoyable, but some topics are more dry than others (Nature of law). You will learn a lot of practical info. Participate and make sure he knows your name/face from the debates or from participating and asking questions, it will help for grading purposes. Can't recommend him enough though

Jim McKenna is the full package. He brings humour, interesting stories, inspiration, respect, and quality teaching to the classroom. He is a full-time lawyer by day and yet understands the student's perspective incredibly well. I thoroughly enjoyed taking this class and I learned a LOT.

One of the best classes I've ever taken at WPI, both in the undergrad and grad level. Outstanding professor, who knows his stuff and engages all the students. I truly look forward to the class each week.

A+++ Prof!  Definately the best teacher at WPI!  Don't miss out on this class!  Even though attendence isn't mandatory, you'll enjoy the break in reality that is found in the lively discussion and engaging examples.  Miss this class and you will miss the most enjoyable course on campus! SIGN UP NOW!

This is by far the best class I've taken at WPI.  Unlike other professors, lets you know exactly whats going to be on the exams.  Take this class if you enjoy discussion and sharing your opinion.  I could have gone to the two review classes before each exam and got an A but the class is too interesting and fun to pass up.

The most interesting professor i have had yet at wpi - if you have to take this course, definately take it with him cause you will surely not regret. I don't see how this class could be made more interesting

Excellent Teacher who really understands the topics he teaches (he is a practicing lawyer). Allows a break in his two hour class and tries to keep things lively. And as a plus I was taught ethics by a lawyer, now that was interesting!!!
She's incredible. Super chill teacher who really cares about educating her students and ensuring their success. Very passionate. Very inspirational. Knows every student by name.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I thought her class sessions were effective each week. We would spend about an hour discussing the final project and our progress on it and we'd spend an hour having a discussion about the week's readings. I enjoyed the class and thought it was organized well, and her feedback was always specific and helpful.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Cool class. Lots of written assignments for the end of the term. There is lots of reading to do for each class, but most of it is skimmable.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Has essays due every other week and gives good feedback on them. There are a lot of readings every week and the reading quizzes only ask questions on about a third of the readings. Lectures are informational but not super interesting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Lectures are extremely boring. 3 papers and a final in-class essay. Too much work for a humanities credit. Avoid
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Prof. Davis is a very nice and kind professor but is extremely critical and precise with her relatively more difficult grading of essays. Overall lots of diverse topics and resources for the readings. You can get away with skimming the text. Make sure to try to participate every so often as she remembers students' names and how often they answer.

Professor Davis is a nice, caring history professor who has an interesting view on teaching history. We had to know only large overarching topics and how they were connected, instead of memorizing tons of useless dates, many people, and the smallest events which took place. It was a nice way to learn the topic. Go to class and write the essays!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Can seem intimidating and impatient at times, but not a bad bloke. Extremely generous with extensions and genuinely do want you to learn and succeed. However, everyone can attest that his explanations can be extremely confusing at times. The three-hour time slot does not help. If he can improve the explanations, the class will be so much better.

Professor clearly knows the content. The lecture is a math-intensive class, so if you want coding tutorials for your work or projects, his class is not for you. You need to have solid programming background on this, and by solid, they mean it. Fun class as he presents you with both the intuitive and theoretical sides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: You gotta be focused when you take a course with him

Just skip the lectures and watch StatQuest for the quiz materials, literally puts up entire pages of text ripped from the textbook on a single slide of which he has 100+ per lecture. No actual code implementation is discussed in class which is mandatory for the projects so if you don't know machine learning and statistics in python get to googling.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Absolutely awful professor. His lectures are so mind-numbingly dull and useless to the quizzes/homework that it's better to study them yourself. Avoid him like the plague if you value your mental health.
he is an excellent instructor, skipping the class is a little tricky!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Amazing professor. He clearly knows what he's talking about and is passionate about the field. Really, really smart. I learn something every time I have a conversation with him.
Simple lectures paired with hard assignments and despite several intents to communicate with the professor she never responded back.

Everything about this professor was very subpar. The lectures weren't very helpful for the assignments. She lets us change our hypothesis to match our results for some reason. Unhelpful feedback on most assignments, and any questions she answered made me question her expertise in the subject. Very inaccessible to meet with. Will make you hate BCB.

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. This professor does not teach her actual class. She uses old lectures from a different professor that teaches from a different book. Her quizzes are impossible as they don't even line up with what is taught in the class. She is so absent I cant believe I spent $5,000 to be taught by Khan Academy.

Does not give good feedback. Harsh grader. Doesn't do her own lectures, instead pulls from Khan Academy and then defends herself by saying "its a masters level course" and we need to put the work in; except she doesn't do the work to properly grade and teach her students. I paid so much money for this class and am not enjoying my experience at all!

I'm not a research and don't want to be. Instead, Prof decided on top of a full research project, presentation, weekly problem sets, weekly text book reading and required discussions, to add additional weekly 'journal club' so we can 'learn to read published papers' and effective prose style to 'learn writing'. Worst of biotech master's program
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: The majority was a useless group project. The professor had us change our hypothesis to better fit the data, which is scientifically unethical to teach. After making all of her changes (which didn't make sense) she still graded harshly. This was my intro to a Masters in Biotech at WPI and now I will not even consider applying to this program.

The majority of the grade is a useless group paper. The professor had us change the hypothesis to better fit the data, which scientifically unethical to teach. After making all of her changes (which didn't make sense) she still graded harshly. This was my intro to a Masters in Biotech at WPI and now I won't even consider applying to this program.
Hard class but learned probably the most valuable skills during his class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: He was absolutely amazing. Definitely knows his stuff well, very clear, informative lectures, and not too many homework's or exams. He made what can be a pretty difficult class very easy and I learned a lot. Definitely take this class with him if you can!

Took it over the summer and he communicated well. definitely a lot of work but its a 3000 class and it wasnt too bad. open note exams but worth 70 percent. explained everything well and wasnt hard class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Mehdi started his first class saying "it is very easy to get an A in my class," and he is absolutely right. His homeworks and tests are surprisingly easy, but mostly due to the fact that he teaches in a methodical and understandable manner. His way of explaining difficult topics makes them click with me super well. Would highly recommend his class!

Mehdi was the first professor I have had at WPI who communicated course objectives clearly and understandably. He answers questions thoughtfully and truly cares that his students succeed. The assigned work was reasonable and exams were laid out exactly as he said they would be. I will be taking future courses with him.

Professor Mortazavi is awesome!  The lectures can be a lot, you'll be taking notes the whole class, but it's key to attend class, for the content, the test hints and the extra credit opportunities. He gives more than enough resources for you to succeed. He cares about his students and is a funny dude. Definitely recommend.

He's one of my favorite professors at WPI. He's extremely approachable and had office hours every day after class. The homework, quizzes, and tests consisted of problems from in-class handouts. He also made YouTube videos that give you a step-by-step solution to these handouts. He provides LOTS of extra credit opportunities. Definitely recommend.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Good balance of lecture and practice problems. The quizzes and exams are very reasonable and you know exactly what you need to study. You'll never be surprised by a question. Slightly disorganized this year as he's new to WPI, but as he figures out the 7-week terms, I'm sure that'll change.

I would definitely take this professor again. The tests are in person, but are exactly like the homework. He uploads all the homework and exam answers and clearly tells you in class what will be on the exam. gives a ton of extra credit and listens to student feedback. Just review the homework and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I loved taking class with him! He had great lectures and obviously knows a lot about music technology. My only complaint was that the class was a bit reading-heavy and that the labs were kind of difficult.
Didn't anticipate the class to have so much reading and writing in psychology, thought it would be more musical oriented according to the course description.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Prof Barton is excellent and gives thoughtful feedback. Very open-minded, committed to ensuring the collective understanding of all students in the class. Not stuffy and subjective like many music classes, which I think some took for granted; stayed away from the critical judgments that usually make classes in the arts stressful for students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: His feedback is great, always a blend of compliments and constructive criticism. he cares about his students well being. Highly recommend mu3615 with him, I learned a lot about composition and music production.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: This class said it didn't require prior knowledge, but half the class came in as electrical engineers and pro-programmers. I knew nothing coming in besides basic programming, and I had to heavily rely on other students to know the rest. Everybody failed his quizzes (25% of final grade) and he still won't scale. Also the final is super expensive $$.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Had him for Topics in Interactive Programming, in which you learn "Max." Didn't need prior programming experience. You'll be totally lost on the quizzes if you don't do the readings. Honestly for the projects he just cares if you worked & thought hard about it. Make it seem like you poured your soul into it and you'll be good to go.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Classes and projects are fun. Homework is time consuming. Lots of readings and writings.

Professor Deskins was a very caring professor and knew his material. He is very willing to give help outside of class and responds to emails in a timely manner. Quizzes are worth 60% of the grade, but the graders we had were very inconsistent with their grading. If you disagree with the grading, you can go back and ask for a regrade which is useful

Professor Deskins is great - his lectures are very informative and he uses a lot of example problems to enhance understanding. The class I took with him had a LOT of homework, but the quizzes (all quizzes, no exams, lowest quiz+hw grade dropped) were much easier than the homeworks.

Prof. Deskins uses the flipped classroom method, and it works surprisingly well. All of his lectures are posted on youtube and you take a short easy quiz after each "day" of lectures. We start homework in class, and it's a lot more helpful than you might think. Homework is due daily, but 3 grades are dropped at the end of the term (at least for me)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Awesome professor with the willingness to meet with students outside of the classroom if they are having issues. The flipped classroom style is awesome, as you get to practice what you learn in the classroom, with classmates to help and Prof Deskins will come over and help if your group can't figure it out.

Homework is due every day, but they are extremely helpful in understanding the material. He is always willing to help when it is needed.  Be prepared to put in a very  large amount of time, but with a successful pay off.

Tests were a good representative of the material covered in class.  Wants everyone to do well.  Makes chemical engineering fun.  Projects could have used more extra helpexplanation because they are so challenging but they are graded relatively easily to make up for it.
Was a great guy and very helpful as an FA

He is the worst teacher I've ever had and he knows no mathematics at all - stay away from him unless you wants getting an A without challenges and understanding the staff. He confused himself at least three times and lost all of us all the time by his pure ignorance.

Great professor who really wants everyone to understand. Makes sure to take his time explaining. Office hours are extremely helpful. His accent might be a bit intimidating at first but you will get used to it. Offered retakes on first exam.

I found his accent hard to understand but he was very helpful in office hours and willing to go over anything you didn't understand as well as explaining HW problems. He overall is not an awful professor but definitely not the best.

This person has no idea what math is and I felt no challenge at his class. I thought as it was my first year, why not to make life easier. Yet, I now realized he never taught important materials and to make thing worse, he did many many things wrong. I cannot imagine how I can manage my cal3 class now without knowing the fundamentals of cal2 sham

I got a 5 on the Calc AB exam in high school, so this class was relatively easy for me, although many I knew struggles. He teaches right from the book, and thus has trouble answering questions without his notes. Homework is very hard and time consuming, although it prepares you well for the quizzes. Accent is thick so be prepared to pay attention.

most confusing character IU had and he removed points for not doing it his way I got the same exact answer but because my process was off I lost points the homework had a value of 30 points and quizzes were normaly 18 By the time it was time for finals I was so confused on everything and didnt know what to do dont take his class if you can.

Professor Bhatta relied on the textbook; the lectures seemed to come straight from the book. His quizzes are very easy (there are 5, he drops the lowest quiz grade), but his homeworks are impossibly difficult (these too are from the text, and expect 40+ tough problems weekly!). Easy quizzes left most students unprepared for the final. Heavy accent.

Cool guy, helpful, and a fair grader. He really looks into your sources, so you can't really BS your papers, but he's still pretty easy. Most of your grade comes from discussions, so try to talk once in a while. Also: field trips. Nuff said.
a great faculty advisor
He was a jerk, and all his grades were based simply on your sources, not what you wrote.
One of the best history classes. Very enthralling lectures. Fosters tremendous amount of quality and sensible class discussion and participations.
Field trips were great, talks all the time and asks students to speak up..."anyone? anyone?"  but the writing isn't bad at all.

This guy is the man, great teacher, fair grader, loves discussion, and takes you on freakin field trips! maybe i'm just a sucker for field trips...but yeah, he's the man. i'm hoping to do my suff with him. your grade is determined mostly by short writing assignments, not too difficult. good guy.

A good guy, a little vague and self-contradicting sometimes but he is helpful if you spend the time to ask for explanations, fair grader, and a resonable professor to talk to.  He knows everything there is to know about his work.

Absolutely amazing Professor. His lectures were extremely clear and informative, and he made everything simple to learn. He also made sure everyone was understanding and would take time to further explain or show in a different way if needed. Started every class by asking how students were and genuinely cared about them. Would highly recommend!
Fantastic teacher. Always willing to explain things to you if you are confused but not in the condescending way. The homeworks are terrible though.
Great Professor, Highly Recommend.
Very nice guy. Always started class by asking how people were even in such a large lecture. Talks fast but nots are available after the fact.

I found it difficult to keep up. It was either you take notes or you pay attention to the lecture, mainly because he writes SUPER fast. However, class notes were always available. Exams were worth 50% of your grade (scaled). He was available outside of class a lot though, and office hrs were helpful. Responded to emails FAST, and gave extensions.

He is a great professor! He really cares about the material, but also the students and makes it a point to try and learn everyones names. He responds to emails FAST, and always gives you help when you need it. The tests are scaled, and everyone does pretty well. I highly recommend.

Based professor, though I can imagine some people not vibing with his lecture style--writing a bunch of definitions, theorems, and proofs in succession (this is a math course, however). I find it nice, as it keeps all of the info in one place. If you don't understand something, you can send him an email and he'll likely respond. Detailed feedback.

I didn't realize it when I took 2071 with Tripp, but he's an amazing professor especially in a smaller class. Keeps lectures lighthearted, usually willing to extend deadlines, and really good at understanding students and answering questions. Also makes sure to connect with the class and relate lectures to our interests.

This class is really important for developing your own apps, games, or any internet based application. You learn really important and technical stuff about networking that you are even expected to use in your final project. The big issue I had with this class is the fact that Gannon's lectures are really dry. This just makes the course harder.

Well designed online course that ends up really helping you learn the material. Lots of both group work and team work. Poor lecturer (feels like reading slides) but assigned reading material makes up for the lectures.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof. Gannon's E-Term cross-listed CS 3516 class (cross-listed with two grad classes; don't remember which) was very interesting. There was one open-ended project, weekly homework, and two take-home exams. While the single-block 4-hour lecture seems daunting, he gives a decent break in the middle, and dismisses class as much as forty minutes early.
SYS ENG 510.  He was great.  Knows his stuff and teaches it well.  Loved his class!

not a bad guy, but using ppt from the author of the book, hw from the book, some exam problems from the book is pretty sad.  didn't try to compensate for the poor, to say the least, slides and book in terms of explaining ideas and processes.
He really knows his stuff. Very helpful and friendly. His lecture is very professional. Highly recommeded for his class!
Friendly guy. Pretty low-key, but occasionally makes attempts at humor.
He is a good professor for Calc 2 and was always listening and attentive to student's needs, and was always willing to discuss concepts further when needed.

His lectures were difficult to understand at first, but after review and homework the concepts became easier to understand. His practice exams are a lifesaver, almost exactly the same as exams. Solid choice for Calc 3.

Sometimes it may be hard to follow along his lectures in class, but he has Echo360 so you can rewatch them. His quizzes are exactly like problems in his lectures, and his practice exams are exactly like the actual exams. He gives a lot of partial and extra credit. If you do the practice exam a couple times and know the steps, you will get an A.

Professor Wei is very accessible for office hours. The homework is very hard (unlimited attempts though). Use the TA office hours and go to the Math Tutoring Center. Watch his recordings of the lecture because he goes through the material fast. Study the practice exam for the midterm. An A is definitely attainable. He gives a lot of partial credit.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I'm sure that he's a great professor, but the way he explains concepts and writes on the board is unclear at best. The TA was the most helpful part of the course

He's a very solid calculus teacher. Gives a fair amount of homework, all WeBWorK, but they're all sensible problems. You're in even better luck if you have a good TA/PLA. He does a great job. Gives you practice exams which are basically the exam with different numbers. No surprises. Great professor.

Prof Wei is an excellent teacher. While he may be understand at first due to his accent, he goes all out trying to help students. He tells students what sections the quizzes are on and offers practice exams very similar to the real one. Posts lecture notes too. Homework is online, and only graded on completion. Outside of class, he is helpful too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Life changing, im not the same person I was before this class
Very simply, I love him
Best prof ever!
The greatest professor I have ever had. Professor Wong changed my outlook on life and the way I viewed the world.
Absolute icon, excellent at anything related to bridges

Professor Wong is an icon at WPI. CE 3086 is known as a crucible in the civil engineering program, covering a wide variety of intense and intricate topics that are requisite of an eminent engineer. Although Professor Wong grades harshly, his clear love and passion for the profession inspires students to try their best. Highly recommend!
Most goated professor. Slight gambling addiction
Don't take her course!!!
Heavy project load and multiple tough assignments each week, not worth taking unless necessary.

Although my grade wasn't the best (tough TA grader), I thoroughly enjoyed this class and professor garcia does a great job teaching the content. There isn't a lot of lecture material, and it is project based. She is a really smart woman who cares deeply about making this class as interesting as possible.

I highly recommend this professor if you really want to learn about entrepreneurship. She made the class entertaining, and brought in a lot of guests that help us understand the business world even more. She is very well educated in entrepreneurship and that reflects on her class.

I loveddddd this class and professor garcia is amazing. she really cares about her students and learning from her has been one of my favorite things about wpi. She has a lot of background in entreprenurship and I really really recommend this class to anyone interested in entrepreneurship.

Unclear grading criteria, bad at grading, seemingly poor reading comprehension. Tends to be rude to students and guest speakers. Does not let you see which questions you get wrong on quizzes. Homework basically every class. Worst professor I've had at WPI.

She gave 3 online quizzes. The class was very informational. There was one big group project (broken into 2 parts (midterm+final), and you pitched a business/product. Attendance is taken in every class+she notes down the name of those who participated. She tries to get to know every student. No hw. There are many extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Raj Basu is the most awesome lab TA ever. Knows exactly what he is doing and explains everything easily. Grades lab reports very fairly. Highly recommended!
best conf inst i ever had!
Great conf inst. Knows what he's doing
Great conf inst. Knows what he's doing
I like this conf inst a lot!
Great guy. VERY helpful.  Little hard to understand at first, but once you get over that, he's excelent.  ALWAYS willing to help.
Learn a lot in the class, but received a grade lower than expected
Not a good experience unlike most courses I have taken at WPI. Do not recommend his classes

Very bad professor. Extremely poor at explaining concepts and how to do things. He will not answer your emails and the class is so disorganized. His office number on the syllabus has been wrong since the beginning of the term and he hasn't changed it. You will not understand anything during lecture and he assumes the class knows more than it does.

1. Does not email students 2. Does not follow up on what he says he will do (ex. Waited ~2 weeks for mid-term grades to be posted). 3. Slides usually do not contain the equations, only excel/financial calculator inputs. 4. Tells you to "write this down" but does not give enough time. I would write more, but character limit =[

1. His slides are always wrong. 2. His explanation is always even harder to understand. 3. If you are a rational-thinking and systematic person, he is your last choice. 4. He is way too behind the schedule and never tried to catch up. 5. His syllabus only has 50% that you should believe. 6. He isn's a kind person. 7. Just don't choose him.
So bad.He use engineer ways to teach business.His English is bad .He doesn't want giver A??.He is not a good person.And he Dnt teach ways to solve problem.Escape from his class!!!

The worst class I have taken during my 6 years at WPI.  He didn't teach at all and expects you to learn from reading the textbook.  I took the online one, and he was good during the cohorts, but i wouldn't recomend for the online version of the course

Before taking the class I heard scary stories about the Prof. and many advised me against it. I took the class anyway. He is simply inspirational. His time management, the clarity of his voice, makes him an amazing Prof.  Hws are  straightforward. Btw no fooling around or ur grade suffers. If u want to learn AI inside out take his class.
He is the best. The last man standing who really teaches something in WPI

The best course I've taken in WPI. HWs are educational, fun and useful, level of difficulty if just right. Prof. gives insightful and detailed feedback on your presentations and reports. I had no background in robotics but the materials and the prof. really make you excited about this field. Will seek for research opportunities in the future.
He is really good
Not helpful at all. Does not really care about students.

His assignments are not easy. Some of them are very hard and long. Class project requirements are also tough. His classes require significant coding experience. However, he's a good professor and you will get a lot of good academic experience from his classes (if you pass)

Benjamin Franklin said "I will speak evil of no man".....but this is not evil, it is just facts. This professor does not give you the impression he is wants to help you.....one wonders if he knows his stuff. I took the very first course he taught and believe you me it was a horrible experience. I cannot recommend him.

Awful prof. He gives you notes for the course and makes you print them out. The notes are super heavy and difficult to understand. He honestly doesn't care about this class. He just stands there and reads off his useless notes. He does throw a pretty big curve
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Datta is a terrible professor. He provides you with his notes on the chapters, and lecture is just him reading his notes. Tests are open book and notes and still impossible and very long. Many asked questions and he seemed to just ignore them. avoid if you can

Boring lectures. This class made me switch majors. The information was so jumbled that homework was very difficult to complete and the subject matter on the tests was a mystery until you were sitting down to take it.

Prof. Datta is the most boring lecturer ever. It is incredibly difficult to stay awake in his class, and I'm not someone to sleep in class. He shows one long pdf file that he slowly scrolls through each lecture. He does not explain material well, and most that pdf is just directly copied from the text book. AVIOD
awul
No Comments
No Comments

It was like a weird scavenger hunt to answer homework questions. Nothing about it was educational, the MSP430 launchpad is a horrible microcontroller with horrible documentation. The time spent on teaching information was never proportional to how important the information was. The labs did not match the lectures in the slightest.

Very kind and smart professor. His goal is to make the material as easy to understand as possible, and often broke up procedures in simple steps. Homework was straight forward and tests followed the homework. Overall a really good professor who is willing to work with you and help you out.
Overall he is a good professor. Lectures notes are clear and easy to follow. The only bad thing that his homework are super easy and his exams are super hard. Will recommend him...

HE IS REALL A GOOD TEACHER. IF YOU HAVE QUESTION, HE WILL SPEND TIME TO HELP YOU EVENIN HIS UNOFFICE HOUR. THE PROJECT IS EASY AND PRATICAL, AND HE GIVE YOU MANY MANY USEFUL INFORMATION FOR SOVLE PROBLEM OF PROJECT. ONLY ONE EXAM AND OPEN BOOK. IN NUT SHELL, IF YOU DO HOMEWORK, AND PROJECT, THE EXAM IS TOALLY EASY AND EASILY TO GET A.
He is a great guy. Always helpful. His lecture is very simple and easy to understand. Exams are tied to homework. So do you work and you will get an A. He really cares about students learning or not.
Good prof - teaches well. Has a bit of an accent, but he's understandable.

He is a great guy, and really knows his subject well. Make sure you sit up front so you can hear him. He is quiet and has some kind of allergy to chalk so it makes his voice quieter. His exams are a good measure of material and he seems very fair. I don't think he offers extra credit, but if you study, you'll be fine.

Proffesor gives more work then my math class and lecture portion of my science class combined. Has habit of assigning things last minute, and stacks papers so that you are expected to start the next paper before your done with the one before. The result is papers due effectively in only one or two days with little chance to get ahead of the work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: She would be a very good upperclassman professor and is obviously extremely knowledgeable, but there is a TON of work in her class, especially for stressed out younger students. I learned a ton and it was a good class, but most of the time she comes off as condescending and vague.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: While a little intimidating, she's a good professor who clearly has a lot of experience in the industry to share. There were so many out-of-class assignments to keep track of which sometimes felt overwhelming. Some of the assignments also weren't very clear, which was to emulate what working in the industry is like, but still frustrating.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Learned nothing just did a lot of work. She tried to teach writing which is odd since I wasn't taking a writing class. Worst part is she is a know-it-all. Like if she makes a claim and you refute it she just restates her claim louder as if it makes her more right. You can't have a discussion this way and it was frustrating and sometimes offensive.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor deWinter was the first writing professor I've had that actually taught me how to write. Gave out clear outlines of how to complete assignments as well as tips in class. Allowed students to redo assignments for better grades. There was a lot of work, but it wasn't that difficult. Highly recommend, would take another class with her.

Prof. deWinter is by far the worst professor I have ever had. She is obnoxious and vulgar. I highly suggest avoiding her at all costs. She assigns a large amount of busy work and I didn't learn much at all.

Lots of work, but not too difficult. Grading based only on doing things mentioned in class. Changed class schedule a lot. Gets angry when you don't do what she says. Not always clear expectations-pay attention. Very helpful in meeting outside class to discuss essays-good feedback. Limited contact hours. My writing improved greatly-highly recommend.
I thought it was too heavy of a workload for an intro humanities course. His lectures are really boring and his teaching style is pretty awkward. However, the class itself wasn't too difficult.

I took RE2725 but that wasn't an option to select. Lots of work (readings & discussion posts for homework, group research + presentation, quizzes, final 8-10 page paper, individual research + presentation), but I learned so much from this class (and got to work on my writing skills). He is very kind, approachable, accommodating, and understanding.

Professor Stoloff is an excellent teacher, and I've taken several of his classes. He really knows his stuff, makes learning fun, and is always there to help when you need it. I'd highly recommend his classes to anyone.

Professor Stoloff effectively conveys the essence of meditation eastern religions allowing me to grow my own personal understanding of the role of both religion and spiritualism in my life. I am agnostic, but I feel this class has given me greater respect for something I had never had the chance to understand.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He called a student out for saying the word novel, rather than book or monogram, in front of the entire class, which is clearly demeaning in behavior. He also made us take 3 hours out of our day, outside of class time, to watch a children's movie, that served little to no educational value, and made us write a 500-word response on the movie.

Absolutely ridiculous workload for an intro level philosophy course. Two 300-500 word discussions every week, each corresponding to roughly 15-40 pages of reading, 2 film reviews, 2 formal essays, group/individual presentations. Needs to realize students take this course to fulfill a requirement and we have other classes. Very boring lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: There was a lecture everyday, and they could be really boring. He was very monotone, and there were very few visual aids in the presentations. He also gave a lot of outside readings that were up to 30 pages, with almost daily discussion posts and in class discussions. There was only one test, plus the midterm and final paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a very good professor, explains problems in detail and is always responsive to student's questions. Class is well placed and he allows for extra classes for review before the final exam. There is homework but a fair amount, and online quizzes aren't hard. The best thing is his practice tests on canvas, they are near identical to his real tests

-uses Pearson, unlimited tries, regenerates new question after third wrong answer, use view an example for step by step instructions to basically the same problem
-quizzes every Sunday
-use materials he gives to review for exams, basically same problems
-always willing to help after class, very genuine
Overall he is a great professor who cares about your learning and prepares you. Nothing on tests was a surprise and he's always willing to help when needed.
A great guy, willing to help whenever needed. Made sure the students felt comfortable, very nice and down to earth. Willing to round up grades if they are close to a 90, highly highly recommend

He was extremely nice and caring. I always felt like I could freely ask questions and he would answer. Always knew the material and gave us various ways of studying that were extremely effective and accurate for the tests. Amazing class. Little amount of homework, only an hour or 2 a week. Truly amazing.

I had him for Calc I and he is a really good professor! Has a lot of examples in class, and the exams are usually easier than the homework! He is really good about adjusting the material to everyone's level. The software for calculus is 180 dollars, so it is an investmenent, but there are many practice problems on the software as well.

I had him for Probability - he's a good professor. The homeworks can be a little tough but the quizzes, midterm and exam were exactly like what we covered in class/the practice exams he gave us. There is a textbook but it's not necessary to buy unless you want to do the optional practice problems he assigns.

I had Professor Cotnoir during a remote term. I highly recommend him. He managed to make the class interesting and thought-provoking in the online setting by discussions during lecture and online. The grading was pretty easy and the grade depended pretty much solely on the homework assignments which were very reasonable. Great class and prof!

Professor Cotnoir teaches hands-on lessons with group activities in the classroom and group homework assignments. Homework is easy (if odd) and relevant, lectures are engaging, and there are no tests. Quizzes are open book word-for-word from the textbook, so get an e-book. I learned a lot, had some fun, and strongly recommend this course.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Easiest thing in the world. Get the E-book and CTRL-F gets you 100% on the quizzes. Homework was super easy. GPA-padding class that looks good on a resume, even if you don't take too much from it. Some funny material in lecture as a bonus.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Super easy class, laid back professor who wants to teach you a few things but is in no rush. Quizzes can be done with google and group homework assignments are relatively simple. I didn't learn much, but it's a great class for a senior who needs/wants credit but doesn't want to work too hard.
Easiest class I've ever had in college. He teaches the facts in mechanical engineers design are truly probably do in industry. I recommend this class
Great practice teacher. Hands on learning style. Communicates effectively and professionally. One might think it is a breeze but the learning outcome is significant and from real life.
This Prof. is too good. Get to learn a lot from his in-class excercises,especially the tower project.

She expects you to know things thats she never even talked about or put in any material she handed out. Grading is unclear, the so call rubric is only visible after she graded things. She needs to step down from teaching and learn from an actual teacher.

Professor Stults has a difficult job having to teach Creo to students who typically learn Solidworks first. It is annoying to model parts in Creo, but the advantage is in the available anaylsis packages. She is very understanding and allowed me to make up a quiz I negligently slept through. Little to no Hwk, simple Labs, and a nice project.

I paid to have a student teach me this year. Why does WPI have instructors that can not teach? She is NOT inspirational, expect long homework assignments, and hope you have a good tutor that knows SolidWorks.

Do not take ES-1310 with her. She does not teach anything that is not in the Software tutorials.  Stay in your dorm, read the tutorials and you will learn more! She did not offer the CSWA certification exam as a final in her class!

Pros: She is available for help and willing to help if you ask.  Cons: Teaches using the built in SW tutorials. Nothing is her own work. Spends too much time with small details. The classes and labs are boring. Do your self a favor, do not take a class with her. No CSWA exam for final..

New to WPI.  Does not understand students and their needs. Just graduated from WPI and has not real world experience and it shows. CAD (SolidWorks) is not her strong point. Spends too much time on using graph paper in labs, simple projects and going over topics which were covered in HS. Does she know this is college? Take her if you want an easy A.

Pros: Does put a lot of effort in teaching. Willing to help if you ask.  Cons: Sometimes can't effectively explain what she is doing. Spends too much time in detail when solving problems in class.  The class itself is boring. With the homework and test it is pure frustration. But it is easy to get a good grade.
He doesn't knwo how to talk, first of all. He also is very arguementative. For this class only the students teach it.
I really enjoyed this class. his powerpoints and the CD were really useful for the exams. Sometimes test questions were a little vague but I like him a lot!
No Comments
very well organized, responds well to students, tests a little too easy

If you get him as your assigned advisor, you want to switch RIGHT AWAY. He had me taking 2000 level classes that I didnt need, and he had another bio major I know taking quantum physics classes. One of my professors actually told me he was a bad advisor - that should tell you something!
worst advisor ever
easy class high school bio

Okay so if you are looking for an easy A take this course, if you are looking to learn more about Civil Engineering eh, Computer Fundamentals? yeah right. He is a nice guy and obviously very proud of his field but a very inefficient professor. Reuses Tests&Assignments every year. Definitely not a class you NEED to take.

Was not born to be a professor. My class was a 2 hour class that met twice a week, and he could've taught that material in half the time. A very inefficient professor in that respect. I learned more about unit conversions than I did the civil engineering discipline in this course. Would not take this course again.
Easy class. He is really organized online but all over the place in lecture, not necessarily worth going to.

I don't recommend this course to anyone. You come to class with an expectation to learn something about civil but the only thing you get is confusion. All work is in groups which you can't choose. This was the most stressful class I took(not that it is hard, just UNCLEAR). Just start with CE2000. There is no "computer fundamentals" in this class.

Good guy overall,  he tells some funny stories in class and is easy to tell he has many more good stories that he is just waiting to tell. His directions can be difficult to follow at times, but overall the class should be an easy A if you put in 100% effort.

Extremely easy, the only work in the class are two tests that you hardly need to study for and a project which takes a good chunk of time but isn't particularly hard. He is a hilarious, very good natured guy. Sometimes his explanations are a bit confusing or roundabout, but he gets the points across that he feels are necessary.
Prof. Hart is a good prof. as well as having a great sense of humor.
One of the best Professors and mentors I had. Always there for you and caring if she sees that you are interested in the subject.
She knows what she is talking about. Very helpful and is there to help you understand the material.
A lot of work on your own as 4/6 hours of class time per week is open lab time. Very helpful and clear with assignment directions

Pretty easy class overall. Teacher is pretty helpful. Class is fun and you learn a good amount of AutoCad. Rivet part is more annoying than fun, save your work often as the computers are prone to crashing at anytime.
The class is easy, but gives a good background in AutoCAD.  She's very nice about absences and stuff, but be prepared to make up the work on your own without anyone holding your hand.
Needs to learn how to make *Engineering* drawings, instead of architectural drawings, needs to learn what she is teaching better
This prof. trys to be helpful. I think she needs to learn how to teach under a 7 week time frame and stop being as ****y

Genuinely confused by the low ratings for Lagasse. She took so much time to explain things to me and my lab partners in order to guide us in the direction of the right answer, met with me and one of my partners outside of class to help us work through group conflict, and gave great early feedback. Would only redo 1030 if I had her for lab again.

She was an incredibly tough grader and was not at all flexible to schedule time outside of class to meet. While she clearly is passionate about chemistry, she does not provide helpful feedback on labs, her comments are often unclear.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: There is a lot of work in her CH1010 Lab, but she gives great feedback and guidance when you ask for it. Do early submissions for Post Labs and Pre Labs, even if you don't have a full rough draft. She'll give you the feedback you need for full credit. Keep your lab notebooks up to date, and do the work. Have good communication with group members.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: This class was extremely difficult for an intro level chem lab class. Labs are extremely difficult and expect to spend long hours on them. Questions are answered as riddles. Submit drafts of the labs by an assigned date and she will give good feedback by them. If you do this you will pass. Overrall be ready to work extra hard in this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She graded prelabs insanely hard when researching a topic you have little to no knowledge about. They are graded out of 15 points and my lab group only broke the 10 point mark once, regardless of getting help before submitting or not. She answers questions with rhetorical questions and is condescending when doing so. Expects you to know everything.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: So much work, so little time. Youre expected to figure out the lab on your own, she doesnt teach you. Doesnt answer questions, saying you have to figure it out for yourself. Grades harshly. The class itself is decent, lots of hands on experience in the lab, but without a good Professor its awful.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This was the single worst class I have ever taken. I had this professor for the lab portion and it was the hardest thing I've ever done. Extremely harsh grader and assignment were very difficult with little to no instructions. Get ready to work. The lab was only supposed to be a small portion of the course, but I ended up spending the most time.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Lectures are sometimes confusing (long-winded examples), but Professor is very accessible outside of class (FAQ boards). Homeworks were okay-length and quizzes/exams were straight forward.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Had her B22 and she's probably the sweetest professor I've ever had, she truly cares about her students. You have two exams, five homeworks, and I think nine quizzes. Homeworks are in groups of two. She grades tough, and her lectures are great, but she doesn't respond super promptly to emails so talk to her in person if you have pressing questions.

I liked Prof Konrad's. Make sure to pay attention to lectures and you will learn a lot. Likes having students participate in lecture as well and is more than willing to help students learn. Would take again.
Homework was stressful and took a long time to figure out. Participate in class, it's part of the grade. Exams were fair. The group project was a lot of work, don't wait till the last minute.
She explains clearly of what she's trying to achieve for her students.
She is nice but her homework was just killing me. She is pretty tough at grading too..But I learnt a lot in this class.
You understand it in class, but then the homework takes hours upon hours and she is a tough grader

I think he set up the class differently for the first time this year and it wasnt great. No in person lectures so you had to watch all them outside class online from previous years. There was a ton of group work. He was nice but I wasnt a fan of the way he set up his class.

For Cell Bio A-term he has an intresting teaching strategy. You basically do all the readings at home (it takes forever like 3 chapters is 12 hours), and in class we do group problems and discussion. The content seems hard at first but quizzes and tests are pretty easy. With no lectures I was scared for the class, but I am good at learning alone.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Vidali flies through the lecture notes so fast just to get through the material. Exams are kind of hard if your not prepared- most of the questions are the applied style rather than asking about facts. Ultimately, the class isn't terrible but if you want to do well you will have to put in time outside class to learn the material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Vidali is a great professor! There are a few group projects throughout the term, but all are manageable and you can always contact him for help. He grades the tests fairly, and the homework, while there is a lot, is very helpful. I'm very glad I took his class because I enjoyed it very much! I 100% recommend!!

Great professor! The weekly-quiz formate made it easy to handle compared to other classes. His lectures are comprehensive and he is always willing to help if you need it. There was a final "project" at the end of the term (you worked on it in class so it was easy) that boosts your grade if you need it. Definitely recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Only grades are based on weekly quizzes. The quizzes are way too detailed and even if you know the concepts well, you will still have a hard time getting a high grade on the quizzes.

Professor Vidali is an amazing guy and a wonderful professor! His lectures are typically well organized and are full of great content from the book. This class had no mid term/final, instead weekly quizzes (with the lowest one getting dropped), which made the class low stress. Very engaging lecturer, and uses similes well to aid in comprehension.

Midterm and Final are each worth 40% of your grade. Does not cover content in the class period, often restarting slides covered before and then only going over 3 more slides during class. Exams are based on the practice exams, but often cover material she did not say would be on the test.
This class is a blessing. Both exams are exactly like the practice Exam. Just memorize it and it's an easy A.

The lectures were kinda boring because we talked about the same thing every class. Also, her lectures were all over the place. Your grade depends on a group and individual project and two tests. The tests are easy if you memorize what she talks about in her lectures.
Very ice professor, but confusing lectures. Exams are extremely easy & similar to the practice exam.

It's clear that she loves what she does and she has a way of getting the class interested in the subject matter. The class was not very difficult assuming  you spend a little bit of time studying. Other than exam prep and two projects there was no homework. She is a great lecturer. I rarely walked out of class confused.  10/10 would take again.

Tanja was great! Very knowledgeable professor, kind, and sometimes funny. Often asks the class questions and wants you to go to office hours. Her lectures can be long and boring depending on your interests. She can be disorganized because of the amount of information in the course. Class project is manageable and tests are very easy if you study.
Very knowledgeable professor. Does a wonderful job showing how biology is used is all sorts of technological applications. Tests are not challenging if you study and read the textbook.
absolutely amazing
The goat. His lectures are funny and engaging. He cares about his students and is always communicating with them. The homework is supposed to be hard because then he makes the tests extremely easy.

This was my second course with Professor Kidwell and I can't recommend him enough! He genuinely cares about teaching the material in an easily digestible and accessible way. He is very accessible outside of class and regularly hold office hours if any question come up. His grading policy is very clear and fair.
Very good professor, would always recommend these math classes over others.

Calc is not really my thing (See grade) but Keenan is really funny and good at teaching, grades exams himself, make sure to try on the written HW. He may drop or adjust grading based on how the class is doing (no curve tho). And he just loves being here at WPI. He even brought Gompei to class one day...

One of the best professors I've had so far. Calculus isn't really my cup of tea, but his lectures and discussions helped me ace that class and understand. I recommend attending his office hours as they are super chill, help with problems, and discussing homework. Very easy to talk to, understanding, and replies fast. Don't forget funny!
He's nice. Very single. Exam and HW is really easy. Grades exams himself. Lots of Office Hours. Fairly easy to talk to.

Awesome Teacher,
Replies to Canvas messages super quickly, and provide great feedback and help.

In all honesty the best, and most hilarious Professor I've had at wpi! He is a new professor but his wit and lectures are unmatched compared to any other professor at wpi. He also knows how to get the class engaged and at the same time make it an enjoyable lecture. If you have the chance to have him for a class, take it!

I came in to CS1102 thinking it would be an easy course, as I had already done a ton of CS work on my own and knew the basic idea of Lisp syntax. But the last two weeks of the course were actually really informative. Rich is also really good at shutting down ignorant freshmen who ask stupid questions because they think they're smarter than him.

This guy is a great professor.  The class you are expected to know how to code a bit but isn't that hard to jump into if you are willing. Homeworks are long to do but you have a partner. Labs are some what difficult but make you reinforce what you learned in class. He is willing to meet with anyone anytime.  He is just a great guy

Had for MQP, felt he was more 'manager' than advisor.  Can go off on tangents, will forget who's ideas were who's, and you will have to wrestle control of the conversation from him. Will grill just about everyone on QA and analytics procedures.
Charles "Crepe" Rich is a great professor. Racket is very different from other programming languages, but Prof. Rich teaches it well. His office hours are very helpful, and he's a great guy.
Great professor. Teaches very well. Crystal clear in his classes. He is always ready to help you out. Drop by his office hours and you could strike up a conversation for hours with him.
