Took Advance intro to CS, which was really interesting. I did really poorly in the class, but I am glad I took it in the end. Rich knows what he's talking about and you can talk to him outside of class (HRI and AI research groups).
Interesting lectures, helpful but blunt during office hours

By far the worst teacher Ive had at this school, and quite possibly ever. She just seems to have this inability to both prepare for classes and teach the material. Shes dreadfully boring, and is constantly making mistakes. I took Algorithms with her, and learned legitimately all of the material outside of class. Truly horrendous teacher.
Does not thoroughly explain concepts. Boring lectures.

Really doesn't understand how to explain things thoroughly, answers questions indirectly with other questions - NOT AN EXAGGERATION she has never answered a question directly and will not make sure you get the answer you need. Horrible handwriting, bad lecturer, doesn't seem to care about the students. Brags about not knowing Windows............
Inconsistent in grading. Doesn't know how to teach and is in her own world. She doesn't know how to use windows operating systems. There's a reason why she probably got fired from URI

The schedule was flexible enough for her to push back deadlines multiple times.  She had a review day before the final, which not enough profs do.  Knows how to teach, not just how to program.  Liked to go through data set as it's sorted or tree as it's built; pseudocode.  Did this neat polling thing with clickers.

If you have no background in Algorithms, do not take this course with her. I'm not sure if she actually knows what she is talking about in class. She uses PowerPoints from past professors. Went to class every day, but still had to learn all the course material from online videos in three days. (Although, HW (5) is worth 55%, exams (2) worth 40% .)

Mello-Stark literally read us the textbook for lecture most days and all of her lecture slides were directly from the textbook. her handwriting is that of a blind second grader making her hand-written mathematical proofs nearly impossible to follow. if you read the textbook you'll do fine in this class, don't expect to get much out of lecture.
Awesome professor. He doesn't get bored of explaining things more than once for students. He is really helpful.

The first half of the course is awesome, test are easy, homework take only 30 mins to finish. Then something called Markov Chain and Conditional Probability basically destroyed us. Need to read textbook a few time to understand. Be sure to sit in the front row. His voice is very accented, making complicated topics much harder to understand.

I can barely understand him on a good day. He  tries to get his point across but it never actually makes sense. He has to curve the class a significant amount even though everything is open notes, open book. He's a very nice guy but I don't think he is fit to teach this course.
Terrible, so unclear, it is probably the class that has taught me less at WPI. Can't believe there aren't more negative comments, I don't know anyone from my classroom who liked the course

If you're looking for a class worth your money in terms of learning and moving onto the next level, I would not recommend this. He is very nice and wants the best for his students, but he is unable to effectively or cohesively teach this material, and the textbook is not very helpful. Open note, open book, but still must curve by 20% points.

He gives everyone an A just by doing the work. Didn't learn anything from the class though and didn't prepare me for stats 2. Nice guy who tries, but his accent is pretty strong. Got lucky having the exams be take home. Otherwise I'm sure many would have failed...but gives A's anyways so I guess it doesn't matter.
He is awesome!He is really honest and is open to questions. Class is well organized and he knows his material really well.

Professor Eddy cares so much about her students and it shows through her work. I know she felt like she struggled a lot this term delivering content virtually, but she did a great job keeping assignments relevant and reasonable, and I loved her class!

Was an awful IQP advisor.  Took too long to get feedback and normally it was only grammatical errors when feedback was received.  Was extremely unprofessional and has been known to write "rage emails" that are completely immature.  Better hope you don't have her as an abroad IQP advisor.

Was extremely unprofessional throughout my IQP experience with her, and consistently failed to give all project teams feedback in a timely manner, with feedback sometimes being returned days after the section being reviewed was due. All in all I would recommend staying away form Professor for IQP.
enthusiastic about the materiallectures, interactive class discussions, do not miss classes

She is a very sweet professor, she is very helpful and really cares about what she is teaching. the only thing is that there is alot if reading required but, its not bad. Take her if you need a religion class!!
very good teacher

Very helpful and passionate about subject matter.  Easy to understand and puts forward a strong effort to make sure everyone follows along.  Assignments are easy--as long as you have an opinion and can support it with the text, you're fine.

Had c term 2020. Was a little strict in grading exams. HW was great practice and quizzes each week in conference. Group projects were a little annoying- required coding. Often repeated himself 3-4 times in lecture, very easy to follow. Enjoyed the course overall. Make sure to study notes on a daily basis as it is easy to fall behind.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lectures are not mandatory but notes are not provided online. Quizzes (6) and exams (2) are great measures of the course material. Lectures are straightforward and super clear. Amazing professor for linear algebra.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Alright, but it kind of makes me feel belittled when he says that things we're doing in class are obvious :(
Very clear in lecture. Ensures that students FULLY understand a topic before moving forward. He is very much from the book but is very kind in terms of testing, nothing should surprise you there.

Best math professor I've had at WPI. Lectures were highly concise, lucid, and coherent. Homework was difficult (you'll need to consult the textbook), but good preparation for the exams. Approachable outside of class and will help if you're struggling. Only negative parts of the class were the two group projects, which I didn't learn anything from.

This professor is incredible. He uses every minute of lecture and teaches at a quick pace, but makes sure that no one is left behind/is confused. If a student still has questions, he's very helpful during after hours. The learning environment is great, as he is very friendly and does not try to act superior to his students, there is mutual respect

This professor is great. He really tries to help his students understand the material. He is more than willing answer questions. Would definitely recommend. The homework and weekly quizzes aren't bad at all.
Awful professor. Avoid at all costs.

Heavy work load for all his classes. Homework's usually take a while. All exams are take home but they will take a long time to finish. You will walk out of the class learning so much and his classes are the only classes I felt have been useful in my field of work. Everything he teaches you is applicable to the working environment.
Really good professor that really made me interested in Fire Protection Engineering.  Although the course is difficult, his lectures are really good and the grading criteria is clear.

The professor is okay. He knows what he is talking about.  And tries to answer your queries.   But he is a harsh grader.   ACTS HELPFUL but he really is not.   Lots of homework, which is both good and bad. The course becomes boring  and repetitive at some point.
Very open discussions in class, but exams were very hard and harshly graded.

One of the most knowledgeable people I've ever studied under.  He's great.  I'm writing this long after taking his course, so  now I appreciate how vague his answers seem.  Definitely deserves his role of Practicing Professor.  He can tell you how it is.

Very knowledgeable professor. Likes to read in between the lines of NFPA or IBC code sometimes too much so it is like a lawyer. Took 1 month (30 days) to get back the midterm. Feedback wasn't helpful on midterm. Final was very vague and open ended. Overall a very difficult class, however the lectures were great; easy to stay awake for a 3 hr class!
Amazing prof with clear explanation of the contents, test are super connected to practice tests

He is really caring about his student and trying to explain everything in detail. He makes complex and difficult content very clear and understandable. Although he has an accent his lecture is very helpful and easy to keep along with.

Fairly easy class, but I feel like he still covered the material pretty well -- maybe because I took the non-accelerated course. Has an accent, but isn't hard to understand. Very helpful during office hours. Tests are straightforward, pay attention and you should have no problem.  He's also a super nice guy and very understanding. Would recommend.

The material presented was really, really easy. Unfortunately he covered the first quarter of the material in 5 weeks and proceeded to rush through the rest which left a lot of people behind. He's very accommodating and a nice guy though.

He's new. Class is easy, but you learn little. He'll give overview something, teach it, draw a diagram, and maybe derive it. Then he'll move to the next idea. Class is SLOW. Later he'll do examples. He falls behind his syllabus, runs out of time. Most students are playing on their phones. Homework is worth more than quizzes. Balances a hard class.

He is a good man who is very willing to help and works hard. However the measure theory seems to be too tricky. He wants to cover all the things in a phd-level book.  Maybe it's better to pick less topics, too much material and homework almost crack me up. Good thing is he posted all lecture notes and HW solutions, very useful.

He got through half of the material in 6 weeks and proceeded to quickly skim over the second half of the material in the last week. The tests were not consistent with the homework or lecture notes so it was very difficult to prepare and pass tests. Everything had to be scaled.

Excellent course and instructor: intelligent, crystal clear and goes out of his way to give you all the printed info you need including copies of out-of-print books. Video tapes his lectures. Highly recommend
Fantastic class, very informative, touched a lot of topics, very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.
Great professor. Able to communicate well and provide useful help for the confused student! I loved this class (electro-optics) but the lectures from projected pdfs got a bit tedious.

He was very helpful when asked a question, and showed a willingness to 'get his hands dirty' that many other profs just don't.  He didn't mind diving in and dividing the work load, and was a fun guy to work for.  I'd do it again in a second.
No Comments
really nice and wants you to be successful.  an accent, but easily understandable.

2 words: seating chart.  I was interested in the class topic: Global Environmental History. But his voice is very slow and puts a lot of people to sleep. No computers are allowed, unless you need it for a special reason. He is unclear about projects and guidelines. I don't feel like I have learned anything from him, sadly enough.

If you've taken AP USH, this class will be a piece of cake. His lectures are a bunch of information thrown in your face in a short amount of time. His discussions are usually him talking about irrelevant points. He never stays on topic and is not helpful with accommodations. Only take this class if you are a good writer and debater.

I had him as an adviser to my project in Costa Rica.  He treated the time there as a 2 month vacation.  He didn't show up to several meetings, wasn't around when you needed him, and didn't  bother reading through our drafts most of the time.

He is a really good person, but the weekly quizzes he gives out are not good measures of the reading.  He does have several aspects of the class that are innovative and interesting, such as his Role Playing assignments.

tests are not hard, he is not out there to get you, as long as you go to class and pay attention. Very reasonable work load. I learn a lot from him, not just history, also how to write better. Fun class, trust me, you will enjoy it.

Daily Quiz, it's not hard, he is not out there and trick you. He wants to hear you talk, and give you lots writing.Writing center is mandatory in his class, he also makes you  sign this paper on each big paper you wrote stated that there will be no careless mistakes in there.

Although he was okay at teaching this class, he wanted to make sure that everyone knew the material that was taught. Each homework assignment was pretty difficult and time consuming but he was more than willing to answer any questions on them. Overall he was very laid back and understanding compared to other professors.

This class is all about how well you can work with your group and willing to put in the work. Prof. Page is really hands-off and tries to recreate the reality of what it's like to design a prototype. When you need help, he is always willing to help though and gives good feedback.
Took him for Biotransport. Only took it upon himself to talk to a select group of students. Was very vague on what his expectations were throughout the term, hard to reach via email.
He is very helpful if you come to him with background knowledge. He really expects students to go the extra mile to make the project work, but he is willing to help you think through the process.
Can seem a little intimidating at first but very helpful. He is very knowledgeable but extremely laid back and has an enjoyable personality. Very fair and reasonable in grading.
Makes many mistakes during lectures that just confuse the entire class, really long homework and difficult quizzes

This class was a waste of my time. The lectures were completely unstructured and all we learned to do was draw and animate things. I can see the appeal for un-grading for those who are less driven to learn, or get anxiety from grades, but I really felt like the whole class was more about the reflections than actually learning code in useful ways.

Professor Smith and her ungraded course made me learned so much more compared to normal graded classes. She is the go-to professor if you want to learn a lot of knowledge while also not getting stressed in the term.

Professor Smith's class was ungraded, so we told her what grade we believed we earned at the end. That immediately reduced any stress about programming! Her follow-along lectures were worth attending, and the term-long group project was the best learning opportunity. The lab and reading assignments were not nearly as useful in my opinion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Online Savvy

comment: Phenomenal professor! She took a completely ungraded approach to programming which I really enjoyed! This approach not only made it easy and accessible to learn how to program, but encouraged learning from my mistakes in my learning. Also no exams or quizzes! Instead we had to reflect on our ability to program! I wish I could take her again for CS!
A great professor. I'm still using what she taught after the term is over. She covers very interesting topic in class. You won't regret if you decide to take class with her.

I've worked with Professor Smith on several occasions now and each one has been a delightful experience. Whenever I had a problem both academically or externally, she was there to assist and advise me, going the extra steps to set up ISP's to help me pursue my dreams. Her teaching methods are slightly unconventional, but certainly in a good way.

I reviewed for literally 12 hours straight and it wasn't enough. No matter how hard you try you will not be able to do well on the exams. The average on the Midterm was 60% and I suspect the finals gonna be worse. Practice exams give you a false scene of security cause they are easier than the real ones and will not cover any of the real content.

Had her D22 and it was alright. There is a sign in sheet for lectures so you are graded for it. There are 5 homeworks, mostly on paper that you scan and then there's a small webwork section for each. Labs are easy, and the exams have open notes. I took my exams in the EPC and was (mostly) fine. It's an alright class that didn't sway good or bad.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She goes very fast and doesn't explain well in her lectures. She grades you on attendance and participation so if you are taking her class before 10am good luck. The labs are confusing and the webworks are on material not explained until the day of or after the due date. This class is easy to pass but not easy to get an A in.

This professor is very hard to understand in lecture. Practice exams do not reflect actual exams in the slightest, in order to pass exams you must have an extensive cheat sheet and be able to ask her questions in person. If tests are taken in different location, they are nearly impossible to pass. Does not change criteria due to difficult situation

She is knowledgeable and helpful if you can ask her a specific and clear question. She is willing to spend 10 minutes of the lecture to explain you how to read the table even if she said it 5 times already. The lecture is OK and clear enough to see what we are doing and what can we achieve but the applications are quite vague. Tests are simple.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Very unclear in lectures and doesn't seem to understand what she's saying. I think she's a smart and kind person, but not a great teacher. Asking for help only gets more confusion. Makes you just frustrated and more confused. -Someone who is majoring in this field and LOVES this subject

Very difficult class (for me an engineer) but Prof was very nice and took the time to explain things better if you had any trouble. Always made office hours and helped students with HW. For such a difficult class I would definitely recommend taking it with Prof Jimenez if she is still at WPI!
she is fine if you have a strong calc background

"Everybody fine with that?" You'll probably here that a few dozen times over 50 minutes of lecture. She is a good professor but I couldn't follow through because she has a voice pitch that could be very intolerable for some. makes you not want to go to her lectures. If you're okay with the range of the pitch of anybody's voice, then she okay 4 u.
moves very quickly, but examples are extremely clear and are exactly like the tests. If you pay attention in class and do the homework you will be very sucessful with this prof.

She is a very fast teacher. She does the lessons exactly same as the textbook so if you don't go to lectures and just study by yourself off the textbook you'll do fine. I honestly didn't learn anything from her lectures. Her practice quizzes are very very similar to the actual. She's too fast, I didn't like her at all..
Awesomeeeeeeeee teacher. goes very fast but is very clear. Tough class but she made it easy. Taking her again for calc 4:)

This class is hard to describe in words. Online lectures to watch in addition to in class lecture and a weekly homework. In class lectures are almost absolutely worthless, you won't understand a thing - so much theory. Online lectures are needed to reference or else homework is impossible - no examples to help cement concepts. Horrible course.

I took ECE 2311 with Prof. Matthews. He's a nice guy. He warned us on the first day that it would be a difficult class; it was. He assigned 6 HWs which were insanely difficult. For tests he gave only a midterm and final which were extremely easy in comparison with the hw. Prepare to spend a LOT of time on his class; he makes you work hard!
He's good indeed. Come to his office hour and the TA's as well. That helps a lot. Try to focus on everything in lecture and you will be fined.
one of the worst professors I've had, don't take his class

Seldom understand what he has been talking about on aboard. You will not be able to take notes unless you listen to him. His writing on board is beyond your reading ability. He hold nice office hours. You get everything clear if you go to his office hour, which is useful than his lectures.

Incomprehensible writing. general lack of explanation for anything we learn. lectures that have nothing to do with the homework which have nothing to do with the tests. When questioned on issues with the grading he says his TAs have the final say (even when he knows you are right). Worst professor ever.

He is the best professor I've seen in the school. I wish there were more quality professors like him. You can simply describe as a quality teacher and person. He is extremely knowledgeable in robotics/electrical engineering, social, sympathetic, empathetic, almost perfect. Also he challenges students, but knows where to stop and grades mercifully.
Had him for 2001 and 2002 and he was one of the best professors I've had at this school... has a tremendous desire to help students learn, and is excellent at doing so!
Reason I'm doubling ECE with RBE now rather than ME, very helpful, well prepared, worked out examples and notes were posted online, a real strength throughout RBE 1001 because all 3 professors did it
Without a doubt the best teacher the RBE program could hope to have.
Great professor and heart of the robotics program
Brilliant professor, really values student input. Knew everybody's name by the end of the first class. An excellent addition to the WPI faculty.
Great professor, great thinker.

His class is described by his first name. Bland. This guy thinks philosophy is what you come to school for when you're trying to just take an easy course to get your humanities over with. He also grades your papers as if he's an english teacher rather than the content of your work. Try to pick another class.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: NOT A HISTORY CLASS. JUST PHILOSOPHY. NOTHING ABOUT EUROPEAN CULTURE. SERIOUSLY! NOT HISTORY FOCUSED Has two subject papers about in class material, two papers about random stuff, and a term paper made of the two subject papers. At the end of the term the two original papers must also be updated too so basically two more papers.  And a final exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Has a very specific view of politics and tries to impose his ideals upon the class.  Is not very open to new ideas or views. Assigns a lot of reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof Addison is a good guy. I realize that it is always difficult to analyze history objectively, but it seems that prof addison makes very little effort to do so. He has a particular world view and interprets everything within it.

Very interesting guy, very passionate about the subject material. Not the most organized, and assigns a lot of reading, but overall a really great professor. Wants you to understand the material, and is pretty reasonable about grades.
Very engaging and interesting lectures and very cool class setup. Half of the classes are like a Model UN setup. Got me interested in International Studies. Easy grading and not a lot of work.
Took Topics in IR with her. Very engaging, very thoughtful professor. Also is very flexible on which assignments you have to do, and an average effort is enough to get an A.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Very good professor, straightforward and important material relating to international relations. Highly recommend for students fulfilling social studies or humanities reqs. Pretty easy class and very clear and prompt on grading. Interesting lectures and really works to make sure everyone understands concepts.

There is a lot of required reading for the class, but you can pretty easily skim through it to find what you need for the homework. She leaves a lot of room to skip a few assignments and still do well in the class, so it's not super high pressure. You do have to do quite a bit of writing though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this in C2017. This is a different class where you represent imaginary countries and try to pursue objectives in the world of Politica. Very interesting and fun class that is easy to get an A with (I technically got a 147%). Very lenient work and while there are groups almost everyone participates and tries.
A great professor. It's a fun class. Very well setup
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Explains concepts very clearly and is an overall good lecturer. Posts practice exams with solutions and a scan of the review notes before each exam. Definitely not a tough grader. Also very nice and easily accessible outside of class. Written homework and online homework due every week and it's not very difficult to complete in time.

She is kind and seems to explain well. Some concepts are difficult and she can sometimes be hard to understand. The homework is fair but MML is really difficult. Exams aren't bad and labs are easy per usual. She has plenty of office hours. She definitely wants students to do well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I loved every second of Carichino's classes. I came in with calculus AB credit and she made the transition between topics very smooth. She was very understanding when I sprained my wrist and was very helpful outside of class. Barring her Italian accent, she is easy to understand and her explanations are helpful.

Can't say enough good things about this prof, she was great. Super funny, took time to explain hard homework problems in lecture to make sure everyone understood. Very example heavy and presented the theorems clearly. All the homework was webwork. This class is hard if you don't go to lectures but is great if you do
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: While she may have been a little off on some of the material at first, she easily fixed mistakes. Solid choice.

Great professor, she is kind and warmand if you have any difficulty, just go & talk with her! Also really patient, and good at explaining details. Lectures are not heavy, but they cover what they should.

Good luck if you have her, she's the worst professor I had at WPI. She has the personality of an overcooked and under seasoned piece of chicken, and a project with her is just as awful to get through. Uncomfortable relationship with students, blatant favoritism (or at least openly dislikes certain students). Awful advice and will make it a problem.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Probably the worst professor I've had, wish I could've had any other professor for ID2050 and IQP. Feedback frequently conflicts. Many inappropriate comments about students and demeans them. Very biased, treats students different based on if she likes them. If she doesn't like you, she will hold it against your whole group for the entire project.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: She is the worst professor in all my years at WPI. Her feedback often doesn't make sense and contradicts with previous feedback. Her lectures were never helpful and the activities are useless. She claims to be approachable but only for the students she likes. Frankly, I felt biased against because of how she treated me and other non-white people.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Courtney is super negative and is constantly speaking in a demeaning or condescending tone. She mostly says good things about one team in order to put another team down by comparison. She says that she wants you to go to her for help, but will not provide help when asked. Her class activities are useless and mandatory.

I love professor Kurlanska. She's so approachable and sweet and really wants you to learn. I had her for ID2050 and she was awesome. She was super helpful in developing our project, and she also does fun activities in class that make those 2 hours go by fast. There is a TON of work, but that's just ID2050 for ya
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: After talking with people from other GPS classes it seemed that this class had the least amount of work involved; however, your grade on each assignment is based on how the professor is feeling at the time of grading and if you are on her good side. It's hard to guarantee an A in this class since the grades are so random but it's an easy B at least
Nice guy, very helpful
One of the best professors at WPI. I had him for multiple courses and worked for him as a PLA. He was amazing at teaching and caring, and a great boss.

Prof Obayemi is an amazing teacher. He is genuinely passionate about the subject and even more passionate about making his students understand it. While the course is rigorous, there is no busy work. Every assignment  helps you understand the subject matter in a practical and real way. I learned more from Obayemi than any other teacher.

Class should list ES2501 as recommended. The first third of the class should be review but some of the class had mixed experiences. After, he does a fair job teaching you the rest. Be aware that his homework can come whenever and sometimes has trouble being clear about when they're due. Lectures and tests are straightforward which is good.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: I took his class at Princeton University and really enjoyed it. He is a dedicated teacher
He is an amazing teacher.

Prof. Ji is very dedicated to students. Explained things very well, was always open to answering questions/going out of his way to help, very open to feedback. Genuinely wants students to do well, as long as you put in enough effort you can succeed. Favorite & most applicable class this year & I now enjoy MatLab despite hating coding.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I thought Professor Ji did a great job teaching the Intro to Matlab course, especially for those (like me) who have never touched programming in their life. Though I did struggle with a few topics, he and the PLAs/TAs were always available to help me, even when the problems I was having seemed very trivial. The course was hard but rewarding.

The course work is confusing at best, asking for help is encouraged but not supported in practice. I asked for help with a previous assignment to see what I did correctly and Professor Songbai essentially just blew my question off. As with many professors, he's extremally intelligent, but not necessarily in teaching and empathetic terms.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Although this class was a lot of work he was willing to help in any way he could. He provided help with all of the homework when students were confused and held regular office hours. Based on other people I know who have taken his MATLAB course, he seems to me like the type of professor that is more effective at teaching higher level classes.

If you're going to take BME1004 for the love of god DO NOT TAKE HIM. His "intro" class covered things from signal and image processing and 3000's. He only knows how to teach on the 4000 level and while he's a nice enough guy- his class will set you on fire and let you burn. Don't make the same mistake we did. Take CS 1004
You dont really learn anything from lecture. Assignments are impossible and take about 8 hours.

Professor Zizza was a fantastic teacher. His class was always the highlight of my day. He's had a lot of experience in the industry and was nothing but helpful in class. His lectures were informative and entertaining enough. Overall, loved this class and would be happy to take a class with him again.
He is not only an excellent professor, but he is also a nice music composer(it really qualifies his game audio skill)

One of the best teachers at WPI. He really knows his stuff and he's always so eager to help when one of his students asks questions. He's proud of what they accomplish, and goes the extra mile to help in any way he can.
A wonderful professor. He cares so much for all his students and wants to make sure they succeed. His classes are fun and laid back, and he's my favorite professor.
One of the greatest professors I had at WPI. Highly approachable and super chill. Knows what to teach in his audio classes without missing a beat.

Seemed rather new to teaching but was enthusiastic about the material.  Very approachable but was almost a little too easy on the students.  Gave much less work than other professors who taught the subject, but the final project (making a board game) encouraged teamwork and originality and was very exciting.

Had him B21 for the discussion component and he was great. I think I learned more in his discussion than I did in the lecture. Discussion grade was determined by either being your average grade for the other 90% of E&M, or you could send him a quick essay explaining what you learned in his discussion and you'd get a 100. Highly recommend him!

I took PH1140 (not PH2101) with him, and it was challenging with his teaching style.  He focuses on the math elements first, then he relates it to physical systems much, much later.  If you can get past that, he's easily the nicest and most caring professor that I have encountered at WPI so far. I definitely recommend taking his class.

Great lecturer, made a once-intimidating subject seem easy. Grade is primarily assessed through six singe-question quizzes, which, if you pay attention in class, should be easy. He clearly cares for his students, encouraging feedback and adjusting his style accordingly. Would definitely take a class with him again.

All grading was done through MasteringPhysics, so lots of resources available to understand the problems. He is a great lecturer, very good at explaining things conceptually. Entire class was graded on a curve in respect to the course average, a bit unfair, but worked out ok for me. He listens to, respects student opinions, and adjusts accordingly

Uhhhhhh... this class was pretty frustrating. He was extremely general in class then going to the homework was completely different. Quizzes were take home and most failed. Too smart for his own good.
Unfortunately, the Callen book he uses is terrible, but he makes up for it by being a fantastic lecturer. If you can find him (unlikely) he will be able to help you a lot though.
Funny, smart, organized, professional, cool, chiller, FTB.
An excellent Professor that truly cares about the students. Very personable, extremely helpful in career and life development, highly recommend taking her class.

Her expertise on decision-making and assessing uncertainty offers a completely unique perspective to the world of engineering. It should be required for all engineering students to take at least one class with her.
Provided opportunity for real world thesis project. Very supportive throughout the whole project.
Tough but fair. Always willing to work with her students to understand the material and complete the work.
Disorganized + Nonprofessional
Hilarious! The class is was a riot and the work was very interesting. Would definitely recommend.

Great class! Makes reading and discussions fun.  because there are only so many classes, attendance is MANDATORY.  Professor Sands is a real hoot.  She is hilarious, and the class is engaging!  Definitely should take!!!
All her classes are always fun. They involve a lot of reading and discussion on the reading, so if you're not willing to do the work, don't sign up for it. Highly recommended.

Before taking this class, I wasn't that keen on American Drama, but I'm really glad I took this class, because it's such an easy one! There isn't much work, and she grades really easily, the average grade on the essays was always an 85.. I highly recommend this prof, she's so sweet! :)

I really DIDN'T like this class AT ALL. I am an upperclassman and this class absorbed more of my time than my 4000 level classes.  The daily mandatory attendance, 15 hrs of work out of class, reading every nite, and endless additional requirements drained me of my free time.  Not to mention if you miss even 1 activity you automatically NR :(

such a cool lady! grades on class discussion! most work u have is 3 essays, a play review, and to read some plays. i looked forward to each and every class b/c all you do is argyue about points made concerning the latest play read. the plays are fun to read cuz they're good and they arent that long at all. if u haven't taken this class yet, SIGN UP
Almost every class we would have a guest speaker present to us and then our assignments would be based off of a guest speaker. Prof Hoy barely lectured in this course. Grading is alright.

The worst part about the class is the textbook .. worst thing I ever read (not clear and poorly written).  The in-class discussions didn't provide any clarity, and doing the requirements gets you a C  (to get a better grade you have to "be innovative" ). Never gives any direct answers + I only really learned from an outside reading book

Expect reading for every class and mandatory out-of-class events that other sections do not have to do.  Grades are determined arbitrarily and there is no rubric to base yourself off of.  Expected to be "innovative" in your responses.  "Meeting my requirements is a C"
Gives no constructive criticism on homework assignments and gives no rubrics for how he scores assignments.  Learned more from the mandatory book report than I did from any of his lectures.
Hard grader and answers all questions with "Be innovative"
Doesn't lecture, wants students to lecture him. He expects the average grade is going to be a C even if your whole class is better than his grad students.

Avoid this professor at all costs. His lecture notes are not his, and he spends no time discussing the dozens of topics thrown at you despite emphasizing their importance ("just read the book"). He rarely practiced problems, relying on his TA (who barely came prepared) to do problems. The TA also graded differently than what was taught.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Zhong is clearly passionate about materials and his research, but is quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had. His teaching style is all over the place, he doesn't do practice problems, and does not explain HW. You will not get anything out of this course.

His classes move very fast, about a chapter a class, but he doesnt really teach much and more so reads off premade slides and expects you fill in the gaps. There is no weighting of work in his class, every point you earn counts directly towards a total grade out of 100 (ie. 1pt on quiz is equal to 1pt on HW is equal to 1pt on final). Hes mediocre
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He doesn't actuallt teach the class. He expects you to read the book and learn everything before even arriving to the class. He doesn't have office hours and gets mad when you ask questions about his terrible explanations. His "teaching" is scrolling through a pre-made powerpoint presentation while skipping half the slides but ending class early.

This professor doesn't actually teach anything, he expects you to figure out what you are doing all on your own. I have spent hours outside of class teaching myself the material, and I still have no idea what is going on and am clueless on the quizzes/ tests

Absolutely avoid him if you can. He reads directly from the slides that he doesnt even make himself, so lectures are worthless. Tests, quizzes, and hw are harder than they need to be. He makes excuses and skips material that you need to know for hw and quizzes/tests. Only grace is that he listens to complaints from students.

Professor Jayaweera is one of the most caring professors I have ever had. Regarding exams and weekly quizzes, she would provide additional office hours and concise lecture summaries, covering exactly what was needed. Her passion for helping students was inspiring, making this my best math course experience ever. I wish she taught more courses!
hard to understand but easy class

For the most part, she's able to deliver the course material in a comprehendible way.  I had no trouble with her teaching style in any way, so expect a solid professor who sufficiently covers what you need to know. No tricks and no gimmicks, but nothing extraordinary either from my experience.

Spent two weeks of a seven week course incredibly sick, which demolished my grade in all of my classes pretty heavily.  Prof. Jayaweera was incredibly accommodating in allowing me to turn in late homework and take quizzes weeks late as long as I understood the material.
I loved this professor so much. She was very clear in her lectures and always willing to help out. Just amazing. And she's such a sweetheart in office hours.

Prof Jayaweera is extremely caring. Her notes are very clear, but she is also available outside of class for help on the homework. The homework is an excellent way to study for the quizzes, and the practice exams are similar to the test. The exams are very fair and graded quickly. This class basically covers the AP Stats material.

I enjoy his lectures and don't really know why there are negative reviews... this is the second class I have taken with him. I think he has clear expectations and grades fairly even giving partial credit. Some weeks are discussion/homework heavy, but most were very doable. If you have questions, ask and he will happily answer your questions.

Two videos/week each 1 hour. 70% of your grade comes from two group projects. The project grade's ranged from 84 to 90. If you do not follow his book and come to his conclusions, you will not do well. This is the only B I received in grad school. Impossibly tough grader with unrealistic expectations. Skip if it is not a requirement
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Professor Monat is a phenomenal professor and leads a very engaging lecture. I highly recommend his courses.
Professor Monat is very enthusiastic about the subject material.  His enthusiasm inspired me.  Grading was fair and lectures were interesting.  I look forward to the next class I have with his.

This professor is a HARSH grader and he gives no leway regarding partial credit.  He doesn't respond to emails and doesn't help much.  Take this class ONLY if you LOVE to do school work.  Awful Professor.

I took this graduate course as a randomly-chosen elective, and it turned out to the one of the best courses I've taken in 5 years at WPI! He genuinely cares about the students, and is extremely knowledgeable and  articulate. Every other class is a "miniproject" (wicked fun), and the rest are lectures, but 3hrs fly by with this guy. Monat kicks a**.

Prof. Sakulich makes the dry topics more manageable through his personality in lectures. He is very accessible outside of class and always willing to further explain lecture topics or exam results. Very reasonable person to work with. Always 3 homework questions and weekly more detailed problem which is effective in reinforcing understanding.

While his explanations and drawings may sometimes be not as clear, if you ask him for help, he is more than willing to help. He answers immediately to emails so he is very accessible. His five quizzes reflect the homework. He is lenient about time for the tests. The homework is a lot for little points (each hw was 0.2 points while a test was 15)

Awsome professor, a ton of work with minimal credit, so it is essentially optional, but means I want to do the work. Great personality, clear communication, super understanding. He is a professor that really cares about students and learning.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Tons of HW, but it 90% of it is virtually worth no points. Absolutely does his best to connect with the students. His examples done in class are taken from previous notes, so very little mistakes. Allows work to be turned in super late. Due to covid/mental health crisis on campus, exams for everyone were given as take home with a rolling deadline.

Lectures were somewhat boring. Pay attention because he makes mistakes that can lead to confusing explanations. Homework is not worth much of grade, but tests mimic hw and practice exams. He doesn't give answers to practice exams unless you ask. Weekly problems are not too difficult and help with grade. Go to TA sessions or office hours for help.

The exams are pretty similar to the practice exams, just with little twists to the questions.  He thinks hes pretty funny and he can be.  The tests are given back the next day which is very nice.  Sometimes wanders off in lecture.
Challenging course but all the material is provided in the notes if you dig through them. Example problems done in class is similar to the ones on the test.
This professor is the devil reincarnated and I'm not exaggerating. Tests and homework are both long and demanding. Notes are extremely unhelpful. Will question your major and will to live

Nothing but a barrage of equations with very little application. He might go through an example problem, but he's gonna skip half the steps leaving you to scour the textbook for answers. Homework is the worst thing ive ever had to do. Exams are extremely stressful and difficult but they're graded on a curve. Cant avoid for 4712, but dont take 5383.

Class is a nonstop assault of equations via overhead projector, with little to no context given. Exams are proof-heavy rather than focused on practical knowledge, and are basically all you're graded on, thankfully they're curved generously. TA and the textbook are the only reasons I know anything about the subject now.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Incredibly knowledgeable, his classes are a real opportunity to introduce yourself to the complexities of solid mechanics. As can be expected, coursework is computationally dense and requires effort to get a decent grade. As a mentor, he is approachable and leaves enough room for you to work and learn concepts practically.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is an extremely tough teacher, but you will learn a lot. For AE 5383 he only does about two examples all term, which can make learning how to apply the material extremely tough. He only gives a midterm and a final (both take-home) but they are extremely long and go above what you learn in class. He is very accessible outside of class. Work hard!
For someone who claims to be mostly focused on asian study, she really should undergo some sensitivity/trigger warning training. Have no respect for students' backgrounds.
Good feedback, tons of reading. Lecture attendance is required, but is honestly rarely helpful. Prone to arguing with students who do not agree with her views. Grade is basically two essays.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: I really enjoyed this class and Professor Rudolph is a great professor- I highly recommend taking one of her classes. There was a good amount of reading, but they were on pretty interesting topics. There were 3 essays we had to write and no tests or quizzes. She grades the essays fairly and gives helpful feedback on them.

She's a tough grader. Her views are very opinionated and she calls you out in class which is very unprofessional. Her essays are tough to write because she wants you to be specific but doesn't provide a topic. She wants you to impress her in order for you to receive an A. Effort doesn't count much to her
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I had her for my humanities seminar in history. I did the Socialism and Economy one with her and she was very guiding and she really knows her stuff. She is super nice and gives good feedback. She gave us reading but we didn't use a textbook. Really interesting seminar I learned a lot

I can't believe she doesn't have a review.  Wonderfu. She answers questions well and makes sure to ask if she explained enough. She isn't shy about her views though, but she will respect you if they are different. She turned down a higher position because it means she would have to stop teaching students, and she did not want to do that. She cares

This guy knows his shtuff in Security. I took him for grad Programming Languages and it was a bit drab, but if you have the chance to take a seminar-style security course from him, don't pass it up. My security nerd power level went up to over 9000 after this course.

Homework is split into textbook and programming. The programming isn't too bad, sometimes it's worded awful, but you can always get help. Homework isn't very important, make sure to show up to the reviews. If you're stuck just keep asking him or friends questions outside of class, and you should be good. With all the extra credit it should be okay.

Class looked interesting.  Then the professor started talking.  Class is an elementary review of what is in the textbook.  Given code is badly written and poorly commented. Grading is seemingly random. Extra credit is given freely apparently to make up for this.  In short, AVOID

The class doesn't really cover anything you need for class, actually he even read the book in class once. If you have a group to study with it will be better then going to class. The projects are poorly coded and commented, and the grading  is very inconsistent. The homework is useless for a grade, but you have to do it to pass the quizzes. !take

The worst CS professor I have had to date. Projects take obscene amounts of time and do not relate to material. Homework is pretty useless. Luckily his tests are easy and he gives out bonus points like my parents give out candy on Halloween. He's a nice guy, but probably the worst communicator ever. Also his code is terrible.
Code provided with homework assignments are both full of errors and poorly commented. Assignments are worded poorly.

He was literally one of the easiest professors I have had at WPI. If you are going to take his class you should do fine. Just understand that he swears. If that offends you, womp womp, dont take his class. Despite being easy, he does a good job at teaching, but can be a little hard to understand and disorganized sometimes.
not a believer of second chances

Although he does have a short fuse, Professor Andrei or Mike truly cares for the class and those who puts in the work and respects the guidelines. The course was straightforward and Mike was very accommodating. Material was very easy to understand. Others may say otherwise, but given the circumstances I think Mike delivered the class exceptionally

Professor Andrei, or as he prefers to be called, Mike, is a great professor. I found lectures easy to follow. He was very helpful in office hours when it came to homework questions. I would definitely take another class with him.

He is a very fun guy to learn from and will teach using tricks and patterns to assist in problem solving. This was very helpful for me, I have a bad memory, but if you are someone who likes to learn from the text book, he may not be exactly what you are looking for. Never-the-less, he provides nice course materials like a summary of each section.

His lectures are often summaries of the book vocab and definitions. Definitely try additional practice problems outside of class. Review the homework for exams. The class is fairly organized but make sure to pay attention in class as it is easy to fall behind. When I went to him for help, he was extremely helpful. He was very approachable.

Lectures weren't super interesting, and there was a lot of homework, but I think the in class activities and homework/projects really did help my understanding. I am not a cs person, and I got a B, it wasn't easy, but Ben does want you to succeed

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! He will force you to team up with person you don't even know and you can not choose team mates on your own will. Also you guys are forced to sit together for every single class! Plus he is very demanding and none of his demands make any sense. For every report, literally all the same question? What's point of so many reports?

I think that the main issue with this class is that the slides need to be updated, and the course needs to be restructured. It makes no sense to have an exam with the number of assignments and the big final project that the class has.

Not sure why Ben received such low score. My experience with Professor Ben at CS542 Database Management. He explain everything well and encourage us team up for multiple challenges, even through not fun enough but I did learn a lot. I enjoy his lecture and think this is one of most useful course when I move into industry

He grades the projects easy and the tests hard. He also teaches some things that are just blatantly wrong or very niche cases of certain techniques that most of us will never use again. As much as it is an intro data science class it is much more focused towards machine learning. You should know how to write python before taking the class
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: His class is a cake walk and to make up for it he gives a brutal final exam worth a huge chunk of your grade. Its the only exam he gave all term. Brutal not because he asks hard questions, but because he takes off points for things he didnt specify and makes you write such a long repetitious program on paper that youll never finish.

Professor Herbert is a great Professor! He is very reasonable and responsive with students, you can email him almost anytime and get a quick response. Discussions were well organized and Herbert provides great insight. There was a decent amount of reading but nothing too bad. Make sure to ask him about the Soviet Union at least once!

I strongly enjoyed taking my class under him, he was funny, articulate, and good at explaining complicated topics by asking questions to guide you there. The assignments were really just reading and asking questions with two papers, very manageable if you partition your time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Great history professor, we didn't use a textbook but rather went through excerpts from books written during the period of time we were discussing in class. This was very engaging for me, I was never bored in a lecture and took away a lot. This class was the most relevant class to real life that I've taken. Definitely recommend Herbert.

Really interesting guy and a really interesting course. While his teaching style didn't really fit my learning style, he definitely cares about his students. He is a fairly lenient grader and really wants students to understand and do well. Definitely get ready to read if you're taking a course with him.

He's a pretty good professor. Gives quick and good feedback and responds quickly to emails. Expect to do a lot of reading but the lectures are informative and cover a majority of the content of the readings. Pretty funny too and willing to poke jokes at the authors, himself, and even students sometimes.

Prof. is exceptionally knowledgeable and passionate about the topic of our class. The readings are dense, and there is a lot of them, but they all add depth to the class theme. I often am confused after reading but don't worry, he goes through the texts in class, the class always discusses, and I always leave class understanding the text themes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor, if you put in the effort you'll do well in the class.
I'm taking his class again, he is so nice and extremely intelligent. Great if you are premed

One of the best, most caring and understanding professors I have had at this school. If I had the chance to take more classes with him I would do it without a second thought. I don't want to call him an easy grader because that might be upsetting towards him, but he definitely is not picky and understands everyone writes differently.

Faber is a great guy (has tons of Iron Man merch as well). He gives great feedback, and if you just follow it, you'll see how eloquent writing can be. He has you read a book that shows how people can fudge data, and he let us play jeopardy to quiz us about the reading. Really fun guy and relaxed class.

I took a class with Dr. Faber several years ago, but it still stands out in my mind. He cared more about our learning than most. It wasn't just about the grade, but he seemed to genuinely care about the students. He also seemed to stay out of the politics of academia, which I really respected and admired. Very nice and helpful professor!

Professor Faber is an excellent professor. I would recommend anyone to take a class with him. He does assign a lot of journal entries which are based off of articles you read, but he grades extremely easy and you learn a lot!! I got an A in the class without really even trying. :)

Would have loved this class if it was tough by anyone else. Assignments are plain brutal, Ive essentially wrote the same essay about 7 times at this point. All I have learned is surface lvl cause he doesn't know the material. Lectures are painful, they are just the essays in person. I still don't even really get the fundamentals.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: He assigns weekly essays as homework with poorly-constructed prompts and a rubric that leaves for no higher-lvl analysis. Student interaction is very forced; we are given assigned seats to have groups to debate with but the in-class prompts are just as vague as the homework. No idea why a PH prof is teaching CS3043

Physics professor. No idea why he's teaching CS 3043. Long essays, 50-100pg of reading/wk. Just had an exam with 40-50 q's about the names of scientists, dates of inventions, advantages the clay tablet had over the abacus.. It's useless. He keeps suggesting we listen to this podcast about him - if anyone has done so, let me know if that explains it
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: It's clear that Professor Murenzi doesn't look over his lecture notes before the lecture and does not give clear explanations for class material beyond what's on the slides. He relies solely on the TA's for helping students with the class and homework and doesn't go over example questions himself as he randomly calls on students instead.

Romain did not make an effort to be a professor in this class. He exclusively used the slides from Pearson and didn't so much as look at them before the class. His lectures were therefore awful and unhelpful. I had to teach myself all of the content on my own using the Pearson materials. Avoid class at all cost. You have been warned.

Nice dude, attendance isn't mandatory so you will be fine as long as you read the textbook. He did daily discussion problems so you basically had homework every day, but it wasn't that bad. Before the exams he gives out a practice exam which is very similar to the actual exam, so if you go over that you will be fine.
Really hard to understand.
Nice guy.  Tough class but he is easy grading the projects.  Seems easier then Norton's class.
HARD to understand... he left his brain in Asia.  Nice guy though.  He seems intimidating but is not.

Projects were very confusing.  He gave unclear directions and graded arbitrarily.  There were no rubriks, or guidelines.  He took 12 points off for a 10 point question once.  Everyone should get an A in this class, we're all doing the same thing.  I don't know how I didn't.

Prof Moon has a very hard time speaking English... I can't understand what he's trying to talk about in lecture every day... The funny thing is that the TA can't understand him either. I don't think many people can.
Really Nice guy.  Knows his stuff.  Doesn't speak a word of English.  Always helpful but wouldn't take another class with him.
Great Professor, great person
Out of the three years I've taken classes here, he is the worst professor I've had
Gross. He hasn't changed his shirt in 3 weeks. Coughs into the microphone. Draws the same pictures on the projector 5 times. Copies examples directly from text.

Holly Shhhhh!!!!!  If you want to learn about histiry sign for a class with him.  Speaking aboit technology the guy is 50 years behing schedule.  He is using fortran compiled software and we are on 2006.  Time to move up SAP 2000, RISA, anything except his FRAME software form 196.....
miserable teacher.  do not take any classes with him
No Comments
She is a passionate professor, but you have to be willing to read all the assigned work and write essays in a timely manner. You have to provide quality work at all times.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Expect guest lecturers and quizzes based off of readings (40+ pages daily). She is not easily accessible outside of class just by email/Canvas. Harsh grading scale with NO forgiveness for mistakes. The final grade is only based off of 5 things: short paper, test, quizzes, participation, and the final project. The class activities are fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Classes are mandatory. pop quizzes on daily readings. Assignments are vague and you get marked off for things not clear she's looking for. Classes are disconnected and half of them taught by guest lecturers, and Prof doesn't even sit in for those lectures so she doesn't know what is brought up and taught. Quizzes and exam straightforward.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Not accommodating towards students. Does not help you outside of class. Pretty disorganized.
Good professor. Teaches the material very well and you learn what you are supposed to. Material focuses on general concepts. Material is not difficult, but she makes you work for an A.

Teaches material well and clearly. Participation and attendance mandatory, ~20 pg. reading + page summary per class. Class focused on general problems for entrepreneurs in the business world; don't expect to learn to start a business.

Jen was the best chemical engineering professor I've had so far at WPI. It is so refreshing to have a professor that is passionate about what they are teaching about and extremely knowledgeable about the subject. She will take the time to help anyone in a one on one setting or schedule someone to help you if she notices you're struggling. Kind lady

clear and concise, gives great feedback.  she has a habit of giving you more work than you can handle but when you dont finish it she grades you fairly on what youve done but def do as much as humanly possible cuz she grades on effort and its obvious with her work if you tried
Excellent Lectures.  She's very good at using the text to help, rather than paraphrasing the entire book in lecture.

She was easily the clearest CHE teacher in the whole department.  Fluids is usually a hard topic but she took us through problems step by step explaining all the little details.  Grades with lots of partial credit and tests just like the homework.  Not that hard and learned a lot... thus a great professor

Wilcox is a Chem Eng professor. Her class is focused on Chem Eng students. We never covered bouyancy, and covered head loss only as an afterthought. I don't think there was a pump in the class.  Nice as a person, just not my sort of prof.

Prof. Wilcox is a good teacher. She communicates well with the students. She did a lot of the homework in class. Quizzes were very straightforward. The final exam was just a compilation of questions from previous quizzes. An easy A!

Lane is an awesome guy and a great professor, would definately recommend taking Algos with him if he teaches it. Very down to earth and caring about his students, also attentive to feedback including coding in lecture to help students understand the algorithms presented.

Algorithms is one of the driest CS courses out there, but Professor Harrison was able to make it fun and interesting by finding ways to insert humor and relatable topics. He's extremely easy to get in contact with and clearly understands how to use and troubleshoot the tools he gives.

He's really knowledgeable and keeps up to date on data vis/other data science research. Very easy to talk to and a great resource if you're looking for some real professional insight into the industry. Class had a reasonable difficulty level. I felt like I learned a lot about data vis that wasn't just "here's Tableau and a data set, go ham"
I really enjoyed data visualization - Professor Harrison taught it really well. The early projects were a bit simplistic, but built up to very interesting topics and projects.
Dynamic teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: thank you for almost ruined my interest of data vis

I had Professor Droessler for two different classes and he is for sure my favorite professor here at wpi. There was a lot of reading to do for homework, but it was all very interesting and I have learned a lot from his classes. He is an easy grader and really does care about his students!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: There is a lot of reading, but so long as you slap a quote or two into your discussion post, you can get away without reading it. Easy grader, very nice professor, and seems to care about his students.

He is an easy grader when it comes to discussion reports and discussion questions and a little harder when it comes to essays. His lectures are engaging. There was a lot of reading but not too many assignments outside of class. He is understanding and will help you if you ask.

Very chill professor. Lectures interesting and insightful. Provides new perspectives. Course structure perfectly organized and paced. Good mix of individual and group work. Flexible and understanding. My only critique is that the material and historical sources tended to have a rather strong political bias, but that did not detract from the course.

He is a great professor and really cares about his students. He tries to expand people's perspective of history in new and exciting ways (he does have a pretty liberal bias though). He recognizes WPI is a STEM school and tries to connect history to student's broader STEM-education. Great guy, great class!

Professor Droessler's course was well structured, and he was very empathetic and understanding when it came to assignments, grading, and making himself available for outside help. His grading was fair, with only two papers and no exams. Participation and discussion posts are a good portion of your grade. Overall, one of my favorite courses at WPI!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Dominic is professor I've had at WPI. He gives very tough feedback but only because he knows it will bring out the best in you. He will always stick up for you when sponsors are being unreasonable. Cares about all of his students and wants to see them succeed. I wish he could teach all of my classes.

Excellent professor. Feedback is tough but fair and you will see yourself improve throughout the class. He doesn't waste any time on busy work and clearly puts in a ton of effort to make IQP go as smoothly as possible. Also has no problems pushing back on a sponsor if they're being difficult. Probably the best/most respectable advisor you can get.
Pushes for the best work and puts in a lot of time giving feedback for each draft you submit. Friendly and interesting to spend time with.

He expects a lot of work on IQP reports. oftentimes you feel like you do great, but the grade just never reach your expectation. He does give tons of feedbacks tho and this is why you improve over the course.
Great professor, sharp tongue but never mean. He expects a lot, but he will gladly work just as hard as you to improve your results. Extremely respectable.

Had this professor for ID2050 prior to going away to London. Extremely difficult professor. Everyone in the class got the same grade. However, he is extremely helpful and provided feedback in a timely manner. Nice guy too with a lot of fun stories and suggestions of things to do in London. I would reccomend him as a teacher but be prepared to work!

Very tough, but a great professor. Provides useful, insightful feedback, and is genuinely interested in seeing students do well. Very approachable and reasonable. He will hear students' concerns, but you have to approah him. He's a fair grader and excellent instructor overall.

Fabs is a tough advisor on IQP but its in a good way. While she may be harsh on your paper and tear it to shreds but, she does a great job at giving feedback to truly make your paper better. One gripe is the delay in enforcing that we basically needed to rewrite an entire part of our paper till the last week. Is a pro at IQP advising at this point
Great prof!

Prof. Miller was my IQP advisor and she did a good job in communicating her expectations and giving us timely feedback. I enjoyed working her but you have to work hard and keep up with the work regularly. She is a good advisor.
Excellent professor. Dedicated. Knowledgeable. Committed to students. Well organized. Fair grader. Reasonable expectations. Highly recommended.
very good prof. strong recommended. best smile~
Extremely helpful, no superfluous material, uses practice problems and class participation as a learning tool. Very clear and easy to understand.

Very detailed lectures and loves to help students. Is clearly very passionate about her work which shows in her slideshows! Practice exams are exactly like the actual exam content, which is a huge plus. Broke the class down into 3 exams: DNA, RNA, Protein. Be warned: you cannot cram for this class. There's way too many protein names for that.
Reading-heavy, test-heavy class but she made it enjoyable. Tests cover a lot of information, but everything you need to know is in the notes, and she is happy to answer any questions you may have.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the best professors at the school. Not an easy A, but is completely fair when it comes to grades. Tests are directly from material covered. Gives a good amount of work, but if you get it done and study the material, you'll get the grade you deserve. Also, one of the most caring and helpful professors. Would 100% recommend
She was very helpful and accepting of student feedback. She gave plenty of study materials and options for help before exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: All tests are based off class notes and practice exam/problem sets
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Farny is one of the best bio professors at WPI. Her lectures are great and straight to the point. Her exams come directly from class notes, discussions and the online quizzes so there are no surprises. Gives a fair amount of HW of a 3000 level class. Always willing to help outside of class and has good office hours.
Here speaking style is dry and monotonous.  She could interact with the class more during lectures and bat ideas about rather than drone.
Grades like a monster, but if you can get a 40/40 on her lab reports, you can publish for NEJM
great organization of the class labs, knows her stuff, and easy to talk to
very flexible, does a good job of teaching
Great teacher
Great professor, makes the material very clear and straightfoward.

He tells you what will be on the test/homework, give you tons of examples of how to do those problems, and then when the tests/homework come around the questions actually are what he said they would be.  What more can you ask for?  Don't take Advanced thermo with anyone else.
Famous words: If you sit down and stare at it for sometime you will get it :) Pretty straight forward. Lots of help on the HW.
Funny accent but not hard to understand
No Comments

Lectures are interesting, but not well-focused. She focuses on what she likes. Everyone does a group project, but it's not that hard. Tests are more name-based and less concept-based than she claims. Know the names of the theories. This class was fine. Not great, not bad, but fine.

the comments below are outdated. Prof Gobert is a very nice lady and honestly wants her students to understand what she is teaching and is a very lenient grader. textbook and slides are all fair game on the tests but if you can recall most of it, youll do fine. gives lots of opportunities for extra credit as well. get to know her and youll be fine

She is very rude and will occasionally make snide comments. For 2 weeks, she actually did lectures and whatnot with a chapter powerpoint. After, she became very lazy and made the class teach the with only 15 minutes notice to prepare. It's very apparent that she cares more about research than her students. Her tests do not reflect material covered.

This professor was very nice, however, her teaching style was boring. She lectured every class with powerpoints that were sometimes unclear. The tests were hard because there was so much material covered. No homework though, just lots of cramming before a test.

This professor was very difficult to work with. Her tests did not reflect the material she covered adequately and ranged from far too easy to far too difficult. Also, she never handed tests back until the class before the next test, and has a tendency to leave things until the last minute. She's a very nice woman, but she grades very unreasonably.

Honestly, she's super smart and nice, but isn't great at explaining things. I found her class pretty funny because she commonly messed up. I didn't go to quite a few classes and just studied before the exam, and I did fine. She is very organized and resources are easily accessible, so studying went well. I would recommend having her as a professor.

Professor Rolle gives clear explanations in her lectures and the course is organized in a way that makes sense (more than I can say for other professors at this school). You can learn a lot in her class but you have to read the papers she assigns and put in the work. She can be hard to get ahold of outside of class because she's always super busy.

This professor is engaging during class, but really isn't helpful during lab. She doesn't directly answer your questions at all if you ask her something. She's okay overall, but definitely not the most interested in helping students. There are other professors in the BME dept that are better.
She is incredibly helpful and makes you really invested in the work you're doing which makes the class that much better. Great professor!
Greatest professor ever, always try to help student. She stayed late in school (9pm) to just meet with and help students!

He is very lecture heavy. Hard to understand him and it's very easy to get lost in his lectures (hard to follow). Goes through his slides very fast. Doesn't give practice exams and doesn't tell you what the format of his exams will be. Very confusing class and hard.
Although the lecture can be difficult at times, if you follow along and do the work that is required, you will learn a lot from this course. The professor is caring and really wants you to succeed.

Pretty terrible prof. Lectures aren't explained well, and grading is often late. Unfortunately the only professor that teaches BME2211. Wastes time teaching useless things, like how to round numbers and precision and accuracy.

Lee is an extremely boring lecturer, and he just reads off of his power points. He does not explain things too well. The homework is alright but just tedious. The quizzes and exams can be challenging. Overall not a pleasant experience but he is the only professor for BME2211 sadly. So you have no choice. Also, having experience in coding helps.

Overall, he's a good professor in that it's clear he wants us to succeed and grasp the material rather than making assignments unnecessarily hard. That being said, his lectures can be dry and the group project was time consuming and a bit stressful.

He is really nice, I had him for ECE 2010, very organized in his head and good at communicating what he is thinking, tries to prepare you as well as he can for the test, his hw is fair. I once asked him for pre lab bc I didn't understand a thing and when I did, his email made so much sense, very detailed and helpful. A good person overall, take him

While the subject matter isn't easy, he is very good at explaining and answering questions.  His practice tests are extremely helpful and prepare you in the fullest for the real tests.  He's there during lab hours too, and seems to enjoy helping students with their lab.  Obviously very passionate about his work, and it shows in his teaching.

Hes a relatively new professor.  I had him once for micro1 and didnt like him all that much.  Then had him again for 3803 and thought he was awesome.  3803 is his course and itll be hard but you'll learn a ton.  Very clear in class but still kinda working the bugs out of 3803. Tells you what's on the tests and didnt really throw any curveballs.

The class started off good, however he lost momentum at the very end and his tests got consistently worse. His first test was definitely fair, his second test was decent however we needed more time, and the third test was brutal. However he's very fair grading.
His class was hard, but for a new prof he's pretty good.

She was awesome! Sure it was a difficult class and you had to work really hard but you actually learn stuff unlike almost every single other class in the CHE department. She actually cares about you learning and was there to help everytime I needed it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: My god this women is terrible! She asked us to do the course rating during our last class, all she care about is herself but not students at all!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: One time in class, she went through an explanation. There was an obvious disconnect in the material as there were arbitrary variables showing up. Even though she knew that material didn't make sense, she asked the class does that makes sense. She then followed by ops I skipped a page. :( She also grades exams harshly. Avoid at all cost!!!
