Very critical grader and her tests are kind of confusing - not connected to homework much. Relied on the textbook because lectures can get disorganized.

Lectures are confusing, she doesn't answer questions very often. Her grading is harsh and critical, very hard to get full points on a questions. Tests are often confusing, she has trouble writing effective questions. Overall, one of the worst professor's I've had so far. Avoid her if at all possible.

RBE 501 Discussion board, writing aesthetically IEEE papers and Matlab live scripts was focus.  Unable to answer assignment questions and suggested posting questions on discussion board for classmates to answer.  Grading rubrics were pointless since it changed during grading.  Assignments were vague. Read intense medical journals. Waste of money.

Took RBE501 with him, not 500.

1. Time spent on Discussion Board is just to meet a weekly quota of participation, it doesn't teach you anything
2. Too much emphasis on research papers which are not even related to dynamics
3. Lectures are sloppy, he just records his first take
4. Ridiculous grade breakdown (40-60% from exam + project)
rating_tags: Participation matters--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Requires outside resources to learn course material and MATLAB. Assignments written with vague instructions and rubrics aren't fully accurate. Quality of discussion board posts and report-style assignment submissions are important. The assignments seem to be graded as 50% course material, 25% technical writing skills, and 25% MATLAB utilization.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Discombobulated lectures with sloppy, irrelevant material. Homeworks are intentionally ambiguous (his words). Format and discussion posts are more important than learning robotics. If you aren't proficient in Matlab, you will suffer. Doesn't respond to email and can only meet on zoom with him if you have a "written statement of purpose approved"
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This course is assignment heavy and the presentation of the assignment matters more than the correctness. He is hardly accessible outside of class so you will have to fend for yourself. Lectures are hard to follow and oftentimes vague. Assignment criteria aren't very clear and that makes it difficult to complete assignments. I wouldn't recommend.
He is useless when you ask him to explain things. The way he writes his questions are very confusing.

Good professor. His material is relatively easy but interesting. He is somehow demanding on the projects, it is a real time deal,extensive analysis is required. You will learn quite a bit about machining and fixturing. Overall he is nice professor.

The class is a waste of time. I could have learned whatever I learned in the class from reading an article. He is unprofessional and not up to WPI reputation. I feel bad paying money for this course.  Yes he is an easy grader and too laid back but the educational  outcome is low.

This class was a breeze.  The tests are easy....hw are easy....and the project is easy.  What more can you ask for?? Oh...he's a nice guy too...Not very helpful though when it comes to questions/answers.
No Comments

Definitely AVOID him. He just reads the slides and gives us nothing helpful.  Learn by yourself and don't waste time on his class. I also heard that he threw everything to his TA, lacking in a sense of responsibility.
He just mumbles lecture notes another professor wrote while facing the wall then sends unrelated homework. The quizzes are also unrelated to both homework and lectures.

Do not take him!  Quizzes and homeworks do not look anything like the lectures. Never provides you with practical exercises and overall has poor structure of the class. Taught the programming lectures related to final project a day after the project was due. Wanna pass? Skip lectures, read slides yourself and seek help from those who took this clas

One of the worst professors I've had at WPI. He's a nice guy, but does a very poor job explaining the material. His accent and manner of speech make it even harder to follow whatever he's talking about. He does dumb the exams down so everyone doesn't fail, but unfortunately you won't learn anything from this course.
This course took a lot of time on labs and final project. Never take it unless it is required.

Professor Narra is one of my favorite professors at WPI. She truly cares about every student in her class and excepts the best from them. Professor Narra gives numerous practice problems and is willing to answer any question you might have. I felt extremely prepared going into stress analysis.
I don't think I've ever wanted to drop out of a class more. Handwriting hard to read, can't speak clearly and do not get me started on Hands-On Fridays. I hated this class and wish I didn't take it.

I was pointed out many times by the professor for the things I never did. She often stopped class and pointed me specifically for no reason which was quite embarrassing for me when everyone in the class looked at me. I hate her.

CONS: -she explains things in confusing ways -homework was often hard to complete since her notes are hard to understand -Used PollEveywhere as a part of participation grade but she would open the poll a few minutes before class started and close it right as the class began PROS: -caring -wants people to understand material

Professor Narra is a very caring and orgaized person. She would often hold additional office hours for students and have class information on Canvas easy to understand. However, professor Narra is not the best teacher. She doesn't explain problems clearly and her notes are illegible. If you want a solid understanding of statics, avoid her class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Rao was an amazing professor.  The class was pretty easy and he had engaging lectures.  Would definitely take a class with him again.
Homework was easy, great lectures.  Not a hard class but it was extremely interesting.

He posts his powerpoints, which he reads from, so class is not necessary to attend but attendance is 10% of your grade. You have to do much of the learning on your own since it is difficult to pay attention. The homework is similar to the tests and he explains it moderately well, but the solutions are often not the most efficient way to solve.

Although he is our boy, Pratap is a mediocre teacher. He basically just reads off of the powerpoints provided by the book and has extremely strict homework formatting requirements. Attendance is 'mandatory' with a sign-in sheet. The tests are easy, although they are not out of many points so it is equally as easy to get a bad grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Pratap Rao is a young guy who is a little awkward in front of the class but otherwise has no flaws. He teaches through PowerPoints and makes you understand the material fairly well by going through the important parts. Fair homework and tests, albeit tough and comprehensive.  His English is perfect by the way.

She was awesome! She was passionate about her work and always showed us things she had worked on. Lectures were interesting and engaging. The grade was determined by discussions on the readings, in-class group assignments (you had to rush a lil), and a big final assignment. The final assignment was a group book chapter on a species of choice, fun!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Bakermans is a wonderful teacher and person overall. It is easy to tell how passionate she is about what she teaches, and I learned a great deal from her. Her class is graded in a balanced way so that one bad grade doesn't tank your grade, and as long as you show up and take notes on her lectures you should be fine.

She does a great job of making the class engaging, she switches it up with activities and opportunities to participate. I learned a lot in the lectures. Her grading system is straightforward but sometimes difficult. The tests ask about specific details but if you pay attention in class and read the book/assignments you can do well on them.
I had her for GPS and she's a great professor but GPS is dumb
Great professor who made her class very engaging with a mix of lecture and activities.  The primary lit reading was honestly a waste of time but other than that she's a good choice.

Took him for marketing at Bryant, the most disorganized syllabus ever. 4 revisions this semester and it's still not correct. Not accessible outside of class whatsoever, does not respond to email. Bounces around from topic to topic, no clear connections in material. Very childish and unprofessional, tries to make his students feel dumb. do not rec.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Doesn't reply to emails, lectures can be mind-numbing at times, various readings that he makes you pay for, minimum $100 dollars for all the texts and business simulation game. Syllabus is long and vague, no rubrics but there are examples for papers. Very disorganized course given its stature. Most interesting part were the presenters brought in.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Had him C22 and it was a good experience. This class may be a business class but don't be fooled, you will have to put the work in, but it's not hard. You have the group project, limited homework (news report, country prospectus, and guest speaker analysis) and then in class quizzes which seem to be graded on participation, so show up. Good class.

I had him for BUS 1020 this past C term and it was an enjoyable experience. Ed makes an 8 am class worth getting up for. The class is pretty easy, with not too many assignments and not a lot of work. The simulation was a lot of fun and I felt like it was an accurate representation of what starting an international business would be like.
He emailed me a couple times to check-in when I was late on assignments. Provides plenty of supplemental material for all types of learners. Lots of reading but it's all interesting.

Ed is a great business teacher and has renewed my love for business classes. He incorporates real-world examples into every lecture and his class requires no notes. The quizzes were definitely tricky if you did not read very carefully. Really no tests, just the quizzes and business sim and final country prospectus. Everything was very interesting!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: INTL2320 - Lots of reading assignments outside of class that are long and really important to read and analyze. He does a really good job of laying out the course so you know what to expect and how to prepare. Analyzing high level text was the hardest part of this class, but it was overall interesting. Lectures were sometimes long and monotonous.

Be prepared for a decent amount of reading outside of class, and high expectations for analysis. Other than that, I would absolutely recommend this professor! He's clearly passionate about what he does and is great at getting you to actually engage with history and current events.

He was very nice and helpful. Lectures were a bit up in the air, with no usual backup powerpoint. Discussions in class could have been stimulated by easier-worded questions, although small group discussions were always fruitful. Final project was a lot of fun, albeit a lot of work. Feedback was great but always a little late. Cared a lot about us.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor San Martin's only problem is he cares a lot about history for a tech school. He is really caring and understanding as a professor, but purposefully challenges you with papers that go beyond answering a simple question. He will make you understand history more than other teachers will.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor San Martin is genuinely passionate in the areas of global environmental policy and historical geopolitics in the Americas. His courses are heavy on reading, class participation, group work, and papers. If you do the reading s and participate, you will learn a lot and be glad you took his course. Great if you want to learn and be involved.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Fontenot is amazing!! Her class was awesome and she gives great feedback on all of the assignments. She won't make another assignment due until she grades the previous one. I would 100% take her class again!!

Prof. Fontenot is great. As long as you have a basic level of writing skill, you will be fine in the course. There is a lot of freedom when it comes to choosing topics for papers, which are very manageable and seem reasonable for an intro writing course.
I loved Fontenot. She was a pretty easy grader and gave great feedback. Gave you multiple times to turn in a paper and get good feedback. I would totally have her again she was so nice.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Very easy grades and straightforward lectures. The essays aren't typical English essays, which makes them very flexible and easy to do. The class is two hours long, but she sometimes lets you go early if you finish your work. Only annoying thing is that attendance is required and if you're absent that day, you get a zero for the day. Otherwise good
Kind and engaging professor. Genuinely cares about students and wants you to succeed. Go to class and finish your papers and you'll do great.

Professor Paffenroth was an inspiration in this class to teach engineers about data science and machine learning. Final group project utilized everything we have learned in the class so far and I felt like I understand data science on a deeper level now.

Randy is an amazing professor I have ever seen. Worked with him for 3 semesters on projects and attended his group meeting. He was always willing to sit down, listen, and discover student's interests together and prepare them with solid knowledge for industry use. Highly recommend both for lecture and research!

He is the teacher who cares about equality so you can rest assure on your grade that it would be fair and square. His lecture is easy to digest. Note that he is not going deep into math or statistics behind but it is available on the textbook for you to read. It is also worth to mention that "cross-validation" is what you need to do to pass.

Best professor I have had at WPI! Adjusted incredibly well to online learning. Learned a ton from this class. Very fair and impartial grader. Really does care about his students. Made hard concepts easy to understand. Take as many classes as you can with Professor Paffenroth. He is simply amazing!
One of the best professors I've had at this school. His class is interesting and engaging. He really cares about helping you learn as much as you can.
Truly an amazing person. If you have the opportunity to take her class, take it.

I had Professor Cote for material science. Hands on labs, super engaging class, amazing professor. We did tensile testing with oreos, marshmallow microstructure labs, and more. The quizzes and exams were very fair and easier than the homework. I highly recommend prof cote

She is one of my favorite professors I have had. She is clearly passionate about material science which makes learning much easier. She creates fun activities and easy to follow lectures. Nothing bad to say.

Taught the material well and was clear about what students were expected to know to do well on the tests. There were also in class mini labs that used food to demonstrate or represent different materials science topics.

Her ES2001 class was way easier than the other ones offered from what I understand. She's clearly extremely knowledgeable about materials science and is a great person to talk to about the field. Kinda wish she gave us more challenging work in class, but we still covered a lot of content.
Nice teacher, good humor and cares about students, but lots of work for the class and you have to hand everything in as printed copies.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Poorly planned course, professor unable to use technology, makes class extremely difficult
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She seems like a super nice person, but not a super great teacher. She's not super organized and it is very lecture heavy.

Disliked this class very much. Professor was extremely unclear and disorganized, making assignments impossible to complete correctly. When assignments were graded, they weren't handed back in a timely manner, so it was difficult to see what you did wrong. There was no good way to succeed in this class, no matter how well expectations are followed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Very rude, disorganized, and heartless teacher. She is super unclear on writing even though writing assignments are due almost every class. She lectures all of the time even though it's a seminar class. Makes me feel awful everyday; I often leave wanting to cry. Content might be interesting, but dealing with her is not worth it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Linlin is really good professor. If you have trouble with calc take her class because she is really great at explaining it. I can even express in words how great she is. By the way, she has the best personality-super nice!

Lin Lin is awesome! She's a very nice person and an okay teacher. She's really great during office hours, and her tests and quizzes are like what you've been practicing. She gives oral exams if the large majority of the class bombs an exam. She wants you to succeed. I didn't go to class for 95% of the lectures, and still got an A :D

Her accent is really difficult to understand. Lectures consist of her paraphrasing the textbook on the board. Homework and quizzes are pretty hard. The only redeeming quality of this class is that she allows retakes of most of her midterms, with a possible grade of 80%.

She has a really awful accent that is hard to understand, but she partially makes up for it by writing everything on the board. She overcomplicates topics and her notes are directly from the book. However, she makes up this by allowing verbal midterm make ups. Overall a nice person, not so great teacher.

Slight accent but after first couple days is easy to understand.  Easiest/Best math professor on campus. Gives you practice  tests and quizzes that are exactly the same just with different numbers.  One of the nicest professors i have met.  Lets you retake quizzes verbally too. Take Linlin!
Worst professor I've ever had. Rude, arrogant, and thinks she's hilarious. Avoid at all costs.

She was a very good teacher and I do recommend her. She has a very sharp personality that not all students will mesh with, but it was a good fit for me. It was a lot of work, especially the required rewrites on failed assignments. My only criticism is that she was pretty unclear when explaining assignment expectations.

The most confusing professor I've ever had. She says one thing and expects something completely different. Doesn't respond to emails and when asking for help she gives you "pointers" that leave you even more confused than you were before. Extremely rude and disrespectful to anyone who has a different opinion. Assigns work 2 days before end of term.
Rude, condescending, mean-spirited teacher.

She is ridiculous. She gives the most work out of any professor at WPI. She expects the quality of work to be on par with academic scholars. Do not take this class if you have a life and want to keep having a life. If you are anorexic or have insomnia this class is for you. You won't have time to eat or sleep.
Beyond awful! WPI should really invest more in hiring good professors.

Passionate about the course and getting his students involved. Lectures can be boring at times but if you participate he will give you extra credit. Homework is a little tough but good prep for tests. Very reasonable grader.

He's good. He's a solid lecturer, but you must read the textbook in advance. HW is harder than the tests. Each test has a basic content question, an application question or two, and an expansion question. If he hints something will be on the test, it will be. There were two group projects, with short due dates and poor instructions. Ask questions!
Power point lectures can be confusing, but he's helpful if you see him in his office.  If you understand the homework, the quizzes are a cake walk.  The projects are long and annoying though.

He is very sexy. Not a good teacher in lecture, but in Office Hours he's awesome-- make sure you go to them! The HW is a good preparation for the exams, and he drops the lowest one. Two projects make up 40% of grade, but they're pretty tough. Use a lot of software in the class, so that helps. His lectures are tough to follow, but dat hair. <3

Nice, understanding person. You can tell that he cares about the things he is teaching. Be prepared to read a lot, uses perusall. Lots of writing, don't take this if you are looking for an easy social science credit. However, if you are interested in sustainable planning I can't recommend Prof. Rosbach enough.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: One of the best prof @WPI. Very accommodating. Very text-heavy, and lots of work, but nothing more than any STEM class. Super knowledgeable and willing to provide additional resources. Can get away with skipping readings, b/c no tests, but then you won't learn half of what you could. If you are a self-starter prof Rosbach teaches you a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: WHAT A GUY. He assigns so much busy work that he can't keep up with the grading. He also thinks that we're all reading two chapters of an awful textbook every night? NOPE. And he assigns group projects and makes you assign sections to be done individually so he can give an 'individual scores'. I didn't realize group projects were done individually?
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: A concussion didn't stop Rosbach from blowing me away during GPS. His helpful suggestions and zany remarks made a miserable class bearable.

GREAT Professor. Learn a lot-- class flows differently than an engineering class, and some may perceive this "softness" with boring. He's GREAT GREAT-- opens your mind to so many different ideas, helps you write, and is always available for support and extra help. Definitely a dad figure, I would recommend him.

Dr. J is the funniest, yet most respectful professor I've had. His lectures can be hard to follow at times, but he genuinely wants to help you learn. He's an easy grader and his tests aren't difficult.

Dr J is absolutely amazing. I would recommend anyone remotely interested in the field of Neuroscience take him as a professor. His passion for the subject is immediately evident and infectious. He is always willing to explain difficult topics in more detail if someone is confused, and the two exams we had were both good reflections of the material.

Dr. J is an awesome professor and he cares a lot about his students. He really wants us to learn something and loves student participation. If you can take him for your BB capstone course, I highly recommend. We read a few papers each week and discussed in class - quizzes were reading papers and interpreting them so a little effort goes a long way.

Dr. J is one of the most down to earth and inspirational professors I HAVE EVER HAD. Not only does he stimulate my interest in the subject matter, he is also a very understanding and personal professor. As long as you do your work and listen to his instructions you have a very high chance of being successful in the courses he teaches!
Wanted all students to get a good grade, and tried to help everyone in the class. No exam, and easy quizzes.

Fun but rather disorganized lecturer so can be difficult to follow. You will learn a decent amount but perhaps not as much as you'd hoped, especially since the quiz questions are very weird and often focused on minutiae instead of the main themes of what we studied. You have to do a lot of scientific paper reading but you'll get good practice in it

The professor makes you purchase a book in which he is the author.  It is wordy without reason, but the general concept is decent.  The lectures are a drawn out review of the material that was read at home that week.  He doesn't add much additional value to the readings.
This guy is really good at what he does. I found his teachings applicable to real life situations.

Belgian. Uses slide show and videos (which are boring). Hard to study for the tests, because there is so much information and he really does not emphasize anything, expect for the 4 P's. Grades easy on the project.
No Comments

This guy is awesome.  really laidback and easy going.  only homework all term was one group ten page paper which isnt that hard.  tests were fairly easy if you put a tiny amount of time into studying, fun and interesting class
He was an ok professor. A lot of times he would mess up on calculations on tests but when it came to his grading policy it was pretty lenient. His voice sounds a lot like Hamm from toy story

He knew what he was doing, but went too fast and seemed to be going all over the place. It was hard to follow him sometimes. Also students had to correct him in his calculations and he somethimes made mistakes.
Eh... Alright, not very good overall. He definitely knows his stuff, but goes too fast at times and doesn't really seem to care about the students.
If you're smart enough to understand him, then you would think he's fantastic.
he doesnt care about the students.  i learned more from the TA.  he will not answer students questions even in a review session

Excited about the subject matter, perhaps more than his ability to teach. And more than the curriculum can support. He likes to teach and to help people learn, but expect high standards. Will assume his techniques are the best way to do things, until you show that your way works too. Assignments are clear enough, but minutiae can get muddled.

Very unorganized.  Is more focused on students learning his exact pipeline than on students learning or growing at all.  He's really nice, but I've never learned anything from him, and most of the other people who took the class didn't either.
This professor is awesome and he knows his stuff.  I learned so much in his animation class.  Due to his teaching I was able to get my first job as an animator.  Best professor I ever had.

Grades extremely unfairly when it comes to the final grade. Received A's on my midterm and my final which is worth 80% of the final grade and A's on other animation assignments. Got a B in the course. Very closed minded about project ideas, barely ever replies to emails, doesn't think anything is good enough, goes way too fast in lectures.

Had for Machinima and IQP work. Is an adequate teacher. He often times isn't the most knowledgeable about the subject he is teaching (although it's hard because much of what he teaches is new stuff), but he tries to learn more about the subject and will help you with questions. In machinima at least, he has lower expectations than I would think.

Great professor. Extremely organized and willing to explain everything. He really deserves better ratings than he has gotten before. I enjoyed the class. The tests and quizzes are very much like the assigned material. He even took the time to graphically demonstrate/visualize some things with MATLAB.

He's a nice guy, gives good examples. His pace is a little fast and tends to teach in the morning at 8:00am. Because of these to reasons you might not get all the information the first time, the textbook is definite worth looking at for review, questions representative of Easy Exams and clarification. He's also good at clarifying if you'll ask him.

Almost switched out after seeing the other ratings on here. Glad I didn't! Sometimes his lectures didn't make any sense but after doing the homework I understood. Quizzes were very short and always scaled.

Very new to teaching - needs more experience.  Helpful in office hours - not prepared for classes and not clear on subject matter - kills students on tests - avg. grade on final was 58%! Don't think we learned what we needed to for future classes.

Probably one the of the worst professors i have gad at WPI. lectures are useless does not cover the material he puts on quizzes and test.  Doesnt assign much which was the on redeeming thing about the course

Easiest A in my life. Just be awake, don't sleep, and no snoozin'. (Yes, that was redundant, just as professor McGlashan is). Typically unclear and attempts to use metaphors frequently. When he talks about eating through the bruise or around the bruise, just know he's talking about an apple. It means fight through, don't chew, you too, can be you.

Highly recommend taking HOS1023 with Professor McGlash. If your GPA is in the slumps you should take his class. It will lift your spirits and I can almost guarantee you'll get an A if you show up. Just make sure he knows you well enough to remember. The only thing I dislike is the lack of syllabus and course structure.
KMAC is the best professor I have ever had at this class. He really puts the Pi in WPI and he makes life one jollie good adventure. Must take! Easy A! Dont leave your things out or you will not pass

If you get KMac (Yes, that's what we call him in class) you can consider yourself to be one of the luckiest people alive. KMac doesn't just teach you material, he helps you live the material. Some people think 'Easy A' or 'Pushover' and while this is true, you don't care. He takes you in like one of his own. You can almost call him dad.
Kelsey is the best hospitality major teacher at WPI.

I've had the honor of having Professor O'Brien as a research advisor and a professor. She is extremely caring and really strives to make class interesting and incorporates material that pertains to specific interests of people in the class. There are a lot of papers to read and a couple of projects, but they're graded fairly and you'll learn a lot!
Easy class for an interesting elective.  If you do the work and read the assigned text you will have no problem doing well.  She cares very much about her students and is passionate about her field.

MUST READ THE BOOK TO GET AN A. Some exam questions come out of the book and are never touched on in class. Many assignments come out of nowhere. You have to check the Syllabus, her lectures, and BB comments to see when things are due. Biggest plus is that she offers a LOT of extra credit at the end.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: A lot of readings and fairly good lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had her in A term when it was her first term at WPI. After grading our first exams, she realized that the exam was way to tough for us. So she scaled the tests, offered tons of extra credit, and made the next exams easier! Wonderful professor! If you participate in class, do extra credit, and go to office hours once, you will likely receive an A.

Gaudette honestly cares so much about everyone in his lectures even though there was over a hundred of us! He welcomes questions and really tries to clear up any confusion which may have arisen regarding the material. He also tries to use hands-on activities to help you see what's actually happening in a given system which was really helpful to me!

He's super funny. He explains everything you need to know with lots of detail. His lecture notes are awful to look at, but it's just funny. He's very helpful when you ask questions. I would highly recommend having him as a professor.
Amazing professor. Don't hesitate to take him

Great guy, great class. Pay attention to all the lectures and you'll get an A.  He likes to teach additional advice to being an engineer which is extremely helpful, many other professors would not go out of their way like this guy.

Awesome teacher overall. Very clear and helpful for everything. He is quite possibly the best BME professor on campus and is always a pleasure to talk to. His tests are reasonable and makes class interesting and fun at the same time. Take every class this man teaches
They are a really nice and good professor. I really enjoyed my time in their class and I learned quite a bit. Also really helped me in later classes. You will enjoy classes with them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Online Savvy

comment: She is simply awesome! Classes are all highly discussion based, don't be afraid to get involved. Very reasonable amount of reading to do outside of class and they are all very interesting. Easy to get a good grade if you put the time in to do the few papers she asks for. All her classes are very interesting and pretty low stress, HIGHLY recommend.

I had professor McWeeny for into to philosophy and religion and she was amazing. She requires a few outside books but theyre easy to rent or buy used for very cheap. She assigns a lot of reading but most of which is enjoyable. This is one of her only classes that she grades qualitatively, so definitely participate in discussion and ask questions.

Professor McWeeny had very interesting and thought provoking lectures. She did assign a lot of work though. For finals week we had a final paper, final project, and a final exam. The class itself was very interesting, but there was a lot of outside reading to do to prepare for it.

She is really good as an Intro Philosophy prof. She didn't go over much religion, however.  She graded the first and second items as you submitted them, then stopped grading the rest of them until the day before grades were due. But when she does grade the rest of the items, she is pretty generous with the grading. Really good and nice professor.

Professor Rosewitz is an incredible professor, combing practical industry experience with valuable class exercises. Her classes will help round out your civil engineering background and her personal anecdotes add a significant level of richness to her lectures. Highly recommend!
Professor Rosewitz is great. Everything in her class makes sense and she gives clear explanations. She gives lots of homework but the assignments are always fair.

A lot of work, multiple HW & exercises assignments each week (combine =70% of grade), so do well on them (very fair grader but takes a very long time to grade) & you'll do well in the class (get an A). Extra discussion reply's = extra credit! Understanding & willing to help. Will allow you to resubmit assignments to fix mistakes! Worth it for an A.
This professor is simply posting way too much homework, literally posts new homework's and discussion boards due the day before when most of us are taking a full course load.

She is one of the best Civil professors at the school. She is young and can relate with her students. If you have due date concerns/ issues she is really laid back as long as you communicate with her. If you pay attention in class and be a good student she loves you.
He is a professor that knows his topic very well and is able to explain clearly the subject. Homework will take you a bit of time but you often have a week to do it. Overall great professor.

This was the most difficult class I've taken in my life. Lectures were nonstop information with a substantial amount of theorems which we never ended up using. The homework was nearly impossible without attending office hours and the exams sometimes varied from the discussions in class. We were always behind other sections.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I will admit, lectures are hard to follow for his class and homework can be tough, but if you go to MASH or do your homework with other friends it ends up being really, really helpful and you understand the concepts a lot better. Also, the sample problems he posts, DO THEM! They are really good & very similar to the test, and the tests aren't hard.

He had some trouble staying on track because of the 7 weeks term. The Homework is so difficult and takes so long. However, before every exam, he provides sample questions that are VERY VERY VERY helpful, so it's easy to get an A, but a lot of stress! Office hours are REALLY helpful.

Lectures go very fast and are difficult to understand, doesn't post notes later so what you write down is what you get, homework is difficult and not like what is taught in class, tests are also not like what was taught or was on the homework. He is available outside of class and is moderately helpful there.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I love Prof.Bailey. She's so sweet and it's been such a joy being in her class. The bonus is she also brings Munchkins' or chocolate during the quiz prep days. Highly recommended taking the class with her. She's the best.
Great teacher that is interested in students success and material taught.

This is my second class with Prof. Bailey. I really enjoyed her class. The class was structured with 6 Quizzes and 6 homework. Most of the quizzes are take home. There was 1 group project. One thing I love is that she does "minute papers" at the end of the week as a check-in/ feedback form and then addresses the feedback usually in the next class.

I love Professor Bailey! She give lots of clear examples in class, and she is happy to help you if you are confused. There are 6 quizzes and 2 group projects in the class, nothing too scary. Overall the class averages on everything were very high. I really enjoyed this class, and I hope to take another class from Professor Bailey in the future.

I love Professor B! Her lectures are clear and easy to understand. Her class was lectures everyday,1 homework/week, 1quiz/week and 2 group projects. When you ask a question in class she really takes time to make sure you understand. Very caring and compassionate towards students and she wants us to genuinely succeed.  She's a 10/10 professor!

A lot of the reviews here are a bit harsh in my opinion. But heres my breakdown:

Pros:
  He is very friendly and extremely accessible outside of class if you need help.
  Not a hard class in the slightest you read a few passages and you write a few papers
  Doesn't call on people
Cons
  attendance is mandatory
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: The class is very boring but overall pretty easy. All he does is talk about the reading for the entire class. He also will always use every second of class time. It is an easy humanities credit if you are not really into ethics.

Racine is disorganized in the way he lectures during class. His grading of submitted work was confusing at best and pretty much unhelpful. The papers were also on incredibly specific topics that with a thesis essentially forced upon you that did not allow for student exploration of the topic or development of independent ideas.

Attendance and quick discussion responses are a pretty big part of the grade, so just do them and you'll pass. The larger papers are a bit trickier, and the professor doesn't ever hand out 100s, but people more or less did fine. If you want an A, go to office hours and engage with the professor. Class is interesting but a lot of reading
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: The professor has a completely subjective grading style, where if you disagree with his points, say bye-bye to your grade.  He always tries to give feedback but it often comes back as a little snarky.  Would not recommend for Intro classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: assigned seating!

Hw is a lot harder than the tests, read over the notes + do the practice test and youll b fine gradewise. She cares abt students and helps when u ask for it, she also takes attendance and will remember ur name even if uve never talked to her. Took APAB in highschool and got a 4 and I was fine for her class. Assigns seats and makes u talk to ppl.
Would have had a better time watching my poop go down the toilet
Did not cover topics on homeworks and tests. Very difficult if no calc II experience.
She gave us assigned seats like we are 4th grad

Material that's covered on homework is much harder than anything on the tests and doesn't really relate much to the tests, but the group reviews done before tests are pretty much exactly what the test questions are. Not a great teacher if you don't already have a solid understanding of calculus.
Really enjoyed her class.  Minimal lab write-ups (though the labs are still very involved) and she is quite reasonable with any problems.  She tries to help you as much as possible.

I really enjoyed taking AI with Chernova.  The lectures were interesting.  The homeworks were automatically graded, and we could test our code with the autograder to make sure that it all works before submitting it.  There were even two times when she brought candy to class for us to eat.

Great professor. She is well prepared and organized for all her classes. She is knowledgeable as well as clear in explaining and slides. Her assignments are challenging but interesting. I learned a lot form her class and became more interested in Artificial Intelligence.
excellent class, well planned. Lectures presented concepts and the labs required us to implement the concepts. Very Easy professor to approach and very helpful.
Difficult to communicate with. Does not seem to be able to understand a "weighted average".

Terrible - Always skips essential material in slides, lectures are theory based, and homeworks require all sorts of equations and little tidbits that are not available from her lectures. This would be impossible without the notes of other classes (5520, 5500)

Tough grader, HW is hard. Textbook is not much better. Good luck if you choose this fate.
Lectures are terrible, skips steps, theory. reads powerpoint slides. Often forgets to upload homeworks. Solutions have typos, shallow with help when emailing for help.
Terrible lecturer. Shallow in her knowledge, and very arrogant.

Jeb is nice & enthusiastic about the topic, but his pre-recorded online lectures are not very helpful, they just glaze over the important topics. Maybe that's enough for this class, b/c it only entailed discussion boards, 2 individual assignments and a group assignment. A fair grader, but the assignment and rubrics were not clear. Pretty easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Had him D22 and I found this class to be a joke. Quizzes are easy if you have the online textbook. Group work is minimal and easy. And as long as you're an okay writer you should be fine with his two essays, which also don't take that long but the grading on the midterm did take a bit I remember. Probably the easiest class that I have taken at WPI.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Good class, but don't be fooled. Midterm/final papers make up 60% of the grade, and class average was 80%. Online quizzes and group video questions were fair. Show up and put in the effort and you should do well. Many people think this class is an easy A, but most ended up with a B.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The extra credit quizzes he gives don't actually count for extra credit and in hindsight were a waste of time. I ended the term with an 89 and emailed my way into an A. The 8 am online lectures were skippable. Most of his quiz questions can be ctrl-F'd using the textbook.

I took a few classes from him. Introduction to Cryptography and Advanced Cryptography. He keeps the courses up to date with new content and assignments. He makes sure you get the fundamentals and give opportunity for extra points with optional assignments and reading materials.

Took Crypto with him. Homeworks and material are not bad and easy to do if you go to lecture, but his final exam is 50% of your grade. In b18, this final exam had questions that he did not cover and he used such large numbers that calculators could not compute, so you had to do it by hand. The whole class bombed the exam and he could not care less.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Koksal Mus is quiet, but knowledgeable. If you go to class, you will pass. Also he got anchor arms.
The professor talks pretty quietly. The class moves very slowly, he spends a lot of time on examples, sometimes entire classes just on one or two. Easy to pass but make sure your phone is charged
Hard to understand during lectures, but he's better at explaining than the book. His grading is super fair, so it's not hard to do well. No exams, just weekly quizzes.

This professor is super nice, had a little trouble teaching so most of the stuff I did have to teach myself. I think he could definitely improve in the future but I did well on the tests! He's just a nice guy (probs one of the nicest teachers I know)

He just isn't a good teacher. Lectures were not helpful. I just read the book, it explained concepts much better. 3 exams that only counted for 20% of the grade. The only homework was 17 Mastering Physics assignments (with effort is an easy 90% average) and was worth 50% of the grade. Easily got 99 because of the way the course was weighted.

He does a fine job of explaining his math but a terrible job of explaining concepts and why he's doing what he's doing and how to apply it. This screws you over later because you don't understand how to derive your equations. I went to his (extremely short) office hours asking him how to do a problem and he wouldn't answer my question. Avoid.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You try to ask a question, he makes you feel stupid. He'll constantly complain that students aren't prepared when he doesn't give clear directions on what to do. He try to act friendly during labs, as if he's trying to hide his true nature, but it always comes out.. Left the lab session on the verge of tears after he chewed me out for nothing.
Great guy, great professor

This material is super difficult conceptually, and the prof doesn't like to answer questions. Instead, he'll ask you questions in return, then make you feel stupid when you don't know what's going on.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Mavor tends not to explain much information at all and simply expects students to intuitively understand the material. Chem labs are also worth less than 15% of the final grade meaning there's a lot of work for very little return. This allows you to really slack off on labs without really facing any consequences.

Dr. Traver cares about teaching well. He makes class interesting, and just wants his students to be engaged. He doesn't want his students to be doing busywork. I have taken the same class with another professor and Dr. Traver's class is a million times better.

Dr. Traver was so much fun, highly recommend! His class was not at all hard, and more than wanting his students to do well on tests, he wants us to understand the material. If you care about the subject (and talk during class) he will like you, and you will do well.

Doctor Traver is the best Professor I've had the chance to work with at WPI. He is very passionate about what he does and has an incredible ability to inspire those around him. He has given incredible feedback that challenges you but helps you understand the project more. He does not hand out an easy grade but if you pay attention enough it's perf

Professor Traver is by far the best professor I have had at WPI. I think social science is completely boring, and I fall asleep in all of my classes, but Traver somehow managed to always keep my attention, and despite the class being two hours at 6PM, I only fell asleep once in the whole term.   His feedback is clear and helpful!

Brett's a great professor who gave a great intro to Business for non business majors. The off-site visits were very interesting and the speakers were engaging. Very light workload which he intented for to have students not stress about the class. Although I feel like it turned into a class for networking at times rather than about business topics

Brent is a wonderful teacher. I could not asked for a better introduction to a business course than from him. It was practical, useful, and I wanted to be there. It's often rare for me to be able to keep motivated and focused, that was not the case here.

I thought the class was pretty interesting. It wasn't about teaching us how to be leaders, but more of trying to determine what kind of leader we can be; which in my opinion, is more useful. I thought the paper was great and even though the class is probably an easy A, I still thought it useful and at least a nice class to go to during a busy term!

leadership is really a boring course. This professor is much more boring than this course itself. You cannot learn how to be a leader here. The only thing you can learn is how to write paper!!  Tremendous reading materials!!

He's a pretty good proff. he is a bit unorganized but he knows what he's talking about. He grades pretty easily. A hint for studying is to do the practice exams he puts up and to practice the problems he does in class. Usually what he puts on the tests closely aligns with those two things- also read the study guides carefully-
Professor was ill prepared to teach. Hard to understand and is unclear. Entire class failed the mid-term. Will probably fail the final.

Teacher's accent is strong and has sloppy notes. He knows what he is talking about, but isn't clear at all presenting them to the students. Good guy, but I don't recommend him for Calc..I learned more from the 1 hour sessions with the R.A.
No Comments

Quizzes aren't too bad (average of two scores if you don't like your first score). Lab assignments take a maximum of 20 minutes outside of class as long as you keep up with the class. Grading in the class is fairly lenient. Professor makes an effort to be perceptive to student feedback. Class isn't too challenging, but it is still taught very well!

He's one of the best professors I've ever had! He really made an effort to help his students - every week, he'd show up to the lab in-person and converse one-on-one with me to see how I was doing on the labs and projects. He also takes student feedback very seriously, and is a very lenient grader! Quizzes were entirely take-home and no homework!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Afzal dresses better than any other professor at WPI. BME 1004 prepared me for all Matlab use cases and he is an outstanding speaker and grader. Overall good guy and jokester. 10/10

Firstly, this professor has insane drip of the likes I've never seen. This course provided me with a superior knowledge of MATLAB coding, as the information was presented efficiently and effectively. This course did not have any tests and was only graded through homework and in-class assignment which were given ample time to complete.
Absolutely Jerk! Be aware!

Class material was taught well and covered a variety of subtopics. Dempski is a very easy going professor, but understands when life happens and you need a short extension. 10/10 would recommend. Grade is based one a paper presentation, one exam (midterm), mock "grant proposal" and participation.

Prof. Dempski is a fun guy. He teaches in a historical/narrative style which is nice but can make exams difficult. Each exam he asked at least one historical question about biochem which was worth half a letter grade-not valuable to material to be testing in my opinion. Also, he assigned a group project which was essentially useless for learning.

He is not typically respectful to students or his TAs. He is lazy and does not care about the class and tends to refuse to answer questions about lab or lab reports. If he does answer questions, they are typically in a sarcastic tone as to imply that you should already know the answer.
awful. no feedback. unclear lectures.

Learned a lot more from the textbook and online than I did during lectures. The main issue for me wasn't that the lectures didn't make sense, but instead how dull they were and how quickly I'd lose focus. Tests are very difficult, and homeworks can take a long time to complete.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The worst thing about this course/professor is that I feel like I learned nothing, but still got an A.   Super boring lecturer, and lectures only address theoretical / calculations portion of the course. Homework will give you all the real problems that you basically have to solve for yourself.

Reading textbook was significantly, if not completely, more helpful than his lectures, did all of my learning from the book and online resources. Poor explanation of material in lecture, poor at making the concepts more understandable. If you ask for help and express interest he will help you though, all exams were take home.

OH.MY. GOD. Avoid like the plague. Just terrible. Can't speak, doesn't work his examples out ahead of time so not only are they sometimes wrong, but he has to waste time computing the answer. TAs don't speak English either, so kids who don't already know some statistics are completely doomed in this course. Also, asked the class for a good review!

Just awful awful. One of the worst professors I have EVER had. Thick language barrier, assigns HW on material that hasn't been covered, never references the text, repeats himself over and over without ever actually saying anything,  doesn't even work his examples out of completion because he can't without a computer program to do it for him! AVOID!
Very easy professor. Test examples taken directly from class. Tries hard, just a tough language barrier. Not as bad as everyone else says...
Cannot explain anything well. He repeats himself a lot without ever being clear.

Weiwei is a fantastic professor. She's always there to help students when they need additional help - just sign up for office hours. It's easy to understand everything as long as you do the (small amount of) homework. All of the quizzes are based directly off of the homework, so if you can understand that, you'll do fine in her course.

Weiwei is a great professor.  She explains topics clearly in class and will take the time needed on difficult topics.  She is very friendly and accessible with her office hours. Just send her an email and she will make time for you. Her quizes are the easiest but if you did the homework and look at your notes most questions are from there.

I love weiwei. She is genuinely nice and loves when students come to her office hours.  If you try and do the homework assigned you will most likely get an A. Some of her quizes can be hard but she will scale or do a make-up if the entire class does poorly.

She does have a Chinese  accent.  However, she is genuinely interested in helping students, and knows the material very well.  The textbook she assigned is ancient, though, and she takes class attendance a little bit too personally.

Great teacher. Uses notes, not a textbook. He is funny and easy to follow. Do the work, you will get an A. If you need help, SEE HIM! He will help you understand. Fair grading as well. All around a great guy and teacher.
He is such a good teacher. His teaching is easy to follow. His note makes hard material easier.
He is a good prof. His note is brief and useful. He makes Stat fun and interesting.

It was his first year @ WPI teaching stats for my class. His lectures are a lot of explanations and some examples here and there. Towards the end the material got a little more confusing, but not too bad. Nice guy, tries to be funny once in a while.
Great proffessor. He explains the topics very well and the class and homeworks were actually really fun and I learned a ton compared to most ECE classes. Got an A.
Best professor ever. Explains everything clearly. very HOT too?actually the hottest.
He is an awesome Professor. One of the best ones on the ECE department.
Really easy grader, lets you use a cheat sheet on every quiz. It's easy to get an A, but you do learn a lot. He explains things really clearly and is pretty funny- highly recommend!

Had him online for ECE2010 due to COVID. Lectures were hard to sit through because he rambles on, doesn't have a clear schedule, and overexplains. His HW and exams are all hand-written *ew*, but luckily his notes are typed and pretty solid. Exams were not too difficult, very similar to HW. Gave lots of examples in notes. Overall, class was just ok.

He clearly knows ECE, but he doesn't really teach it. I can't remember a lecture we actually covered something on the test. Usually he just talked about "cool" circuits and told anecdotes about various electrical engineering things. I learned everything outside of class, most of it was covered in Physics E&M.

This class was the easiest A I have ever received andI never went to class. We have about 2 homework's per every two weeks and four exams, but you get a full sheet of notes to use for the test. He puts all of his notes online. The only thing that sucked about this class was the labs. I would highly recommend him as a professor.

He literally just rambles for the whole lecture, does not actually teach you anything. I had a friend take it with a different professor and we were learning nowhere near anything they learned.  You can never show up except to turn in homework and take exams and pass.  Labs were difficult if you haven't done ECE before.

The worst professor and worst teaching style I have ever had in my life. WPI should design a modeling class for non IMGD students, He teaches this class as an IMGD class instead of an art class. I barely learned anything useful from this class. He claims the purpose is to make students suffer, he barely teaches, only speed tutorials without steps.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I'd recommend Farley's classes to anyone interested in 3D with the ability to take them. His lectures and classes are highly informative, but also legitimately fun to attend. He isn't afraid to critique students' work in an honest way, which can be a bit unusual among art teachers, but he does it in a way that provides a lot of helpful information.

Funny guy, treats his students well, and I learned a lot from the class. You do have to do a lot of work, the course took about 16 hours outside of class per week, but he tells you this the first day. Taking two more classes with him next year since I learned so much.

Farley is a great guy--cares for his students and super funny. HE EXPECTS YOU TO WORK FOR IT. He made me a better modeler and is very good at what he does. The biggest issues I had was class organization and grading criteria. Grading was basically just how he felt about it. Syllabus was meaningless. Take if you're flexible & willing to put in time.

I took this alongside ID2050 and a MA 4000+ class, so things were rather strenuous for me, but still manageable! She had a group project (final presentation and final paper), final exam, and both weekly readings and short essays that you had to do. Participation was also paramount too, but her lectures were superb and her comments were great too!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Lessing displays a clear appreciation and care for her students. She is very aware and understanding of mental health. Participation and attendance matter, but as long as you go to class and do the work, you should get an A.

Prof Lessing genuinely cares about not only her students doing well in class, but also their well-being and mental health. I liked that she encouraged students to be creative and use their voice in their writing. She set up her class with the fact that most of her students are STEM majors in mind, so it was a nice break while also being engaging.

The course was engaging + she teaches very well, but what stood out to me about Prof. Lessing is her genuine care for our mental health. After a suicide on campus, we had a class discussion about the school's response to the post-COVID mental health crisis that genuinely helped me process the stressful experience of being a college student in 2021.

The professor is extremely insightful and knows absolutely everything you could possibly ever want to know, but it was absolutely apparent that this course came bottom-priority to them. Provided class notes, homework solutions, and quiz solutions were often prone with errors or only half-updated from the previous year's iterations.

Super friendly and nice. He really wants you to learn the content to do well on the FE exam. His lectures were engaging in my opinion. He had weekly quizzes instead of cumulative exams, which were mostly reasonable and he gave plenty of partial credit.

I really enjoyed this class, the material itself was difficult to understand at times, but the professor was always available and extremely helpful. If you take this class I recommend you take full advantage of his office hours or send him an email for help. I have always found this professor to be kind, respectful, and considerate of students.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Loves to hear himself talk. Really frustrating when you need to ask specific questions in office hours and have limited time. Throws a lot of work at you, with only partially helpful powerpoint slides. Said a few things that made me believe he shouldn't be teaching. Not the fun guy at dinner parties.

The class switches from between learning about grammar and culture. It is pretty easy but participation was difficult because rest of class didn't want to. Was not clear with HW due dates and the HW was time consuming but easy. Funny and approachable. He wrote an entire page of feedback for my writing project.

If you do all of the hw of which you can easily get all 100s on it's impossible to get below a B. If you have an average of 80 on the exams you can get an A. He's also really understanding and super nice. But attendance is mandatory unless you have a an excuse and you send it beforehand.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: A phenomenal professor! He will grant extensions and excuses you if you have to miss class. He also gives you very detailed feedback on grammar because he really wants you to learn the language, while being a very lenient grader! Tells fascinating stories and funny jokes! If you really want to learn the Spanish language in-detail, take his class!

Only take this class if you have a specific reason and a true passion to learn Spanish. If you need a class to do your breadth and find Spanish interesting, you are better off doing another class. Had 4 tests, 5 quizzes, a composition, and lots of readings and homework. An absurd amount of work and stress for humanity. Nice but extremely strict
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Smith provided clear lecture content that while attempting to engage students. While it could sometimes feel a little dry he has a clear love for the content. He does not record lectures though so you actually have to go to class. His grading was based off daily quizzes about content from that days class and a midterm and final exam.

Prof Smith's lectures were really good. He taught by writing everything on the whiteboard and did not use Echo360 so attendance is mandatory. He gave a group quiz at the end of every lecture which was easy if you paid attention. There was a midterm and final. Definitely go to office hours if you have trouble understanding the content.

He is kind of boring but the class is simple. He does care about you as a student though. The daily group quizzes is on the thing he lectures right before the quiz so it's not hard plus you're in a group. He covers book material well during lectures and tells you what to know so you don't really need to read the book. He relies too much on the book
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: No assigned homework but some details on quizzes came from the textbook that weren't discussed in lecture. There was a group quiz at the end of each class, but the material was covered in lectures in the beginning of that same class. Overall taught pretty well and fairly simple intro class.

Took Cell Engineering Lab with her. There was a midterm and a final, both take home. There were three lab reports with the expectations clearly laid out. This class did require a time commitment, but was very interesting and she is very helpful!

Jain is clear in her expectations and objectives for the course. Her teaching style is mainly based off of powerpoints that are fairly bare but she explains them in class - be prepared to take notes on what she is saying, not what's on the screen (you can find those online). Exams are easy if you pay attention, do the homework, and skim the book.
Although this isn't a class she truly teaches, I still thought she came off condescending throughout the course. I liked Mendelson way better when he did Seminar last year.
This is a good class for undecided majors.

Always ended class early. Funny/nice guy will give pop quizzes when attendance is low, never skip the class following a test!! Sometimes he can be very brief when it comes to his explanations of a topic, the TA office hours really helped I recommend you go to them! Do the homework and understand it to prepare for tests!!! Over all not a bad class(:

What an awesome professor! His lectures can be a bit boring sometimes but he's a hilariousadorable guy overall, His pop quizzes are very easy and he will usually only do them when there's low attendance. He has a bit of an accent but his lecture notes are very clear and he's good at answering any questions a student may have.
Yeesock is the man. He loves being corrected, his smile is classic. I am going to make my first sons middle name yeesock after this guy.
He is ok. the class is clear but extremely boring.
I asked nearly everyone in class. Everyone wished they didn't have this professor.
Worst professor in the ECE department.  Has completely lost it.  Is fairly easy though.

A low key, down to earth, intelligent, albeit drifty at times, professor. If you take the time to talk him and ask questions, you get a lot of insight into the material. He has a lot of experience in industry. If you can do the homework without help, the tests are easy. A moderate workload overall, but in the end, a lot learned.
No Comments

I had this professor at Assumption not WPI but anyway she is a nice and funny lady, and a decent teacher. She is sometimes hard to understand because of how quickly she speaks Spanish but just pay close attention to what she is saying and you will understand. Some of her group and cultural assignments can be annoying, but they are tolerable.

For Topics in Latino Culture: Has you do lots of readings and goes over important details in lecture. She speaks Spanish quickly but very clearly so easy to understand. Really nice lady who shows you the most interesting parts of each culture. Tests/quizzes were good measures of material covered. Presentations went into depth on other cool things.

Mrs. Warren is a funny, nice, and pleasant person! I had her for Intermediate Span. I. The class was generally easy; not a lot of work involved. Tests are fair, but challenging, and cover all material . She speaks in both Spanish and English to clarify her lectures. She provides personal stories during the lectures; good class, pretty interesting.

I had Warren for Advanced SP I, and I'm pretty happy with it. I received an A, which is nice, but I didn't feel the class was sufficiently challenging. I didn't learn much, and wish I had. That said, she's sweet, helpful, and very enthusiastic about teaching. Sprinkles stories about her life, travels, etc. into lecture- very interesting!
She was brand new when I took her class, but it was a nightmare. Learned very little.

Professor Yang is accessible outside of class and flexible. She can't lecture at all though, just reads derivations off the powerpoint slide, and she changes variables around. The group presentation at the end was just a big grade booster, but interesting enough. Tests were hard, homework harder. She's a very new professor, and it shows.

She was brand new when I took her class. She learned throughout the course of the term. I think she will figure teaching out after a few more terms. She is very helpful in office hours and she loves talking. Great personality.
Brand new prof. Didn't learn anything. Steer clear.
NO FIELD TRIP :( ...... hes a chiller tho
Assignments and exams were a little difficult, but all the information was covered in lecture and were easily found in the slides. Grades very fairly and wants everyone to understand

Took Geology with Carrick, felt like I didn't learn anything in this class, who uses geology, it was required. The tests were really easy. The homework messed up my grade missed one homework assignment. Cares about climate change and how it will affect the earth, isn't a big rock guy. I emailed him once and asked for help responded with help.

Professor Eggleston was definitely a surprise for this class. I was expecting an easy class, "rocks for jocks", and what I got was a real college geology class. It was difficult, but the professor made it interesting. We took more of an approach on climate change and the earth system. Be prepared to work, but wonderful professor and cares about us.

Seminar: A lot of reading outside of sources you find for your paper. Gives very blunt peer editing, is very direct with what he likes and dislikes. Can be a little intimidating. If you're a good writer and go "above and beyond" it is possible to get an A. If you 'only' do everything asked of you, you get a B. Challenging, but possible. Good luck.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Best humanities teacher I have ever had. Absolute great guy. I've taken two of his classes, both the same format (work-wise), and the weekly work load is very light. No quizzes or exams. Primarily writing assignments and then one final group project that you have to present at the end of the term.
Very passionate professor. Listens to other people and respects their opinions. And gives the students a turn on writing about what is most passionate to them.

Always willing to listen to opposing viewpoints and judges them based on a neutral stance. You shouldn't put off readings until the last day though; they can be pretty long if you are a procrastinator. As long as you come with an open mind and do the work, you'll do fine in this class. This class will really make you think about current problems.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Graded assignments are hard, many mistakes in quizzes (have 24 hours to take it on Canvas). 3 graded discussions, 3 quizzes (quizzes 1 and 2 have 2 attempts, quiz 3 has one attempt but is not bad compared to other quizzes). Project presentation on anything related to human bio (you will not present it) (gives the guidelines for each slide)

OK professor who made lots of mistakes and had gaps in her knowledge but her class is one of the easiest things I've ever taken. The quizzes were online and super easy (there's 3 of them) as well as 3 discussions and 1 project presentation on a topic of your choice. Not a lot of opportunity for credit but how easy it is makes up for it. Take notes.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures did have a lot of typos and some tests had problems with the right answers being wrong, but that was fixed and might be because of the online format. Overall Loved the professor, she was very nice and the material was interesting. 4 short essays and 4 quizzes is what the entire graded is made of so make sure you do all of them.

She seems knowledgable about the topic (human bio) but makes so many typos and grammar mistakes in her lecture powerpoints and quizzes that it is hard to understand. Sometimes makes false claims about current events. Grades are mostly determined by quizzes which again have many mistakes in the questions or answers.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: Fiber Optic Sensors (ME5225) is an objectively hard course but I'd say he made it bearable. He's always smiling and invested in what he's teaching. Only graded on weekly homeworks (hard) and a group project that isn't introduced until after the midterm (open note). But, he's very accessible, honest, and wants to make sure students understand him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: For Stress Analysis ES2502. He's generally a good lecturer if you can pay attention, but will often waste time in class with pointless facts from the syllabus (~10min a class). Tests aren't too difficult, but they're 80% of your grade. A lot of homework with harsh deadlines. But he really wants to make sure you understand the material strongly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Very clear, Very helpful Worthy to take his course. Btw, it's an important course for design concentration,you gonna understand its content clearly

Expects way too much of the student. When my group was put together, we literaly had less than five days to work on our project and put together a presentation. Lectures are dense, and he does not give enough time to explain everything. He is not clear on how students are expected to complete problems. He is a very strict grader, so class is a pain

She: makes the whole class pronounce every French word in an accent just because she is fluent in French; spends more time reminding students to check the syllabus for their questions than it would take to answer them; constantly refers to "scholars" like herself as the only people who's opinions matter. STAY AWAY from this arrogant professor.
Too damn hard for a tech school!

She does not understand that it is a history class at a tech school and expects way too much out of her students. There is 40 pages of reading a night and clicker quizzes (not multiple choice) every day. She gives no edits on exams and just gives a grade with no justification. I highly recommend not taking this class.

This class has been the hardest I've ever taken here at WPI. I've had to work the hardest I have ever in this class just to aim for a B, although I'm pretty sure that I will be getting a C. Her clicker quizzes are short answers, not multiple choice and are worth a large percentage of your grade.Nice lady, very hard teacher. Avoid its not worth it.

This dude is awesome, advised DC and Worcester and has nothing but praise. Most caring professor I've worked with, isn't very difficult at all, and also has an insane life story. Also balls all the time at the gym
Scott is the most dedicated IQP advisor ever. He loves his work, is pretty chill and can mediate a meeting in an informal settlement like a boss.
Probably one of the worst professors I have encountered at WPI.  He advised my IQP abroad in PR, and his unprofessionalism with sponsors and TOTAL lack of clarity contributed greatly to this rating.
No Comments

She teaches at UB now and I must say she is the best teacher in its real sense who has taught me yet. She is just amazing, passionate, meticulous and very approachable. Makes the subject simple and interesting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is an excellent professor. She is very nice to students and her notes are helpful to learn the material. Tests don't have any "curveball" questions, so if you study her notes, you shouldn't have any problems. She is very friendly and I think most students wished she would teach more classes!
she a great teacher who cares about the students. her classes are not boring.

One of the best professors at WPI, very structured and organized lectures with good examples. Attendance isn't taken except on Fridays but if you miss a class you will eventually regret it. Tests were pretty straight forward, but were generally too long...ended up getting scaled anyway. Very passionate and knowledgeable about what she teaches.

I had him for lab and it was impossible to get an A. Luckily lab was a small portion of the grade. Conference was also useless but mandatory. He was no help when it came to experiments and was more concerned with glove use. We did not know what to do and he gave poor feedback so we could not improve our papers.
Worst teacher i've ever had.

He explained none of purpose of the course, criterial for the writing materials, or requirement for lab notebook at the beginning gives very low grades for every assignments. Horton and the TA provide negligible help. If you get nearly 100% in all lecture exam and write every pre-lab and lab reports as good as you can, you may get low A or high B.

Chem lab is not even a course youll get a full credit for, its linked to your lecture, so youd think youd get an easy supplemental grade. Wrong. He grades pre labs and post labs like they are way more serious than they are. The work load in chem lab is unreal. Avoid Horton- he never helps if you have questions and leaves rude comments on labs.

Prof. Badmos's lectures are very straight forward. His lectures are mostly based on the book, so I highly recommend getting it. The problems are usual, just take good notes and you'll get it. Always available during office hours, helps very well. As long as you study and put good notes on your cheat sheets, you'll pass.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Great teacher very straight forward, follow his class and you will do well on hw exams and quizzes. Go to class and make yourself known, he really likes students who try and are engaged. you will get an A if you apply yourself

Yes, lectures could be tedious but material was not very difficult. First half covered concepts already seen in any physics class. Nightly homework, but generally very easy to do. Visited him a few times for office hours and was very kind and helpful. As mentioned, sometimes he was wrong during lecture, but he did correct himself when pointed out.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Not the worst ever, but the worst Ive had. I had him for an 8am, and two things mainly stood out about his teaching method. 1. He didnt seem to review the slides beforehand. This is shown by him only reading off slides, and basically only what they said. 2. He cant admit he is wrong. This makes it hard, as we mostly do in class problems.
