rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Brisson is amazing. She cares about her students in and out of the classroom. She works hard preparing class material so each lesson will be enjoying. She knows different students weakness in German and would help you on it.
This was the only live course I had during quarantine. Brisson made it really enjoyable. You can tell she cares alot about her students.
I've learned more in two terms then in four years of high school language. Hard not to get an A if you do the work. Brisson speaks slowly and clearly.
Classes were boring and the exams were not so easy. couldn't understand her most of the time in classes. Btw it is mandatory to buy a $100+ textbook in order to do homework.
Great guy, was much tougher in past classes but has become a pretty chill person and is a great professor

Pretty good lectures, only problem I had is the lack of in class examples and walk throughs. Spends majority of time just deriving equations but the application of them is left up to you to figure out. Easy to access after class use office hours.

Professor Taillefer is extremely smart, however he has a lot of difficulty in explaining tough concepts and it doesn't help with the very few examples he gives. Homework is time consuming and graded far more harshly than I've seen in the past. His lectures are often confusing and run overtime each time. I would not recommend taking him if possible.

Honestly the best professor I've had at WPI. He's extremely understanding/flexible, one of the few profs that genuinely listens to feedback and applies it. His lectures go at a good pace, and he's easily accessible. He's also patient and kind when you need help understanding a concept and doesn't talk down to you as other professors may

Great professor. Teaches straightforwardly from the textbook. If you have trouble with homework, he is very helpful, and responds to emails at surprisingly late hours. Exams are only 30% of the grade, and he allows you to bring notes. He clearly wants his to students succeed, and if you put in the work, there's a good chance you will.

Standard. Taught off the textbook. Direct teaching, with concept --> examples --> questions, etc. It was effective but not very interesting. Exams were only 30% and were very lenient. Allowed notes on exams, which was great. Eager to answer questions and help outside of class if needed.

The worst part of this class were the labs on Rstudio. I had no coding experience and struggled, but my PLA was super nice and patient so she helped me. I got 100s on everything, the exams were easy - he posted six questions, you had to do three during the week. Homeworks were straightforward on webwork, never too heavy. He was organized and clear.

He says he assumes no coding experience for his RStudio, but I'm a CS major and his coding was hard to follow (even for the TA and PLA). Friendly and welcoming during office hours but also short tempered. Drops a lot of scores from the final grade calculations so most people end up getting an A. The guy clearly knows and tries to be funny(he's not)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class consumes time, since it is a group project about making a business. I had a laborious time in the class, yet, I learned a lot, maybe even more than I thought I would. Just be mindful it is best to do things as quickly as possible, some assignments may take longer than expected to complete

While many people doesn't like his teaching style. I'm okay with the more sandbox approach he utilized for the business-oriented class, and I think he had a great personality and constantly trying to adapt to students as time goes on.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: A lot of confusing assignments with unclear expectations of the assignment. He did not know how to help us when we looked for help. High pressure presentations with strict grading without any reasonable explanations. Grading seemed to be all on opinion and gave feedback way too late which made assignments difficult to do.

Don't take this class unless you are a business major who has genuine interest in becoming an entrepreneur. If you are taking this class as a fun little 1000 level elective or as a major requirement, DON'T. This has the difficulty, expectations, and workload of a 3000-4000 level course. I cried multiple times.

The work and knowledge expected in this class was far beyond an introductory level. Lectures planned were too long for class time. He did not seem to understand how technology worked. Feedback would often come weeks later. His grading was unnecessarily harsh, and explanations were confusing. Brought adults in to give feedback who swore at students.
Incredibly bad at explaining concepts and spends all of class on theory. He had to drop both the midterm and final from everyone's grades because nobody could understand his questions.

Indeed, a new professor to WPI and there is plenty of time for him to improve. Avoid this professor definitely, unless you already understand the concepts of this course. Lectures are repetitive for weeks on end, does not provide explanations to questions and WILL NOT provide assistance on homework so grades will suffer. Discussion is essential.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures are a bunch of unnecesary theory, and doesn't spend time in doing examples, I feel like I learnt nothing from him. You have to teach yourself for this class. I understand that he's new, but professors like this shouldn't be giving classes in a fast paced universities like this one. His notes are completely uncomprehensible. Avoid him.

He's brand new to WPI as of D24, so there's lots of time for improvement. We only had three quizzes and three hw assignments. It was lecture-heavy and he spent a lot of time on the concepts and little time on examples. I would recommend getting a good discussion time because that's where you'll learn examples and take quizzes.
Amazing Professor. So understanding and willing to work with her students and truly cares
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Difficult IQP experience
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--So many papers

comment: I LOVE this professor. CE3070 is an 8AM and you MUST go to every class, but I wouldn't miss it for the world. I'm going to take every class with her for the rest of my college career. She has lots of practical knowledge that she links into the class and she really knows her stuff! It's reading intensive, but the writing is split up and manageable.

Professional and friendly. She has a genuine interest in helping students not only achieve their goals, but to do so by their own hard work. Since she worked in the field for many years, she really knows her stuff.

Best Professor ever had in wpi. Happy class. Full of care to his student. He will ask you how do you feel. Pays for donuts and coffee on classy. Talks about his  experience with famous chemistry as a fun fact. Seeing him off the class, seeing him off the building. Waved goodbye, but he never came back.

never came to class. had the TA do all of the work. did not learn anything at all from this class. when asked a question about a lab we were doing and what calculations had to be handed in he didnt know how to respond.
he is really helpful and really cares about making sure that everyone knows the material.  he is very approachable.
Really smart, and always bringing innovation and new information to class. Really dedicated to his job
Knows what he's doing. The class is very well-organized. However, he shouldn't be teaching freshman. His style is much more suited for experienced students.
No Comments

Awful professor for E&M. Could not control a classroom and it felt like a high school class (thought that was partially my fault). Makes lots of simple algebraic mistakes and has horrible handwriting.

During lectures and conferences, he kept saying "right guys?" and "right?". That almost implies that he isn't confident with his knowledge of the course. The averages of the tests being around 12/20 to 13/20 also show that what it's a problem in the professor that the class would generally do poorly on the tests. Don't ever take his classes.

Course started out good, and challenging. Then as the material become more difficult he made excessive mistakes. When corrected by a student, he didn't go back through the problem fixing his mistake, however large it may be. Leaving the entire class with incorrect notes. Also does not show up to his own office hours with no prior notice.

Took fluid power lab as a senior lab. I would rank Jim as one of the best professors in the ME department. Explains the concepts very clearly and appreciates questions. He goes the extra mile by bringing in guest lecturers and even helping with projects outside of his class. The U better not let this guy go. Whatever he teaches, take his class.
He ended up making A cut off line for 91 even though his class seems easy, he cut off line is determined by percentage so even if you do overall well, if all of your class do well, then you're doomed
Excellent teacher. Gave great one on one help and is always willing to meet with you. The homeworks and quizzes were easy enough, making the projects not too overwhelming.

He seemed nervous whenever he would lecture. He seems like an interesting guy who has a lot of world knowledge and information on the subject, but he basically taught from the book. Hard to study for because he was vague about what would be on the test. Class is very opinionated and debate heavy, and the there's a final paper as well as an exam
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Lectures consist of him reading off of lengthy slides (kinda monotone) and Poll Everywhere. Participation and attendance impact your grade significantly. Final paper is easy, midterm and final are average difficulty. Lots of class discussion. If you don't usually talk in class, this is a good place to learn to share your thoughts without judgement.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class is interesting and pretty much an open discussion environment. He asks you to read, but I never read anything and just studied off of his notes. Midterm was easy, but someone complained and he made the final pretty hard. Chill guy and eye-opening class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Definitely tough at 8AM, but go to as many lectures as you can since they're interesting. Go to conferences, and don't be afraid to go ask for help

Capogna teaches linear algebra, which is easy but weird conceptually. He is engaging in class and you won't get bored. The exams are pretty easy although homework questions can be pretty difficult (you get unlimited attempts though). There are surprise pop-up quizzes that are just for extra credit. He's a nice guy who answers all questions!

Prof. Capogna is brilliant and teaches an excellent course, but will probably be intimidatingfrustrating for students who aren't serious about math. The course is very theoretical. He has a thick Italian accent that can be difficult to understand, sometimes.  Tests are super easy if you do the homework and figure out what you did wrong.

Shes really passionate but her grading on the class is very stupid. She makes it seem as if getting an A is for the top 1% of the class. A lot of know the material but no matter how many 100s you get on quizzes she will drop your grade on essays. No one can get a 100 on essays and 70s are good for them. Shes way too hard for someone who dont care

Professor Elgert gives very in-depth and timely feedback for papers (which were how our grade was determined this term) and I felt myself growing and learning how to navigate content better with every essay. Would absolutely take again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Laureen is truly a special professor. Her lectures were in depth, thoughtful, and really made you think critically. Her entire course was structured for you to absorb, and then mold your own conclusions, something I really liked. I highly suggest taking a class with her!

Professor Lombardi is a great guy and human. He tells jokes the whole class, and his experience in law and the stories he has to tell are amazing. There are a couple of writing assignments and a take home exam, but overall it is just an useful and interesting class to take. He is there because he wants to there, which is very refreshing.

Professor Lombardi is awesome. One of my favorite professors. Very real, not doing this for the money, always in good spirits. Classes were fun, and if you try you'll pass. Recommended to friends, and all of you!

Lombardi was a wonderful guy who is very passionate about his teachings. He does solely rely on students answering questions in class and calls on anyone and everyone so be prepared to talk. Over the class has valuable information.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Absolutely, positively, unbelievably, outstanding. Challenging class, but it doesn't feel it because you're genuinely excited to do the work. I'm a grad and have been using Chinese at my robotics job. If I ever visit WPI again I'll be bringing her a bottle of wine.

I absolutely love Professor Du! She is extremely well-spoken and understanding. In terms of lectures, my course CN357X was very fast-paced and required quite a bit of studying outside of class. However, her design of the course ensured that a lot of current world issues and information was incorporated into the content she distributed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Like other Chinese classes, participation & attendance are critical to success, and there are daily quizzes on vocab. All of the Chinese professors are eager to do anything they can to support your success, and Du Laoshi is no exception. She's charismatic and energetic, and always easy to get in contact with.

Fantastic teacher, spends time and effort making sure his lectures are effective. If you pay attention to his lectures, you will have no problem in:
1. getting an A on the homework assignments
2. developing a solid understanding of the Foundations of Robotics

I hope I get to take more classes by this Professor.
A Professor that spends the time to make sure you actually understand the foundations of robotics. Other than that he is very kind, understanding, and organized. He is awesome.

Great teacher if you want to learn about robotics. Very good lectures, and genuinely cares about teaching you the material, which is very rare if you ask me in academia. The homework is challenging and so is the project, but you learn a lot. If you are serious about robotics take the class.

He solved many Product of Exponential examples in class. Instead of showing proof of equations written in the book, he showed how to use those equations in real problems. His exams are hard. He doesn't repeat homework questions on the exam.
Homework does not cover the material that is necessary for the exam. Provides no feedback towards direct questions during exams. Unresponsive to email. Horrible experience
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Good professor. Has a bad reputation because his new :(

Rosendo is a very unfair grader, and his lectures simply aren't informative. The course I took with him required lab access, and the lab had few open hours, but he refused to give an extension and docked points heavily for late submissions. Also, the lab equipment was malfunctioning during our final project demo, and he docked points for that.

I loved creative writing with Prof. McIntyre. We read lots of short pieces and did in-class exercises, with only two essays for the class. Attendance was required and participation was recommended, but she never cold-called. Would absolutely take again.

Definately a caring professor and open to feedback. Mostly a discussion based class based on the readings, with a few essays as well. Always made sure to be accessible to students and their needs, having been flexible with deadlines at times and caring for students' mental health.

Professor McIntyre showed a clear love for creative writing and brought that passion to every class. Although she had us reading a ton, her grading was very laid-back and you only wrote two essays in total. Overall, I loved her structure of the class with workshops and revising your essay, and it made for a very useful but straightforward course.

She is nice and personable. Her lectures are intense, they average around 100 slides and she goes fast enough that even typing you can't get everything. The upside is most of it isn't terribly important as long as you get the gist of most of the topics. Attendance is mandatory but if you're lucky she might have candy.
Terrible teacher. Does not care about the students or their grades. Or the fact that its a elective that nobody has time to put 20+ hours into. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!

Never take this course my friends and I are all extremely frustrated with Schneider's lack of understanding, intense workload, and incompetence in the subject. There is virtually no way to get a good grade in this class unless you have no life and complete all of her extra credit assignments and put 20+ hours into studying for each of the 3 exams.

He is an amazing person. I wish I spoke to him more because it was an online class but god damn he is so good at holding a conversation with black screens. He deserves the absolute best and I hope WPI has offered him that.

My friends and I have started calling Professor Manzo 'The Man --- zo' because to put it simply, he is the man. His classes are entertaining, and the workloads are very fair. I never felt like I was doing any busywork, and I never wanted to miss a lecture because I might miss another Wayne's World reference.

He's a wicked nice guy. I took the computer and synthesizers in music class with him which was really fun. The class is an easy A; just show up and do the project and you're good to go. The class is 3 hours long which was really rough, but I think it went by fairly fast. He's an interesting character so if anything he'll help to keep you focused

It was his first year teaching when I had him. Really nice guy and always willing to help students. He was a bit disorganized in lectures probably due to his inexperience. Very passionate about the material and genuinely cares about his students.

Terrible teacher. Clearly told us tests werent going to get more difficult then the first one then completely ruined everyones grade with the third test. Went from a high A to a C. Didnt teach much of anything. Can't say i learned anything at all. Avoid his classes.
Overall the class was not structure as well as it should have been and because of that many students were unhappy about the final grading.

There are many projects to make up for only one midterm exam (no final). There was an end of the term project and homework though. The homeworks were case studies that required more thought than following examples. If you don't get it, go to her office hours and show her your work. She is VERY cautious about how much work she assigns. Great Proff!
Great Researcher

Great Professor, if you attend the lectures and do the HW its easy to get a good grade. very helpful with giving office hours and teaches well. exams are sometimes tricky but she is considerate if you make certain careless mistakes. would recommend to take classes with her. great great professor.

Xin lao shi (teacher Xin) is an amazing Chinese mentor. She makes the marathon of learning this totally foreign language a fun and inspirational experience. You will enjoy attending each class and all of your classmates, as Xin lao shi brings out the best in everyone.
Chinese is a hard language to learn, but Xin Xin makes it even more difficult due to the fact that she gives quizzes literally everyday. 1 day isn't nearly enough time to learn 10 new characters.

Want to learn Chinese? Xin Xin is the way to go! She knows it's a difficult language to grasp, so her teachings make it easy and fun. Attendance is crucial, both for your sake (2 absences  1 grade letter down, 4  failure) and for learning the material.  However, she is a master at teaching a whole language course in a quarter. You won't regret it

Rahman is an awesome professor. His lectures are really clear and he gives a lot of examples in class. I never used the textbook for information, but the textbook is needed for some homework problems. The labs are a bit boring. He also gives pop quizzes just to make sure you go to class. The exams are based on what is taught in class.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class was a pretty good time. He is very clear with his teaching and you can always go to lectures/ask questions in class if you're unsure of anything. He has random pop quizzes but they are super easy and basically to make sure that you come to class. There's homework every week and 4 tests a term.

Terrible grader: no partial credit, tests were average but near impossible to get a perfect score. Lots and lots and lots of homework. Labs were not fun. At least his teaching style is decent and organized with a lot of examples in lectures.  Helpful.

She is a very good Prof. Even though attending the class is not mandatory, you should still go to the class because she usually mentions what will be on the test and the test is not hard. Most of the questions of her exams are similar to workgroup problems.
Very nice, go to office hours

Few people care about their students as much as Prof. Rodriguez. She communicates clearly and is dedicated to helping students learn and understand. She had a baby during the course and was on maternity leave, but still made time to respond quickly to student emails and send out review materials to the class. Excellent professor.

Amazing guy and incredibly helpful professor. Probably my favorite professor at this school, in fact. More than willing to help you at any time, and a WIZARD artist. Humble personality despite the fact that he is magical. Best artist I've ever met in my life. I highly recommend this man's classes.  1010, would bang.

An amazing artist in his own right, is also a very good teacher. I came into his class terrified of painting and he helped me approach it in a laid-back and easy to absorb way. He's very easy to understand and understands the rules of creative critique very well. Also, he's probably a wizard.

He's fantastic. So many times I've done a terrible piece of art and he'll go "Lemme just get in here real quick" and make it beautiful. I'm pretty bad at art, but I definitely improved a lot. Very laid back.
I personally believe that Erika deserves a much higher grade on this site.  Of course if theatre isn't your thing, then this course might not be for you, but otherwise, you'll love working with her.

Interesting class and very hands on. She gives you free reign on the final project, with little to no direction. A lot of reading! I didn't read everything because we talked about it in class anyways. But she is helpful outside of class if you have questions.
Interesting class. Close to no lecture, you're usually hands-on and doing. Not the hardest class, but easy to get gipped in grading.
Will always go the extra mile to make sure students are comfortable. Great professor.

Professor Zhang has a unique character. He is very friendly and willing to help you anytime along the course. The exams are a good representation of the homework and class examples. The professor engages the students in the lecture. During exams he brought donuts and coffee for everyone. Never seen that before. Great individual.

I had prof. Zhang for the first class he had ever taught. Overall, great professor and an even better person. He was always available outside of class for questions or any sort of help! Very fair grader on homeworks and exams. The final project was difficult, but he provided much supporting material and provided feedback and help whenever needed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I liked Professor Stander's lectures. She is very open for criticism and wants to know how she can help you. Labs were kind of tough though. Professor Stander was always available outside of class and was very good at clarifying confusing parts of lecture. If you're willing to put in the work and seek extra help when needed, you'll do just fine.

Pro: live recorded lecture, practice test somewhat similar to real test, cheat sheet allowed Con: no answer key given for practice test, lectures are hard to read, do not expect to learn from her lecture, test are way too long for 50 minutes given Horrendous experience...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This professor give me the worst experience in WPI, The lecture notes during class is unreadable, and she post someone's notes after lecture which means the lecture is really useless. The average in second test is 48/100. She usually give us tons of homework every week. She looks kind but does not know how to teach at all. Waste of time!

The lectures were extremely boring and not useful at all. Treated this like a 2000 level cs class, and I hadn't coded before(there's no recommended background in coding courses). It is a nightmare if you don't already understand code, the homework is crazy long and difficult.

His class is very straightforward. As long as you look at that day's presentation, it'll take you some time to get but you'll get there. Always willing to answer questions during and after the lecture. If you pay attention and study, you'll do fine on his quiz and tests, the latter which he allows you to have a cheat sheet.

This was his first time teaching this class, but it was still pretty awful. The lectures were incredibly boring and it wasn't worth it to pay attention or even go because he covered material that didn't appear on the test or the programs assigned for homework. This was a MATLAB course yet he never opened MATLAB once during lecture. Avoid.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: If youre interested in combing Robot Control, game theory and AI, this is the go-to prof. She is very diligent, and expects prompt work from her students. She is always ready to help. The thing that makes her stand out from other profs is that she provides in-depth explanations for concepts and derives every important type of controller.

She feels like she understands the concepts behind the course well enough, but she is unable to teach it. Her assignments and lectures frequently do not cover material present on the Exams. Exams are graded harshly, and are designed in ways that prevent earning partial credit should even basic errors be preformed.

Professor Fu is an extraordinarily bright and kind. She is incredibly intelligent: she combines controls and AI into Formal Methods of Robotics, and is global leader in this domain. Her lab is also a great opportunity to gain hands on experience. My advice is, if Professor Fu gives you something to read, read it and ask many questions.

Great class with a great, caring professor. The programming assignments and term project are the bulk of the grade (which is determined through points, not percentages), which allows you to pick and choose what to focus on. Professor was very open to feedback and adjusted the amount of assignments through the term to keep the workload manageable.

Do not take, the worst teacher I have had in my 4 years at WPI. The assignments are way too hard and she doesn't give nearly enough time to finish them. Don't expect to get any help from her if you are lost or having trouble with the homework. She is also not accommodating so don't expect her to be flexible.

Yeah, this professor is awful. Firstly, there are 3 projects which will rip your soul to shreds. Secondly, the professor treated us like kindergarten students each class by asking what we learned in the beginning and giving out candy. Finally, the homeworks. The homeworks. 100 questions in one week. 0/10, dont do it learn on youtube
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment:
The GOAT, he is funny and knowledgeable. Recommended 100%.

One of the best in WPI.
I took machine learning course from Professor Lee a few years ago. He explain everything well, making lecture interesting and funny. Enjoy to take his lecture!
Best professor ever. Interesting and clear. He has his own sense of humor.

Marty is an excellent lecturer and has good energy, even for an 8 AM lecture. Unfortunately, I was just not really interested in the class, so I really struggled to connect with Marty. If you are interested in business, Marty is a great professor. If not, the class will feel like a drag.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: There is definitely a reading and writing heavy class. For only a twice a week two hour class, we have about 6 hours of reading a week for homework and two single page essays to write a week. Our final group project (for a twice a week class) had too much workload & unclear grading. The grade we got for each assignment essentially was a roulette.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Definitely on the harder side, but I really got a lot out of it. Participation is important, but not too bad if you speak once during most classes. The group projects are fun since you get to work with classmates, but you don't have to worry abt unfair grades because we do group member surveys. Def recommend if you're interested in this course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: Nice guy but grading is strict bc he picks out every little detail. The textbks can be taken for free online. Grades based on tests + group proj, but group proj is j a paper report that u can lie on. If u dont read the textbks youll still get an 80+ on test if u pay attention to lectures, which are examples + experiments he does for u

I guess he's an alright person, but a very strict grader for no reason. Takes off a bunch of points for small writing things and criticizes lots of little things on the homework assignments. I would have enjoyed the class if he wasn't so strict on grading, and sometimes his feedback can be very vague too
This Professor made our exams based solely on textbook/activity outside of class, while also requiring attendance in lecture.  Would not recommend taking.

I've taken 3 terms with her and she's been amazing every time, she genuinely cares about her students. The class is set up to have a weekly quiz, a few scattered projects that aren't usually too hard, and a few online homework a week (completion-based). Complaint most have is that the homework site is annoying. Stay on top of it and you'll be fine

She is very caring and will give feedback on all the written assignments. There is a quiz every week and she uses exposure as a teaching method, meaning she speaks in german for 95% of the time. The homework isn't difficult, they're just quick online things but it will pile on if you don't stay on top of it. Overall, she was a great professor!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Arslan is super caring. I've taken two classes with her and she really values students' feedback and implements it. Lots of homework, but it is short and simple. Attendance makes a significant part of the grade. No exams, just a couple of quizzes, very straightforward. All assignments have clear rubrics.

I thought Boris was a great professor. Lectures went pretty slow so you could uncerstand what he was teaching, and he did a lot of the math out. He gives you a practice exam before each exam, and theyre the exact same thing as the real exam. Then, the lecture before the exam is spent going over it in detail. Not too much homework either.

This class is the epitome of what a college class should be like: A fair work load, a need to learn outside of class, and a professor is ready to help you if you need it. To start with, the teaching style is him going through examples step by step. I loved this, others may not. Tests aren't too hard and practice tests help a LOT. Take his class.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: DO. NOT. DO. IT. Unless you're prepared to learn all of calc 4 on your own like I and the rest of my class did, do not take this professor. You have three exams worth 20%, 25%, and 25% of your final grade and another 8% will be taken by quizzes in conference. For the love of all things holy don't do this to yourself.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The worst class ever. I was interested in biology until I took this class. It is an entry level course but learned more specifics that friends learned in nursing school. Professor has very monotone voice and never had any expression. Do not take a class with him.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Not easy for a 1000 level course. Lectures every day and entire grade is based off of 3 tests and a research paper. Tests often include information not in lecture and are way too specific.

You look at the slides and take a test after a few weeks. That's about it but there is too much specific information especially for a 1000 level course. Overall it's a nothing class where you memorize redundant material and regurgitate the subject matter. If you're expecting a 1000 level course then prepared to be surprised.
Professor Agloro has a complete lack of respect for students. Seems more concerned with degrading students (both to their face and behind their backs) instead of actually teaching something useful.
really RUDE to some students in the class
not helpful, rude

Connectors and the passive voice were covered. Attendance is mandatory, but in understanding difficult circumstances, you need to inform him that you will not be able to attend class in person/at all. This term we only had to do 5, 1-hour tutoring sessions (over Zoom). 2/4 (last 2) quizzes were given in person. There was no HW grade this term.

Gives one short assignment per lecture (due at 11:59 pm, 4 assignments/week), and 3 quizzes to be done remotely. 3 skits (with no preparation given outside of class time), the topic is given in class, and you have half of the class time to prepare. He introduced required speaking sessions with a tutor (a total of 14 hours for the term) this term.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: There is one hw assignment/day. There were 4 online quizzes. We went over adjectives and past tense. Be prepared for interacting with your classmates in most classes. Most classes are spent making conversation with classmates.

This professor is amazing, he's understanding and so approachable. Taking his class was a pleasure. If you are struggling in any way, do not hesitate to reach out to him for extensions on deadlines and such.
He is a wonderful teacher and gave fair homework and exams. Overall, I enjoyed his class and is a really kind professor! :)
He made me forget how to do things that I already knew how to do

Professor Sales is one of the nicest professors at WPI. He cares for the students and gives his best every day. He made learning statistics fun, and I look forward to taking more classes with him in the future. Tests were fair, and homework was straight forward and challenged you.

Among the most caring and understanding professor I've had. He is lenient with circumstances and teaches great lectures. the homework in this class is manageable and valuable to understanding the materials. Even gives several late passes to webwork in case something pops up for you. Curves the test fairly and wants the best for his students. Great!

Professor Sales was alright. It was really nice of him to allow me to revise the midterm I failed to a 70 and that the exams were open-note, however, his lectures were a lot more confusing than the actual material; I didn't get a lot out of them. Also his practice exams didn't resemble the actual exams, which were a lot harder than the homework.

We love him! Allowed us to get points back on our midterm if we got below a 70 and the exams were open notes. Gave extensions when needed and was super understanding; goes above and beyond for his students. Not a difficult course but made higher-level stats concepts understandable. Overall a well-respected professor with a well-planned class.
Easy class but had to pay for online Zybook textbook. Lots of homework but was helpful for the final project. Easy grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: The worst and least useful class I have ever taken. First class he shows how you calculate the mean.  In a 4k level class for DS majors. The class changes the name of every single data science concept in the same way that a bad teammate changes a few words in a paper to be 'helpful'.  I wish I didn't take the class, but it is required to graduate

He's a nice professor and an understanding professor. There's a lot of workload in his class but they are relevant to the course. The midterm and final are really fun. They're both presentations and fun to do.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Great professor and really knowledgeable about marketing. Decent amount of group work but overall moderately easy class for how high the level was.
Extremely tough grader. Prepare for getting a B or lower if she is your instructor.
DO NOT choose her class. She only scored 2/20 tasks and barely gave feedback. And a tough grader.

she is such a good professor. her classes are very entertaining and interesting. she allows her students to give her opinions and likes to learn from their thoughts. she is very approachable and encourages you to read. =)take  her courses..great professor
Very unpleasant reading voice, biased and opinionated with feedback, and uncooperative to work with. Would not recommend unless your graduation depends on taking her class.

Honestly, she is a very bad teacher. She is incredibly biased and continuously bashes soldiers and the military in class when it does not relate to the material we're discussing. Some of the "literature" was by her friends so we couldn't express our opinions about it. I expected more classical lit-didn't happen.
Coach Steele is the best! You can take rowing for fitness with him if you don't want to be on the varsity team. he's very committed and motivating

Did not stimulate my interest in golf at all.  Took four classes to actually swing a club.  Made me feel very frustrated.  Although he was helpful, he was overly helpful, and could only help two people a class.
No Comments
Great professor, explains all concepts according to the pace students want her to.
lots of homework but her lectures help
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Awesome Professor!

Polite, gives very good feedback. Big homework assignments and you're expected to read the textbook, so a heavy workload. Exams match up to the homework very well. In class problems are very good, but he goes through powerpoints too fast.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Simeoni's teaching style is very straight to the point, he knows his stuff. Lectures consist of speeding through slides based off the textbook and working through example problems. You will need to consult the textbook ALOT. HW was reasonable. Exams were 3 Qs, and as long as you did the HW and example problems, you're fine. Overall, solid prof.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: His explanation of the subject material is nothing more than a regurgitation of the text books used in the class. The text books are both poorly written for learning.

Possibly the worst professor at Chapman. Extremely unhelpful, makes students feel stupid for asking any relevant questions. She was over 30 minutes late to our MIDTERM and did not give extra time to take the test! Is that legal? Bottom line don't take her, avoid at all costs.
very rude! goes through excel like shes a pro. is really snappy and is no help. even going to her office during office hours did not help. do not take her

She is a very hard and very very unfair grader. She does not listen to any suggestions that actually matter - she just listens to the ones that are easy for her to change (like where to stand in the class). Her class is just boring. Don't take her class unless you want an unfair grade that you don't deserve.
Great professor, class got boring sometimes but I think that was just because it was a GPS and not her. Gave very detailed feedback and was very accommodating.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Really helpful and cared about each individual student. We got to learn about topics that were actually interesting and learned useful skills

One of the greatest professors I've ever had. The material in this class is very interesting and in terms of projects and writing papers you have a lot of freedom - most of the time you can write about any social issue you want. You do need to show up for class and there are two assignments each week but 100% worth it. She gives great feedback also

There is one presentation slideshow on a chapter of the textbook and it is done in a small group. There are occasional listening quizzes but they are fine if you pay attention in class. Also, you have to watch a couple movies and write small papers about them but nothing too serious. Overall, great guy and you listen to a lot of spotify in class.

Awesome Professor. Very understanding, gave great feedback, and genuinely cares about his students. History of American Popular music was fun, engaging, challenging, and he truly cares about what his students are getting out the course. Lot of papers, but I learned more in 7 weeks than I did in 1 year of high schoolMusic. Highly Recommend!!!
Very easy class if you do all the work. There is a lot of homework, but it is all easy. Interesting topics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He doesn't explain concepts as well as some other ece professors imo, but still alright. He is fairly lenient if you need a couple extra days to finish an assignment. Homeworks were long.

Professor Doroz stated that this was his first time teaching the ECE2029 course and did an excellent job! He was flexible when it came to lab and homework help, and after witnessing how hard the first exam was, he made the second one open notes (even allowed the use of laptop notes). The homework sometimes took a while to complete but was useful!

A great professor; a real gem. Caring and helpful. Knows the matter well. Gives good feedback. Clear grading criteria. Best to go to class to ask questions. Lectures recorded; edited lecture notes available. Labs and homework take time to complete; start early. Highly recommend having a lab partner. "Go to class. Do the homework. Ask for help."

One of the best professor I took. Lecture is easy and clear, either TA or prof will come anytime if you need help in class. Learned a lot and group projects are fun, challenging, and can design what ever you want just need to be complex enough. Prof is caring, respectful to everyone and will always try to find an alternative if you got any concern.

The projects however can be very difficult because of how open ended they are. Also a nice professor overall who gives extensions. I am not good at CAD and got the lowest score on one of the two projects. Even so, if you just do the homework well and raise your hand in class for help from TA's or the prof himself you can get an A.

Advanced CAD class that covers less than the introduction to CAD class is how I would describe this class and professor. Quiz's were unreasonably hard and short and assignments have more parts, subsections, requirements, and overall junk than most any other assignments I've done. Doesn't do examples with CREO.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Tough class, lots of group work and work in class. The part on relativity was cool, but tricky, but we quickly went into quantum stuff which was cool since that is their field of research.
Liked the quiz format. Lots of office hours too, appreciated that. Would take a class with her again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Trubko was a terrible lecturer. I didn't mind her course set up however her lectures were impossible to follow. This was her first year teaching, I believe, and she did very poorly. Teaching just isn't for her. Students would ask questions and she would reply with "Good question, I'm not sure". Her explanations were very confusing.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: While you can't control your ID2050 professor, if you have Professor Eddy you are in good shape. She does everything she can to minimize the stress level and is always willing to work with you on deadlines. She gives exceptional feedback, always in a timely manner.

She cares a lot about a student's health- mental, emotional, and physical. She loves to work very closely with students and helps develop your and your group's writing skills, and professionalism without being disrespectful about it. She cares deeply about her students, and her projects.
She always says that you're doing amazing and cares more about being your friend than helping you learn. (Great if you just want good grade, terrible if you want to learn)

This professor was given feedback by students to  improve the course during its experimental run. Not only was the feedback not taken and applied for future assignments, but it was also not applied to future lab sections. This professor often seemed like she did not understand the material herself, along with labs that were not thought out.

Professor Alatalo always made sure that I understood the material and what to do specifically in lab. Sometimes spent time on things that didn't really matter, but I enjoyed the lab overall. Also took this class during a transitionary period so she was still working out some of the kinks. No fault on her though, she did a great job teaching.
Very harsh grader, especially for minuscule things like showing work for manipulating simple formulas. Be prepared to show your work for 1+1=2.

This class was run dysfunctionally and it amazes me everyday that this professor was able to get her PhD. In all honesty I felt like she did not have a complete grasp on lab practices and other parts of the course that made me question her ability to be a good professor. I expect her time at this school to be short.

To start off, you're not allowed to use any electronic devices to follow along with her notes that she rapidly flies through. You're not allowed to discuss anything with anyone in class, only her & when it is discussed with her you get shamed upon for asking a "dumb" question. Lastly, her exams are awful, it's like a game of Russian roulette.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Emmert is rude and uncaring while simultaneously making orgo seem like rocket science with her unhelpful and confusing explanations. Makes fun of students in class. Insults students in office hours. Gives 3 5-question tests with grad level material. Get ready to teach yourself. Buy the book (and the solution manual.)

Any questions asked are met with a rude/snide comment before a shallow explanation to the question. No partial credit on anything and there are only 3 exams. Does not make herself accessible outside of class to meet. Does not seem to care about the students in class at all.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I had her as conference instructor and she is best instructor ever!

I had her as a Conference instructor. She is simply the best Staff in the entire WPI faculty list. Very helpful and actually likes what she does. Two teaching of excellence awards says it all. Why can't they all be like her? Try to take her class, you will succeed. And yes, hot indeed, I always looked forward to her classes although it was at 9am.
Grades harshly. Not helpful. Somewhat rude and very narrow-minded.

Would highly advise against taking this professor. Her flipped classroom style expects that the material is learned from a textbook, then quickly goes over the formulas associated with the topics but does not explain them well. She  has 3 exams that are worth a large portion of your grade and are only 5 questions. Find another professor.

Prof. Friedman had lecture material for each class, but the way she delivered this material was not ideal. The class was a "flipped classroom" style, with heavy emphasis on learning the material outside of class. I appreciated her attention to group activities in class to try to demonstrate physical concepts for conceptual understanding.
Great person, bad teaching. One can't look at one's work without looking at one's own. She has a lot of practice problems and activities but doesn't often provide answers or even sound explanations.

Very lenient grader, easy class if you know how to write. The entire class was made up of one big paper and two supplemental papers and bibliography. If you know how to write it's a cakewalk. Danielski is a good teacher although she can be a little predictable/boring at times. Overall, a good class and would definitely take her again!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a really nice person, and always willing to help and gives feedback. There are no exams, but you can have more than 1 project or assignment at the same time. She is a little bit tough grader, but at the same time you have to submit drafts first, so you have the chance to improve your writing.
Extremely tough grader. She is really nice and responsible. She is always willing to help and gives very good feedbacks. She rarely gives A to students.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: the best professor at wpi

First half of the classes are informative and helpful and help to complement the lab portion of class. However, as time goes on pop quizzes worth a surprising amount begin to pop up randomly, requiring participation and group work. Overall, a partner with a strong coding background (arduino/RPIPW) is needed to enjoy the lab and writeup portion.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Sometimes his lectures become a bit confusing but he takes time to walk around to everyone and explain it clearly. Participation is 5% of your grade and it is extremely easy to get it you have to almost try to not participate. He takes time to get to know his student as well. He understands the stress tests can bring.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Easy grading, One hw a week that was relatively simple, his lectures are clear and concise. He writes a little funky which is annoying but he takes notes with you during lectures. A real gem

Prof Sagna is nice and understanding, however his course had no structure and homework was to read each chapter and submit a reflection for each. It was hard to hear at times, never knew what we were going to cover, and just not engaging. Easy to pass if you read the book well, but I just retained nothing from this class.

He did not lecture once. The whole class was other students presenting their chapter in the book while you take notes. The class was very easy, I did not read the textbook outside of my groups chapter. The work was very easy, the midterm was the most amount of work that was done
Gives no structure or information about any assignment and barely teaches you any information.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: This professor does not know how to lecture effectively. Feels like all her explanations were convoluted and overly difficult, especially when compared to other professors running the same class. Homework is daily, but the amount of work it requires changes drastically based on what or how many problems are assigned. Avoid if possible
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had this professor for controls and this class should not be as hard as she's making it out to be. The lectures were very hard to follow even after attending class every day. the amount of time I spent doing work outside of the class was insane. Probably one of the hardest 2000-level classes I have taken because of her teaching style.

Moorthy talks in circles, and once you figure that out, you realize how impossible it is to follow what it is she's saying. Controls should not be a difficult course, but her own lack of understanding material undermines her students' trust in her. You need help with something and email her, and her response is "follow the directions." thanks?

I felt like he didn't know much and did very little teaching. He comes from the business side of things and we just had guest lecturers. The homework was sloppily put together and I wasn't impressed by his teaching. He pales in comparison to the other BME faculty. I learned about research our faculty did but no real concepts or ideas.

He structure the class in such a way that it is very easy, but you still learn a lot. He only gives a couple homework assignments but they can be frustrating. He tends to ask the same questions just in slightly different forms multiple times. Not a big deal overall though. Great guy.
Great professor knows his stuff very well ! Can be strict but treats all students fairly.  Expect to put in work for this class.
Avoid at all costs! Flaherty knows his stuff but is rude, condescending, & a poor communicator. The midterm was very unreasonable but the final was improved. Avoid, avoid, avoid!

Be prepared to learn by yourself if you take the class. The professor offers limited knowledge in the class and always finish the class at least 30 mins earlier. There are many quizzes and other works. Also, he says the attendance is not mandatory but he does record it twice or so.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The professor talks few things about the knowledge in class, I always learn by myself. There are 2 projects and 7 quizzes online but you need to pay $80 for the code. This professor gives the same score to everyone in the same team. He never considers what if some members don't work even though you explain to him. He is NOT responsible at all!!!
Awesome person, super kind! Her tests are almost identical to the ones from years prior (which she posts). If you participate a good amount she will round you up. One big group project at the end.
Excellent, knowledgeable, fair, intelligent, enthusiastic, available to students. Highly recommend her!

Lectures, homework, and exams were focused entirely on proofs, without any examples, including many of the new integral topics introduced beyond Calc IV. The textbook is 50 years old. 2 exams make up 70% of the grade, with the rest of the grade being the weekly homework. The class was a lot harder than it needed to be, and was the most difficult.

Prof Peng was very good at teaching MA1023. He is understanding. Homework consisted of online and written hw which both counted for credit. Go to MASH or the Math Tutoring Center for help. He gave 3 exams.

He is willing to help you outside the class. His lecture was clear (although it is so into math, be prepare) if you have read the paper or resources mentioned. The idea of swarm intelligence is interesting and he is knowledgeable on this field. This class required you to work on research paper and that teaches us a lot on how to be a good scientist

He is hands down the best RBE Professor at this school. His lectures are interesting and engaging. He himself is incredibly funny and extremely helpful. This is a professor that will answer emails on the homework at 1 am and provide any extra help you need. He's a nice guy, a great teacher and is always nice to talk to.
do not recommend at all.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Can be a bit of a rambling lecturer but makes sure you know the material. Quite a lot of HW (reading, essays, online HW, group projects) so be prepared. One exam and one presentation, neither of which were graded too hard. Knows his stuff and is very friendly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Really great guy, super chill and will go out of his way to help you.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Chill as hell. Graded mostly on inclass assignments and take home assignments. It's not a ton of work, and you know when your work is right or wrong. Take this class

Lectures were useless and irrelevant, often posted only a day before homework was due. Office hours were also useless, as she seemed unaware of what her own questions were asking. Easily the worst class I have ever taken.

The worst college course I have ever taken. Did not know what she was talking about, during office hours she basically did not know what was going on and was not helpful at all. The lectures had nothing to do with the homework or project. Would stutter through her two 20 minute lectures a week, ramble off formulas without explaining anything.

While being a nice person and tries to care is a real tough person to work with. She was a disorganized mess and relied heavily on the other advisor. Gave little to no actual feedback on drafts mostly just saying "Good job" instead of actual helpful feedback like the other advisor. By the end my group tried to differ everything to the other advisor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Bhada was extremely difficult to work with during both ID2050 and IQP (for Wellington project center). She often gave little to no feedback on assignments. When she did give meaningful feedback, it was often much to late to adjust the paper. When asked a question related to adjusting to life abroad, she often answered in the rhetorical.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Avoid her classes. 2 hours of lecture with no student interaction in any way other than quizzes. Does not ever do calculations in class. Group assignments are expected to be perfect and if they are not you can expect to see a 50% or lower on an assignment worth 10% of your grade. Exam still not returned a month later (and a week after class end)

This professor does not explain how to do calculations for HVAC systems at all in class. She will talk for the whole 2 hours about the different components of different HVAC systems but never go over how to calculate anything. She assumes you will teach yourself how to do it. I do not recommend taking her class if it possible (rip all AREN majors)
lectures were useless. tests were not focused on content taught during lectures. Grading was extremely hard because tests were hard. reading hw was really hard and useless.

Lectures were completely useless but attendance was mandatory. Has no idea how to use clickers but still uses them. Does not know how to use a computer or fix the lighting in a classroom so we had to sit in the dark.

Never written one of these before but felt it was appropriate. Prof is pretentious and arrogant, honestly wish I could go back in time and not take this class. Only class I will ever advise a student not to take, at least other classes are useful. Brutal because the subject matter has so much potential. Just avoid, there are other humanities.

He's a friendly poetry professor. Everyone reads some of the poet's works, then we hold a round table discussion, lead by the professor and a student "discussant" for that poet. There are 6 reflections and a final research paper. He doesn't give much feedback, but assignments are broad and students pick their topics. A fun class, but not a snooze.

The most pathetic lab class I have ever had. A literal insult to the scientific method. A lab consists of some apparatus and no communication of objective. Also the lab instructions seem like they were written the morning of.
Avoid him at all costs, grades very harshly compared to other TAs, never answers questions, very unclear on his expectations.
Great teacher overall. You can tell this subject isn't his favorite, but he does a great job teaching it. Get out of class early on a lot of days.
gave handouts for every class.  open note and book tests.  take home final
She is horrible. her class is boring and useless even though she makes it sound interesting. the time you'll spend is not worth the credit. take a PE class

Class she manages is Insight Wellness. Very poorly organized, last minute assignments, poor communication with students. Highly discourage taking class even though it sounds interesting - take a standard PE class instead!

I have him for Stats II. I was expecting him to be terrible, and the first day I thought the class was going to be dreadful. He got much better and I like the tinny microphone because I can hear him and it wakes me up. I actually am learning from him; he's not bad. We've taken one exam, and it was a cake walk.

This professor's attitude is pompous and unfriendly.  Assumes everyone in the class is a supergenius by pulling stunts like putting questions on the midterm/final that were not covered on homeworks, quizzes, and barely glossed over (if at all) in lecture.  You might get an A if you are a supergenius, but if you are just a regular genius, expect a B

Mr. Harmon is the best professor I have ever had here! He's so chill. The first day of class, he said, "Just call me Josh." The class is a discussion based class so Josh will often assign some short reading (10 pgs max) and then the next class everyone talks about what they thought about the reading. Also, only 2 essays the whole quarter! :DDD

This class was by far the best experience I 've had so far under English: Humanities and Arts. He is a really hilarious and laid back professor. If I had the chance to take him again, I'd take him in a heartbeat. His course work is very easy to do- just turn it in on time and you'll do just fine! :)
Great professor. She wants people to get A's. Gives alot of homework but its definitely doable and it helps for the test. Overall great person.
she is a great professor, gives a lot of HW but its worth it, extremely helpful, never says no when you ask her somehting, clearly knows her stuff + she is a clear on explanations,would recommend
Its a good professor, the class is really great, the tests are not so hard. Study around 5 hours each week you you will be fine, probably end with an A.
Good class good professor
Awesome professor. Many assignment but fairly easy. She just wants to make sure you understand the material. Group projects without a doubt. This woman knows her stuff. No cellphone use allowed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof Worthington is a really awesome professor. This class has an emphasis on presentation skills and professonial growth, and challenges you in ways typical classes don't. She clearly knows what she's talking about, but the only thing I might ding her on is that she often lets students lead the class instead of lecturing. Overall, great course.
Spent 90 minutes talking about periods during a lecture in Philosophy of Science

Great Professor. Topics are genuinely interesting and get you to think. 1 Group project and 2 papers. Weekly readings that are very dense and full of theory. Very understanding when it came to workloads and mental health. Has some extra credit opportunities that are very worth to take.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Laplante really cares about his students, and you can tell at the end of the day he just wants students to learn and not stress about the class, which was really appreciated.

Great personality and sense of humor. Tests cover things he has mentioned in class and on slides and he grades fairly. While lectures aren't mandatory, they are helpful and interesting and worth the 2 hours. I love his classes!

One of the best professors I've had after three years. Interactive teaching style, makes sure everyone knows what they are doing. Homework solutions readily available and covered in class (after due time) so you never feel left behind. Makes a two hour course feel like a one hour. This professor also responds to emails nearly instantly if awake.

Robinson lays the class goals very clearly. Only two lectures a week so skipping is not recommended. Class itself is pretty interesting and you learn the basics of the NFPA 70. Exams are open book and there is an easy 2-group project for 30% of the final grade. Extra credit is given on exams for up to 10% per exam. Very fun class for an ES credit.

Had prof. Urban for my heat transfer class. He was extremely helpful when students asked questions and did a great job breaking topics down for us. He expects a lot from his students (obviously any professor would) and encourages us to spend time mastering solving problems. Definitely would enjoy having prof. Urban again.

Urban refused to upload classes, prompting only the severest of emergencies to warrant a recording of class. However, despite that, I enjoyed heat transfer, I thought his pacing was appropriate for WPI, although the last few weeks were rushed and not at par of his teaching before then. While he can be a little full of himself. I would take again.

Study from HW and practice problems for midterm and final exams. Mainly just reads off ppt during lectures. There is one final group project (groups are not assigned, so make a friend or 2). There are 4 HWs. HWs are pretty hard, but TAs will help. Exams are done in class time, take about an hour to complete.

Prof. Mangoubi is knowledgeable on the topic. In this class, he will present you the concept of deep learning in the way that you would not think about. His lecture, although pretty slow, the content inside is really dense. He usually makes some jokes before the lecture. He is really reachable and give very good feedback on your work.
Prof. Wetters has very clear grading criteria and the course is not hard at all. The lectures are interesting, but biased to a minor extent

Shoutout to my man Brent. Lectures are high-quality and very interesting (if you like music history). He seems to understand that this is a humanities class at a tech school, so the workload is very low but with opportunities to learn more if you're interested. Super accessible outside of class for questions, overall a relaxed and rewarding class.

Had him B22 and it was alright. He cancelled class on the last day so we could study for finals, and let us watch the world cup in the rec center meeting room if a match was on. Overall would recommend.
Great class. Loved learning about softball. Truly knows his stuff!!! #swag #profdylandub

This was the worst class I have ever taken. If you would like an easy A and learn nothing, this is the class to take. Very woke teacher, no lectures, all group work, no tests, so boring. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

She's incredibly passionate about teaching and physics. Most of her classes are focused around group work. She doesn't specifically lecture in her main physics class but will answer questions as the class progresses through group work. She is new to teaching, but I really liked this class because it was more interactive than my other classes.
Heavy on the group work. Disorganized. Doesn't give good lectures (or lecture at all frankly). Clearly cares a lot but is new to teaching.

Prof. Crowe, more affectionately known as Pat, is amazing. This technical theatre class is mostly group project based, with a different focus each week. Your grade is not only based on his feedback but your own feedback and reflection as well. He also took us on a tour of the Hanover Theatre, which was definitely one of the highlights.
Project based class that was super enjoyable. Professor crowe is a great guy and really made the class fun even in covid times. Highly recommend for a good humanities class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Best Basketball PE class. Didn't bore us with drills just let us play. Sometimes frustrating when he let the class get out early and half your team leaves... But easy and wicked fun class. Love the humor of Coach Bartley
BEST CLASS EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Just dont piss him off by writing a bad review
A person I consider to be a mentor and a friend
Outstanding

Dr. Lynch is an awesome professor! His lectures are interesting, he encourages student participation at all times, and he goes out of his way to help you. Your grade is determined primarily by six essays you write, but as long as you pay attention in class and do the reading, it's quite easy to succeed.

HIGHLY recommend this professor. He was engaging & involved with every lecture & he made me want to learn and pay attention. He is incredibly funny, sarcastic & will bluntly tell you his opinion without trying to unduly influence yours. He only teaches at WPI parttime, but if you are at all interested in History & his name pops up, sign up ASAP!

This TA really is awesome. He is always willing to offer help outside of classes and he gives great explanations on confusing material covered in class. He basically clarifies all questions and knows his material really well
Mr. Shaun Marshall is the best TA ever. He explains things, unlike the professors. He knows what he is talking about. I've learned so much more from him than from the professor. Recommend highly.
I had Don "The Don" Barry for both intro physics labs. He's cool, smart, helpful, everything a TA should be, and then some. I even got to take a selfie with him at the end of the term.
Don is awesome!  He is very helpful does a great job at explaining the labs and the theory behind them.  I had him for PH1110 and now PH1120 labs.

She was very willing to help, and answer questions. Sometimes her explanations of things were too long, and difficult to understand. Good at answering questions. She cares a lot about her students, but need some work in how she writes notes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: If you are looking to master the material and understand concepts from lecture, enroll in a different class. Prof Mayer copies the textbook problems in pretty colors and does not explain methods for solving each problem. Will often stop halfway through probs because she ran out of class time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Madan is an excellent Spanish teacher who really takes the time to make sure that you understand everything fully. She keeps you up to date with current events and keeps you engaged in class.

Awesome teacher, listens to her students. Tests are accurate in terms of what she taught, always available for help. It is a challenging course, but she is very easy to listen to, and it's close to impossible to fall asleep in her class. Probably the best professor I've had at WPI.

Class is mostly discussion based. No tests, and grades are mostly determined by reflections on readings and participation. I was hesitant to actually do the reading since they didn't seem very interesting, but wow was I wrong, super interesting and well-written readings. The movie on test stress and just the class in general was so eye opening.

I never went to this class and got an A. The majority of the grade is two group projects and a bunch of short journal-style reaction papers about reading the chapter in the textbook. Participation and attendance literally don't matter. The only thing bad is the video project; it's worth a lot and you literally have to spend hours with your group.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He taught with heavy theory not a ton of practice and his lectures were a bit dry

The first time he taught Intro to Statics. Great Professor. Slides but describes his own well; online class. Class notes shared. Half-hour to hour homework each week; midterm and final exam. Submit handwritten HW or online Pearson. Be sure to go to his office hours and participate in lectures. WPI Tip: "Go to class. Do the homework. Ask for help."

Very caring and laid back professor. Passionate about the subject at hand, but doesn't make the workload too heavy. Also makes sure to give class time to work on assignments, so the outside workload is relatively small.

Professor Gioielli was a great professor for my time in her class. Course load wasn't too heavy, and she is very caring and will make accommodations for you if you are having trouble. If you do the readings, participate in class, and show you care you can do well.

Prof Ghoshal is one of the best professor I have ever had at WPI. The homework amount is reasonable and no written exams. There are some easy python assignments, midterm presentation and finalterm presentation. If you take all assignments seriously, you should have no problem get an A.

Participation and attendance are required. 2 group projects (midterm+final), weekly python assignment on Kaggle (very easy, can see hints/answers and will get full credit). Bi-weekly data visualization assignment (not bad). Prof is awkward and a little boring (new to teaching). Must do reading to participate in class (there is a lot of reading).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: A lot of the topics in lectures he would skip steps, which make it difficult when trying to follow along and learn the concepts.

Professor Ashenafi was a horrible teacher as he only went over concepts in his lecture. He was also very hard to understand with his accent and did not teach us stuff that was on the final exam. Would never ever take again. Everyone in class complained about him. I taught myself off youTube, if not I would've 100% failed.
Not a hard class just pay attention
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment:
If you are a lazy bum, do not take it from him. He is different.
You will learn a lot if you stick with the schedule, and ask lots of questions and interact with him and his teaching team. You will ove it.
The worst class ever. Just don't even take him, do anything else

Prof. Ay was very informative, and with a good TA team you can excel in this class. Be prepared to spend 20 hours or more a week on work. With lengthy lab reports, weekly homework's, weekend take home quizzes it may feel like all your time is spent on this class. The tests are relatively difficult, but extra credit is given to help make up for that

Not very good at answering questions and often goes on tangents during class. Usually not available for office hours or help beyond lecture. Not very inspiring or exciting to listen too during class. TA's answer HW during conference and can learn the material using textbook.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The class isn't that hard. I had her for MA1023 and MA1024. She is a little hard to understand at times, and sometimes gets carried away (goes into theory instead of concepts). If you read the book and do the homework. You will pass the course with at least a B. Tests are easy.
I took this class to find my major. I did not find my major.
The class didn't help me find out my career, would not take again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Micheal Timko is a god amongst men. One of the best professors at wpi. The chem eng department has a lot of great professors and he is definitely one of them. He is funny in lecture and tries making the hard material fun to learn. He genuinely wants students to succeed and is always around to help with questions.

He genuinely cares about getting to know his students. He also makes lectures fun, by switching up the classes by doing in class problems and sometimes experiments. He also explains the material in a way that makes the class much easier than expected.
He is an amazing professor and has an immense knowledge base! I enjoyed taking his class, although watch out for pop quizzes which are very relevant to the final exam!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: If you have a choice, don't take this class with this professor. You won't learn much. A lot of class time will be spent on students giving presentations on topics which he will quiz you on. His lectures don't help you understand, he doesn't seem to understand the subject matter himself. The quizzes are hard! We had no direction for our project.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: It was a cool intro class to water treatment. I feel like I learned a lot from her and the class was not very hard it was all very straightforward. There was a lot of homeworks but it was not bad because homework is a huge part of your grade and they were not too complicated so a good grade booster if youre not a good test taker. She cares too

for the first half of the term did not teach anything water treatment related, it was basically a chemistry class. what was taught was not presented on exams and HW and in class problems did not help at all. would not recommend

Jerry is a professor of practice, meaning that he actually knows of which he speaks. He keeps long classes interesting with discussion, and gives good feedback on written assignments. It might not be what you wanted to hear all the time, but at least you know he read the whole thing, word for word.

Super easy class, but you don't gain much from it. Readings about huge companies/group discussion for the first hour, self-important ramblings about how wonderful this class and topic is for the second. Do the reading summaries and you'll get an A, we basically got a 90 for showing up for the midterm. Won't learn how to be an entrepreneur though.
You never want to take his class anymore. It wasted your time and drive you mad. Please, change some other professors.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: You will find it very difficult to understand his English
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: This professor is awesome!! He is often humorous during class!!

Not a bad professor, but unfamiliar with how to teach a class within a 7-week term.
