He constantly reminded us that his music course at his other school was better because he didn't have to cut content. And the cut content really showed. The class only covered classical string quartets and jazz trombone voicing. He does not keep office hours at WPI.

Amazing professor. Gives clear explanations of all course material, and makes difficult math understandable to students. Homeworks, exams, and projects are good representations of the material covered in lectures. I would recommend taking courses with professor Arnold.
Professor Arnold is kind and understanding. She has perfectly reasonable expectations of students and gives clear explanations in class.

Overall, since class is asynchronous without a set office hours, getting help on homework problems or anything will be more difficult. There is a lot of homework especially an extra long homework due right after spring break. Overall a difficult class and will require lots of effort to keep on top of assignments and lectures.

Professor Floru's homeworks and lectures are littered with errors and he refuses to admit that some of the hw questions don't make sense. This is an opinion shared by other students as well. Overall, his class was frustrating and frankly unfair due to his arbitrary grading. I don't mind a hard class, but I do mind a class where effort is unrewarded

Professor Duguay's writing class is very simple, has a lot of assignments to pad your grade and she is a very lenient grader, it is very easy to maintain a high grade, and she is very lenient on attendance, while it is required she offers zoom every day so you don't always have to go to class. Deffinatly take her for writing classes.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Duguay is great. We had three essays and a few short quizzes that were very easy. For the argumentative, short, and descriptive essays we could choose our own topic and she is an extremely fair grader. The class was engaging and with a combination of workshops, quizzes, and 3 essays, it wasn't overwhelming at all. Super friendly and caring.
Actually cares about the students. Drops low grades, allows a "cheat sheet" on exams, and provides extra credit. Had him for Lin Alg, I would definitely recommend him.
Prof. Villagran is good at explaining concepts in calculus and doesn't hesitate to curve grades and give extra credit
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Villagran did not teach well compared to other professors my friends experienced. If you need to take one of his classes, then rely heavily on the textbooks and use other resources to get a better understanding of the material.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Corey gave our team excellent feedback on our report throughout the term. Would meet whenever we needed, and was always willing to go the extra mile to help. She handled personal and experience-related concerns quickly and properly. She tried so hard to help out each and every student, and I wish she knew how much students appreciated it!

She explains things in the most backwards way which does not help whatsoever. She is so disorganized and does not tell you anything about when something needs to be done or how to do it. She acts friendly on the outside but is very pretentious and gives very bad criticism and comments.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: After loving Albano for CE 2000, wow did I hate structural engineering after taking courses with her.  You have to go to her office hours to understand what's going on.  Otherwise, you're in a hole.  Question her examples in class like crazy if you don't get it right away.

This professor is the worst professor I've had WPI. Do not take a class with her. She it utterly useless because she just reads from the textbook which might have been more useful if the textbook was better. She does not understand what are the important topics to concentrate on and rewrites the exact proofs found in the textbook instead.

The class was easy as a whole, but the homework was unnecessarily challenging as few examples relevant to the homework were given in class (hence the low helpfulness score). The video project was easy to get a good grade on and fun to make, but time-consuming. You'll get to hear some cool speakers. My only real complaint is the homework.

Very nice professor, but not much to be taught. Entire class is just watch a presentation then right a fairly simple 3-5 page paper. Final 10-15 minute video project at the close of the semester was a little difficult (mainly due to procrastination) but she grades them very easily. Overall pretty easy class and a very nice professor.

Amazing teacher who clarifies everything, and is intent on the students understanding the materials.  Exams are fairly straight forward with the occasional "everyone is doing to well, final is going to be extremely difficult"

Prof. Hussein teaches some hard material but he is intent on making you learn it. If you like falling asleep in class don't take any of his as he actually gets upset when the class isn't participating in the lecture.
Did not show up to more than half of lecture time during a summer class, and did not make it up. Homework had nothing to do with lecture. Easy grader, but I didn't learn a thing.

She's good in class and in lab if you ask her questions, but she isn't very useful via email questions.  The class isn't difficult if you pay attention, and she's not a tough grader.  Mid-term and final was mostly multiple choice with 2 or 3 open ended questions.

This class is not easy but the professor is trying super hard to make this class good for everyone. He is very passionate about mass transfer and I genuinely enjoyed his teaching. If anyone else taught this course I feel like it would be miserable
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: I don't advise taking this class unless recommended for your field. The class seems tailored to Chem Eng. He is a very nice guy and is constantly asking for feedback on how to improve his class. His lectures are entirely conceptual with few examples. The book solves problems different than he does. His homework assignments are extremely hard.

Arroyo is a fine professor, she's knowledgable and caring. Textbook is a must (super affordable) and there are daily 2 question quizzes on readings (drops lowest). Lots of reading, writing, and discussions. Overall fine, maybe not the best, but she doesn't deserve the "Awful" rating the other person gave her (only one other review at this time).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: So much useless work, subjective grading. Also you will have to learn the whole material of the next class beforehand and get daily quizzes about it before the class starts

Mishra is a wonderful professor! He is very accessible and willing to help you with your homework/questions. He uses the textbook to assign HW. His exams reflect the HW pretty well. His lectures were okay (online asynchronously due to COVID), and office hours were very helpful. Overall a balanced class, lots of content but well organized.

Professor Mishra was a reasonable professor. Lectures were clear, orderly, and kinda funny. The tests looked like the homework and the lectures. He missed a few classes for medical reasons, and so the class was harder. I know many people struggled to pass the class. He was flexible with grades. No projects, all individual work.

Professor Shah has done a great job with this class. She is truly dedicated and always respectful. She has managed to make the course relatable and teaches us skills we will need in the future. I recommend you take a class with her.

She made the course about marketing strategy (which is not listed anywhere in the course description). She is extremely nitpicky about details in assignments, and even the best submissions in the class don't score above 90%. No sympathy for students who miss class due to extenuating circumstances or have horrible group members on their team.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: that is one cool dude. and smart too
Totally awesome...Dude.

BB3003 is Prof. Rao's only class, and it shows. She's a great person and her lectures (and the content) are fascinating, but she goes way too fast, her exams are incredibly hard, and the group project was largely unrelated to the course content. A's are almost unheard of. I ironically still really enjoyed the class, but would've failed without PLAs

Medical Microbio is a very difficult class, but so fascinating and worthwhile. Massive amounts of material and studying are required. I took this class A term of my Freshman year but with a ton of hard work, I did well and gained so much. Prof Rao cares so much about her students. She is tough but her passion for biology and teaching is evident.
I bet she's a nice professor. I just wish she would have her class put the desks back to being in lines after her class because it's really hard to maneuver in the classroom after :(

Daily vocab quizzes like the other Chinese teachers. Good feedback on the oral exams that inspire you to do better. Kind, funny, and overall creates a very positive learning environment where you don't feel afraid to ask questions.

His lectures are very interesting, he asks good discussion questions, and genuinely wants to hear the students opinion or thoughts. The homework may seem like a lot, but its actually very achievable and work you want to do.

Not a professor by occupation, but is able to teach beautifully. He makes you realize how much cyber law and policy affects our daily lives without us even knowing it and raises several good questions on both sides. He appreciates discussion; viewpoints from both sides are respected. He also finds a way to make a discussion about sensitive topics.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome professor, really makes the lectures as engaging as possible. Works with students to make sure you're not overloaded with work and as long as you show up to class, you can easily get an A or B. Would absolutely take another class with her
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Gives great feedback and the lectures are actually fun to attend. She is able to share history in fun and relatable ways
She was fantastic very caring and understanding and was clear with her teaching.

She's incredibly knowledgeable, made the transition into learning Racket seamless for me, responded to every email within minutes, always had office hours, and was accommodating when I needed a little extra time on a couple of things. She even pushed back exam dates for everyone set by the other professors when there was too much due on one day.
Only material posted and discussed are sloppy handwritten notes. Does not provide any examples/practice problems.

Makes it so difficult to get a good grade in this class. I had all As on almost every homework and exam. I got a C on one homework and it made it impossible for me to get an A in the class after that. Lecture notes are not helpful and make no sense. Only bright side is he tells you what topics exactly will be on the exam. switch out while you can..

Instructor lacked genuine care, delayed feedback, ignored questions. Communication poor: unanswered emails, last-minute schedule changes. Unfair assignment weights, unclear grading. Manipulated students for positive assessments, blaming circumstances for what was listed above. Avoid this instructor.

Watching grass grow would be a better use of my time than taking this class. The homework is boring and time consuming. I didn't learn any useful skills from this class. Test questions are vague, and the grading is equally vague. He is unsupportive and very passive agressive. Avoid this class at all costs. Just bite the bullet and take OS.

Overall most of the negatives stem from the structure of ECE 2019's overlap with ECE 2010. This leads to an impossible balance between differentiating the content from 2010 while also making sure those who have not taken it are not lost. Professor Asheghan is caring and passionate but the structure leads to analogy/challenge topic heavy lectures.

He is a fun lecturer and is always making fun jokes and was very personable. He gave lots of examples that are applicable to real world scenarios. He even showed up in the labs on multiple occasions and would help students if needed. I have not seen any other professor do this and it shows how much he cares about his students and the course.

He is passionate and FUNNY. He genuinely cares about the students and makes an effort to get to know his students. Lots of extra credit. He moves more slowly than other professors so you actually get a chance to learn the material.

He is animated, passionate, and engaging to listen to. He gives a lot of extra credit and he's accessible outside of class. He is wonderful at explaining the topics, and he will sit down with you to make sure you understand the content. He lets students create index card notes for use in tests. He's amazing! I learned a lot in his class.

An absolutely brilliant professor! Lectures are engaging and he has a great sense of humor. I never found myself bored in a lecture. He makes difficult concepts easy to grasp. Posts notes on Canvas after class and always posts homework solutions after the due date. Homework is not too bad, and he always happy to help with problems.

A phenomenal and extremely enthusiastic professor! Without his help outside of class, I wouldn't have passed. It was the first proof's class I had and the most challenging. The homework also ramped up in difficulty, however, he was always willing to help and answer questions outside of his office hours - he even spent 3 hours to do so one time!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Difficult to understand what's being asked in any homeworktest problem. Wording is often confusing. He's happy to go over concepts, but if you ever ask questions about HW assignments, he'll either be as vague as possible or not answer - he doesn't like to "give away" the answers, even if the question is unclear. Overall, a frustrating experience.

Prof Keys is the man. I ook two env classes with him for my social science and free elective class. Barely any homework and tests are always open booknotes. Jokes around during lecture but still covers material. Take one of his classes if you can

Never clear on what is needed for assignments, expects you to run things and figure everything out for yourself. If you don't do exactly what she wants, she will trash all of your work most harshly. She does not give good feedback, and I have never felt worse about myself than when in that class.

Lectures could be pretty boring. A lot of students disagreed with some viewpoints that she had, but she seemed to dismiss them after restating her opinion. The only parts I found valuable were some insights that students had into various parts of sociology. Not too hard of a class.
Verifiably violated the Americans with disabilities act, it's interesting she is legally allowed to still teach

I have never taken an engineering science course before, and this one was my last. This professor literally will call you out in the middle of class if you send him an email and act like a deranged child when people criticize him. He does nothing but lecture at you with content that isn't even close to the representative on the homework or tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
I feel like there was no real application of the things we learned in class.
Lots of proofs. 
I would not recommend taking his class.

Amazing teacher, her class really made me challenge my perspectives and inspired me. The learning doesn't feel forced, because she ignites an interest in the subject and then you excitedly go down the rabbit hole. The 2-hour lectures were interesting and went by fast. She is very caring and flexible, which makes the class less stressful.

Was always willing to help students out if they had any questions. Her lectures were pretty straight forward, as long as you pay attention to the lecture notes. Exams and homework were challenging though fair. Much of how I did in this class related to effort, and I'm glad to have had this course with this professor.
Homeworks will help you learn the material, any questions the TA was more than happy to help. Tests were on the material taught and all reqiurements were clearly communicated to us.

Took literally the first class she taught her. She was great. Interesting lectures and not much work to do. There is a fair amount of reading to be done, but you get plenty of time to do so. Lots of group work.

A professor so cool, smart, and grand,
With explanations clear, easy to understand.
Rigorous yet kind, he made math a breeze,
Turning tough concepts into lessons with ease.

His tests were simple, his style refined,
A sharper mind, you'd be hard-pressed to find.
Handsome and humble, he's truly the best,
Rate him with stars—he's aced the test!
I took calc 4 with him, he was great. Moderate homework, if you do the homework and follow his test review then you will do very well.

the homework is hard
weekly quizzes
lots of lecture

there is one problem on the quiz and its the same thing as they go over in the discussion
the test are very similar to the practice test so if you review those you will do fine on the actual tests

She was very good at communicating the material clearly.  I also felt like she was exceptional about creating questions that were not overly cumbersome for no reason but really forced you to demonstrate understanding of the material.  One of the best professors I've ever had.  Effective for online teaching, too.

Lectures describe simple yet critical concepts skipped-over by other teachers (ie: dimensional and practical comparison of Laplace/Fourier/Z-trans). Good Book:lecture HW ratio, without excessive analytical calculation when unnecessary. Will Skype with you over an hour to make sure you understand everything you're learning.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: CE3030 was a difficult class, but worth it. To learn CAD, you need to put in the time to show up to class and follow along with the lectures. Lectures were fast, and we needed to ask the prof to slow down sometimes. The prof always responded to emails quickly. Ask for help when you need it. It's tough to catch up after you get behind.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor is incredibly boring. He reads the slides off the projector, and does not explain the concepts so they could be understood well.

Her lecture's can get a bit boring, but the material is pretty cool. She shows you how to use the Instron, but only once before you have to do the homework, so I suggest you pay attention if you don't want to break the thing.
Gives the most consistently useful and constructive feedback on assignments I've ever had from a professor.

Good teacher!  Hammered in on the basics.  This was an overview course, what you should know about Finance/Accounting, and he covered it all, especially on Accounts Receivable (getting paid) and Property Plant and Equipment depreciation.  Big finish on Financial Statement Evaluation, which I used to select my employer.
Awesome Guy! There were days where I didnt feel like leaving class because he literally mesmerized us! Smooth on grading. You do what the syllabus says, you get an A.
An excellent and inspiring professor! You will learn really much from his course.

He is vague and never answers emails. Also he will not tell you if he will be showing up to your meeting and will yell at you for not having time to meet with him when you are also taking two other courses. Does not understand that on campus IQP is taken with other courses. Expects 20-40 hours of research a week. The worst and he is also crazy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Great professor that knows the topics really well. Each lecture is good at describing the topics, and the assignments aren't too hard. Uses group projects

Professor Ayobami gave the perfect amount of work for people just starting out in programming. The tests were not hard and the homework and labs always had TAs accessible to help. If you do the work you will have a good gread!

New professor, seemed a bit confused when teaching. Knowledgable about some material but does not know how to explain in a coherent manner. Need to depend on PLA to actually teach material. Stick to the book and you should be good.
Amazing professor who truly cares about her students and their futures. Such a stress-relieving class that has taught me life lessons! Highly recommend
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: The class was basically just sitting and listening to him read notes from the textbook and then taking a test that was based off of how much you had memorized. If you missed class, you were out of luck unless you got the notes from someone else. He also gave out study guides before the test. So easy, love him, and definitely recommend this class.

This was her first year teaching out of retirement.  Grading: 2 assignments/week. 1 final exam, 1 group project. She is an easy grader and just wants to make sure you understand and are getting something out of the class.

Professor Hunt's class was very easy to pass, but she was bad at explaining fundamental concepts and simply ignored some of the objections the students had. All of her lectures had an obvious far-left bias. The discussions in her class were very superficial. If you want to understand philosophy, YouTube videos are much more helpful
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: BEST PROF. AT WPI. She is so understanding and caring. I loved going to her class

I asked him to clarify what he grades participation based on, like working with your group or just raising your hand in class, and he said, "If you are unclear about how participation works, I can give you an exam instead. See me if you want this.", and that was all?? He is very hard to reach via email outside of class.

Going in, I hated calculus with a passion. Prof. Henry made it seem not so bad and was always clear in his lectures. The thing that got me was the homework... the problems (primarily even #s) were a lot more difficult than than examples he went over in class and it got tough sometimes.

Knows his stuff and seems like a decent guy but is not cut out for teaching high school, let alone a reputable college like WPI. Constantly gets corrected and forgets what he is trying to write on the board. Tests were a nightmare, he has no sense of what the length or difficulty should be. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Gericke has clear and simple lectures, explaining both concepts and doing out multiple practice problems for the class, ensuring understanding. He is very straight forward regarding what is on the exams, and doing the optional worksheets and being honest regarding understanding will go a long way. He's a fascinating and caring individual!!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Online lectures were extremely dull and consisted of slides being narrated by a read script. Weekly quizzes were similarly focused on a test of reading and were not flexible to give partial credit for partial understanding. Different philosophy than mine, I suppose.

This was his first class, he switched it up to 2, 2 hour lectures so it made it hard to pay attention in class.  All of the power points get posted on line.  Overall, he is a very nice guy and just wants you to learn.
Great math teacher as long as you show up to class and pay attention to what he's saying. Don't be intimated by hi accent. He is an intelligent man and a good teacher if you choose to listen.
The professor was generally unprofessional. He tended to focus on sharing his opinions on class topics rather than facts. He does not understand the fundamental purpose of the "NR"

I had Professor Shockey in Environmental Governance and Innovation, and I did not really have any expectations, but I was positively surprised by her inspirational lectures, it was always interesting to go to class - the work load was bearable but you still learned a lot. I will 100% recommend this class and this professor in general. Very caring.
She's super nice and does a great job explaining things. Clearly knowledgeable about water treatment and environmental engineering.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Mattson is genuinely the best professor I've ever had at WPI. She truly sets the bar for a new look on education. She is the direct opposite of a narrow minded professor. Her syllabus is packed with different options to succeed in a very difficult class. She realises that people have strengths and weaknesses and everyone can succeed.

Her genetics class was easy and interesting. Tests were very similar to practice problems and all open note. No trick questions. She is very nice and gave everyone 6 extra points on the final because over half the class got two questions wrong, regardless if you missed those two particular questions. Very sweet and understanding. Highly recommend.

Professor Laura is such a kind and caring human being. She really cares for students and wants everyone to succeed. Her lighting class was very fun and laid back I would definitely take more classes with her. There was long reading homework and the projects were a little rushed but overall a good class.

Professor is respectful, and understanding. Majority of class time was dedicated to group project. He gives feedback and has guest speakers. Course was a bit unorganized due to course being new. Although not required, there are supplemental videos and articles that are helpful. Overall great professor, you get out what you put in, easy/fair grader.
Very nice and lenient about deadlines. Some of us didn't hand in homework assignments until 3 weeks later and she still took them.
Nice guy, retired FDA agent teaching the FDA regulations as it applies to medical devices. Very informative class, he gives some hilarious real world examples, and is a nice guy.

She's a high school teacher who teaches a teaching class. The class is off-campus, at Doherty High School. It's a practical class, and you'll learn why teachers do some of the stranger things they do. You'll pretend to be a teacher. She funny and practical and honest. Bring your thinking caps!

He teaches a teaching methods class. It's not on campus, it's at Doherty High School. He's a high school teacher there. It's a fun and practical class. He's got a good sense of humor, and he's approachable. Polite but honest about the world of teaching. You'll get a tiny taste of what it's like to teach.

Professor McCarthy is the coolest professor I have met here at WPI. Absolutely zero complaints about him and he has earned my respect for a lifetime. The class, well it does have a lot of reading, wasn't challenging because of how easy Professor McCarthy made it for us students to understand the material. 1010 would English again.

Professor Meacham teaches this course hardcore. Its a whirlwind overview of fire protection. There's one or two lectures per topic, one homework assignment per lecture, two tests per course. The hw is long and is heavily weighted in the final grade, but he lightened up on hw as the class went, so you may see less hw than we did. I recommend him!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Johns a Professor?
Calls on students randomly, so make sure you always do the reading the night before. NO LATE WORK. (not even if it is one second late) Very picky about wording of papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: There is a lot of assignments and prep for the actual lecture, but most of the work is fairly straightforward and easy. Rob is easily my favorite business professor I have taken a course with. Super reasonable passionate guy. Teaches a lot about the real world and the corporate culture and workplace. The most realistic business class I have taken

Dont take him. seriously, 1/3 of the class showed up to class because he takes an hour to talk about one example problem in class and never writes any notes on the board. Intense reading with a textbook that makes no sense and even more HW probs. Stay away.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: not much feedback on assignments

Sakire completely surpassed my initial vibes of her. She seemed like she'd be a dry and boring teacher, but was actually surprisingly funny and engaging. She's the most available teacher I've had so far. She's active in responding on Discord. My one complaint of the class is that she re-teaches a lot of things from required videos - but she's good.

Lottie was an awesome professor for intro to Africana studies. I was put in the class by an advisor and wasn't sure if I'd like it, but it ended up being my favorite class in A term. She clearly cares about the stuff she's teaching and even at 8am made me want to come to class every day. Definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment:
Lovely woman.

Ms. Fulton was always willing to help and cared for her students. Be ready for tests though, they are sneaky difficult.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Matt Oney was incredible. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Lots of group projects for my class but that was the point of the class
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Super cool, occasionally brings his dog to lecture. Really respectful of students and I actually learned a lot in his class

This guy's awesome. Great teacher, good grader, funny guy. Tests can be a little difficult but he's very accommodating if you don't do well. I've only been in his class for a couple weeks and I already think he deserves five stars.

Really passionate about what she does, and clearly cares about introducing her students to the field of Biomedical Engineering. Includes lots of faculty visitors and uses slack extensively, but never to her detriment. Optional guided tour of Gateway; very fun.

Charlie is definately one of the more caring and empathetic professors at WPI, and also a good lecturer. Makes the course interesting and engaging through the projects assigned, and allows students to choose their final project using the frameworks used during the class. Would definately recommend taking his Webware class for a Web Dev intro.
Horrible

Took a class required for my major with Landau last year and was so enthralled with her teaching that I took another course with her even though it didn't fill any requirements. Unlike many professors, Susan Landau has spent most of her life in industry and knows how the world works.

Fun gym class with a fun guy. He's laid back, but smarter than you think. Lets students break into groups by ability level, and teaches each group according to their abilities. If you miss a class, he's quite forgiving if you tell him why. Patient, reasonable, and a good teacher.

The class has many interesting topics although I reccommend taking this class with another teacher. The tests and quizzes are hard and this class trys to relate psychology to other fields way too much.
VAGUE unfair grading

Core courses I have to take in ME, Math and ECE only make sense and connect together after taking his class.He is more hardworking than any other professor and student I know. Goes extra miles to help you out because he just loves teaching and cares about students. Very down to earth and smart. Now I can graduate happily 'coz I wrote a review here.
Great, meaningful discussions are held within this course. The one downside... he makes meat jokes a lot, and  his breath wreaked of ham!!...tries to cover with cologne... It works? Would recommend!

Lots of note-taking required and a bunch of homework every week. She's a dedicated teacher and she tries her best to make her students understand the material, but the workload seems a bit overwhelming sometimes. Plus: well-dressed and fashionable. I'm not saying she's the best, but it's not the end of the world if you need to take her course.

I had her A term and I've heard she's far harsher at the beginning of the year and gets easier moving forward. We didn't do great at first in lab, but it's easier moving forward, it just took perseverance. Her rubrics were super helpful in ensuring a decent grade on labs, and she cares more about your knowledge, not the results you actually receive

Best class I have ever taken!! Professor is such a good person and really made us all feel like stars when we acted. Even during covid-19 she still found ways to make the class just as fun even with the restrictions. Highly recommend !
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor Sethi is a good teacher and is good at explaining key concepts in class. However, some classes are far worse than others. Sometimes a class is watching 3 episodes of John Green's Crash Courses which is dull, and it doesn't help with retaining any sort of information. Homework consists of long reading assignments, one major group project.
Syllabus and grading scale is neat. Too many topics because of which professor doesn't explain coherently. Lecture heavy. Difficult to make time to complete all lectures.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Fairly easy assignments are due right before every class. Prof is VERY helpful in office hours. There is a midterm and final that is reflective of the assignments. There is an individual project and a group project. The ind. proj. is done in classes, just need to follow along. Group proj. is done out of class and is pretty challenging but doable.

Overall great class, only downside is the lack of extra credit opportunities to support your grade. Each of the three tests is abound 25% of your grade and the homework is out of 16. Engaging lectures, approachable to ask anything to.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Ted is a very nice Professor. His lecture is clear and straightforward. if you want to get a good score, you should definitely put effort into it. But you could learn a lot from him.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a great lab professor and was very understanding about partner issues. She gave helpful feedback when my group submitted assignments early. She was very helpful in lab, clearly explaining what we were supposed to do when we asked questions.

New professor and I was in her first class. Many of our assignments were created on the spot yet the class flew naturally, as I was her first class here. She was easy on the grading for this first class and the assignments were meaningful, even if they only got into the technology part later into the term. Could have been more technical, though.

Professor Maag is easily the best professor I've had. I registered him as a professor on this website just so I could say how good of a professor he is. Definitely take classes with him if you can. He is extremely helpful and is an insanely good professor in general.

This was one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. There were weekly quizzes on canvas and the answers were very obvious. There were two projects, both of which were interesting and they were graded easy. The class was organized well and the professor did some engaging activities (like construction site jeopardy).
Great professor overall, really accessible outside of class, and gives really good feedback. He truly wants you to do well, highly recommend him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a great professor and teach the topics innovatively.

I had Prof. Bigonah for Graphic Design and I really liked her. As long as you put in a good effort you'll get a good grade. She is very understanding and clearly cares about her students. There were textbook readings but you won't be lost if you don't do them. Would definitely have her again, I really enjoyed her class.

Good explanations, derivations and subsequent formulas were extremely helpful. Compressible flow calculator provided in Canvas. Many examples done in class, straightforward and useful for homework. Homework would range in size and complexity, sometimes easy, sometimes not. Homework due week after assigned. Exams are take-home 2 hours, can be tough!
McCarthy is a great professor! Clear expectations and always guides in the right direction. Really enjoyed this lab course. Also, phenomenal MQP advisor!

4 projects (conducted with a partner; could be done alone if you wanted), 4 quizzes (closed book), cumulative final exam (open book). We are required to present a project/research paper/any project related to the course as a part of our grade. Prof is extremely understanding, i.e. if you need an extension, don't hesitate to ask for it.
I have learned a lot in Thermodynamics and this give me a perfect foundations in Fluid dynamics and CFD later on

I really liked this class, I thought the lectures were interesting and made sense. He gave us 3 exams and dropped the lowest score and gave lots of partial credit. Homework questions were harder than the exam questions.
Amazing teacher! I learned so much in her class. She is very accessible via email and is excited to help you learn, especially if you mention you have a Spanish speaking IQP.
